title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवं रत्वीजम | होतारं रत्नधातमम
transliteration: aghnimīḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devaṃ ṛtvījam | hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam
translation: I Laud Agni, the chosen Priest, God, minister of sacrifice, The hotar, lavishest of wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्निः पूर्वेभिर्र्षिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत | स देवानेह वक्षति
transliteration: aghniḥ pūrigvedaebhirṛṣibhirīḍyo nūtanairuta | sa devāneha vakṣati
translation: Worthy is Agni to be praised by living as by ancient seers. He shall bring. hitherward the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्निना रयिमश्नवत पोषमेव दिवे-दिवे | यशसं वीरवत्तमम
transliteration: aghninā rayimaśnavat poṣameva dive-dive | yaśasaṃ vīravattamam
translation: Through Agni man obtaineth wealth, yea, plenty waxing day by day, Most rich in heroes, glorious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि | स इद्देवेषु गछति
transliteration: aghne yaṃ yajñamadhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūrasi | sa iddeveṣu ghachati
translation: Agni, the perfect sacrifice which thou encompassest about Verily goeth to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः | देवो देवेभिरा गमत
transliteration: aghnirhotā kavikratuḥ satyaścitraśravastamaḥ | devo devebhirā ghamat
translation: May Agni, sapient-minded Priest, truthful, most gloriously great, The God, come hither with the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: यदङग दाशुषे तवमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि | तवेत तत सत्यमङगिरः
transliteration: yadaṅgha dāśuṣe tvamaghne bhadraṃ kariṣyasi | tavet tat satyamaṅghiraḥ
translation: Whatever blessing, Agni, thou wilt grant unto thy worshipper, That, Angiras, is indeed thy truth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: उप तवाग्ने दिवे-दिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम | नमो भरन्त एमसि
transliteration: upa tvāghne dive-dive doṣāvastardhiyā vayam | namo bharanta emasi
translation: To thee, dispeller of the night, O Agni, day by day with prayer Bringing thee reverence, we come

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपां रतस्य दीदिविम | वर्धमानंस्वे दमे
transliteration: rājantamadhvarāṇāṃ ghopāṃ ṛtasya dīdivim | vardhamānaṃsve dame
translation: Ruler of sacrifices, guard of Law eternal, radiant One, Increasing in thine own abode.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 1
sanskrit: स नः पितेव सूनवे.अग्ने सूपायनो भव | सचस्वा नः सवस्तये
transliteration: sa naḥ piteva sūnave.aghne sūpāyano bhava | sacasvā naḥ svastaye
translation: Be to us easy of approach, even as a father to his son: Agni, be with us for our weal.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंक्र्ताः | तेषां पाहि शरुधी हवम
transliteration: vāyavā yāhi darśateme somā araṃkṛtāḥ | teṣāṃ pāhi śrudhī havam
translation: BEAUTIFUL Vayu, come, for thee these Soma drops have been prepared: Drink of them, hearken to our call.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वाय उक्थेभिर्जरन्ते तवामछा जरितारः | सुतसोमा अहर्विदः
transliteration: vāya ukthebhirjarante tvāmachā jaritāraḥ | sutasomā aharigvedadaḥ
translation: Knowing the days, with Soma juice poured forth, the singers glorify Thee, Vayu, with their hymns of praise.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वायो तव परप्र्ञ्चती धेना जिगाति दाशुषे | उरूची सोमपीतये
transliteration: vāyo tava prapṛñcatī dhenā jighāti dāśuṣe | urūcī somapītaye
translation: Vayu, thy penetrating stream goes forth unto the worshipper, Far-spreading for the Soma draught.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू इमे सुता उप परयोभिरा गतम | इन्दवो वामुशन्ति हि
transliteration: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhirā ghatam | indavo vāmuśanti hi
translation: These, Indra-Vayu, have been shed; come for our offered dainties' sake: The drops are yearning for you both.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वायविन्द्रश्च चेतथः सुतानां वाजिनीवसू | तावा यातमुप दरवत
transliteration: vāyavindraśca cetathaḥ sutānāṃ vājinīvasū | tāvā yātamupa dravat
translation: Well do ye mark libations, ye Vayu and Indra, rich in spoil So come ye swiftly hitherward.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वायविन्द्रश्च सुन्वत आ यातमुप निष्क्र्तम | मक्ष्वित्था धिया नरा
transliteration: vāyavindraśca sunvata ā yātamupa niṣkṛtam | makṣvitthā dhiyā narā
translation: Vayu and Indra, come to what the Soma. presser hath prepared: Soon, Heroes, thus I make my prayer.

title: Rig Veda Book 1 Hymn 2
sanskrit: मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च रिशादसम | धियं घर्ताचीं साधन्ता
transliteration: mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam | dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīṃ sādhantā
translation: Mitra, of holy strength, I call, and foe-destroying Varuna, Who make the oil-fed rite complete.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो दरवत्पाणी शुभस पती | पुरुभुजाचनस्यतम
transliteration: aśvinā yajvarīriṣo dravatpāṇī śubhas patī | purubhujācanasyatam
translation: 2 Ye Asvins, rich in wondrous deeds, ye heroes worthy of our praise, Accept our songs with mighty thought. 3 Nasatyas, wonder-workers, yours are these libations with clipt grass: Come ye whose paths are red with flame. 4 O Indra marvellously bright, come, these libations long for thee, Thus by fine fingers purified. 5 Urged by the holy singer, sped by song, come, Indra, to the prayers, Of the libation-pouring priest. 6 Approach, O Indra, hasting thee, Lord of Bay Horses, to the prayers. In our libation take delight. 7 Ye Visvedevas, who protect, reward, and cherish men, approach Your worshipper's drink-offering. 8 Ye Visvedevas, swift at work, come hither quickly to the draught, As milch-kine hasten to their stalls. 9 The Visvedevas, changing shape like serpents, fearless, void of guile, Bearers, accept the sacred draught 10 Wealthy in spoil, enriched with hymns, may bright Sarasvati desire, With eager love, our sacrifice. 11 Inciter of all pleasant songs, inspirer o all gracious thought, Sarasvati accept our rite 12 Sarasvati, the mighty flood,--she with be light illuminates, She brightens every pious thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 4
sanskrit: सुरूपक्र्त्नुमूतये सुदुघामिव गोदुहे | जुहूमसि दयवि-दयवि
transliteration: surūpakṛtnumūtaye sudughāmiva ghoduhe | juhūmasi dyavi-dyavi
translation: 2 Come thou to our libations, drink of Soma; Soma-drinker thou! The rich One's rapture giveth kine. 3 So may we be acquainted with thine innermost benevolence: Neglect us not, come hitherward. 4 Go to the wise unconquered One, ask thou of Indra, skilled in song, Him who is better than thy friends. 5 Whether the men who mock us say, Depart unto another place, Ye who serve Indra and none else; 6 Or whether, God of wondrous deeds, all our true people call us blest, Still may we dwell in Indra's care. 7 Unto the swift One bring the swift, man-cheering, grace of sacrifice, That to the Friend gives wings and joy. 8 Thou, Satakratu, drankest this and wast the Vrtras' slayer; thou Helpest the warrior in the fray. 9 We strengthen, Satakratu, thee, yea, thee the powerful in fight, That, Indra, we may win us wealth. 10 To him the mighty stream of wealth, prompt friend of him who pours the juice, yea, to this Indra sing your song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 5
sanskrit: आ तवेता नि षीदतेन्द्रमभि पर गायत | सखाय सतोमवाहसः
transliteration: sakhāya stomavāhasaḥ
translation: 2 To him the richest of the rich, the Lord of treasures excellent, Indra, with Soma juice outpoured. 3 May he stand by us in our need and in abundance for our wealth: May he come nigh us with his strength. 4 Whose pair of tawny horses yoked in battles foemen challenge not: To him, to Indra sing your song. 5 Nigh to the Soma-drinker come, for his enjoyment, these pure drops, The Somas mingled with the curd. 6 Thou, grown at once to perfect strength, wast born to drink the Soma juice, Strong Indra, for preëminence. 7 O Indra, lover of the song, may these quick Somas enter thee: May they bring bliss to thee the Sage. 8 Our chants of praise have strengthened thee, O Satakratu, and our lauds So strengthen thee the songs we sing. 9 Indra, whose succour never fails, accept these viands thousandfold, Wherein all manly powers abide. 10 O Indra, thou who lovest song, let no man hurt our bodies, keep Slaughter far from us, for thou canst.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 6
sanskrit: युञ्जन्ति बरध्नमरुषं चरन्तं परि तस्थुषः | रोचन्तेरोचना दिवि
transliteration: yuñjanti bradhnamaruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ | rocanterocanā divi
translation: 2 On both sides to the car they yoke the two bay coursers dear to him, Bold, tawny, bearers of the Chief. 3 Thou, making light where no light was, and form, O men: where form was not, Wast born together with the Dawns. 4 Thereafter they, as is their wont, threw off the state of babes unborn, Assuming sacrificial names. 5 Thou, Indra, with the Tempest-Gods, the breakers down of what is firm, Foundest the kine even in the cave. 6 Worshipping even as they list, singers laud him who findeth wealth, The far-renowned, the mighty One. 7 Mayest thou verily be seen coming by fearless Indra's side: Both joyous, equal in your sheen. 8 With Indra's well beloved hosts, the blameless, hastening to heaven, The sacrificer cries aloud. 9 Come from this place, O Wanderer, or downward from the light of heaven: Our songs of praise all yearn for this. 10 Indra we seek to give us help, from here, from heaven above the earth, Or from the spacious firmament.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 7
sanskrit: इन्द्रमिद गाथिनो बर्हदिन्द्रमर्केभिरर्किणः | इन्द्रं वाणीरनूषत
transliteration: indramid ghāthino bṛhadindramarkebhirarkiṇaḥ | indraṃ vāṇīranūṣata
translation: 2 Indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and word-yoked car, Indra the golden, thunder-armed. 3 Indra hath raised the Sun on high in heaven, that he may see afar: He burst the mountain for the kine. 4 Help us, O Indra, in the frays, yea, frays, where thousand spoils are gained, With awful aids, O awful One. 5 In mighty battle we invoke Indra, Indra in lesser fight, The Friend who bends his bolt at fiends. 6 Unclose, our manly Hero, thou for ever bounteous, yonder cloud, For us, thou irresistible. 7 Still higher, at each strain of mine, thunder-armed Indra's praises rise: I find no laud worthy of him. 8 Even as the bull drives on the herds, he drives the people with his might, The Ruler irresistible: 9 Indra who rules with single sway men, riches, and the fivefold race Of those who dwell upon the earth. 10 For your sake from each side we call Indra away from other men: Ours, and none others', may he be.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: एन्द्र सानसिं रयिं सजित्वानं सदासहम | वर्षिष्ठमूतये भर
transliteration: endra sānasiṃ rayiṃ sajitvānaṃ sadāsaham | varṣiṣṭhamūtaye bhara
translation: INDRA, bring wealth that gives delight, the victor's ever-conquering wealth, Most excellent, to be our aid;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: नि येन मुष्टिहत्यया नि वर्त्रा रुणधामहै | तवोतासो नयर्वता
transliteration: ni yena muṣṭihatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai | tvotāso nyarigvedaatā
translation: By means of which we may repel our foes in battle hand to hand, By thee assisted with the car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: इन्द्र तवोतास आ वयं वज्रं घना ददीमहि | जयेम सं युधि सप्र्धः
transliteration: indra tvotāsa ā vayaṃ vajraṃ ghanā dadīmahi | jayema saṃ yudhi spṛdhaḥ
translation: Aided by thee, the thunder-armed, Indra, may we lift up the bolt, And conquer all our foes in fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: वयं शूरेभिरस्त्र्भिरिन्द्र तवया युजा वयम | सासह्याम पर्तन्यतः
transliteration: vayaṃ śūrebhirastṛbhirindra tvayā yujā vayam | sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ
translation: With thee, O India, for ally with missile-darting heroes, may We conquer our embattled foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: महानिन्द्रः परश्च नु महित्वमस्तु वज्रिणे | दयौर्नप्रथिना शवः
transliteration: mahānindraḥ paraśca nu mahitvamastu vajriṇe | dyaurnaprathinā śavaḥ
translation: Mighty is Indra, yea supreme; greatness be his, the Thunderer: Wide as the heaven extends his power

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: समोहे वा य आशत नरस्तोकस्य सनितौ | विप्रासो वा धियायवः
transliteration: samohe vā ya āśata narastokasya sanitau | viprāso vā dhiyāyavaḥ
translation: Which aideth those to win them sons, who come as heroes to the fight, Or singers loving holy thoughts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: यः कुक्षिः सोमपातमः समुद्र इव पिन्वते | उर्वीरापो न काकुदः
transliteration: yaḥ kukṣiḥ somapātamaḥ samudra iva pinvate | urigvedaīrāpo na kākudaḥ
translation: His belly, drinking deepest draughts of Soma, like an ocean swells, Like wide streams from the cope of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: एवा हयस्य सून्र्ता विरप्शी गोमती मही | पक्वा शाखा न दाशुषे
transliteration: evā hyasya sūnṛtā virapśī ghomatī mahī | pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe
translation: So also is his excellence, great, vigorous, rich in cattle, like A ripe branch to the worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: एवा हि ते विभूतय ऊतय इन्द्र मावते | सद्यश्चित सन्तिदाशुषे
transliteration: evā hi te vibhūtaya ūtaya indra māvate | sadyaścit santidāśuṣe
translation: For verily thy mighty powers, Indra, are saving helps at once Unto a worshipper like me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 8
sanskrit: एवा हयस्य काम्या सतोम उक्थं च शंस्या | इन्द्राय सोमपीतये
transliteration: evā hyasya kāmyā stoma ukthaṃ ca śaṃsyā | indrāya somapītaye
translation: So are his lovely gifts; let lauds and praises be to Indra sung, That he may drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: इन्द्रेहि मत्स्यन्धसो विश्वेभिः सोमपर्वभिः | महानभिष्टिरोजसा
transliteration: indrehi matsyandhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparigvedaabhiḥ | mahānabhiṣṭirojasā
translation: COME, Indra, and delight thee with the juice at all the Soma feasts, Protector, mighty in thy strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: एमेनं सर्जता सुते मन्दिमिन्द्राय मन्दिने | चक्रिं विश्वानि चक्रये
transliteration: emenaṃ sṛjatā sute mandimindrāya mandine | cakriṃ viśvāni cakraye
translation: To Indra pour ye forth the juice, the active gladdening juice to him The gladdening, omnific God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: मत्स्वा सुशिप्र मन्दिभिः सतोमेभिर्विश्वचर्षणे | सचैषुसवनेष्वा
transliteration: matsvā suśipra mandibhiḥ stomebhirigvedaśvacarṣaṇe | sacaiṣusavaneṣvā
translation: O Lord of all men, fair of cheek, rejoice thee in the gladdening lauds, Present at these drink-offerings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अस्र्ग्रमिन्द्र ते गिरः परति तवामुदहासत | अजोषा वर्षभं पतिम
transliteration: asṛghramindra te ghiraḥ prati tvāmudahāsata | ajoṣā vṛṣabhaṃ patim
translation: Songs have outpoured themselves to thee, Indra, the strong, the guardian Lord, And raised themselves unsatisfied.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: सं चोदय चित्रमर्वाग राध इन्द्र वरेण्यम | असदित ते विभु परभु
transliteration: saṃ codaya citramarigvedaāgh rādha indra vareṇyam | asadit te vibhu prabhu
translation: Send to us bounty manifold, O Indra, worthy of' our wish, For power supreme is only thine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अस्मान सु तत्र चोदयेन्द्र राये रभस्वतः | तुविद्युम्न यशस्वतः
transliteration: asmān su tatra codayendra rāye rabhasvataḥ | tuvidyumna yaśasvataḥ
translation: O Indra, stimulate thereto us emulously fain for wealth, And glorious, O most splendid One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: सं गोमदिन्द्र वाजवदस्मे पर्थु शरवो बर्हत | विश्वायुर्धेह्यक्षितम
transliteration: saṃ ghomadindra vājavadasme pṛthu śravo bṛhat | viśvāyurdhehyakṣitam
translation: Give, Indra, wide and lofty fame, wealthy in cattle and in strength, Lasting our life-time, failing not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अस्मे धेहि शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं सहस्रसातमम | इन्द्र ता रथिनीरिषः
transliteration: asme dhehi śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ sahasrasātamam | indra tā rathinīriṣaḥ
translation: Grant us high fame, O Indra, grant riches bestowing thousands, those Fair fruits of earth borne home in wains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: वसोरिन्द्रं वसुपतिं गीर्भिर्ग्र्णन्त रग्मियम | होम गन्तारमूतये
transliteration: vasorindraṃ vasupatiṃ ghīrbhirghṛṇanta ṛghmiyam | homa ghantāramūtaye
translation: Praising with songs the praise-worthy who cometh to our aid, we call Indra, the Treasure-Lord of wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 9
sanskrit: सुते-सुते नयोकसे बर्हद बर्हत एदरिः | इन्द्राय शूषमर्चति
transliteration: sute-sute nyokase bṛhad bṛhata edariḥ | indrāya śūṣamarcati
translation: To lofty Indra, dweller by each libation, the pious man Sings forth aloud a strengthening hymn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 10
sanskrit: गायन्ति तवा गायत्रिणो.अर्चन्त्यर्कमर्किणः | बरह्माणस्त्वा शतक्रत उद वंशमिव येमिरे
transliteration: ghāyanti tvā ghāyatriṇo.arcantyarkamarkiṇaḥ | brahmāṇastvā śatakrata ud vaṃśamiva yemire
translation: THE chanters hymn thee, they who say the word of praise magnify thee. The priests have raised thee up on high, O Satakratu, like a pole.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यत सानोः सानुमारुहद भूर्यस्पष्ट कर्त्वम | तदिन्द्रो अर्थं चेतति यूथेन वर्ष्णिरेजति
transliteration: yat sānoḥ sānumāruhad bhūryaspaṣṭa kartvam | tadindro arthaṃ cetati yūthena vṛṣṇirejati
translation: As up he clomb from ridge to ridge and looked upon the toilsome task, Indra observes this wish of his, and the Rain hastens with his troop.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 10
sanskrit: युक्ष्वा हि केशिना हरी वर्षणा कक्ष्यप्रा | अथा न इन्द्र सोमपा गिरामुपश्रुतिं चर
transliteration: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣyaprā | athā na indra somapā ghirāmupaśrutiṃ cara
translation: Harness thy pair of strong bay steeds, long-maned, whose bodies fill the girths, And, Indra, Soma-drinker, come to listen to our songs of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 10
sanskrit: एहि सतोमानभि सवराभि गर्णीह्या रुव | बरह्म च नो वसोसचेन्द्र यज्ञं च वर्धय
transliteration: ehi stomānabhi svarābhi ghṛṇīhyā ruva | brahma ca no vasosacendra yajñaṃ ca vardhaya
translation: Come hither, answer thou the song, sing in approval, cry aloud. Good Indra, make our prayer succeed, and prosper this our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 10
sanskrit: उक्थमिन्द्राय शंस्यं वर्धनं पुरुनिष्षिधे | शक्रो यथा सुतेषु णो रारणत सख्येषु च
transliteration: ukthamindrāya śaṃsyaṃ vardhanaṃ puruniṣṣidhe |
translation: To Indra must a laud be said, to strengthen him who freely gives, That Sakra may take pleasure in our friendship and drink-offerings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: इन्द्रं विश्वा अवीव्र्धन समुद्रव्यचसं गिरः | रथीतमंरथीनां वाजानां सत्पतिं पतिम
transliteration: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhan samudravyacasaṃ ghiraḥ | rathītamaṃrathīnāṃ vājānāṃ satpatiṃ patim
translation: ALL sacred songs have magnified Indra expansive as the sea, The best of warriors borne on cars, the Lord, the very Lord of strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: सख्ये त इन्द्र वाजिनो मा भेम शवसस पते | तवामभि परणोनुमो जेतारमपराजितम
transliteration: sakhye ta indra vājino mā bhema śavasas pate | tvāmabhi praṇonumo jetāramaparājitam
translation: Strong in thy friendship, Indra, Lord of power and might, we have no fear. We glorify with praises thee, the never-conquered conqueror.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: पूर्वीरिन्द्रस्य रातयो न वि दस्यन्त्यूतयः | यदी वाजस्य गोमत सतोत्र्भ्यो मंहते मघम
transliteration: pūrigvedaīrindrasya rātayo na vi dasyantyūtayaḥ | yadī vājasya ghomata stotṛbhyo maṃhate magham
translation: The gifts of Indra from of old, his saving succours, never fail, When to the praise-singers he gives the boon of substance rich in kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: पुरां भिन्दुर्युवा कविरमितौजा अजायत | इन्द्रो विश्वस्यकर्मणो धर्ता वज्री पुरुष्टुतः
transliteration: purāṃ bhinduryuvā kaviramitaujā ajāyata | indro viśvasyakarmaṇo dhartā vajrī puruṣṭutaḥ
translation: Crusher of forts, the young, the wise, of strength unmeasured, was he born Sustainer of each sacred rite, Indra, the Thunderer, much-extolled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवं वलस्य गोमतो.अपावरद्रिवो बिलम | तवां देवा अबिभ्युषस्तुज्यमानास आविषुः
transliteration: tvaṃ valasya ghomato.apāvaradrivo bilam | tvāṃ devā abibhyuṣastujyamānāsa āviṣuḥ
translation: Lord of the thunder, thou didst burst the cave of Vala rich in cows. The Gods came pressing to thy side, and free from terror aided thee,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवाहं शूर रातिभिः परत्यायं सिन्धुमावदन | उपातिष्ठन्त गिर्वणो विदुष टे तस्य कारवः
transliteration: tavāhaṃ śūra rātibhiḥ pratyāyaṃ sindhumāvadan | upātiṣṭhanta ghirigvedaaṇo viduṣ ṭe tasya kāravaḥ
translation: I, Hero, through thy bounties am come to the flood addressing thee. Song-lover, here the singers stand and testify to thee thereof.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: मायाभिरिन्द्र मायिनं तवं शुष्णमवातिरः | विदुष टे तस्य मेधिरास्तेषां शरवांस्युत तिर
transliteration: māyābhirindra māyinaṃ tvaṃ śuṣṇamavātiraḥ | viduṣ ṭe tasya medhirāsteṣāṃ śravāṃsyut tira
translation: The wily Susna, Indra! thou o'er-threwest with thy wondrous powers. The wise beheld this deed of thine: now go beyond their eulogies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 11
sanskrit: इन्द्रमीशानमोजसाभि सतोमा अनूषत | सहस्रं यस्य रातय उत वा सन्ति भूयसीः
transliteration: indramīśānamojasābhi stomā anūṣata | sahasraṃ yasya rātaya uta vā santi bhūyasīḥ
translation: Our songs of praise have glorified Indra who ruleth by his might, Whose precious gifts in thousands come, yea, even more abundantly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्निं दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम | अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम
transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam | asya yajñasya sukratum
translation: I WE choose Agni the messenger, the herald, master of all wealth, Well skilled in this our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्निम-अग्निं हवीमभिः सदा हवन्त विश्पतिम | हव्यवाहं पुरुप्रियम
transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim | havyavāhaṃ purupriyam
translation: With callings ever they invoke Agni, Agni, Lord of the House, Oblation-bearer, much beloved.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्ने देवानिहा वह जज्ञानो वर्क्तबर्हिषे | असि होता न ईड्यः
transliteration: aghne devānihā vaha jajñāno vṛktabarhiṣe | asi hotā na īḍyaḥ
translation: Bring the Gods hither, Agni, born for him who strews the sacred grass: Thou art our herald, meet for praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: तानुशतो वि बोधय यदग्ने यासि दूत्यम | देवैरा सत्सि बर्हिषि
transliteration: tānuśato vi bodhaya yadaghne yāsi dūtyam | devairā satsi barhiṣi
translation: Wake up the willing Gods, since thou, Agni, performest embassage: Sit on the sacred grass with Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: घर्ताहवन दीदिवः परति षम रिषतो दह | अग्ने तवं रक्षस्विनः
transliteration: ghṛtāhavana dīdivaḥ prati ṣma riṣato daha | aghne tvaṃ rakṣasvinaḥ
translation: O Agni, radiant One, to whom the holy oil is poured, burn up Our enemies whom fiends protect.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्निनाग्निः समिध्यते कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा | हव्यवाड जुह्वास्यः
transliteration: aghnināghniḥ samidhyate kavirghṛhapatiryuvā | havyavāḍ juhvāsyaḥ
translation: By Agni Agni is inflamed, Lord of the House, wise, young, who bears The gift: the ladle is his mouth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: कविमग्निमुप सतुहि सत्यधर्माणमध्वरे | देवममीवचातनम
transliteration: kavimaghnimupa stuhi satyadharmāṇamadhvare | devamamīvacātanam
translation: Praise Agni in the sacrifice, the Sage whose ways are ever true, The God who driveth grief away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यस्त्वामग्ने हविष्पतिर्दूतं देव सपर्यति | तस्य सम पराविता भव
transliteration: yastvāmaghne haviṣpatirdūtaṃ deva saparyati | tasya sma prāvitā bhava
translation: God, Agni, be his strong defence who lord of sacrificial gifts, Worshippeth thee the messenger.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यो अग्निं देववीतये हविष्मानाविवासति | तस्मै पावक मर्ळय
transliteration: yo aghniṃ devavītaye haviṣmānāvivāsati | tasmai pāvaka mṛḷaya
translation: Whoso with sacred gift would fain call Agni to the feast of Gods, O Purifier, favour him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: स नः पावक दीदिवो.अग्ने देवानिहा वह | उप यज्ञं हविश्च नः
transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivo.aghne devānihā vaha | upa yajñaṃ haviśca naḥ
translation: Such, Agni, Purifier, bright, bring hither to our sacrifice, To our oblation bring the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: स न सतवान आ भर गायत्रेण नवीयसा | रयिं वीरवतीमिषम
transliteration: sa na stavāna ā bhara ghāyatreṇa navīyasā | rayiṃ vīravatīmiṣam
translation: So lauded by our newest song of praise bring opulence to us, And food, with heroes for our sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषा विश्वाभिर्देवहूतिभिः | इमं सतोमं जुषस्व नः
transliteration: aghne śukreṇa śociṣā viśvābhirdevahūtibhiḥ | imaṃ stomaṃ juṣasva naḥ
translation: O Agni, by effulgent flame, by all invokings of the Gods, Show pleasure in this laud of ours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सुसमिद्धो न आ वह देवानग्ने हविष्मते | होतः पावक यक्षि च
transliteration: susamiddho na ā vaha devānaghne haviṣmate | hotaḥ pāvaka yakṣi ca
translation: AGNI, well-kindled, bring the Gods for him who offers holy gifts. Worship them, Purifier, Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: मधुमन्तं तनूनपाद यज्ञं देवेषु नः कवे | अद्या कर्णुहि वीतये
transliteration: madhumantaṃ tanūnapād yajñaṃ deveṣu naḥ kave | adyā kṛṇuhi vītaye
translation: Son of Thyself, present, O Sage, our sacrifice to the Gods today. Sweet to the taste, that they may feast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: नराशंसमिह परियमस्मिन यज्ञ उप हवये | मधुजिह्वंहविष्क्र्तम
transliteration: narāśaṃsamiha priyamasmin yajña upa hvaye | madhujihvaṃhaviṣkṛtam
translation: Dear Narasamsa, sweet of tongue, the giver of oblations, I Invoke to this our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अग्ने सुखतमे रथे देवानीळित आ वह | असि होता मनुर्हितः
transliteration: aghne sukhatame rathe devānīḷita ā vaha | asi hotā manurhitaḥ
translation: Agni, on thy most easy car, glorified, hither bring the Gods: Manu appointed thee as Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सत्र्णीत बर्हिरानुषग घर्तप्र्ष्ठं मनीषिणः | यत्राम्र्तस्य चक्षणम
transliteration: stṛṇīta barhirānuṣagh ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ manīṣiṇaḥ | yatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇam
translation: Strew, O ye wise, the sacred grass that drips with oil, in order due, Where the Immortal is beheld.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: वि शरयन्तां रताव्र्धो दवारो देवीरसश्चतः | अद्या नूनं च यष्टवे
transliteration: vi śrayantāṃ ṛtāvṛdho dvāro devīrasaścataḥ | adyā nūnaṃ ca yaṣṭave
translation: Thrown open be the Doors Divine, unfailing, that assist the rite, For sacrifice this day and now.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: नक्तोषासा सुपेशसास्मिन यज्ञ उप हवये | इदं नो बर्हिरासदे
transliteration: naktoṣāsā supeśasāsmin yajña upa hvaye | idaṃ no barhirāsade
translation: I call the lovely Night and Dawn to seat them on the holy grass At this our solemn sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: ता सुजिह्वा उप हवये होतारा दैव्या कवी | यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमम
transliteration: tā sujihvā upa hvaye hotārā daivyā kavī | yajñaṃ no yakṣatāmimam
translation: The two Invokers I invite, the wise, divine and sweet of tongue, To celebrate this our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: इळा सरस्वती मही तिस्रो देवीर्मयोभुवः | बर्हिः सीदन्त्वस्रिधः
transliteration: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīrmayobhuvaḥ | barhiḥ sīdantvasridhaḥ
translation: Ila, Sarasvati, Mahi, three Goddesses who bring delight, Be seated, peaceful, on the grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: इह तवष्टारमग्रियं विश्वरूपमुप हवये | अस्माकमस्तुकेवलः
transliteration: iha tvaṣṭāramaghriyaṃ viśvarūpamupa hvaye | asmākamastukevalaḥ
translation: Tvastar I call, the earliest born, the wearer of all forms at will: May he be ours and curs alone.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अव सर्जा वनस्पते देव देवेभ्यो हविः | पर दातुरस्तु चेतनम
transliteration: ava sṛjā vanaspate deva devebhyo haviḥ | pra dāturastu cetanam
translation: God, Sovran of the Wood, present this our oblation to the Gods, And let the giver be renowned.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सवाहा यज्ञं कर्णोतनेन्द्राय यज्वनो गर्हे | तत्र देवानुप हवये
transliteration: svāhā yajñaṃ kṛṇotanendrāya yajvano ghṛhe | tatra devānupa hvaye
translation: With Svaha pay the sacrifice to Indra in the offerer's house: Thither I call the Deities.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 14
sanskrit: ऐभिरग्ने दुवो गिरो विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये | देवेभिर्याहि यक्षि च
transliteration: aibhiraghne duvo ghiro viśvebhiḥ somapītaye | devebhiryāhi yakṣi ca
translation: To drink the Soma, Agni, come, to our service and our songs. With all these Gods; and worship them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमं पिब रतुना तवा विशन्त्विन्दवः | मत्सरासस्तदोकसः
transliteration: indra somaṃ piba ṛtunā tvā viśantvindavaḥ | matsarāsastadokasaḥ
translation: O INDRA drink the Soma juice with Rtu; let the cheering drops Sink deep within, which settle there.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: मरुतः पिबत रतुना पोत्राद यज्ञं पुनीतन | यूयं हि षठा सुदानवः
transliteration: marutaḥ pibata ṛtunā potrād yajñaṃ punītana | yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānavaḥ
translation: Drink from the Purifier's cup, Maruts, with Rtu; sanctify The rite, for ye give precious gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अभि यज्ञं गर्णीहि नो गनावो नेष्टः पिब रतुना | तवंहि रत्नधा असि
transliteration: abhi yajñaṃ ghṛṇīhi no ghnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā | tvaṃhi ratnadhā asi
translation: O Nestar, with thy Dame accept our sacrifice; with Rtu drink, For thou art he who giveth wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्ने देवानिहा वह सादया योनिषु तरिषु | परि भूष पिब रतुना
transliteration: aghne devānihā vaha sādayā yoniṣu triṣu | pari bhūṣa piba ṛtunā
translation: Bring the Gods, Agni; in the three appointed places set them down: Surround them, and with Rtu drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: बराह्मणादिन्द्र राधसः पिबा सोमं रतून्रनु | तवेद धि सख्यमस्त्र्तम
transliteration: brāhmaṇādindra rādhasaḥ pibā somaṃ ṛtūnranu | taved dhi sakhyamastṛtam
translation: Drink Soma after the Rtus, from the Brahmana's bounty: undissolved, O Indra, is thy friendship's bond.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 15
sanskrit: युवं दक्षं धर्तव्रत मित्रावरुण दूळभम | रतुना यज्ञमाशाथे
transliteration: yuvaṃ dakṣaṃ dhṛtavrata mitrāvaruṇa dūḷabham |
translation: Mitra, Varuna, ye whose ways are firm--a Power that none deceives--, With Rtu ye have reached the rite.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: आ तवा वहन्तु हरयो वर्षणं सोमपीतये | इन्द्र तवा सूरचक्षसः
transliteration: indra tvā sūracakṣasaḥ
translation: LET thy Bay Steeds bring thee, the Strong, hither to drink the Soma draught-- Those, Indra, who are bright as suns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: इमा धाना घर्तस्नुवो हरी इहोप वक्षतः | इन्द्रं सुखतमे रथे
transliteration: imā dhānā ghṛtasnuvo harī ihopa vakṣataḥ | indraṃ sukhatame rathe
translation: Here are the grains bedewed with oil: hither let the Bay Coursers bring Indra upon his easiest car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: इन्द्रं परातर्हवामह इन्द्रं परयत्यध्वरे | इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये
transliteration: indraṃ prātarhavāmaha indraṃ prayatyadhvare | indraṃ somasya pītaye
translation: Indra at early morn we call, Indra in course of sacrifice, Indra to drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: उप नः सुतमा गहि हरिभिरिन्द्र केशिभिः | सुते हि तवाहवामहे
transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā ghahi haribhirindra keśibhiḥ | sute hi tvāhavāmahe
translation: Come hither, with thy long-maned Steeds, O Indra, to the draught we pour We call thee when the juice is shed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: सेमं न सतोमं आ गह्युपेदं सवनं सुतम | गौरो नत्र्षितः पिब
transliteration: semaṃ na stomaṃ ā ghahyupedaṃ savanaṃ sutam | ghauro natṛṣitaḥ piba
translation: Come thou to this our song of praise, to the libation poured for thee Drink of it like a stag athirst.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: इमे सोमास इन्दवः सुतासो अधि बर्हिषि | तानिन्द्र सहसेपिब
transliteration: ime somāsa indavaḥ sutāso adhi barhiṣi | tānindra sahasepiba
translation: Here are the drops of Soma juice expressed on sacred grass: thereof Drink, Indra, to increase thy might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: अयं ते सतोमो अग्रियो हर्दिस्प्र्गस्तु शन्तमः | अथा सोमंसुतं पिब
transliteration: ayaṃ te stomo aghriyo hṛdispṛghastu śantamaḥ | athā somaṃsutaṃ piba
translation: Welcome to thee be this our hymn, reaching thy heart, most excellent: Then drink the Soma juice expressed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: विश्वमित सवनं सुतमिन्द्रो मदाय गछति | वर्त्रहा सोमपीतये
transliteration: viśvamit savanaṃ sutamindro madāya ghachati | vṛtrahā somapītaye
translation: To every draught of pressed-out juice Indra, the Vrtra-slayer, comes, To drink the Soma for delight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 16
sanskrit: सेमं नः काममा पर्ण गोभिरश्वैः शतक्रतो | सतवाम तवा सवाध्यः
transliteration: semaṃ naḥ kāmamā pṛṇa ghobhiraśvaiḥ śatakrato | stavāma tvā svādhyaḥ
translation: Fulfil, O Satakratu, all our wish with horses and with kine: With holy thoughts we sing thy praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणयोरहं सम्राजोरव आ वर्णे | ता नो मर्ळातीद्र्शे
transliteration: indrāvaruṇayorahaṃ samrājorava ā vṛṇe | tā no mṛḷātaīdṛśe
translation: I CRAVE help from the Imperial Lords, from Indra-Varuna; may they Both favour one of us like me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: गन्तारा हि सथो.अवसे हवं विप्रस्य मावतः | धर्ताराचर्षणीनाम
transliteration: ghantārā hi stho.avase havaṃ viprasya māvataḥ | dhartārācarṣaṇīnām
translation: Guardians of men, ye ever come with ready succour at the call Of every singer such as I.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अनुकामं तर्पयेथामिन्द्रावरुण राय आ | ता वां नेदिष्ठमीमहे
transliteration: anukāmaṃ tarpayethāmindrāvaruṇa rāya ā | tā vāṃ nediṣṭhamīmahe
translation: Sate you, according to your wish, O Indra-Varuna, with wealth: Fain would we have you nearest us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: युवाकु हि शचीनां युवाकु सुमतीनाम | भूयाम वाजदाव्नाम
transliteration: yuvāku hi śacīnāṃ yuvāku sumatīnām | bhūyāma vājadāvnām
translation: May we be sharers of the powers, sharers of the benevolence Of you who give strength bounteously.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सहस्रदाव्नां वरुणः शंस्यानाम | करतुर्भवत्युक्थ्यः
transliteration: indraḥ sahasradāvnāṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃsyānām | kraturbhavatyukthyaḥ
translation: Indra and Varuna, among givers of thousands, meet for praise, Are Powers who merit highest laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तयोरिदवसा वयं सनेम नि च धीमहि | सयादुत पररेचनम
transliteration: tayoridavasā vayaṃ sanema ni ca dhīmahi | syāduta prarecanam
translation: Through their protection may we gain great store of wealth, and heap it up Enough and still to spare, be ours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुण वामहं हुवे चित्राय राधसे | अस्मान सु जिग्युषस कर्तम
transliteration: indrāvaruṇa vāmahaṃ huve citrāya rādhase | asmān su jighyuṣas kṛtam
translation: O Indra-Varuna, on you for wealth in many a form I call: Still keep ye us victorious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुण नू नु वां सिषासन्तीषु धीष्वा | अस्मभ्यं शर्म यछतम
transliteration: indrāvaruṇa nū nu vāṃ siṣāsantīṣu dhīṣvā | asmabhyaṃ śarma yachatam
translation: O Indra-Varuna, through our songs that seek to win you to ourselves, Give us at once your sheltering help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 17
sanskrit: पर वामश्नोतु सुष्टुतिरिन्द्रावरुण यां हुवे | यां रधाथे सधस्तुतिम
transliteration: pra vāmaśnotu suṣṭutirindrāvaruṇa yāṃ huve | yāṃ ṛdhāthe sadhastutim
translation: O Indra-Varuna, to you may fair praise which I offer come, Joint eulogy which ye dignify.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: सोमानं सवरणं कर्णुहि बरह्मणस पते | कक्षीवन्तं याुशिजः
transliteration: somānaṃ svaraṇaṃ kṛṇuhi brahmaṇas pate | kakṣīvantaṃ yāuśijaḥ
translation: O BRAHMANAPSATI, make him who presses Soma glorious, Even Kaksivan Ausija.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: यो रेवान यो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः | स नः सिषक्तु यस्तुरः
transliteration: yo revān yo amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ | sa naḥ siṣaktu yasturaḥ
translation: The rich, the healer of disease, who giveth wealth, increaseth store, The prompt,--may he be with us still.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: मा नः शंसो अररुषो धूर्तिः परणं मर्त्यस्य | रक्षा णो बरह्मणस पते
transliteration: mā naḥ śaṃso araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṃ martyasya | rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇas pate
translation: Let not the foeman's curse, let not a mortal's onslaught fall on us Preserve us, Brahmanaspati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: स घा वीरो न रिष्यति यमिन्द्रो बरह्मणस पतिः | सोमो हिनोति मर्त्यम
transliteration: sa ghā vīro na riṣyati yamindro brahmaṇas patiḥ | somo hinoti martyam
translation: Ne'er is the mortal hero harmed whom Indra, Brahmanaspati, And Soma graciously inspire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तवं तं बरह्मणस पते सोम इन्द्रश्च मर्त्यम | दक्षिणा पात्वंहसः
transliteration: tvaṃ taṃ brahmaṇas pate soma indraśca martyam | dakṣiṇā pātvaṃhasaḥ
translation: Do, thou, O Brahmanaspati, and Indra, Soma, Daksina, Preserve that mortal from distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: सदसस पतिमद्भुतं परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम | सनिं मेधामयासिषम
transliteration: sadasas patimadbhutaṃ priyamindrasya kāmyam | saniṃ medhāmayāsiṣam
translation: To the Assembly's wondrous Lord, to Indra's lovely Friend who gives Wisdom, have I drawn near in prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 18
sanskrit: यस्माद रते न सिध्यति यज्ञो विपश्चितश्चन | स धीनां योगमिन्वति
transliteration: yasmād ṛte na sidhyati yajño vipaścitaścana | sa dhīnāṃ yoghaminvati
translation: He without whom no sacrifice, e'en of the wise man, prospers; he Stirs up the series of thoughts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: परति तयं चारुमध्वरं गोपीथाय पर हूयसे | मरुद्भिरग्न आ गहि
transliteration: prati tyaṃ cārumadhvaraṃ ghopīthāya pra hūyase | marudbhiraghna ā ghahi
translation: To this fair sacrifice to drink the milky draught thou art invoked: O Agni, with the Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: नहि देवो न मर्त्यो महस्तव करतुं परः | म...
transliteration: nahi devo na martyo mahastava kratuṃ paraḥ | ma...
translation: No mortal man, no God exceeds thy mental power, O Mighty one: O Agni, with the Maruts come:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: ये महो रजसो विदुर्विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः | म...
transliteration: ye maho rajaso vidurigvedaśve devāso adruhaḥ | ma...
translation: All Gods devoid of guile, who know the mighty region of mid-air: O Agni, with those Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: य उग्रा अर्कमान्र्चुरनाध्र्ष्टास ओजसा | म...
transliteration: ya ughrā arkamānṛcuranādhṛṣṭāsa ojasā | ma...
translation: The terrible, who sing their song, not to be overcome by might: O Agni, with those Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: ये शुभ्रा घोरवर्पसः सुक्षत्रासो रिशादसः | म...
transliteration: ye śubhrā ghoravarpasaḥ sukṣatrāso riśādasaḥ | ma...
translation: Brilliant, and awful in their form, mighty, devourers of their foes': O Agni, with those Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: ये नाकस्याधि रोचने दिवि देवास आसते | म...
transliteration: ye nākasyādhi rocane divi devāsa āsate | ma...
translation: Who sit as Deities in heaven, above the sky-vault's luminous sphere: O Agni, with those Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 19
sanskrit: य ईङखयन्ति पर्वतान तिरः समुद्रमर्णवम | म...
transliteration: ya īṅkhayanti parigvedaatān tiraḥ samudramarṇavam | ma...
translation: Who scatter clouds about the sky, away over the billowy sea: O Agni, with those Maruts come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अयं देवाय जन्मने सतोमो विप्रेभिरासया | अकारि रत्नधातमः
transliteration: ayaṃ devāya janmane stomo viprebhirāsayā | akāri ratnadhātamaḥ
translation: FOR the Celestial Race this song of praise which gives wealth lavishly Was made by singers with their lips.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 20
sanskrit: य इन्द्राय वचोयुजा ततक्षुर्मनसा हरी | शमीभिर्यज्ञमाशत
transliteration: ya indrāya vacoyujā tatakṣurmanasā harī |
translation: They who for Indra, with their mind, formed horses harnessed by a word, Attained by works to sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इहेन्द्राग्नी उप हवये तयोरित सतोममुश्मसि | ता सोमं सोमपातमा
transliteration: ihendrāghnī upa hvaye tayorit stomamuśmasi | tā somaṃ somapātamā
translation: INDRA and Agni I invoke fain are we for their song of praise: Chief Soma-drinkers are they both.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: ता यज्ञेषु पर शंसतेन्द्राग्नी शुम्भता नरः | ता गायत्रेषु गायत
transliteration: tā yajñeṣu pra śaṃsatendrāghnī śumbhatā naraḥ | tā ghāyatreṣu ghāyata
translation: Praise ye, O men, and glorify Indra-Agni in the holy rites: Sing praise to them in sacred songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: ता मित्रस्य परशस्तय इन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे | सोमपा सोमपीतये
transliteration: tā mitrasya praśastaya indrāghnī tā havāmahe | somapā somapītaye
translation: Indra and Agni we invite, the Soma-drinkers, for the fame Of Mitra, to the Soma-draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: उग्रा सन्ता हवामह उपेदं सवनं सुतम | इन्द्राग्नी एह गछताम
transliteration: ughrā santā havāmaha upedaṃ savanaṃ sutam | indrāghnī eha ghachatām
translation: Strong Gods, we bid them come to this libation that stands ready here: Indra and Agni, come to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: ता महान्ता सदस्पती इन्द्राग्नी रक्ष उब्जतम | अप्रजाःसन्त्वत्रिणः
transliteration: tā mahāntā sadaspatī indrāghnī rakṣa ubjatam | aprajāḥsantvatriṇaḥ
translation: Indra and Agni, mighty Lords of our assembly, crush the fiends: Childless be the devouring ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तेन सत्येन जाग्र्तमधि परचेतुने पदे | इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यछतम
transliteration: tena satyena jāghṛtamadhi pracetune pade | indrāghnī śarma yachatam
translation: Watch ye, through this your truthfulness, there in the place of spacious view Indra and Agni, send us bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: परातर्युजा वि बोधयाश्विनावेह गछताम | अस्य सोमस्य पीतये
transliteration: prātaryujā vi bodhayāśvināveha ghachatām | asya somasya pītaye
translation: WAKEN the Asvin Pair who yoke their car at early morn: may they Approach to drink this Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: या सुरथा रथीतमोभा देवा दिविस्प्र्शा | अश्विना ता हवामहे
transliteration: yā surathā rathītamobhā devā divispṛśā | aśvinā tā havāmahe
translation: We call the Asvins Twain, the Gods borne in a noble car, the best Of charioteers, who reach the heavens.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: या वां कशा मधुमत्यश्विना सून्र्तावती | तया यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम
transliteration: yā vāṃ kaśā madhumatyaśvinā sūnṛtāvatī | tayā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam
translation: Dropping with honey is your whip, Asvins, and full of pleasantness Sprinkle therewith the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: नहि वामस्ति दूरके यत्रा रथेन गछथः | अश्विना सोमिनो गर्हम
transliteration: nahi vāmasti dūrake yatrā rathena ghachathaḥ | aśvinā somino ghṛham
translation: As ye go thither in your car, not far, O Asvins, is the home Of him who offers Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: हिरण्यपाणिमूतये सवितारमुप हवये | स चेत्ता देवतापदम
transliteration: hiraṇyapāṇimūtaye savitāramupa hvaye | sa cettā devatāpadam
translation: For my protection I invoke the golden-handed Savitar. He knoweth, as a God, the place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अपां नपातमवसे सवितारमुप सतुहि | तस्य वरतान्युश्मसि
transliteration: apāṃ napātamavase savitāramupa stuhi | tasya vratānyuśmasi
translation: That he may send us succour, praise the Waters' Offspring Savitar: Fain are we for his holy ways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: विभक्तारं हवामहे वसोश्चित्रस्य राधसः | सवितारंन्र्चक्षसम
transliteration: vibhaktāraṃ havāmahe vasościtrasya rādhasaḥ | savitāraṃnṛcakṣasam
translation: We call on him, distributer of wondrous bounty and of wealth, On Savitar who looks on men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: सखाय आ नि षीदत सविता सतोम्यो नु नः | दाता राधांसि शुम्भति
transliteration: sakhāya ā ni ṣīdata savitā stomyo nu naḥ | dātā rādhāṃsi śumbhati
translation: Come hither, friends, and seat yourselves Savitar, to be praised by us, Giving good gifts, is beautiful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अग्ने पत्नीरिहा वह देवानामुशतीरुप | तवष्टारं सोमपीतये
transliteration: aghne patnīrihā vaha devānāmuśatīrupa | tvaṣṭāraṃ somapītaye
translation: O Agni, hither bring to us the willing Spouses of the Gods, And Tvastar, to the Soma draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 23
sanskrit: तीव्राः सोमास आ गह्याशीर्वन्तः सुता इमे | वायो तान परस्थितान पिब
transliteration: tīvrāḥ somāsa ā ghahyāśīrigvedaantaḥ sutā ime | vāyo tān prasthitān piba
translation: STRONG are the Somas; come thou nigh; these juices have been mixt with milk: Drink, Vayu, the presented draughts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 23
sanskrit: उभा देवा दिविस्प्र्शेन्द्रवायू हवामहे | अस्य सोमस्य पीतये
transliteration: ubhā devā divispṛśendravāyū havāmahe | asya somasya pītaye
translation: Both Deities who touch the heaven, Indra and Vayu we invoke To drink of this our soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 23
sanskrit: इन्द्रवायू मनोजुवा विप्रा हवन्त ऊतये | सहस्राक्षा धियस पती
transliteration: indravāyū manojuvā viprā havanta ūtaye | sahasrākṣā dhiyas patī
translation: The singers' for their aid, invoke Indra and Vayu, swift as mind, The thousand-eyed, the Lords of thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 23
sanskrit: मित्रं वयं हवामहे वरुणं सोमपीतये | जज्ञाना पूतदक्षसा
transliteration: mitraṃ vayaṃ havāmahe varuṇaṃ somapītaye | jajñānā pūtadakṣasā
translation: Mitra and Varuna, renowned as Gods of consecrated might, We call to drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: कस्य नूनं कतमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम | को नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च
transliteration: kasya nūnaṃ katamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma | ko no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca
translation: WHO now is he, what God among Immortals, of whose auspicious name we may bethink us? Who shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्नेर्वयं परथमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम | स नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च
transliteration: aghnerigvedaayaṃ prathamasyāmṛtānāṃ manāmahe cāru devasya nāma | sa no mahyā aditaye punardāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyaṃ mātaraṃ ca
translation: Agni the God the first among the Immortals,--of his auspicious name let us bethink us. He shall to mighty Aditi restore us, that I may see my Father and my Mother.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अभि तवा देव सवितरीशानं वार्याणाम | सदावन भागमीमहे
transliteration: abhi tvā deva savitarīśānaṃ vāryāṇām | sadāvan bhāghamīmahe
translation: To thee, O Savitar, the Lord of precious things, who helpest us Continually, for our share we come-

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: यश्चिद धि त इत्था भगः शशमानः पुरा निदः | अद्वेषो हस्तयोर्दधे
transliteration: yaścid dhi ta itthā bhaghaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ | adveṣo hastayordadhe
translation: Wealth, highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it, which is laid, Free from all hatred, in thy hands

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: भगभक्तस्य ते वयमुदशेम तवावसा | मूर्धानं राय आरभे
transliteration: bhaghabhaktasya te vayamudaśema tavāvasā | mūrdhānaṃ rāya ārabhe
translation: Through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence Which Bhaga hath dealt out to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: नहि ते कषत्रं न सहो न मन्युं वयश्चनामी पतयन्त आपुः | नेमा आपो अनिमिषं चरन्तीर्न ये वातस्य परमिनन्त्यभ्वम
transliteration: nahi te kṣatraṃ na saho na manyuṃ vayaścanāmī patayanta āpuḥ | nemā āpo animiṣaṃ carantīrna ye vātasya praminantyabhvam
translation: Ne'er have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit; Nor these the waters that flow on for ever, nor hills, abaters of the wind's wild fury.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अबुध्ने राजा वरुणो वनस्योर्ध्वं सतूपं ददते पूतदक्षः | नीचीना सथुरुपरि बुध्न एषामस्मे अन्तर्निहिताःकेतवः सयुः
transliteration: abudhne rājā varuṇo vanasyordhvaṃ stūpaṃ dadate pūtadakṣaḥ | nīcīnā sthurupari budhna eṣāmasme antarnihitāḥketavaḥ syuḥ
translation: Varuna, King, of hallowed might, sustaineth erect the Tree's stem in the baseless region. Its rays, whose root is high above, stream downward. Deep may they sink within us, and be hidden.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 24
sanskrit: उरुं हि राजा वरुणश्चकार सूर्याय पन्थामन्वेतवा उ | अपदे पादा परतिधातवे.अकरुतापवक्ता हर्दयाविधश्चित
transliteration: uruṃ hi rājā varuṇaścakāra sūryāya panthāmanvetavā u | apade pādā pratidhātave.akarutāpavaktā hṛdayāvidhaścit
translation: King Varuna hath made a spacious pathway, a pathway for the Sun wherein to travel. Where no way was he made him set his footstep, and warned afar whate'er afflicts the spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: यच्चिद धि ते विशो यथा पर देव वरुण वरतम | मिनीमसिद्यवि-दयवि
transliteration: yaccid dhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam | minīmasidyavi-dyavi
translation: WHATEVER law of thine, O God, O Varuna, as we are men, Day after day we violate.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: मा नो वधाय हत्नवे जिहीळानस्य रीरधः | मा हर्णानस्य मन्यवे
transliteration: mā no vadhāya hatnave jihīḷānasya rīradhaḥ | mā hṛṇānasya manyave
translation: give us not as a prey to death, to be destroyed by thee in wrath, To thy fierce anger when displeased.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: वि मर्ळीकाय ते मनो रथीरश्वं न सन्दितम | गीर्भिर्वरुण सीमहि
transliteration: vi mṛḷīkāya te mano rathīraśvaṃ na sanditam | ghīrbhirigvedaaruṇa sīmahi
translation: To gain thy mercy, Varuna, with hymns we bind thy heart, as binds The charioteer his tethered horse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: परा हि मे विमन्यवः पतन्ति वस्यैष्टये | वयो न वसतीरुप
transliteration: parā hi me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasyaiṣṭaye | vayo na vasatīrupa
translation: They flee from me dispirited, bent only on obtaining wealths As to their nests the birds of air.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: कदा कषत्रश्रियं नरमा वरुणं करामहे | मर्ळीकायोरुचक्षसम
transliteration: kadā kṣatraśriyaṃ naramā varuṇaṃ karāmahe | mṛḷīkāyorucakṣasam
translation: When shall we bring, to be appeased, the Hero, Lord of warrior might, Him, the far-seeing Varuna?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तदित समानमाशाते वेनन्ता न पर युछतः | धर्तव्रताय दाशुषे
transliteration: tadit samānamāśāte venantā na pra yuchataḥ | dhṛtavratāya dāśuṣe
translation: This, this with joy they both accept in common: never do they fail The ever-faithful worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: वेदा यो वीनां पदमन्तरिक्षेण पतताम | वेद नावः समुद्रियः
transliteration: vedā yo vīnāṃ padamantarikṣeṇa patatām | veda nāvaḥ samudriyaḥ
translation: He knows the path of birds that fly through heaven, and, Sovran of the sea, He knows the ships that are thereon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: वेद मासो धर्तव्रतो दवादश परजावतः | वेदा य उपजायते
transliteration: veda māso dhṛtavrato dvādaśa prajāvataḥ | vedā ya upajāyate
translation: True to his holy law, he knows the twelve moons with their progeny: He knows the moon of later birth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: वेद वातस्य वर्तनिमुरोर्र्ष्वस्य बर्हतः | वेदा ये अध्यासते
transliteration: veda vātasya vartanimurorṛṣvasya bṛhataḥ | vedā ye adhyāsate
translation: He knows the pathway of the wind, the spreading, high, and mighty wind: He knows the Gods who dwell above.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: नि षसाद धर्तव्रतो वरुणः पस्त्यास्वा | साम्राज्याय सुक्रतुः
transliteration: ni ṣasāda dhṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsvā | sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ
translation: Varuna, true to holy law, sits down among his people; he, Most wise, sits there to govern all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अतो विश्वान्यद्भुता चिकित्वानभि पश्यति | कर्तानि या चकर्त्वा
transliteration: ato viśvānyadbhutā cikitvānabhi paśyati | kṛtāni yā cakartvā
translation: From thence percerving he beholds all wondrous things, both what hath been, And what hereafter will be done.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: स नो विश्वाहा सुक्रतुरादित्यः सुपथा करत | पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत
transliteration: sa no viśvāhā sukraturādityaḥ supathā karat | pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translation: May that Aditya, very wise, make fair paths for us all our days: May he prolong our lives for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: बिभ्रद दरापिं हिरण्ययं वरुणो वस्त निर्णिजम | परि सपशो नि षेदिरे
transliteration: bibhrad drāpiṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇo vasta nirṇijam | pari spaśo ni ṣedire
translation: Varuna, wearing golden mail, hath clad him in a shining robe. His spies are seated found about.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: न यं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवो न दरुह्वाणो जनानाम | न देवमभिमातयः
transliteration: na yaṃ dipsanti dipsavo na druhvāṇo janānām | na devamabhimātayaḥ
translation: The God whom enemies threaten not, nor those who tyrannize o'er men, Nor those whose minds are bent on wrong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: उत यो मानुषेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या | अस्माकमुदरेष्वा
transliteration: uta yo mānuṣeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā | asmākamudareṣvā
translation: He who gives glory to mankind, not glory that is incomplete, To our own bodies giving it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: परा मे यन्ति धीतयो गावो न गव्यूतीरनु | इछन्तीरुरुचक्षसम
transliteration: parā me yanti dhītayo ghāvo na ghavyūtīranu | ichantīrurucakṣasam
translation: Yearning for the wide-seeing One, my thoughts move onward unto him, As kine unto their pastures move.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: सं नु वोचावहै पुनर्यतो मे मध्वाभ्र्तम | होतेव कषदसे परियम
transliteration: saṃ nu vocāvahai punaryato me madhvābhṛtam | hoteva kṣadase priyam
translation: Once more together let us speak, because my meath is brought: priest-like Thou eatest what is dear to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: दर्शं नु विश्वदर्षतं दर्शं रथमधि कषमि | एता जुषत मे गिरः
transliteration: darśaṃ nu viśvadarṣataṃ darśaṃ rathamadhi kṣami | etā juṣata me ghiraḥ
translation: Now saw I him whom all may see, I saw his car above the earth: He hath accepted these my songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: इमं मे वरुण शरुधी हवमद्या च मर्ळय | तवामवस्युरा चके
transliteration: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havamadyā ca mṛḷaya | tvāmavasyurā cake
translation: Varuna, hear this call of mine: be gracious unto us this day Longing for help I cried to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तवं विश्वस्य मेधिर दिवश्च गमश्च राजसि | स यामनिप्रति शरुधि
transliteration: tvaṃ viśvasya medhira divaśca ghmaśca rājasi | sa yāmaniprati śrudhi
translation: Thou, O wise God, art Lord of all, thou art the King of earth and heaven Hear, as thou goest on thy way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 25
sanskrit: उदुत्तमं मुमुग्धि नो वि पाशं मध्यमं चर्त | अवाधमानि जीवसे
transliteration: uduttamaṃ mumughdhi no vi pāśaṃ madhyamaṃ cṛta | avādhamāni jīvase
translation: Release us from the upper bond, untie the bond between, and loose The bonds below, that I may live.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 26
sanskrit: वसिष्वा हि मियेध्य वस्त्राण्यूर्जां पते | सेमं नो अध्वरं यज
transliteration: vasiṣvā hi miyedhya vastrāṇyūrjāṃ pate | semaṃ no adhvaraṃ yaja
translation: O WORTHY of oblation, Lord of prospering powers, assume thy robes, And offer this our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 26
sanskrit: नि नो होता वरेण्यः सदा यविष्ठ मन्मभिः | अग्ने दिवित्मता वचः
transliteration: ni no hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manmabhiḥ | aghne divitmatā vacaḥ
translation: Sit ever to be chosen, as our Priest, most youthful, through our hymns, O Agni, through our heavenly word.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 27
sanskrit: अश्वं न तवा वारवन्तं वन्दध्या अग्निं नमोभिः | सम्राजन्तमध्वराणाम
transliteration: aśvaṃ na tvā vāravantaṃ vandadhyā aghniṃ namobhiḥ | samrājantamadhvarāṇām
translation: WITH worship will I glorify thee, Agni, like a long-tailed steed, Imperial Lord of sacred rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 27
sanskrit: स घा नः सूनुः शवसा पर्थुप्रगामा सुशेवः | मीढ्वानस्माकं बभूयात
transliteration: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthupraghāmā suśevaḥ | mīḍhvānasmākaṃ babhūyāt
translation: May the far-striding Son of Strength, bringer of great felicity, Who pours his gifts like rain, be ours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 27
sanskrit: स नो दूराच्चासाच्च नि मर्त्यादघायोः | पाहि सदमिद विश्वायुः
transliteration: sa no dūrāccāsācca ni martyādaghāyoḥ | pāhi sadamid viśvāyuḥ
translation: Lord of all life, from near; from far, do thou, O Agni evermore Protect us from the sinful man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 27
sanskrit: इममू षु तवमस्माकं सनिं गायत्रं नव्यांसम | अग्ने देवेषु पर वोचः
transliteration: imamū ṣu tvamasmākaṃ saniṃ ghāyatraṃ navyāṃsam | aghne deveṣu pra vocaḥ
translation: O Agni, graciously announce this our oblation to the Gods, And this our newest song of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यत्र गरावा पर्थुबुध्न ऊर्ध्वो भवति सोतवे | उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः
transliteration: yatra ghrāvā pṛthubudhna ūrdhvo bhavati sotave | ulūkhalasutānāmaved vindra jalghulaḥ
translation: THERE where the broad-based stone raised on high to press the juices out, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यत्र दवाविव जघनाधिषवण्या कर्ता | उलू...
transliteration: yatra dvāviva jaghanādhiṣavaṇyā kṛtā | ulū...
translation: Where, like broad hips, to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यत्र नार्यपच्यवमुपच्यवं च शिक्षते | उलू...
transliteration: yatra nāryapacyavamupacyavaṃ ca śikṣate | ulū...
translation: There where the woman marks and leans the pestle's constant rise and fall, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यत्र मन्थां विबध्नते रश्मीन यमितवा इव | उलू...
transliteration: yatra manthāṃ vibadhnate raśmīn yamitavā iva | ulū...
translation: Where, as with reins to guide a horse, they bind the churning-staff with cords, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यच्चिद धि तवं गर्हेग्र्ह उलूखलक युज्यसे | इह दयुमत्तमं वद यजतामिव दुन्दुभिः
transliteration: yaccid dhi tvaṃ ghṛheghṛha ulūkhalaka yujyase | iha dyumattamaṃ vada yajatāmiva dundubhiḥ
translation: If of a truth in every house, O Mortar thou art set for work, Here give thou forth thy clearest sound, loud as the drum of conquerors.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 28
sanskrit: उत सम ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित | अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल
transliteration: uta sma te vanaspate vāto vi vātyaghramit | atho indrāya pātave sunu somamulūkhala
translation: O Sovran of the Forest, as the wind blows soft in front of thee, Mortar, for Indra press thou forth the Soma juice that he may drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 29
sanskrit: यच्चिद धि सत्य सोमपा अनाशस्ता इव समसि | आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु सुभ्रिषु सहस्रेषु तुवीमघ
transliteration: yaccid dhi satya somapā anāśastā iva smasi |
translation: O SOMA DRINKER, ever true, utterly hopeless though we be, Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 30
sanskrit: आ व इन्द्रं करिविं यथा वाजयन्तः शतक्रतुम | मंहिष्ठं सिञ्च इन्दुभिः
transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ siñca indubhiḥ
translation: WE seeking strength with Soma-drops fill full your Indra like a well, Most liberal, Lord of Hundred Powers,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरा रषिर्देवो देवानामभवः शिवः सखा | तव वरते कवयो विद्मनापसो.अजायन्त मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः
transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirā ṛṣirdevo devānāmabhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā | tava vrate kavayo vidmanāpaso.ajāyanta maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ
translation: Thou, Agni, wast the earliest Angiras, a Seer; thou wast, a God thyself, the Gods' auspicious Friend. After thy holy ordinance the Maruts, sage, active through wisdom, with their glittering spears, were born.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरस्तमः कविर्देवानां परि भूषसिव्रतम | विभुर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय मेधिरो दविमाता शयुः कतिधा चिदायवे
transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo aṅghirastamaḥ kavirdevānāṃ pari bhūṣasivratam | vibhurigvedaśvasmai bhuvanāya medhiro dvimātā śayuḥ katidhā cidāyave
translation: O Agni, thou, the best and earliest Angiras, fulfillest as a Sage the holy law of Gods. Sprung from two mothers, wise, through all existence spread, resting in many a place for sake of living man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवमग्ने परथमो मातरिश्वन आविर्भव सुक्रतूया विवस्वते | अरेजेतां रोदसी होत्र्वूर्ये.असघ्नोर्भारमयजो महोवसो
transliteration: tvamaghne prathamo mātariśvana āvirbhava sukratūyā vivasvate | arejetāṃ rodasī hotṛvūrye.asaghnorbhāramayajo mahovaso
translation: To Matarisvan first thou, Agni, wast disclosed, and to Vivasvan through thy noble inward power. Heaven and Earth, Vasu! shook at the choosing of the Priest: the burthen thou didst bear, didst worship mighty Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवमग्ने मनवे दयामवाशयः पुरूरवसे सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः | शवात्रेण यत पित्रोर्मुच्यसे पर्या तवा पूर्वमनयन्नापरं पुनः
transliteration: tvamaghne manave dyāmavāśayaḥ purūravase sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ |
translation: Agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind; thou, yet more pious, for pious Pururavas. When thou art rapidly freed from thy parents, first eastward they bear thee round, and, after, to the west.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 32
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि पर वोचं यानि चकार परथमानि वज्री | अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द पर वक्षणा अभिनत पर्वतानाम
transliteration: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī | ahannahimanvapastatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parigvedaatānām
translation: I WILL declare the manly deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved, the Thunder-wielder. He slew the Dragon, then disclosed the waters, and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं तवष्टास्मै वज्रं सवर्यं ततक्ष | वाश्रा इव धेनवः सयन्दमाना अञ्जः समुद्रमव जग्मुरापः
transliteration: ahannahiṃ parigvedaate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭāsmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa | vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānā añjaḥ samudramava jaghmurāpaḥ
translation: He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: his heavenly bolt of thunder Tvastar fashioned. Like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 32
sanskrit: वर्षायमाणो.अव्र्णीत सोमं तरिकद्रुकेष्वपिबत सुतस्य | आसायकं मघवादत्त वज्रमहन्नेनं परथमजामहीनाम
transliteration: vṛṣāyamāṇo.avṛṇīta somaṃ trikadrukeṣvapibat sutasya |
translation: Impetuous as a bull, he chose the Soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices. Maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon, and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: एतायामोप गव्यन्त इन्द्रमस्माकं सु परमतिं वाव्र्धाति | अनाम्र्णः कुविदादस्य रायो गवां केतं परमावर्जते नः
transliteration: etāyāmopa ghavyanta indramasmākaṃ su pramatiṃ vāvṛdhāti | anāmṛṇaḥ kuvidādasya rāyo ghavāṃ ketaṃ paramāvarjate naḥ
translation: Come, fain for booty let us seek to Indra: yet more shall he increase his care that guides us. Will not the Indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth, of cattle?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: उपेदहं धनदामप्रतीतं जुष्टं न शयेनो वसतिम्पतामि | इन्द्रं नमस्यन्नुपमेभिरर्कैर्यः सतोत्र्भ्यो हव्यो अस्ति यामन
transliteration: upedahaṃ dhanadāmapratītaṃ juṣṭaṃ na śyeno vasatimpatāmi | indraṃ namasyannupamebhirarkairyaḥ stotṛbhyo havyo asti yāman
translation: I fly to him invisible Wealth-giver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie, With fairest hymns of praise adoring Indra, whom those who laud him must invoke in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: नि सर्वसेन इषुधीन्रसक्त समर्यो गा अजति यस्य वष्टि | चोष्कूयमाण इन्द्र भूरि वामं मा पणिर्भूरस्मदधि परव्र्द्ध
transliteration: ni sarigvedaasena iṣudhīnrasakta samaryo ghā ajati yasya vaṣṭi | coṣkūyamāṇa indra bhūri vāmaṃ mā paṇirbhūrasmadadhi pravṛddha
translation: Mid all his host, he bindeth on the quiver: he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth: Gathering up great store of riches, Indra. be thou no trafficker with us, most mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: वधीर्हि दस्युं धनिनं घनेननेकश्चरन्नुपशाकेभिरिन्द्र | धनोरधि विषुणक ते वयायन्नयज्वनः सनकाः परेतिमीयुः
transliteration: vadhīrhi dasyuṃ dhaninaṃ ghanenanekaścarannupaśākebhirindra | dhanoradhi viṣuṇak te vyāyannayajvanaḥ sanakāḥ pretimīyuḥ
translation: Thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy Dasyu, alone, yet going with thy helpers, Indra! Far from the floor of heaven in all directions, the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: परा चिच्छीर्षा वव्र्जुस्त इन्द्रायज्वानो यज्वभिः सपर्धमानाः | पर यद दिवो हरिव सथातरुग्र निरव्रतानधमोरोदस्योः
transliteration: parā cicchīrṣā vavṛjusta indrāyajvāno yajvabhiḥ spardhamānāḥ | pra yad divo hariva sthātarughra niravratānadhamorodasyoḥ
translation: Fighting with pious worshippers, the riteless turned and fled, Indra! with averted faces. When thou, fierce Lord of the Bay Steeds, the Stayer, blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: अयुयुत्सन्ननवद्यस्य सेनामयातयन्त कषितयो नवग्वाः | वर्षायुधो न वध्रयो निरष्टाः परवद्भिरिन्द्राच्चितयन्त आयन
transliteration: ayuyutsannanavadyasya senāmayātayanta kṣitayo navaghvāḥ | vṛṣāyudho na vadhrayo niraṣṭāḥ pravadbhirindrāccitayanta āyan
translation: They met in fight the army of the blameless: then the Navagvas put forth all their power. They, like emasculates with men contending, fled, conscious, by steep paths from Indra, scattered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: तवमेतान रुदतो जक्षतश्चायोधयो रजस इन्द्र पारे | अवादहो दिव आ दस्युमुच्चा पर सुन्वतः सतुवतः शंसमावः
transliteration: tvametān rudato jakṣataścāyodhayo rajasa indra pāre | avādaho diva ā dasyumuccā pra sunvataḥ stuvataḥ śaṃsamāvaḥ
translation: Whether they weep or laugh, thou hast o'erthrown them, O Indra, on the sky's extremest limit. The Dasyu thou hast burned from heaven, and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: चक्राणासः परीणहं पर्थिव्या हिरण्येन मणिना शुम्भमानाः | न हिन्वानासस्तितिरुस्त इन्द्रं परि सपशो अदधात सूर्येण
transliteration: cakrāṇāsaḥ parīṇahaṃ pṛthivyā hiraṇyena maṇinā śumbhamānāḥ | na hinvānāsastitirusta indraṃ pari spaśo adadhāt sūryeṇa
translation: Adorned with their array of gold and jewels, they o'er the earth a covering veil extended. Although they hastened, they o'ercame not Indra: their spies he compassed with the Sun of morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: परि यदिन्द्र रोदसी उभे अबुभोजीर्महिना विश्वतः सीम | अमन्यमानानभि मन्यमानैर्निर्ब्रह्मभिरधमो दस्युमिन्द्र
transliteration: pari yadindra rodasī ubhe abubhojīrmahinā viśvataḥ sīm | amanyamānānabhi manyamānairnirbrahmabhiradhamo dasyumindra
translation: As thou enjoyest heaven and earth, O Indra, on every side surrounded with thy greatness, So thou with priests bast blown away the Dasyu, and those who worship not with those who worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: न ये दिवः पर्थिव्या अन्तमापुर्न मायाभिर्धनदां पर्यभूवन | युजं वज्रं वर्षभश्चक्र इन्द्रो निर्ज्योतिषा तमसो गा अदुक्षत
transliteration: na ye divaḥ pṛthivyā antamāpurna māyābhirdhanadāṃ paryabhūvan | yujaṃ vajraṃ vṛṣabhaścakra indro nirjyotiṣā tamaso ghā adukṣat
translation: They who pervaded earth's extremest limit subdued not with their charms the Wealth-bestower: Indra, the Bull, made his ally the thunder, and with its light milked cows from out the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: अनु सवधामक्षरन्नापो अस्यावर्धत मध्य आ नाव्यानाम | सध्रीचीनेन मनसा तमिन्द्र ओजिष्ठेन हन्मनाहन्नभि दयून
transliteration: anu svadhāmakṣarannāpo asyāvardhata madhya ā nāvyānām | sadhrīcīnena manasā tamindra ojiṣṭhena hanmanāhannabhi dyūn
translation: The waters flowed according to their nature; he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty. Then Indra, with his spirit concentrated, smote him for ever with his strongest weapon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: नयाविध्यदिलीबिशस्य दर्ल्हा वि शर्ङगिणमभिनच्छुष्णमिन्द्रः | यावत तरो मघवन यावदोजो वज्रेण शत्रुमवधीः पर्तन्युम
transliteration: nyāvidhyadilībiśasya dṛlhā vi śṛṅghiṇamabhinacchuṣṇamindraḥ | yāvat taro maghavan yāvadojo vajreṇa śatrumavadhīḥ pṛtanyum
translation: Indra broke through Ilibisa's strong castles, and Susna with his horn he cut to pieces: Thou, Maghavan, for all his might and swiftness, slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 33
sanskrit: अभि सिध्मो अजिगादस्य शत्रून वि तिग्मेन वर्षभेण पुरो.अभेत | सं वज्रेणास्र्जद वर्त्रमिन्द्रः पर सवां मतिमतिरच्छाशदानः
transliteration: abhi sidhmo ajighādasya śatrūn vi tighmena vṛṣabheṇa puro.abhet | saṃ vajreṇāsṛjad vṛtramindraḥ pra svāṃ matimatiracchāśadānaḥ
translation: Fierce on his enemies fell Indra's weapon: with. his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces. He with his thunderbolt dealt blows on Vrtra; and conquered, executing all his purpose.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिश चिन नो अद्या भवतं नवेदसा विभुर वां याम उत रातिर अश्विना | युवोर हि यन्त्रं हिम्येव वाससो ऽभयायंसेन्या भवतम मनीषिभिः
transliteration: triś cin no adyā bhavataṃ navedasā vibhur vāṃ yāma uta rātir aśvinā | yuvor hi yantraṃ himyeva vāsaso 'bhyāyaṃsenyā bhavatam manīṣibhiḥ
translation: Ye who observe this day be with us even thrice: far-stretching is you bounty, Asvins and your course. To you, as to a cloak in winter, we cleave close: you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरयः पवयो मधुवाहने रथे सोमस्य वेनाम अनु विश्व इद विदुः | तरय सकम्भास सकभितास आरभे तरिर नक्तं याथस तरिर व अश्विना दिवा
transliteration: trayaḥ pavayo madhuvāhane rathe somasya venām anu viśva id viduḥ | traya skambhāsa skabhitāsa ārabhe trir naktaṃ yāthas trir v aśvinā divā
translation: Three are the fellies in your honey-bearing car, that travels after Soma's loved one, as all know. Three are the pillars set upon it for support: thrice journey ye by night, O Asvins, thrice by day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: समाने अहन तरिर अवद्यगोहना तरिर अद्य यज्ञम मधुना मिमिक्षतम | तरिर वाजवतीर इषो अश्विना युवं दोषा अस्मभ्यम उषसश च पिन्वतम
transliteration: samāne ahan trir avadyaghohanā trir adya yajñam madhunā mimikṣatam | trir vājavatīr iṣo aśvinā yuvaṃ doṣā asmabhyam uṣasaś ca pinvatam
translation: Thrice in the self-same day, ye Gods who banish want, sprinkle ye thrice to-day our sacrifice with meath; And thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength, at evening, O ye Asvins, and at break of day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिर वर्तिर यातं तरिर अनुव्रते जने तरिः सुप्राव्येत्रेधेव शिक्षतम | तरिर नान्द्यं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिः पर्क्षो अस्मे अक्षरेव पिन्वतम
transliteration: trir vartir yātaṃ trir anuvrate jane triḥ suprāvyetredheva śikṣatam | trir nāndyaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ triḥ pṛkṣo asme akṣareva pinvatam
translation: Thrice come ye to our home, thrice to the righteous folk, thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help. Thrice, O ye Asvins, bring us what shall make us glad; thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिर नो रयिं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिर देवताता तरिर उतावतं धियः | तरिः सौभगत्वं तरिर उत शरवांसि नस तरिष्ठं वां सूरे दुहिता रुहद रथम
transliteration: trir no rayiṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ trir devatātā trir utāvataṃ dhiyaḥ | triḥ saubhaghatvaṃ trir uta śravāṃsi nas triṣṭhaṃ vāṃ sūre duhitā ruhad ratham
translation: Thrice, O ye Asvins, bring to us abundant wealth: thrice in the Gods' assembly, thrice assist our thoughts. Thrice, grant ye us prosperity, thrice grant us fame; for the Sun's daughter hath mounted your three-wheeled car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिर नो अश्विना दिव्यानि भेषजा तरिः पार्थिवानि तरिर उ दत्तम अद्भ्यः | ओमानं शंयोर ममकाय सूनवे तरिधातु शर्म वहतं शुभस पती
transliteration: trir no aśvinā divyāni bheṣajā triḥ pārthivāni trir u dattam adbhyaḥ | omānaṃ śaṃyor mamakāya sūnave tridhātu śarma vahataṃ śubhas patī
translation: Thrice, Asvins, grant to us the heavenly medicines, thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold, Favour and health and strength bestow upon my son; triple protection, Lords of Splendour, grant to him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिर नो अश्विना यजता दिवे-दिवे परि तरिधातु पर्थिवीम अशायतम | तिस्रो नासत्या रथ्या परावत आत्मेव वातः सवसराणि गछतम
transliteration: trir no aśvinā yajatā dive-dive pari tridhātu pṛthivīm aśāyatam | tisro nāsatyā rathyā parāvata ātmeva vātaḥ svasarāṇi ghachatam
translation: Thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us: thrice, O ye Asvins, ye travel around the earth. Car-borne from far away, O ye Nasatyas, come, like vital air to bodies, come ye to the three.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिर अश्विना सिन्धुभिः सप्तमात्र्भिस तरय आहावास तरेधा हविष कर्तम | तिस्रः पर्थिवीर उपरि परवा दिवो नाकं रक्षेथे दयुभिर अक्तुभिर हितम
transliteration: trir aśvinā sindhubhiḥ saptamātṛbhis traya āhāvās tredhā haviṣ kṛtam | tisraḥ pṛthivīr upari pravā divo nākaṃ rakṣethe dyubhir aktubhir hitam
translation: Thrice, O ye Asvins, with the Seven Mother Streams; three are the jars, the triple offering is prepared. Three are the worlds, and moving on above the sky ye guard the firm-set vault of heaven through days and nights.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 34
sanskrit: कव तरी चक्रा तरिव्र्तो रथस्य कव तरयो वन्धुरो ये सनीळाः | कदा योगो वाजिनो रासभस्य येन यज्ञं नासत्योपयाथः
transliteration: kva trī cakrā trivṛto rathasya kva trayo vandhuro ye sanīḷāḥ | kadā yogho vājino rāsabhasya yena yajñaṃ nāsatyopayāthaḥ
translation: Where are the three wheels of your triple chariot, where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened? When will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it, to bring you to our sacrifice. Nasatyas?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 35
sanskrit: हवयाम्य अग्निम परथमं सवस्तये हवयामि मित्रावरुणाव इहावसे | हवयामि रात्रीं जगतो निवेशनीं हवयामि देवं सवितारम ऊतये
transliteration: hvayāmy aghnim prathamaṃ svastaye hvayāmi mitrāvaruṇāv ihāvase | hvayāmi rātrīṃ jaghato niveśanīṃ hvayāmi devaṃ savitāram ūtaye
translation: AGNI I first invoke for our prosperity; I call on Mitra, Varuna, to aid us here. I call on Night who gives rest to all moving life; I call on Savitar the God to lend us help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: पर वो यह्वं पुरूणां विशां देवयतीनाम | अग्निं सूक्तेभिर्वचोभिरीमहे यं सीमिदन्य ईळते
transliteration: pra vo yahvaṃ purūṇāṃ viśāṃ devayatīnām | aghniṃ sūktebhirigvedaacobhirīmahe yaṃ sīmidanya īḷate
translation: WITH words sent forth in holy hymns, Agni we supplicate, the Lord Of many families who duly serve the Gods, yea, him whom others also praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: जनासो अग्निं दधिरे सहोव्र्धं हविष्मन्तो विधेम ते | स तवं नो अद्य सुमना इहाविता भवा वाजेषु सन्त्य
transliteration: janāso aghniṃ dadhire sahovṛdhaṃ haviṣmanto vidhema te | sa tvaṃ no adya sumanā ihāvitā bhavā vājeṣu santya
translation: Men have won Agni, him who makes their strength abound: we, with oblations, worship thee. Our gracious-minded Helper in our deeds of might, be thou, O Excellent, this day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: पर तवा दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम | महस्ते सतो वि चरन्त्यर्चयो दिवि सप्र्शन्ति भानवः
transliteration: pra tvā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam | mahaste sato vi carantyarcayo divi spṛśanti bhānavaḥ
translation: Thee for our messenger we choose, thee, the Omniscient, for our Priest. The flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around: thy splendour reaches to the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: देवासस्त्वा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सं दूतं परत्नमिन्धते | विश्वं सो अग्ने जयति तवया धनं यस्ते ददाश मर्त्यः
transliteration: devāsastvā varuṇo mitro aryamā saṃ dūtaṃ pratnamindhate | viśvaṃ so aghne jayati tvayā dhanaṃ yaste dadāśa martyaḥ
translation: The Gods enkindle thee their ancient messenger,--Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman. That mortal man, O Agni, gains through thee all wealth, who hath poured offerings unto thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: मन्द्रो होता गर्हपतिरग्ने दूतो विशामसि | तवे विश्वा संगतानि वरता धरुवा यानि देवा अक्र्ण्वत
transliteration: mandro hotā ghṛhapatiraghne dūto viśāmasi | tve viśvā saṃghatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devā akṛṇvata
translation: Thou, Agni, art a cheering Priest, Lord of the House, men's messenger: All constant high decrees established by the Gods, gathered together, meet in thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: तवे इदग्ने सुभगे यविष्ठ्य विश्वमा हूयते हविः | सत्वं नो अद्य सुमना उतापरं यक्षि देवान सुवीर्या
transliteration: tve idaghne subhaghe yaviṣṭhya viśvamā hūyate haviḥ | satvaṃ no adya sumanā utāparaṃ yakṣi devān suvīryā
translation: In thee, the auspicious One, O Agni, youthfullest, each sacred gift is offered up: This day, and after, gracious, worship thou our Gods, that we may have heroic sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: तं घेमित्था नमस्विन उप सवराजमासते | होत्राभिरग्निं मनुषः समिन्धते तितिर्वांसो अति सरिधः
transliteration: taṃ ghemitthā namasvina upa svarājamāsate | hotrābhiraghniṃ manuṣaḥ samindhate titirigvedaāṃso ati sridhaḥ
translation: To him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout. Men kindle Agni with their sacrificial gifts, victorious o'er the enemies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: घनन्तो वर्त्रमतरन रोदसी अप उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे | भुवत कण्वे वर्षा दयुम्न्याहुतः करन्ददश्वो गविष्टिषु
transliteration: ghnanto vṛtramataran rodasī apa uru kṣayāya cakrire | bhuvat kaṇve vṛṣā dyumnyāhutaḥ krandadaśvo ghaviṣṭiṣu
translation: Vrtra they smote and slew, and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode. The glorious Bull, invoked, hath stood at Kanva's side: loud neighed the Steed in frays for kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: सं सीदस्व महानसि शोचस्व देववीतमः | वि धूममग्ने अरुषं मियेध्य सर्ज परशस्त दर्शतम
transliteration: saṃ sīdasva mahānasi śocasva devavītamaḥ | vi dhūmamaghne aruṣaṃ miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam
translation: Seat thee, for thou art mighty; shine, best entertainer of the Gods. Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke, ruddy and beautiful to see.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: यं तवा देवासो मनवे दधुरिह यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन | यं कण्वो मेध्यातिथिर्धनस्प्र्तं यं वर्षा यमुपस्तुतः
transliteration: yaṃ tvā devāso manave dadhuriha yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana | yaṃ kaṇvo medhyātithirdhanaspṛtaṃ yaṃ vṛṣā yamupastutaḥ
translation: Bearer of offerings, whom, best sacrificing Priest, the Gods for Manu's sake ordained; Whom Kanva, whom Medhyatithi made the source of wealth, and Vrsan and Upastuta.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
sanskrit: यमग्निं मेध्यातिथिः कण्व ईध रतादधि | तस्य परेषो दीदियुस्तमिमा रचस्तमग्निं वर्धयामसि
transliteration: yamaghniṃ medhyātithiḥ kaṇva īdha ṛtādadhi | tasya preṣo dīdiyustamimā ṛcastamaghniṃ vardhayāmasi
translation: Him, Agni, whom Medhyatithi, whom Kanva kindled for his rite, Him these our songs of praise, him, Agni, we extol: his powers shine out preeminent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 36
