sanskrit: रायस पूर्धि सवधावो.अस्ति हि ते.अग्ने देवेष्वाप्यम | तवंवाजस्य शरुत्यस्य राजसि स नो मर्ळ महानसि
transliteration: rāyas pūrdhi svadhāvo.asti hi te.aghne deveṣvāpyam | tvaṃvājasya śrutyasya rājasi sa no mṛḷa mahānasi
translation: Make our wealth perfect thou, O Agni, Lord divine: for thou hast kinship with the Gods. Thou rulest as a King o'er widely-famous strength: be good to us, for thou art great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: करीळं वः शर्धो मारुतमनर्वाणं रथेशुभम | कण्वा अभि पर गायत
transliteration: krīḷaṃ vaḥ śardho mārutamanarigvedaāṇaṃ ratheśubham | kaṇvā abhi pra ghāyata
translation: SING forth, O Kanvas, to your band of Maruts unassailable, Sporting, resplendent on their car

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: ये पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिः साकं वाशीभिरञ्जिभिः | अजायन्त सवभानवः
transliteration: ye pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiḥ sākaṃ vāśībhirañjibhiḥ | ajāyanta svabhānavaḥ
translation: They who, self-luminous, were born together, with the spotted deer, Spears, swords, and glittering ornaments.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: इहेव शर्ण्व एषां कशा हस्तेषु यद वदान | नि यामञ्चित्रं रञ्जते
transliteration: iheva śṛṇva eṣāṃ kaśā hasteṣu yad vadān | ni yāmañcitraṃ ṛñjate
translation: One hears, as though 'twere close at hand, the cracking of the whips they hold They gather glory on their way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: पर वः शर्धाय घर्ष्वये तवेषद्युम्नाय शुष्मिणे | देवत्तं बरह्म गायत
transliteration: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣadyumnāya śuṣmiṇe | devattaṃ brahma ghāyata
translation: Now sing ye forth the God-given hymn to your exultant Marut host, The fiercely-vigorous, the strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: पर शंसा गोष्वघ्न्यं करीळं यच्छर्धो मारुतम | जम्भे रसस्य वाव्र्धे
transliteration: pra śaṃsā ghoṣvaghnyaṃ krīḷaṃ yacchardho mārutam | jambhe rasasya vāvṛdhe
translation: Praise ye the Bull among the cows; for 'tis the Maruts' sportive band: It strengthened as it drank the rain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: को वो वर्षिष्ठ आ नरो दिवश्च गमश्च धूतयः | यत सीम अन्तं न धूनुथ
transliteration: ko vo varṣiṣṭha ā naro divaśca ghmaśca dhūtayaḥ | yat sīm antaṃ na dhūnutha
translation: Who is your mightiest, Heroes, when, O shakers of the earth and heaven, Ye shake them like a garment's hem?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: नि वो यामाय मानुषो दध्र उग्राय मन्यवे | जिहीत पर्वतो गिरिः
transliteration: ni vo yāmāya mānuṣo dadhra ughrāya manyave | jihīta parigvedaato ghiriḥ
translation: At your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath: The rugged-jointed mountain yields.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: येषाम अज्मेषु पर्थिवी जुजुर्वां इव विश्पतिः | भिया यामेषु रेजते
transliteration: yeṣām ajmeṣu pṛthivī jujurigvedaāṃ iva viśpatiḥ | bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate
translation: They at whose racings forth the earth, like an age-weakened lord of men, Trembles in terror on their ways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: सथिरं हि जानम एषां वयो मातुर निरेतवे | यत सीम अनु दविता शवः
transliteration: sthiraṃ hi jānam eṣāṃ vayo mātur niretave | yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ
translation: Strong is their birth: vigour have they to issue from their Mother; strength, Yea, even twice enough, is theirs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: उद उ तये सूनवो गिरः काष्ठा अज्मेष्व अत्नत | वाश्रा अभिज्ञु यातवे
transliteration: ud u tye sūnavo ghiraḥ kāṣṭhā ajmeṣv atnata | vāśrā abhijñu yātave
translation: And these, the Sons, the Singers, in their racings have enlarged the bounds, So that the kine must walk knee-deep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: तयं चिद घा दीर्घम पर्थुम मिहो नपातम अम्र्ध्रम | पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः
transliteration: tyaṃ cid ghā dīrgham pṛthum miho napātam amṛdhram | pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ
translation: Before them, on the ways they go, they drop this offspring of the cloud, Long, broad, and inexhaustible.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: मरुतो यद ध वो बलं जनां अचुच्यवीतन | गिरींर अचुच्यवीतन
transliteration: maruto yad dha vo balaṃ janāṃ acucyavītana | ghirīṃr acucyavītana
translation: O Maruts, as your strength is great, so have ye cast men down on earth, So have ye made the mountains fall.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 37
sanskrit: यद ध यान्ति मरुतः सं ह बरुवते ऽधवन्न आ | शर्णोति कश चिद एषाम
transliteration: yad dha yānti marutaḥ saṃ ha bruvate 'dhvann ā |
translation: The while the Maruts pass along, they talk together on the way: Doth any hear them as they speak?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: कद ध नूनं कधप्रियः पिता पुत्रं न हस्तयोः | दधिध्वे वर्क्तबर्हिषः
transliteration: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyaḥ pitā putraṃ na hastayoḥ | dadhidhve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
translation: WHAT now? When will ye take us by both hands, as a dear sire his son, Gods, for whom sacred grass is clipped?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: कव नूनं कद वो अर्थं गन्ता दिवो न पर्थिव्याः | कव वो गावो न रण्यन्ति
transliteration: kva nūnaṃ kad vo arthaṃ ghantā divo na pṛthivyāḥ | kva vo ghāvo na raṇyanti
translation: Now whither? To what goal of yours go ye in heaven, and not on earth? Where do your cows disport themselves?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: कव वः सुम्ना नव्यांसि मरुतः कव सुविता | कव विश्वानि सौभगा
transliteration: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṃsi marutaḥ kva suvitā | kv viśvāni saubhaghā
translation: Where are your newest favours shown? Where, Maruts, your prosperity? Where all your high felicities?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: यद यूयम पर्श्निमातरो मर्तासः सयातन | सतोता वो अम्र्तः सयात
transliteration: yad yūyam pṛśnimātaro martāsaḥ syātana | stotā vo amṛtaḥ syāt
translation: If, O ye Maruts, ye the Sons whom Prsni bore, were mortal, and Immortal he who sings your praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: मा वो मर्गो न यवसे जरिता भूद अजोष्यः | पथा यमस्य गाद उप
transliteration: mā vo mṛgho na yavase jaritā bhūd ajoṣyaḥ | pathā yamasya ghād upa
translation: Then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pasture-land, Nor should he go on Yama's path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: मो षु णः परा-परा निर्र्तिर दुर्हणा वधीत | पदीष्ट तर्ष्णया सह
transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ parā-parā nirṛtir durhaṇā vadhīt | padīṣṭa tṛṣṇayā saha
translation: Let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered, strike its down: Let each, with drought, depart from us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: सत्यं तवेषा अमवन्तो धन्वञ चिद आ रुद्रियासः | मिहं कर्ण्वन्त्य अवाताम
transliteration: satyaṃ tveṣā amavanto dhanvañ cid ā rudriyāsaḥ | mihaṃ kṛṇvanty avātām
translation: Truly, they the fierce and mighty Sons of Rudra send their windless Rain e'en on the desert places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: वाश्रेव विद्युन मिमाति वत्सं न माता सिषक्ति | यद एषां वर्ष्टिर असर्जि
transliteration: vāśreva vidyun mimāti vatsaṃ na mātā siṣakti | yad eṣāṃ vṛṣṭir asarji
translation: Like a cow the lightning lows and follows, motherlike, her youngling, When their rain-flood hath been loosened.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: दिवा चित तमः कर्ण्वन्ति पर्जन्येनोदवाहेन | यत पर्थिवीं वयुन्दन्ति
transliteration: divā cit tamaḥ kṛṇvanti parjanyenodavāhena | yat pṛthivīṃ vyundanti
translation: When they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness e'en in day time, With the water-laden rain-cloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अध सवनान मरुतां विश्वम आ सद्म पार्थिवम | अरेजन्त पर मानुषाः
transliteration: adha svanān marutāṃ viśvam ā sadma pārthivam | arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ
translation: O Maruts, at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes, And each man reels who dwells therein.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: मरुतो वीळुपाणिभिश चित्रा रोधस्वतीर अनु | यातेम अखिद्रयामभिः
transliteration: maruto vīḷupāṇibhiś citrā rodhasvatīr anu | yātem akhidrayāmabhiḥ
translation: O Maruts, with your strong-hoofed steeds, unhindered in their courses, haste Along the bright embanked streams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: सथिरा वः सन्तु नेमयो रथा अश्वास एषाम | सुसंस्क्र्ता अभीशवः
transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santu nemayo rathā aśvāsa eṣām | susaṃskṛtā abhīśavaḥ
translation: Firm be the fellies of your wheels, steady your horses and your cars, And may your reins be fashioned well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अछा वदा तना गिरा जरायै बरह्मणस पतिम | अग्निम मित्रं न दर्शतम
transliteration: achā vadā tanā ghirā jarāyai brahmaṇas patim | aghnim mitraṃ na darśatam
translation: Invite thou hither with this song, for praise, Agni the Lord of Prayer, Him who is fair as Mitra is.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: मिमीहि शलोकम आस्यपर्जन्य इव ततनः | गाय गायत्रम उक्थ्यम
transliteration: mimīhi ślokam āsyaparjanya iva tatanaḥ | ghāya ghāyatram ukthyam
translation: Form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like, a rainy cloud Sing forth the measured eulogy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 38
sanskrit: वन्दस्व मारुतं गणं तवेषम पनस्युम अर्किणम | अस्मे वर्द्धा असन्न इह
transliteration: vandasva mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam | asme vṛddhā asann iha
translation: Sing glory to the Marut host, praiseworthy, tuneful, vigorous: Here let the Strong Ones dwell with us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: पर यद इत्था परावतः शोचिर न मानम अस्यथ | कस्य करत्वा मरुतः कस्य वर्पसा कं याथ कं ह धूतयः
transliteration: pra yad itthā parāvataḥ śocir na mānam asyatha | kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kaṃ yātha kaṃ ha dhūtayaḥ
translation: WHEN thus, like flame, from far away, Maruts, ye cast your measure forth, To whom go Ye, to whom, O shakers of the earth, moved by whose wisdom, whose design?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: सथिरा वः सन्त्व आयुधा पराणुदे वीळू उत परतिष्कभे | युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी पनीयसी मा मर्त्यस्य मायिनः
transliteration: sthirā vaḥ santv āyudhā parāṇude vīḷū uta pratiṣkabhe | yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ
translation: Strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes, firm for resistance let them be. Yea, passing glorious must be your warrior might, not as a guileful mortal's strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: परा ह यत सथिरं हथ नरो वर्तयथा गुरु | वि याथन वनिनः पर्थिव्या वय आशाः पर्वतानाम
transliteration: parā ha yat sthiraṃ hatha naro vartayathā ghuru | vi yāthana vaninaḥ pṛthivyā vy āśāḥ parigvedaatānām
translation: When what is strong ye overthrow, and whirl about each ponderous thing, Heroes, your course is through the forest trees of earth, and through the fissures of the rocks.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: नहि वः शत्रुर विविदे अधि दयवि न भूम्यां रिशादसः | युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी तना युजा रुद्रासो नू चिद आध्र्षे
transliteration: nahi vaḥ śatrur vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyāṃ riśādasaḥ | yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāso nū cid ādhṛṣe
translation: Consumers of your foes, no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth: Ye Rudras, may the strength, held in this bond, be yours, to bid defiance even now.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान वि विञ्चन्ति वनस्पतीन | परो आरत मरुतो दुर्मदा इव देवासः सर्वया विशा
transliteration: pra vepayanti parigvedaatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn | pro ārata maruto durmadā iva devāsaḥ sarigvedaayā viśā
translation: They make the mountains rock and reel, they rend the forest-kings apart. Onward, ye Maruts, drive, like creatures drunk with wine, ye, Gods with all your company.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 39
sanskrit: उपो रथेषु पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम परष्टिर वहति रोहितः | आ वो यामाय पर्थिवी चिद अश्रोद अबीभयन्त मानुषाः
transliteration: upo ratheṣu pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam praṣṭir vahati rohitaḥ |
translation: Ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer: a red deer, as a leader, draws. Even the Earth herself listened as ye came near, and men were sorely terrified.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: उत तिष्ठ बरह्मणस पते देवयन्तस्त्वेमहे | उप पर यन्तु मरुतः सुदानव इन्द्र पराशूर्भवा सचा
transliteration: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devayantastvemahe | upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūrbhavā sacā
translation: O BRAMANASPATI, stand up: God-serving men we pray to thee. May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, most swift, be thou with them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: तवामिद धि सहसस पुत्र मर्त्य उपब्रूते धने हिते | सुवीर्यं मरुत आ सवश्व्यं दधीत यो व आचके
transliteration: tvāmid dhi sahasas putra martya upabrūte dhane hite | suvīryaṃ maruta ā svaśvyaṃ dadhīta yo va ācake
translation: O Son of Strength, each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him. O Maruts, may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: परैतु बरह्मणस पतिः पर देव्येतु सून्र्ता | अछा वीरंनर्यं पङकतिराधसं देवा यज्ञं नयन्तु नः
transliteration: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devyetu sūnṛtā | achā vīraṃnaryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ
translation: May Brahmanaspati draw nigh, may Sunrta the Goddess come, And Gods bring to this rite which gives the five-fold gift the Hero, lover of mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: यो वाघते ददाति सूनरं वसु स धत्ते अक्षिति शरवः | तस्मा इळां सुवीरामा यजामहे सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम
transliteration: yo vāghate dadāti sūnaraṃ vasu sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ | tasmā iḷāṃ suvīrāmā yajāmahe supratūrtimanehasam
translation: He who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay. For him we offer sacred hero-giving food, peerless and conquering easily.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: पर नूनं बरह्मणस पतिर्मन्त्रं वदत्युक्थ्यम | यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा देवा ओकांसि चक्रिरे
transliteration: pra nūnaṃ brahmaṇas patirmantraṃ vadatyukthyam | yasminnindro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okāṃsi cakrire
translation: Now Brahmanaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise, Wherein Indra and Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods, have made their dwelling place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: तमिद वोचेमा विदथेषु शम्भुवं मन्त्रं देवा अनेहसम | इमां च वाचं परतिहर्यथा नरो विश्वेद वामा वो अश्नवत
transliteration: tamid vocemā vidatheṣu śambhuvaṃ mantraṃ devā anehasam | imāṃ ca vācaṃ pratiharyathā naro viśved vāmā vo aśnavat
translation: May we in holy synods, Gods! recite that hymn, peerless, that brings felicity. If you, O Heroes, graciously accept this word, may it obtain all bliss from you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: को देवयन्तमश्नवज्जनं को वर्क्तबर्हिषम | पर-पर दाश्वान पस्त्याभिरस्थितान्तर्वावत कषयं दधे
transliteration: ko devayantamaśnavajjanaṃ ko vṛktabarhiṣam | pra-pra dāśvān pastyābhirasthitāntarigvedaāvat kṣayaṃ dadhe
translation: Who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed? The offerer with his folk advances more and more: he fills his house with precious things.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 40
sanskrit: उप कष्स्त्रं पर्ञ्चीत हन्ति राजभिर्भये चित सुक्षितिं दधे | नास्य वर्ता न तरुता महाधने नार्भे अस्ति वज्रिणः
transliteration: upa kṣstraṃ pṛñcīta hanti rājabhirbhaye cit sukṣitiṃ dadhe | nāsya vartā na tarutā mahādhane nārbhe asti vajriṇaḥ
translation: He amplifies his lordly might, with kings he slays: e'en mid alarms he dwells secure In great or lesser fight none checks him, none subdues,--the wielder of the thunderbolt.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: यं रक्षन्ति परचेतसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा | नू चित स दभ्यते जनः
transliteration: yaṃ rakṣanti pracetaso varuṇo mitro aryamā | nū cit sa dabhyate janaḥ
translation: NE'ER is he injured whom the Gods Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, The excellently wise, protect.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: यं बाहुतेव पिप्रति पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः | अरिष्टः सर्व एधते
transliteration: yaṃ bāhuteva piprati pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ | ariṣṭaḥ sarigvedaa edhate
translation: He prospers ever, free from scathe, whom they, as with full hands, enrich, Whom they preserve from every foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: वि दुर्गा वि दविषः पुरो घनन्ति राजान एषाम | नयन्ति दुरिता तिरः
transliteration: vi durghā vi dviṣaḥ puro ghnanti rājāna eṣām | nayanti duritā tiraḥ
translation: The Kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies, And lead him safely o'er distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: सुगः पन्था अन्र्क्षर आदित्यास रतं यते | नात्रावखादो अस्ति वः
transliteration: sughaḥ panthā anṛkṣara ādityāsa ṛtaṃ yate | nātrāvakhādo asti vaḥ
translation: Thornless, Adityas, is the path, easy for him who seeks the Law: With him is naught to anger you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: यं यज्ञं नयथा नर आदित्या रजुना पथा | पर वः स धीतये नशत
transliteration: yaṃ yajñaṃ nayathā nara ādityā ṛjunā pathā | pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat
translation: What sacrifice, Adityas, ye Heroes guide by the path direct,-- May that come nigh unto your thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: स रत्नं मर्त्यो वसु विश्वं तोकमुत तमना | अछा गछत्यस्त्र्तः
transliteration: sa ratnaṃ martyo vasu viśvaṃ tokamuta tmanā | achā ghachatyastṛtaḥ
translation: That mortal, ever unsubdued, gains wealth and every precious thing, And children also of his own.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: कथा राधाम सखायः सतोमं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः | महि पसरो वरुणस्य
transliteration: kathā rādhāma sakhāyaḥ stomaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ | mahi psaro varuṇasya
translation: How, my friends, shall we prepare Aryaman's and Mitra's laud, Glorious food of Varuna?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: मा वो घनन्तं मा शपन्तं परति वोचे देवयन्तम | सुम्नैरिद व आ विवासे
transliteration: mā vo ghnantaṃ mā śapantaṃ prati voce devayantam | sumnairid va ā vivāse
translation: I point not out to you a man who strikes the pious, or reviles: Only with hymns I call you nigh.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 41
sanskrit: चतुरश्चिद ददमानाद बिभीयादा निधातोः | न दुरुक्ताय सप्र्हयेत
transliteration: caturaścid dadamānād bibhīyādā nidhātoḥ | na duruktāya spṛhayet
translation: Let him not love to speak ill words: but fear the One who holds all four Within his hand, until they fall.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 42
sanskrit: सं पूषन्नध्वनस्तिर वयंहो विमुचो नपात | सक्ष्वा देवप्र णस पुरः
transliteration: saṃ pūṣannadhvanastira vyaṃho vimuco napāt | sakṣvā devapra ṇas puraḥ
translation: SHORTEN our ways, O Pusan, move aside obstruction in the path: Go close before us, cloud-born God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 42
sanskrit: यो नः पूषन्नघो वर्को दुःशेव आदिदेशति | अप सम तम्पथो जहि
transliteration: yo naḥ pūṣannagho vṛko duḥśeva ādideśati | apa sma tampatho jahi
translation: Drive, Pusan, from our road the wolf, the wicked inauspicious wolf, Who lies in wait to injure us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अप तयं परिपन्थिनं मुषीवाणं हुरश्चितम | दूरमधिस्रुतेरज
transliteration: apa tyaṃ paripanthinaṃ muṣīvāṇaṃ huraścitam | dūramadhisruteraja
translation: Who lurks about the path we take, the robber with a guileful heart: Far from the road chase him away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 42
sanskrit: तवं तस्य दवयाविनो.अघशंसस्य कस्य चित | पदाभि तिष्ठ तपुषिम
transliteration: tvaṃ tasya dvayāvino.aghaśaṃsasya kasya cit | padābhi tiṣṭha tapuṣim
translation: Tread with thy foot and trample out the firebrand of the wicked one, The double-tongued, whoe'er he be.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 43
sanskrit: कद रुद्राय परचेतसे मीळ्हुष्टमाय तव्यसे | वोचेम शन्तमं हर्दे
transliteration: kad rudrāya pracetase mīḷhuṣṭamāya tavyase | vocema śantamaṃ hṛde
translation: WHAT shall we sing to Rudra, strong, most bounteous, excellently wise, That shall be dearest to his heart?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यथा नो अदितिः करत पश्वे नर्भ्यो यथा गवे | यथा तोकाय रुद्रियम
transliteration: yathā no aditiḥ karat paśve nṛbhyo yathā ghave | yathā tokāya rudriyam
translation: That Aditi may grant the grace of Rudra to our folk, our kine, Our cattle and our progeny;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो यथा रुद्रश्चिकेतति | यथा विश्वे सजोषसः
transliteration: yathā no mitro varuṇo yathā rudraściketati | yathā viśve sajoṣasaḥ
translation: That Mitra and that Varuna, that Rudra may remember us, Yea, all the Gods with one accord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 43
sanskrit: गाथपतिं मेधपतिं रुद्रं जलाषभेषजम | तच्छंयोः सुम्नमीमहे
transliteration: ghāthapatiṃ medhapatiṃ rudraṃ jalāṣabheṣajam | tacchaṃyoḥ sumnamīmahe
translation: To Rudra Lord of sacrifice, of hymns and balmy medicines, We pray for joy and health and strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यः शुक्र इव सूर्यो हिरण्यमिव रोचते | शरेष्ठो देवानां वसुः
transliteration: yaḥ śukra iva sūryo hiraṇyamiva rocate |
translation: He shines in splendour like the Sun, refulgent as bright gold is he, The good, the best among the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 44
sanskrit: अग्ने विवस्वदुषसश्चित्रं राधो अमर्त्य | आ दाशुषे जातवेदो वहा तवमद्या देवानुषर्बुधः
transliteration: aghne vivasvaduṣasaścitraṃ rādho amartya |
translation: IMMORTAL Jatavedas, thou many-hued fulgent gift of Dawn, Agni, this day to him who pays oblations bring the Gods who waken with the morn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 45
sanskrit: तवमग्ने वसून्रिह रुद्रानादित्यानुत | यजा सवध्वरं जनं मनुजातं घर्तप्रुषम
transliteration: tvamaghne vasūnriha rudrānādityānuta | yajā svadhvaraṃ janaṃ manujātaṃ ghṛtapruṣam
translation: WORSHIP the Vasus, Agni! here, the Rudras, the Adityas, all Who spring from Manu, those who know fair rites, who pour their blessings down.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 46
sanskrit: एषो उषा अपूर्व्य वयुछति परिया दिवः | सतुषे वामश्विना बर्हत
transliteration: eṣo uṣā apūrigvedaya vyuchati priyā divaḥ | stuṣe vāmaśvinā bṛhat
translation: Now Morning with her earliest light shines forth, dear Daughter of the Sky: High, Asvins, I extol your praise,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 46
sanskrit: या दस्रा सिन्धुमातरा मनोतरा रयीणाम | धिया देवा वसुविदा
transliteration: yā dasrā sindhumātarā manotarā rayīṇām | dhiyā devā vasuvidā
translation: Sons of the Sea, mighty to save discoverers of riches, ye Gods with deep thought who find out wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 46
sanskrit: वच्यन्ते वां ककुहासो जूर्णायामधि विष्टपि | यद वांरथो विभिष पतात
transliteration: vacyante vāṃ kakuhāso jūrṇāyāmadhi viṣṭapi | yad vāṃratho vibhiṣ patāt
translation: Your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames, When your car flies with winged steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 46
sanskrit: हविषा जारो अपां पिपर्ति पपुरिर्नरा | पिता कुटस्य चर्षणिः
transliteration: haviṣā jāro apāṃ piparti papurirnarā | pitā kuṭasya carṣaṇiḥ
translation: He, liberal, lover of the flood, Lord of the House, the vigilant, Chiefs! with oblations feeds you full.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अयं वां मधुमत्तमः सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा | तमश्विना पिबतं तिरोह्न्यं धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुशे
transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā | tamaśvinā pibataṃ tiroahnyaṃ dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuśe
translation: ASVINS, for you who strengthen Law this sweetest Soma hath been shed. Drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता सुपेशसा रथेना यातमश्विना | कण्वासो वां बरह्म कर्ण्वन्त्यध्वरे तेषां सु शर्णुतं हवम
transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā supeśasā rathenā yātamaśvinā | kaṇvāso vāṃ brahma kṛṇvantyadhvare teṣāṃ su śṛṇutaṃ havam
translation: Come, O ye Asvins, mounted on your triple car three-seated, beautiful of form To you at sacrifice the Kanvas send the prayer: graciously listen to their call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अश्विना मधुमत्तमं पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा | अथाद्य दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे दाश्वांसमुप गछतम
transliteration: aśvinā madhumattamaṃ pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā | athādya dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe dāśvāṃsamupa ghachatam
translation: O Asvins, ye who strengthen Law, drink ye this sweetest Soma juice. Borne on your wealth-fraught car come ye this day to him who offers, ye of wondrous deeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: तरिषधस्थे बर्हिषि विश्ववेदसा मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम | कण्वासो वां सुतसोमा अभिद्यवो युवां हवन्ते अश्विना
transliteration: triṣadhasthe barhiṣi viśvavedasā madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam | kaṇvāso vāṃ sutasomā abhidyavo yuvāṃ havante aśvinā
translation: Omniscient Asvins, on the thrice-heaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice. The sons of Kanva, striving heavenward, call on you with draughts of Soma juice out-poured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: याभिः कण्वमभिष्टिभिः परावतं युवमश्विना | ताभिः षवस्मानवतं शुभस पती पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा
transliteration: yābhiḥ kaṇvamabhiṣṭibhiḥ prāvataṃ yuvamaśvinā | tābhiḥ ṣvasmānavataṃ śubhas patī pātaṃ somaṃ ṛtāvṛdhā
translation: O Asvins, with those aids wherewith ye guarded Kanva carefully, Keep us, O Lords of Splendour: drink the Soma juice, ye strengtheners of holy law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: सुदासे दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे पर्क्षो वहतमश्विना | रयिं समुद्रादुत वा दिवस पर्यस्मे धत्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम
transliteration: sudāse dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe pṛkṣo vahatamaśvinā | rayiṃ samudrāduta vā divas paryasme dhattaṃ puruspṛham
translation: O Mighty Ones, ye gave Sudas abundant food, brought on your treasure-laden car; So now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave, either from heaven or from the sea.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: यन नासत्या परावति यद वा सथो अधि तुर्वशे | अतो रथेन सुव्र्ता न आ गतं साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः
transliteration: yan nāsatyā parāvati yad vā stho adhi turigvedaaśe | ato rathena suvṛtā na ā ghataṃ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
translation: Nasatyas, whether ye be far away or close to Turvasa, Borne on your lightly-rolling chariot come to us, together with the sunbeams come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चा वां सप्तयो.अध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप | इषं पर्ञ्चन्ता सुक्र्ते सुदानव आ बर्हिः सीदतं नरा
transliteration: arigvedaāñcā vāṃ saptayo.adhvaraśriyo vahantu savanedupa | iṣaṃ pṛñcantā sukṛte sudānava ā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā
translation: So let your coursers, ornaments of sacrifice, bring you to our libations here. Bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright, sit, Chiefs, upon the sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: तेन नासत्या गतं रथेन सूर्यत्वचा | येन शश्वदूहथुर्दाशुषे वसु मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये
transliteration: tena nāsatyā ghataṃ rathena sūryatvacā | yena śaśvadūhathurdāśuṣe vasu madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
translation: Come, O Nasatyas, on your car decked with a sunbright canopy, Whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper, to drink the Soma's pleasant juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 47
sanskrit: उक्थेभिरर्वागवसे पुरूवसू अर्कैश्च नि हवयामहे | शश्वत कण्वानां सदसि परिये हि कं सोमं पपथुरश्विना
transliteration: ukthebhirarigvedaāghavase purūvasū arkaiśca ni hvayāmahe |
translation: With lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us, that they, most rich, may succour us; For ye have ever in the Kanvas' well-loved house, O Asvins, drunk the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 48
sanskrit: सह वामेन न उषो वयुछा दुहितर्दिवः | सह दयुम्नेन बर्हता विभावरि राया देवि दास्वती
transliteration: saha vāmena na uṣo vyuchā duhitardivaḥ | saha dyumnena bṛhatā vibhāvari rāyā devi dāsvatī
translation: DAWN on us with prosperity, O Usas, Daughter of the Sky, Dawn with great glory, Goddess, Lady of the Light, dawn thou with riches, Bounteous One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्वसुविदो भूरि चयवन्त वस्तवे | उदीरय परति मा सून्र्ता उषश्चोद राधो मघोनाम
transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrigvedaśvasuvido bhūri cyavanta vastave | udīraya prati mā sūnṛtā uṣaścoda rādho maghonām
translation: They, bringing steeds and kine, boon-givers of all wealth, have oft sped forth to lighten us. O Usas, waken up for me the sounds of joy: send us the riches of the great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 48
sanskrit: उवासोषा उछाच्च नु देवी जीरा रथानाम | ये अस्या आचरणेषु दध्रिरे समुद्रे न शरवस्यवः
transliteration: uvāsoṣā uchācca nu devī jīrā rathānām | ye asyā ācaraṇeṣu dadhrire samudre na śravasyavaḥ
translation: Usas hath dawned, and now shall dawn, the Goddess, driver forth of cars Which, as she cometh nigh, have fixed their thought on her, like glory-seekers on the flood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 48
sanskrit: उषो ये ते पर यामेषु युञ्जते मनो दानाय सूरयः | अत्राह तत कण्व एषां कण्वतमो नाम गर्णाति नर्णाम
transliteration: uṣo ye te pra yāmeṣu yuñjate mano dānāya sūrayaḥ | atrāha tat kaṇva eṣāṃ kaṇvatamo nāma ghṛṇāti nṛṇām
translation: Here Kanva, chief of Kanva's race, sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes' names,-- The. princes who, O Usas, as thou comest near, direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 49
sanskrit: उषो भद्रेभिरा गहि दिवश्चिद रोचनादधि | वहन्त्वरुणप्सव उप तवा सोमिनो गर्हम
transliteration: uṣo bhadrebhirā ghahi divaścid rocanādadhi | vahantvaruṇapsava upa tvā somino ghṛham
translation: E'EN from above the sky's bright realm come, Usas, by auspicious ways: Let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the Soma, juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 49
sanskrit: सुपेशसं सुखं रथं यमध्यस्था उषस्त्वम | तेना सुश्रवसं जनं परावाद्य दुहितर्दिवः
transliteration: supeśasaṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ yamadhyasthā uṣastvam | tenā suśravasaṃ janaṃ prāvādya duhitardivaḥ
translation: The chariot which thou mountest, fair of shape, O Usas light to move,-- Therewith, O Daughter of the Sky, aid men of noble fame today.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 49
sanskrit: वयश्चित ते पतत्रिणो दविपच्चतुष्पदर्जुनि | उषः परारन्न्र्तून्रनु दिवो अन्तेभ्यस परि
transliteration: vayaścit te patatriṇo dvipaccatuṣpadarjuni | uṣaḥ prārannṛtūnranu divo antebhyas pari
translation: Bright Usas, when thy times return, all quadrupeds and bipeds stir, And round about flock winged birds from all the boundaries of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 49
sanskrit: वयुछन्ती हि रश्मिभिर्विश्वमाभासि रोचनम | तां तवामुषर्वसूयवो गीर्भिः कण्वा अहूषत
transliteration: vyuchantī hi raśmibhirigvedaśvamābhāsi rocanam | tāṃ tvāmuṣarigvedaasūyavo ghīrbhiḥ kaṇvā ahūṣata
translation: Thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm. Thee, as thou art, the Kanvas, fain for wealth, have called with sacred songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: उदु तयं जातवेदसं देवं वहन्ति केतवः | दर्शे विश्वाय सूर्यम
transliteration: udu tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ | dṛśe viśvāya sūryam
translation: HIS bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that lives, Surya, that all may look on him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: अप तये तायवो यथा नक्षत्रा यन्त्यक्तुभिः | सूराय विश्वचक्षसे
transliteration: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yantyaktubhiḥ | sūrāya viśvacakṣase
translation: The constellations pass away, like thieves, together with their beams, Before the all-beholding Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: अद्र्श्रमस्य केतवो वि रश्मयो जनाननु | भराजन्तो अग्नयो यथा
transliteration: adṛśramasya ketavo vi raśmayo janānanu | bhrājanto aghnayo yathā
translation: His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o'er the world of men, Like flames of fire that burn and blaze.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: तरणिर्विश्वदर्शतो जयोतिष्क्र्दसि सूर्य | विश्वमा भासिरोचनम
transliteration: taraṇirigvedaśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛdasi sūrya | viśvamā bhāsirocanam
translation: Swift and all beautiful art thou, O Surya, maker of the light, Illuming all the radiant realm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: परत्यं देवानां विशः परत्यङङ उदेषि मानुषान | परत्यं विश्वं सवर्द्र्शे
transliteration: pratyaṃ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ udeṣi mānuṣān | pratyaṃ viśvaṃ svardṛśe
translation: Thou goest to the hosts of Gods, thou comest hither to mankind, Hither all light to be beheld.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: येना पावक चक्षसा भुरण्यन्तं जनाननु | तवं वरुण पश्यसि
transliteration: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janānanu | tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi
translation: With that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant Varuna, Upon the busy race of men,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: वि दयामेषि रजस पर्थ्वहा मिमानो अक्तुभिः | पश्यञ जन्मानि सूर्य
transliteration: vi dyāmeṣi rajas pṛthvahā mimāno aktubhiḥ | paśyañ janmāni sūrya
translation: Traversing sky and wide mid-air, thou metest with thy beams our days, Sun, seeing all things that have birth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 50
sanskrit: सप्त तवा हरितो रथे वहन्ति देव सूर्य | शोचिष्केशं विचक्षण
transliteration: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya |
translation: Seven Bay Steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee, O thou farseeing One, God, Surya, with the radiant hair.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: अभि तयं मेषं पुरुहूतं रग्मियमिन्द्रं गीर्भिर्मदता वस्वो अर्णवम | यस्य दयावो न विचरन्ति मानुषा भुजे मंहिष्ठमभि विप्रमर्चत
transliteration: abhi tyaṃ meṣaṃ puruhūtaṃ ṛghmiyamindraṃ ghīrbhirmadatā vasvo arṇavam | yasya dyāvo na vicaranti mānuṣā bhuje maṃhiṣṭhamabhi vipramarcata
translation: MAKE glad with songs that Ram whom many men invoke, worthy of songs of praise, Indra, the sea of wealth; Whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad: sing praise to him the Sage, most liberal for our good.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: अभीमवन्वन सवभिष्टिमूतयो.अन्तरिक्षप्रां तविषीभिराव्र्तम | इन्द्रं दक्षास रभवो मदच्युतं शतक्रतुं जवनी सून्र्तारुहत
transliteration: abhīmavanvan svabhiṣṭimūtayo.antarikṣaprāṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtam | indraṃ dakṣāsa ṛbhavo madacyutaṃ śatakratuṃ javanī sūnṛtāruhat
translation: As aids the skilful Rbhus yearned to Indra strong to save, who fills mid-air, encompassed round with might, Rushing in rapture; and o'er Satakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तवं गोत्रमङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरपोतात्रये शतदुरेषु गातुवित | ससेन चिद विमदायावहो वस्वाजावद्रिं वावसानस्यनर्तयन
transliteration: tvaṃ ghotramaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapotātraye śatadureṣu ghātuvit | sasena cid vimadāyāvaho vasvājāvadriṃ vāvasānasyanartayan
translation: Thou hast disclosed the kine's stall for the Angirases, and made a way for Atri by a hundred doors. On Vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth, making thy bolt dance in the sacrificer's fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तवमपामपिधानाव्र्णोर अपाधारयः पर्वते दानुमद वसु | वर्त्रं यदिन्द्र शवसावधीरहिमादित सूर्यं दिव्यारोहयो दर्शे
transliteration: tvamapāmapidhānāvṛṇor apādhārayaḥ parigvedaate dānumad vasu | vṛtraṃ yadindra śavasāvadhīrahimādit sūryaṃ divyārohayo dṛśe
translation: Thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters; thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts. When thou hadst slain with might the dragon Vrtra, thou, Indra, didst raise the Sun in heaven for all to see.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तवं मायाभिरप मायिनो.अधमः सवधाभिर्ये अधि शुप्तावजुह्वत | तवं पिप्रोर्न्र्मणः परारुजः पुरः पर रजिश्वानं दस्युहत्येष्वाविथ
transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhirapa māyino.adhamaḥ svadhābhirye adhi śuptāvajuhvata | tvaṃ piprornṛmaṇaḥ prārujaḥ puraḥ pra ṛjiśvānaṃ dasyuhatyeṣvāvitha
translation: With wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away, with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest. Thou, hero-hearted, hast broken down Pipru's forts, and helped Rjisvan when the Dasyus were struck dead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तवं कुत्सं शुष्णहत्येष्वाविथारन्धयो.अतिथिग्वाय शम्बरम | महान्तं चिदर्बुदं नि करमीः पदा सनादेव दस्युहत्याय जज्ञिषे
transliteration: tvaṃ kutsaṃ śuṣṇahatyeṣvāvithārandhayo.atithighvāya śambaram | mahāntaṃ cidarbudaṃ ni kramīḥ padā sanādeva dasyuhatyāya jajñiṣe
translation: Thou savedst Kutsa when Susna was smitten down; to Atithigva gavest Sambara for a prey. E'en mighty Arbuda thou troddest under foot: thou from of old wast born to strike the Dasyus dead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तवे विश्वा तविषी सध्र्यग घिता तव राधः सोमपीथाय हर्षते | तव वज्रश्चिकिते बाह्वोर्हितो वर्श्चा शत्रोरव विश्वानि वर्ष्ण्या
transliteration: tve viśvā taviṣī sadhryagh ghitā tava rādhaḥ somapīthāya harṣate | tava vajraścikite bāhvorhito vṛścā śatrorava viśvāni vṛṣṇyā
translation: All power and might is closely gathered up in thee; thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking Soma juice. Known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms: rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 51
sanskrit: वि जानीह्यार्यान ये च दस्यवो बर्हिष्मते रन्धया शासदव्रतान | शाकी भव यजमानस्य चोदिता विश्वेत ता ते सधमादेषु चाकन
transliteration: vi jānīhyāryān ye ca dasyavo barhiṣmate randhayā śāsadavratān |
translation: Discern thou well Aryas and Dasyus; punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn. Be thou the sacrificer's strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 52
sanskrit: तयं सु मेषं महया सवर्विदं शतं यस्य सुभ्वः साकमीरते | अत्यं न वाजं हवनस्यदं रथमेन्द्रं वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः
transliteration: tyaṃ su meṣaṃ mahayā svarigvedadaṃ śataṃ yasya subhvaḥ sākamīrate | atyaṃ na vājaṃ havanasyadaṃ rathamendraṃ vavṛtyāmavase suvṛktibhiḥ
translation: I GLORIFY that Ram who finds the light of heaven, whose hundred nobly-natured ones go forth with him. With hymns may I turn hither Indra to mine aid,--the Car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 52
sanskrit: स पर्वतो न धरुणेष्वच्युतः सहस्रमूतिस्तविषीषु वाव्र्धे | इन्द्रो यद वर्त्रमवधीन नदीव्र्तमुब्जन्नर्णांसिजर्ह्र्षाणो अन्धसा
transliteration: sa parigvedaato na dharuṇeṣvacyutaḥ sahasramūtistaviṣīṣu vāvṛdhe | indro yad vṛtramavadhīn nadīvṛtamubjannarṇāṃsijarhṛṣāṇo andhasā
translation: Like as a mountain on firm basis, unremoved, he, thousandfold protector, waxed in mighty strength, When Indra, joying in the draughts of Soma juice, forced the clouds, slaying Vrtra stayer of their flow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 52
sanskrit: स हि दवरो दवरिषु वव्र ऊधनि चन्द्रबुध्नो मदव्र्द्धो मनीषिभिः | इन्द्रं तमह्वे सवपस्यया धिया मंहिष्ठरातिं स हि पप्रिरन्धसः
transliteration: sa hi dvaro dvariṣu vavra ūdhani candrabudhno madavṛddho manīṣibhiḥ | indraṃ tamahve svapasyayā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭharātiṃ sa hi paprirandhasaḥ
translation: For he stays e'en the stayers, spread o'er laden cloud, rooted in light, strengthened in rapture by the wise. Indra with thought, with skilled activity, I call, most liberal giver, for he sates him with the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 53
sanskrit: नयू षु वाचं पर महे भरामहे गिर इन्द्राय सदने विवस्वतः | नू चिद धि रत्नं ससतामिवाविदन न दुष्टुतिर्द्रविणोदेषु शस्यते
transliteration: nyū ṣu vācaṃ pra mahe bharāmahe ghira indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ | nū cid dhi ratnaṃ sasatāmivāvidan na duṣṭutirdraviṇodeṣu śasyate
translation: I WE will present fair praise unto the Mighty One, our hymns to Indra in Vivasvan's dwelling-place; For he hath ne'er found wealth in those who seem to sleep: those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 53
sanskrit: दुरो अश्वस्य दुर इन्द्र गोरसि दुरो यवस्य वसुन इनस पतिः | शिक्षानरः परदिवो अकामकर्शनः सखा सखिभ्यस्तमिदं गर्णीमसि
transliteration: duro aśvasya dura indra ghorasi duro yavasya vasuna inas patiḥ |
translation: Giver of horses, Indra, giver, thou, of kine, giver of barley, thou art Lord and guard of wealth: Man's helper from of old, not disappointing hope, Friend of our friends, to thee as such we sing this praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: मा नो अस्मिन मघवन पर्त्स्वंहसि नहि ते अन्तः शवसः परीणशे | अक्रन्दयो नद्यो रोरुवद वना कथा न कषोणीर्भियसा समारत
transliteration: mā no asmin maghavan pṛtsvaṃhasi nahi te antaḥ śavasaḥ parīṇaśe | akrandayo nadyo roruvad vanā kathā na kṣoṇīrbhiyasā samārata
translation: URGE us not, Maghavan, to this distressful fight, for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength. Thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar: did not men run in crowds together in their fear?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अर्चा शक्राय शाकिने शचीवते शर्ण्वन्तमिन्द्रं महयन्नभि षटुहि | यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा रोदसी उभे वर्षा वर्षत्वा वर्षभो नय्र्ञ्जते
transliteration: arcā śakrāya śākine śacīvate śṛṇvantamindraṃ mahayannabhi ṣṭuhi | yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā rodasī ubhe vṛṣā vṛṣatvā vṛṣabho nyṛñjate
translation: Sing hymns of praise to Sakra, Lord of power and might; laud thou and magnify Indra who heareth thee, Who with his daring might, a Bull exceeding strong in strength, maketh him master of the heaven and earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अर्चा दिवे बर्हते शूष्यं वचः सवक्षत्रं यस्य धर्षतो धर्षन मनः | बर्हच्छ्रवा असुरो बर्हणा कर्तः पुरो हरिभ्यां वर्षभो रथो हि षः
transliteration: arcā dive bṛhate śūṣyaṃ vacaḥ svakṣatraṃ yasya dhṛṣato dhṛṣan manaḥ | bṛhacchravā asuro barhaṇā kṛtaḥ puro haribhyāṃ vṛṣabho ratho hi ṣaḥ
translation: Sing forth to lofty Dyaus a strength-bestowing song, the Bold, whose resolute mind hath independent sway. High glory hath the Asura, compact of strength, drawn on by two Bay Steeds: a Bull, a Car is he.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तवं दिवो बर्हतः सानु कोपयो.अव तमना धर्षता शम्बरं भिनत | यन मायिनो वरन्दिनो मन्दिना धर्षच्छितां गभस्तिमशनिं पर्तन्यसि
transliteration: tvaṃ divo bṛhataḥ sānu kopayo.ava tmanā dhṛṣatā śambaraṃ bhinat | yan māyino vrandino mandinā dhṛṣacchitāṃ ghabhastimaśaniṃ pṛtanyasi
translation: The ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake; thou, daring, of thyself smotest through Sambara, When bold with gladdening juice, thou warredst with thy bolt, sharp and two-edged, against the banded sorcerers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: नि यद वर्णक्षि शवसनस्य मूर्धनि शुष्णस्य चिद वरन्दिनोरोरुवद वना | पराचीनेन मनसा बर्हणावता यदद्या चित कर्णवः कस्त्वा परि
transliteration: ni yad vṛṇakṣi śvasanasya mūrdhani śuṣṇasya cid vrandinororuvad vanā | prācīnena manasā barhaṇāvatā yadadyā cit kṛṇavaḥ kastvā pari
translation: When with a roar that fills the woods, thou forcest down on wind's head the stores which Susna kept confined, Who shall have power to stay thee firm and eager-souled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तवमाविथ नर्यं तुर्वशं यदुं तवं तुर्वीतिं वय्यंशतक्रतो | तवं रथमेतशं कर्त्व्ये धने तवं पुरो नवतिं दम्भयो नव
transliteration: tvamāvitha naryaṃ turigvedaaśaṃ yaduṃ tvaṃ turigvedaītiṃ vayyaṃśatakrato | tvaṃ rathametaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane tvaṃ puro navatiṃ dambhayo nava
translation: Thou helpest Narya, Turvasa, and Yadu, and Vayya's son Turviti, Satakratu! Thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nine-and-ninety castles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: स घा राजा सत्पतिः शूशुवज्जनो रातहव्यः परति यः शासमिन्वति | उक्था वा यो अभिग्र्णाति राधसा दानुरस्मा उपरा पिन्वते दिवः
transliteration: sa ghā rājā satpatiḥ śūśuvajjano rātahavyaḥ prati yaḥ śāsaminvati | ukthā vā yo abhighṛṇāti rādhasā dānurasmā uparā pinvate divaḥ
translation: A hero-lord is he, King of a mighty folk, who offers free oblations and promotes the Law, Who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise: for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: असमं कषत्रमसमा मनीषा पर सोमपा अपसा सन्तु नेमे | ये त इन्द्र ददुषो वर्धयन्ति महि कषत्रं सथविरं वर्ष्ण्यं च
transliteration: asamaṃ kṣatramasamā manīṣā pra somapā apasā santu neme | ye ta indra daduṣo vardhayanti mahi kṣatraṃ sthaviraṃ vṛṣṇyaṃ ca
translation: His power is matchless, matchless is his wisdom; chief, through their work, be some who drink the Soma, Those, Indra, who increase the lordly power, the firm heroic strength of thee the Giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तुभ्येदेते बहुला अद्रिदुग्धाश्चमूषदश्चमसा इन्द्रपानाः | वयश्नुहि तर्पया काममेषामथा मनो वसुदेयाय कर्ष्व
transliteration: tubhyedete bahulā adridughdhāścamūṣadaścamasā indrapānāḥ | vyaśnuhi tarpayā kāmameṣāmathā mano vasudeyāya kṛṣva
translation: Therefore for thee are these abundant beakers Indra's drink, stone-pressed juices held in ladles. Quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing; then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अपामतिष्ठद धरुणह्वरं तमो.अन्तर्व्र्त्रस्य जठरेषुपर्वतः | अभीमिन्द्रो नद्यो वव्रिणा हिता विश्वा अनुष्ठाः परवणेषु जिघ्नते
transliteration: apāmatiṣṭhad dharuṇahvaraṃ tamo.antarigvedaṛtrasya jaṭhareṣuparigvedaataḥ | abhīmindro nadyo vavriṇā hitā viśvā anuṣṭhāḥ pravaṇeṣu jighnate
translation: There darkness stood, the vault that stayed the waters' flow: in Vrtra's hollow side the rain-cloud lay concealed. But Indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed, flood following after flood, down steep declivities.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 54
sanskrit: स शेव्र्धमधि धा दयुम्नमस्मे महि कषत्रं जनाषाळिन्द्र तव्यम | रक्षा च नो मघोनः पाहि सूरीन राये च नः सवपत्या इषे धाः
transliteration: sa śevṛdhamadhi dhā dyumnamasme mahi kṣatraṃ janāṣāḷindra tavyam | rakṣā ca no maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn rāye ca naḥ svapatyā iṣe dhāḥ
translation: So give us, Indra, bliss-increasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people. Preserve our wealthy patrons, save our princes; vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: दिवश्चिदस्य वरिमा वि पप्रथ इन्द्रं न मह्ना पर्थिवीचन परति | भीमस्तुविष्माञ्चर्षणिभ्य आतपः शिशीते वज्रं तेजसे न वंसगः
transliteration: divaścidasya varimā vi papratha indraṃ na mahnā pṛthivīcana prati | bhīmastuviṣmāñcarṣaṇibhya ātapaḥ śiśīte vajraṃ tejase na vaṃsaghaḥ
translation: THOUGH e'en this heaven's wide space and earth have spread them out, nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness Indra's match. Awful and very mighty, causing woe to men, he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness, as a bull.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: सो अर्णवो न नद्यः समुद्रियः परति गर्भ्णाति विश्रिता वरीमभिः | इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वर्षायते सनात स युध्म ओजसा पनस्यते
transliteration: so arṇavo na nadyaḥ samudriyaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti viśritā varīmabhiḥ | indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣāyate sanāt sa yudhma ojasā panasyate
translation: Like as the watery ocean, so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width. He bears him like a bull to drink of Soma juice, and will, as Warrior from of old, be praised for might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं न भोजसे महो नर्म्णस्य धर्मणामिरज्यसि | पर वीर्येण देवताति चेकिते विश्वस्मा उग्रः कर्मणे पुरोहितः
transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parigvedaataṃ na bhojase maho nṛmṇasya dharmaṇāmirajyasi | pra vīryeṇa devatāti cekite viśvasmā ughraḥ karmaṇe purohitaḥ
translation: Thou swayest, Indra, all kinds of great manly power, so as to bend, as't were, even that famed mountain down. Foremost among the Gods is he through hero might, set in the van, the Strong One, for each arduous deed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: स इद वने नमस्युभिर्वचस्यते चारु जनेषु परब्रुवाण इन्द्रियम | वर्षा छन्दुर्भवति हर्यतो वर्षा कषेमेण धेनाम्मघवा यदिन्वति
transliteration: sa id vane namasyubhirigvedaacasyate cāru janeṣu prabruvāṇa indriyam | vṛṣā chandurbhavati haryato vṛṣā kṣemeṇa dhenāmmaghavā yadinvati
translation: He only in the wood is praised by worshippers, when he shows forth to men his own fair Indra-power. A friendly Bull is he, a Bull to be desired when Maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: स इन महानि समिथानि मज्मना कर्णोति युध्म ओजसा जनेभ्यः | अधा चन शरद दधति तविषीमत इन्द्राय वज्रं निघनिघ्नते वधम
transliteration: sa in mahāni samithāni majmanā kṛṇoti yudhma ojasā janebhyaḥ | adhā cana śrad dadhati tviṣīmata indrāya vajraṃ nighanighnate vadham
translation: Yet verily the Warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind; And men have faith in Indra, the resplendent One, what time he hurleth down his bolt, his dart of death.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: स हि शरवस्युः सदनानि कर्त्रिमा कष्मया वर्धान ओजसाविनाशयन | जयोतींषि कर्ण्वन्नव्र्काणि यज्यवे.अव सुक्रतुः सर्तवा अपः सर्जत
transliteration: sa hi śravasyuḥ sadanāni kṛtrimā kṣmayā vṛdhāna ojasāvināśayan | jyotīṃṣi kṛṇvannavṛkāṇi yajyave.ava sukratuḥ sartavā apaḥ sṛjat
translation: Though, fain for glory, and with strength increased on earth, he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art, He makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure, he bids, exceeding wise, the floods flow for his worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: दानाय मनः सोमपावन्नस्तु ते.अर्वाञ्चा हरी वन्दनश्रुदा कर्धि | यमिष्ठासः सारथयो य इन्द्र ते न तवा केताा दभ्नुवन्ति भूर्णयः
transliteration: dānāya manaḥ somapāvannastu te.arigvedaāñcā harī vandanaśrudā kṛdhi | yamiṣṭhāsaḥ sārathayo ya indra te na tvā ketāā dabhnuvanti bhūrṇayaḥ
translation: Drinker of Soma, let thy heart incline to give; bring thy Bays hitherward, O thou who hearest praise. Those charioteers of' thine, best skilled to draw the rein, the rapid sunbeams, Indra, lead thee not astray.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 55
sanskrit: अप्रक्षितं वसु बिभर्षि हस्तयोरषाळ्हं सहस्तन्वि शरुतो दधे | आव्र्तासो.अवतासो न कर्त्र्भिस्तनूषु ते करतवैन्द्र भूरयः
transliteration: aprakṣitaṃ vasu bibharṣi hastayoraṣāḷhaṃ sahastanvi śruto dadhe |
translation: Thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails; the famed One in his body holds unvanquished might. O Indra, in thy members many powers abide, like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: एष पर पूर्वीरव तस्य चम्रिषो.अत्यो न योषामुदयंस्त भुर्वणिः | दक्षं महे पाययते हिरण्ययं रथमाव्र्त्या हरियोगं रभ्वसम
transliteration: eṣa pra pūrigvedaīrava tasya camriṣo.atyo na yoṣāmudayaṃsta bhurigvedaaṇiḥ | dakṣaṃ mahe pāyayate hiraṇyayaṃ rathamāvṛtyā hariyoghaṃ ṛbhvasam
translation: FOR this man's full libations held in ladles, he hath roused him, eager, as a horse to meet the mare. He stays his golden car, yoked with Bay Horses, swift, and drinks the Soma juice which strengthens for great deeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: तं गूर्तयो नेमन्निषः परीणसः समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवः | पतिं दक्षस्य विदथस्य नू सहो गिरिं न वेना अधि रोह तेजसा
transliteration: taṃ ghūrtayo nemanniṣaḥ parīṇasaḥ samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ | patiṃ dakṣasya vidathasya nū saho ghiriṃ na venā adhi roha tejasā
translation: To him the guidance-following songs of praise flow full, as those who seek gain go in company to the flood. To him the Lord of power, the holy synod's might, as to a hill, with speed, ascend the loving ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: स तुर्वणिर्महानरेणु पौंस्ये गिरेर्भ्र्ष्टिर्न भराजते तुजा शवः | येन शुष्णं मायिनमायसो मदे दुध्राभूषु रामयन नि दामनि
transliteration: sa turigvedaaṇirmahānareṇu pauṃsye ghirerbhṛṣṭirna bhrājate tujā śavaḥ | yena śuṣṇaṃ māyinamāyaso made dudhraābhūṣu rāmayan ni dāmani
translation: Victorious, great is he; in manly battle shines, unstained with dust, his might, as shines a mountain peak; Wherewith the iron one, fierce e'en against the strong, in rapture, fettered wily Sushna fast in bonds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: देवी यदि तविषी तवाव्र्धोतय इन्द्रं सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः | यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा बाधते तम इयर्ति रेणुं बर्हदर्हरिष्वणिः
transliteration: devī yadi taviṣī tvāvṛdhotaya indraṃ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ | yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā bādhate tama iyarti reṇuṃ bṛhadarhariṣvaṇiḥ
translation: When Strength the Goddess, made more strong for help by thee, waits upon Indra as the Sun attends the Dawn, Then. he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft, with joy and triumphing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: वि यत तिरो धरुणमच्युतं रजो.अतिष्ठिपो दिव आतासुबर्हणा | सवर्मीळ्हे यन मद इन्द्र हर्ष्याहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम
transliteration: vi yat tiro dharuṇamacyutaṃ rajo.atiṣṭhipo diva ātāsubarhaṇā | svarmīḷhe yan mada indra harṣyāhan vṛtraṃ nirapāmaubjo arṇavam
translation: When thou with might, upon the framework of the heaven, didst fix, across, air's region firmly, unremoved, In the light-winning war, Indra, in rapturous joy, thou smotest Vrtra dead and broughtest floods of rain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 56
sanskrit: तवं दिवो धरुणं धिष ओजसा पर्थिव्या इन्द्र सदनेषु माहिनः | तवं सुतस्य मदे अरिणा अपो वि वर्त्रस्य समया पाष्यारुजः
transliteration: tvaṃ divo dharuṇaṃ dhiṣa ojasā pṛthivyā indra sadaneṣu māhinaḥ | tvaṃ sutasya made ariṇā apo vi vṛtrasya samayā pāṣyārujaḥ
translation: Thou with thy might didst grasp, the holder-up of heaven, thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth. Thou, gladdened by the juice, hast set the waters free, and broken Vrtra's stony fences through and through.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: पर मंहिष्ठाय बर्हते बर्हद्रये सत्यशुष्माय तवसे मतिं भरे | अपामिव परवणे यस्य दुर्धरं राधो विश्वायुशवसे अपाव्र्तम
transliteration: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satyaśuṣmāya tavase matiṃ bhare | apāmiva pravaṇe yasya durdharaṃ rādho viśvāyuśavase apāvṛtam
translation: To him most liberal, lofty Lord of lofty wealth, verily powerful and strong, I bring my hymn,-- Whose checkless bounty, as of waters down a slope, is spread abroad for all that live, to give them strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: अध ते विश्वमनु हासदिष्टय आपो निम्नेव सवना हविष्मतः | यत पर्वते न समशीत हर्यत इन्द्रस्य वज्रः शनथिता हिरण्ययः
transliteration: adha te viśvamanu hāsadiṣṭaya āpo nimneva savanā haviṣmataḥ | yat parigvedaate na samaśīta haryata indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ
translation: Now all this world, for worship, shall come after thee--the offerer's libations like floods to the depth, When the well-loved one seems to rest upon the hill, the thunderbolt of Indra, shatterer wrought of gold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: अस्मै भीमाय नमसा समध्वर उषो न शुभ्र आ भरापनीयसे | यस्य धाम शरवसे नामेन्द्रियं जयोतिरकारिहरितो नायसे
transliteration: asmai bhīmāya namasā samadhvara uṣo na śubhra ā bharāpanīyase | yasya dhāma śravase nāmendriyaṃ jyotirakāriharito nāyase
translation: To him the terrible, most meet for lofty praise, like bright Dawn, now bring gifts with reverence in this rite, Whose being, for renown, yea, Indra-power and light, have been created, like bay steeds, to move with speed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: इमे त इन्द्र ते वयं पुरुष्टुत ये तवारभ्य चरामसि परभूवसो | नहि तवदन्यो गिर्वणो गिरः सघत कषोणीरिव परति नो हर्य तद वचः
transliteration: ime ta indra te vayaṃ puruṣṭuta ye tvārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso | nahi tvadanyo ghirigvedaaṇo ghiraḥ saghat kṣoṇīriva prati no harya tad vacaḥ
translation: Thine, Indra, praised by many, excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee. Lover of praise, none else but thou receives our laud: as earth loves all her creatures, love thou this our hymn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: भूरि त इन्द्र वीर्यं तव समस्यस्य सतोतुर्मघवन काममा पर्ण | अनु ते दयौर्ब्र्हती वीर्यं मम इयं च ते पर्थिवी नेम ओजसे
transliteration: bhūri ta indra vīryaṃ tava smasyasya stoturmaghavan kāmamā pṛṇa | anu te dyaurbṛhatī vīryaṃ mama iyaṃ ca te pṛthivī nema ojase
translation: Great is thy power, O Indra, we are thine. Fulfil, O Maghavan, the wish of this thy worshipper. After thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength: to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 57
sanskrit: तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं महामुरुं वज्रेण वज्रिन पर्वशश्चकर्तिथ | अवास्र्जो निव्र्ताः सर्तवा अपः सत्रा विश्वं दधिषे केवलं सहः
transliteration: tvaṃ tamindra parigvedaataṃ mahāmuruṃ vajreṇa vajrin parigvedaaśaścakartitha | avāsṛjo nivṛtāḥ sartavā apaḥ satrā viśvaṃ dadhiṣe kevalaṃ sahaḥ
translation: Thou, who hast thunder for thy weapon, with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud. Thou hast sent down the obstructed floods that they may flow: thou hast, thine own for ever, all victorious might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 58
sanskrit: नू चित सहोजा अम्र्तो नि तुन्दते होता यद दूतो अभवद विवस्वतः | वि साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभी रजो मम आ देवताताहविषा विवासति
transliteration: nū cit sahojā amṛto ni tundate hotā yad dūto abhavad vivasvataḥ | vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhī rajo mama ā devatātāhaviṣā vivāsati
translation: NE'ER waxeth faint the Immortal, Son of Strength, since he, the Herald, hath become Vivasvan's messenger. On paths most excellent he measured out mid-air: he with oblation calls to service of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 59
sanskrit: वया इदग्ने अग्नयस्ते अन्ये तवे विश्वे अम्र्ता मादयन्ते | वैश्वानर नाभिरसि कषितीनां सथूणेव जनानुपमिद ययन्थ
transliteration: vayā idaghne aghnayaste anye tve viśve amṛtā mādayante | vaiśvānara nābhirasi kṣitīnāṃ sthūṇeva janānupamid yayantha
translation: THE other fires are, verily, thy branches; the Immortals all rejoice in thee, O Agni. Centre art thou, Vaisvanara, of the people, sustaining men like a deep-founded pillar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 59
sanskrit: मूर्धा दिवो नाभिरग्निः पर्थिव्या अथाभवदरती रोदस्योः | तं तवा देवासो.अजनयन्त देवं वैश्वानर जयोतिरिदार्याय
transliteration: mūrdhā divo nābhiraghniḥ pṛthivyā athābhavadaratī rodasyoḥ | taṃ tvā devāso.ajanayanta devaṃ vaiśvānara jyotiridāryāya
translation: The forehead of the sky, earth's centre, Agni became the messenger of earth and heaven. Vaisvanara, the Deities produced thee, a God, to be a light unto the Arya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 60
sanskrit: वह्निं यशसं विदथस्य केतुं सुप्राव्यं दूतं सद्योर्थम | दविजन्मानं रयिमिव परशस्तं रातिं भरद भर्गवेमातरिश्वा
transliteration: vahniṃ yaśasaṃ vidathasya ketuṃ suprāvyaṃ dūtaṃ sadyoartham | dvijanmānaṃ rayimiva praśastaṃ rātiṃ bharad bhṛghavemātariśvā
translation: As 'twere Some goodly treasure Matarisvan brought, as a gift, the glorious Priest to Bhrgu, Banner of sacrifice, the good Protector, child of two births, the swiftly moving envoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अस्य शासुरुभयासः सचन्ते हविष्मन्त उशिजो ये च मर्ताः | दिवश्चित पूर्वो नयसादि होताप्र्छ्यो विश्पतिर्विक्षुवेधाः
transliteration: asya śāsurubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmanta uśijo ye ca martāḥ | divaścit pūrigvedao nyasādi hotāpṛchyo viśpatirigvedakṣuvedhāḥ
translation: Both Gods and men obey this Ruler's order, Gods who are worshipped, men who yearn and worship. As Priest he takes his seat ere break of morning, House-Lord, adorable with men, Ordainer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 60
sanskrit: तं नव्यसी हर्द आ जायमानमस्मत सुकीर्तिर्मधुजिह्वमश्याः | यं रत्विजो वर्जने मानुषासः परयस्वन्त आयवो जीजनन्त
transliteration: taṃ navyasī hṛda ā jāyamānamasmat sukīrtirmadhujihvamaśyāḥ | yaṃ ṛtvijo vṛjane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvanta āyavo jījananta
translation: May our fair praise, heart-born, most recent, reach him whose tongue, e'en at his birth, is sweet as honey; Whom mortal priests, men, with their strong endeavour, supplied with dainty viands, have created.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 60
sanskrit: उशिक पावको वसुर्मानुषेषु वरेण्यो होताधायि विक्षु | दमूना गर्हपतिर्दम आ अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणाम
transliteration: uśik pāvako vasurmānuṣeṣu vareṇyo hotādhāyi vikṣu | damūnā ghṛhapatirdama ā aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām
translation: Good to mankind, the yearning Purifier hath among men been placed as Priest choice-worthy. May Agni be our Friend, Lord of the Household, protector of the riches in the dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 60
sanskrit: तं तवा वयं पतिमग्ने रयीणां पर शंसामो मतिभिर्गोतमासः | आशुं न वाजम्भरं मर्जयन्तः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात
transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ patimaghne rayīṇāṃ pra śaṃsāmo matibhirghotamāsaḥ |
translation: As such we Gotamas with hymns extol thee, O Agni, as the guardian Lord of riches, Decking thee like a horse, the swift prizewinner. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 61
sanskrit: अस्मा इदु पर तवसे तुराय परयो न हर्मि सतोमं माहिनाय | रचीषमायाध्रिगव ओहमिन्द्राय बरह्माणि राततमा
transliteration: asmā idu pra tavase turāya prayo na harmi stomaṃ māhināya |
translation: EVEN to him, swift, strong and high. exalted, I bring my song of praise as dainty viands, My thought to him resistless, praise-deserving, prayers offered most especially to Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: पर मन्महे शवसानाय शूषमाङगूषं गिर्वणसे अङगिरस्वत | सुव्र्क्तिभिः सतुवत रग्मियायार्चामार्कं नरे विश्रुताय
transliteration: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣamāṅghūṣaṃ ghirigvedaaṇase aṅghirasvat | suvṛktibhiḥ stuvata ṛghmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya
translation: LIKE Angiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song, exceeding mighty. Let us sing glory to the far-famed Hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: पर वो महे महि नमो भरध्वमाङगूष्यं शवसानाय साम | येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञा अर्चन्तो अङगिरसो गा अविन्दन
transliteration: pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvamāṅghūṣyaṃ śavasānāya sāma | yenā naḥ pūrigvedae pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅghiraso ghā avindan
translation: Unto the great bring ye great adoration, a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty, Through whom our sires, Angirases, singing praises and knowing well the places, found the cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्याङगिरसां चेष्टौ विदत सरमा तनयाय धासिम | बर्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः समुस्रियाभिर्वावशन्त नरः
transliteration: indrasyāṅghirasāṃ ceṣṭau vidat saramā tanayāya dhāsim | bṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad ghāḥ samusriyābhirigvedaāvaśanta naraḥ
translation: When Indra and the Angirases desired it, Sarama found provision for her offspring. Brhaspati cleft the mountain, found the cattle: the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: स सुष्टुभा स सतुभा सप्त विप्रैः सवरेणाद्रिं सवर्यो नवग्वैः | सरण्युभिः फलिगमिन्द्र शक्र वलं रवेणदरयो दशग्वैः
transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa stubhā sapta vipraiḥ svareṇādriṃ svaryo navaghvaiḥ | saraṇyubhiḥ phalighamindra śakra valaṃ raveṇadarayo daśaghvaiḥ
translation: Mid shout, loud shout, and roar, with the Navagvas, seven singers, hast thou, heavenly, rent the mountain; Thou hast, with speeders, with Dasagvas, Indra, Sakra, with thunder rent obstructive Vala.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: गर्णानो अङगिरोभिर्दस्म वि वरुषसा सूर्येण गोभिरन्धः | वि भूम्या अप्रथय इन्द्र सानु दिवो रज उपरमस्तभायः
transliteration: ghṛṇāno aṅghirobhirdasma vi varuṣasā sūryeṇa ghobhirandhaḥ | vi bhūmyā aprathaya indra sānu divo raja uparamastabhāyaḥ
translation: Praised by Angirases, thou, foe-destroyer, hast, with the Dawn, Sun, rays, dispelled the darkness. Thou Indra, hast spread out the earth's high ridges, and firmly fixed the region under heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: तदु परयक्षतममस्य कर्म दस्मस्य चारुतममस्ति दंसः | उपह्वरे यदुपरा अपिन्वन मध्वर्णसो नद्यश्चतस्रः
transliteration: tadu prayakṣatamamasya karma dasmasya cārutamamasti daṃsaḥ | upahvare yaduparā apinvan madhvarṇaso nadyaścatasraḥ
translation: This is the deed most worthy of all honour, the fairest marvel of the Wonder-Worker, That, nigh where heaven bends down, he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: दविता वि वव्रे सनजा सनीळे अयास्य सतवमानेभिरर्कैः | भगो न मेने परमे वयोमन्नधारयद रोदसी सुदंसाः
transliteration: dvitā vi vavre sanajā sanīḷe ayāsya stavamānebhirarkaiḥ | bhagho na mene parame vyomannadhārayad rodasī sudaṃsāḥ
translation: Unwearied, won with lauding hymns, he parted of old the ancient Pair, united ever. In highest sky like Bhaga, he the doer of marvels set both Dames and earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: सनाद दिवं परि भूमा विरूपे पुनर्भुवा युवती सवेभिरेवैः | कर्ष्णेभिरक्तोषा रुशद्भिर्वपुर्भिरा चरतो अन्यान्या
transliteration: sanād divaṃ pari bhūmā virūpe punarbhuvā yuvatī svebhirevaiḥ | kṛṣṇebhiraktoṣā ruśadbhirigvedaapurbhirā carato anyānyā
translation: Still born afresh, young Dames, each in her manner, unlike in hue, the Pair in alternation Round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled, Night with her dark limbs, Dawn with limbs of splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 62
sanskrit: सनेमि सख्यं सवपस्यमानः सूनुर्दाधार शवसा सुदंसाः | आमासु चिद दधिषे पक्वमन्तः पयः कर्ष्णासु रुशद रोहिणीषु
transliteration: sanemi sakhyaṃ svapasyamānaḥ sūnurdādhāra śavasā sudaṃsāḥ |
translation: Rich in good actions, skilled in operation, the Son with might maintains his perfect friendship. Thou in the raw cows, black of hue or ruddy, storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 63
sanskrit: तवं महानिन्द्र यो ह शुष्मैर्द्यावा जज्ञानः पर्थिवीमे धाः | यद ध ते विश्वा गिरयश्चिदभ्वा भिया दर्ळ्हासः किरणा नैजन
transliteration: tvaṃ mahānindra yo ha śuṣmairdyāvā jajñānaḥ pṛthivīame dhāḥ | yad dha te viśvā ghirayaścidabhvā bhiyā dṛḷhāsaḥ kiraṇā naijan
translation: THOU art the Mighty One; when born, O Indra, with power thou terrifiedst earth and heaven; When, in their fear of thee, all firm-set mountains and monstrous creatures shook like dust before thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 64
sanskrit: वर्ष्णे शर्धाय सुमखाय वेधसे नोधः सुव्र्क्तिं पर भरा मरुद्भ्यः | अपो न धीरो मनसा सुहस्त्यो गिरः समञ्जे विदथेष्वाभुवः
transliteration: vṛṣṇe śardhāya sumakhāya vedhase nodhaḥ suvṛktiṃ pra bharā marudbhyaḥ | apo na dhīro manasā suhastyo ghiraḥ samañje vidatheṣvābhuvaḥ
translation: BRING for the manly host, wise and majestical, O Nodhas, for the Maruts bring thou a pure gift. I deck my songs as one deft-handed, wise in mind prepares the water that hath power in solemn rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 64
sanskrit: ते जज्ञिरे दिव रष्वास उक्षणो रुद्रस्य मर्या असुरा अरेपसः | पावकासः शुचयः सूर्या इव सत्वानो न दरप्सिनोघोरवर्पसः
transliteration: te jajñire diva ṛṣvāsa ukṣaṇo rudrasya maryā asurā arepasaḥ | pāvakāsaḥ śucayaḥ sūryā iva satvāno na drapsinoghoravarpasaḥ
translation: They spring to birth, the lofty Ones, the Bulls of Heaven, divine, the youths of Rudra, free from spot and stain; The purifiers, shining brightly even as suns, awful of form like giants, scattering rain-drops down.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 64
sanskrit: युवानो रुद्रा अजरा अभोग्घनो ववक्षुरध्रिगावः पर्वता इव | दर्ळ्हा चिद विश्वा भुवनानि पार्थिवा पर चयावयन्तिदिव्यानि मज्मना
transliteration: yuvāno rudrā ajarā abhoghghano vavakṣuradhrighāvaḥ parigvedaatā iva | dṛḷhā cid viśvā bhuvanāni pārthivā pra cyāvayantidivyāni majmanā
translation: Young Rudras, demon-slayers, never growing old, they have waxed, even as mountains, irresistible. They make all beings tremble with their mighty strength, even the very strongest, both of earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 64
sanskrit: चित्रैरञ्जिभिर्वपुषे वयञ्जते वक्षस्सु रुक्मानधि येतिरे शुभे | अंसेष्वेषां नि मिम्र्क्षुर रष्टयः साकं जज्ञिरे सवधया दिवो नरः
transliteration: citrairañjibhirigvedaapuṣe vyañjate vakṣassu rukmānadhi yetire śubhe | aṃseṣveṣāṃ ni mimṛkṣur ṛṣṭayaḥ sākaṃ jajñire svadhayā divo naraḥ
translation: With glittering ornaments they deck them forth for show; for beauty on their breasts they bind their chains of gold. The lances on their shoulders pound to pieces; they were born together, of themselves, the Men of Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 65
sanskrit: पश्वा न तायुं गुहा चतन्तं नमो युजानं नमो वहन्तम | सजोषा धीराः पदैरनु गमन्नुप तवा सीदन विश्वेयजत्राः
transliteration: paśvā na tāyuṃ ghuhā catantaṃ namo yujānaṃ namo vahantam | sajoṣā dhīrāḥ padairanu ghmannupa tvā sīdan viśveyajatrāḥ
translation: ONE-MINDED, wise, they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow: Thee claiming worship, bearing it to Gods: there nigh to thee sate all the Holy Ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 66
sanskrit: रयिर्न चित्रा सूरो न सन्द्र्गायुर्न पराणो नित्यो नसूनुः | तक्वा न भूर्णिर्वना सिषक्ति पयो न धेनुः शुचिर्विभावा
transliteration: rayirna citrā sūro na sandṛghāyurna prāṇo nityo nasūnuḥ | takvā na bhūrṇirigvedaanā siṣakti payo na dhenuḥ śucirigvedabhāvā
translation: LIKE the Sun's glance, like wealth of varied sort, like breath which is the life, like one's own son, Like a swift bird, a cow who yields her milk, pure and refulgent to the wood he speeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 66
sanskrit: दाधार कषेममोको न रण्वो यवो न पक्वो जेता जनानाम | रषिर्न सतुभ्वा विक्षु परशस्तो वाजी न परीतो वयोदधति
transliteration: dādhāra kṣemamoko na raṇvo yavo na pakvo jetā janānām |
translation: He offers safety like a pleasant home, like ripened corn, the Conqueror of men. Like a Seer lauding, famed among the folk; like a steed friendly he vouchsafes us power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 67
sanskrit: वनेषु जायुर्मर्तेषु मित्रो वर्णीते शरुष्टिं राजेवाजुर्यम | कषेमो न साधुः करतुर्न भद्रो भुवत सवाधिर्होता हव्यवाट
transliteration: vaneṣu jāyurmarteṣu mitro vṛṇīte śruṣṭiṃ rājevājuryam | kṣemo na sādhuḥ kraturna bhadro bhuvat svādhirhotā havyavāṭ
translation: VICTORIOUS in the wood, Friend among men, ever he claims obedience as a King. Gracious like peace, blessing like mental power, Priest was he, offering-bearer, full of thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 67
sanskrit: हस्ते दधानो नर्म्णा विश्वान्यमे देवान धाद गुहा निषीदन | विदन्तीमत्र नरो धियन्धा हर्दा यत तष्टान मन्त्रानशंसन
transliteration: haste dadhāno nṛmṇā viśvānyame devān dhād ghuhā niṣīdan | vidantīmatra naro dhiyandhā hṛdā yat taṣṭān mantrānaśaṃsan
translation: He, bearing in his hand all manly might, crouched in the cavern, struck the Gods with fear. Men filled with understanding find him there, when they have sting prayers formed within their heart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 67
sanskrit: अजो न कषां दाधार पर्थिवीं तस्तम्भ दयां मन्त्रेभिः सत्यैः | परिया पदानि पश्वो नि पाहि विश्वायुरग्ने गुहा गुहं गाः
transliteration: ajo na kṣāṃ dādhāra pṛthivīṃ tastambha dyāṃ mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ | priyā padāni paśvo ni pāhi viśvāyuraghne ghuhā ghuhaṃ ghāḥ
translation: He, like the Unborn, holds the broad earth up; and with effective utterance fixed the sky. O Agni, guard the spots which cattle love: thou, life of all, hast gone from lair to lair.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 67
sanskrit: य ईं चिकेत गुहा भवन्तमा यः ससाद धारां रतस्य | वि ये चर्तन्त्य रता सपन्त आदिद वसूनि पर ववाचास्मै
transliteration: ya īṃ ciketa ghuhā bhavantamā yaḥ sasāda dhārāṃ ṛtasya | vi ye cṛtanty ṛtā sapanta ādid vasūni pra vavācāsmai
translation: Whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair, and hath approached the stream of holy Law,-- They who release him, paying sacred rites,--truly to such doth he announce great wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 67
sanskrit: वि यो वीरुत्सु रोधन महित्वोत परजा उत परसूष्वन्तः | चित्तिरपां दमे विश्वायुः सद्मेव धीराः सम्माय चक्रुः
transliteration: vi yo vīrutsu rodhan mahitvota prajā uta prasūṣvantaḥ | cittirapāṃ dame viśvāyuḥ sadmeva dhīrāḥ sammāya cakruḥ
translation: He who grows mightily in herbs, within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears, Wise, life of all men, in the waters' home,--for him have sages built as 'twere a seat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 68
sanskrit: शरीणन्नुप सथाद दिवं भुरण्यु सथातुश्चरथमक्तून्व्यूर्णोत | परि यदेषामेको विश्वेषां भुवद देवो देवानां महित्वा
transliteration: pari yadeṣāmeko viśveṣāṃ bhuvad devo devānāṃ mahitvā
translation: COMMINGLING, restless, he ascends the sky, unveiling nights and all that stands or moves, As he the sole God is preeminent in greatness among all these other Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 69
sanskrit: शुक्रः शुशुक्वानुषो न जारः पप्रा समीची दिवो नज्योतिः | परि परजातः करत्वा बभूथ भुवो देवानां पिता पुत्रः सन
transliteration: pari prajātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvo devānāṃ pitā putraḥ san
translation: BRIGHT, splendid, like Dawn's lover, he hath filled the two joined worlds as with the light of heaven. When born, with might thou hast encompassed them: Father of Gods, and yet their Son wast thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 69
sanskrit: वेधा अद्र्प्तो अग्निर्विजानन्नूधर्न गोनां सवाद्मा पितूनाम | जने न शेव आहूर्यः सन मध्ये निषत्तो रण्वो दुरोणे
transliteration: vedhā adṛpto aghnirigvedajānannūdharna ghonāṃ svādmā pitūnām | jane na śeva āhūryaḥ san madhye niṣatto raṇvo duroṇe
translation: Agni, the Sage, the humble, who discerns like the cow's udder, the sweet taste of food, Like a bliss-giver to be drawn to men, sits gracious in the middle of the house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 69
sanskrit: पुत्रो न जातो रण्वो दुरोणे वाजी न परीतो विशो वि तारीत | विशो यदह्वे नर्भिः सनीळा अग्निर्देवत्वा विश्वान्यश्याः
transliteration: putro na jāto raṇvo duroṇe vājī na prīto viśo vi tārīt | viśo yadahve nṛbhiḥ sanīḷā aghnirdevatvā viśvānyaśyāḥ
translation: Born in the dwelling like a lovely son, pleased, like a strong steed, he bears on the folk. What time the men and I, with heroes, call, may Agni then gain all through Godlike power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 69
sanskrit: नकिष ट एता वरता मिनन्ति नर्भ्यो यदेभ्यः शरुष्टिं चकर्थ | तत तु ते दंसो यदहन समानैर्न्र्भिर्यद युक्तो विवे रपांसि
transliteration: nakiṣ ṭa etā vratā minanti nṛbhyo yadebhyaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakartha | tat tu te daṃso yadahan samānairnṛbhiryad yukto vive rapāṃsi
translation: None breaks these holy laws of thine when thou hast granted audience to these chieftains here. This is thy boast, thou smotest with thy peers, and joined with heroes dravest off disgrace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 69
sanskrit: उषो न जारो विभावोस्रः संज्ञातरूपश्चिकेतदस्मै | तमना वहन्तो दुरो वय रण्वन नवन्त विश्वे सवर्द्र्शीके
transliteration: uṣo na jāro vibhāvosraḥ saṃjñātarūpaściketadasmai | tmanā vahanto duro vy ṛṇvan navanta viśve svardṛśīke
translation: Like the Dawn's lover, spreading light, well-known as hued like morn, may he remember me. They, bearing of themselves, unbar the doors: they all ascend to the fair place of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 70
sanskrit: वनेम पूर्वीरर्यो मनीषा अग्निः सुशोको विश्वान्यश्याः | आ दैव्यानि वरता चिकित्वाना मानुषस्य जनस्य जन्म
transliteration: vanema pūrigvedaīraryo manīṣā aghniḥ suśoko viśvānyaśyāḥ |
translation: MAY we, the pious, win much food by prayer, may Agni with fair light pervade each act,-- He the observer of the heavenly laws of Gods, and of the race of mortal man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उप पर जिन्वन्नुशतीरुशन्तं पतिं न नित्यं जनयः सनीळाः | सवसारः शयावीमरुषीमजुष्रञ्चित्रमुछन्तीमुषसं न गावः
transliteration: upa pra jinvannuśatīruśantaṃ patiṃ na nityaṃ janayaḥ sanīḷāḥ | svasāraḥ śyāvīmaruṣīmajuṣrañcitramuchantīmuṣasaṃ na ghāvaḥ
translation: LOVING the loving One, as wives their husband, the sisters of one home have urged him forward, Bright-coloured, even, as the cows love morning, dark, breaking forth to view, and redly beaming.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 71
sanskrit: वीळु चिद दर्ळ्हा पितरो न उक्थैरद्रिं रुजन्नङगिरसो रवेण | चक्रुर्दिवो बर्हतो गातुमस्मे अहः सवर्विविदुः केतुमुस्राः
transliteration: vīḷu cid dṛḷhā pitaro na ukthairadriṃ rujannaṅghiraso raveṇa | cakrurdivo bṛhato ghātumasme ahaḥ svarigvedaviduḥ ketumusrāḥ
translation: Our sires with lauds burst e'en the firm-set fortress, yea, the Angirases, with roar, the mountain. They made for us a way to reach high heaven, they found us day, light, day's sign, beams of morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 71
sanskrit: दधन्न्र्तं धनयन्नस्य धीतिमादिदर्यो दिधिष्वो विभ्र्त्राः | अत्र्ष्यन्तीरपसो यन्त्यछा देवाञ जन्म परयसा वर्धयन्तीः
transliteration: dadhannṛtaṃ dhanayannasya dhītimādidaryo didhiṣvo vibhṛtrāḥ | atṛṣyantīrapaso yantyachā devāñ janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ
translation: They stablished order, made his service fruitful; then parting them among the longing faithful, Not thirsting after aught, they come, most active, while with sweet food the race of Gods they strengthen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 71
sanskrit: मथीद यदीं विभ्र्तो मातरिश्वा गर्हे-गर्हे शयेतो जेन्यो भूत | आदीं राज्ञे न सहीयसे सचा सन्ना दूत्यं भर्गवाणो विवाय
transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ vibhṛto mātariśvā ghṛhe-ghṛhe śyeto jenyo bhūt |
translation: Since Matarisvan, far-diffused, hath stirred him, and he in every house grown bright and noble, He, Bhrgu-like I hath gone as his companion, as on commission to a greater Sovran.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 72
sanskrit: नि काव्या वेधसः शश्वतस कर्हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि | अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणां सत्रा चक्राणो अम्र्तानि विश्वा
transliteration: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvatas karhaste dadhāno naryā purūṇi | aghnirbhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ satrā cakrāṇo amṛtāni viśvā
translation: THOUGH holding many gifts for men, he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer. Agni is now the treasure-lord of treasures, for ever granting all immortal bounties.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 72
sanskrit: अस्मे वत्सं परि षन्तं न विन्दन्निछन्तो विश्वे अम्र्ता अमूराः | शरमयुवः पदव्यो धियन्धास्तस्थुः पदे परमेचार्वग्नेः
transliteration: asme vatsaṃ pari ṣantaṃ na vindannichanto viśve amṛtā amūrāḥ |
translation: The Gods infallible all searching found not him, the dear Babe who still is round about us. Worn weary, following his track, devoted, they reached the lovely highest home of Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 73
sanskrit: रयिर्न यः पित्र्वित्तो वयोधाः सुप्रणीतिश्चिकितुषो नशासुः | सयोनाशीरतिथिर्न परीणानो होतेव सद्म विधतो वि तारीत
transliteration: rayirna yaḥ pitṛvitto vayodhāḥ supraṇītiścikituṣo naśāsuḥ | syonāśīratithirna prīṇāno hoteva sadma vidhato vi tārīt
translation: HE who gives food, like patrimonial riches and guides aright like some wise man's instruction, Loved like a guest who lies in pleasant lodging,--may he, as Priest, prosper his servant's dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 73
sanskrit: देवो न यः सविता सत्यमन्मा करत्वा निपाति वर्जनानि विश्वा | पुरुप्रशस्तो अमतिर्न सत्य आत्मेव शेवो दिधिषाय्यो भूत
transliteration: devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā kratvā nipāti vṛjanāni viśvā | purupraśasto amatirna satya ātmeva śevo didhiṣāyyo bhūt
translation: He who like Savitar the God, true-minded protecteth with his power. all acts of vigour, Truthful, like splendour, glorified by many, like breath joy-giving,--all must strive to win him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 73
sanskrit: देवो न यः पर्थिवीं विश्वधाया उपक्षेति हितमित्रो न राजा | पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा अनवद्या पतिजुष्टेव नारी
transliteration: devo na yaḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upakṣeti hitamitro na rājā | puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā anavadyā patijuṣṭeva nārī
translation: He who on earth dwells like a king surrounded by faithful friends, like a God all-sustaining, Like heroes who preside, who sit in safety: like as a blameless dame dear to her husband.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 73
sanskrit: तं तवा नरो दम आ नित्यमिद्धमग्ने सचन्त कषितिषु धरुवासु | अधि दयुम्नं नि दधुर्भूर्यस्मिन भवा विश्वायुर्धरुणो रयीणाम
transliteration: taṃ tvā naro dama ā nityamiddhamaghne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu | adhi dyumnaṃ ni dadhurbhūryasmin bhavā viśvāyurdharuṇo rayīṇām
translation: Thee, such, in settlements secure, O Agni, our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling. On him have they laid splendour in abundance: dear to all men, bearer be he of riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 73
sanskrit: वि पर्क्षो अग्ने मघवानो अश्युर्वि सूरयो ददतो विश्वमायुः | सनेम वाजं समिथेष्वर्यो भागं देवेषु शरवसेदधानाः
transliteration: vi pṛkṣo aghne maghavāno aśyurigveda sūrayo dadato viśvamāyuḥ | sanema vājaṃ samitheṣvaryo bhāghaṃ deveṣu śravasedadhānāḥ
translation: May thy rich worshippers win food, O Agni, and princes gain long life who bring oblation. May we get booty from our foe in battle, presenting to the Gods their share for glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 74
sanskrit: उपप्रयन्तो अध्वरं मन्त्रं वोचेमाग्नये | आरे अस्मे च शर्ण्वते
transliteration: upaprayanto adhvaraṃ mantraṃ vocemāghnaye |
translation: As forth to sacrifice we go, a hymn to a hymn let us say, Who hears us even when afar;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 75
sanskrit: जुषस्व सप्रथस्तमं वचो देवप्सरस्तमम | हव्या जुह्वानासनि
transliteration: juṣasva saprathastamaṃ vaco devapsarastamam | havyā juhvānaāsani
translation: ACCEPT our loudest-sounding hymn, food most delightful to the Gods, Pouring our offerings in thy mouth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 75
sanskrit: अथा ते अङगिरस्तमाग्ने वेधस्तम परियम | वोचेम बरह्म सानसि
transliteration: athā te aṅghirastamāghne vedhastama priyam | vocema brahma sānasi
translation: Now, Agni, will we say to thee, O wisest and best Angiras, Our precious, much-availing prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 75
sanskrit: कस्ते जामिर्जनानामग्ने को दाश्वध्वरः | को ह कस्मिन्नसि शरितः
transliteration: kaste jāmirjanānāmaghne ko dāśvadhvaraḥ | ko ha kasminnasi śritaḥ
