translation: Who, Agni, is thy kin, of men? who is thy worthy worshipper? On whom dependent? who art thou?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 75
sanskrit: तवं जामिर्जनानामग्ने मित्रो असि परियः | सखा सखिभ्य ईड्यः
transliteration: tvaṃ jāmirjanānāmaghne mitro asi priyaḥ | sakhā sakhibhya īḍyaḥ
translation: The kinsman, Agni, of mankind, their well beloved Friend art thou, A Friend whom friends may supplicate.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 75
sanskrit: यजा नो मित्रावरुणा यजा देवान रतं बर्हत | अग्ने यक्षिस्वं दमम
transliteration: yajā no mitrāvaruṇā yajā devān ṛtaṃ bṛhat | aghne yakṣisvaṃ damam
translation: Bring to us Mitra, Varuna, bring the Gods to mighty sacrifice. Bring them, O Agni, to thine home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 76
sanskrit: का त उपेतिर्मनसो वराय भुवदग्ने शन्तमा का मनीषा | को वा यज्ञैः परि दक्षं त आप केन वा ते मनसादाशेम
transliteration: kā ta upetirmanaso varāya bhuvadaghne śantamā kā manīṣā | ko vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣaṃ ta āpa kena vā te manasādāśema
translation: How may the mind draw nigh to please thee, Agni? What hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing? Or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices? or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 76
sanskrit: एह्यग्न इह होता नि षीदादब्धः सु पुरेता भवा नः | अवतां तवा रोदसी विश्वमिन्वे यजा महे सौमनसाय देवान
transliteration: ehyaghna iha hotā ni ṣīdādabdhaḥ su puraetā bhavā naḥ | avatāṃ tvā rodasī viśvaminve yajā mahe saumanasāya devān
translation: Come hither, Agni; sit thee down as Hotar; be thou who never wast deceived our leader. May Heaven and Earth, the all-pervading, love thee: worship the Gods to win for us their favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 76
sanskrit: पर सु विश्वान रक्षसो धक्ष्यग्ने भवा यज्ञानामभिशस्तिपावा | अथा वह सोमपतिं हरिभ्यामातिथ्यमस्मै चक्र्मा सुदाव्ने
transliteration: pra su viśvān rakṣaso dhakṣyaghne bhavā yajñānāmabhiśastipāvā | athā vaha somapatiṃ haribhyāmātithyamasmai cakṛmā sudāvne
translation: Burn thou up all the Raksasas, O Agni; ward thou off curses from our sacrifices. Bring hither with his Bays the Lord of Soma: here is glad welcome for the Bounteous Giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 76
sanskrit: परजावता वचसा वह्निरासा च हुवे नि च सत्सीह देवैः | वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं यजत्र बोधि परयन्तर्जनितर्वसूनाम
transliteration: prajāvatā vacasā vahnirāsā ca huve ni ca satsīha devaiḥ | veṣi hotramuta potraṃ yajatra bodhi prayantarjanitarigvedaasūnām
translation: Thou Priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked. Here with the Gods be seated. Thine is the task of Cleanser and Presenter: waken us, Wealth-bestower and Producer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 76
sanskrit: यथा विप्रस्य मनुषो हविर्भिर्देवानयजः कविभिः कविः सन | एवा होतः सत्यतर तवमद्याग्ने मन्द्रया जुह्वा यजस्व
transliteration: yathā viprasya manuṣo havirbhirdevānayajaḥ kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san | evā hotaḥ satyatara tvamadyāghne mandrayā juhvā yajasva
translation: As with oblations of the priestly Manus thou worshippedst the Gods, a Sage with sages, So now, O truthfullest Invoker Agni, worship this day with joy-bestowing ladle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 77
sanskrit: कथा दाशेमाग्नये कास्मै देवजुष्टोच्यते भामिने गीः | यो मर्त्येष्वम्र्त रतावा होता यजिष्ठ इत कर्णोति देवान
transliteration: kathā dāśemāghnaye kāsmai devajuṣṭocyate bhāmine ghīḥ | yo martyeṣvamṛta ṛtāvā hotā yajiṣṭha it kṛṇoti devān
translation: How shall we pay oblation unto Agni? What hymn, Godloved, is said to him refulgent? Who, deathless, true to Law, mid men a herald, bringeth the Gods as best of sacrificers?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 77
sanskrit: यो अध्वरेषु शन्तम रतावा होता तमू नमोभिरा कर्णुध्वम | अग्निर्यद वेर्मर्ताय देवान स चा बोधाति मनसायजाति
transliteration: yo adhvareṣu śantama ṛtāvā hotā tamū namobhirā kṛṇudhvam | aghniryad vermartāya devān sa cā bodhāti manasāyajāti
translation: Bring him with reverence hither, most propitious in sacrifices, true to Law, the herald; For Agni, when he seeks the Gods for mortals, knows them full well and worships them in spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 77
sanskrit: स हि करतुः स मर्यः स साधुर्मित्रो न भूदद्भुतस्य रथीः | तं मेधेषु परथमं देवयन्तीर्विश उप बरुवते दस्ममारीः
transliteration: sa hi kratuḥ sa maryaḥ sa sādhurmitro na bhūdadbhutasya rathīḥ | taṃ medheṣu prathamaṃ devayantīrigvedaśa upa bruvate dasmamārīḥ
translation: For he is mental power, a man, and perfect; he is the bringer, friend-like, of the wondrous. The pious Aryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 77
sanskrit: स नो नर्णां नर्तमो रिशाद अग्निर्गिरो.अवसा वेतु धीतिम | तना च ये मघवानः शविष्ठ वाजप्रसूता इषयन्तमन्म
transliteration: sa no nṛṇāṃ nṛtamo riśāda aghnirghiro.avasā vetu dhītim | tanā ca ye maghavānaḥ śaviṣṭha vājaprasūtā iṣayantamanma
translation: May Agni, foe-destroyer, manliest Hero, accept with love our hymns and our devotion. So may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest, urged by their riches, stir our thoughts with vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 77
sanskrit: एवाग्निर्गोतमेभिर्र्तावा विप्रेभिरस्तोष्ट जातवेदाः | स एषु दयुम्नं पीपयत स वाजं स पुष्टिं याति जोषमा चिकित्वान
transliteration: evāghnirghotamebhirṛtāvā viprebhirastoṣṭa jātavedāḥ | sa eṣu dyumnaṃ pīpayat sa vājaṃ sa puṣṭiṃ yāti joṣamā cikitvān
translation: Thus Agni Jatavedas, true to Order, hath by the priestly Gotamas been lauded. May he augment in them splendour and vigour: observant, as he lists, he gathers increase.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अभि तवा गोतमा गिरा जातवेदो विचर्षणे | दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः
transliteration: abhi tvā ghotamā ghirā jātavedo vicarṣaṇe | dyumnairabhi pra ṇonumaḥ
translation: O JATAVEDAS, keen and swift, we Gotamas with sacred song exalt thee for thy glories' sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 78
sanskrit: तमु तवा गोतमो गिरा रायस्कामो दुवस्यति | दयुम्नैर...
transliteration: tamu tvā ghotamo ghirā rāyaskāmo duvasyati | dyumnair...
translation: Thee, as thou art, desiring wealth Gotama worships with his song: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 78
sanskrit: तमु तवा वाजसातममङगिरस्वद धवामहे | दयुम्नैर...
transliteration: tamu tvā vājasātamamaṅghirasvad dhavāmahe | dyumnair...
translation: As such, like Angiras we call on thee best winner of the spoil: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 78
sanskrit: तमु तवा वर्त्रहन्तमं यो दस्यून्रवधूनुषे | दयुम्नैर.. .
transliteration: tamu tvā vṛtrahantamaṃ yo dasyūnravadhūnuṣe | dyumnair.. .
translation: Thee, best of Vrtra-slayers, thee who shakest off our Dasyu foes: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अवोचाम रहूगणा अग्नये मधुमद वचः | दयुम्नैर...
transliteration: avocāma rahūghaṇā aghnaye madhumad vacaḥ | dyumnair...
translation: A pleasant song to Agni we, sons of Rahugana, have sung: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 79
sanskrit: हिरण्यकेशो रजसो विसारे.अहिर्धुनिर्वात इव धरजीमान | शुचिभ्राजा उषसो नवेदा यशस्वतीरपस्युवो न सत्याः
transliteration: hiraṇyakeśo rajaso visāre.ahirdhunirigvedaāta iva dhrajīmān |
translation: HE in mid-air's expanse hath golden tresses; a raging serpent, like the rushing tempest: Purely refulgent, knowing well the morning; like honourable dames, true, active workers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 80
sanskrit: इत्था हि सोम इन मदे बरह्मा चकार वर्धनम | शविष्ठ वज्रिन्नोजसा पर्थिव्या निः शशा अहिमर्चन्ननु सवराज्यम
transliteration: itthā hi soma in made brahmā cakāra vardhanam |
translation: THUS in the Soma, in wild joy the Brahman hath exalted thee: Thou, mightiest thunder-armed, hast driven by force the Dragon from the earth, lauding thine own imperial sway.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 81
sanskrit: इन्द्रो मदाय वाव्र्धे शवसे वर्त्रहा नर्भिः | तमिन महत्स्वाजिषूतेमर्भे हवामहे स वाजेषु पर नो.अविषत
transliteration: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ | tamin mahatsvājiṣūtemarbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no.aviṣat
translation: THE men have lifted Indra up, the Vrtra slayer, to joy and strength: Him, verily, we invocate in battles whether great or small: be he our aid in deeds of might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 81
sanskrit: असि हि वीर सेन्यो.असि भूरि पराददिः | असि दभ्रस्य चिद्व्र्धो यजमानाय शिक्षसि सुन्वते भूरि ते वसु
transliteration: asi hi vīra senyo.asi bhūri parādadiḥ | asi dabhrasya cidvṛdho yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu
translation: Thou, Hero, art a warrior, thou art giver of abundant spoil. Strengthening e'en the feeble, thou aidest the sacrificer, thou givest the offerer ample wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 81
sanskrit: यदुदीरत आजयो धर्ष्णवे धीयते धना | युक्ष्वा मदच्युता हरी कं हनः कं वसौ दधो.अस्मानिन्द्र वसौ दधः
transliteration: yadudīrata ājayo dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā | yukṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho.asmānindra vasau dadhaḥ
translation: When war and battles are on foot, booty is laid before the bold. Yoke thou thy wildly-rushing Bays. Whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? Do thou, O Indra, make us rich.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 81
sanskrit: करत्वामहाननुष्वधं भीम आ वाव्र्धे शवः | शरियर्ष्व उपाकयोर्नि शिप्री हरिवान दधे हस्तयोर्वज्रमायसम
transliteration: kratvāmahānanuṣvadhaṃ bhīma ā vāvṛdhe śavaḥ |
translation: Mighty through wisdom, as he lists, terrible, he hath waxed in strength. Lord of Bay Steeds, strong-jawed, sublime, he in joined hands for glory's sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: उपो षु शर्णुही गिरो मघवन मातथा इव | यदा नः सून्र्तावतः कर आदर्थयास इद योजा नविन्द्र ते हरी
transliteration: upo ṣu śṛṇuhī ghiro maghavan mātathā iva | yadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ kara ādarthayāsa id yojā nvindra te harī
translation: GRACIOUSLY listen to our songs, Maghavan, be not negligent. As thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee, now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: अक्षन्नमीमदन्त हयव परिया अधूषत | अस्तोषत सवभानवो विप्रा नविष्ठया मती योजा ...
transliteration: akṣannamīmadanta hyava priyā adhūṣata | astoṣata svabhānavo viprā naviṣṭhayā matī yojā ...
translation: Well have they eaten and rejoiced; the friends have risen and passed away. The sages luminous in themselves have. praised thee with their latest hymn. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं मघवन वन्दिषीमहि | पर नूनं पूर्णवन्धुर सतुतो याहि वशाननु योजा ...
transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavan vandiṣīmahi | pra nūnaṃ pūrṇavandhura stuto yāhi vaśānanu yojā ...
translation: Maghavan, we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon. Thus praised, according to our wish come now with richly laden car. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: स घा तं वर्षणं रथमधि तिष्ठाति गोविदम | यःपात्रं हारियोजनं पूर्णमिन्द्र चिकेतति योजा ...
transliteration: sa ghā taṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rathamadhi tiṣṭhāti ghovidam | yaḥpātraṃ hāriyojanaṃ pūrṇamindra ciketati yojā ...
translation: He will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine, Who thinks upon the well-filled bowl, the Tawny Coursers' harnesser. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: युक्तस्ते अस्तु दक्षिण उत सव्यः शतक्रतो
transliteration: yuktaste astu dakṣiṇa uta savyaḥ śatakrato
translation: Let, Lord of Hundred Powers, thy Steeds be harnessed on the right and left. Therewith in rapture of the juice, draw near to thy beloved Spouse. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 82
sanskrit: तेन जायामुप परियां मन्दानो याह्यन्धसो योजा ...
transliteration: tena jāyāmupa priyāṃ mandāno yāhyandhaso yojā ...
translation: With holy prayer I yoke thy long-maned pair of Bays: come hitherward; thou holdest them in both thy hands. The stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad: thou, Thunderer, hast rejoiced with Pusan and thy Spouse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अश्वावति परथमो गोषु गछति सुप्रावीरिन्द्र मर्त्यस्तवोतिभिः | तमित पर्णक्षि वसुना भवीयसा सिन्धुमापो यथाभितो विचेतसः
transliteration: aśvāvati prathamo ghoṣu ghachati suprāvīrindra martyastavotibhiḥ | tamit pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhumāpo yathābhito vicetasaḥ
translation: INDRA, the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine. With amplest wealth thou fillest him, as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill Sindhu full.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 84
sanskrit: असावि सोम इन्द्र ते शविष्ठ धर्ष्णवा गहि | आ तवा पर्णक्त्विन्द्रियं रजः सूर्यो न रश्मिभिः
transliteration: asāvi soma indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇavā ghahi |
translation: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra; mightiest, bold One, come. May Indra-vigour fill thee full, as the Sun fills mid-air with rays.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 85
sanskrit: पर ये शुम्भन्ते जनयो न सप्तयो यामन रुद्रस्य सूनवःसुदंससः | रोदसी हि मरुतश्चक्रिरे वर्धे मदन्ति वीरा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः
transliteration: pra ye śumbhante janayo na saptayo yāman rudrasya sūnavaḥsudaṃsasaḥ | rodasī hi marutaścakrire vṛdhe madanti vīrā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ
translation: THEY who are glancing forth, like women, on their way, doers of mighty deeds, swift racers, Rudra's Sons, The Maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow: in sacrifices they delight, the strong and wild.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 85
sanskrit: त उक्षितासो महिमानमाशत दिवि रुद्रासो अधि चक्रिरे सदः | अर्चन्तो अर्कं जनयन्त इन्द्रियमधि शरियो दधिरे पर्श्निमातरः
transliteration: ta ukṣitāso mahimānamāśata divi rudrāso adhi cakrire sadaḥ | arcanto arkaṃ janayanta indriyamadhi śriyo dadhire pṛśnimātaraḥ
translation: Grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained; the Rudras have established their abode in heaven. Singing their song of praise and generating might, they have put glory on, the Sons whom Prsni bare.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 85
sanskrit: गोमातरो यच्छुभयन्ते अञ्जिभिस्तनूषु शुभ्रा दधिरे विरुक्मतः | बाधन्ते विश्वमभिमातिनमप वर्त्मान्येषामनु रीयते घर्तम
transliteration: ghomātaro yacchubhayante añjibhistanūṣu śubhrā dadhire virukmataḥ | bādhante viśvamabhimātinamapa vartmānyeṣāmanu rīyate ghṛtam
translation: When, Children of the Cow, they shine in bright attire, and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments, They drive away each adversary from their path, and, following their traces, fatness floweth down,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 85
sanskrit: वि ये भराजन्ते सुमखास रष्टिभिः परच्यावयन्तो अच्युताचिदोजसा | मनोजुवो यन मरुतो रथेष्वा वर्षव्रातासः पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वम
transliteration: vi ye bhrājante sumakhāsa ṛṣṭibhiḥ pracyāvayanto acyutācidojasā | manojuvo yan maruto ratheṣvā vṛṣavrātāsaḥ pṛṣatīrayughdhvam
translation: When, mighty Warriors, ye who glitter with your spears, o'erthrowing with your strength e'en what is ne'er o'erthrown, When, O ye Maruts, ye the host that send the rain, had harnessed to your cars the thought-fleet spotted deer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 85
sanskrit: पर यद रथेषु पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वं वाजे अद्रिं मरुतो रंहयन्तः | उतारुषस्य वि षयन्ति धाराश्चर्मेवोदभिर्व्युन्दन्ति भूम
transliteration: pra yad ratheṣu pṛṣatīrayughdhvaṃ vāje adriṃ maruto raṃhayantaḥ | utāruṣasya vi ṣyanti dhārāścarmevodabhirigvedayundanti bhūma
translation: When ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer, urging the thunderbolt, O Maruts, to the fray, Forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud, and moisten, like a skin, the earth with water-floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: मरुतो यस्य हि कषये पाथा दिवो विमहसः | स सुगोपातमो जनः
transliteration: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ | sa sughopātamo janaḥ
translation: THE best of guardians hath that man within whose dwelling place ye drink, O Maruts, giants of the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: यज्ञैर्वा यज्ञवाहसो विप्रस्य वा मतीनाम | मरुतः शर्णुता हवम
transliteration: yajñairigvedaā yajñavāhaso viprasya vā matīnām | marutaḥ śṛṇutā havam
translation: Honoured with sacrifice or with the worship of the sages' hymns, O Maruts, listen to the call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: उत वा यस्य वाजिनो.अनु विप्रमतक्षत | स गन्ता गोमतिव्रजे
transliteration: uta vā yasya vājino.anu vipramatakṣata | sa ghantā ghomativraje
translation: Yea, the strong man to whom ye have vouchsafed to give a sage, shall move Into a stable rich in kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अस्य वीरस्य बर्हिषि सुतः सोमो दिविष्टिषु | उक्थं मदश्च शस्यते
transliteration: asya vīrasya barhiṣi sutaḥ somo diviṣṭiṣu | ukthaṃ madaśca śasyate
translation: Upon this hero's sacred grass Soma is poured in daily rites: Praise and delight are sung aloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अस्य शरोषन्त्वा भुवो विश्वा यश्चर्षणीरभि | सूरं चित सस्रुषीरिषः
transliteration: asya śroṣantvā bhuvo viśvā yaścarṣaṇīrabhi | sūraṃ cit sasruṣīriṣaḥ
translation: Let the strong Maruts hear him, him surpassing all men: strength be his That reaches even to the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पूर्वीभिर्हि ददाशिम शरद्भिर्मरुतो वयम | अवोभिश्चर्षणीनाम
transliteration: pūrigvedaībhirhi dadāśima śaradbhirmaruto vayam | avobhiścarṣaṇīnām
translation: For, through the swift Gods' loving help, in many an autumn, Maruts, we Have offered up our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 86
sanskrit: सुभगः स परयज्यवो मरुतो अस्तु मर्त्यः | यस्य परयांसिपर्षथ
transliteration: subhaghaḥ sa prayajyavo maruto astu martyaḥ | yasya prayāṃsiparṣatha
translation: Fortunate shall that mortal be, O Maruts most adorable, Whose offerings ye bear away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 87
sanskrit: परत्वक्षसः परतवसो विरप्शिनो.अनानता अविथुरा रजीषिणः | जुष्टतमासो नर्तमासो अञ्जिभिर्व्यानज्रे के चिदुस्रा इव सत्र्भिः
transliteration: pratvakṣasaḥ pratavaso virapśino.anānatā avithurā ṛjīṣiṇaḥ | juṣṭatamāso nṛtamāso añjibhirigvedayānajre ke cidusrā iva stṛbhiḥ
translation: LOUD Singers, never humbled, active, full of strength, immovable, impetuous, manliest, best-beloved, They have displayed themselves with glittering ornaments, a few in number only, like the heavens with stars.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 87
sanskrit: उपह्वरेषु यदचिध्वं ययिं वय इव मरुतः केन चित पथा | शचोतन्ति कोशा उप वो रथेष्वा घर्तमुक्षता मधुवर्णमर्चते
transliteration: upahvareṣu yadacidhvaṃ yayiṃ vaya iva marutaḥ kena cit pathā |
translation: When, Maruts, on the steeps ye pile the moving cloud, ye are like birds on whatsoever path it be. Clouds everywhere shed forth the rain upon your cars. Drop fatness, honey-hued, for him who sings your praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 88
sanskrit: आ विद्युन्मद्भिर्मरुतः सवर्कै रथेभिर्यात रष्टिमद्भिरश्वपर्णैः | आ वर्षिष्ठया न इषा वयो न पप्तता सुमायाः
transliteration: te.aruṇebhirigvedaaramā piśaṅghaiḥ śubhe kaṃ yānti rathatūrbhiraśvaiḥ | rukmo na citraḥ svadhitīvān pavyā rathasya jaṅghananta bhūma
translation: COME hither, Maruts, on your lightning laden cars, sounding with sweet songs, armed with lances, winged with steeds. Fly unto us with noblest food, like birds, O ye of mighty power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: आ नो भद्राः करतवो कष्यन्तु विश्वतो.अदब्धासो अपरीतास उद्भिदः | देवा नो यथा सदमिद वर्धे असन्नप्रायुवो रक्षितारो दिवे-दिवे
transliteration: devā no yathā sadamid vṛdhe asannaprāyuvo rakṣitāro dive-dive
translation: MAY powers auspicious come to us from every side, never deceived, unhindered, and victorious, That the Gods ever may be with us for our gain, our guardians day by day unceasing in their care.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: देवानां भद्रा सुमतिर्र्जूयतां देवानां रातिरभि नोनि वर्तताम | देवानां सख्यमुप सेदिमा वयं देवा न आयुः पर तिरन्तु जीवसे
transliteration: devānāṃ bhadrā sumatirṛjūyatāṃ devānāṃ rātirabhi noni vartatām | devānāṃ sakhyamupa sedimā vayaṃ devā na āyuḥ pra tirantu jīvase
translation: May the auspicious favour of the Gods be ours, on us descend the bounty of the righteous Gods. The friendship of the Gods have we devoutly sought: so may the Gods extend our life that we may live.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: तान पूर्वया निविदा हूमहे वयं भगं मित्रमदितिं दक्षमस्रिधम | अर्यमणं वरुणं सोममश्विना सरस्वतीनः सुभगा मयस करत
transliteration: tān pūrigvedaayā nividā hūmahe vayaṃ bhaghaṃ mitramaditiṃ dakṣamasridham | aryamaṇaṃ varuṇaṃ somamaśvinā sarasvatīnaḥ subhaghā mayas karat
translation: We call them hither with a hymn of olden time, Bhaga, the friendly Daksa, Mitra, Aditi, Aryaman, Varuna, Soma, the Asvins. May Sarasvati, auspicious, grant felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: तन नो वातो मयोभु वातु भेषजं तन माता पर्थिवी तत्पिता दयौः | तद गरावाणः सोमसुतो मयोभुवस्तदश्विना शर्णुतं धिष्ण्या युवम
transliteration: tan no vāto mayobhu vātu bheṣajaṃ tan mātā pṛthivī tatpitā dyauḥ | tad ghrāvāṇaḥ somasuto mayobhuvastadaśvinā śṛṇutaṃ dhiṣṇyā yuvam
translation: May the Wind waft to us that pleasant medicine, may Earth our Mother give it, and our Father Heaven, And the joy-giving stones that press the Soma's juice. Asvins, may ye, for whom our spirits long, hear this.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: तमीशानं जगतस्तस्थुषस पतिं धियंजिन्वमवसे हूमहे वयम | पूषा नो यथा वेदसामसद वर्धे रक्षिता पायुरदब्धः सवस्तये
transliteration: tamīśānaṃ jaghatastasthuṣas patiṃ dhiyaṃjinvamavase hūmahe vayam | pūṣā no yathā vedasāmasad vṛdhe rakṣitā pāyuradabdhaḥ svastaye
translation: Him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme, the Lord of all that stands or moves, inspirer of the soul, That Pusan may promote the increase of our wealth, our keeper and our guard infallible for our good.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: सवस्ति न इन्द्रो वर्द्धश्रवाः सवस्ति नः पुषा विश्ववेदाः | सवस्ति नस्तार्क्ष्यो अरिष्टनेमिः सवस्ति नो बर्हस्पतिर्दधातु
transliteration: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ puṣā viśvavedāḥ | svasti nastārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatirdadhātu
translation: Illustrious far and wide, may Indra prosper us: may Pusan prosper us, the Master of all wealth. May Tarksya with uninjured fellies prosper us: Brhaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: पर्षदश्वा मरुतः पर्श्निमातरः शुभंयावानो विदथेषुजग्मयः | अग्निजिह्वा मनवः सूरचक्षसो विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्निह
transliteration: pṛṣadaśvā marutaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvāno vidatheṣujaghmayaḥ | aghnijihvā manavaḥ sūracakṣaso viśve no devā avasā ghamanniha
translation: The Maruts, Sons of Prsni, borne by spotted steeds, moving in glory, oft visiting holy rites, Sages whose tongue is Agni, brilliant as the Sun,--hither let all the Gods for our protection come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 89
sanskrit: भद्रं कर्णेभिः शर्णुयाम देवा भद्रं पश्येमाक्षभिर्यजत्राः | सथिरैरङगैस्तुष्टुवांसस्तनूभिर्व्यशेमदेवहितं यदायुः
transliteration: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhiryajatrāḥ | sthirairaṅghaistuṣṭuvāṃsastanūbhirigvedayaśemadevahitaṃ yadāyuḥ
translation: Gods, may we with our ears listen to what is good, and with our eyes see what is good, ye Holy Ones. With limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: रजुनीती नो वरुणो मित्रो नयतु विद्वान | अर्यमा देवैः सजोषाः
transliteration: aryamā devaiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translation: MAY Varuna with guidance straight, and Mitra lead us, he who knows, And Aryaman in accord with Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: ते हि वस्वो वसवानास्ते अप्रमूरा महोभिः | वरता रक्षन्ते विश्वाहा
transliteration: te hi vasvo vasavānāste apramūrā mahobhiḥ | vratā rakṣante viśvāhā
translation: For they are dealers forth of wealth, and, not deluded, with their might Guard evermore the holy laws.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: ते अस्मभ्यं शर्म यंसन्नम्र्ता मर्त्येभ्यः | बाधमानाप दविषः
transliteration: te asmabhyaṃ śarma yaṃsannamṛtā martyebhyaḥ | bādhamānāapa dviṣaḥ
translation: Shelter may they vouchsafe to us, Immortal Gods to mortal men, Chasing our enemies away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: वि नः पथः सुविताय चियन्त्विन्द्रो मरुतः | पूषा भगो वन्द्यासः
transliteration: vi naḥ pathaḥ suvitāya ciyantvindro marutaḥ | pūṣā bhagho vandyāsaḥ
translation: May they mark out our paths to bliss, Indra, the Maruts, Pusan, and Bhaga, the Gods to be adored.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: उत नो धियो गोग्राः पूषन विष्णवेवयावः | कर्ता नः सवस्तिमतः
transliteration: uta no dhiyo ghoaghrāḥ pūṣan viṣṇavevayāvaḥ | kartā naḥ svastimataḥ
translation: Yea, Pusan, Visnu, ye who run your course, enrich our hymns with kine; Bless us with all prosperity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: मधु वाता रतायते मधु कषरन्ति सिन्धवः | माध्वीर्नः सन्त्वोषधीः
transliteration: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ | mādhvīrnaḥ santvoṣadhīḥ
translation: The winds waft sweets, the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the Law So may the plants be sweet for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: मधु नक्तमुतोषसो मधुमत पार्थिवं रजः | मधु दयौरस्तु नः पिता
transliteration: madhu naktamutoṣaso madhumat pārthivaṃ rajaḥ | madhu dyaurastu naḥ pitā
translation: Sweet be the night and sweet the dawns, sweet the terrestrial atmosphere; Sweet be our Father Heaven to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 90
sanskrit: मधुमान नो वनस्पतिर्मधुमानस्तु सूर्यः | माध्वीर्गावो भवन्तु नः
transliteration: madhumān no vanaspatirmadhumānastu sūryaḥ | mādhvīrghāvo bhavantu naḥ
translation: May the tall tree be full of sweets for us, and full of sweets the Sun: May our milch-kine be sweet for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 91
sanskrit: तवं सोम पर चिकितो मनीषा तवं रजिष्ठमनु नेषि पन्थाम | तव परणीती पितरो न इन्दो देवेषु रत्नमभजन्त धीराः
transliteration: tvaṃ soma pra cikito manīṣā tvaṃ rajiṣṭhamanu neṣi panthām | tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnamabhajanta dhīrāḥ
translation: Thou, Soma, art preeminent for wisdom; along the straightest path thou art our leader. Our wise forefathers by thy guidance, Indu, dealt out among the Gods their share of treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 91
sanskrit: तवं सोम करतुभिः सुभूस्त्वं दक्षैः सुदक्षो विश्ववेदाः | तवं वर्षा वर्षत्वेभिर्महित्वा दयुम्नेभिर्द्युम्न्यभवो नर्चक्षाः
transliteration: tvaṃ soma kratubhiḥ subhūstvaṃ dakṣaiḥ sudakṣo viśvavedāḥ | tvaṃ vṛṣā vṛṣatvebhirmahitvā dyumnebhirdyumnyabhavo nṛcakṣāḥ
translation: Thou by thine insight art most wise, O Soma, strong by thine energies and all possessing, Mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness, by glories art thou glorious, guide of mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 91
sanskrit: राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य वरतानि बर्हद गभीरं तव सोम धाम | शुचिष टवमसि परियो न मित्रो दक्षाय्यो अर्यमेवासिसोम
transliteration: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad ghabhīraṃ tava soma dhāma |
translation: Thine are King Varuna's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory. All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: एता उ तया उषसः केतुमक्रत पूर्वे अर्धे रजसो भानुमञ्जते | निष्क्र्ण्वाना आयुधानीव धर्ष्णवः परति गावोऽरुषीर्यन्ति मातरः
transliteration: etā u tyā uṣasaḥ ketumakrata pūrigvedae ardhe rajaso bhānumañjate | niṣkṛṇvānā āyudhānīva dhṛṣṇavaḥ prati ghāvo'ruṣīryanti mātaraḥ
translation: THESE Dawns have raised their banner; in the eastern half of the mid-air they spread abroad their shining light. Like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war, onward they come bright red in hue, the Mother Cows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: उदपप्तन्नरुणा भानवो वर्था सवायुजो अरुषीर्गा अयुक्सत | अक्रन्नुषासो वयुनानि पूर्वथा रुशन्तं भानुमरुषीरशिश्रयुः
transliteration: udapaptannaruṇā bhānavo vṛthā svāyujo aruṣīrghā ayuksata | akrannuṣāso vayunāni pūrigvedaathā ruśantaṃ bhānumaruṣīraśiśrayuḥ
translation: Readily have the purple beams of light shot up; the Red Cows have they harnessed, easy to be yoked. The Dawns have brought distinct perception as before: red-hued, they have attained their fulgent brilliancy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: अर्चन्ति नारीरपसो न विष्टिभिः समानेन योजनेना परावतः | इषं वहन्तीः सुक्र्ते सुदानवे विश्वेदह यजमानाय सुन्वते
transliteration: arcanti nārīrapaso na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanenā parāvataḥ | iṣaṃ vahantīḥ sukṛte sudānave viśvedaha yajamānāya sunvate
translation: They sing their song like women active in their tasks, along their common path hither from far away, Bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee, yea, all things to the worshipper who pours the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: अधि पेशांसि वपते नर्तूरिवापोर्णुते वक्ष उस्रेव बर्जहम | जयोतिर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कर्ण्वती गावो न वरजं वयुषा आवर्तमः
transliteration: adhi peśāṃsi vapate nṛtūrivāporṇute vakṣa usreva barjaham | jyotirigvedaśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvatī ghāvo na vrajaṃ vyuṣā āvartamaḥ
translation: She, like a dancer, puts her broidered garments on: as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast. Creating light for all the world of life, the Dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: परत्यर्ची रुशदस्या अदर्शि वि तिष्ठते बाधते कर्ष्णमभ्वम | सवरुं न पेशो विदथेष्वञ्जञ्चित्रं दिवो दुहिता भानुमश्रेत
transliteration: pratyarcī ruśadasyā adarśi vi tiṣṭhate bādhate kṛṣṇamabhvam | svaruṃ na peśo vidatheṣvañjañcitraṃ divo duhitā bhānumaśret
translation: We have beheld the brightness of her shining; it spreads and drives away the darksome monster. Like tints that deck the Post at sacrifices, Heaven's Daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 92
sanskrit: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्योषा उछन्ती वयुना कर्णोति | शरिये छन्दो न समयते विभाती सुप्रतीका सौमनसायाजीगः
transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasyoṣā uchantī vayunā kṛṇoti |
translation: We have o'erpast the limit of this darkness; Dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception. She like a flatterer smiles in light for glory, and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 93
sanskrit: अग्नीषोमाविमं सु मे शर्णुतं वर्षणा हवम | परति सूक्तानि हर्यतं भवतं दाशुषे मयः
transliteration: aghnīṣomāvimaṃ su me śṛṇutaṃ vṛṣaṇā havam | prati sūktāni haryataṃ bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translation: AGNI and Soma, mighty Pair, graciously hearken to my call, Accept in friendly wise my hymn, and prosper him who offers gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 93
sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा यो अद्य वामिदं वचः सपर्यति | तस्मै धत्तं सुवीर्यं गवां पोषं सवश्व्यम
transliteration: aghnīṣomā yo adya vāmidaṃ vacaḥ saparyati | tasmai dhattaṃ suvīryaṃ ghavāṃ poṣaṃ svaśvyam
translation: The man who honours you to-day, Agni and Soma, with this hymn, Bestow on him heroic strength, increase of kine, and noble steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 93
sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा य आहुतिं यो वां दाशाद धविष्क्र्तिम | स परजया सुवीर्यं विश्वमायुर्व्यश्नवत
transliteration: aghnīṣomā ya āhutiṃ yo vāṃ dāśād dhaviṣkṛtim | sa prajayā suvīryaṃ viśvamāyurigvedayaśnavat
translation: The man who offers holy oil and burnt oblations unto you, Agni and Soma, shall enjoy great strength, with offspring, all his life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 93
sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा चेति तद वीर्यं वां यदमुष्णीतमवसं पणिं गाः | अवातिरतं बर्सयस्य शेषो.अविन्दतं जयोतिरेकं बहुभ्यः
transliteration: aghnīṣomā ceti tad vīryaṃ vāṃ yadamuṣṇītamavasaṃ paṇiṃ ghāḥ | avātirataṃ bṛsayasya śeṣo.avindataṃ jyotirekaṃ bahubhyaḥ
translation: Agni and Soma, famed is that your. prowess wherewith ye stole the kine, his food, from Pani. Ye caused the brood of Brsaya to perish; ye found the light, the single light for many.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 93
sanskrit: युवमेतानि दिवि रोचनान्यग्निश्च सोम सक्रतू अधत्तम | युवं सिन्धून्रभिशस्तेरवद्यादग्नीषोमावमुञ्चतं गर्भीतान
transliteration: yuvametāni divi rocanānyaghniśca soma sakratū adhattam | yuvaṃ sindhūnrabhiśasteravadyādaghnīṣomāvamuñcataṃ ghṛbhītān
translation: Agni and Soma, joined in operation ye have set up the shining lights in heaven. From curse and from reproach, Agni and Soma, ye freed the rivers that were bound in fetters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 94
sanskrit: इमं सतोममर्हते जातवेदसे रथमिव सं महेमा मनीषया | भद्रा हि नः परमतिरस्य संसद्यग्ने सख्ये मा रिषामा वयं तव
transliteration: imaṃ stomamarhate jātavedase rathamiva saṃ mahemā manīṣayā | bhadrā hi naḥ pramatirasya saṃsadyaghne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava
translation: FOR Jatavedas worthy of our praise will we frame with our mind this eulogy as 'twere a car. For good, in his assembly, is this care of ours. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 94
sanskrit: यस्मै तवमायजसे स साधत्यनर्वा कषेति दधते सुवीर्यम | स तूताव नैनमश्नोत्यंहतिरग्ने ...
transliteration: yasmai tvamāyajase sa sādhatyanarigvedaā kṣeti dadhate suvīryam | sa tūtāva nainamaśnotyaṃhatiraghne ...
translation: The man for whom thou sacrificest prospereth, dwelleth without a foe, gaineth heroic might. He waxeth strong, distress never approacheth him. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 95
sanskrit: दवे वीरूपे चरतः सवर्थे अन्यान्या वत्समुप धापयेते | हरिरन्यस्यां भवति सवधावाञ्छुक्रो अन्यस्यां दद्र्शे सुवर्चाः
transliteration: dve vīrūpe carataḥ svarthe anyānyā vatsamupa dhāpayete | hariranyasyāṃ bhavati svadhāvāñchukro anyasyāṃ dadṛśe suvarcāḥ
translation: To fair goals travel Two unlike in semblance: each in succession nourishes an infant. One bears a Godlike Babe of golden colour; bright and fair-shining, is he with the other.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 95
sanskrit: दशेमं तवष्टुर्जनयन्त गर्भमतन्द्रासो युवतयो विभ्र्त्रम | तिग्मानीकं सवयशसं जनेषु विरोचमानं परि षीं नयन्ति
transliteration: daśemaṃ tvaṣṭurjanayanta gharbhamatandrāso yuvatayo vibhṛtram | tighmānīkaṃ svayaśasaṃ janeṣu virocamānaṃ pari ṣīṃ nayanti
translation: Tvastar's ten daughters, vigilant and youthful, produced this Infant borne to sundry quarters. They bear around him whose long flames are pointed, fulgent among mankind with native splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 95
sanskrit: तरीणि जाना परि भूषन्त्यस्य समुद्र एकं दिव्येकमप्सु | पूर्वामनु पर दिशं पार्थिवानां रतून परशासद विदधावनुष्ठु
transliteration: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣantyasya samudra ekaṃ divyekamapsu | pūrigvedaāmanu pra diśaṃ pārthivānāṃ ṛtūn praśāsad vidadhāvanuṣṭhu
translation: Three several places of his birth they honour, in mid-air, in the heaven, and in the waters. Governing in the east of earthly regions, the seasons hath he stablished in their order.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 95
sanskrit: क इमं वो निण्यमा चिकेत वत्सो मातॄर्जनयत सवधाभिः | बह्वीनां गर्भो अपसामुपस्थान महान कविर्निश्चरति सवधावान
transliteration: ka imaṃ vo niṇyamā ciketa vatso mātṝrjanayata svadhābhiḥ | bahvīnāṃ gharbho apasāmupasthān mahān kavirniścarati svadhāvān
translation: Who of you knows this secret One? The Infant by his own nature hath brought forth his Mothers. The germ of many, from the waters' bosom he goes forth, wise and great, of Godlike nature.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 96
sanskrit: स परत्नथा सहसा जायमानः सद्यः काव्यानि बळ अधत्त विश्वा | अपश्च मित्रं धिषणा च साधन देवा अग्निन्धारयन दरविणोदाम
transliteration: sa pratnathā sahasā jāyamānaḥ sadyaḥ kāvyāni baḷ adhatta viśvā | apaśca mitraṃ dhiṣaṇā ca sādhan devā aghnindhārayan draviṇodām
translation: HE in the ancient way by strength engendered, lo! straight hath taken to himself all wisdom. The waters and the bowl have made him friendly. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 96
sanskrit: स पूर्वया निविदा कव्यतायोरिमाः परजा अजनयन मनूनाम | विवस्वता चक्षसा दयामपश्च देवा अ. ध. द.
transliteration: sa pūrigvedaayā nividā kavyatāyorimāḥ prajā ajanayan manūnām | vivasvatā cakṣasā dyāmapaśca devā a. dh. d.
translation: At Ayu's ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being, And, by refulgent light, heaven and the waters. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 96
sanskrit: तमीळत परथमं यज्ञसाधं विश आरीराहुतं रञ्जसानम | ऊर्जः पुत्रं भरतं सर्प्रदानुं देवा ...
transliteration: tamīḷata prathamaṃ yajñasādhaṃ viśa ārīrāhutaṃ ṛñjasānam |
translation: Praise him, ye Aryan folk, as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling, Well-tended, Son of Strength, the Constant Giver. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: अप नः शोशुचदघमग्ने शुशुग्ध्या रयिम | अप नः शोशुचदघम
transliteration: apa naḥ śośucadaghamaghne śuśughdhyā rayim | apa naḥ śośucadagham
translation: Chasing with light our sin away, O Agni, shine thou wealth on us. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: सुक्षेत्रिया सुगातुया वसूया च यजामहे | अप ...
transliteration: sukṣetriyā sughātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe | apa ...
translation: For goodly fields, for pleasant homes, for wealth we sacrifice to thee. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: पर यद भन्दिष्ठ एषां परास्माकासश्च सूरयः | अप...
transliteration: pra yad bhandiṣṭha eṣāṃ prāsmākāsaśca sūrayaḥ | apa...
translation: Best praiser of all these be he; foremost, our chiefs who sacrifice. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: पर यत ते अग्ने सूरयो जायेमहि पर ते वयम | अप ...
transliteration: pra yat te aghne sūrayo jāyemahi pra te vayam | apa ...
translation: So that thy worshippers and we, thine, Agni, in our sons may live. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: पर यदग्नेः सहस्वतो विश्वतो यन्ति भानवः | अप ...
transliteration: pra yadaghneḥ sahasvato viśvato yanti bhānavaḥ | apa ...
translation: As ever-conquering Agni's beams of splendour go to every side, May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: तवं हि विश्वतोमुख विश्वतः परिभूरसि | अप ...
transliteration: tvaṃ hi viśvatomukha viśvataḥ paribhūrasi | apa ...
translation: To every side thy face is turned, thou art triumphant everywhere. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: दविषो नो विश्वतोमुखाति नावेव पारय | अप ...
transliteration: dviṣo no viśvatomukhāti nāveva pāraya | apa ...
translation: O thou whose face looks every way, bear us past foes as in a ship. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 97
sanskrit: स नः सिन्धुमिव नावयाति पर्षा सवस्तये | अप ...
transliteration: sa naḥ sindhumiva nāvayāti parṣā svastaye | apa ...
translation: As in a ship, convey thou us for our advantage o'er the flood. May his light chase our sin away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 98
sanskrit: वैश्वानरस्य सुमतौ सयाम राजा हि कं भुवनानामभिश्रीः | इतो जातो विश्वमिदं वि चष्टे वैश्वानरो यतते सूर्येण
transliteration: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kaṃ bhuvanānāmabhiśrīḥ | ito jāto viśvamidaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa
translation: Still in Vaisvanara's grace may we continue: yea, he is King supreme o'er all things living. Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaisvanara hath rivalry with Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 98
sanskrit: पर्ष्टो दिवि पर्ष्टो अग्निः पर्थिव्यां पर्ष्टो विश्वा ओषधीरा विवेश | वैश्वानरः सहसा पर्ष्टो अग्निः स नो दिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम
transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo aghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīrā viveśa | vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo aghniḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
translation: Present in heaven, in earth, all-present Agni,--all plants that grow on ground hath he pervaded. May Agni, may Vaisvanara with vigour, present, preserve us day and night from foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 98
sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव तत सत्यमस्त्वस्मान रायो मघवानः सचन्ताम | तन नो ...
transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tat satyamastvasmān rāyo maghavānaḥ sacantām | tan no ...
translation: Be this thy truth, Vaisvanara, to us-ward: let wealth in rich abundance gather round us. This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 99
sanskrit: जातवेदसे सुनवाम सोममरातीयतो नि दहाति वेदः | स नः पर्षदति दुर्गाणि विश्वा नावेव सिन्धुं दुरितात्यग्निः
transliteration: jātavedase sunavāma somamarātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ | sa naḥ parṣadati durghāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritātyaghniḥ
translation: FOR Jatavedas let us press the Soma: may he consume the wealth of the malignant. May Agni carry us through all our troubles, through grief as in a boat across the river.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 100
sanskrit: स यो वर्षा वर्ष्ण्येभिः समोका महो दिवः पर्थिव्याश्चसम्राट | सतीनसत्वा हव्यो भरेषु मरुत्वान नो भवत्विन्द्र ऊती
transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā vṛṣṇyebhiḥ samokā maho divaḥ pṛthivyāścasamrāṭ | satīnasatvā havyo bhareṣu marutvān no bhavatvindra ūtī
translation: MAY he who hath his home with strength, the Mighty, the King supreme of earth and spacious heaven, Lord of true power, to he invoked in battles,--may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 100
sanskrit: यस्यानाप्तः सूर्यस्येव यामो भरे-भरे वर्त्रहा शुष्मो अस्ति | वर्षन्तमः सखिभिः सवेभिरेवैर्म...
transliteration: yasyānāptaḥ sūryasyeva yāmo bhare-bhare vṛtrahā śuṣmo asti | vṛṣantamaḥ sakhibhiḥ svebhirevairma...
translation: Whose way is unattainable like Surya's: he in each fight is the strong Vrtra-slayer, Mightiest with his Friends in his own courses. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 100
sanskrit: दिवो न यस्य रेतसो दुघानाः पन्थासो यन्ति शवसापरीताः | तरद्द्वेषाः सासहिः पौंस्येभिर्म...
transliteration: divo na yasya retaso dughānāḥ panthāso yanti śavasāparītāḥ | taraddveṣāḥ sāsahiḥ pauṃsyebhirma...
translation: Whose paths go forth in their great might resistless, forth milking, as it were, heaven's genial moisture. With manly strength triumphant, foe-subduer,--may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 100
sanskrit: सो अङगिरोभिरङगिरस्तमो भूद वर्षा वर्षभिः सखिभिः सखा सन | रग्मिभिर्र्ग्मी गातुभिर्ज्येष्ठो म...
transliteration: so aṅghirobhiraṅghirastamo bhūd vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sakhā san |
translation: Among Angirases he was the chiefest, a Friend with friends, mighty amid the mighty. Praiser mid praisers, honoured most of singers. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: पर मन्दिने पितुमदर्चता वचो यः कर्ष्णगर्भा निरहन्न्र्जिश्वना | अवस्यवो वर्षणं वज्रदक्षिणं मरुत्वन्तं सख्याय हवामहे
transliteration: pra mandine pitumadarcatā vaco yaḥ kṛṣṇagharbhā nirahannṛjiśvanā | avasyavo vṛṣaṇaṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe
translation: SING, with oblation, praise to him who maketh glad, who with Rjisvan drove the dusky brood away. Fain for help, him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt, him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यो वयंसं जाह्र्षाणेन मन्युना यः शम्बरं यो अहन पिप्रुमव्रतम | इन्द्रो यः शुष्णमशुषं नयाव्र्णं म. ..
transliteration: yo vyaṃsaṃ jāhṛṣāṇena manyunā yaḥ śambaraṃ yo ahan piprumavratam | indro yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ nyāvṛṇaṃ ma. ..
translation: Indra, who with triumphant wrath smote Vyamsa down, and Sambara, and Pipru the unrighteous one; Who extirpated Susna the insatiate,--him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी पौंस्यं महद यस्य वरते वरुणो यस्य सूर्यः | यस्येन्द्रस्य सिन्धवः सश्चति वरतं म...
transliteration: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī pauṃsyaṃ mahad yasya vrate varuṇo yasya sūryaḥ | yasyendrasya sindhavaḥ saścati vrataṃ ma...
translation: He whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth, and Varuna and Surya keep his holy law; Indra, whose law the rivers follow as they flow,--him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यो अश्वानां यो गवां गोपतिर्वशी य आरितः कर्मणि कर्मणि सथिरः | वीळोश्चिदिन्द्रो यो असुन्वतो वधो म...
transliteration: yo aśvānāṃ yo ghavāṃ ghopatirigvedaaśī ya āritaḥ karmaṇi karmaṇi sthiraḥ | vīḷościdindro yo asunvato vadho ma...
translation: He who is Lord and Master of the steeds and kine, honoured--the firm and sure--at every holy act; Stayer even of the strong who pours no offering out,--him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यो विश्वस्य जगतः पराणतस पतिर्यो बरह्मणे परथमो गा अविन्दत | इन्द्रो यो दस्यून्रधरानवातिरन म...
transliteration: yo viśvasya jaghataḥ prāṇatas patiryo brahmaṇe prathamo ghā avindat | indro yo dasyūnradharānavātiran ma...
translation: He who is Lord of all the world that moves and breathes, who for the Brahman first before all found the Cows; Indra who cast the Dasyus down beneath his feet,--him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यः शूरेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भीरुभिर्यो धावद्भिर्हूयते यश्च जिग्युभिः | इन्द्रं यं विश्वा भुवनाभि सन्दधुर्म...
transliteration: yaḥ śūrebhirhavyo yaśca bhīrubhiryo dhāvadbhirhūyate yaśca jighyubhiḥ | indraṃ yaṃ viśvā bhuvanābhi sandadhurma...
translation: Whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war, invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee; Indra, to whom all beings turn their constant thought,--him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: रुद्राणामेति परदिशा विचक्षणो रुद्रेभिर्योषा तनुते पर्थु जरयः | इन्द्रं मनीषा अभ्यर्चति शरुतं म...
transliteration: rudrāṇāmeti pradiśā vicakṣaṇo rudrebhiryoṣā tanute pṛthu jrayaḥ | indraṃ manīṣā abhyarcati śrutaṃ ma...
translation: Refulgent in the Rudras' region he proceeds, and with the Rudras through the wide space speeds the Dame. The hymn of praise extols Indra the far-renowned: him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यद वा मरुत्वः परमे सधस्थे यद वावमे वर्जने मादयासे | अत आ याह्यध्वरं नो अछा तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा सत्यराधः
transliteration: yad vā marutvaḥ parame sadhasthe yad vāvame vṛjane mādayāse | ata ā yāhyadhvaraṃ no achā tvāyā haviścakṛmā satyarādhaḥ
translation: O girt by Maruts, whether thou delight thee in loftiest gathering-place or lowly dwelling, Come thence unto our rite, true boon-best-ower: through love of thee have we prepared oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: तवायेन्द्र सोमं सुषुमा सुदक्ष तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा बरह्मवाहः | अधा नियुत्वः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिषिमादयस्व
transliteration: tvāyendra somaṃ suṣumā sudakṣa tvāyā haviścakṛmā brahmavāhaḥ | adhā niyutvaḥ saghaṇo marudbhirasmin yajñe barhiṣimādayasva
translation: We, fain for thee, strong Indra, have pressed Soma, and, O thou sought with prayer, have made oblations. Now at this sacrifice, with all thy Maruts, on sacred grass, O team-borne God, rejoice thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 101
sanskrit: मादयस्व हरिभिर्ये त इन्द्र वि षयस्व शिप्रे वि सर्जस्व धेने | आ तवा सुशिप्र हरयो वहन्तूशन हव्यानि परति नो जुषस्व
transliteration: mādayasva haribhirye ta indra vi ṣyasva śipre vi sṛjasva dhene |
translation: Rejoice thee with thine own Bay Steeds, O Indra, unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open. Thou with the fair cheek, let thy Bay Steeds bring thee: gracious to us, he pleased with our oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 102
sanskrit: इमां ते धियं पर भरे महो महीमस्य सतोत्रे धिषणायत त आनजे | तमुत्सवे च परसवे च सासहिमिन्द्रं देवासः शवसामदन्ननु
transliteration: imāṃ te dhiyaṃ pra bhare maho mahīmasya stotre dhiṣaṇāyat ta ānaje | tamutsave ca prasave ca sāsahimindraṃ devāsaḥ śavasāmadannanu
translation: To thee the Mighty One I bring this mighty hymn, for thy desire hath been gratified by my laud. In Indra, yea in him victorious through his strength, the Gods have joyed at feast and when the Soma flowed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 102
sanskrit: अस्य शरवो नद्यः सप्त बिभ्रति दयावाक्षामा पर्थिवी दर्शतं वपुः | अस्मे सूर्याचन्द्रमसाभिचक्षे शरद्धे कमिन्द्र चरतो वितर्तुरम
transliteration: asya śravo nadyaḥ sapta bibhrati dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī darśataṃ vapuḥ | asme sūryācandramasābhicakṣe śraddhe kamindra carato vitarturam
translation: The Seven Rivers bear his glory far and wide, and heaven and sky and earth display his comely form. The Sun and Moon in change alternate run their course, that we, O Indra, may behold and may have faith.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 102
sanskrit: तं समा रथं मघवन्न्प्राव सातये जैत्रं यं ते अनुमदाम संगमे | आजा न इन्द्र मनसा पुरुष्टुत तवायद्भ्यो मघवञ्छर्म यछ नः
transliteration: taṃ smā rathaṃ maghavannprāva sātaye jaitraṃ yaṃ te anumadāma saṃghame |
translation: Maghavan, grant us that same car to bring us spoil, thy conquering car in which we joy in shock of fight. Thou, Indra, whom our hearts praise highly in the war, grant shelter, Maghavan, to us who love thee well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: तत त इन्द्रियं परमं पराचैरधारयन्त कवयः पुरेदम | कषमेदमन्यद दिव्यन्यदस्य समी पर्च्यते समनेव केतुः
transliteration: tat ta indriyaṃ paramaṃ parācairadhārayanta kavayaḥ puredam | kṣamedamanyad divyanyadasya samī pṛcyate samaneva ketuḥ
translation: THAT highest Indra-power of thine is distant: that which is here sages possessed aforetime. This one is on the earth, in heaven the other, and both unite as flag with flag in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: स धारयत पर्थिवीं पप्रथच्च वज्रेण हत्वा निरपः ससर्ज | अहन्नहिमभिनद रौहिणं वयहन वयंसं मघवा शचीभिः
transliteration: sa dhārayat pṛthivīṃ paprathacca vajreṇa hatvā nirapaḥ sasarja | ahannahimabhinad rauhiṇaṃ vyahan vyaṃsaṃ maghavā śacībhiḥ
translation: He spread the wide earth out and firmly fixed it, smote with his thunderbolt and loosed the waters. Maghavan with his puissance struck down Ahi, rent Rauhina to death and slaughtered Vyamsa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: स जातूभर्मा शरद्दधान ओजः पुरो विभिन्दन्नचरद विदासीः | विद्वान वज्रिन दस्यवे हेतिमस्यार्यं सहो वर्धया दयुम्नमिन्द्र
transliteration: sa jātūbharmā śraddadhāna ojaḥ puro vibhindannacarad vidāsīḥ | vidvān vajrin dasyave hetimasyāryaṃ saho vardhayā dyumnamindra
translation: Armed with his bolt and trusting in his prowess he wandered shattering the forts of Dasas. Cast thy dart, knowing, Thunderer, at the Dasyu; increase the Arya's might and glory, Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: तदूचुषे मानुषेमा युगानि कीर्तेन्यं मघवा नाम बिभ्रत | उपप्रयन दस्युहत्याय वज्री यद ध सूनुः शरवसे नाम दधे
transliteration: tadūcuṣe mānuṣemā yughāni kīrtenyaṃ maghavā nāma bibhrat | upaprayan dasyuhatyāya vajrī yad dha sūnuḥ śravase nāma dadhe
translation: For him who thus hath taught these human races, Maghavan, bearing a fame-worthy title, Thunderer, drawing nigh to slay the Dasyus, hath given himself the name of Son for glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: तदस्येदं पश्यता भूरि पुष्टं शरदिन्द्रस्य धत्तन वीर्याय | स गा अविन्दत सो अविन्ददश्वान स ओषधीः सोपः स वनानि
transliteration: tadasyedaṃ paśyatā bhūri puṣṭaṃ śradindrasya dhattana vīryāya | sa ghā avindat so avindadaśvān sa oṣadhīḥ soapaḥ sa vanāni
translation: See this abundant wealth that he possesses, and put your trust in Indra's hero vigour. He found the cattle, and he found the horses, he found the plants, the forests and the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: भुरिकर्मणे वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे सत्यशुष्माय सुनवाम सोमम | य आद्र्त्या परिपन्थीव शूरो.अयज्वनो विभजन्नेति वेदः
transliteration: bhurikarmaṇe vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe satyaśuṣmāya sunavāma somam | ya ādṛtyā paripanthīva śūro.ayajvano vibhajanneti vedaḥ
translation: To him the truly strong, whose deeds are many, to him the strong Bull let us pour the Soma. The Hero, watching like a thief in ambush, goes parting the possessions of the godless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 103
sanskrit: तदिन्द्र परेव वीर्यं चकर्थ यत ससन्तं वज्रेणाबोधयो.अहिम | अनु तवा पत्नीर्ह्र्षितं वयश्च विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननु तवा
transliteration: tadindra preva vīryaṃ cakartha yat sasantaṃ vajreṇābodhayo.ahim | anu tvā patnīrhṛṣitaṃ vayaśca viśve devāso amadannanu tvā
translation: Well didst thou do that hero deed, O Indra, in waking with thy bolt the slumbering Ahi. in thee, delighted, Dames divine rejoiced them, the flying Maruts and all Gods were joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: योनिष ट इन्द्र निषदे अकारि तमा नि षीद सवानो नार्वा | विमुच्य वयो.अवसायाश्वान दोषा वस्तोर्वहीयसः परपित्वे
transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra niṣade akāri tamā ni ṣīda svāno nārigvedaā | vimucya vayo.avasāyāśvān doṣā vastorigvedaahīyasaḥ prapitve
translation: THE altar hath been made for thee to rest on: come like a panting courser and be seated. Loosen thy flying Steeds, set free thy Horses who bear thee swiftly nigh at eve and morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: ओ तये नर इन्द्रमूतये गुर्नू चित तान सद्यो अध्वनो जगम्यात | देवासो मन्युं दासस्य शचम्नन ते न आ वक्षन सुविताय वर्णम
transliteration: o tye nara indramūtaye ghurnū cit tān sadyo adhvano jaghamyāt | devāso manyuṃ dāsasya ścamnan te na ā vakṣan suvitāya varṇam
translation: These men have come to Indra for assistance: shall he not quickly come upon these pathways? May the Gods quell the fury of the Dasa, and may they lead our folk to happy fortune.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: अव तमन भरते केतवेदा अव तमना भरते फेनमुदन | कषीरेण सनातः कुयवस्य योषे हते ते सयातां परवणे शिफायाः
transliteration: ava tmana bharate ketavedā ava tmanā bharate phenamudan | kṣīreṇa snātaḥ kuyavasya yoṣe hate te syātāṃ pravaṇe śiphāyāḥ
translation: He who hath only wish as his possession casts on himself, casts foam amid the waters. Both wives of Kuyava in milk have bathed them: may they be drowned within the depth of Sipha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: युयोप नाभिरुपरस्यायोः पर पूर्वाभिस्तिरते राष्टि शूरः | अञ्जसी कुलिशी वीरपत्नी पयो हिन्वाना उदभिर्भरन्ते
transliteration: yuyopa nābhiruparasyāyoḥ pra pūrigvedaābhistirate rāṣṭi śūraḥ | añjasī kuliśī vīrapatnī payo hinvānā udabhirbharante
translation: This hath his kinship checked who lives beside us: with ancient streams forth speeds and rules the Hero, Añjasi, Kulisi, and Virapatni, delighting him, bear milk upon their waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: परति यत सया नीथादर्शि दस्योरोको नाछा सदनं जानती गात | अध समा नो मघवञ्चर्क्र्तादिन मा नो मघेव निष्षपी परा दाः
transliteration: prati yat syā nīthādarśi dasyoroko nāchā sadanaṃ jānatī ghāt | adha smā no maghavañcarkṛtādin mā no magheva niṣṣapī parā dāḥ
translation: Soon as this Dasyu's traces were discovered, as she who knows her home, he sought the dwelling. Now think thou of us, Maghavan, nor cast us away as doth a profligate his treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र सूर्ये सो अप्स्वनागास्त्व आ भज जीवशंसे | मान्तरां भुजमा रीरिषो नः शरद्धितं ते महत इन्द्रियाय
transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra sūrye so apsvanāghāstva ā bhaja jīvaśaṃse | māntarāṃ bhujamā rīriṣo naḥ śraddhitaṃ te mahata indriyāya
translation: Indra, as such, give us a share of sunlight, of waters, sinlessness, and reputation. Do thou no harm to our yet unborn offspring: our trust is in thy mighty Indra-power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: अधा मन्ये शरत ते अस्मा अधायि वर्षा चोदस्व महते धनाय | मा नो अक्र्ते पुरुहूत योनाविन्द्र कषुध्यद्भ्यो वय आसुतिं दाः
transliteration: adhā manye śrat te asmā adhāyi vṛṣā codasva mahate dhanāya | mā no akṛte puruhūta yonāvindra kṣudhyadbhyo vaya āsutiṃ dāḥ
translation: Now we, I think, in thee as such have trusted: lead us on, Mighty One, to ample riches. In no unready house give us, O Indra invoked of many, food and drink when hungry.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 104
sanskrit: मा नो वधीरिन्द्र मा परा दा मा नः परिया भोजनानि पर मोषीः | आण्डा मा नो मघवञ्छक्र निर्भेन मा नः पात्रा भेत सहजानुषाणि
transliteration: mā no vadhīrindra mā parā dā mā naḥ priyā bhojanāni pra moṣīḥ |
translation: Slay us not, Indra; do not thou forsake us: steal not away the joys which we delight in. Rend not our unborn brood, strong Lord of Bounty! our vessels with the life that is within them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: चन्द्रमा अप्स्वन्तरा सुपर्णो धावते दिवि | न वो हिरण्यनेमयः पदं विन्दन्ति विद्युतो वित्तं मे अस्य रोदसी
transliteration: candramā apsvantarā suparṇo dhāvate divi | na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittaṃ me asya rodasī
translation: WITHIN the waters runs the Moon, he with the beauteous wings in heaven. Ye lightnings with your golden wheels, men find not your abiding-place. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अर्थमिद वा उ अर्थिन आ जाया युवते पतिम | तुञ्जाते वर्ष्ण्यं पयः परिदाय रसं दुहे वित्तम...
transliteration: arthamid vā u arthina ā jāyā yuvate patim | tuñjāte vṛṣṇyaṃ payaḥ paridāya rasaṃ duhe vittam...
translation: Surely men crave and gain their wish. Close to her husband clings the wife. And, in embraces intertwined, both give and take the bliss of love. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: मो षु देव अदः सवरव पादि दिवस परि | मा सोम्यस्य शम्भुवः शूने भूम कदा चन वित्तम...
transliteration: mo ṣu deva adaḥ svarava pādi divas pari | mā somyasya śambhuvaḥ śūne bhūma kadā cana vittam...
translation: O never may that light, ye Gods, fall from its station in the sky. Ne'er fail us one like Soma sweet, the spring of our felicity. Mark this my woe ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: यज्ञं पर्छाम्यवमं स तद दूतो वि वोचति | कव रतं पूर्व्यं गतं कस्तद बिभर्ति नूतनो वि...
transliteration: yajñaṃ pṛchāmyavamaṃ sa tad dūto vi vocati | kva ṛtaṃ pūrigvedayaṃ ghataṃ kastad bibharti nūtano vi...
translation: I ask the last of sacrifice. As envoy he shall tell it forth. Where is the ancient law divine? Who is its new diffuser now? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अमी ये देवा सथन तरिष्वा रोचने दिवः | कद व रतं कदन्र्तं कव परत्ना व आहुतिर्वि...
transliteration: amī ye devā sthana triṣvā rocane divaḥ | kad va ṛtaṃ kadanṛtaṃ kva pratnā va āhutirigveda...
translation: Ye Gods who yonder have your home in the three lucid realms of heaven, What count ye truth and what untruth? Where is mine ancient call on you? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: कद व रतस्य धर्णसि कद वरुणस्य चक्षणम | कदर्यम्णो महस पथाति करामेम दूढ्यो वि...
transliteration: kad va ṛtasya dharṇasi kad varuṇasya cakṣaṇam | kadaryamṇo mahas pathāti krāmema dūḍhyo vi...
translation: What is your firm support of Law? What Varuna's observant eye? How may we pass the wicked on the path of mighty Aryaman? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अहम सो अस्मि यः पुरा सुते वदामि कानि चित | तं मा वयन्त्याध्यो वर्को न तर्ष्णजं मर्गं वि...
transliteration: aham so asmi yaḥ purā sute vadāmi kāni cit | taṃ mā vyantyādhyo vṛko na tṛṣṇajaṃ mṛghaṃ vi...
translation: I am the man who sang of old full many a laud when Soma flowed. Yet torturing cares consume me as the wolf assails the thirsty deer. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः | मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो वि...
transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ | mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato vi...
translation: Like rival wives on every side enclosing ribs oppress me sore. O Satakratu, biting cares devour me, singer of thy praise, as rats devour the weaver's threads. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अमी ये सप्त रश्मयस्तत्रा मे नाभिरातता | तरितस्तद वेदाप्त्यः स जामित्वाय रेभति वि...
transliteration: amī ye sapta raśmayastatrā me nābhirātatā | tritastad vedāptyaḥ sa jāmitvāya rebhati vi...
translation: Where those seven rays are shining, thence my home and family extend. This Trta Aptya knoweth well, and speaketh out for brotherhood. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अमी ये पञ्चोक्षणो मध्ये तस्थुर्महो दिवः | देवत्रा नु परवाच्यं सध्रीचीना नि वाव्र्तुर्वि...
transliteration: amī ye pañcokṣaṇo madhye tasthurmaho divaḥ | devatrā nu pravācyaṃ sadhrīcīnā ni vāvṛturigveda...
translation: May those five Bulls which stand on high full in the midst of mighty heaven, Having together swiftly borne my praises to the Gods, return. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: सुपर्णा एत आसते मध्य आरोधने दिवः | ते सेधन्ति पथो वर्कं तरन्तं यह्वतीरपो वि...
transliteration: suparṇā eta āsate madhya ārodhane divaḥ | te sedhanti patho vṛkaṃ tarantaṃ yahvatīrapo vi...
translation: High in the mid ascent of heaven those Birds of beauteous pinion sit. Back from his path they drive the wolf as he would cross the restless floods. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 105
sanskrit: नव्यं तदुक्थ्यं हितं देवासः सुप्रवाचनम | रतमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः सत्यं तातान सूर्यो वि...
transliteration: navyaṃ tadukthyaṃ hitaṃ devāsaḥ supravācanam |
translation: Firm is this new-wrought hymn of praise, and meet to be told forth, O Gods. The flowing of the floods is Law, Truth is the Sun's extended light. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमूतये मारुतं शर्धो अदितिंहवामहे | रथं न दुर्गाद वसवः सुदानवो विश्वस्मान नोंहसो निष पिपर्तन
transliteration: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇamaghnimūtaye mārutaṃ śardho aditiṃhavāmahe | rathaṃ na durghād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān noaṃhaso niṣ pipartana
translation: CALL we for aid on Indra, Mitra, Varuna and Agni and the Marut host and Aditi. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये भूत देवा वर्त्रतूर्येषु शम्भुवः | रथं ...
transliteration: ta ādityā ā ghatā sarigvedaatātaye bhūta devā vṛtratūryeṣu śambhuvaḥ | rathaṃ ...
translation: Come ye Adityas for our full prosperity, in conquests of the foe, ye Gods, bring joy to us. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: अवन्तु नः पितरः सुप्रवाचना उत देवी देवपुत्रे रताव्र्धा | रथं ...
transliteration: avantu naḥ pitaraḥ supravācanā uta devī devaputre ṛtāvṛdhā | rathaṃ ...
translation: May the most glorious Fathers aid us, and the two Goddesses, Mothers of the Gods, who strengthen Law. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: नराशंसं वाजिनं वाजयन्निह कषयद्वीरं पूषणं सुम्नैरीमहे | रथं ...
transliteration: narāśaṃsaṃ vājinaṃ vājayanniha kṣayadvīraṃ pūṣaṇaṃ sumnairīmahe | rathaṃ ...
translation: To mighty Narasamsa, strengthening his might, to Pusan, ruler over men, we pray with hymns. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते सदमिन नः सुगं कर्धि शं योर्यत ते मनुर्हितं तदीमहे | रथं ...
transliteration: bṛhaspate sadamin naḥ sughaṃ kṛdhi śaṃ yoryat te manurhitaṃ tadīmahe | rathaṃ ...
translation: Brhaspati, make us evermore an easy path: we crave what boon thou hast for men in rest and stir. Like as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: इन्द्रं कुत्सो वर्त्रहणं शचीपतिं काटे निबाळ्ह रषिरह्वदूतये | रथं ...
transliteration: indraṃ kutso vṛtrahaṇaṃ śacīpatiṃ kāṭe nibāḷha ṛṣirahvadūtaye | rathaṃ ...
translation: Sunk in the pit the Rsi Kutsa called, to aid, Indra the Vrtra-slayer, Lord of power and might. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 106
sanskrit: देवैर्नो देव्यदितिर्नि पातु देवस्त्राता तरायतामप्रयुछन | तन नो ...
transliteration: devairno devyaditirni pātu devastrātā trāyatāmaprayuchan | tan no ...
translation: May Aditi the Goddess guard us with the Gods: may the protecting God keep us with ceaseless care. This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 107
sanskrit: यज्ञो देवानां परत्येति सुम्नमादित्यासो भवता मर्ळयन्तः | आ वो.अर्वाची सुमतिर्वव्र्त्यादंहोश्चिद या वरिवोवित्तरासत
transliteration: yajño devānāṃ pratyeti sumnamādityāso bhavatā mṛḷayantaḥ |
translation: THE sacrifice obtains the Gods' acceptance: be graciously inclined to us, Adityas. Hitherward let your favour be directed, and be our best deliverer from trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: य इन्द्राग्नी चित्रतमो रथो वामभि विश्वानि भुवनानि चष्टे | तेना यातं सरथं तस्थिवांसाथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य
transliteration: ya indrāghnī citratamo ratho vāmabhi viśvāni bhuvanāni caṣṭe | tenā yātaṃ sarathaṃ tasthivāṃsāthā somasya pibataṃ sutasya
translation: ON that most wondrous car of yours, O Indra and Agni, which looks round on all things living, Take ye your stand and come to us together, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यावदिदं भुवनं विश्वमस्त्युरुव्यचा वरिमता गभीरम | तावानयं पातवे सोमो अस्त्वरमिन्द्राग्नी मनसे युवभ्याम
transliteration: yāvadidaṃ bhuvanaṃ viśvamastyuruvyacā varimatā ghabhīram | tāvānayaṃ pātave somo astvaramindrāghnī manase yuvabhyām
translation: As vast as all this world is in its compass, deep as it is, with its far-stretching surface, So let this Soma be, Indra and Agni, made for your drinking till your soul be sated.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: चक्राथे हि सध्र्यं नाम भद्रं सध्रीचीना वर्त्रहणाुत सथः | ताविन्द्राग्नी सध्र्यञ्चा निषद्या वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम
transliteration: cakrāthe hi sadhryaṃ nāma bhadraṃ sadhrīcīnā vṛtrahaṇāuta sthaḥ | tāvindrāghnī sadhryañcā niṣadyā vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
translation: For ye have won a blessed name together: yea, with one aim ye strove, O Vrtra-slayers. So Indra-Agni, seated here together, pour in, ye Mighty Ones, the mighty Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: समिद्धेष्वग्निष्वानजाना यतस्रुचा बर्हिरु तिस्तिराणा | तीव्रैः सोमैः परिषिक्तेभिरर्वागेन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम
transliteration: samiddheṣvaghniṣvānajānā yatasrucā barhiru tistirāṇā | tīvraiḥ somaiḥ pariṣiktebhirarigvedaāghendrāghnī saumanasāya yātam
translation: Both stand adorned, when fires are duly kindled, spreading the sacred grass, with lifted ladles. Drawn by strong Soma juice poured forth around us, come, Indra-Agni, and display your favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यानीन्द्राग्नी चक्रथुर्वीर्याणि यानि रूपाण्युत वर्ष्ण्यानि | या वां परत्नानि सख्या शिवानि तेभिः सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य
transliteration: yānīndrāghnī cakrathurigvedaīryāṇi yāni rūpāṇyuta vṛṣṇyāni | yā vāṃ pratnāni sakhyā śivāni tebhiḥ somasya pibataṃ sutasya
translation: The brave deeds ye have done, Indra and Agni, the forms ye have displayed and mighty exploits, The ancient and auspicious bonds of friendship,--for sake of these drink of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदब्रवं परथमं वां वर्णानो.अयं सोमो असुरैर्नो विहव्यः | तां सत्यां शरद्धामभ्या हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य
transliteration: yadabravaṃ prathamaṃ vāṃ vṛṇāno.ayaṃ somo asurairno vihavyaḥ | tāṃ satyāṃ śraddhāmabhyā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya
translation: As first I said when choosing you, in battle we must contend with Asuras for this Soma. So came ye unto this my true conviction, and drank libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी मदथः सवे दुरोणे यद बरह्मणि राजनि वायजत्रा | अतः परि वर्षणावा हि यातमथा सोमस्य पिबतं सुतस्य
transliteration: yadindrāghnī madathaḥ sve duroṇe yad brahmaṇi rājani vāyajatrā | ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāvā hi yātamathā somasya pibataṃ sutasya
translation: If in your dwelling, or with prince or Brahman, ye, Indra-Agni, Holy Ones, rejoice you, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libation of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी यदुषु तुर्वशेषु यद दरुह्युष्वनुषु पूरुषु सथः | अतः ...
transliteration: yadindrāghnī yaduṣu turigvedaaśeṣu yad druhyuṣvanuṣu pūruṣu sthaḥ | ataḥ ...
translation: If with, the Yadus, Turvasas, ye sojourn, with Druhyus, Anus, Purus, Indra-Agni! Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी अवमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यां परमस्यामुत सथः | अतः ...
transliteration: yadindrāghnī avamasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāṃ paramasyāmuta sthaḥ | ataḥ ...
translation: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in lowest earth, in central, or in highest. Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी परमस्यां पर्थिव्यां मध्यमस्यामवमस्यामुत सथः | अतः ...
transliteration: yadindrāghnī paramasyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ madhyamasyāmavamasyāmuta sthaḥ | ataḥ ...
translation: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in highest earth, in central, or in lowest, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी दिवि षठो यत पर्थिव्यां यत पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु | अतः ...
transliteration: yadindrāghnī divi ṣṭho yat pṛthivyāṃ yat parigvedaateṣvoṣadhīṣvapsu | ataḥ ...
translation: Whether ye be in heaven, O Indra-Agni, on earth, on mountains, in the herbs, or waters, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राग्नी उदिता सूर्यस्य मध्ये दिवः सवधया मादयेथे | अतः ...
transliteration: yadindrāghnī uditā sūryasya madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayethe | ataḥ ...
translation: If, when the Sun to the mid-heaven hath mounted, ye take delight in food, O Indra-Agni, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 108
sanskrit: एवेन्द्राग्नी पपिवांसा सुतस्य विश्वास्मभ्यं सं जयतन्धनानि | तन नो ...
transliteration: evendrāghnī papivāṃsā sutasya viśvāsmabhyaṃ saṃ jayatandhanāni | tan no ...
translation: Thus having drunk your fill of our libation, win us all kinds of wealth, Indra and Agni. This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: वि हयख्यं मनसा वस्य इछन्निन्द्राग्नी जञास उत वा सजातान | नान्या युवत परमतिरस्ति मह्यं स वां धियं वाजयन्तीमतक्षम
transliteration: vi hyakhyaṃ manasā vasya ichannindrāghnī jñāsa uta vā sajātān | nānyā yuvat pramatirasti mahyaṃ sa vāṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantīmatakṣam
translation: LONGING for weal I looked around, in spirit, for kinsmen, Indra-Agni, or for brothers. No providence but yours alone is with me so have I wrought for you this hymn for succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: अश्रवं हि भूरिदावत्तरा वां विजामातुरुत वा घा सयालात | अथा सोमस्य परयती युवभ्यामिन्द्राग्नी सतोमं जनयामि नव्यम
transliteration: aśravaṃ hi bhūridāvattarā vāṃ vijāmāturuta vā ghā syālāt | athā somasya prayatī yuvabhyāmindrāghnī stomaṃ janayāmi navyam
translation: For I have heard that ye give wealth more freely than worthless son-in-law or spouse's brother. So offering to you this draught of Soma, I make you this new hymn, Indra and Agni,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: मा छेद्म रश्मीन्रिति नाधमानाः पितॄणां शक्तीरनुयछमानाः | इन्द्राग्निभ्यां कं वर्षणो मदन्ति ता हयद्री धिषणाया उपस्थे
transliteration: mā chedma raśmīnriti nādhamānāḥ pitṝṇāṃ śaktīranuyachamānāḥ | indrāghnibhyāṃ kaṃ vṛṣaṇo madanti tā hyadrī dhiṣaṇāyā upasthe
translation: Let us not break the cords: with this petition we strive to gain the powers of our forefathers. For Indra-Agni the strong drops are joyful, for here in the bowl's lap are both the press-stones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: युवाभ्यां देवी धिषणा मदायेन्द्राग्नी सोममुशती सुनोति | तावश्विना भद्रहस्ता सुपाणी आ धावतं मधुना पर्ङकतमप्सु
transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ devī dhiṣaṇā madāyendrāghnī somamuśatī sunoti | tāvaśvinā bhadrahastā supāṇī ā dhāvataṃ madhunā pṛṅktamapsu
translation: For you the bowl divine, Indra and Agni, presses the Soma gladly to delight you. With hands auspicious and fair arms, ye Asvins, haste, sprinkle it with sweetness in the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: युवामिन्द्राग्नी वसुनो विभागे तवस्तमा शुश्रव वर्त्रहत्ये | तावासद्या बर्हिषि यज्ञे अस्मिन पर चर्षणी मादयेथां सुतस्य
transliteration: yuvāmindrāghnī vasuno vibhāghe tavastamā śuśrava vṛtrahatye | tāvāsadyā barhiṣi yajñe asmin pra carṣaṇī mādayethāṃ sutasya
translation: You, I have heard, were mightiest, Indra-Agni, when Vrtra fell and when the spoil was parted. Sit at this sacrifice, ye ever active, on the strewn grass, and with the juice delight you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 109
sanskrit: पर चर्षणिभ्यः पर्तनाहवेषु पर पर्थिव्या रिरिचाथे दिवश्च | पर सिन्धुभ्यः पर गिरिभ्यो महित्वा परेन्द्राग्नी विश्वा भुवनात्यन्या
transliteration: pra carṣaṇibhyaḥ pṛtanāhaveṣu pra pṛthivyā riricāthe divaśca | pra sindhubhyaḥ pra ghiribhyo mahitvā prendrāghnī viśvā bhuvanātyanyā
translation: Surpassing all men where they shout for battle, ye Twain exceed the earth and heaven in greatness. Greater are ye than rivers and than mountains, O Indra-Agni, and all things beside them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 110
sanskrit: ततं मे अपस्तदु तायते पुनः सवादिष्ठा धीतिरुचथाय शस्यते | अयं समुद्र इह विश्वदेव्यः सवाहाक्र्तस्य समु तर्प्णुत रभवः
transliteration: tataṃ me apastadu tāyate punaḥ svādiṣṭhā dhītirucathāya śasyate | ayaṃ samudra iha viśvadevyaḥ svāhākṛtasya samu tṛpṇuta ṛbhavaḥ
translation: THE holy work I wrought before is wrought again: my sweetest hymn is sung to celebrate your praise. Here, O ye Rbhus, is this sea for all the Gods: sate you with Soma offered with the hallowing word.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 111
sanskrit: तक्षन रथं सुव्र्तं विदम्नापसस्तक्षन हरी इन्द्रवाहा वर्षण्वसू | तक्षन पित्र्भ्यां रभवो युवद वयस्तक्षन्वत्साय मातरं सचाभुवम
transliteration: takṣan rathaṃ suvṛtaṃ vidamnāpasastakṣan harī indravāhā vṛṣaṇvasū | takṣan pitṛbhyāṃ ṛbhavo yuvad vayastakṣanvatsāya mātaraṃ sacābhuvam
translation: WORKING with skill they wrought the lightly rolling car: they wrought the Bays who bear Indra and bring great gifts. The Rbhus for their Parents made life young again; and fashioned for the calf a mother by its side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: ईळे दयावाप्र्थिवी पूर्वचित्तये.अग्निं घर्मं सुरुचं यामन्निष्टये | याभिर्भरे कारमंशाय जिन्वथस्ताभिरू षु ऊतिभिरश्विना गतम
transliteration: yābhirbhare kāramaṃśāya jinvathastābhirū ṣu ūtibhiraśvinā ghatam
translation: To give first thought to them, I worship Heaven and Earth, and Agni, fair bright glow, to hasten their approach. Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids wherewith in fight ye speed the war-cry to the spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: युवोर्दानाय सुभरा असश्चतो रथमा तस्थुर्वचसं न मन्तवे | याभिर्धियो.अवथःकर्मन्निष्टये ताभिर...
transliteration: yuvordānāya subharā asaścato rathamā tasthurigvedaacasaṃ na mantave | yābhirdhiyo.avathaḥkarmanniṣṭaye tābhir...
translation: Ample, unfailing, they have mounted as it were an eloquent car that ye may think of us and give. Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids wherewith ye help our thoughts to further holy acts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: युवं तासां दिव्यस्य परशासने विशां कषयथो अम्र्तस्यमज्मना | याभिर्धेनुमस्वं पिन्वथो नरा ताभिर...
transliteration: yuvaṃ tāsāṃ divyasya praśāsane viśāṃ kṣayatho amṛtasyamajmanā | yābhirdhenumasvaṃ pinvatho narā tābhir...
translation: Ye by the might which heavenly nectar giveth you are in supreme dominion Lords of all these folk. Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids wherewith ye, Heroes, made the barren cow give milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः परिज्मा तनयस्य मज्मना दविमाता तूर्षु तरणिर्विभूषति | याभिस्त्रिमन्तुरभवद विचक्षणस्ताभिर.. .
transliteration: yābhiḥ parijmā tanayasya majmanā dvimātā tūrṣu taraṇirigvedabhūṣati | yābhistrimanturabhavad vicakṣaṇastābhir.. .
translation: The aids wherewith the Wanderer through his offspring's might, or the Two-Mothered Son shows swiftest mid the swift; Wherewith the sapient one acquired his triple lore,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभी रेभं निव्र्तं सितमद्भ्य उद वन्दनमैरयतं सवर्द्र्शे | याभिः कण्वं पर सिषासन्तमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhī rebhaṃ nivṛtaṃ sitamadbhya ud vandanamairayataṃ svardṛśe | yābhiḥ kaṇvaṃ pra siṣāsantamāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye raised from waters, prisoned and fast bound, Rebha, and Vandana to look upon the light; Wherewith ye succoured Kanva as he strove to win,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिरन्तकं जसमानमारणे भुज्यं याभिरव्यथिभिर्जिजिन्वथुः | याभिः कर्कन्धुं वय्यं च जिन्वथस्ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirantakaṃ jasamānamāraṇe bhujyaṃ yābhiravyathibhirjijinvathuḥ | yābhiḥ karkandhuṃ vayyaṃ ca jinvathastābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye rescued Antaka when languishing deep in the pit, and Bhujyu with unfailing help. And comforted Karkandhu, Vayya, in their woe,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः शुचन्तिं धनसां सुषंसदं तप्तं घर्ममोम्यावन्तमत्रये | याभिः पर्ष्निगुं पुरुकुत्समावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ śucantiṃ dhanasāṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ taptaṃ gharmamomyāvantamatraye | yābhiḥ pṛṣnighuṃ purukutsamāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye gave Sucanti wealth and happy home, and made the fiery pit friendly for Atri's sake; Wherewith ye guarded Purukutsa, Prsnigu,--Come hither unto us, O Asvin;, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः शचीभिर्व्र्षणा पराव्र्जं परान्धं शरोणं चक्षस एतवे कर्थः | याभिर्वर्तिकां गरसिताममुञ्चतन्ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhirigvedaṛṣaṇā parāvṛjaṃ prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ cakṣasa etave kṛthaḥ | yābhirigvedaartikāṃ ghrasitāmamuñcatantābhir...
translation: Mighty Ones, with what powers ye gave Paravrj aid what time ye made the blind and lame to see and walk; Wherewith ye set at liberty the swallowed quail,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः सिन्धुं मधुमन्तमसश्चतं वसिष्ठं याभिरजरावजिन्वतम | याभिः कुत्सं शरुतर्यं नर्यमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ sindhuṃ madhumantamasaścataṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ yābhirajarāvajinvatam | yābhiḥ kutsaṃ śrutaryaṃ naryamāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye quickened the most sweet exhaustless flood, and comforted Vasistha, ye who ne'er decay; And to Srutarya, Kutsa, Narya gave your help,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिर्विश्पलां धनसामथर्व्यं सहस्रमीळ्ह आजावजिन्वतम | याभिर्वशमश्व्यं परेणिमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirigvedaśpalāṃ dhanasāmatharigvedayaṃ sahasramīḷha ājāvajinvatam | yābhirigvedaaśamaśvyaṃ preṇimāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye helped, in battle of a thousand spoils, Vispala seeking booty, powerless to move. Wherewith ye guarded friendly Vasa, Asva's son,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः सुदानू औशिजाय वणिजे दीर्घश्रवसे मधु कोशोक्षरत | कक्षीवन्तं सतोतारं याभिरावतं ताभिर. ..
transliteration: yābhiḥ sudānū auśijāya vaṇije dīrghaśravase madhu kośoakṣarat | kakṣīvantaṃ stotāraṃ yābhirāvataṃ tābhir. ..
translation: Whereby the cloud, ye Bounteous Givers, shed sweet rain for Dirghasravas, for the merchant Ausija, Wherewith ye helped Kaksivan, singer of your praise,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभी रसां कषोदसोद्नः पिपिन्वथुरनश्वं याभी रथमावतं जिषे | याभिस्त्रिशोक उस्रिया उदाजत ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhī rasāṃ kṣodasodnaḥ pipinvathuranaśvaṃ yābhī rathamāvataṃ jiṣe | yābhistriśoka usriyā udājata tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye made Rasa swell full with water-floods, and urged to victory the car without a horse; Wherewith Trisoka drove forth his recovered cows,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः सूर्यं परियाथः परावति मन्धातारं कषैत्रपत्येष्वावतम | याभिर्विप्रं पर भरद्वाजमावतं ताभिर...
