transliteration: yābhiḥ sūryaṃ pariyāthaḥ parāvati mandhātāraṃ kṣaitrapatyeṣvāvatam | yābhirigvedapraṃ pra bharadvājamāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye, compass round the Sun when far away, strengthened Mandhatar in his tasks as lord of lands, And to sage Bharadvaja gave protecting help,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिर्महामतिथिग्वं कशोजुवं दिवोदासं शम्बरहत्यावतम | याभिः पूर्भिद्ये तरसदस्युमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirmahāmatithighvaṃ kaśojuvaṃ divodāsaṃ śambarahatyaāvatam | yābhiḥ pūrbhidye trasadasyumāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith, when Sambara was slain, ye guarded well great Atithigva, Divodisa, Kasoju, And Trasadasyu when the forts were shattered down,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिर्वम्रं विपिपानमुपस्तुतं कलिं याभिर्वित्तजानिं दुवस्यथः | याभिर्व्यश्वमुत पर्थिमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirigvedaamraṃ vipipānamupastutaṃ kaliṃ yābhirigvedattajāniṃ duvasyathaḥ | yābhirigvedayaśvamuta pṛthimāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye honoured the great drinker Vamra, and Upastuta and Kali when he gained his wife, And lent to Vyasva and to Prthi favouring help,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिर्नरा शयवे याभिरत्रये याभिः पुरा मनवे गातुमीषथुः | याभिः शारीराजतं सयूमरश्मये ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirnarā śayave yābhiratraye yābhiḥ purā manave ghātumīṣathuḥ | yābhiḥ śārīrājataṃ syūmaraśmaye tābhir...
translation: Wherewith, O Heroes, ye vouchsafed deliverance to Sayu, Atri, and to Manu long ago; Wherewith ye shot your shafts in Syumarasmi's cause.--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः पठर्वा जठरस्य मज्मनाग्निर्नादीदेच्चित इद्धो अज्मन्ना | याभिः शर्यातमवथो महाधने ताभिर.. .
transliteration: yābhiḥ paṭharigvedaā jaṭharasya majmanāghnirnādīdeccita iddho ajmannā | yābhiḥ śaryātamavatho mahādhane tābhir.. .
translation: Wherewith Patharva, in his majesty of form, shone in his course like to a gathered kindled fire; Wherewith ye helped Saryata in the mighty fray,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिरङगिरो मनसा निरण्यथो.अग्रं गछथो विवरे गोर्णसः | याभिर्मनुं शूरमिषा समावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiraṅghiro manasā niraṇyatho.aghraṃ ghachatho vivare ghoarṇasaḥ | yābhirmanuṃ śūramiṣā samāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith, Angirases! ye triumphed in your heart, and onward went to liberate the flood of milk; Wherewith ye helped the hero Manu with new strength,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः पत्नीर्विमदाय नयूहथुरा घ वा याभिररुणीरशिक्षतम | याभिः सुदास ऊहथुः सुदेव्यं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ patnīrigvedamadāya nyūhathurā gha vā yābhiraruṇīraśikṣatam | yābhiḥ sudāsa ūhathuḥ sudevyaṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye brought a wife for Vimada to wed, wherewith ye freely gave the ruddy cows away; Wherewith ye brought the host of kind Gods to Sudas--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः शन्ताती भवथो ददाशुषे भुज्युं याभिरवथो याभिरध्रिगुम | ओम्यावतीं सुभरां रतस्तुभं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ śantātī bhavatho dadāśuṣe bhujyuṃ yābhiravatho yābhiradhrighum | omyāvatīṃ subharāṃ ṛtastubhaṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye bring great bliss to him who offers gifts, wherewith ye have protected Bhujyu, Adhrigu, And good and gracious Subhara and Rtastup,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः कर्शानुमसने दुवस्यथो जवे याभिर्यूनो अर्वन्तमावतम | मधु परियं भरथो यत सरड्भ्यस्ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ kṛśānumasane duvasyatho jave yābhiryūno arigvedaantamāvatam | madhu priyaṃ bharatho yat saraḍbhyastābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye served Krsanu where the shafts were shot, and helped the young man's horse to swiftness in the race; Wherewith ye bring delicious honey to the bees,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिर्नरं गोषुयुधं नर्षाह्ये कषेत्रस्य साता तनयस्य जिन्वथः | याभी रथानवथो याभिरर्वतस्ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhirnaraṃ ghoṣuyudhaṃ nṛṣāhye kṣetrasya sātā tanayasya jinvathaḥ | yābhī rathānavatho yābhirarigvedaatastābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye speed the hero as he fights for kine in hero battle, in the strife for land and sons, Wherewith ye safely guard his horses and his car,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: याभिः कुत्समार्जुनेयं शतक्रतू पर तुर्वीतिं पर च दभीतिमावतम | याभिर्ध्वसन्तिं पुरुषन्तिमावतं ताभिर...
transliteration: yābhiḥ kutsamārjuneyaṃ śatakratū pra turigvedaītiṃ pra ca dabhītimāvatam | yābhirdhvasantiṃ puruṣantimāvataṃ tābhir...
translation: Wherewith ye, Lords of Hundred Powers, helped Kutsa, son of Arjuni, gave Turviti and Dabhiti strength, Favoured Dhvasanti and lent Purusanti help,--Come hither unto us, O Asvins, with those aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: अप्नस्वतीमश्विना वाचमस्मे कर्तं नो दस्रा वर्षणा मनीषाम | अद्यूत्ये.अवसे नि हवये वां वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ
transliteration: apnasvatīmaśvinā vācamasme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām | adyūtye.avase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau
translation: Make ye our speech effectual, O ye Asvins, and this our hymn, ye mighty Wonder-Workers. In luckless game I call on you for succour: strengthen us also on the field of battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 112
sanskrit: दयुभिरक्तुभिः परि पातमस्मानरिष्टेभिरश्विना सौभगेभिः | तन नो ...
transliteration: dyubhiraktubhiḥ pari pātamasmānariṣṭebhiraśvinā saubhaghebhiḥ | tan no ...
translation: With, undiminished blessings, O ye Asvins, for evermore both night and day protect us. This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरागाच्चित्रः परकेतो अजनिष्ट विभ्वा | यथा परसूता सवितुः सवयमेवा रात्र्युषसे योनिमारैक
transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotirāghāccitraḥ praketo ajaniṣṭa vibhvā | yathā prasūtā savituḥ savayamevā rātryuṣase yonimāraik
translation: This light is come, amid all lights the fairest; born is the brilliant, far-extending brightness. Night, sent away for Savitar's uprising, hath yielded up a birth-place for the Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: रुशद्वत्सा रुशती शवेत्यागादारैगु कर्ष्णा सदनान्यस्याः | समानबन्धू अम्र्ते अनुची दयावा वर्णं चरत आमिनाने
transliteration: ruśadvatsā ruśatī śvetyāghādāraighu kṛṣṇā sadanānyasyāḥ | samānabandhū amṛte anucī dyāvā varṇaṃ carata āmināne
translation: The Fair, the Bright is come with her white offspring; to her the Dark One hath resigned her dwelling. Akin, immortal, following each other, changing their colours both the heavens move onward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: समानो अध्वा सवस्रोरनन्तस्तमन्यान्या चरतो देवशिष्टे | न मेथेते न तस्थतुः सुमेके नक्तोषासा समनसा विरूपे
transliteration: samāno adhvā svasroranantastamanyānyā carato devaśiṣṭe | na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe
translation: Common, unending is the Sisters' pathway; taught by the Gods, alternately they travel. Fair-formed, of different hues and yet one-minded, Night and Dawn clash not, neither do they travel.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानामचेति चित्रा वि दुरो न आवः | परार्प्या जगद वयु नो रायो अख्यदुषा अजीगर्भुवनानि विश्वा
transliteration: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāmaceti citrā vi duro na āvaḥ | prārpyā jaghad vyu no rāyo akhyaduṣā ajīgharbhuvanāni viśvā
translation: Bright leader of glad sounds, our eyes behold her; splendid in hue she hath unclosed the portals. She, stirring up the world, hath shown us riches: Dawn hath awakened every living creature.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: जिह्मश्ये चरितवे मघोन्याभोगय इष्टये राय उ तवम | दभ्रं पश्यद्भ्य उर्विया विचक्ष उषा
transliteration: jihmaśye caritave maghonyābhoghaya iṣṭaye rāya u tvam | dabhraṃ paśyadbhya urigvedayā vicakṣa uṣā
translation: Rich Dawn, she sets afoot the coiled-up sleeper, one for enjoyment, one for wealth or worship, Those who saw little for extended vision. All living creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: कषत्राय तवं शरवसे तवं महीया इष्टये तवमर्थमिवत्वमित्यै | विसद्र्शा जीविताभिप्रचक्ष उषा ...
transliteration: kṣatrāya tvaṃ śravase tvaṃ mahīyā iṣṭaye tvamarthamivatvamityai | visadṛśā jīvitābhipracakṣa uṣā ...
translation: One to high sway, one to exalted glory, one to pursue his gain, and one his labour: All to regard their different vocations, all moving creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: एषा दिवो दुहिता परत्यदर्शि वयुछन्ती युवतिः शुक्रवासाः | विश्वस्येशाना पार्थिवस्य वस्व उषो अद्येह सुभगेव्युछ
transliteration: eṣā divo duhitā pratyadarśi vyuchantī yuvatiḥ śukravāsāḥ | viśvasyeśānā pārthivasya vasva uṣo adyeha subhaghevyucha
translation: We see her there, the Child of Heaven apparent, the young Maid, flushing in her shining raiment. Thou sovran Lady of all earthly treasure, flush on us here, auspicious Dawn, this morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: परायतीनामन्वेति पाथ आयतीनां परथमा शश्वतीनाम | वयुछन्ती जीवमुदीरयन्त्युषा मर्तं कं चन बोधयन्ती
transliteration: parāyatīnāmanveti pātha āyatīnāṃ prathamā śaśvatīnām | vyuchantī jīvamudīrayantyuṣā mṛtaṃ kaṃ cana bodhayantī
translation: She first of endless morns to come hereafter, follows the path of morns that have departed. Dawn, at her rising, urges forth the living him who is dead she wakes not from his slumber.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: उषो यदग्निं समिधे चकर्थ वि यदावश्चक्षसा सूर्यस्य | यन मानुषान यक्ष्यमाणानजीगस्तद देवेषु चक्र्षे भद्रमप्नः
transliteration: uṣo yadaghniṃ samidhe cakartha vi yadāvaścakṣasā sūryasya | yan mānuṣān yakṣyamāṇānajīghastad deveṣu cakṛṣe bhadramapnaḥ
translation: As thou, Dawn, hast caused Agni to be kindled, and with the Sun's eye hast revealed creation. And hast awakened men to offer worship, thou hast performed, for Gods, a noble service.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 113
sanskrit: कियात्या यत समया भवाति या वयूषुर्याश्च नूनंव्युछान | अनु पूर्वाः कर्पते वावशाना परदीध्याना जोषमन्याभिरेति
transliteration: kiyātyā yat samayā bhavāti yā vyūṣuryāśca nūnaṃvyuchān | anu pūrigvedaāḥ kṛpate vāvaśānā pradīdhyānā joṣamanyābhireti
translation: How long a time, and they shall be together,--Dawns that have shone and Dawns to shine hereafter? She yearns for former Dawns with eager longing, and goes forth gladly shining with the others.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 114
sanskrit: इमा रुद्राय तवसे कपर्दिने कषयद्वीराय पर भरामहे मतीः | यथा शमसद दविपदे चतुष्पदे विश्वं पुष्टंग्रामे अस्मिन्ननातुरम
transliteration: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ | yathā śamasad dvipade catuṣpade viśvaṃ puṣṭaṃghrāme asminnanāturam
translation: To the strong Rudra bring we these our songs of praise, to him the Lord of Heroes with the braided hair, That it be well with all our cattle and our men, that in this village all be healthy and well-fed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 114
sanskrit: मर्ळा नो रुद्रोत नो मयस कर्धि कषयद्वीराय नमसा विधेमते | यच्छं च योश्च मनुरायेजे पिता तदश्याम तवरुद्र परणीतिषु
transliteration: mṛḷā no rudrota no mayas kṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhemate | yacchaṃ ca yośca manurāyeje pitā tadaśyāma tavarudra praṇītiṣu
translation: Be gracious unto us, O Rudra, bring us joy: thee, Lord of Heroes, thee with reverence will we serve. Whatever health and strength our father Manu won by sacrifice may we, under thy guidance, gain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 114
sanskrit: अश्याम ते सुमतिं देवयज्यया कषयद्वीरस्य तव रुद्र मीढ्वः | सुम्नायन्निद विशो अस्माकमा चरारिष्टवीरा जुहवाम ते हविः
transliteration: aśyāma te sumatiṃ devayajyayā kṣayadvīrasya tava rudra mīḍhvaḥ | sumnāyannid viśo asmākamā carāriṣṭavīrā juhavāma te haviḥ
translation: By worship of the Gods may we, O Bounteous One, O Rudra, gain thy grace, Ruler of valiant men. Come to our families, bringing them bliss: may we, whose heroes are uninjured, bring thee sacred gifts,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 114
sanskrit: तवेषं वयं रुद्रं यज्ञसाधं वङकुं कविमवसे निह्वयामहे | आरे अस्मद दैव्यं हेळो अस्यतु सुमतिमिद वयमस्या वर्णीमहे
transliteration: tveṣaṃ vayaṃ rudraṃ yajñasādhaṃ vaṅkuṃ kavimavase nihvayāmahe |
translation: Hither we call for aid the wise, the wanderer, impetuous Rudra, perfecter of sacrifice. May he repel from us the anger of the Gods: verily we desire his favourable grace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 115
sanskrit: चित्रं देवानामुदगादनीकं चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्याग्नेः | आप्रा दयावाप्र्थिवी अन्तरिक्षं सूर्य आत्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च
transliteration: citraṃ devānāmudaghādanīkaṃ cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasyāghneḥ |
translation: THE brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna and Agni. The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath filled the air and earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: नासत्याभ्यां बर्हिरिव पर वर्ञ्जे सतोमानियर्म्यभ्रियेव वातः | यावर्भगाय विमदाय जायां सेनाजुवा नयूहतूरथेन
transliteration: nāsatyābhyāṃ barhiriva pra vṛñje stomāniyarmyabhriyeva vātaḥ | yāvarbhaghāya vimadāya jāyāṃ senājuvā nyūhatūrathena
translation: I TRIM like grass my song for the Nasatyas and send their lauds forth as the wind drives rain-clouds, Who, in a chariot rapid as an arrow, brought to the youthful Vimada a consort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: वीळुपत्मभिराशुहेमभिर्वा देवानां वा जूतिभिः शाशदाना | तद रासभो नासत्या सहस्रमाजा यमस्य परधने जिगाय
transliteration: vīḷupatmabhirāśuhemabhirigvedaā devānāṃ vā jūtibhiḥ śāśadānā | tad rāsabho nāsatyā sahasramājā yamasya pradhane jighāya
translation: Borne on by rapid steeds of mighty pinion, or proudly trusting in the Gods' incitements. That stallion ass of yours won, O Nasatyas, that thousand in the race, in Yama's contest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: तुग्रो ह भुज्युमश्विनोदमेघे रयिं न कश्चिन मम्र्वानवाहाः | तमूहथुर्नौभिरात्मन्वतीभिरन्तरिक्षप्रुद्भिरपोदकाभिः
transliteration: tughro ha bhujyumaśvinodameghe rayiṃ na kaścin mamṛvānavāhāḥ | tamūhathurnaubhirātmanvatībhirantarikṣaprudbhirapodakābhiḥ
translation: Yea, Asvins, as a dead man leaves his riches, Tugra left Bhujyu in the cloud of waters. Ye brought him back in animated vessels, traversing air, unwetted by the billows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: तिस्रः कषपस्त्रिरहातिव्रजद्भिर्नासत्या भुज्युमूहथुः पतंगैः | समुद्रस्य धन्वन्नार्द्रस्य पारे तरिभी रथैः शतपद्भिः षळश्वैः
transliteration: tisraḥ kṣapastrirahātivrajadbhirnāsatyā bhujyumūhathuḥ pataṃghaiḥ | samudrasya dhanvannārdrasya pāre tribhī rathaiḥ śatapadbhiḥ ṣaḷaśvaiḥ
translation: Bhujyu ye bore with winged things, Nasatyas, which for three nights, three days full swiftly travelled, To the sea's farther shore, the strand of ocean, in three cars, hundred-footed, with six horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: अनारम्भणे तदवीरयेथामनास्थाने अग्रभणे समुद्रे | यदश्विना ऊहथुर्भुज्युमस्तं शतारित्रां नावमातस्थिवांसम
transliteration: anārambhaṇe tadavīrayethāmanāsthāne aghrabhaṇe samudre | yadaśvinā ūhathurbhujyumastaṃ śatāritrāṃ nāvamātasthivāṃsam
translation: Ye wrought that hero exploit in the ocean which giveth no support, or hold or station, What time ye carried Bhujyu to his dwelling, borne in a ship with hundred oars, O Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: यमश्विना ददथुः शवेतमश्वमघाश्वाय शश्वदित्स्वस्ति | तद वां दात्रं महि कीर्तेन्यं भूत पैद्वो वाजीसदमिद धव्यो अर्यः
transliteration: yamaśvinā dadathuḥ śvetamaśvamaghāśvāya śaśvaditsvasti | tad vāṃ dātraṃ mahi kīrtenyaṃ bhūt paidvo vājīsadamid dhavyo aryaḥ
translation: The white horse which of old ye gave Aghasva, Asvins, a gift to be his wealth for ever,-- Still to be praised is that your glorious present, still to be famed is the brave horse of Pedu.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: युवं नरा सतुवते पज्रियाय कक्षीवते अरदतं पुरन्धिम | कारोतराच्छफादश्वस्य वर्ष्णः शतं कुम्भानसिञ्चतं सुरायाः
transliteration: yuvaṃ narā stuvate pajriyāya kakṣīvate aradataṃ purandhim | kārotarācchaphādaśvasya vṛṣṇaḥ śataṃ kumbhānasiñcataṃ surāyāḥ
translation: O Heroes, ye gave wisdom to Kaksivan who sprang from Pajra's line, who sang your praises. Ye poured forth from the hoof of your strong charger a hundred jars of wine as from a strainer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 116
sanskrit: हिमेनाग्निं घरंसमवारयेथां पितुमतीमूर्जमस्मा अधत्तम | रबीसे अत्रिमश्विनावनीतमुन निन्यथुः सर्वगणं सवस्ति
transliteration: himenāghniṃ ghraṃsamavārayethāṃ pitumatīmūrjamasmā adhattam |
translation: Ye warded off with cold the fire's fierce burning; food very rich in nourishment ye furnished. Atri, cast downward in the cavern, Asvins ye brought, with all his people, forth to comfort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 117
sanskrit: मध्वः सोमस्याश्विना मदाय परत्नो होता विवासते वाम | बर्हिष्मती रातिर्विश्रिता गीरिषा यातं नासत्योप वाजैः
transliteration: madhvaḥ somasyāśvinā madāya pratno hotā vivāsate vām | barhiṣmatī rātirigvedaśritā ghīriṣā yātaṃ nāsatyopa vājaiḥ
translation: ASVINS, your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of Soma. Our gift is on the grass, our song apportioned: with food and strength come hither, O Nasatyas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 117
sanskrit: यो वामश्विना मनसो जवीयान रथः सवश्वो विश आजिगाति | येन गछथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तेन नरा वर्तिरस्मभ्यं यातम
transliteration: yo vāmaśvinā manaso javīyān rathaḥ svaśvo viśa ājighāti | yena ghachathaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tena narā vartirasmabhyaṃ yātam
translation: That car of yours, swifter than thought, O Asvins, which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people, Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious,--come ye thereon to our abode, O Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 118
sanskrit: आ वां रथो अश्विना शयेनपत्वा सुम्र्ळीकः सववान यात्वर्वां | यो मर्त्यस्य मनसो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षणा वातरंहाः
transliteration: yo martyasya manaso javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇā vātaraṃhāḥ
translation: FLYING, with falcons, may your chariot, Asvins, most gracious, bringing friendly help, come hither,-- Your chariot, swifter than the mind of mortal, fleet as the wind, three-seated O ye Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 118
sanskrit: तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता रथेन तरिचक्रेण सुव्र्ता यातमर्वाक | पिन्वतं गा जिन्वतमर्वतो नो वर्धयतमश्विना वीरमस्मे
transliteration: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā rathena tricakreṇa suvṛtā yātamarigvedaāk | pinvataṃ ghā jinvatamarigvedaato no vardhayatamaśvinā vīramasme
translation: Come to us with your chariot triple seated, three-wheeled, of triple form, that rolleth lightly. Fill full our cows, give mettle to our horses, and make each hero son grow strong, O Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 118
sanskrit: परवद्यामना सुव्र्ता रथेन दस्राविमं शर्णुतं शलोकमद्रेः | किमङग वां परत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासोश्विना पुराजाः
transliteration: pravadyāmanā suvṛtā rathena dasrāvimaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokamadreḥ | kimaṅgha vāṃ pratyavartiṃ ghamiṣṭhāhurigvedaprāsoaśvinā purājāḥ
translation: With your well-rolling car, descending swiftly, hear this the press-stone's song, ye Wonder-Workers. How then have ancient sages said, O Asvins, that ye most swiftly come to stay affliction?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 119
sanskrit: आ वां रथं पुरुमायं मनोजुवं जीराश्वं यज्ञियं जीवसे हुवे | सहस्रकेतुं वनिनं शतद्वसुं शरुष्टीवानं वरिवोधामभि परयः
transliteration: sahasraketuṃ vaninaṃ śatadvasuṃ śruṣṭīvānaṃ varivodhāmabhi prayaḥ
translation: HITHER, that I may live, I call unto the feast your wondrous car, thought-swift, borne on by rapid steeds. With thousand banners, hundred treasures, pouring gifts, promptly obedient, bestowing ample room.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 120
sanskrit: का राधद धोत्राश्विना वां को वां जोष उभयोः | कथा विधात्यप्रचेताः
transliteration: kā rādhad dhotrāśvinā vāṃ ko vāṃ joṣa ubhayoḥ | kathā vidhātyapracetāḥ
translation: ASVINS, what praise may win your grace? Who may be pleasing to you both? How shall the ignorant worship you?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 120
sanskrit: विद्वांसाविद दुरः पर्छेदविद्वानित्थापरो अचेताः | नू चिन नु मर्ते अक्रौ
transliteration: vidvāṃsāvid duraḥ pṛchedavidvānitthāparo acetāḥ | nū cin nu marte akrau
translation: Here let the ignorant ask the means of you who know--for none beside you knoweth aught-- Not of a spiritless mortal man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 120
sanskrit: ता विद्वांसा हवामहे वां ता नो विद्वांसा मन्म वोचेतमद्य | परार्चद दयमानो युवाकुः
transliteration: tā vidvāṃsā havāmahe vāṃ tā no vidvāṃsā manma vocetamadya | prārcad dayamāno yuvākuḥ
translation: Such as ye: are, all-wise, we call you. Ye wise, declare to us this day accepted prayer. Loving you well your servant lauds you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 120
sanskrit: वि पर्छामि पाक्या न देवान वषट्क्र्तस्याद्भुतस्य दस्रा | पातं च सह्यसो युवं च रभ्यसो नः
transliteration: vi pṛchāmi pākyā na devān vaṣaṭkṛtasyādbhutasya dasrā | pātaṃ ca sahyaso yuvaṃ ca rabhyaso naḥ
translation: Simply, ye Mighty Ones, I ask the Gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word. Save us from what is stronger, fiercer than ourselves.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 120
sanskrit: पर या घोषे भर्गवाणे न शोभे यया वाचा यजति पज्रियो वाम | परैषयुर्न विद्वान
transliteration: pra yā ghoṣe bhṛghavāṇe na śobhe yayā vācā yajati pajriyo vām | praiṣayurna vidvān
translation: Forth go the hymn that shone in Ghosa Bhrgu's like, the song wherewith the son of Pajra worships you, Like some wise minister.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 121
sanskrit: कदित्था नॄनः पात्रं देवयतां शरवद गिरो अङगिरसां तुरण्यन | पर यदानड विश आ हर्म्यस्योरु करंसते अध्वरे यजत्रः
transliteration: kaditthā nṝnḥ pātraṃ devayatāṃ śravad ghiro aṅghirasāṃ turaṇyan | pra yadānaḍ viśa ā harmyasyoru kraṃsate adhvare yajatraḥ
translation: WHEN Will men's guardians hasting hear with favour the song of Angiras's pious children? When to the people of the home he cometh he strideth to the sacrifice, the Holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 121
sanskrit: सतम्भीद ध दयां स धरुणं परुषायद रभुर्वाजाय दरविणं नरो गोः | अनु सवाजां महिषश्चक्षत वरां मेनामश्वस्य परि मातरं गोः
transliteration: stambhīd dha dyāṃ sa dharuṇaṃ pruṣāyad ṛbhurigvedaājāya draviṇaṃ naro ghoḥ | anu svājāṃ mahiṣaścakṣata vrāṃ menāmaśvasya pari mātaraṃ ghoḥ
translation: He stablished heaven; he poured forth, skilful worker, the wealth of kine, for strength, that nurtures heroes. The Mighty One his self-born host regarded, the horse's mate, the mother of the heifer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 121
sanskrit: नक्षद धवमरुणीः पूर्व्यं राट तुरो विशामङगिरसामनु दयून | तक्षद वज्रं नियुतं तस्तम्भद दयां चतुष्पदे नर्याय दविपादे
transliteration: nakṣad dhavamaruṇīḥ pūrigvedayaṃ rāṭ turo viśāmaṅghirasāmanu dyūn | takṣad vajraṃ niyutaṃ tastambhad dyāṃ catuṣpade naryāya dvipāde
translation: Lord of red dawns, he came victorious, daily to the Angirases' former invocation. His bolt and team hath he prepared, and stablished the heaven for quadrupeds and men two-footed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 121
sanskrit: अस्य मदे सवर्यं दा रतायापीव्र्तमुस्रियाणामनीकम | यद ध परसर्गे तरिककुं निवर्तदप दरुहो मानुषस्य दुरो वः
transliteration: asya made svaryaṃ dā ṛtāyāpīvṛtamusriyāṇāmanīkam | yad dha prasarghe trikakuṃ nivartadapa druho mānuṣasya duro vaḥ
translation: In joy of this thou didst restore, for worship, the lowing company of hidden cattle. When the three-pointed one descends with onslaught he opens wide the doors that cause man trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 121
sanskrit: तुभ्यं पयो यत पितरावनीतां राधः सुरेतस्तुरणे भुरण्यू | शुचि यत ते रेक्ण आयजन्त सबर्दुघायाः पयौस्रियायाः
transliteration: tubhyaṃ payo yat pitarāvanītāṃ rādhaḥ suretasturaṇe bhuraṇyū |
translation: Thine is that milk which thy swift-moving Parents brought down, a strengthening genial gift for conquest; When the pure treasure unto thee they offered, the milk shed from the cow who streameth nectar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 122
sanskrit: पर वः पान्तं रघुमन्यवो.अन्धो यज्ञं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे भरद्वम | दिवो अस्तोष्यसुरस्य वीरैरिषुध्येव मरुतो रोदस्योः
transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntaṃ raghumanyavo.andho yajñaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe bharadvam | divo astoṣyasurasya vīrairiṣudhyeva maruto rodasyoḥ
translation: SAY, bringing sacrifice to bounteous Rudra, This juice for drink to you whose wrath is fleeting! With Dyaus the Asura's Heroes I have lauded the Maruts as with prayer to Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 122
sanskrit: पत्नीव पूर्वहूतिं वाव्र्धध्या उषासानक्ता पुरुधा विदाने | सतरीर नात्कं वयुतं वसाना सूर्यस्य शरिया सुद्र्शी हिरण्यैः
transliteration: patnīva pūrigvedaahūtiṃ vāvṛdhadhyā uṣāsānaktā purudhā vidāne | starīr nātkaṃ vyutaṃ vasānā sūryasya śriyā sudṛśī hiraṇyaiḥ
translation: Strong to exalt the early invocation are Night and Dawn who show with varied aspect. The Barren clothes her in wide-woven raiment, and fair Morn shines with Surya's golden splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 122
sanskrit: ममत्तु नः परिज्मा वसर्हा ममत्तु वातो अपां वर्षण्वान | शिशीतमिन्द्रापर्वता युवं नस्तन नो विश्वे वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः
transliteration: mamattu naḥ parijmā vasarhā mamattu vāto apāṃ vṛṣaṇvān |
translation: Cheer us the Roamer round, who strikes at morning, the Wind delight us, pourer forth of waters! Sharpen our wits, O Parvata and Indra. May all the Gods vouchsafe to us this favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: पर्थू रथो दक्षिणाया अयोज्यैनं देवासो अम्र्तासो अस्थुः | कर्ष्णादुदस्थादर्या विहायाश्चिकित्सन्ती मानुषायक्षयाय
transliteration: pṛthū ratho dakṣiṇāyā ayojyainaṃ devāso amṛtāso asthuḥ | kṛṣṇādudasthādaryā vihāyāścikitsantī mānuṣāyakṣayāya
translation: THE Daksina's broad chariot hath been harnessed: this car the Gods Immortal have ascended. Fain to bring light to homes of men the noble and active Goddess hath emerged from darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: पूर्वा विश्वस्माद भुवनादबोधि जयन्ती वाजं बर्हती सनुत्री | उच्चा वयख्यद युवतिः पुनर्भूरोषा अगन परथमा पूर्वहूतौ
transliteration: pūrigvedaā viśvasmād bhuvanādabodhi jayantī vājaṃ bṛhatī sanutrī | uccā vyakhyad yuvatiḥ punarbhūroṣā aghan prathamā pūrigvedaahūtau
translation: She before all the living world hath wakened, the Lofty One who wins and gathers treasure. Revived and ever young on high she glances. Dawn hath come first unto our morning worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: यदद्य भागं विभजासि नर्भ्य उषो देवि मर्त्यत्रा सुजाते | देवो नो अत्र सविता दमूना अनागसो वोचति सूर्याय
transliteration: yadadya bhāghaṃ vibhajāsi nṛbhya uṣo devi martyatrā sujāte | devo no atra savitā damūnā anāghaso vocati sūryāya
translation: If, Dawn, thou Goddess nobly born, thou dealest fortune this day to all the race of mortals, May Savitar the God, Friend of the homestead, declare before the Sun that we are sinless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: गर्हं-गर्हमहना यात्यछा दिवे-दिवे अधि नामा दधाना | सिषासन्ती दयोतना शश्वदागादग्रम-अग्रमिद भजतेवसूनाम
transliteration: ghṛhaṃ-ghṛhamahanā yātyachā dive-dive adhi nāmā dadhānā | siṣāsantī dyotanā śaśvadāghādaghram-aghramid bhajatevasūnām
translation: Showing her wonted form each day that passeth, spreading the light she visiteth each dwelling. Eager for conquest, with bright sheen she cometh. Her portion is the best of goodly treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: भगस्य सवसा वरुणस्य जामिरुषः सून्र्ते परथमा जरस्व | पश्चा स दघ्या यो अघस्य धाता जयेम तं दक्षिणया रथेन
transliteration: bhaghasya svasā varuṇasya jāmiruṣaḥ sūnṛte prathamā jarasva | paścā sa daghyā yo aghasya dhātā jayema taṃ dakṣiṇayā rathena
translation: Sister of Varuna, sister of Bhaga, first among all sing forth, O joyous Morning. Weak be the strength of him who worketh evil: may we subdue him with our car the guerdon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: उदीरतां सून्र्ता उत पुरन्धीरुदग्नयः शुशुचानासोस्थुः | सपार्हा वसूनि तमसापगूळ्हाविष कर्ण्वन्त्युषसो विभातीः
transliteration: udīratāṃ sūnṛtā ut purandhīrudaghnayaḥ śuśucānāsoasthuḥ | spārhā vasūni tamasāpaghūḷhāviṣ kṛṇvantyuṣaso vibhātīḥ
translation: Let our glad hymns and holy thoughts rise upward, for the flames brightly burning have ascended. The far-refulgent Mornings make apparent the lovely treasures which the darkness covered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: अपान्यदेत्यभ्यन्यदेति विषुरूपे अहनी सं चरेते | परिक्षितोस्तमो अन्या गुहाकरद्यौदुषाः शोशुचता रथेन
transliteration: apānyadetyabhyanyadeti viṣurūpe ahanī saṃ carete | parikṣitostamo anyā ghuhākaradyauduṣāḥ śośucatā rathena
translation: The one departeth and the other cometh: unlike in hue day's, halves march on successive. One hides the gloom of the surrounding Parents. Dawn on her shining chariot is resplendent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: सद्र्शीरद्य सद्र्शीरिदु शवो दीर्घं सचन्ते वरुणस्यधाम | अनवद्यास्त्रिंशतं योजनान्येकैका करतुं परियन्ति सद्यः
transliteration: sadṛśīradya sadṛśīridu śvo dīrghaṃ sacante varuṇasyadhāma | anavadyāstriṃśataṃ yojanānyekaikā kratuṃ pariyanti sadyaḥ
translation: The same in form to-day, the same tomorrow, they still keep Varuna's eternal statute. Blameless, in turn they traverse thirty regions, and dart across the spirit in a moment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 123
sanskrit: जानत्यह्नः परथमस्य नाम शुक्रा कर्ष्णादजनिष्ट शवितीची | रतस्य योषा न मिनाति धामाहर अहर्निष्क्र्तमाचरन्ती
transliteration: jānatyahnaḥ prathamasya nāma śukrā kṛṣṇādajaniṣṭa śvitīcī |
translation: She who hath knowledge Of the first day's nature is born refulgent white from out the darkness. The Maiden breaketh not the law of Order, day by day coming to the place appointed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 125
sanskrit: पराता रत्नं परातरित्वा दधाति तं चिकित्वान परतिग्र्ह्यानि धत्ते | तेन परजां वर्धयमान आयू रायस पोषेण सचते सुवीरः
transliteration: prātā ratnaṃ prātaritvā dadhāti taṃ cikitvān pratighṛhyāni dhatte | tena prajāṃ vardhayamāna āyū rāyas poṣeṇa sacate suvīraḥ
translation: THE Dawn refulgent when the fire is kindled, and the Sun rising, far diffuse their brightness. Savitar, God, hath sent us forth to labour, each quadruped, each biped, to be active.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 125
sanskrit: सुगुरसत सुहिरण्यः सवश्वो बर्हदस्मै वय इन्द्रो दधाति | यस्त्वायन्तं वसुना परातरित्वो मुक्षीजयेव पदिमुत्सिनाति
transliteration: sughurasat suhiraṇyaḥ svaśvo bṛhadasmai vaya indro dadhāti | yastvāyantaṃ vasunā prātaritvo mukṣījayeva padimutsināti
translation: Not interrupting heavenly ordinances, although she minisheth human generations. The last of endless morns that have departed, the first of those that come, Dawn brightly shineth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 126
sanskrit: अमन्दान सतोमान पर भरे मनीषा सिन्धावधि कषियतो भाव्यस्य | यो मे सहस्रममिमीत सवानतूर्तो राजा शरवैछमानः
transliteration: amandān stomān pra bhare manīṣā sindhāvadhi kṣiyato bhāvyasya | yo me sahasramamimīta savānatūrto rājā śravaichamānaḥ
translation: COMING at early morn he gives his treasure; the prudent one receives and entertains him. Thereby increasing still his life and offspring, he comes with brave sons to abundant riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 127
sanskrit: अग्निं होतारं मन्ये दास्वन्तं वसुं सूनुं सहसो जातवेदसं विप्रं न जातवेदसम | य ऊर्ध्वया सवध्वरो देवो देवाच्या कर्पा | घर्तस्य विभ्राष्टिमनु वष्टि शोचिषाजुह्वानस्य सर्पिषः
transliteration: aghniṃ hotāraṃ manye dāsvantaṃ vasuṃ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ vipraṃ na jātavedasam | ya ūrdhvayā svadhvaro devo devācyā kṛpā | ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭimanu vaṣṭi śociṣājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ
translation: WITH wisdom I present these lively praises of Bhavya dweller on the bank of Sindhu; For he, unconquered King, desiring glory, hath furnished me a thousand sacrifices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 127
sanskrit: यजिष्ठं तवा यजमाना हुवेम जयेष्ठमङगिरसां विप्रमन्मभिर्विप्रेभिः शुक्र मन्मभिः | परिज्मानमिव दयां होतारं चर्षणीनाम | शोचिष्केशं वर्षणं यमिमा विशः परावन्तु जूतये विशः
transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā yajamānā huvema jyeṣṭhamaṅghirasāṃ vipramanmabhirigvedaprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ | parijmānamiva dyāṃ hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām |
translation: A hundred necklets from the King, beseeching, a hundred gift-steeds I at once accepted; Of the lord's cows a thousand, I Kaksivan. His deathless glory hath he spread to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: अयं जायत मनुषो धरीमणि होता यजिष्ठ उशिजामनुव्रतमग्निः सवमनु वरतम | विश्वश्रुष्टिः सखीयते रयिरिव शरवस्यते | अदब्धो होता नि षददिळस पदे परिवीत इळस पदे
transliteration: ayaṃ jāyata manuṣo dharīmaṇi hotā yajiṣṭha uśijāmanuvratamaghniḥ svamanu vratam | viśvaśruṣṭiḥ sakhīyate rayiriva śravasyate | adabdho hotā ni ṣadadiḷas pade parivīta iḷas pade
translation: AGNI I hold as herald, the munificent, the gracious, Son of Strength, who knoweth all that live, as holy Singer, knowing all, Lord of fair rites, a God with form erected turning to the Gods, He, when the flame hath sprung forth from the holy oil, the offered fatness, longeth for it with his glow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: तं यज्ञसाधमपि वातयामस्य रतस्य पथा नमसा हविष्मता देवताता हविष्मता | स न ऊर्जामुपाभ्र्त्यया कर्पा न जूर्यति | यं मातरिश्वा मनवे परावतो देवं भाः परावतः
transliteration: taṃ yajñasādhamapi vātayāmasy ṛtasya pathā namasā haviṣmatā devatātā haviṣmatā | sa na ūrjāmupābhṛtyayā kṛpā na jūryati | yaṃ mātariśvā manave parāvato devaṃ bhāḥ parāvataḥ
translation: We, sacrificing, call on thee best worshipper, the eldest of Angirases, Singer, with hymns, thee, brilliant One! with singers' hymns; Thee, wandering round as 't were the sky, who art the invoking Priest of men, Whom, Bull with hair of flame the people must observe, the people that he speed them on.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: एवेन सद्यः पर्येति पार्थिवं मुहुर्गी रेतो वर्षभः कनिक्रदद दधद रेतह कनिक्रदत | शतं चक्षाणो अक्षभिर्देवो वनेषु तुर्वणिः | सदो दधान उपरेषु सानुष्वग्निः परेषु सानुषु
transliteration: evena sadyaḥ paryeti pārthivaṃ muhurghī reto vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradad dadhad retah kanikradat | śataṃ cakṣāṇo akṣabhirdevo vaneṣu turigvedaaṇiḥ | sado dadhāna upareṣu sānuṣvaghniḥ pareṣu sānuṣu
translation: He with his shining glory blazing far and wide, he verily it is who slayeth demon foes, slayeth the demons like an axe: At whose close touch things solid shake, and what is stable yields like trees. Subduing all, he keeps his ground and flinches not, from the skilled archer flinches not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: स सुक्रतुः पुरोहितो दमे दमे.अग्निर्यज्ञस्याध्वरस्य चेतति करत्वा यज्ञस्य चेतति | करत्वा वेधा इषूयते विश्वा जातानि पस्पशे | यतो घर्तश्रीरतिथिरजायत वह्निर्वेधा अजायत
transliteration: sa sukratuḥ purohito dame dame.aghniryajñasyādhvarasya cetati kratvā yajñasya cetati | kratvā vedhā iṣūyate viśvā jātāni paspaśe | yato ghṛtaśrīratithirajāyata vahnirigvedaedhā ajāyata
translation: To him, as one who knows, even things solid yield: unrough fire-sticks heated hot he gives his gifts to aid. Men offer Agni gifts for aid. He deeply piercing many a thing hews it like wood with fervent glow. Even hard and solid food he crunches with his might, yea, hard and solid food with might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: करत्वा यदस्य तविषीषु पर्ञ्चते.अग्नेरवेण मरुतां न भोज्येषिराय न भोज्या | स हि षमा दानमिन्वति वसूनां च मज्मना | स नस्त्रासते दुरितादभिह्रुतः शंसादघादभिह्रुतः
transliteration: kratvā yadasya taviṣīṣu pṛñcate.aghneraveṇa marutāṃ na bhojyeṣirāya na bhojyā | sa hi ṣmā dānaminvati vasūnāṃ ca majmanā | sa nastrāsate duritādabhihrutaḥ śaṃsādaghādabhihrutaḥ
translation: Here near we place the sacrificial food for him who shines forth fairer in the night than in the day, with life then stronger than by day. His life gives sure and firm defence as that one giveth to a son. The during fires enjoy things given and things not given, the during fires enjoy as food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: विश्वो विहाया अरतिर्वसुर्दधे हस्ते दक्षिणे तरणिर्नशिश्रथच्छ्रवस्यया न शिश्रथत | विश्वस्मा इदिषुध्यते देवत्रा हव्यमोहिषे | विश्वस्मा इत सुक्र्ते वारं रण्वत्यग्निर्द्वारा वय रण्वति
transliteration: viśvo vihāyā aratirigvedaasurdadhe haste dakṣiṇe taraṇirnaśiśrathacchravasyayā na śiśrathat | viśvasmā idiṣudhyate devatrā havyamohiṣe | viśvasmā it sukṛte vāraṃ ṛṇvatyaghnirdvārā vy ṛṇvati
translation: He, roaring very loudly like the Maruts' host, in fertile cultivated fields adorable, in desert spots adorable, Accepts and eats our offered gifts, ensign of sacrifice by desert; So let all, joying, love his path when he is glad, as men pursue a path for bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: स मानुषे वर्जने शन्तमो हितो.अग्निर्यज्ञेषु जेन्यो न विश्पतिः परियो यज्ञेषु विश्पतिः | स हव्या मानुषाणामिळा कर्तानि पत्यते | स नस्त्रासते वरुणस्य धूर्तेर्महोदेवस्य धूर्तेः
transliteration: sa mānuṣe vṛjane śantamo hito.aghniryajñeṣu jenyo na viśpatiḥ priyo yajñeṣu viśpatiḥ | sa havyā mānuṣāṇāmiḷā kṛtāni patyate | sa nastrāsate varuṇasya dhūrtermahodevasya dhūrteḥ
translation: Even as they who sang forth hymns, addressed to heaven, the Bhrgus with their prayer and praise invited him, the Bhrgus rubbing, offering gifts. For radiant Agni, Lord of all these treasures, is exceeding strong. May he, the wise, accept the grateful coverings, the wise accept the coverings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 128
sanskrit: अग्निं होतारमीळते वसुधितिं परियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं नयेरिरे हव्यवाहं नयेरिरे | विश्वायुं विश्ववेदसं होतारं यजतं कविम | देवासो रण्वमवसे वसूयवो गीर्भीरण्वं वसूयवः
transliteration: aghniṃ hotāramīḷate vasudhitiṃ priyaṃ cetiṣṭhamaratiṃ nyerire havyavāhaṃ nyerire | viśvāyuṃ viśvavedasaṃ hotāraṃ yajataṃ kavim | devāso raṇvamavase vasūyavo ghīrbhīraṇvaṃ vasūyavaḥ
translation: Thee we invoke, the Lord of all our settled homes, common to all, the household's guardian, to enjoy, bearer of true hymns, to enjoy. Thee we invoke, the guest of men, by whose mouth, even as a sire's, All these Immortals come to gain their food of life, oblations come to Gods as food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: यं तवं रथमिन्द्र मेधसातये.अपाका सन्तमिषिर परणयसि परानवद्य नयसि | सद्यश्चित तमभिष्टये करो वशश्च वाजिनम | सास्माकमनवद्य तूतुजान वेधसामिमां वाचं न वेधसाम
transliteration: yaṃ tvaṃ rathamindra medhasātaye.apākā santamiṣira praṇayasi prānavadya nayasi | sadyaścit tamabhiṣṭaye karo vaśaśca vājinam | sāsmākamanavadya tūtujāna vedhasāmimāṃ vācaṃ na vedhasām
translation: By Manu's law was born this Agni, Priest most skilled, born for the holy work of those who yearn therefore, yea, born for his own holy work. All ear to him who seeks his love and wealth to him who strives for fame, Priest ne'er deceived, he sits in Ila's holy place, girt round in Ila's holy place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: स शरुधि यः समा पर्तनासु कासु चिद दक्षाय्य इन्द्र भरहूतये नर्भिरसि परतूर्तये नर्भिः | यः शूरैः सवः सनिता यो विप्रैर्वाजं तरुता | तमीशानास इरधन्त वाजिनं पर्क्षमत्यं न वाजिनम
transliteration: sa śrudhi yaḥ smā pṛtanāsu kāsu cid dakṣāyya indra bharahūtaye nṛbhirasi pratūrtaye nṛbhiḥ | yaḥ śūraiḥ svaḥ sanitā yo viprairigvedaājaṃ tarutā | tamīśānāsa iradhanta vājinaṃ pṛkṣamatyaṃ na vājinam
translation: We call that perfecter of worship by the path or sacrifice; with reverence rich in offerings, with worship rich in offerings. Through presentation of our food he grows not old in this his from; The God whom Matarisvan brought from far away, for Manu brought from far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: दस्मो हि षमा वर्षणं पिन्वसि तवचं कं चिद यावीरररुं शूर मर्त्यं परिव्र्णक्षि मर्त्यम | इन्द्रोत तुभ्यं तद्दिवे तद रुद्राय सवयशसे | मित्राय वोचं वरुणाय सप्रथः सुम्र्ळीकाय सप्रथः
transliteration: dasmo hi ṣmā vṛṣaṇaṃ pinvasi tvacaṃ kaṃ cid yāvīrararuṃ śūra martyaṃ parivṛṇakṣi martyam | indrota tubhyaṃ taddive tad rudrāya svayaśase | mitrāya vocaṃ varuṇāya saprathaḥ sumṛḷīkāya saprathaḥ
translation: In ordered course forthwith he traverses the earth, swift-swallowing, bellowing Steer, bearing the genial seed, bearing the seed and bellowing. Observant with a hundred eyes the God is conqueror in the wood: Agni, who hath his seat in broad plains here below, and in the high lands far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: अस्माकं व इन्द्रमुश्मसीष्टये सखायं विश्वायुं परासहं युजं वाजेषु परासहं युजम | अस्माकंब्रह्मोत्ये.अवा पर्त्सुषु कासु चित | नहि तवा शत्रु सतरते सत्र्णोषि यंविश्वं शत्रुं सत्र्णोषि यम
transliteration: asmākaṃ va indramuśmasīṣṭaye sakhāyaṃ viśvāyuṃ prāsahaṃ yujaṃ vājeṣu prāsahaṃ yujam | asmākaṃbrahmotye.avā pṛtsuṣu kāsu cit | nahi tvā śatru starate stṛṇoṣi yaṃviśvaṃ śatruṃ stṛṇoṣi yam
translation: That Agni, wise High-Priest, in every house takes thought for sacrifice and holy service, yea, takes thought, with mental power, for sacrifice. Disposer, he with mental power shows all things unto him who strives; Whence he was born a guest enriched with holy oil, born as Ordainer and as Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: नि षू नमातिमतिं कयस्य चित तेजिष्ठाभिररणिभिर्नोतिभिरुग्राभिरुग्रोतिभिः | नेषि णो यथा पुरानेनाः शूर मन्यसे | विश्वानि पूरोरप पर्षि वह्निरासा वह्निर्नो अछ
transliteration: ni ṣū namātimatiṃ kayasya cit tejiṣṭhābhiraraṇibhirnotibhirughrābhirughrotibhiḥ | neṣi ṇo yathā purānenāḥ śūra manyase | viśvāni pūrorapa parṣi vahnirāsā vahnirno acha
translation: When through his power and in his strong prevailing flames the Maruts' gladdening boons mingle with Agni's roar, boons gladdening for the active One, Then he accelerates the gift, and by the greatness of his wealth, Shall rescue us from overwhelming misery, from curse and overwhelming woe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: पर तद वोचेयं भव्यायेन्दवे हव्यो न य इषवान मन्म रेजति रक्षोहा मन्म रेजति | सवयं सो अस्मदा निदो वधैरजेत दुर्मतिम | अव सरवेदघशंसो.अवतरमव कषुद्रमिव सरवेत
transliteration: pra tad voceyaṃ bhavyāyendave havyo na ya iṣavān manma rejati rakṣohā manma rejati | svayaṃ so asmadā nido vadhairajeta durmatim | ava sravedaghaśaṃso.avataramava kṣudramiva sravet
translation: Vast, universal, good he was made messenger; the speeder with his right hand hath not loosed his hold, through love of fame not loosed his hold. He bears oblations to the Gods for whosoever supplicates. Agni bestows a blessing on each pious man, and opens wide the doors for him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 129
sanskrit: वनेम तद धोत्रया चितन्त्या वनेम रयिं रयिवः सुवीर्यं रण्वं सन्तं सुवीर्यम | दुर्मन्मानं सुमन्तुभिरेमिषा पर्चीमहि | आ सत्याभिरिन्द्रं दयुम्नहूतिभिर्यजत्रं दयुम्नहूतिभिः
transliteration: vanema tad dhotrayā citantyā vanema rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīryaṃ raṇvaṃ santaṃ suvīryam | durmanmānaṃ sumantubhiremiṣā pṛcīmahi |
translation: That Agni hath been set most kind in camp of men, in sacrifice like a Lord victorious, like a dear Lord in sacred rites. His are the oblations of mankind when offered up at Ila's place. He shall preserve us from Varuna's chastisement, yea, from the great God's chastisement.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 130
sanskrit: एन्द्र याह्युप नः परावतो नायमछा विदथानीव सत्पतिरस्तं राजेव सत्पतिः | हवामहे तवा वयं परयस्वन्तः सुते सचा | पुत्रासो न पितरं वाजसातये मंहिष्ठं वाजसातये
transliteration: endra yāhyupa naḥ parāvato nāyamachā vidathānīva satpatirastaṃ rājeva satpatiḥ | havāmahe tvā vayaṃ prayasvantaḥ sute sacā | putrāso na pitaraṃ vājasātaye maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vājasātaye
translation: THE car which Indra, thou, for service of the Gods though it be far away, O swift One, bringest near, which, Blameless One, thou bringest near, Place swiftly nigh us for our help: be it thy will that it be strong. Blameless and active, hear this speech of orderers, this speech of us like orderers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 130
sanskrit: पिबा सोममिन्द्र सुवानमद्रिभिः कोशेन सिक्तमवतं नवंसगस्तात्र्षाणो न वंसगः | मदाय हर्यतय ते तुविष्टमाय धायसे | आ तवा यछन्तु हरितो न सूर्यमहाविश्वेव सूर्यम
transliteration: pibā somamindra suvānamadribhiḥ kośena siktamavataṃ navaṃsaghastātṛṣāṇo na vaṃsaghaḥ | madāya haryataya te tuviṣṭamāya dhāyase |
translation: Hear, Indra, thou whom men in every fight must call to show thy strength, for cry of battle with the men, with men of war for victory. He who with heroes wins the light, who with the singers gains the prize, Him the rich seek to gain even as a swift strong steed, even as a courser fleet and strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 131
sanskrit: इन्द्राय हि दयौरसुरो अनम्नतेन्द्राय मही पर्थिवी वरीमभिर्द्युम्नसाता वरीमभिः | इन्द्रं विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दधिरे पुरः | इन्द्राय विश्वा सवनानि मानुषा रातानि सन्तु मानुषा
transliteration: indrāya hi dyaurasuro anamnatendrāya mahī pṛthivī varīmabhirdyumnasātā varīmabhiḥ | indraṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dadhire puraḥ | indrāya viśvā savanāni mānuṣā rātāni santu mānuṣā
translation: Come to us, Indra, from afar, conducting us even as a lord of heroes to the gatherings, home, like a King, his heroes' lord. We come with gifts of pleasant food, with juice poured forth, invoking thee, As sons invite a sire, that thou mayst get thee strength thee, bounteousest, to get thee strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 131
sanskrit: विश्वेषु हि तवा सवनेषु तुञ्जते समानमेकं वर्षमण्यवः पर्थक सवः सनिष्यवः पर्थक | तं तवा नावं न पर्षणिं शूषस्य धुरि धीमहि | इन्द्रं न यज्ञैश्चितयन्त आयव सतोमेभिरिन्द्रमायवः
transliteration: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānamekaṃ vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svaḥ saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak | taṃ tvā nāvaṃ na parṣaṇiṃ śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi | indraṃ na yajñaiścitayanta āyava stomebhirindramāyavaḥ
translation: O Indra, drink the Soma juice pressed out with stones. poured from the reservoir, as an ox drinks the spring, a very thirsty bull the spring. For the sweet draught that gladdens thee, for mightiest freshening of thy strength. Let thy Bay Horses bring thee hither as the Sun, as every day they bring the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 131
sanskrit: वि तवा ततस्रे मिथुना अवस्यवो वरजस्य साता गव्यस्य निःस्र्जः सक्षन्त इन्द्र निःस्र्जः | यद गव्यन्ता दवा जना सवर्यन्ता समूहसि | आविष करिक्रद वर्षणं सचाभुवं वज्रमिन्द्र सचाभुवम
transliteration: vi tvā tatasre mithunā avasyavo vrajasya sātā ghavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣanta indra niḥsṛjaḥ | yad ghavyantā dvā janā svaryantā samūhasi |
translation: He found the treasure brought from heaven that lay concealed, close-hidden, like the nestling of a bird, in rock, enclosed in never-ending rock. Best Angiras, bolt-armed, he strove to win, as 'twere, the stall of kine; So Indra hath disclosed the food concealed, disclosed the doors, the food that lay concealed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: तवया वयं मघवन पूर्व्ये धन इन्द्रत्वोताः सासह्याम पर्तन्यतो वनुयाम वनुष्यतः | नेदिष्ठे अस्मिन्नहन्यधि वोचा नु सुन्वते | अस्मिन यज्ञे वि चयेमा भरे कर्तं वाजयन्तो भरे कर्तम
transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ maghavan pūrigvedaye dhana indratvotāḥ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyataḥ | nediṣṭhe asminnahanyadhi vocā nu sunvate | asmin yajñe vi cayemā bhare kṛtaṃ vājayanto bhare kṛtam
translation: To Indra Dyaus the Asura hath bowed him down, to Indra mighty Earth with wide-extending tracts, to win the light, with wide-spread tracts. All Gods of one accord have set Indra in front preeminent. For Indra all libations must be set apart, all man's libations set apart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: सवर्जेषे भर आप्रस्य वक्मन्युषर्बुधः सवस्मिन्नञ्जसिक्राणस्य सवस्मिन्नञ्जसि | अहन्निन्द्रो यथा विदे शीर्ष्णा-शीर्ष्णोपवाच्यः | अस्मत्रा ते सध्र्यक सन्तु रातयो भद्रा भद्रस्य रातयः
transliteration: svarjeṣe bhara āprasya vakmanyuṣarbudhaḥ svasminnañjasikrāṇasya svasminnañjasi | ahannindro yathā vide śīrṣṇā-śīrṣṇopavācyaḥ | asmatrā te sadhryak santu rātayo bhadrā bhadrasya rātayaḥ
translation: In all libations men with hero spirit urge the Universal One, each seeking several light, each fain to win the light apart. Thee, furthering like a ship, will we set to the chariot-pole of strength, As men who win with sacrifices Indra's thought, men who win Indra with their lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: तत तु परयः परत्नथा ते शुशुक्वनं यस्मिन यज्ञे वारमक्र्ण्वत कषयं रतस्य वारसि कषयम | वि तद वोचेरध दवितान्तः पश्यन्ति रश्मिभिः | स घा विदे अन्विन्द्रो गवेषणो बन्धुक्षिद्भ्यो गवेषणः
transliteration: tat tu prayaḥ pratnathā te śuśukvanaṃ yasmin yajñe vāramakṛṇvata kṣayaṃ ṛtasya vārasi kṣayam | vi tad voceradha dvitāntaḥ paśyanti raśmibhiḥ | sa ghā vide anvindro ghaveṣaṇo bandhukṣidbhyo ghaveṣaṇaḥ
translation: Couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee, pouring their presents forth to win a stall of kine, pouring gifts, Indra, seeking thee. When two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war, Thou showest, Indra, then the bolt thy constant friend, the Bull that ever waits on thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: नू इत्था ते पूर्वथा च परवाच्यं यदङगिरोभ्यो.अव्र्णोरप वरजमिन्द्र शिक्षन्नप वरजम | ऐभ्यः समान्या दिशास्मभ्यं जेषि योत्सि च | सुन्वद्भ्यो रन्धया कं चिदव्रतं हर्णायन्तं चिदव्रतम
transliteration: nū itthā te pūrigvedaathā ca pravācyaṃ yadaṅghirobhyo.avṛṇorapa vrajamindra śikṣannapa vrajam | aibhyaḥ samānyā diśāsmabhyaṃ jeṣi yotsi ca | sunvadbhyo randhayā kaṃ cidavrataṃ hṛṇāyantaṃ cidavratam
translation: This thine heroic power men of old time have known, wherewith thou breakest down, Indra, autumnal forts, breakest them down with conquering might. Thou hast chastised, O Indra, Lord of Strength, the man who worships not, And made thine own this great earth and these water-floods; with joyous heart these water-floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: सं यज्जनान करतुभिः शूर ईक्षयद धने हिते तरुषन्त शरवस्यवः पर यक्षन्त शरवस्यवः | तस्मा आयुः परजावदिद बाधे अर्चन्त्योजसा | इन्द्र ओक्यं दिधिषन्त धीतयो देवानछा न धीतयः
transliteration: saṃ yajjanān kratubhiḥ śūra īkṣayad dhane hite taruṣanta śravasyavaḥ pra yakṣanta śravasyavaḥ | tasmā āyuḥ prajāvadid bādhe arcantyojasā | indra okyaṃ didhiṣanta dhītayo devānachā na dhītayaḥ
translation: And they have bruited far this hero-might when thou, O Strong One, in thy joy helpest thy suppliants, who sought to win thee for their Friend. Their battle-cry thou madest sound victorious in the shocks of war. One stream after another have they gained from thee, eager for glory have they gained.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 132
sanskrit: युवं तमिन्द्रापर्वता पुरोयुधा यो नः पर्तन्यादप तं-तमिद धतं वज्रेअ तं-तमिद धतम | दूरे चत्ताय छन्त्सद गहनं यदिनक्षत | अस्माकं शत्रून परि शूर विश्वतो दर्मा दर्षीष्ट विश्वतः
transliteration: yuvaṃ tamindrāparigvedaatā puroyudhā yo naḥ pṛtanyādapa taṃ-tamid dhataṃ vajrea taṃ-tamid dhatam | dūre cattāya chantsad ghahanaṃ yadinakṣat | asmākaṃ śatrūn pari śūra viśvato darmā darṣīṣṭa viśvataḥ
translation: Also this morn may he be well inclined to us, mark at our call our offerings and our song of praise, our call that we may win the light. As thou, O Indra Thunder-armed, wilt, as the Strong One, slay the foe, Listen thou to the prayer of me a later sage, hear thou a later sage's prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: उभे पुनामि रोदसी रतेन दरुहो दहामि सं महीरनिन्द्राः | अभिव्लग्य यत्र हता अमित्रा वैलस्थानं परि तर्ळ्हा अशेरन
transliteration: ubhe punāmi rodasī ṛtena druho dahāmi saṃ mahīranindrāḥ | abhivlaghya yatra hatā amitrā vailasthānaṃ pari tṛḷhā aśeran
translation: HELPED, Indra Maghavan, by thee in war of old, may we subdue in fight the men who strive with us, conquer the men who war with us. This day that now is close at hand bless him who pours the Soma juice. In this our sacrifice may we divide the spoil, showing our strength, the spoil of war.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: अभिव्लग्या चिदद्रिवः शीर्षा यातुमतीनाम | छिन्धि वटूरिणा पदा महावटूरिणा पदा
transliteration: abhivlaghyā cidadrivaḥ śīrṣā yātumatīnām | chindhi vaṭūriṇā padā mahāvaṭūriṇā padā
translation: In war which wins the light, at the free-giver's call, at due oblation of the early-rising one, oblation of the active one, Indra slew, even as we know--whom each bowed head must reverence. May all thy bounteous gifts be gathered up for us, yea, the good gifts of thee the Good.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: अवासां मघवञ जहि शर्धो यातुमतीनाम | वैलस्थानके अर्मके महावैलस्थे अर्मके
transliteration: avāsāṃ maghavañ jahi śardho yātumatīnām | vailasthānake armake mahāvailasthe armake
translation: This food glows for thee as of old at sacrifice, wherein they made thee chooser of the place, for thou choosest the place of sacrifice. Speak thou and make it known to us: they see within with beams of light. Indra, indeed, is found a seeker after spoil, spoil-seeker for his own allies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: यासां तिस्रः पञ्चाशतो.अभिव्लङगैरपावपः | तत सुते मनायति तकत सु ते मनायति
transliteration: yāsāṃ tisraḥ pañcāśato.abhivlaṅghairapāvapaḥ | tat sute manāyati takat su te manāyati
translation: So now must thy great deed be lauded as of old, when for the Angirases thou openedst the stall, openedst, giving aid, the stall. In the same manner for us here fight thou and be victorious: To him who pours the juice give up the lawless man, the lawless who is wroth with us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: पिशङगभ्र्ष्टिमम्भ्र्णं पिशाचिमिन्द्र सं मर्ण | सर्वंरक्षो नि बर्हय
transliteration: piśaṅghabhṛṣṭimambhṛṇaṃ piśācimindra saṃ mṛṇa | sarigvedaaṃrakṣo ni barhaya
translation: When with wise plan the Hero leads the people forth, they conquer in the ordered battle, seeking fame, press, eager, onward seeking fame. To him in time of need they sing for life with offspring and with strength. Their hymns with Indra find a welcome place of rest: the hymns go forward to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 133
sanskrit: अवर्मह इन्द्र दाद्र्हि शरुधी नः शुशोच हि दयौः कषान भीषानद्रिवो घर्णान न भीषानद्रिवः | शुष्मिन्तमो हि शुष्मिभिर्वधैरुग्रेभिरीयसे | अपूरुषघ्नो अप्रतीत शूर सत्वभिस्त्रिसप्तैः शूर सत्वभिः
transliteration: avarmaha indra dādṛhi śrudhī naḥ śuśoca hi dyauḥ kṣāna bhīṣānadrivo ghṛṇān na bhīṣānadrivaḥ | śuṣmintamo hi śuṣmibhirigvedaadhairughrebhirīyase | apūruṣaghno apratīta śūra satvabhistrisaptaiḥ śūra satvabhiḥ
translation: Indra and Parvata, our champions in the fight, drive ye away each man who fain would war with us, drive him far from us with the bolt. Welcome to him concealed afar shall he the lair that he hath found. So may the Render rend our foes on every side, rend them, O Hero, everywhere.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: आ तवा जुवो रारहाणा अभि परयो वायो वहन्त्विह पूर्वपीतये सोमस्य पूर्वपीतये | ऊर्ध्वा ते अनु सून्र्ता मनस्तिष्ठतु जानती | नियुत्वता रथेना याहि दावने वायो मखस्य दावने
transliteration: niyutvatā rathenā yāhi dāvane vāyo makhasya dāvane
translation: WITH sacrifice I purge both earth and heaven: I burn up great she-fiends who serve not Indra, Where throttled by thy hand the foes were slaughtered, and in the pit of death lay pierced and mangled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: मन्दन्तु तवा मन्दिनो वायविन्दवो.अस्मत कराणासः सुक्र्ता अभिद्यवो गोभिः कराणा अभिद्यवः | यद ध कराणा] इरध्यै दक्षं सचन्त ऊतयः | सध्रीचीना नियुतो दावने धिय उप बरुवत ईं धियः
transliteration: mandantu tvā mandino vāyavindavo.asmat krāṇāsaḥ sukṛtā abhidyavo ghobhiḥ krāṇā abhidyavaḥ | yad dha krāṇā] iradhyai dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ | sadhrīcīnā niyuto dāvane dhiya upa bruvata īṃ dhiyaḥ
translation: O thou who castest forth the stones crushing the sorceresses' heads, Break them with thy wide-spreading foot, with thy wide-spreading mighty foot.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: वायुर्युङकते रोहिता वायुररुणा वायू रथे अजिरा धुरि वोळ्हवे वहिष्ठा धुरि वोळ्हवे | पर बोधया पुरन्धिंजार आ ससतीमिव | पर चक्षय रोदसी वासयोषसः शरवसे वासयोषसः
transliteration: vāyuryuṅkte rohitā vāyuraruṇā vāyū rathe ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave | pra bodhayā purandhiṃjāra ā sasatīmiva | pra cakṣaya rodasī vāsayoṣasaḥ śravase vāsayoṣasaḥ
translation: Do thou, O Maghavan, beat off these sorceresses' daring strength. Cast them within the narrow pit. within the deep and narrow pit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: तुभ्यमुषासः शुचयः परावति भद्रा वस्त्रा तन्वते दंसु रश्मिषु चित्रा नव्येषु रश्मिषु | तुभ्यं धेनुः सबर्दुघा विश्वा वसूनि दोहते | अजनयो मरुतो वक्षणाभ्योदिव आ वक्षणाभ्यः
transliteration: tubhyamuṣāsaḥ śucayaḥ parāvati bhadrā vastrā tanvate daṃsu raśmiṣu citrā navyeṣu raśmiṣu | tubhyaṃ dhenuḥ sabardughā viśvā vasūni dohate | ajanayo maruto vakṣaṇābhyodiva ā vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
translation: Of whom thou hast ere now destroyed thrice-fifty with thy fierce attacks. That deed they count a glorious deed, though small to thee, a glorious deed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: तुभ्यं शुक्रासः शुचयस्तुरण्यवो मदेषूग्रा इषणन्तभुर्वण्यपामिषन्त भुर्वणि | तवां तसारी दसमानो भगमीट्टे तक्ववीये | तवां विश्वस्माद भुवनात पासि धर्मणासुर्यात पासि धर्मण
transliteration: tubhyaṃ śukrāsaḥ śucayasturaṇyavo madeṣūghrā iṣaṇantabhurigvedaaṇyapāmiṣanta bhurigvedaaṇi | tvāṃ tsārī dasamāno bhaghamīṭṭe takvavīye | tvāṃ viśvasmād bhuvanāt pāsi dharmaṇāsuryāt pāsi dharmaṇa
translation: O Indra, crush and bray to bits the fearful fiery-weaponed fiend: Strike every demon to the ground.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 134
sanskrit: तवं नो वायवेषामपूर्व्यः सोमानां परथमः पीतिमर्हसि सुतानां पीतिमर्हसि | उतो विहुत्मतीनां विशां ववर्जुषीणाम | विश्वा इत ते धेनवो दुह्र आशिरं घर्तं दुह्रत आशिरम
transliteration: tvaṃ no vāyaveṣāmapūrigvedayaḥ somānāṃ prathamaḥ pītimarhasi sutānāṃ pītimarhasi | uto vihutmatīnāṃ viśāṃ vavarjuṣīṇām | viśvā it te dhenavo duhra āśiraṃ ghṛtaṃ duhrata āśiram
translation: Tear down the mighty ones. O Indra, hear thou us. For heaven hath glowed like earth in fear, O Thunder-armed, as dreading fierce heat, Thunder-armed! Most Mighty mid the Mighty Ones thou speedest with strong bolts of death, Not slaying men, unconquered Hero with the brave, O Hero, with the thrice-seven brave.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 135
sanskrit: सतीर्णं बर्हिरुप नो याहि वीतये सहस्रेण नियुता नियुत्वते शतिनीभिर्नियुत्वते | तुभ्यं हि पूर्वपीतये देवा देवाय येमिरे | पर ते सुतासो मधुमन्तो अस्थिरन मदाय करत्वे अस्थिरन
transliteration: stīrṇaṃ barhirupa no yāhi vītaye sahasreṇa niyutā niyutvate śatinībhirniyutvate | tubhyaṃ hi pūrigvedaapītaye devā devāya yemire | pra te sutāso madhumanto asthiran madāya kratve asthiran
translation: Vayu, let fleet-foot coursers bring thee speedily to this our feast, to drink first of the juice we pour, to the first draught of Soma juice. May our glad hymn, discerning well, uplifted, gratify thy mind. Come with thy team-drawn car, O Vayu, to the gift, come to the sacrificer's gift.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 135
sanskrit: तुभ्यायं सोमः परिपूतो अद्रिभि सपार्हा वसानः परि कोशमर्षति शुक्रा वसानो अर्षति | तवायं भाग आयुषुसोमो देवेषु हूयते | वह वायो नियुतो याह्यस्मयुर्जुषाणो याह्यस्मयुः
transliteration: tubhyāyaṃ somaḥ paripūto adribhi spārhā vasānaḥ pari kośamarṣati śukrā vasāno arṣati | tavāyaṃ bhāgha āyuṣusomo deveṣu hūyate | vaha vāyo niyuto yāhyasmayurjuṣāṇo yāhyasmayuḥ
translation: May the joy-giving drops, O Vayu gladden thee, effectual, well prepared, directed to the heavens, strong, blent with milk and seeking heaven; That aids, effectual to fulfil, may wait upon our skilful power. Associate teams come hitherward to grant our prayers: they shall address the hymns we sing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: पर सु जयेष्ठं निचिराभ्यां बर्हन नमो हव्यं मतिं भरता मर्ळयद्भ्यां सवादिष्ठं मर्ळयद्भ्याम | ता सम्राजाघ्र्तासुती यज्ञे-यज्ञ उपस्तुता | अथैनोः कषत्रं न कुतश्चनाध्र्षे देवत्वं नू चिदाध्र्षे
transliteration: pra su jyeṣṭhaṃ nicirābhyāṃ bṛhan namo havyaṃ matiṃ bharatā mṛḷayadbhyāṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ mṛḷayadbhyām | tā samrājāghṛtāsutī yajñe-yajña upastutā | athainoḥ kṣatraṃ na kutaścanādhṛṣe devatvaṃ nū cidādhṛṣe
translation: STREWN is the sacred grass; come Vayu, to our feast, with team of thousands, come, Lord of the harnessed team, with hundreds, Lord of harnessed steeds! The drops divine are lifted up for thee, the God, to drink them first. The juices rich in sweets have raised them for thy joy, have raised themselves to give thee strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: अद्रशि गातुरुरवे वरीयसी पन्था रतस्य समयंस्त रश्मिभिश्चक्षुर्भगस्य रश्मिभिः | दयुक्षं मित्रस्य सादनमर्यम्णो वरुणस्य च | अथा दधाते बर्हदुक्त्य्हं वयौपस्तुत्यं बर्हद वयः
transliteration: adraśi ghātururave varīyasī panthā ṛtasya samayaṃsta raśmibhiścakṣurbhaghasya raśmibhiḥ | dyukṣaṃ mitrasya sādanamaryamṇo varuṇasya ca | athā dadhāte bṛhaduktyhaṃ vayaupastutyaṃ bṛhad vayaḥ
translation: Purified by the stones the Soma flows for thee, clothed with its lovely splendours, to the reservoir, flows clad in its refulgent light. For thee the Soma is poured forth, thy portioned share mid Gods and men. Drive thou thy horses, Vayu, come to us with love, come well-inclined and loving us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: जयोतिष्मतीमदितिं धारयत्क्षितिं सवर्वतीमा सचेते दिवे-दिवे जाग्र्वांसा दिवे-दिवे | जयोतिष्मत कषत्रमाशाते आदित्या दानुनस पती | मित्रस्तयोर्वरुणो यातयज्जनो.अर्यमा यातयज्जनः
transliteration: jyotiṣmatīmaditiṃ dhārayatkṣitiṃ svarigvedaatīmā sacete dive-dive jāghṛvāṃsā dive-dive | jyotiṣmat kṣatramāśāte ādityā dānunas patī | mitrastayorigvedaaruṇo yātayajjano.aryamā yātayajjanaḥ
translation: Come thou with hundreds, come with thousands in thy team to this our solemn rite, to taste the sacred food, Vayu, to taste the offerings. This is thy seasonable share, that comes co-radiant with the Sun. Brought by attendant priests pure juice is offered up, Vayu, pure juice is offered up.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: अयं मित्राय वरुणाय शन्तमः सोमो भूत्ववपानेष्वाभगो देवो देवेष्वाभगः | तं देवासो जुषेरत विश्वे अद्य सजोषसः | तथा राजाना करथो यदिमह रतावाना यदीमहे
transliteration: ayaṃ mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ somo bhūtvavapāneṣvābhagho devo deveṣvābhaghaḥ | taṃ devāso juṣerata viśve adya sajoṣasaḥ | tathā rājānā karatho yadimaha ṛtāvānā yadīmahe
translation: The chariot with its team of horses bring you both, to guard us and to taste the well-appointed food, Vayu, to taste the offerings! Drink of the pleasant-flavoured juice: the first draught is assigned to you. O Vayu, with your splendid bounty come ye both, Indra, with bounty come ye both.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: यो मित्राय वरुणायाविधज्जनो.अनर्वाणं तं परि पातोंहसो दाश्वांसं मर्तमंहसः | तमर्यमाभि रक्षत्य रजूयन्तमनु वरतम | उक्थैर्य एनोः परिभूषति वरतं सतोमैराभूषति वरतम
transliteration: yo mitrāya varuṇāyāvidhajjano.anarigvedaāṇaṃ taṃ pari pātoaṃhaso dāśvāṃsaṃ martamaṃhasaḥ | tamaryamābhi rakṣaty ṛjūyantamanu vratam | ukthairya enoḥ paribhūṣati vrataṃ stomairābhūṣati vratam
translation: May our songs bring you hither to our solemn rites: these drops of mighty vigour have they beautified, like a swift steed of mighty strength. Drink of them well-inclined to us, come hitherward to be our help. Drink, Indra-Vayu, of these Juices pressed with stones, Strength-givers! till they gladden you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 136
sanskrit: नमो दिवे बर्हते रोदसीभ्यां मित्राय वोचं वरुणाय मीळ्हुषे सुम्र्ळीकाय मीळ्हुषे | इन्द्रमग्निमुप सतुहि दयुक्षमर्यमणं भगम | जयोग जीवन्तः परजया सचेमहि सोमस्योती सचेमहि
transliteration: namo dive bṛhate rodasībhyāṃ mitrāya vocaṃ varuṇāya mīḷhuṣe sumṛḷīkāya mīḷhuṣe | indramaghnimupa stuhi dyukṣamaryamaṇaṃ bhagham | jyogh jīvantaḥ prajayā sacemahi somasyotī sacemahi
translation: These Soma juices pressed for you in waters here, borne by attendant priests, are offered up to you: bright, Vayu, are they offered up. Swift through the strainer have they flowed, and here are shed for both of you, Soma-drops, fain for you, over the wether's fleece, Somas over the wether's fleece.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 137
sanskrit: सुषुमा यातमद्रिभिर्गोश्रीता मत्सरा इमे सोमासो मत्सरा इमे | आ राजाना दिविस्प्र्शास्मत्रा गन्तमुप नः | इमे वां मित्रावरुणा गवाशिरः सोमाः शुक्रा गवाशिरः
transliteration: suṣumā yātamadribhirghośrītā matsarā ime somāso matsarā ime | ā rājānā divispṛśāsmatrā ghantamupa naḥ | ime vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ghavāśiraḥ somāḥ śukrā ghavāśiraḥ
translation: BRING adoration ample and most excellent, hymn, offerings, to the watchful Twain, the bountiful, your sweetest to the bounteous Ones. Sovrans adored with streams of oil and praised at every sacrifice. Their high imperial might may nowhere be assailed, ne'er may their Godhead be assailed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 137
sanskrit: इम आ यातम इन्दवः सोमासो दध्याशिरः सुतासो दध्याशिरः | उत वाम उषसो बुधि साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः | सुतो मित्राय वरुणाय पीतये चारुर रताय पीतये
transliteration: ima ā yātam indavaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ sutāso dadhyāśiraḥ | uta vām uṣaso budhi sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ | suto mitrāya varuṇāya pītaye cārur ṛtāya pītaye
translation: For the broad Sun was seen a path more widely laid, the path of holy law hath been maintained with rays, the eye with Bhaga's rays of light. Firm-set in heaven is Mitra's home, and Aryaman's and Varuna's. Thence they give forth great vital strength which merits praise, high power of life that men shall praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 137
sanskrit: तां वां धेनुं न वासरीम अंशुं दुहन्त्य अद्रिभिः सोमं दुहन्त्य अद्रिभिः | अस्मत्रा गन्तम उप नो ऽरवाञ्चा सोमपीतये | अयं वाम मित्रावरुणा नर्भिः सुतः सोम आ पीतये सुतः
transliteration: tāṃ vāṃ dhenuṃ na vāsarīm aṃśuṃ duhanty adribhiḥ somaṃ duhanty adribhiḥ | asmatrā ghantam upa no 'rigvedaāñcā somapītaye | ayaṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā nṛbhiḥ sutaḥ soma ā pītaye sutaḥ
translation: With Aditi the luminous, the celestial, upholder of the people, come ye day by day, ye who watch sleepless, day by day. Resplendent might have ye obtained, Adityas, Lords of liberal gifts. Movers of men, mild both, are Mitra, Varuna, mover of men is Aryaman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 138
sanskrit: पर-पर पूष्णस तुविजातस्य शस्यते महित्वम अस्य तवसो न तन्दते सतोत्रम अस्य न तन्दते | अर्चामि सुम्नयन्न अहम अन्त्यूतिम मयोभुवम | विश्वस्य यो मन आयुयुवे मखो देव आयुयुवे मखः
transliteration: pra-pra pūṣṇas tuvijātasya śasyate mahitvam asya tavaso na tandate stotram asya na tandate | arcāmi sumnayann aham antyūtim mayobhuvam | viśvasya yo mana āyuyuve makho deva āyuyuve makhaḥ
translation: WITH stones have we pressed out: O come; these gladdening drops are blent with milk, these Soma-drops which gladden you. Come to us, Kings who reach to heaven, approach us, coming hitherward. These milky drops are yours, Mitra and Varuna, bright Soma juices blent with milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 138
sanskrit: पर हि तवा पूषन्न अजिरं न यामनि सतोमेभिः कर्ण्व रणवो यथा मर्ध उष्ट्रो न पीपरो मर्धः | हुवे यत तवा मयोभुवं देवं सख्याय मर्त्यः | अस्माकम आङगूषान दयुम्निनस कर्धि वाजेषु दयुम्निनस कर्धि
transliteration: pra hi tvā pūṣann ajiraṃ na yāmani stomebhiḥ kṛṇva ṛṇavo yathā mṛdha uṣṭro na pīparo mṛdhaḥ | huve yat tvā mayobhuvaṃ devaṃ sakhyāya martyaḥ | asmākam āṅghūṣān dyumninas kṛdhi vājeṣu dyumninas kṛdhi
translation: Here are the droppings; come ye nigh the Soma-droppings blent with curd, juices expressed and blent with curd. Now for the wakening of your Dawn together with the Sun-God's rays, juice waits for Mitra and for Varuna to drink, fair juice for drink, for sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 138
sanskrit: यस्य ते पूषन सख्ये विपन्यवः करत्वा चित सन्तो ऽवसा बुभुज्रिर इति करत्वा बुभुज्रिरे | ताम अनु तवा नवीयसीं नियुतं राय ईमहे | अहेळमान उरुशंस सरी भव वाजे-वाजे सरी भव
transliteration: yasya te pūṣan sakhye vipanyavaḥ kratvā cit santo 'vasā bubhujrira iti kratvā bubhujrire | tām anu tvā navīyasīṃ niyutaṃ rāya īmahe | aheḷamāna uruśaṃsa sarī bhava vāje-vāje sarī bhava
translation: As 'twere a radiant-coloured cow, they milk with stones the stalk for you, with stones they milk the Soma-plant. May ye come nigh us, may ye turn hither to drink the Soma juice. The men pressed out this juice, Mitra and Varuna, pressed out this Soma for your drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 139
sanskrit: अस्तु शरौषट पुरो अग्नीं धिया दध आ नु तच छर्धो दिव्यं वर्णीमह इन्द्रवायू वर्णीमहे | यद ध कराणा विवस्वति नाभा संदायि नव्यसी | अध पर सू न उप यन्तु धीतयो देवां अछा न धीतयः
transliteration: astu śrauṣaṭ puro aghnīṃ dhiyā dadha ā nu tac chardho divyaṃ vṛṇīmaha indravāyū vṛṇīmahe | yad dha krāṇā vivasvati nābhā saṃdāyi navyasī | adha pra sū na upa yantu dhītayo devāṃ achā na dhītayaḥ
translation: STRONG Pusan's majesty is lauded evermore, the glory of his lordly might is never faint, his song of praise is never faint. Seeking felicity I laud him nigh to help, the source, of bliss, Who, Vigorous one, hath drawn to him the hearts of all, drawn them, the Vigorous One, the God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 139
sanskrit: यद ध तयन मित्रावरुणाव रताद अध्य आददाथे अन्र्तं सवेन मन्युना दक्षस्य सवेन मन्युना | युवोर इत्थाधि सद्मस्व अपश्याम हिरण्ययम
transliteration: yad dha tyan mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtād adhy ādadāthe anṛtaṃ svena manyunā dakṣasya svena manyunā | yuvor itthādhi sadmasv apaśyāma hiraṇyayam
translation: Thee, then, O Pusan, like a swift one on his way, I urge with lauds that thou mayst make the foemen flee, drive, camel-like, our foes afar. As I, a man, call thee, a God, giver of bliss, to be my Friend, So make our loudly-chanted praises glorious, in battles make them glorious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 139
sanskrit: धीभिश चन मनसा सवेभिर अक्षभिः सोमस्य सवेभिर अक्षभिः
transliteration: dhībhiś cana manasā svebhir akṣabhiḥ somasya svebhir akṣabhiḥ
translation: Thou, Pusan, in whose friendship they who sing forth praise enjoy advantage, even in wisdom, through thy grace, in wisdom even they are advanced. So, after this most recent course, we come to thee with prayers for wealth. Not stirred to anger, O Wide-Ruler, come to us, come thou to us in every fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 139
sanskrit: युवां सतोमेभिर देवयन्तो अश्विनाश्रावयन्त इव शलोकम आयवो युवां हव्याभ्य आयवः | युवोर विश्वा अधि शरियः पर्क्षश च विश्ववेदसा | परुषायन्ते वाम पवयो हिरण्यये रथे दस्रा हिरण्यये
transliteration: yuvāṃ stomebhir devayanto aśvināśrāvayanta iva ślokam āyavo yuvāṃ havyābhy āyavaḥ | yuvor viśvā adhi śriyaḥ pṛkṣaś ca viśvavedasā | pruṣāyante vām pavayo hiraṇyaye rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye
translation: Not stirred to anger, come, Free-giver, nigh to us, to take this gift of ours, thou who hast goats for steeds, Goat-borne! their gift who long for fame. So, Wonder-Worker! may we turn thee hither with effectual lauds. I slight thee not, O Pusan, thou Resplendent One: thy friendship may not be despised.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 140
sanskrit: वेदिषदे परियधामाय सुद्युते धासिम इव पर भरा योनिम अग्नये | वस्त्रेणेव वासया मन्मना शुचिं जयोतीरथं शुक्रवर्णं तमोहनम
transliteration: vediṣade priyadhāmāya sudyute dhāsim iva pra bharā yonim aghnaye | vastreṇeva vāsayā manmanā śuciṃ jyotīrathaṃ śukravarṇaṃ tamohanam
translation: HEARD be our prayer! In thought I honour Agni first: now straightway we elect this heavenly company, Indra and Vayu we elect. For when our latest thought is raised and on Vivasvan centred well, Then may our holy songs go forward on their way, our songs as 'twere unto the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 140
sanskrit: अभि दविजन्मा तरिव्र्दन्नं रज्यते संवत्सरे वाव्र्धे जग्धमी पुनः | अन्यस्यासा जिह्वय जेन्यो वर्षा नयन्येन वनिनोम्र्ष्ट वरणः
transliteration: abhi dvijanmā trivṛdannaṃ ṛjyate saṃvatsare vāvṛdhe jaghdhamī punaḥ | anyasyāsā jihvaya jenyo vṛṣā nyanyena vaninomṛṣṭa varaṇaḥ
translation: As there ye, Mitra, Varuna, above the true have taken to yourselves the untrue with your mind, with wisdom's mental energy, So in the seats wherein ye dwell have we beheld the Golden One, Not with our thoughts or spirit, but with these our eyes, yea, with the eyes that Soma gives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 140
sanskrit: कर्ष्णप्रुतौ वेविजे अस्य सक्षिता उभा तरेते अभि मतरा शिशुम | पराचजिह्वं धवसयन्तं तर्षुच्युतमा साच्यं कुपयं वर्धनं पितुः
transliteration: kṛṣṇaprutau vevije asya sakṣitā ubhā tarete abhi matarā śiśum | prācajihvaṃ dhvasayantaṃ tṛṣucyutamā sācyaṃ kupayaṃ vardhanaṃ pituḥ
translation: Asvins, the pious call you with their hymns of praise, sounding their loud song forth to you, these living men, to their oblations, living men. All glories and all nourishment, Lords of all wealth! depend on you. The fellies of your golden chariot scatter drops, Mighty Ones! of your golden car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 140
sanskrit: मुमुक्ष्वो मनवे मनवस्यते रघुद्रुवः कर्ष्णसीतास ऊ जुवः | असमना अजिरासो रघुष्यदो वातजूता उप युज्यन्त आशवः
transliteration: mumukṣvo manave manavasyate raghudruvaḥ kṛṣṇasītāsa ū juvaḥ | asamanā ajirāso raghuṣyado vātajūtā upa yujyanta āśavaḥ
translation: Well is it known, O Mighty Ones: ye open heaven; for you the chariot-steeds are yoked for morning rites, unswerving steeds for morning rites, We set you on the chariot-seat, ye Mighty, on the golden car. Ye seek mid-air as by a path that leads aright, as by a path that leads direct.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 141
sanskrit: बळ इत्था तद वपुषे धायि दर्शतं देवस्य भर्गः सहसो यतो जनि | यदीमुप हवरते साधते मतिर्र्तस्य धेन अनयन्त सस्रुतः
transliteration: baḷ itthā tad vapuṣe dhāyi darśataṃ devasya bharghaḥ sahaso yato jani | yadīmupa hvarate sādhate matirṛtasya dhena anayanta sasrutaḥ
translation: To splendid Agni seated by the altar, loving well his home, I bring the food as 'twere his place of birth. I clothe the bright One with my hymn as with a robe, him with the car of light, bright-hued, dispelling gloom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 141
sanskrit: पर्क्षो वपुः पितुमान नित्य आ शये दवितीयमा सप्तशिवासु मात्र्षु | तर्तीयमस्य वर्षभस्य दोहसे दशप्रमतिं जनयन्त योषणः
transliteration: pṛkṣo vapuḥ pitumān nitya ā śaye dvitīyamā saptaśivāsu mātṛṣu | tṛtīyamasya vṛṣabhasya dohase daśapramatiṃ janayanta yoṣaṇaḥ
translation: Child of a double birth he grasps at triple food; in the year's course what he hath swallowed grows anew. He, by another's mouth and tongue a noble Bull, with other, as an elephant, consumes the trees.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 141
sanskrit: निर्यदीं बुध्नान महिषस्य वर्पस ईशानासः शवसाक्रन्त सूरयः | यदीमनु परदिवो मध्व आधवे गुहा सन्तं मातरिश्वा मथायति
transliteration: niryadīṃ budhnān mahiṣasya varpasa īśānāsaḥ śavasākranta sūrayaḥ | yadīmanu pradivo madhva ādhave ghuhā santaṃ mātariśvā mathāyati
translation: The pair who dwell together, moving in the dark bestir themselves: both parents hasten to the babe, Impetuous-tongued, destroying, springing swiftly forth, one to be watched and cherished, strengthener of his sire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 141
sanskrit: पर यत पितुः परमान नीयते पर्या पर्क्षुधो वीरुधो दंसु रोहति | उभा यदस्य जनुषं यदिन्वत आदिद यविष्ठो अभवद घर्णा शुचिः
transliteration: pra yat pituḥ paramān nīyate paryā pṛkṣudho vīrudho daṃsu rohati | ubhā yadasya januṣaṃ yadinvata ādid yaviṣṭho abhavad ghṛṇā śuciḥ
translation: For man, thou Friend of men, these steeds of thine are yoked, impatient, lightly running, ploughing blackened lines, Discordant-minded, fleet, gliding with easy speed, urged onward by the wind and rapid in their course.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 142
sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्न आ वह देवानद्य यतस्रुचे | तन्तुं तनुष्व पूर्व्यं सुतसोमाय दाशुषे
transliteration: samiddho aghna ā vaha devānadya yatasruce | tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrigvedayaṃ sutasomāya dāśuṣe
translation: YEA, verily, the fair effulgence of the God for glory was established, since he sprang from strength. When he inclines thereto successful is the hymn: the songs of sacrifice have brought him as they flow

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 142
sanskrit: घर्तवन्तमुप मासि मधुमन्तं तनूनपात | यज्ञं विप्रस्य मावतः शशमानस्य दाशुषः
transliteration: ghṛtavantamupa māsi madhumantaṃ tanūnapāt | yajñaṃ viprasya māvataḥ śaśamānasya dāśuṣaḥ
translation: Wonderful, rich in nourishment, he dwells in food; next, in the seven auspicious Mothers is his home. Thirdly, that they might drain the treasures of the Bull, the maidens brought forth him for whom the ten provide.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: पर तव्यसीं नव्यसीं धीतिमग्नये वाचो मतिं सहसःसूनवे भरे | अपां नपाद यो वसुभिः सह परियो होता पर्थिव्यां नयसीदद रत्वियः
transliteration: pra tavyasīṃ navyasīṃ dhītimaghnaye vāco matiṃ sahasaḥsūnave bhare | apāṃ napād yo vasubhiḥ saha priyo hotā pṛthivyāṃ nyasīdad ṛtviyaḥ
translation: KINDLED, bring, Agni, Gods to-day for him who lifts the ladle up. Spin out the ancient thread for him who sheds, with gifts, the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन्याविरग्निरभवन मातरिश्वने | अस्य करत्वा समिधानस्य मज्मना पर दयावा शोचिः पर्थिवी अरोचयत
transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomanyāviraghnirabhavan mātariśvane | asya kratvā samidhānasya majmanā pra dyāvā śociḥ pṛthivī arocayat
translation: Thou dealest forth, Tanunapat, sweet sacrifice enriched with oil, Brought by a singer such as I who offers gifts and toils for thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: अस्य तवेषा अजरा अस्य भानवः सुसन्द्र्शः सुप्रतीकस्यसुद्युतः | भात्वक्षसो अत्यक्तुर्न सिन्धवो.अग्ने रेजन्ते अससन्तो अजराः
transliteration: asya tveṣā ajarā asya bhānavaḥ susandṛśaḥ supratīkasyasudyutaḥ | bhātvakṣaso atyakturna sindhavo.aghne rejante asasanto ajarāḥ
translation: He wondrous, sanctifying, bright, sprinkles the sacrifice with mead, Thrice, Narasamsa from the heavens, a God mid Gods adorable.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: यमेरिरे भर्गवो विश्ववेदसं नाभा पर्थिव्या भुवनस्य मज्मना | अग्निं तं गीर्भिर्हिनुहि सव आ दमे य एको वस्वो वरुणो न राजति
transliteration: yamerire bhṛghavo viśvavedasaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā bhuvanasya majmanā | aghniṃ taṃ ghīrbhirhinuhi sva ā dame ya eko vasvo varuṇo na rājati
translation: Agni, besought, bring hitherward Indra the Friend, the Wonderful, For this my hymn of praise, O sweet of tongue, is chanted forth to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: न यो वराय मरुतामिव सवनः सेनेव सर्ष्टा दिव्या यथाशनिः | अग्निर्जम्भैस्तिगितैरत्ति भर्वति योधो न शत्रून स वना नय रञ्जते
transliteration: na yo varāya marutāmiva svanaḥ seneva sṛṣṭā divyā yathāśaniḥ | aghnirjambhaistighitairatti bharigvedaati yodho na śatrūn sa vanā ny ṛñjate
translation: The ladle-holders strew trimmed grass at this well-ordered sacrifice; A home for Indra is adorned, wide, fittest to receive the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: कुविन नो अग्निरुचथस्य वीरसद वसुष कुविद वसुभिः काममावरत | चोदः कुवित तुतुज्यात सातये धियः शुचिप्रतीकं तमया धिया गर्णे
transliteration: kuvin no aghnirucathasya vīrasad vasuṣ kuvid vasubhiḥ kāmamāvarat | codaḥ kuvit tutujyāt sātaye dhiyaḥ śucipratīkaṃ tamayā dhiyā ghṛṇe
translation: Thrown open be the Doors Divine, unfailing, that assist the rite, High, purifying, much-desired, so that the Gods may enter in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: घर्तप्रतीकं व रतस्य धूर्षदमग्निं मित्रं न समिधान रञ्जते | इन्धानो अक्रो विदथेषु दीद्यच्छुक्रवर्णामुदु नो यंसते धियम
transliteration: ghṛtapratīkaṃ va ṛtasya dhūrṣadamaghniṃ mitraṃ na samidhāna ṛñjate | indhāno akro vidatheṣu dīdyacchukravarṇāmudu no yaṃsate dhiyam
translation: May Night and Morning, hymned with lauds, united, fair to look upon, Strong Mothers of the sacrifice, seat them together on the grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 143
sanskrit: अप्रयुछन्नप्रयुछद्भिरग्ने शिवेभिर्नः पायुभिः पाहि शग्मैः | अदब्धेभिरद्र्पितेभिरिष्टे.अनिमिषद्भिः परि पाहि नो जाः
transliteration: aprayuchannaprayuchadbhiraghne śivebhirnaḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śaghmaiḥ | adabdhebhiradṛpitebhiriṣṭe.animiṣadbhiḥ pari pāhi no jāḥ
translation: May the two Priests Divine, the sage, the sweet-voiced lovers of the hymn, Complete this sacrifice of ours, effectual, reaching heaven to-day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 144
sanskrit: एति पर होता वरतमस्य माययोर्ध्वां दधानः शुचिपेशसं धियम | अभि सरुचः करमते दक्षिणाव्र्तो या अस्य धाम परथमं ह निंसते
transliteration: eti pra hotā vratamasya māyayordhvāṃ dadhānaḥ śucipeśasaṃ dhiyam | abhi srucaḥ kramate dakṣiṇāvṛto yā asya dhāma prathamaṃ ha niṃsate
translation: To Agni I present a newer mightier hymn, I bring my words and song unto the Son of Strength, Who, Offspring of the Waters, bearing precious things sits on the earth, in season, dear Invoking Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 144
sanskrit: अभीं रतस्य दोहना अनूषत योनौ देवस्य सदने परीव्र्ताः | अपामुपस्थे विभ्र्तो यदावसदध सवधा अधयद याभिरीयते
