transliteration: abhīṃ ṛtasya dohanā anūṣata yonau devasya sadane parīvṛtāḥ | apāmupasthe vibhṛto yadāvasadadha svadhā adhayad yābhirīyate
translation: Soon as he sprang to birth that Agni was shown forth to Matarisvan in the highest firmament. When he was kindled, through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 144
sanskrit: युयूषतः सवयसा तदिद वपुः समानमर्थं वितरित्रता मिथः | आदीं भगो न हव्यः समस्मदा वोळ्हुर्न रश्मीन समयंस्त सारथिः
transliteration: yuyūṣataḥ savayasā tadid vapuḥ samānamarthaṃ vitaritratā mithaḥ |
translation: His flames that wax not old, beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely, shine with beauteous sheen. The rays of Agni, him whose active force is light, through the nights glimmer sleepless, ageless, like the floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 145
sanskrit: तं पर्छता स जगामा स वेद स चिकित्वानीयते सा नवीयते | तस्मिन सन्ति परशिषस्तस्मिन्निष्टयः स वाजस्य शवसः शुष्मिणस पतिः
transliteration: taṃ pṛchatā sa jaghāmā sa veda sa cikitvānīyate sā nvīyate | tasmin santi praśiṣastasminniṣṭayaḥ sa vājasya śavasaḥ śuṣmiṇas patiḥ
translation: THE Priest goes forth to sacrifice, with wondrous power sending aloft the hymn of glorious brilliancy. He moves to meet the ladles turning to the right, which are the first to kiss the place where he abides.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 145
sanskrit: तमित पर्छन्ति न सिमो वि पर्छति सवेनेव धीरो मनसा यदग्रभीत | न मर्ष्यते परथमं नापरं वचो.अस्य करत्वसचते अप्रद्र्पितः
transliteration: tamit pṛchanti na simo vi pṛchati sveneva dhīro manasā yadaghrabhīt | na mṛṣyate prathamaṃ nāparaṃ vaco.asya kratvasacate apradṛpitaḥ
translation: To him sang forth the flowing streams of Holy Law, encompassed in the home and birth-place of the God. He, when he dwelt extended in the waters' lap, absorbed those Godlike powers for which he is adored.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 145
sanskrit: तमिद गछन्ति जुह्वस्तमर्वतीर्विश्वान्येकः शर्णवद वचांसि मे | पुरुप्रैषस्ततुरिर्यज्ञसाधनो.अछिद्रोतिः शिशुरादत्त सं रभः
transliteration: tamid ghachanti juhvastamarigvedaatīrigvedaśvānyekaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me | purupraiṣastaturiryajñasādhano.achidrotiḥ śiśurādatta saṃ rabhaḥ
translation: Seeking in course altern to reach the selfsame end the two copartners strive to win this beauteous form. Like Bhaga must he be duly invoked by us, as he who drives the car holds fast the horse's reins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 145
sanskrit: उपस्थायं चरति यत समारत सद्यो जातस्तत्सार युज्येभिः | अभि शवान्तं मर्शते नान्द्ये मुदे यदीं गछन्त्युशतीरपिष्ठितम
transliteration: upasthāyaṃ carati yat samārata sadyo jātastatsāra yujyebhiḥ | abhi śvāntaṃ mṛśate nāndye mude yadīṃ ghachantyuśatīrapiṣṭhitam
translation: He whom the two copartners with observance tend, the pair who dwell together in the same abode, By night as in the day the grey one was born young, passing untouched by eld through many an age of man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 145
sanskrit: स ईं मर्गो अप्यो वनर्गुरुप तवच्युपमस्यां नि धायि | वयब्रवीद वयुना मर्त्येभ्यो.अग्निर्विद्वान रतचिद धि सत्यः
transliteration: sa īṃ mṛgho apyo vanarghurupa tvacyupamasyāṃ ni dhāyi | vyabravīd vayunā martyebhyo.aghnirigvedadvān ṛtacid dhi satyaḥ
translation: Him the ten fingers, the devotions, animate: we mortals call on him a God to give us help. He speeds over the sloping surface of the land: new deeds hath he performed with those who gird him round.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 146
sanskrit: तरिमूर्धानं सप्तरश्मिं गर्णीषे.अनूनमग्निं पित्रोरुपस्थे | निषत्तमस्य चरतो धरुवस्य विश्वा दिवो रोचनापप्रिवांसम
transliteration: trimūrdhānaṃ saptaraśmiṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anūnamaghniṃ pitrorupasthe | niṣattamasya carato dhruvasya viśvā divo rocanāpaprivāṃsam
translation: Ask ye of him for he is come, he knoweth it; he, full of wisdom, is implored, is now implored. With him are admonitions and with him commands: he is the Lord of Strength, the Lord of Power and Might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 146
sanskrit: उक्षा महानभि ववक्ष एने अजरस्तस्थावितूतिर्र्ष्वः | उर्व्याः पदो नि दधाति सानौ रिहन्त्यूधो अरुषासो अस्य
transliteration: ukṣā mahānabhi vavakṣa ene ajarastasthāvitaūtirṛṣvaḥ | urigvedayāḥ pado ni dadhāti sānau rihantyūdho aruṣāso asya
translation: They ask of him: not all learn by their questioning what he, the Sage, hath grasped, as 'twere, with his own mind. Forgetting not the former nor the later word, he goeth on, not careless, in his mental power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 146
sanskrit: समानं वत्समभि संचरन्ती विष्वग धेनू वि चरतः सुमेके | अनपव्र्ज्यानध्वनो मिमाने विश्वान केतानधि महोदधाने
transliteration: samānaṃ vatsamabhi saṃcarantī viṣvagh dhenū vi carataḥ sumeke | anapavṛjyānadhvano mimāne viśvān ketānadhi mahodadhāne
translation: To him these ladles go, to him these racing mares: he only will give ear to all the words I speak. All-speeding, victor, perfecter of sacrifice, the Babe with flawless help hath mustered vigorous might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 146
sanskrit: धीरासः पदं कवयो नयन्ति नाना हर्दा रक्षमाणा अजुर्यम | सिषासन्तः पर्यपश्यन्त सिन्धुमाविरेभ्यो अभवत्सूर्यो नॄन
transliteration: dhīrāsaḥ padaṃ kavayo nayanti nānā hṛdā rakṣamāṇā ajuryam | siṣāsantaḥ paryapaśyanta sindhumāvirebhyo abhavatsūryo nṝn
translation: Whate'er he meets he grasps and then runs farther on, and straightway, newly born, creeps forward with his kin. He stirs the wearied man to pleasure and great joy what time the longing gifts approach him as he comes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 146
sanskrit: दिद्र्क्षेण्यः परि काष्ठासु जेन्य ईळेन्यो महो अर्भाय जीवसे | पुरुत्रा यदभवत सूरहैभ्यो गर्भेभ्यो मघवा विश्वदर्शतः
transliteration: didṛkṣeṇyaḥ pari kāṣṭhāsu jenya īḷenyo maho arbhāya jīvase | purutrā yadabhavat sūrahaibhyo gharbhebhyo maghavā viśvadarśataḥ
translation: He is a wild thing of the flood and forest: he hath been laid upon the highest surface. He hath declared the lore of works to mortals, Agni the Wise, for he knows Law, the Truthful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 147
sanskrit: कथा ते अग्ने शुचयन्त आयोर्ददाशुर्वाजेभिराशुषाणाः | उभे यत तोके तनये दधाना रतस्य सामन रणयन्तदेवाः
transliteration: kathā te aghne śucayanta āyordadāśurigvedaājebhirāśuṣāṇāḥ | ubhe yat toke tanaye dadhānā ṛtasya sāman raṇayantadevāḥ
translation: I LAUD the seven-rayed, the triple-headed, Agni all-perfect in his Parents' bosom, Sunk in the lap of all that moves and moves not, him who hath filled all luminous realms of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 147
sanskrit: बोधा मे अस्य वचसो यविष्ठ मंहिष्ठस्य परभ्र्तस्य सवधावः | पीयति तवो अनु तवो गर्णाति वन्दारुस्ते तन्वं वन्देग्ने
transliteration: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha maṃhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ | pīyati tvo anu tvo ghṛṇāti vandāruste tanvaṃ vandeaghne
translation: As a great Steer he grew to these his Parents; sublime he stands, untouched by eld, far-reaching. He plants his footsteps on the lofty ridges of the broad earth: his red flames lick the udder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 147
sanskrit: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरितादरक्षन | ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः
transliteration: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te aghne paśyanto andhaṃ duritādarakṣan | rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ
translation: Coming together to their common youngling both Cows, fairshaped, spread forth in all directions, Measuring out the paths that must be travelled, entrusting all desires to him the Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 147
sanskrit: यो नो अग्ने अररिवानघायुररातीवा मर्चयति दवयेन | मन्त्रो गुरुः पुनरस्तु सो अस्मा अनु मर्क्षीष्ट तन्वं दुरुक्तैः
transliteration: yo no aghne ararivānaghāyurarātīvā marcayati dvayena | mantro ghuruḥ punarastu so asmā anu mṛkṣīṣṭa tanvaṃ duruktaiḥ
translation: The prudent sages lead him to his dwelling, guarding with varied skill the Ever-Youthful. Longing, they turned their eyes unto the River: to these the Sun of men was manifested.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 147
sanskrit: उत वा यः सहस्य परविद्वान मर्तो मर्तं मर्चयति दवयेन | अतः पाहि सतवमान सतुवन्तमग्ने माकिर्नो दुरिताय धायीः
transliteration: uta vā yaḥ sahasya pravidvān marto martaṃ marcayati dvayena | ataḥ pāhi stavamāna stuvantamaghne mākirno duritāya dhāyīḥ
translation: Born noble in the regions, aim of all mens' eyes to be implored for life by great and small alike, Far as the Wealthy One hath spread himself abroad, he is the Sire all-visible of this progeny.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 148
sanskrit: मथीद यदीं विष्टो मातरिश्वा होतारं विश्वाप्सुं विश्वदेव्यम | नि यं दधुर्मनुष्यासु विक्षु सवर्ण चित्रं वपुषे विभावम
transliteration: mathīd yadīṃ viṣṭo mātariśvā hotāraṃ viśvāpsuṃ viśvadevyam | ni yaṃ dadhurmanuṣyāsu vikṣu svarṇa citraṃ vapuṣe vibhāvam
translation: How, Agni, have the radiant ones, aspiring, endued thee with the vigour of the living, So that on both sides fostering seed and offspring, the Gods may joy in Holy Law's fulfilment?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 148
sanskrit: ददानमिन न ददभन्त मन्माग्निर्वरूथं मम तस्य चाकन | जुषन्त विश्वन्यस्य कर्मोपस्तुतिं भरमाणस्य कारोः
transliteration: dadānamin na dadabhanta manmāghnirigvedaarūthaṃ mama tasya cākan | juṣanta viśvanyasya karmopastutiṃ bharamāṇasya kāroḥ
translation: Mark this my speech, Divine One, thou, Most Youthful! offered to thee by him who gives most freely. One hates thee, and another sings thy praises: I thine adorer laud thy form, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 148
sanskrit: नित्ये चिन नु यं सदने जग्र्भ्रे परशस्तिभिर्दधिरे यज्ञियसः | पर सू नयन्त गर्भयन्त इष्टावश्वासो न रथ्योररहणाः
transliteration: nitye cin nu yaṃ sadane jaghṛbhre praśastibhirdadhire yajñiyasaḥ | pra sū nayanta ghṛbhayanta iṣṭāvaśvāso na rathyorarahaṇāḥ
translation: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mamateya from affliction. Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 148
sanskrit: पुरूणि दस्मो नि रिणाति जम्भैराद रोचते वन आ विभावा | आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरस्तुर्न शर्यामसनामनु दयून
transliteration: purūṇi dasmo ni riṇāti jambhairād rocate vana ā vibhāvā |
translation: The sinful man who worships not, O Agni, who, offering not, harms us with double-dealing,-- Be this in turn to him a heavy sentence may he distress himself by his revilings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 149
sanskrit: महः स राय एषते पतिर्दन्निन इनस्य वसुनः पद आ | उप धरजन्तमद्रयो विधन्नित
transliteration: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate patirdannina inasya vasunaḥ pada ā | upa dhrajantamadrayo vidhannit
translation: WHAT Matarisvan, piercing, formed by friction, Herald of all the Gods. in varied figure, Is he whom they have set mid human houses, gay-hued as light and shining forth for beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 149
sanskrit: स यो वर्षा नरां न रोदस्योः शरवोभिरस्ति जीवपीतसर्गः | पर यः सस्राणः शिश्रीत योनौ
transliteration: sa yo vṛṣā narāṃ na rodasyoḥ śravobhirasti jīvapītasarghaḥ | pra yaḥ sasrāṇaḥ śiśrīta yonau
translation: They shall not harm the man who brings thee praises: such as I am, Agni my help approves me. All acts of mine shall they accept with pleasure, laudation from the singer who presents it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 150
sanskrit: पुरु तव दाश्वान वोचे.अरिरग्ने तव सविदा | तोदस्येव शरण आ महस्य
transliteration: puru tva dāśvān voce.ariraghne tava svidā | todasyeva śaraṇa ā mahasya
translation: HITHER he hastens to give, Lord of great riches, King of the mighty, to the place of treasure. The pressing-stones shall serve him speeding near us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 150
sanskrit: वयनिनस्य धनिनः परहोषे चिदररुषः | कदा चन परजिगतो अदेवयोः
transliteration: vyaninasya dhaninaḥ prahoṣe cidararuṣaḥ | kadā cana prajighato adevayoḥ
translation: As Steer of men so Steer of earth and heaven by glory, he whose streams all life hath drunken, Who hasting forward rests upon the altar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 150
sanskrit: स चन्द्रो विप्र मर्त्यो महो वराधन्तमो दिवि | पर-परेत ते अग्ने वनुषः सयाम
transliteration: sa candro vipra martyo maho vrādhantamo divi | pra-pret te aghne vanuṣaḥ syāma
translation: He who hath lighted up the joyous castle, wise Courser like the Steed of cloudy heaven, Bright like the Sun, with hundredfold existence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 151
sanskrit: मित्रं न यं शिम्या गोषु गव्यवः सवाध्यो विदथे अप्सुजीजनन | अरेजेतां रोदसी पाजसा गिरा परति परियं यजतं जनुषमवः
transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ śimyā ghoṣu ghavyavaḥ svādhyo vidathe apsujījanan | arejetāṃ rodasī pājasā ghirā prati priyaṃ yajataṃ januṣamavaḥ
translation: AGNI, thy faithful servant I call upon thee with many a gift, As in the keeping of the great inciting God;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 151
sanskrit: यद ध तयद वां पुरुमीळ्हस्य सोमिनः पर मित्रासो न दधिरे सवाभुवः | अध करतुं विदतं गतुमर्चत उत शरुतं वर्षणा पस्त्यावतः
transliteration: yad dha tyad vāṃ purumīḷhasya sominaḥ pra mitrāso na dadhire svābhuvaḥ | adha kratuṃ vidataṃ ghatumarcata uta śrutaṃ vṛṣaṇā pastyāvataḥ
translation: Thou who ne'er movest thee to aid the indolent, the godless man, Him who though wealthy never brings an offering.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 152
sanskrit: युवं वस्त्रणि पुवसा वसाथे युवोरछिद्रा मन्तवो ह सर्गाः | अवातिरतमन्र्तानि विश्व रतेन मित्रावरुणा सचेथे
transliteration: yuvaṃ vastraṇi puvasā vasāthe yuvorachidrā mantavo ha sarghāḥ | avātiratamanṛtāni viśva ṛtena mitrāvaruṇā sacethe
translation: HEAVEN and earth trembled at the might and voice of him, whom, loved and Holy One, helper of all mankind, The wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power, a Friend, mid waters, at the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 152
sanskrit: एतच्चन तवो वि चिकेतदेषां सत्यो मन्त्रः कविशस्त रघावान | तरिरश्रिं हन्ति चतुरश्रिरुग्रो देवनिदो ह परथमाजूर्यन
transliteration: etaccana tvo vi ciketadeṣāṃ satyo mantraḥ kaviśasta ṛghāvān | triraśriṃ hanti caturaśrirughro devanido ha prathamāajūryan
translation: As these, like friends, have done this work for you, these prompt servants of Purumilha Soma-offerer, Give mental power to him who sings the sacred song, and hearken, Strong Ones, to the master of the house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 152
sanskrit: अपादेति परथमा पद्वतीनां कस्तद वां मित्रावरुणा चिकेत | गर्भो भारं भरत्या चिदस्य रतं पिपर्त्यन्र्तं नि तारीत
transliteration: apādeti prathamā padvatīnāṃ kastad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ciketa | gharbho bhāraṃ bharatyā cidasya ṛtaṃ pipartyanṛtaṃ ni tārīt
translation: The folk have glorified your birth from Earth and Heaven, to be extolled, ye Strong Ones, for your mighty power. Ye, when ye bring to singer and the rite, enjoy the sacrifice performed with holy praise and strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 152
sanskrit: परयन्तमित परि जारं कनीनां पश्यामसि नोपनिपद्यमानम | अनवप्र्ग्णा वितता वसानं परियं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम
transliteration: prayantamit pari jāraṃ kanīnāṃ paśyāmasi nopanipadyamānam | anavapṛghṇā vitatā vasānaṃ priyaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma
translation: The people prospers, Asuras! whom ye dearly love: ye, Righteous Ones, proclaim aloud the Holy Law. That efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven, ye bind unto the work, as to the pole an ox.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 152
sanskrit: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुरर्वा कनिक्रदत पतयदूर्ध्वसानुः | अचित्तं बरह्म जुजुषुर्युवानः पर मित्रे धाम वरुणेग्र्णन्तः
transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśurarigvedaā kanikradat patayadūrdhvasānuḥ | acittaṃ brahma jujuṣuryuvānaḥ pra mitre dhāma varuṇeghṛṇantaḥ
translation: On this great earth ye send your treasure down with might: unstained by dust, the crowding kine are in the stalls. Here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the Sun at morning and at evening, like swift birds of prey.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 153
sanskrit: यजामहे वां महः सजोषा हव्येभिर्मित्रावरुणा नमोभिः | घर्तैर्घ्र्तस्नू अध यद वामस्मे अध्वर्यवो न धीतिभिर्भरन्ति
transliteration: yajāmahe vāṃ mahaḥ sajoṣā havyebhirmitrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ | ghṛtairghṛtasnū adha yad vāmasme adhvaryavo na dhītibhirbharanti
translation: THE robes which ye put on abound with fatness: uninterrupted courses are your counsels. All falsehood, Mitra-Varuna! ye conquer, and closely cleave unto the Law Eternal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 153
sanskrit: परस्तुतिर्वां धाम न परयुक्तिरयामि मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिः | अनक्ति यद वां विदथेषु होता सुम्नं वां सूरिर्व्र्षणावियक्षन
transliteration: prastutirigvedaāṃ dhāma na prayuktirayāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktiḥ | anakti yad vāṃ vidatheṣu hotā sumnaṃ vāṃ sūririgvedaṛṣaṇāviyakṣan
translation: This might of theirs hath no one comprehended. True is the crushing word the sage hath uttered, The fearful four-edged bolt smites down the three-edged, and those who hate the Gods first fall and perish.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 153
sanskrit: पीपाय धेनुरदितिर्र्ताय जनाय मित्रावरुणा हविर्दे | हिनोति यद वां विदथे सपर्यन स रातहव्यो मानुषो न होता
transliteration: pīpāya dhenuraditirṛtāya janāya mitrāvaruṇā havirde | hinoti yad vāṃ vidathe saparyan sa rātahavyo mānuṣo na hotā
translation: The Footless Maid precedeth footed creatures. Who marketh, Mitra-Varuna, this your doing? The Babe Unborn supporteth this world's burthen, fulfilleth Law and overcometh falsehood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 153
sanskrit: उत वां विक्षु मद्यास्वन्धो गाव आपश्च पीपयन्त देवीः | उतो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पतिर्दन वीतं पातं पयस उस्रियायाः
transliteration: uta vāṃ vikṣu madyāsvandho ghāva āpaśca pīpayanta devīḥ | uto no asya pūrigvedayaḥ patirdan vītaṃ pātaṃ payasa usriyāyāḥ
translation: We look on him the darling of the Maidens, always advancing, never falling downward, Wearing inseparable, wide-spread raiment, Mitra's and Varuna's delightful glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 154
sanskrit: विष्णोर्नु कं वीर्याणि पर वोचं यः पार्थिवानि विममेरजांसि | यो अस्कभायदुत्तरं सधस्थं विचक्रमाणस्त्रेधोरुगायः
transliteration: viṣṇornu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimamerajāṃsi | yo askabhāyaduttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇastredhorughāyaḥ
translation: WE worship with our reverence and oblations you, Mitra Varuna, accordant, mighty, So that with us, ye Twain whose backs are sprinkled with oil, the priests with oil and hymns support you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 154
sanskrit: पर तद विष्णु सतवते वीर्येण मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः | यस्योरुषु तरिषु विक्रमणेष्वधिक्षियन्ति भुवनानि विश्वा
transliteration: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ | yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣvadhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā
translation: Your praise is like a mighty power, an impulse: to you, Twain Gods, a well-formed hymn is offered, As the priest decks yon, Strong Ones, in assemblies, and the prince fain to worship you for blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 154
sanskrit: पर विष्णवे शूषमेतु मन्म गिरिक्षित उरुगायाय वर्ष्णे | य इदं दीर्घं परयतं सधस्थमेको विममे तरिभिरित पदेभिः
transliteration: pra viṣṇave śūṣametu manma ghirikṣita urughāyāya vṛṣṇe | ya idaṃ dīrghaṃ prayataṃ sadhasthameko vimame tribhirit padebhiḥ
translation: O Mitra-Varuna, Aditi the Milch-cow streams for the rite, for folk who bring oblation, When in the assembly he who worships moves you, like to a human priest, with gifts presented.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 154
sanskrit: यस्य तरी पूर्णा मधुना पदान्यक्षीयमाणा सवधयामदन्ति | य उ तरिधातु पर्तिवीमुत दयामेको दाधार भुवनानि विश्वा
transliteration: yasya trī pūrṇā madhunā padānyakṣīyamāṇā svadhayāmadanti | ya u tridhātu pṛtivīmuta dyāmeko dādhāra bhuvanāni viśvā
translation: So may the kine and heavenly Waters pour you sweet drink in families that make you joyful. Of this may he, the ancient House-Lord, give us. Enjoy, drink of the milk the cow provideth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: पर वः पान्तमन्धसो धियायते महे शूराय विष्णवे चार्चत | या सानुनि पर्वतानामदाभ्या महस्तस्थतुरर्वतेव साधुना
transliteration: pra vaḥ pāntamandhaso dhiyāyate mahe śūrāya viṣṇave cārcata | yā sānuni parigvedaatānāmadābhyā mahastasthaturarigvedaateva sādhunā
translation: I WILL declare the mighty deeds of Visnu, of him who measured out the earthly regions, Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: तवेषमित्था समरणं शिमीवतोरिन्द्राविष्णू सुतपा वामुरुष्यति | या मर्त्याय परतिधीयमानमित कर्शानोरस्तुरसनामुरुष्यथः
transliteration: tveṣamitthā samaraṇaṃ śimīvatorindrāviṣṇū sutapā vāmuruṣyati | yā martyāya pratidhīyamānamit kṛśānorasturasanāmuruṣyathaḥ
translation: For this his mighty deed is Visnu lauded, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming; He within whose three wide-extended paces all living creatures have their habitation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: ता ईं वर्धन्ति मह्यस्य पौंस्यं नि मातरा नयति रेतसे भुजे | दधाति पुत्रो.अवरं परं पितुर्नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः
transliteration: tā īṃ vardhanti mahyasya pauṃsyaṃ ni mātarā nayati retase bhuje | dadhāti putro.avaraṃ paraṃ piturnāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ
translation: Let the hymn lift itself as strength to Visnu, the Bull far-striding, dwelling on the mountains, Him who alone with triple step hath measured this common dwelling-place, long, far extended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: तत-तदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसीनस्य तरतुरव्र्कस्य मीळ्हुषः | यः पार्थिवानि तरिभिरिद विगामभिरुरु करमिष्टोरुगायाय जीवसे
transliteration: tat-tadidasya pauṃsyaṃ ghṛṇīmasīnasya traturavṛkasya mīḷhuṣaḥ | yaḥ pārthivāni tribhirid vighāmabhiruru kramiṣṭorughāyāya jīvase
translation: Him whose three places that are filled with sweetness, imperishable, joy as it may list them, Who verily alone upholds the threefold, the earth, the heaven, and all living creatures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: दवे इदस्य करमणे सवर्द्र्शो.अभिख्याय मर्त्यो भुरण्यति | तर्तीयमस्य नकिरा दधर्षति वयश्चन पतयन्तः पतत्रिणः
transliteration: dve idasya kramaṇe svardṛśo.abhikhyāya martyo bhuraṇyati | tṛtīyamasya nakirā dadharṣati vayaścana patayantaḥ patatriṇaḥ
translation: May I attain to that his well-loved mansion where men devoted to the Gods are happy. For there springs, close akin to the Wide-Strider, the well of meath in Visnu's highest footstep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 155
sanskrit: चतुर्भिः साकं नवतिं च नामभिश्चक्रं न वर्त्तं वयतीन्रवीविपत | बर्हच्छरीरो विमिमान रक्वभिर्युवाकुमारः परत्येत्याहवम
transliteration: caturbhiḥ sākaṃ navatiṃ ca nāmabhiścakraṃ na vṛttaṃ vyatīnravīvipat | bṛhaccharīro vimimāna ṛkvabhiryuvākumāraḥ pratyetyāhavam
translation: Fain would we go unto your dwelling-places where there are many-horned and nimble oxen, For mightily, there, shineth down upon us the widely-striding Bull's sublimest mansion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 156
sanskrit: भवा मित्रो न शेव्यो घर्तासुतिर्विभूतद्युम्न एवया उ सप्रथाः | अधा ते विष्णो विदुषा चिदर्ध्य सतोमो यज्ञश्चराध्यो हविष्मता
transliteration: bhavā mitro na śevyo ghṛtāsutirigvedabhūtadyumna evayā u saprathāḥ | adhā te viṣṇo viduṣā cidardhya stomo yajñaścarādhyo haviṣmatā
translation: To the great Hero, him who sets his mind thereon, and Visnu, praise aloud in song your draught of juice,-- Gods ne'er beguiled, who borne as 'twere by noble steed, have stood upon the lofty ridges of the hills.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 156
sanskrit: यः पूर्व्याय वेधसे नवीयसे सुमज्जानये विष्णवे ददाशति | यो जातमस्य महतो महि बरवत सेदु शरवोभिर्युज्यं चिदभ्यसत
transliteration: yaḥ pūrigvedayāya vedhase navīyase sumajjānaye viṣṇave dadāśati | yo jātamasya mahato mahi bravat sedu śravobhiryujyaṃ cidabhyasat
translation: Your Soma-drinker keeps afar your furious rush, Indra and Visnu, when ye come with all your might. That which hath been directed well at mortal man, bow-armed Krsanu's arrow, ye turn far aside.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 156
sanskrit: तमु सतोतारः पूर्व्यं यथा विद रतस्य गर्भं जनुषापिपर्तन | आस्य जानन्तो नाम चिद विवक्तन महस्ते विष्णो सुमतिं भजामहे
transliteration: tamu stotāraḥ pūrigvedayaṃ yathā vida ṛtasya gharbhaṃ januṣāpipartana |
translation: These offerings increase his mighty manly strength: he brings both Parents down to share the genial flow. He lowers, though a son, the Father's highest name; the third is that which is high in the light of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 157
sanskrit: अबोध्यग्निर्ज्म उदेति सूर्यो वयुषाश्चन्द्रा मह्यावो अर्चिषा | आयुक्षातामश्विना यातवे रथं परासावीद देवः सविता जगत पर्थक
transliteration: abodhyaghnirjma udeti sūryo vyuṣāścandrā mahyāvo arciṣā |
translation: FAR-SHINING, widely famed, going thy wonted way, fed with the oil, be helpful. Mitra-like, to us. So, Visnu, e'en the wise must swell thy song of praise, and he who hath oblations pay thee solemn rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 158
sanskrit: वसू रुद्रा पुरुमन्तू वर्धन्ता दशस्यतं नो वर्षणावभिष्टौ | दस्रा ह यद रेक्ण औचथ्यो वां पर यत सस्राथेकवाभिरूती
transliteration: vasū rudrā purumantū vṛdhantā daśasyataṃ no vṛṣaṇāvabhiṣṭau | dasrā ha yad rekṇa aucathyo vāṃ pra yat sasrātheakavābhirūtī
translation: AGNI is wakened: Surya riseth from the earth. Mighty, refulgent Dawn hath shone with all her light. The Asvins have equipped their chariot for the course. God Savitar hath moved the folk in sundry ways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 158
sanskrit: को वां दाशत सुमतये चिदस्यै वसू यद धेथे नमसा पदे गोः | जिग्र्तमस्मे रेवतीः पुरन्धीः कामप्रेणेव मनसा चरन्ता
transliteration: ko vāṃ dāśat sumataye cidasyai vasū yad dhethe namasā pade ghoḥ | jighṛtamasme revatīḥ purandhīḥ kāmapreṇeva manasā carantā
translation: When, Asvins, ye equip your very mighty car, bedew, ye Twain, our power with honey and with oil. To our devotion give victorious strength in war: may we win riches in the heroes' strife for spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 158
sanskrit: युक्तो ह यद वां तौग्र्याय पेरुर्वि मध्ये अर्णसो धायि पज्रः | उप वामवः शरणं गमेयं शूरो नाज्म पतयद्भिरेवैः
transliteration: yukto ha yad vāṃ taughryāya perurigveda madhye arṇaso dhāyi pajraḥ | upa vāmavaḥ śaraṇaṃ ghameyaṃ śūro nājma patayadbhirevaiḥ
translation: Nigh to us come the Asvins' lauded three-wheeled car, the car laden with meath and drawn by fleet-foot steeds, Three-seated, opulent, bestowing all delight. may it bring weal to us, to cattle and to men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 158
sanskrit: उपस्तुतिरौचथ्यमुरुष्येन मा मामिमे पतत्रिणी वि दुग्धाम | मा मामेधो दशतयश्चितो धाक पर यद वां बद्धस्त्मनि खादति कषाम
transliteration: upastutiraucathyamuruṣyen mā māmime patatriṇī vi dughdhām | mā māmedho daśatayaścito dhāk pra yad vāṃ baddhastmani khādati kṣām
translation: Bring hither nourishment for us, ye Asvins Twain; sprinkle us with your whip that drops with honey-dew. Prolong our days of life, wipe out our trespasses; destroy our foes, be our companions and our Friends.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 158
sanskrit: न मा गरन नद्यो मात्र्तमा दासा यदीं सुसमुब्धमवाधुः | शिरो यदस्य तरैतनो वितक्षत सवयं दास उरो अंसावपि गध
transliteration: na mā gharan nadyo mātṛtamā dāsā yadīṃ susamubdhamavādhuḥ |
translation: Ye store the germ of life in female creatures, ye lay it up within all living beings. Ye have sent forth, O Asvins passing mighty, the fire, the sovrans of the wood, the waters,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 159
sanskrit: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी रताव्र्धा मही सतुषे विदथेषु परचेतसा | देवेभिर्ये देवपुत्रे सुदंससेत्था धिया वार्याणि परभूषतः
transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī ṛtāvṛdhā mahī stuṣe vidatheṣu pracetasā | devebhirye devaputre sudaṃsasetthā dhiyā vāryāṇi prabhūṣataḥ
translation: YE Vasus Twain, ye Rudras full of counsel, grant us, Strong Strengtheners, when ye stand beside us, What wealth Aucathya craves of you, great Helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 159
sanskrit: उत मन्ये पितुरद्रुहो मनो मातुर्महि सवतवस्तद धवीमभिः | सुरेतसा पितरा भूम चक्रतुरुरु परजाया अम्र्तंवरीमभिः
transliteration: uta manye pituradruho mano māturmahi svatavastad dhavīmabhiḥ | suretasā pitarā bhūma cakratururu prajāyā amṛtaṃvarīmabhiḥ
translation: Who may give you aught, Vasus, for your favour, for what, at the Cow's place, ye grant through worship? Wake for us understanding full of riches, come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 159
sanskrit: ते सूनवः सवपसः सुदंससो मही जज्ञुर्मातरा पूर्वचित्तये | सथातुश्च सत्यं जगतश्च धर्मणि पुत्रस्य पाथः पदमद्वयाविनः
transliteration: te sūnavaḥ svapasaḥ sudaṃsaso mahī jajñurmātarā pūrigvedaacittaye | sthātuśca satyaṃ jaghataśca dharmaṇi putrasya pāthaḥ padamadvayāvinaḥ
translation: As erst for Tugra's son your car, sea-crossing, strong, was equipped and set amid the waters, So may I gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 159
sanskrit: ते मायिनो ममिरे सुप्रचेतसो जामी सयोनी मिथुना समोकसा | नव्यं-नव्यं तन्तुमा तन्वते दिवि समुद्रे अन्तः कवयः सुदीतयः
transliteration: te māyino mamire supracetaso jāmī sayonī mithunā samokasā | navyaṃ-navyaṃ tantumā tanvate divi samudre antaḥ kavayaḥ sudītayaḥ
translation: May this my praise preserve Ucathya's offspring: let not these Twain who fly with wings exhaust me. Let not the wood ten times up-piled consume me, when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 159
sanskrit: तद राधो अद्य सवितुर्वरेण्यं वयं देवस्य परसवे मनामहे | अस्मभ्यं दयावाप्र्थिवी सुचेतुना रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं शतग्विनम
transliteration: tad rādho adya saviturigvedaareṇyaṃ vayaṃ devasya prasave manāmahe | asmabhyaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ śataghvinam
translation: The most maternal streams, wherein the Dasas cast me securely bound, have not devoured me. When Traitana would cleave my head asunder, the Dasa wounded his own breast and shoulders.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 160
sanskrit: ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वशम्भुव रतावरी रजसो धारयत्कवी | सुजन्मनी धिषणे अन्तरीयते देवो देवी धर्मणा सूर्यः शुचिः
transliteration: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśambhuva ṛtāvarī rajaso dhārayatkavī | sujanmanī dhiṣaṇe antarīyate devo devī dharmaṇā sūryaḥ śuciḥ
translation: I PRAISE with sacrifices mighty Heaven and Earth at festivals, the wise, the Strengtheners of Law. Who, having Gods for progeny, conjoined with Gods, through wonder-working wisdom bring forth choicest boons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 160
sanskrit: उरुव्यचसा महिनी असश्चता पिता माता च भुवनानि रक्षतः | सुध्र्ष्टमे वपुष्ये न रोदसी पिता यत सीमभि रूपैरवासयत
transliteration: uruvyacasā mahinī asaścatā pitā mātā ca bhuvanāni rakṣataḥ | sudhṛṣṭame vapuṣye na rodasī pitā yat sīmabhi rūpairavāsayat
translation: With invocations, on the gracious Father's mind, and on the Mother's great inherent power I muse. Prolific Parents, they have made the world of life, and for their brood all round wide immortality.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 160
sanskrit: स वह्निः पुत्रः पित्रोः पवित्रवान पुनाति धीरो भुवनानि मायया | धेनुं च पर्श्निं वर्षभं सुरेतसं विश्वाहा शुक्रं पयो अस्य दुक्षत
transliteration: sa vahniḥ putraḥ pitroḥ pavitravān punāti dhīro bhuvanāni māyayā | dhenuṃ ca pṛśniṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suretasaṃ viśvāhā śukraṃ payo asya dukṣata
translation: These Sons of yours well skilled in work, of wondrous power, brought forth to life the two great Mothers first of all. To keep the truth of all that stands and all that moves, ye guard the station of your Son who knows no guile.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 160
sanskrit: अयं देवानामपसामपस्तमो यो जजान रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा | वि यो ममे रजसी सुक्रतूययाजरेभि सकम्भनेभिःसमान्र्चे
transliteration: ayaṃ devānāmapasāmapastamo yo jajāna rodasī viśvaśambhuvā | vi yo mame rajasī sukratūyayājarebhi skambhanebhiḥsamānṛce
translation: They with surpassing skill, most wise, have measured out the Twins united in their birth and in their home. They, the refulgent Sages, weave within the sky, yea, in the depths of sea, a web for ever new.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 160
sanskrit: ते नो गर्णाने महिनी महि शरवः कषत्रं दयावाप्र्थिवी धासथो बर्हत | येनाभि कर्ष्टीस्ततनाम विश्वहा पनाय्यमोजो अस्मे समिन्वतम
transliteration: te no ghṛṇāne mahinī mahi śravaḥ kṣatraṃ dyāvāpṛthivī dhāsatho bṛhat | yenābhi kṛṣṭīstatanāma viśvahā panāyyamojo asme saminvatam
translation: This is to-day the goodliest gift of Savitar: this thought we have when now the God is furthering us. On us with loving-kindness Heaven and Earth bestow riches and various wealth and treasure hundredfold!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 161
sanskrit: किमु शरेष्ठः किं यविष्ठो न आजगन किमीयते दूत्यं कद यदूचिम | न निन्दिम चमसं यो महाकुलो.अग्ने भरातर्द्रुण इद भूतिमूदिम
transliteration: kimu śreṣṭhaḥ kiṃ yaviṣṭho na ājaghan kimīyate dūtyaṃ kad yadūcima | na nindima camasaṃ yo mahākulo.aghne bhrātardruṇa id bhūtimūdima
translation: THESE, Heaven and Earth, bestow prosperity on all, sustainers of the region, Holy Ones and wise, Two Bowls of noble kind: between these Goddesses the God, the fulgent Sun, travels by fixed decree.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 161
sanskrit: एकं चमसं चतुरः कर्णोतन तद वो देवा अब्रुवन तद व आगमम | सौधन्वना यद्येवा करिष्यथ साकं देवैर्यज्ञियासो भविष्यथ
transliteration: ekaṃ camasaṃ caturaḥ kṛṇotana tad vo devā abruvan tad va āghamam | saudhanvanā yadyevā kariṣyatha sākaṃ devairyajñiyāso bhaviṣyatha
translation: Widely-capacious Pair, mighty, that never fail, the Father and the Mother keep all creatures safe: The two world-halves, the spirited, the beautiful, because the Father hath clothed them in goodly forms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 161
sanskrit: अग्निं दूतं परति यदब्रवीतनाश्वः कर्त्वो रथ उतेह कर्त्वः | धेनुः कर्त्वा युवशा कर्त्वा दवा तानि भरातरनु वः कर्त्व्येमसि
transliteration: aghniṃ dūtaṃ prati yadabravītanāśvaḥ kartvo ratha uteha kartvaḥ | dhenuḥ kartvā yuvaśā kartvā dvā tāni bhrātaranu vaḥ kṛtvyemasi
translation: Son of these Parents, he the Priest with power to cleanse, Sage, sanctifies the worlds with his surpassing power. Thereto for his bright milk he milked through all the days the party-coloured Cow and the prolific Bull.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 161
sanskrit: चक्र्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छत कवेदभूद यः सय दूतो न आजगन | यदावाख्यच्चमसाञ्चतुरः कर्तानादित तवष्टा गनास्वन्तर्न्यानजे
transliteration: cakṛvāṃsa ṛbhavastadapṛchata kvedabhūd yaḥ sya dūto na ājaghan | yadāvākhyaccamasāñcaturaḥ kṛtānādit tvaṣṭā ghnāsvantarnyānaje
translation: Among the skilful Gods most skilled is he, who made the two world-halves which bring prosperity to all; Who with great wisdom measured both the regions out, and stablished them with pillars that shall ne'er decay.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 161
sanskrit: हनामैनानिति तवष्टा यदब्रवीच्चमसं ये देवपानमनिन्दिषुः | अन्या नामानि कर्ण्वते सुते सचानन्यैरेनान्कन्या नामभि सपरत
transliteration: hanāmaināniti tvaṣṭā yadabravīccamasaṃ ye devapānamanindiṣuḥ | anyā nāmāni kṛṇvate sute sacānanyairenānkanyā nāmabhi sparat
translation: Extolled in song, O Heaven and Earth, bestow on us, ye mighty Pair, great glory and high lordly sway, Whereby we may extend ourselves ever over the folk; and send us strength that shall deserve the praise of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: मा नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुरिन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतः परिख्यन | यद वाजिनो देवजतस्य सप्तेः परवक्ष्यामो विदथे वीर्याणि
transliteration: mā no mitro varuṇo aryamāyurindra ṛbhukṣā marutaḥ parikhyan | yad vājino devajatasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmo vidathe vīryāṇi
translation: WHY hath the Best, why hath the Youngest come to us? Upon what embassy comes he? What have we said? We have not blamed the chalice of illustrious birth. We, Brother Agni, praised the goodness of the wood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यन निर्णिजा रेक्णसा पराव्र्तस्य रतिं गर्भीतां मुखतो नयन्ति | सुप्रनजो मेम्यद विश्वरूप इन्द्रापूष्णोः परियमप्येति पाथः
transliteration: yan nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya ratiṃ ghṛbhītāṃ mukhato nayanti | supranajo memyad viśvarūpa indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyamapyeti pāthaḥ
translation: The chalice that is single make ye into four: thus have the Gods commanded; therefore am I come. If, O Sudhanvan's Children, ye will do this thing ye shall participate in sacrifice with Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: एष छागः पुरो अश्वेन वाजिना पूष्णो भागो नीयते विश्वदेव्यः | अभिप्रियं यत पुरोळाशमर्वता तवष्टेदेनं सौश्रवसाय जिन्वति
transliteration: eṣa chāghaḥ puro aśvena vājinā pūṣṇo bhāgho nīyate viśvadevyaḥ | abhipriyaṃ yat puroḷāśamarigvedaatā tvaṣṭedenaṃ sauśravasāya jinvati
translation: What to the envoy Agni in reply ye spake, A courser must be made, a chariot fashioned here, A cow must be created, and the Twain made young. When we have done these things, Brother, we turn to you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यद धविष्यं रतुशो देवयानं तरिर्मानुषाः पर्यश्वं नयन्ति | अत्रा पूष्णः परथमो भाग एति यज्ञं देवेभ्यः परतिवेदयन्नजः
transliteration: yad dhaviṣyaṃ ṛtuśo devayānaṃ trirmānuṣāḥ paryaśvaṃ nayanti | atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamo bhāgha eti yajñaṃ devebhyaḥ prativedayannajaḥ
translation: When thus, O Rbhus, ye had done ye questioned thus, Whither went he who came to us a messenger? Then Tvastar, when he viewed the four wrought chalices, concealed himself among the Consorts of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: होताध्वर्युरावया अग्निमिन्धो गरावग्राभ उत शंस्ता सुविप्रः | तेन यज्ञेन सवरंक्र्तेन सविष्टेन वक्षणा आप्र्णध्वम
transliteration: hotādhvaryurāvayā aghnimindho ghrāvaghrābha uta śaṃstā suvipraḥ | tena yajñena svaraṃkṛtena sviṣṭena vakṣaṇā āpṛṇadhvam
translation: As Tvastar thus had spoken, Let us slay these men who have reviled the chalice, drinking-cup of Gods, They gave themselves new names when Soma juice was shed, and under these new names the Maiden welcomed them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यूपव्रस्का उत ये यूपवाहाश्चषालं ये अश्वयूपाय तक्षति | ये चार्वते पचनं सम्भरन्त्युतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु
transliteration: yūpavraskā uta ye yūpavāhāścaṣālaṃ ye aśvayūpāya takṣati | ye cārigvedaate pacanaṃ sambharantyuto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu
translation: Indra hath yoked his Bays, the Asvins' car is horsed, Brhaspati hath brought the Cow of every hue. Ye went as Rbhus, Vibhvan, Vaja to the Gods, and skilled in war, obtained your share in sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: उप परागात सुमन मे.अधायि मन्म देवानामाशा उप वीतप्र्ष्ठः | अन्वेनं विप्रा रषयो मदन्ति देवानां पुष्टे चक्र्मा सुबन्धुम
transliteration: upa prāghāt suman me.adhāyi manma devānāmāśā upa vītapṛṣṭhaḥ | anvenaṃ viprā ṛṣayo madanti devānāṃ puṣṭe cakṛmā subandhum
translation: Ye by your wisdom brought a cow from out a hide; unto that ancient Pair ye gave again their youth. Out of a horse, Sudhanvan's Sons, ye formed a horse: a chariot ye equipped, and went unto the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यद वाजिनो दाम सुन्दानमर्वतो या शीर्षण्या रशनारज्जुरस्य | यद वा घास्य परभ्र्तमास्ये तर्णं सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु
transliteration: yad vājino dāma sundānamarigvedaato yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanārajjurasya | yad vā ghāsya prabhṛtamāsye tṛṇaṃ sarigvedaā tā te api deveṣvastu
translation: Drink ye this water, were the words ye spake to them; or drink ye this, the rinsing of the Muñja-grass. If ye approve not even this, Sudhanvan's Sons, then at the third libation gladden ye yourselves.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यदश्वस्य करविषो मक्षिकाश यद वा सवरौ सवधितौ रिप्तमस्ति | यद धस्तयोः शमितुर्यन नखेषु सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु
transliteration: yadaśvasya kraviṣo makṣikāśa yad vā svarau svadhitau riptamasti | yad dhastayoḥ śamituryan nakheṣu sarigvedaā tā te api deveṣvastu
translation: Most excellent are waters, thus said one of you; most excellent is Agni, thus another said. Another praised to many a one the lightning cloud. Then did ye shape the cups, speaking the words of truth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यदूवध्यमुदरस्यापवाति य आमस्य करविषो गन्धो अस्ति | सुक्र्ता तच्छमितारः कर्ण्वन्तूत मेधं शर्तपाकं पचन्तु
transliteration: yadūvadhyamudarasyāpavāti ya āmasya kraviṣo ghandho asti | sukṛtā tacchamitāraḥ kṛṇvantūta medhaṃ śṛtapākaṃ pacantu
translation: One downward to the water drives the crippled cow, another trims the flesh brought on the carving-board. One carries off the refuse at the set of sun. How did the Parents aid their children in their task!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यत ते गात्रादग्निना पच्यमानादभि शूलं निहतस्यावधावति | मा तद भूम्यामा शरिषन मा तर्णेषु देवेभ्यस्तदुशद्भ्यो रातमस्तु
transliteration: yat te ghātrādaghninā pacyamānādabhi śūlaṃ nihatasyāvadhāvati | mā tad bhūmyāmā śriṣan mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyastaduśadbhyo rātamastu
translation: On the high places ye have made the grass for man, and water in the valleys, by your skill, O Men. Rbhus, ye iterate not to-day that act of yours, your sleeping in the house of him whom naught can hide.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: ये वाजिनं परिपश्यन्ति पक्वं य ईमाहुः सुरभिर्निर्हरेति | ये चार्वतो मांसभिक्षामुपासत उतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु
transliteration: ye vājinaṃ paripaśyanti pakvaṃ ya īmāhuḥ surabhirnirhareti | ye cārigvedaato māṃsabhikṣāmupāsata uto teṣāmabhighūrtirna invatu
translation: As, compassing them round, ye glided through the worlds, where had the venerable Parents their abode? Ye laid a curse on him who raised his arm at you: to him who spake aloud to you ye spake again.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यन नीक्षणं मांस्पचन्या उखाया या पात्राणि यूष्णासेचनानि | ऊष्मण्यापिधाना चरूणामङकाः सूनाःपरि भूषन्त्यश्वम
transliteration: yan nīkṣaṇaṃ māṃspacanyā ukhāyā yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇaāsecanāni |
translation: When ye had slept your fill, ye Rbhus, thus ye asked, O thou whom naught may hide, who now hath wakened us? The goat declared the hound to be your wakener. That day, in a full year, ye first unclosed our eyes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 163
sanskrit: यदक्रन्दः परथमं जायमान उद्यन समुद्रादुत वा पुरीषात | शयेनस्य पक्षा हरिणस्य बाहू उपस्तुत्यं महि जातं ते अर्वन
transliteration: yadakrandaḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāna udyan samudrāduta vā purīṣāt |
translation: SLIGHT us not Varuna, Aryaman, or Mitra, Rbhuksan, Indra, Ayu, or the Maruts, When we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong Steed, God-descended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: अस्य वामस्य पलितस्य होतुस्तस्य भराता मध्यमो अस्त्यश्नः | तर्तीयो भराता घर्तप्र्ष्ठो अस्यात्रापश्यं विश्पतिं सप्तपुत्रम
transliteration: asya vāmasya palitasya hotustasya bhrātā madhyamo astyaśnaḥ | tṛtīyo bhrātā ghṛtapṛṣṭho asyātrāpaśyaṃ viśpatiṃ saptaputram
translation: WHAT time, first springing into life, thou neighedst, proceeding from the sea or upper waters, Limbs of the deer hadst thou, and eagle pinions. O Steed, thy birth is nigh and must be lauded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: सप्त युञ्जन्ति रथमेकचक्रमेको अश्वो वहति सप्तनामा | तरिनाभि चक्रमजरमनर्वं यत्रेमा विश्वा भुवनाधितस्थुः
transliteration: sapta yuñjanti rathamekacakrameko aśvo vahati saptanāmā | trinābhi cakramajaramanarigvedaaṃ yatremā viśvā bhuvanādhitasthuḥ
translation: This Steed which Yama gave hath Trita harnessed, and him, the first of all, hath Indra mounted. His bridle the Gandharva grasped. O Vasus, from out the Sun ye fashioned forth the Courser.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: इमं रथमधि ये सप्त तस्थुः सप्तचक्रं सप्त वहन्त्यश्वाः | सप्त सवसारो अभि सं नवन्ते यत्र गवां निहिता सप्त नाम
transliteration: imaṃ rathamadhi ye sapta tasthuḥ saptacakraṃ sapta vahantyaśvāḥ | sapta svasāro abhi saṃ navante yatra ghavāṃ nihitā sapta nāma
translation: Yama art thou, O Horse; thou art Aditya; Trita art thou by secret operation. Thou art divided thoroughly from Soma. They say thou hast three bonds in heaven that hold thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: को ददर्श परथमं जायमानमस्थन्वन्तं यदनस्था बिभर्ति | भूम्या असुरस्र्गात्मा कव सवित को विद्वांसमुप गात परष्टुमेतत
transliteration: ko dadarśa prathamaṃ jāyamānamasthanvantaṃ yadanasthā bibharti | bhūmyā asurasṛghātmā kva svit ko vidvāṃsamupa ghāt praṣṭumetat
translation: Three bonds, they say, thou hast in heaven that bind thee, three in the waters, three within the ocean. To me thou seemest Varuna, O Courser, there where they say is thy sublimest birth-place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: पाकः पर्छामि मनसाविजानन देवानामेना निहिता पदानि | वत्से बष्कये.अधि सप्त तन्तून वि तत्निरे कवय ओतवाु
transliteration: pākaḥ pṛchāmi manasāvijānan devānāmenā nihitā padāni | vatse baṣkaye.adhi sapta tantūn vi tatnire kavaya otavāu
translation: Here-, Courser, are the places where they groomed thee, here are the traces of thy hoofs as winner. Here have I seen the auspicious reins that guide thee, which those who guard the holy Law keep safely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: अचिकित्वाञ्चिकितुषश्चिदत्र कवीन पर्छामि विद्मने न विद्वान | वि यस्तस्तम्भ षळ इमा रजांस्यजस्य रूपे किमपि सविदेकम
transliteration: acikitvāñcikituṣaścidatra kavīn pṛchāmi vidmane na vidvān | vi yastastambha ṣaḷ imā rajāṃsyajasya rūpe kimapi svidekam
translation: Thyself from far I recognized in spirit,--a Bird that from below flew through the heaven. I saw thy head still soaring, striving upward by paths unsoiled by dust, pleasant to travel.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 164
sanskrit: इह बरवीतु य ईमङग वेदास्य वामस्य निहितं पदं वेः | शीर्ष्णः कषीरं दुह्रते गावो अस्य वव्रिं वसाना उदकं पदापुः
transliteration: iha bravītu ya īmaṅgha vedāsya vāmasya nihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ |
translation: Here I beheld thy form, matchless in glory, eager to win thee food at the Cow's station. Whene'er a man brings thee to thine enjoyment, thou swallowest the plants most greedy eater.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 165
sanskrit: कया शुभा सवयसः सनीळाः समान्या मरुतः सं मिमिक्षुः | कया मती कुत एतास एते.अर्चन्ति शुष्मं वर्षणो वसूया
transliteration: kayā śubhā savayasaḥ sanīḷāḥ samānyā marutaḥ saṃ mimikṣuḥ | kayā matī kuta etāsa ete.arcanti śuṣmaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasūyā
translation: OF this benignant Priest, with eld grey-coloured, the brother midmost of the three is lightning. The third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled. Here I behold the Chief with seven male children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 165
sanskrit: कस्य बरह्माणि जुजुषुर्युवानः को अध्वरे मरुत आ ववर्त | शयेनानिव धरजतो अन्तरिक्षे केन महा मनसा रीरमाम
transliteration: kasya brahmāṇi jujuṣuryuvānaḥ ko adhvare maruta ā vavarta |
translation: Seven to the one-wheeled chariot yoke the Courser; bearing seven names the single Courser draws it. Three-naved the wheel is, sound and undecaying, whereon are resting all these worlds of being.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 166
sanskrit: तन नु वोचाम रभसाय जन्मने पूर्वं महित्वं वर्षभस्यकेतवे | ऐधेव यामन मरुतस्तुविष्वणो युधेव शक्रास्तविषाणि कर्तन
transliteration: tan nu vocāma rabhasāya janmane pūrigvedaaṃ mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasyaketave | aidheva yāman marutastuviṣvaṇo yudheva śakrāstaviṣāṇi kartana
translation: WITH what bright beauty are the Maruts jointly invested, peers in age, who dwell together? From what place have they come? With what intention? Sing they their strength through love of wealth, these Heroes?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 166
sanskrit: नित्यं न सूनुं मधु बिभ्रत उप करीळन्ति करीळा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः | नक्षन्ति रुद्रा अवसा नमस्विनं न मर्धन्ति सवतवसो हविष्क्र्तम
transliteration: nityaṃ na sūnuṃ madhu bibhrata upa krīḷanti krīḷā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ | nakṣanti rudrā avasā namasvinaṃ na mardhanti svatavaso haviṣkṛtam
translation: Whose prayers have they, the Youthful Ones, accepted? Who to his sacrifice hath turned the Maruts? We will delay them on their journey sweeping--with what high spirit!--through the air like eagles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 166
sanskrit: यस्मा ऊमासो अम्र्ता अरासत रायस पोषं च हविषा ददाशुषे | उक्षन्त्यस्मै मरुतो हिता इव पुरू रजांसि पयसा मयोभुवः
transliteration: yasmā ūmāso amṛtā arāsata rāyas poṣaṃ ca haviṣā dadāśuṣe | ukṣantyasmai maruto hitā iva purū rajāṃsi payasā mayobhuvaḥ
translation: Whence comest thou alone, thou who art mighty, Indra, Lord of the Brave? What is thy purpose? Thou greetest us when meeting us the Bright Ones. Lord of Bay Steeds, say what thou hast against us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 167
sanskrit: सहस्रं त इन्द्रोतयो नः सहस्रमिषो हरिवो गूर्ततमाः | सहस्रं रायो मादयध्यै सहस्रिण उप नो यन्तु वाजाः
transliteration: sahasraṃ ta indrotayo naḥ sahasramiṣo harivo ghūrtatamāḥ | sahasraṃ rāyo mādayadhyai sahasriṇa upa no yantu vājāḥ
translation: Now let us publish, for the vigorous company the herald of the Strong One, their primeval might. With fire upon your way, O Maruts loud of voice, with battle, Mighty Ones, achieve your deeds of strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 168
sanskrit: यज्ञा-यज्ञा वः समना तुतुर्वणिर्धियं-धियं वो देवया उ दधिध्वे | आ वो.अर्वाचः सुविताय रोदस्योर्महे वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः
transliteration: yajñā-yajñā vaḥ samanā tuturigvedaaṇirdhiyaṃ-dhiyaṃ vo devayā u dadhidhve |
translation: A THOUSAND are thy helps for us, O Indra: a thousand, Lord of Bays, thy choice refreshments. Wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us: may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: महश्चित तवमिन्द्र यत एतान महश्चिदसि तयजसो वरूता | स नो वेधो मरुतां चिकित्वान सुम्ना वनुष्व तव हि परेष्ठा
transliteration: mahaścit tvamindra yata etān mahaścidasi tyajaso varūtā | sa no vedho marutāṃ cikitvān sumnā vanuṣva tava hi preṣṭhā
translation: SWIFT gain is his who hath you near at every rite: ye welcome every song of him who serves the Gods. So may I turn you hither with fair hymns of praise to give great succour for the weal of both the worlds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: अयुज्रन त इन्द्र विश्वक्र्ष्टीर्विदानासो निष्षिधो मर्त्यत्रा | मरुतां पर्त्सुतिर्हासमाना सवर्मीळ्हस्य परधनस्य सातौ
transliteration: ayujran ta indra viśvakṛṣṭīrigvedadānāso niṣṣidho martyatrā | marutāṃ pṛtsutirhāsamānā svarmīḷhasya pradhanasya sātau
translation: Surrounding, as it were, self-born, self-powerful, they spring to life the shakers-down of food and light; Like as the countess undulations of the floods, worthy of praise when near, like bullocks and like kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: अम्यक सा त इन्द्र रष्टिरस्मे सनेम्यभ्वं मरुतो जुनन्ति | अग्निश्चिद धि षमातसे शुशुक्वानापो न दवीपं दधतिप्रयांसि
transliteration: amyak sā ta indra ṛṣṭirasme sanemyabhvaṃ maruto junanti | aghniścid dhi ṣmātase śuśukvānāpo na dvīpaṃ dadhatiprayāṃsi
translation: They who, like Somas with their well-grown stalks pressed out, imbibed within the heart, dwell there in friendly wise. Upon their shoulders rests as 'twere a warrior's spear and in their hand they hold a dagger and a ring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: तवं तू न इन्द्र तं रयिं दा ओजिष्ठया दक्षिणयेव रातिम | सतुतश्च यास्ते चकनन्त वायो सतनं न मध्वःपीपयन्त वाजैः
transliteration: tvaṃ tū na indra taṃ rayiṃ dā ojiṣṭhayā dakṣiṇayeva rātim | stutaśca yāste cakananta vāyo stanaṃ na madhvaḥpīpayanta vājaiḥ
translation: Self-yoked they have descended lightly from the sky. With your own lash, Immortals, urge yourselves to speed. Unstained by dust the Maruts, mighty in their strength, have cast down e'en firm things, armed with their shining spears.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: तवे राय इन्द्र तोशतमाः परणेतारः कस्य चिद रतायोः | ते षु णो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तु ये समा पुरा गातूयन्तीव देवाः
transliteration: tve rāya indra tośatamāḥ praṇetāraḥ kasya cid ṛtāyoḥ | te ṣu ṇo maruto mṛḷayantu ye smā purā ghātūyantīva devāḥ
translation: Who among you, O Maruts armed with lightning-spears, moveth you by himself, as with the tongue his jaws? Ye rush from heaven's floor as though ye sought for food, on many errands like the Sun's diurnal Steed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: परति पर याहीन्द्र मीळ्हुषो नॄन महः पार्थिवे सदने यतस्व | अध यदेषां पर्थुबुध्नास एतास्तीर्थे नार्यः पौंस्यानि तस्थुः
transliteration: prati pra yāhīndra mīḷhuṣo nṝn mahaḥ pārthive sadane yatasva | adha yadeṣāṃ pṛthubudhnāsa etāstīrthe nāryaḥ pauṃsyāni tasthuḥ
translation: Say where, then, is this mighty region's farthest bound, where, Maruts, is the lowest depth that ye have reached, When ye cast down like chaff the firmly stablished pile, and from the mountain send the glittering water-flood?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: परति घोराणामेतानामयासां मरुतां शर्ण्व आयतामुपब्दिः | ये मर्त्यं पर्तनायन्तमूमैर्र्णावानं न पतयन्त सर्गैः
transliteration: prati ghorāṇāmetānāmayāsāṃ marutāṃ śṛṇva āyatāmupabdiḥ | ye martyaṃ pṛtanāyantamūmairṛṇāvānaṃ na patayanta sarghaiḥ
translation: Your winning is with strength, dazzling, with heavenly light, with fruit mature, O Maruts, fall of plenteousness. Auspicious is your gift like a free giver's meed, victorious, spreading far, as of immortal Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 169
sanskrit: तवं मानेभ्य इन्द्र विश्वजन्या रदा मरुद्भिः शुरुधो गोग्राः | सतवानेभि सतवसे देव देवैर्विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम
transliteration: tvaṃ mānebhya indra viśvajanyā radā marudbhiḥ śurudho ghoaghrāḥ | stavānebhi stavase deva devairigvedadyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum
translation: The rivers roar before your chariot fellies when they are uttering the voice of rain-clouds. The lightnings laugh upon the earth beneath them, what time the Maruts scatter forth their fatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 170
sanskrit: न नूनमस्ति नो शवः कस्तद वेद यदद्भुतम | अन्यस्यचित्तमभि संचरेण्यमुताधीतं वि नश्यति
transliteration: na nūnamasti no śvaḥ kastad veda yadadbhutam | anyasyacittamabhi saṃcareṇyamutādhītaṃ vi naśyati
translation: As, Indra, from great treason thou protectest, yea, from great treachery these who approach us, So, marking well, Controller of the Maruts grant us their blessings, for they are thy dearest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 170
sanskrit: किं न इन्द्र जिघांससि भरातरो मरुतस्तव | तेभिः कल्पस्व साधुया मा नः समरणे वधीः
transliteration: kiṃ na indra jighāṃsasi bhrātaro marutastava | tebhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā mā naḥ samaraṇe vadhīḥ
translation: The various doings of all mortal people by thee are ordered, in thy wisdom, Indra. The host of Maruts goeth forth exulting to win the light-bestowing spoil of battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 170
sanskrit: किं नो भरातरगस्त्य सखा सन्नति मन्यसे | विद्मा हि तेयथा मनो.अस्मभ्यमिन न दित्ससि
transliteration: kiṃ no bhrātaraghastya sakhā sannati manyase | vidmā hi teyathā mano.asmabhyamin na ditsasi
translation: That spear of thine sat firm for us, O Indra: the Maruts set their whole dread power in motion. E'en Agni shines resplendent in the brush-wood: the viands hold him as floods hold an island.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 170
sanskrit: अरं कर्ण्वन्तु वेदिं समग्निमिन्धतां पुरः | तत्राम्र्तस्य चेतनं यज्ञं ते तनवावहै
transliteration: araṃ kṛṇvantu vediṃ samaghnimindhatāṃ puraḥ | tatrāmṛtasya cetanaṃ yajñaṃ te tanavāvahai
translation: Vouchsafe us now that opulence, O Indra, as guerdon won by mightiest donation. May hymns that please thee cause the breast of Vayu to swell as with the mead's refreshing sweetness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 170
sanskrit: तवमीशिषे वसुपते वसूनां तवं मित्राणां मित्रपते धेष्ठः | इन्द्र तवं मरुद्भिः सं वदस्वाध पराशान रतुथा हवींषि
transliteration: tvamīśiṣe vasupate vasūnāṃ tvaṃ mitrāṇāṃ mitrapate dheṣṭhaḥ | indra tvaṃ marudbhiḥ saṃ vadasvādha prāśāna ṛtuthā havīṃṣi
translation: With thee, O Indra, are most bounteous riches that further every one who lives uprightly. Now may these Maruts show us loving-kindness, Gods who of old were ever prompt to help us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 171
sanskrit: परति व एना नमसाहमेमि सूक्तेन भिक्षे सुमतिं तुराणाम | रराणता मरुतो वेद्याभिर्नि हेळो धत्त वि मुचध्वमश्वान
transliteration: prati va enā namasāhamemi sūktena bhikṣe sumatiṃ turāṇām | rarāṇatā maruto vedyābhirni heḷo dhatta vi mucadhvamaśvān
translation: NAUGHT is to-day, to-morrow naught. Who comprehends the mystery? We must address ourselves unto another's thought, and lost is then the hope we formed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 171
sanskrit: एष व सतोमो मरुतो नमस्वान हर्दा तष्टो मनसा धायि देवाः | उपेमा यात मनसा जुषाणा यूयं हि षठा नमस इद वर्धासः
transliteration: eṣa va stomo maruto namasvān hṛdā taṣṭo manasā dhāyi devāḥ | upemā yāta manasā juṣāṇā yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā namasa id vṛdhāsaḥ
translation: The Maruts are thy brothers. Why, O Indra, wouldst thou take our lives? Agree with them in friendly wise, and do not slay us in the fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 171
sanskrit: सतुतासो नो मरुतो मर्ळयन्तूत सतुतो मघवा शमभविष्ठः | ऊर्ध्वा नः सन्तु कोम्या वनान्यहानि विश्वा मरुतो जिगीषा
transliteration: stutāso no maruto mṛḷayantūta stuto maghavā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ |
translation: Agastya, brother, why dost thou neglect us, thou who art our friend? We know the nature of thy mind. Verity thou wilt give us naught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 172
sanskrit: चित्रो वो.अस्तु यामश्चित्र ऊती सुदानवः | मरुतो अहिभानवः
transliteration: citro vo.astu yāmaścitra ūtī sudānavaḥ | maruto ahibhānavaḥ
translation: To you I come with this mine adoration, and with a hymn I crave the Strong Ones' favour A hymn that truly makes you joyful, Maruts. Suppress your anger and unyoke your horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 173
sanskrit: गायत साम नभन्यं यथा वेरर्चाम तद वाव्र्धानं सवर्वत | गावो धेनवो बर्हिष्यदब्धा आ यत सद्मानं दिव्यं विवासान
transliteration: ghāyat sāma nabhanyaṃ yathā verarcāma tad vāvṛdhānaṃ svarigvedaat | ghāvo dhenavo barhiṣyadabdhā ā yat sadmānaṃ divyaṃ vivāsān
translation: WONDERFUL let your coming be, wondrous with help, ye Bounteous Ones, Maruts, who gleam as serpents gleam.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 173
sanskrit: अर्चद वर्षा वर्षभिः सवेदुहव्यैर्म्र्गो नाश्नो अति यज्जुगुर्यात | पर मन्दयुर्मनां गूर्त होता भरते मर्यो मिथुना यजत्रः
transliteration: arcad vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sveduhavyairmṛgho nāśno ati yajjughuryāt | pra mandayurmanāṃ ghūrta hotā bharate maryo mithunā yajatraḥ
translation: Far be from us, O Maruts, ye free givers, your impetuous shaft; Far from us be the stone ye hurl.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 173
sanskrit: नक्षद धोता परि सद्म मिता यन भरद गर्भमा शरदः पर्थिव्याः | करन्ददश्वो नयमानो रुवद गौरन्तर्दूतो न रोदसी चरद वाक
transliteration: nakṣad dhotā pari sadma mitā yan bharad gharbhamā śaradaḥ pṛthivyāḥ | krandadaśvo nayamāno ruvad ghaurantardūto na rodasī carad vāk
translation: O Bounteous Givers, touch ye not, O Maruts, Trnskanda's folk; Lift ye us up that we may live.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 174
sanskrit: तवं राजेन्द्र ये च देवा रक्षा नॄन पाह्यसुर तवमस्मान | तवं सत्पतिर्मघवा नस्तरुत्रस्त्वं सत्यो वसवानः सहोदाः
transliteration: tvaṃ rājendra ye ca devā rakṣā nṝn pāhyasura tvamasmān | tvaṃ satpatirmaghavā nastarutrastvaṃ satyo vasavānaḥ sahodāḥ
translation: THE praise-song let him sing forth bursting bird-like: sing we that hymn which like heaven's light expandeth, That the milk-giving cows may, unimpeded call to the sacred grass the Gods' assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 174
sanskrit: दनो विश इन्द्र मर्ध्रवाचः सप्त यत पुरः शर्म शारदीर्दर्त | रणोरपो अनवद्यार्णा यूने वर्त्रं पुरुकुत्साय रन्धीः
transliteration: dano viśa indra mṛdhravācaḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīrdart |
translation: Let the Bull sing with Bulls whose toil is worship, with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers. Praised God! the glad priest brings his heart's devotion; the holy youth presents twofold oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 175
sanskrit: मत्स्यपायि ते महः पात्रस्येव हरिवो मत्सरो मदः | वर्षा ते वर्ष्ण इन्दुर्वाजी सहस्रसातमः
transliteration: matsyapāyi te mahaḥ pātrasyeva harivo matsaro madaḥ | vṛṣā te vṛṣṇa indurigvedaājī sahasrasātamaḥ
translation: THOU art the King of all the Gods, O Indra: protect the men, O Asura, preserve us. Thou Lord of Heroes, Maghavan, our saver, art faithful, very rich, the victory-giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 176
sanskrit: मत्सि नो वस्यैष्टय इन्द्रमिन्दो वर्षा विश | रघायमाणैन्वसि शत्रुमन्ति न विन्दसि
transliteration: matsi no vasyaiṣṭaya indramindo vṛṣā viśa |
translation: GLAD thee: thy glory hath been quaffed, Lord of Bay Steeds, as 'twere the bowl's enlivening mead. For thee the Strong there is strong drink, mighty, omnipotent to win.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 177
sanskrit: आ चर्षणिप्रा वर्षभो जनानां राजा कर्ष्टीनां पुरुहूत इन्द्रः | सतुतः शरवस्यन्नवसोप मद्रिग युक्त्वा हरीव्र्षणा याह्यर्वां
transliteration: stutaḥ śravasyannavasopa madrigh yuktvā harīvṛṣaṇā yāhyarigvedaāṃ
translation: CHEER thee with draughts to win us bliss: Soma, pierce Indra in thy strength. Thou stormest trembling in thy rage, and findest not a foeman nigh.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 177
sanskrit: ये ते वर्षणो वर्षभास इन्द्र बरह्मयुजो वर्षरथासो अत्याः | ताना तिष्ठ तेभिरा याह्यर्वां हवामहे तवा सुत इन्द्र सोमे
transliteration: ye te vṛṣaṇo vṛṣabhāsa indra brahmayujo vṛṣarathāso atyāḥ | tānā tiṣṭha tebhirā yāhyarigvedaāṃ havāmahe tvā suta indra some
translation: Make our songs penetrate to him who is the Only One of men; For whom the sacred food is spread, as the steer ploughs the barley in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 178
sanskrit: यद ध सया त इन्द्र शरुष्टिरस्ति यया बभूथ जरित्र्भ्य ऊती | मा नः कामं महयन्तमा धग विश्वा ते अश्याम्पर्याप आयोः
transliteration: yad dha syā ta indra śruṣṭirasti yayā babhūtha jaritṛbhya ūtī | mā naḥ kāmaṃ mahayantamā dhagh viśvā te aśyāmparyāpa āyoḥ
translation: THE Bull of men, who cherishes all people, King of the Races, Indra, called of many, Fame-loving, praised, hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous Bay Horses!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 178
sanskrit: न घा राजेन्द्र आ दभन नो या नु सवसारा कर्णवन्त योनौ | आपश्चिदस्मै सुतुका अवेषन गमन न इन्द्रः सख्या वयश्च
transliteration: na ghā rājendra ā dabhan no yā nu svasārā kṛṇavanta yonau |
translation: Thy mighty Stallions, yoked by prayer, O Indra, thy. Coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed,-- Ascend thou these, and borne by them come hither: with Soma juice out. poured, Indra, we call thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 179
sanskrit: परुवीरहं शरदः शश्रमणा दोषा वस्तोरुषसो जरयन्तीः | मिनाति शरियं जरिमा तनूनमप्यु नु पत्नीर्व्र्षणो जगम्युः
transliteration: pruvīrahaṃ śaradaḥ śaśramaṇā doṣā vastoruṣaso jarayantīḥ | mināti śriyaṃ jarimā tanūnamapyu nu patnīrigvedaṛṣaṇo jaghamyuḥ
translation: IF, Indra, thou hast given that gracious hearing where with thou helpest those who sang thy praises. Blast not the wish that would exalt us may I gain all from thee, and pay all man's devotions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 179
sanskrit: ये चिद धि पूर्व रतसाप आसन साकं देवेभिरवदन्न्र्तानि | ते चिदवसुर्नह्यन्तमापुः समू नु पत्नीर्व्र्षभिर्जगम्युः
transliteration: ye cid dhi pūrigvedaa ṛtasāpa āsan sākaṃ devebhiravadannṛtāni | te cidavasurnahyantamāpuḥ samū nu patnīrigvedaṛṣabhirjaghamyuḥ
translation: Let not the Sovran Indra disappoint us in what shall bring both Sisters to our dwelling. To him have run the quickly flowing waters. May Indra come to us with life and friendship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 179
sanskrit: न मर्षा शरान्तं यदवन्ति देवा विश्वा इत सप्र्धो अभ्यश्नवाव | जयावेदत्र शतनीथमजिं यत सम्यञ्चा मिथुनावभ्यजाव
transliteration: na mṛṣā śrāntaṃ yadavanti devā viśvā it spṛdho abhyaśnavāva | jayāvedatra śatanīthamajiṃ yat samyañcā mithunāvabhyajāva
translation: Victorious with the men, Hero in battles, Indra, who hears the singer's supplication, Will bring his car nigh to the man who offers, if he himself upholds the songs that praise him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 179
sanskrit: नदस्य मा रुधतः काम आगन्नित आजातो अमुतः कुतश्चित | लोपामुद्र वर्षणं नी रिणति धीरमधीर धयति शवसन्तम
transliteration: nadasya mā rudhataḥ kāma āghannita ājāto amutaḥ kutaścit | lopāmudra vṛṣaṇaṃ nī riṇati dhīramadhīra dhayati śvasantam
translation: Yea, Indra, with the men, through love of glory consumes the sacred food which friends have offered. The ever-strengthening song of him who worships is sung in fight amid the clash of voices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 179
sanskrit: इमं न सोममन्तितो हर्त्सु पीतमुप बरुवे | यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळतु पुलुकामो हि मर्त्यः
transliteration: imaṃ n somamantito hṛtsu pītamupa bruve | yat sīmāghaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷatu pulukāmo hi martyaḥ
translation: Aided by thee, O Maghavan, O Indra, may we subdue our foes who count them mighty. Be our protector, strengthen and increase us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 180
sanskrit: युवो रजांसि सुयमासो अश्वा रथो यद वां पर्यर्णांसिदियत | हिरण्यया वां पवयह परुषायन मध्वः पिबन्ता उषसः सचेथे
transliteration: yuvo rajāṃsi suyamāso aśvā ratho yad vāṃ paryarṇāṃsidiyat | hiraṇyayā vāṃ pavayah pruṣāyan madhvaḥ pibantā uṣasaḥ sacethe
translation: (The following Hymn was originally only found in the Appendix, with certain lines translated in Latin.--JBH.)

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 181
sanskrit: कदु परेष्टाविषां रयीणामध्वर्यन्ता यदुन्निनीथोपाम | अयं वां यज्ञो अक्र्त परशस्तिं वसुधिती अवितारा जनानाम
transliteration: kadu preṣṭāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmadhvaryantā yadunninīthoapām | ayaṃ vāṃ yajño akṛta praśastiṃ vasudhitī avitārā janānām
translation: LIGHTLY your coursers travel through the regions when round the sea of air your car is flying. Your golden fellies scatter drops of moisture: drinking the sweetness ye attend the Mornings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: अभूदिदं वयुनमो षु भूषता रथो वर्षण्वान मदता मनीषिणः | धियंजिन्वा धिष्ण्या विश्पलावसू दिवो नपात सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रता
transliteration: abhūdidaṃ vayunamo ṣu bhūṣatā ratho vṛṣaṇvān madatā manīṣiṇaḥ | dhiyaṃjinvā dhiṣṇyā viśpalāvasū divo napāta sukṛte śucivratā
translation: WHAT, dearest Pair, is this in strength and riches that ye as Priests are bring from the waters? This sacrifice is your glorification, ye who protect mankind and give them treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: इन्द्रतमा हि धिष्ण्या मरुत्तमा दस्रा दंसिष्ठा रथ्या रथीतमा | पूर्णं रथं वहेथे मध्व आचितं तेन दाश्वांसमुप याथो अश्विना
transliteration: indratamā hi dhiṣṇyā maruttamā dasrā daṃsiṣṭhā rathyā rathītamā | pūrṇaṃ rathaṃ vahethe madhva ācitaṃ tena dāśvāṃsamupa yātho aśvinā
translation: May your pure steeds, rain-drinkers, bring you hither, swift as the tempest, your celestial coursers, Rapid as thought, with fair backs, full of vigour, resplendent in their native light, O Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: किमत्र दस्रा कर्णुथः किमासाथे जनो यः कश्चिदहविर्महीयते | अति करमिष्टं जुरतं पणेरसुं जयोतिर्विप्राय कर्णुतं वचस्यवे
transliteration: kimatra dasrā kṛṇuthaḥ kimāsāthe jano yaḥ kaścidahavirmahīyate | ati kramiṣṭaṃ jurataṃ paṇerasuṃ jyotirigvedaprāya kṛṇutaṃ vacasyave
translation: Your car is like a torrent rushing downward: may it come nigh, broad-seated, for our welfare,-- Car holy, strong, that ever would be foremost, thought-swift, which ye, for whom we long, have mounted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: जम्भयतमभितो रायतः शुनो हतं मर्धो विदथुस्तान्यश्विना | वाचं-वाचं जरितू रत्निनीं कर्तमुभा शंसं नासत्यावतं मम
transliteration: jambhayatamabhito rāyataḥ śuno hataṃ mṛdho vidathustānyaśvinā | vācaṃ-vācaṃ jaritū ratninīṃ kṛtamubhā śaṃsaṃ nāsatyāvataṃ mama
translation: Here sprung to life, they both have sung together, with bodies free from stain, with signs that mark them; One of you Prince of Sacrifice, the Victor, the other counts as Heaven's auspicious offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: युवमेतं चक्रथुः सिन्धुषु पलवमात्मन्वन्तं पक्षिणन्तौग्र्याय कम | येन देवत्रा मनसा निरूहथुः सुपप्तनीपेतथुः कषोदसो महः
transliteration: yuvametaṃ cakrathuḥ sindhuṣu plavamātmanvantaṃ pakṣiṇantaughryāya kam | yena devatrā manasā nirūhathuḥ supaptanīpetathuḥ kṣodaso mahaḥ
translation: May your car-seat, down-gliding, golden-coloured, according to your wish approach our dwellings. Men shall feed full the bay steeds of the other, and, Asvins they with roars shall stir the regions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: अवविद्धं तौग्र्यमप्स्वन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि परविद्धम | चतस्रो नावो जठलस्य जुष्टा उदश्विभ्यामिषिताः पारयन्ति
transliteration: avaviddhaṃ taughryamapsvantaranārambhaṇe tamasi praviddham | catasro nāvo jaṭhalasya juṣṭā udaśvibhyāmiṣitāḥ pārayanti
translation: Forth comes your strong Bull like a cloud of autumn, sending abundant food of liquid sweetness. Let them feed with the other's ways and vigour: the upper streams have come and do us service.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: कः सविद वर्क्षो निष्ठितो मध्ये अर्णसो यं तौग्र्यो नाधितः पर्यषस्वजत | पर्णा मर्गस्य पतरोरिवारभ उदश्विना ऊहथुः शरोमताय कम
transliteration: kaḥ svid vṛkṣo niṣṭhito madhye arṇaso yaṃ taughryo nādhitaḥ paryaṣasvajat | parṇā mṛghasya patarorivārabha udaśvinā ūhathuḥ śromatāya kam
translation: Your constant song hath been sent forth, Disposers! that flows threefold in mighty strength, O Asvins. Thus lauded, give the suppliant protection moving or resting hear mine invocation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 182
sanskrit: तद वां नरा नासत्यावनु षयाद यद वां मानास उचथमवोचन | अस्मादद्य सदसः सोम्यादा] वि...
transliteration: tad vāṃ narā nāsatyāvanu ṣyād yad vāṃ mānāsa ucathamavocan | asmādadya sadasaḥ somyādā] vi...
translation: This song of bright contents for you is swelling in the men's hall where three-fold grass is ready. Your strong rain-cloud, ye Mighty Ones, hath swollen, honouring men as 'twere with milk's outpouring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 183
sanskrit: तं युञ्जाथां मनसो यो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षण यस्त्रिचक्रः | येनोपयाथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तरिधातुन पतथोविर्न पर्णैः
transliteration: taṃ yuñjāthāṃ manaso yo javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇa yastricakraḥ | yenopayāthaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tridhātuna patathovirna parṇaiḥ
translation: THIS was the task. Appear promptly, ye prudent Ones. Here is the chariot drawn by strong steeds: be ye glad. Heart-stirring, longed for, succourers of Vispala, here are Heaven's Sons whose sway blesses the pious man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 183
sanskrit: सुव्र्द रथो वर्तते यन्नभि कषां यत तिष्ठथः करतुमन्तानु पर्क्षे | वपुर्वपुष्या सचतामियं गीर्दिवो दुहित्रोषसा सचेथे
transliteration: suvṛd ratho vartate yannabhi kṣāṃ yat tiṣṭhathaḥ kratumantānu pṛkṣe | vapurigvedaapuṣyā sacatāmiyaṃ ghīrdivo duhitroṣasā sacethe
translation: Longed for, most Indra-like, mighty, most Marut-like, most wonderful in deed, car-borne, best charioteers, Bring your full chariot hither heaped with liquid sweet: thereon, ye Asvins, come to him who offers gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 184
sanskrit: ता वामद्य तावपरं हुवेमोछन्त्यामुषसि वह्निरुक्थैः | नासत्या कुह चित सन्तावर्यो दिवो नपाता सुदास्तराय
transliteration: tā vāmadya tāvaparaṃ huvemochantyāmuṣasi vahnirukthaiḥ | nāsatyā kuha cit santāvaryo divo napātā sudāstarāya
translation: MAKE ready that which passes thought in swiftness, that hath three wheels and triple seat, ye Mighty, Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious, whereon, threefold, ye fly like birds with pinions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 184
sanskrit: अस्मे ऊ षु वर्षणा मादयेथामुत पणीन्र्हतमूर्म्या मदन्ता | शरुतं मे अछोक्तिभिर्मतीनामेष्टा नरा निचेतारच कर्णैः
transliteration: asme ū ṣu vṛṣaṇā mādayethāmut paṇīnrhatamūrmyā madantā |
translation: Light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward, what time, for food, ye, full of wisdom, mount it. May this song, wondrous fair, attend your glory: ye, as ye travel, wait on Dawn Heaven's Daughter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: कतरा पूर्वा कतरापरायोः कथा जाते कवयः को वि वेद | विश्वं तमना बिभ्र्तो यद ध नाम वि वर्तेते अहनी चक्रियेव
transliteration: katarā pūrigvedaā katarāparāyoḥ kathā jāte kavayaḥ ko vi veda | viśvaṃ tmanā bibhṛto yad dha nāma vi vartete ahanī cakriyeva
translation: LET us invoke you both this day and after the priest is here with lauds when morn is breaking: Nasatyas, wheresoe'er ye be, Heaven's Children, for him who is more liberal than the godless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: भूरिं दवे अचरन्ती चरन्तं पद्वन्तं गर्भमपदी दधाते | नित्यं न सूनुं पित्रोरुपस्थे दयावा रक्षतं पर्थिवी नो अभ्वात
transliteration: bhūriṃ dve acarantī carantaṃ padvantaṃ gharbhamapadī dadhāte | nityaṃ na sūnuṃ pitrorupasthe dyāvā rakṣataṃ pṛthivī no abhvāt
translation: With us, ye Mighty, let yourselves be joyful, glad in our stream of Soma slay the niggards. Graciously hear my hymns and invitations, marking, O Heroes, with your cars my longing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: अनेहो दात्रमदितेरनर्वं हुवे सवर्वदवधं नमस्वत | तद रोदसी जनयतं जरित्रे दयावा ...
transliteration: aneho dātramaditeranarigvedaaṃ huve svarigvedaadavadhaṃ namasvat | tad rodasī janayataṃ jaritre dyāvā ...
translation: Nasatyas, Pusans, ye as Gods for glory arranged and set in order Surya's bridal. Your giant steeds move on, sprung from the waters, like ancient times of Varuna the Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: अतप्यमाने अवसावन्ती अनु षयाम रोदसी देवपुत्रे | उभे देवानामुभयेभिरह्नां दयावा ...
transliteration: atapyamāne avasāvantī anu ṣyāma rodasī devaputre | ubhe devānāmubhayebhirahnāṃ dyāvā ...
translation: Your grace be with us, ye who love sweet juices: further the hymn sung by the poet Mana, When men are joyful in your glorious actions, to win heroic strength, ye Bounteous Givers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: संगछमाने युवती समन्ते सवसारा जामी पित्रोरुपस्थे | अभिजिघ्रन्ती भुवनस्य नाभिं दयावा ...
transliteration: saṃghachamāne yuvatī samante svasārā jāmī pitrorupasthe | abhijighrantī bhuvanasya nābhiṃ dyāvā ...
translation: This praise was made, O liberal Lords, O Asvins, for you with fair adornment by the Manas. Come to our house for us and for our children, rejoicing, O Nasatyas, in Agastya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 185
sanskrit: उर्वी सद्मनी बर्हती रतेन हुवे देवानामवसा जनित्री | दधाते ये अम्र्तं सुप्रतीके दयावा ...
transliteration: urigvedaī sadmanī bṛhatī ṛtena huve devānāmavasā janitrī | dadhāte ye amṛtaṃ supratīke dyāvā ...
translation: We have passed o'er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been bestowed on you, O Asvins. Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 186
sanskrit: आ न इळभिर्विदथे सुशस्ति विश्वानरः सविता देव एतु | अपि यथा युवानो मत्सथा नो विश्वं जगदभिपित्वे मनीषा
transliteration: api yathā yuvāno matsathā no viśvaṃ jaghadabhipitve manīṣā
translation: WHETHER of these is elder, whether later? How were they born? Who knoweth it, ye sages? These of themselves support all things existing: as on a car the Day and Night roll onward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: पितुं नु सतोषं महो धर्माणं तविषीम | यस्य तरितो वयोजसा वर्त्रं विपर्वमर्दयत
transliteration: pituṃ nu stoṣaṃ maho dharmāṇaṃ taviṣīm | yasya trito vyojasā vṛtraṃ viparigvedaamardayat
translation: LOVED of all men, may Savitar, through praises offered as sacred food, come to our synod, That you too, through-our hymn, ye ever-youthful, may gladden, at your visit, all our people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: सवादो पितो मधो पितो वयं तवा वव्र्महे | अस्माकमविता भव
transliteration: svādo pito madho pito vayaṃ tvā vavṛmahe | asmākamavitā bhava
translation: To us may all the Gods come trooped together, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna concordant, That all may be promoters of our welfare, and with great might preserve our strength from slackness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: उप नः पितवा चर शिवः शिवाभिरूतिभिः | मयोभुरद्विषेण्यः सखा सुशेवो अद्वयाः
transliteration: upa naḥ pitavā cara śivaḥ śivābhirūtibhiḥ | mayobhuradviṣeṇyaḥ sakhā suśevo advayāḥ
translation: Agni I sing, the guest you love most dearly: the Conqueror through our lauds is friendly-minded. That he may be our Varuna rich in glory and send food like a prince praised by the godly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: तव तये पितो रस रजांस्यनु विष्ठिताः | दिवि वाता इव शरिताः
transliteration: tava tye pito rasa rajāṃsyanu viṣṭhitāḥ | divi vātā iva śritāḥ
translation: To you I seek with reverence, Night and Morning, like a cow good to milk, with hope to conquer, Preparing on a common day the praise. song with milk of various hues within this udder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: तव तये पितो ददतस्तव सवादिष्ठ ते पितो | पर सवाद्मानो रसानां तुविग्रीवा इवेरते
transliteration: tava tye pito dadatastava svādiṣṭha te pito | pra svādmāno rasānāṃ tuvighrīvā iverate
translation: May the great Dragon of the Deep rejoice us: as one who nourishes her young comes Sindhu, With whom we will incite the Child of Waters whom vigorous course swift as thought bring hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: तवे पितो महानां देवानां मनो हिताम | अकारि चारु केतुना तवाहिमवसावधीत
transliteration: tve pito mahānāṃ devānāṃ mano hitām | akāri cāru ketunā tavāhimavasāvadhīt
translation: Moreover Tvastar also shall approach us, one-minded with the princes at his visit. Hither shall come the Vrtra-slayer Indra, Ruler of men, as strongest of the Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: यददो पितो अजगन विवस्व पर्वतानाम | अत्रा चिन नो मधो पितो.अरं भक्षाय गम्याः
transliteration: yadado pito ajaghan vivasva parigvedaatānām | atrā cin no madho pito.araṃ bhakṣāya ghamyāḥ
translation: Him too our hymns delight, that yoke swift horses, like mother cows who lick their tender youngling. To him our songs shall yield themselves like spouses, to him the most delightful of the Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: यदपामोषधीनां परिंशमारिशामहे | वातपे पीवैद भव
transliteration: yadapāmoṣadhīnāṃ pariṃśamāriśāmahe | vātape pīvaid bhava
translation: So may the Maruts, armed with mighty weapons, rest here on heaven and earth with hearts in concord, As Gods whose cars have dappled steeds like torrents, destroyers of the foe allies of Mitra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: यत ते सोम गवाशिरो यवाशिरो भजामहे | वातापे ...
transliteration: yat te soma ghavāśiro yavāśiro bhajāmahe | vātāpe ...
translation: They hasten on to happy termination their orders when they are made known by glory. As on a fair bright day the arrow flieth o'er all the barren soil their missiles sparkle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: करम्भ ओषधे भव पीवो वर्क्क उदारथिः | वातापे ...
transliteration: karambha oṣadhe bhava pīvo vṛkka udārathiḥ | vātāpe ...
translation: Incline the Asvins to show grace, and Pusan, for power and might have they, their own possession. Friendly are Visnu, Vata, and Rbhuksan so may I bring the Gods to make us happy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 187
sanskrit: तं तवा वयं पितो वचोभिर्गावो न हव्या सुषूदिम | देवेभ्यस्त्वा सधमादमस्मभ्यं तवा सधमादम
transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ pito vacobhirghāvo na havyā suṣūdima | devebhyastvā sadhamādamasmabhyaṃ tvā sadhamādam
translation: This is my reverent thought of you, ye Holy; may it inspire you, make you dwell among us,-- Thought, toiling for the Gods and seeking treasure. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 188
sanskrit: समिद्धो अद्य राजसि देवो देवैः सहस्रजित | दूतो हव्या कविर्वह
transliteration: samiddho adya rājasi devo devaiḥ sahasrajit | dūto havyā kavirigvedaaha
translation: Now will I glorify Food that upholds great strength, By whose invigorating power Trita rent Vrtra limb from limb.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 188
sanskrit: तनुनपाद रतं यते मध्वा यज्ञः समज्यते | दधत सहस्रिणीरिषः
transliteration: tanunapād ṛtaṃ yate madhvā yajñaḥ samajyate | dadhat sahasriṇīriṣaḥ
translation: O pleasant Food, O Food of meath, thee have we chosen for our own, So be our kind protector thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान विश्वानि देव वयुनानि विद्वान | युयोध्यस्मज्जुहुराणमेनो भूयिष्ठां ते नमौक्तिंविधेम
transliteration: aghne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān | yuyodhyasmajjuhurāṇameno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namauktiṃvidhema
translation: WINNER of thousands, kindled, thou shinest a God with Gods to-day. Bear out oblations, envoy, Sage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: अग्ने तवं पारया नव्यो अस्मान सवस्तिभिरति दुर्गाणि विश्वा | पुश्च पर्थ्वी बहुला न उर्वि भवा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
transliteration: aghne tvaṃ pārayā navyo asmān svastibhirati durghāṇi viśvā | puśca pṛthvī bahulā na urigveda bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
translation: Child of Thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath, Presenting viands thousandfold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: अग्ने तवमस्मद युयोध्यमीवा अनग्नित्रा अभ्यमन्त कर्ष्टीः | पुनरस्मभ्यं सुविताय देव कषां विश्वेभिरम्र्तेभिर्यजत्र
transliteration: aghne tvamasmad yuyodhyamīvā anaghnitrā abhyamanta kṛṣṭīḥ | punarasmabhyaṃ suvitāya deva kṣāṃ viśvebhiramṛtebhiryajatra
