translation: Invoked and worthy of our praise bring Gods whose due is sacrifice: Thou, Agni, givest countless gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: पाहि नो अग्ने पायुभिरजस्रैरुत परिये सदन आ शुशुक्वान | मा ते भयं जरितारं यविष्ठ नूनं विदन मापरं सहस्वः
transliteration: pāhi no aghne pāyubhirajasrairuta priye sadana ā śuśukvān | mā te bhayaṃ jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha nūnaṃ vidan māparaṃ sahasvaḥ
translation: To seat a thousand Heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might, Whereon, Adityas, ye shine forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: मा नो अग्ने.अव सर्जो अघायाविष्यवे रिपवे दुछुनायै | मादत्वते दशते मादते नो मा रीषते सहसावन परा दाः
transliteration: mā no aghne.ava sṛjo aghāyāviṣyave ripave duchunāyai | mādatvate daśate mādate no mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ
translation: The sovran all-imperial Doors, wide, good, many and manifold, Have poured their streams of holy oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: वि घ तवावान रतजात यंसद गर्णानो अग्ने तन्वे वरूथम | विश्वाद रिरिक्षोरुत वा निनित्सोरभिह्रुतामसि हि देव विष्पट
transliteration: vi gha tvāvān ṛtajāta yaṃsad ghṛṇāno aghne tanve varūtham | viśvād ririkṣoruta vā ninitsorabhihrutāmasi hi deva viṣpaṭ
translation: With gay adornment, fair to see, in glorious beauty shine they forth: Let Night and Morning rest them here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: तवं तानग्न उभयानिव विद्वान वेषि परपित्वे मनुषो यजत्र | अभिपित्वे मनवे शास्यो भूर्मर्म्र्जेन्य उशिग्भिर्नाक्रः
transliteration: tvaṃ tānaghna ubhayāniv vidvān veṣi prapitve manuṣo yajatra | abhipitve manave śāsyo bhūrmarmṛjenya uśighbhirnākraḥ
translation: Let these two Sages first of all, heralds divine and eloquent, Perform for us this sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 189
sanskrit: अवोचाम निवचनान्यस्मिन मानस्य सूनुः सहसाने अग्नौ | वयं सहस्रं रषिभिः सनेम वि...
transliteration: avocāma nivacanānyasmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne aghnau | vayaṃ sahasraṃ ṛṣibhiḥ sanema vi...
translation: You I address, Sarasvati, and Bharati, and Ila, all: Urge ye us on to glorious fame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: अनर्वाणं वर्षभं मन्द्रजिह्वं बर्हस्पतिं वर्धया नव्यमर्कैः | गाथान्यः सुरुचो यस्य देवा आश्र्ण्वन्ति नवमानस्य मर्ताः
transliteration: anarigvedaāṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ mandrajihvaṃ bṛhaspatiṃ vardhayā navyamarkaiḥ | ghāthānyaḥ suruco yasya devā āśṛṇvanti navamānasya martāḥ
translation: BY goodly paths lead us to riches, Agni, God who knowest every sacred duty. Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander. most ample adoration will we bring thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: तं रत्विया उप वाचः सचन्ते सर्गो न यो देवयतामसर्जि | बर्हस्पतिः स हयञ्जो वरांसि विभ्वाभवत सं रते मातरिश्वा
transliteration: taṃ ṛtviyā upa vācaḥ sacante sargho na yo devayatāmasarji | bṛhaspatiḥ sa hyañjo varāṃsi vibhvābhavat saṃ ṛte mātariśvā
translation: Lead us anew to happiness, O Agni; lead us beyond all danger and affliction. Be unto us a wide broad ample castle bless, prosper on their way our sons and offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: उपस्तुतिं नमस उद्यतिं च शलोकं यंसत सवितेव पर बाहू | अस्य करत्वाहन्यो यो अस्ति मर्गो न भीमो अरक्षसस्तुविष्मान
transliteration: upastutiṃ namasa udyatiṃ ca ślokaṃ yaṃsat saviteva pra bāhū | asya kratvāhanyo yo asti mṛgho na bhīmo arakṣasastuviṣmān
translation: Far from us, Agni, put thou all diseases let them strike lauds that have no saving Agni. God, make our home again to be a blessing, with all the Immortal Deities, O Holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: अस्य शलोको दिवीयते पर्थिव्यामत्यो न यंसद यक्षभ्र्द विचेताः | मर्गाणां न हेतयो यन्ति चेमा बर्हस्पतेरहिमायानभि दयून
transliteration: asya śloko divīyate pṛthivyāmatyo na yaṃsad yakṣabhṛd vicetāḥ | mṛghāṇāṃ na hetayo yanti cemā bṛhaspaterahimāyānabhi dyūn
translation: Preserve us, Agni, with perpetual succour, refulgent in the dwelling which thou lovest. O Conqueror, most youthful, let no danger touch him who praises thee to-day or after.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: ये तवा देवोस्रिकं मन्यमानाः पापा भद्रमुपजीवन्ति पज्राः | न दूढ्ये अनु ददासि वामं बर्हस्पते चयस इत पियारुम
transliteration: ye tvā devosrikaṃ manyamānāḥ pāpā bhadramupajīvanti pajrāḥ | na dūḍhye anu dadāsi vāmaṃ bṛhaspate cayasa it piyārum
translation: Give not us up a prey to sin, O Agni, the greedy enemy that brings us trouble; Not to the fanged that bites, not to the toothless: give not us up, thou Conqueror, to the spoiler.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: सुप्रैतुः सूयवसो न पन्था दुर्नियन्तुः परिप्रीतो न मित्रः | अनर्वाणो अभि ये चक्षते नो.अपीव्र्ता अपोर्णुवन्तो अस्थुः
transliteration: supraituḥ sūyavaso na panthā durniyantuḥ pariprīto na mitraḥ | anarigvedaāṇo abhi ye cakṣate no.apīvṛtā aporṇuvanto asthuḥ
translation: Such as thou art, born after Law, O Agni when lauded give protection to our bodies, From whosoever would reproach or injure: for thou, God, rescuest from all oppression.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: सं यं सतुभो.अवनयो न यन्ति समुद्रं न सरवतो रोधचक्राः | स विद्वानुभयं चष्टे अन्तर्ब्र्हस्पतिस्तर आपश्च गर्ध्रः
transliteration: saṃ yaṃ stubho.avanayo na yanti samudraṃ na sravato rodhacakrāḥ | sa vidvānubhayaṃ caṣṭe antarbṛhaspatistara āpaśca ghṛdhraḥ
translation: Thou, well discerning both these classes, comest to men at early morn, O holy Agni. Be thou obedient unto man at evening, to be adorned, as keen, by eager suitors.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 190
sanskrit: एवा महस्तुविजातस्तुविष्मान बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभो धायि देवः | स न सतुतो वीरवद धातु गोमद वि...
transliteration: evā mahastuvijātastuviṣmān bṛhaspatirigvedaṛṣabho dhāyi devaḥ | sa na stuto vīravad dhātu ghomad vi...
translation: To him have we addressed our pious speeches, I, Mana's son, to him victorious Agni. May we gain countless riches with the sages. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 191
sanskrit: कङकतो न कङकतो.अथो सतीनकङकतः | दवाविति पलुषी इति नयद्र्ष्ट अलिप्सत
transliteration: kaṅkato na kaṅkato.atho satīnakaṅkataḥ | dvāviti pluṣī iti nyadṛṣṭa alipsata
translation: GLORIFY thou Brhaspati, the scatheless, who must be praised with hymns, sweet-tongued and mighty, To whom as leader of the song, resplendent, worthy of lauds, both Gods and mortals listen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 1 Hymn 191
sanskrit: अद्र्ष्टान हन्त्यायत्यथो हन्ति परायती | अथो अवघ्नती हन्त्यथो पिनष्टि पिंषती
transliteration: adṛṣṭān hantyāyatyatho hanti parāyatī | atho avaghnatī hantyatho pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī
translation: On him wait songs according to the season even as a stream of pious men set moving. Brhaspati--for he laid out the expanses--was, at the sacrifice, vast Matarisvan.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने दयुभिस्त्वमाशुशुक्षणिस्त्वमद्भ्यस्त्वमश्मनस परि | तवं वनेभ्यस्त्वमोषधीभ्यस्त्वं नर्णां नर्पते जायसे शुचिः
transliteration: tvamaghne dyubhistvamāśuśukṣaṇistvamadbhyastvamaśmanas pari | tvaṃ vanebhyastvamoṣadhībhyastvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
translation: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generatad [sic] pure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः | तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्मा चासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे
transliteration: tavāghne hotraṃ tava potraṃ ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamaghnid ṛtāyataḥ | tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi ghṛhapatiśca no dame
translation: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्न इन्द्रो वर्षभः सतामसि तवं विष्णुरुरुगायो नमस्यः | तवं बरह्मा रयिविद बरह्मणस पते तवं विधर्तःसचसे पुरन्ध्या
transliteration: tvamaghna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satāmasi tvaṃ viṣṇururughāyo namasyaḥ | tvaṃ brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṃ vidhartaḥsacase purandhyā
translation: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Visnu of the Mighty Stride, adorable: Thou, Brahmanaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने राजा वरुणो धर्तव्रतस्त्वं मित्रो भवसि दस्म ईड्यः | तवमर्यमा सत्पतिर्यस्य सम्भुजं तवमंशो विदथे देव भाजयुः
transliteration: tvamaghne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratastvaṃ mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ | tvamaryamā satpatiryasya sambhujaṃ tvamaṃśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
translation: Agni, thou art King Varuna whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored. Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enrich ing all, and liberal Amsa in the synod, O thou God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने तवष्टा विधते सुवीर्यं तव गनावो मित्रमहः सजात्यम | तवमाशुहेमा ररिषे सवश्व्यं तवं नरां शर्धो असि पुरूवसुः
transliteration: tvamaghne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṃ tava ghnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam | tvamāśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṃ tvaṃ narāṃ śardho asi purūvasuḥ
translation: Thou givest strength, as Tvastar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames. Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने रुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पर्क्ष ईशिषे | तवं वातैररुणैर्यासि शंगयस्त्वं पूषा विधतः पासि नु तमना
transliteration: tvamaghne rudro asuro maho divastvaṃ śardho mārutaṃ pṛkṣa īśiṣe | tvaṃ vātairaruṇairyāsi śaṃghayastvaṃ pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā
translation: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts' host, thou art the Lord of food, Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pusan thou thyself protectest worshippers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने दरविणोदा अरंक्र्ते तवं देवः सविता रत्नधासि | तवं भगो नर्पते वस्व ईशिषे तवं पायुर्दमे यस्तेऽविधत
transliteration: tvamaghne draviṇodā araṃkṛte tvaṃ devaḥ savitā ratnadhāasi | tvaṃ bhagho nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvaṃ pāyurdame yaste'vidhat
translation: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things. As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने दम आ विश्पतिं विशस्त्वां राजानं सुविदत्रं रञ्जते | तवं विश्वानि सवनीक पत्यसे तवं सहस्राणि शता दश परति
transliteration: tvamaghne dama ā viśpatiṃ viśastvāṃ rājānaṃ suvidatraṃ ṛñjate | tvaṃ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṃ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
translation: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined. Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवामग्ने पितरमिष्टिभिर्नरस्त्वां भरात्राय शम्या तनूरुचम | तवं पुत्रो भवसि यस्ते.अविधत तवं सखा सुशेवः पास्याध्र्षः
transliteration: tvāmaghne pitaramiṣṭibhirnarastvāṃ bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam | tvaṃ putro bhavasi yaste.avidhat tvaṃ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsyādhṛṣaḥ
translation: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act. Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्न रभुराके नमस्यस्त्वं वाजस्य कषुमतो राय ईशिषे | तवं वि भास्यनु दक्षि दावने तवं विशिक्षुरसियज्ञमातनिः
transliteration: tvamaghna ṛbhurāke namasyastvaṃ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe | tvaṃ vi bhāsyanu dakṣi dāvane tvaṃ viśikṣurasiyajñamātaniḥ
translation: A Rbhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth. Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने अदितिर्देव दाशुषे तवं होत्रा भारती वर्धसेगिरा | तवमिळा षतहिमासि दक्षसे तवं वर्त्रहा वसुपते सरस्वती
transliteration: tvamaghne aditirdeva dāśuṣe tvaṃ hotrā bhāratī vardhaseghirā | tvamiḷā ṣatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṃ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī
translation: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotri, Bharati, art strengthened by the song. Thou art the hundred-wintered Ila to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vrtra-slayer and Sarasvati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवमग्ने सुभ्र्त उत्तमं वयस्तव सपार्हे वर्ण आ सन्द्र्शि शरियः | तवं वाजः परतरणो बर्हन्नसि तवं रयिर्बहुलो विश्वतस पर्थुः
transliteration: tvamaghne subhṛta uttamaṃ vayastava spārhe varṇa ā sandṛśi śriyaḥ | tvaṃ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhannasi tvaṃ rayirbahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ
translation: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible. Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवामग्न आदित्यास आस्यं तवां जिह्वां शुचयश्चक्रिरेकवे | तवां रातिषाचो अध्वरेषु सश्चिरे तवे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम
transliteration: tvāmaghna ādityāsa āsyaṃ tvāṃ jihvāṃ śucayaścakrirekave | tvāṃ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā haviradantyāhutam
translation: Thee, Agni, have the Adityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue. They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवे अग्ने विश्वे अन्र्तासो अद्रुह आसा देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम | तवया मर्तासः सवदन्त आसुतिं तवं गर्भो वीरुधां जज्ञिषे शुचिः
transliteration: tve aghne viśve anṛtāso adruha āsā devā haviradantyāhutam | tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṃ tvaṃ gharbho vīrudhāṃ jajñiṣe śuciḥ
translation: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods eat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them. By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवं तान सं च परति चासि मज्मनाग्ने सुजात पर च देवरिच्यसे | पर्क्षो यदत्र महिना वि ते भुवदनु दयावाप्र्थिवी रोदसी उभे
transliteration: tvaṃ tān saṃ ca prati cāsi majmanāghne sujāta pra ca devaricyase | pṛkṣo yadatra mahinā vi te bhuvadanu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe
translation: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty, Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 1
sanskrit: ये सतोत्र्भ्यो गोग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपस्र्जन्ति सूरयः | अस्माञ्च तांश्च पर हि नेषि वस्य आ बर्हद वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
transliteration: ye stotṛbhyo ghoaghrāmaśvapeśasamaghne rātimupasṛjanti sūrayaḥ | asmāñca tāṃśca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
translation: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,- Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: यज्ञेन वर्धत जातवेदसमग्निं यजध्वं हविषा तना गिरा | समिधानं सुप्रयसं सवर्णरं दयुक्षं होतारंव्र्जनेषु धूर्षदम
transliteration: yajñena vardhata jātavedasamaghniṃ yajadhvaṃ haviṣā tanā ghirā | samidhānaṃ suprayasaṃ svarṇaraṃ dyukṣaṃ hotāraṃvṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam
translation: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him 'with oblation and the song of praise, Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: अभि तवा नक्तीरुषसो ववाशिरे.अग्ने वत्सं न सवसरेषुधेनवः | दिव इवेदरतिर्मानुषा युगा कषपो भासि पुरुवार संयतः
transliteration: abhi tvā naktīruṣaso vavāśire.aghne vatsaṃ na svasareṣudhenavaḥ | diva ivedaratirmānuṣā yughā kṣapo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyataḥ
translation: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young. As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तं देवा बुध्ने रजसः सुदंससं दिवस्प्र्थिव्योररतिंन्येरिरे | रथमिव वेद्यं शुक्रशोचिषमग्निं मित्रं नक्षितिषु परशंस्यम
transliteration: taṃ devā budhne rajasaḥ sudaṃsasaṃ divaspṛthivyoraratiṃnyerire | rathamiva vedyaṃ śukraśociṣamaghniṃ mitraṃ nakṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam
translation: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth; Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra. to be glorified among the folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तमुक्षमाणं रजसि सव आ दमे चन्द्रमिव सुरुचं हवार आ दधुः | पर्श्न्याः पतरं चितयन्तमक्षभिः पाथो न पायुं जनसी उभे अनु
transliteration: tamukṣamāṇaṃ rajasi sva ā dame candramiva surucaṃ hvāra ā dadhuḥ | pṛśnyāḥ pataraṃ citayantamakṣabhiḥ pātho na pāyuṃ janasī ubhe anu
translation: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air. Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as 'twere, looking to Gods and men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: स होता विश्वं परि भूत्वध्वरं तमु हव्यैर्मनुष रञ्जते गिरा | हिरिशिप्रो वर्धसानासु जर्भुरद दयौर्न सत्र्भिश्चितयद रोदसी अनु
transliteration: sa hotā viśvaṃ pari bhūtvadhvaraṃ tamu havyairmanuṣa ṛñjate ghirā | hiriśipro vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurad dyaurna stṛbhiścitayad rodasī anu
translation: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise. Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 2
sanskrit: स नो रेवत समिधानः सवस्तये सन्ददस्वान रयिमस्मासु दीदिहि | आ नः कर्णुष्व सुविताय रोदसी अग्ने हव्या मनुषोदेव वीतये
transliteration: sa no revat samidhānaḥ svastaye sandadasvān rayimasmāsu dīdihi |
translation: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine, For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 3
sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्निर्निहितः पर्थिव्यां परत्यं विश्वानि भुवनान्यस्थात | होता पावकः परदिवः सुमेधा देवो देवान यजत्वग्निरर्हन
transliteration: samiddho aghnirnihitaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pratyaṃ viśvāni bhuvanānyasthāt | hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatvaghnirarhan
translation: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings. Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 3
sanskrit: नराशंसः परति धामान्यञ्जन तिस्रो दिवः परति मह्ना सवर्चिः | घर्तप्रुषा मनसा हव्यमुन्दन मूर्धन यज्ञस्य समनक्तु देवान
transliteration: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmānyañjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ | ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyamundan mūrdhan yajñasya samanaktu devān
translation: May Narasamsa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven, Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 4
sanskrit: हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुव्र्क्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसम | मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः
transliteration: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṃ suvṛktiṃ viśāmaghnimatithiṃ suprayasam | mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ
translation: FOR you I call the glorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 4
sanskrit: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे दवितादधुर्भ्र्गवो विक्ष्वायोः | एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः
transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe dvitādadhurbhṛghavo vikṣvāyoḥ | eṣa viśvānyabhyastu bhūmā devānāmaghniraratirjīrāśvaḥ
translation: Bhrgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living. Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 4
sanskrit: अग्निं देवासो मानुषीषु विक्षु परियं धुः कषेष्यन्तो नमित्रम | स दीदयदुशतीरूर्म्या आ दक्षाय्यो यो दास्वते दम आ
transliteration: aghniṃ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto namitram | sa dīdayaduśatīrūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā
translation: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them. Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 4
sanskrit: अस्य रण्वा सवस्येव पुष्टिः सन्द्र्ष्टिरस्य हियानस्य दक्षोः | वि यो भरिभ्रदोषधीषु जिह्वामत्यो न रथ्यो दोधवीति वारान
transliteration: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ sandṛṣṭirasya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ | vi yo bharibhradoṣadhīṣu jihvāmatyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān
translation: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely. He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 5
sanskrit: होताजनिष्ट चेतनः पिता पित्र्भ्य ऊतये | परयक्षञ जेन्यं वसु शकेम वाजिनो यमम
transliteration: hotājaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhya ūtaye | prayakṣañ jenyaṃ vasu śakema vājino yamam
translation: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons' help, Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 6
sanskrit: इमां मे अग्ने समिधमिमामुपसदं वनेः | इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः
transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhamimāmupasadaṃ vaneḥ | imā u ṣu śrudhī ghiraḥ
translation: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee: Hear graciously these songs of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अया ते अग्ने विधेमोर्जो नपादश्वमिष्टे | एना सूक्तेन सुजात
transliteration: ayā te aghne vidhemorjo napādaśvamiṣṭe | enā sūktena sujāta
translation: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength, With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 6
sanskrit: तं तवा गीर्भिर्गिर्वणसं दरविणस्युं दरविणोदः | सपर्येम सपर्यवः
transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirghirigvedaaṇasaṃ draviṇasyuṃ draviṇodaḥ | saparyema saparyavaḥ
translation: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth! With reverence let us worship thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 6
sanskrit: स बोधि सूरिर्मघवा वसुपते वसुदावन | युयोध्यस्मद दवेषांसि
transliteration: sa bodhi sūrirmaghavā vasupate vasudāvan | yuyodhyasmad dveṣāṃsi
translation: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things. Drive those who hate us far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 6
sanskrit: स नो वर्ष्तिं दिवस परि स नो वाजमनर्वाणम | स नः सहस्रिणीरिषः
transliteration: sa no vṛṣtiṃ divas pari sa no vājamanarigvedaāṇam | sa naḥ sahasriṇīriṣaḥ
translation: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist: Give food exceeding plentiful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 7
sanskrit: शरेष्ठं यविष्ठ भारताग्ने दयुमन्तमा भर | वसो पुरुस्प्र्हं रयिम
transliteration: vaso puruspṛhaṃ rayim
translation: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bharata, Agni, bring us wealth, Excellent, splendid, much-desired.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 7
sanskrit: मा नो अरातिरीशत देवस्य मर्त्यस्य च | पर्षि तस्या उतद्विषः
transliteration: mā no arātirīśata devasya martyasya ca | parṣi tasyā utadviṣaḥ
translation: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's. Save us from this and enmity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 7
sanskrit: विश्वा उत तवया वयं धारा उदन्या इव | अति गाहेमहि दविषः
transliteration: viśvā uta tvayā vayaṃ dhārā udanyā iva | ati ghāhemahi dviṣaḥ
translation: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way, As 'twere through streaming water-floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 8
sanskrit: वाजयन्निव नू रथान योगानग्नेरुप सतुहि | यशस्तमस्य मीळ्हुषः
transliteration: vājayanniva nū rathān yoghānaghnerupa stuhi | yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
translation: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car, The liberal, the most splendid One;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 8
sanskrit: यः सुनीथो ददाशुषे.अजुर्यो जरयन्नरिम | चारुप्रतीकाहुतः
transliteration: yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe.ajuryo jarayannarim | cārupratīkaāhutaḥ
translation: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe: When worshipped fair to look upon;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 8
sanskrit: य उ शरिया दमेष्वा दोषोषसि परशस्यते | यस्य वरतं न मीयते
transliteration: ya u śriyā dameṣvā doṣoṣasi praśasyate | yasya vrataṃ na mīyate
translation: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes, Whose statute is inviolate;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: नि होता होत्र्षदने विदानस्त्वेषो दीदिवानसदत सुदक्षः | अदब्धव्रतप्रमतिर्वसिष्ठः सहस्रम्भरः शुचिजिह्वो अग्निः
transliteration: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānastveṣo dīdivānasadat sudakṣaḥ | adabdhavratapramatirigvedaasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo aghniḥ
translation: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty, Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: तवं दूतस्त्वमु नः परस्पास्त्वं वस्य आ वर्षभ परणेता | अग्ने तोकस्य नस्तने तनूनामप्रयुछन दीद्यद बोधि गोपाः
transliteration: tvaṃ dūtastvamu naḥ paraspāstvaṃ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā | aghne tokasya nastane tanūnāmaprayuchan dīdyad bodhi ghopāḥ
translation: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings. Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: विधेम ते परमे जन्मन्नग्ने विधेम सतोमैरवरे सधस्थे | यस्माद योनेरुदारिथा यजे तं पर तवे हवींषि जुहुरेसमिद्धे
transliteration: vidhema te parame janmannaghne vidhema stomairavare sadhasthe | yasmād yonerudārithā yaje taṃ pra tve havīṃṣi juhuresamiddhe
translation: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station. The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अग्ने यजस्व हविषा यजीयाञ्छ्रुष्टी देष्णमभि गर्णीहि राधः | तवं हयसि रयिपती रयीणां तवं शुक्रस्य वचसो मनोता
transliteration: aghne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñchruṣṭī deṣṇamabhi ghṛṇīhi rādhaḥ | tvaṃ hyasi rayipatī rayīṇāṃ tvaṃ śukrasya vacaso manotā
translation: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented; For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: उभयं ते न कषीयते वसव्यं दिवे-दिवे जायमानस्य दस्म | कर्धि कषुमन्तं जरितारमग्ने कर्धि पतिं सवपत्यस्य रायः
transliteration: ubhayaṃ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṃ dive-dive jāyamānasya dasma | kṛdhi kṣumantaṃ jaritāramaghne kṛdhi patiṃ svapatyasya rāyaḥ
translation: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases. Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 9
sanskrit: सैनानीकेन सुविदत्रो अस्मे यष्टा देवानायजिष्ठः सवस्ति | अदब्धो गोपा उत नः परस्पा अग्ने दयुमदुत रेवद दिदीहि
transliteration: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devānāyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti | adabdho ghopā uta naḥ paraspā aghne dyumaduta revad didīhi
translation: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us. Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 10
sanskrit: जोहूत्रो अग्निः परथमः पितेवेळस पदे मनुषा यत समिद्धः | शरियं वसानो अम्र्तो विचेता मर्म्र्जेन्यः शरवस्यःस वाजी
transliteration: johūtro aghniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḷas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ |
translation: Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 11
sanskrit: शरुधी हवमिन्द्र मा रिशण्यः सयाम ते दावने वसूनाम | इमा हि तवामूर्जो वर्धयन्ति वसूयवः सिन्धवो न कषरन्तः
transliteration: imā hi tvāmūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ
translation: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures; For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 11
sanskrit: सर्जो महीरिन्द्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः | अमर्त्यं चिद दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वाव्र्धानः
transliteration: sṛjo mahīrindra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrigvedaīḥ | amartyaṃ cid dāsaṃ manyamānamavābhinadukthairigvedaāvṛdhānaḥ
translation: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero. Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dasa, him who deemed himself immortal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 11
sanskrit: उक्थेष्विन नु शूर येषु चाकन सतोमेष्विन्द्र रुद्रियेषु च | तुभ्येदेता यासु मन्दसानः पर वायवे सिस्रते न शुभ्राः
transliteration: uktheṣvin nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣvindra rudriyeṣu ca | tubhyedetā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ
translation: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras, These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vayu.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यो जात एव परथमो मनस्वान देवो देवान करतुना पर्यभूषत | यस्य शुष्माद रोदसी अभ्यसेतां नर्म्णस्य मह्ना स जनास इन्द्रः
transliteration: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat | yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ
translation: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods' protector, Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यः पर्थिवीं वयथमानामद्रंहद यः पर्वतान परकुपितानरम्णात | यो अन्तरिक्षं विममे वरीयो यो दयामस्तभ्नात स जनास इन्द्रः
transliteration: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānāmadṛṃhad yaḥ parigvedaatān prakupitānaramṇāt | yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyāmastabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ
translation: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यो हत्वाहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य | यो अश्मनोरन्तरग्निं जजान संव्र्क समत्सु स. ज. इ.
transliteration: yo hatvāhimariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo ghā udājadapadhā valasya | yo aśmanorantaraghniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu s. j. i.
translation: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala, Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors' battle, He, O men, is Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 12
sanskrit: येनेमा विश्वा चयवना कर्तानि यो दासं वर्णमधरंगुहाकः | शवघ्नीव यो जिगीवान लक्षमाददर्यः पुष्टानि स. ज. इ.
transliteration: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇamadharaṃghuhākaḥ |
translation: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons, Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: रतुर्जनित्री तस्या अपस परि मक्षू जात आविशद यासु वर्धते | तदाहना अभवत पिप्युषी पयो.अंशोः पीयूषं परथमं तदुक्थ्यम
transliteration: tadāhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣaṃ prathamaṃ tadukthyam
translation: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows. Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सध्रीमा यन्ति परि बिभ्रतीः पयो विश्वप्स्न्याय पर भरन्त भोजनम | समानो अध्वा परवतामनुष्यदे यस्ताक्र्णोः परथमं सास्युक्थ्यः
transliteration: sadhrīmā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam | samāno adhvā pravatāmanuṣyade yastākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsyukthyaḥ
translation: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all. The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अन्वेको वदति यद ददाति तद रूपा मिनन तदपा एक ईयते | विश्वा एकस्य विनुदस्तितिक्षते यस्ताक्र...
transliteration: anveko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate | viśvā ekasya vinudastitikṣate yastākṛ...
translation: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task, The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: परजाभ्यः पुष्टिं विभजन्त आसते रयिमिव पर्ष्ठं परभवन्तमायते | असिन्वन दंष्ट्रैः पितुरत्ति भोजनं यस्ताक्र...
transliteration: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ vibhajanta āsate rayimiva pṛṣṭhaṃ prabhavantamāyate | asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituratti bhojanaṃ yastākṛ...
translation: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear. Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अधाक्र्णोः पर्थिवीं सन्द्र्शे दिवे यो धौतीनामहिहन्नारिणक पथः | तं तवा सतोमेभिरुदभिर्न वाजिनं देवं देवा अजनन सास्युक्थ्यः
transliteration: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṃ sandṛśe dive yo dhautīnāmahihannāriṇak pathaḥ | taṃ tvā stomebhirudabhirna vājinaṃ devaṃ devā ajanan sāsyukthyaḥ
translation: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths. Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: यो भोजनं च दयसे च वर्धनमार्द्रादा शुष्कं मधुमद दुदोहिथ | स शेवधिं नि दधिषे विवस्वति विश्वस्यैक ईशिषे सास्यु.
transliteration: yo bhojanaṃ ca dayase ca vardhanamārdrādā śuṣkaṃ madhumad dudohitha | sa śevadhiṃ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsyu.
translation: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets. Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: यः पुष्पिणीश्च परस्वश्च धर्मणाधि दाने वयवनीरधारयः | यश्चासमा अजनो दिद्युतो दिव उरुरूर्वानभितः स. उ.
transliteration: yaḥ puṣpiṇīśca prasvaśca dharmaṇādhi dāne vyavanīradhārayaḥ | yaścāsamā ajano didyuto diva ururūrigvedaānabhitaḥ s. u.
translation: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed; Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,-vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 13
sanskrit: यो नार्मरं सहवसुं निहन्तवे पर्क्षाय च दासवेशाय चावहः | ऊर्जयन्त्या अपरिविष्टमास्यमुतैवाद्य पुरुक्र्त्स. उ.
transliteration: yo nārmaraṃ sahavasuṃ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ |
translation: Who broughtest Narmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed, Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो भरतेन्द्राय सोममामत्रेभिः सिञ्चता मद्यमन्धः | कामी हि वीरः सदमस्य पीतिं जुहोत वर्ष्णे तदिदेश वष्टि
transliteration: adhvaryavo bharatendrāya somamāmatrebhiḥ siñcatā madyamandhaḥ | kāmī hi vīraḥ sadamasya pītiṃ juhota vṛṣṇe tadideśa vaṣṭi
translation: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.logeth ever To drink of this the Hero offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो अपो वव्रिवांसं वर्त्रं जघानाशन्येव वर्क्षम | तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशायनेष इन्द्रो अर्हति पीतिमस्य
transliteration: adhvaryavo yo apo vavrivāṃsaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghānāśanyeva vṛkṣam | tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśāyaneṣa indro arhati pītimasya
translation: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vrtra- Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो दर्भीकं जघान यो गा उदाजदप हि वलं वः | तस्मा एतमन्तरिक्षे न वातमिन्द्रं सोमैरोर्णुत जूर्न वस्त्रैः
transliteration: adhvaryavo yo dṛbhīkaṃ jaghāna yo ghā udājadapa hi valaṃ vaḥ | tasmā etamantarikṣe na vātamindraṃ somairorṇuta jūrna vastraiḥ
translation: Ye ministers, to him who smote Drhhikas who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala, Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो य उरणं जघान नव चख्वांसं नवतिं चबाहून | यो अर्बुदमव नीचा बबाधे तमिन्द्रं सोमस्यभ्र्थे हिनोत
transliteration: adhvaryavo ya uraṇaṃ jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsaṃ navatiṃ cabāhūn | yo arbudamava nīcā babādhe tamindraṃ somasyabhṛthe hinota
translation: Him who did Urana to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number; Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,-speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः सवश्नं जघान यः शुष्णमशुषं यो वयंसम | यः पिप्रुं नमुचिं यो रुधिक्रां तस्मा इन्द्रायान्धसो जुहोत
transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ svaśnaṃ jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇamaśuṣaṃ yo vyaṃsam | yaḥ pipruṃ namuciṃ yo rudhikrāṃ tasmā indrāyāndhaso juhota
translation: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svasna, and did to death Vyamsa and greedy Susna, And Rudhikras and Namuci and Pipru,- to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः शतं शम्बरस्य पुरो बिभेदाश्मनेव पूर्वीः | यो वर्चिनः शतमिन्द्रः सहस्रमपावपद भरतासोममस्मै
transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ śataṃ śambarasya puro bibhedāśmaneva pūrigvedaīḥ | yo varcinaḥ śatamindraḥ sahasramapāvapad bharatāsomamasmai
translation: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Sambara's hundred ancient castles; Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,-to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यः शतमा सहस्रं भूम्या उपस्थे.अवपज्जघन्वान | कुत्सस्यायोरतिथिग्वस्य वीरान नयाव्र्णग भरता सोममस्मै
transliteration: adhvaryavo yaḥ śatamā sahasraṃ bhūmyā upasthe.avapajjaghanvān | kutsasyāyoratithighvasya vīrān nyāvṛṇagh bharatā somamasmai
translation: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom; Who quelled the valiant men of Atithigva, Kutsa, and Ayu,-bring to him the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यन नरः कामयाध्वे शरुष्टी वहन्तो नशथा तदिन्द्रे | गभस्तिपूतं भरत शरुतायेन्द्राय सोमं यज्यवो जुहोत
transliteration: adhvaryavo yan naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahanto naśathā tadindre | ghabhastipūtaṃ bharata śrutāyendrāya somaṃ yajyavo juhota
translation: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra. Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवः कर्तना शरुष्टिमस्मै वने निपूतं वन उन नयध्वम | जुषाणो हस्त्यमभि वावशे व इन्द्राय सोमं मदिरं जुहोत
transliteration: adhvaryavaḥ kartanā śruṣṭimasmai vane nipūtaṃ vana un nayadhvam | juṣāṇo hastyamabhi vāvaśe va indrāya somaṃ madiraṃ juhota
translation: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye. Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवः पयसोधर्यथा गोः सोमेभिरीं पर्णता भोजमिन्द्रम | वेदाहमस्य निभ्र्तं म एतद दित्सन्तं भूयो यजतश्चिकेत
transliteration: adhvaryavaḥ payasodharyathā ghoḥ somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram | vedāhamasya nibhṛtaṃ ma etad ditsantaṃ bhūyo yajataściketa
translation: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver. I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो यो दिव्यस्य वस्वो यः पार्थिवस्य कषम्यस्य राजा | तमूर्दरं न परिणता यवेनेन्द्रं सोमेभिस्तदपोवो अस्तु
transliteration: adhvaryavo yo divyasya vasvo yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā | tamūrdaraṃ na priṇatā yavenendraṃ somebhistadapovo astu
translation: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses, Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अस्मभ्यं तद ...
transliteration: asmabhyaṃ tad ...
translation: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: पर घा नवस्य महतो महानि सत्या सत्यस्य करणानि वोचम | तरिकद्रुकेश्वपिबत सुतस्यास्य मदे अहिमिन्द्रो जघान
transliteration: pra ghā nvasya mahato mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam | trikadrukeśvapibat sutasyāsya made ahimindro jaghāna
translation: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty. In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अवंशे दयामस्तभायद बर्हन्तमा रोदसी अप्र्णदन्तरिक्षम | स धारयद पर्थिवीं पप्रथच्च सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
transliteration: avaṃśe dyāmastabhāyad bṛhantamā rodasī apṛṇadantarikṣam | sa dhārayad pṛthivīṃ paprathacca somasya tā mada indraścakāra
translation: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region. Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सद्मेव पराचो वि मिमाय मानैर्वज्रेण खान्यत्र्णन नदीनाम | वर्थास्र्जत पथिभिर्दीर्घयाथैः सोमस्य ता ...
transliteration: sadmeva prāco vi mimāya mānairigvedaajreṇa khānyatṛṇan nadīnām | vṛthāsṛjat pathibhirdīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā ...
translation: From front, as 'twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers, And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स परवोळ्हॄन परिगत्या दभीतेर्विश्वमधागायुधमिद्धे अग्नौ | सं गोभिरश्वैरस्र्जद रथेभिः सो...
transliteration: sa pravoḷhṝn parighatyā dabhīterigvedaśvamadhāghāyudhamiddhe aghnau | saṃ ghobhiraśvairasṛjad rathebhiḥ so...
translation: Compassing those who bore away Dabhiti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons. And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स ईं महीं धुनिमेतोररम्णात सो अस्नातॄनपारयत सवस्ति | त उत्स्नाय रयिमभि पर तस्थुः सो...
transliteration: sa īṃ mahīṃ dhunimetoraramṇāt so asnātṝnapārayat svasti | ta utsnāya rayimabhi pra tasthuḥ so...
translation: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over. They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सोदञ्चं सिन्धुमरिणान महित्वा वज्रेणान उषसः सं पिपेष | अजवसो जविनीभिर्विव्र्श्चन सो...
transliteration: sodañcaṃ sindhumariṇān mahitvā vajreṇāna uṣasaḥ saṃ pipeṣa | ajavaso javinībhirigvedavṛścan so...
translation: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Usas, Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स विद्वानपगोहं कनीनामाविर्भवन्नुदतिष्ठत पराव्र्क | परति शरोण सथाद वयनगचष्ट सो...
transliteration: sa vidvānapaghohaṃ kanīnāmāvirbhavannudatiṣṭhat parāvṛk | prati śroṇa sthād vyanaghacaṣṭa so...
translation: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them. The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: भिनद वलमङगिरोभिर्ग्र्णानो वि पर्वतस्य दरंहितान्यैरत | रिणग रोधांसि कर्त्रिमाण्येषां सो...
transliteration: bhinad valamaṅghirobhirghṛṇāno vi parigvedaatasya dṛṃhitānyairat | riṇagh rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇyeṣāṃ so...
translation: Praised by the Angirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain. He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सवप्नेनाभ्युप्या चुमुरिं धुनिं च जघन्थ दस्यं पर दभीतिमावः | रम्भी चिदत्र विविदे हिरण्यं सो...
transliteration: svapnenābhyupyā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca jaghantha dasyaṃ pra dabhītimāvaḥ | rambhī cidatra vivide hiraṇyaṃ so...
translation: Thou, with sleep whelming Cumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhiti. There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 15
sanskrit: नूनं सा ते परति ...
transliteration: nūnaṃ sā te prati ...
translation: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: पर वः सतां जयेष्ठतमाय सुष्टुतिमग्नाविव समिधाने हविर्भरे | इन्द्रमजुर्यं जरयन्तमुक्षितं सनाद युवानमवसे हवामहे
transliteration: pra vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutimaghnāviva samidhāne havirbhare | indramajuryaṃ jarayantamukṣitaṃ sanād yuvānamavase havāmahe
translation: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire. We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: यस्मादिन्द्राद बर्हतः किं चनें रते विश्वान्यस्मिन सम्भ्र्ताधि वीर्या | जठरे सोमं तन्वी सहो महो हस्ते वज्रं भरति शीर्षणि करतुम
transliteration: yasmādindrād bṛhataḥ kiṃ caneṃ ṛte viśvānyasmin sambhṛtādhi vīryā | jaṭhare somaṃ tanvī saho maho haste vajraṃ bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum
translation: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined. The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: न कषोणीभ्यां परिभ्वे त इन्द्रियं न समुद्रैः पर्वतैरिन्द्र ते रथः | न ते वज्रमन्वश्नोति कश्चन यदाशुभिः पतसि योजना पुरु
transliteration: na kṣoṇībhyāṃ paribhve ta indriyaṃ na samudraiḥ parigvedaatairindra te rathaḥ | na te vajramanvaśnoti kaścana yadāśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru
translation: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas. None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: विश्वे हयस्मै यजताय धर्ष्णवे करतुं भरन्ति वर्षभाय सश्चते | वर्षा यजस्व हविषा विदुष्टरः पिबेन्द्र सोमं वर्षभेण भानुना
transliteration: viśve hyasmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratuṃ bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate | vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ pibendra somaṃ vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā
translation: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave. Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: वर्ष्णः कोशः पवते मध्व ऊर्मिर्व्र्षभान्नाय वर्षभाय पातवे | वर्षणाध्वर्यू वर्षभासो अद्रयो वर्षणं सोमं वर्षभाय सुष्वति
transliteration: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhva ūrmirigvedaṛṣabhānnāya vṛṣabhāya pātave | vṛṣaṇādhvaryū vṛṣabhāso adrayo vṛṣaṇaṃ somaṃ vṛṣabhāya suṣvati
translation: The vessel of the strong flows forth, the flood of meath, unto the Strong who feeds upon the strong, for drink, Strong are the two Adhvaryus, strong are both the stones. They press the Soma that is strong for him the Strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: वर्षा ते वज्र उत ते वर्षा रथो वर्षणा हरी वर्षभाण्यायुधा | वर्ष्णो मदस्य वर्षभ तवमीशिष इन्द्र सोमस्य वर्षभस्य तर्प्णुहि
transliteration: vṛṣā te vajra uta te vṛṣā ratho vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇyāyudhā | vṛṣṇo madasya vṛṣabha tvamīśiṣa indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi
translation: Strong is thy thunderbolt, yea, and thy car is strong; strong are thy Bay Steeds and thy weapons powerful. Thou, Indra, Bull, art Lord of the strong gladdening drink. with the strong Soma, Indra, satisfy thyself.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: पर ते नावं न समने वचस्युवं बरह्मणा यामि सवनेषुदाध्र्षिः | कुविन नो अस्य वचसो निबोधिषदिन्द्रमुत्सं न वसुनः सिचामहे
transliteration: pra te nāvaṃ na samane vacasyuvaṃ brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣudādhṛṣiḥ | kuvin no asya vacaso nibodhiṣadindramutsaṃ na vasunaḥ sicāmahe
translation: I, bold by prayer, come near thee in thy sacred rites, thee like a saving ship, thee shouting in the war. Verily he will hear and mark this word of ours: we will pour Indra forth as 'twere a spring of wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
sanskrit: पुरा सम्बाधादभ्या वव्र्त्स्व नो धेनुर्न वत्सं यवसस्य पिप्युषी | सक्र्त सु ते सुमतिभिः शतक्रतो सं पत्नीभिर्न वर्षणो नसीमहि
transliteration: purā sambādhādabhyā vavṛtsva no dhenurna vatsaṃ yavasasya pipyuṣī | sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato saṃ patnībhirna vṛṣaṇo nasīmahi
translation: Turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh, as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf. Lord of a Hundred Powers, may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 16
transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...
translation: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तदस्मै नव्यमङगिरस्वदर्चत शुष्मा यदस्य परत्नथोदीरते | विश्वा यद गोत्रा सहसा परीव्र्ता मदे सोमस्य दरंहितान्यैरयत
transliteration: tadasmai navyamaṅghirasvadarcata śuṣmā yadasya pratnathodīrate | viśvā yad ghotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitānyairayat
translation: LIKE the Angirases, sing this new song forth to him, for, as in ancient days, his mighty powers are shown, When in the rapture of the Soma he unclosed with strength the solid firm-shut stables of the kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 17
sanskrit: स भुतु यो ह परथमाय धायस ओजो मिमानो महिमानमातिरत | शूरो यो युत्सु तन्वं परिव्यत शीर्षणि दयां महिना परत्यमुञ्चत
transliteration: sa bhutu yo ha prathamāya dhāyasa ojo mimāno mahimānamātirat |
translation: Let him be even that God who, for the earliest draught measuring out his power, increased his majesty; Hero who fortified his body in the wars, and through his greatness set the heaven upon his head.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 18
sanskrit: पराता रथो नवो योजि सस्निश्चतुर्युगस्त्रिकशः सप्तरश्मिः | दशारित्रो मनुष्यः सवर्षाः स इष्टिभिर्मतिभीरंह्यो भूत
transliteration: prātā ratho navo yoji sasniścaturyughastrikaśaḥ saptaraśmiḥ | daśāritro manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ sa iṣṭibhirmatibhīraṃhyo bhūt
translation: THE rich new car hath been equipped at morning; four yokes it hath, three whips, seven reins to guide it: Ten-sided, friendly to mankind, light-winner, that must be urged to speed with prayers and wishes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 18
sanskrit: सास्मा अरं परथमं स दवितीयमुतो तर्तीयं मनुषः स होता | अन्यस्या गर्भमन्य ऊ जनन्त सो अन्येभिः सचते जेन्यो वर्षा
transliteration: sāsmā araṃ prathamaṃ sa dvitīyamuto tṛtīyaṃ manuṣaḥ sa hotā | anyasyā gharbhamanya ū jananta so anyebhiḥ sacate jenyo vṛṣā
translation: This is prepared for him the first, the second, and the third time: he is man's Priest and Herald. Others get offspring of another parent he goeth, as a noble Bull, with others.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 18
sanskrit: हरी नु कं रथ इन्द्रस्य योजमायै सूक्तेन वचसा नवेन | मो षु तवामत्र बहवो हि विप्रा नि रीरमन यजमानासो अन्ये
transliteration: harī nu kaṃ ratha indrasya yojamāyai sūktena vacasā navena | mo ṣu tvāmatra bahavo hi viprā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye
translation: To Indra's car the Bay Steeds have I harnessed, that new well-spoken words may bring him hither. Here let not other worshippers detain thee, for among us are many holy singers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अपाय्यस्यान्धसो मदाय मनीषिणः सुवानस्य परयसः | यस्मिन्निन्द्रः परदिवि वाव्र्धान ओको दधे बरह्मण्यन्तश्च नरः
transliteration: apāyyasyāndhaso madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ | yasminnindraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhāna oko dadhe brahmaṇyantaśca naraḥ
translation: DRAUGHTS of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture, of the wise Soma-presser's offered dainty, Wherein, grown mighty in the days aforetime, Indra hath found delight, and men who worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अस्य मन्दानो मध्वो वज्रहस्तो.अहिमिन्द्रो अर्णोव्र्तं वि वर्श्चत | पर यद वयो स सवसराण्यछा परयांसि च नदीनां चक्रमन्त
transliteration: asya mandāno madhvo vajrahasto.ahimindro arṇovṛtaṃ vi vṛścat | pra yad vayo sa svasarāṇyachā prayāṃsi ca nadīnāṃ cakramanta
translation: Cheered by this meath Indra, whose hand wields thunder, rent piecemeal Ahi who barred up the waters, So that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their resting-places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 19
sanskrit: स माहिन इन्द्रो अर्णो अपां परैरयदहिहाछा समुद्रम | अजनयत सूर्यं विदद गा अक्तुनाह्नां वयुनानि साधत
transliteration: sa māhina indro arṇo apāṃ prairayadahihāchā samudram | ajanayat sūryaṃ vidad ghā aktunāhnāṃ vayunāni sādhat
translation: Indra, this Mighty One, the Dragon's slayer, sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean. He gave the Sun his life, he found the cattle, and with the night the works of days completed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 19
sanskrit: सो अप्रतीनि मनवे पुरूणीन्द्रो दाशद दाशुषे हन्ति वर्त्रम | सद्यो यो नर्भ्यो अतसाय्यो भूत पस्प्र्धानेभ्यः सूर्यस्य सातौ
transliteration: so apratīni manave purūṇīndro dāśad dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram | sadyo yo nṛbhyo atasāyyo bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau
translation: To him who worshippeth hath Indra given many and matchless gifts. He slayeth Vrtra. Straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 19
sanskrit: स सुन्वत इन्द्रः सूर्यमा देवो रिणं मर्त्याय सतवान | आ यद रयिं गुहदवद्यमस्मै भरदंशं नैतशो दशस्यन
transliteration: sa sunvata indraḥ sūryamā devo riṇaṃ martyāya stavān |
translation: To him who poured him gifts he gave up Surya,-Indra, the God, the Mighty, to the mortal; For Etasa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar, as 'twere his portion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: वयं ते वय इन्द्र विद्धि षु णः पर भरामहे वाजयुर्न रथम | विपन्यवो दीध्यतो मनीषा सुम्नमियक्षन्तस्त्वावतो नॄन
transliteration: vayaṃ te vaya indra viddhi ṣu ṇaḥ pra bharāmahe vājayurna ratham | vipanyavo dīdhyato manīṣā sumnamiyakṣantastvāvato nṝn
translation: As one brings forth his car when fain for combat, so bring we power to thee- regard us, Indra- Well skilled in song, thoughtful in spirit, seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: तवं न इन्द्र तवाभिरूती तवायतो अभिष्टिपासि जनान | तवमिनो दाशुषो वरूतेत्थाधीरभि यो नक्षति तवा
transliteration: tvaṃ na indra tvābhirūtī tvāyato abhiṣṭipāsi janān | tvamino dāśuṣo varūtetthādhīrabhi yo nakṣati tvā
translation: Indra, thou art our own with thy protection, a guardian near to men who love thee truly, Active art thou, the liberal man's defender, his who draws near to thee with right devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: स नो युवेन्द्रो जोहूत्रः सखा शिवो नरामस्तु पाता | यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती पचन्तं च सतुवन्तंच परणेषत
transliteration: sa no yuvendro johūtraḥ sakhā śivo narāmastu pātā | yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānamūtī pacantaṃ ca stuvantaṃca praṇeṣat
translation: May Indra, called with solemn invocations. the young, the Friend, be men's auspicious keeper, One who will further with his aid the singer, the toiler, praiser, dresser of oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: तमु सतुष इन्द्रं तं गर्णीषे यस्मिन पुरा वाव्र्धुः शाशदुश्च | स वस्वः कामं पीपरदियानो बरह्मण्यतो नूतनस्यायोः
transliteration: tamu stuṣa indraṃ taṃ ghṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduśca | sa vasvaḥ kāmaṃ pīparadiyāno brahmaṇyato nūtanasyāyoḥ
translation: With laud and song let me extol that Indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty. May he, implored, fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships, of the living mortal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: सो अङगिरसामुचथा जुजुष्वान बरह्मा तूतोदिन्द्रो गातुमिष्णन | मुष्णन्नुषसः सूर्येण सतवानश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत पूर्व्याणि
transliteration: so aṅghirasāmucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtodindro ghātumiṣṇan | muṣṇannuṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavānaśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrigvedayāṇi
translation: He, Indra whom the Angirases' praise delighted, strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper. Stealing away the mornings with the sunlight, he, lauded, crushed even Asna's ancient powers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: स ह शरुत इन्द्रो नाम देव ऊर्ध्वो भुवन मनुषे दस्मतमः | अव परियमर्शसानस्य साह्वाञ्छिरो भरद दासस्य सवधावान
transliteration: sa ha śruta indro nāma deva ūrdhvo bhuvan manuṣe dasmatamaḥ | ava priyamarśasānasya sāhvāñchiro bharad dāsasya svadhāvān
translation: He verily, the God, the glorious Indra, hath raised him up for man, best Wonder-Worker. He, self-reliant, mighty and triumphant, brought low the dear head of the wicked Dasa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: स वर्त्रहेन्द्रः कर्ष्णयोनीः पुरन्दरो दासीरैरयद वि | अजनयन मनवे कषामपश्च सत्रा शंसं यजमानस्य तूतोत
transliteration: sa vṛtrahendraḥ kṛṣṇayonīḥ purandaro dāsīrairayad vi | ajanayan manave kṣāmapaśca satrā śaṃsaṃ yajamānasya tūtot
translation: Indra the Vrtra-slayer, Fort-destroyer, scattered the Dasa hosts who dwelt in darkness. For men hath he created earth and waters, and ever helped the prayer of him who worships.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
sanskrit: तस्मै तवस्यमनु दायि सत्रेन्द्राय देवेभिरर्णसातौ | परति यदस्य वज्रं बाह्वोर्धुर्हत्वी दस्यून पुर आयसीर्नि तारीत
transliteration: tasmai tavasyamanu dāyi satrendrāya devebhirarṇasātau | prati yadasya vajraṃ bāhvordhurhatvī dasyūn pura āyasīrni tārīt
translation: To him in might the Gods have ever yielded, to Indra in the tumult of the battle. When in his arms they laid the bolt, he slaughtered the Dasyus and cast down their forts of iron.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 20
transliteration: nūnaṃ sā ...
translation: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: विश्वजिते धनजिते सवर्जिते सत्राजिते नर्जित उर्वराजिते | अश्वजिते गोजिते अब्जिते भरेन्द्राय सोमं यजताय हर्यतम
transliteration: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urigvedaarājite | aśvajite ghojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam
translation: To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth, Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine,of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अभिभुवे.अभिभङगाय वन्वते.अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे | तुविग्रये वह्नये दुष्टरीतवे सत्रासाहे नम इन्द्राय वोचत
transliteration: abhibhuve.abhibhaṅghāya vanvate.aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase | tuvighraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata
translation: To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all, The migbty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः | वर्तंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इन्द्रस्य वोचं पर कर्तानि वीर्या
transliteration: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaścyavano yudhmo anu joṣamukṣitaḥ | vṛtaṃcayaḥ sahuririgvedakṣvārita indrasya vocaṃ pra kṛtāni vīryā
translation: Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o'erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would; Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अनानुदो वर्षभो दोधतो वधो गम्भीर रष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः | रध्रचोदः शनथनो वीळितस पर्थुरिन्द्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः सवर्जनत
transliteration: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho ghambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ | radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḷitas pṛthurindraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svarjanat
translation: The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable; Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,-Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: यज्णेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः | अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इन्द्रे हिन्वाना दरविणान्याशत
transliteration: yajṇena ghātumapturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ | abhisvarā niṣadā ghā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇānyāśata
translation: By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood. In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इन्द्र शरेष्ठानि दरविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वं अस्मे | पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां सवाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नाम
transliteration: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhaghatvaṃ asme | poṣaṃ rayīṇāmariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācaḥ sudinatvamahnām
translation: Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune; Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तरिकद्रुकेषु महिषो यवाशिरं तुविशुष्मस्त्र्पत सोममपिबद विष्णुना सुतं यथावशत | स ईं ममाद महि कर्म कर्तवे महामुरुं सैनं सश्चद देवो देवं सत्यमिन्द्रंसत्य इन्दुः
transliteration: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmastṛpat somamapibad viṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśat | sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma kartave mahāmuruṃ sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyamindraṃsatya induḥ
translation: At the Trikadrukas the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Visnu hath he quaffed the poured out Soma juice, all that he would. That hath so heightened him the Great, the Wide, to do his mighty work. So may the God attain the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अध तविषीमानभ्योजसा करिविं युधाभवदा रोदसी अप्र्णदस्य मज्मना पर वाव्र्धे | अधत्तान्यं जठरे परेमरिच्यत सैनं ...
transliteration: adha tviṣīmānabhyojasā kriviṃ yudhābhavadā rodasī apṛṇadasya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe | adhattānyaṃ jaṭhare premaricyata sainaṃ ...
translation: So he resplendent in the battle overcame Krivi by might. He with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven, and waxen strong. One share of the libation hath he swallowed down: one share he left. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 22
sanskrit: साकं जातः करतुना साकमोजसा ववक्षिथ साकं वर्द्धो वीर्यैः सासहिर्म्र्धो विचर्षणिः | दाता राधः सतुवते काम्यं वसु सैनं ...
transliteration: sākaṃ jātaḥ kratunā sākamojasā vavakṣitha sākaṃ vṛddho vīryaiḥ sāsahirmṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ | dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sainaṃ ...
translation: Brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent, most swift in act; Giving prosperity, and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तव तयन नर्यं नर्तो.अप इन्द्र परथमं पूर्व्यं दिवि परवाच्यं कर्तम | यद देवस्य शवसा परारिणा असुं रिणन्नपः | भुवद विश्वमभ्यादेवमोजसा विदादूर्जं शतक्रतुर्विदादिषम
transliteration: tava tyan naryaṃ nṛto.apa indra prathamaṃ pūrigvedayaṃ divi pravācyaṃ kṛtam | yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṃ riṇannapaḥ | bhuvad viśvamabhyādevamojasā vidādūrjaṃ śatakraturigvedadādiṣam
translation: This, Indra, was thy hero deed, Dancer, thy first and ancient work, worthy to be told forth in heaven, What time thou sentest down life with a God's own power, freeing the floods. All that is godless may he conquer with his might, and, Lord of Hundred Powers, find for us strength and food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 23
sanskrit: गणानां तवा गणपतिं हवामहे कविं कवीनामुपमश्रवस्तमम | जयेष्ठराजं बरह्मणां बरह्मणस पत आ नः षर्ण्वन्नूतिभिः सीद सादनम
transliteration: ghaṇānāṃ tvā ghaṇapatiṃ havāmahe kaviṃ kavīnāmupamaśravastamam | jyeṣṭharājaṃ brahmaṇāṃ brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ ṣṛṇvannūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam
translation: WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all, The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmanaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 23
sanskrit: देवाश्चित ते असुर्य परचेतसो बर्हस्पते यज्ञियं भागमानशुः | उस्रा इव सूर्यो जयोतिषा महो विश्वेषामिज्जनिता बरह्मणामसि
transliteration: devāścit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśuḥ | usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣāmijjanitā brahmaṇāmasi
translation: Brhaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites. As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: सेमामविड्ढि परभ्र्तिं य ईशिषे.अया विधेम नवया महा गिरा | यथा नो मीढ्वान सतवते सखा तव बर्हस्पतेसीषधः सोत नो मतिम
transliteration: semāmaviḍḍhi prabhṛtiṃ ya īśiṣe.ayā vidhema navayā mahā ghirā | yathā no mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspatesīṣadhaḥ sota no matim
translation: BE pleased with this our offering, thou who art the Lord; we will adore thee with this new and mighty song. As this thy friend, our liberal patron, praises thee, do thou, Brhaspati, fulfil our hearts' desire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: यो नन्त्वान्यनमन नयोजसोतादर्दर्मन्युना शम्बराणि वि | पराच्यावयदच्युता बरह्मणस पतिरा चाविशद वसुमन्तं वि पर्वतम
transliteration: yo nantvānyanaman nyojasotādardarmanyunā śambarāṇi vi | prācyāvayadacyutā brahmaṇas patirā cāviśad vasumantaṃ vi parigvedaatam
translation: He who with might bowed down the things that should be bowed, and in his fury rent the holds of Sambara: Who overthrew what shook not, Brahmapaspati,-he made his way within the mountain stored with wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: तद देवानां देवतमाय कर्त्वमश्रथ्नन दर्ळ्हाव्रदन्त वीळिता | उद गा आजदभिनद बरह्मणा वलमगूहत तमो वयचक्षयत सवः
transliteration: tad devānāṃ devatamāya kartvamaśrathnan dṛḷhāvradanta vīḷitā | ud ghā ājadabhinad brahmaṇā valamaghūhat tamo vyacakṣayat svaḥ
translation: That was a great deed for the Godliest of the Gods: strong things were loosened and the firmly fixed gave way. He drave the kine forth and cleft Vala through by prayer, dispelled the darkness and displayed the light of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अश्मास्यमवतं बरह्मणस पतिर्मधुधारमभि यमोजसात्र्णत | तमेव विश्वे पपिरे सवर्द्र्शो बहु साकं सिसिचुरुत्समुद्रिणम
transliteration: aśmāsyamavataṃ brahmaṇas patirmadhudhāramabhi yamojasātṛṇat | tameva viśve papire svardṛśo bahu sākaṃ sisicurutsamudriṇam
translation: The well with mouth of stone that poured a flood of meath, which Brahmapaspati hath opened with his might- All they who see the light have drunk their fill thereat: together they have made the watery fount flow forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: सना ता का चिद भुवना भवीत्वा माद्भिः शरद्भिर्दुरो वरन्त वः | अयतन्ता चरतो अन्यद-अन्यदिद य चकार वयुना बरह्मणस पतिः
transliteration: sanā tā kā cid bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhirduro varanta vaḥ | ayatantā carato anyad-anyadid ya cakāra vayunā brahmaṇas patiḥ
translation: Ancient will be those creatures, whatsoe'er they be; with moons, with autumns, doors unclose themselves to you. Effortless they pass on to perfect this and that, appointed works which Brahmanaspati ordained.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अभिनक्षन्तो अभि ये तमानशुर्निधिं पणीनां परमंगुहा हितम | ते विद्वांसः परतिचक्ष्यान्र्ता पुनर्यत उायन तदुदीयुराविशम
transliteration: abhinakṣanto abhi ye tamānaśurnidhiṃ paṇīnāṃ paramaṃghuhā hitam | te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punaryata uāyan tadudīyurāviśam
translation: They who with much endeavour searching round obtained the Panis' noblest treasure hidden in the cave,- Those sages, having marked the falsehoods, turned them back whence they had come, and sought again to enter in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 25
sanskrit: इन्धानो अग्निं वनवद वनुष्यतः कर्तब्रह्मा शूशुवद रातहव्य इत
transliteration: indhāno aghniṃ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it
translation: HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift. He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 25
sanskrit: जातेन जातमति स पर सर्स्र्ते यं-यं युजंक्र्णुते बरह्मणस पतिः
transliteration: jātena jātamati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃ-yaṃ yujaṃkṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
translation: With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be. His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 25
sanskrit: वीरेभिर्वीरान वनवद वनुष्यतो गोभी रयिं पप्रथद बोधति तमना | तोकं च तस्य तनयं च वर्धते यं-यं ...
transliteration: vīrebhirigvedaīrān vanavad vanuṣyato ghobhī rayiṃ paprathad bodhati tmanā | tokaṃ ca tasya tanayaṃ ca vardhate yaṃ-yaṃ ...
translation: He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength. Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 25
sanskrit: सिन्धुर्न कषोदः शिमीवान रघायतो वर्षेव वध्रीन्रभि वष्ट्योजसा | अग्नेरिव परसितिर्नाह वर्तवे यं-यं ..
transliteration: sindhurna kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīnrabhi vaṣṭyojasā | aghneriva prasitirnāha vartave yaṃ-yaṃ ..
translation: For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine. He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तस्मा अर्षन्ति दिव्या असश्चतः स सत्वभिः परथमो गोषुगछति | अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिर्हन्त्योजसा यं-यं ...
transliteration: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo ghoṣughachati | anibhṛṣṭataviṣirhantyojasā yaṃ-yaṃ ...
translation: All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him. Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 26
sanskrit: रजुरिच्छंसो वनवद वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयन्तमभ्यसत | सुप्रावीरिद वनवत पर्त्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनम
transliteration: suprāvīrid vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ yajvedayajyorigveda bhajāti bhojanam
translation: THE righteous singer shall o'ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man. The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 26
sanskrit: यजस्व वीर पर विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये | हविष कर्णुष्व सुभगो यथाससि बरह्मणस पतेरव आ वर्णीमहे
transliteration: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye | haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhagho yathāsasi brahmaṇas paterava ā vṛṇīmahe
translation: Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes. Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmanaspati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 26
sanskrit: स इज्जनेन स विशा स जन्मना स पुत्रैर्वाजं भरतेधना नर्भिः | देवानां यः पितरमाविवासति शरद्धामना हविषा बरह्मणस पतिम
transliteration: sa ijjanena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrairigvedaājaṃ bharatedhanā nṛbhiḥ | devānāṃ yaḥ pitaramāvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim
translation: He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,believing Who with oblation and a true heart serves Brahmanaspati the Father of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 26
sanskrit: यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घ्र्तवद्भिरविधत पर तं पराचा नयति बरह्मणस पतिः | उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषो.अंहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः
transliteration: yo asmai havyairghṛtavadbhiravidhat pra taṃ prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ | uruṣyatīmaṃhaso rakṣatī riṣo.aṃhościdasmā urucakriradbhutaḥ
translation: Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmanaspati leads forward on his way, Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 27
sanskrit: इमा गिर आदित्येभ्यो घर्तस्नूः सनाद राजभ्यो जुह्वा जुहोमि | शर्णोतु मित्रो अर्यमा भगो नस्तुविजातो वरुणो दक्षो अंशः
transliteration: imā ghira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi |
translation: THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer to the Kings Adityas. May Mitra, Aryaman, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuna Daksa, and Amsa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: इदं कवेरादित्यस्य सवराजो विश्वानि सान्त्यभ्यस्तु मह्ना | अति यो मन्द्रो यजथाय देवः सुकीर्तिं भिक्षे वरुणस्य भूरेः
transliteration: idaṃ kaverādityasya svarājo viśvāni sāntyabhyastu mahnā | ati yo mandro yajathāya devaḥ sukīrtiṃ bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ
translation: THIS laud of the self-radiant wise Aditya shall be supreme o'er all that is in greatness. Beg renown of Varuna the Mighty, the God exceeding kind to him who worships. 2, Having extolled thee. Varuna, with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service, Sniffing thy praises like the fires at coming, day after day, of mornings rich in cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: तव वरते सुभगासः सयाम सवाध्यो वरुण तुष्टुवांसः | उपायन उषसां गोमतीनामग्नयो न जरमाणा अनु दयून
transliteration: tava vrate subhaghāsaḥ syāma svādhyo varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ | upāyana uṣasāṃ ghomatīnāmaghnayo na jaramāṇā anu dyūn
translation: May we be in thy keeping, O thou Leader wide-ruling Varuna, Lord of many heroes. O sons of Aditi, for ever faithful, pardon us, Gods, admit us to your friendship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: तव सयाम पुरुवीरस्य शर्मन्नुरुशंसस्य वरुण परणेतः | यूयं नः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धा अभि कषमध्वं युज्याय देवाः
transliteration: tava syāma puruvīrasya śarmannuruśaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ | yūyaṃ naḥ putrā aditeradabdhā abhi kṣamadhvaṃ yujyāya devāḥ
translation: He made them flow, the Aditya, the Sustainer: the rivers run by Varuna's commandment. These feel no weariness, nor cease from flowing: swift have they flown like birds in air around us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: पर सीमादित्यो अस्र्जद विधर्तान रतं सिन्धवो वरुणस्य यन्ति | न शराम्यन्ति न वि मुचन्त्येते वयो न पप्तू रघुयापरिज्मन
transliteration: pra sīmādityo asṛjad vidhartān ṛtaṃ sindhavo varuṇasya yanti | na śrāmyanti na vi mucantyete vayo na paptū raghuyāparijman
translation: Loose me from sin as from a bond that binds me: may we swell, Varuna, thy spring of Order. Let not my thread, while I weave song, be severed, nor my work's sum, before the time, be shattered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: वि मच्छ्रथाय रशनामिवाग रध्याम ते वरुण खां रतस्य | मा तन्तुश्छेदि वयतो धियं मे मा मात्रा शार्यपसः पुर रतोः
transliteration: vi macchrathāya raśanāmivāgha ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khāṃ ṛtasya | mā tantuśchedi vayato dhiyaṃ me mā mātrā śāryapasaḥ pura ṛtoḥ
translation: Far from me, Varuna, remove all danger accept me graciously, thou Holy Sovran. Cast off, like cords that hold a calf, my troubles: I am not even mine eyelid's lord without thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अपो सु मयक्ष वरुण भियसं मत सम्राळ रतावो.अनु मा गर्भाय | दामेव वत्साद वि मुमुग्ध्यंहो नहि तवदारे निमिषश्चनेशे
transliteration: apo su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasaṃ mat samrāḷ ṛtāvo.anu mā ghṛbhāya | dāmeva vatsād vi mumughdhyaṃho nahi tvadāre nimiṣaścaneśe
translation: Strike us not, Varuna, with those dread weapons which, Asura, at thy bidding wound the sinner. Let us not pass away from light to exile. Scatter, that we may live, the men who hate us

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: मा नो वधैर्वरुण ये त इष्टावेनः कर्ण्वन्तमसुर भरीणन्ति | मा जयोतिषः परवसथानि गन्म वि षू मर्धः शिश्रथो जीवसे नः
transliteration: mā no vadhairigvedaaruṇa ye ta iṣṭāvenaḥ kṛṇvantamasura bhrīṇanti | mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ghanma vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ śiśratho jīvase naḥ
translation: O mighty Varuna, now and hereafter, even as of old, will we speak forth our worship. For in thyself, invincible God, thy statutes never to be moved are fixed as on a mountain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: नमः पुरा ते वरुणोत नूनमुतापरं तुविजात बरवाम | तवे हि कं पर्वते न शरितान्यप्रच्युतानि दूळभ वरतानि
transliteration: namaḥ purā te varuṇota nūnamutāparaṃ tuvijāta bravāma | tve hi kaṃ parigvedaate na śritānyapracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni
translation: Move far from me what sins I have committed: let me not suffer, King, for guilt of others. Full many a morn remains to dawn upon us: in these, O Varuna, while we live direct us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: पर रणा सावीरध मत्क्र्तानि माहं राजन्नन्यक्र्तेन भोजम | अव्युष्टा इन नु भूयसीरुषास आ नो जीवान वरुण तासु शाधि
transliteration: para ṛṇā sāvīradha matkṛtāni māhaṃ rājannanyakṛtena bhojam | avyuṣṭā in nu bhūyasīruṣāsa ā no jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi
translation: O King, whoever, be he friend or kinsman, hath threatened me affrighted in my slumber- If any wolf or robber fain would harm us, therefrom, O Varuna, give thou us protection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यो मे राजन युज्यो वा सखा वा सवप्ने भयं भीरवे मह्यमाह | सतेनो वा यो दिप्सति नो वर्को वा तवं तस्माद वरुणपाह्यस्मान
transliteration: yo me rājan yujyo vā sakhā vā svapne bhayaṃ bhīrave mahyamāha | steno vā yo dipsati no vṛko vā tvaṃ tasmād varuṇapāhyasmān
translation: May I not live O Varuna, to witness my wealthy, liberal dear friend's destitution. King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 29
sanskrit: धर्तव्रता आदित्या इषिरा आरे मत कर्त रहसूरिवागः | शर्ण्वतो वो वरुण मित्र देवा भद्रस्य विद्वानवसे हुवेवः
transliteration: dhṛtavratā ādityā iṣirā āre mat karta rahasūrivāghaḥ |
translation: UPHOLDERS of the Law, ye strong Adityas, remove my sin like her who bears in secret. You, Varuna, Mitra and all Gods who listen, I call to help me, I who know your goodness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 30
sanskrit: रतं देवाय कर्ण्वते सवित्र इन्द्रायाहिघ्ने न रमन्त आपः | अहर-अहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या परथमः सर्ग आसाम
transliteration: ahar-aharyātyakturapāṃ kiyātyā prathamaḥ sargha āsām
translation: THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller, Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यो वर्त्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत पर तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच | पथो रदन्तीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवे-दिवे धुनयो यन्त्यर्थम
transliteration: yo vṛtrāya sinamatrābhariṣyat pra taṃ janitrī viduṣa uvāca | patho radantīranu joṣamasmai dive-dive dhunayo yantyartham
translation: His Mother-for she knew-spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vrtra. Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अस्माकं मित्रावरुणावतं रथमादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा | पर यद वयो न पप्तन वस्मनस परि शरवस्यवोह्र्षीवन्तो वनर्षदः
transliteration: asmākaṃ mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ rathamādityai rudrairigvedaasubhiḥ sacābhuvā | pra yad vayo na paptan vasmanas pari śravasyavohṛṣīvanto vanarṣadaḥ
translation: HELP, Varuna and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Adityas, help our car, That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
