sanskrit: अध समा न उदवता सजोषसो रथं देवासो अभि विक्षु वाजयुम | यदाशवः पद्याभिस्तित्रतो रजः पर्थिव्याः सानौ जङघनन्त पाणिभिः
transliteration: adha smā na udavatā sajoṣaso rathaṃ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum | yadāśavaḥ padyābhistitrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ
translation: Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might; When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: उत सय न इन्द्रो विश्वचर्षणिर्दिवः शर्धेन मारुतेन सुक्रतुः | अनु नु सथात्यव्र्काभिरूतिभी रथं महे सनये वाजसातये
transliteration: uta sya na indro viśvacarṣaṇirdivaḥ śardhena mārutena sukratuḥ | anu nu sthātyavṛkābhirūtibhī rathaṃ mahe sanaye vājasātaye
translation: Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most wise, girt by the Marut host, Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: उत सय देवो भुवनस्य सक्षणिस्त्वष्टा गनाभिः सजोषा जूजुवद रथम | इळा भगो बर्हद्दिवोत रोदसी पूषा पुरन्धिरश्विनावधा पती
transliteration: uta sya devo bhuvanasya sakṣaṇistvaṣṭā ghnābhiḥ sajoṣā jūjuvad ratham | iḷā bhagho bṛhaddivota rodasī pūṣā purandhiraśvināvadhā patī
translation: Or may this Tvastar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car; Ila and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pusan, Purandhi, and the Asvins, ruling Lords.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: उत तये देवी सुभगे मिथूद्र्शोषासानक्ता जगतामपीजुवा | सतुषे यद वां पर्थिवि नव्यसा वच सथातुश्च वयस्त्रिवया उपस्तिरे
transliteration: uta tye devī subhaghe mithūdṛśoṣāsānaktā jaghatāmapījuvā | stuṣe yad vāṃ pṛthivi navyasā vaca sthātuśca vayastrivayā upastire
translation: Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act: While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: उत वः शंसमुशिजामिव शमस्यहिर्बुध्न्यो.अज एकपादुत | तरित रभुक्षाः सविता चनो दधे.अपां नपादाशुहेमा धिया शमि
transliteration: uta vaḥ śaṃsamuśijāmiva śmasyahirbudhnyo.aja ekapāduta | trita ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā cano dadhe.apāṃ napādāśuhemā dhiyā śami
translation: Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapad, Trita, Rbhuksan, Savitar shall joy in us, and the Floods' swift Child in our worship and our prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 31
sanskrit: एता वो वश्म्युद्यता यजत्रा अतक्षन्नायवो नव्यसे सम | शरवस्यवो वाजं चकानाः सप्तिर्न रथ्यो अह धीतिमश्याः
transliteration: etā vo vaśmyudyatā yajatrā atakṣannāyavo navyase sam |
translation: These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them, Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अस्य मे दयावाप्र्थिवी रतायतो भूतमवित्री वचसः सिषासतः | ययोरायः परतरं ते इदं पुर उपस्तुते वसूयुर्वां महो दधे
transliteration: asya me dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāyato bhūtamavitrī vacasaḥ siṣāsataḥ | yayorāyaḥ prataraṃ te idaṃ pura upastute vasūyurigvedaāṃ maho dadhe
translation: GRACIOUSLY further, O ye Heaven and Earth, this speech striving to win reward, of me your worshipper. First rank I give to you, Immortal, high extolled! I, fain to win me wealth, to you the migbty Pair.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: मा नो गुह्या रिप आयोरहन दभन मा न आभ्यो रीरधो दुछुनाभ्यः | मा नो वि यौः सख्या विद्धि तस्य नः सुम्नायता मनसा तत तवेमहे
transliteration: mā no ghuhyā ripa āyorahan dabhan mā na ābhyo rīradho duchunābhyaḥ | mā no vi yauḥ sakhyā viddhi tasya naḥ sumnāyatā manasā tat tvemahe
translation: Let not man's guile annoy us, secret or by day: give not us up a prey to these calamities. Sever not thou our friendship: think thereon for us. This, with a heart that longs for bliss, we seek from thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अहेळता मनसा शरुष्टिमा वह दुहानां धेनुं पिप्युषीमसश्चतम | पद्याभिराशुं वचसा च वाजिनं तवां हिनोमि पुरुहूत विश्वहा
transliteration: aheḷatā manasā śruṣṭimā vaha duhānāṃ dhenuṃ pipyuṣīmasaścatam | padyābhirāśuṃ vacasā ca vājinaṃ tvāṃ hinomi puruhūta viśvahā
translation: Bring hither with benignant mind the willing Cow teeming with plenteous milk, full, inexhaustible. O thou invoked by many, day by day I urge thee with my word, a charger rapid in his tread.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: राकामहं सुहवां सुष्टुती हुवे शर्णोतु नः सुभगा बोधतु तमना | सीव्यत्वपः सूच्याछिद्यमानया ददातु वीरं सतदायमुक्थ्यम
transliteration: rākāmahaṃ suhavāṃ suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhaghā bodhatu tmanā | sīvyatvapaḥ sūcyāchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṃ satadāyamukthyam
translation: With eulogy I call on Raka swift to hear may she, auspicious, hear us, and herself observe. With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and give a hero son most wealthy, meet for praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: यास्ते राके सुमतयः सुपेशसो याभिर्ददासि दाशुषे वसूनि | ताभिर्नो अद्य सुमना उपागहि सहस्रपोषं सुभगे रराणा
transliteration: yāste rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhirdadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni | tābhirno adya sumanā upāghahi sahasrapoṣaṃ subhaghe rarāṇā
translation: All thy kind thoughts, O Raka, lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts- With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O Blessed One, bestowing food of thousand sorts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: सिनीवालि पर्थुष्टुके या देवानामसि सवसा | जुषस्व हव्यमाहुतं परजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः
transliteration: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānāmasi svasā | juṣasva havyamāhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translation: O broad-tressed Sinivali, thou who art the Sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: या सुबाहुः सवङगुरिः सुषूमा बहुसूवरी | तस्यै विश्पत्न्यै हविः सिनीवाल्यै जुहोतन
transliteration: yā subāhuḥ svaṅghuriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī | tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
translation: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons- Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinivali Queen of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 32
sanskrit: या गुङगूर्या सिनीवाली या राका या सरस्वती | इन्द्राणीमह्व ऊतये वरुणानीं सवस्तये
transliteration: yā ghuṅghūryā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī | indrāṇīmahva ūtaye varuṇānīṃ svastaye
translation: Her, Sinivali, her, Gungu, her, Raka, her, Sarasvati, Indrani to mine aid I call, and Varunani for my weal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 33
sanskrit: आ ते पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमेतु मा नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्षो युयोथाः | अभि नो वीरो अर्वति कषमेत पर जायेमहि रुद्र परजाभिः
transliteration: abhi no vīro arigvedaati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ
translation: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight. Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 33
sanskrit: तवादत्तेभी रुद्र शन्तमेभिः शतं हिमा अशीय भेषजेभिः | वयस्मद दवेषो वितरं वयंहो वयमीवाश्चातयस्वा विषूचीः
transliteration: tvādattebhī rudra śantamebhiḥ śataṃ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ | vyasmad dveṣo vitaraṃ vyaṃho vyamīvāścātayasvā viṣūcīḥ
translation: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters. Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 34
sanskrit: धारावरा मरुतो धर्ष्ण्वोजसो मर्गा न भीमास्तविषीभिरर्चिनः | अग्नयो न शुशुचाना रजीषिणो भर्मिं धमन्तोप गा अव्र्ण्वत
transliteration: dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛghā na bhīmāstaviṣībhirarcinaḥ | aghnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṃ dhamantoapa ghā avṛṇvata
translation: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength, Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering raincloud, have disclosed the kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 34
sanskrit: दयावो न सत्र्भिश्चितयन्त खादिनो वयभ्रिया न दयुतयन्तव्र्ष्टयः | रुद्रो यद वो मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो वर्षाजनि पर्श्न्याः शुक्र ऊधनि
transliteration: dyāvo na stṛbhiścitayanta khādino vyabhriyā na dyutayantavṛṣṭayaḥ | rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani
translation: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain. Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Prsni's radiant lap.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 34
sanskrit: उक्षन्ते अश्वानत्यानिवाजिषु नदस्य कर्णैस्तुरयन्त आशुभिः | हिरण्यशिप्रा मरुतो दविध्वतः पर्क्षं याथ पर्षतीभिः समन्यवः
transliteration: ukṣante aśvānatyānivājiṣu nadasya karṇaisturayanta āśubhiḥ | hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṃ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
translation: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way. Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake, come with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 34
sanskrit: पर्क्षे ता विश्वा भुवना ववक्षिरे मित्राय वा सदमा जीरदानवः | पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधस रजिप्यासो न वयुनेषु धूर्षदः
transliteration: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadamā jīradānavaḥ | pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ
translation: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow; Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्धन्वभिर्धेनुभी रप्शदूधभिरध्वस्मभिः पथिभिर्भ्राजद्र्ष्टयः | आ हंसासो न सवसराणि गन्तन मधोर्मदाय मरुतः समन्यवः
transliteration: indhanvabhirdhenubhī rapśadūdhabhiradhvasmabhiḥ pathibhirbhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ |
translation: With brightly-flaming kine whose udders swell with milk, with glittering lances on your unobstructed paths, O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: उपेमस्र्क्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे | अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित स सुपेशसस करति जोषिषद धि
transliteration: upemasṛkṣi vājayurigvedaacasyāṃ cano dadhīta nādyo ghiro me | apāṃ napādāśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi
translation: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour. Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: इमं सवस्मै हर्द आ सुतष्टं मन्त्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत | अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान
transliteration: imaṃ svasmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭaṃ mantraṃ vocema kuvidasya vedat | apāṃ napādasuryasya mahnā viśvānyaryo bhuvanā jajāna
translation: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it' The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: समन्या यन्त्युप यन्त्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पर्णन्ति | तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः
transliteration: samanyā yantyupa yantyanyāḥ samānamūrigvedaaṃ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti | tamū śuciṃ śucayo dīdivāṃsamapāṃ napātaṃ pari tasthurāpaḥ
translation: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse. On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: तमस्मेरा युवतयो युवानं मर्म्र्ज्यमानाः परि यन्त्यापः | स शुक्रेभिः शिक्वभी रेवदस्मे दीदायानिध्मो घर्तनिर्णिगप्सु
transliteration: tamasmerā yuvatayo yuvānaṃ marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yantyāpaḥ | sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revadasme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇighapsu
translation: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful. He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood. in waters, oil-enveloped.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: अस्मै तिस्रो अव्यथ्याय नारीर्देवाय देवीर्दिधिषन्त्यन्नम | कर्ता इवोप हि परसर्स्रे अप्सु स पीयूषं धयति पूर्वसूनाम
transliteration: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīrdevāya devīrdidhiṣantyannam | kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṃ dhayati pūrigvedaasūnām
translation: To him three Dames are offering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure. Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 35
sanskrit: अश्वस्यात्र जनिमास्य च सवर्द्रुहो रिषः सम्प्र्चः पाहिसूरीन | आमासु पूर्षु परो अप्रम्र्ष्यं नारातयो वि नशन नान्र्तानि
transliteration: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svardruho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhisūrīn |
translation: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught. Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 36
sanskrit: तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपो.अधुक्षन सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः | पिबेन्द्र सवाहा परहुतं वषत्क्र्तं होत्रादासोमं परथमो य ईशिषे
transliteration: tubhyaṃ hinvāno vasiṣṭa ghā apo.adhukṣan sīmavibhiradribhirnaraḥ | pibendra svāhā prahutaṃ vaṣatkṛtaṃ hotrādāsomaṃ prathamo ya īśiṣe
translation: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones. Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowl first right is thine-Soma hallowed and poured with Vasat and Svaha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 36
sanskrit: यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अञ्जिषु परिया उत | आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः
transliteration: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhirṛṣṭibhiryāmañchubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta |
translation: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends, Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 37
sanskrit: मन्दस्व होत्रादनु जोषमन्धसो.अध्वर्यवः स पूर्णांवष्ट्यासिचम | तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशो ददिर्होत्राद सोमं दरविणोदः पिब रतुभिः
transliteration: mandasva hotrādanu joṣamandhaso.adhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṃvaṣṭyāsicam | tasmā etaṃ bharata tadvaśo dadirhotrād somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
translation: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him. Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Hotar's cup.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 37
sanskrit: यमु पूर्वमहुवे तमिदं हुवे सेदु हव्यो ददिर्यो नाम पत्यते | अध्वर्युभिः परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पोत्रात सोमं द. प. र.
transliteration: yamu pūrigvedaamahuve tamidaṃ huve sedu havyo dadiryo nāma patyate | adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu potrāt somaṃ d. p. ṛ.
translation: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives, Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Potar's cup.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 37
sanskrit: मेद्यन्तु ते वह्नयो येभिरीयसे.अरिषण्यन वीळयस्वा वनस्पते | आयूया धर्ष्णो अभिगूर्या तवं नेष्ट्रात सोमं ...
transliteration: medyantu te vahnayo yebhirīyase.ariṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate |
translation: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself. Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Nestar's cup.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात | नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद वीतिहोत्रं सवस्तौ
transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṃ tadapā vahnirasthāt | nūnaṃ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnamathābhajad vītihotraṃ svastau
translation: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty. To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 38
sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि शरुष्टये देव ऊर्ध्वः पर बाहवा पर्थुपाणिः सिसर्ति | आपश्चिदस्य वरत आ निम्र्ग्रा अयं चिद वातो रमते परिज्मन
transliteration: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti |
translation: Having gone up on high, the God broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him. Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 39
sanskrit: गरावाणेव तदिदथं जरेथे गर्ध्रेव वर्क्षं निधिमन्तमछ | बरह्माणेव विदथ उक्थशासा दूतेव हव्या जन्या पुरुत्रा
transliteration: ghrāvāṇeva tadidathaṃ jarethe ghṛdhreva vṛkṣaṃ nidhimantamacha | brahmāṇeva vidatha ukthaśāsā dūteva havyā janyā purutrā
translation: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure; Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 39
sanskrit: परातर्यावाणा रथ्येव वीराजेव यमा वरमा सचेथे | मेने इव तन्वा शुम्भमाने दम्पतीव करतुविदा जनेषु
transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā rathyeva vīrājeva yamā varamā sacethe | mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatīva kratuvidā janeṣu
translation: Moving at morning like two chr-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing; Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 40
sanskrit: सोमापूषणा जनना रयीणां जनना दिवो जनना पर्थिव्याः | जातौ विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपौ देवा अक्र्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य नाभिम
transliteration: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇāṃ jananā divo jananā pṛthivyāḥ | jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya ghopau devā akṛṇvannamṛtasya nābhim
translation: SOMA and Pusan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven, You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इमौ देवौ जायमानौ जुषन्तेमौ तमांसि गूहतामजुष्टा | आभ्यामिन्द्रः पक्वमामास्वन्तः सोमापूषभ्यां जनदुस्रियासु
transliteration: imau devau jāyamānau juṣantemau tamāṃsi ghūhatāmajuṣṭā |
translation: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish. With these, with Soma and with Pusan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 41
sanskrit: वायो ये ते सहस्रिणो रथासस्तेभिरा गहि | नियुत्वान सोमपीतये
transliteration: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsastebhirā ghahi | niyutvān somapītaye
translation: O VAYU, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine, Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 41
sanskrit: नियुत्वान वायवा गह्ययं शुक्रो अयामि ते | गन्तासि सुन्वतो गर्हम
transliteration: niyutvān vāyavā ghahyayaṃ śukro ayāmi te | ghantāsi sunvato ghṛham
translation: Drawn by thy team, O Vayu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure. Thou visitest the presser's house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 42
sanskrit: कनिक्रदज्जनुषं परब्रुवाण इयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम | सुमङगलश्च शकुने भवासि मा तवा का चिदभिभा विश्व्या विदत
transliteration: kanikradajjanuṣaṃ prabruvāṇa iyarti vācamariteva nāvam | sumaṅghalaśca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cidabhibhā viśvyā vidat
translation: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman. O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 42
sanskrit: मा तवा शयेन उद वधीन मा सुपर्णो मा तवा विददिषुमान्वीरो अस्ता | पित्र्यामनु परदिशं कनिक्रदत सुमङगलो भद्रवादी वदेह
transliteration: mā tvā śyena ud vadhīn mā suparṇo mā tvā vidadiṣumānvīro astā | pitryāmanu pradiśaṃ kanikradat sumaṅghalo bhadravādī vadeha
translation: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee. Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अव करन्द दक्षिणतो गर्हाणां सुमङगलो भद्रवादी शकुन्ते | मा न सतेन ईशत माघशंसो बर्हद ...
transliteration: ava kranda dakṣiṇato ghṛhāṇāṃ sumaṅghalo bhadravādī śakunte | mā na stena īśata māghaśaṃso bṛhad ...
translation: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings, So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 43
sanskrit: परदक्षिनिदभि गर्णन्ति कारवो वयो वदन्त रतुथा शकुन्तयः | उभे वाचौ वदति सामगा इव गायत्रं च तरैष्टुभं चानु राजति
transliteration: pradakṣinidabhi ghṛṇanti kāravo vayo vadanta ṛtuthā śakuntayaḥ | ubhe vācau vadati sāmaghā iva ghāyatraṃ ca traiṣṭubhaṃ cānu rājati
translation: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak. He, like: a Sama-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Trstup and of Gayatri.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 2 Hymn 43
sanskrit: उद्गातेव शकुने साम गायसि बरह्मपुत्र इव सवनेषु शंससि | वर्षेव वाजी शिशुमतीरपीत्या सर्वतो नः शकुने भद्रमा वद विश्वतो नः शकुने पुण्यमा वद
transliteration: udghāteva śakune sāma ghāyasi brahmaputra iva savaneṣu śaṃsasi | vṛṣeva vājī śiśumatīrapītyā sarigvedaato naḥ śakune bhadramā vada viśvato naḥ śakune puṇyamā vada
translation: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sama, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son. Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good fortune, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 1
sanskrit: सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै | देवानछा दीद्यद युञ्जे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वंजुषस्व
transliteration: somasya mā tavasaṃ vakṣyaghne vahniṃ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai | devānachā dīdyad yuñje adriṃ śamāye aghne tanvaṃjuṣasva
translation: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly. Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the press stones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 1
sanskrit: पराञ्चं यज्ञं चक्र्म वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन | दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गर्त्साय चित तवसे गातुमीषुः
transliteration: prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛma vardhatāṃ ghīḥ samidbhiraghniṃ namasā duvasyan | divaḥ śaśāsurigvedadathā kavīnāṃ ghṛtsāya cit tavase ghātumīṣuḥ
translation: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni. From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: c'en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 1
sanskrit: मयो दधे मेधिरः पूतदक्षो दिवः सुबन्धुर्जनुषा पर्थिव्याः | अविन्दन्नु दर्शतमप्स्वन्तर्देवासो अग्निमपसि सवसॄणाम
transliteration: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhurjanuṣā pṛthivyāḥ | avindannu darśatamapsvantardevāso aghnimapasi svasṝṇām
translation: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship. The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अवर्धयन सुभगं सप्त यह्वीः शवेतं जज्ञानमरुषम्महित्वा | शिशुं न जातमभ्यारुरश्वा देवासो अग्निंजनिमन वपुष्यन
transliteration: avardhayan subhaghaṃ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṃ jajñānamaruṣammahitvā |
translation: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty. As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वैश्वानराय धिषणां रताव्र्धे घर्तं न पूतमग्नयेजनामसि | दविता होतारं मनुषश्च वाघतो धिया रथंन कुलिशः सं रण्वति
transliteration: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇāṃ ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṃ na pūtamaghnayejanāmasi | dvitā hotāraṃ manuṣaśca vāghato dhiyā rathaṃna kuliśaḥ saṃ ṛṇvati
translation: To him, Vaisvanara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure. With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 2
sanskrit: स रोचयज्जनुषा रोदसी उभे स मात्रोरभवत पुत्र ईड्यः | हव्यवाळ अग्निरजरश्चनोहितो दूळभो विशामतिथिर्विभावसुः
transliteration: sa rocayajjanuṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātrorabhavat putra īḍyaḥ | havyavāḷ aghnirajaraścanohito dūḷabho viśāmatithirigvedabhāvasuḥ
translation: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored, Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 2
sanskrit: करत्वा दक्षस्य तरुषो विधर्मणि देवासो अग्निं जनयन्त चित्तिभिः | रुरुचानं भानुना जयोतिषा महामत्यं न वाजं सनिष्यन्नुप बरुवे
transliteration: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso aghniṃ janayanta cittibhiḥ | rurucānaṃ bhānunā jyotiṣā mahāmatyaṃ na vājaṃ saniṣyannupa bruve
translation: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought. I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 3
sanskrit: वैश्वानराय पर्थुपाजसे विपो रत्ना विधन्त धरुणेषु गातवे | अग्निर्हि देवानम्र्तो दुवस्यत्यथा धर्माणि सनता न दूदुषत
transliteration: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu ghātave | aghnirhi devānamṛto duvasyatyathā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat
translation: To him who shines afar, Vaisvanara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अन्तर्दूतो रोदसी दस्म ईयते होता निषत्तो मनुषः पुरोहितः | कषयं बर्हन्तं परि भूषति दयुभिर्देवेभिरग्निरिषितो धियावसुः
transliteration: antardūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ | kṣayaṃ bṛhantaṃ pari bhūṣati dyubhirdevebhiraghniriṣito dhiyāvasuḥ
translation: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men. He compasseth with rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 3
sanskrit: केतुं यज्ञानां विदथस्य सा धनं विप्रासो अग्निं महयन्त चित्तिभिः | अपांसि यस्मिन्नधि सन्दधुर्गिरस्तस्मिन सुम्नानि यजमान आ चके
transliteration: ketuṃ yajñānāṃ vidathasya sā dhanaṃ viprāso aghniṃ mahayanta cittibhiḥ | apāṃsi yasminnadhi sandadhurghirastasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake
translation: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 3
sanskrit: पिता यज्ञानामसुरो विपश्चितां विमानमग्निर्वयुनं च वाघताम | आ विवेश रोदसी भूरिवर्पसा पुरुप्रियो भन्दते धामभिः कविः
transliteration: pitā yajñānāmasuro vipaścitāṃ vimānamaghnirigvedaayunaṃ ca vāghatām |
translation: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests, Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 4
sanskrit: समित-समित सुमना बोध्यस्मे शुचा-शुचा सुमतिं रासि वस्वः | आ देव देवान यजथाय वक्षि सखा सखीन सुमना यक्ष्यग्ने
transliteration: samit-samit sumanā bodhyasme śucā-śucā sumatiṃ rāsi vasvaḥ |
translation: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches. Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 5
sanskrit: परत्यग्निरुषसश्चेकितानो.अबोधि विप्रः पदवीः कवीनाम | पर्थुपाजा देवयद्भिः समिद्धो.अप दवारा तमसो वह्निरावः
transliteration: pratyaghniruṣasaścekitāno.abodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām | pṛthupājā devayadbhiḥ samiddho.apa dvārā tamaso vahnirāvaḥ
translation: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages. With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 5
sanskrit: परेद वग्निर्वाव्र्धे सतोमेभिर्गीर्भि सतोतॄणां नमस्य उक्थैः | पूर्वीर्र्तस्य सन्द्र्शश्चकानः सं दूतो अद्यौदुषसो विरोके
transliteration: pred vaghnirigvedaāvṛdhe stomebhirghīrbhi stotṝṇāṃ namasya ukthaiḥ | pūrigvedaīrṛtasya sandṛśaścakānaḥ saṃ dūto adyauduṣaso viroke
translation: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him. Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 5
sanskrit: अधाय्यग्निर्मानुषीषु विक्ष्वपां गर्भो मित्र रतेन साधन | आ हर्यतो यजतः सान्वस्थादभूदु विप्रो हव्योमतीनाम
transliteration: adhāyyaghnirmānuṣīṣu vikṣvapāṃ gharbho mitra ṛtena sādhan |
translation: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters. Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 6
sanskrit: पर कारवो मनना वच्यमाना देवद्रीचीं नयत देवयन्तः | दक्षिणावाड वाजिनी पराच्येति हविर्भरन्त्यग्नये घर्ताची
transliteration: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṃ nayata devayantaḥ | dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācyeti havirbharantyaghnaye ghṛtācī
translation: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle. Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 7
sanskrit: पर य आरुः शितिप्र्ष्ठस्य धासेरा मातरा विविशुः सप्त वाणीः | परिक्षिता पितरा सं चरेते पर सर्स्राते दीर्घमायुः परयक्षे
transliteration: pra ya āruḥ śitipṛṣṭhasya dhāserā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ | parikṣitā pitarā saṃ carete pra sarsrāte dīrghamāyuḥ prayakṣe
translation: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers. Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 7
sanskrit: दिवक्षसो धेनवो वर्ष्णो अश्वा देवीरा तस्थौ मधुमद वहन्तीः | रतस्य तवा सदसि कषेमयन्तं पर्येका चरति वर्तनिं गौः
transliteration: divakṣaso dhenavo vṛṣṇo aśvā devīrā tasthau madhumad vahantīḥ |
translation: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milch kine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure. To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 8
sanskrit: अञ्जन्ति तवामध्वरे देवयन्तो वनस्पते मधुना दैव्येन | यदूर्ध्वस्तिष्ठा दरविणेह धत्ताद यद वा कषयो मातुरस्या उपस्थे
transliteration: añjanti tvāmadhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena | yadūrdhvastiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo māturasyā upasthe
translation: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee. Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 8
sanskrit: समिद्धस्य शरयमाणः पुरस्ताद बरह्म वन्वानो अजरं सुवीरम | आरे अस्मदमतिं बाधमान उच्छ्रयस्व महते सौभगाय
transliteration: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṃ suvīram |
translation: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero. Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 9
sanskrit: सखायस्त्वा वव्र्महे देवं मर्तास ऊतये | अपां नपातंसुभगं सुदीदितिं सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम
transliteration: sakhāyastvā vavṛmahe devaṃ martāsa ūtaye | apāṃ napātaṃsubhaghaṃ sudīditiṃ supratūrtimanehasam
translation: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help, The Waters' Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 9
sanskrit: कायमानो वना तवं यन मातॄरजगन्नपः | न तत तेग्ने परम्र्षे निवर्तनं यद दूरे सन्निहाभवः
transliteration: kāyamāno vanā tvaṃ yan mātṝrajaghannapaḥ | na tat teaghne pramṛṣe nivartanaṃ yad dūre sannihābhavaḥ
translation: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams, Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अति तर्ष्टं ववक्षिथाथैव सुमना असि | पर-परान्ये यन्ति पर्यन्य आसते येषां सख्ये असि शरितः
transliteration: ati tṛṣṭaṃ vavakṣithāthaiva sumanā asi | pra-prānye yanti paryanya āsate yeṣāṃ sakhye asi śritaḥ
translation: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent. Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तवामग्ने मनीषिणः सम्राजं चर्षणीनाम | देवं मर्तास इन्धते समध्वरे
transliteration: tvāmaghne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām | devaṃ martāsa indhate samadhvare
translation: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men With understanding kindle at the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजमग्ने होतारमीळते | गोपा रतस्य दीदिहि सवे दमे
transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijamaghne hotāramīḷate | ghopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame
translation: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest, Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: स घा यस्ते ददाशति समिधा जातवेदसे | सो अग्ने धत्तेसुवीर्यं स पुष्यति
transliteration: sa ghā yaste dadāśati samidhā jātavedase | so aghne dhattesuvīryaṃ sa puṣyati
translation: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life, He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: स केतुरध्वराणामग्निर्देवेभिरा गमत | अञ्जानः सप्त होत्र्भिर्हविष्मते
transliteration: sa keturadhvarāṇāmaghnirdevebhirā ghamat | añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhirhaviṣmate
translation: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us, Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: पर होत्रे पूर्व्यं वचो.अग्नये भरता बर्हत | विपां जयोतींषि बिभ्रते न वेधसे
transliteration: pra hotre pūrigvedayaṃ vaco.aghnaye bharatā bṛhat | vipāṃ jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase
translation: To Agni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech, To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो यतो जायत उक्थ्यः | महे वाजायद्रविणाय दर्शतः
transliteration: aghniṃ vardhantu no ghiro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ | mahe vājāyadraviṇāya darśataḥ
translation: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life, To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: अग्ने यजिष्ठो अध्वरे देवान देवयते यज | होता मन्द्रो विराजस्यति सरिधः
transliteration: aghne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja | hotā mandro virājasyati sridhaḥ
translation: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: स नः पावक दीदिहि दयुमदस्मे सुवीर्यम | भवा सतोत्र्भ्योन्तमः सवस्तये
transliteration: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumadasme suvīryam | bhavā stotṛbhyoantamaḥ svastaye
translation: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तं तवा विप्रा विपन्यवो जाग्र्वांसः समिन्धते | हव्यवाहममर्त्यं सहोव्र्धम
transliteration: taṃ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāghṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate | havyavāhamamartyaṃ sahovṛdham
translation: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee. Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अग्निर्होता पुरोहितो.अध्वरस्य विचर्षणिः | स वेद यज्ञमानुषक
transliteration: aghnirhotā purohito.adhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ | sa veda yajñamānuṣak
translation: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act: He knows the rite in constant course.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: स हव्यवाळ अमर्त्य उशिग दूतस चनोहितः | अग्निर्धिया सं रण्वति
transliteration: sa havyavāḷ amartya uśigh dūtas canohitaḥ | aghnirdhiyā saṃ ṛṇvati
translation: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger, Agni comes nigh us with the thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अग्निर्धिया स चेतति केतुर्यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः | अर्थं हयस्य तरणि
transliteration: aghnirdhiyā sa cetati keturyajñasya pūrigvedayaḥ | arthaṃ hyasya taraṇi
translation: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought To prosper this man's aim and hope.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अग्निं सूनुं सनश्रुतं सहसो जातवेदसम | वह्निं देवाक्र्ण्वत
transliteration: aghniṃ sūnuṃ sanaśrutaṃ sahaso jātavedasam | vahniṃ devāakṛṇvata
translation: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life, The Gods have made to their Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अदाभ्यः पुरेता विशामग्निर्मानुषीणाम | तूर्णी रथः सदा नवः
transliteration: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśāmaghnirmānuṣīṇām | tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
translation: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men, A chariot swift and ever new.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: साह्वान विश्वा अभियुजः करतुर्देवानामम्र्क्तः | अग्निस्तुविश्रवस्तमः
transliteration: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kraturdevānāmamṛktaḥ | aghnistuviśravastamaḥ
translation: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies, Agni is mightiest in fame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अभि परयांसि वाहसा दाश्वानश्नोति मर्त्यः | कषयं पावकशोचिषः
transliteration: abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvānaśnoti martyaḥ | kṣayaṃ pāvakaśociṣaḥ
translation: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains. A home from him whose light makes pure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: परि विश्वानि सुधिताग्नेरश्याम मन्मभिः | विप्रासो जातवेदसः
transliteration: pari viśvāni sudhitāghneraśyāma manmabhiḥ | viprāso jātavedasaḥ
translation: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness, Singers of him who knows all life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वानि वार्या वाजेषु सनिषामहे | तवे देवास एरिरे
transliteration: aghne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe | tve devāsa erire
translation: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things: The Gods are centred all in thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं सुतं गीर्भिर्नभो वरेण्यम | अस्य पातं धियेषिता
transliteration: indrāghnī ā ghataṃ sutaṃ ghīrbhirnabho vareṇyam | asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā
translation: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew: Drink ye thereof, impelled by song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी जरितुः सचा यज्ञो जिगाति चेतनः | अया पातमिमं सुतम
transliteration: indrāghnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jighāti cetanaḥ | ayā pātamimaṃ sutam
translation: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite: So drink ye both this juice assured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इन्द्रमग्निं कविछदा यज्ञस्य जूत्या वर्णे | ता सोमस्येह तर्म्पताम
transliteration: indramaghniṃ kavichadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe | tā somasyeha tṛmpatām
translation: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise: With Sorna let these sate them here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: तोशा वर्त्रहणा हुवे सजित्वानापराजिता | इन्द्राग्नी वाजसातमा
transliteration: tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā | indrāghnī vājasātamā
translation: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued, Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: पर वामर्चन्त्युक्थिनो नीथाविदो जरितारः | इन्द्राग्नी इष आ वर्णे
transliteration: pra vāmarcantyukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ | indrāghnī iṣa ā vṛṇe
translation: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds: I choose you for the sacred food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी नवतिं पुरो दासपत्नीरधूनुतम | साकमेकेन कर्मणा
transliteration: indrāghnī navatiṃ puro dāsapatnīradhūnutam | sākamekena karmaṇā
translation: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which DAsas held, Together, with one mighty deed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी अपसस पर्युप पर यन्ति धीतयः | रतस्य पथ्या अनु
transliteration: indrāghnī apasas paryupa pra yanti dhītayaḥ |
translation: To Indra-Agni reverent thoughts go forward from the holy task Along the path of sacred Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 13
sanskrit: पर वो देवायाग्नये बर्हिष्ठमर्चास्मै | गमद देवेभिरास नो यजिष्ठो बर्हिरा सदत
transliteration: pra vo devāyāghnaye barhiṣṭhamarcāsmai | ghamad devebhirāsa no yajiṣṭho barhirā sadat
translation: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power. May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: आ होता मन्द्रो विदथान्यस्थात सत्यो यज्वा कवितमः सवेधाः | विद्युद्रथः सहसस पुत्रो अग्निः शोचिष्केशः पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत
transliteration: vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro aghniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret
translation: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer. Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अयामि ते नमौक्तिं जुषस्व रतावस्तुभ्यं चेतते सहस्वः | विद्वाना वक्षि विदुषो नि षत्सि मध्य आ बर्हिरूतये यजत्र
transliteration: ayāmi te namauktiṃ juṣasva ṛtāvastubhyaṃ cetate sahasvaḥ | vidvānā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhirūtaye yajatra
translation: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful! Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: दरवतां त उषसा वाजयन्ती अग्ने वातस्य पथ्याभिरछ | यत सीमञ्जन्ति पूर्व्यं हविर्भिरा वन्धुरेव तस्थतुर्दुरोणे
transliteration: dravatāṃ ta uṣasā vājayantī aghne vātasya pathyābhiracha | yat sīmañjanti pūrigvedayaṃ havirbhirā vandhureva tasthaturduroṇe
translation: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni. When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: मित्रश्च तुभ्यं वरुणः सहस्वो.अग्ने विश्वे मरुतः सुम्नमर्चन | यच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र तिष्ठा अभि कषितीः परथयन सूर्यो नॄन
transliteration: mitraśca tubhyaṃ varuṇaḥ sahasvo.aghne viśve marutaḥ sumnamarcan | yacchociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn
translation: To thee, strong Agni! Varuna and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph, What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: वयं ते अद्य ररिमा हि काममुत्तानहस्ता नमसोपसद्य | यजिष्ठेन मनसा यक्षि देवानस्रेधता मन्मना विप्रो अग्ने
transliteration: vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmamuttānahastā namasopasadya | yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devānasredhatā manmanā vipro aghne
translation: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing. Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: तवद धि पुत्र सहसो वि पूर्वीर्देवस्य यन्त्यूतयो वि वाजाः | तवं देहि सहस्रिणं रयिं नो.अद्रोघेण वचसा सत्यमग्ने
transliteration: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrigvedaīrdevasya yantyūtayo vi vājāḥ | tvaṃ dehi sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ no.adrogheṇa vacasā satyamaghne
translation: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses. Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 14
sanskrit: तुभ्यं दक्ष कविक्रतो यानीमा देव मर्तासो अध्वरे अकर्म | तवं विश्वस्य सुरथस्य बोधि सर्वं तदग्ने अम्र्त सवदेह
transliteration: tubhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma | tvaṃ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarigvedaaṃ tadaghne amṛta svadeha
translation: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose! Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: वि पाजसा पर्थुना शोशुचानो बाधस्व दविषो रक्षसो अमीवाः | सुशर्मणो बर्हतः शर्मणि सयामग्नेरहं सुहवस्य परणीतौ
transliteration: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ | suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syāmaghnerahaṃ suhavasya praṇītau
translation: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवं नो अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ तवं सूर उदिते बोधि गोपाः | जन्मेव नित्यं तनयं जुषस्व सतोमं मे अग्ने तन्वा सुजात
transliteration: tvaṃ no asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau tvaṃ sūra udite bodhi ghopāḥ | janmeva nityaṃ tanayaṃ juṣasva stomaṃ me aghne tanvā sujāta
translation: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted.. Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवं नर्चक्षा वर्षभानु पूर्वीः कर्ष्णास्वग्ने अरुषो विभाहि | वसो नेषि च पर्षि चात्यंहः कर्धी नो राय उशिजो यविष्ठ
transliteration: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā vṛṣabhānu pūrigvedaīḥ kṛṣṇāsvaghne aruṣo vibhāhi | vaso neṣi ca parṣi cātyaṃhaḥ kṛdhī no rāya uśijo yaviṣṭha
translation: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni. Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अषाळ्हो अग्ने वर्षभो दिदीहि पुरो विश्वाः सौभगा संजिगीवान | यज्ञस्य नेता परथमस्य पायोर्जातवेदो बर्हतः सुप्रणीते
transliteration: aṣāḷho aghne vṛṣabho didīhi puro viśvāḥ saubhaghā saṃjighīvān | yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyorjātavedo bṛhataḥ supraṇīte
translation: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures, Thou Jatavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अछिद्रा शर्म जरितः पुरूणि देवानछा दीद्यानः सुमेधाः | रथो न सस्निरभि वक्षि वाजमगने तवं रोदसीनः सुमेके
transliteration: achidrā śarma jaritaḥ purūṇi devānachā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ | ratho na sasnirabhi vakṣi vājamaghne tvaṃ rodasīnaḥ sumeke
translation: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters. Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: पर पीपय वर्षभ जिन्व वाजानग्ने तवं रोदसी नः सुदोघे | देवेभिर्देव सुरुचा रुचानो मा नो मर्तस्य दुर्मतिः परि षठात
transliteration: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājānaghne tvaṃ rodasī naḥ sudoghe | devebhirdeva surucā rucāno mā no martasya durmatiḥ pari ṣṭhāt
translation: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e'en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty, Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 15
sanskrit: इळामग्ने ...
transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...
translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 16
sanskrit: अयमग्निः सुवीर्यस्येशे महः सौभगस्य | राय ईशे सवपत्यस्य गोमत ईशे वर्त्रहथानाम
transliteration: ayamaghniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhaghasya | rāya īśe svapatyasya ghomata īśe vṛtrahathānām
translation: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength; Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 16
sanskrit: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चता वर्धं यस्मिन रायः शेव्र्धासः | अभि ये सन्ति पर्तनासु दूढ्यो विश्वाहा शत्रुमादभुः
transliteration: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṃ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ | abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrumādabhuḥ
translation: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth; Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स तवं नो रायः शिशीहि मीढ्वो अग्ने सुविर्यस्य | तुविद्युम्न वर्षिष्ठस्य परजावतो.अनमीवस्य शुष्मिणः
transliteration: sa tvaṃ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo aghne suviryasya | tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato.anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translation: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One! Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 16
sanskrit: चक्रिर्यो विश्वा भुवनाभि सासहिश्चक्रिर्देवेष्वा दुवः | आ देवेषु यतत आ सुवीर्य आ शंस उत नर्णाम
transliteration: cakriryo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiścakrirdeveṣvā duvaḥ |
translation: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods, He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 17
sanskrit: समिध्यमानः परथमानु धर्मा समक्तुभिरज्यते विश्ववारः | शोचिष्केशो घर्तनिर्णिक पावकः सुयज्ञो अग्निर्यजथाय देवान
transliteration: samidhyamānaḥ prathamānu dharmā samaktubhirajyate viśvavāraḥ |
translation: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,- Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 18
sanskrit: भवा नो अग्ने सुमना उपेतौ सखेव सख्ये पितरेव साधुः | पुरुद्रुहो हि कषितयो जनानां परति परतीचीर्दहतादरातीः
transliteration: bhavā no aghne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ | purudruho hi kṣitayo janānāṃ prati pratīcīrdahatādarātīḥ
translation: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother. The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तपो शवग्ने अन्तरानमित्रान तपा शंसमररुषः परस्य | तपो वसो चिकितानो अचित्तान वि ते तिष्ठन्तामजरा अयासः
transliteration: tapo śvaghne antarānamitrān tapā śaṃsamararuṣaḥ parasya | tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantāmajarā ayāsaḥ
translation: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship. Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 18
sanskrit: इध्मेनाग्न इछमानो घर्तेन जुहोमि हव्यं तरसे बलाय | यावदीशे बरह्मणा वन्दमान इमां धियं शतसेयाय देवीम
transliteration: idhmenāghna ichamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya | yāvadīśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm
translation: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest, With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 18
sanskrit: उच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र सतुतो बर्हद वयः शशमानेषु धेहि | रेवदग्ने विश्वामित्रेषु शं योर्मर्म्र्ज्मा ते तन्वं भूरि कर्त्वः
transliteration: ucchociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi | revadaghne viśvāmitreṣu śaṃ yormarmṛjmā te tanvaṃ bhūri kṛtvaḥ
translation: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee. Give richly, Agni, to the Visvamitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 18
sanskrit: कर्धि रत्नं सुसनितर्धनानां स घेदग्ने भवसि यत समिद्धः | सतोतुर्दुरोणे सुभगस्य रेवत सर्प्रा करस्ना दधिषे वपूंषि
transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ susanitardhanānāṃ sa ghedaghne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ | stoturduroṇe subhaghasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi
translation: Give us, O liberal Lord, great store of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled. Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अग्निं होतारं पर वर्णे मियेधे गर्त्सं कविं विश्वविदममूरम | स नो यक्षद देवताता यजीयान राये वाजाय वनतेमघानि
transliteration: aghniṃ hotāraṃ pra vṛṇe miyedhe ghṛtsaṃ kaviṃ viśvavidamamūram | sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanatemaghāni
translation: How, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation. In our Gods' service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पर ते अग्ने हविष्मतीमियर्म्यछा सुद्युम्नां रातिनीं घर्ताचीम | परदक्षिणिद देवतातिमुराणः सं रातिभिर्वसुभिर्यज्ञमश्रेत
transliteration: pra te aghne haviṣmatīmiyarmyachā sudyumnāṃ rātinīṃ ghṛtācīm | pradakṣiṇid devatātimurāṇaḥ saṃ rātibhirigvedaasubhiryajñamaśret
translation: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation. From the right hand, choosing the Gods' attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 19
sanskrit: स तेजीयसा मनसा तवोत उत शिक्ष सवपत्यस्य शिक्षोः | अग्ने रायो नर्तमस्य परभूतौ भूयाम ते सुष्टुतयश्च वस्वः
transliteration: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ | aghne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaśca vasvaḥ
translation: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely. In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 19
sanskrit: भूरीणि हि तवे दधिरे अनीकाग्ने देवस्य यज्यवो जनासः | स आ वह देवतातिं यविष्ठ शर्धो यदद्य दिव्यंयजासि
transliteration: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāghne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ | sa ā vaha devatātiṃ yaviṣṭha śardho yadadya divyaṃyajāsi
translation: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect. So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods' asserrigly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 19
sanskrit: यत तवा होतारमनजन मियेधे निषादयन्तो यजथाय देवाः | स तवं नो अग्ने.अवितेह बोध्यधि शरवांसि धेहि नस्तनूषु
transliteration: yat tvā hotāramanajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ | sa tvaṃ no aghne.aviteha bodhyadhi śravāṃsi dhehi nastanūṣu
translation: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer, O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां वयुष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः | सुज्योतिषो नः शर्ण्वन्तु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः
transliteration: aghnimuṣasamaśvinā dadhikrāṃ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnirukthaiḥ | sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṃ vāvaśānāḥ
translation: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikras, and both the Asvins. With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अग्ने तरी ते वाजिना तरी षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा रतजात पूर्वीः | तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुछन
transliteration: aghne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisraste jihvā ṛtajāta pūrigvedaīḥ | tisra u te tanvo devavātāstābhirnaḥ pāhi ghiro aprayuchan
translation: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order! Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अग्ने भूरीणि तव जातवेदो देव सवधावो.अम्र्तस्य नाम | याश्च माया मायिनां विश्वमिन्व तवे पूर्वीः सन्दधुःप्र्ष्टबन्धो
transliteration: aghne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo.amṛtasya nāma | yāśca māyā māyināṃ viśvaminva tve pūrigvedaīḥ sandadhuḥpṛṣṭabandho
translation: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jatavedas. And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अग्निर्नेता भग इव कषितीनां दैवीनां देव रतुपा रतावा | स वर्त्रहा सनयो विश्ववेदाः पर्षद विश्वाति दुरिता गर्णन्तम
transliteration: aghnirnetā bhagha iva kṣitīnāṃ daivīnāṃ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā | sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā ghṛṇantam
translation: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons. Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vrtra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 20
sanskrit: ददहिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीं बर्हस्पतिं सवितारं चदेवम | अश्विना मित्रावरुणा भगं च वसून रुद्रानादित्यानिह हुवे
transliteration: dadahikrāmaghnimuṣasaṃ ca devīṃ bṛhaspatiṃ savitāraṃ cadevam | aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhaghaṃ ca vasūn rudrānādityāniha huve
translation: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Brhaspati, and Dadhikras, and Agni, On Varuna and Mitra, on the Asvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Adityas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इमं नो यज्ञमम्र्तेषु धेहीमा हव्या जातवेदो जुषस्व | सतोकानामग्ने मेदसो घर्तस्य होतः पराशान परथमो निषद्य
transliteration: imaṃ no yajñamamṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva | stokānāmaghne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya
translation: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jatavedas. O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 21
sanskrit: घर्तवन्तः पावक ते सतोका शचोतन्ति मेदसः | सवधर्मन देववीतये शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यम
transliteration: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ | svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryam
translation: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil. After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तुभ्यं सतोका घर्तश्चुतो.अग्ने विप्राय सन्त्य | रषिः शरेष्ठः समिध्यसे यज्ञस्य पराविता भव
transliteration: tubhyaṃ stokā ghṛtaścuto.aghne viprāya santya |
translation: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil. Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अयं सो अग्निर्यस्मिन सोममिन्द्रः सुतं दधे जठरे वावशानः | सहस्रिणं वाजमत्यं न सप्तिं ससवान सन सतूयसे जातवेदः
transliteration: ayaṃ so aghniryasmin somamindraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ | sahasriṇaṃ vājamatyaṃ na saptiṃ sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
translation: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body. Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अग्ने यत ते दिवि वर्चः पर्थिव्यां यदोषधीष्वप्स्वा यजत्र | येनान्तरिक्षमुर्वाततन्थ तवेषः स भानुरर्णवो नर्चक्षाः
transliteration: aghne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yadoṣadhīṣvapsvā yajatra | yenāntarikṣamurigvedaātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānurarṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ
translation: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters, Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, man-beholding.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अग्ने दिवो अर्णमछा जिगास्यछा देवानूचिषे धिष्ण्याये | या रोचने परस्तात सूर्यस्य याश्चावस्तादुपतिष्ठण्त आपः
transliteration: aghne divo arṇamachā jighāsyachā devānūciṣe dhiṣṇyāye | yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāścāvastādupatiṣṭhaṇta āpaḥ
translation: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit. The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 22
sanskrit: पुरीष्यासो अग्नयः परावणेभिः सजोषसः | जुषन्तां यज्ञमद्रुहो.अनमीवा इषो महीः
transliteration: purīṣyāso aghnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ | juṣantāṃ yajñamadruho.anamīvā iṣo mahīḥ
translation: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods, Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 22
sanskrit: इळामग्ने ...
transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...
translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 23
sanskrit: निर्मथितः सुधित आ सधस्थे युवा कविरध्वरस्य परणेता | जूर्यत्स्वग्निरजरो वनेष्वत्रा दधे अम्र्तं जातवेदाः
transliteration: nirmathitaḥ sudhita ā sadhasthe yuvā kaviradhvarasya praṇetā | jūryatsvaghnirajaro vaneṣvatrā dadhe amṛtaṃ jātavedāḥ
translation: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful, Here in the wasting fuel Jatavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 23
sanskrit: अमन्थिष्टां भारता रेवदग्निं देवश्रवा देववातः सुदक्षम | अग्ने वि पश्य बर्हताभि रायेषां नो नेता भवतादनु दयून
transliteration: amanthiṣṭāṃ bhāratā revadaghniṃ devaśravā devavātaḥ sudakṣam | aghne vi paśya bṛhatābhi rāyeṣāṃ no netā bhavatādanu dyūn
translation: Both Bharatas, Devasravas, Devavata, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni. O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 23
sanskrit: दश कषिपः पूर्व्यं सीमजीजनन सुजातं मात्र्षु परियम | अग्निं सतुहि दैववातं देवश्रवो यो जनानामसद वशी
transliteration: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrigvedayaṃ sīmajījanan sujātaṃ mātṛṣu priyam | aghniṃ stuhi daivavātaṃ devaśravo yo janānāmasad vaśī
translation: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear. Praise Devavata's Agni, thou Devasravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 23
sanskrit: नि तवा दधे वर आ पर्थिव्या इळायास पदे सुदिनत्वे अह्नाम | दर्षद्वत्यां मानुष आपयायां सरस्वत्यां रेवदग्नेदिदीहि
transliteration: ni tvā dadhe vara ā pṛthivyā iḷāyās pade sudinatve ahnām | dṛṣadvatyāṃ mānuṣa āpayāyāṃ sarasvatyāṃ revadaghnedidīhi
translation: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Ila's place, in days of fair bright weather. On man, on Apaya, Agni! on the rivers Drsadvati, Sarasvati, shine richly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 23
sanskrit: इळामग्ने ...
transliteration: iḷāmaghne ...
translation: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels. To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्ने सहस्व पर्तना अभिमातीरपास्य | दुष्टरस्तरन्नरातीर्वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे
transliteration: aghne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīrapāsya | duṣṭarastarannarātīrigvedaarco dhā yajñavāhase
translation: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away. Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्न इळा समिध्यसे वीतिहोत्रो अमर्त्यः | जुषस्व सू नो अध्वरम
transliteration: aghna iḷā samidhyase vītihotro amartyaḥ | juṣasva sū no adhvaram
translation: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast, Accept our sacrifice with joy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्ने दयुम्नेन जाग्र्वे सहसः सूनवाहुत | एदं बर्हिः सदो
transliteration: aghne dyumnena jāghṛve sahasaḥ sūnavāhuta | edaṃ barhiḥ sado
translation: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One. Seat thee on this my sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 24
sanskrit: मम
transliteration: mama
translation: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing. And living men in holy rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वेभिरग्निभिर्देवेभिर्महया गिरः | यज्ञेषु यौ चायवः
transliteration: aghne viśvebhiraghnibhirdevebhirmahayā ghiraḥ | yajñeṣu yau cāyavaḥ
translation: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store, Make thou us rich with many sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अगने दिवः सूनुरसि परचेतास्तना पर्थिव्या उत विश्ववेदाः | रधग देवानिह यजा चिकित्वः
transliteration: aghne divaḥ sūnurasi pracetāstanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ |
translation: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things. Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: वैश्वानरं मनसाग्निं निचाय्या हविष्मन्तो अनुषत्यं सवर्विदम | सुदानुं देवं रथिरं वसूयवो गीर्भी रण्वंकुशिकासो हवामहे
transliteration: vaiśvānaraṃ manasāghniṃ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṃ svarigvedadam | sudānuṃ devaṃ rathiraṃ vasūyavo ghīrbhī raṇvaṃkuśikāso havāmahe
translation: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaisvanara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true, The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kusikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तं शुभ्रमग्निमवसे हवामहे वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वानमुक्थ्यम | बर्हस्पतिं मनुषो देवतातये विप्रं शरोतारमतिथिं रघुष्यदम
transliteration: taṃ śubhramaghnimavase havāmahe vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvānamukthyam | bṛhaspatiṃ manuṣo devatātaye vipraṃ śrotāramatithiṃ raghuṣyadam
translation: That Agni, bright, Vaisvanara, we invoke for help, and Matarisvan worthy of the song of praise; Brhaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अश्वो न करन्दञ जनिभिः समिध्यते वैश्वानरः कुशिकेभिर्युगे-युगे | स नो अग्निः सुवीर्यं सवश्व्यं दधातु रत्नमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विः
transliteration: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ samidhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiryughe-yughe | sa no aghniḥ suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ dadhātu ratnamamṛteṣu jāghṛviḥ
translation: Age after age Vaisvanara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kusikas. May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: पर यन्तु वाजास्तविषीभिरग्नयः शुभे सम्मिष्लाः पर्षतीरयुक्षत | बर्हदुक्षो मरुतो विश्ववेदसः पर वेपयन्तिपर्वतानदाभ्याः
transliteration: pra yantu vājāstaviṣībhiraghnayaḥ śubhe sammiṣlāḥ pṛṣatīrayukṣata | bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayantiparigvedaatānadābhyāḥ
translation: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer. Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne'er be conquered, make the mountains shake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अग्निश्रियो मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टय आ तवेषमुग्रमव ईमहे वयम | ते सवानिनो रुद्रिया वर्षनिर्णिजः सिंहा न हेषक्रतवः सुदानवः
transliteration: aghniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣamughramava īmahe vayam | te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṃhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ
translation: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore. Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: वरातं-वरातं गणं-गणं सुशस्तिभिरग्नेर्भामं मरुतामोज ईमहे | पर्षदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधसो गन्तारो यज्ञं विदथेषु धीराः
transliteration: vrātaṃ-vrātaṃ ghaṇaṃ-ghaṇaṃ suśastibhiraghnerbhāmaṃ marutāmoja īmahe | pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso ghantāro yajñaṃ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translation: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts' might, With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अग्निरस्मि जन्मना जातवेदा घर्तं मे चक्षुरम्र्तं म आसन | अर्कस्त्रिधातू रजसो विमानो.अजस्रो घर्मो हविरस्मि नाम
transliteration: aghnirasmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣuramṛtaṃ ma āsan | arkastridhātū rajaso vimāno.ajasro gharmo havirasmi nāma
translation: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar. I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तरिभिः पवित्रैरपुपोद धयर्कं हर्दा मतिं जयोतिरनु परजानन | वर्षिष्ठं रत्नमक्र्त सवधाभिरादिद दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्यपश्यत
transliteration: tribhiḥ pavitrairapupod dhyarkaṃ hṛdā matiṃ jyotiranu prajānan | varṣiṣṭhaṃ ratnamakṛta svadhābhirādid dyāvāpṛthivī paryapaśyat
translation: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings; By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 27
sanskrit: पर वो वाजा अभिद्यवो हविष्मन्तो घर्ताच्या | देवाञ जिगातिसुम्नयुः
transliteration: pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā | devāñ jighātisumnayuḥ
translation: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven, Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अग्ने जुषस्व नो हविः पुरोळाशं जातवेदः | परातःसावेधियावसो
transliteration: aghne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ | prātaḥsāvedhiyāvaso
translation: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal, At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: पुरोळा अग्ने पचतस्तुभ्यं वा घा परिष्क्र्तः | तं जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य
transliteration: puroḷā aghne pacatastubhyaṃ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ | taṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translation: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अग्ने वीहि पुरोळाषमाहुतं तिरोह्न्यम | सहसः सूनुरस्यध्वरे हितः
transliteration: aghne vīhi puroḷāṣamāhutaṃ tiroahnyam | sahasaḥ sūnurasyadhvare hitaḥ
translation: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: माध्यन्दिने सवने जातवेदः पुरोळाशमिह कवे जुषस्व | अग्ने यह्वस्य तव भागधेयं न पर मिनन्ति विदथेषु धीराः
transliteration: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśamiha kave juṣasva | aghne yahvasya tava bhāghadheyaṃ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translation: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jatavedas! Agni, the sages in assemblies never diminish the portion due to thee the Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अग्ने तर्तीये सवने हि कानिषः पुरोळाशं सहसः सूनवाहुतम | अथा देवेष्वध्वरं विपन्यया धा रत्नवन्तमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विम
transliteration: aghne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśaṃ sahasaḥ sūnavāhutam | athā deveṣvadhvaraṃ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantamamṛteṣu jāghṛvim
translation: O Agni, at the third libation take with joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength. Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अग्ने वर्धान आहुतिं पुरोळाशं जातवेदः | जुषस्व तिरोह्न्यम
transliteration: aghne vṛdhāna āhutiṃ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ | juṣasva tiroahnyam
translation: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake, And that prepared ere yesterday.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अस्तीदमधिमन्थनमस्ति परजननं कर्तम | एतां विश्पत्नीमा भराग्निं मन्थाम पूर्वथा
transliteration: astīdamadhimanthanamasti prajananaṃ kṛtam | etāṃ viśpatnīmā bharāghniṃ manthāma pūrigvedaathā
translation: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark. Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अरण्योर्निहितो जातवेदा गर्भ इव सुधितो गर्भिणीषु | दिवे-दिव ईड्यो जाग्र्वद्भिर्हविष्मद्भिर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः
transliteration: araṇyornihito jātavedā gharbha iva sudhito gharbhiṇīṣu | dive-diva īḍyo jāghṛvadbhirhaviṣmadbhirmanuṣyebhiraghniḥ
translation: 1n the two fire-sticks Jatavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women, Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: उत्तानायामव भरा चिकित्वान सद्यः परवीता वर्षणं जजान | अरुषस्तूपो रुशदस्य पाज इळायास पुत्रो वयुने.अजनिष्ट
transliteration: uttānāyāmava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna | aruṣastūpo ruśadasya pāja iḷāyās putro vayune.ajaniṣṭa
translation: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steerwhen made prolific. With his red pillar-radiant is his splendour -in our skilled task is born the Son of Ila.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: इळायास्त्वा पदे वयं नाभा पर्थिव्या अधि | जातवेदो नि धीमह्यग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे
transliteration: iḷāyāstvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi | jātavedo ni dhīmahyaghne havyāya voḷhave
translation: In Ila's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth, That, Agni Jatavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: मन्थता नरः कविमद्वयन्तं परचेतसमम्र्तं सुप्रतीकम | यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरस्तादग्निं नरो जनयता सुशेवम
transliteration: manthatā naraḥ kavimadvayantaṃ pracetasamamṛtaṃ supratīkam | yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purastādaghniṃ naro janayatā suśevam
translation: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on. O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: यदी मन्थन्ति बाहुभिर्वि रोचते.अश्वो न वाज्यरुषो वनेष्वा | चित्रो न यामन्नश्विनोरनिव्र्तः परि वर्णक्त्यश्मनस्त्र्णा दहन
transliteration: yadī manthanti bāhubhirigveda rocate.aśvo na vājyaruṣo vaneṣvā | citro na yāmannaśvinoranivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇaktyaśmanastṛṇā dahan
translation: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood. Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Atvins' path, lie passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: जातो अग्नी रोचते चेकितानो वाजी विप्रः कविशस्तः सुदानुः | यं देवास ईड्यं विश्वविदं हव्यवाहमदधुरध्वरेषु
transliteration: jāto aghnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ | yaṃ devāsa īḍyaṃ viśvavidaṃ havyavāhamadadhuradhvareṣu
translation: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singar praised by sages; Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offering bearer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: सीद होतः सव उ लोके चिकित्वान सादया यज्ञं सुक्र्तस्य योनौ | देवावीर्देवान हविषा यजास्यग्ने बर्हद यजमाने वयो धाः
transliteration: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṃ sukṛtasya yonau | devāvīrdevān haviṣā yajāsyaghne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ
translation: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship. Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: कर्णोत धूमं वर्षणं सखायो.अस्रेधन्त इतन वाजमछ | अयमग्निः पर्तनाषाट सुवीरो येन देवासो असहन्त दस्यून
transliteration: kṛṇota dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sakhāyo.asredhanta itana vājamacha | ayamaghniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn
translation: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction. This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अयं ते योनिर्र्त्वियो यतो जातो अरोचथाः | तं जानन्नग्न आ सीदाथा नो वर्धया गिरः
transliteration: ayaṃ te yonirṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ | taṃ jānannaghna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā ghiraḥ
translation: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth. Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: तनूनपादुच्यते गर्भ आसुरो नराशंसो भवति यद विजायते | मातरिश्वा यदमिमीत मातरि वातस्य सर्गो अभवत्सरीमणि
transliteration: tanūnapāducyate gharbha āsuro narāśaṃso bhavati yad vijāyate | mātariśvā yadamimīta mātari vātasya sargho abhavatsarīmaṇi
translation: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanunapat, and Narasamsa born diffused in varied shape. Formed in his Mother he is Matarisvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: सुनिर्मथा निर्मथितः सुनिधा निहितः कविः | अग्ने सवध्वरा कर्णु देवान देवयते यज
transliteration: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ | aghne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja
translation: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage, Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अजीजनन्नम्र्तं मर्त्यासो.अस्रेमाणं तरणिं वीळुजम्भम | दश सवसारो अग्रुवः समीचीः पुमांसं जातमभि सं रभन्ते
transliteration: ajījanannamṛtaṃ martyāso.asremāṇaṃ taraṇiṃ vīḷujambham | daśa svasāro aghruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsaṃ jātamabhi saṃ rabhante
translation: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing. The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: पर सप्तहोता सनकादरोचत मातुरुपस्थे यदशोचदूधनि | न नि मिषति सुरणो दिवे-दिवे यदसुरस्य जठरादजायत
transliteration: pra saptahotā sanakādarocata māturupasthe yadaśocadūdhani | na ni miṣati suraṇo dive-dive yadasurasya jaṭharādajāyata
translation: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed. Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अमित्रायुधो मरुतामिव परयाः परथमजा बरह्मणो विश्वमिद विदुः | दयुम्नवद बरह्म कुशिकास एरिर एक-एको दमे अग्निं समीधिरे
transliteration: amitrāyudho marutāmiva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvamid viduḥ | dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira eka-eko dame aghniṃ samīdhire
translation: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer. The Kusikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 29
sanskrit: यदद्य तवा परयति यज्ञे अस्मिन होतश्चिकित्वो.अव्र्णीमहीह | धरुवमया धरुवमुताशमिष्ठाः परजानन विद्वानुप याहि सोमम
transliteration: yadadya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaścikitvo.avṛṇīmahīha | dhruvamayā dhruvamutāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam
translation: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began, So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: इछन्ति तवा सोम्यासः सखायः सुन्वन्ति सोमं दधति परयांसि | तितिक्षन्ते अभिशस्तिं जनानामिन्द्र तवदा कश्चन हि परकेतः
transliteration: ichanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi | titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānāmindra tvadā kaścana hi praketaḥ
translation: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands. They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: न ते दूरे परमा चिद रजांस्या तु पर याहि हरिवो हरिभ्याम | सथिराय वर्ष्णे सवना कर्तेमा युक्ता गरावाणः समिधाने अग्नौ
transliteration: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṃsyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām | sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā ghrāvāṇaḥ samidhāne aghnau
translation: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses. Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुशिप्रो मघवा तरुत्रो महाव्रातस्तुविकूर्मिर्र्घावान | यदुग्रो धा बाधितो मर्त्येषु कव तया ते वर्षभ वीर्याणि
transliteration: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātastuvikūrmirṛghāvān | yadughro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi
translation: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action. What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,-where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: तवं हि षमा चयावयन्नच्युतान्येको वर्त्रा चरसि जिघ्नमानः | तव दयावाप्र्थिवी पर्वतासो.अनु वरताय निमितेव तस्थुः
transliteration: tvaṃ hi ṣmā cyāvayannacyutānyeko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ | tava dyāvāpṛthivī parigvedaatāso.anu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ
translation: For, overthrowing what hath ne'er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vrtras. For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उताभये पुरुहूत शरवोभिरेको दर्ळ्हमवदो वर्त्रहा सन | इमे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी अपारे यत संग्र्भ्णा मघवन काशिरित ते
