transliteration: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhireko dṛḷhamavado vṛtrahā san | ime cidindra rodasī apāre yat saṃghṛbhṇā maghavan kāśirit te
translation: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vrtra's slayer. E'en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: पर सू त इन्द्र परवता हरिभ्यां पर ते वज्रः परम्र्णन्नेतु शत्रून | जहि परतीचो अनूचः पराचो विश्वं सत्यंक्र्णुहि विष्टमस्तु
transliteration: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyāṃ pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇannetu śatrūn | jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṃ satyaṃkṛṇuhi viṣṭamastu
translation: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder! Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यस्मै धायुरदधा मर्त्यायाभक्तं चिद भजते गेह्यं सः | भद्रा त इन्द्र सुमतिर्घ्र्ताची सहस्रदाना पुरुहूत रातिः
transliteration: yasmai dhāyuradadhā martyāyābhaktaṃ cid bhajate ghehyaṃ saḥ | bhadrā ta indra sumatirghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ
translation: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided. Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सहदानुं पुरुहूत कषियन्तमहस्तमिन्द्र सं पिणक कुणारुम | अभि वर्त्रं वर्धमानं पियारुमपादमिन्द्र तवसा जघन्थ
transliteration: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantamahastamindra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum | abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārumapādamindra tavasā jaghantha
translation: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with Danu. Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vrtra as he waxed in vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: नि सामनामिषिरामिन्द्र भूमिं महीमपारां सदने ससत्थ | अस्तभ्नाद दयां वर्षभो अन्तरिक्षमर्षन्त्वापस्त्वयेह परसूताः
transliteration: ni sāmanāmiṣirāmindra bhūmiṃ mahīmapārāṃ sadane sasattha | astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣamarṣantvāpastvayeha prasūtāḥ
translation: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded. The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अलात्र्णो वल इन्द्र वरजो गोः पुरा हन्तोर्भयमानो वयार | सुगान पथो अक्र्णोन निरजे गाः परावन वाणीः पुरुहूतं धमन्तीः
transliteration: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo ghoḥ purā hantorbhayamāno vyāra | sughān patho akṛṇon niraje ghāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṃ dhamantīḥ
translation: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra. He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: एको दवे वसुमती समीची इन्द्र आ पप्रौ पर्थिवीमुत दयाम | उतान्तरिक्षादभि नः समीक इषो रथीः सयुजः शूर वाजान
transliteration: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīmuta dyām | utāntarikṣādabhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān
translation: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures. Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: दिशः सूर्यो न मिनाति परदिष्टा दिवे-दिवे हर्यश्वप्रसूताः | सं यदानळ अध्वन आदिदश्वैर्विमोचनं कर्णुते तत तवस्य
transliteration: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā dive-dive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ | saṃ yadānaḷ adhvana ādidaśvairigvedamocanaṃ kṛṇute tat tvasya
translation: Surya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers. When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: दिद्र्क्षन्त उषसो यामन्नक्तोर्विवस्वत्या महि चित्रमनीकम | विश्वे जानन्ति महिना यदागादिन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्तापुरूणि
transliteration: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmannaktorigvedavasvatyā mahi citramanīkam | viśve jānanti mahinā yadāghādindrasya karma sukṛtāpurūṇi
translation: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning; And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: महि जयोतिर्निहितं वक्षणास्वामा पक्वं चरति बिभ्रती गौः | विश्वं सवाद्म सम्भ्र्तमुस्रियायां यत सीमिन्द्रो अदधाद भोजनाय
transliteration: mahi jyotirnihitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvāmā pakvaṃ carati bibhratī ghauḥ | viśvaṃ svādma sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ yat sīmindro adadhād bhojanāya
translation: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances. All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: इन्द्र दर्ह्य यामकोशा अभूवन यज्ञाय शिक्ष गर्णते सखिभ्यः | दुर्मायवो दुरेवा मर्त्यासो निषङगिणो रिपवो हन्त्वासः
transliteration: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa ghṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ | durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅghiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ
translation: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth. These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiver bearing foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सं घोषः शर्ण्वे.अवमैरमित्रैर्जही नयेष्वशनिं तपिष्ठाम | वर्श्चेमधस्ताद वि रुजा सहस्व जहि रक्षो मघवन रन्धयस्व
transliteration: saṃ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve.avamairamitrairjahī nyeṣvaśaniṃ tapiṣṭhām | vṛścemadhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva
translation: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon. Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उद वर्ह रक्षः सहमूलमिन्द्र वर्श्चा मध्यं परत्यग्रंश्र्णीहि | आ कीवतः सललूकं चकर्थ बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य
transliteration: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlamindra vṛścā madhyaṃ pratyaghraṃśṛṇīhi |
translation: Root up the race of Raksasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle. How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: शासद वह्निर्दुहितुर्नप्त्यं गाद विद्वान रतस्य दीधितिंसपर्यन | पिता यत्र दुहितुः सेकं रञ्जन सं शग्म्येन मनसा दधन्वे
transliteration: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekaṃ ṛñjan saṃ śaghmyena manasā dadhanve
translation: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter. Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: न जामये तान्वो रिक्थमारैक चकार गर्भं सनितुर्निधानम | यदी मातरो जनयन्त वह्निमन्यः कर्ता सुक्र्तोरन्य रन्धन
transliteration: na jāmaye tānvo rikthamāraik cakāra gharbhaṃ saniturnidhānam | yadī mātaro janayanta vahnimanyaḥ kartā sukṛtoranya ṛndhan
translation: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it. What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अग्निर्जज्ञे जुह्वा रेजमानो महस पुत्रानरुषस्य परयक्षे | महान गर्भो मह्या जातमेषां मही परव्र्द धर्यश्वस्य यज्ञैः
transliteration: aghnirjajñe juhvā rejamāno mahas putrānaruṣasya prayakṣe | mahān gharbho mahyā jātameṣāṃ mahī pravṛd dharyaśvasya yajñaiḥ
translation: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured. Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अभि जैत्रीरसचन्त सप्र्धानं महि जयोतिस्तमसो निरजानन | तं जानतीः परत्युदायन्नुषासः पतिर्गवामभवदेक इन्द्रः
transliteration: abhi jaitrīrasacanta spṛdhānaṃ mahi jyotistamaso nirajānan | taṃ jānatīḥ pratyudāyannuṣāsaḥ patirghavāmabhavadeka indraḥ
translation: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness. The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: वीळौ सतीरभि धीरा अत्र्न्दन पराचाहिन्वन मनसा सप्तविप्राः | विश्वामविन्दन पथ्यां रतस्य परजानन्नित तानमसा विवेश
transliteration: vīḷau satīrabhi dhīrā atṛndan prācāhinvan manasā saptaviprāḥ | viśvāmavindan pathyāṃ ṛtasya prajānannit tānamasā viveśa
translation: The sages freed them from their firm built prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit. All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: विदद यदी सरमा रुग्णमद्रेर्महि पाथः पूर्व्यं सध्र्यक कः | अग्रं नयत सुपद्यक्षराणामछा रवं परथमा जानती गात
transliteration: vidad yadī saramā rughṇamadrermahi pāthaḥ pūrigvedayaṃ sadhryak kaḥ | aghraṃ nayat supadyakṣarāṇāmachā ravaṃ prathamā jānatī ghāt
translation: When Sarama had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly. In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अगछदु विप्रतमः सखीयन्नसूदयत सुक्र्ते गर्भमद्रिः | ससान मर्यो युवभिर्मखस्यन्नथाभवदङगिराः सद्यो अर्चन
transliteration: aghachadu vipratamaḥ sakhīyannasūdayat sukṛte gharbhamadriḥ | sasāna maryo yuvabhirmakhasyannathābhavadaṅghirāḥ sadyo arcan
translation: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious. The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Angiras was singing praises,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: सतः-सतः परतिमानं पुरोभूर्विश्वा वेद जनिमा हन्ति शुष्णम | पर णो दिवः पदवीर्गव्युरर्चन सखा सखीन्रमुञ्चन निरवद्यात
transliteration: sataḥ-sataḥ pratimānaṃ purobhūrigvedaśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam | pra ṇo divaḥ padavīrghavyurarcan sakhā sakhīnramuñcan niravadyāt
translation: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Susna. Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: नि गव्यता मनसा सेदुरर्कैः कर्ण्वानासो अम्र्तत्वाय गातुम | इदं चिन नु सदनं भूर्येषां येन मासानसिषासन्न्र्तेन
transliteration: ni ghavyatā manasā sedurarkaiḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya ghātum | idaṃ cin nu sadanaṃ bhūryeṣāṃ yena māsānasiṣāsannṛtena
translation: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal. And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: सम्पश्यमाना अमदन्नभि सवं पयः परत्नस्य रेतसो दुघानाः | वि रोदसी अतपद घोष एषां जाते निष्ठामदधुर्गोषु वीरान
transliteration: sampaśyamānā amadannabhi svaṃ payaḥ pratnasya retaso dughānāḥ | vi rodasī atapad ghoṣa eṣāṃ jāte niṣṭhāmadadhurghoṣu vīrān
translation: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession. Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: स जातेभिर्व्र्त्रहा सेदु हव्यैरुदुस्रिया अस्र्जदिन्द्रो अर्कैः | उरूच्यस्मै घर्तवद भरन्ती मधु सवाद्म दुदुहे जेन्या गौः
transliteration: sa jātebhirigvedaṛtrahā sedu havyairudusriyā asṛjadindro arkaiḥ | urūcyasmai ghṛtavad bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā ghauḥ
translation: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vrtra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered. For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: पित्रे चिच्चक्रुः सदनं समस्मै महि तविषीमत सुक्र्तो विहि खयन | विष्कभ्नन्त सकम्भनेना जनित्री आसीना ऊर्ध्वं रभसं वि मिन्वन
transliteration: pitre ciccakruḥ sadanaṃ samasmai mahi tviṣīmat sukṛto vihi khyan | viṣkabhnanta skambhanenā janitrī āsīnā ūrdhvaṃ rabhasaṃ vi minvan
translation: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling; With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: मही यदि धिषणा शिश्नथे धात सद्योव्र्धं विभ्वं रोदस्योः | गिरो यस्मिन्ननवद्याः समीचीर्विश्वा इन्द्राय तविषीरनुत्ताः
transliteration: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdhaṃ vibhvaṃ rodasyoḥ | ghiro yasminnanavadyāḥ samīcīrigvedaśvā indrāya taviṣīranuttāḥ
translation: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,- Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: मह्या ते सख्यं वश्मि शक्तीरा वर्त्रघ्ने नियुतो यन्ति पूर्वीः | महि सतोत्रमव आगन्म सूरेरस्माकं सु मघवन बोधि गोपाः
transliteration: mahyā te sakhyaṃ vaśmi śaktīrā vṛtraghne niyuto yanti pūrigvedaīḥ | mahi stotramava āghanma sūrerasmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi ghopāḥ
translation: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vrtra-slayer. Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: महि कषेत्रं पुरु शचन्द्रं विविद्वानादित सखिभ्यश्चरथं समैरत | इन्द्रो नर्भिरजनद दीद्यानः साकं सूर्यमुषसं गातुमग्निम
transliteration: mahi kṣetraṃ puru ścandraṃ vividvānādit sakhibhyaścarathaṃ samairat | indro nṛbhirajanad dīdyānaḥ sākaṃ sūryamuṣasaṃ ghātumaghnim
translation: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers. Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अपश्चिदेष विभ्वो दमूनाः पर सध्रीचीरस्र्जद विश्वश्चन्द्राः | मध्वः पुनानाः कविभिः पवित्रैर्द्युभिर्हिन्वन्त्यक्तुभिर्धनुत्रीः
transliteration: apaścideṣa vibhvo damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīrasṛjad viśvaścandrāḥ | madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitrairdyubhirhinvantyaktubhirdhanutrīḥ
translation: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together. By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अनु कर्ष्णे वसुधिती जिहाते उभे सूर्यस्य मंहना यजत्रे | परि यत ते महिमानं वर्जध्यै सखाय इन्द्र काम्या रजिप्याः
transliteration: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre | pari yat te mahimānaṃ vṛjadhyai sakhāya indra kāmyā ṛjipyāḥ
translation: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Surya's bounty. The while thy overly storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 31
sanskrit: पतिर्भव वर्त्रहन सून्र्तानां गिरां विश्वायुर्व्र्षभो वयोधाः | आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन
transliteration: patirbhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānāṃ ghirāṃ viśvāyurigvedaṛṣabho vayodhāḥ |
translation: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vrtra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living. Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमं सोमपते पिबेमं माध्यन्दिनं सवनं चारु यत ते | परप्रुथ्या शिप्रे मघवन्न्र्जीषिन विमुच्या हरी इहमादयस्व
transliteration: indra somaṃ somapate pibemaṃ mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ cāru yat te | prapruthyā śipre maghavannṛjīṣin vimucyā harī ihamādayasva
translation: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest. Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: गवाशिरं मन्थिनमिन्द्र शुक्रं पिबा सोमं ररिमा ते मदाय | बरह्मक्र्ता मारुतेना गणेन सजोषा रुद्रैस्त्र्पदाव्र्षस्व
transliteration: ghavāśiraṃ manthinamindra śukraṃ pibā somaṃ rarimā te madāya | brahmakṛtā mārutenā ghaṇena sajoṣā rudraistṛpadāvṛṣasva
translation: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture. Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: ये ते शुष्मं ये तविषीमवर्धन्नर्चन्त इन्द्र मरुतस्तोजः | माध्यन्दिने सवने वज्रहस्त पिबा रुद्रेभिः सगणः सुशिप्र
transliteration: ye te śuṣmaṃ ye taviṣīmavardhannarcanta indra marutastaojaḥ | mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ saghaṇaḥ suśipra
translation: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra. Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: त इन नवस्य मधुमद विविप्र इन्द्रस्य शर्धो मरुतो य आसन | येभिर्व्र्त्रस्येषितो विवेदामर्मणो मन्यमानस्य मर्म
transliteration: ta in nvasya madhumad vivipra indrasya śardho maruto ya āsan | yebhirigvedaṛtrasyeṣito vivedāmarmaṇo manyamānasya marma
translation: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra. By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vrtra, though he deemed that none might wound him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: मनुष्वदिन्द्र सवनं जुषाणः पिबा सोमं शश्वते वीर्याय | स आ वव्र्त्स्व हर्यश्व यज्ञैः सरण्युभिरपो अर्णा सिसर्षि
transliteration: manuṣvadindra savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ pibā somaṃ śaśvate vīryāya | sa ā vavṛtsva haryaśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhirapo arṇā sisarṣi
translation: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma. Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तवमपो यद ध वर्त्रं जघन्वानत्यानिव परास्र्जः सर्तवाजौ | शयानमिन्द्र चरत वधेन वव्रिवांसं परि देवीरदेवम
transliteration: tvamapo yad dha vṛtraṃ jaghanvānatyāniva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau |
translation: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vrtra With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: पर पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने | गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट छुतुद्री पयसाजवेते
transliteration: pra parigvedaatānāmuśatī upasthādaśve iva viṣite hāsamāne | ghāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasājavete
translation: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending, Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipas and Sutudri speed down their waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: इन्द्रेषिते परसवं भिक्षमाणे अछा समुद्रं रथ्येव याथः | समाराणे ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमाने अन्या वामन्यामप्येति शुभ्रे
transliteration: indreṣite prasavaṃ bhikṣamāṇe achā samudraṃ rathyeva yāthaḥ | samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vāmanyāmapyeti śubhre
translation: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as 'twere on chariots to the ocean. Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: अछा सिन्धुं मात्र्तमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म | वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरन्ती
transliteration: achā sindhuṃ mātṛtamāmayāsaṃ vipāśamurigvedaīṃ subhaghāmaghanma | vatsamiva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantī
translation: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipas, the broad, the blessed. Licking as 'twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: एन वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवक्र्तं चरन्तीः | न वर्तवे परसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति
transliteration: ena vayaṃ payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ carantīḥ | na vartave prasavaḥ sarghataktaḥ kiṃyurigvedapro nadyo johavīti
translation: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us. Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय रतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः | पर सिन्धुमछा बर्हती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः
transliteration: ramadhvaṃ me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīrupa muhūrtamevaiḥ | pra sindhumachā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyurahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ
translation: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey. With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kusika's son hath called unto the River.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: इन्द्रो अस्मानरदद वज्रबाहुरपाहन वर्त्रं परिधिं नदीनाम | देवो.अनयत सवित सुपाणिस्तस्य वयं परसवे याम उर्वीः
transliteration: indro asmānaradad vajrabāhurapāhan vṛtraṃ paridhiṃ nadīnām | devo.anayat savita supāṇistasya vayaṃ prasave yāma urigvedaīḥ
translation: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vrtra, him who stayed our currents. Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: परवाच्यं शश्वधा वीर्यं तदिन्द्रस्य कर्म यदहिंविव्र्श्चत | वि वज्रेण परिषदो जघानायन्नापो.अयनमिछमानाः
transliteration: pravācyaṃ śaśvadhā vīryaṃ tadindrasya karma yadahiṃvivṛścat | vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyannāpo.ayanamichamānāḥ
translation: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces. He smote away the obstructers with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: एतद वचो जरितर्मापि मर्ष्ठा आ यत ते घोषानुत्तरा युगानि | उक्थेषु कारो परति नो जुषस्व मा नो नि कः पुरुषत्रा नमस्ते
transliteration: etad vaco jaritarmāpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣānuttarā yughāni | uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaste
translation: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho. In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 33
sanskrit: ओ षु सवसारः कारवे शर्णोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन | नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोक्षाः सिन्धवःस्रोत्याभिः
transliteration: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrādanasā rathena | ni ṣū namadhvaṃ bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥsrotyābhiḥ
translation: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon. Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्द्रः पूर्भिदातिरद दासमर्कैर्विदद्वसुर्दयमानो विशत्रून | बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो भूरिदात्र आप्र्णद रोदसी उभे
transliteration: indraḥ pūrbhidātirad dāsamarkairigvedadadvasurdayamāno viśatrūn | brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe
translation: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dasa. Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: मखस्य ते तविषस्य पर जूतिमियर्मि वाचमम्र्ताय भूषन | इन्द्र कषितीनामसि मानुषीणां विशां दैवीनामुत पूर्वयावा
transliteration: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtimiyarmi vācamamṛtāya bhūṣan | indra kṣitīnāmasi mānuṣīṇāṃ viśāṃ daivīnāmuta pūrigvedaayāvā
translation: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal. O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्द्रो वर्त्रमव्र्णोच्छर्धनीतिः पर मायिनाममिनाद वर्पणीतिः | अहन वयंसमुशधग वनेष्वाविर्धेना अक्र्णोद राम्याणाम
transliteration: indro vṛtramavṛṇocchardhanītiḥ pra māyināmaminād varpaṇītiḥ | ahan vyaṃsamuśadhagh vaneṣvāvirdhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām
translation: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vrtra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyamsa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सवर्षा जनयन्नहानि जिगायोशिग्भिः पर्तना अभिष्टिः | परारोचयन मनवे केतुमह्नामविन्दज्ज्योतिर्ब्र्हतेरणाय
transliteration: indraḥ svarṣā janayannahāni jighāyośighbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ | prārocayan manave ketumahnāmavindajjyotirbṛhateraṇāya
translation: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him. For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्तुजो बर्हणा आ विवेश नर्वद दधानो नर्या पुरूणि | अचेतयद धिय इमा जरित्रे परेमं वर्णमतिरच्छुक्रमासाम
transliteration: indrastujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi | acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṃ varṇamatiracchukramāsām
translation: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, hero like doing many hero exploits. These holy songs he taught the bard who praised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: महो महानि पनयन्त्यस्येन्द्रस्य कर्म सुक्र्ता पुरूणि | वर्जनेन वर्जिनान सं पिपेष मायाभिर्दस्यून्रभिभूत्योजाः
transliteration: maho mahāni panayantyasyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi | vṛjanena vṛjinān saṃ pipeṣa māyābhirdasyūnrabhibhūtyojāḥ
translation: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra. He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: युधेन्द्रो मह्ना वरिवश्चकार देवेभ्यः सत्पतिश्चर्षणिप्राः | विवस्वतः सदने अस्य तानि विप्रा उक्थेभिः कवयोग्र्णन्ति
transliteration: yudhendro mahnā varivaścakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiścarṣaṇiprāḥ | vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayoghṛṇanti
translation: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle. Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvan's dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: सत्रासाहं वरेण्यं सहोदां ससवांसं सवरपश्च देवीः | ससान यः पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमामिन्द्रं मदन्त्यनु धीरणासः
transliteration: satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyaṃ sahodāṃ sasavāṃsaṃ svarapaśca devīḥ | sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāmindraṃ madantyanu dhīraṇāsaḥ
translation: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters, He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: ससानात्यानुत सूर्यं ससानेन्द्रः ससान पुरुभोजसं गाम | हिरण्ययमुत भोगं ससान हत्वी दस्यून परार्यंवर्णमावत
transliteration: sasānātyānuta sūryaṃ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṃ ghām | hiraṇyayamuta bhoghaṃ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṃvarṇamāvat
translation: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many. Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Aryan colour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 34
sanskrit: इन्द्र ओषधीरसनोदहानि वनस्पतीन्रसनोदन्तरिक्षम | बिभेद वलं नुनुदे विवाचो.अथाभवद दमितद्भिक्रतूनाम
transliteration: indra oṣadhīrasanodahāni vanaspatīnrasanodantarikṣam | bibheda valaṃ nunude vivāco.athābhavad damitadbhikratūnām
translation: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region. Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: तिष्ठा हरी रथ आ युज्यमाना याहि वायुर्न नियुतो नो अछ | पिबास्यन्धो अभिस्र्ष्टो अस्मे इन्द्र सवाहा ररिमाते मदाय
transliteration: tiṣṭhā harī ratha ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyurna niyuto no acha | pibāsyandho abhisṛṣṭo asme indra svāhā rarimāte madāya
translation: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vayu with his coursers. Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: उपाजिरा पुरुहूताय सप्ती हरी रथस्य धूर्ष्वा युनज्मि | दरवद यथा सम्भ्र्तं विश्वतश्चिदुपेमं यज्ञमावहात इन्द्रम
transliteration: upājirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣvā yunajmi | dravad yathā sambhṛtaṃ viśvataścidupemaṃ yajñamāvahāta indram
translation: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness, That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e'en to this sacrifice arranged completely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: उपो नयस्व वर्षणा तपुष्पोतेमव तवं वर्षभ सवधावः | गरसेतामश्वा वि मुचेह शोणा दिवे-दिवे सद्र्शीरद्धिधानाः
transliteration: upo nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpotemava tvaṃ vṛṣabha svadhāvaḥ | ghrasetāmaśvā vi muceha śoṇā dive-dive sadṛśīraddhidhānāḥ
translation: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious. Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: बरह्मणा ते बरह्मयुजा युनज्मि हरी सखाया सधमाद आशू | सथिरं रथं सुखमिन्द्राधितिष्ठन परजानन विद्वानुप याहि सोमम
transliteration: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū | sthiraṃ rathaṃ sukhamindrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam
translation: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together. Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: मा ते हरी वर्षणा वीतप्र्ष्ठा नि रीरमन यजमानासो अन्ये | अत्यायाहि शश्वतो वयं ते.अरं सुतेभिः कर्णवामसोमैः
transliteration: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vītapṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye | atyāyāhi śaśvato vayaṃ te.araṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāmasomaiḥ
translation: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers. Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: तवायं सोमस्त्वमेह्यर्वां छश्वत्तमं सुमना अस्यपाहि | अस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिष्या निषद्या दधिष्वेमं जठर इन्दुमिन्द्र
transliteration: tavāyaṃ somastvamehyarigvedaāṃ chaśvattamaṃ sumanā asyapāhi | asmin yajñe barhiṣyā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indumindra
translation: Thine is this Sorna: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not. Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: सतीर्णं ते बर्हिः सुत इन्द्र सोमः कर्ता धाना अत्तवे तेहरिभ्याम | तदोकसे पुरुशाकाय वर्ष्णे मरुत्वते तुभ्यंराता हवींषि
transliteration: stīrṇaṃ te barhiḥ suta indra somaḥ kṛtā dhānā attave teharibhyām | tadokase puruśākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṃrātā havīṃṣi
translation: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on. To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: इमं नरः पर्वतास्तुभ्यमापः समिन्द्र गोभिर्मधुमन्तमक्रन | तस्यागत्या सुमना रष्व पाहि परजानन विद्वान पथ्या अनु सवाः
transliteration: imaṃ naraḥ parigvedaatāstubhyamāpaḥ samindra ghobhirmadhumantamakran | tasyāghatyā sumanā ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyā anu svāḥ
translation: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready. Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: यानाभजो मरुत इन्द्र सोमे ये तवामवर्धन्नभवन गणस्ते | तेभिरेतं सजोषा वावशानो.अग्नेः पिब जिह्वयासोममिन्द्र
transliteration: yānābhajo maruta indra some ye tvāmavardhannabhavan ghaṇaste | tebhiretaṃ sajoṣā vāvaśāno.aghneḥ piba jihvayāsomamindra
translation: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,- With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 35
sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब सवधया चित सुतस्याग्नेर्वा पाहि जिह्वया यजत्र | अध्वर्योर्वा परयतं शक्र हस्ताद धोतुर्वा यज्ञं हविषो जुषस्व
transliteration: indra piba svadhayā cit sutasyāghnerigvedaā pāhi jihvayā yajatra | adhvaryorigvedaā prayataṃ śakra hastād dhoturigvedaā yajñaṃ haviṣo juṣasva
translation: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy. Accept the sacrificial gift, O Sakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: इमामू षु परभ्र्तिं सातये धाः शश्वचः छश्वदूतिभिर्यादमानः | सुते-सुते वाव्र्धे वर्धनेभिर्यः कर्मभिर्महद्भिः सुश्रुतो भूत
transliteration: imāmū ṣu prabhṛtiṃ sātaye dhāḥ śaśvacḥ chaśvadūtibhiryādamānaḥ | sute-sute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhiryaḥ karmabhirmahadbhiḥ suśruto bhūt
translation: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective. Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोमाः परदिवो विदाना रभुर्येभिर्व्र्षपर्वा विहायाः | परयम्यमानान परति षू गर्भायेन्द्र पिब वर्षधूतस्य वर्ष्णः
transliteration: indrāya somāḥ pradivo vidānā ṛbhuryebhirigvedaṛṣaparigvedaā vihāyāḥ | prayamyamānān prati ṣū ghṛbhāyendra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translation: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful. Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: पिबा वर्धस्व तव घा सुतास इन्द्र सोमासः परथमा उतेमे | यथापिबः पूर्व्यानिन्द्र सोमानेवा पाहि पन्यो अद्या नवीयान
transliteration: pibā vardhasva tava ghā sutāsa indra somāsaḥ prathamā uteme | yathāpibaḥ pūrigvedayānindra somānevā pāhi panyo adyā navīyān
translation: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee. Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: महानमत्रो वर्जने विरप्श्युग्रं शवः पत्यते धर्ष्ण्वोजः | नाह विव्याच पर्थिवी चनैनं यत सोमासो हर्यश्वममन्दन
transliteration: mahānamatro vṛjane virapśyughraṃ śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇvojaḥ | nāha vivyāca pṛthivī canainaṃ yat somāso haryaśvamamandan
translation: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless. Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: महानुग्रो वाव्र्धे वीर्याय समाचक्रे वर्षभः काव्येन | इन्द्रो भगो वाजदा अस्य गावः पर जायन्ते दक्षिणा अस्य पूर्वीः
transliteration: mahānughro vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena | indro bhagho vājadā asya ghāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇā asya pūrigvedaīḥ
translation: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom. Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: पर यत सिन्धवः परसवं यथायन्नापः समुद्रं रथ्येव जग्मुः | अतश्चिदिन्द्रः सदसो वरीयान यदीं सोमः पर्णति दुग्धो अंशुः
transliteration: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavaṃ yathāyannāpaḥ samudraṃ rathyeva jaghmuḥ | ataścidindraḥ sadaso varīyān yadīṃ somaḥ pṛṇati dughdho aṃśuḥ
translation: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters. Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: समुद्रेण सिन्धवो यादमाना इन्द्राय सोमं सुषुतं भरन्तः | अंशुं दुहन्ति हस्तिनो भरित्रैर्मध्वः पुनन्ति धारया पवित्रैः
transliteration: samudreṇa sindhavo yādamānā indrāya somaṃ suṣutaṃ bharantaḥ | aṃśuṃ duhanti hastino bharitrairmadhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ
translation: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra. They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 36
sanskrit: हरदा इव कुक्षयः सोमधानाः समी विव्याच सवना पुरूणि | अन्ना यदिन्द्रः परथमा वयाश वर्त्रं जघन्वानव्र्णीत सोमम
transliteration: hradā iva kukṣayaḥ somadhānāḥ samī vivyāca savanā purūṇi | annā yadindraḥ prathamā vyāśa vṛtraṃ jaghanvānavṛṇīta somam
translation: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance. When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vrtra, claimed the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: वार्त्रहत्याय शवसे पर्तनाषाह्याय च | इन्द्र तवा वर्तयामसि
transliteration: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca | indra tvā vartayāmasi
translation: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vrtra and conquers in the fight, We turn thee hitherward to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: अर्वाचीनं सु ते मन उत चक्षुः शतक्रतो | इन्द्र कर्ण्वन्तु वाघतः
transliteration: arigvedaācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato | indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
translation: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward. Direct thy spirit and thine eye.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: नामानि ते शतक्रतो विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरीमहे | इन्द्राभिमातिषाह्ये
transliteration: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhirghīrbhirīmahe | indrābhimātiṣāhye
translation: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate Thy names for triumph over foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: पुरुष्टुतस्य धामभिः शतेन महयामसि | इन्द्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तः
transliteration: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi | indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ
translation: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise, Of Indra who supports mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे पुरुहूतमुप बरुवे | भरेषु वाजसातये
transliteration: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtamupa bruve | bhareṣu vājasātaye
translation: For Vrtra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate, To win us booty in the wars.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: वाजेषु सासहिर्भव तवामीमहे शतक्रतो | इन्द्र वर्त्रायहन्तवे
transliteration: vājeṣu sāsahirbhava tvāmīmahe śatakrato | indra vṛtrāyahantave
translation: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers, Indra, that Vrtra may be slain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 37
sanskrit: दयुम्नेषु पर्तनाज्ये पर्त्सुतूर्षु शरवस्सु च | इन्द्र साक्ष्वाभिमातिषु
transliteration: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca | indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu
translation: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won. Indra, be victor over foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अभि तष्टेव दीधया मनीषामत्यो न वाजी सुधुरो जिहानः | अभि परियाणि मर्म्र्शत पराणि कवीन्रिछामि सन्द्र्शे सुमेधाः
transliteration: abhi taṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣāmatyo na vājī sudhuro jihānaḥ | abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīnrichāmi sandṛśe sumedhāḥ
translation: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman. Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 38
sanskrit: इनोत पर्छ जनिमा कवीनां मनोध्र्तः सुक्र्तस्तक्षत दयाम | इमा उ ते परण्यो वर्धमाना मनोवाता अध नु धर्मणिग्मन
transliteration: inota pṛcha janimā kavīnāṃ manodhṛtaḥ sukṛtastakṣata dyām | imā u te praṇyo vardhamānā manovātā adha nu dharmaṇighman
translation: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven. These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 38
sanskrit: नि षीमिदत्र गुह्या दधाना उत कषत्राय रोदसी समञ्जन | सं मात्राभिर्ममिरे येमुर उर्वी अन्तर मही सम्र्ते धायसे धुः
transliteration: ni ṣīmidatra ghuhyā dadhānā uta kṣatrāya rodasī samañjan | saṃ mātrābhirmamire yemur urigvedaī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ
translation: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion, Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: इन्द्रं मतिर्ह्र्द आ वच्यमानाछा पतिं सतोमतष्टा जिगाति | या जाग्र्विर्विदथे शस्यमानेन्द्र यत ते जायते विद्धि तस्य
transliteration: indraṃ matirhṛda ā vacyamānāchā patiṃ stomataṣṭā jighāti | yā jāghṛvirigvedadathe śasyamānendra yat te jāyate viddhi tasya
translation: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises; The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: दिवश्चिदा पूर्व्या जायमाना वि जाग्र्विर्विदथे शस्यमाना | भद्रा वस्त्राण्यर्जुना वसाना सेयमस्मे सनजापित्र्या धीः
transliteration: divaścidā pūrigvedayā jāyamānā vi jāghṛvirigvedadathe śasyamānā | bhadrā vastrāṇyarjunā vasānā seyamasme sanajāpitryā dhīḥ
translation: Born from the heaven e'en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod, Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यमा चिदत्र यमसूरसूत जिह्वाया अग्रं पतदा हयस्थात | वपूंषि जाता मिथुना सचेते तमोहना तपुषो बुध्न एता
transliteration: yamā cidatra yamasūrasūta jihvāyā aghraṃ patadā hyasthāt | vapūṃṣi jātā mithunā sacete tamohanā tapuṣo budhna etā
translation: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent. Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: नकिरेषां निन्दिता मर्त्येषु ये अस्माकं पितरो गोषु योधाः | इन्द्र एषां दरंहिता माहिनावानुद गोत्राणि सस्र्जे दंसनावान
transliteration: nakireṣāṃ ninditā martyeṣu ye asmākaṃ pitaro ghoṣu yodhāḥ | indra eṣāṃ dṛṃhitā māhināvānud ghotrāṇi sasṛje daṃsanāvān
translation: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle. Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: सखा ह यत्र सखिभिर्नवग्वैरभिज्ञ्वा सत्वभिर्गा अनुग्मन | सत्यं तदिन्द्रो दसभिर्दशग्भिः सूर्यं विवेदतमसि कषियन्तम
transliteration: sakhā ha yatra sakhibhirnavaghvairabhijñvā satvabhirghā anughman | satyaṃ tadindro dasabhirdaśaghbhiḥ sūryaṃ vivedatamasi kṣiyantam
translation: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle. There, verily with ten Dasagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: इन्द्रो मधु सम्भ्र्तमुस्रियायां पद्वद विवेद शफवन नमेगोः | गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्सु हस्ते दधे दक्षिणे दक्षिणावान
transliteration: indro madhu sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ padvad viveda śaphavan nameghoḥ | ghuhā hitaṃ ghuhyaṃ ghūḷhamapsu haste dadhe dakṣiṇe dakṣiṇāvān
translation: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture. That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: जयोतिर्व्र्णीत तमसो विजानन्नारे सयाम दुरितादभीके | इमा गिरः सोमपाः सोमव्र्द्ध जुषस्वेन्द्र पुरुतमस्य कारोः
transliteration: jyotirigvedaṛṇīta tamaso vijānannāre syāma duritādabhīke | imā ghiraḥ somapāḥ somavṛddha juṣasvendra purutamasya kāroḥ
translation: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune. These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 39
sanskrit: जयोतिर्यज्ञाय रोदसी अनु षयादारे सयाम दुरितस्य भूरेः | भूरि चिद धि तुजतो मर्त्यस्य सुपारासो वसवो बर्हणावत
transliteration: jyotiryajñāya rodasī anu ṣyādāre syāma duritasya bhūreḥ | bhūri cid dhi tujato martyasya supārāso vasavo barhaṇāvat
translation: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil. Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इन्द्र तवा वर्षभं वयं सुते सोमे हवामहे | स पाहि मध्वो अन्धसः
transliteration: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sute some havāmahe | sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ
translation: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed. So drink thou of the savoury juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इन्द्र करतुविदं सुतं सोमं हर्य पुरुष्टुत | पिबा वर्षस्व तात्र्पिम
transliteration: indra kratuvidaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ harya puruṣṭuta | pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translation: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice: Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इन्द्र पर णो धितावानं यज्ञं विश्वेभिर्देवेभिः | तिर सतवान विश्पते
transliteration: indra pra ṇo dhitāvānaṃ yajñaṃ viśvebhirdevebhiḥ | tira stavāna viśpate
translation: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice, Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तव पर यन्ति सत्पते | कषयं चन्द्रास इन्दवः
transliteration: indra somāḥ sutā ime tava pra yanti satpate | kṣayaṃ candrāsa indavaḥ
translation: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed, The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: दधिष्वा जठरे सुतं सोममिन्द्र वरेण्यम | तव दयुक्षास इन्दवः
transliteration: dadhiṣvā jaṭhare sutaṃ somamindra vareṇyam | tava dyukṣāsa indavaḥ
translation: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent: Thine are the drops celestial.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: गिर्वणः पाहि नः सुतं मधोर्धाराभिरज्यसे | इन्द्र तवादातमिद यशः
transliteration: ghirigvedaaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutaṃ madhordhārābhirajyase | indra tvādātamid yaśaḥ
translation: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: अभि दयुम्नानि वनिन इन्द्रं सचन्ते अक्षिता | पीत्वी सोमस्य वाव्र्धे
transliteration: abhi dyumnāni vanina indraṃ sacante akṣitā | pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe
translation: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail: He drinks the Soma and is strong

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: अर्वावतो न आ गहि परावतश्च वर्त्रहन | इमा जुषस्व नो गिरः
transliteration: arigvedaāvato na ā ghahi parāvataśca vṛtrahan | imā juṣasva no ghiraḥ
translation: From far away, from near at hand, O Vrtra-slayer, come to us: Accept the songs we sing to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 40
sanskrit: यदन्तरा परावतमर्वावतं च हूयसे | इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि
transliteration: yadantarā parāvatamarigvedaāvataṃ ca hūyase | indreha tata ā ghahi
translation: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us, Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र मद्र्यग घुवानः सोमपीतये | हरिभ्यां याह्यद्रिवः
transliteration: haribhyāṃ yāhyadrivaḥ
translation: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed Come, Indra, hitherward to me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: सत्तो होता न रत्वियस्तिस्तिरे बर्हिरानुषक | अयुज्रन परातरद्रयः
transliteration: satto hotā na ṛtviyastistire barhirānuṣak | ayujran prātaradrayaḥ
translation: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn; The pressing-stones were set at morn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इमा बरह्म बरह्मवाहः करियन्त आ बर्हिः सीद | वीहि शूर पुरोळाशम
transliteration: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda | vīhi śūra puroḷāśam
translation: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass. Hero, enjoy the offered cake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: रारन्धि सवनेषु ण एषु सतोमेषु वर्त्रहन | उक्थेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः
transliteration: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan | uktheṣvindra ghirigvedaaṇaḥ
translation: O Vrtra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns, Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: मतयः सोमपामुरुं रिहन्ति शवसस पतिम | इन्द्रं वत्सं न मातरः
transliteration: matayaḥ somapāmuruṃ rihanti śavasas patim | indraṃ vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ
translation: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे | न सतोतारं निदे करः
transliteration: sa mandasvā hyandhaso rādhase tanvā mahe | na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ
translation: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: वयमिन्द्र तवायवो हविष्मन्तो जरामहे | उत तवमस्मयुर्वसो
transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe | uta tvamasmayurigvedaaso
translation: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: मारे अस्मद वि मुमुचो हरिप्रियार्वां याहि | इन्द्र सवधावोमत्स्वेह
transliteration: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārigvedaāṃ yāhi | indra svadhāvomatsveha
translation: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 41
sanskrit: अर्वाञ्चं तवा सुखे रथे वहतामिन्द्र केशिना | घर्तस्नूबर्हिरासदे
transliteration: arigvedaāñcaṃ tvā sukhe rathe vahatāmindra keśinā | ghṛtasnūbarhirāsade
translation: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward, Indra, to seat thee on the grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 42
sanskrit: उप नः सुतमा गहि सोममिन्द्र गवाशिरम | हरिभ्यां यस्ते अस्मयुः
transliteration: upa naḥ sutamā ghahi somamindra ghavāśiram | haribhyāṃ yaste asmayuḥ
translation: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Sorna, Indra, bleat with milk: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 42
sanskrit: तमिन्द्र मदमा गहि बर्हिष्ठां गरावभिः सुतम | कुविन नवस्य तर्प्णवः
transliteration: tamindra madamā ghahi barhiṣṭhāṃ ghrāvabhiḥ sutam | kuvin nvasya tṛpṇavaḥ
translation: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 42
sanskrit: इन्द्रमित्था गिरो ममाछागुरिषिता इतः | आव्र्ते सोमपीतये
transliteration: indramitthā ghiro mamāchāghuriṣitā itaḥ |
translation: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence, To turn him to the Soma-draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 43
sanskrit: आ याह्यर्वां उप वन्धुरेष्ठास्तवेदनु परदिवः सोमपेयम | परिया सखाया वि मुचोप बर्हिस्त्वामिमे हव्यवाहो हवन्ते
transliteration: priyā sakhāyā vi mucopa barhistvāmime havyavāho havante
translation: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Soma-draught from days aforetime. Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 44
sanskrit: अयं ते अस्तु हर्यतः सोम आ हरिभिः सुतः | जुषाण इन्द्र हरिभिर्न आ गह्या तिष्ठ हरितं रथम
transliteration: ayaṃ te astu haryataḥ soma ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ | juṣāṇa indra haribhirna ā ghahyā tiṣṭha haritaṃ ratham
translation: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones. Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come: ascend thy golden-coloured car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 44
sanskrit: हर्यन्नुषसमर्चयः सूर्यं हर्यन्नरोचयः | विद्वांष्चिकित्वान हर्यश्व वर्धस इन्द्र विश्वा अभि शरियः
transliteration: haryannuṣasamarcayaḥ sūryaṃ haryannarocayaḥ | vidvāṃṣcikitvān haryaśva vardhasa indra viśvā abhi śriyaḥ
translation: In love thou madest Usas glow, in love thou madest Surya shine. Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 44
sanskrit: दयामिन्द्रो हरिधायसं पर्थिवीं हरिवर्पसम | अधारयद धरितोर्भूरि भोजनं ययोरन्तर्हरिश्चरत
transliteration: dyāmindro haridhāyasaṃ pṛthivīṃ harivarpasam | adhārayad dharitorbhūri bhojanaṃ yayorantarhariścarat
translation: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold- The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 44
sanskrit: जज्ञानो हरितो वर्षा विश्वमा भाति रोचनम | हर्यश्वो हरितं धत्त आयुधमा वज्रं बाह्वोर्हरिम
transliteration: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvamā bhāti rocanam | haryaśvo haritaṃ dhatta āyudhamā vajraṃ bāhvorharim
translation: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light. He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 44
sanskrit: इन्द्रो हर्यन्तमर्जुनं वज्रं शुक्रैरभीव्र्तम | अपाव्र्णोद धरिभिरद्रिभिः सुतमुद गा हरिभिराजत
transliteration: indro haryantamarjunaṃ vajraṃ śukrairabhīvṛtam | apāvṛṇod dharibhiradribhiḥ sutamud ghā haribhirājata
translation: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed, Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 45
sanskrit: आ मन्द्रैरिन्द्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः | मा तवा केचिन नि यमन विं न पाशिनो.अति धन्वेव तानिहि
transliteration: mā tvā kecin ni yaman viṃ na pāśino.ati dhanveva tānihi
translation: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes. Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 45
sanskrit: वर्त्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः | सथाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इन्द्रो दर्ळ्हा चिदारुजः
transliteration: vṛtrakhādo valaṃrujaḥ purāṃ darmo apāmajaḥ | sthātā rathasya haryorabhisvara indro dṛḷhā cidārujaḥ
translation: He who slew Vrtra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods, Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e'en things that stand most firm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 45
sanskrit: गम्भीरानुदधीन्रिव करतुं पुष्यसि गा इव | पर सुगोपायवसं धेनवो यथा हरदं कुल्या इवाशत
transliteration: ghambhīrānudadhīnriva kratuṃ puṣyasi ghā iva | pra sughopāyavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata
translation: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might; Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 46
sanskrit: युध्मस्य ते वर्षभस्य सवराज उग्रस्य यून सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः | अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणीन्द्र शरुतस्य महतो महानि
transliteration: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ughrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ | ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni
translation: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful, The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 46
sanskrit: महानसि महिष वर्ष्ण्येभिर्धनस्प्र्दुग्र सहमानो अन्यान | एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च कषयया च जनान
transliteration: mahānasi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhirdhanaspṛdughra sahamāno anyān | eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān
translation: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others, Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 46
sanskrit: पर मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः पर देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः | पर मज्मना दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्याः परोरोर्महो अन्तरिक्षाद रजीषी
transliteration: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhirigvedaśvato apratītaḥ | pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ prorormaho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī
translation: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal. Impetuous Indra in his might exceedeth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 46
sanskrit: उरुं गभीरं जनुषाभ्युग्रं विश्वव्यचसमवतं मतीनाम | इन्द्रं सोमासः परदिवि सुतासः समुद्रं न सरवता विशन्ति
transliteration: uruṃ ghabhīraṃ januṣābhyughraṃ viśvavyacasamavataṃ matīnām | indraṃ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṃ na sravataā viśanti
translation: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices; To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, all-comprehending.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यं सोममिन्द्र पर्थिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभ्र्तस्त्वाया | तं ते हिन्वन्ति तमु ते मर्जन्त्यध्वर्यवो वर्षभ पातवा उ
transliteration: yaṃ somamindra pṛthivīdyāvā gharbhaṃ na mātā bibhṛtastvāyā | taṃ te hinvanti tamu te mṛjantyadhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u
translation: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant, This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 47
sanskrit: मरुत्वानिन्द्र वर्षभो रणाय पिबा सोममनुष्वधं मदाय | आ सिञ्चस्व जठरे मध्व ऊर्मिं तवं राजासि परदिवः सुतानाम
transliteration: marutvānindra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somamanuṣvadhaṃ madāya |
translation: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest. Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 48
sanskrit: सद्यो ह जातो वर्षभः कनीनः परभर्तुमावदन्धसः सुतस्य | साधोः पिब परतिकामं यथा ते रसाशिरः परथमं सोम्यस्य
transliteration: sadyo ha jāto vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartumāvadandhasaḥ sutasya | sādhoḥ piba pratikāmaṃ yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamaṃ somyasya
translation: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor. Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 48
sanskrit: यज्जायथास्तदहरस्य कामे.अंशोः पीयूषमपिबो गिरिष्ठाम | तं ते माता परि योषा जनित्री महः पितुर्दम आसिञ्चदग्रे
transliteration: yajjāyathāstadaharasya kāme.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣamapibo ghiriṣṭhām | taṃ te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ piturdama āsiñcadaghre
translation: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish. That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 48
sanskrit: उपस्थाय मातरमन्नमैट्ट तिग्ममपश्यदभि सोममूधः | परयावयन्नचरद गर्त्सो अन्यान महानि चक्रे पुरुधप्रतीकः
transliteration: upasthāya mātaramannamaiṭṭa tighmamapaśyadabhi somamūdhaḥ | prayāvayannacarad ghṛtso anyān mahāni cakre purudhapratīkaḥ
translation: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma. Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 48
sanskrit: उग्रस्तुराषाळ अभिभूत्योजा यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः | तवष्टारमिन्द्रो जनुषाभिभूयामुष्या सोममपिबच्चमूषु
transliteration: ughrasturāṣāḷ abhibhūtyojā yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ | tvaṣṭāramindro januṣābhibhūyāmuṣyā somamapibaccamūṣu
translation: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed. E'en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvastar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 49
sanskrit: शंसा महामिन्द्रं यस्मिन विश्वा आ कर्ष्टयः सोमपाः काममव्यन | यं सुक्रतुं धिषणे विभ्वतष्टं घनं वर्त्राणां जनयन्त देवाः
transliteration: yaṃ sukratuṃ dhiṣaṇe vibhvataṣṭaṃ ghanaṃ vṛtrāṇāṃ janayanta devāḥ
translation: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing; Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vrtras.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 49
sanskrit: यं नु नकिः पर्तनासु सवराजं दविता तरति नर्तमं हरिष्ठाम | इनतमः सत्वभिर्यो ह शूषैः पर्थुज्रया अमिनादायुर्दस्योः
transliteration: yaṃ nu nakiḥ pṛtanāsu svarājaṃ dvitā tarati nṛtamaṃ hariṣṭhām | inatamaḥ satvabhiryo ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā aminādāyurdasyoḥ
translation: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle; Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 49
sanskrit: सहावा पर्त्सु तरणिर्नार्वा वयानशी रोदसी मेहनावान | भगो न कारे हव्यो मतीनां पितेव चारुः सुहवो वयोधाः
transliteration: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇirnārigvedaā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān | bhagho na kāre havyo matīnāṃ piteva cāruḥ suhavo vayodhāḥ
translation: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings, To be invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as 'twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 49
sanskrit: धर्ता दिवो रजसस पर्ष्ट ऊर्ध्वो रथो न वायुर्वसुभिर्नियुत्वान | कषपां वस्ता जनिता सूर्यस्य विभक्ता भागं धिषणेव वाजम
transliteration: dhartā divo rajasas pṛṣṭa ūrdhvo ratho na vāyurigvedaasubhirniyutvān | kṣapāṃ vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāghaṃ dhiṣaṇeva vājam
translation: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vayu with his team of Vasus. Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhisana he deals forth strength and riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 50
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सवाहा पिबतु यस्य सोम आगत्या तुम्रो वर्षभो मरुत्वान | ओरुव्यचाः पर्णतामेभिरन्नैरास्य हविस्तन्वःकामं रध्याः
transliteration: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya soma āghatyā tumro vṛṣabho marutvān | oruvyacāḥ pṛṇatāmebhirannairāsya havistanvaḥkāmaṃ ṛdhyāḥ
translation: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,-the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither. Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 51
sanskrit: चर्षणीध्र्तं मघवानमुक्थ्यमिन्द्रं गिरो बर्हतीरभ्यनूषत | वाव्र्धानं पुरुहूतं सुव्र्क्तिभिरमर्त्यं जरमाणं दिवे-दिवे
transliteration: carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ maghavānamukthyamindraṃ ghiro bṛhatīrabhyanūṣata | vāvṛdhānaṃ puruhūtaṃ suvṛktibhiramartyaṃ jaramāṇaṃ dive-dive
translation: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds; Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: धानावन्तं करम्भिणमपूपवन्तमुक्थिनम | इन्द्र परातर्जुषस्व नः
transliteration: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇamapūpavantamukthinam | indra prātarjuṣasva naḥ
translation: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn, With groats with cake, with eulogies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: पुरोळाशं पचत्यं जुषस्वेन्द्रा गुरस्व च | तुभ्यं हव्यानि सिस्रते
transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ pacatyaṃ juṣasvendrā ghurasva ca | tubhyaṃ havyāni sisrate
translation: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake: Oblations are poured forth to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश्च नः | वधूयुरिव योषणाम
transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse ghiraśca naḥ | vadhūyuriva yoṣaṇām
translation: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing, As he who woes accepts his bride.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: पुरोळाशं सनश्रुत परातःसावे जुषस्व नः | इन्द्र करतुर्हि ते बर्हन
transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ sanaśruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ | indra kraturhi te bṛhan
translation: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn, For great, O Indra, is thy power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य धानाः पुरोळाशमिन्द्र कर्ष्वेहचारुम | पर यत सतोता जरिता तूर्ण्यर्थो वर्षायमाण उप गीर्भिरीट्टे
transliteration: mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśamindra kṛṣvehacārum | pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇyartho vṛṣāyamāṇa upa ghīrbhirīṭṭe
translation: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra, What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 52
sanskrit: तर्तीये धानाः सवने पुरुष्टुत पुरोळाशमाहुतं मामहस्व नः | रभुमन्तं वाजवन्तं तवा कवे परयस्वन्त उप शिक्षेम धीतिभिः
transliteration: tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśamāhutaṃ māmahasva naḥ |
translation: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake. With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vaja and the Rbhus wait upon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 53
sanskrit: इन्द्रापर्वता बर्हता रथेन वामीरिष आ वहतं सुवीराः | वीतं हव्यान्यध्वरेषु देवा वर्धेथां गीर्भीरिळया मदन्ता
transliteration: indrāparigvedaatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣa ā vahataṃ suvīrāḥ | vītaṃ havyānyadhvareṣu devā vardhethāṃ ghīrbhīriḷayā madantā
translation: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither. Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 53
sanskrit: तिष्ठा सु कं मघवन मा परा गाः सोमस्य नु तवा सुषुतस्य यक्षि | पितुर्न पुत्रः सिचमा रभे त इन्द्र सवादिष्ठया गिरा शचीवः
transliteration: tiṣṭhā su kaṃ maghavan mā parā ghāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi | piturna putraḥ sicamā rabhe ta indra svādiṣṭhayā ghirā śacīvaḥ
translation: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee. With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 54
sanskrit: इमं महे विदथ्याय शूषं शश्वत कर्त्व ईड्यय पर जभ्रुः | शर्णोतु नो दम्येभिरनीकैः शर्णोत्वग्निर्दिव्यैरजस्रः
transliteration: imaṃ mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṃ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyaya pra jabhruḥ |
translation: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered. May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 55
sanskrit: उषसः पूर्वा अध यद वयूषुर्महद वि जज्ञे अक्षरं पदे गोः | वरता देवानामुप नु परभूषन महद देवानामसुरत्वमेकम
transliteration: uṣasaḥ pūrigvedaā adha yad vyūṣurmahad vi jajñe akṣaraṃ pade ghoḥ | vratā devānāmupa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānāmasuratvamekam
translation: AT the first shining of the earliest Mornings, in the Cow's home was born the Great Eternal. Now shall the statutes of the Gods be valid. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion -

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 55
sanskrit: मो षू णो अत्र जुहुरन्त देवा मा पूर्वे अग्ने पितरः पदज्ञाः | पुराण्योः सद्मनोः केतुरन्तर्म...
transliteration: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrigvedae aghne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ | purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ keturantarma...
translation: Let not the Gods here injure us, O Agni, nor Fathers of old time who know the region, Nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 55
sanskrit: वि मे पुरुत्रा पतयन्ति कामाः शम्यछा दीद्ये पूर्व्याणि | समिद्धे अग्नाव रतमिद वदेम म...
transliteration: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamyachā dīdye pūrigvedayāṇi | samiddhe aghnāv ṛtamid vadema ma...
translation: My wishes fly abroad to many places: I glance back to the ancient sacrifices. Let us declare the truth when fire is kindled. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 55
sanskrit: समानो राजा विभ्र्तः पुरुत्रा शये शयासु परयुतो वनानु | अन्या वत्सं भरति कषेति माता म...
transliteration: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu | anyā vatsaṃ bharati kṣeti mātā ma...
translation: King Universal, born to sundry quarters, extended through the wood be lies on couches. One Mother rests: another feeds the Infant. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 56
sanskrit: न ता मिनन्ति मायिनो न धीरा वरता देवानां परथमा धरुवाणि | न रोदसी अद्रुहा वेद्याभिर्न पर्वता निनमे तस्थिवांसः
transliteration: na tā minanti māyino na dhīrā vratā devānāṃ prathamā dhruvāṇi | na rodasī adruhā vedyābhirna parigvedaatā niname tasthivāṃsaḥ
translation: NOT men of magic skill, not men of wisdom impair the Gods' first steadfast ordinances. Ne'er may the earth and heaven which know not malice, nor the fixed hills, be bowed by sage devices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: पर मे विविक्वानविदन मनीषां धेनुं चरन्तीं परयुतामगोपाम | सद्यश्चिद या दुदुहे भूरि धासेरिन्द्रस्तदग्निः पनितारो अस्याः
transliteration: pra me vivikvānavidan manīṣāṃ dhenuṃ carantīṃ prayutāmaghopām | sadyaścid yā duduhe bhūri dhāserindrastadaghniḥ panitāro asyāḥ
translation: MY thought with fine discernment hath discovered the Cow who wanders free without a herdsman, Her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty: Indra and Agni therefore are her praisers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सु पूषा वर्षणा सुहस्ता दिवो न परीताः शशयं दुदुह्रे | विश्वे यदस्यां रणयन्त देवाः पर वो.अत्र वसवः सुम्नमश्याम
transliteration: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā suhastā divo na prītāḥ śaśayaṃ duduhre | viśve yadasyāṃ raṇayanta devāḥ pra vo.atra vasavaḥ sumnamaśyām
translation: Indra and Pusan, deft of hand and mighty, well-pleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder. As in this praise the Gods have all delighted, may I win blessing here from you, O Vasus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: या जामयो वर्ष्ण इछन्ति शक्तिं नमस्यन्तीर्जानते गर्भमस्मिन | अछा पुत्रं धेनवो वावशाना महश्चरन्ति बिभ्रतं वपूंषि
transliteration: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa ichanti śaktiṃ namasyantīrjānate gharbhamasmin | achā putraṃ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaścaranti bibhrataṃ vapūṃṣi
translation: Fain to lend vigour to the Bull, the sister with reverence recognize the germ within him. The Cows come lowing hither to the Youngling, to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: अछा विवक्मि रोदसी सुमेके गराव्णो युजानो अध्वरे मनीषा | इमा उ ते मनवे भूरिवारा ऊर्ध्वा भवन्ति दर्शता यजत्राः
transliteration: achā vivakmi rodasī sumeke ghrāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā | imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ
translation: Fixing with thought, at sacrifice, the press-stones, I bid the well-formed Heaven and Earth come hither; For these thy flames, which give men boons in plenty, rise up on high, the beautiful, the holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची | तयेह विश्वानवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि
transliteration: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā aghne deveṣūcyata urūcī | tayeha viśvānavase yajatrānā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni
translation: Agni, thy meath-sweet tongue that tastes fair viands, which among Gods is called the far-extended,- Therewith make all the Holy Odes be seated here for our help, and feed them with sweet juices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 57
sanskrit: या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चन्ती पीपयद देव चित्रा | तामस्मभ्यं परमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम
transliteration: yā te aghne parigvedaatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā | tāmasmabhyaṃ pramatiṃ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṃ viśvajanyām
translation: Let thy stream give us drink, O God, O Agni, wonderful and exhaustless like the rain-clouds. Thus care for us, O Vasu Jatavedas, show us thy loving-kindness, reaching all men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 58
sanskrit: धेनुः परत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानान्तः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः | आ दयोतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषस सतोमो अश्विनावजीगः
transliteration: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṃ duhānāntaḥ putraścarati dakṣiṇāyāḥ |
translation: THE Ancient's Milch-cow yields the things we long for: the Son of Daksina travels between them. She with the splendid chariot brings refulgence. The praise of Usas hath awoke the Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 59
sanskrit: मित्रो जनान यातयति बरुवाणो मित्रो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम | मित्रः कर्ष्टीरनिमिषाभि चष्टे मित्राय हव्यंघ्र्तवज्जुहोत
transliteration: mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām | mitraḥ kṛṣṭīranimiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃghṛtavajjuhota
translation: MITRA, when speaking, stirreth men to labour: Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven. Mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 59
sanskrit: पर स मित्र मर्तो अस्तु परयस्वान यस्त आदित्य शिक्षति वरतेन | न हन्यते न जीयते तवोतो नैनमंहो अश्नोत्यन्तितो न दूरात
transliteration: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yasta āditya śikṣati vratena | na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainamaṃho aśnotyantito na dūrāt
translation: Foremost be he who brings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, Aditya. He whom thou helpest ne'er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 59
sanskrit: अनमीवास इळया मदन्तो मितज्ञवो वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्याः | आदित्यस्य वरतमुपक्षियन्तो वयं मित्रस्य सुमतौ सयाम
transliteration: anamīvāsa iḷayā madanto mitajñavo varimannā pṛthivyāḥ |
translation: joying in sacred food and free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface, Following closely the Aditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इहेह वो मनसा बन्धुता नर उशिजो जग्मुरभि तानि वेदसा | याभिर्मायाभिः परतिजूतिवर्पसः सौधन्वना यज्ञियं भागमानश
transliteration: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jaghmurabhi tāni vedasā | yābhirmāyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyaṃ bhāghamānaśa
translation: HERE is your ghostly kinship, here, O Men: they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth, With wondrous arts, whereby, with schemes to meet each need, Ye gained, Sudhanvan's Sons! your share in sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: याभिः शचीभिश्चमसानपिंशत यया धिया गामरिणीत चर्मणः | येन हरी मनसा निरतक्षत तेन देवत्वं रभवः समानश
transliteration: yābhiḥ śacībhiścamasānapiṃśata yayā dhiyā ghāmariṇīta carmaṇaḥ | yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśa
translation: The mighty powers wherewith. ye formed the chalices, the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide, The intellect wherewith ye wrought the two Bay Steeds,-through these, O Rbhus, ye attained divinity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य सख्यं रभवः समानशुर्मनोर्नपातो अपसो दधन्विरे | सौधन्वनासो अम्र्तत्वमेरिरे विष्ट्वी शमीभिः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया
transliteration: indrasya sakhyaṃ ṛbhavaḥ samānaśurmanornapāto apaso dadhanvire | saudhanvanāso amṛtatvamerire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā
translation: Friendship with Indra have the Rbhus, fully gained: grandsons of Manu, they skilfully urged the work. Sudhanvan's Children won them everlasting life, serving with holy rites, pious with noble acts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्रेण याथ सरथं सुते सचानथो वशानां भवथासह शरिया | न वः परतिमै सुक्र्तानि वाघतः सौधन्वना रभवो वीर्याणि च
transliteration: indreṇa yātha sarathaṃ sute sacānatho vaśānāṃ bhavathāsaha śriyā | na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca
translation: In company with Indra come ye to the juice, then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled. Not to be paragoned, ye Priests, are your good deeds, nor your heroic acts, Rbhus, Sudhanvan's Sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजवद्भिः समुक्षितं सुतं सोममा वर्षस्वा गभस्त्योः | धियेषितो मघवन दाशुषो गर्हे सौधन्वनेभिः सह मत्स्वा नर्भिः
transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirigvedaājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṃ sutaṃ somamā vṛṣasvā ghabhastyoḥ | dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo ghṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ
translation: O Indra, with the Rbhus, Mighty Ones, pour down the Soma juice effused, well-blent, from both thy hands. Maghavan, urged by song, in the drink-offerer's house rejoice thee with the Heroes, with Sudhanvan's Sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुमान वाजवान मत्स्वेह नो.अस्मिन सवने शच्या पुरुष्टुत | इमानि तुभ्यं सवसराणि येमिरे वरता देवानां मनुषश्च धर्मभिः
transliteration: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no.asmin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta | imāni tubhyaṃ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānāṃ manuṣaśca dharmabhiḥ
translation: With Rbhu near, and Vaja, Indra, here exult, with Saci, praised of many, in the juice we pour. These homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee, devotions to the Gods, as laws of men ordain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजिभिर्वाजयन्निह सतोमं जरितुरुप याहि यज्ञियम | शतं केतेभिरिषिरेभिरायवे सहस्रणीथोध्वरस्य होमनि
transliteration: indra ṛbhubhirigvedaājibhirigvedaājayanniha stomaṃ jariturupa yāhi yajñiyam |
translation: Come with the mighty Rbhus, Indra, come to us, strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise; At hundred eager calls come to the living man, with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 61
sanskrit: उषो वाजेन वाजिनि परचेता सतोमं जुषस्व गर्णतो मघोनि | पुराणी देवि युवतिः पुरन्धिरनु वरतं चरसि विश्ववारे
transliteration: uṣo vājena vājini pracetā stomaṃ juṣasva ghṛṇato maghoni | purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiranu vrataṃ carasi viśvavāre
translation: O Usas, strong with strength, endowed with knowledge, accept the singer's praise, O wealthy Lady. Thou, Goddess, ancient, young, and full of wisdom, movest, all-bounteous! as the Law ordaineth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 61
sanskrit: उषो देव्यमर्त्या वि भाहि चन्द्ररथा सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती | आ तवा वहन्तु सुयमासो अश्वा हिरण्यवर्णां पर्थुपाजसो ये
transliteration: uṣo devyamartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī |
translation: Shine forth, O Morning, thou auspicious Goddess, on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices. Let docile horses of far-reaching splendour convey thee hitherward, the golden coloured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 62
sanskrit: इमा उ वां भर्मयो मन्यमाना युवावते न तुज्या अभूवन | कव तयदिन्द्रावरुणा यशो वां येन समा सिनं भरथः सखिभ्यः
transliteration: imā u vāṃ bhṛmayo manyamānā yuvāvate na tujyā abhūvan | kva tyadindrāvaruṇā yaśo vāṃ yena smā sinaṃ bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
translation: YOUR well-known prompt activities aforetime needed no impulse from your faithful servant. Where, Indra-Varuna, is now that glory wherewith ye brought support to those who loved you?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 62
sanskrit: अयमु वां पुरुतमो रयीयञ्छश्वत्तममवसे जोहवीति | सजोषाविन्द्रावरुणा मरुद्भिर्दिवा पर्थिव्या शर्णुतं हवम्मे
transliteration: ayamu vāṃ purutamo rayīyañchaśvattamamavase johavīti | sajoṣāvindrāvaruṇā marudbhirdivā pṛthivyā śṛṇutaṃ havamme
translation: This man, most diligent, seeking after riches, incessantly invokes you for your favour. Accordant, Indra-Varuna, with Maruts, with Heaven and Earth, hear ye mine invocation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 62
sanskrit: अस्मे तदिन्द्रावरुणा वसु षयादस्मे रयिर्मरुतः सर्ववीरः | अस्मान वरूत्रीः शरणैरवन्त्वस्मान होत्रा भारती दक्षिणाभिः
transliteration: asme tadindrāvaruṇā vasu ṣyādasme rayirmarutaḥ sarigvedaavīraḥ | asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇairavantvasmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ
translation: O Indra-Varuna, ours be this treasure ours be wealth, Maruts, with full store of heroes. .May the Varutris with their shelter aid us, and Bharati and Hotri with the Mornings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 3 Hymn 62
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते जुषस्व नो हव्यानि विश्वदेव्य | रास्व रत्नानि दाशुषे
transliteration: bṛhaspate juṣasva no havyāni viśvadevya | rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe
translation: Be pleased! with our oblations, thou loved of all Gods, Brhaspati: Give wealth to him who brings thee gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवां हय अग्ने सदम इत समन्यवो देवासो देवम अरतिं नयेरिर इति करत्वा नयेरिरे | अमर्त्यं यजत मर्त्येष्व आ देवम आदेवं जनत परचेतसं विश्वम आदेवं जनत परचेतसम
transliteration: tvāṃ hy aghne sadam it samanyavo devāso devam aratiṃ nyerira iti kratvā nyerire | amartyaṃ yajata martyeṣv ā devam ādevaṃ janata pracetasaṃ viśvam ādevaṃ janata pracetasam
translation: THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down. The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 1
sanskrit: स भरातरं वरुणम अग्न आ वव्र्त्स्व देवां अछा सुमती यज्ञवनसं जयेष्ठं यज्ञवनसम | रतावानम आदित्यं चर्षणीध्र्तं राजानं चर्षणीध्र्तम
transliteration: sa bhrātaraṃ varuṇam aghna ā vavṛtsva devāṃ achā sumatī yajñavanasaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ yajñavanasam |
translation: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuna who loveth sacrifice, True to the Law, the Aditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: यो मर्त्येष्व अम्र्त रतावा देवो देवेष्व अरतिर निधायि | होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैर अग्निर मनुष ईरयध्यै
transliteration: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi | hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair aghnir manuṣa īrayadhyai
translation: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy, Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.
