title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: इह तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जातां उभयां अन्तर अग्ने | दूत ईयसे युयुजान रष्व रजुमुष्कान वर्षणः शुक्रांश च
transliteration: iha tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātāṃ ubhayāṃ antar aghne | dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrāṃś ca
translation: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni, Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: अत्या वर्धस्नू रोहिता घर्तस्नू रतस्य मन्ये मनसा जविष्ठा | अन्तर ईयसे अरुषा युजानो युष्मांश च देवान विश आ च मर्तान
transliteration: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā | antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmāṃś ca devān viśa ā ca martān
translation: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, fleetest through the thoualit of Order. Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: अर्यमणं वरुणम मित्रम एषाम इन्द्राविष्णू मरुतो अश्विनोत | सवश्वो अग्ने सुरथः सुराधा एद उ वह सुहविषे जनाय
transliteration: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota | svaśvo aghne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya
translation: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, and Indra with Visnu, of the Gods, Maruts and Asvins- These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: गोमां अग्ने ऽविमां अश्वी यज्ञो नर्वत्सखा सदम इद अप्रम्र्ष्यः | इळावां एषो असुर परजावान दीर्घो रयिः पर्थुबुध्नः सभावान
transliteration: ghomāṃ aghne 'vimāṃ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ | iḷāvāṃ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān
translation: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses, Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: यस त इध्मं जभरत सिष्विदानो मूर्धानं वा ततपते तवाया | भुवस तस्य सवतवांः पायुर अग्ने विश्वस्मात सीम अघायत उरुष्य
transliteration: yas ta idhmaṃ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṃ vā tatapate tvāyā | bhuvas tasya svatavāṃḥ pāyur aghne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya
translation: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,- Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 2
sanskrit: यस ते भराद अन्नियते चिद अन्नं निशिषन मन्द्रम अतिथिम उदीरत | आ देवयुर इनधते दुरोणे तस्मिन रयिर धरुवो अस्तु दास्वान
transliteration: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṃ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat |
translation: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward, Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling to him be wealth secure and freely giving.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 3
sanskrit: आ वो राजानम अध्वरस्य रुद्रं होतारं सत्ययजं रोदस्योः | अग्निम पुरा तनयित्नोर अचित्ताद धिरण्यरूपम अवसे कर्णुध्वम
transliteration: aghnim purā tanayitnor acittād dhiraṇyarūpam avase kṛṇudhvam
translation: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual Sacrificer, Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अयं योनिश चक्र्मा यं वयं ते जायेव पत्य उशती सुवासाः | अर्वाचीनः परिवीतो नि षीदेमा उ ते सवपाक परतीचीः
transliteration: ayaṃ yoniś cakṛmā yaṃ vayaṃ te jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ | arigvedaācīnaḥ parivīto ni ṣīdemā u te svapāka pratīcīḥ
translation: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband. Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 4
sanskrit: कर्णुष्व पाजः परसितिं न पर्थ्वीं याहि राजेवामवां इभेन | तर्ष्वीम अनु परसितिं दरूणानो ऽसतासि विध्य रक्षसस तपिष्ठैः
transliteration: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavāṃ ibhena | tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ
translation: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 4
sanskrit: तव भरमास आशुया पतन्त्य अनु सप्र्श धर्षता शोशुचानः | तपूंष्य अग्ने जुह्वा पतंगान असंदितो वि सर्ज विष्वग उल्काः
transliteration: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ | tapūṃṣy aghne juhvā pataṃghān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvagh ulkāḥ
translation: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 4
sanskrit: परति सपशो वि सर्ज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर विशो अस्या अदब्धः | यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अन्त्य अग्ने माकिष टे वयथिर आ दधर्षीत
transliteration: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ | yo no dūre aghaśaṃso yo anty aghne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt
translation: Send thy spies forward, fleetest in thy motion; be, ne'er deceived, the guardian of this people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o'ercome us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 4
sanskrit: उद अग्ने तिष्ठ परत्य आ तनुष्व नय अमित्रां ओषतात तिग्महेते | यो नो अरातिं समिधान चक्रे नीचा तं धक्ष्य अतसं न शुष्कम
transliteration: ud aghne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrāṃ oṣatāt tighmahete | yo no arātiṃ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam
translation: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: वैश्वानराय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः कथा दाशेमाग्नये बर्हद भाः | अनूनेन बर्हता वक्षथेनोप सतभायद उपमिन न रोधः
transliteration: vaiśvānarāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśemāghnaye bṛhad bhāḥ | anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathenopa stabhāyad upamin na rodhaḥ
translation: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaisvanara the Bounteous? Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: मा निन्दत य इमाम मह्यं रातिं देवो ददौ मर्त्याय सवधावान | पाकाय गर्त्सो अम्र्तो विचेता वैश्वानरो नर्तमो यह्वो अग्निः
transliteration: mā nindata ya imām mahyaṃ rātiṃ devo dadau martyāya svadhāvān | pākāya ghṛtso amṛto vicetā vaiśvānaro nṛtamo yahvo aghniḥ
translation: Reproach not him who, God and self reliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,- Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaisvanara most manly, youthful Aini.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: साम दविबर्हा महि तिग्मभ्र्ष्टिः सहस्ररेता वर्षभस तुविष्मान | पदं न गोर अपगूळ्हं विविद्वान अग्निर मह्यम परेद उ वोचन मनीषाम
transliteration: sāma dvibarhā mahi tighmabhṛṣṭiḥ sahasraretā vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān | padaṃ na ghor apaghūḷhaṃ vividvān aghnir mahyam pred u vocan manīṣām
translation: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,-he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: पर तां अग्निर बभसत तिग्मजम्भस तपिष्ठेन शोचिषा यः सुराधाः | पर ये मिनन्ति वरुणस्य धाम परिया मित्रस्य चेततो धरुवाणि
transliteration: pra tāṃ aghnir babhasat tighmajambhas tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ surādhāḥ | pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetato dhruvāṇi
translation: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing. Those who regard not Varuna's commandments and the dear steadfast laws of sapient Mitra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: अभ्रातरो न योषणो वयन्तः पतिरिपो न जनयो दुरेवाः | पापासः सन्तो अन्र्ता असत्या इदम पदम अजनता गभीरम
transliteration: abhrātaro na yoṣaṇo vyantaḥ patiripo na janayo durevāḥ | pāpāsaḥ santo anṛtā asatyā idam padam ajanatā ghabhīram
translation: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct, They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: इदम मे अग्ने कियते पावकामिनते गुरुम भारं न मन्म | बर्हद दधाथ धर्षता गभीरं यह्वम पर्ष्ठम परयसा सप्तधातु
transliteration: idam me aghne kiyate pāvakāminate ghurum bhāraṃ na manma | bṛhad dadhātha dhṛṣatā ghabhīraṃ yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā saptadhātu
translation: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, bast boldly given as 'twere a heavy burthen, This Prstha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तम इन नव एव समना समानम अभि करत्वा पुनती धीतिर अश्याः | ससस्य चर्मन्न अधि चारु पर्श्नेर अग्रे रुप आरुपितं जबारु
transliteration: tam in nv eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītir aśyāḥ | sasasya carmann adhi cāru pṛśner aghre rupa ārupitaṃ jabāru
translation: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal, Established on the height, on earth's best .station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Prsni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: परवाच्यं वचसः किम मे अस्य गुहा हितम उप निणिग वदन्ति | यद उस्रियाणाम अप वार इव वरन पाति परियं रुपो अग्रम पदं वेः
transliteration: pravācyaṃ vacasaḥ kim me asya ghuhā hitam upa niṇigh vadanti | yad usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyaṃ rupo aghram padaṃ veḥ
translation: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret When they have thrown as 'twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths' best and well-loved station.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 5
sanskrit: इदम उ तयन महि महाम अनीकं यद उस्रिया सचत पूर्व्यं गौः | रतस्य पदे अधि दीद्यानं गुहा रघुष्यद रघुयद विवेद
transliteration: idam u tyan mahi mahām anīkaṃ yad usriyā sacata pūrigvedayaṃ ghauḥ |
translation: This is the Great Ones' mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed. This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 6
sanskrit: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु णो अध्वरस्य होतर अग्ने तिष्ठ देवताता यजीयान | तवं हि विश्वम अभ्य असि मन्म पर वेधसश चित तिरसि मनीषाम
transliteration: tvaṃ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām
translation: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods' service best of sacrificers, For over every thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e'en the wisdom of the pious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अमूरो होता नय असादि विक्ष्व अग्निर मन्द्रो विदथेषु परचेताः | ऊर्ध्वम भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन मेतेव धूमं सतभायद उप दयाम
transliteration: amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv aghnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ |
translation: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods. Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 7
sanskrit: अयम इह परथमो धायि धात्र्भिर होता यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यः | यम अप्नवानो भर्गवो विरुरुचुर वनेषु चित्रं विभ्वं विशे-विशे
transliteration: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ | yam apnavāno bhṛghavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśe
translation: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites: Whom Apnavana, and the Bhrgus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 7
sanskrit: अग्ने कदा त आनुषग भुवद देवस्य चेतनम | अधा हि तवा जग्र्भ्रिरे मर्तासो विक्ष्व ईड्यम
transliteration: aghne kadā ta ānuṣagh bhuvad devasya cetanam | adhā hi tvā jaghṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam
translation: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth. For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: दूतं वो विश्ववेदसं हव्यवाहम अमर्त्यम | यजिष्ठम रञ्जसे गिरा
transliteration: dūtaṃ vo viśvavedasaṃ havyavāham amartyam | yajiṣṭham ṛñjase ghirā
translation: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts, Best worshipper, I woo with song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: स हि वेदा वसुधितिम महां आरोधनं दिवः | स देवां एह वक्षति
transliteration: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ | sa devāṃ eha vakṣati
translation: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: स वेद देव आनमं देवां रतायते दमे | दाति परियाणि चिद वसु
transliteration: sa veda deva ānamaṃ devāṃ ṛtāyate dame | dāti priyāṇi cid vasu
translation: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home: He gives e'en treasures that we love.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: स होता सेद उ दूत्यं चिकित्वां अन्तर ईयते | विद्वां आरोधनं दिवः
transliteration: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṃ cikitvāṃ antar īyate | vidvāṃ ārodhanaṃ divaḥ
translation: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro, Knowing the deep recess of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: ते सयाम ये अग्नये ददाशुर हव्यदातिभिः | य ईम पुष्यन्त इन्धते
transliteration: te syāma ye aghnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ | ya īm puṣyanta indhate
translation: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts, Who cherish and enkindle him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: ते राया ते सुवीर्यैः ससवांसो वि शर्ण्विरे | ये अग्ना दधिरे दुवः
transliteration: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṃso vi śṛṇvire | ye aghnā dadhire duvaḥ
translation: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious, Who have served Agni reverently.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: अस्मे रायो दिवे-दिवे सं चरन्तु पुरुस्प्र्हः | अस्मे वाजास ईरताम
transliteration: asme rāyo dive-dive saṃ carantu puruspṛhaḥ | asme vājāsa īratām
translation: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come, And power and might spring up for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 8
sanskrit: स विप्रश चर्षणीनां शवसा मानुषाणाम | अति कषिप्रेव विध्यति
transliteration: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṃ śavasā mānuṣāṇām | ati kṣipreva vidhyati
translation: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than The swift shafts of the tribes of men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अग्ने मर्ळ महां असि य ईम आ देवयुं जनम | इयेथ बर्हिर आसदम
transliteration: aghne mṛḷa mahāṃ asi ya īm ā devayuṃ janam | iyetha barhir āsadam
translation: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come, To seat thee on the sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: स मानुषीषु दूळभो विक्षु परावीर अमर्त्यः | दूतो विश्वेषाम भुवत
transliteration: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḷabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ | dūto viśveṣām bhuvat
translation: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind, Become the messenger of all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: स सद्म परि णीयते होता मन्द्रो दिविष्टिषु | उत पोता नि षीदति
transliteration: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu | uta potā ni ṣīdati
translation: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites, Or as the Potar sits him down.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: उत गना अग्निर अध्वर उतो गर्हपतिर दमे | उत बरह्मा नि षीदति
transliteration: uta ghnā aghnir adhvara uto ghṛhapatir dame | uta brahmā ni ṣīdati
translation: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof, And as a Brahman takes his seat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: वेषि हय अध्वरीयताम उपवक्ता जनानाम | हव्या च मानुषाणाम
transliteration: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām | havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
translation: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice, And to oblations brought by men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: वेषीद व अस्य दूत्यं यस्य जुजोषो अध्वरम | हव्यम मर्तस्य वोळ्हवे
transliteration: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṃ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram | havyam martasya voḷhave
translation: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well, To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अस्माकं जोष्य अध्वरम अस्माकं यज्ञम अङगिरः | अस्माकं शर्णुधी हवम
transliteration: asmākaṃ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṃ yajñam aṅghiraḥ | asmākaṃ śṛṇudhī havam
translation: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Angiras, with our sacrifice: Give ear and listen to our call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 9
sanskrit: परि ते दूळभो रथो ऽसमां अश्नोतु विश्वतः | येन रक्षसि दाशुषः
transliteration: pari te dūḷabho ratho 'smāṃ aśnotu viśvataḥ | yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
translation: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give, Come near to us from every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 10
sanskrit: अग्ने तम अद्याश्वं न सतोमैः करतुं न भद्रं हर्दिस्प्र्शम | रध्यामा त ओहैः
transliteration: aghne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadraṃ hṛdispṛśam |
translation: This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest. Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 11
sanskrit: भद्रं ते अग्ने सहसिन्न अनीकम उपाक आ रोचते सूर्यस्य | रुशद दर्शे दद्र्शे नक्तया चिद अरूक्षितं दर्श आ रूपे अन्नम
transliteration: bhadraṃ te aghne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya | ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṃ dṛśa ā rūpe annam
translation: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Surya. Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 11
sanskrit: वि षाह्य अग्ने गर्णते मनीषां खं वेपसा तुविजात सतवानः | विश्वेभिर यद वावनः शुक्र देवैस तन नो रास्व सुमहो भूरि मन्म
transliteration: vi ṣāhy aghne ghṛṇate manīṣāṃ khaṃ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ | viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma
translation: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour. Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवद अग्ने काव्या तवन मनीषास तवद उक्था जायन्ते राध्यानि | तवद एति दरविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय
transliteration: tvad aghne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni | tvad eti draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
translation: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper; From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवद वाजी वाजम्भरो विहाया अभिष्टिक्र्ज जायते सत्यशुष्मः | तवद रयिर देवजूतो मयोभुस तवद आशुर जूजुवां अग्ने अर्वा
transliteration: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ | tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvāṃ aghne arigvedaā
translation: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage. From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने परथमं देवयन्तो देवम मर्ता अम्र्त मन्द्रजिह्वम | दवेषोयुतम आ विवासन्ति धीभिर दमूनसं गर्हपतिम अमूरम
transliteration: tvām aghne prathamaṃ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam | dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṃ ghṛhapatim amūram
translation: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals Invite with hymns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यस तवाम अग्न इनधते यतस्रुक तरिस ते अन्नं कर्णवत सस्मिन्न अहन | स सु दयुम्नैर अभ्य अस्तु परसक्षत तव करत्वा जातवेदश चिकित्वान
transliteration: yas tvām aghna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṃ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan | sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān
translation: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offiers thee food, O Agni, May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इध्मं यस ते जभरच छश्रमाणो महो अग्ने अनीकम आ सपर्यन | स इधानः परति दोषाम उषासम पुष्यन रयिं सचते घनन्न अमित्रान
transliteration: idhmaṃ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho aghne anīkam ā saparyan | sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṃ sacate ghnann amitrān
translation: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni, He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अग्निर ईशे बर्हतः कषत्रियस्याग्निर वाजस्य परमस्य रायः | दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो वय आनुषङ मर्त्याय सवधावान
transliteration: aghnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāghnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ | dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān
translation: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches. Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यच चिद धि ते पुरुषत्रा यविष्ठाचित्तिभिश चक्र्मा कच चिद आगः | कर्धी षव अस्मां अदितेर अनागान वय एनांसि शिश्रथो विष्वग अग्ने
transliteration: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āghaḥ | kṛdhī ṣv asmāṃ aditer anāghān vy enāṃsi śiśratho viṣvagh aghne
translation: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed, In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: महश चिद अग्न एनसो अभीक ऊर्वाद देवानाम उत मर्त्यानाम | मा ते सखायः सदम इद रिषाम यछा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
transliteration: mahaś cid aghna enaso abhīka ūrigvedaād devānām uta martyānām | mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yachā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
translation: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals. Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताम अमुञ्चता यजत्राः | एवो षव अस्मन मुञ्चता वय अंहः पर तार्य अग्ने परतरं न आयुः
transliteration: yathā ha tyad vasavo ghauryaṃ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ | evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṃhaḥ pra tāry aghne prataraṃ na āyuḥ
translation: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered, So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 13
sanskrit: परत्य अग्निर उषसाम अग्रम अख्यद विभातीनां सुमना रत्नधेयम | यातम अश्विना सुक्र्तो दुरोणम उत सूर्यो जयोतिषा देव एति
transliteration: praty aghnir uṣasām aghram akhyad vibhātīnāṃ sumanā ratnadheyam | yātam aśvinā sukṛto duroṇam ut sūryo jyotiṣā deva eti
translation: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings. Come, Asvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Surya the God is rising with his splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 14
sanskrit: परत्य अग्निर उषसो जातवेदा अख्यद देवो रोचमाना महोभिः | आ नासत्योरुगाया रथेनेमं यज्ञम उप नो यातम अछ
transliteration: praty aghnir uṣaso jātavedā akhyad devo rocamānā mahobhiḥ |
translation: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jatavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories. Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nasatyas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्निर होता नो अध्वरे वाजी सन परि णीयते | देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः
transliteration: aghnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate | devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
translation: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite, God among Gods adorable.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 15
sanskrit: परि तरिविष्ट्य अध्वरं यात्य अग्नी रथीर इव | आ देवेषु परयो दधत
transliteration: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṃ yāty aghnī rathīr iva |
translation: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer, Bearing the viands to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 16
sanskrit: आ सत्यो यातु मघवां रजीषी दरवन्त्व अस्य हरय उप नः | तस्मा इद अन्धः सुषुमा सुदक्षम इहाभिपित्वं करते गर्णानः
transliteration: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate ghṛṇānaḥ
translation: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 16
sanskrit: अव सय शूराध्वनो नान्ते ऽसमिन नो अद्य सवने मन्दध्यै | शंसात्य उक्थम उशनेव वेधाश चिकितुषे असुर्याय मन्म
transliteration: ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai |
translation: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation. Like Usana, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तवम महां इन्द्र तुभ्यं ह कषा अनु कषत्रम मंहना मन्यत दयौः | तवं वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्वान सर्जः सिन्धूंर अहिना जग्रसानान
transliteration: tvam mahāṃ indra tubhyaṃ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṃhanā manyata dyauḥ | tvaṃ vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūṃr ahinā jaghrasānān
translation: GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion. Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vrtra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तव तविषो जनिमन रेजत दयौ रेजद भूमिर भियसा सवस्य मन्योः | रघायन्त सुभ्वः पर्वतास आर्दन धन्वानि सरयन्त आपः
transliteration: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ |
translation: Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure. The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: अयम पन्था अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायन्त विश्वे | अतश चिद आ जनिषीष्ट परव्र्द्धो मा मातरम अमुया पत्तवे कः
transliteration: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve | ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ
translation: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence. Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: नाहम अतो निर अया दुर्गहैतत तिरश्चता पार्श्वान निर गमाणि | बहूनि मे अक्र्ता कर्त्वानि युध्यै तवेन सं तवेन पर्छै
transliteration: nāham ato nir ayā durghahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir ghamāṇi | bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṃ tvena pṛchai
translation: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue. Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: परायतीम मातरम अन्व अचष्ट न नानु गान्य अनु नू गमानि | तवष्टुर गर्हे अपिबत सोमम इन्द्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य
transliteration: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu ghāny anu nū ghamāni | tvaṣṭur ghṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṃ camvoḥ sutasya
translation: He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow. In Tvastar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: किं स रधक कर्णवद यं सहस्रम मासो जभार शरदश च पूर्वीः | नही नव अस्य परतिमानम अस्त्य अन्तर जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः
transliteration: kiṃ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṃ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrigvedaīḥ | nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ
translation: What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns? No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: अवद्यम इव मन्यमाना गुहाकर इन्द्रम माता वीर्येणा नयॄष्टम | अथोद अस्थात सवयम अत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज जायमानः
transliteration: avadyam iva manyamānā ghuhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṝṣṭam | athod asthāt svayam atkaṃ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ
translation: Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour. Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: एता अर्षन्त्य अललाभवन्तीर रतावरीर इव संक्रोशमानाः | एता वि पर्छ किम इदम भनन्ति कम आपो अद्रिम परिधिं रुजन्ति
transliteration: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṃkrośamānāḥ | etā vi pṛcha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṃ rujanti
translation: With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as 'twere, together. Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: किम उ षविद अस्मै निविदो भनन्तेन्द्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषन्त आपः | ममैतान पुत्रो महता वधेन वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून
transliteration: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṃ didhiṣanta āpaḥ | mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn
translation: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra? With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vrtra, and set these rivers free to wander.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: ममच चन तवा युवतिः परास ममच चन तवा कुषवा जगार | ममच चिद आपः शिशवे मम्र्ड्युर ममच चिद इन्द्रः सहसोद अतिष्ठत
transliteration: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jaghāra | mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat
translation: I cast thee from me, mine,-thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kusava hath swallowed. To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: ममच चन ते मघवन वयंसो निविविध्वां अप हनू जघान | अधा निविद्ध उत्तरो बभूवाञ छिरो दासस्य सम पिणक वधेन
transliteration: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṃso nivividhvāṃ apa hanū jaghāna | adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇak vadhena
translation: Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyamsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces. But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dasa's head thou crushedst.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: गर्ष्टिः ससूव सथविरं तवागाम अनाध्र्ष्यं वर्षभं तुम्रम इन्द्रम | अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता सवयं गातुं तन्व इछमानम
transliteration: ghṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṃ tavāghām anādhṛṣyaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tumram indram | arīḷhaṃ vatsaṃ carathāya mātā svayaṃ ghātuṃ tanva ichamānam
translation: The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra. The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: उत माता महिषम अन्व अवेनद अमी तवा जहति पुत्र देवाः | अथाब्रवीद वर्त्रम इन्द्रो हनिष्यन सखे विष्णो वितरं वि करमस्व
transliteration: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ | athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṃ vi kramasva
translation: Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee. Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vrtra, O my friend Vrtra, stride full boldly forward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: कस ते मातरं विधवाम अचक्रच छयुं कस तवाम अजिघांसच चरन्तम | कस ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद यत पराक्षिणाः पितरम पादग्र्ह्य
transliteration: kas te mātaraṃ vidhavām acakrac chayuṃ kas tvām ajighāṃsac carantam | kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādaghṛhya
translation: Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving? What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 18
sanskrit: अवर्त्या शुन आन्त्राणि पेचे न देवेषु विविदे मर्डितारम | अपश्यं जायाम अमहीयमानाम अधा मे शयेनो मध्व आ जभार
transliteration: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram | apaśyaṃ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra
translation: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort. My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: एवा तवाम इन्द्र वज्रिन्न अत्र विश्वे देवासः सुहवास ऊमाः | महाम उभे रोदसी वर्द्धम रष्वं निर एकम इद वर्णते वर्त्रहत्ये
transliteration: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ | mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṃ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye
translation: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen, And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vrtra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अवास्र्जन्त जिव्रयो न देवा भुवः सम्राळ इन्द्र सत्ययोनिः | अहन्न अहिम परिशयानम अर्णः पर वर्तनीर अरदो विश्वधेनाः
transliteration: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḷ indra satyayoniḥ | ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ
translation: The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अत्र्प्णुवन्तं वियतम अबुध्यम अबुध्यमानं सुषुपाणम इन्द्र | सप्त परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण वि रिणा अपर्वन
transliteration: atṛpṇuvantaṃ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṃ suṣupāṇam indra | sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṃ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparigvedaan
translation: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra, The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अक्षोदयच छवसा कषाम बुध्नं वार ण वातस तविषीभिर इन्द्रः | दर्ळ्हान्य औभ्नाद उशमान ओजो ऽवाभिनत ककुभः पर्वतानाम
transliteration: akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṃ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ | dṛḷhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parigvedaatānām
translation: Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury. Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अभि पर दद्रुर जनयो न गर्भं रथा इव पर ययुः साकम अद्रयः | अतर्पयो विस्र्त उब्ज ऊर्मीन तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून
transliteration: abhi pra dadrur janayo na gharbhaṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ | atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṃ vṛtāṃ ariṇā indra sindhūn
translation: They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together. Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तवम महीम अवनिं विश्वधेनां तुर्वीतये वय्याय कषरन्तीम | अरमयो नमसैजद अर्णः सुतरणां अक्र्णोर इन्द्र सिन्धून
transliteration: tvam mahīm avaniṃ viśvadhenāṃ turigvedaītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm | aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇāṃ akṛṇor indra sindhūn
translation: Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turviti didst stay the great stream, flowing, allsustaining: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पराग्रुवो नभन्वो न वक्वा धवस्रा अपिन्वद युवतीर रतज्ञाः | धन्वान्य अज्रां अप्र्णक तर्षाणां अधोग इन्द्र सतर्यो दंसुपत्नीः
transliteration: prāghruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ | dhanvāny ajrāṃ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇāṃ adhogh indra staryo daṃsupatnīḥ
translation: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward. He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पूर्वीर उषसः शरदश च गूर्ता वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून | परिष्ठिता अत्र्णद बद्बधानाः सीरा इन्द्रः सरवितवे पर्थिव्या
transliteration: pūrigvedaīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca ghūrtā vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad vi sindhūn | pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā
translation: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vrtra, lie set free the rivers. Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: वम्रीभिः पुत्रम अग्रुवो अदानं निवेशनाद धरिव आ जभर्थ | वय अन्धो अख्यद अहिम आददानो निर भूद उखछित सम अरन्त पर्व
transliteration: vamrībhiḥ putram aghruvo adānaṃ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha | vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhachit sam aranta parigvedaa
translation: Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating. The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: his joints again united.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पर ते पूर्वाणि करणानि विप्राविद्वां आह विदुषे करांसि | यथा-यथा वर्ष्ण्यानि सवगूर्तापांसि राजन नर्याविवेषीः
transliteration: pra te pūrigvedaāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvāṃ āha viduṣe karāṃsi | yathā-yathā vṛṣṇyāni svaghūrtāpāṃsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ
translation: To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits. Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 19
sanskrit: नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः | अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः
transliteration: nū ṣṭuta indra nū ghṛṇāna iṣaṃ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ | akāri te harivo brahma navyaṃ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
translation: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer. For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 20
sanskrit: आ न इन्द्रो दूराद आ न आसाद अभिष्टिक्र्द अवसे यासद उग्रः | ओजिष्ठेभिर नर्पतिर वज्रबाहुः संगे समत्सु तुर्वणिः पर्तन्यून
transliteration: ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃghe samatsu turigvedaaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
translation: FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 21
sanskrit: आ यात्व इन्द्रो ऽवस उप न इह सतुतः सधमाद अस्तु शूरः | वाव्र्धानस तविषीर यस्य पूर्वीर दयौर न कषत्रम अभिभूति पुष्यात
transliteration: vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrigvedaīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt
translation: MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion. May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तस्येद इह सतवथ वर्ष्ण्यानि तुविद्युम्नस्य तुविराधसो नॄन | यस्य करतुर विदथ्यो न सम्राट साह्वान तरुत्रो अभ्य अस्ति कर्ष्टीः
transliteration: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn | yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ
translation: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties, Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 22
sanskrit: यन न इन्द्रो जुजुषे यच च वष्टि तन नो महान करति शुष्म्य आ चित | बरह्म सतोमम मघवा सोमम उक्था यो अश्मानं शवसा बिभ्रद एति
transliteration: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit | brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṃ śavasā bibhrad eti
translation: THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One. He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 22
sanskrit: वर्षा वर्षन्धिं चतुरश्रिम अस्यन्न उग्रो बाहुभ्यां नर्तमः शचीवान | शरिये परुष्णीम उषमाण ऊर्णां यस्याः पर्वाणि सख्याय विव्ये
transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṃ caturaśrim asyann ughro bāhubhyāṃ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān |
translation: Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic; Wearing as wool Parusni for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: कथा महाम अव्र्धत कस्य होतुर यज्ञं जुषाणो अभि सोमम ऊधः | पिबन्न उशानो जुषमाणो अन्धो ववक्ष रष्वः शुचते धनाय
transliteration: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṃ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ | pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya
translation: How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain? Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: को अस्य वीरः सधमादम आप सम आनंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य | कद अस्य चित्रं चिकिते कद ऊती वर्धे भुवच छशमानस्य यज्योः
transliteration: ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṃśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya | kad asya citraṃ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ
translation: What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness? What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: कथा शर्णोति हूयमानम इन्द्रः कथा शर्ण्वन्न अवसाम अस्य वेद | का अस्य पूर्वीर उपमातयो ह कथैनम आहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे
transliteration: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda | kā asya pūrigvedaīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṃ jaritre
translation: How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes? What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशद अभि दरविणं दीध्यानः | देवो भुवन नवेदा म रतानां नमो जग्र्भ्वां अभि यज जुजोषत
transliteration: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṃ dīdhyānaḥ | devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṃ namo jaghṛbhvāṃ abhi yaj jujoṣat
translation: How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth? May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: कथा कद अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष | कथा कद अस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे
transliteration: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa | kathā kad asya sakhyaṃ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṃ suyujaṃ tatasre
translation: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking? How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 23
sanskrit: किम आद अमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भरात्रम पर बरवाम | शरिये सुद्र्शो वपुर अस्य सर्गाः सवर ण चित्रतमम इष आ गोः
transliteration: kim ād amatraṃ sakhyaṃ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma |
translation: Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us, -when may we tell it? The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 24
sanskrit: का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुम इन्द्रम अर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत | ददिर हि वीरो गर्णते वसूनि स गोपतिर निष्षिधां नो जनासः
transliteration: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arigvedaācīnaṃ rādhasa ā vavartat | dadir hi vīro ghṛṇate vasūni sa ghopatir niṣṣidhāṃ no janāsaḥ
translation: WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches; For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 24
sanskrit: स वर्त्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इन्द्रः सत्यराधाः | स यामन्न आ मघवा मर्त्याय बरह्मण्यते सुष्वये वरिवो धात
transliteration: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ | sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt
translation: To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vrtra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties. That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 24
sanskrit: तम इन नरो वि हवयन्ते समीके रिरिक्वांसस तन्वः कर्ण्वत तराम | मिथो यत तयागम उभयासो अग्मन नरस तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ
transliteration: tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām | mitho yat tyāgham ubhayāso aghman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau
translation: Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector, When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 24
sanskrit: करतूयन्ति कषितयो योग उग्राशुषाणासो मिथो अर्णसातौ | सं यद विशो ऽवव्र्त्रन्त युध्मा आद इन नेम इन्द्रयन्ते अभीके
transliteration: kratūyanti kṣitayo yogha ughrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau | saṃ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke
translation: Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle. When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: को अद्य नर्यो देवकाम उशन्न इन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुजोष | को वा महे ऽवसे पार्याय समिद्धे अग्नौ सुतसोम ईट्टे
transliteration: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṃ jujoṣa | ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe aghnau sutasoma īṭṭe
translation: WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship? Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: को नानाम वचसा सोम्याय मनायुर वा भवति वस्त उस्राः | क इन्द्रस्य युज्यं कः सखित्वं को भरात्रं वष्टि कवये क ऊती
transliteration: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ | ka indrasya yujyaṃ kaḥ sakhitvaṃ ko bhrātraṃ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī
translation: Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning? Who seeks bond, friendship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: को देवानाम अवो अद्या वर्णीते क आदित्यां अदितिं जयोतिर ईट्टे | कस्याश्विनाव इन्द्रो अग्निः सुतस्यांशोः पिबन्ति मनसाविवेनम
transliteration: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityāṃ aditiṃ jyotir īṭṭe | kasyāśvināv indro aghniḥ sutasyāṃśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam
translation: Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Adityas? Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Asvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तस्मा अग्निर भारतः शर्म यंसज जयोक पश्यात सूर्यम उच्चरन्तम | य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह नरे नर्याय नर्तमाय नर्णाम
transliteration: tasmā aghnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṃsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam | ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām
translation: To him shall Agni Bharata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising, Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: न तं जिनन्ति बहवो न दभ्रा उर्व अस्मा अदितिः शर्म यंसत | परियः सुक्र्त परिय इन्द्रे मनायुः परियः सुप्रावीः परियो अस्य सोमी
transliteration: na taṃ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urigveda asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat | priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī
translation: Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter. Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: सुप्राव्यः पराशुषाळ एष वीरः सुष्वेः पक्तिं कर्णुते केवलेन्द्रः | नासुष्वेर आपिर न सखा न जामिर दुष्प्राव्यो ऽवहन्तेद अवाचः
transliteration: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḷ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṃ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ | nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ
translation: This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely: No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 25
sanskrit: न रेवता पणिना सख्यम इन्द्रो ऽसुन्वता सुतपाः सं गर्णीते | आस्य वेदः खिदति हन्ति नग्नं वि सुष्वये पक्तये केवलो भूत
transliteration: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṃ ghṛṇīte |
translation: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance. He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अहम मनुर अभवं सूर्यश चाहं कक्षीवां रषिर अस्मि विप्रः | अहं कुत्सम आर्जुनेयं नय ॠञ्जे ऽहं कविर उशना पश्यता मा
transliteration: aham manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvāṃ ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ | ahaṃ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ ny ṝñje 'haṃ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā
translation: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Surya: I am the sage Kaksivan, holy singer. Kutsa the son of Arjuni I master. I am the sapient Usana behold me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अहम भूमिम अददाम आर्यायाहं वर्ष्टिं दाशुषे मर्त्याय | अहम अपो अनयं वावशाना मम देवासो अनु केतम आयन
transliteration: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ dāśuṣe martyāya | aham apo anayaṃ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan
translation: I have bestowed the earth upon the Arya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation. I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अहम पुरो मन्दसानो वय ऐरं नव साकं नवतीः शम्बरस्य | शततमं वेश्यं सर्वताता दिवोदासम अतिथिग्वं यद आवम
transliteration: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṃ nava sākaṃ navatīḥ śambarasya |
translation: In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Sambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together; And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodasa Atithigva.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 27
sanskrit: गर्भे नु सन्न अन्व एषाम अवेदम अहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा | शतम मा पुर आयसीर अरक्षन्न अध शयेनो जवसा निर अदीयम
transliteration: gharbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṃ devānāṃ janimāni viśvā |
translation: I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order. A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 28
sanskrit: तवा युजा तव तत सोम सख्य इन्द्रो अपो मनवे सस्रुतस कः | अहन्न अहिम अरिणात सप्त सिन्धून अपाव्र्णोद अपिहितेव खानि
transliteration: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ | ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni
translation: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together, Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 28
sanskrit: तवा युजा नि खिदत सूर्यस्येन्द्रश चक्रं सहसा सद्य इन्दो | अधि षणुना बर्हता वर्तमानम महो दरुहो अप विश्वायु धायि
transliteration: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṃ sahasā sadya indo | adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi
translation: Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Surya. What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अहन्न इन्द्रो अदहद अग्निर इन्दो पुरा दस्यून मध्यंदिनाद अभीके | दुर्गे दुरोणे करत्वा न याताम पुरू सहस्रा शर्वा नि बर्हीत
transliteration: ahann indro adahad aghnir indo purā dasyūn madhyaṃdinād abhīke | durghe duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarigvedaā ni barhīt
translation: Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict. Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 28
sanskrit: विश्वस्मात सीम अधमां इन्द्र दस्यून विशो दासीर अक्र्णोर अप्रशस्ताः | अबाधेथाम अम्र्णतं नि शत्रून अविन्देथाम अपचितिं वधत्रैः
transliteration: viśvasmāt sīm adhamāṃ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ | abādhethām amṛṇataṃ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṃ vadhatraiḥ
translation: Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dasas. Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 28
sanskrit: एवा सत्यम मघवाना युवं तद इन्द्रश च सोमोर्वम अश्व्यं गोः | आदर्द्र्तम अपिहितान्य अश्ना रिरिचथुः कषाश चित तत्र्दाना
transliteration: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṃ tad indraś ca somorigvedaam aśvyaṃ ghoḥ |
translation: So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses, The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 29
sanskrit: आ न सतुत उप वाजेभिर ऊती इन्द्र याहि हरिभिर मन्दसानः | तिरश चिद अर्यः सवना पुरूण्य आङगूषेभिर गर्णानः सत्यराधाः
transliteration: tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅghūṣebhir ghṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ
translation: COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting, Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: नकिर इन्द्र तवद उत्तरो न जयायां अस्ति वर्त्रहन | नकिर एवा यथा तवम
transliteration: nakir indra tvad uttaro na jyāyāṃ asti vṛtrahan | nakir evā yathā tvam
translation: O INDRA, Vrtra-slayer, none is better, mightier than thou: Verily there is none like thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सत्रा ते अनु कर्ष्टयो विश्वा चक्रेव वाव्र्तुः | सत्रा महां असि शरुतः
transliteration: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayo viśvā cakreva vāvṛtuḥ | satrā mahāṃ asi śrutaḥ
translation: Like chariot-wheels these people all together follow after thee: Thou ever art renowned as Great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: विश्वे चनेद अना तवा देवास इन्द्र युयुधुः | यद अहा नक्तम आतिरः
transliteration: viśve caned anā tvā devāsa indra yuyudhuḥ | yad ahā naktam ātiraḥ
translation: Not even all the gathered Gods conquered thee, Indra, in the war, When thou didst lengthen days by night.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यत्रोत बाधितेभ्यश चक्रं कुत्साय युध्यते | मुषाय इन्द्र सूर्यम
transliteration: yatrota bādhitebhyaś cakraṃ kutsāya yudhyate | muṣāya indra sūryam
translation: When for the sake of those oppressed, and Kutsa as he battled, Thou stolest away the Sun's car-wheel.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यत्र देवां रघायतो विश्वां अयुध्य एक इत | तवम इन्द्र वनूंर अहन
transliteration: yatra devāṃ ṛghāyato viśvāṃ ayudhya eka it | tvam indra vanūṃr ahan
translation: When, fighting singly, Indra. thou o'ercamest all the furious Gods, Thou slewest those who strove with thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यत्रोत मर्त्याय कम अरिणा इन्द्र सूर्यम | परावः शचीभिर एतशम
transliteration: yatrota martyāya kam ariṇā indra sūryam | prāvaḥ śacībhir etaśam
translation: When also for a mortal man, Indra, thou speddest forth the Sun, And holpest Etasa with might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: किम आद उतासि वर्त्रहन मघवन मन्युमत्तमः | अत्राह दानुम आतिरः
transliteration: kim ād utāsi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ | atrāha dānum ātiraḥ
translation: What? Vrtra-slayer, art not thou, Maghavan, fiercest in thy wrath? So hast thou quelled the demon too.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: एतद घेद उत वीर्यम इन्द्र चकर्थ पौंस्यम | सत्रियं यद दुर्हणायुवं वधीर दुहितरं दिवः
transliteration: etad ghed uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṃsyam | striyaṃ yad durhaṇāyuvaṃ vadhīr duhitaraṃ divaḥ
translation: And this heroic deed of might thou, Indra, also hast achieved, That thou didst smite to death the Dame, Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: दिवश चिद घा दुहितरम महान महीयमानाम | उषासम इन्द्र सम पिणक
transliteration: divaś cid ghā duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām | uṣāsam indra sam piṇak
translation: Thou, Indra, Mighty One, didst crush Usas, though Daughter of the Sky. When lifting up herself in pride.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अपोषा अनसः सरत सम्पिष्टाद अह बिभ्युषी | नि यत सीं शिश्नथद वर्षा
transliteration: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭād aha bibhyuṣī | ni yat sīṃ śiśnathad vṛṣā
translation: Then from her chariot Usas fled, affrighted, from her ruined car. When the strong God had shattered it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: एतद अस्या अनः शये सुसम्पिष्टं विपाश्य आ | ससार सीम परावतः
transliteration: etad asyā anaḥ śaye susampiṣṭaṃ vipāśy ā | sasāra sīm parāvataḥ
translation: So there this car of Usas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipas, And she herself fled far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत सिन्धुं विबाल्यं वितस्थानाम अधि कषमि | परि षठा इन्द्र मायया
transliteration: uta sindhuṃ vibālyaṃ vitasthānām adhi kṣami | pari ṣṭhā indra māyayā
translation: Thou, Indra, didst. with magic power resist the overflowing stream Who spread her waters o'er the land.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत शुष्णस्य धर्ष्णुया पर मर्क्षो अभि वेदनम | पुरो यद अस्य सम्पिणक
transliteration: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣo abhi vedanam | puro yad asya sampiṇak
translation: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which Susna had amassed, When thou didst crush his fortresses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत दासं कौलितरम बर्हतः पर्वताद अधि | अवाहन्न इन्द्र शम्बरम
transliteration: uta dāsaṃ kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parigvedaatād adhi | avāhann indra śambaram
translation: Thou, Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's son Sambara, The Dasa, from the lofty hill.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत दासस्य वर्चिनः सहस्राणि शतावधीः | अधि पञ्च परधींर इव
transliteration: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatāvadhīḥ | adhi pañca pradhīṃr iva
translation: Of Dasa Varcin's thou didst slay the hundred thousand and the five, Crushed like the fellies, of a car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत तयम पुत्रम अग्रुवः पराव्र्क्तं शतक्रतुः | उक्थेष्व इन्द्र आभजत
transliteration: uta tyam putram aghruvaḥ parāvṛktaṃ śatakratuḥ | uktheṣv indra ābhajat
translation: So Indra, Lord of Heroes, Powers, caused the unwedded damsel's son, The castaway, to share the lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत तया तुर्वशायदू अस्नातारा शचीपतिः | इन्द्रो विद्वां अपारयत
transliteration: uta tyā turigvedaaśāyadū asnātārā śacīpatiḥ | indro vidvāṃ apārayat
translation: So sapient Indra, Lord of Might, brought Turvaga and Yadu, those Who feared the flood, in safely o'er.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: उत तया सद्य आर्या सरयोर इन्द्र पारतः | अर्णाचित्ररथावधीः
transliteration: uta tyā sadya āryā sarayor indra pārataḥ | arṇācitrarathāvadhīḥ
translation: Arpa and Citraratha, both Aryas, thou, Indra, slewest swift, On yonder side of Sarayu,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अनु दवा जहिता नयो ऽनधं शरोणं च वर्त्रहन | न तत ते सुम्नम अष्टवे
transliteration: anu dvā jahitā nayo 'ndhaṃ śroṇaṃ ca vṛtrahan | na tat te sumnam aṣṭave
translation: Thou, Vrtra-slayer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame. None may attain this bliss of thine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 31
sanskrit: कया नश चित्र आ भुवद ऊती सदाव्र्धः सखा | कया शचिष्ठया वर्ता
transliteration: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā | kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā
translation: WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend; With what most mighty company?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 31
sanskrit: कस तवा सत्यो मदानाम मंहिष्ठो मत्सद अन्धसः | दर्ळ्हा चिद आरुजे वसु
transliteration: kas tvā satyo madānām maṃhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ | dṛḷhā cid āruje vasu
translation: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst Open e'en strongly-guarded wealth?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अभी षु णः सखीनाम अविता जरित्णाम | शतम भवास्य ऊतिभिः
transliteration: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṇām |
translation: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: आ तू न इन्द्र वर्त्रहन्न अस्माकम अर्धम आ गहि | महान महीभिर ऊतिभिः
transliteration: mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ
translation: O THOU who slewest Vrtra, come, O Indra, hither to our side, Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: भर्मिश चिद घासि तूतुजिर आ चित्र चित्रिणीष्व आ | चित्रं कर्णोष्य ऊतये
transliteration: bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā | citraṃ kṛṇoṣy ūtaye
translation: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk: Thou doest marvels for our help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: दभ्रेभिश चिच छशीयांसं हंसि वराधन्तम ओजसा | सखिभिर ये तवे सचा
transliteration: dabhrebhiś cic chaśīyāṃsaṃ haṃsi vrādhantam ojasā | sakhibhir ye tve sacā
translation: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: वयम इन्द्र तवे सचा वयं तवाभि नोनुमः | अस्मां-अस्मां इद उद अव
transliteration: vayam indra tve sacā vayaṃ tvābhi nonumaḥ | asmāṃ-asmāṃ id ud ava
translation: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs: Help and defend us, even us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: स नश चित्राभिर अद्रिवो ऽनवद्याभिर ऊतिभिः | अनाध्र्ष्टाभिर आ गहि
transliteration: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ | anādhṛṣṭābhir ā ghahi
translation: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful, Blameless, and irresistible.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: भूयामो षु तवावतः सखाय इन्द्र गोमतः | युजो वाजाय घर्ष्वये
transliteration: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra ghomataḥ | yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translation: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine, Comrades for lively energy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तवं हय एक ईशिष इन्द्र वाजस्य गोमतः | स नो यन्धि महीम इषम
transliteration: tvaṃ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya ghomataḥ | sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam
translation: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine So grant thou us abundant food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: न तवा वरन्ते अन्यथा यद दित्ससि सतुतो मघम | सतोत्र्भ्य इन्द्र गिर्वणः
transliteration: na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham | stotṛbhya indra ghirigvedaaṇaḥ
translation: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song, Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अभि तवा गोतमा गिरानूषत पर दावने | इन्द्र वाजाय घर्ष्वये
transliteration: abhi tvā ghotamā ghirānūṣata pra dāvane | indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye
translation: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give, Indra, for lively energy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: पर ते वोचाम वीर्या या मन्दसान आरुजः | पुरो दासीर अभीत्य
transliteration: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ | puro dāsīr abhītya
translation: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Disa forts thou brakest down, Attacking them in rapturous joy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: ता ते गर्णन्ति वेधसो यानि चकर्थ पौंस्या | सुतेष्व इन्द्र गिर्वणः
transliteration: tā te ghṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṃsyā | suteṣv indra ghirigvedaaṇaḥ
translation: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song, Thou wroughtest when the Soma flowed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अवीव्र्धन्त गोतमा इन्द्र तवे सतोमवाहसः | ऐषु धा वीरवद यशः
transliteration: avīvṛdhanta ghotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ | aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ
translation: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee. Give them renown with hero sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: यच चिद धि शश्वताम असीन्द्र साधारणस तवम | तं तवा वयं हवामहे
transliteration: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam | taṃ tvā vayaṃ havāmahe
translation: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all . Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अर्वाचीनो वसो भवास्मे सु मत्स्वान्धसः | सोमानाम इन्द्र सोमपाः
transliteration: arigvedaācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ | somānām indra somapāḥ
translation: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अस्माकं तवा मतीनाम आ सतोम इन्द्र यछतु | अर्वाग आ वर्तया हरी
transliteration: asmākaṃ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yachatu | arigvedaāgh ā vartayā harī
translation: May praise from us who think on thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us. Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश च नः | वधूयुर इव योषणाम
transliteration: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse ghiraś ca naḥ | vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām
translation: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing. Even as a lover in his bride.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 32
sanskrit: सहस्रं वयतीनां युक्तानाम इन्द्रम ईमहे | शतं सोमस्य खार्यः
transliteration: sahasraṃ vyatīnāṃ yuktānām indram īmahe |
translation: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray, And hundred jars of Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 33
sanskrit: पर रभुभ्यो दूतम इव वाचम इष्य उपस्तिरे शवैतरीं धेनुम ईळे | ये वातजूतास तरणिभिर एवैः परि दयां सद्यो अपसो बभूवुः
transliteration: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṃ dhenum īḷe | ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṃ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ
translation: I SEND my voice as herald to the Rbhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading. Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 33
sanskrit: यदारम अक्रन्न रभवः पित्र्भ्याम परिविष्टी वेषणा दंसनाभिः | आद इद देवानाम उप सख्यम आयन धीरासः पुष्टिम अवहन मनायै
transliteration: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṃsanābhiḥ |
translation: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents, They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 34
sanskrit: रभुर विभ्वा वाज इन्द्रो नो अछेमं यज्ञं रत्नधेयोप यात | इदा हि वो धिषणा देव्य अह्नाम अधात पीतिं सम मदा अग्मता वः
transliteration: idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṃ sam madā aghmatā vaḥ
translation: To this our sacrifice come Rbhu, Vibhvan, Vaja, and Indra with the gift of riches, Because this day hath Dhisana the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 34
sanskrit: विदानासो जन्मनो वाजरत्ना उत रतुभिर रभवो मादयध्वम | सं वो मदा अग्मत सम पुरंधिः सुवीराम अस्मे रयिम एरयध्वम
transliteration: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam | saṃ vo madā aghmata sam puraṃdhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam
translation: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, Rbhus, rejoice together with the Rtus. The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अयं वो यज्ञ रभवो ऽकारि यम आ मनुष्वत परदिवो दधिध्वे | पर वो ऽछा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुर अभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः
transliteration: ayaṃ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve | pra vo 'chā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve aghriyota vājāḥ
translation: For you was made this sacrifice, O Rbhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime. To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were-even the two elder-Vajas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अभूद उ वो विधते रत्नधेयम इदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय | पिबत वाजा रभवो ददे वो महि तर्तीयं सवनम मदाय
transliteration: abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya | pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṃ savanam madāya
translation: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches. Drink, Vajas, Rbhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 35
sanskrit: इहोप यात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना रभवो माप भूत | अस्मिन हि वः सवने रत्नधेयं गमन्त्व इन्द्रम अनु वो मदासः
transliteration: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta | asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṃ ghamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ
translation: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye Rbhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan. At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 36
sanskrit: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुर उक्थ्यो रथस तरिचक्रः परि वर्तते रजः | महत तद वो देव्यस्य परवाचनं दयाम रभवः पर्थिवीं यच च पुष्यथ
transliteration: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ | mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṃ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṃ yac ca puṣyatha
translation: This car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament. That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye Rbhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 36
sanskrit: रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं सुचेतसो ऽविह्वरन्तम मनसस परि धयया | तां ऊ नव अस्य सवनस्य पीतय आ वो वाजा रभवो वेदयामसि
transliteration: rathaṃ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṃ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā | tāṃ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi
translation: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs, You, being such, to drink of this drink offering, you, O ye Vajas, and ye Rbhus, we invoke.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 36
sanskrit: तद वो वाजा रभवः सुप्रवाचनं देवेषु विभ्वो अभवन महित्वनम | जिव्री यत सन्ता पितरा सनाजुरा पुनर युवाना चरथाय तक्षथ
transliteration: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṃ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam | jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha
translation: O Vajas, Rbhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared, In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 36
sanskrit: एकं वि चक्र चमसं चतुर्वयं निश चर्मणो गाम अरिणीत धीतिभिः | अथा देवेष्व अम्र्तत्वम आनश शरुष्टी वाजा रभवस तद व उक्थ्यम
transliteration: ekaṃ vi cakra camasaṃ caturigvedaayaṃ niś carmaṇo ghām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ | athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam
translation: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide. So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vajas and Rbhus, your great work must be extolled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 37
sanskrit: उप नो वाजा अध्वरम रभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर देवयानैः | यथा यज्ञम मनुषो विक्ष्व आसु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्व अह्नाम
transliteration: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ | yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām
translation: COME to our sacrifice, Vajas, Rbhuksans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel, As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 37
sanskrit: ते वो हर्दे मनसे सन्तु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घर्तनिर्णिजो गुः | पर वः सुतासो हरयन्त पूर्णाः करत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयन्त पीताः
transliteration: te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo ghuḥ | pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ
translation: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you. May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 37
sanskrit: तर्युदायं देवहितं यथा व सतोमो वाजा रभुक्षणो ददे वः | जुह्वे मनुष्वद उपरासु विक्षु युष्मे सचा बर्हद्दिवेषु सोमम
transliteration: tryudāyaṃ devahitaṃ yathā va stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ | juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam
translation: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vajas and Rbhuksans. So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 37
sanskrit: पीवोश्वाः शुचद्रथा हि भूतायःशिप्रा वाजिनः सुनिष्काः | इन्द्रस्य सूनो शवसो नपातो ऽनु वश चेत्य अग्रियम मदाय
transliteration: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ | indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety aghriyam madāya
translation: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses. Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उतो हि वां दात्रा सन्ति पूर्वा या पूरुभ्यस तरसदस्युर नितोशे | कषेत्रासां ददथुर उर्वरासां घनं दस्युभ्यो अभिभूतिम उग्रम
transliteration: uto hi vāṃ dātrā santi pūrigvedaā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe | kṣetrāsāṃ dadathur urigvedaarāsāṃ ghanaṃ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ughram
translation: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Purus. Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasytis.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उत वाजिनम पुरुनिष्षिध्वानं दधिक्राम उ ददथुर विश्वक्र्ष्टिम | रजिप्यं शयेनम परुषितप्सुम आशुं चर्क्र्त्यम अर्यो नर्पतिं न शूरम
transliteration: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṃ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim |
translation: And ye gave mighty Dadhikras, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people, Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: आशुं दधिक्रां तम उ नु षटवाम दिवस पर्थिव्या उत चर्किराम | उछन्तीर माम उषसः सूदयन्त्व अति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन
transliteration: uchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan
translation: Now give we praise to Dadhikras the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven. May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: महश चर्कर्म्य अर्वतः करतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वर्ष्णः | यम पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर मित्रावरुणा ततुरिम
transliteration: mahaś carkarmy arigvedaataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ | yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṃsaṃ nāghniṃ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim
translation: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikravan rich in bounties, Whom, swift of foot and shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuna and Mitra, gave to Purus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो वयुष्टौ | अनागसं तम अदितिः कर्णोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः
transliteration: yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe aghnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau | anāghasaṃ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ
translation: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrivan, Him, of one mind with Varuna and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यद अमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रम | सवस्तये वरुणम मित्रम अग्निं हवामह इन्द्रं वज्रबाहुम
transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṃ nāma bhadram | svastaye varuṇam mitram aghniṃ havāmaha indraṃ vajrabāhum
translation: When we remember mighty Dadhikravan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts, Varuna, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: इन्द्रम इवेद उभये वि हवयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञम उपप्रयन्तः | दधिक्राम उ सूदनम मर्त्याय ददथुर मित्रावरुणा नो अश्वम
transliteration: indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ | dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam
translation: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing. To us have Varuna and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikris, a guide for mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 39
sanskrit: दधिक्राव्णो अकारिषं जिष्णोर अश्वस्य वाजिनः | सुरभि नो मुखा करत पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत
transliteration: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ | surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translation: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikravan, conquering Steed. Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 40
sanskrit: दधिक्राव्ण इद उ नु चर्किराम विश्वा इन माम उषसः सूदयन्तु | अपाम अग्नेर उषसः सूर्यस्य बर्हस्पतेर आङगिरसस्य जिष्णोः
transliteration: dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu | apām aghner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅghirasasya jiṣṇoḥ
translation: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikravan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion; Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Brhaspati Son of Angiras, and Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 40
sanskrit: सत्वा भरिषो गविषो दुवन्यसच छरवस्याद इष उषसस तुरण्यसत | सत्यो दरवो दरवरः पतंगरो दधिक्रावेषम ऊर्जं सवर जनत
transliteration: satvā bhariṣo ghaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat | satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṃgharo dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṃ svar janat
translation: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn. May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikravan, bring food, strength, and light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 40
sanskrit: उत समास्य दरवतस तुरण्यतः पर्णं न वेर अनु वाति परगर्धिनः | शयेनस्येव धरजतो अङकसम परि दधिक्राव्णः सहोर्जा तरित्रतः
transliteration: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti praghardhinaḥ |
translation: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim, And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikravan's side as he speeds on with might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इन्द्रा को वां वरुणा सुम्नम आप सतोमो हविष्मां अम्र्तो न होता | यो वां हर्दि करतुमां अस्मद उक्तः पस्पर्शद इन्द्रावरुणा नमस्वान
transliteration: indrā ko vāṃ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmāṃ amṛto na hotā | yo vāṃ hṛdi kratumāṃ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān
translation: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuna, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour? Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuna, in spirit?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इन्द्रा ह यो वरुणा चक्र आपी देवौ मर्तः सख्याय परयस्वान | स हन्ति वर्त्रा समिथेषु शत्रून अवोभिर वा महद्भिः स पर शर्ण्वे
transliteration: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān | sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve
translation: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuna, Gods, as his allies to friendship, Jayeth the Vrtras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इन्द्रा ह रत्नं वरुणा धेष्ठेत्था नर्भ्यः शशमानेभ्यस ता | यदी सखाया सख्याय सोमैः सुतेभिः सुप्रयसा मादयैते
transliteration: indrā ha ratnaṃ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā | yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite
translation: Indra and Varuna are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them, When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा दिद्युम अस्मिन्न ओजिष्ठम उग्रा नि वधिष्टं वज्रम | यो नो दुरेवो वर्कतिर दभीतिस तस्मिन मिमाथाम अभिभूत्य ओजः
transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ughrā ni vadhiṣṭaṃ vajram | yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ
translation: Indra and Varuna, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा भूतम अस्या धियः परेतारा वर्षभेव धेनोः | सा नो दुहीयद यवसेव गत्वी सहस्रधारा पयसा मही गौः
transliteration: indrā yuvaṃ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ | sā no duhīyad yavaseva ghatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī ghauḥ
translation: O Indra-Varuna, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow. Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: तोके हिते तनय उर्वरासु सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश च पौंस्ये | इन्द्रा नो अत्र वरुणा सयाताम अवोभिर दस्मा परितक्म्यायाम
transliteration: toke hite tanaya urigvedaarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṃsye | indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām
