translation: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour, May Indra-Varuna with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: युवाम इद धय अवसे पूर्व्याय परि परभूती गविषः सवापी | वर्णीमहे सख्याय परियाय शूरा मंहिष्ठा पितरेव शम्भू
transliteration: yuvām id dhy avase pūrigvedayāya pari prabhūtī ghaviṣaḥ svāpī | vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṃhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū
translation: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty, We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 41
sanskrit: ता वां धियो ऽवसे वाजयन्तीर आजिं न जग्मुर युवयूः सुदानू | शरिये न गाव उप सोमम अस्थुर इन्द्रं गिरो वरुणम मे मनीषाः
transliteration: tā vāṃ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṃ na jaghmur yuvayūḥ sudānū |
translation: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle. For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuna my thoughts and praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 42
sanskrit: मम दविता राष्ट्रं कषत्रियस्य विश्वायोर विश्वे अम्र्ता यथा नः | करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः
transliteration: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṃ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ | kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
translation: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals. Varuna's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अहं राजा वरुणो मह्यं तान्य असुर्याणि परथमा धारयन्त | करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः
transliteration: ahaṃ rājā varuṇo mahyaṃ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta | kratuṃ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
translation: I am King Varuna. To me were given these first existing high celestial powers. Varuna's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अहम इन्द्रो वरुणस ते महित्वोर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके | तवष्टेव विश्वा भुवनानि विद्वान सम ऐरयं रोदसी धारयं च
transliteration: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorigvedaī ghabhīre rajasī sumeke | tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṃ rodasī dhārayaṃ ca
translation: I Varuna am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions, These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvastar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अहम अपो अपिन्वम उक्षमाणा धारयं दिवं सदन रतस्य | रतेन पुत्रो अदितेर रतावोत तरिधातु परथयद वि भूम
transliteration: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṃ divaṃ sadana ṛtasya |
translation: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order. By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: क उ शरवत कतमो यज्ञियानां वन्दारु देवः कतमो जुषाते | कस्येमां देवीम अम्र्तेषु परेष्ठां हर्दि शरेषाम सुष्टुतिं सुहव्याम
transliteration: ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānāṃ vandāru devaḥ katamo juṣāte | kasyemāṃ devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhāṃ hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutiṃ suhavyām
translation: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage? On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: को मर्ळाति कतम आगमिष्ठो देवानाम उ कतमः शम्भविष्ठः | रथं कम आहुर दरवदश्वम आशुं यं सूर्यस्य दुहिताव्र्णीत
transliteration: ko mṛḷāti katama āghamiṣṭho devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ | rathaṃ kam āhur dravadaśvam āśuṃ yaṃ sūryasya duhitāvṛṇīta
translation: Who will be gracious? Who will come most quickly of all the Gods? Who will bring bliss most largely? What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: मक्षू हि षमा गछथ ईवतो दयून इन्द्रो न शक्तिम परितक्म्यायाम | दिव आजाता दिव्या सुपर्णा कया शचीनाम भवथः शचिष्ठा
transliteration: makṣū hi ṣmā ghachatha īvato dyūn indro na śaktim paritakmyāyām | diva ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā
translation: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle. Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: का वाम भूद उपमातिः कया न आश्विना गमथो हूयमाना | को वाम महश चित तयजसो अभीक उरुष्यतम माध्वी दस्रा न ऊती
transliteration: kā vām bhūd upamātiḥ kayā na āśvinā ghamatho hūyamānā | ko vām mahaś cit tyajaso abhīka uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī
translation: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Asvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated? Whether of you confronts e'en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: उरु वां रथः परि नक्षति दयाम आ यत समुद्राद अभि वर्तते वाम | मध्वा माध्वी मधु वाम परुषायन यत सीं वाम पर्क्षो भुरजन्त पक्वाः
transliteration: uru vāṃ rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrād abhi vartate vām | madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīṃ vām pṛkṣo bhurajanta pakvāḥ
translation: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean. Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: सिन्धुर ह वां रसया सिञ्चद अश्वान घर्णा वयो ऽरुषासः परि गमन | तद ऊ षु वाम अजिरं चेति यानं येन पती भवथः सूर्यायाः
transliteration: sindhur ha vāṃ rasayā siñcad aśvān ghṛṇā vayo 'ruṣāsaḥ pari ghman | tad ū ṣu vām ajiraṃ ceti yānaṃ yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ
translation: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither. Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Siirya's Daughter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 43
sanskrit: इहेह यद वां समना पप्र्क्षे सेयम अस्मे सुमतिर वाजरत्ना | उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह शरितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक
transliteration: iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā | uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik
translation: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nasatyas, is my wish directed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 44
sanskrit: तं वां रथं वयम अद्या हुवेम पर्थुज्रयम अश्विना संगतिं गोः | यः सूर्यां वहति वन्धुरायुर गिर्वाहसम पुरुतमं वसूयुम
transliteration: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃghatiṃ ghoḥ | yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur ghirigvedaāhasam purutamaṃ vasūyum
translation: WE will invoke this day your car, farspreading, O Asvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,- Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 44
sanskrit: युवं शरियम अश्विना देवता तां दिवो नपाता वनथः शचीभिः | युवोर वपुर अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते वहन्ति यत ककुहासो रथे वाम
transliteration: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ | yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām
translation: Asvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power. Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 44
sanskrit: को वाम अद्या करते रातहव्य ऊतये वा सुतपेयाय वार्कैः | रतस्य वा वनुषे पूर्व्याय नमो येमानो अश्विना ववर्तत
transliteration: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ |
translation: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices? Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Asvins, offering homage?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 45
sanskrit: एष सय भानुर उद इयर्ति युज्यते रथः परिज्मा दिवो अस्य सानवि | पर्क्षासो अस्मिन मिथुना अधि तरयो दर्तिस तुरीयो मधुनो वि रप्शते
transliteration: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi | pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate
translation: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven. Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 45
sanskrit: उद वाम पर्क्षासो मधुमन्त ईरते रथा अश्वास उषसो वयुष्टिषु | अपोर्णुवन्तस तम आ परीव्र्तं सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः
transliteration: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu | aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṃ svar ṇa śukraṃ tanvanta ā rajaḥ
translation: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn, Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 45
sanskrit: मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिर उत परियम मधुने युञ्जाथां रथम | आ वर्तनिम मधुना जिन्वथस पथो दर्तिं वहेथे मधुमन्तम अश्विना
transliteration: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṃ ratham |
translation: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love. Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Asvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 46
sanskrit: अग्रम पिबा मधूनां सुतं वायो दिविष्टिषु | तवं हि पूर्वपा असि
transliteration: aghram pibā madhūnāṃ sutaṃ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu | tvaṃ hi pūrigvedaapā asi
translation: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vayu, at our holy rites: For thou art he who drinketh first.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 47
sanskrit: वायो शुक्रो अयामि ते मध्वो अग्रं दिविष्टिषु | आ याहि सोमपीतये सपार्हो देव नियुत्वता
transliteration: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo aghraṃ diviṣṭiṣu |
translation: Vayu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites. Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 48
sanskrit: विहि होत्रा अवीता विपो न रायो अर्यः | वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
transliteration: vihi hotrā avītā vipo na rāyo aryaḥ | vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translation: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth. O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 48
sanskrit: निर्युवाणो अशस्तीर नियुत्वां इन्द्रसारथिः | वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
transliteration: niryuvāṇo aśastīr niyutvāṃ indrasārathiḥ | vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translation: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with Indra, seated by thy side, O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अनु कर्ष्णे वसुधिती येमाते विश्वपेशसा | वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
transliteration: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī yemāte viśvapeśasā | vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translation: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear all beauties wait on thee. O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 48
sanskrit: वहन्तु तवा मनोयुजो युक्तासो नवतिर नव | वायव आ चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
transliteration: vahantu tvā manoyujo yuktāso navatir nava | vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
translation: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee. O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 48
sanskrit: वायो शतं हरीणां युवस्व पोष्याणाम | उत वा ते सहस्रिणो रथ आ यातु पाजसा
transliteration: vāyo śataṃ harīṇāṃ yuvasva poṣyāṇām | uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā
translation: Harness, O Vayu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds, Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 49
sanskrit: इदं वाम आस्य हविः परियम इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती | उक्थम मदश च शस्यते
transliteration: idaṃ vām āsy haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī | uktham madaś ca śasyate
translation: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Brhaspati: Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अयं वाम परि षिच्यते सोम इन्द्राब्र्हस्पती | चारुर मदाय पीतये
transliteration: ayaṃ vām pari ṣicyate soma indrābṛhaspatī | cārur madāya pītaye
translation: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Brhaspati, For you, to drink it and rejoice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: यस तस्तम्भ सहसा वि जमो अन्तान बर्हस्पतिस तरिषधस्थो रवेण | तम परत्नास रषयो दीध्यानाः पुरो विप्रा दधिरे मन्द्रजिह्वम
transliteration: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa | tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam
translation: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Brhaspati, with thunder, Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: धुनेतयः सुप्रकेतम मदन्तो बर्हस्पते अभि ये नस ततस्रे | पर्षन्तं सर्प्रम अदब्धम ऊर्वम बर्हस्पते रक्षताद अस्य योनिम
transliteration: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre | pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrigvedaam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim
translation: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Brhaspati, who pressed around us. Preserve Brhaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते या परमा परावद अत आ त रतस्प्र्शो नि षेदुः | तुभ्यं खाता अवता अद्रिदुग्धा मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम
transliteration: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ | tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridughdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam
translation: Brhaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal. For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिः परथमं जायमानो महो जयोतिषः परमे वयोमन | सप्तास्यस तुविजातो रवेण वि सप्तरश्मिर अधमत तमांसि
transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman | saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi
translation: Brhaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven, Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: स सुष्टुभा स रक्वता गणेन वलं रुरोज फलिगं रवेण | बर्हस्पतिर उस्रिया हव्यसूदः कनिक्रदद वावशतीर उद आजत
transliteration: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā ghaṇena valaṃ ruroja phalighaṃ raveṇa | bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat
translation: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala. Brhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: एवा पित्रे विश्वदेवाय वर्ष्णे यज्ञैर विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः | बर्हस्पते सुप्रजा वीरवन्तो वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम
transliteration: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ | bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām
translation: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father. Brhaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: स इद राजा परतिजन्यानि विश्वा शुष्मेण तस्थाव अभि वीर्य्ण | बर्हस्पतिं यः सुभ्र्तम बिभर्ति वल्गूयति वन्दते पूर्वभाजम
transliteration: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryṇa | bṛhaspatiṃ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valghūyati vandate pūrigvedaabhājam
translation: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions, Who cherishes Brhaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: स इत कषेति सुधित ओकसि सवे तस्मा इळा पिन्वते विश्वदानीम | तस्मै विशः सवयम एवा नमन्ते यस्मिन बरह्मा राजनि पूर्व एति
transliteration: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḷā pinvate viśvadānīm | tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrigvedaa eti
translation: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly. To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hatb precedence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: अप्रतीतो जयति सं धनानि परतिजन्यान्य उत या सजन्या | अवस्यवे यो वरिवः कर्णोति बरह्मणे राजा तम अवन्ति देवाः
transliteration: apratīto jayati saṃ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā | avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ
translation: He, unopposed, is master of the riches of his own subjects and of hostile people. The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 50
sanskrit: इन्द्रश च सोमम पिबतम बर्हस्पते ऽसमिन यज्ञे मन्दसाना वर्षण्वसू | आ वां विशन्त्व इन्दवः सवाभुवो ऽसमे रयिं सर्ववीरं नि यछतम
transliteration: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū |
translation: Indra, Brhaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma. Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: इदम उ तयत पुरुतमम पुरस्ताज जयोतिस तमसो वयुनावद अस्थात | नूनं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर गातुं कर्णवन्न उषसो जनाय
transliteration: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt | nūnaṃ divo duhitaro vibhātīr ghātuṃ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya
translation: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hath mounted. Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: अस्थुर उ चित्रा उषसः पुरस्तान मिता इव सवरवो ऽधवरेषु | वय ऊ वरजस्य तमसो दवारोछन्तीर अव्रञ छुचयः पावकाः
transliteration: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu | vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārochantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translation: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices, And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: उछन्तीर अद्य चितयन्त भोजान राधोदेयायोषसो मघोनीः | अचित्रे अन्तः पणयः ससन्त्व अबुध्यमानास तमसो विमध्ये
transliteration: uchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ | acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye
translation: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures. In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: कुवित स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयाद उषसो वो अद्य | येना नवग्वे अङगिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवद ऊष
transliteration: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya | yenā navaghve aṅghire daśaghve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa
translation: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings, Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Dasagva Angira, the seven-toned singer?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: यूयं हि देवीर रतयुग्भिर अश्वैः परिप्रयाथ भुवनानि सद्यः | परबोधयन्तीर उषसः ससन्तं दविपाच चतुष्पाच चरथाय जीवम
transliteration: yūyaṃ hi devīr ṛtayughbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ | prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṃ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam
translation: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel, Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 51
sanskrit: कव सविद आसां कतमा पुराणी यया विधाना विदधुर रभूणाम | शुभं यच छुभ्रा उषसश चरन्ति न वि जञायन्ते सद्र्शीर अजुर्याः
transliteration: kva svid āsāṃ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām |
translation: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the Rbhus' regulations? What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known apart alike, unwasting.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 52
sanskrit: परति षया सूनरी जनी वयुछन्ती परि सवसुः | दिवो अदर्शि दुहिता
transliteration: prati ṣyā sūnarī janī vyuchantī pari svasuḥ | divo adarśi duhitā
translation: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth, Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.-

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अश्वेव चित्रारुषी माता गवाम रतावरी | सखाभूद अश्विनोर उषाः
transliteration: aśveva citrāruṣī mātā ghavām ṛtāvarī | sakhābhūd aśvinor uṣāḥ
translation: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare, The Dawn became the Asvins' Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 52
sanskrit: उत सखास्य अश्विनोर उत माता गवाम असि | उतोषो वस्व ईशिषे
transliteration: uta sakhāsy aśvinor uta mātā ghavām asi | utoṣo vasva īśiṣe
translation: Yea, and thou art the Asvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou: O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 52
sanskrit: यावयद्द्वेषसं तवा चिकित्वित सून्र्तावरि | परति सतोमैर अभुत्स्महि
transliteration: yāvayaddveṣasaṃ tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari | prati stomair abhutsmahi
translation: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away, We woke to meet thee with our lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 52
sanskrit: परति भद्रा अद्र्क्षत गवां सर्गा न रश्मयः | ओषा अप्रा उरु जरयः
transliteration: prati bhadrā adṛkṣata ghavāṃ sarghā na raśmayaḥ | oṣā aprā uru jrayaḥ
translation: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed. Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 53
sanskrit: तद देवस्य सवितुर वार्यम महद वर्णीमहे असुरस्य परचेतसः | छर्दिर येन दाशुषे यछति तमना तन नो महां उद अयान देवो अक्तुभिः
transliteration: tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ | chardir yena dāśuṣe yachati tmanā tan no mahāṃ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ
translation: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice, Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defense. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 53
sanskrit: दिवो धर्ता भुवनस्य परजापतिः पिशङगं दरापिम परति मुञ्चते कविः | विचक्षणः परथयन्न आप्र्णन्न उर्व अजीजनत सविता सुम्नम उक्थ्यम
transliteration: divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅghaṃ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ | vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urigveda ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam
translation: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail. Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अभूद देवः सविता वन्द्यो नु न इदानीम अह्न उपवाच्यो नर्भिः | वि यो रत्ना भजति मानवेभ्यः शरेष्ठं नो अत्र दरविणं यथा दधत
transliteration: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ | vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṃ no atra draviṇaṃ yathā dadhat
translation: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him, Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 54
sanskrit: देवेभ्यो हि परथमं यज्ञियेभ्यो ऽमर्तत्वं सुवसि भागम उत्तमम | आद इद दामानं सवितर वय ्र्णुषे ऽनूचीना जीविता मानुषेभ्यः
transliteration: devebhyo hi prathamaṃ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṃ suvasi bhāgham uttamam |
translation: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immortality: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 55
sanskrit: को वस तराता वसवः को वरूता दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नः | सहीयसो वरुण मित्र मर्तात को वो ऽधवरे वरिवो धाति देवाः
transliteration: ko vas trātā vasavaḥ ko varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ naḥ | sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martāt ko vo 'dhvare varivo dhāti devāḥ
translation: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us, Varuna., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 55
sanskrit: पर ये धामानि पूर्व्याण्य अर्चान वि यद उछान वियोतारो अमूराः | विधातारो वि ते दधुर अजस्रा रतधीतयो रुरुचन्त दस्माः
transliteration: pra ye dhāmāni pūrigvedayāṇy arcān vi yad uchān viyotāro amūrāḥ | vidhātāro vi te dadhur ajasrā ṛtadhītayo rurucanta dasmāḥ
translation: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers, Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted WonderWorkers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 55
sanskrit: पर पस्त्याम अदितिं सिन्धुम अर्कैः सवस्तिम ईळे सख्याय देवीम | उभे यथा नो अहनी निपात उषासानक्ता करताम अदब्धे
transliteration: pra pastyām aditiṃ sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḷe sakhyāya devīm | ubhe yathā no ahanī nipāta uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe
translation: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship: And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 55
sanskrit: वय अर्यमा वरुणश चेति पन्थाम इषस पतिः सुवितं गातुम अग्निः | इन्द्राविष्णू नर्वद उ षु सतवाना शर्म नो यन्तम अमवद वरूथम
transliteration: vy aryamā varuṇaś ceti panthām iṣas patiḥ suvitaṃ ghātum aghniḥ | indrāviṣṇū nṛvad u ṣu stavānā śarma no yantam amavad varūtham
translation: Aryaman, Varuna have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare. Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Visnu grant us their powerful defense and shelter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 56
sanskrit: मही दयावाप्र्थिवी इह जयेष्ठे रुचा भवतां शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः | यत सीं वरिष्ठे बर्हती विमिन्वन रुवद धोक्षा पप्रथानेभिर एवैः
transliteration: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṃ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ | yat sīṃ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ
translation: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours; When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 56
sanskrit: देवी देवेभिर यजते यजत्रैर अमिनती तस्थतुर उक्षमाणे | रतावरी अद्रुहा देवपुत्रे यज्ञस्य नेत्री शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः
transliteration: devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe |
translation: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 57
sanskrit: कषेत्रस्य पतिना वयं हितेनेव जयामसि | गाम अश्वम पोषयित्न्व आ स नो मर्ळातीद्र्शे
transliteration: kṣetrasya patinā vayaṃ hiteneva jayāmasi | ghām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḷātīdṛśe
translation: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 57
sanskrit: कषेत्रस्य पते मधुमन्तम ऊर्मिं धेनुर इव पयो अस्मासु धुक्ष्व | मधुश्चुतं घर्तम इव सुपूतम रतस्य नः पतयो मर्ळयन्तु
transliteration: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṃ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva | madhuścutaṃ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḷayantu
translation: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness, Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 57
sanskrit: मधुमतीर ओषधीर दयाव आपो मधुमन नो भवत्व अन्तरिक्षम | कषेत्रस्य पतिर मधुमान नो अस्त्व अरिष्यन्तो अन्व एनं चरेम
transliteration: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam | kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema
translation: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region. May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: समुद्राद ऊर्मिर मधुमां उद आरद उपांशुना सम अम्र्तत्वम आनट | घर्तस्य नाम गुह्यं यद अस्ति जिह्वा देवानाम अम्र्तस्य नाभिः
transliteration: samudrād ūrmir madhumāṃ ud ārad upāṃśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ | ghṛtasya nāma ghuhyaṃ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translation: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amrta, That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods' tongue is truly Amrta's centre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: वयं नाम पर बरवामा घर्तस्यास्मिन यज्ञे धारयामा नमोभिः | उप बरह्मा शर्णवच छस्यमानं चतुःश्र्ङगो ऽवमीद गौर एतत
transliteration: vayaṃ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ | upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṃ catuḥśṛṅgho 'vamīd ghaura etat
translation: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghrta, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage. So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: चत्वारि शर्ङगा तरयो अस्य पादा दवे शीर्षे सप्त हस्तासो अस्य | तरिधा बद्धो वर्षभो रोरवीति महो देवो मर्त्यां आ विवेश
transliteration: catvāri śṛṅghā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya | tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyāṃ ā viveśa
translation: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number. Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: तरिधा हितम पणिभिर गुह्यमानं गवि देवासो घर्तम अन्व अविन्दन | इन्द्र एकं सूर्य एकं जजान वेनाद एकं सवधया निष टतक्षुः
transliteration: tridhā hitam paṇibhir ghuhyamānaṃ ghavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan | indra ekaṃ sūrya ekaṃ jajāna venād ekaṃ svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ
translation: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Panis. Indra produced one shape, Surya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: एता अर्षन्ति हर्द्यात समुद्राच छतव्रजा रिपुणा नावचक्षे | घर्तस्य धारा अभि चाकशीमि हिरण्ययो वेतसो मध्य आसाम
transliteration: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe | ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām
translation: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not. I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: सम्यक सरवन्ति सरितो न धेना अन्तर हर्दा मनसा पूयमानाः | एते अर्षन्त्य ऊर्मयो घर्तस्य मर्गा इव कषिपणोर ईषमाणाः
transliteration: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ | ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛghā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ
translation: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit. The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: सिन्धोर इव पराध्वने शूघनासो वातप्रमियः पतयन्ति यह्वाः | घर्तस्य धारा अरुषो न वाजी काष्ठा भिन्दन्न ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमानः
transliteration: sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ | ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ
translation: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents, The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: अभि परवन्त समनेव योषाः कल्याण्यः समयमानासो अग्निम | घर्तस्य धाराः समिधो नसन्त ता जुषाणो हर्यति जातवेदाः
transliteration: abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso aghnim | ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ
translation: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni. The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jatavedas joyfully receives them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: कन्या इव वहतुम एतवा उ अञ्ज्य अञ्जाना अभि चाकशीमि | यत्र सोमः सूयते यत्र यज्ञो घर्तस्य धारा अभि तत पवन्ते
transliteration: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi | yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante
translation: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them. Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: अभ्य अर्षत सुष्टुतिं गव्यम आजिम अस्मासु भद्रा दरविणानि धत्त | इमं यज्ञं नयत देवता नो घर्तस्य धारा मधुमत पवन्ते
transliteration: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṃ ghavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta | imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante
translation: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions. Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 4 Hymn 58
sanskrit: धामन ते विश्वम भुवनम अधि शरितम अन्तः समुद्रे हर्द्य अन्तर आयुषि | अपाम अनीके समिथे य आभ्र्तस तम अश्याम मधुमन्तं त ऊर्मिम
transliteration: dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi | apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṃ ta ūrmim
translation: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अबोध्य अग्निः समिधा जनानाम परति धेनुम इवायतीम उषासम | यह्वा इव पर वयाम उज्जिहानाः पर भानवः सिस्रते नाकम अछ
transliteration: abodhy aghniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam | yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha
translation: Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow. Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अबोधि होता यजथाय देवान ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः परातर अस्थात | समिद्धस्य रुशद अदर्शि पाजो महान देवस तमसो निर अमोचि
transliteration: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo aghniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt | samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci
translation: For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen. Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 1
sanskrit: यद ईं गणस्य रशनाम अजीगः शुचिर अङकते शुचिभिर गोभिर अग्निः | आद दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयन्त्य उत्तानाम ऊर्ध्वो अधयज जुहूभिः
transliteration: yad īṃ ghaṇasya raśanām ajīghaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir ghobhir aghniḥ |
translation: When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed. The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: कुमारम माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे | अनीकम अस्य न मिनज जनासः पुरः पश्यन्ति निहितम अरतौ
transliteration: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṃ ghuhā bibharti na dadāti pitre | anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau
translation: THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father. But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: कम एतं तवं युवते कुमारम पेषी बिभर्षि महिषी जजान | पूर्वीर हि गर्भः शरदो ववर्धापश्यं जातं यद असूत माता
transliteration: kam etaṃ tvaṃ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna | pūrigvedaīr hi gharbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṃ jātaṃ yad asūta mātā
translation: What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath bome him. The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: हिरण्यदन्तं शुचिवर्णम आरात कषेत्राद अपश्यम आयुधा मिमानम | ददानो अस्मा अम्र्तं विप्र्क्वत किम माम अनिन्द्राः कर्णवन्न अनुक्थाः
transliteration: hiraṇyadantaṃ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam | dadāno asmā amṛtaṃ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ
translation: I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation, What time I gave him Amrta free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: कषेत्राद अपश्यं सनुतश चरन्तं सुमद यूथं न पुरु शोभमानम | न ता अग्र्भ्रन्न अजनिष्ट हि षः पलिक्नीर इद युवतयो भवन्ति
transliteration: kṣetrād apaśyaṃ sanutaś carantaṃ sumad yūthaṃ na puru śobhamānam | na tā aghṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti
translation: I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining. These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: के मे मर्यकं वि यवन्त गोभिर न येषां गोपा अरणश चिद आस | य ईं जग्र्भुर अव ते सर्जन्त्व आजाति पश्व उप नश चिकित्वान
transliteration: ke me maryakaṃ vi yavanta ghobhir na yeṣāṃ ghopā araṇaś cid āsa | ya īṃ jaghṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān
translation: Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger? Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to us-ward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वसां राजानं वसतिं जनानाम अरातयो नि दधुर मर्त्येषु | बरह्माण्य अत्रेर अव तं सर्जन्तु निन्दितारो निन्द्यासो भवन्तु
transliteration: vasāṃ rājānaṃ vasatiṃ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu | brahmāṇy atrer ava taṃ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu
translation: Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people. So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तवम अग्ने वरुणो जायसे यत तवम मित्रो भवसि यत समिद्धः | तवे विश्वे सहसस पुत्र देवास तवम इन्द्रो दाशुषे मर्त्याय
transliteration: tvam aghne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ | tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya
translation: THOU at thy birth art Varuna, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra. In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तवम अर्यमा भवसि यत कनीनां नाम सवधावन गुह्यम बिभर्षि | अञ्जन्ति मित्रं सुधितं न गोभिर यद दम्पती समनसा कर्णोषि
transliteration: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṃ nāma svadhāvan ghuhyam bibharṣi | añjanti mitraṃ sudhitaṃ na ghobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi
translation: Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer. As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makest wife and lord one-minded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तव शरिये मरुतो मर्जयन्त रुद्र यत ते जनिम चारु चित्रम | पदं यद विष्णोर उपमं निधायि तेन पासि गुह्यं नाम गोनाम
transliteration: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram | padaṃ yad viṣṇor upamaṃ nidhāyi tena pāsi ghuhyaṃ nāma ghonām
translation: The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured. That which was fixed as Visnu's loftiest station-therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तव शरिया सुद्र्शो देव देवाः पुरू दधाना अम्र्तं सपन्त | होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर दशस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः
transliteration: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṃ sapanta | hotāram aghnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ
translation: Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal. As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: न तवद धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान न काव्यैः परो अस्ति सवधावः | विशश च यस्या अतिथिर भवासि स यज्ञेन वनवद देव मर्तान
transliteration: na tvad dhotā pūrigvedao aghne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ | viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān
translation: There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom. Ile man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: वयम अग्ने वनुयाम तवोता वसूयवो हविषा बुध्यमानाः | वयं समर्ये विदथेष्व अह्नां वयं राया सहसस पुत्र मर्तान
transliteration: vayam aghne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ | vayaṃ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṃ vayaṃ rāyā sahasas putra martān
translation: Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened: May we in battle, in the days' assemblies, O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: यो न आगो अभ्य एनो भरात्य अधीद अघम अघशंसे दधात | जही चिकित्वो अभिशस्तिम एताम अग्ने यो नो मर्चयति दवयेन
transliteration: yo na āgho abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṃse dadhāta | jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām aghne yo no marcayati dvayena
translation: He shall bring evil on the evil-plotter whoever turns against us sin and outrage. Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तवाम अस्या वयुषि देव पूर्वे दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्त हव्यैः | संस्थे यद अग्न ईयसे रयीणां देवो मर्तैर वसुभिर इध्यमानः
transliteration: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrigvedae dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ | saṃsthe yad aghna īyase rayīṇāṃ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ
translation: At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy, When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God enkindled with good things by mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अव सप्र्धि पितरं योधि विद्वान पुत्रो यस ते सहसः सून ऊहे | कदा चिकित्वो अभि चक्षसे नो ऽगने कदां रतचिद यातयासे
transliteration: ava spṛdhi pitaraṃ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe | kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'ghne kadāṃ ṛtacid yātayāse
translation: Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power. O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: भूरि नाम वन्दमानो दधाति पिता वसो यदि तज जोषयासे | कुविद देवस्य सहसा चकानः सुम्नम अग्निर वनते वाव्र्धानः
transliteration: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse | kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam aghnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ
translation: Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father. And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: तवम अङग जरितारं यविष्ठ विश्वान्य अग्ने दुरिताति पर्षि | सतेना अद्र्श्रन रिपवो जनासो ऽजञातकेता वर्जिना अभूवन
transliteration: tvam aṅgha jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha viśvāny aghne duritāti parṣi | stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan
translation: Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles. Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 3
sanskrit: इमे यामासस तवद्रिग अभूवन वसवे वा तद इद आगो अवाचि | नाहायम अग्निर अभिशस्तये नो न रीषते वाव्र्धानः परा दात
transliteration: ime yāmāsas tvadrigh abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgho avāci | nāhāyam aghnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt
translation: To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken. But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने वसुपतिं वसूनाम अभि पर मन्दे अध्वरेषु राजन | तवया वाजं वाजयन्तो जयेमाभि षयाम पर्त्सुतीर मर्त्यानाम
transliteration: tvām aghne vasupatiṃ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan | tvayā vājaṃ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām
translation: O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices. Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: हव्यवाळ अग्निर अजरः पिता नो विभुर विभावा सुद्र्शीको अस्मे | सुगार्हपत्याः सम इषो दिदीह्य अस्मद्र्यक सम मिमीहि शरवांसि
transliteration: havyavāḷ aghnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme | sughārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
translation: Agni, Eternal Father, offering- bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent, From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिम मानुषीणां शुचिम पावकं घर्तप्र्ष्ठम अग्निम | नि होतारं विश्वविदं दधिध्वे स देवेषु वनते वार्याणि
transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṃ śucim pāvakaṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭham aghnim | ni hotāraṃ viśvavidaṃ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi
translation: The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter, Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: जुषस्वाग्न इळया सजोषा यतमानो रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य | जुषस्व नः समिधं जातवेद आ च देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि
transliteration: juṣasvāghna iḷayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya | juṣasva naḥ samidhaṃ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi
translation: Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Ila, striving in rivalry with beams of Sarya, Enjoy, O Jatavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: जुष्टो दमूना अतिथिर दुरोण इमं नो यज्ञम उप याहि विद्वान | विश्वा अग्ने अभियुजो विहत्या शत्रूयताम आ भरा भोजनानि
transliteration: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān | viśvā aghne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni
translation: As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest. And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: वधेन दस्युम पर हि चातयस्व वयः कर्ण्वानस तन्वे सवायै | पिपर्षि यत सहसस पुत्र देवान्त सो अग्ने पाहि नर्तम वाजे अस्मान
transliteration: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai | piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so aghne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān
translation: Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body, O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: वयं ते अग्न उक्थैर विधेम वयं हव्यैः पावक भद्रशोचे | अस्मे रयिं विश्ववारं सम इन्वास्मे विश्वानि दरविणानि धेहि
transliteration: vayaṃ te aghna ukthair vidhema vayaṃ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce | asme rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi
translation: May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier! Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: अस्माकम अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व सहसः सूनो तरिषधस्थ हव्यम | वयं देवेषु सुक्र्तः सयाम शर्मणा नस तरिवरूथेन पाहि
transliteration: asmākam aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam | vayaṃ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi
translation: Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation. Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: विश्वानि नो दुर्गहा जातवेदः सिन्धुं न नावा दुरिताति पर्षि | अग्ने अत्रिवन नमसा गर्णानो ऽसमाकम बोध्य अविता तनूनाम
transliteration: viśvāni no durghahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi | aghne atrivan namasā ghṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām
translation: Over all woes and dangers, Jatavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river. Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यस तवा हर्दा कीरिणा मन्यमानो ऽमर्त्यम मर्त्यो जोहवीमि | जातवेदो यशो अस्मासु धेहि परजाभिर अग्ने अम्र्तत्वम अश्याम
transliteration: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi | jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir aghne amṛtatvam aśyām
translation: As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal, Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jatavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यस्मै तवं सुक्र्ते जातवेद उलोकम अग्ने कर्णवः सयोनम | अश्विनं स पुत्र्णं वीरवन्तं गोमन्तं रयिं नशते सवस्ति
transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ sukṛte jātaveda ulokam aghne kṛṇavaḥ syonam | aśvinaṃ sa putṛṇaṃ vīravantaṃ ghomantaṃ rayiṃ naśate svasti
translation: The pious man, O Jatavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure, Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 5
sanskrit: सुसमिद्धाय शोचिषे घर्तं तीव्रं जुहोतन | अग्नये जातवेदसे
transliteration: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana | aghnaye jātavedase
translation: To Agni, Jatavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God, Offer thick sacrificial oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 5
sanskrit: नराशंसः सुषूदतीमं यज्ञम अदाभ्यः | कविर हि मधुहस्त्यः
transliteration: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdatīmaṃ yajñam adābhyaḥ | kavir hi madhuhastyaḥ
translation: He, Narasamsa, ne'er beguiled, inspiriteth this sacrifice: For sage is he, with sweets in hand.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अग्निं तम मन्ये यो वसुर अस्तं यं यन्ति धेनवः | अस्तम अर्वन्त आशवो ऽसतं नित्यासो वाजिन इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर
transliteration: aghniṃ tam manye yo vasur astaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ | astam arigvedaanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
translation: I VALUE Agni that good Lord, the home to which the kine return: Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 6
sanskrit: सो अग्निर यो वसुर गर्णे सं यम आयन्ति धेनवः | सम अर्वन्तो रघुद्रुवः सं सुजातासः सूरय इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर
transliteration: so aghnir yo vasur ghṛṇe saṃ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ | sam arigvedaanto raghudruvaḥ saṃ sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
translation: 'Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine come in herds, To whom the chargers swift of foot, to whom our well-born princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अग्निर हि वाजिनं विशे ददाति विश्वचर्षणिः | अग्नी राये सवाभुवं स परीतो याति वार्यम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर
transliteration: aghnir hi vājinaṃ viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ | aghnī rāye svābhuvaṃ sa prīto yāti vāryam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara
translation: Agni the God of all mankind, gives, verily, a steed to man. Agni gives precious gear for wealth, treasure he gives when he is pleased. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: सखायः सं वः सम्यञ्चम इषं सतोमं चाग्नये | वर्षिष्ठाय कषितीनाम ऊर्जो नप्त्रे सहस्वते
transliteration: sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṃ stomaṃ cāghnaye | varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate
translation: OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise; To him supremest o'er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: कुत्रा चिद यस्य सम्र्तौ रण्वा नरो नर्षदने | अर्हन्तश चिद यम इन्धते संजनयन्ति जन्तवः
transliteration: kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane | arhantaś cid yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ
translation: Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice; Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: सं यद इषो वनामहे सं हव्या मानुषाणाम | उत दयुम्नस्य शवस रतस्य रश्मिम आ ददे
transliteration: saṃ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṃ havyā mānuṣāṇām | uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade
translation: When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men, He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: स समा कर्णोति केतुम आ नक्तं चिद दूर आ सते | पावको यद वनस्पतीन पर समा मिनात्य अजरः
transliteration: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṃ cid dūra ā sate | pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ
translation: He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar, When he, the Bright, unchanged by old, consumes the sovrans of the wood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: अव सम यस्य वेषणे सवेदम पथिषु जुह्वति | अभीम अह सवजेन्यम भूमा पर्ष्ठेव रुरुहुः
transliteration: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati | abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ
translation: He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat, On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: यम मर्त्यः पुरुस्प्र्हं विदद विश्वस्य धायसे | पर सवादनम पितूनाम अस्ततातिं चिद आयवे
transliteration: yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṃ vidad viśvasya dhāyase | pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṃ cid āyave
translation: Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all; He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 7
sanskrit: स हि षमा धन्वाक्षितं दाता न दात्य आ पशुः | हिरिश्मश्रुः शुचिदन्न रभुर अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिः
transliteration: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṃ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ | hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ
translation: Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness, With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्न रतायवः सम ईधिरे परत्नम परत्नास ऊतये सहस्क्र्त | पुरुश्चन्द्रं यजतं विश्वधायसं दमूनसं गर्हपतिं वरेण्यम
transliteration: tvām aghna ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsa ūtaye sahaskṛta | puruścandraṃ yajataṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ damūnasaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ vareṇyam
translation: O AGNI urged to strength, the men of old who loved the Law enkindled thee, the Ancient, for their aid, Thee very bright, and holy, nourisher of all, most excellent, the Friend and Master of the home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने अतिथिम पूर्व्यं विशः शोचिष्केशं गर्हपतिं नि षेदिरे | बर्हत्केतुम पुरुरूपं धनस्प्र्तं सुशर्माणं सववसं जरद्विषम
transliteration: tvām aghne atithim pūrigvedayaṃ viśaḥ śociṣkeśaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ ni ṣedire | bṛhatketum pururūpaṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ suśarmāṇaṃ svavasaṃ jaradviṣam
translation: Thee, Agni, men have stablished as their guest of old, as Master of the household, thee, with hair of flame; High-bannered, multiform, distributor of wealth, kind helper, good protector, drier of the floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने मानुषीर ईळते विशो होत्राविदं विविचिं रत्नधातमम | गुहा सन्तं सुभग विश्वदर्शतं तुविष्वणसं सुयजं घर्तश्रियम
transliteration: tvām aghne mānuṣīr īḷate viśo hotrāvidaṃ viviciṃ ratnadhātamam | ghuhā santaṃ subhagha viśvadarśataṃ tuviṣvaṇasaṃ suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam
translation: The tribes of men praise thee, Agni, who knowest well burnt offerings, the Discerner, lavishest of wealth, Dwelling in secret, Blest One! visible to all, loud-roaring, skilled in worship, glorified with oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने धर्णसिं विश्वधा वयं गीर्भिर गर्णन्तो नमसोप सेदिम | स नो जुषस्व समिधानो अङगिरो देवो मर्तस्य यशसा सुदीतिभिः
transliteration: tvām aghne dharṇasiṃ viśvadhā vayaṃ ghīrbhir ghṛṇanto namasopa sedima | sa no juṣasva samidhāno aṅghiro devo martasya yaśasā sudītibhiḥ
translation: Ever to thee, O Agni, as exceeding strong have we drawn nigh with songs and reverence singing hymns. So be thou pleased with us, Angiras! as a God enkindled by the noble with man's goodly light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवम अग्ने पुरुरूपो विशे-विशे वयो दधासि परत्नथा पुरुष्टुत | पुरूण्य अन्ना सहसा वि राजसि तविषिः सा ते तित्विषाणस्य नाध्र्षे
transliteration: tvam aghne pururūpo viśe-viśe vayo dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta | purūṇy annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya nādhṛṣe
translation: Thou, Agni! multiform, God who art lauded much! givest in every house subsistence as of old. Thou rulest by thy might o'er food of many a sort: that light of thine when blazing may not be opposed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने समिधानं यविष्ठ्य देवा दूतं चक्रिरे हव्यवाहनम | उरुज्रयसं घर्तयोनिम आहुतं तवेषं चक्षुर दधिरे चोदयन्मति
transliteration: tvām aghne samidhānaṃ yaviṣṭhya devā dūtaṃ cakrire havyavāhanam | urujrayasaṃ ghṛtayonim āhutaṃ tveṣaṃ cakṣur dadhire codayanmati
translation: The Gods, Most Youthful Agni, have made thee, inflamed, the bearer of oblations and the messenger. Thee, widely-reaching, homed in sacred oil, invoked, effulgent, have they made the Eye that stirs the thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 8
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने परदिव आहुतं घर्तैः सुम्नायवः सुषमिधा सम ईधिरे | स वाव्र्धान ओषधीभिर उक्षितो ऽभि जरयांसि पार्थिवा वि तिष्ठसे
transliteration: tvām aghne pradiva āhutaṃ ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ suṣamidhā sam īdhire | sa vāvṛdhāna oṣadhībhir ukṣito 'bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase
translation: Men seeking joy have lit thee worshipped from of old, O Agni, with good fuel and with sacred oil. So thou, bedewed and waxing mighty by the plants, spreadest thyself abroad over the realms of earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने हविष्मन्तो देवम मर्तास ईळते | मन्ये तवा जातवेदसं स हव्या वक्ष्य आनुषक
transliteration: tvām aghne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḷate | manye tvā jātavedasaṃ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak
translation: BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God. I deem thee Jatavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अग्निर होता दास्वतः कषयस्य वर्क्तबर्हिषः | सं यज्ञासश चरन्ति यं सं वाजासः शरवस्यवः
transliteration: aghnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ | saṃ yajñāsaś caranti yaṃ saṃ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ
translation: In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest, To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: उत सम यं शिशुं यथा नवं जनिष्टारणी | धर्तारम मानुषीणां विशाम अग्निं सवध्वरम
transliteration: uta sma yaṃ śiśuṃ yathā navaṃ janiṣṭāraṇī | dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṃ viśām aghniṃ svadhvaram
translation: Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life, Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: उत सम दुर्ग्र्भीयसे पुत्रो न हवार्याणाम | पुरू यो दग्धासि वनाग्ने पशुर न यवसे
transliteration: uta sma durghṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām | purū yo daghdhāsi vanāghne paśur na yavase
translation: Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes, When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अध सम यस्यार्चयः सम्यक संयन्ति धूमिनः | यद ईम अह तरितो दिव्य उप धमातेव धमति शिशीते धमातरी यथा
transliteration: adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ | yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā
translation: Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark, When Trta in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e'en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: तवाहम अग्न ऊतिभिर मित्रस्य च परशस्तिभिः | दवेषोयुतो न दुरिता तुर्याम मर्त्यानाम
transliteration: tavāham aghna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ | dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām
translation: O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance, May we, averting hate, subdue the wickedness of mortal men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 9
sanskrit: तं नो अग्ने अभी नरो रयिं सहस्व आ भर | स कषेपयत स पोषयद भुवद वाजस्य सातय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे
transliteration: taṃ no aghne abhī naro rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara | sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
translation: O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God. May he protect and nourish us, and help in gaining strength: be thou near us in fight for our success.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 10
sanskrit: अग्न ओजिष्ठम आ भर दयुम्नम अस्मभ्यम अध्रिगो | पर नो राया परीणसा रत्सि वाजाय पन्थाम
transliteration: aghna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigho | pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām
translation: BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way. With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने अद्भुत करत्वा दक्षस्य मंहना | तवे असुर्यम आरुहत कराणा मित्रो न यज्ञियः
transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā | tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ
translation: Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, by wisdom and bounteousness of power. The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तवं नो अग्न एषां गयम पुष्टिं च वर्धय | ये सतोमेभिः पर सूरयो नरो मघान्य आनशुः
transliteration: tvaṃ no aghna eṣāṃ ghayam puṣṭiṃ ca vardhaya | ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ
translation: Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these, The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 10
sanskrit: ये अग्ने चन्द्र ते गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अश्वराधसः | शुष्मेभिः शुष्मिणो नरो दिवश चिद येषाम बर्हत सुकीर्तिर बोधति तमना
transliteration: ye aghne candra te ghiraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ |
translation: Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed. The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own accord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: जनस्य गोपा अजनिष्ट जाग्र्विर अग्निः सुदक्षः सुविताय नव्यसे | घर्तप्रतीको बर्हता दिविस्प्र्शा दयुमद वि भाति भरतेभ्यः शुचिः
transliteration: janasya ghopā ajaniṣṭa jāghṛvir aghniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase | ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
translation: THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity. With oil upon his face, with high heaven touching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुम परथमम पुरोहितम अग्निं नरस तरिषधस्थे सम ईधिरे | इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं स बर्हिषि सीदन नि होता यजथाय सुक्रतुः
transliteration: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam aghniṃ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire | indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ
translation: Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the. men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat, With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: असम्म्र्ष्टो जायसे मात्रोः शुचिर मन्द्रः कविर उद अतिष्ठो विवस्वतः | घर्तेन तवावर्धयन्न अग्न आहुत धूमस ते केतुर अभवद दिवि शरितः
transliteration: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ | ghṛtena tvāvardhayann aghna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ
translation: Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest from Vivasvan as a charming Sage. With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अग्निर नो यज्ञम उप वेतु साधुयाग्निं नरो वि भरन्ते गर्हे-गर्हे | अग्निर दूतो अभवद धव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं वर्णाना वर्णते कविक्रतुम
transliteration: aghnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāghniṃ naro vi bharante ghṛhe-ghṛhe | aghnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'ghniṃ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum
translation: May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house. He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तुभ्येदम अग्ने मधुमत्तमं वचस तुभ्यम मनीषा इयम अस्तु शं हर्दे | तवां गिरः सिन्धुम इवावनीर महीर आ पर्णन्ति शवसा वर्धयन्ति च
transliteration: tubhyedam aghne madhumattamaṃ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṃ hṛde | tvāṃ ghiraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca
translation: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought. As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने अङगिरसो गुहा हितम अन्व अविन्दञ छिश्रियाणं वने वने | स जायसे मथ्यमानः सहो महत तवाम आहुः सहसस पुत्रम अङगिरः
transliteration: tvām aghne aṅghiraso ghuhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vane vane | sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅghiraḥ
translation: O Agni, the Angirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood. Thou by attrition art produced as conquering might, and men, O Angiras, call thee the Son of Strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 12
sanskrit: पराग्नये बर्हते यज्ञियाय रतस्य वर्ष्णे असुराय मन्म | घर्तं न यज्ञ आस्य सुपूतं गिरम भरे वर्षभाय परतीचीम
transliteration: prāghnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma | ghṛtaṃ na yajña āsy supūtaṃ ghiram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm
translation: To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer; I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अर्चन्तस तवा हवामहे ऽरचन्तः सम इधीमहि | अग्ने अर्चन्त ऊतये
transliteration: arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi | aghne arcanta ūtaye
translation: WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise, Agni, -with songs of praise, for help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अग्ने सतोमम मनामहे सिध्रम अद्य दिविस्प्र्शः | देवस्य दरविणस्यवः
transliteration: aghne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ | devasya draviṇasyavaḥ
translation: Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day, Praise of the God who touches heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अग्निर जुषत नो गिरो होता यो मानुषेष्व आ | स यक्षद दैव्यं जनम
transliteration: aghnir juṣata no ghiro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā | sa yakṣad daivyaṃ janam
translation: May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise, And worship the Celestial Folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तवम अग्ने सप्रथा असि जुष्टो होता वरेण्यः | तवया यज्ञं वि तन्वते
transliteration: tvam aghne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ | tvayā yajñaṃ vi tanvate
translation: Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee Men make the sacrifice complete.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने वाजसातमं विप्रा वर्धन्ति सुष्टुतम | स नो रास्व सुवीर्यम
transliteration: tvām aghne vājasātamaṃ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam | sa no rāsva suvīryam
translation: Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength: So grant thou us heroic might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 13
sanskrit: अग्ने नेमिर अरां इव देवांस तवम परिभूर असि | आ राधश चित्रम रञ्जसे
transliteration: aghne nemir arāṃ iva devāṃs tvam paribhūr asi |
translation: Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods. yearn for bounty manifold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निं सतोमेन बोधय समिधानो अमर्त्यम | हव्या देवेषु नो दधत
transliteration: aghniṃ stomena bodhaya samidhāno amartyam | havyā deveṣu no dadhat
translation: ENKINDLING the Immortal, wake Agni with song of praise: may he bear our oblations to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: तम अध्वरेष्व ईळते देवम मर्ता अमर्त्यम | यजिष्ठम मानुषे जने
transliteration: tam adhvareṣv īḷate devam martā amartyam | yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
translation: At high solemnities mortal men glorify him the Immortal, best At sacrifice among mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: तं हि शश्वन्त ईळते सरुचा देवं घर्तश्चुता | अग्निं हव्याय वोळ्हवे
transliteration: taṃ hi śaśvanta īḷate srucā devaṃ ghṛtaścutā | aghniṃ havyāya voḷhave
translation: That he may bear their gifts to heaven, all glorify him Agni, God, With ladle that distilleth oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निर जातो अरोचत घनन दस्यूञ जयोतिषा तमः | अविन्दद गा अपः सवः
transliteration: aghnir jāto arocata ghnan dasyūñ jyotiṣā tamaḥ | avindad ghā apaḥ svaḥ
translation: Agni shone bright when born, with light killing the Dasyus and the dark: He found the Kine, the Floods, the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निम ईळेन्यं कविं घर्तप्र्ष्ठं सपर्यत | वेतु मे शर्णवद धवम
transliteration: aghnim īḷenyaṃ kaviṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ saparyata | vetu me śṛṇavad dhavam
translation: Serve Agni, God adorable, the Sage whose back is balmed with oil: Let him approach, and hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निं घर्तेन वाव्र्धु सतोमेभिर विश्वचर्षणिम | सवाधीभिर वचस्युभिः
transliteration: aghniṃ ghṛtena vāvṛdhu stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇim | svādhībhir vacasyubhiḥ
translation: They have exalted Agni, God of all mankind, with oil and hymns Of praise, devout and eloquent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 15
sanskrit: पर वेधसे कवये वेद्याय गिरम भरे यशसे पूर्व्याय | घर्तप्रसत्तो असुरः सुशेवो रायो धर्ता धरुणो वस्वो अग्निः
transliteration: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya ghiram bhare yaśase pūrigvedayāya | ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo aghniḥ
translation: To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer. Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 16
sanskrit: बर्हद वयो हि भानवे ऽरचा देवायाग्नये | यम मित्रं न परशस्तिभिर मर्तासो दधिरे पुरः
transliteration: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāghnaye | yam mitraṃ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ
translation: GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स हि दयुभिर जनानां होता दक्षस्य बाह्वोः | वि हव्यम अग्निर आनुषग भगो न वारम रण्वति
transliteration: sa hi dyubhir janānāṃ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ | vi havyam aghnir ānuṣagh bhagho na vāram ṛṇvati
translation: He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man. Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 16
sanskrit: अस्य सतोमे मघोनः सख्ये वर्द्धशोचिषः | विश्वा यस्मिन तुविष्वणि सम अर्ये शुष्मम आदधुः
transliteration: asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ | viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ
translation: All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God, On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 16
sanskrit: अधा हय अग्न एषां सुवीर्यस्य मंहना | तम इद यह्वं न रोदसी परि शरवो बभूवतुः
transliteration: adhā hy aghna eṣāṃ suvīryasya maṃhanā | tam id yahvaṃ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ
translation: So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength. Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 16
sanskrit: नू न एहि वार्यम अग्ने गर्णान आ भर | ये वयं ये च सूरयः सवस्ति धामहे सचोतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे
transliteration: nū na ehi vāryam aghne ghṛṇāna ā bhara | ye vayaṃ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe
translation: O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth. So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 17
sanskrit: आ यज्ञैर देव मर्त्य इत्था तव्यांसम ऊतये | अग्निं कर्ते सवध्वरे पूरुर ईळीतावसे
transliteration: aghniṃ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḷītāvase
translation: GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid, A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अस्य हि सवयशस्तर आसा विधर्मन मन्यसे | तं नाकं चित्रशोचिषम मन्द्रम परो मनीषया
transliteration: asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase | taṃ nākaṃ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā
translation: Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अस्य वासा उ अर्चिषा य आयुक्त तुजा गिरा | दिवो न यस्य रेतसा बर्हच छोचन्त्य अर्चयः
transliteration: asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā ghirā | divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ
translation: Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful song hath bound to act, Whose beams of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अस्य करत्वा विचेतसो दस्मस्य वसु रथ आ | अधा विश्वासु हव्यो ऽगनिर विक्षु पर शस्यते
transliteration: asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā | adhā viśvāsu havyo 'ghnir vikṣu pra śasyate
translation: Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power. Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni glorified.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 17
sanskrit: नू न इद धि वार्यम आसा सचन्त सूरयः | ऊर्जो नपाद अभिष्टये पाहि शग्धि सवस्तय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे
transliteration: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ |
translation: Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips. Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 18
sanskrit: परातर अग्निः पुरुप्रियो विश सतवेतातिथिः | विश्वानि यो अमर्त्यो हव्या मर्तेषु रण्यति
transliteration: prātar aghniḥ purupriyo viśa stavetātithiḥ | viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati
translation: AT dawn let: Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified; Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 18
sanskrit: दविताय मर्क्तवाहसे सवस्य दक्षस्य मंहना | इन्दुं स धत्त आनुषक सतोता चित ते अमर्त्य
transliteration: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā | induṃ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya
translation: For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings, Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तं वो दीर्घायुशोचिषं गिरा हुवे मघोनाम | अरिष्टो येषां रथो वय अश्वदावन्न ईयते
transliteration: taṃ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṃ ghirā huve maghonām | ariṣṭo yeṣāṃ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate
translation: Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life, For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 18
sanskrit: चित्रा वा येषु दीधितिर आसन्न उक्था पान्ति ये | सतीर्णम बर्हिः सवर्णरे शरवांसि दधिरे परि
transliteration: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye | stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari
translation: They who have varied ways of thought, who guard, the lauds within their lips, And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 18
sanskrit: ये मे पञ्चाशतं ददुर अश्वानां सधस्तुति | दयुमद अग्ने महि शरवो बर्हत कर्धि मघोनां नर्वद अम्र्त नर्णाम
transliteration: ye me pañcāśataṃ dadur aśvānāṃ sadhastuti | dyumad aghne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṃ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām
translation: Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite, Heroes' illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 19
sanskrit: अभ्य अवस्थाः पर जायन्ते पर वव्रेर वव्रिश चिकेत | उपस्थे मातुर वि चष्टे
transliteration: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa | upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe
translation: ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk: Within his Mother's side he speaks.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 19
sanskrit: जुहुरे वि चितयन्तो ऽनिमिषं नर्म्णम पान्ति | आ दर्ळ्हाम पुरं विविशुः
transliteration: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṃ nṛmṇam pānti |
translation: Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes. To a strong fort have they pressed in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 20
sanskrit: यम अग्ने वाजसातम तवं चिन मन्यसे रयिम | तं नो गीर्भिः शरवाय्यं देवत्रा पनया युजम
transliteration: yam aghne vājasātama tvaṃ cin manyase rayim | taṃ no ghīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam
translation: AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 20
sanskrit: ये अग्ने नेरयन्ति ते वर्द्धा उग्रस्य शवसः | अप दवेषो अप हवरो ऽनयव्रतस्य सश्चिरे
transliteration: ye aghne nerayanti te vṛddhā ughrasya śavasaḥ | apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire
translation: Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 20
sanskrit: होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे ऽगने दक्षस्य साधनम | यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं गिरा परयस्वन्तो हवामहे
transliteration: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'ghne dakṣasya sādhanam | yajñeṣu pūrigvedayaṃ ghirā prayasvanto havāmahe
translation: Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill; We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 20
sanskrit: इत्था यथा त ऊतये सहसावन दिवे-दिवे | राय रताय सुक्रतो गोभिः षयाम सधमादो वीरैः सयाम सधमादः
transliteration: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan dive-dive | rāya ṛtāya sukrato ghobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ
translation: Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day, For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at the feast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 21
sanskrit: मनुष्वत तवा नि धीमहि मनुष्वत सम इधीमहि | अग्ने मनुष्वद अङगिरो देवान देवयते यज
transliteration: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi | aghne manuṣvad aṅghiro devān devayate yaja
translation: WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee. Like Manus, for the pious man , Angiras, Agni, worship Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवं हि मानुषे जने ऽगने सुप्रीत इध्यसे | सरुचस तवा यन्त्य आनुषक सुजात सर्पिरासुते
transliteration: tvaṃ hi mānuṣe jane 'ghne suprīta idhyase | srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute
translation: For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind. Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवां विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दूतम अक्रत | सपर्यन्तस तवा कवे यज्ञेषु देवम ईळते
transliteration: tvāṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata | saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḷate
translation: Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger. Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 21
sanskrit: देवं वो देवयज्ययाग्निम ईळीत मर्त्यः | समिद्धः शुक्र दीदिह्य रतस्य योनिम आसदः ससस्य योनिम आसदः
transliteration: devaṃ vo devayajyayāghnim īḷīta martyaḥ | samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ
translation: Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods. Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 22
sanskrit: पर विश्वसामन्न अत्रिवद अर्चा पावकशोचिषे | यो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यो होता मन्द्रतमो विशि
transliteration: pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe | yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi
translation: LIKE Atri, Visvasaman! sing to him of purifying light, Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 22
sanskrit: नय अग्निं जातवेदसं दधाता देवम रत्विजम | पर यज्ञ एत्व आनुषग अद्या देवव्यचस्तमः
transliteration: ny aghniṃ jātavedasaṃ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam | pra yajña etv ānuṣagh adyā devavyacastamaḥ
translation: Set Jatavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister. Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 22
sanskrit: चिकित्विन्मनसं तवा देवम मर्तास ऊतये | वरेण्यस्य ते ऽवस इयानासो अमन्महि
transliteration: cikitvinmanasaṃ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye | vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi
translation: All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind. Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.
