title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अग्ने चिकिद्ध्य अस्य न इदं वचः सहस्य | तं तवा सुशिप्र दम्पते सतोमैर वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गीर्भिः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः
transliteration: aghne cikiddhy asya na idaṃ vacaḥ sahasya | taṃ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo ghīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
translation: Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One. Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 23
sanskrit: अग्ने सहन्तम आ भर दयुम्नस्य परासहा रयिम | विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभ्य रसा वाजेषु सासहत
transliteration: aghne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim | viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy ṛsā vājeṣu sāsahat
translation: By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth, Wealth that o'ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 23
sanskrit: तम अग्ने पर्तनाषहं रयिं सहस्व आ भर | तवं हि सत्यो अद्भुतो दाता वाजस्य गोमतः
transliteration: tam aghne pṛtanāṣahaṃ rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara | tvaṃ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya ghomataḥ
translation: Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war; For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 23
sanskrit: विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः | होतारं सद्मसु परियं वयन्ति वार्या पुरु
transliteration: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ | hotāraṃ sadmasu priyaṃ vyanti vāryā puru
translation: For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn, Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 23
sanskrit: स हि षमा विश्वचर्षणिर अभिमाति सहो दधे | अग्न एषु कषयेष्व आ रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि
transliteration: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe | aghna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
translation: For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes. O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अग्ने तवं नो अन्तम उत तराता शिवो भवा वरूथ्यः | वसुर अग्निर वसुश्रवा अछा नक्षि दयुमत्तमं रयिं दाः | स नो बोधि शरुधी हवम उरुष्या णो अघायतः समस्मात | तं तवा शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सुम्नाय नूनम ईमहे सखिभ्यः |
transliteration: aghne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ | vasur aghnir vasuśravā achā nakṣi dyumattamaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ | sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt | taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ | rigveda05024.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:11:34 GMT
translation: O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अछा वो अग्निम अवसे देवं गासि स नो वसुः | रासत पुत्र रषूणाम रतावा पर्षति दविषः
transliteration: achā vo aghnim avase devaṃ ghāsi sa no vasuḥ | rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ
translation: I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us. Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: स हि सत्यो यम पूर्वे चिद देवासश चिद यम ईधिरे | होतारम मन्द्रजिह्वम इत सुदीतिभिर विभावसुम
transliteration: sa hi satyo yam pūrigvedae cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire | hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum
translation: For be is true, whom men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves, The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: स नो धीती वरिष्ठया शरेष्ठया च सुमत्या | अग्ने रायो दिदीहि नः सुव्र्क्तिभिर वरेण्य
transliteration: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā | aghne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya
translation: With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent, O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अग्निर देवेषु राजत्य अग्निर मर्तेष्व आविशन | अग्निर नो हव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं धीभिः सपर्यत
transliteration: aghnir deveṣu rājaty aghnir marteṣv āviśan | aghnir no havyavāhano 'ghniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata
translation: Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike. Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अग्निस तुविश्रवस्तमं तुविब्रह्माणम उत्तमम | अतूर्तं शरावयत्पतिम पुत्रं ददाति दाशुषे
transliteration: aghnis tuviśravastamaṃ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam | atūrtaṃ śrāvayatpatim putraṃ dadāti dāśuṣe
translation: Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame, Of deep devotion, ne'er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अग्निर ददाति सत्पतिं सासाह यो युधा नर्भिः | अग्निर अत्यं रघुष्यदं जेतारम अपराजितम
transliteration: aghnir dadāti satpatiṃ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ | aghnir atyaṃ raghuṣyadaṃ jetāram aparājitam
translation: Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight. Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: यद वाहिष्ठं तद अग्नये बर्हद अर्च विभावसो | महिषीव तवद रयिस तवद वाजा उद ईरते
transliteration: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad aghnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso | mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate
translation: The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light. Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed -from thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तव दयुमन्तो अर्चयो गरावेवोच्यते बर्हत | उतो ते तन्यतुर यथा सवानो अर्त तमना दिवः
transliteration: tava dyumanto arcayo ghrāvevocyate bṛhat | uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ
translation: Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones. Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 25
sanskrit: एवां अग्निं वसूयवः सहसानं ववन्दिम | स नो विश्वा अति दविषः पर्षन नावेव सुक्रतुः
transliteration: evāṃ aghniṃ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṃ vavandima | sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ
translation: Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror. May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अग्ने पावक रोचिषा मन्द्रया देव जिह्वया | आ देवान वक्षि यक्षि च
transliteration: aghne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā |
translation: O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue Bring hither and adore the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: अनस्वन्ता सत्पतिर मामहे मे गावा चेतिष्ठो असुरो मघोनः | तरैव्र्ष्णो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैर वैश्वानर तर्यरुणश चिकेत
transliteration: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me ghāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ | traivṛṣṇo aghne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa
translation: THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon. Trvrsan's son Tryaruna hath distinguished himself, Vaisvanara Agni! with ten thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यो मे शता च विंशतिं च गोनां हरी च युक्ता सुधुरा ददाति | वैश्वानर सुष्टुतो वाव्र्धानो ऽगने यछ तर्यरुणाय शर्म
transliteration: yo me śatā ca viṃśatiṃ ca ghonāṃ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti | vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'ghne yacha tryaruṇāya śarma
translation: Protect Tryaruna, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaisvanara Agni! Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: एवा ते अग्ने सुमतिं चकानो नविष्ठाय नवमं तरसदस्युः | यो मे गिरस तुविजातस्य पूर्वीर युक्तेनाभि तर्यरुणो गर्णाति
transliteration: evā te aghne sumatiṃ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṃ trasadasyuḥ | yo me ghiras tuvijātasya pūrigvedaīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo ghṛṇāti
translation: So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni; Tryaruya who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यो म इति परवोचत्य अश्वमेधाय सूरये | ददद रचा सनिं यते ददन मेधाम रतायते
transliteration: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye | dadad ṛcā saniṃ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate
translation: He who declares his wish to me, to Asvamedha, to the Prince, Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यस्य मा परुषाः शतम उद्धर्षयन्त्य उक्षणः | अश्वमेधस्य दानाः सोमा इव तर्य्र्शिरः
transliteration: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ | aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryṛśiraḥ
translation: From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart, The gifts of Asvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 27
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी शतदाव्न्य अश्वमेधे सुवीर्यम | कषत्रं धारयतम बर्हद दिवि सूर्यम इवाजरम
transliteration: indrāghnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam | kṣatraṃ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram
translation: To Asvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power, O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 28
sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्निर दिवि शोचिर अश्रेत परत्यङङ उषसम उर्विया वि भाति | एति पराची विश्ववारा नमोभिर देवां ईळाना हविषा घर्ताची
transliteration: samiddho aghnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urigvedayā vi bhāti | eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devāṃ īḷānā haviṣā ghṛtācī
translation: AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning. Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 28
sanskrit: समिध्यमानो अम्र्तस्य राजसि हविष कर्ण्वन्तं सचसे सवस्तये | विश्वं स धत्ते दरविणं यम इन्वस्य आतिथ्यम अग्ने नि च धत्त इत पुरः
transliteration: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṃ sacase svastaye | viśvaṃ sa dhatte draviṇaṃ yam invasy ātithyam aghne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ
translation: Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal. He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अग्ने शर्ध महते सौभगाय तव दयुम्नान्य उत्तमानि सन्तु | सं जास्पत्यं सुयमम आ कर्णुष्व शत्रूयताम अभि तिष्ठा महांसि
transliteration: aghne śardha mahate saubhaghāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu | saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi
translation: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours. Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 28
sanskrit: समिद्धस्य परमहसो ऽगने वन्दे तव शरियम | वर्षभो दयुम्नवां असि सम अध्वरेष्व इध्यसे
transliteration: samiddhasya pramahaso 'ghne vande tava śriyam | vṛṣabho dyumnavāṃ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase
translation: Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength. A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 28
sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्न आहुत देवान यक्षि सवध्वर | तवं हि हव्यवाळ असि
transliteration: samiddho aghna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara | tvaṃ hi havyavāḷ asi
translation: Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice: For thou art bearer of our gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 29
sanskrit: तर्य अर्यमा मनुषो देवताता तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त | अर्चन्ति तवा मरुतः पूतदक्षास तवम एषाम रषिर इन्द्रासि धीरः
transliteration: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta | arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ
translation: MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient Rsi.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अनु यद ईम मरुतो मन्दसानम आर्चन्न इन्द्रम पपिवांसं सुतस्य | आदत्त वज्रम अभि यद अहिं हन्न अपो यह्वीर अस्र्जत सर्तवा उ
transliteration: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṃsaṃ sutasya |
translation: What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices, He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: कव सय वीरः को अपश्यद इन्द्रं सुखरथम ईयमानं हरिभ्याम | यो राया वज्री सुतसोमम इछन तद ओको गन्ता पुरुहूत ऊती
transliteration: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṃ sukharatham īyamānaṃ haribhyām | yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam ichan tad oko ghantā puruhūta ūtī
translation: WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers, Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अवाचचक्षम पदम अस्य सस्वर उग्रं निधातुर अन्व आयम इछन | अप्र्छम अन्यां उत ते म आहुर इन्द्रं नरो बुबुधाना अशेम
transliteration: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ughraṃ nidhātur anv āyam ichan | apṛcham anyāṃ uta te ma āhur indraṃ naro bubudhānā aśema
translation: I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation. I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: पर नु वयं सुते या ते कर्तानीन्द्र बरवाम यानि नो जुजोषः | वेदद अविद्वाञ छर्णवच च विद्वान वहते ऽयम मघवा सर्वसेनः
transliteration: pra nu vayaṃ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ | vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarigvedaasenaḥ
translation: We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us. Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सथिरम मनश चक्र्षे जात इन्द्र वेषीद एको युधये भूयसश चित | अश्मानं चिच छवसा दिद्युतो वि विदो गवाम ऊर्वम उस्रियाणाम
transliteration: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit | aśmānaṃ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido ghavām ūrigvedaam usriyāṇām
translation: Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many. With might thou clavest e'en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: परो यत तवम परम आजनिष्ठाः परावति शरुत्यं नाम बिभ्रत | अतश चिद इन्द्राद अभयन्त देवा विश्वा अपो अजयद दासपत्नीः
transliteration: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṃ nāma bibhrat | ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ
translation: When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions, Since then e'en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dasa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: तुभ्येद एते मरुतः सुशेवा अर्चन्त्य अर्कं सुन्वन्त्य अन्धः | अहिम ओहानम अप आशयानम पर मायाभिर मायिनं सक्षद इन्द्रः
transliteration: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṃ sunvanty andhaḥ | ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṃ sakṣad indraḥ
translation: These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma. Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: वि षू मर्धो जनुषा दानम इन्वन्न अहन गवा मघवन संचकानः | अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यद अवर्तयो मनवे गातुम इछन
transliteration: vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan ghavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ | atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave ghātum ichan
translation: Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver. There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dasa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: युजं हि माम अक्र्था आद इद इन्द्र शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर मथायन | अश्मानं चित सवर्यं वर्तमानम पर चक्रियेव रोदसी मरुद्भ्यः
transliteration: yujaṃ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan | aśmānaṃ cit svaryaṃ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ
translation: Pounding the head of Namuci the Dasa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra! Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सत्रियो हि दास आयुधानि चक्रे किम मा करन्न अबला अस्य सेनाः | अन्तर हय अख्यद उभे अस्य धेने अथोप परैद युधये दस्युम इन्द्रः
transliteration: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ | antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ
translation: Women for weapons hath the Dasa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me? Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सम अत्र गावो ऽभितो ऽनवन्तेहेह वत्सैर वियुता यद आसन | सं ता इन्द्रो अस्र्जद अस्य शाकैर यद ईं सोमासः सुषुता अमन्दन
transliteration: sam atra ghāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan | saṃ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṃ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan
translation: Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither. These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यद ईं सोमा बभ्रुधूता अमन्दन्न अरोरवीद वर्षभः सादनेषु | पुरंदरः पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य पुनर गवाम अददाद उस्रियाणाम
transliteration: yad īṃ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu | puraṃdaraḥ papivāṃ indro asya punar ghavām adadād usriyāṇām
translation: What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations. So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 30
sanskrit: भद्रम इदं रुशमा अग्ने अक्रन गवां चत्वारि ददतः सहस्रा | रणंचयस्य परयता मघानि परत्य अग्रभीष्म नर्तमस्य नर्णाम
transliteration: bhadram idaṃ ruśamā aghne akran ghavāṃ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā |
translation: This good deed have the Rusamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle. We have received Rnancaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 31
sanskrit: इन्द्रो रथाय परवतं कर्णोति यम अध्यस्थान मघवा वाजयन्तम | यूथेव पश्वो वय उनोति गोपा अरिष्टो याति परथमः सिषासन
transliteration: indro rathāya pravataṃ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam | yūtheva paśvo vy unoti ghopā aṛiṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan
translation: MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted. Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अदर्दर उत्सम अस्र्जो वि खानि तवम अर्णवान बद्बधानां अरम्णाः | महान्तम इन्द्र पर्वतं वि यद वः सर्जो वि धारा अव दानवं हन
transliteration: adardar utsam asṛjo vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānāṃ aramṇāḥ | mahāntam indra parigvedaataṃ vi yad vaḥ sṛjo vi dhārā ava dānavaṃ han
translation: Thou, Indra, laying the great mountain open, slaying the Danava, didst loose the torrents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तवम उत्सां रतुभिर बद्बधानां अरंह ऊधः पर्वतस्य वज्रिन | अहिं चिद उग्र परयुतं शयानं जघन्वां इन्द्र तविषीम अधत्थाः
transliteration: tvam utsāṃ ṛtubhir badbadhānāṃ araṃha ūdhaḥ parigvedaatasya vajrin | ahiṃ cid ughra prayutaṃ śayānaṃ jaghanvāṃ indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ
translation: The fountain-depths obstructed in their seasons, thou, Thunderer! madest flow, the mountain's udder. Strong Indra, thou by slaying e'en the Dragon that lay extended there hast shown thy vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तयस्य चिन महतो निर मर्गस्य वधर जघान तविषीभिर इन्द्रः | य एक इद अप्रतिर मन्यमान आद अस्माद अन्यो अजनिष्ट तव्यान
transliteration: tyasya cin mahato nir mṛghasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhir indraḥ | ya eka id apratir manyamāna ād asmād anyo ajaniṣṭa tavyān
translation: Indra with violence smote down the weapon, yea, even of that wild and mighty creature. Although he deemed himself alone unequalled, another had been born e'en yet more potent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तयं चिद एषां सवधया मदन्तम मिहो नपातं सुव्र्धं तमोगाम | वर्षप्रभर्मा दानवस्य भामं वज्रेण वज्री नि जघान शुष्णम
transliteration: tyaṃ cid eṣāṃ svadhayā madantam miho napātaṃ suvṛdhaṃ tamoghām | vṛṣaprabharmā dānavasya bhāmaṃ vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam
translation: Him, whom the heavenly food of these delighted, child of the mist, strong waxing, couched in darkness, Him the bolt-hurling Thunderer with his lightning smote down and slew, the Danava's wrath-fire, Susna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तयं चिद अस्य करतुभिर निषत्तम अमर्मणो विदद इद अस्य मर्म | यद ईं सुक्षत्र परभ्र्ता मदस्य युयुत्सन्तं तमसि हर्म्ये धाः
transliteration: tyaṃ cid asya kratubhir niṣattam amarmaṇo vidad id asya marma | yad īṃ sukṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantaṃ tamasi harmye dhāḥ
translation: Though he might ne'er be wounded still his vitals felt that, the God's bolt, which his powers supported, When, after offered draughts, Strong Lord, thou laidest him, fain to battle, in the pit in darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तयं चिद इत्था कत्पयं शयानम असूर्ये तमसि वाव्र्धानम | तं चिन मन्दानो वर्षभः सुतस्योच्चैर इन्द्रो अपगूर्या जघान
transliteration: tyaṃ cid itthā katpayaṃ śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam | taṃ cin mandāno vṛṣabhaḥ sutasyoccair indro apaghūryā jaghāna
translation: Him as he lay there huge in length extended, still waxing in the gloom which no sun lightened, Him, after loud-voiced threats, the Hero Indra, rejoicing in the poured libation, slaughtered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: उद यद इन्द्रो महते दानवाय वधर यमिष्ट सहो अप्रतीतम | यद ईं वज्रस्य परभ्र्तौ ददाभ विश्वस्य जन्तोर अधमं चकार
transliteration: ud yad indro mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa saho apratītam | yad īṃ vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantor adhamaṃ cakāra
translation: When 'gainst the mighty Danava his weapon Indra uplifted, power which none could combat, When at the hurling of his bolt he smote him, he made him lower than all living creatures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तयं चिद अर्णम मधुपं शयानम असिन्वं वव्रम मह्य आदद उग्रः | अपादम अत्रम महता वधेन नि दुर्योण आव्र्णङ मर्ध्रवाचम
transliteration: tyaṃ cid arṇam madhupaṃ śayānam asinvaṃ vavram mahy ādad ughraḥ | apādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācam
translation: The fierce God seized that huge and restless coiler, insatiate, drinker of the sweets, recumbent, And with his mighty weapon in his dwelling smote down the footless evil-speaking ogre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: को अस्य शुष्मं तविषीं वरात एको धना भरते अप्रतीतः | इमे चिद अस्य जरयसो नु देवी इन्द्रस्यौजसो भियसा जिहाते
transliteration: ko asya śuṣmaṃ taviṣīṃ varāta eko dhanā bharate apratītaḥ | ime cid asya jrayaso nu devī indrasyaujaso bhiyasā jihāte
translation: Who may arrest his strength or cheek his vigour? Alone, resistless, he bears off all riches. Even these Twain, these Goddesses, through terror of Indra's might, retire from his dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: नय अस्मै देवी सवधितिर जिहीत इन्द्राय गातुर उशतीव येमे | सं यद ओजो युवते विश्वम आभिर अनु सवधाव्ने कषितयो नमन्त
transliteration: ny asmai devī svadhitir jihīta indrāya ghātur uśatīva yeme | saṃ yad ojo yuvate viśvam ābhir anu svadhāvne kṣitayo namanta
translation: E'en the Celestial Axe bows down before him, and the Earth, lover-like, gives way to Indra. As he imparts all vigour to these people, straightway the folk bend them to him the Godlike.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: एकं नु तवा सत्पतिम पाञ्चजन्यं जातं शर्णोमि यशसं जनेषु | तम मे जग्र्भ्र आशसो नविष्ठं दोषा वस्तोर हवमानास इन्द्रम
transliteration: ekaṃ nu tvā satpatim pāñcajanyaṃ jātaṃ śṛṇomi yaśasaṃ janeṣu | tam me jaghṛbhra āśaso naviṣṭhaṃ doṣā vastor havamānāsa indram
translation: I hear that thou wast born sole Lord of heroes of the Five Races, famed among the people. As such my wishes have most lately grasped him, invoking Indra both at eve and morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 32
sanskrit: एवा हि तवाम रतुथा यातयन्तम मघा विप्रेभ्यो ददतं शर्णोमि | किं ते बरह्माणो गर्हते सखायो ये तवाया निदधुः कामम इन्द्र
transliteration: evā hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyo dadataṃ śṛṇomi | kiṃ te brahmāṇo ghṛhate sakhāyo ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra
translation: So, too, I hear of thee as in due season urging to action and enriching singers. What have thy friends received from thee, the Brahmans who, faithful, rest their hopes on thee, O Indra?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 33
sanskrit: महि महे तवसे दीध्ये नॄन इन्द्रायेत्था तवसे अतव्यान | यो अस्मै सुमतिं वाजसातौ सतुतो जने समर्यश चिकेत
transliteration: mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāyetthā tavase atavyān | yo asmai sumatiṃ vājasātau stuto jane samaryaś ciketa
translation: GREAT praise to Indra, great and strong mid heroes, I ponder thus, the feeble to the Mighty, Who with his band shows favour to this people, when lauded, in the fight where spoil is gathered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 33
sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र धियसानो अर्कैर हरीणां वर्षन योक्त्रम अश्रेः | या इत्था मघवन्न अनु जोषं वक्षो अभि परार्यः सक्षि जनान
transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra dhiyasāno arkair harīṇāṃ vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ | yā itthā maghavann anu joṣaṃ vakṣo abhi prāryaḥ sakṣi janān
translation: So made attentive by our hymns, Steer! Indra! thou fastenedst the girth of thy Bay Coursers, Which, Maghavan, at thy will thou drivest hither. With these subdue for us the men who hate us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 33
sanskrit: न ते त इन्द्राभ्य अस्मद रष्वायुक्तासो अब्रह्मता यद असन | तिष्ठा रथम अधि तं वज्रहस्ता रश्मिं देव यमसे सवश्वः
transliteration: na te ta indrābhy asmad ṛṣvāyuktāso abrahmatā yad asan | tiṣṭhā ratham adhi taṃ vajrahastā raśmiṃ deva yamase svaśvaḥ
translation: They were not turned to us-ward, lofty Indra! while yet through lack of prayer they stood unharnessed. Ascend this chariot, thou whose hand wields thunder, and draw the rein, O Lord of noble horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 33
sanskrit: पुरू यत त इन्द्र सन्त्य उक्था गवे चकर्थोर्वरासु युध्यन | ततक्षे सूर्याय चिद ओकसि सवे वर्षा समत्सु दासस्य नाम चित
transliteration: purū yat ta indra santy ukthā ghave cakarthorigvedaarāsu yudhyan | tatakṣe sūryāya cid okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit
translation: Thou, because many lauds are thine, O Indra, wast active warring in the fields for cattle. For Surya in his own abode thou, Hero, formedst in fights even a Dasa's nature.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 33
sanskrit: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च नरः शर्धो जज्ञाना याताश च रथाः | आस्माञ जगम्याद अहिशुष्म सत्वा भगो न हव्यः परभ्र्थेषु चारुः
transliteration: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca naraḥ śardho jajñānā yātāś ca rathāḥ |
translation: Thine are we, Indra; thine are all these people, conscious of might, whose cars are set in motion. Some hero come to us, O Strong as Ahi beauteous in war, to be invoked like Bhaga.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अजातशत्रुम अजरा सवर्वत्य अनु सवधामिता दस्मम ईयते | सुनोतन पचत बरह्मवाहसे पुरुष्टुताय परतरं दधातन
transliteration: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarigvedaaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate | sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṃ dadhātana
translation: BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds. Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 35
sanskrit: यस ते साधिष्ठो ऽवस इन्द्र करतुष टम आ भर | अस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहं सस्निं वाजेषु दुष्टरम
transliteration: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara | asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sasniṃ vājeṣu duṣṭaram
translation: INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine, Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 35
sanskrit: यद इन्द्र ते चतस्रो यच छूर सन्ति तिस्रः | यद वा पञ्च कषितीनाम अवस तत सु न आ भर
transliteration: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ | yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara
translation: Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three, Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 36
sanskrit: स आ गमद इन्द्रो यो वसूनां चिकेतद दातुं दामनो रयीणाम | धन्वचरो न वंसगस तर्षाणश चकमानः पिबतु दुग्धम अंशुम
transliteration: sa ā ghamad indro yo vasūnāṃ ciketad dātuṃ dāmano rayīṇām | dhanvacaro na vaṃsaghas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dughdham aṃśum
translation: MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches. Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 37
sanskrit: सम भानुना यतते सूर्यस्याजुह्वानो घर्तप्र्ष्ठः सवञ्चाः | तस्मा अम्र्ध्रा उषसो वय उछान य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह
transliteration: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ | tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy uchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha
translation: BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Surya's beam in splendour. For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 37
sanskrit: समिद्धाग्निर वनवत सतीर्णबर्हिर युक्तग्रावा सुतसोमो जराते | गरावाणो यस्येषिरं वदन्त्य अयद अध्वर्युर हविषाव सिन्धुम
transliteration: samiddhāghnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktaghrāvā sutasomo jarāte | ghrāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṃ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum
translation: With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted: And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 37
sanskrit: वधूर इयम पतिम इछन्त्य एति य ईं वहाते महिषीम इषिराम | आस्य शरवस्याद रथ आ च घोषात पुरू सहस्रा परि वर्तयाते
transliteration: vadhūr iyam patim ichanty eti ya īṃ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām |
translation: This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort. Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उरोष ट इन्द्र राधसो विभ्वी रातिः शतक्रतो | अधा नो विश्वचर्षणे दयुम्ना सुक्षत्र मंहय
transliteration: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato | adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṃhaya
translation: WIDE, Indra Satakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace: So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 38
sanskrit: यद ईम इन्द्र शरवाय्यम इषं शविष्ठ दधिषे | पप्रथे दीर्घश्रुत्तमं हिरण्यवर्ण दुष्टरम
transliteration: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe | paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṃ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram
translation: The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यद इन्द्र चित्र मेहनास्ति तवादातम अद्रिवः | राधस तन नो विदद्वस उभयाहस्त्य आ भर
transliteration: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ | rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara
translation: STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee, That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यन मन्यसे वरेण्यम इन्द्र दयुक्षं तद आ भर | विद्याम तस्य ते वयम अकूपारस्य दावने
transliteration: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṃ tad ā bhara | vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane
translation: Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven. So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यत ते दित्सु परराध्यम मनो अस्ति शरुतम बर्हत | तेन दर्ळ्हा चिद अद्रिव आ वाजं दर्षि सातये
transliteration: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat | tena dṛḷhā cid adriva ā vājaṃ darṣi sātaye
translation: Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,- With this thou rendest e'en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 39
sanskrit: मंहिष्ठं वो मघोनां राजानं चर्षणीनाम | इन्द्रम उप परशस्तये पूर्वीभिर जुजुषे गिरः
transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghonāṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīnām | indram upa praśastaye pūrigvedaībhir jujuṣe ghiraḥ
translation: Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame, Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 39
sanskrit: अस्मा इत काव्यं वच उक्थम इन्द्राय शंस्यम | तस्मा उ बरह्मवाहसे गिरो वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः
transliteration: asmā it kāvyaṃ vaca uktham indrāya śaṃsyam | tasmā u brahmavāhase ghiro vardhanty atrayo ghiraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ
translation: To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise. To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 40
sanskrit: आ याह्य अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं सोमपते पिब | वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम
transliteration: vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
translation: COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord, Indra best Vrtra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 40
sanskrit: वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः | वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम
transliteration: vṛṣā ghrāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ | vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
translation: Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed, Indra, best Vrtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 40
sanskrit: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ चित्राभिर ऊतिभिः | वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम
transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ | vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama
translation: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids, Indra, best Vrtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 41
sanskrit: को नु वाम मित्रावरुणाव रतायन दिवो वा महः पार्थिवस्य वा दे | रतस्य वा सदसि तरासीथां नो यज्ञायते वा पशुषो न वाजान
transliteration: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de |
translation: WHO, Mitra-Varuna, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven? Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 42
sanskrit: पर शंतमा वरुणं दीधिती गीर मित्रम भगम अदितिं नूनम अश्याः | पर्षद्योनिः पञ्चहोता शर्णोत्व अतूर्तपन्था असुरो मयोभुः
transliteration: pra śaṃtamā varuṇaṃ dīdhitī ghīr mitram bhagham aditiṃ nūnam aśyāḥ | pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ
translation: Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuna, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga. May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 42
sanskrit: परति मे सतोमम अदितिर जग्र्भ्यात सूनुं न माता हर्द्यं सुशेवम | बरह्म परियं देवहितं यद अस्त्य अहम मित्रे वरुणे यन मयोभु
transliteration: prati me stomam aditir jaghṛbhyāt sūnuṃ na mātā hṛdyaṃ suśevam | brahma priyaṃ devahitaṃ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu
translation: May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her. The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuna and Mitra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 42
sanskrit: उद ईरय कवितमं कवीनाम उनत्तैनम अभि मध्वा घर्तेन | स नो वसूनि परयता हितानि चन्द्राणि देवः सविता सुवाति
transliteration: ud īraya kavitamaṃ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena | sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti
translation: In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 42
sanskrit: सम इन्द्र णो मनसा नेषि गोभिः सं सूरिभिर हरिवः सं सवस्ति | सम बरह्मणा देवहितं यद अस्ति सं देवानां सुमत्या यज्ञियानाम
transliteration: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi ghobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivaḥ saṃ svasti | sam brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatyā yajñiyānām
translation: With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons; And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 42
sanskrit: देवो भगः सविता रायो अंश इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य संजितो धनानाम | रभुक्षा वाज उत वा पुरंधिर अवन्तु नो अम्र्तासस तुरासः
transliteration: devo bhaghaḥ savitā rāyo aṃśa indro vṛtrasya saṃjito dhanānām |
translation: God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vrtra's treasures, And Vaja and Rbhuksan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 43
sanskrit: आ धेनवः पयसा तूर्ण्यर्था अमर्धन्तीर उप नो यन्तु मध्वा | महो राये बर्हतीः सप्त विप्रो मयोभुवो जरिता जोहवीति
transliteration: maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti
translation: MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness. The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 44
sanskrit: तम परत्नथा पूर्वथा विश्वथेमथा जयेष्ठतातिम बर्हिषदं सवर्विदम | परतीचीनं वर्जनं दोहसे गिराशुं जयन्तम अनु यासु वर्धसे
transliteration: tam pratnathā pūrigvedaathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadaṃ svarigvedadam | pratīcīnaṃ vṛjanaṃ dohase ghirāśuṃ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase
translation: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with song, The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxeth strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 45
sanskrit: विदा दिवो विष्यन्न अद्रिम उक्थैर आयत्या उषसो अर्चिनो गुः | अपाव्र्त वरजिनीर उत सवर गाद वि दुरो मानुषीर देव आवः
transliteration: vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino ghuḥ | apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar ghād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ
translation: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open. The Sun hath risen and open the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 45
sanskrit: वि सूर्यो अमतिं न शरियं साद ओर्वाद गवाम माता जानती गात | धन्वर्णसो नद्यः खादोर्णा सथूणेव सुमिता दरंहत दयौः
transliteration: vi sūryo amatiṃ na śriyaṃ sād origvedaād ghavām mātā jānatī ghāt | dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ
translation: Surya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable, To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 45
sanskrit: अस्मा उक्थाय पर्वतस्य गर्भो महीनां जनुषे पूर्व्याय | वि पर्वतो जिहीत साधत दयौर आविवासन्तो दसयन्त भूम
transliteration: asmā ukthāya parigvedaatasya gharbho mahīnāṃ januṣe pūrigvedayāya | vi parigvedaato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma
translation: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 45
sanskrit: सूक्तेभिर वो वचोभिर देवजुष्टैर इन्द्रा नव अग्नी अवसे हुवध्यै | उक्थेभिर हि षमा कवयः सुयज्ञा आविवासन्तो मरुतो यजन्ति
transliteration: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv aghnī avase huvadhyai | ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti
translation: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour, For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 45
sanskrit: एतो नव अद्य सुध्यो भवाम पर दुछुना मिनवामा वरीयः | आरे दवेषांसि सनुतर दधामायाम पराञ्चो यजमानम अछ
transliteration: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra duchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ |
translation: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune. Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: हयो न विद्वां अयुजि सवयं धुरि तां वहामि परतरणीम अवस्युवम | नास्या वश्मि विमुचं नाव्र्तम पुनर विद्वान पथः पुरेत रजु नेषति
transliteration: hayo na vidvāṃ ayuji svayaṃ dhuri tāṃ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam | nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṃ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati
translation: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help. I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: अग्न इन्द्र वरुण मित्र देवाः शर्धः पर यन्त मारुतोत विष्णो | उभा नासत्या रुद्रो अध गनाः पूषा भगः सरस्वती जुषन्त
transliteration: aghna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo | ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha ghnāḥ pūṣā bhaghaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta
translation: O Agni, Indra, Varuna, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Visnu. May both Nasatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pusan, Sarasvati, Bhaga, accept us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी मित्रावरुणादितिं सवः पर्थिवीं दयाम मरुतः पर्वतां अपः | हुवे विष्णुम पूषणम बरह्मणस पतिम भगं नु शंसं सवितारम ऊतये
transliteration: indrāghnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṃ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām marutaḥ parigvedaatāṃ apaḥ | huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhaghaṃ nu śaṃsaṃ savitāram ūtaye
translation: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven, Visnu I call, Pusan, and Brahmanaspati, and Bhaga, Samsa, Savitar that they may help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: उत नो विष्णुर उत वातो अस्रिधो दरविणोदा उत सोमो मयस करत | उत रभव उत राये नो अश्विनोत तवष्टोत विभ्वानु मंसते
transliteration: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat | uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṃsate
translation: May Visnu also and Vata who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy; And may the Rbhus and the Asvins, Tvastar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: उत तयन नो मारुतं शर्ध आ गमद दिविक्षयं यजतम बर्हिर आसदे | बर्हस्पतिः शर्म पूषोत नो यमद वरूथ्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
transliteration: uta tyan no mārutaṃ śardha ā ghamad divikṣayaṃ yajatam barhir āsade | bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā
translation: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass; Brhaspati and Pusan grant us sure defense, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: उत तये नः पर्वतासः सुशस्तयः सुदीतयो नद्यस तरामणे भुवन | भगो विभक्ता शवसावसा गमद उरुव्यचा अदितिः शरोतु मे हवम
transliteration: uta tye naḥ parigvedaatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan | bhagho vibhaktā śavasāvasā ghamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam
translation: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm. May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: देवानाम पत्नीर उशतीर अवन्तु नः परावन्तु नस तुजये वाजसातये | याः पार्थिवासो या अपाम अपि वरते ता नो देवीः सुहवाः शर्म यछत
transliteration: devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye | yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yachata
translation: May the Gods' Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil. Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 46
sanskrit: उत गना वयन्तु देवपत्नीर इन्द्राण्य अग्नाय्य अश्विनी राट | आ रोदसी वरुणानी शर्णोतु वयन्तु देवीर य रतुर जनीनाम
transliteration: uta ghnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy aghnāyy aśvinī rāṭ |
translation: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Rat, Asvini, Agnayi, and Indrani. May Rodasi and Varunani hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 47
sanskrit: परयुञ्जती दिव एति बरुवाणा मही माता दुहितुर बोधयन्ती | आविवासन्ती युवतिर मनीषा पित्र्भ्य आ सदने जोहुवाना
transliteration: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī |
translation: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 48
sanskrit: कद उ परियाय धाम्ने मनामहे सवक्षत्राय सवयशसे महे वयम | आमेन्यस्य रजसो यद अभ्र आं अपो वर्णाना वितनोति मायिनी
transliteration: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam |
translation: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself, Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to the immeasurable middle region's cloud?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 49
sanskrit: देवं वो अद्य सवितारम एषे भगं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः | आ वां नरा पुरुभुजा वव्र्त्यां दिवे-दिवे चिद अश्विना सखीयन
transliteration: devaṃ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhaghaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ |
translation: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals. You, Asvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 50
sanskrit: विश्वो देवस्य नेतुर मर्तो वुरीत सख्यम | विश्वो राय इषुध्यति दयुम्नं वर्णीत पुष्यसे
transliteration: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam | viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase
translation: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 50
sanskrit: ते ते देव नेतर ये चेमां अनुशसे | ते राया ते हय रप्र्चे सचेमहि सचथ्यः
transliteration: te te deva netar ye cemāṃ anuśase | te rāyā te hy ṛpṛce sacemahi sacathyaḥ
translation: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us. As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 50
sanskrit: अतो न आ नञ्न अतिथीन अतः पत्नीर दशस्यत | आरे विश्वम पथेष्ठां दविषो युयोतु यूयुविः
transliteration: ato na ā nñn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata |
translation: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames. May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 51
sanskrit: अग्ने सुतस्य पीतये विश्वैर ऊमेभिर आ गहि | देवेभिर हव्यदातये
transliteration: aghne sutasya pītaye viśvair ūmebhir ā ghahi | devebhir havyadātaye
translation: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice; With Gods unto our sacred gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 52
sanskrit: पर शयावाश्व धर्ष्णुयार्चा मरुद्भिर रक्वभिः | ये अद्रोघम अनुष्वधं शरवो मदन्ति यज्ञियाः
transliteration: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ | ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṃ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ
translation: SING boldly forth, Syavasva, with the Maruts who are loud in song, Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 52
sanskrit: ते हि सथिरस्य शवसः सखायः सन्ति धर्ष्णुया | ते यामन्न आ धर्षद्विनस तमना पान्ति शश्वतः
transliteration: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā | te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ
translation: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength. They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 52
sanskrit: ते सयन्द्रासो नोक्षणो ऽति षकन्दन्ति शर्वरीः | मरुताम अधा महो दिवि कषमा च मन्महे
transliteration: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarigvedaarīḥ | marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe
translation: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights; And thus the Maruts' power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 52
sanskrit: मरुत्सु वो दधीमहि सतोमं यज्ञं च धर्ष्णुया | विश्वे ये मानुषा युगा पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः
transliteration: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā | viśve ye mānuṣā yughā pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ
translation: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अर्हन्तो ये सुदानवो नरो असामिशवसः | पर यज्ञं यज्ञियेभ्यो दिवो अर्चा मरुद्भ्यः
transliteration: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ | pra yajñaṃ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ
translation: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength - To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 53
sanskrit: को वेद जानम एषां को वा पुरा सुम्नेष्व आस मरुताम | यद युयुज्रे किलास्यः
transliteration: ko veda jānam eṣāṃ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām | yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ
translation: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts' favour in the days of old What time their spotted deer were yoked?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 53
sanskrit: ऐतान रथेषु तस्थुषः कः शुश्राव कथा ययुः | कस्मै सस्रुः सुदासे अन्व आपय इळाभिर वर्ष्टयः सह
transliteration: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ | kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḷābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha
translation: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went? Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 53
sanskrit: ते म आहुर य आययुर उप दयुभिर विभिर मदे | नरो मर्या अरेपस इमान पश्यन्न इति षटुहि
transliteration: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made | naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi
translation: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught, Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 53
sanskrit: ये अञ्जिषु ये वाशीषु सवभानवः सरक्षु रुक्मेषु खादिषु | शराया रथेषु धन्वसु
transliteration: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu |
translation: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths, Arrayed on chariots and with bows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: पर शर्धाय मारुताय सवभानव इमां वाचम अनजा पर्वतच्युते | घर्मस्तुभे दिव आ पर्ष्ठयज्वने दयुम्नश्रवसे महि नर्म्णम अर्चत
transliteration: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṃ vācam anajā parigvedaatacyute | gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata
translation: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down. Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: पर वो मरुतस तविषा उदन्यवो वयोव्र्धो अश्वयुजः परिज्रयः | सं विद्युता दधति वाशति तरितः सवरन्त्य आपो ऽवना परिज्रयः
transliteration: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ | saṃ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ
translation: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far. Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: विद्युन्महसो नरो अश्मदिद्यवो वातत्विषो मरुतः पर्वतच्युतः | अब्दया चिन मुहुर आ हरादुनीव्र्त सतनयदमा रभसा उदोजसः
transliteration: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parigvedaatacyutaḥ | abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ
translation: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills, Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: वय अक्तून रुद्रा वय अहानि शिक्वसो वय अन्तरिक्षं वि रजांसि धूतयः | वि यद अज्रां अजथ नाव ईं यथा वि दुर्गाणि मरुतो नाह रिष्यथ
transliteration: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṃ vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ | vi yad ajrāṃ ajatha nāva īṃ yathā vi durghāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha
translation: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all, When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e'en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तद वीर्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दीर्घं ततान सूर्यो न योजनम | एता न यामे अग्र्भीतशोचिषो ऽनश्वदां यन नय अयातना गिरिम
transliteration: tad vīryaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ tatāna sūryo na yojanam | etā na yāme aghṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṃ yan ny ayātanā ghirim
translation: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o'er a lengthened way, When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अभ्राजि शर्धो मरुतो यद अर्णसम मोषथा वर्क्षं कपनेव वेधसः | अध समा नो अरमतिं सजोषसश चक्षुर इव यन्तम अनु नेषथा सुगम
transliteration: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṃ kapaneva vedhasaḥ | adha smā no aramatiṃ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugham
translation: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it. Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: न स जीयते मरुतो न हन्यते न सरेधति न वयथते न रिष्यति | नास्य राय उप दस्यन्ति नोतय रषिं वा यं राजानं वा सुषूदथ
transliteration: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati | nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṃ vā yaṃ rājānaṃ vā suṣūdatha
translation: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne'er is distressed or harmed; His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or Rsi, ye direct.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: नियुत्वन्तो गरामजितो यथा नरो ऽरयमणो न मरुतः कबन्धिनः | पिन्वन्त्य उत्सं यद इनासो अस्वरन वय उन्दन्ति पर्थिवीम मध्वो अन्धसा
transliteration: niyutvanto ghrāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ | pinvanty utsaṃ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā
translation: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their water-casks, Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: परवत्वतीयम पर्थिवी मरुद्भ्यः परवत्वती दयौर भवति परयद्भ्यः | परवत्वतीः पथ्य्र अन्तरिक्ष्याः परवत्वन्तः पर्वता जीरदानवः
transliteration: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ | pravatvatīḥ pathyṛ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parigvedaatā jīradānavaḥ
translation: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents. The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: यन मरुतः सभरसः सवर्णरः सूर्य उदिते मदथा दिवो नरः | न वो ऽशवाः शरथयन्ताह सिस्रतः सद्यो अस्याध्वनः पारम अश्नुथ
transliteration: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ | na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha
translation: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky, Your coursers weary not when speeding on their way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: अंसेषु व रष्टयः पत्सु खादयो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा मरुतो रथे शुभः | अग्निभ्राजसो विद्युतो गभस्त्योः शिप्राः शीर्षसु वितता हिरण्ययीः
transliteration: aṃseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣassu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ | aghnibhrājaso vidyuto ghabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ
translation: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car. Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wrought of gold are laid upon your heads.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तं नाकम अर्यो अग्र्भीतशोचिषं रुशत पिप्पलम मरुतो वि धूनुथ | सम अच्यन्त वर्जनातित्विषन्त यत सवरन्ति घोषं विततम रतायवः
transliteration: taṃ nākam aryo aghṛbhītaśociṣaṃ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha | sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṃ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ
translation: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit. They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a far-resounding shout.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: युष्मादत्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रायः सयाम रथ्यो वयस्वतः | न यो युछति तिष्यो यथा दिवो ऽसमे रारन्त मरुतः सहस्रिणम
transliteration: yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ | na yo yuchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam
translation: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches full of life that have been given by you. O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: यूयं रयिम मरुत सपार्हवीरं यूयम रषिम अवथ सामविप्रम | यूयम अर्वन्तम भरताय वाजं यूयं धत्थ राजानं शरुष्टिमन्तम
transliteration: yūyaṃ rayim maruta spārhavīraṃ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram | yūyam arigvedaantam bharatāya vājaṃ yūyaṃ dhattha rājānaṃ śruṣṭimantam
translation: Maruts, ye further wealth with longed for heroes, further the Rsi skilled in chanted verses. Ye give the Bharata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तद वो यामि दरविणं सद्यूतयो येना सवर ण ततनाम नॄंर अभि | इदं सु मे मरुतो हर्यता वचो यस्य तरेम तरसा शतं हिमाः
transliteration: tad vo yāmi draviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝṃr abhi | idaṃ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṃ himāḥ
translation: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun. Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 55
sanskrit: परयज्यवो मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयो बर्हद वयो दधिरे रुक्मवक्षसः | ईयन्ते अश्वैः सुयमेभिर आशुभिः शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत
transliteration: prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayo bṛhad vayo dadhire rukmavakṣasaḥ |
translation: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of life. They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 56
sanskrit: अग्ने शर्धन्तम आ गणम पिष्टं रुक्मेभिर अञ्जिभिः | विशो अद्य मरुताम अव हवये दिवश चिद रोचनाद अधि
transliteration: aghne śardhantam ā ghaṇam piṣṭaṃ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ | viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi
translation: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold, The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 56
sanskrit: यथा चिन मन्यसे हर्दा तद इन मे जग्मुर आशसः | ये ते नेदिष्ठं हवनान्य आगमन तान वर्ध भीमसंद्र्शः
transliteration: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jaghmur āśasaḥ | ye te nediṣṭhaṃ havanāny āghaman tān vardha bhīmasaṃdṛśaḥ
translation: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend. Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 56
sanskrit: मीळ्हुष्मतीव पर्थिवी पराहता मदन्त्य एत्य अस्मद आ | रक्षो न वो मरुतः शिमीवां अमो दुध्रो गौर इव भीमयुः
transliteration: mīḷhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā |
translation: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us. Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is you rush terrible as a dreadful bull..

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 57
sanskrit: आ रुद्रास इन्द्रवन्तः सजोषसो हिरण्यरथाः सुविताय गन्तन | इयं वो अस्मत परति हर्यते मतिस तर्ष्णजे न दिव उत्सा उदन्यवे
transliteration: iyaṃ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave
translation: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity. An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who thirsts for water, heavenly springs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 57
sanskrit: वाशीमन्त रष्टिमन्तो मनीषिणः सुधन्वान इषुमन्तो निषङगिणः | सवश्वा सथ सुरथाः पर्श्निमातरः सवायुधा मरुतो याथना शुभम
transliteration: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅghiṇaḥ | svaśvā stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham
translation: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows, Good horses and good cars have ye, O Prsni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 57
sanskrit: धूनुथ दयाम पर्वतान दाशुषे वसु नि वो वना जिहते यामनो भिया | कोपयथ पर्थिवीम पर्श्निमातरः शुभे यद उग्राः पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम
transliteration: dhūnutha dyām parigvedaatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā | kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ughrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam
translation: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down. Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Prsni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 57
sanskrit: वातत्विषो मरुतो वर्षनिर्णिजो यमा इव सुसद्र्शः सुपेशसः | पिशङगाश्वा अरुणाश्वा अरेपसः परत्वक्षसो महिना दयौर इवोरवः
transliteration: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ | piśaṅghāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ
translation: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form, The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawny hued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 57
sanskrit: पुरुद्रप्सा अञ्जिमन्तः सुदानवस तवेषसंद्र्शो अनवभ्रराधसः | सुजातासो जनुषा रुक्मवक्षसो दिवो अर्का अम्र्तं नाम भेजिरे
transliteration: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṃdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ | sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṃ nāma bhejire
translation: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure, Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 58
sanskrit: तम उ नूनं तविषीमन्तम एषां सतुषे गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम | य आश्वश्वा अमवद वहन्त उतेशिरे अम्र्तस्य सवराजः
transliteration: tam u nūnaṃ taviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣe ghaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām | ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ
translation: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts, Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amrta.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 58
sanskrit: तवेषं गणं तवसं खादिहस्तं धुनिव्रतम मायिनं दातिवारम | मयोभुवो ये अमिता महित्वा वन्दस्व विप्र तुविराधसो नॄन
transliteration: tveṣaṃ ghaṇaṃ tavasaṃ khādihastaṃ dhunivratam māyinaṃ dātivāram | mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn
translation: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness, With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,-these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: पर व सपळ अक्रन सुविताय दावने ऽरचा दिवे पर पर्थिव्या रतम भरे | उक्षन्ते अश्वान तरुषन्त आ रजो ऽनु सवम भानुं शरथयन्ते अर्णवैः
transliteration: pra va spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare | ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṃ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ
translation: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice. They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: अमाद एषाम भियसा भूमिर एजति नौर न पूर्णा कषरति वयथिर यती | दूरेद्र्शो ये चितयन्त एमभिर अन्तर महे विदथे येतिरे नरः
transliteration: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī | dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ
translation: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in. Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: गवाम इव शरियसे शर्ङगम उत्तमं सूर्यो न चक्षू रजसो विसर्जने | अत्या इव सुभ्वश चारव सथन मर्या इव शरियसे चेतथा नरः
transliteration: ghavām iva śriyase śṛṅgham uttamaṃ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane | atyā iva subhvaś cārava sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ
translation: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse, Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: को वो महान्ति महताम उद अश्नवत कस काव्या मरुतः को ह पौंस्या | यूयं ह भूमिं किरणं न रेजथ पर यद भरध्वे सुविताय दावने
transliteration: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṃsyā | yūyaṃ ha bhūmiṃ kiraṇaṃ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane
translation: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds? Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: अश्वा इवेद अरुषासः सबन्धवः शूरा इव परयुधः परोत युयुधुः | मर्या इव सुव्र्धो वाव्र्धुर नरः सूर्यस्य चक्षुः पर मिनन्ति वर्ष्टिभिः
transliteration: aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ | maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ
translation: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van. The Heroes have waxed strong like we.1grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: ते अज्येष्ठा अकनिष्ठास उद्भिदो ऽमध्यमासो महसा वि वाव्र्धुः | सुजातासो जनुषा पर्श्निमातरो दिवो मर्या आ नो अछा जिगातन
transliteration: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ | sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no achā jighātana
translation: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlemost, preeminent they have waxed in might, These Sons of Prsni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitherward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: वयो न ये शरेणीः पप्तुर ओजसान्तान दिवो बर्हतः सानुनस परि | अश्वास एषाम उभये यथा विदुः पर पर्वतस्य नभनूंर अचुच्यवुः
transliteration: vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari | aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parigvedaatasya nabhanūṃr acucyavuḥ
translation: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky. The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mountains to descend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 59
sanskrit: मिमातु दयौर अदितिर वीतये नः सं दानुचित्रा उषसो यतन्ताम | आचुच्यवुर दिव्यं कोशम एत रषे रुद्रस्य मरुतो गर्णानाः
transliteration: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṃ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām |
translation: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture. Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O Rsi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 60
sanskrit: ईळे अग्निं सववसं नमोभिर इह परसत्तो वि चयत कर्तं नः | रथैर इव पर भरे वाजयद्भिः परदक्षिणिन मरुतां सतोमम रध्याम
transliteration: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām
translation: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us. As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 61
sanskrit: के षठा नरः शरेष्ठतमा य एक-एक आयय | परमस्याः परावतः
transliteration: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya eka-eka āyaya | paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ
translation: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come Forth from a region most remote?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 61
sanskrit: कव वो ऽशवाः कव्र्भीशवः कथं शेक कथा यय | पर्ष्ठे सदो नसोर यमः
transliteration: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvṛbhīśavaḥ kathaṃ śeka kathā yaya | pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ
translation: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power? Rein was on nose and seat on back.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 61
sanskrit: जघने चोद एषां वि सक्थानि नरो यमुः | पुत्रक्र्थे न जनयः
transliteration: jaghane coda eṣāṃ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ | putrakṛthe na janayaḥ
translation: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart, Like women when the babe is born.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 61
sanskrit: परा वीरास एतन मर्यासो भद्रजानयः | अग्नितपो यथासथ
transliteration: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ | aghnitapo yathāsatha
translation: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse That ye may warm you at the fire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 61
sanskrit: सनत साश्व्यम पशुम उत गव्यं शतावयम | शयावाश्वस्तुताय या दोर वीरायोपबर्ब्र्हत
transliteration: sanat sāśvyam paśum uta ghavyaṃ śatāvayam |
translation: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine, Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom Gyavaiva praised.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 62
sanskrit: रतेन रतम अपिहितं धरुवं वां सूर्यस्य यत्र विमुचन्त्य अश्वान | दश शता सह तस्थुस तद एकं देवानां शरेष्ठं वपुषाम अपश्यम
transliteration: daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṃ devānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vapuṣām apaśyam
translation: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Surya's horses. Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 62
sanskrit: तत सु वाम मित्रावरुणा महित्वम ईर्मा तस्थुषीर अहभिर दुदुह्रे | विश्वाः पिन्वथः सवसरस्य धेना अनु वाम एकः पविर आ ववर्त
transliteration: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre | viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta
translation: This, Mitra-Varuna, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted. Ye cause to flow all voices of the cow pen: your single chariot felly hath rolled hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 62
sanskrit: अधारयतम पर्थिवीम उत दयाम मित्रराजाना वरुणा महोभिः | वर्धयतम ओषधीः पिन्वतं गा अव वर्ष्टिं सर्जतं जीरदानू
transliteration: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ | vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṃ ghā ava vṛṣṭiṃ sṛjataṃ jīradānū
translation: O Mitra-Varuna, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven, Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rain-flood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: रतस्य गोपाव अधि तिष्ठथो रथं सत्यधर्माणा परमे वयोमनि | यम अत्र मित्रावरुणावथो युवं तस्मै वर्ष्टिर मधुमत पिन्वते दिवः
transliteration: yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṃ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ
translation: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend. O Mitra-Varuna whomsoe'er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: सम्राजाव अस्य भुवनस्य राजथो मित्रावरुणा विदथे सवर्द्र्शा | वर्ष्टिं वां राधो अम्र्तत्वम ईमहे दयावाप्र्थिवी वि चरन्ति तन्यवः
transliteration: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā | vṛṣṭiṃ vāṃ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ
translation: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuna, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light. We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: सम्राजा उग्रा वर्षभा दिवस पती पर्थिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी | चित्रेभिर अभ्रैर उप तिष्ठथो रवं दयां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया
transliteration: samrājā ughrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī | citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṃ dyāṃ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā
translation: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuna, ye ever active Ones, Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: माया वाम मित्रावरुणा दिवि शरिता सूर्यो जयोतिश चरति चित्रम आयुधम | तम अभ्रेण वर्ष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य दरप्सा मधुमन्त ईरते
transliteration: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham | tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā ghūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate
translation: Your magic, Mitra-Varuna, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light. Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: रथं युञ्जते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु | रजांसि चित्रा वि चरन्ति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतम
transliteration: rathaṃ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṃ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā ghaviṣṭiṣu | rajāṃsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam
translation: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuna, as a hero in the wars. The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: वाचं सु मित्रावरुणाव इरावतीम पर्जन्यश चित्रां वदति तविषीमतीम | अभ्रा वसत मरुतः सु मायया दयां वर्षयतम अरुणाम अरेपसम
transliteration: vācaṃ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṃ vadati tviṣīmatīm | abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṃ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam
translation: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuna: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice. With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 63
sanskrit: धर्मणा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता वरता रक्षेथे असुरस्य मायया | रतेन विश्वम भुवनं वि राजथः सूर्यम आ धत्थो दिवि चित्र्यं रथम
transliteration: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā |
translation: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuna. Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 64
sanskrit: वरुणं वो रिशादसम रचा मित्रं हवामहे | परि वरजेव बाह्वोर जगन्वांसा सवर्णरम
transliteration: varuṇaṃ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṃ havāmahe | pari vrajeva bāhvor jaghanvāṃsā svarṇaram
translation: You, foeman-slaying Varuna and Mitra, we invoke with song, Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 64
sanskrit: ता बाहवा सुचेतुना पर यन्तम अस्मा अर्चते | शेवं हि जार्यं वां विश्वासु कषासु जोगुवे
transliteration: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate |
translation: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns, For in all places is sung forth your ever gracious friendliness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: यश चिकेत स सुक्रतुर देवत्रा स बरवीतु नः | वरुणो यस्य दर्शतो मित्रो वा वनते गिरः
transliteration: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ | varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate ghiraḥ
translation: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe. For Varuna, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: ता हि शरेष्ठवर्चसा राजाना दीर्घश्रुत्तमा | ता सत्पती रताव्र्ध रतावाना जने-जने
transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā | tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā jane-jane
translation: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine. And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: ता वाम इयानो ऽवसे पूर्वा उप बरुवे सचा | सवश्वासः सु चेतुना वाजां अभि पर दावने
transliteration: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrigvedaā upa bruve sacā | svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājāṃ abhi pra dāvane
translation: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours- You who accept the eulogy of Ratahavya with his hymns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: मित्रो अंहोश चिद आद उरु कषयाय गातुं वनते | मित्रस्य हि परतूर्वतः सुमतिर अस्ति विधतः
transliteration: mitro aṃhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya ghātuṃ vanate | mitrasya hi pratūrigvedaataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ
translation: And ye show whom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intelligence. By men's discernment are ye marked, O ye whose might is purified.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: वयम मित्रस्यावसि सयाम सप्रथस्तमे | अनेहसस तवोतयः सत्रा वरुणशेषसः
transliteration: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame | anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ
translation: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the Rsis' toil for fame The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 65
sanskrit: युवम मित्रेमं जनं यतथः सं च नयथः | मा मघोनः परि खयतम मो अस्माकम रषीणां गोपीथे न उरुष्यतम
transliteration: yuvam mitremaṃ janaṃ yatathaḥ saṃ ca nayathaḥ | mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṃ ghopīthe na uruṣyatam
translation: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 66
sanskrit: आ चिकितान सुक्रतू देवौ मर्त रिशादसा | वरुणाय रतपेशसे दधीत परयसे महे
transliteration: varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe
translation: YE Gods, Adityas, Varuna, Aryaman, Mitra, verily Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 66
sanskrit: ता हि कषत्रम अविह्रुतं सम्यग असुर्यम आशाते | अध वरतेव मानुषं सवर ण धायि दर्शतम
transliteration: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṃ samyagh asuryam āśāte | adha vrateva mānuṣaṃ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam
translation: When, Varuna and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place, Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foe slayers, give felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 66
sanskrit: ता वाम एषे रथानाम उर्वीं गव्यूतिम एषाम | रातहव्यस्य सुष्टुतिं दध्र्क सतोमैर मनामहे
transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām urigvedaīṃ ghavyūtim eṣām | rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṃ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe
translation: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 66
sanskrit: अधा हि काव्या युवं दक्षस्य पूर्भिर अद्भुता | नि केतुना जनानां चिकेथे पूतदक्षसा
transliteration: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṃ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā | ni ketunā janānāṃ cikethe pūtadakṣasā
translation: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race, Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 66
sanskrit: तद रतम पर्थिवि बर्हच छरवेष रषीणाम | जरयसानाव अरम पर्थ्व अति कषरन्ति यामभिः
transliteration: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām | jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ
translation: Which of your persons, Varuna or Mitra, merits not our praise? Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 67
sanskrit: बळ इत्था देव निष्क्र्तम आदित्या यजतम बर्हत | वरुण मित्रार्यमन वर्षिष्ठं कषत्रम आशाथे
transliteration: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat | varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatram āśāthe
translation: SING forth unto your Varuna and Mitra with a song inspired. They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 68
sanskrit: पर वो मित्राय गायत वरुणाय विपा गिरा | महिक्षत्राव रतम बर्हत
transliteration: pra vo mitrāya ghāyata varuṇāya vipā ghirā | mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat
translation: THREE spheres of light, O Varuna, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 68
sanskrit: सम्राजा या घर्तयोनी मित्रश चोभा वरुणश च | देवा देवेषु परशस्ता
