transliteration: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca | devā deveṣu praśastā
translation: Ye, Varuna, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness. There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 68
sanskrit: ता नः शक्तम पार्थिवस्य महो रायो दिव्यस्य | महि वां कषत्रं देवेषु
transliteration: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya | mahi vāṃ kṣatraṃ deveṣu
translation: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting. I pray, O Mitra-Varuna, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 69
sanskrit: तरी रोचना वरुण तरींर उत दयून तरीणि मित्र धारयथो रजांसि | वाव्र्धानाव अमतिं कषत्रियस्यानु वरतं रक्षमाणाव अजुर्यम
transliteration: trī rocanā varuṇa trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṃsi | vāvṛdhānāv amatiṃ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṃ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam
translation: EVEN far and wide, O Varuna and Mitra, doth your grace extend. May I obtain your kind good-will.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 69
sanskrit: इरावतीर वरुण धेनवो वाम मधुमद वां सिन्धवो मित्र दुह्रे | तरयस तस्थुर वर्षभासस तिस्र्णां धिषणानां रेतोधा वि दयुमन्तः
transliteration: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṃ sindhavo mitra duhre | trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṃ dhiṣaṇānāṃ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ
translation: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance. Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 69
sanskrit: परातर देवीम अदितिं जोहवीमि मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य | राये मित्रावरुणा सर्वतातेळे तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
transliteration: prātar devīm aditiṃ johavīmi madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya | rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarigvedaatāteḷe tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ
translation: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guard save us, ye skilled to save, my we Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 69
sanskrit: या धर्तारा रजसो रोचनस्योतादित्या दिव्या पार्थिवस्य | न वां देवा अम्र्ता आ मिनन्ति वरतानि मित्रावरुणा धरुवाणि
transliteration: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya | na vāṃ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi
translation: Or ne'er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast, Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 70
sanskrit: पुरूरुणा चिद धय अस्त्य अवो नूनं वां वरुण | मित्र वंसि वां सुमतिम
transliteration: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṃ vāṃ varuṇa | mitra vaṃsi vāṃ sumatim
translation: O Varuna and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might To this our goodly sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 70
sanskrit: ता वां सम्यग अद्रुह्वाणेषम अश्याम धायसे | वयं ते रुद्रा सयाम
transliteration: tā vāṃ samyagh adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase | vayaṃ te rudrā syāma
translation: For, Varuna and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all. Fill full our songs, for this ye can.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 70
sanskrit: पातं नो रुद्रा पायुभिर उत तरायेथां सुत्रात्रा | तुर्याम दस्यून तनूभिः
transliteration: pātaṃ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṃ sutrātrā | turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ
translation: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuna, Mitra, come to drink This Soma of the worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 71
sanskrit: आ नो गन्तं रिशादसा वरुण मित्र बर्हणा | उपेमं चारुम अध्वरम
transliteration: upemaṃ cārum adhvaram
translation: To Varuna and Mitra we offer with songs, as Atri did. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 71
sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि परचेतसा वरुण मित्र राजथः | ईशाना पिप्यतं धियः
transliteration: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ |
translation: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 72
sanskrit: आ मित्रे वरुणे वयं गीर्भिर जुहुमो अत्रिवत | नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये
transliteration: ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye
translation: WHETHER, O Asvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand, In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 72
sanskrit: वरतेन सथो धरुवक्षेमा धर्मणा यातयज्जना | नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये
transliteration: vratena stho dhruvakṣemā dharmaṇā yātayajjanā | ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye
translation: These here, who show o'er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act, Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 72
sanskrit: मित्रश च नो वरुणश च जुषेतां यज्ञम इष्टये | नि बर्हिषि सदतां सोमपीतये
transliteration: mitraś ca no varuṇaś ca juṣetāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye | ni barhiṣi sadatāṃ somapītaye
translation: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car. With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 73
sanskrit: यद अद्य सथः परावति यद अर्वावत्य अश्विना | यद वा पुरू पुरुभुजा यद अन्तरिक्ष आ गतम
transliteration: yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arigvedaāvaty aśvinā | yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā ghatam
translation: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Asvins, rich in constancy? Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 73
sanskrit: इह तया पुरुभूतमा पुरू दंसांसि बिभ्रता | वरस्या याम्य अध्रिगू हुवे तुविष्टमा भुजे
transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā | varasyā yāmy adhrighū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje
translation: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nasatyas, Gods in heaven? Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: कूष्ठो देवाव अश्विनाद्या दिवो मनावसू | तच छरवथो वर्षण्वसू अत्रिर वाम आ विवासति
transliteration: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū | tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati
translation: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us, Asvins, the Rsi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: कुह तया कुह नु शरुता दिवि देवा नासत्या | कस्मिन्न आ यतथो जने को वां नदीनां सचा
transliteration: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā | kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṃ nadīnāṃ sacā
translation: Pass, O ye Asvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men, Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: कं याथः कं ह गछथः कम अछा युञ्जाथे रथम | कस्य बरह्माणि रण्यथो वयं वाम उश्मसीष्टये
transliteration: kaṃ yāthaḥ kaṃ ha ghachathaḥ kam achā yuñjāthe ratham | kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṃ vām uśmasīṣṭaye
translation: Come to us, O ye Asvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: पौरं चिद धय उदप्रुतम पौर पौराय जिन्वथः | यद ईं गर्भीततातये सिंहम इव दरुहस पदे
transliteration: pauraṃ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ | yad īṃ ghṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhas pade
translation: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car. And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: पर चयवानाज जुजुरुषो वव्रिम अत्कं न मुञ्चथः | युवा यदी कर्थः पुनर आ कामम रण्वे वध्वः
transliteration: pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṃ na muñcathaḥ | yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ
translation: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry, Asvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to Cyavana void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: अस्ति हि वाम इह सतोता समसि वां संद्र्शि शरिये | नू शरुतम म आ गतम अवोभिर वाजिनीवसू
transliteration: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṃ saṃdṛśi śriye | nū śrutam ma ā ghatam avobhir vājinīvasū
translation: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought, Your flying steeds, O Asvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 74
sanskrit: को वाम अद्य पुरूणाम आ वव्ने मर्त्यानाम | को विप्रो विप्रवाहसा को यज्ञैर वाजिनीवसू
transliteration: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām | ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū
translation: O Asvins, hither come to us; Nasatyas, be not disinclined. Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 75
sanskrit: परति परियतमं रथं वर्षणं वसुवाहनम | सतोता वाम अश्विनाव रषि सतोमेन परति भूषति माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम
transliteration: prati priyatamaṃ rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vasuvāhanam | stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣi stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
translation: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended. Borne on your chariot, Asvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 75
sanskrit: अत्यायातम अश्विना तिरो विश्वा अहं सना | दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी सुषुम्ना सिन्धुवाहसा माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम
transliteration: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṃ sanā | dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam
translation: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Asvins are beside us. With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 76
sanskrit: आ भात्य अग्निर उषसाम अनीकम उद विप्राणां देवया वाचो अस्थुः | अर्वाञ्चा नूनं रथ्येह यातम पीपिवांसम अश्विना घर्मम अछ
transliteration: arigvedaāñcā nūnaṃ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam acha
translation: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard. The Asvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 76
sanskrit: न संस्क्र्तम पर मिमीतो गमिष्ठान्ति नूनम अश्विनोपस्तुतेह | दिवाभिपित्वे ऽवसागमिष्ठा परत्य अवर्तिं दाशुषे शम्भविष्ठा
transliteration: na saṃskṛtam pra mimīto ghamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha | divābhipitve 'vasāghamiṣṭhā praty avartiṃ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā
translation: Worship at dawn and instigate the Asvins: nor is the worshipper at eve rejected. Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 76
sanskrit: उता यातं संगवे परातर अह्नो मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य | दिवा नक्तम अवसा शंतमेन नेदानीम पीतिर अश्विना ततान
transliteration: utā yātaṃ saṃghave prātar ahno madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya | divā naktam avasā śaṃtamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna
translation: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither, Swift as thought, Asvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 76
sanskrit: इदं हि वाम परदिवि सथानम ओक इमे गर्हा अश्विनेदं दुरोणम | आ नो दिवो बर्हतः पर्वताद आद्भ्यो यातम इषम ऊर्जं वहन्ता
transliteration: idaṃ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime ghṛhā aśvinedaṃ duroṇam |
translation: He who hath served most often the Nasatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution, Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 77
sanskrit: परातर्यावाणा परथमा यजध्वम पुरा गर्ध्राद अररुषः पिबातः | परातर हि यज्ञम अश्विना दधाते पर शंसन्ति कवयः पूर्वभाजः
transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā ghṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ | prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrigvedaabhājaḥ
translation: YE Asvins, hither come to us: Nasatyas, be not disinclined. Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 77
sanskrit: परातर यजध्वम अश्विना हिनोत न सायम अस्ति देवया अजुष्टम | उतान्यो अस्मद यजते वि चावः पूर्वः-पूर्वो यजमानो वनीयान
transliteration: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam | utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrigvedaaḥ-pūrigvedao yajamāno vanīyān
translation: O Asvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 77
sanskrit: हिरण्यत्वङ मधुवर्णो घर्तस्नुः पर्क्षो वहन्न आ रथो वर्तते वाम | मनोजवा अश्विना वातरंहा येनातियाथो दुरितानि विश्वा
transliteration: hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām | manojavā aśvinā vātaraṃhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā
translation: O Asvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 77
sanskrit: यो भूयिष्ठं नासत्याभ्यां विवेष चनिष्ठम पित्वो ररते विभागे | स तोकम अस्य पीपरच छमीभिर अनूर्ध्वभासः सदम इत तुतुर्यात
transliteration: yo bhūyiṣṭhaṃ nāsatyābhyāṃ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāghe | sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt
translation: As Atri when descending to the cave called on you loudly like a wailing woman. Ye came to him, O Asvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 77
sanskrit: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम | आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि
transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema |
translation: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child. Ye Asvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम | हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप
transliteration: aśvināv eha ghachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam | haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa
translation: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अश्विना हरिणाव इव गौराव इवानु यवसम | हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप
transliteration: aśvinā hariṇāv iva ghaurāv ivānu yavasam | haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa
translation: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunitha Sucadratha's son, So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अश्विना वाजिनीवसू जुषेथां यज्ञम इष्टये | हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप
transliteration: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye | haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa
translation: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky, As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyatravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अत्रिर यद वाम अवरोहन्न रबीसम अजोहवीन नाधमानेव योषा | शयेनस्य चिज जवसा नूतनेनागछतम अश्विना शंतमेन
transliteration: atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā |
translation: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns, And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: महे नो अद्य बोधयोषो राये दिवित्मती | यथा चिन नो अबोधयः सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī | yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight, Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: या सुनीथे शौचद्रथे वय औछो दुहितर दिवः | सा वय उछ सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy aucho duhitar divaḥ | sā vy ucha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled. High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: सा नो अद्याभरद्वसुर वय उछा दुहितर दिवः | यो वय औछः सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: sā no adyābharadvasur vy uchā duhitar divaḥ | yo vy auchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches. Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: अभि ये तवा विभावरि सतोमैर गर्णन्ति वह्नयः | मघैर मघोनि सुश्रियो दामन्वन्तः सुरातयः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair ghṛṇanti vahnayaḥ | maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body. She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: यच चिद धि ते गणा इमे छदयन्ति मघत्तये | परि चिद वष्टयो दधुर ददतो राधो अह्रयं सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: yac cid dhi te ghaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye | pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṃ sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as 'twere, erect that we may see her. Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 79
sanskrit: ऐषु धा वीरवद यश उषो मघोनि सूरिषु | ये नो राधांस्य अह्रया मघवानो अरासत सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते
transliteration: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu | ye no rādhāṃsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte
translation: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward. The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 80
sanskrit: दयुतद्यामानम बर्हतीम रतेन रतावरीम अरुणप्सुं विभातीम | देवीम उषसं सवर आवहन्तीम परति विप्रासो मतिभिर जरन्ते
transliteration: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṃ vibhātīm | devīm uṣasaṃ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante
translation: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts. He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 80
sanskrit: एषा जनं दर्शता बोधयन्ती सुगान पथः कर्ण्वती यात्य अग्रे | बर्हद्रथा बर्हती विश्वमिन्वोषा जयोतिर यछत्य अग्रे अह्नाम
transliteration: eṣā janaṃ darśatā bodhayantī sughān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty aghre | bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yachaty aghre ahnām
translation: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good. Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 80
sanskrit: एषा गोभिर अरुणेभिर युजानास्रेधन्ती रयिम अप्रायु चक्रे | पथो रदन्ती सुविताय देवी पुरुष्टुता विश्ववारा वि भाति
transliteration: eṣā ghobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre | patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti
translation: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might, He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 80
sanskrit: एषा वयेनी भवति दविबर्हा आविष्क्र्ण्वाना तन्वम पुरस्तात | रतस्य पन्थाम अन्व एति साधु परजानतीव न दिशो मिनाति
transliteration: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt |
translation: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee. Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 81
sanskrit: युञ्जते मन उत युञ्जते धियो विप्रा विप्रस्य बर्हतो विपश्चितः | वि होत्रा दधे वयुनाविद एक इन मही देवस्य सवितुः परिष्टुतिः
transliteration: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ | vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ
translation: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed. The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 81
sanskrit: विश्वा रूपाणि परति मुञ्चते कविः परासावीद भद्रं दविपदे चतुष्पदे | वि नाकम अख्यत सविता वरेण्यो ऽनु परयाणम उषसो वि राजति
transliteration: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade | vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati
translation: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all, No one diminisheth in aught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 81
sanskrit: यस्य परयाणम अन्व अन्य इद ययुर देवा देवस्य महिमानम ओजसा | यः पार्थिवानि विममे स एतशो रजांसि देवः सविता महित्वना
transliteration: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā | yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
translation: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper. That wondrous portion we implore.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 81
sanskrit: उत यासि सवितस तरीणि रोचनोत सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः सम उच्यसि | उत रात्रीम उभयतः परीयस उत मित्रो भवसि देव धर्मभिः
transliteration: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi | uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ
translation: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny. Drive thou the evil dream away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 81
sanskrit: उतेशिषे परसवस्य तवम एक इद उत पूषा भवसि देव यामभिः | उतेदं विश्वम भुवनं वि राजसि शयावाश्वस ते सवित सतोमम आनशे
transliteration: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ | utedaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savita stomam ānaśe
translation: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities, And send us only what is good.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 82
sanskrit: तत सवितुर वर्णीमहे वयं देवस्य भोजनम | शरेष्ठं सर्वधातमं तुरम भगस्य धीमहि
transliteration: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṃ devasya bhojanam |
translation: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya. The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अछा वद तवसं गीर्भिर आभि सतुहि पर्जन्यं नमसा विवास | कनिक्रदद वर्षभो जीरदानू रेतो दधात्य ओषधीषु गर्भम
transliteration: achā vada tavasaṃ ghīrbhir ābhi stuhi parjanyaṃ namasā vivāsa | kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu gharbham
translation: THOU, of a truth, O Prthivi, bearest the tool that rends the hills: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 83
sanskrit: वि वर्क्षान हन्त्य उत हन्ति रक्षसो विश्वम बिभाय भुवनम महावधात | उतानागा ईषते वर्ष्ण्यावतो यत पर्जन्य सतनयन हन्ति दुष्क्र्तः
transliteration: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt | utānāghā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanya stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ
translation: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day, Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 83
sanskrit: रथीव कशयाश्वां अभिक्षिपन्न आविर दूतान कर्णुते वर्ष्य्रं अह | दूरात सिंहस्य सतनथा उद ईरते यत पर्जन्यः कर्णुते वर्ष्यं नभः
transliteration: rathīva kaśayāśvāṃ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyṛṃ aha | dūrāt siṃhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṃ nabhaḥ
translation: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e'en the strong sovrans of the wood, When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 84
sanskrit: बळ इत्था पर्वतानां खिद्रम बिभर्षि पर्थिवि | पर या भूमिम परवत्वति मह्ना जिनोषि महिनि
transliteration: baḷ itthā parigvedaatānāṃ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi | pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini
translation: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuna, imperial Ruler, Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 84
sanskrit: सतोमासस तवा विचारिणि परति षटोभन्त्य अक्तुभिः | पर या वाजं न हेषन्तम पेरुम अस्यस्य अर्जुनि
transliteration: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ | pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni
translation: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses, Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Surya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 84
sanskrit: दर्ळ्हा चिद या वनस्पतीन कष्मया दर्धर्ष्य ओजसा | यत ते अभ्रस्य विद्युतो दिवो वर्षन्ति वर्ष्टयः
transliteration: dṛḷhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā | yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ
translation: Varuna lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's mid-region. Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: पर सम्राजे बर्हद अर्चा गभीरम बरह्म परियं वरुणाय शरुताय | वि यो जघान शमितेव चर्मोपस्तिरे पर्थिवीं सूर्याय
transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhad arcā ghabhīram brahma priyaṃ varuṇāya śrutāya | vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṃ sūryāya
translation: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight, Breaks through e'en strongly-guarded wealth as Trta burst his way through reeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: वनेषु वय अन्तरिक्षं ततान वाजम अर्वत्सु पय उस्रियासु | हर्त्सु करतुं वरुणो अप्स्व अग्निं दिवि सूर्यम अदधात सोमम अद्रौ
transliteration: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arigvedaatsu paya usriyāsu | hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo apsv aghniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
translation: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays, Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: नीचीनबारं वरुणः कवन्धम पर ससर्ज रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम | तेन विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा यवं न वर्ष्टिर वय उनत्ति भूम
transliteration: nīcīnabāraṃ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam | tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma
translation: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair, Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vrtra's slayer for the kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: उनत्ति भूमिम पर्थिवीम उत दयां यदा दुग्धं वरुणो वष्ट्य आद इत | सम अभ्रेण वसत पर्वतासस तविषीयन्तः शरथयन्त वीराः
transliteration: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ yadā dughdhaṃ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it | sam abhreṇa vasata parigvedaatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ
translation: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: इमाम ऊ षव रसुरस्य शरुतस्य महीम मायां वरुणस्य पर वोचम | मानेनेव तस्थिवां अन्तरिक्षे वि यो ममे पर्थिवीं सूर्येण
transliteration: imām ū ṣv ṛsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṃ varuṇasya pra vocam | māneneva tasthivāṃ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṃ sūryeṇa
translation: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man, Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 85
sanskrit: इमाम ऊ नु कवितमस्य मायाम महीं देवस्य नकिर आ दधर्ष | एकं यद उद्ना न पर्णन्त्य एनीर आसिञ्चन्तीर अवनयः समुद्रम
transliteration: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṃ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa | ekaṃ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram
translation: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones. Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी यम अवथ उभा वाजेषु मर्त्यम | दर्ळ्हा चित स पर भेदति दयुम्ना वाणीर इव तरितः
transliteration: indrāghnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam | dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ
translation: To Visnu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut; To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: या पर्तनासु दुष्टरा या वाजेषु शरवाय्या | या पञ्च चर्षणीर अभॄन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे
transliteration: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā | yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhṝndrāghnī tā havāmahe
translation: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut. Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless as the mountains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: तयोर इद अमवच छवस तिग्मा दिद्युन मघोनोः | परति दरुणा गभस्त्योर गवां वर्त्रघ्न एषते
transliteration: tayor id amavac chavas tighmā didyun maghonoḥ | prati druṇā ghabhastyor ghavāṃ vṛtraghna eṣate
translation: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamarut; In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roaring rivers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: ता वाम एषे रथानाम इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे | पती तुरस्य राधसो विद्वांसा गिर्वणस्तमा
transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāghnī havāmahe | patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṃsā ghirigvedaaṇastamā
translation: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in common. When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: ता वर्धन्ताव अनु दयून मर्ताय देवाव अदभा | अर्हन्ता चित पुरो दधे ऽंशेव देवाव अर्वते
transliteration: tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā | arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṃśeva devāv arigvedaate
translation: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayamarut, Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and well-weaponed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 5 Hymn 86
sanskrit: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्याम अहावि हव्यं शूष्यं घर्तं न पूतम अद्रिभिः | ता सूरिषु शरवो बर्हद रयिं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम इषं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम
transliteration: evendrāghnibhyām ahāvi havyaṃ śūṣyaṃ ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adribhiḥ | tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam
translation: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut; For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and insult.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवं हयग्ने परथमो मनोतास्या धियो अभवो दस्म होता | तवं सीं वर्षन्नक्र्णोर्दुष्टरीतु सहो विश्वस्मै सहसे सहध्यै
transliteration: tvaṃ hyaghne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā | tvaṃ sīṃ vṛṣannakṛṇorduṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai
translation: THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald. Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अधा होता नयसीदो यजीयानिळस पद इषयन्नीड्यः सन | तं तवा नरः परथमं देवयन्तो महो राये चितयन्तो अनु गमन
transliteration: adhā hotā nyasīdo yajīyāniḷas pada iṣayannīḍyaḥ san | taṃ tvā naraḥ prathamaṃ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu ghman
translation: As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour. So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: वर्तेव यन्तं बहुभिर्वसव्यैस्त्वे रयिं जाग्र्वांसो अनु गमन | रुशन्तमग्निं दर्शतं बर्हन्तं वपावन्तं विश्वहा दीदिवांसम
transliteration: vṛteva yantaṃ bahubhirigvedaasavyaistve rayiṃ jāghṛvāṃso anu ghman | ruśantamaghniṃ darśataṃ bṛhantaṃ vapāvantaṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam
translation: In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army, The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: पदं देवस्य नमसा वयन्तः शरवस्यवः शरव आपन्नम्र्क्तम | नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियानि भद्रायां ते रणयन्तसन्द्र्ष्टौ
transliteration: padaṃ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpannamṛktam | nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṃ te raṇayantasandṛṣṭau
translation: They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory: Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तवां वर्धन्ति कषितयः पर्थिव्यां तवां राय उभयासो जनानाम | तवं तराता तरणे चेत्यो भूः पिता माता सदमिन मानुषाणाम
transliteration: tvāṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tvāṃ rāya ubhayāso janānām | tvaṃ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadamin mānuṣāṇām
translation: On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches. Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: सपर्येण्यः स परियो विक्ष्वग्निर्होता मन्द्रो नि षसादा यजीयान | तं तवा वयं दम आ दीदिवांसमुप जञुबाधो नमसा सदेम
transliteration: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣvaghnirhotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān | taṃ tvā vayaṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsamupa jñubādho namasā sadema
translation: Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship. Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तं तवा वयं सुध्यो नव्यमग्ने-सुम्नायव ईमहे देवयन्तः | तवं विशो अनयो दीद्यानो दिवो अग्ने बर्हता रोचनेन
transliteration: taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudhyo navyamaghne-sumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ | tvaṃ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo aghne bṛhatā rocanena
translation: Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded. Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिं शश्वतीनां नितोशनं वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम | परेतीषणिमिषयन्तं पावकं राजन्तमग्निं यजतं रयीणाम
transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ śaśvatīnāṃ nitośanaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām | pretīṣaṇimiṣayantaṃ pāvakaṃ rājantamaghniṃ yajataṃ rayīṇām
translation: Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings, Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: सो अग्न ईजे शशमे च मर्तो यस्त आनट समिधा हव्यदातिम | य आहुतिं परि वेदा नमोभिर्विश्वेत स वामा दधतेत्वोतः
transliteration: so aghna īje śaśame ca marto yasta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim | ya āhutiṃ pari vedā namobhirigvedaśvet sa vāmā dadhatetvotaḥ
translation: Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel, And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अस्मा उ ते महि महे विधेम नमोभिरग्ने समिधोत हव्यैः | वेदी सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैरा ते भद्रायां सुमतौयतेम
transliteration: asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiraghne samidhota havyaiḥ | vedī sūno sahaso ghīrbhirukthairā te bhadrāyāṃ sumatauyatema
translation: Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations, With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तवं हि कषैतवद यशो.अग्ने मित्रो न पत्यसे | तवं विचर्षणे शरवो वसो पुष्टिं न पुष्यसि
transliteration: tvaṃ hi kṣaitavad yaśo.aghne mitro na patyase | tvaṃ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṃ na puṣyasi
translation: THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own. Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तवां हि षमा चर्षणयो यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिरीळते | तवां वाजी यात्यव्र्को रजस्तूर्विश्वचर्षणिः
transliteration: tvāṃ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhirghīrbhirīḷate | tvāṃ vājī yātyavṛko rajastūrigvedaśvacarṣaṇiḥ
translation: For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs. To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 2
sanskrit: सजोषस्त्वा दिवो नरो यज्ञस्य केतुमिन्धते | यद ध सय मानुषो जनः सुम्नायुर्जुह्वे अध्वरे
transliteration: sajoṣastvā divo naro yajñasya ketumindhate | yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyurjuhve adhvare
translation: Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice, When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अग्ने स कषेषद रतपा रतेजा उरु जयोतिर्नशते देवयुष टे | यं तवं मित्रेण वरुणः सजोषा देव पासि तयजसा मर्तमंहः
transliteration: aghne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotirnaśate devayuṣ ṭe | yaṃ tvaṃ mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martamaṃhaḥ
translation: TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni, Whom thou, as Varuna in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यथा होतर्मनुषो देवताता यज्ञेभिः सूनो सहसो यजासि | एवा नो अद्य समना समानानुशन्नग्न उशतो यक्षि देवान
transliteration: yathā hotarmanuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi | evā no adya samanā samānānuśannaghna uśato yakṣi devān
translation: As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship, So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 4
sanskrit: स नो विभावा चक्षणिर्न वस्तोरग्निर्वन्दारु वेद्यश्चनो धात | विश्वायुर्यो अम्र्तो मर्त्येषूषर्भुद भूदतिथिर्जातवेदाः
transliteration: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇirna vastoraghnirigvedaandāru vedyaścano dhāt | viśvāyuryo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūdatithirjātavedāḥ
translation: May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour. Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 4
sanskrit: दयावो न यस्य पनयन्त्यभ्वं भासांसि वस्ते सूर्यो न शुक्रः | वि य इनोत्यजरः पावको.अश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत पूर्व्याणि
transliteration: dyāvo na yasya panayantyabhvaṃ bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ | vi ya inotyajaraḥ pāvako.aśnasya cicchiśnathat pūrigvedayāṇi
translation: Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre. He who sends forth,, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e'en the ancient works of Asna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 4
sanskrit: वद्मा हि सूनो अस्यद्मसद्वा चक्रे अग्निर्जनुषाज्मान्नम | स तवं न ऊर्जसन ऊर्जं धा राजेव जेरव्र्के कषेष्यन्तः
transliteration: vadmā hi sūno asyadmasadvā cakre aghnirjanuṣājmānnam | sa tvaṃ na ūrjasana ūrjaṃ dhā rājeva jeravṛke kṣeṣyantaḥ
translation: Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway. Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 4
sanskrit: नितिक्ति यो वारणमन्नमत्ति वायुर्न राष्ट्र्यत्येत्यक्तून | तुर्याम यस्त आदिशामरातीरत्यो न हरुतः पततः परिह्रुत
transliteration: nitikti yo vāraṇamannamatti vāyurna rāṣṭryatyetyaktūn | turyāma yasta ādiśāmarātīratyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut
translation: Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vayu kingdoms. May we o'ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: हुवे वः सूनुं सहसो युवानमद्रोघवाचं मतिभिर्यविष्ठम | य इन्वति दरविणानि परचेता विश्ववाराणि पुरुवारोध्रुक
transliteration: huve vaḥ sūnuṃ sahaso yuvānamadroghavācaṃ matibhiryaviṣṭham | ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāroadhruk
translation: I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless; Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तवे वसूनि पुर्वणीक होतर्दोषा वस्तोरेरिरे यज्ञियासः | कषामेव विश्वा भुवनानि यस्मिन सं सौभगानि दधिरेपावके
transliteration: tve vasūni purigvedaaṇīka hotardoṣā vastorerire yajñiyāsaḥ | kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṃ saubhaghāni dadhirepāvake
translation: At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects, On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तवं विक्षु परदिवः सीद आसु करत्वा रथीरभवो वार्याणाम | अत इनोषि विधते चिकित्वो वयानुषग जातवेदो वसूनि
transliteration: tvaṃ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīrabhavo vāryāṇām | ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vyānuṣagh jātavedo vasūni
translation: Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings. Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jatavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: यो नः सनुत्यो अभिदासदग्ने यो अन्तरो मित्रमहो वनुष्यात | तमजरेभिर्व्र्षभिस्तव सवैस्तपा तपिष्ठ तपसा तपस्वान
transliteration: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsadaghne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt | tamajarebhirigvedaṛṣabhistava svaistapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān
translation: Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us, Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: यस्ते यज्ञेन समिधा य उक्थैरर्केभिः सूनो सहसो ददाशत | स मर्त्येष्वम्र्त परचेता राया दयुम्नेन शरवसा वि भाति
transliteration: yaste yajñena samidhā ya ukthairarkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat | sa martyeṣvamṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti
translation: He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises, Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: स तत कर्धीषितस्तूयमग्ने सप्र्धो बाधस्व सहसा सहस्वान | यच्छस्यसे दयुभिरक्तो वचोभिस्तज्जुषस्व जरितुर्घोषि मन्म
transliteration: sa tat kṛdhīṣitastūyamaghne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān | yacchasyase dyubhirakto vacobhistajjuṣasva jariturghoṣi manma
translation: Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen. When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 5
sanskrit: अश्याम तं काममग्ने तवोती अश्याम रयिं रयिवः सुवीरम | अश्याम वाजमभि वाजयन्तो.अश्याम दयुम्नमजराजरं ते
transliteration: aśyāma taṃ kāmamaghne tavotī aśyāma rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīram | aśyāma vājamabhi vājayanto.aśyāma dyumnamajarājaraṃ te
translation: Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes. Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 6
sanskrit: पर नव्यसा सहसः सूनुमछा यज्ञेन गातुमव इछमानः | वर्श्चद्वनं कर्ष्णयामं रुशन्तं वीती होतारन्दिव्यं जिगाति
transliteration: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnumachā yajñena ghātumava ichamānaḥ | vṛścadvanaṃ kṛṣṇayāmaṃ ruśantaṃ vītī hotārandivyaṃ jighāti
translation: HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship, Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 6
sanskrit: स शवितानस्तन्यतू रोचनस्था अजरेभिर्नानदद्भिर्यविष्ठः | यः पावकः पुरुतमः पुरूणि पर्थून्यग्निरनुयाति भर्वन
transliteration: sa śvitānastanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhirnānadadbhiryaviṣṭhaḥ | yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūnyaghniranuyāti bharigvedaan
translation: White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal- Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 6
sanskrit: वि ते विष्वग वातजूतासो अग्ने भामासः शुचे शुचयश्चरन्ति | तुविम्रक्षासो दिव्या नवग्वा वना वनन्ति धर्षता रुजन्तः
transliteration: vi te viṣvagh vātajūtāso aghne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaścaranti | tuvimrakṣāso divyā navaghvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ
translation: Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions. Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 6
sanskrit: ये ते शुक्रासः शुचयः शुचिष्मः कषां वपन्ति विषितासो अश्वाः | अध भरमस्त उर्विया वि भाति यातयमानो अधि सानु पर्श्नेः
transliteration: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṃ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ | adha bhramasta urigvedayā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ
translation: Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them, And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अध जिह्वा पापतीति पर वर्ष्णो गोषुयुधो नाशनिः सर्जाना | शूरस्येव परसितिः कषातिरग्नेर्दुर्वर्तुर्भीमो दयते वनानि
transliteration: adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo ghoṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā |
translation: Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle. Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: मूर्धानं दिवो अरतिं पर्थिव्या वैश्वानरं रत आ जातमग्निम | कविं सम्राजमतिथिं जनानामासन्ना पात्रं जनयन्त देवाः
transliteration: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaraṃ ṛta ā jātamaghnim | kaviṃ samrājamatithiṃ janānāmāsannā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ
translation: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaisvanara, born in holy Order, The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: नाभिं यज्ञानां सदनं रयीणां महामाहावमभिसं नवन्त | वैश्वानरं रथ्यमध्वराणां यज्ञस्य केतुं जनयन्त देवाः
transliteration: nābhiṃ yajñānāṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ mahāmāhāvamabhisaṃ navanta | vaiśvānaraṃ rathyamadhvarāṇāṃ yajñasya ketuṃ janayanta devāḥ
translation: Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches. Vaisvanara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: तवद विप्रो जायते वाज्यग्ने तवद वीरासो अभिमातिषाहः | वैश्वानर तवमस्मासु धेहि वसूनि राजन सप्र्हयाय्याणि
transliteration: tvad vipro jāyate vājyaghne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ | vaiśvānara tvamasmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi
translation: From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman. O King, Vaisvanara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: तवां विश्वे अम्र्त जायमानं शिशुं न देवा अभि सं नवन्ते | तव करतुभिरम्र्तत्वमायन वैश्वानर यत पित्रोरदीदेः
transliteration: tvāṃ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṃ śiśuṃ na devā abhi saṃ navante | tava kratubhiramṛtatvamāyan vaiśvānara yat pitroradīdeḥ
translation: To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant. They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaisvanara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव तानि वरतानि महान्यग्ने नकिरा दधर्ष | यज्जायमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे.अविन्दः केतुं वयुनेष्वह्नाम
transliteration: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahānyaghne nakirā dadharṣa | yajjāyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe.avindaḥ ketuṃ vayuneṣvahnām
translation: Agni Vaisvanara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances, When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: वैश्वानरस्य विमितानि चक्षसा सानूनि दिवो अम्र्तस्य केतुना | तस्येदु विश्वा भुवनाधि मूर्धनि वया इव रुरुहुःसप्त विस्रुहः
transliteration: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā | tasyedu viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥsapta visruhaḥ
translation: The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaisvanara's brilliancy. All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches forth,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 7
sanskrit: वि यो रजांस्यमिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो वि दिवो रोचना कविः | परि यो विश्वा भुवनानि पप्रथे.अदब्धो गोपा अम्र्तस्य रक्षिता
transliteration: vi yo rajāṃsyamimīta sukraturigvedaaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ | pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe.adabdho ghopā amṛtasya rakṣitā
translation: Vaisvanara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven, The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 8
sanskrit: पर्क्षस्य वर्ष्णो अरुषस्य नू सहः पर नु वोचं विदथाजातवेदसः | वैश्वानराय मतिर्नव्यसी शुचिः सोम इवपवते चारुरग्नये
transliteration: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū sahaḥ pra nu vocaṃ vidathājātavedasaḥ | vaiśvānarāya matirnavyasī śuciḥ soma ivapavate cāruraghnaye
translation: AT Jatavedas' holy gathering I will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift red-hued Steer. A pure and fresher hymn flows to Vaisvanara, even as for Agni lovely Soma is made pure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 8
sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमनि वरतान्यग्निर्व्रतपा अरक्षत | वयन्तरिक्षममिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो महिना नाकमस्प्र्शत
transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratānyaghnirigvedaratapā arakṣata | vyantarikṣamamimīta sukraturigvedaaiśvānaro mahinā nākamaspṛśat
translation: That Agni, when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life, Guardian of Holy Laws, kept and observed them well. Exceeding wise, he measured out the firmament. Vaisvanara attained to heaven by mightiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 8
sanskrit: वयस्तभ्नाद रोदसी मित्रो अद्भुतो.अन्तर्वावदक्र्णोज्ज्योतिषा तमः | वि चर्मणीव धिषणे अवर्तयद वैश्वानरो विश्वमधत्त वर्ष्ण्यम
transliteration: vyastabhnād rodasī mitro adbhuto.antarigvedaāvadakṛṇojjyotiṣā tamaḥ | vi carmaṇīva dhiṣaṇe avartayad vaiśvānaro viśvamadhatta vṛṣṇyam
translation: Wonderful Mitra propped the heaven and earth apart, and covered and concealed the darkness with his light. He made the two bowls part asunder like two skins. Vaisvanara put forth all his creative power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 8
sanskrit: अपामुपस्थे महिषा अग्र्भ्णत विशो राजानमुप तस्थुर्र्ग्मियम | आ दूतो अग्निमभरद विवस्वतो वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वा परावतः
transliteration: apāmupasthe mahiṣā aghṛbhṇata viśo rājānamupa tasthurṛghmiyam |
translation: The Migbty seized him in the bosom of the floods: the people waited on the King who should be praised. As envoy of Vivasvan MatariSvan brought Agni Vaisvanara hither from far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अहश्च कर्ष्णमहरर्जुनं च वि वर्तेते रजसी वेद्याभिः | वैश्वानरो जायमानो न राजावातिरज्ज्योतिषाग्निस्तमांसि
transliteration: ahaśca kṛṣṇamahararjunaṃ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ | vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātirajjyotiṣāghnistamāṃsi
translation: ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices. Agni Vaisvanara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: नाहं तन्तुं न वि जानाम्योतुं न यं वयन्ति समरेऽतमानाः | कस्य सवित पुत्र इह वक्त्वानि परो वदात्यवरेण पित्रा
transliteration: nāhaṃ tantuṃ na vi jānāmyotuṃ na yaṃ vayanti samare'tamānāḥ | kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadātyavareṇa pitrā
translation: I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest. Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: स इत तन्तुं स वि जानात्योतुं स वक्त्वान्य रतुथा वदाति | य ईं चिकेतदम्र्तस्य गोपा अवश्चरन परो अन्येन पश्यन
transliteration: sa it tantuṃ sa vi jānātyotuṃ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti | ya īṃ ciketadamṛtasya ghopā avaścaran paro anyena paśyan
translation: For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken, Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अयं होता परथमः पश्यतेममिदं जयोतिरम्र्तं मर्त्येषु | अयं स जज्ञे धरुव आ निषत्तो.अमर्त्यस्तन्वा वर्धमानः
transliteration: ayaṃ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemamidaṃ jyotiramṛtaṃ martyeṣu | ayaṃ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto.amartyastanvā vardhamānaḥ
translation: He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal. Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: धरुवं जयोतिर्निहितं दर्शये कं मनो जविष्ठं पतयत्स्वन्तः | विश्वे देवाः समनसः सकेता एकं करतुमभिवि यन्ति साधु
transliteration: dhruvaṃ jyotirnihitaṃ dṛśaye kaṃ mano javiṣṭhaṃ patayatsvantaḥ | viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṃ kratumabhivi yanti sādhu
translation: A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest. All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: वि मे कर्णा पतयतो वि चक्षुर्वीदं जयोतिर्ह्र्दय आहितं यत | वि मे मनश्चरति दूराधीः किं सविद वक्ष्यामिकिमु नू मनिष्ये
transliteration: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣurigvedaīdaṃ jyotirhṛdaya āhitaṃ yat | vi me manaścarati dūraādhīḥ kiṃ svid vakṣyāmikimu nū maniṣye
translation: Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens. Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 9
sanskrit: विश्वे देवा अनमस्यन भियानास्त्वामग्ने तमसि तस्थिवांसम | वैश्वानरो.अवतूतये नो.अमर्त्यो.अवतूतये नः
transliteration: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānāstvāmaghne tamasi tasthivāṃsam | vaiśvānaro.avatūtaye no.amartyo.avatūtaye naḥ
translation: All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness. Vaisvanara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 10
sanskrit: पुरो वो मन्द्रं दिव्यं सुव्र्क्तिं परयति यज्ञे अग्निमध्वरेदधिध्वम | पुर उक्थेभिः स हि नो विभावा सवध्वरा करति जातवेदाः
transliteration: puro vo mandraṃ divyaṃ suvṛktiṃ prayati yajñe aghnimadhvaredadhidhvam | pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ
translation: INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises. With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jatavedas, makes our rites successful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तमु दयुमः पुर्वणीक होतरग्ने अग्निभिर्मनुष इधानः | सतोमं यमस्मै ममतेव शूषं घर्तं न शुचि मतयः पवन्ते
transliteration: tamu dyumaḥ purigvedaaṇīka hotaraghne aghnibhirmanuṣa idhānaḥ | stomaṃ yamasmai mamateva śūṣaṃ ghṛtaṃ na śuci matayaḥ pavante
translation: Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled, Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as 'twere for self-advantage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 10
sanskrit: पीपाय स शरवसा मर्त्येषु यो अग्नये ददाश विप्र उक्थैः | चित्राभिस्तमूतिभिश्चित्रशोचिर्व्रजस्य साता गोमतो दधाति
transliteration: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo aghnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ | citrābhistamūtibhiścitraśocirigvedarajasya sātā ghomato dadhāti
translation: Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni, And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 11
sanskrit: यजस्व होतरिषितो यजीयानग्ने बाधो मरुतां न परयुक्ति | आ नो मित्रावरुणा नासत्या दयावा होत्राय पर्थिवी वव्र्त्याः
transliteration: yajasva hotariṣito yajīyānaghne bādho marutāṃ na prayukti |
translation: EAGERLY Sacrifice thou, most skilful, Agni! Priest, pressing on as if the Maruts sent thee. To our oblation bring the two Nasatyas, Mitra and Varuna and Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 12
sanskrit: मध्ये होता दुरोणे बर्हिषो राळ अग्निस्तोदस्य रोदसी यजध्यै | अयं स सूनुः सहस रतावा दूरात सूर्यो न शोचिषा ततान
transliteration: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḷ aghnistodasya rodasī yajadhyai | ayaṃ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna
translation: KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves. He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तवद विश्वा सुभग सौभगान्यग्ने वि यन्ति वनिनो न वयाः | शरुष्टी रयिर्वाजो वर्त्रतूर्ये दिवो वर्ष्टिरीड्यो रीतिरपाम
transliteration: tvad viśvā subhagha saubhaghānyaghne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ |
translation: FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings- Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्ना यो मर्त्यो दुवो धियं जुजोष धीतिभिः | भसन नुष पर पूर्व्य इषं वुरीतावसे
transliteration: aghnā yo martyo duvo dhiyaṃ jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ | bhasan nuṣa pra pūrigvedaya iṣaṃ vurītāvase
translation: WHOSO to Agni hath endeared his thought and service by his hymns, That mortal eats before the rest, and finds sufficiency of food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निरिद धि परचेता अग्निर्वेधस्तम रषिः | अग्निं होतारमीळते यज्ञेषु मनुषो विशः
transliteration: aghnirid dhi pracetā aghnirigvedaedhastama ṛṣiḥ | aghniṃ hotāramīḷate yajñeṣu manuṣo viśaḥ
translation: Agni, in truth, is passing wise, most skilled in ordering, a Seer. At sacrifices Manus' sons glorify Agni as their Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: नाना हयग्ने.अवसे सपर्धन्ते रायो अर्यः | तूर्वन्तो दस्युमायवो वरतैः सीक्षन्तो अव्रतम
transliteration: nānā hyaghne.avase spardhante rāyo aryaḥ | tūrigvedaanto dasyumāyavo vrataiḥ sīkṣanto avratam
translation: The foeman's wealth in many a place, Agni, is emulous to help. Men fight the fiend, and seek by rites to overcome the riteless foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निरप्सां रतीषहं वीरं ददाति सत्पतिम | यस्य तरसन्ति शवसः संचक्षि शत्रवो भिया
transliteration: aghnirapsāṃ ṛtīṣahaṃ vīraṃ dadāti satpatim | yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravo bhiyā
translation: Agni bestows the hero chief, winner of waters, firm in fray. Soon as they look upon his might his enemies tremble in alarm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अग्निर्हि विद्मना निदो देवो मर्तमुरुष्यति | सहावा यस्याव्र्तो रयिर्वाजेष्वव्र्तः
transliteration: aghnirhi vidmanā nido devo martamuruṣyati | sahāvā yasyāvṛto rayirigvedaājeṣvavṛtaḥ
translation: For with his wisdom Agni, God, protects the mortal from reproach, Whose conquering wealth is never checked, is never checked in deeds of might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 14
sanskrit: अछा नो मित्रमहो ...
transliteration: achā no mitramaho ...
translation: O Agni, God with Mitra's might call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven. Bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o'ercome them, through thy help o'ercome them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: इममू षु वो अतिथिमुषर्बुधं विश्वासां विशां पतिम्र्ञ्जसे गिरा | वेतीद दिवो जनुषा कच्चिदा शुचिर्ज्योक चिदत्ति गर्भो यदच्युतम
transliteration: imamū ṣu vo atithimuṣarbudhaṃ viśvāsāṃ viśāṃ patimṛñjase ghirā | vetīd divo januṣā kaccidā śucirjyok cidatti gharbho yadacyutam
translation: WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tribes. Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child eats everlasting food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: मित्रं न यं सुधितं भर्गवो दधुर्वनस्पतावीड्यमूर्ध्वशोचिषम | स तवं सुप्रीतो वीतहव्ये अद्भुत परशस्तिभिर्महयसे दिवे दिवे
transliteration: mitraṃ na yaṃ sudhitaṃ bhṛghavo dadhurigvedaanaspatāvīḍyamūrdhvaśociṣam | sa tvaṃ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhirmahayase dive dive
translation: Whom, well disposed, the Bhrgus stablished as a friend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood. As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vitahavya, O thou wondrous God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स तवं दक्षस्याव्र्को वर्धो भूरर्यः परस्यान्तरस्य तरुषः | रायः सूनो सहसो मर्त्येष्वा छर्दिर्यछ वीतहव्याय सप्रथो भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः
transliteration: sa tvaṃ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūraryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ | rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣvā chardiryacha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ
translation: Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away. Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vitahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bharadvaja wide-spread wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: दयुतानं वो अतिथिं सवर्णरमग्निं होतारं मनुषः सवध्वरम | विप्रं न दयुक्षवचसं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्हव्यवाहमरतिं देवं रञ्जसे
transliteration: dyutānaṃ vo atithiṃ svarṇaramaghniṃ hotāraṃ manuṣaḥ svadhvaram | vipraṃ na dyukṣavacasaṃ suvṛktibhirhavyavāhamaratiṃ devaṃ ṛñjase
translation: Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites, Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: पावकया यश्चितयन्त्या कर्पा कषामन रुरुच उषसो न भानुना | तूर्वन न यामन्नेतशस्य नू रण आ यो घर्णे न तत्र्षाणो अजरः
transliteration: pāvakayā yaścitayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā | tūrigvedaan na yāmannetaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ
translation: Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn; Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्निम-अग्निं वः समिधा दुवस्यत परियम-परियं वो अतिथिं गर्णीषणि | उप वो गीर्भिरम्र्तं विवासत देवो देवेषु वनते हि वार्यं देवो देवेषु वनते हि नो दुवः
transliteration: aghnim-aghniṃ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam-priyaṃ vo atithiṃ ghṛṇīṣaṇi | upa vo ghīrbhiramṛtaṃ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṃ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ
translation: Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs. Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth our service, God mid Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: समिद्धमग्निं समिधा गिरा गर्णे शुचिं पावकं पुरो अध्वरे धरुवम | विप्रं होतारं पुरुवारमद्रुहं कविं सुम्नैरीमहे जातवेदसम
transliteration: samiddhamaghniṃ samidhā ghirā ghṛṇe śuciṃ pāvakaṃ puro adhvare dhruvam | vipraṃ hotāraṃ puruvāramadruhaṃ kaviṃ sumnairīmahe jātavedasam
translation: Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice. Wise Jatavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवां दूतमग्ने अम्र्तं युगे-युगे हव्यवाहं दधिरे पायुमीड्यम | देवासश्च मर्तासश्च जाग्र्विं विभुं विश्पतिं नमसा नि षेदिरे
transliteration: tvāṃ dūtamaghne amṛtaṃ yughe-yughe havyavāhaṃ dadhire pāyumīḍyam | devāsaśca martāsaśca jāghṛviṃ vibhuṃ viśpatiṃ namasā ni ṣedire
translation: Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable. With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: विभूषन्नग्न उभयाननु वरता दूतो देवानां रजसी समीयसे | यत ते धीतिं सुमतिमाव्र्णीमहे.अध समा नस्त्रिवरूथः शिवो भव
transliteration: vibhūṣannaghna ubhayānanu vratā dūto devānāṃ rajasī samīyase | yat te dhītiṃ sumatimāvṛṇīmahe.adha smā nastrivarūthaḥ śivo bhava
translation: Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds. When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तं सुप्रतीकं सुद्र्शं सवञ्चमविद्वांसो विदुष्टरं सपेम | स यक्षद विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान पर हव्यमग्निरम्र्तेषु वोचत
transliteration: taṃ supratīkaṃ sudṛśaṃ svañcamavidvāṃso viduṣṭaraṃ sapema | sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyamaghniramṛteṣu vocat
translation: Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow. Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तमग्ने पास्युत तं पिपर्षि यस्त आनट कवये शूर धीतिम | यज्ञस्य वा निशितिं वोदितिं वा तमित पर्णक्षि शवसोत राया
transliteration: tamaghne pāsyuta taṃ piparṣi yasta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim | yajñasya vā niśitiṃ voditiṃ vā tamit pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā
translation: Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero, The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि तवमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात | सं तवा धवस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयि सप्र्हयाय्यःसहस्री
transliteration: tvamaghne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvamu naḥ sahasāvannavadyāt | saṃ tvā dhvasmanvadabhyetu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥsahasrī
translation: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour. Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्निर्होता गर्हपतिः स राजा विश्वा वेद जनिमा जातवेदः | देवानामुत यो मर्त्यानां यजिष्ठः स पर यजतां रतावा
transliteration: aghnirhotā ghṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedaḥ | devānāmuta yo martyānāṃ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatāṃ ṛtāvā
translation: Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations. Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्ने यदद्य विशो अध्वरस्य होतः पावकशोचे वेष टवं हि यज्वा | रता यजासि महिना वि यद भूर्हव्या वह यविष्ठ या ते अद्य
transliteration: aghne yadadya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṃ hi yajvā |
translation: Whate'er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer- Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तवमग्ने यज्ञानां होता विश्वेषां हितः | देवेभिर्मानुषे जने
transliteration: tvamaghne yajñānāṃ hotā viśveṣāṃ hitaḥ | devebhirmānuṣe jane
translation: PRIEST of all sacrifices hast thou been appointed by the Gods, Agni, amid the race of man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स नो मन्द्राभिरध्वरे जिह्वाभिर्यजा महः | आ देवान वक्षि यक्षि च
transliteration: sa no mandrābhiradhvare jihvābhiryajā mahaḥ |
translation: So with thy joyous tongues for us sacrifice nobly in this rite. Bring thou the Gods and worship them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 17
sanskrit: पिबा सोममभि यमुग्र तर्द ऊर्वं गव्यं महि गर्णानैन्द्र | वि यो धर्ष्णो वधिषो वज्रहस्त विश्वा वर्त्रममित्रिया शवोभिः
transliteration: pibā somamabhi yamughra tarda ūrigvedaaṃ ghavyaṃ mahi ghṛṇānaindra | vi yo dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣo vajrahasta viśvā vṛtramamitriyā śavobhiḥ
translation: DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra; Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vrtra with might, and every hostile being.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 17
sanskrit: स ईं पाहि य रजीषी तरुत्रो यः शिप्रवान वर्षभो यो मतीनाम | यो गोत्रभिद वज्रभ्र्द यो हरिष्ठाः स इन्द्र चित्रानभि तर्न्धि वाजान
transliteration: sa īṃ pāhi ya ṛjīṣī tarutro yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabho yo matīnām | yo ghotrabhid vajrabhṛd yo hariṣṭhāḥ sa indra citrānabhi tṛndhi vājān
translation: Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero, Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 17
sanskrit: एवा पाहि परत्नथा मन्दतु तवा शरुधि बरह्म वाव्र्धस्वोतगीर्भिः | आविः सूर्यं कर्णुहि पीपिहीषो जहि शत्रून्रभि गा इन्द्र तर्न्धि
transliteration: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvotaghīrbhiḥ |
translation: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee. Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तमु षटुहि यो अभिभूत्योजा वन्वन्नवातः पुरुहूत इन्द्रः | अषाळ्हमुग्रं सहमानमाभिर्गीर्भिर्वर्ध वर्षभं चर्षणीनाम
transliteration: tamu ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvannavātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ | aṣāḷhamughraṃ sahamānamābhirghīrbhirigvedaardha vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām
translation: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured. Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: स युध्मः सत्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा तुविम्रक्षो नदनुमान रजीषी | बर्हद्रेणुश्च्यवनो मानुषीणामेकः कर्ष्टीनामभवत सहावा
transliteration: sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumān ṛjīṣī | bṛhadreṇuścyavano mānuṣīṇāmekaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmabhavat sahāvā
translation: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer, Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तवं ह नु तयददमायो दस्यून्रेकः कर्ष्टीरवनोरार्याय | अस्ति सविन नु वीर्यं तत त इन्द्र न सविदस्ति तद रतुथा वि वोचः
transliteration: tvaṃ ha nu tyadadamāyo dasyūnrekaḥ kṛṣṭīravanorāryāya | asti svin nu vīryaṃ tat ta indra na svidasti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ
translation: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Arya. In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: सदिद धि ते तुविजातस्य मन्ये सहः सहिष्ठ तुरतस्तुरस्य | उग्रमुग्रस्य तवसस्तवीयो.अरध्रस्य रध्रतुरो बभूव
transliteration: sadid dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatasturasya | ughramughrasya tavasastavīyo.aradhrasya radhraturo babhūva
translation: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor; Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तन नः परत्नं सख्यमस्तु युष्मे इत्था वदद्भिर्वलमङगिरोभिः | हन्नच्युतच्युद दस्मेषयन्तं रणोः पुरो वि दुरोस्य विश्वाः
transliteration: tan naḥ pratnaṃ sakhyamastu yuṣme itthā vadadbhirigvedaalamaṅghirobhiḥ | hannacyutacyud dasmeṣayantaṃ ṛṇoḥ puro vi duroasya viśvāḥ
translation: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Angirases here who speak of Vala. Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: स हि धीभिर्हव्यो अस्त्युग्र ईशानक्र्न महति वर्त्रतूर्ये | स तोकसाता तनये स वज्री वितन्तसाय्यो अभवत समत्सु
transliteration: sa hi dhībhirhavyo astyughra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye | sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu
translation: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vrtra. He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: स मज्मना जनिम मानुषाणाममर्त्येन नाम्नाति पर सर्स्रे | स दयुम्नेन स शवसोत राया स वीर्येण नर्तमः समोकाः
transliteration: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇāmamartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre | sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ
translation: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations. He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: स यो न मुहे न मिथू जनो भूत सुमन्तुनामा चुमुरिं धुनिं च | वर्णक पिप्रुं शम्बरं शुष्णमिन्द्रः पुरांच्यौत्नाय शयथाय नू चित
transliteration: sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca | vṛṇak pipruṃ śambaraṃ śuṣṇamindraḥ purāṃcyautnāya śayathāya nū cit
translation: Stranger to guile, who ne'er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered, Indra crushed Cumuri, Dhuni, Sambara, Pipru, and Susna, that their castles fell in ruin.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: उदावता तवक्षसा पन्यसा च वर्त्रहत्याय रथमिन्द्र तिष्ठ | धिष्व वज्रं हस्त आ दक्षिणत्राभि पर मन्द पुरुदत्र मायाः
transliteration: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya rathamindra tiṣṭha | dhiṣva vajraṃ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ
translation: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vrtra. In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 18
sanskrit: अग्निर्न शुष्कं वनमिन्द्र हेती रक्षो नि धक्ष्यशनिर्न भीमा | गम्भीरय रष्वया यो रुरोजाध्वानयद दुरिता दम्भयच्च
transliteration: aghnirna śuṣkaṃ vanamindra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣyaśanirna bhīmā | ghambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayacca
translation: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra; Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 19
sanskrit: महानिन्द्रो नर्वदा चर्षणिप्रा उत दविबर्हा अमिनः सहोभिः | अस्मद्र्यग वाव्र्धे विर्यायोरुः पर्थुः सुक्र्तः कर्त्र्भिर्भूत
transliteration: mahānindro nṛvadā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ | asmadryagh vāvṛdhe viryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhirbhūt
translation: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness. He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 19
sanskrit: इन्द्रमेव धिषणा सातये धाद बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं युवानम | अषाळ्हेन सवसा शूशुवांसं सद्यश्चिद यो वाव्र्धे असामि
transliteration: indrameva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhād bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ yuvānam | aṣāḷhena savasā śūśuvāṃsaṃ sadyaścid yo vāvṛdhe asāmi
translation: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying, Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पर्थू करस्ना बहुला गभस्ती अस्मद्र्यक सं मिमीहि शरवांसि | यूथेव पश्वः पशुपा दमूना अस्मानिन्द्राभ्या वव्र्त्स्वाजौ
transliteration: pṛthū karasnā bahulā ghabhastī asmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi | yūtheva paśvaḥ paśupā damūnā asmānindrābhyā vavṛtsvājau
translation: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory. Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तं व इन्द्रं चतिनमस्य शाकैरिह नूनं वाजयन्तो हुवेम | यथा चित पूर्वे जरितार आसुरनेद्या अनवद्या अरिष्टाः
transliteration: taṃ va indraṃ catinamasya śākairiha nūnaṃ vājayanto huvema | yathā cit pūrigvedae jaritāra āsuranedyā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ
translation: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,- Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e'en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 19
sanskrit: धर्तव्रतो धनदाः सोमव्र्द्धः स हि वामस्य वसुनः पुरुक्षुः | सं जग्मिरे पथ्या रायो अस्मिन समुद्रे न सिन्धवो यादमानाः
transliteration: dhṛtavrato dhanadāḥ somavṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ | saṃ jaghmire pathyā rāyo asmin samudre na sindhavo yādamānāḥ
translation: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us. In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 20
sanskrit: दयौर्न य इन्द्राभि भूमार्यस्तस्थौ रयिः शवसा पर्त्सु जनान | तं नः सहस्रभरमुर्वरासां दद्धि सूनो सहसो वर्त्रतुरम
transliteration: dyaurna ya indrābhi bhūmāryastasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān | taṃ naḥ sahasrabharamurigvedaarāsāṃ daddhi sūno sahaso vṛtraturam
translation: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o'ertops the earth, o'ercomes our foes in battle Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 20
sanskrit: दिवो न तुभ्यमन्विन्द्र सत्रासुर्यं देवेभिर्धायि विश्वम | अहिं यद वर्त्रमपो वव्रिवांसं हन्न्र्जीषिन विष्णुनासचानः
transliteration: divo na tubhyamanvindra satrāsuryaṃ devebhirdhāyi viśvam | ahiṃ yad vṛtramapo vavrivāṃsaṃ hannṛjīṣin viṣṇunāsacānaḥ
translation: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted, When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Visnu, slewest Vrtra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 20
sanskrit: तूर्वन्नोजीयान तवसस्तवीयान कर्तब्रह्मेन्द्रो वर्द्धमहाः | राजाभवन मधुनः सोम्यस्य विश्वासां यत पुरां दर्त्नुमावत
transliteration: tūrigvedaannojīyān tavasastavīyān kṛtabrahmendro vṛddhamahāḥ | rājābhavan madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsāṃ yat purāṃ dartnumāvat
translation: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour, Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इमा उ तवा पुरुतमस्य कारोर्हव्यं वीर हव्या हवन्ते | धियो रथेष्ठामजरं नवीयो रयिर्विभूतिरीयते वचस्या
transliteration: imā u tvā purutamasya kārorhavyaṃ vīra havyā havante | dhiyo ratheṣṭhāmajaraṃ navīyo rayirigvedabhūtirīyate vacasyā
translation: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero; Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तमु सतुष इन्द्रं यो विदानो गिर्वाहसं गीर्भीर्यज्ञव्र्द्धम | यस्य दिवमति मह्ना पर्थिव्याः पुरुमायस्य रिरिचेमहित्वम
transliteration: tamu stuṣa indraṃ yo vidāno ghirigvedaāhasaṃ ghīrbhīryajñavṛddham | yasya divamati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya riricemahitvam
translation: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices, Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: स इत तमो.अवयुनं ततन्वत सूर्येण वयुनवच्चकार | कदा ते मर्ता अम्र्तस्य धामेयक्षन्तो न मिनन्ति सवधावः
transliteration: sa it tamo.avayunaṃ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavaccakāra | kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ
translation: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless. Mortals who yearn to worship ne'er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: यस्ता चकार स कुह सविदिन्द्रः कमा जनं चरति कासु विक्षु | कस्ते यज्ञो मनसे शं वराय को अर्क इन्द्रकतमः स होता
transliteration: yastā cakāra sa kuha svidindraḥ kamā janaṃ carati kāsu vikṣu | kaste yajño manase śaṃ varāya ko arka indrakatamaḥ sa hotā
translation: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit? What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इदा हि ते वेविषतः पुराजाः परत्नास आसुः पुरुक्र्त सखायः | ये मध्यमास उत नूतनास उतावमस्य पुरुहूत बोधि
transliteration: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ | ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi
translation: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker. Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तं पर्छन्तो.अवरासः पराणि परत्ना त इन्द्र शरुत्यानु येमुः | अर्चामसि वीर बरह्मवाहो यादेव विद्म तात तवा महान्तम
transliteration: taṃ pṛchanto.avarāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ | arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yādeva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam
