translation: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions. Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अभि तवा पाजो रक्षसो वि तस्थे महि जज्ञानमभि तत सु तिष्ठ | तव परत्नेन युज्येन सख्या वज्रेण धर्ष्णो अपता नुदस्व
transliteration: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānamabhi tat su tiṣṭha | tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apatā nudasva
translation: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it. With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: स तु शरुधीन्द्र नूतनस्य बरह्मण्यतो वीर कारुधायः | तवं हयापिः परदिवि पितॄणां शश्वद बभूथ सुहव एष्टौ
transliteration: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ | tvaṃ hyāpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṃ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau
translation: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer. For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: परोतये वरुणं मित्रमिन्द्रं मरुतः कर्ष्वावसे नो अद्य | पर पूषणं विष्णुमग्निं पुरन्धिं सवितारमोषधीः पर्वतांश्च
transliteration: protaye varuṇaṃ mitramindraṃ marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya | pra pūṣaṇaṃ viṣṇumaghniṃ purandhiṃ savitāramoṣadhīḥ parigvedaatāṃśca
translation: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuna, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts, Pusan and Visnu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 21
sanskrit: इम उ तवा पुरुशाक परयज्यो जरितारो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः | शरुधी हवमा हुवतो हुवानो न तवावानन्यो अम्र्त तवदस्ति
transliteration: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhyarcantyarkaiḥ |
translation: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy. Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: य एक इद धव्यश्चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं तं गीर्भिरभ्यर्च आभिः | यः पत्यते वर्षभो वर्ष्ण्यावान सत्यः सत्वा पुरुमायः सहस्वान
transliteration: ya eka id dhavyaścarṣaṇīnāmindraṃ taṃ ghīrbhirabhyarca ābhiḥ | yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān
translation: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals, The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तमु नः पूर्वे पितरो नवग्वाः सप्त विप्रासो अभि वाजयन्तः | नक्षद्दाभं ततुरिं पर्वतेष्ठामद्रोघवाचं मतिभिः शविष्ठम
transliteration: tamu naḥ pūrigvedae pitaro navaghvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ | nakṣaddābhaṃ taturiṃ parigvedaateṣṭhāmadroghavācaṃ matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
translation: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him, Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तमीमह इन्द्रमस्य रायः पुरुवीरस्य नर्वतः पुरुक्षोः | यो अस्क्र्धोयुरजरः सवर्वान तमा भर हरिवो मादयध्यै
transliteration: tamīmaha indramasya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ | yo askṛdhoyurajaraḥ svarigvedaān tamā bhara harivo mādayadhyai
translation: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes. Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तन नो वि वोचो यदि ते पुरा चिज्जरितार आनशुः सुम्नमिन्द्र | कस्ते भागः किं वयो दुध्र खिद्वः पुरुहूत पुरूवसो.असुरघ्नः
transliteration: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cijjaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnamindra | kaste bhāghaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso.asuraghnaḥ
translation: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune, What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तं पर्छन्ती वज्रहस्तं रथेष्ठामिन्द्रं वेपी वक्वरीयस्य नू गीः | तुविग्राभं तुविकूर्मिं रभोदां गातुमिषे नक्षते तुम्रमछ
transliteration: taṃ pṛchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhāmindraṃ vepī vakvarīyasya nū ghīḥ | tuvighrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ ghātumiṣe nakṣate tumramacha
translation: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent, Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अया ह तयं मायया वाव्र्धानं मनोजुवा सवतवः पर्वतेन | अच्युता चिद वीळिता सवोजो रुजो वि दर्ळ्हा धर्षता विरप्शिन
transliteration: ayā ha tyaṃ māyayā vāvṛdhānaṃ manojuvā svatavaḥ parigvedaatena | acyutā cid vīḷitā svojo rujo vi dṛḷhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
translation: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee, And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 22
sanskrit: तं वो धिया नव्यस्या शविष्ठं परत्नं परत्नवत परितंसयध्यै | स नो वक्षदनिमानः सुवह्मेन्द्रो विश्वान्यतिदुर्गहाणि
transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭhaṃ pratnaṃ pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai | sa no vakṣadanimānaḥ suvahmendro viśvānyatidurghahāṇi
translation: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner. So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: सुत इत तवं निमिश्ल इन्द्र सोमे सतोमे बरह्मणि शस्यमानौक्थे | यद वा युक्ताभ्यां मघवन हरिभ्यां बिभ्रद वज्रम्बाह्वोरिन्द्र यासि
transliteration: suta it tvaṃ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamānaukthe | yad vā yuktābhyāṃ maghavan haribhyāṃ bibhrad vajrambāhvorindra yāsi
translation: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted; Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: यद वा दिवि पार्ये सुष्विमिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये.अवसि शूरसातौ | यद वा दक्षस्य बिभ्युषो अबिभ्यदरन्धयः शर्धत इन्द्र दस्यून
transliteration: yad vā divi pārye suṣvimindra vṛtrahatye.avasi śūrasātau | yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyadarandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn
translation: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vrtra's slaughter; Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं परणेनीरुग्रो जरितारमूती | कर्ता वीराय सुष्वय उ लोकं दाता वसु सतुवते कीरये चित
transliteration: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ praṇenīrughro jaritāramūtī | kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṃ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit
translation: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises. He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: गन्तेयान्ति सवना हरिभ्यां बभ्रिर्वज्रं पपिः सोमं ददिर्गाः | कर्ता वीरं नर्यं सर्ववीरं शरोता हवंग्र्णत सतोमवाहाः
transliteration: ghanteyānti savanā haribhyāṃ babhririgvedaajraṃ papiḥ somaṃ dadirghāḥ | kartā vīraṃ naryaṃ sarigvedaavīraṃ śrotā havaṃghṛṇata stomavāhāḥ
translation: E'en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle. He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: अस्मै वयं यद वावान तद विविष्म इन्द्राय यो नः परदिवो अपस कः | सुते सोमे सतुमसि शंसदुक्थेन्द्राय बरह्म वर्धनं यथासत
transliteration: asmai vayaṃ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ | sute some stumasi śaṃsadukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṃ yathāsat
translation: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service. While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: बरह्माणि हि चक्र्षे वर्धनानि तावत त इन्द्र मतिभिर्विविष्मः | सुते सोमे सुतपाः शन्तमानि रान्द्र्या करियास्म वक्षणानि यज्ञैः
transliteration: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhirigvedaviṣmaḥ | sute some sutapāḥ śantamāni rāndryā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ
translation: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra. May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: स नो बोधि पुरोळाशं रराणः पिबा तु सोमं गोर्जीकमिन्द्र | एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदोरुं कर्धि तवायत उ लोकम
transliteration: sa no bodhi puroḷāśaṃ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṃ ghoṛjīkamindra | edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdoruṃ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam
translation: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled. Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: स मन्दस्वा हयनु जोषमुग्र पर तवा यज्ञास इमे अश्नुवन्तु | परेमे हवासः पुरुहूतमस्मे आ तवेयं धीरवस इन्द्र यम्याः
transliteration: sa mandasvā hyanu joṣamughra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu | preme havāsaḥ puruhūtamasme ā tveyaṃ dhīravasa indra yamyāḥ
translation: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee; And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: तं वः सखायः सं यथा सुतेषु सोमेभिरीं पर्णता भोजमिन्द्रम | कुवित तस्मा असति नो भराय न सुष्विमिन्द्रो.अवसे मर्धाति
transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṃ yathā suteṣu somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram | kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvimindro.avase mṛdhāti
translation: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma. Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 23
sanskrit: एवेदिन्द्रः सुते अस्तावि सोमे भरद्वाजेषु कषयदिन मघोनः | असद यथा जरित्र उत सूरिरिन्द्रो रायो विश्ववारस्य दाता
transliteration: evedindraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayadin maghonaḥ | asad yathā jaritra uta sūririndro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā
translation: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvajas, That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 24
sanskrit: वर्षा मद इन्द्रे शलोक उक्था सचा सोमेषु सुतपा रजीषी | अर्चत्र्यो मघवा नर्भ्य उक्थैर्द्युक्षो राजा गिरामक्षितोतिः
transliteration: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī | arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthairdyukṣo rājā ghirāmakṣitotiḥ
translation: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 24
sanskrit: ततुरिर्वीरो नर्यो विचेताः शरोता हवं गर्णत उर्व्यूतिः | वसुः शंसो नरां कारुधाया वाजी सतुतो विदथे दाति वाजम
transliteration: taturirigvedaīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṃ ghṛṇata urigvedayūtiḥ | vasuḥ śaṃso narāṃ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam
translation: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him. Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 24
sanskrit: अक्षो न चक्र्योः शूर बर्हन पर ते मह्ना रिरिचे रोदस्योः | वर्क्षस्य नु ते पुरुहूत वया वयूतयो रुरुहुरिन्द्र पूर्वीः
transliteration: akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ | vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vyūtayo ruruhurindra pūrigvedaīḥ
translation: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness. Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 25
sanskrit: या त ऊतिरवमा या परमा या मध्यमेन्द्र शुष्मिन्नस्ति | ताभिरू षु वर्त्रहत्ये.अवीर्न एभिश्च वाजैर्महान्न उग्र
transliteration: yā ta ūtiravamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminnasti | tābhirū ṣu vṛtrahatye.avīrna ebhiśca vājairmahānna ughra
translation: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,- Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: शरुधी न इन्द्र हवयामसि तवा महो वाजस्य सातौ वाव्र्षाणाः | सं यद विशो.अयन्त शूरसाता उग्रं नो.अवः पार्ये अहन दाः
transliteration: saṃ yad viśo.ayanta śūrasātā ughraṃ no.avaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ
translation: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour. Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तवां वाजी हवते वाजिनेयो महो वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ | तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं तरुत्रं तवां चष्टे मुष्टिहा गोषु युध्यन
transliteration: tvāṃ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya ghadhyasya sātau | tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ tarutraṃ tvāṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā ghoṣu yudhyan
translation: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तवं कविं चोदयो.अर्कसातौ तवं कुत्साय शुष्णं दाशुषे वर्क | तवं शिरो अमर्मणः पराहन्नतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन
transliteration: tvaṃ kaviṃ codayo.arkasātau tvaṃ kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ dāśuṣe vark | tvaṃ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhannatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan
translation: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Susna for the pious Kutsa. The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Atithigva.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तवं रथं पर भरो योधं रष्वमावो युध्यन्तं वर्षभं दशद्युम | तवं तुग्रं वेतसवे सचाहन तवं तुजिं गर्णन्तमिन्द्र तूतोः
transliteration: tvaṃ rathaṃ pra bharo yodhaṃ ṛṣvamāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum | tvaṃ tughraṃ vetasave sacāhan tvaṃ tujiṃ ghṛṇantamindra tūtoḥ
translation: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Dasadyu the strong when fighting. Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तवं तदुक्थमिन्द्र बर्हणा कः पर यच्छता सहस्राशूर दर्षि | अव गिरेर्दासं शम्बरं हन परावो दिवोदासं चित्राभिरूती
transliteration: tvaṃ tadukthamindra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yacchatā sahasrāśūra darṣi | ava ghirerdāsaṃ śambaraṃ han prāvo divodāsaṃ citrābhirūtī
translation: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero, Slewest the Dasa Sambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodasa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: तवं शरद्धाभिर्मन्दसानः सोमैर्दभीतये चुमुरिमिन्द्रसिष्वप | तवं रजिं पिठीनसे दशस्यन षष्टिं सहस्राशच्या सचाहन
transliteration: tvaṃ śraddhābhirmandasānaḥ somairdabhītaye cumurimindrasiṣvap | tvaṃ rajiṃ piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāśacyā sacāhan
translation: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Cumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhiti. Thou, kindly giving Raji to Pithinas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: अहं चन तत सूरिभिरानश्यां तव जयाय इन्द्र सुम्नमोजः | तवया यत सतवन्ते सधवीर वीरास्त्रिवरूथेन नहुषा शविष्ठ
transliteration: ahaṃ cana tat sūribhirānaśyāṃ tava jyāya indra sumnamojaḥ | tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāstrivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha
translation: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination, When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahusa heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 26
sanskrit: वयं ते अस्यामिन्द्र दयुम्नहूतौ सखायः सयाम महिन परेष्ठाः | परातर्दनिः कषत्रश्रीरस्तु शरेष्ठो घने वर्त्राणां सनये धनानाम
transliteration: vayaṃ te asyāmindra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ | prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīrastu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṃ sanaye dhanānām
translation: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation. Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: किमस्य मदे किं वस्य पीताविन्द्रः किमस्य सख्ये चकार | रणा वा ये निषदि किं ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे किमु नूतनासः
transliteration: kimasya made kiṃ vasya pītāvindraḥ kimasya sakhye cakāra | raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṃ te asya pura vividre kimu nūtanāsaḥ
translation: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma? What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: सदस्य मदे सद वस्य पितविन्द्रः सदस्य सख्ये चकार | रणा वा ये निषदि सत ते अस्य पुर विविद्रे सदु नूतनासः
transliteration: sadasya made sad vasya pitavindraḥ sadasya sakhye cakāra | raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya pura vividre sadu nūtanāsaḥ
translation: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship. His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: नहि नु ते महिमनः समस्य न मघवन मघवत्त्वस्य विद्म | न राधसो-राधसो नूतनस्येन्द्र नकिर्दद्र्श इन्द्रियं ते
transliteration: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma | na rādhaso-rādhaso nūtanasyendra nakirdadṛśa indriyaṃ te
translation: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance. No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: एतत तयत त इन्द्रियमचेति येनावधीर्वरशिखस्य शेषः | वज्रस्य यत ते निहतस्य शुष्मात सवनाच्चिदिन्द्र परमोददार
transliteration: etat tyat ta indriyamaceti yenāvadhīrigvedaaraśikhasya śeṣaḥ | vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāccidindra paramodadāra
translation: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varasikha's children, When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere sound, their boldest was demolished.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: वधीदिन्द्रो वरशिखस्य शेषो.अभ्यावर्तिने चायमानाय शिक्षन | वर्चीवतो यद धरियूपीयायां हन पूर्वे अर्धे भियसापरो दर्त
transliteration: vadhīdindro varaśikhasya śeṣo.abhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan | vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṃ han pūrigvedae ardhe bhiyasāparo dart
translation: In aid of Abhyavartin Cayamana, Indra destroyed the seed of Varasikha. At Hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the Vrcivans, and the rear fled frighted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: तरिंशच्छतं वर्मिण इन्द्र साकं यव्यावत्यां पुरुहूत शरवस्या | वर्चीवन्तः शरवे पत्यमानाः पात्रा भिन्दानन्यर्थान्यायन
transliteration: triṃśacchataṃ varmiṇa indra sākaṃ yavyāvatyāṃ puruhūta śravasyā | vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānanyarthānyāyan
translation: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyavati, O much-sought Indra, Vrcivan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यस्य गावावरुषा सूयवस्यू अन्तरू षु चरतो रेरिहाणा | स सर्ञ्जयाय तुर्वशं परादाद वर्चीवतो दैववातायशिक्षन
transliteration: yasya ghāvāvaruṣā sūyavasyū antarū ṣu carato rerihāṇā | sa sṛñjayāya turigvedaaśaṃ parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāyaśikṣan
translation: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven, Gave Turvasa to Srnjaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vrcivans up to Daivavata.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 27
sanskrit: दवयानग्ने रथिनो विंशतिं गा वधूमतो मघवा मह्यं सम्राट | अभ्यावर्ती चायमानो ददाति दूणाशेयं दक्षिणा पार्थवानाम
transliteration: dvayānaghne rathino viṃśatiṃ ghā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṃ samrāṭ | abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṃ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām
translation: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhydvartin Cayamana, The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Prthu's seed is hard to win from others.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: आ गावो अग्मन्नुत भद्रमक्रन सीदन्तु गोष्ठे रणयन्त्वस्मे | परजावतीः पुरुरूपा इह सयुरिन्द्राय पूर्वीरुषसो दुहानाः
transliteration: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syurindrāya pūrigvedaīruṣaso duhānāḥ
translation: THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us. Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: इन्द्रो यज्वने पर्णते च शिक्षत्युपेद ददाति न सवं मुषायति | भूयो-भूयो रयिमिदस्य वर्धयन्नभिन्ने खिल्ये निदधाति देवयुम
transliteration: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣatyuped dadāti na svaṃ muṣāyati | bhūyo-bhūyo rayimidasya vardhayannabhinne khilye nidadhāti devayum
translation: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto. Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: न ता नशन्ति न दभाति तस्करो नासामामित्रो वयथिरादधर्षति | देवांश्च याभिर्यजते ददाति च जयोगित ताभिः सचते गोपतिः सह
transliteration: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsāmāmitro vyathirādadharṣati | devāṃśca yābhiryajate dadāti ca jyoghit tābhiḥ sacate ghopatiḥ saha
translation: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them. The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: न ता अर्वा रेणुककाटो अश्नुते न संस्क्र्तत्रमुप यन्ति ता अभि | उरुगायमभयं तस्य ता अनु गावो मर्तस्य विचरन्ति यज्वनः
transliteration: na tā arigvedaā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṃskṛtatramupa yanti tā abhi | urughāyamabhayaṃ tasya tā anu ghāvo martasya vicaranti yajvanaḥ
translation: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way. These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: गावो भगो गाव इन्द्रो मे अछान गावः सोमस्य परथमस्य भक्षः | इमा या गावः स जनास इन्द्र इछामीद धर्दामनसा चिदिन्द्रम
transliteration: ghāvo bhagho ghāva indro me achān ghāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ | imā yā ghāvaḥ sa janāsa indra ichāmīd dhṛdāmanasā cidindram
translation: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma. These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: यूयं गावो मेदयथा कर्शं चिदश्रीरं चित कर्णुथा सुप्रतीकम | भद्रं गर्हं कर्णुथ भद्रवाचो बर्हद वो वय उच्यते सभासु
transliteration: yūyaṃ ghāvo medayathā kṛśaṃ cidaśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam | bhadraṃ ghṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu
translation: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on. Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: परजावतीः सूयवसं रिशन्तीः शुद्धा अपः सुप्रपाणेपिबन्तीः | मा व सतेन ईशत माघशंसः परि वो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः
transliteration: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṃ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇepibantīḥ | mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ
translation: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places. Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 28
sanskrit: उपेदमुपपर्चनमासु गोषूप पर्च्यताम | उप रषभस्य रेतस्युपेन्द्र तव वीर्ये
transliteration: upedamupaparcanamāsu ghoṣūpa pṛcyatām | upa ṛṣabhasya retasyupendra tava vīrye
translation: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows, Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 29
sanskrit: इन्द्रं वो नरः सख्याय सेपुर्महो यन्तः सुमतये चकानाः | महो हि दाता वज्रहस्तो अस्ति महामु रण्वमवसे यजध्वम
transliteration: indraṃ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepurmaho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ | maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahāmu raṇvamavase yajadhvam
translation: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him. For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 30
sanskrit: भूय इद वाव्र्धे वीर्यायनेको अजुर्यो दयते वसूनि | पर रिरिचे दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्या अर्धमिदस्य परति रोदसी उभे
transliteration: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyaneko ajuryo dayate vasūni | pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardhamidasya prati rodasī ubhe
translation: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures. Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अधा मन्ये बर्हदसुर्यमस्य यानि दाधार नकिरा मिनाति | दिवे-दिवे सूर्यो दर्शतो भूद वि सद्मान्युर्विया सुक्रतुर्धात
transliteration: adhā manye bṛhadasuryamasya yāni dādhāra nakirā mināti | dive-dive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmānyurigvedayā sukraturdhāt
translation: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined. Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अद्या चिन नू चित तदपो नदीनां यदाभ्यो अरदो गातुमिन्द्र | नि पर्वता अद्मसदो न सेदुस्त्वया दर्ळ्हानि सुक्रतो रजांसि
transliteration: adyā cin nū cit tadapo nadīnāṃ yadābhyo arado ghātumindra | ni parigvedaatā admasado na sedustvayā dṛḷhāni sukrato rajāṃsi
translation: E'en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage. Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 30
sanskrit: सत्यमित तन न तवावानन्यो अस्तीन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यो जयायान | अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णो.अवास्र्जो अपो अछा समुद्रम
transliteration: satyamit tan na tvāvānanyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān | ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇo.avāsṛjo apo achā samudram
translation: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 30
sanskrit: तवमपो वि दुरो विषूचीरिन्द्र दर्ळ्हमरुजः पर्वतस्य | राजाभवो जगतश्चर्षणीनां साकं सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासम
transliteration: tvamapo vi duro viṣūcīrindra dṛḷhamarujaḥ parigvedaatasya | rājābhavo jaghataścarṣaṇīnāṃ sākaṃ sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsam
translation: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain. Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अभूरेको रयिपते रयीणामा हस्तयोरधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः | वि तोके अप्सु तनये च सूरे.अवोचन्त चर्षणयो विवाचः
transliteration: abhūreko rayipate rayīṇāmā hastayoradhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ | vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre.avocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ
translation: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra! Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवद भियेन्द्र पार्थिवानि विश्वाच्युता चिच्च्यावयन्ते रजांसि | दयावाक्षामा पर्वतासो वनानि विश्वं दर्ळ्हं भयते अज्मन्ना ते
transliteration: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā ciccyāvayante rajāṃsi | dyāvākṣāmā parigvedaatāso vanāni viśvaṃ dṛḷhaṃ bhayate ajmannā te
translation: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble. All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवं कुत्सेनाभि शुष्णमिन्द्राशुषं युध्य कुयवं गविष्टौ | दश परपित्वे अध सूर्यस्य मुषायश्चक्रमविवेरपांसि
transliteration: tvaṃ kutsenābhi śuṣṇamindrāśuṣaṃ yudhya kuyavaṃ ghaviṣṭau | daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaścakramaviverapāṃsi
translation: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Susna, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle. In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 31
sanskrit: तवं शतान्यव शम्बरस्य पुरो जघन्थाप्रतीनि सस्योः | अशिक्षो यत्र शच्या शचीवो दिवोदासाय सुन्वते सुतक्रे भरद्वाजाय गर्णते वसूनि
transliteration: tvaṃ śatānyava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni sasyoḥ | aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya ghṛṇate vasūni
translation: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Sambara the Dasyu, When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodasa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvaja rich who praised thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 31
sanskrit: स सत्यसत्वन महते रणाय रथमा तिष्ठ तुविन्र्म्ण भीमम | याहि परपथिन्नवसोप मद्रिक पर च शरुत शरावय चर्षणिभ्यः
transliteration: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya rathamā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam | yāhi prapathinnavasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ
translation: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly. Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अपूर्व्या पुरुतमान्यस्मै महे वीराय तवसे तुराय | विरप्शिने वज्रिणे शन्तमानि वचांस्यासा सथविराय तक्षम
transliteration: apūrigvedayā purutamānyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya | virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsyāsā sthavirāya takṣam
translation: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious, For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 32
sanskrit: स मातरा सूर्येणा कवीनामवासयद रुजदद्रिं गर्णानः | सवाधीभिर्र्क्वभिर्वावशान उदुस्रियाणामस्र्जन निदानम
transliteration: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnāmavāsayad rujadadriṃ ghṛṇānaḥ | svādhībhirṛkvabhirigvedaāvaśāna udusriyāṇāmasṛjan nidānam
translation: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain; And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 32
sanskrit: स वह्निभिर्र्क्वभिर्गोषु शश्वन मितज्ञुभिः पुरुक्र्त्वा जिगाय | पुरः पुरोहा सखिभिः सखीयन दर्ळ्हा रुरोज कविभिः कविः सन
transliteration: sa vahnibhirṛkvabhirghoṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jighāya | puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
translation: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle, And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 32
sanskrit: स नीव्याभिर्जरितारमछा महो वाजेभिर्महद्भिश्च शुष्मैः | पुरुवीराभिर्व्र्षभ कषितीनामा गिर्वणः सुविताय पर याहि
transliteration: sa nīvyābhirjaritāramachā maho vājebhirmahadbhiśca śuṣmaiḥ | puruvīrābhirigvedaṛṣabha kṣitīnāmā ghirigvedaaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi
translation: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises. Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 32
sanskrit: स सर्गेण शवसा तक्तो अत्यैरप इन्द्रो दक्षिणतस्तुराषाट | इत्था सर्जाना अनपाव्र्दर्थं दिवे-दिवे विविषुरप्रम्र्ष्यम
transliteration: sa sargheṇa śavasā takto atyairapa indro dakṣiṇatasturāṣāṭ | itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛdarthaṃ dive-dive viviṣurapramṛṣyam
translation: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward. Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 33
sanskrit: य ओजिष्ठ इन्द्र तं सु नो दा मदो वर्षन सवभिष्टिर्दास्वान | सौवश्व्यं यो वनवत सवश्वो वर्त्रा समत्सु सासहदमित्रान
transliteration: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṃ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭirdāsvān | sauvaśvyaṃ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahadamitrān
translation: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero, That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vrtras and the foes in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 33
sanskrit: तवां हीन्द्रावसे विवाचो हवन्ते चर्षणयः शूरसातौ | तवं विप्रेभिर्वि पणीन्रशायस्त्वोत इत सनिता वाजमर्वा
transliteration: tvāṃ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau | tvaṃ viprebhirigveda paṇīnraśāyastvota it sanitā vājamarigvedaā
translation: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes. Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Panis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 33
sanskrit: तवं तानिन्द्रोभयानमित्रान दासा वर्त्राण्यार्या च शूर | वधीर्वनेव सुधितेभिरत्कैरा पर्त्सु दर्षि नर्णां नर्तम
transliteration: tvaṃ tānindrobhayānamitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā ca śūra | vadhīrigvedaaneva sudhitebhiratkairā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṃ nṛtama
translation: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Arya and the Dasa, Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 33
sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्राकवाभिरूती सखा विश्वायुरविता वर्धे भूः | सवर्षाता यद धवयामसि तवा युध्यन्तो नेमधिताप्र्त्सु शूर
transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indrākavābhirūtī sakhā viśvāyuravitā vṛdhe bhūḥ | svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitāpṛtsu śūra
translation: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth, When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 33
sanskrit: नूनं न इन्द्रापराय च सया भवा मर्ळीक उत नो अभिष्टौ | इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्मन दिवि षयाम पार्ये गोषतमाः
transliteration: nūnaṃ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḷīka uta no abhiṣṭau | itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye ghoṣatamāḥ
translation: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us. Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 34
sanskrit: सं च तवे जग्मुर्गिर इन्द्र पूर्वीर्वि च तवद यन्ति विभ्वोमनीषाः | पूरा नूनं च सतुतय रषीणां पस्प्र्ध्र इन्द्रे अध्युक्थार्का
transliteration: saṃ ca tve jaghmurghira indra pūrigvedaīrigveda ca tvad yanti vibhvomanīṣāḥ | pūrā nūnaṃ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇāṃ paspṛdhra indre adhyukthārkā
translation: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth. Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 34
sanskrit: पुरुहूतो यः पुरुगूर्त रभ्वानेकः पुरुप्रशस्तो अस्ति यज्ञैः | रथो न महे शवसे युजानो.अस्माभिरिन्द्रो अनुमाद्यो भूत
transliteration: puruhūto yaḥ purughūrta ṛbhvānekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ | ratho na mahe śavase yujāno.asmābhirindro anumādyo bhūt
translation: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices. Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 34
sanskrit: न यं हिंसन्ति धीतयो न वाणीरिन्द्रं नक्षन्तीदभि वर्धयन्तीः | यदि सतोतारः शतं यत सहस्रं गर्णन्ति गिर्वणसं शं तदस्मै
transliteration: na yaṃ hiṃsanti dhītayo na vāṇīrindraṃ nakṣantīdabhi vardhayantīḥ | yadi stotāraḥ śataṃ yat sahasraṃ ghṛṇanti ghirigvedaaṇasaṃ śaṃ tadasmai
translation: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble; For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अस्मा एतद दिव्यर्चेव मासा मिमिक्ष इन्द्रे नययामि सोमः | जनं न धन्वन्नभि सं यदापः सत्रा वाव्र्धुर्हवनानि यज्ञैः
transliteration: asmā etad divyarceva māsā mimikṣa indre nyayāmi somaḥ | janaṃ na dhanvannabhi saṃ yadāpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhurhavanāni yajñaiḥ
translation: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra. Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अस्मा एतन मह्याङगूषमस्मा इन्द्राय सतोत्रं मतिभिरवाचि | असद यथा महति वर्त्रतूर्य इन्द्रो विश्वायुरविता वर्धश्च
transliteration: asmā etan mahyāṅghūṣamasmā indrāya stotraṃ matibhiravāci | asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyuravitā vṛdhaśca
translation: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets, That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 35
sanskrit: कदा भुवन रथक्षयाणि बरह्म कदा सतोत्रे सहस्रपोष्यन्दाः | कदा सतोमं वासयो.अस्य राया कदा धियः करसि वाजरत्नाः
transliteration: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyandāḥ | kadā stomaṃ vāsayo.asya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ
translation: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands? When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 35
sanskrit: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यन नर्भिर्नॄन वीरैर्वीरान नीळयासे जयाजीन | तरिधातु गा अधि जयासि गोष्विन्द्र दयुम्नंस्वर्वद धेह्यस्मे
transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yan nṛbhirnṝn vīrairigvedaīrān nīḷayāse jayājīn | tridhātu ghā adhi jayāsi ghoṣvindra dyumnaṃsvarigvedaad dhehyasme
translation: When wilt thou gatber men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat? Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 35
sanskrit: कर्हि सवित तदिन्द्र यज्जरित्रे विष्वप्सु बरह्म कर्णवः शविष्ठ | कदा धियो न नियुतो युवासे कदा गोमघा हवनानि गछाः
transliteration: karhi svit tadindra yajjaritre viṣvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha | kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā ghomaghā havanāni ghachāḥ
translation: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer? When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 35
sanskrit: स गोमघा जरित्रे अश्वश्चन्द्रा वाजश्रवसो अधि धेहि पर्क्षः | पीपिहीषः सुदुघामिन्द्र धेनुं भरद्वाजेषु सुरुचो रुरुच्याः
transliteration: sa ghomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ | pīpihīṣaḥ sudughāmindra dhenuṃ bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ
translation: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches. Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvajas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 35
sanskrit: तमा नूनं वर्जनमन्यथा चिच्छूरो यच्छक्र वि दुरोग्र्णीषे | मा निररं शुक्रदुघस्य धेनोराङगिरसान बरह्मणा विप्र जिन्व
transliteration: tamā nūnaṃ vṛjanamanyathā cicchūro yacchakra vi duroghṛṇīṣe | mā niraraṃ śukradughasya dhenorāṅghirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva
translation: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Sakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Angirases by devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 36
sanskrit: सत्रा मदासस्तव विश्वजन्याः सत्रा रायो.अध ये पार्थिवासः | सत्रा वाजानामभवो विभक्ता यद देवेषु धारयथा असुर्यम
transliteration: satrā madāsastava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo.adha ye pārthivāsaḥ | satrā vājānāmabhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam
translation: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches. Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 36
sanskrit: अनु पर येजे जन ओजो अस्य सत्रा दधिरे अनु वीर्याय | सयूमग्र्भे दुधये.अर्वते च करतुं वर्ञ्जन्त्यपि वर्त्रहत्ये
transliteration: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya | syūmaghṛbhe dudhaye.arigvedaate ca kratuṃ vṛñjantyapi vṛtrahatye
translation: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour. For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vrtra's slaughter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 36
sanskrit: तं सध्रीचीरूतयो वर्ष्ण्यानि पौंस्यानि नियुतः सश्चुरिन्द्रम | समुद्रं न सिन्धव उक्थशुष्मा उरुव्यचसं गिरा विशन्ति
transliteration: taṃ sadhrīcīrūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścurindram | samudraṃ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṃ ghiraā viśanti
translation: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra. As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 36
sanskrit: स रायस खामुप सर्जा गर्णानः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य तवमिन्द्रवस्वः | पतिर्बभूथासमो जनानामेको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा
transliteration: sa rāyas khāmupa sṛjā ghṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvamindravasvaḥ | patirbabhūthāsamo janānāmeko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translation: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches. For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 36
sanskrit: स तु शरुधि शरुत्या यो दुवोयुर्द्यौर्न भूमाभि रायोर्यः | असो यथा नः शवसा चकानो युगे-युगे वयसा चेकितानः
transliteration: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyurdyaurna bhūmābhi rāyoaryaḥ | aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yughe-yughe vayasā cekitānaḥ
translation: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure; Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 37
sanskrit: अर्वाग रथं विश्ववारं त उग्रेन्द्र युक्तासो हरयो वहन्तु | कीरिश्चिद धि तवा हवते सवर्वान रधीमहि सधमादस्तेद्य
transliteration: arigvedaāgh rathaṃ viśvavāraṃ ta ughrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu | kīriścid dhi tvā havate svarigvedaān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādasteadya
translation: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing. For thee, the Heavenly, e'en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 37
sanskrit: परो दरोणे हरयः कर्माग्मन पुनानास रज्यन्तो अभूवन | इन्द्रो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पपीयाद दयुक्षो मदस्य सोम्यस्य राजा
transliteration: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāghman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan | indro no asya pūrigvedayaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā
translation: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward. May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अपादित उदु नश्चित्रतमो महीं भर्षद दयुमतीमिन्द्रहूतिम | पन्यसीं धीतिं दैव्यस्य यामञ जनस्य रातिं वनते सुदानुः
transliteration: apādita udu naścitratamo mahīṃ bharṣad dyumatīmindrahūtim | panyasīṃ dhītiṃ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṃ vanate sudānuḥ
translation: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra. The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 38
sanskrit: दूराच्चिदा वसतो अस्य कर्णा घोषादिन्द्रस्य तन्यति बरुवाणः | एयमेनं देवहूतिर्वव्र्त्यान मद्र्यगिन्द्रमियं रच्यमाना
transliteration: dūrāccidā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣādindrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ | eyamenaṃ devahūtirigvedaavṛtyān madryaghindramiyaṃ ṛcyamānā
translation: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e'en from a distance. May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 38
sanskrit: तं वो धिया परमया पुराजामजरमिन्द्रमभ्यनूष्यर्कैः | बरह्मा च गिरो दधिरे समस्मिन महांश्च सतोमो अधि वर्धदिन्द्रे
transliteration: taṃ vo dhiyā paramayā purājāmajaramindramabhyanūṣyarkaiḥ | brahmā ca ghiro dadhire samasmin mahāṃśca stomo adhi vardhadindre
translation: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting. For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 38
sanskrit: वर्धाद यं यज्ञ उत सोम इन्द्रं वर्धाद बरह्म गिर उक्था च मन्म | वर्धाहैनमुषसो यामन्नक्तोर्वर्धान मासाः शरदो दयाव इन्द्रम
transliteration: vardhād yaṃ yajña uta soma indraṃ vardhād brahma ghira ukthā ca manma | vardhāhainamuṣaso yāmannaktorigvedaardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram
translation: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion, Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 38
sanskrit: एवा जज्ञानं सहसे असामि वाव्र्धानं राधसे च शरुताय | महामुग्रमवसे विप्र नूनमा विवासेम वर्त्रतूर्येषु
transliteration: evā jajñānaṃ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṃ rādhase ca śrutāya | mahāmughramavase vipra nūnamā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu
translation: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory, Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 39
sanskrit: मन्द्रस्य कवेर्दिव्यस्य वह्नेर्विप्रमन्मनो वचनस्य मध्वः | अपा नस्तस्य सचनस्य देवेषो युवस्व गर्णते गोग्राः
transliteration: mandrasya kaverdivyasya vahnerigvedapramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ | apā nastasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva ghṛṇate ghoaghrāḥ
translation: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion, Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 39
sanskrit: अयमुशानः पर्यद्रिमुस्र रतधीतिभिर्र्तयुग युजानः | रुजदरुग्णं वि वलस्य सानुं पणीन्र्वचोभिरभि योधदिन्द्रः
transliteration: ayamuśānaḥ paryadrimusra ṛtadhītibhirṛtayugh yujānaḥ | rujadarughṇaṃ vi valasya sānuṃ paṇīnrigvedaacobhirabhi yodhadindraḥ
translation: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades, He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Panis.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 39
sanskrit: अयं दयोतयदद्युतो वयक्तून दोषा वस्तोः शरद इन्दुरिन्द्र | इमं केतुमदधुर्नू चिदह्नां शुचिजन्मन उषसश्चकार
transliteration: ayaṃ dyotayadadyuto vyaktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indurindra | imaṃ ketumadadhurnū cidahnāṃ śucijanmana uṣasaścakāra
translation: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening. Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 39
sanskrit: अयं रोचयदरुचो रुचानो.अयं वासयद वय रतेन पूर्वीः | अयमीयत रतयुग्भिरश्वैः सवर्विदा नाभिना चर्षणिप्राः
transliteration: ayaṃ rocayadaruco rucāno.ayaṃ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrigvedaīḥ | ayamīyata ṛtayughbhiraśvaiḥ svarigvedadā nābhinā carṣaṇiprāḥ
translation: He shone and caused to shine the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings. He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 39
sanskrit: नू गर्णानो गर्णते परत्न राजन्निषः पिन्व वसुदेयाय पूर्वीः | अप ओषधीरविषा वनानि गा अर्वतो नॄन रचसे रिरीहि
transliteration: nū ghṛṇāno ghṛṇate pratna rājanniṣaḥ pinva vasudeyāya pūrigvedaīḥ | apa oṣadhīraviṣā vanāni ghā arigvedaato nṝn ṛcase rirīhi
translation: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures. Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 40
sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब तुभ्यं सुतो मदायाव सय हरी वि मुचा सखाया | उत पर गाय गण आ निषद्याथा यज्ञाय गर्णते वयो धाः
transliteration: indra piba tubhyaṃ suto madāyāva sya harī vi mucā sakhāyā | uta pra ghāya ghaṇa ā niṣadyāthā yajñāya ghṛṇate vayo dhāḥ
translation: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom. Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 40
sanskrit: अस्य पिब यस्य जज्ञान इन्द्र मदाय करत्वे अपिबो विरप्शिन | तमु ते गावो नर आपो अद्रिरिन्दुं समह्यन पीतये समस्मै
transliteration: asya piba yasya jajñāna indra madāya kratve apibo virapśin | tamu te ghāvo nara āpo adririnduṃ samahyan pītaye samasmai
translation: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture. The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 40
sanskrit: समिद्धे अग्नौ सुत इन्द्र सोम आ तवा वहन्तु हरयो वहिष्ठाः | तवायता मनसा जोहवीमीन्द्रा याहि सुविताय महे नः
transliteration: samiddhe aghnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ | tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ
translation: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither. With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 41
sanskrit: अहेळमान उप याहि यज्ञं तुभ्यं पवन्त इन्दवः सुतासः | गावो न वज्रिन सवमोको अछेन्द्रा गहि परथमो यज्ञियानाम
transliteration: aheḷamāna upa yāhi yajñaṃ tubhyaṃ pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ | ghāvo na vajrin svamoko achendrā ghahi prathamo yajñiyānām
translation: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee. As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 41
sanskrit: या ते काकुत सुक्र्ता या वरिष्ठा यया शश्वत पिबसि मध्व ऊर्मिम | तया पाहि पर ते अध्वर्युरस्थात सं ते वज्रोवर्ततामिन्द्र गव्युः
transliteration: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim | tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryurasthāt saṃ te vajrovartatāmindra ghavyuḥ
translation: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness, Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 41
sanskrit: एष दरप्सो वर्षभो विश्वरूप इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे समकारि सोमः | एतं पिब हरिव सथातरुग्र यस्येशिषे परदिवि यस्तेन्नम
transliteration: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe samakāri somaḥ | etaṃ piba hariva sthātarughra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yasteannam
translation: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India. Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 41
sanskrit: सुतः सोमो असुतादिन्द्र वस्यानयं शरेयाञ्चिकितुषे रणाय | एतं तितिर्व उप याहि यज्ञं तेन विश्वास्तविषीरा पर्णस्व
transliteration: sutaḥ somo asutādindra vasyānayaṃ śreyāñcikituṣe raṇāya | etaṃ titirigvedaa upa yāhi yajñaṃ tena viśvāstaviṣīrā pṛṇasva
translation: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure. Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 41
sanskrit: हवयामसि तवेन्द्र याह्यर्वां अरं ते सोमस्तन्वे भवाति | शतक्रतो मादयस्वा सुतेषु परास्मानव पर्तनासु पर विक्षु
transliteration: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhyarigvedaāṃ araṃ te somastanve bhavāti |
translation: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body. Rejoice thee, Satakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 42
sanskrit: परत्यस्मै पिपीषते विश्वानि विदुषे भर | अरंगमाय जग्मये.अपश्चाद्दघ्वने नरे
transliteration: pratyasmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara | araṃghamāya jaghmaye.apaścāddaghvane nare
translation: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink, The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 42
sanskrit: एमेनं परत्येतन सोमेभिः सोमपातमम | अमत्रेभिर्र्जीषिणमिन्द्रं सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः
transliteration: emenaṃ pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam | amatrebhirṛjīṣiṇamindraṃ sutebhirindubhiḥ
translation: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 42
sanskrit: यदी सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः सोमेभिः परतिभूषथ | वेदा विश्वस्य मेधिरो धर्षत तं-तमिदेषते
transliteration: yadī sutebhirindubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha | vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṃ-tamideṣate
translation: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God, Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अस्मा-अस्मा इदन्धसो.अध्वर्यो पर भरा सुतम | कुवित समस्य जेन्यस्य शर्धतो.अभिशस्तेरवस्परत
transliteration: asmā-asmā idandhaso.adhvaryo pra bharā sutam | kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato.abhiśasteravasparat
translation: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed. Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यस्य तयच्छम्बरं मदे दिवोदासाय रन्धयः | अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब
transliteration: yasya tyacchambaraṃ made divodāsāya randhayaḥ | ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
translation: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Sambara Divodasa's prey, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यस्य तीव्रसुतं मदं मध्यमन्तं च रक्षसे | अयं स...
transliteration: yasya tīvrasutaṃ madaṃ madhyamantaṃ ca rakṣase | ayaṃ sa...
translation: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यस्य गा अन्तरश्मनो मदे दर्ळ्हा अवास्र्जः | अयं स .. .
transliteration: yasya ghā antaraśmano made dṛḷhā avāsṛjaḥ | ayaṃ sa .. .
translation: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 43
sanskrit: यस्य मन्दानो अन्धसो माघोनं दधिषे शवः | अयं स...
transliteration: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṃ dadhiṣe śavaḥ | ayaṃ sa...
translation: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: यो रयिवो रयिन्तमो यो दयुम्नैर्द्युम्नवत्तमः | सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र ते.अस्ति सवधापते मदः
transliteration: yo rayivo rayintamo yo dyumnairdyumnavattamaḥ | somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te.asti svadhāpate madaḥ
translation: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: यः शग्मस्तुविशग्म ते रायो दामा मतीनाम | सोमः सुतः ...
transliteration: yaḥ śaghmastuviśaghma te rāyo dāmā matīnām | somaḥ sutaḥ ...
translation: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: येन वर्द्धो न शवसा तुरो न सवाभिरूतिभिः | सोमः सुतः ...
transliteration: yena vṛddho na śavasā turo na svābhirūtibhiḥ | somaḥ sutaḥ ...
translation: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: तयमु वो अप्रहणं गर्णीषे शवसस पतिम | इन्द्रं विश्वासाहं नरं मंहिष्ठं विश्वचर्षणिम
transliteration: tyamu vo aprahaṇaṃ ghṛṇīṣe śavasas patim | indraṃ viśvāsāhaṃ naraṃ maṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim
translation: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none, The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: यं वर्धयन्तीद गिरः पतिं तुरस्य राधसः | तमिन्न्वस्य रोदसी देवी शुष्मं सपर्यतः
transliteration: yaṃ vardhayantīd ghiraḥ patiṃ turasya rādhasaḥ | taminnvasya rodasī devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ
translation: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him, Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: तद व उक्थस्य बर्हणेन्द्रायोपस्त्र्णीषणि | विपो न यस्योतयो वि यद रोहन्ति सक्षितः
transliteration: tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi | vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ
translation: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise. The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 44
sanskrit: अविदद दक्षं मित्रो नवीयान पपानो देवेभ्यो वस्यो अचैत | ससवान सतौलाभिर्धौतरीभिरुरुष्या पायुरभवत सखिभ्यः
transliteration: avidad dakṣaṃ mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait | sasavān staulābhirdhautarībhiruruṣyā pāyurabhavat sakhibhyaḥ
translation: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods. He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: य आनयत परावतः सुनीती तुर्वशं यदुम | इन्द्रः सनो युवा सखा
transliteration: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turigvedaaśaṃ yadum | indraḥ sano yuvā sakhā
translation: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led Turvasa, Yadu from afar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: अविप्रे चिद वयो दधदनाशुना चिदर्वता | इन्द्रो जेता हितं धनम
transliteration: avipre cid vayo dadhadanāśunā cidarigvedaatā | indro jetā hitaṃ dhanam
translation: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins Even with slow steed the offered prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: महीरस्य परणीतयः पूर्वीरुत परशस्तयः | नास्य कषीयन्त ऊतयः
transliteration: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrigvedaīruta praśastayaḥ | nāsya kṣīyanta ūtayaḥ
translation: Great are his ways of guiding us, and! manifold are his eulogies: His kind protections never fail.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: सखायो बरह्मवाहसे.अर्चत पर च गायत | स हि नः परमतिर्मही
transliteration: sakhāyo brahmavāhase.arcata pra ca ghāyata | sa hi naḥ pramatirmahī
translation: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought: For our great Providence is he.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: तवमेकस्य वर्त्रहन्नविता दवयोरसि | उतेद्र्शे यथा वयम
transliteration: tvamekasya vṛtrahannavitā dvayorasi | utedṛśe yathā vayam
translation: Thou, Slaughterer of Vrtra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two, Yea, of a man like one of us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: नयसीद वति दविषः कर्णोष्युक्थशंसिनः | नर्भिः सुवीर उच्यसे
transliteration: nayasīd vati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣyukthaśaṃsinaḥ | nṛbhiḥ suvīra ucyase
translation: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise: Good hero art thou called by men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: बरह्माणं बरह्मवाहसं गीर्भिः सखायं रग्मियम | गांन दोहसे हुवे
transliteration: brahmāṇaṃ brahmavāhasaṃ ghīrbhiḥ sakhāyaṃ ṛghmiyam | ghāṃna dohase huve
translation: I call with hymns, as 'twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise, The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: यस्य विश्वानि हस्तयोरूचुर्वसूनि नि दविता | वीरस्य पर्तनाषहः
transliteration: yasya viśvāni hastayorūcurigvedaasūni ni dvitā | vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ
translation: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old, The Hero, conquering in the fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: वि दर्ळ्हानि चिदद्रिवो जनानां शचीपते | वर्ह माया अनानत
transliteration: vi dṛḷhāni cidadrivo janānāṃ śacīpate | vṛha māyā anānata
translation: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men, And foil their arts, unbending God!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: तमु तवा सत्य सोमपा इन्द्र वाजानां पते | अहूमहि शरवस्यवः
transliteration: tamu tvā satya somapā indra vājānāṃ pate | ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
translation: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true, We, fain for glory, have invoked.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: तमु तवा यः पुरासिथ यो वा नूनं हिते धने | हव्यःस शरुधी हवम
transliteration: tamu tvā yaḥ purāsitha yo vā nūnaṃ hite dhane | havyaḥsa śrudhī havam
translation: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize lies ready, listen to our call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: धीभिरर्वद्भिरर्वतो वाजानिन्द्र शरवाय्यान | तवया जेष्म हितं धनम
transliteration: dhībhirarigvedaadbhirarigvedaato vājānindra śravāyyān | tvayā jeṣma hitaṃ dhanam
translation: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: अभूरु वीर गिर्वणो महानिन्द्र धने हिते | भरे वितन्तसाय्यः
transliteration: abhūru vīra ghirigvedaaṇo mahānindra dhane hite | bhare vitantasāyyaḥ
translation: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been Great in the contest for the prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: या त ऊतिरमित्रहन मक्षूजवस्तमासति | तया नो हिनुही रथम
transliteration: yā ta ūtiramitrahan makṣūjavastamāsati | tayā no hinuhī ratham
translation: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course, With that impel our car to speed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: स रथेन रथीतमो.अस्माकेनाभियुग्वना | जेषि जिष्णो हितं धनम
transliteration: sa rathena rathītamo.asmākenābhiyughvanā | jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṃ dhanam
translation: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim, O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: य एक इत तमु षटुहि कर्ष्टीनां विचर्षणिः | पतिर्जज्ञे वर्षक्रतुः
transliteration: ya eka it tamu ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṃ vicarṣaṇiḥ | patirjajñe vṛṣakratuḥ
translation: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men, Most active, with heroic soul.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: यो गर्णतामिदासिथापिरूती शिवः सखा | स तवंन इन्द्र मर्ळय
transliteration: yo ghṛṇatāmidāsithāpirūtī śivaḥ sakhā | sa tvaṃna indra mṛḷaya
translation: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid, As such, O Indra, favour us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: धिष्व वज्रं गभस्त्यो रक्षोहत्याय वज्रिवः | सासहीष्ठा अभि सप्र्धः
transliteration: dhiṣva vajraṃ ghabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ | sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ
translation: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: परत्नं रयीणां युजं सखायं कीरिचोदनम | बरह्मवाहस्तमं हुवे
transliteration: pratnaṃ rayīṇāṃ yujaṃ sakhāyaṃ kīricodanam | brahmavāhastamaṃ huve
translation: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man, Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: स हि विश्वानि पार्थिवानेको वसूनि पत्यते | गिर्वणस्तमो अध्रिगुः
transliteration: sa hi viśvāni pārthivāneko vasūni patyate | ghirigvedaaṇastamo adhrighuḥ
translation: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: स नो नियुद्भिरा पर्ण कामं वाजेभिरश्विभिः | गोमद्भिर्गोपते धर्षत
transliteration: sa no niyudbhirā pṛṇa kāmaṃ vājebhiraśvibhiḥ | ghomadbhirghopate dhṛṣat
translation: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine! 22 Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked, To please him as a mighty Steer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 45
sanskrit: तद वो गाय सुते सचा पुरुहूताय सत्वने | शं यद गवे
transliteration: tad vo ghāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane |
translation: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine, When he hath listened to our songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: तवामिद धि हवामहे साता वाजस्य कारवः | तवां वर्त्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं नरस्त्वां काष्ठास्वर्वतः
transliteration: tvāmid dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ | tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ narastvāṃ kāṣṭhāsvarigvedaataḥ
translation: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: स तवं नश्चित्र वज्रहस्त धर्ष्णुया मह सतवानो अद्रिवः | गामश्वं रथ्यमिन्द्र सं किर सत्रा वाजं न जिग्युषे
transliteration: sa tvaṃ naścitra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ | ghāmaśvaṃ rathyamindra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jighyuṣe
translation: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone! Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यः सत्राहा विचर्षणिरिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम | सहस्रमुष्क तुविन्र्म्ण सत्पते भवा समत्सु नो वर्धे
transliteration: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇirindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam | sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe
translation: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: बाधसे जनान वर्षभेव मन्युना घर्षौ मीळ्ह रचीषम | अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने तनूष्वप्सु सूर्ये
transliteration: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḷha ṛcīṣama | asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane tanūṣvapsu sūrye
translation: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray. Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इन्द्र जयेष्ठं न आ भरनोजिष्ठं पपुरि शरवः | येनेमे चित्र वज्रहस्त रोदसी ओभे सुशिप्र पराः
transliteration: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharanojiṣṭhaṃ papuri śravaḥ | yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ
translation: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent, Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: तवामुग्रमवसे चर्षणीसहं राजन देवेषु हूमहे | विश्वा सु नो विथुरा पिब्दना वसो.अमित्रान सुषहान कर्धि
transliteration: tvāmughramavase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe | viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso.amitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
translation: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us. All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र नाहुषीष्वानोजो नर्म्णं च कर्ष्टिषु | यद वापञ्च कषितीनां दयुम्नमा भर सत्रा विश्वानि पौंस्या
transliteration: yadindra nāhuṣīṣvānojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu | yad vāpañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnamā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā
translation: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahusas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यद वा तर्क्षौ मघवन दरुह्यावा जने यत पूरौ कच्च वर्ष्ण्यम | अस्मभ्यं तद रिरीहि सं नर्षाह्ये.अमित्रान पर्त्सुतुर्वणे
transliteration: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāvā jane yat pūrau kacca vṛṣṇyam | asmabhyaṃ tad rirīhi saṃ nṛṣāhye.amitrān pṛtsuturigvedaaṇe
translation: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Trksi lay, in Druhyus or in Paru's folk, Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इन्द्र तरिधातु शरणं तरिवरूथं सवस्तिमत | छर्दिर्यछ मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च यावया दिद्युमेभ्यः
transliteration: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat | chardiryacha maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyumebhyaḥ
translation: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong. Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: ये गव्यता मनसा शत्रुमादभुरभिप्रघ्नन्ति धर्ष्णुया | अध समा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनूपा अन्तमो भव
transliteration: ye ghavyatā manasā śatrumādabhurabhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā | adha smā no maghavannindra ghirigvedaaṇastanūpā antamo bhava
translation: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,- From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: अध समा नो वर्धे भवेन्द्र नायमवा युधि | यदन्तरिक्षेपतयन्ति पर्णिनो दिद्यवस्तिग्ममूर्धानः
transliteration: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyamavā yudhi | yadantarikṣepatayanti parṇino didyavastighmamūrdhānaḥ
translation: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight, What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यत्र शूरासस्तन्वो वितन्वते परिया शर्म पितॄणाम | अध समा यछ तन्वे तने च छर्दिरचित्तं यावय दवेषः
transliteration: yatra śūrāsastanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām | adha smā yacha tanve tane ca chardiracittaṃ yāvaya dveṣaḥ
translation: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved. To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र सर्गे अर्वतश्चोदयासे महाधने | असमने अध्वनिव्र्जिने पथि शयेनानिव शरवस्यतह
transliteration: yadindra sarghe arigvedaataścodayāse mahādhane | asamane adhvanivṛjine pathi śyenāniva śravasyatah
translation: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed, On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 46
sanskrit: सिन्धून्रिव परवण आशुया यतो यदि कलोशमनु षवणि | आ ये वयो न वर्व्र्तत्यामिषि गर्भीता बाह्वोर्गवि
transliteration: sindhūnriva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośamanu ṣvaṇi |
translation: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call, That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: सवादुष किलायं मधुमानुतायं तीव्रः किलायं रसवानुतायम | उतो नवस्य पपिवांसमिन्द्रं न कश्चनसहत आहवेषु
transliteration: svāduṣ kilāyaṃ madhumānutāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavānutāyam | uto nvasya papivāṃsamindraṃ na kaścanasahata āhaveṣu
translation: YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour. No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अयं सवादुरिह मदिष्ठ आस यस्येन्द्रो वर्त्रहत्ये ममाद | पुरूणि यश्च्यौत्ना शम्बरस्य वि नवतिं नव च देह्यो हन
transliteration: ayaṃ svāduriha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda | purūṇi yaścyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṃ nava ca dehyo han
translation: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vrtra, When he defeated Sambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अयं मे पीत उदियर्ति वचमयं मनीषामुशतीमजीगः | अयं षळ उर्वीरमिमीत धीरो न याभ्यो भुवनं कच्चनारे
transliteration: ayaṃ me pīta udiyarti vacamayaṃ manīṣāmuśatīmajīghaḥ | ayaṃ ṣaḷ urigvedaīramimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṃ kaccanāre
translation: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit. This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अयं स यो वरिमाणं पर्थिव्या वर्ष्माणं दिवो अक्र्णोदयं सः | अयं पीयूषं तिस्र्षु परवत्सु सोमो दाधारोर्वन्तरिक्षम
transliteration: ayaṃ sa yo varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṃ divo akṛṇodayaṃ saḥ | ayaṃ pīyūṣaṃ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorigvedaantarikṣam
translation: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven. He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: अयं विदच्चित्रद्र्शीकमर्णः शुक्रसद्मनामुषसामनीके | अयं महान महता सकम्भनेनोद दयामस्तभ्नाद वर्षभोमरुत्वान
transliteration: ayaṃ vidaccitradṛśīkamarṇaḥ śukrasadmanāmuṣasāmanīke | ayaṃ mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyāmastabhnād vṛṣabhomarutvān
translation: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness. This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: धर्षत पिब कलशे सोममिन्द्र वर्त्रहा शूर समरे वसूनाम | माध्यन्दिने सवन आ वर्षस्व रयिस्थानो रयिमस्मासु धेहि
transliteration: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somamindra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām | mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayimasmāsu dhehi
translation: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vrtra-slayer! Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: इन्द्र पर णः पुरेतेव पश्य पर नो नय परतरं वस्यो अछ | भवा सुपारो अतिपारयो नो भवा सुनीतिरुत वामनीतिः
transliteration: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṃ vasyo acha | bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītiruta vāmanītiḥ
translation: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure. Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 47
sanskrit: उरुं नो लोकमनु नेषि विद्वान सवर्वज्ज्योतिरभयं सवस्ति | रष्वा त इन्द्र सथविरस्य बाहू उप सथेयाम शरणा बर्हन्ता
transliteration: uruṃ no lokamanu neṣi vidvān svarigvedaajjyotirabhayaṃ svasti |
translation: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight. High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 48
sanskrit: यज्ञा-यज्ञा वो अग्नये गिरा-गिरा च दक्षसे | पर-पर वयमम्र्तं जातवेदसं परियं मित्रं न शंसिषम
transliteration: yajñā-yajñā vo aghnaye ghirā-ghirā ca dakṣase | pra-pra vayamamṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śaṃsiṣam
translation: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength. Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: सतुषे जनं सुव्रतं नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणा सुम्नयन्ता | त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्तु सुक्षत्रासो वरुणोमित्रो अग्निः
transliteration: stuṣe janaṃ suvrataṃ navyasībhirghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā | ta ā ghamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇomitro aghniḥ
translation: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuna who make us happy. Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuna, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: विशो-विश ईड्यमध्वरेष्वद्र्प्तक्रतुमरतिं युवत्योः | दिवः शिशुं सहसः सूनुमग्निं यज्ञस्य केतुमरुषं यजध्यै
transliteration: viśo-viśa īḍyamadhvareṣvadṛptakratumaratiṃ yuvatyoḥ | divaḥ śiśuṃ sahasaḥ sūnumaghniṃ yajñasya ketumaruṣaṃ yajadhyai
translation: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald, The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अरुषस्य दुहितरा विरूपे सत्र्भिरन्या पिपिशे सूरो अन्या | मिथस्तुरा विचरन्ती पावके मन्म शरुतं नक्षत रच्यमाने
transliteration: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhiranyā pipiśe sūro anyā | mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutaṃ nakṣata ṛcyamāne
translation: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other. Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: पर वायुमछा बर्हती मनीषा बर्हद्रयिं विश्ववारं रथप्राम | दयुतद्यामा नियुतः पत्यमानः कविः कविमियक्षसि परयज्यो
transliteration: pra vāyumachā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṃ viśvavāraṃ rathaprām | dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavimiyakṣasi prayajyo
translation: I with a lofty song call hither Vayu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy. Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: स मे वपुश्छदयदश्विनोर्यो रथो विरुक्मान मनसा युजानः | येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयाय तमने च
transliteration: sa me vapuśchadayadaśvinoryo ratho virukmān manasā yujānaḥ | yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartiryāthastanayāya tmane ca
translation: That chariot of the Asvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent, Wherewith, Nasatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: पर्जन्यवाता वर्षभा पर्थिव्याः पुरीषाणि जिन्वतमप्यानि | सत्यश्रुतः कवयो यस्य गीर्भिर्जगत सथातर्जगदाक्र्णुध्वम
transliteration: parjanyavātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatamapyāni | satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yasya ghīrbhirjaghata sthātarjaghadākṛṇudhvam
translation: Bulls of the Earth, O Vata and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water. Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: पावीरवी कन्या चित्रायुः सरस्वती वीरपत्नी धियं धात | गनाभिरछिद्रं शरणं सजोषा दुराधर्षं गर्णते शर्म यंसत
transliteration: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṃ dhāt | ghnābhirachidraṃ śaraṇaṃ sajoṣā durādharṣaṃ ghṛṇate śarma yaṃsat
translation: So may Sarasvati, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us, And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: पथस-पथः परिपतिं वचस्या कामेन कर्तो अभ्यानळ अर्कम | स नो रासच्छुरुधश्चन्द्राग्रा धियं-धियं सीषधाति पर पूषा
transliteration: pathas-pathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhyānaḷ arkam | sa no rāsacchurudhaścandrāghrā dhiyaṃ-dhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā
translation: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka. May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pusan make each prayer of ours efective.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: परथमभाजं यशसं वयोधां सुपाणिं देवं सुगभस्तिं रभ्वम | होता यक्षद यजतं पस्त्यानामग्निस्त्वष्टारं सुहवं विभावा
transliteration: prathamabhājaṃ yaśasaṃ vayodhāṃ supāṇiṃ devaṃ sughabhastiṃ ṛbhvam | hotā yakṣad yajataṃ pastyānāmaghnistvaṣṭāraṃ suhavaṃ vibhāvā
translation: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvastar adored, in homes and swift to listen, Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 49
sanskrit: भुवनस्य पितरं गीर्भिराभी रुद्रं दिवा वर्धया रुद्रमक्तौ | बर्हन्तं रष्वमजरं सुषुम्नं रधग घुवेम कविनेषितासः
transliteration: bhuvanasya pitaraṃ ghīrbhirābhī rudraṃ divā vardhayā rudramaktau | bṛhantaṃ ṛṣvamajaraṃ suṣumnaṃ ṛdhagh ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ
translation: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father. Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 50
sanskrit: हुवे वो देवीमदितिं नमोभिर्म्र्ळीकाय वरुणं मित्रमग्निम | अभिक्षदामर्यमणं सुशेवं तरातॄन देवान सवितारं भगं च
transliteration: huve vo devīmaditiṃ namobhirmṛḷīkāya varuṇaṃ mitramaghnim | abhikṣadāmaryamaṇaṃ suśevaṃ trātṝn devān savitāraṃ bhaghaṃ ca
translation: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuna for favour, On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 50
sanskrit: सुज्योतिषः सूर्य दक्षपितॄननागास्त्वे सुमहो वीहि देवान | दविजन्मानो य रतसापः सत्याः सवर्वन्तो यजता अग्निजिह्वाः
transliteration: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝnanāghāstve sumaho vīhi devān | dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarigvedaanto yajatā aghnijihvāḥ
translation: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Surya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Daksa, Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 50
sanskrit: उत दयावाप्र्थिवी कषत्रमुरु बर्हद रोदसी शरणं सुषुम्ने | महस करथो वरिवो यथा नो.अस्मे कषयाय धिषणे अनेहः
