transliteration: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatramuru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṃ suṣumne | mahas karatho varivo yathā no.asme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ
translation: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter, Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 51
sanskrit: उदु तयच्चक्षुर्महि मित्रयोरानेति परियं वरुणयोरदब्धम | रतस्य शुचि दर्शतमनीकं रुक्मो न दिव उदिताव्यद्यौत
transliteration: udu tyaccakṣurmahi mitrayorāneti priyaṃ varuṇayoradabdham |
translation: THAT mighty eye of Varuna and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward. The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: न तद दिवा न पर्थिव्यानु मन्ये न यज्ञेन नोत शमीभिराभिः | उब्जन्तु तं सुभ्वः पर्वतासो नि हीयतामतियाजस्य यष्टा
transliteration: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhirābhiḥ | ubjantu taṃ subhvaḥ parigvedaatāso ni hīyatāmatiyājasya yaṣṭā
translation: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties. May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अति वा यो मरुतो मन्यते नो बरह्म वा यः करियमाणं निनित्सात | तपूंषि तस्मै वर्जिनानि सन्तु बरह्मद्विषमभि तं शोचतु दयौः
transliteration: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṃ ninitsāt | tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣamabhi taṃ śocatu dyauḥ
translation: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making, May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: किमङग तवा बरह्मणः सोम गोपां किमङग तवाहुरभिशस्तिपां नः | किमङग नः पश्यसि निद्यमानान बरह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य
transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma ghopāṃ kimaṅgha tvāhurabhiśastipāṃ naḥ | kimaṅgha naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya
translation: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches? Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अवन्तु मामुषसो जायमाना अवन्तु मा सिन्धवः पिन्वमानाः | अवन्तु मा पर्वतासो धरुवासो.अवन्तु मा पितरो देवहूतौ
transliteration: avantu māmuṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ | avantu mā parigvedaatāso dhruvāso.avantu mā pitaro devahūtau
translation: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me. My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वदानीं सुमनसः सयाम पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम | तथा करद वसुपतिर्वसूनां देवानोहानो.अवसागमिष्ठः
transliteration: viśvadānīṃ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam | tathā karad vasupatirigvedaasūnāṃ devānohāno.avasāghamiṣṭhaḥ
translation: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises. Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: इन्द्रो नेदिष्ठमवसागमिष्ठः सरस्वती सिन्धुभिः पिन्वमाना | पर्जन्यो न ओषधीभिर्मयोभुरग्निः सुशंसः सुहवः पितेव
transliteration: indro nediṣṭhamavasāghamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā | parjanyo na oṣadhībhirmayobhuraghniḥ suśaṃsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva
translation: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvati, who swells with rivers - Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम | एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत
transliteration: viśve devāsa ā ghata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam | edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata
translation: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods, Be seated on this holy grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: यो वो देवा घर्तस्नुना हव्येन परतिभूषति | तं विश्व उप गछथ
transliteration: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati | taṃ viśva upa ghachatha
translation: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil- Approach ye, one and all, to him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: उप नः सूनवो गिरः शर्ण्वन्त्वम्र्तस्य ये | सुम्र्ळीका भवन्तु नः
transliteration: upa naḥ sūnavo ghiraḥ śṛṇvantvamṛtasya ye | sumṛḷīkā bhavantu naḥ
translation: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing, And be exceeding good to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वे देवा रताव्र्ध रतुभिर्हवनश्रुतः | जुषन्तां युज्यं पयः
transliteration: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhirhavanaśrutaḥ | juṣantāṃ yujyaṃ payaḥ
translation: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Rtus, listening to our call, Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: सतोत्रमिन्द्रो मरुद्गणस्त्वष्ट्र्मान मित्रो अर्यमा | इमा हव्या जुषन्त नः
transliteration: stotramindro marudghaṇastvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā | imā havyā juṣanta naḥ
translation: May 1ndra, with the Marut host, with Tvastar, Mitra, Aryaman, Accept the laud and these our gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं होतर्वयुनशो यज | चिकित्वान दैव्यं जनम
transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ hotarigvedaayunaśo yaja | cikitvān daivyaṃ janam
translation: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours, Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः शर्णुतेमं हवं मे ये अन्तरिक्षे य उप दयवि षठ | ये अग्निजिह्वा उत वा यजत्रा आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयध्वम
transliteration: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ havaṃ me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha | ye aghnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
translation: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions, All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वे देवा मम शर्ण्वन्तु यज्ञिया उभे रोदसी अपां नपाच्च मन्म | मा वो वचांसि परिचक्ष्याणि वोचं सुम्नेष्विद वो अन्तमा मदेम
transliteration: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṃ napācca manma | mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣvid vo antamā madema
translation: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters' Child. Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: ये के च जमा महिनो अहिमाया दिवो जज्ञिरे अपां सधस्थे | ते अस्मभ्यमिषये विश्वमायुः कषप उस्रा वरिवस्यन्तुदेवाः
transliteration: ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṃ sadhasthe | te asmabhyamiṣaye viśvamāyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantudevāḥ
translation: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather- May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अग्नीपर्जन्याववतं धियं मे.अस्मिन हवे सुहवा सुष्टुतिंनः | इळामन्यो जनयद गर्भमन्यः परजावतीरिष आ धत्तमस्मे
transliteration: aghnīparjanyāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me.asmin have suhavā suṣṭutiṃnaḥ | iḷāmanyo janayad gharbhamanyaḥ prajāvatīriṣa ā dhattamasme
translation: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation. One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 52
sanskrit: सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्नौ सूक्तेन महा नमसा विवासे | अस्मिन नो अद्य विदथे यजत्रा विश्वे देवा हविषि मादयध्वम
transliteration: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne aghnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse | asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam
translation: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you. All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: वयमु तवा पथस पते रथं न वाजसातये | धिये पूषन्नयुज्महि
transliteration: vayamu tvā pathas pate rathaṃ na vājasātaye | dhiye pūṣannayujmahi
translation: LORD of the path, O Pusan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn, Even as a car, to win the prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: अभि नो नर्यं वसु वीरं परयतदक्षिणम | वामं गर्हपतिं नय
transliteration: abhi no naryaṃ vasu vīraṃ prayatadakṣiṇam | vāmaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ naya
translation: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house, Free-handed with the liberal meed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: अदित्सन्तं चिदाघ्र्णे पूषन दानाय चोदय | पणेश्चिद विम्रदा मनः
transliteration: aditsantaṃ cidāghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya | paṇeścid vimradā manaḥ
translation: Even him who would not give, do thou, O glowing Pusan, urge to give, And make the niggard's soul grow soft.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: वि पथो वाजसातये चिनुहि वि मर्धो जहि | साधन्तामुग्र नो धियः
transliteration: vi patho vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdho jahi | sādhantāmughra no dhiyaḥ
translation: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar. Strong God, be all our thoughts fulfilled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: परि तर्न्धि पणीनामारया हर्दया कवे | अथेमस्मभ्यं रन्धय
transliteration: pari tṛndhi paṇīnāmārayā hṛdayā kave | athemasmabhyaṃ randhaya
translation: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 53
sanskrit: वि पूषन्नारया तुद पणेरिछ हर्दि परियम | अथें ...
transliteration: vi pūṣannārayā tuda paṇericha hṛdi priyam | atheṃ ...
translation: Thrust with thine awl, O Pusan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear, And make him subject to our will.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: सं पूषन विदुषा नय यो अञ्जसानुशासति | य एवेदमिति बरवत
transliteration: saṃ pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati | ya evedamiti bravat
translation: O PUSAN, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight, And say unto us, It is here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: समु पूष्णा गमेमहि यो गर्हानभिशासति | इम एवेति चब्रवत
transliteration: samu pūṣṇā ghamemahi yo ghṛhānabhiśāsati | ima eveti cabravat
translation: May we go forth with Pusan who shall point the houses out to us, And say to us, These same are they.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: पूष्णश्चक्रं न रिष्यति न कोशो.अव पद्यते | नो अस्य वयथते पविः
transliteration: pūṣṇaścakraṃ na riṣyati na kośo.ava padyate | no asya vyathate paviḥ
translation: Unharmed is Pusan's chariot wheel; the box ne'er falleth to the ground, Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: यो अस्मै हविषाविधन न तं पूषापि मर्ष्यते | परथमो विदते वसु
transliteration: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na taṃ pūṣāpi mṛṣyate | prathamo vidate vasu
translation: Pusan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift: That man is first to gather wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: पूषा गा अन्वेतु नः पुषा रक्षत्वर्वतः | पूषा वाजं सनोतु नः
transliteration: pūṣā ghā anvetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatvarigvedaataḥ | pūṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ
translation: May Pusan follow near our kine; may Pusan keep our horses safe: May Pusan gather gear for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: पूषन्ननु पर गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः | अस्माकं सतुवतामुत
transliteration: pūṣannanu pra ghā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ | asmākaṃ stuvatāmuta
translation: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee; And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 54
sanskrit: माकिर्नेशन माकीं रिषन माकीं सं शारि केवटे | अथारिष्टाभिरा गहि
transliteration: mākirneśan mākīṃ riṣan mākīṃ saṃ śāri kevaṭe | athāriṣṭābhirā ghahi
translation: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb. Return with these all safe and sound.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 55
sanskrit: एहि वां विमुचो नपादाघ्र्णे सं सचावहै | रथीरतस्य नो भव
transliteration: ehi vāṃ vimuco napādāghṛṇe saṃ sacāvahai | rathīrtasya no bhava
translation: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God! Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 55
sanskrit: रथीतमं कपर्दिनमीशानं राधसो महः | रायः सखायमीमहे
transliteration: rathītamaṃ kapardinamīśānaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ | rāyaḥ sakhāyamīmahe
translation: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair, Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 55
sanskrit: रायो धारास्याघ्र्णे वसो राशिरजाश्व | धीवतो-धीवतः सखा
transliteration: rāyo dhārāsyāghṛṇe vaso rāśirajāśva | dhīvato-dhīvataḥ sakhā
translation: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap, The Friend of every pious man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 55
sanskrit: पूषणं नवजाश्वमुप सतोषाम वाजिनम | सवसुर्यो जार उच्यते
transliteration: pūṣaṇaṃ nvajāśvamupa stoṣāma vājinam | svasuryo jāra ucyate
translation: Pusan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called His Sister's lover, will we laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 55
sanskrit: मातुर्दिधिषुमब्रवं सवसुर्जारः शर्णोतु नः | भरातेन्द्रस्य सखा मम
transliteration: māturdidhiṣumabravaṃ svasurjāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ | bhrātendrasya sakhā mama
translation: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear, Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 56
sanskrit: य एनमादिदेशति करम्भादिति पूषणम | न तेन देव आदिशे
transliteration: ya enamādideśati karambhāditi pūṣaṇam | na tena deva ādiśe
translation: WHOSO remembers Pusan as cater of mingled curd and meal Need think no more upon the God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 56
sanskrit: उत घा स रथीतमः सख्या सत्पतिर्युजा | इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते
transliteration: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiryujā | indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translation: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 56
sanskrit: उतादः परुषे गवि सूरश्चक्रं हिरण्ययम | नयैरयद्रथीतमः
transliteration: utādaḥ paruṣe ghavi sūraścakraṃ hiraṇyayam | nyairayadrathītamaḥ
translation: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud The golden wheel of Sura's car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 56
sanskrit: यदद्य तवा पुरुष्टुत बरवाम दस्र मन्तुमः | तत सु नो मन्म साधय
transliteration: yadadya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ | tat su no manma sādhaya
translation: Whate'er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise, Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 56
sanskrit: इमं च नो गवेषणं सातये सीषधो गणम | आरात पूषन्नसि शरुतः
transliteration: imaṃ ca no ghaveṣaṇaṃ sātaye sīṣadho ghaṇam |
translation: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil: Thou, Pusan, art renowned afar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: इन्द्रा नु पूषणा वयं सख्याय सवस्तये | हुवेम वाजसातये
transliteration: indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṃ sakhyāya svastaye | huvema vājasātaye
translation: INDRA and Pusan will we call for friend ship and prosperity And for the winning of the spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: सोममन्य उपासदत पातवे चम्वोः सुतम | करम्भमन्य इछति
transliteration: somamanya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam | karambhamanya ichati
translation: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed: The other longs for curd and meal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: अजा अन्यस्य वह्नयो हरी अन्यस्य सम्भ्र्ता | ताभ्यां वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते
transliteration: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā | tābhyāṃ vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translation: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand; With both of these he slays the fiends.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: यदिन्द्रो अनयद रितो महीरपो वर्षन्तमः | तत्र पूषाभवत सचा
transliteration: yadindro anayad rito mahīrapo vṛṣantamaḥ | tatra pūṣābhavat sacā
translation: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods, Pusan was standing by his side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: तां पूष्णः सुमतिं वयं वर्क्षस्य पर वयामिव | इन्द्रस्य चा रभामहे
transliteration: tāṃ pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṃ vayaṃ vṛkṣasya pra vayāmiva | indrasya cā rabhāmahe
translation: To this, to Pusan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling, As to a tree's extended bough.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 57
sanskrit: उत पूषणं युवामहे.अभीशून्रिव सारथिः | मह्या इन्द्रं सवस्तये
transliteration: ut pūṣaṇaṃ yuvāmahe.abhīśūnriva sārathiḥ | mahyā indraṃ svastaye
translation: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pusan near, And Indra, for our great success.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 58
sanskrit: शुक्रं ते अन्यद यजतं ते अन्यद विषुरूपे अहनी दयौरिवासि | विश्वा हि माया अवसि सवधावो भद्रा ते पूषन्निहरातिरस्तु
transliteration: viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣanniharātirastu
translation: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour. All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pusan.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 58
sanskrit: अजाश्वः पशुपा वाजपस्त्यो धियंजिन्वो भुवने विश्वे अर्पितः | अष्ट्रां पूषा शिथिरामुद्वरीव्र्जत संचक्षाणोभुवना देव ईयते
transliteration: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyaṃjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ | aṣṭrāṃ pūṣā śithirāmudvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇobhuvanā deva īyate
translation: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world; Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pusan, God, goes forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यास्ते पूषन नावो अन्तः समुद्रे हिरण्ययीरन्तरिक्षे चरन्ति | ताभिर्यासि दूत्यां सूर्यस्य कामेन कर्त शरव इछमानः
transliteration: yāste pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīrantarikṣe caranti | tābhiryāsi dūtyāṃ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava ichamānaḥ
translation: O Pusan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region, Thou goest on an embassy to Surya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 58
sanskrit: पूषा सुबन्धुर्दिव आ पर्थिव्या इळस पतिर्मघवा दस्मवर्चाः | यं देवासो अददुः सूर्यायै कामेन कर्तं तवसं सवञ्चम
transliteration: pūṣā subandhurdiva ā pṛthivyā iḷas patirmaghavā dasmavarcāḥ | yaṃ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṃ tavasaṃ svañcam
translation: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pusan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous iustre, Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: पर नु वोचा सुतेषु वां वीर्या यानि चक्रथुः | हतासो वां पितरो देवशत्रव इन्द्राग्नी जीवथो युवम
transliteration: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṃ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ | hatāso vāṃ pitaro devaśatrava indrāghnī jīvatho yuvam
translation: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: बळ इत्था महिमा वामिन्द्राग्नी पनिष्ठ आ | समानो वां जनिता भरातरा युवं यमाविहेहमातरा
transliteration: baḷ itthā mahimā vāmindrāghnī paniṣṭha ā | samāno vāṃ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṃ yamāvihehamātarā
translation: Thus, Indra-Agni verily your greatness merits loftiest praise, Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: ओकिवांसा सुते सचानश्वा सप्ती इवादने | इन्द्रा नवग्नी अवसेह वज्रिणा वयं देवा हवामहे
transliteration: okivāṃsā sute sacānaśvā saptī ivādane | indrā nvaghnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṃ devā havāmahe
translation: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food, Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: य इन्द्राग्नी सुतेषु वां सतवत तेष्व रताव्र्धा | जोषवाकं वदतः पज्रहोषिणा न देवा भसथश्चन
transliteration: ya indrāghnī suteṣu vāṃ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā | joṣavākaṃ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaścana
translation: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne'er consume.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी को अस्य वां देवौ मर्तश्चिकेतति | विषूचो अश्वान युयुजान ईयत एकः समान आ रथे
transliteration: indrāghnī ko asya vāṃ devau martaściketati | viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe
translation: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way? One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी अपादियं पूर्वागात पद्वतीभ्यः | हित्वी शिरो जिह्वया वावदच्चरत तरिंशत पदा नयक्रमीत
transliteration: indrāghnī apādiyaṃ pūrigvedaāghāt padvatībhyaḥ | hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadaccarat triṃśat padā nyakramīt
translation: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet. Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी आ हि तन्वते नरो धन्वानि बाह्वोः | मा नो अस्मिन महाधने परा वर्क्तं गविष्टिषु
transliteration: indrāghnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ | mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṃ ghaviṣṭiṣu
translation: E'en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows. Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी तपन्ति माघा अर्यो अरातयः | अप दवेषांस्या कर्तं युयुतं सूर्यादधि
transliteration: indrāghnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ | apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛtaṃ yuyutaṃ sūryādadhi
translation: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore. Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 59
sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी युवोरपि वसु दिव्यानि पार्थिवा | आ न इह परयछतं रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम
transliteration: indrāghnī yuvorapi vasu divyāni pārthivā |
translation: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth. Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 60
sanskrit: शनथद वर्त्रमुत सनोति वाजमिन्द्रा यो अग्नी सहुरी सपर्यात | इरज्यन्ता वसव्यस्य भूरेः सहस्तमा सहसा वाजयन्ता
transliteration: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā
translation: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes, Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 60
sanskrit: ता योधिष्टमभि गा इन्द्र नूनमपः सवरुषसो अग्न ऊळ्हः | दिशः सवरुषस इन्द्र चित्रा अपो गा अग्ने युवसे नियुत्वान
transliteration: tā yodhiṣṭamabhi ghā indra nūnamapaḥ svaruṣaso aghna ūḷhaḥ | diśaḥ svaruṣasa indra citrā apo ghā aghne yuvase niyutvān
translation: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings. Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: इयमददाद रभसं रणच्युतं दिवोदासं वध्र्यश्वाय दाशुषे | या शश्वन्तमाचखादावसं पणिं ता ते दात्राणि तविषा सरस्वति
transliteration: iyamadadād rabhasaṃ ṛṇacyutaṃ divodāsaṃ vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe | yā śaśvantamācakhādāvasaṃ paṇiṃ tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati
translation: To Vadhryasva when. be worshipped her with gifts she gave fierce Divodasa, canceller of debts. Consumer of the churlish niggard, one and all, thine, O Sarasvati, are these effectual boons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: इयं शुष्मेभिर्बिसखा इवारुजत सानु गिरीणां तविषेभिरूर्मिभिः | पारावतघ्नीमवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः सरस्वतीमा विवासेम धीतिभिः
transliteration: iyaṃ śuṣmebhirbisakhā ivārujat sānu ghirīṇāṃ taviṣebhirūrmibhiḥ | pārāvataghnīmavase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīmā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ
translation: She with her might, like one who digs for lotus-stems, hath burst with her strong waves the ridges of the hills. Let us invite with songs and holy hymns for help Sarasvati who slayeth the Paravatas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: सरस्वति देवनिदो नि बर्हय परजां विश्वस्य बर्सयस्य मायिनः | उत कषितिभ्यो.अवनीरविन्दो विषमेभ्यो अस्रवो वाजिनीवति
transliteration: sarasvati devanido ni barhaya prajāṃ viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ | uta kṣitibhyo.avanīravindo viṣamebhyo asravo vājinīvati
translation: Thou castest down, Sarasvati, those who scorned the Gods, the brood of every Brsaya skilled in magic arts. Thou hast discovered rivers for the tribes of men, and, rich in wealth! made poison flow away from them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: पर णो देवी सरस्वती वाजेभिर्वाजिनीवती | धीनामवित्र्यवतु
transliteration: pra ṇo devī sarasvatī vājebhirigvedaājinīvatī | dhīnāmavitryavatu
translation: May the divine Sarasvati, rich in her wealth, protect us well, Furthering all our thoughts with might

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: यस्त्वा देवि सरस्वत्युपब्रूते धने हिते | इन्द्रं न वर्त्रतूर्ये
transliteration: yastvā devi sarasvatyupabrūte dhane hite | indraṃ na vṛtratūrye
translation: Whoso, divine Sarasvati, invokes thee where the prize is set, Like Indra when he smites the foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: तवं देवि सरस्वत्यवा वाजेषु वाजिनि | रदा पूषेव नःसनिम
transliteration: tvaṃ devi sarasvatyavā vājeṣu vājini | radā pūṣeva naḥsanim
translation: Aid us, divine Sarasvad, thou who art strong in wealth and power Like Pusan, give us opulence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: उत सया नः सरस्वती घोरा हिरण्यवर्तनिः | वर्त्रघ्नी वष्टि सुष्टुतिम
transliteration: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇyavartaniḥ | vṛtraghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim
translation: Yea, this divine Sarasvati, terrible with her golden path, Foe-slayer, claims our eulogy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: यस्या अनन्तो अह्रुतस्त्वेषश्चरिष्णुरर्णवः | अमश्चरति रोरुवत
transliteration: yasyā ananto ahrutastveṣaścariṣṇurarṇavaḥ | amaścarati roruvat
translation: Whose limitless unbroken flood, swift-moving with a rapid rush, Comes onward with tempestuous roar.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: सा नो विश्वा अति दविषः सवसॄरन्या रतावरी | अतन्नहेव सूर्यः
transliteration: sā no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ svasṝranyā ṛtāvarī | atannaheva sūryaḥ
translation: She hath spread us beyond all foes, beyond her Sisters, Holy One, As Surya spreadeth out the days.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 61
sanskrit: उत नः परिया परियासु सप्तस्वसा सुजुष्टा | सरस्वती सतोम्या भूत
transliteration: uta naḥ priyā priyāsu saptasvasā sujuṣṭā | sarasvatī stomyā bhūt
translation: Yea, she most dear amid dear stream, Seven-sistered, graciously inclined, Sarasvati hath earned our praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 62
sanskrit: सतुषे नरा दिवो अस्य परसन्ताश्विना हुवे जरमाणो अर्कैः | या सद्य उस्रा वयुषि जमो अन्तान युयूषतः पर्युरूवरांसि
transliteration: stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ | yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ paryurūvarāṃsi
translation: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Asvins, Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 62
sanskrit: ता यज्ञमा शुचिभिश्चक्रमाणा रथस्य भानुं रुरुचूरजोभिः | पुरू वरांस्यमिता मिमानापो धन्वान्यति याथो अज्रान
transliteration: tā yajñamā śucibhiścakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṃ rurucūrajobhiḥ | purū varāṃsyamitā mimānāpo dhanvānyati yātho ajrān
translation: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them. Traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 62
sanskrit: ता ह तयद वर्तिर्यदरध्रमुग्रेत्था धिय ऊहथुः शश्वदश्वैः | मनोजवेभिरिषिरैः शयध्यै परि वयथिर्दाशुषो मर्त्यस्य
transliteration: tā ha tyad vartiryadaradhramughretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvadaśvaiḥ | manojavebhiriṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathirdāśuṣo martyasya
translation: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses, Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 62
sanskrit: ता नव्यसो जरमाणस्य मन्मोप भूषतो युयुजानसप्ती | शुभं पर्क्षमिषमूर्जं वहन्ता होता यक्षत परत्नो अध्रुग युवाना
transliteration: tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī |
translation: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer. Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 63
sanskrit: कव तया वल्गू पुरुहूताद्य दूतो न सतोमो.अविदन नमस्वान | आ यो अर्वां नासत्या ववर्त परेष्ठा हयसथो अस्य मन्मन
transliteration: kva tyā valghū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo.avidan namasvān |
translation: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many- Hymn that hath brought the two Nasatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 64
sanskrit: उदु शरिय उषसो रोचमाना अस्थुरपां नोर्मयो रुशन्तः | कर्णोति विश्वा सुपथा सुगान्यभूदु वस्वी दक्षिणामघोनी
transliteration: udu śriya uṣaso rocamānā asthurapāṃ normayo ruśantaḥ | kṛṇoti viśvā supathā sughānyabhūdu vasvī dakṣiṇāmaghonī
translation: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters. She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 64
sanskrit: भद्रा दद्र्क्ष उर्विया वि भास्युत ते शोचिर्भानवो दयामपप्तन | आविर्वक्षः कर्णुषे शुम्भमानोषो देवि रोचमानामहोभिः
transliteration: bhadrā dadṛkṣa urigvedayā vi bhāsyut te śocirbhānavo dyāmapaptan |
translation: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven. Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 65
sanskrit: एषा सया नो दुहिता दिवोजाः कषितीरुछन्ती मानुषीरजीगः | या भानुना रुशता राम्यास्वज्ञायि तिरस्तमसश्चिदक्तून
transliteration: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīruchantī mānuṣīrajīghaḥ | yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsvajñāyi tirastamasaścidaktūn
translation: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber; She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e'en through the shades of darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 65
sanskrit: वि तद ययुररुणयुग्भिरश्वैश्चित्रं भान्त्युषसश्चन्द्ररथाः | अग्रं यज्ञस्य बर्हतो नयन्तीर्वि ता बाधन्तेतम ऊर्म्यायाः
transliteration: vi tad yayuraruṇayughbhiraśvaiścitraṃ bhāntyuṣasaścandrarathāḥ | aghraṃ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīrigveda tā bādhantetama ūrmyāyāḥ
translation: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion. They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: वपुर्नु तच्चिकितुषे चिदस्तु समानं नाम धेनु पत्यमानम | मर्तेष्वन्यद दोहसे पीपाय सक्र्च्छुक्रं दुदुहे पर्श्निरूधः
transliteration: vapurnu taccikituṣe cidastu samānaṃ nāma dhenu patyamānam | marteṣvanyad dohase pīpāya sakṛcchukraṃ duduhe pṛśnirūdhaḥ
translation: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given. The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Prsni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: ये अग्नयो न शोशुचन्निधाना दविर्यत तरिर्मरुतो वाव्र्धन्त | अरेञवो हिरण्ययास एषां साकं नर्म्णैः पौंस्येभिश्च भूवन
transliteration: ye aghnayo na śośucannidhānā dviryat trirmaruto vāvṛdhanta | areñavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṃ sākaṃ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiśca bhūvan
translation: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty. Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: रुद्रस्य ये मीळ्हुषः सन्ति पुत्रा यांश्चो नु दाध्र्विर्भरध्यै | विदे हि माता महो मही षा सेत पर्श्निः सुभ्वे गर्भमाधात
transliteration: rudrasya ye mīḷhuṣaḥ santi putrā yāṃśco nu dādhṛvirbharadhyai | vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve gharbhamādhāt
translation: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Prsni is known to have received for man's advantage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: न य इषन्ते जनुषो.अया नवन्तः सन्तो.अवद्यानि पुनानाः | निर्यद दुह्रे शुचयो.अनु जोषमनु शरिया तन्वमुक्षमाणाः
transliteration: na ya iṣante januṣo.ayā nvantaḥ santo.avadyāni punānāḥ | niryad duhre śucayo.anu joṣamanu śriyā tanvamukṣamāṇāḥ
translation: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches. When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: मक्षू न येषु दोहसे चिदया आ नाम धर्ष्णु मारुतन्दधानाः | न ये सतौना अयासो मह्ना नू चित सुदानुरव वासदुग्रान
transliteration: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cidayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutandadhānāḥ | na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānurava vāsadughrān
translation: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking. Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: त इदुग्राः शवसा धर्ष्णुषेणा उभे युजन्त रोदसी सुमेके | अध समैषु रोदसी सवशोचिरामवत्सु तस्थौ न रोकः
transliteration: ta idughrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke | adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocirāmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ
translation: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven, Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: अनेनो वो मरुतो यामो अस्त्वनश्वश्चिद यमजत्यरथीः | अनवसो अनभीशू रजस्तूर्वि रोदसी पथ्या याति साधन
transliteration: aneno vo maruto yāmo astvanaśvaścid yamajatyarathīḥ | anavaso anabhīśū rajastūrigveda rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan
translation: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it. Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: नास्य वर्ता न तरुता नवस्ति मरुतो यमवथ वजसातौ | तोके वा गोषु तनये यमप्सु स वरजं दर्ता पार्ये अध दयोः
transliteration: nāsya vartā na tarutā nvasti maruto yamavatha vajasātau | toke vā ghoṣu tanaye yamapsu sa vrajaṃ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ
translation: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: पर चित्रमर्कं गर्णते तुराय मारुताय सवतवसे भरध्वम | ये सहांसि सहसा सहन्ते रेजते अग्ने पर्थिवी मखेभ्यः
transliteration: pra citramarkaṃ ghṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam | ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate aghne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ
translation: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour, Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: तविषीमन्तो अध्वरस्येव दिद्युत तर्षुच्यवसो जुह्वो नाग्नेः | अर्चत्रयो धुनयो न वीरा भराजज्जन्मानो मरुतो अध्र्ष्टाः
transliteration: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāghneḥ | arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ
translation: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset, Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 66
sanskrit: तं वर्धन्तं मारुतं भराजद्र्ष्टिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा विवासे | दिवः शर्धाय शुचयो मनीषा गिरयो नाप उग्रा अस्प्र्ध्रन
transliteration: taṃ vṛdhantaṃ mārutaṃ bhrājadṛṣṭiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā vivāse | divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā ghirayo nāpa ughrā aspṛdhran
translation: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances. Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 67
sanskrit: विश्वेषां वः सतां जयेष्ठतमा गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणावाव्र्धध्यै | सं या रश्मेव यमतुर्यमिष्ठा दवा जनानसमा बाहुभिः सवैः
transliteration: viśveṣāṃ vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamā ghīrbhirmitrāvaruṇāvāvṛdhadhyai | saṃ yā raśmeva yamaturyamiṣṭhā dvā janānasamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ
translation: NOW Mitra-Varuna shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing; They who, as 'twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 67
sanskrit: इयं मद वां पर सत्र्णीते मनीषोप परिया नमसा बर्हिरछ | यन्तं नो मित्रावरुणावध्र्ष्टं छर्दिर्यद वां वरूथ्यं सुदानू
transliteration: iyaṃ mad vāṃ pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhiracha | yantaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvadhṛṣṭaṃ chardiryad vāṃ varūthyaṃ sudānū
translation: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage. Give us, O Mitra-Varuna, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: शरुष्टी वां यज्ञ उद्यतः सजोषा मनुष्वद वर्क्तबर्हिषो यजध्यै | आ य इन्द्रावरुणाविषे अद्य महे सुम्नाय मह आववर्तत
transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṃ śaviṣṭhātā hi bhūtam | maghonāṃ maṃhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarigvedaasenā
translation: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant, The rite which Indra-Varuna shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: ता हि शरेष्ठा देवताता तुजा शूराणां शविष्ठाता हि भूतम | मघोनां मंहिष्ठा तुविशुष्म रतेन वर्त्रतुरा सर्वसेना
transliteration: tā ghṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhirindrāvaruṇā cakānā | vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṃ siṣaktyanyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ
translation: For at Gods' worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes; With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vrtra's slayers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: ता गर्णीहि नमस्येभिः शूषैः सुम्नेभिरिन्द्रावरुणा चकाना | वज्रेणान्यः शवसा हन्ति वर्त्रं सिषक्त्यन्यो वर्जनेषु विप्रः
transliteration: ghnāśca yan naraśca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṃ svaghūrtāḥ | praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauśca pṛthivi bhūtamurigvedaī
translation: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuna, for bliss, the joyous. One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vrtra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: गनाश्च यन नरश्च वाव्र्धन्त विश्वे देवासो नरां सवगूर्ताः | परैभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा महित्वा दयौश्च पर्थिवि भूतमुर्वी
transliteration: sa it sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvendrā yo vāṃ varuṇa dāśatitman | iṣā sa dviṣastared dāsvān vaṃsad rayiṃ rayivataśca janān
translation: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes, Ye, Indra-Varuna, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: स इत सुदानुः सववान रतावेन्द्रा यो वां वरुण दाशतित्मन | इषा स दविषस्तरेद दास्वान वंसद रयिं रयिवतश्च जनान
transliteration: yaṃ yuvaṃ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṃ dhattho vasumantaṃ purukṣum | asme sa indrāvaruṇāvapi ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣāmaśastīḥ
translation: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuna, brings you gifts with gladness. That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: यं युवं दाश्वध्वराय देवा रयिं धत्थो वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम | अस्मे स इन्द्रावरुणावपि षयात पर यो भनक्ति वनुषामशस्तीः
transliteration: uta naḥ sutrātro devaghopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt | yeṣāṃ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnātirate taturiḥ
translation: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices, Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuna, e'en our own possession.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: उत नः सुत्रात्रो देवगोपाः सूरिभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा रयिः षयात | येषां शुष्मः पर्तनासु साह्वान पर सद्यो दयुम्नातिरते ततुरिः
transliteration: nū na indrāvaruṇā ghṛṇānā pṛṅktaṃ rayiṃ sauśravasāya devā | itthā ghṛṇanto mahinasya śardho.apo na nāvā duritātarema
translation: So also, Indra-Varuna, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them- They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: नू न इन्द्रावरुणा गर्णाना पर्ङकतं रयिं सौश्रवसाय देवा | इत्था गर्णन्तो महिनस्य शर्धो.अपो न नावा दुरितातरेम
transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyamarca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ | ayaṃ ya urigvedaī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhātyajaro na śociṣā
translation: Indra. and Varuna, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory. May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: पर सम्राजे बर्हते मन्म नु परियमर्च देवाय वरुणाय सप्रथः | अयं य उर्वी महिना महिव्रतः करत्वा विभात्यजरो न शोचिषा
transliteration: indrāvaruṇā sutapāvimaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ pibataṃ madyaṃ dhṛtavratā | yuvo ratho adhvaraṃ devavītaye prati svasaramupa yāti pītaye
translation: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuna the God, sublime, imperial Lord, Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा सुतपाविमं सुतं सोमं पिबतं मद्यं धर्तव्रता | युवो रथो अध्वरं देववीतये परति सवसरमुप याति पीतये
transliteration: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām | idaṃ vāmandhaḥ pariṣiktamasme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām
translation: True to Law, Indra-Varuna, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy. Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 68
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा मधुमत्तमस्य वर्ष्णः सोमस्य वर्षणा वर्षेथाम | इदं वामन्धः परिषिक्तमस्मे आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयेथाम
transliteration: rigveda06068.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:11:52 GMT
translation: Indra and Varuna, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma. This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 69
sanskrit: सं वां कर्मणा समिषा हिनोमीन्द्राविष्णू अपसस परेस्य | जुषेथां यज्ञं दरविणं च धत्तमरिष्टैर्नः पथिभिः पारयन्ता
transliteration: saṃ vāṃ karmaṇā samiṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pareasya | juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattamariṣṭairnaḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā
translation: INDRA and Visnu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service. Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 69
sanskrit: या विश्वासां जनितरा मतीनामिन्द्राविष्णू कलशा सोमधाना | पर वां गिरः शस्यमाना अवन्तु पर सतोमासो गीयमानासो अर्कैः
transliteration: yā viśvāsāṃ janitarā matīnāmindrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā | pra vāṃ ghiraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso ghīyamānāso arkaiḥ
translation: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Visnu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices, May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 69
sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू मदपती मदानामा सोमं यातं दरविणो दधाना | सं वामञ्जन्त्वक्तुभिर्मतीनां सं सतोमासः शस्यमानास उक्थैः
transliteration: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānāmā somaṃ yātaṃ draviṇo dadhānā | saṃ vāmañjantvaktubhirmatīnāṃ saṃ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ
translation: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Visnu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma. With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 70
sanskrit: घर्तवती भुवनानामभिश्रियोर्वी पर्थ्वी मधुदुघे सुपेशसा | दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणस्य धर्मणा विष्कभिते अजरेभूरिरेतसा
transliteration: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānāmabhiśriyorigvedaī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā | dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajarebhūriretasā
translation: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form, The Heaven and the Earth by Varuna's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 70
sanskrit: असश्चन्ती भूरिधारे पयस्वती घर्तं दुहाते सुक्र्ते शुचिव्रते | राजन्ती अस्य भुवनस्य रोदसी अस्मे रेतः सिञ्चतंयन मनुर्हितम
transliteration: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṃ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate | rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃyan manurhitam
translation: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man. Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 70
sanskrit: यो वां रजवे करमणाय रोदसी मर्तो ददाश धिषणे स साधति | पर परजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस परि युवोः सिक्ता विषुरूपाणि सव्रता
transliteration: yo vāṃ ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati | pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā
translation: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds. He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 70
sanskrit: घर्तेन दयावाप्र्थिवी अभीव्र्ते घर्तश्रिया घर्तप्र्चा घर्ताव्र्धा | उर्वी पर्थ्वी होत्र्वूर्ये पुरोहिते ते इद विप्रा ईळते सुम्नमिष्टये
transliteration: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā | urigvedaī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḷate sumnamiṣṭaye
translation: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase. Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 70
sanskrit: मधु नो दयावाप्र्थिवी मिमिक्षतां मधुश्चुता मधुदुघे मधुव्रते | दधाने यज्ञं दरविणं च देवता महि शरवो वाजमस्मे सुवीर्यम
transliteration: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatāṃ madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate | dadhāne yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca devatā mahi śravo vājamasme suvīryam
translation: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path, Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता हिरण्यया बाहू अयंस्त सवनायसुक्रतुः | घर्तेन पाणी अभि परुष्णुते मखो युवा सुदक्षो रजसो विधर्मणि
transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāyasukratuḥ | ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi
translation: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life. Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: देवस्य वयं सवितुः सवीमनि शरेष्ठे सयाम वसुनश्चदावने | यो विश्वस्य दविपदो यश्चतुष्पदो निवेशने परसवे चासि भूमनः
transliteration: devasya vayaṃ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaścadāvane | yo viśvasya dvipado yaścatuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ
translation: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: अदब्धेभिः सवितः पायुभिष टवं शिवेभिरद्य परि पाहि नो गयम | हिरण्यजिह्वः सुविताय नव्यसे रक्षा माकिर्नोघशंस ईशत
transliteration: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṃ śivebhiradya pari pāhi no ghayam | hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākirnoaghaśaṃsa īśata
translation: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true. God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता दमूना हिरण्यपाणिः परतिदोषमस्थात | अयोहनुर्यजतो मन्द्रजिह्व आ दाशुषे सुवति भूरिवामम
transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣamasthāt | ayohanuryajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūrivāmam
translation: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight. With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उदू अयानुपवक्तेव बाहू हिरण्यया सविता सुप्रतीका | दिवो रोहांस्यरुहत पर्थिव्या अरीरमत पतयत कच्चिदभ्वम
transliteration: udū ayānupavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā | divo rohāṃsyaruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kaccidabhvam
translation: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on. He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 71
sanskrit: वाममद्य सवितर्वाममु शवो दिवे-दिवे वाममस्मभ्यं सावीः | वामस्य हि कषयस्य देव भूरेरया धिया वामभाजः सयाम
transliteration: vāmamadya savitarigvedaāmamu śvo dive-dive vāmamasmabhyaṃ sāvīḥ | vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma
translation: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes. May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 72
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा महि तद वां महित्वं युवं महानि परथमानि चक्रथुः | युवं सूर्यं विविदथुर्युवं सवर्विश्वा तमांस्यहतं निदश्च
transliteration: indrāsomā mahi tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ yuvaṃ mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ | yuvaṃ sūryaṃ vividathuryuvaṃ svarigvedaśvā tamāṃsyahataṃ nidaśca
translation: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements. Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods' blasphemers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 72
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वासयथ उषासमुत सूर्यं नयथो जयोतिषा सह | उप दयां सकम्भथुः सकम्भनेनाप्रथतं पर्थिवीं मातरं वि
transliteration: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsamut sūryaṃ nayatho jyotiṣā saha | upa dyāṃ skambhathuḥ skambhanenāprathataṃ pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃ vi
translation: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour. Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 72
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमावहिमपः परिष्ठां हथो वर्त्रमनु वां दयौरमन्यत | परार्णांस्यैरयतं नदीनामा समुद्राणिपप्रथुः पुरूणि
transliteration: indrāsomāvahimapaḥ pariṣṭhāṃ hatho vṛtramanu vāṃ dyauramanyata | prārṇāṃsyairayataṃ nadīnāmā samudrāṇipaprathuḥ purūṇi
translation: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vrtra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit. Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 72
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा पक्वमामास्वन्तर्नि गवामिद दधथुर्वक्षणासु | जग्र्भथुरनपिनद्धमासु रुशच्चित्रासु जगतीष्वन्तः
transliteration: indrāsomā pakvamāmāsvantarni ghavāmid dadhathurigvedaakṣaṇāsu | jaghṛbhathuranapinaddhamāsu ruśaccitrāsu jaghatīṣvantaḥ
translation: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma. Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 72
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा युवमङग तरुत्रमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथे | युवं शुष्मं नर्यं चर्षणिभ्यः सं विव्यथुः पर्तनाषाहमुग्रा
transliteration: indrāsomā yuvamaṅgha tarutramapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthe | yuvaṃ śuṣmaṃ naryaṃ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṃ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāhamughrā
translation: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children. Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 73
sanskrit: यो अद्रिभित परथमजा रतावा बर्हस्पतिराङगिरसो हविष्मान | दविबर्हज्मा पराघर्मसत पिता न आ रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति
transliteration: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatirāṅghiraso haviṣmān | dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti
translation: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' son, Brhaspati, the Holy, With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 73
sanskrit: जनाय चिद य ईवत उ लोकं बर्हस्पतिर्देवहूतौ चकार | घनन वर्त्राणि वि पुरो दर्दरीति जयञ्छत्रून्रमित्रान पर्त्सु साहन
transliteration: janāya cid ya īvata u lokaṃ bṛhaspatirdevahūtau cakāra | ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañchatrūnramitrān pṛtsu sāhan
translation: Brhaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated, Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 73
sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिः समजयद वसूनि महो वरजान गोमतो देव एषः | अपः सिषासन सवरप्रतीतो बर्हस्पतिर्हन्त्यमित्रमर्कैः
transliteration: bṛhaspatiḥ samajayad vasūni maho vrajān ghomato deva eṣaḥ | apaḥ siṣāsan svarapratīto bṛhaspatirhantyamitramarkaiḥ
translation: Brhaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle. Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Brhaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 74
sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा धारयेथामसुर्यं पर वामिष्टयो.अरमश्नुवन्तु | दमे-दमे सप्त रत्ना दधाना शं नो भूतं दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे
transliteration: somārudrā dhārayethāmasuryaṃ pra vāmiṣṭayo.aramaśnuvantu | dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade
translation: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you. Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 74
sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा वि वर्हतं विषूचीममीवा या नो गयमाविवेश | आरे बाधेथां निरतिं पराचैरस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु
transliteration: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīmamīvā yā no ghayamāviveśa |
translation: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling. Drive Nirrti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: जीमूतस्येव भवति परतीकं यद वर्मी याति समदामुपस्थे | अनाविद्धया तन्वा जय तवं स तवा वर्मणो महिमा पिपर्तु
transliteration: jīmūtasyeva bhavati pratīkaṃ yad varmī yāti samadāmupasthe | anāviddhayā tanvā jaya tvaṃ sa tvā varmaṇo mahimā pipartu
translation: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle. Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: धन्वना गा धन्वनाजिं जयेम धन्वना तीव्राः समदो जयेम | धनुः शत्रोरपकामं कर्णोति धन्वना सर्वाः परदिशो जयेम
transliteration: dhanvanā ghā dhanvanājiṃ jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samado jayema | dhanuḥ śatrorapakāmaṃ kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarigvedaāḥ pradiśo jayema
translation: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters. The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: वक्ष्यन्तीवेदा गनीगन्ति कर्णं परियं सखायं परिषस्वजाना | योषेव शिङकते वितताधि धन्वञ जया इयं समने पारयन्ती
transliteration: vakṣyantīvedā ghanīghanti karṇaṃ priyaṃ sakhāyaṃ pariṣasvajānā | yoṣeva śiṅkte vitatādhi dhanvañ jyā iyaṃ samane pārayantī
translation: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces. Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: ते आचरन्ती समनेव योषा मातेव पुत्रं बिभ्र्तामुपस्थे | अप शत्रून विध्यतां संविदाने आर्त्नी इमे विष्फुरन्तीमित्रान
transliteration: te ācarantī samaneva yoṣā māteva putraṃ bibhṛtāmupasthe | apa śatrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantīamitrān
translation: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom. May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: बह्वीनां पिता बहुरस्य पुत्रश्चिश्चा कर्णोति समनावगत्य | इषुधिः सङकाः पर्तनाश्च सर्वाः पर्ष्ठे निनद्धो जयति परसूतः
transliteration: bahvīnāṃ pitā bahurasya putraściścā kṛṇoti samanāvaghatya | iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāśca sarigvedaāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddho jayati prasūtaḥ
translation: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle. Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: रथे तिष्ठन नयति वाजिनः पुरो यत्र-यत्र कामयते सुषारथिः | अभीशूनां महिमानं पनायत मनः पश्चादनु यछन्ति रश्मयः
transliteration: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puro yatra-yatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ | abhīśūnāṃ mahimānaṃ panāyata manaḥ paścādanu yachanti raśmayaḥ
translation: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe'er he will. See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who drives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: तीव्रान घोषान कर्ण्वते वर्षपाणयो.अश्वा रथेभिः सहवाजयन्तः | अवक्रामन्तः परपदैरमित्रान कषिणन्ति शत्रून्रनपव्ययन्तः
transliteration: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣapāṇayo.aśvā rathebhiḥ sahavājayantaḥ | avakrāmantaḥ prapadairamitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūnranapavyayantaḥ
translation: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour, With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: रथवाहनं हविरस्य नाम यत्रायुधं निहितमस्य वर्म | तत्रा रथमुप शग्मं सदेम विश्वाहा वयं सुमनस्यमानाः
transliteration: rathavāhanaṃ havirasya nāma yatrāyudhaṃ nihitamasya varma | tatrā rathamupa śaghmaṃ sadema viśvāhā vayaṃ sumanasyamānāḥ
translation: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whereon are laid his Weapons and his Armour. So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: सवादुषंसदः पितरो वयोधाः कर्छ्रेश्रितः शक्तीवन्तो गभीराः | चित्रसेना इषुबला अम्र्ध्राः सतोवीरा उरवो वरातसाहाः
transliteration: svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaro vayodhāḥ kṛchreśritaḥ śaktīvanto ghabhīrāḥ | citrasenā iṣubalā amṛdhrāḥ satovīrā uravo vrātasāhāḥ
translation: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble, Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: बराह्मणासः पितरः सोम्यासः शिवे नो दयावाप्र्थिवी अनेहसा | पूषा नः पातु दुरिताद रताव्र्धो रक्षा माकिर्नो अघशंस ईशत
transliteration: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive no dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā | pūṣā naḥ pātu duritād ṛtāvṛdho rakṣā mākirno aghaśaṃsa īśata
translation: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Earth. Guard us from evil, Pusan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 6 Hymn 75
sanskrit: सुपर्णं वस्ते मर्गो अस्या दन्तो गोभिः संनद्धा पतति परसूता | यत्रा नरः सं च वि च दरवन्ति तत्रास्मभ्यमिषवः शर्म यंसन
transliteration: suparṇaṃ vaste mṛgho asyā danto ghobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā | yatrā naraḥ saṃ ca vi ca dravanti tatrāsmabhyamiṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan
translation: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward. There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्निं नरो दीधितिभिररण्योर्हस्तच्युती जनयन्त परशस्तम | दूरेद्र्शं गर्हपतिमथर्युम
transliteration: aghniṃ naro dīdhitibhiraraṇyorhastacyutī janayanta praśastam | dūredṛśaṃ ghṛhapatimatharyum
translation: THE men from fire-sticks, with their hands' swift movement, have, in deep thought, engendered glorious Agni, Far-seen, with pointed flame, Lord of the homestead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: तमग्निमस्ते वसवो नय रण्वन सुप्रतिचक्षमवसे कुतश्चित | दक्षाय्यो यो दम आस नित्यः
transliteration: tamaghnimaste vasavo ny ṛṇvan supraticakṣamavase kutaścit | dakṣāyyo yo dama āsa nityaḥ
translation: The Vasus set that Agni in the dwelling, fair to behold, for help from every quarter: Who, in the home for ever, must be honoured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: परेद्धो अग्ने दीदिहि पुरो नो.अजस्रया सूर्म्या यविष्ठ | तवां शश्वन्त उप यन्ति वाजाः
transliteration: preddho aghne dīdihi puro no.ajasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha | tvāṃ śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ
translation: Shine thou before us, Agni, well-enkindled, with flame, Most Youthful God, that never fadeth. To thee come all our sacrificial viands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: पर ते अग्नयो.अग्निभ्यो वरं निः सुवीरासः शोशुचन्त दयुमन्तः | यत्रा नरः समासते सुजाताः
transliteration: pra te aghnayo.aghnibhyo varaṃ niḥ suvīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ | yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ
translation: Among all fires these fires have shone most brightly, splendid with light, begirt by noble heroes, Where men of lofty birth sit down together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: दा नो अग्ने धिया रयिं सुवीरं सवपत्यं सहस्य परशस्तम | न यं यावा तरति यातुमावान
transliteration: dā no aghne dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ svapatyaṃ sahasya praśastam | na yaṃ yāvā tarati yātumāvān
translation: Victorious Agni, grant us wealth with wisdom, wealth with brave sons, famous and independent, Which not a foe who deals in magic conquers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: उप यमेति युवतिः सुदक्षं दोषा वस्तोर्हविष्मती घर्ताची | उप सवैनमरमतिर्वसूयुः
transliteration: upa yameti yuvatiḥ sudakṣaṃ doṣā vastorhaviṣmatī ghṛtācī | upa svainamaramatirigvedaasūyuḥ
translation: To whom, the Strong, at morn and eve comes, maid-like, the ladle dropping oil, with its oblation. Wealth-seeking comes to him his own devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 1
sanskrit: विश्वा अग्ने.अप दहारातीर्येभिस्तपोभिरदहो जरूथम | पर निस्वरं चातयस्वामीवाम
transliteration: viśvā aghne.apa dahārātīryebhistapobhiradaho jarūtham | pra nisvaraṃ cātayasvāmīvām
translation: Burn up all malice with those flames, O Agni, wherewith of old thou burntest up Jarutha, And drive away in silence pain and sickness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 2
sanskrit: जुषस्व नः समिधमग्ने अद्य शोचा बर्हद यजतं धूमम्र्ण्वन | उप सप्र्श दिव्यं सानु सतूपैः सं रश्मिभिस्ततनः सूर्यस्य
transliteration: juṣasva naḥ samidhamaghne adya śocā bṛhad yajataṃ dhūmamṛṇvan | upa spṛśa divyaṃ sānu stūpaiḥ saṃ raśmibhistatanaḥ sūryasya
translation: GLADLY accept, this day, our fuel, Agni: send up thy sacred smoke and shine sublimely. Touch the celestial summits with thy columns, and overspread thee with the rays of Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 2
sanskrit: नराशंसस्य महिमानमेषामुप सतोषाम यजतस्य यज्ञैः | ये सुक्रतवः शुचयो धियन्धाः सवदन्ति देवा उभयानि हव्या
transliteration: narāśaṃsasya mahimānameṣāmupa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ | ye sukratavaḥ śucayo dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devā ubhayāni havyā
translation: With sacrifice to these we men will honour the majesty of holy Narasamsa- To these the pure, most wise, the thought. inspirers, Gods who enjoy both sorts of our oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 3
sanskrit: अग्निं वो देवमग्निभिः सजोषा यजिष्ठं दूतमध्वरेक्र्णुध्वम | यो मर्त्येषु निध्रुविरतावा तपुर्मूर्धा घर्तान्नः पावकः
transliteration: aghniṃ vo devamaghnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṃ dūtamadhvarekṛṇudhvam | yo martyeṣu nidhruvirtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ
translation: ASSOCIATE with fires, make your God Agni envoy at sacrifice, best skilled in worship, Established firm among mankind, the Holy, flame-crowned and fed with oil, the Purifier.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 3
sanskrit: परोथदश्वो न यवसे.अविष्यन यदा महः संवरणाद वयस्थात | आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरध सम ते वरजनं कर्ष्णमस्ति
transliteration: prothadaśvo na yavase.aviṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vyasthāt |
translation: Like a steed neighing eager for the pasture, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure: Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and, straight, the path is black which thou hast travelled.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 4
sanskrit: पर वः शुक्राय भानवे भरध्वं हव्यं मतिं चाग्नये सुपूतम | यो दैव्यानि मानुषा जनूंष्यन्तर्विश्वानि विद्मना जिगाति
transliteration: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvaṃ havyaṃ matiṃ cāghnaye supūtam | yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣyantarigvedaśvāni vidmanā jighāti
translation: BRING forth your gifts to his refulgent splendour, your hymn as purest offering to Agni, To him who goes as messenger with knowledge between all songs of men and Gods in heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 4
sanskrit: स गर्त्सो अग्निस्तरुणश्चिदस्तु यतो यविष्ठो अजनिष्ट मातुः | सं यो वना युवते शुचिदन भूरि चिदन्ना समिदत्ति सद्यः
transliteration: sa ghṛtso aghnistaruṇaścidastu yato yaviṣṭho ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ | saṃ yo vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cidannā samidatti sadyaḥ
translation: Wise must this Agni be, though young and tender, since he was born, Most Youthful, of his Mother; He who with bright teeth seizeth fast the forests, and eats his food, though plenteous, in a moment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 4
sanskrit: अस्य देवस्य संसद्यनीके यं मर्तासः शयेतं जग्र्भ्रे | नि यो गर्भं पौरुषेयीमुवोच दुरोकमग्निरायवे शुशोच
transliteration: asya devasya saṃsadyanīke yaṃ martāsaḥ śyetaṃ jaghṛbhre | ni yo ghṛbhaṃ pauruṣeyīmuvoca durokamaghnirāyave śuśoca
translation: Before his presence must we all assemble, this God's whom men have seized in his white splendour. This Agni who hath brooked that men should seize him hath shone for man with glow insufferable.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 4
sanskrit: अयं कविरकविषु परचेता मर्तेष्वग्निरम्र्तो नि धायि | स मा नो अत्र जुहुरः सहस्वः सदा तवे सुमनसः सयाम
transliteration: ayaṃ kavirakaviṣu pracetā marteṣvaghniramṛto ni dhāyi | sa mā no atra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma
translation: Far-seeing hath this Agni been established, deathless mid mortals, wise among the foolish. Here, O victorious God, forbear to harm us: may we forever share thy gracious favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: पराग्नये तवसे भरध्वं गिरं दिवो अरतये पर्थिव्याः | यो विश्वेषामम्र्तानामुपस्थे वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धे जाग्र्वद्भिः
transliteration: prāghnaye tavase bharadhvaṃ ghiraṃ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ | yo viśveṣāmamṛtānāmupasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāghṛvadbhiḥ
translation: BRING forth your song of praise to mighty Agni, the speedy messenger of earth and heaven, Vaisvanara, who, with those who wake, hath waxen great in the lap of all the Gods Immortal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: पर्ष्टो दिवि धाय्यग्निः पर्थिव्यां नेता सिन्धूनां वर्षभ सतियानाम | स मानुषीरभि विशो वि भाति वैश्वानरो वाव्र्धानो वरेण
transliteration: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyyaghniḥ pṛthivyāṃ netā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabha stiyānām | sa mānuṣīrabhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa
translation: Sought in the heavens, on earth is Agni stablished, leader of rivers, Bull of standing waters. Vaisvanara when he hath grown in glory, shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तवद भिया विश आयन्नसिक्नीरसमना जहतीर्भोजनानि | वैश्वानर पूरवे शोशुचानः पुरो यदग्ने दरयन्नदीदेः
transliteration: tvad bhiyā viśa āyannasiknīrasamanā jahatīrbhojanāni | vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yadaghne darayannadīdeḥ
translation: For fear of thee forth fled the dark-hued races, scattered abroad, deserting their possessions, When, glowing, O Vaisvanara, for Puru, thou Agni didst light up and rend their castles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तव तरिधातु पर्थिवी उत दयौर्वैश्वानर वरतमग्ने सचन्त | तवं भासा रोदसी आ ततन्थाजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचानः
transliteration: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaurigvedaaiśvānara vratamaghne sacanta | tvaṃ bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ
translation: Agni Vaisvanara, both Earth and Heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction. Refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तवामग्ने हरितो वावशाना गिरः सचन्ते धुनयो घर्ताचीः | पतिं कर्ष्टीनां रथ्यं रयीणां वैश्वानरमुषसां केतुमह्नाम
transliteration: tvāmaghne harito vāvaśānā ghiraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ | patiṃ kṛṣṭīnāṃ rathyaṃ rayīṇāṃ vaiśvānaramuṣasāṃ ketumahnām
translation: Agni, the tawny horses, loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil, attend thee; Lord of the tribes, our Charioteer of riches, Ensign of days, Vaisvanara of mornings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तवे असुर्यं वसवो नय रण्वन करतुं हि ते मित्रमहो जुषन्त | तवं दस्यून्रोकसो अग्न आज उरु जयोतिर्जनयन्नार्याय
transliteration: tve asuryaṃ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṃ hi te mitramaho juṣanta | tvaṃ dasyūnrokaso aghna āja uru jyotirjanayannāryāya
translation: In thee, O bright as Mitra, Vasus seated the might of Aduras, for they loved thy spirit. Thou drivest Dasyus from their home, O Agni, and broughtest forth broad light to light the Arya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: स जायमानः परमे वयोमन वायुर्न पाथः परि पासि सद्यः | तवं भुवना जनयन्नभि करन्नपत्याय जातवेदो दशस्यन
transliteration: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyurna pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ | tvaṃ bhuvanā janayannabhi krannapatyāya jātavedo daśasyan
translation: Born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest, like wind, the place where Gods inhabit. Thou, favouring thine offspring, roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures, Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तामग्ने अस्मे इषमेरयस्व वैश्वानर दयुमतीं जातवेदः | यया राधः पिन्वसि विश्ववार पर्थु शरवो दाशुषे मर्त्याय
transliteration: tāmaghne asme iṣamerayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṃ jātavedaḥ | yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya
translation: Send us that strength, Vaisvanara, send it, Agni, that strength, O Jatavedas, full of splendour, Wherewith, all-bounteous God, thou pourest riches, as fame wide-spreading, on the man who offers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 5
sanskrit: तं नो अग्ने मघवद्भ्यः पुरुक्षुं रयिं नि वाजं शरुत्यं युवस्व | वैश्वानर महि नः शर्म यछ रुद्रेभिरग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः
transliteration: taṃ no aghne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṃ rayiṃ ni vājaṃ śrutyaṃ yuvasva | vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yacha rudrebhiraghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translation: Agni, bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power, that wealth which feedeth many. Accordant with the Vasus and the Rudras, Agni, Vaisvanara, give us sure protection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: पर सम्राजो असुरस्य परशस्तिं पुंसः कर्ष्टीनामनुमाद्यस्य | इन्द्रस्येव पर तवसस कर्तानि वन्दे दारुं वन्दमानोविवक्मि
transliteration: pra samrājo asurasya praśastiṃ puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmanumādyasya | indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṃ vandamānovivakmi
translation: PRAISE of the Asura, high imperial Ruler, the Manly One in whom the folk shall triumph- I laud his deeds who is as strong as Indra, and lauding celebrate the Fort-destroyer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: कविं केतुं धासिं भानुमद्रेर्हिन्वन्ति शं राज्यं रोदस्योः | पुरन्दरस्य गीर्भिरा विवासे.अग्नेर्व्रतानि पूर्व्या महानि
transliteration: kaviṃ ketuṃ dhāsiṃ bhānumadrerhinvanti śaṃ rājyaṃ rodasyoḥ | purandarasya ghīrbhirā vivāse.aghnerigvedaratāni pūrigvedayā mahāni
translation: Sage, Sing, Food, Light,-they bring him from the mountain, the blessed Sovran of the earth and heaven. I decorate with songs the mighty actions which Agni, Fort-destroyer, did aforetime.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: नयक्रतून गरथिनो मर्ध्रवाचः पणीन्रश्रद्धानव्र्धानयज्ञान | पर-पर तान दस्यून्रग्निर्विवाय पूर्वश्चकारापरानयज्यून
transliteration: nyakratūn ghrathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīnraśraddhānavṛdhānayajñān | pra-pra tān dasyūnraghnirigvedavāya pūrigvedaaścakārāparānayajyūn
translation: The foolish, faithless, rudely-speaking niggards, without belief or sacrifice or worship,- Far far away hath Agni chased those Dasyus, and, in the cast, hath turned the godless westward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: यो अपाचीने तमसि मदन्तीः पराचीश्चकार नर्तमः शचीभिः | तमीशानं वस्वो अग्निं गर्णीषे.अनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून
transliteration: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīścakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ | tamīśānaṃ vasvo aghniṃ ghṛṇīṣe.anānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn
translation: Him who brought eastward, manliest with his prowess, the Maids rejoicing in the western darkness, That Agni I extol, the Lord of riches, unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: यो देह्यो अनमयद वधस्नैर्यो अर्यपत्नीरुषसश्चकार | स निरुध्या नहुषो यज्वो अग्निर्विशश्चक्रे बलिह्र्तः सहोभिः
transliteration: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnairyo aryapatnīruṣasaścakāra | sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yajvo aghnirigvedaśaścakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ
translation: Him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons, and gave the Mornings to a noble Husband, Young Agni, who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of Nahus made them bring their tribute.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 6
sanskrit: यस्य शर्मन्नुप विश्वे जनास एवैस्तस्थुः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणाः | वैश्वानरो वरमा रोदस्योराग्निः ससाद पित्रोरुपस्थम
transliteration: yasya śarmannupa viśve janāsa evaistasthuḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ | vaiśvānaro varamā rodasyorāghniḥ sasāda pitrorupastham
translation: In whose protection all men rest by nature, desiring to enjoy his gracious favour- Agni Vaisvanara in his Parents, bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 7
sanskrit: पर वो देवं चित सहसानमग्निमश्वं न वाजिनं हिषे नमोभिः | भवा नो दूतो अध्वरस्य विद्वान तमना देवेषु विविदे मितद्रुः
transliteration: pra vo devaṃ cit sahasānamaghnimaśvaṃ na vājinaṃ hiṣe namobhiḥ | bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ
translation: I SEND forth even your God, victorious Agni, like a strong courser, with mine adoration. Herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached Gods, himself, with measured motion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: इन्धे राजा समर्यो नमोभिर्यस्य परतीकमाहुतं घर्तेन | नरो हव्येभिरीळते सबाध आग्निरग्र उषसामशोचि
transliteration: indhe rājā samaryo namobhiryasya pratīkamāhutaṃ ghṛtena | naro havyebhirīḷate sabādha āghniraghra uṣasāmaśoci
translation: THE King whose face is decked with oil is kindled with homage offered by his faithful servant. The men, the priests adore him with oblations. Agni hath shone forth when the dawn is breaking.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: अयमु षय सुमहानवेदि होता मन्द्रो मनुषो यज्वो अग्निः | वि भा अकः सस्र्जानः पर्थिव्यां कर्ष्णपविरोषधीभिर्ववक्षे
transliteration: ayamu ṣya sumahānavedi hotā mandro manuṣo yajvo aghniḥ | vi bhā akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyāṃ kṛṣṇapaviroṣadhībhirigvedaavakṣe
translation: Yea, he hath been acknowledged as most mighty, the joyous Priest of men, the youthful Agni. He, spreading o'er the earth, made light around him, and grew among the plants with blackened fellies..

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: कया नो अग्ने वि वसः सुव्र्क्तिं कामु सवधां रणवः शस्यमानः | कदा भवेम पतयह सुदत्र रायो वन्तारो दुष्टरस्य साधोः
transliteration: kayā no aghne vi vasaḥ suvṛktiṃ kāmu svadhāṃ ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ | kadā bhavema patayah sudatra rāyo vantāro duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ
translation: How dost thou decorate our hymn, O Agni? What power dost thou exert when thou art lauded? When, Bounteous God, may we be lords of riches, winners of precious wealth which none may conquer?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: पर-परायमग्निर्भरतस्य शर्ण्वे वि यत सूर्यो न रोचतेब्र्हद भाः | अभि यः पूरुं पर्तनासु तस्थौ दयुतानो दैव्यो अतिथिः शुशोच
transliteration: pra-prāyamaghnirbharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocatebṛhad bhāḥ | abhi yaḥ pūruṃ pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutāno daivyo atithiḥ śuśoca
translation: Far famed is this the Bharata's own Agni he shineth like the Sun with lofty splendour. He who hath vanquished Puru in the battle, the heavenly guest hath glowed in full refulgence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: असन्नित तवे आहवनानि भूरि भुवो विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः | सतुतश्चिदग्ने शर्ण्विषे गर्णानः सवयं वर्धस्व तन्वं सुजात
transliteration: asannit tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvo viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ | stutaścidaghne śṛṇviṣe ghṛṇānaḥ svayaṃ vardhasva tanvaṃ sujāta
translation: Full many oblations are in thee collected: with all thine aspects thou hast waxen gracious. Thou art already famed as praised and lauded, yet still, O nobly born, increase thy body.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 8
sanskrit: इदं वचः शतसाः संसहस्रमुदग्नये जनिषीष्ट दविबर्हाः | शं यत सतोत्र्भ्य आपये भवाति दयुमदमीवचातनं रक्षोहा
transliteration: idaṃ vacaḥ śatasāḥ saṃsahasramudaghnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ |
translation: Be this my song, that winneth countless treasure, engendered with redoubled force for Agni, That, splendid, chasing sickness, slaying demons, it may delight our friend and bless the singers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अबोधि जार उषसामुपस्थाद धोता मन्द्रः कवितमः पावकः | दधाति केतुमुभयस्य जन्तोर्हव्या देवेषु दरविणं सुक्र्त्सु
transliteration: abodhi jāra uṣasāmupasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ | dadhāti ketumubhayasya jantorhavyā deveṣu draviṇaṃ sukṛtsu
translation: ROUSED from their bosom is the Dawns' beloved, the joyous Priest, most sapient, Purifier. He gives a signal both to Gods and mortals, to Gods oblations, riches to the pious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 9
sanskrit: स सुक्रतुर्यो वि दुरः पणीनां पुनानो अर्कं पुरुभोजसं नः | होता मन्द्रो विशां दमूनास्तिरस्तमो दद्र्शे राम्याणाम
transliteration: sa sukraturyo vi duraḥ paṇīnāṃ punāno arkaṃ purubhojasaṃ naḥ | hotā mandro viśāṃ damūnāstirastamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām
translation: Most wise is he who, forcing doors of Panis, brought the bright Sun to us who feedeth many. The cheerful Priest, men's Friend and home-companion, through still night's darkness he is made apparent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अमूरः कविरदितिर्विवस्वान सुसंसन मित्रो अतिथिः शिवोनः | चित्रभानुरुषसां भात्यग्रे.अपां गर्भः परस्वा विवेश
transliteration: amūraḥ kaviraditirigvedavasvān susaṃsan mitro atithiḥ śivonaḥ | citrabhānuruṣasāṃ bhātyaghre.apāṃ gharbhaḥ prasvaā viveśa
translation: Wise, ne.'er deceived, uncircumscribed, refulgent, our gracious guest, a Friend with good attendants, Shines forth with wondrous light before the Mornings; the young plants hath he entered, Child of Waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 10
sanskrit: उषो न जारः पर्थु पाजो अश्रेद दविद्युतद दीद्यच्छोशुचानः | वर्षा हरिः शुचिरा भाति भासा धियो हिन्वान उशतीरजीगः
transliteration: uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyacchośucānaḥ | vṛṣā hariḥ śucirā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīrajīghaḥ
translation: HE hath sent forth, bright, radiant, and refulgent, like the Dawn's Lover, his far-spreading lustre. Pure in his splendour shines the golden Hero: our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 10
sanskrit: सवर्ण वस्तोरुषसामरोचि यज्ञं तन्वाना उशिजो न मन्म | अग्निर्जन्मानि देव आ वि विद्वान दरवद दूतो देवयावा वनिष्ठः
transliteration: svarṇa vastoruṣasāmaroci yajñaṃ tanvānā uśijo na manma | aghnirjanmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ
translation: He, like the Sun, hath shone while Morn is breaking, and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises, Agni, the God, who knows their generations and visits Gods, most bounteous, rapid envoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 10
sanskrit: अछा गिरो मतयो देवयन्तीरग्निं यन्ति दरविणं भिक्षमाणाः | सुसन्द्र्शं सुप्रतीकं सवञ्चं हव्यवाहमरतिम्मानुषाणाम
transliteration: achā ghiro matayo devayantīraghniṃ yanti draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ | susandṛśaṃ supratīkaṃ svañcaṃ havyavāhamaratimmānuṣāṇām
