translation: Our songs and holy hymns go forth to Agni, seeking the God and asking him for riches, Him fair to see, of goodly aspect, mighty, men's messenger who carries their oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 10
sanskrit: इन्द्रं नो अग्ने वसुभिः सजोषा रुद्रं रुद्रेभिरा वहा बर्हन्तम | आदित्येभिरदितिं विश्वजन्यां बर्हस्पतिं रक्वभिर्विश्ववारम
transliteration: indraṃ no aghne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṃ rudrebhirā vahā bṛhantam |
translation: Joined with the Vasus, Agni, bring thou Indra bring hither mighty Rudra with the Rudras, Aditi good to all men with Adityas, Brhaspati All-bounteous, with the Singers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 11
sanskrit: महानस्यध्वरस्य परकेतो न रते तवदम्र्ता मादयन्ते | आ विश्वेभिः सरथं याहि देवैर्न्यग्ने होता परथमः सदेह
transliteration: mahānasyadhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvadamṛtā mādayante |
translation: GREAT art thou, Agni, sacrifice's Herald: not without thee are deathless Gods made joyful. Come hither with all Deities about thee here take thy seat, the first, as Priest, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अगन्म महा नमसा यविष्ठं यो दीदाय समिद्धः सवे दुरोणे | चित्रभानुं रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी सवाहुतं विश्वतः परत्यञ्चम
transliteration: aghanma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṃ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe | citrabhānuṃ rodasī antarurigvedaī svāhutaṃ viśvataḥ pratyañcam
translation: WE with great reverence have approached The Youngest who hath shone forth well-kindled in his dwelling, With wondrous light between wide earth and heaven, well-worshipped, looking forth in all directions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 12
sanskrit: स मह्ना विश्वा दुरितानि साह्वानग्निः षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः | स नो रक्षिषद दुरितादवद्यादस्मान गर्णत उत नो मघोनः
transliteration: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvānaghniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ | sa no rakṣiṣad duritādavadyādasmān ghṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ
translation: Through his great might o'ercoming all misfortunes, praised in the house is Agni Jatavedas. May he protect us from disgrace and trouble, both us who laud him and our noble patrons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 12
sanskrit: तवं वरुण उत मित्रो अग्ने तवां वर्धन्ति मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः | तवे वसु सुषणनानि सन्तु यूयं पात ...
transliteration: tvaṃ varuṇa uta mitro aghne tvāṃ vardhanti matibhirigvedaasiṣṭhāḥ | tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: O Agni, thou art Varuna and Mitra: Vasisthas with their holy hymns exalt thee. With thee be most abundant gain of treasure. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 13
sanskrit: पराग्नये विश्वशुचे धियन्धे.असुरघ्ने मन्म धीतिं भरध्वम | भरे हविर्न बर्हिषि परीणानो वैश्वानराय यतये मतीनाम
transliteration: prāghnaye viśvaśuce dhiyandhe.asuraghne manma dhītiṃ bharadhvam | bhare havirna barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām
translation: BRING song and hymn to Agni, Asura-slayer, enlightener of all and thought-bestower. Like an oblation on the grass, to please him, I bring this to Vaisvanara, hymn-inspirer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तवमग्ने शोचिषा शोशुचान आ रोदसी अप्र्णा जायमानः | तवं देवानभिशस्तेरमुञ्चो वैस्वानर जातवेदो महित्वा
transliteration: tvamaghne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ | tvaṃ devānabhiśasteramuñco vaisvānara jātavedo mahitvā
translation: Thou with thy flame, O Agni, brightly glowing, hast at thy birth filled full the earth and heaven. Thou with thy might, Vaisvanara Jatavedas, settest the Gods free from the curse that bound them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 13
sanskrit: जातो यदग्ने भुवना वयख्यः पशून न गोपा इर्यः परिज्मा | वैश्वानर बरह्मणे विन्द गातुं यूयं पात ...
transliteration: jāto yadaghne bhuvanā vyakhyaḥ paśūn na ghopā iryaḥ parijmā | vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda ghātuṃ yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Agni, when, born thou lookedst on all creatures, like a brisk herdsman moving round his cattle. The path to prayer, Vaisvanara, thou foundest. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 14
sanskrit: समिधा जातवेदसे देवाय देवहूतिभिः | हविर्भिः शुक्रशोचिषे नमस्विनो वयं दाशेमाग्नये
transliteration: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ | havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṃ dāśemāghnaye
translation: WITH reverence and with offered gifts serve we the God whose flame is bright: Let us bring Jatavedas fuel, and adore Agni when we invoke the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 14
sanskrit: वयं ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम वयं दाशेम सुष्टुती यजत्र | वयं घर्तेनाध्वरस्य होतर्वयं देव हविषा भद्रशोचे
transliteration: vayaṃ te aghne samidhā vidhema vayaṃ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra | vayaṃ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotarigvedaayaṃ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce
translation: Agni, may we perform thy rites with fuel, and honour thee, O Holy one, with praises: Honour thee, Priest of sacrifice! with butter, thee, God of blessed light! with our oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: उपसद्याय मीळ्हुष आस्ये जुहुता हविः | यो नो नेदिष्ठमाप्यम
transliteration: upasadyāya mīḷhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ | yo no nediṣṭhamāpyam
translation: OFFER oblations in his mouth, the bounteous God's whom we must serve. His who is nearest kin to us:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: यः पञ्च चर्षणीरभि निषसाद दमे-दमे | कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा
transliteration: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīrabhi niṣasāda dame-dame | kavirghṛhapatiryuvā
translation: Who for the Fivefold People's take hath seated him in every home Wise, Youthful, Master of the house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स नो वेदो अमात्यमग्नी रक्षतु विश्वतः | उतास्मान पात्वंहसः
transliteration: sa no vedo amātyamaghnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ | utāsmān pātvaṃhasaḥ
translation: On all sides may that Agni guard our household folk and property; May he deliver us from woe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: नवं नु सतोममग्नये दिवः शयेनाय जीजनम | वस्वः कुविद वनाति नः
transliteration: navaṃ nu stomamaghnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam | vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ
translation: I have begotten this new hymn for Agni, Falcon of the sky: Will he not give us of his wealth?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सपार्हा यस्य शरियो दर्शे रयिर्वीरवतो यथा | अग्रे यज्ञस्य शोचतः
transliteration: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayirigvedaīravato yathā | aghre yajñasya śocataḥ
translation: Whose glories when he glows in front of sacrifice are fair to see, Like wealth of one with hero sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सेमां वेतु वषट्क्र्तिमग्निर्जुषत नो गिरः | यजिष्ठो हव्यवाहनः
transliteration: semāṃ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtimaghnirjuṣata no ghiraḥ | yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ
translation: May he enjoy this hallowed gift, Agni accept our songs, who bears Oblations, best of worshippers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: नि तवा नक्ष्य विश्पते दयुमन्तं देव धीमहि | सुवीरमग्न आहुत
transliteration: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṃ deva dhīmahi | suvīramaghna āhuta
translation: Lord of the house, whom men must seek, we set thee down, O Worshipped One Bright, rich in heroes, Agni! God

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: कषप उस्रश्च दीदिहि सवग्नयस्त्वया वयम | सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः
transliteration: kṣapa usraśca dīdihi svaghnayastvayā vayam | suvīrastvamasmayuḥ
translation: Shine forth at night and morn: through thee with fires are we provided well. Thou, rich in heroes, art our Friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: उप तवा सातये नरो विप्रासो यन्ति धीतिभिः | उपाक्षरासहस्रिणी
transliteration: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ | upākṣarāsahasriṇī
translation: The men come near thee for their gain, the singers with their songs of praise: Speech, thousand fold, comes near to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति शुक्रशोचिरमर्त्यः | शुचिः पावक ईड्यः
transliteration: aghnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśociramartyaḥ |
translation: Bright, Purifier, meet for praise, Immortal with refulgent glow, Agni drives Raksasas away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: एना वो अग्निं नमसोर्जो नपातमा हुवे | परियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं सवध्वरं विश्वस्य दूतमम्र्तम
transliteration: enā vo aghniṃ namasorjo napātamā huve | priyaṃ cetiṣṭhamaratiṃ svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtamamṛtam
translation: WITH this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son of Strength, Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal messenger of all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स योजते अरुषा विश्वभोजसा स दुद्रवत सवाहुतः | सुब्रह्मा यज्ञः सुशमी वसूनां देवं राधो जनानाम
transliteration: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ | subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devaṃ rādho janānām
translation: His two red horses, all-supporting, let him yoke: let him, well-worshipped, urge them fast. Then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end, and heavenly gift of wealth to men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: उदस्य शोचिरस्थादाजुह्वानस्य मीळ्हुषः | उद धूमासोरुषासो दिविस्प्र्शः समग्निमिन्धते नरः
transliteration: udasya śocirasthādājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ | ud dhūmāsoaruṣāso divispṛśaḥ samaghnimindhate naraḥ
translation: The flame of him the Bountiful, the Much-invoked, hath mounted up, And his red-coloured smoke-clouds reach and touch the sky: the men are kindling Agni well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तं तवा दूतं कर्ण्महे यशस्तमं देवाना वीतये वह | विश्वा सूनो सहसो मर्तभोजना रास्व तद यत तवेमहे
transliteration: taṃ tvā dūtaṃ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṃ devānā vītaye vaha | viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe
translation: Thee, thee Most Glorious One we make our messenger. Bring the Gods hither to the feast. Give us, O Son of Strength, all food that feedeth man: give that for which we pray to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तवमग्ने गर्हपतिस्त्वं होता नो अध्वरे | तवं पोता विश्ववार परचेता यक्षि वेषि च वार्यम
transliteration: tvamaghne ghṛhapatistvaṃ hotā no adhvare | tvaṃ potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam
translation: Thou, Agni, art the homestead's Lord, our Herald at the sacrifice. Lord of all boons, thou art the Cleanser and a Sage. Pay worship, and enjoy the good.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 16
sanskrit: कर्धि रत्नं यजमानाय सुक्रतो तवं हि रत्नधा असि | आन रते शिशीहि विश्वं रत्विजं सुशंसो यश्च दक्षते
transliteration: kṛdhi ratnaṃ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṃ hi ratnadhā asi |
translation: Give riches to the sacrificer, O Most Wise, for thou art he who granteth wealth. Inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अग्ने भव सुषमिधा समिद्ध उत बर्हिरुर्विया वि सत्र्णीताम
transliteration: aghne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhirurigvedayā vi stṛṇītām
translation: AGNI, be kindled well with proper fuel, and let the grass be scattered wide about thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: उत दवार उशतीर्वि शरयन्तामुत देवानुशत आ वहेह
transliteration: uta dvāra uśatīrigveda śrayantāmuta devānuśata ā vaheha
translation: Let the impatient Portals be thrown open bring thou the Gods impatient to come hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अग्ने वीहि हविषा वक्षि देवान सवध्वरा कर्णुहि जातवेदः
transliteration: aghne vīhi haviṣā vakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translation: Taste, Agni: serve the Gods with our oblation. Offer good sacrifices, Jatavedas!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: सवध्वरा करति जातवेदा यक्षद देवानम्र्तान पिप्रयच्च
transliteration: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devānamṛtān piprayacca
translation: Let Jatavedas pay fair sacrifices, worship and gratify the Gods Immortal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: वंस्व विश्वा वार्याणि परचेतः सत्या भवन्त्वाशिषो नोद्य
transliteration: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantvāśiṣo noadya
translation: Wise God, win for us things that are all-goodly, and let the prayers, we pray today be fruitful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तवामु ते दधिरे हव्यवाहं देवासो अग्न ऊर्ज आ नपातम
transliteration: tvāmu te dadhire havyavāhaṃ devāso aghna ūrja ā napātam
translation: Thee, even thee, the Son of Strength, O Agni, those Gods have made the bearer of oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 17
sanskrit: ते ते देवाय दाशतः सयाम महो नो रत्ना वि दध इयानः
transliteration: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ
translation: To thee the God may we perform our worship: do thou, besought, grant us abundant riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 18
sanskrit: तवे ह यत पितरश्चिन न इन्द्र विश्वा वामा जरितारो असन्वन | तवे गावः सुदुघास्त्वे हयश्वास्त्वं वसु देवयतेवनिष्ठः
transliteration: tve ha yat pitaraścin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan | tve ghāvaḥ sudughāstve hyaśvāstvaṃ vasu devayatevaniṣṭhaḥ
translation: ALL is with thee, O Indra, all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises. With thee are milch-kine good to milk, and horses: best winner thou of riches for the pious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 18
sanskrit: राजेव हि जनिभिः कषेष्येवाव दयुभिरभि विदुष कविः सन | पिशा गिरो मघवन गोभिरश्वैस्त्वायतः शिशीहिराये अस्मान
transliteration: rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣyevāva dyubhirabhi viduṣ kaviḥ san | piśā ghiro maghavan ghobhiraśvaistvāyataḥ śiśīhirāye asmān
translation: For like a King among his wives thou dwellest: with glories, as a Sage, surround and help us. Make us, thy servants, strong for wealth, and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 18
sanskrit: इमा उ तवा पस्प्र्धानासो अत्र मन्द्रा गिरो देवयन्तीरुप सथुः | अर्वाची ते पथ्या राय एतु सयाम ते सुमताविन्द्र शर्मन
transliteration: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā ghiro devayantīrupa sthuḥ | arigvedaācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāvindra śarman
translation: Here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee. Hitherward come thy path that leads to riches: may we find shelter in thy favour, Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 18
sanskrit: धेनुं न तवा सूयवसे दुदुक्षन्नुप बरह्माणि सस्र्जे वसिष्ठः | तवामिन मे गोपतिं विश्व आहा न इन्द्रः सुमतिं गन्त्वछ
transliteration: dhenuṃ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣannupa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ | tvāmin me ghopatiṃ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṃ ghantvacha
translation: Vasistha hath poured forth his prayers, desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture. All these my people call thee Lord of cattle: may Indra. come unto the prayer we offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 18
sanskrit: अर्णांसि चित पप्रथाना सुदास इन्द्रो गाधान्यक्र्णोत सुपारा | शर्धन्तं शिम्युमुचथस्य नव्यः शापं सिन्धूनामक्र्णोदशस्तीः
transliteration: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro ghādhānyakṛṇot supārā |
translation: What though the floods spread widely, Indra made them shallow and easy for Sudas to traverse. He, worthy of our praises, caused the Simyu, foe of our hymn, to curse the rivers' fury.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: यस्तिग्मश्र्ङगो वर्षभो न भीम एकः कर्ष्टीश्च्यावयति पर विश्वाः | यः शश्वतो अदाशुषो गयस्य परयन्तासिसुष्वितराय वेदः
transliteration: yastighmaśṛṅgho vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīścyāvayati pra viśvāḥ | yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo ghayasya prayantāsisuṣvitarāya vedaḥ
translation: HE like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people: Thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not, for his own possession.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तवं ह तयदिन्द्र कुत्समावः शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये | दासं यच्छुष्णं कुयवं नयस्मा अरन्धय आर्जुनेयाय शिक्षन
transliteration: tvaṃ ha tyadindra kutsamāvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇastanvā samarye | dāsaṃ yacchuṣṇaṃ kuyavaṃ nyasmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan
translation: Thou, verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly giving car to him in battle, When, aiding Arjuneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dasa Susna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तवं धर्ष्णो धर्षता वीतहव्यं परावो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सुदासम | पर पौरुकुत्सिं तरसदस्युमावः कषेत्रसाता वर्त्रहत्येषु पूरुम
transliteration: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyaṃ prāvo viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sudāsam | pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyumāvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum
translation: O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen Sudas whose offerings were accepted, Puru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तवं नर्भिर्न्र्मणो देववीतौ भूरीणि वर्त्रा हर्यश्व हंसि | तवं नि दस्युं चुमुरिं धुनिं चास्वापयो दभीतये सुहन्तु
transliteration: tvaṃ nṛbhirnṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi | tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu
translation: At the Gods' banquet, hero-souled! with Heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many foemen. Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Cumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhiti.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तव चयौत्नानि वज्रहस्त तानि नव यत पुरो नवतिं च सद्यः | निवेशने शततमाविवेषीरहञ्च वर्त्रं नमुचिमुताहन
transliteration: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ | niveśane śatatamāviveṣīrahañca vṛtraṃ namucimutāhan
translation: These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder, thou swiftly crushedst nine-and-ninety castles: Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuci, thou slewest Vrtra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: सना ता त इन्द्र भोजनानि रातहव्याय दाशुषे सुदासे | वर्ष्णे ते हरी वर्षणा युनज्मि वयन्तु बरह्माणि पुरुशाक वाजम
transliteration: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse | vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
translation: Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudas the worshipper who brought oblations. For thee, the Strong, I yoke thy strong Bay Horses: may our prayers reach thee and win strength, Most Mighty!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: मा ते अस्यां सहसावन परिष्टावघाय भूम हरिवः परादै | तरायस्व नो.अव्र्केभिर्वरूथैस्तव परियासः सूरिषु सयाम
transliteration: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāvaghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai | trāyasva no.avṛkebhirigvedaarūthaistava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
translation: Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, Victor, in this thine own assembly, to the wicked. Deliver us with true and faithful succours: dear may we be to thee among the princes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: परियास इत ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरो मदेम शरणे सखायः | नि तुर्वशं नि याद्वं शिशीह्यतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन
transliteration: priyāsa it te maghavannabhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ | ni turigvedaaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhyatithighvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan
translation: May we men, Maghavan, the friends thou lovest, near thee be joyful under thy protection. Fain to fulfil the wish of Atithigva humble. the pride of Turvasa and Yadva.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: सद्यश्चिन नु ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरः शंसन्त्युक्थशास उक्था | ये ते हवेभिर्वि पणीन्रदाशन्नस्मान वर्णीष्व युज्याय तस्मै
transliteration: sadyaścin nu te maghavannabhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsantyukthaśāsa ukthā | ye te havebhirigveda paṇīnradāśannasmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai
translation: Swiftly, in truth, O Maghavan, about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises. ' Elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: एते सतोमा नरां नर्तम तुभ्यमस्मद्र्यञ्चो ददतो मघानि | तेषामिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये शिवो भूः सखा च शूरो.अविताच नर्णाम
transliteration: ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyamasmadryañco dadato maghāni | teṣāmindra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro.avitāca nṛṇām
translation: Thine are these lauds, O manliest of heroes, lauds which revert to us and give us riches. Favour these, Indra, when they fight with foemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' Helper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 19
sanskrit: नू इन्द्र शूर सतवमान ऊती बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धस्व | उप नो वाजान मिमीह्युप सतीन यूयं पात ...
transliteration: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhasva | upa no vājān mimīhyupa stīn yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Now, lauded for thine aid, Heroic Indra, sped by our prayer, wax mighty in thy body. Apportion to us strength and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: उग्रो जज्ञे वीर्याय सवधावाञ्चक्रिरपो नर्यो यत करिष्यन | जग्मिर्युवा नर्षदनमवोभिस्त्राता न इन्द्र एनसो महश्चित
transliteration: ughro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñcakrirapo naryo yat kariṣyan | jaghmiryuvā nṛṣadanamavobhistrātā na indra enaso mahaścit
translation: STRONG, Godly-natured, born for hero exploit, man's Friend, he doth whatever deed he willeth. Saving us e'en from great transgression, Indra, the Youthful, visiteth man's home with favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: हन्त वर्त्रमिन्द्रः शूशुवानः परावीन नु वीरो जरितारमूती | कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत
transliteration: hanta vṛtramindraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāramūtī | kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṃ dātā vasu muhurā dāśuṣe bhūt
translation: Waxing greatness Indra slayeth Vrtra: the Hero with his aid hath helped the singer. He gave Sudas wide room and space, and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: युध्मो अनर्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड जनुषेमषाळ्हः | वयास इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा अधा विश्वंशत्रूयन्तं जघान
transliteration: yudhmo anarigvedaā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣemaṣāḷhaḥ | vyāsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṃśatrūyantaṃ jaghāna
translation: Soldier unchecked, war-rousing, battling Hero, unconquered from of old, victorious ever, Indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea, he hath slain each foe who fought against him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: उभे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी महित्वा पप्राथ तविषीभिस्तुविष्मः | नि वज्रमिन्द्रो हरिवान मिमिक्षन समन्धसा मदेषु वाुवोच
transliteration: ubhe cidindra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhistuviṣmaḥ | ni vajramindro harivān mimikṣan samandhasā madeṣu vāuvoca
translation: Thou with thy greatness hast filled full, O Indra, even both the worlds with might, O thou Most Mighty. Lord of Bays, Indra, brandishing his thunder, is gratified with Soma at the banquet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: वर्षा जजान वर्षणं रणाय तमु चिन नारी नर्यं ससूव | पर यः सेनानीरध नर्भ्यो अस्तीनः सत्वा गवेषणः स धर्ष्णुः
transliteration: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṃ raṇāya tamu cin nārī naryaṃ sasūva | pra yaḥ senānīradha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā ghaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ
translation: A Bull begat the Bull for joy of battle, and a strong Mother brought forth him the manly. He who is Chief of men, their armies' Leader, is strong Hero, bold, and fain for booty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: नू चित स भरेषते जनो न रेषन मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात | यज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे दधते दुवांसि कषयत स राय रतपा रतेजाः
transliteration: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoramāvivāsāt | yajñairya indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ
translation: The people falter not, nor suffer sorrow, who win themselves this God's terrific spirit. He who with sacrifices worships Indra is lord of wealth, law-born and law's protector.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान कनीयसो देष्णम | अम्र्त इत पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः
transliteration: yadindra pūrigvedao aparāya śikṣannayajjyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam | amṛta it paryāsīta dūramā citra citryaṃ bharā rayiṃ naḥ
translation: Whene'er the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lesser's present. Shall the Immortal sit aloof' inactive? O Wondrous Indra, bring us wondrous riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: यस्त इन्द्र परियो जनो ददाशदसन निरेके अद्रिवः सखा ते | वयं ते अस्यां सुमतौ चनिष्ठाः सयाम वरूथे अघ्नतो नर्पीतौ
transliteration: yasta indra priyo jano dadāśadasan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te | vayaṃ te asyāṃ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau
translation: Thy dear folk, Indra, who present oblations, are, in chief place, thy friends, O Thunder-wielder. May we be best content in this thy favour, sheltered by One who slays not, but preserves us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: एष सतोमो अचिक्रदद वर्षा त उत सतामुर्मघवन्नक्रपिष्ट | रायस कामो जरितारं त आगन तवमङग शक्र वस्व आशको नः
transliteration: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmurmaghavannakrapiṣṭa | rāyas kāmo jaritāraṃ ta āghan tvamaṅgha śakra vasva āśako naḥ
translation: To thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly, and, Maghavan, the eloquent hath besought thee. Desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer: help us then, Sakra, to our share of riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 20
sanskrit: स न इन्द्र तवयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति | वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात ...
transliteration: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhāstmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti | vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktiryūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us. Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: असावि देवं गोर्जीकमन्धो नयस्मिन्निन्द्रो जनुषेमुवोच | बोधामसि तवा हर्यश्व यज्ञैर्बोधा न सतोममन्धसो मदेषु
transliteration: asāvi devaṃ ghoṛjīkamandho nyasminnindro januṣemuvoca | bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñairbodhā na stomamandhaso madeṣu
translation: PRESSED is the juice divine with milk commingled: thereto hath Indra ever been accustomed. We wake thee, Lord of Bays, with sacrifices: mark this our laud in the wild joy of Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: पर यन्ति यज्ञं विपयन्ति बर्हिः सोममादो विदथे दुध्रवाचः | नयु भरियन्ते यशसो गर्भादा दूर उपब्दो वर्षणोन्र्षाचः
transliteration: pra yanti yajñaṃ vipayanti barhiḥ somamādo vidathe dudhravācaḥ | nyu bhriyante yaśaso ghṛbhādā dūra upabdo vṛṣaṇonṛṣācaḥ
translation: On to the rite they move, the grass they scatter, these Soma-drinkers eloquent in synod. Hither, for men to grasp, are brought the press-stones, far-thundering, famous, strong, that wait on heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सरवितवा अपस कः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः | तवद वावक्रे रथ्यो न धेना रेजन्ते विश्वा कर्त्रिमाणि भीषा
transliteration: tvamindra sravitavā apas kaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrigvedaīḥ | tvad vāvakre rathyo na dhenā rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā
translation: Indra, thou settest free the many waters that were encompassed, Hero, by the Dragon. Down rolled, as if on chariots borne, the rivers: through fear of thee all things created tremble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: भीमो विवेषायुधेभिरेषामपांसि विश्वा नर्याणि विद्वान | इन्द्रः पुरो जर्ह्र्षाणो वि दूधोद वि वज्रहस्तो महिनाजघान
transliteration: bhīmo viveṣāyudhebhireṣāmapāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān | indraḥ puro jarhṛṣāṇo vi dūdhod vi vajrahasto mahinājaghāna
translation: Skilled in all manly deeds the God terrific hath with his weapons mastered these opponents. Indra in rapturous joy shook down their castles he slew them in his might, the Thunder-wielder.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: न यातव इन्द्र जूजुवुर्नो न वन्दना शविष्ठ वेद्याभिः | स शर्धदर्यो विषुणस्य जन्तोर्मा शिश्नदेवा अपि गुरतं नः
transliteration: na yātava indra jūjuvurno na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ | sa śardhadaryo viṣuṇasya jantormā śiśnadevā api ghurtaṃ naḥ
translation: No evil spirits have impelled us, Indra, nor fiends, O Mightiest God, with their devices. Let our true God subdue the hostile rabble: let not the lewd approach our holy worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अभि करत्वेन्द्र भूरध जमन न ते विव्यं महिमानं रजांसि | सवेना हि वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्थ न शत्रुरन्तंविविदद युधा ते
transliteration: abhi kratvendra bhūradha jman na te vivyaṃ mahimānaṃ rajāṃsi | svenā hi vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghantha na śatrurantaṃvividad yudhā te
translation: Thou in thy strength surpassest Earth and Heaven: the regions comprehend not all thy greatness. With thine own power and might thou slewest Vrtra: no foe hath found the end of thee in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: देवाश्चित ते असुर्याय पूर्वे.अनु कषत्राय ममिरे सहांसि | इन्द्रो मघानि दयते विषह्येन्द्रं वाजस्य जोहुवन्त सातौ
transliteration: devāścit te asuryāya pūrigvedae.anu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi | indro maghāni dayate viṣahyendraṃ vājasya johuvanta sātau
translation: Even the earlier Deities submitted their powers to thy supreme divine dominion. Indra wins wealth and deals it out to other's: men in the strife for booty call on Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: कीरिश्चिद धि तवामवसे जुहावेशानमिन्द्र सौभगस्य भूरेः | अवो बभूथ शतमूते अस्मे अभिक्षत्तुस्त्वावतो वरूता
transliteration: kīriścid dhi tvāmavase juhāveśānamindra saubhaghasya bhūreḥ | avo babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattustvāvato varūtā
translation: The humble hath invoked thee for protection, thee, Lord of great felicity, O Indra. Thou with a hundred aids hast been our Helper: one who brings gifts like thee hath his defender.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: सखायस्त इन्द्र विश्वह सयाम नमोव्र्धासो महिना तरुत्र | वन्वन्तु समा ते.अवसा समीके.अभीतिमर्यो वनुषां शवांसि
transliteration: sakhāyasta indra viśvaha syāma namovṛdhāso mahinā tarutra | vanvantu smā te.avasā samīke.abhītimaryo vanuṣāṃ śavāṃsi
translation: May we, O Indra, be thy friends for ever, eagerly, Conqueror, yielding greater homage. May, through thy grace, the strength of us who battle quell in the shock the onset of the foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 21
sanskrit: स न इन्द्र तवयताया ...
transliteration: sa na indra tvayatāyā ...
translation: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us. Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 22
sanskrit: पिबा सोममिन्द्र मन्दतु तवा यं ते सुषाव हर्यश्वाद्रिः | सोतुर्बाहुभ्यां सुयतो नार्वा
transliteration: pibā somamindra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ | soturbāhubhyāṃ suyato nārigvedaā
translation: DRINK Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well guided courser, Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 22
sanskrit: यस्ते मदो युज्यश्चारुरस्ति येन वर्त्राणि हर्यश्व हंसि | स तवामिन्द्र परभूवसो ममत्तु
transliteration: yaste mado yujyaścārurasti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi | sa tvāmindra prabhūvaso mamattu
translation: So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen, Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 22
sanskrit: बोधा सु मे मघवन वाचमेमां यां ते वसिष्ठो अर्चतिप्रशस्तिम | इमा बरह्म सधमादे जुषस्व
transliteration: bodhā su me maghavan vācamemāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcatipraśastim | imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
translation: Mark closely, Maghavan, the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasistha: Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 23
sanskrit: उदु बरह्माण्यैरत शरवस्येन्द्रं समर्ये महया वसिष्ठ | आ यो विश्वानि शवसा ततानोपश्रोता म ईवतो वचांसि
transliteration: udu brahmāṇyairata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha |
translation: PRAYERS have been offered up through love of glory: Vasistha, honour Indra in the battle. He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 24
sanskrit: योनिष ट इन्द्र सदने अकारि तमा नर्भिः पुरुहूत पर याहि | असो यथा नो.अविता वर्धे च ददो वसूनि ममदश्च सोमैः
transliteration: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi | aso yathā no.avitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaśca somaiḥ
translation: A HOME is made for thee to dwell in, Indra: O Much-invoked, go thitherwith the heroes. That thou, to prosper us, mayst be our Helper, vouchsafe us wealth, rejoice with draughts of Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 24
sanskrit: गर्भीतं ते मन इन्द्र दविबर्हाः सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि | विस्र्ष्टधेना भरते सुव्र्क्तिरियमिन्द्रं जोहुवती मनीषा
transliteration: ghṛbhītaṃ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni | visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktiriyamindraṃ johuvatī manīṣā
translation: Indra, thy wish, twice-strong, is comprehended: pressed is the Soma, poured are pleasant juices. This hymn of praise, from loosened tongue, made perfect, draws Indra to itself with loud invoking.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 25
sanskrit: आ ते मह इन्द्रोतयुग्र समन्यवो यत समरन्त सेनाः | पताति दिद्युन नर्यस्य बाह्वोर्मा ते मनो विष्वद्र्यग वि चारीत
transliteration: patāti didyun naryasya bāhvormā te mano viṣvadryagh vi cārīt
translation: WHEN with thy mighty help, O potent Indra, the armies rush together in their fury. When from the strong man's arm the lightning flieth, let not the mind go forth to side with others.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 25
sanskrit: नि दुर्ग इन्द्र शनथिह्यमित्रानभि ये नो मर्तासो अमन्ति | आरे तं शंसं कर्णुहि निनित्सोरा नो भर सम्भरणं वसूनाम
transliteration: ni durgha indra śnathihyamitrānabhi ye no martāso amanti |
translation: O Indra, where the ground is hard to traverse, smite down our foes, the mortals who assail us, Keep far from us the curse of the reviler: bring us accumulated store of treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 26
sanskrit: न सोम इन्द्रमसुतो ममाद नाब्रह्माणो मघवानं सुतासः | तस्मा उक्थं जनये यज्जुजोषन नर्वन नवीयः शर्णवद यथा नः
transliteration: na soma indramasuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ | tasmā ukthaṃ janaye yajjujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ
translation: SOMA unpressed ne'er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him. I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 26
sanskrit: उक्थ-उक्थे सोम इन्द्रं ममाद नीथे-नीथे मघवानं सुतासः | यदीं सबाधः पितरं न पुत्राः समानदक्षा अवसे हवन्ते
transliteration: uktha-ukthe soma indraṃ mamāda nīthe-nīthe maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ | yadīṃ sabādhaḥ pitaraṃ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante
translation: At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted, What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 26
sanskrit: चकार ता कर्णवन नूनमन्या यानि बरुवन्ति वेधसः सुतेषु | जनीरिव पतिरेकः समानो नि माम्र्जे पुर इन्द्रःसु सर्वाः
transliteration: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnamanyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu | janīriva patirekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥsu sarigvedaāḥ
translation: These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations. Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 26
sanskrit: एवा तमाहुरुत शर्ण्व इन्द्र एको विभक्ता तरणिर्मघानाम | मिथस्तुर ऊतयो यस्य पूर्वीरस्मे भद्राणि सश्चतप्रियाणि
transliteration: evā tamāhuruta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇirmaghānām | mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrigvedaīrasme bhadrāṇi saścatapriyāṇi
translation: Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures; Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 26
sanskrit: एवा वसिष्ठ इन्द्रमूतये नॄन कर्ष्टीनां वर्षभं सुते गर्णाति | सहस्रिण उप नो माहि वाजान यूयं पात ...
transliteration: evā vasiṣṭha indramūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sute ghṛṇāti | sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Thus, to bring help to men, Vasistha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation. Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 27
sanskrit: इन्द्रं नरो नेमधिता हवन्ते यत पार्या युनजते धियस्ताः | शूरो नर्षाता शवसश्चकान आ गोमति वरजे भजात्वं नः
transliteration: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyastāḥ |
translation: MEN call on Indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive. Hero, rejoicing in thy might, in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 28
sanskrit: बरह्मा ण इन्द्रोप याहि विद्वानर्वाञ्चस्ते हरयः सन्तु युक्ताः | विश्वे चिद धि तवा विहवन्त मर्ता अस्माकमिच्छ्र्णुहि विश्वमिन्व
transliteration: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvānarigvedaāñcaste harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ | viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākamicchṛṇuhi viśvaminva
translation: COME to our prayers, O Indra, thou who knowest: let thy Bay Steeds be yoked and guided hither. Though mortal men on every side invoke thee, still give thine ear to us, O All-impeller.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 28
sanskrit: हवं त इन्द्र महिमा वयानड बरह्म यत पासि शवसिन्न्र्षीणाम | आ यद वज्रं दधिषे हस्त उग्र घोरः सन करत्वा जनिष्ठा अषाळः
transliteration: havaṃ ta indra mahimā vyānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinnṛṣīṇām |
translation: Thy greatness reacheth to our invocation, the sages' prayer which, Potent God, thou guardest. What time thy hand, O Mighty, holds the thunder, awful in strength thou hast become resistless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 29
sanskrit: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्व आ तु पर याहि हरिवस्तदोकाः | पिबा तवस्य सुषुतस्य चारोर्ददो मघानि मघवन्नियानः
transliteration: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunva ā tu pra yāhi harivastadokāḥ | pibā tvasya suṣutasya cārordado maghāni maghavanniyānaḥ
translation: THIS Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra: come hither, Lord of Bays, for this thou lovest. Drink of this fair, this well-effused libation: Maghavan, give us wealth when we implore thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 29
sanskrit: बरह्मन वीर बरह्मक्र्तिं जुषाणो.अर्वाचीनो हरिभिर्याहि तूयम | अस्मिन्नू षु सवने मादयस्वोप बरह्माणि शर्णव इमा नः
transliteration: brahman vīra brahmakṛtiṃ juṣāṇo.arigvedaācīno haribhiryāhi tūyam | asminnū ṣu savane mādayasvopa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā naḥ
translation: Come to us quickly with thy Bay Steeds, Hero, come to our prayer, accepting our devotion. Enjoy thyself aright at this libation, and listen thou unto the prayers we offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 29
sanskrit: का ते अस्त्यरंक्र्तिः सूक्तैः कदा नूनं ते मघवन दाशेम | विश्वा मतीरा ततने तवायाधा म इन्द्र शर्णवो हवेमा
transliteration: kā te astyaraṃkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnaṃ te maghavan dāśema | viśvā matīrā tatane tvāyādhā ma indra śṛṇavo havemā
translation: What satisfaction do our hymns afford thee? When, Maghavan? Now let us do thee service. Hymns, only hymns, with love for thee, I weave thee: then hear, O Indra, these mine invocations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 29
sanskrit: उतो घा ते पुरुष्या इदासन येषां पूर्वेषामश्र्णोरषीणाम | अधाहं तवा मघवञ जोहवीमि तवं न इन्द्रासि परमतिः पितेव
transliteration: uto ghā te puruṣyā idāsan yeṣāṃ pūrigvedaeṣāmaśṛṇorṣīṇām | adhāhaṃ tvā maghavañ johavīmi tvaṃ na indrāsi pramatiḥ piteva
translation: They, verily, were also human beings whom thou wast wont to hear, those earlier sages. Hence I, O Indra Maghavan, invoke thee: thou art our Providence, even as a Father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 29
sanskrit: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं ...
transliteration: vocemedindraṃ ...
translation: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches, Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 30
sanskrit: आ नो देव शवसा याहि शुष्मिन भवा वर्ध इन्द्र रायो अस्य | महे नर्म्णाय नर्पते सुवज्र महि कषत्राय पौंस्याय शूर
transliteration: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate suvajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra
translation: WITH power and strength, O Mighty God, approach us: be the augmenter, Indra, of these riches; Strong Thunderer, Lord of men, for potent valour, for manly exploit and for high dominion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 30
sanskrit: हवन्त उ तवा हव्यं विवाचि तनूषु शूराः सूर्यस्य सातौ | तवं विश्वेषु सेन्यो जनेषु तवं वर्त्राणि रन्धया सुहन्तु
transliteration: havanta u tvā havyaṃ vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau | tvaṃ viśveṣu senyo janeṣu tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi randhayā suhantu
translation: Thee, worth invoking, in the din of battle, heroes invoke in fray for life and sunlight. Among all people thou art foremost fighter: give up our enemies to easy slaughter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अहा यदिन्द्र सुदिना वयुछान दधो यत केतुमुपमं समत्सु | नयग्निः सीददसुरो न होता हुवानो अत्र सुभगाय देवान
transliteration: ahā yadindra sudinā vyuchān dadho yat ketumupamaṃ samatsu | nyaghniḥ sīdadasuro na hotā huvāno atra subhaghāya devān
translation: When fair bright days shall dawn on us, O Indra, and thou shalt bring thy banner near in battle, Agni the Asura shall sit as Herald, calling Gods hither for our great good fortune.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 30
sanskrit: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च देव सतवन्त शूर ददतो मघानि | यछा सूरिभ्य उपमं वरूथं सवाभुवो जरणामश्नवन्त
transliteration: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadato maghāni | yachā sūribhya upamaṃ varūthaṃ svābhuvo jaraṇāmaśnavanta
translation: Thine are we, Indra, thine, both these who praise thee, and those who give rich gifts, O God and Hero. Grant to our princes excellent protection, may they wax old and still be strong and happy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 30
sanskrit: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं ...
transliteration: vocemedindraṃ ...
translation: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 31
sanskrit: पर व इन्द्राय मादनं हर्यश्वाय गायत | सखायः सोमपाव्ने
transliteration: pra va indrāya mādanaṃ haryaśvāya ghāyata | sakhāyaḥ somapāvne
translation: SING ye a song, to make him glad, to Indra, Lord of Tawny Steeds, The Soma-drinker, O my friends.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 32
sanskrit: मो षु तवा वाघतश्चनारे अस्मन नि रीरमन | आरात्ताच्चित सधमादं न आ गहीह वा सन्नुप शरुधि
transliteration: mo ṣu tvā vāghataścanāre asman ni rīraman |
translation: LET none, no, not thy worshippers, delay thee far away from us. Even from far away come thou unto our feast, or listen if already here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: शवित्यञ्चो मा दक्षिणतस्कपर्दा धियंजिन्वासो अभि हि परमन्दुः | उत्तिष्ठन वोचे परि बर्हिषो नॄन न मे दूरादवितवे वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrādavitave vasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: THESE who wear hair-knots on the right, the movers of holy thought, white-robed, have won me over. I warned the men, when from the grass I raised me, Not from afar can my Vasisthas help you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: दूरादिन्द्रमनयन्ना सुतेन तिरो वैशन्तमति पान्तमुग्रम | पाशद्युम्नस्य वायतस्य सोमात सुतादिन्द्रो.अव्र्णीतावसिष्ठान
transliteration: dūrādindramanayannā sutena tiro vaiśantamati pāntamughram | pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutādindro.avṛṇītāvasiṣṭhān
translation: With soma they brought Indra from a distance, Over Vaisanta, from the strong libation. Indra preferred Vasisthas to the Soma pressed by the son of Vayata, Pasadyumna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: एवेन नु कं सिन्धुमेभिस्ततारेवेन नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान | एवेन नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं परावदिन्द्रो बरह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: even nu kaṃ sindhumebhistatāreven nu kaṃ bhedamebhirjaghāna | even nu kaṃ dāśarājñe sudāsaṃ prāvadindro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: So, verily, with these he crossed the river, in company with these he slaughtered Bheda. So in the fight with the Ten Kings, Vasisthas! did Indra help Sudas through your devotions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: जुष्टी नरो बरह्मणा वः पितॄणामक्षमव्ययं न किला रिषाथ | यच्छक्वरीषु बर्हता रवेणेन्द्रे शुष्ममदधाता वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇāmakṣamavyayaṃ na kilā riṣātha | yacchakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmamadadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: I gladly, men I with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle: ye shall not be injured: Since, when ye sang aloud the Sakvari verses, Vasisthas! ye invigorated Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: उद दयामिवेत तर्ष्णजो नाथितासो.अदीधयुर्दाशराज्ञे वर्तासः | वसिष्ठस्य सतुवत इन्द्रो अश्रोदुरुं तर्त्सुभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकम
transliteration: ud dyāmivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso.adīdhayurdāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ | vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśroduruṃ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇodu lokam
translation: Like thirsty men they looked to heaven, in battle with the Ten Kings, surrounded and imploring. Then Indra heard Vasistha as he praised him, and gave the Trtsus ample room and freedom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: दण्डा इवेद गोजनास आसन परिछिन्ना भरता अर्भकासः | अभवच्च पुरेता वसिष्ठ आदित तर्त्सूनां विशो अप्रथन्त
transliteration: daṇḍā ived ghoajanāsa āsan parichinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ | abhavacca puraetā vasiṣṭha ādit tṛtsūnāṃ viśo aprathanta
translation: Like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle, Stripped bare, the Bharatas were found defenceless: Vasistha then became their chief and leader: then widely. were the Trtsus' clans extended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: तरयः कर्ण्वन्ति भुवनेषु रेतस्तिस्रः परजा आर्या जयोतिरग्राः | तरयो घर्मास उषसं सचन्ते सर्वानित ताननुविदुर्वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retastisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiraghrāḥ | trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṃ sacante sarigvedaānit tānanuvidurigvedaasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: Three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture: three noble Creatures cast a light before them. Three that give warmth to all attend the morning. All these have they discovered, these Vasisthas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो जयोतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः | वातस्येव परजवो नान्येन सतोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः
transliteration: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotireṣāṃ samudrasyeva mahimā ghabhīraḥ | vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ
translation: Like the Sun's growing glory is their splendour, and like the sea's is their unflathomed greatness. Their course is like the wind's. Your laud, Vasisthas, can never be attained by any other.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: त इन निण्यं हर्दयस्य परकेतैः सहस्रवल्शमभि संचरन्ति | यमेन ततं परिधिं वयन्तो.अप्सरस उप सेदुर्वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: ta in niṇyaṃ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśamabhi saṃcaranti | yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayanto.apsarasa upa sedurigvedaasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: They with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches. The Apsaras brought hither the Vasisthas wearing the vesture spun for them by Yama.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: विद्युतो जयोतिः परि संजिहानं मित्रावरुणा यदपश्यतां तवा | तत ते जन्मोतैकं वसिष्ठागस्त्यो यत तवा विशाजभार
transliteration: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānaṃ mitrāvaruṇā yadapaśyatāṃ tvā | tat te janmotaikaṃ vasiṣṭhāghastyo yat tvā viśaājabhāra
translation: A form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou, when Varuna and Mitra saw thee. Thy one and only birth was then, Vasistha, when from thy stock Agastya brought thee hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: उतासि मैत्रावरुणो वसिष्ठोर्वश्या बरह्मन मनसो.अधि जातः | दरप्सं सकन्नं बरह्मणा दैव्येन विश्वे देवाः पुष्करे तवाददन्त
transliteration: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorigvedaaśyā brahman manaso.adhi jātaḥ | drapsaṃ skannaṃ brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta
translation: Born of their love for Urvasi, Vasistha thou, priest, art son of Varuna and Mitra; And as a fallen drop, in heavenly fervour, all the Gods laid thee on a lotus-blossom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: स परकेत उभयस्य परविद्वान सहस्रदान उत वा सदानः | यमेन ततं परिधिं वयिष्यन्नप्सरसः परि जज्ञे वसिष्ठः
transliteration: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ | yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayiṣyannapsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ
translation: He thinker, knower both of earth and heaven, endowed with many a gift, bestowing thousands, Destined to wear the vesture spun by Yama, sprang from the Apsaras to life, Vasistha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: सत्रे ह जाताविषिता नमोभिः कुम्भे रेतः सिषिचतुः समानम | ततो ह मान उदियाय मध्यात ततो जातं रषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम
transliteration: satre ha jātāviṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam | tato ha māna udiyāya madhyāt tato jātaṃ ṛṣimāhurigvedaasiṣṭham
translation: Born at the sacrifice, urged by adorations, both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher. Then from the midst thereof there rose up Mana, and thence they say was born the sage Vasistha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 33
sanskrit: उक्थभ्र्तं सामभ्र्तं बिभर्ति गरावाणं बिभ्रत पर वदात्यग्रे | उपैनमाध्वं सुमनस्यमाना आ वो गछाति परत्र्दो वसिष्ठः
transliteration: ukthabhṛtaṃ sāmabhṛtaṃ bibharti ghrāvāṇaṃ bibhrat pra vadātyaghre | upainamādhvaṃ sumanasyamānā ā vo ghachāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ
translation: He brings the bearer of the laud and Saman: first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing. With grateful hearts in reverence approach him: to you, O Pratrdas, Vasistha cometh.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 34
sanskrit: पर शुक्रैतु देवी मनीषा अस्मत सुतष्टो रथो न वाजी
transliteration: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī
translation: MAY our divine and brilliant hymn go forth, like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 34
sanskrit: विदुः पर्थिव्या दिवो जनित्रं शर्ण्वन्त्यापो अध कषरन्तीः
transliteration: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṃ śṛṇvantyāpo adha kṣarantīḥ
translation: The waters listen as they flow along: they know the origin of heaven and earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 35
sanskrit: शं न इन्द्राग्नी भवतामवोभिः शं न इन्द्रावरुणा रातहव्या | शमिन्द्रासोमा सुविताय शं योः शं न इन्द्रापूषणा वाजसातौ
transliteration: ye devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānāṃ manoryajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ | te no rāsantāmurughāyamadya yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: BEFRIEND us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuna who receive oblations! Indra and Soma give health, strength and comfort, Indra and Pusan be our help in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 35
sanskrit: शं नो भगः शमु नः शंसो अस्तु शं नः पुरन्धिःशमु सन्तु रायः | शं नः सत्यस्य सुयमस्य शंसःशं नो अर्यमा पुरुजातो अस्तु
transliteration: rigveda07035.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:11:55 GMT
translation: Auspicious Friends to us be Bhaga, Sathsa, auspicious be Purandhi aid all Riches; The blessing of the true and well-conducted, and Aryaman in many forms apparent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 36
sanskrit: पर बरह्मैतु सदनाद रतस्य वि रश्मिभिः सस्र्जे सूर्यो गाः | वि सानुना पर्थिवी सस्र उर्वी पर्थु परतीकमध्येधे अग्निः
transliteration: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo ghāḥ | vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urigvedaī pṛthu pratīkamadhyedhe aghniḥ
translation: LET the prayer issue from the seat of Order, for Surya with his beams hath loosed the cattle. With lofty ridges earth is far extended, and Agni's flame hath lit the spacious surface.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 36
sanskrit: इमां वां मित्रावरुणा सुव्र्क्तिमिषं न कर्ण्वे असुरा नवीयः | इनो वामन्यः पदवीरदब्धो जनं च मित्रो यतति बरुवाणः
transliteration: imāṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktimiṣaṃ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ | ino vāmanyaḥ padavīradabdho janaṃ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ
translation: O Asuras, O Varuna and Mitra, this hymn to you, like food, anew I offer. One of you is a strong unerring Leader, and Mitra, speaking, stirreth men to labour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: आ वो वाहिष्ठो वहतु सतवध्यै रथो वाजा रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तः | अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठैः सवनेषु सोमैर्मदे सुशिप्रा महभिः पर्णध्वम
transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somairmade suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam
translation: LET your best-bearing car that must be lauded, ne'er injured, bring you Vajas and Rbhuksans. Fill you, fair-helmeted! with mighty Soma, thrice-mixed, at our libations to delight you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: यूयं ह रत्नं मघवत्सु धत्थ सवर्द्र्श रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तम | सं यज्ञेषु सवधावन्तः पिबध्वं वि नो राधांसि मतिभिर्दयध्वम
transliteration: yūyaṃ ha ratnaṃ maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam | saṃ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ vi no rādhāṃsi matibhirdayadhvam
translation: Ye who behold the light of heaven, Rbhuksans, give our rich patrons unmolested riches. Drink, heavenly-natured. at our sacrifices, and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: उवोचिथ हि मघवन देष्णं महो अर्भस्य वसुनो विभागे | उभा ते पूर्णा वसुना गभस्ती न सून्र्ता नि यमते वसव्या
transliteration: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇaṃ maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāghe | ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā ghabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā
translation: For thou, O Bounteous One, art used to giving, at parting treasure whether small or ample. Filled full are both thine arms with great possessions: thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सवयशा रभुक्षा वाजो न साधुरस्तमेष्य रक्वा | वयं नु ते दाश्वांसः सयाम बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो हरिवो वसिष्ठाः
transliteration: tvamindra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhurastameṣy ṛkvā | vayaṃ nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ
translation: Indra, high-famed, as Vaja and Rbhuksans, thou goest working, singing to the dwelling. Lord of Bay Steeds, this day may we Vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: सनितासि परवतो दाशुषे चिद याभिर्विवेषो हर्यश्व धीभिः | ववन्मा नु ते युज्याभिरूती कदा न इन्द्र राय आ दशस्येः
transliteration: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhirigvedaveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ | vavanmā nu te yujyābhirūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ
translation: Thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant, through hymns, Lord of Bay Steeds, which thou hast favoured. For thee with friendly succour have we battled, and when, O Indra, wilt thou grant us riches?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: वासयसीव वेधसस्त्वं नः कदा न इन्द्र वचसो बुबोधः | अस्तं तात्या धिया रयिं सुवीरं पर्क्षो नो अर्वा नयुहीत वाजी
transliteration: vāsayasīva vedhasastvaṃ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ | astaṃ tātyā dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ pṛkṣo no arigvedaā nyuhīta vājī
translation: To us thy priests a home, as 'twere, thou givest: when, Indra wilt thou recognize our praises? May thy strong Steed, through our ancestral worship, bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 37
sanskrit: अभि यं देवी निरतिश्चिदीशे नक्षन्त इन्द्रं शरदःसुप्र्क्षः | उप तरिबन्धुर्जरदष्टिमेत्यस्ववेशं यं कर्णवन्त मर्ताः
transliteration: abhi yaṃ devī nirtiścidīśe nakṣanta indraṃ śaradaḥsupṛkṣaḥ | upa tribandhurjaradaṣṭimetyasvaveśaṃ yaṃ kṛṇavanta martāḥ
translation: Though Nirrti the Goddess reigneth round him, Autumns with food in plenty come to Indra. With three close Friends to length of days he cometh, he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उदु षय देवः सविता ययाम हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत | नूनं भगो हव्यो मानुषेभिर्वि यो रत्ना पुरूवसुर्दधाति
transliteration: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīmamatiṃ yāmaśiśret | nūnaṃ bhagho havyo mānuṣebhirigveda yo ratnā purūvasurdadhāti
translation: ON high hath Savitar, this God, extended the golden lustre which he spreads around him. Now, now must Bhaga be invoked by mortals, Lord of great riches who distributes treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: उदु तिष्ठ सवितः शरुध्यस्य हिरण्यपाणे परभ्र्ताव रतस्य | वयुर्वीं पर्थ्वीममतिं सर्जान आ नर्भ्यो मर्तभोजनं सुवानः
transliteration: udu tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhyasya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya | vyurigvedaīṃ pṛthvīmamatiṃ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṃ suvānaḥ
translation: Rise up, O Savitar whose hands are golden, and hear this man while sacrifice is offered, Spreading afar thy broad and wide effulgence, and bringing mortal men the food that feeds them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अपि षटुतः सविता देवो अस्तु यमा चिद विश्वे वसवो गर्णन्ति | स न सतोमान नमस्यश्चनो धाद विश्वेभिः पातु पायुभिर्नि सूरीन
transliteration: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yamā cid viśve vasavo ghṛṇanti | sa na stomān namasyaścano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhirni sūrīn
translation: Let Savitar the God he hymned with praises, to whom the Vasus, even, all sing glory. Sweet be our lauds to him whose due is worship: may he with all protection guard our princes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अभि यं देव्यदितिर्ग्र्णाति सवं देवस्य सवितुर्जुषाणा | अभि सम्राजो वरुणो गर्णन्त्यभि मित्रासो अर्यमा सजोषाः
transliteration: abhi yaṃ devyaditirghṛṇāti savaṃ devasya saviturjuṣāṇā | abhi samrājo varuṇo ghṛṇantyabhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ
translation: Even he whom Aditi the Goddess praises, rejoicing in God Savitar's incitement: Even he who praise the high imperial Rulers, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, sing in concert.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अभि ये मिथो वनुषः सपन्ते रातिं दिवो रातिषाचः पर्थिव्याः | अहिर्बुध्न्य उत नः शर्णोतु वरूत्र्येकधेनुभिर्नि पातु
transliteration: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṃ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ | ahirbudhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtryekadhenubhirni pātu
translation: They who come emulous to our oblation, dispensing bounty, from the earth and heaven. May they and Ahibudhnya hear our calling: guard us Varutri with the Ekadhenus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अनु तन नो जास्पतिर्मंसीष्ट रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानः | भगमुग्रो.अवसे जोहवीति भगमनुग्रो अध याति रत्नम
transliteration: anu tan no jāspatirmaṃsīṣṭa ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānaḥ | bhaghamughro.avase johavīti bhaghamanughro adha yāti ratnam
translation: This may the Lord of Life, entreated, grant us,-the wealth which Savitar the God possesses. The mighty calls on Bhaga for protection, on Bhaga calls the weak to give him riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 39
sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमतिं वस्वो अश्रेत परतीची जूर्णिर्देवतातिमेति | भेजाते अद्री रथ्येव पन्थां रतं होता न इषितो यजाति
transliteration: bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthāṃ ṛtaṃ hotā na iṣito yajāti
translation: AGNI, erect, hath shown enriching favour: the flame goes forward to the Gods' assembly. Like car-borne men the stones their path have chosen: let the priest, quickened, celebrate our worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 39
sanskrit: पर वाव्र्जे सुप्रया बर्हिरेषामा विश्पतीव बीरिट इयाते | विशामक्तोरुषसः पूर्वहूतौ वायुः पूषा सवस्तये नियुत्वान
transliteration: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhireṣāmā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte | viśāmaktoruṣasaḥ pūrigvedaahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān
translation: Soft to the tread, their sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them, At the folks early call on Night and Morning,-Vayu, and Pusan with his team, to bless us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 39
sanskrit: जमया अत्र वसवो रन्त देवा उरावन्तरिक्षे मर्जयन्त शुभ्राः | अर्वाक पथ उरुज्रयः कर्णुध्वं शरोता दूतस्य जग्मुषो नो अस्य
transliteration: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāvantarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ | arigvedaāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ śrotā dūtasya jaghmuṣo no asya
translation: Here on their path the noble Gods proceeded: in the wide firmament the Beauteous decked them. Bend your way hither, ye who travel widely: hear this our envoy who hath gone to meet you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 39
sanskrit: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमाः सधस्थं विश्वे अभि सन्ति देवाः | तानध्वर उशतो यक्ष्यग्ने शरुष्टी भगं नासत्या पुरन्धिम
transliteration: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṃ viśve abhi santi devāḥ | tānadhvara uśato yakṣyaghne śruṣṭī bhaghaṃ nāsatyā purandhim
translation: For they are holy aids at sacrifices: all Gods approach the place of congregation. Bring these, desirous, to our worship, Agni, swift the Nisatyas, Bhaga, and Purandhi.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: ओ शरुष्टिर्विदथ्या समेतु परति सतोमं दधीमहि तुराणाम | यदद्य देवः सविता सुवाति सयामास्य रत्निनो विभागे
transliteration: o śruṣṭirigvedadathyā sametu prati stomaṃ dadhīmahi turāṇām | yadadya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāmāsya ratnino vibhāghe
translation: BE gathered all the audience of the synod: let us begin their praise whose course is rapid. Whate'er God Savitar this day produces, may we be where the Wealthy One distributes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो रोदसी च दयुभक्तमिन्द्रो अर्यमा ददातु | दिदेष्टु देव्यदिती रेक्णो वायुश्च यन नियुवैते भगश्च
transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo rodasī ca dyubhaktamindro aryamā dadātu | dideṣṭu devyaditī rekṇo vāyuśca yan niyuvaite bhaghaśca
translation: This, dealt from heaven ' may both the Worlds vouchsafe us, and Varuna, Indra, Aryaman, and Mitra. May Goddess Aditi assign us riches, Vayu and Bhaga make them ours for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: सेदुग्रो अस्तु मरुतः स शुष्मी यं मर्त्यं पर्षदश्वा अवाथ | उतेमग्निः सरस्वती जुनन्ति न तस्य रायः पर्येतास्ति
transliteration: sedughro astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yaṃ martyaṃ pṛṣadaśvā avātha | utemaghniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetāsti
translation: Strong be the man and full of power, O Maruts, whom ye, borne on by spotted coursers, favour. Him, too, Sarasvati and Agni further, and there is none to rob him of his riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: अयं हि नेता वरुण रतस्य मित्रो राजानो अर्यमापो धुः | सुहवा देव्यदितिरनर्वा ते नो अंहो अति पर्षन्नरिष्टान
transliteration: ayaṃ hi netā varuṇa ṛtasya mitro rājāno aryamāpo dhuḥ | suhavā devyaditiranarigvedaā te no aṃho ati parṣannariṣṭān
translation: This Varuna is guide of Law, he, Mitra, and Aryaman, the Kings, our work have finished. Divine and foeless Aditi quickly listens. May these deliver us unharmed from trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: अस्य देवस्य मीळ्हुषो वया विष्णोरेषस्य परभ्र्थे हविर्भिः | विदे हि रुद्रो रुद्रियं महित्वं यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत
transliteration: asya devasya mīḷhuṣo vayā viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ | vide hi rudro rudriyaṃ mahitvaṃ yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat
translation: With offerings I propitiate the branches of this swift-moving God, the bounteous Visnu. Hence Rudra gained his Rudra-strength: O Asvins, ye sought the house that hath celestial viands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: मात्र पूषन्नाघ्र्ण इरस्यो वरूत्री यद रातिषाचश्च रासन | मयोभुवो नो अर्वन्तो नि पान्तु वर्ष्टिं परिज्मा वातो ददातु
transliteration: mātra pūṣannāghṛṇa irasyo varūtrī yad rātiṣācaśca rāsan | mayobhuvo no arigvedaanto ni pāntu vṛṣṭiṃ parijmā vāto dadātu
translation: Be not thou angry here, O glowing Pusan, for what Varutri and the Bounteous gave us. May the swift-moving Gods protect and bless us, and Vata send us rain, wha wanders round us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 40
sanskrit: नू रोदसी ...
transliteration: nū rodasī ...
translation: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas, and holy Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 41
sanskrit: परातरग्निं परातरिन्द्रं हवामहे परातर्मित्रावरुणाप्रातरश्विना | परातर्भगं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिं परातः सोममुत रुद्रं हुवेम
transliteration: prātaraghniṃ prātarindraṃ havāmahe prātarmitrāvaruṇāprātaraśvinā | prātarbhaghaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patiṃ prātaḥ somamuta rudraṃ huvema
translation: AGNI at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuna and Mitra, and the Asvins twain. Bhaga at dawn, Pusan, and Brahmanaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 41
sanskrit: परातर्जितं भगमुग्रं हुवेम वयं पुत्रमदितेर्यो विधर्ता | आध्रश्चिद यं मन्यमानस्तुरश्चिद राजा चिद यं भगं भक्षीत्याह
transliteration: prātarjitaṃ bhaghamughraṃ huvema vayaṃ putramaditeryo vidhartā |
translation: We will invoke strong, early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great supporter: Thinking of whom, the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King himself says, Give me Bhaga.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 42
sanskrit: पर बरह्माणो अङगिरसो नक्षन्त पर करन्दनुर्नभन्यस्य वेतु | पर धेनव उदप्रुतो नवन्त युज्यातामद्री अध्वरस्य पेशः
transliteration: pra brahmāṇo aṅghiraso nakṣanta pra krandanurnabhanyasya vetu | pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātāmadrī adhvarasya peśaḥ
translation: LET Brahmans and Angirases come forward, and let the roar of cloudy heaven surround us. Loud low the Milch-kine swimming in the waters: set be the stones that grace our holy service.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 42
sanskrit: सुगस्ते अग्ने सनवित्तो अध्वा युक्ष्वा सुते हरितो रोहितश्च | ये वा सद्मन्नरुषा वीरवाहो हुवे देवानां जनिमानिसत्तः
transliteration: sughaste aghne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaśca | ye vā sadmannaruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṃ janimānisattaḥ
translation: Fair, Agni, is thy long-known path to travel: yoke for the juice tfiy bay, thy ruddy horses, Or red steeds, Hero-bearing, for the chamber. Seated, I call the Deities' generations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 42
sanskrit: समु वो यज्ञं महयन नमोभिः पर होता मन्द्रो रिरिच उपाके | यजस्व सु पुर्वणीक देवाना यज्ञियामरमतिं वव्र्त्याः
transliteration: samu vo yajñaṃ mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke | yajasva su purigvedaaṇīka devānā yajñiyāmaramatiṃ vavṛtyāḥ
translation: They glorify your sacrifice with worship, yet the glad Priest near them is left unequalled. Bring the Gods hither, thou of many aspects: turn hitherward Aramati the Holy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 42
sanskrit: यदा वीरस्य रेवतो दुरोणे सयोनशीरतिथिराचिकेतत | सुप्रीतो अग्निः सुधितो दम आ स विशे दाति वार्यमियत्यै
transliteration: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīratithirāciketat | suprīto aghniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryamiyatyai
translation: What time the Guest hath made himself apparent, at ease reclining in the rich man's dwelling, Agni, well-pleased, well-placed within the chamber gives to a house like this wealth worth the choosing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 42
sanskrit: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व मरुत्स्विन्द्रे यशसं कर्धी नः | आ नक्ता बर्हिः सदतामुषासोशन्ता मित्रावरुणायजेह
transliteration: imaṃ no aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva marutsvindre yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ |
translation: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni; glorify it with Indra and the Maruts. Here on our grass let Night and Dawn be seated: bring longing Varuna and Mitra hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 43
sanskrit: पर वो यज्ञेषु देवयन्तो अर्चन दयावा नमोभिः परिथिवी इषध्यै | येषां बरह्माण्यसमानि विप्रा विष्वग वियन्ति वनिनो न शाखाः
transliteration: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ prithivī iṣadhyai | yeṣāṃ brahmāṇyasamāni viprā viṣvagh viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ
translation: SING out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations Earth and Heaven- The Holy Singers, whose unmatched devotions, like a tree's branches, part in all directions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 43
sanskrit: पर यज्ञ एतु हेत्वो न सप्तिरुद यछध्वं समनसो घर्ताचीः | सत्र्णीत बर्हिरध्वराय साधूर्ध्वा शोचींषि देवयून्यस्थुः
transliteration: pra yajña etu hetvo na saptirud yachadhvaṃ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ | stṛṇīta barhiradhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūnyasthuḥ
translation: Let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser: with one accord lift ye on high the ladles. Strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service: bright flames that love the Gods have mounted upward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 44
sanskrit: दधिक्रां वः परथममश्विनोषसमग्निं समिद्धं भगमूतये हुवे | इन्द्रं विष्णुं पूषणं बरह्मणस पतिमादित्यान दयावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः
transliteration: dadhikrāṃ vaḥ prathamamaśvinoṣasamaghniṃ samiddhaṃ bhaghamūtaye huve | indraṃ viṣṇuṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patimādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ
translation: I CALL on Dadhikras, the first, to give you aid, the Asvins, Bhaga, Dawn, and Agni kindled well, Indra, and Visnu, Pusan, Brahmanaspati, Adityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 44
sanskrit: दधिक्रामु नमसा बोधयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञमुपप्रयन्तः | इळां देवीं बर्हिषि सादयन्तो.अश्विना विप्रा सुहवाहुवेम
transliteration: dadhikrāmu namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñamupaprayantaḥ | iḷāṃ devīṃ barhiṣi sādayanto.aśvinā viprā suhavāhuvema
translation: When, rising, to the sacrifice we hasten, awaking Dadhikras with adorations. Seating on sacred grass the Goddess Ila. let us invoke the sage swift-hearing Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 44
sanskrit: दधिक्रावाणं बुबुधानो अग्निमुप बरुव उषसं सूर्यं गाम | बरध्नं मांश्चतोर्वरुणस्य बभ्रुं ते विश्वास्मद दुरिता यावयन्तु
transliteration: dadhikrāvāṇaṃ bubudhāno aghnimupa bruva uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ ghām | bradhnaṃ māṃścatorigvedaaruṇasya babhruṃ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu
translation: While I am thus arousing Dadhikravan I speak to Agni, Earth, and Dawn, and Surya, The red, the brown of Varuna ever mindful: may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 44
sanskrit: दधिक्रावा परथमो वाज्यर्वाग्रे रथानां भवति परजानन | संविदान उषसा सूर्येणादित्येभिर्वसुभिरङगिरोभिः
transliteration: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājyarigvedaāghre rathānāṃ bhavati prajānan | saṃvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhirigvedaasubhiraṅghirobhiḥ
translation: Foremost is Dadhikravan, vigorous courser; in forefront of the cars, his way he knoweth, Closely allied with Surya and with Morning, Adityas, and Angirases, and Vasus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 45
sanskrit: आ देवो यातु सविता सुरत्नो.अन्तरिक्षप्रा वहमानो अश्वैः | हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि निवेशयञ्च परसुवञ्च भूम
transliteration: haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañca prasuvañca bhūma
translation: MAY the God Savitar, rich in goodly treasures, filling the region, borne by steeds, come hither, In his hand holding much that makes men happy, lulling to slumber and arousing creatures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 45
sanskrit: उदस्य बाहू शिथिरा बर्हन्ता हिरण्यया दिवो अन्ताननष्टाम | नूनं सो अस्य महिमा पनिष्ट सूरश्चिदस्मा अनु दादपस्याम
transliteration: udasya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antānanaṣṭām | nūnaṃ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraścidasmā anu dādapasyām
translation: Golden, sublime, and easy in their motion, his arms extend unto the bounds of heaven. Now shall that mightiness of his he lauded: even Surya yields to him in active vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 45
sanskrit: स घा नो देवः सविता सहावा साविषद वसुपतिर्वसूनि | विश्रयमाणो अमतिमुरूचीं मर्तभोजनमध रासते नः
transliteration: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatirigvedaasūni | viśrayamāṇo amatimurūcīṃ martabhojanamadha rāsate naḥ
translation: May this God Savitar, the Strong and Mighty, the Lord of precious wealth, vouchsafe us treasures. May he, advancing his far-spreading lustre, bestow on us the food that feedeth mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 45
sanskrit: इमा गिरः सवितारं सुजिह्वं पूर्णगभस्तिमीळते सुपाणिम | चित्रं वयो बर्हदस्मे दधातु यूयं पात ...
transliteration: imā ghiraḥ savitāraṃ sujihvaṃ pūrṇaghabhastimīḷate supāṇim | citraṃ vayo bṛhadasme dadhātu yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: These songs praise Savitar whose tongue is pleasant, praise him whose arms are full, whose hands are lovely. High vital strength, and manifold, may he grant us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इमा रुद्राय सथिरधन्वने गिरः कषिप्रेषवे देवाय सवधाव्ने | अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे तिग्मायुधाय भरता शर्णोतु नः
transliteration: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane ghiraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne | aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tighmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ
translation: To Rudra bring these songs, whose bow is firm and strong, the self-dependent God with swiftly-flying shafts, The Wise, the Conqueror whom none may overcome, armed with sharp-pointed weapons: may he hear our call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 46
sanskrit: स हि कषयेण कषम्यस्य जन्मनः साम्राज्येन दिव्यस्य चेतति | अवन्नवन्तीरुप नो दुरश्चरानमीवो रुद्र जासु नो भव
transliteration: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati | avannavantīrupa no duraścarānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava
translation: He through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth, on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway. Come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee, and heal all sickness, Rudra., in our families.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 46
sanskrit: या ते दिद्युदवस्र्ष्टा दिवस परि कष्मया चरति परि साव्र्णक्तु नः | सहस्रं ते सवपिवात भेषजा मा नस्तोकेषुतनयेषु रीरिषह
transliteration: yā te didyudavasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sāvṛṇaktu naḥ | sahasraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nastokeṣutanayeṣu rīriṣah
translation: May thy bright arrow which, shot down by thee from heaven, flieth upon the earth, pass us uninjured by. Thou, very gracious God, bast thousand medicines: inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 46
sanskrit: मा नो वधी रुद्र मा परा दा मा ते भूम परसितौ हीळितस्य | आ नो भज बर्हिषि जीवशंसे यूयं पात ...
transliteration: mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya |
translation: Slay us not, nor abandon us, O Rudra let not thy noose, when thou art angry, seize us. Give us trimmed grass and fame among the living. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 47
sanskrit: आपो यं वः परथमं देवयन्त इन्द्रपानमूर्मिमक्र्ण्वतेळः | तं वो वयं शुचिमरिप्रमद्य घर्तप्रुषं मधुमन्तं वनेम
transliteration: taṃ vo vayaṃ śucimaripramadya ghṛtapruṣaṃ madhumantaṃ vanema
translation: MAY we obtain this day from you, O Waters, that wave of pure refreshment, which the pious Made erst the special beverage of Indra, bright, stainless, rich in sweets and dropping fatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 47
sanskrit: तमूर्मिमापो मधुमत्तमं वो.अपां नपादवत्वाशुहेमा | यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वसुभिर्मादयाते तमश्याम देवयन्तो वो अद्य
transliteration: tamūrmimāpo madhumattamaṃ vo.apāṃ napādavatvāśuhemā | yasminnindro vasubhirmādayāte tamaśyāma devayanto vo adya
translation: May the Floods' Offspring, he whose course is rapid, protect that wave most rich in sweets, O Waters, That shall make Indra and the Vasus joyful. This may we gain from you to-day, we pious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 48
sanskrit: रभुक्षणो वाजा मादयध्वमस्मे नरो मघवानः सुतस्य | आ वो.अर्वाचः करतवो न यातां विभ्वो रथं नर्यं वर्तयन्तु
transliteration: vājo asmānavatu vājasātāvindreṇa yujā taruṣemavṛtram
translation: YE liberal Heroes, Vajas and Rbhuksans, come and delight you with our flowing Soma. May your strength, Vibhus, as ye come to meet us, turn hitherward your car that brings men profit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 48
sanskrit: रभुरभुभिरभि वः सयाम विभ्वो विभुभिः शवसा शवांसि | वाजो अस्मानवतु वाजसाताविन्द्रेण युजा तरुषेमव्र्त्रम
transliteration: te cid dhi pūrigvedaīrabhi santi śāsā viśvānarya uparatāti vanvan | indro vibhvān ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatrormithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam
translation: May we as Rbhu with your Rbhus conquer strength with our strength, as Vibhus with the Vibhus. May Vaja aid us in the fight for booty, and helped by Indra may we quell the foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 48
sanskrit: ते चिद धि पूर्वीरभि सन्ति शासा विश्वानर्य उपरताति वन्वन | इन्द्रो विभ्वान रभुक्षा वाजो अर्यः शत्रोर्मिथत्या कर्णवन वि नर्म्णम
transliteration: nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve.avase sajoṣāḥ | samasme iṣaṃ vasavo dadīran yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: For they rule many tribes with high dominion, and conquer all their foes in close encounter. May Indra, Vibhvan, Vaja, and Rbhuksan destroy by turns the wicked foeman's valour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 48
sanskrit: नू देवासो वरिवः कर्तना नो भूत नो विश्वे.अवसे सजोषाः | समस्मे इषं वसवो ददीरन यूयं पात ...
transliteration: rigveda07048.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:11:56 GMT
translation: Now, Deities, give us ample room and freedom: be all of you, one-minded, our protection. So let the Vasus grant us strength and vigour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 49
sanskrit: समुद्रज्येष्ठाः सलिलस्य मध्यात पुनाना यन्त्यनिविशमानाः | इन्द्रो या वज्री वर्षभो रराद ता आपो देवीरिहमामवन्तु
transliteration: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yantyaniviśamānāḥ | indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīrihamāmavantu
translation: FORTH from the middle of the flood the Waters-their chief the Sea-flow cleansing, never sleeping. Indra, the Bull, the Thunderer, dug their channels: here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 49
sanskrit: या आपो दिव्या उत वा सरवन्ति खनित्रिमा उत वा याः सवयंजाः | समुद्रार्था याः शुचयः पावकास्ता आपो .. .
transliteration: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayaṃjāḥ | samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāstā āpo .. .
translation: Waters which come from heaven, or those that wander dug from the earth, or flowing free by nature, Bright, purifying, speeding to the Ocean, here let those Waters. Goddesses, protect me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 49
sanskrit: यासां राजा वरुणो याति मध्ये सत्यान्र्ते अवपश्यञ जनानाम | मधुश्चुतः शुचयो याः पावकास्ता आपो ...
transliteration: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām | madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakāstā āpo ...
translation: Those amid whom goes Varuna the Sovran, he who discriminates men's truth and falsehood- Distilling meath, the bright, the purifying, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 49
sanskrit: यासु राजा वरुणो यासु सोमो विश्वे देवा यासूर्जं मदन्ति | वैश्वानरो यास्वग्निः परविष्टस्ता आपो ...
transliteration: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjaṃ madanti | vaiśvānaro yāsvaghniḥ praviṣṭastā āpo ...
translation: They from whom Varuna the King, and Soma, and all the Deities drink strength and vigour, They into whom Vaisvanara Agni entered, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect Me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 50
sanskrit: आ मां मित्रावरुणेह रक्षतं कुलाययद विश्वयन मा न आ गन | अजकावं दुर्द्र्शीकं तिरो दधे मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत तसरुः
transliteration: ajakāvaṃ durdṛśīkaṃ tiro dadhe mā māṃ padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
translation: O MITRA-VARUNA, guard and protect me here: let not that come to me which nests within and swells. I drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 50
sanskrit: यद विजामन परुषि वन्दनं भुवदष्ठीवन्तौ परि कुल्फौ च देहत | अग्निष टच्छोचन्नप बाधतामितो मा माम्पद्येन ...
transliteration: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanaṃ bhuvadaṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat | aghniṣ ṭacchocannapa bādhatāmito mā māmpadyena ...
translation: Eruption that appears upon the twofold joints, and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees, May the refulgent Agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 50
sanskrit: यच्छल्मलौ भवति यन नदीषु यदोषधीभ्यः परि जायते विषम | विश्वे देवा निरितस्तत सुवन्तु मा मां पद्येन ...
transliteration: yacchalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yadoṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam | viśve devā niritastat suvantu mā māṃ padyena ...
translation: The poison that is formed upon the Salmali, that which is found in streams, that which the plants produce, All this may all the Gods banish and drive away: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 50
sanskrit: याः परवतो निवत उद्वत उदन्वतीरनुदकाश्च याः | ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः शिवा देवीरशिपदा भवन्तु सर्वा नद्यो अशिमिदा भवन्तु
transliteration: yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīranudakāśca yāḥ | tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīraśipadā bhavantu sarigvedaā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu
translation: The steep declivities, the valleys, and the heights, the channels full of water, and the waterless- May those who swell with water, gracious Goddesses, never afflict us with the Sipada disease, may all the rivers keep us free from Simida.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 51
sanskrit: आदित्यानामवसा नूतनेन सक्षीमहि शर्मणा शन्तमेन | अनागास्त्वे अदितित्वे तुरास इमं यज्ञं दधतु शरोषमाणाः
transliteration: anāghāstve adititve turāsa imaṃ yajñaṃ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ
translation: THROUGH the Adityas' most auspicious shelter, through their most recent succour may we conquer. May they, the Mighty, giving ear, establish this sacrifice, to make us free and sinless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 52
sanskrit: आदित्यासो अदितयः सयाम पूर्देवत्रा वसवो मर्त्यत्रा | सनेम मित्रावरुणा सनन्तो भवेम दयावाप्र्थिवी भवन्तः
transliteration: sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ
translation: MAY we be free from every bond, Adityas! a castle among Gods and men, ye Vasus. Winning, may we win Varuna and Mitra, and, being, may we be, O Earth and Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 52
sanskrit: मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो मामहन्त शर्म तोकाय तनयाय गोपाः | मा वो भुजेमान्यजातमेनो मा तत कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे
transliteration: mitrastan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya ghopāḥ | mā vo bhujemānyajātameno mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve
translation: May Varuna and Mitra grant this blessing, our Guardians, shelter to our seed and offspring. Let us not suffer for another's trespass. nor do the thing that ye, O Vasus, punish.
