title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 52
sanskrit: तुरण्यवो.अङगिरसो नक्षन्त रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानाः | पिता च तन नो महान यजत्रो विश्वे देवाः समनसो जुषन्त
transliteration: turaṇyavo.aṅghiraso nakṣanta ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānāḥ | pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta
translation: The ever-prompt Angirases, imploring riches from Savitar the God, obtained them. So may our Father who is great and holy, and all the Gods, accordant, grant this favour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 53
sanskrit: पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी नमोभिः सबाध ईळे बर्हतीयजत्रे | ते चिद धि पूर्वे कवयो गर्णन्तः पुरो मही दधिरे देवपुत्रे
transliteration: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḷe bṛhatīyajatre | te cid dhi pūrigvedae kavayo ghṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre
translation: AS priest with solemn rites and adorations I worship Heaven and Earth, the High and Holy. To them, great Parents of the Gods, have sages of ancient time, singing, assigned precedence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 53
sanskrit: पर पूर्वजे पितरा नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिः कर्णुध्वं सदने रतस्य | आ नो दयावाप्र्थिवी दैव्येन जनेन यातं महि वां वरूथम
transliteration: pra pūrigvedaaje pitarā navyasībhirghīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sadane ṛtasya |
translation: With newest hymns set in the seat of Order, those the Two Parents, born before all others, Come, Heaven and Earth, with the Celestial People, hither to us, for strong is your protection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 54
sanskrit: वास्तोष पते परति जानीह्यस्मान सवावेशो अनमीवो भवा नः | यत तवेमहे परति तन नो जुषस्व शं नो भव दविपदे शं चतुष्पदे
transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhyasmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ | yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade
translation: ACKNOWLEDGE us, O Guardian of the Homestead: bring no disease, and give us happy entrance. Whate'er we ask of thee, be pleased to grant it, and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 54
sanskrit: वास्तोष पते परतरणो न एधि गयस्फानो गोभिरश्वेभिरिन्दो | अजरासस्ते सख्ये सयाम पितेव पुत्रान परति नो जुषस्व
transliteration: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi ghayasphāno ghobhiraśvebhirindo | ajarāsaste sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva
translation: Protector of the Home, be our promoter: increase our wealth in kine and steeds, O Indu. May we be ever-youthful in thy friendship: be pleased in us as in his sons a father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 54
sanskrit: वास्तोष पते शग्मया संसदा ते सक्षीमहि रण्वया गातुमत्या | पाहि कषेम उत योगे वरं नो यूयं पात ...
transliteration: vāstoṣ pate śaghmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā ghātumatyā | pāhi kṣema uta yoghe varaṃ no yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare, may we be victors, Guardian of the Dwelling! Protect our happiness in rest and labour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: अमीवहा वास्तोष पते विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन | सखा सुशेव एधि नः
transliteration: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan | sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ
translation: VASTOSPATI, who killest all disease and wearest every form, Be an auspicious Friend to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: यदर्जुन सारमेय दतः पिशङग यछसे | वीव भराजन्त रष्टय उप सरक्वेषु बप्सतो नि षु सवप
transliteration: yadarjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅgha yachase | vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa
translation: When, O bright Son of Sarama, thou showest, tawny-hued! thy teeth, They gleam like lances' points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite; go thou to steep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: सतेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर | सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान दुछुनायसे नि षु सवप
transliteration: stenaṃ rāya sārameya taskaraṃ vā punaḥsara | stotṝnindrasya rāyasi kimasmān duchunāyase ni ṣu svapa
translation: Sarama's Son, retrace thy way: bark at the robber and the thief. At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dust thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: तवं सूकरस्य दर्द्र्हि तव दर्दर्तु सूकरः | सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य ...
transliteration: tvaṃ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ | stotṝnindrasya ...
translation: Be on thy guard against the boar, and let the boar beware of thee. At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dost thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: सस्तु माता सस्तु पिता सस्तु शवा सस्तु विश्पतिः | ससन्तु सर्वे जञातयः सस्त्वयमभितो जनः
transliteration: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ | sasantu sarigvedae jñātayaḥ sastvayamabhito janaḥ
translation: Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog and master of the house. Let all the kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: य आस्ते यश्च चरति यश्च पश्यति नो जनः | तेषांसं हन्मो अक्षाणि यथेदं हर्म्यं तथा
transliteration: ya āste yaśca carati yaśca paśyati no janaḥ | teṣāṃsaṃ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā
translation: The man who sits, the man who walks, and whosoever looks on us, Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभो यः समुद्रादुदाचरत | तेना सहस्येना वयं नि जनान सवापयामसि
transliteration: sahasraśṛṅgho vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrādudācarat | tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janān svāpayāmasi
translation: The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea,- By him the Strong and Mighty One we lull and make the people sleep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 55
sanskrit: परोष्ठशया वह्येशया नारीर्यास्तल्पशीवरीः | सत्रियो याः पुण्यगन्धास्ताः सर्वाः सवापयामसि
transliteration: proṣṭhaśayā vahyeśayā nārīryāstalpaśīvarīḥ | striyo yāḥ puṇyaghandhāstāḥ sarigvedaāḥ svāpayāmasi
translation: The women sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds, The matrons with their odorous sweets these, one and all, we lull to sleep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: क ईं वयक्ता नरः सनीळा रुद्रस्य मर्या अध सवश्वाः
transliteration: ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḷā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ
translation: Who are these radiant men in serried rank, Rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: नकिर्ह्येषां जनूंषि वेद ते अङग विद्रे मिथो जनित्रम
transliteration: nakirhyeṣāṃ janūṃṣi veda te aṅgha vidre mitho janitram
translation: Verily no one knoweth whence they sprang: they, and they only, know each other's birth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: अभि सवपूभिर्मिथो वपन्त वातस्वनसः शयेना अस्प्र्ध्रन
transliteration: abhi svapūbhirmitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran
translation: They strew each other with their blasts, these Hawks: they strove together, roaring like the wind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: एतानि धीरो निण्या चिकेत पर्श्निर्यदूधो मही जभार
transliteration: etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśniryadūdho mahī jabhāra
translation: A sage was he who knew these mysteries, what in her udder mighty Prsni bore.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: सा विट सुवीरा मरुद्भिरस्तु सनात सहन्ती पुष्यन्ती नर्म्णम
transliteration: sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhirastu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam
translation: Ever victorious, through the Maruts, be this band of Heroes, nursing manly strength,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: यामं येष्ठाः शुभा शोभिष्ठाः शरिया सम्मिश्ला ओजोभिरुग्राः
transliteration: yāmaṃ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhirughrāḥ
translation: Most bright in splendour, fleetest on their way, close-knit to glory, strong with varied power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 56
sanskrit: उग्रं व ओज सथिरा शवांस्यधा मरुद्भिर्गणस्तुविष्मान
transliteration: ughraṃ va oja sthirā śavāṃsyadhā marudbhirghaṇastuviṣmān
translation: Yea, mighty is your power and firm your strength: so, potent, with the Maruts, be the band.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 57
sanskrit: मध्वो वो नाम मारुतं यजत्राः पर यज्ञेषु शवसा मदन्ति | ये रेजयन्ति रोदसी चिदुर्वी पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदयासुरुग्राः
transliteration: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṃ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti | ye rejayanti rodasī cidurigvedaī pinvantyutsaṃ yadayāsurughrāḥ
translation: YEA, through the power of your sweet juice, ye Holy! the Marut host is glad at sacrifices. They cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble, they make the spring flow when they come, the Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 57
sanskrit: निचेतारो हि मरुतो गर्णन्तं परणेतारो यजमानस्य मन्म | अस्माकमद्य विदथेषु बर्हिरा वीतये सदत पिप्रियाणाः
transliteration: nicetāro hi maruto ghṛṇantaṃ praṇetāro yajamānasya manma | asmākamadya vidatheṣu barhirā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ
translation: The Maruts watch the man who sings their praises, promoters of the thought of him who worships. Seat you on sacred grass in our assembly, this day, with friendly minds, to share the banquet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 57
sanskrit: नैतावदन्ये मरुतो यथेमे भराजन्ते रुक्मैरायुधैस्तनूभिः | आ रोदसी विश्वपिशः पिशानाः समानमञ्ज्यञ्जते शुभे कम
transliteration: naitāvadanye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmairāyudhaistanūbhiḥ |
translation: No others gleam so brightly as these Maruts with their own forms, their golden gauds, their weapons. With all adornments, decking earth and heaven, they heighten, for bright show, their common splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: पर साकमुक्षे अर्चता गणाय यो दैव्यस्य धाम्नस्तुविष्मान | उत कषोदन्ति रोदसी महित्वा नक्षन्ते नाकं निरतेरवंशात
transliteration: pra sākamukṣe arcatā ghaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnastuviṣmān | uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṃ nirteravaṃśāt
translation: SING to the troop that pours down rain in common, the Mighty Company of celestial nature. They make the world-halves tremble with their greatness: from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: जनूश्चिद वो मरुतस्त्वेष्येण भीमासस्तुविमन्यवो.अयासः | पर ये महोभिरोजसोत सन्ति विश्वो वो यामन भयते सवर्द्र्क
transliteration: janūścid vo marutastveṣyeṇa bhīmāsastuvimanyavo.ayāsaḥ | pra ye mahobhirojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk
translation: Yea, your birth, Maruts, was with wild commotion, ye who move swiftly, fierce in wrath, terrific. Ye all-surpassing in your might and vigour, each looker on the light fears at your coming.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: बर्हद वयो मघवद्भ्यो दधात जुजोषन्निन मरुतः सुष्टुतिं नः | गतो नाध्वा वि तिराति जन्तुं पर ण सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेत
transliteration: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣannin marutaḥ suṣṭutiṃ naḥ | ghato nādhvā vi tirāti jantuṃ pra ṇa spārhābhirūtibhistireta
translation: Give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the Maruts. As the way travelled helpeth people onward, so further us with your delightful succours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: युष्मोतो विप्रो मरुतः शतस्वी युष्मोतो अर्वा सहुरिः सहस्री | युष्मोतः सम्राळ उत हन्ति वर्त्रं पर तद वो अस्तु धूतयो देष्णम
transliteration: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arigvedaā sahuriḥ sahasrī | yuṣmotaḥ samrāḷ uta hanti vṛtraṃ pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam
translation: Your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds: the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand. The Sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman. May this your gift, ye Shakers, be distinguished.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: ताना रुद्रस्य मीळ्हुषो विवासे कुविन नंसन्ते मरुतः पुनर्नः | यत सस्वर्ता जिहीळिरे यदाविरव तदेन ईमहे तुराणाम
transliteration: tānā rudrasya mīḷhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṃsante marutaḥ punarnaḥ | yat sasvartā jihīḷire yadāvirava tadena īmahe turāṇām
translation: I call, as such, the Sons of bounteous Rudra: will not the Maruts turn again to us-ward? What secret sin or open stirs their anger, that we implore the Swift Ones to forgive us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 58
sanskrit: परा सा वाचि सुष्टुतिर्मघोनामिदं सूक्तं मरुतो जुषन्त | आराच्चिद दवेषो वर्षणो युयोत यूयं पात ...
transliteration: prā sā vāci suṣṭutirmaghonāmidaṃ sūktaṃ maruto juṣanta |
translation: This eulogy of the Bounteous hath been spoken: accept, ye Maruts, this our hymn of praises. Ye Bulls, keep those who hate us at a distance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 59
sanskrit: यं तरायध्व इदम-इदं देवासो यं च नयथ | तस्मा अग्ने वरुण मित्रार्यमन मरुतः शर्म यछत
transliteration: yaṃ trāyadhva idam-idaṃ devāso yaṃ ca nayatha | tasmā aghne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yachata
translation: WHOM SO ye rescue here and there, whom so ye guide, O Deities, To him give shelter, Agni, Mitra, Varuna, ye Maruts, and thou Aryaman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 59
sanskrit: युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि परिय ईजानस्तरति दविषः | पर स कषयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति
transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priya ījānastarati dviṣaḥ | pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati
translation: Through your kind favour, Gods, on some auspicious day, the worshipper subdues his foes. That man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 59
sanskrit: नहि वश्चरमं चन वसिष्ठः परिमंसते | अस्माकमद्य मरुतः सुते सचा विश्वे पिबत कामिनः
transliteration: nahi vaścaramaṃ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate | asmākamadya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ
translation: Vasistha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all. O Maruts, of our Soma juice effused to-day drink all of you with eager haste.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 59
sanskrit: नहि व ऊतिः पर्तनासु मर्धति यस्मा अराध्वं नरः | अभि व आवर्त सुमतिर्नवीयसी तूयं यात पिपीषवः
transliteration: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṃ naraḥ | abhi va āvart sumatirnavīyasī tūyaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ
translation: Your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye, Heroes, grant your gifts. May your most recent favour turn to us again. Come quickly, ye who fain would drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 59
sanskrit: ओ षु घर्ष्विराधसो यातनान्धांसि पीतये | इमा वो हव्या मरुतो ररे हि कं मो षवन्यत्र गन्तन
transliteration: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṃsi pītaye | imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kaṃ mo ṣvanyatra ghantana
translation: Come hitherward to drink the juice, O ye whose bounties give you joy. These offerings are for you, these, Maruts, I present. Go not to any place but this.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यदद्य सूर्य बरवो.अनागा उद्यन मित्राय वरुणाय सत्यम | वयं देवत्रादिते सयाम तव परियासो अर्यमन गर्णन्तः
transliteration: yadadya sūrya bravo.anāghā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam | vayaṃ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman ghṛṇantaḥ
translation: WHEN thou, O Sun, this day, arising sinless, shalt speak the truth to Varuna and Mitra, O Aditi, may all the Deities love us, and thou, O Aryaman, while we are singing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: एष सय मित्रावरुणा नर्चक्षा उभे उदेति सूर्यो अभि जमन | विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्च गोपा रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना चपश्यन
transliteration: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe udeti sūryo abhi jman | viśvasya sthāturjaghataśca ghopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā capaśyan
translation: Looking on man, O Varuna and Mitra, this Sun ascendeth up by both the pathways, Guardian of all things fixt, of all that moveth, beholding good and evil acts of mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अयुक्त सप्त हरितः सधस्थाद या ईं वहन्ति सूर्यं घर्ताचीः | धामानि मित्रावरुणा युवाकुः सं यो यूथेव जनिमानि चष्टे
transliteration: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṃ vahanti sūryaṃ ghṛtācīḥ | dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṃ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe
translation: He from their home hath yoked the Seven gold Coursers who, dropping oil and fatness, carry Surya. Yours, Varuna and Mitra, he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: उद वां पर्क्षासो मधुमन्तो अस्थुरा सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णः | यस्मा आदित्या अध्वनो रदन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणःसजोषाः
transliteration: ud vāṃ pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthurā sūryo aruhacchukramarṇaḥ | yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥsajoṣāḥ
translation: Your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted: to the bright ocean Surya hath ascended, For whom the Adityas make his pathway ready, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, accordant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इमे चेतारो अन्र्तस्य भूरेर्मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो हि सन्ति | इम रतस्य वाव्र्धुर्दुरोणे शग्मासः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धाः
transliteration: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrermitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi | ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhurduroṇe śaghmāsaḥ putrā aditeradabdhāḥ
translation: For these, even Aryaman, Varuna and Mitra, are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood. These, Aditi's Sons, infallible and mighty, have waxen in the home of law Eternal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इमे मित्रो वरुणो दूळभासो.अचेतसं चिच्चितयन्ति दक्षैः | अपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतन्तस्तिरश्चिदंहः सुपथानयन्ति
transliteration: ime mitro varuṇo dūḷabhāso.acetasaṃ ciccitayanti dakṣaiḥ | api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatantastiraścidaṃhaḥ supathānayanti
translation: These, Mitra, Varuna whom none deceiveth, with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom, And, wakening, moreover, thoughtful insight, lead it by easy paths o'er grief and trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इमे दिवो अनिमिषा पर्थिव्याश्चिकित्वांसो अचेतसं नयन्ति | परव्राजे चिन नद्यो गाधमस्ति पारं नो अस्य विष्पितस्य पर्षन
transliteration: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāścikitvāṃso acetasaṃ nayanti | pravrāje cin nadyo ghādhamasti pāraṃ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan
translation: They ever vigilant, with eyes that close not, caring for heaven and earth, lead on the thoughtless. Even in the river's bed there is a shallow. across this broad expanse may they conduct us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यद गोपावददितिः शर्म भद्रं मित्रो यछन्ति वरुणः सुदासे | तस्मिन्ना तोकं तनयं दधाना मा कर्म देवहेळनं तुरासः
transliteration: yad ghopāvadaditiḥ śarma bhadraṃ mitro yachanti varuṇaḥ sudāse | tasminnā tokaṃ tanayaṃ dadhānā mā karma devaheḷanaṃ turāsaḥ
translation: When Aditi and Varuna and Mitra, like guardians, give Sudas their friendly shelter, Granting him sons and lineal succession, let us not, bold ones! move the Gods to anger.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अव वेदिं होत्राभिर्यजेत रिपः काश्चिद वरुणध्रुतः सः | परि दवेषोभिरर्यमा वर्णक्तूरुं सुदासे वर्षणा उ लोकम
transliteration: ava vediṃ hotrābhiryajeta ripaḥ kāścid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ | pari dveṣobhiraryamā vṛṇaktūruṃ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam
translation: May he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of Varuna's reviler. Aryaman save us us all those who hate us: give room and freedom to Sudas, ye Mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: सस्वश्चिद धि सम्र्तिस्त्वेष्येषामपीच्येन सहसा सहन्ते | युष्मद भिया वर्षणो रेजमाना दक्षस्य चिन महिना मर्ळता नः
transliteration: sasvaścid dhi samṛtistveṣyeṣāmapīcyena sahasā sahante | yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḷatā naḥ
translation: Hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting: by their mysterious might they hold dominion. Heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you, even in the greatness of your power have mercy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यो बरह्मणे सुमतिमायजाते वाजस्य सातौ परमस्य रायः | सीक्षन्त मन्युं मघवानो अर्य उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे सुधातु
transliteration: yo brahmaṇe sumatimāyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ | sīkṣanta manyuṃ maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu
translation: He who wins favour for his prayer by worship, that he may gain him strength and highest riches, That good man's mind the Mighty Ones will follow: they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि | विश्वानि दुर्गा पिप्र्तं तिरो नो यूयं पात ...
transliteration: iyaṃ deva purohitiryuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāvakāri | viśvāni durghā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: This priestly task, Gods! Varuna and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices. Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 61
sanskrit: उद वां चक्षुर्वरुण सुप्रतीकं देवयोरेति सूर्यस्ततन्वान | अभि यो विश्वा भुवनानि चष्टे स मन्युं मर्त्येष्वा चिकेत
transliteration: ud vāṃ cakṣurigvedaaruṇa supratīkaṃ devayoreti sūryastatanvān | abhi yo viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyuṃ martyeṣvā ciketa
translation: O VARUNA and Mitra, Surya spreading the beauteous light of you Twain Gods ariseth. He who beholdeth all existing creatures observeth well the zeal that is in mortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 61
sanskrit: पर वां स मित्रावरुणाव रतावा विप्रो मन्मानि दीर्घश्रुदियर्ति | यस्य बरह्माणि सुक्रतू अवाथ आ यत करत्वा न शरदः पर्णैथे
transliteration: pra vāṃ sa mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvā vipro manmāni dīrghaśrudiyarti | yasya brahmāṇi sukratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe
translation: The holy sage, renowned afar, directeth his hymns to you, O Varuna and Mitra,- He whose devotions, sapient Gods, ye favour so that ye fill, as 'twere, with power his autumns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 61
sanskrit: परोरोर्मित्रावरुणा पर्थिव्याः पर दिव रष्वाद बर्हतः सुदानू | सपशो दधाथे ओषधीषु विक्ष्व रधग यतो अनिमिषंरक्षमाणा
transliteration: prorormitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra diva ṛṣvād bṛhataḥ sudānū | spaśo dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣv ṛdhagh yato animiṣaṃrakṣamāṇā
translation: From the wide earth, O Varuna and Mitra from the great lofty heaven, ye, Bounteous Givers, - Have in the fields and houses set your warder-, who visit every spot and watch unceasing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 62
sanskrit: उत सूर्यो बर्हदर्चींष्यश्रेत पुरु विश्वा जनिम मानुषाणाम | समो दिवा दद्र्शे रोचमानः करत्वा कर्तः सुक्र्तःकर्त्र्भिर्भूत
transliteration: ut sūryo bṛhadarcīṃṣyaśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām | samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥkartṛbhirbhūt
translation: SURYA hath sent aloft his beams of splendour o'er all the tribes of men in countless places. Together with the heaven he shines apparent, formed by his Makers well with power and wisdom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 62
sanskrit: स सूर्य परति पुरो न उद गा एभिः सतोमेभिरेतशेभिरेवैः | पर नो मित्राय वरुणाय वोचो.अनागसो अर्यम्णे अग्नये च
transliteration: sa sūrya prati puro na ud ghā ebhiḥ stomebhiretaśebhirevaiḥ | pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco.anāghaso aryamṇe aghnaye ca
translation: So hast thou mounted up before us, Surya, through these our praises, with fleet dappled horses. Declare us free from all offence to Mitra, and Varuna, and Aryaman, and Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 62
sanskrit: वि नः सहस्रं शुरुधो रदन्त्व रतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः | यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कमा नः कामं पूपुरन्तुस्तवानाः
transliteration: vi naḥ sahasraṃ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro aghniḥ | yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkamā naḥ kāmaṃ pūpurantustavānāḥ
translation: May holy Agni, Varuna, and Mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands. May they, the Bright Ones, make our praise-song perfect, and, when we laud them, grant us all our wishes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 62
sanskrit: दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नो ये वां जज्ञुः सुजनिमान रष्वे | मा हेळे भूम वरुणस्य वायोर्मा मित्रस्य परियतमस्य नर्णाम
transliteration: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ no ye vāṃ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve | mā heḷe bhūma varuṇasya vāyormā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām
translation: O undivided Heaven and Earth, preserve us, us, Lofty Ones! your nobIy-born descendants. Let us not anger Varuna, nor Vayu, nor him, the dearest Friend of mortals, Mitra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 62
sanskrit: पर बाहवा सिस्र्तं जीवसे न आ नो गव्यूतिमुक्षतं घर्तेन | आ नो जने शरवयतं युवाना शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमा
transliteration: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no ghavyūtimukṣataṃ ghṛtena |
translation: Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle. Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuna, these mine invocations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: उद वेति सुभगो विश्वचक्षाः साधारणः सूर्यो मानुषाणाम | चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्य देवश्चर्मेव यः समविव्यक तमांसि
transliteration: ud veti subhagho viśvacakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryo mānuṣāṇām | cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasya devaścarmeva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi
translation: COMMON to all mankind, auspicious Surya, he who beholdeth all, is mounting upward; The God, the eye of Varuna and Mitra, who rolled up darkness like a piece of leather.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: उद वेति परसवीता जनानां महान केतुरर्णवः सूर्यस्य | समानं चक्रं पर्याविव्र्त्सन यदेतशो वहति धूर्षु युक्तः
transliteration: ud veti prasavītā janānāṃ mahān keturarṇavaḥ sūryasya | samānaṃ cakraṃ paryāvivṛtsan yadetaśo vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ
translation: Surya's great ensign, restless as the billow, that urgeth men to action, is advancing: Onward he still would roll the wheel well-rounded, which Etasa, harnessed to the car-pole, moveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: विभ्राजमान उषसामुपस्थाद रेभैरुदेत्यनुमद्यमानः | एष मे देवः सविता चछन्द यः समानं न परमिनातिधाम
transliteration: vibhrājamāna uṣasāmupasthād rebhairudetyanumadyamānaḥ | eṣa me devaḥ savitā cachanda yaḥ samānaṃ na praminātidhāma
translation: Refulgent from the bosom of the Mornings, he in Whom singers take delight ascendeth. This Savitar, God, is my chief joy and pleasure, who breaketh not the universal statute.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: दिवो रुक्म उरुचक्षा उदेति दूरेर्थस्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः | नूनं जनाः सूर्येण परसूता अयन्नर्थानि कर्णवन्नपांसि
transliteration: divo rukma urucakṣā udeti dūrearthastaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ | nūnaṃ janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtā ayannarthāni kṛṇavannapāṃsi
translation: Golden, far-seeing, from the heaven he riseth: far is his goal, he hasteth on resplendent. Men, verily, inspirited by Surya speed to their aims and do the work assigned them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: यत्रा चक्रुरम्र्ता गातुमस्मै शयेनो न दीयन्नन्वेति पाथः | परति वां सूर उदिते विधेम नमोभिर्मित्रावरुणोत हव्यैः
transliteration: yatrā cakruramṛtā ghātumasmai śyeno na dīyannanveti pāthaḥ | prati vāṃ sūra udite vidhema namobhirmitrāvaruṇota havyaiḥ
translation: Where the immortals have prepared his pathway he flieth through the region like a falcon. With homage and oblations will we serve you, O Mitra-Varuna, when the Sun hath risen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 63
sanskrit: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा ...
transliteration: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā ...
translation: Now Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children. May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 64
sanskrit: दिवि कषयन्ता रजसः पर्थिव्यां पर वां घर्तस्य निर्णिजोददीरन | हव्यं नो मित्रो अर्यमा सुजातो राजा सुक्षत्रो वरुणो जुषन्त
transliteration: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pra vāṃ ghṛtasya nirṇijodadīran | havyaṃ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta
translation: YE Twain who rule, in heaven and earth, the region, clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness. May the imperial Varuna, and Mitra, and high-born Aryaman accept our presents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 65
sanskrit: परति वां सूर उदिते सूक्तैर्मित्रं हुवे वरुणं पूतदक्षम | ययोरसुर्यमक्षितं जयेष्ठं विश्वस्य यामन्नाचिता जिगत्नु
transliteration: prati vāṃ sūra udite sūktairmitraṃ huve varuṇaṃ pūtadakṣam | yayorasuryamakṣitaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ viśvasya yāmannācitā jighatnu
translation: WITH hymns I call you, when the Sun hath risen, Mitra, and Varuna whose thoughts are holy, Whose Power Divine, supreme and everlasting, comes with good heed at each man's supplication.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 65
sanskrit: ता हि देवानामसुरा तावर्या ता नः कषितीः करतमूर्जयन्तीः | अश्याम मित्रावरुणा वयं वां दयावा च यत्र पीपयन्नहा च
transliteration: tā hi devānāmasurā tāvaryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatamūrjayantīḥ | aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayaṃ vāṃ dyāvā ca yatra pīpayannahā ca
translation: For they are Asuras of Gods, the friendly make, both of you, our lands exceeding fruitful. May we obtain you, Varuna and Mitra, wherever Heaven and Earth and days may bless us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 65
sanskrit: ता भूरिपाशावन्र्तस्य सेतू दुरत्येतू रिपवे मर्त्याय | रतस्य मित्रावरुणा पथा वामपो न नावा दुरिता तरेम
transliteration: tā bhūripāśāvanṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya |
translation: Bonds of the sinner, they bear many nooses: the wicked mortal hardly may escape them. Varuna-Mitra, may your path of Order bear us o'er trouble as a boat o'er waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: पर मित्रयोर्वरुणयोः सतोमो न एतु शूष्यः | नमस्वान तुविजातयोः
transliteration: pra mitrayorigvedaaruṇayoḥ stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ | namasvān tuvijātayoḥ
translation: LET our strong hymn of praise go forth, the laud of Mitra-Varuna, With homage to that high-born Pair;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: या धारयन्त देवाः सुदक्षा दक्षपितरा | असुर्याय परमहसा
transliteration: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā | asuryāya pramahasā
translation: The Two exceeding wise, the Sons of Daksa, whom the gods ordained For lordship, excellently great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: ता न सतिपा तनूपा वरुण जरितॄणाम | मित्र साधयतं धियः
transliteration: tā na stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām | mitra sādhayataṃ dhiyaḥ
translation: Such, Guardians of our homes and us, O Mitra-Varuna, fulfil The thoughts of those who sing your praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: यदद्य सूर उदिते.अनागा मित्रो अर्यमा | सुवाति सविताभगः
transliteration: yadadya sūra udite.anāghā mitro aryamā | suvāti savitābhaghaḥ
translation: So when the Sun hath risen to-day, may sinless Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, and Savitar send us forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: सुप्रावीरस्तु स कषयः पर नु यामन सुदानवः | ये नो अंहो.अतिपिप्रति
transliteration: suprāvīrastu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ | ye no aṃho.atipiprati
translation: May this our home be guarded well forward, ye Bounteous, on the way, Who bear us safely o'er distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: उत सवराजो अदितिरदब्धस्य वरतस्य ये | महो राजान ईशते
transliteration: uta svarājo aditiradabdhasya vratasya ye | maho rājāna īśate
translation: And those Self-reigning, Aditi, whose statute is inviolate, The Kings who rule a vast domain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: परति वां सूर उदिते मित्रं गर्णीषे वरुणम | अर्यमणंरिशादसम
transliteration: prati vāṃ sūra udite mitraṃ ghṛṇīṣe varuṇam | aryamaṇaṃriśādasam
translation: Soon as the Sun hath risen, to you, to Mitra-Varuna, I sing, And Aryaman who slays the foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: राया हिरण्यया मतिरियमव्र्काय शवसे | इयं विप्रामेधसातये
transliteration: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiriyamavṛkāya śavase | iyaṃ viprāmedhasātaye
translation: With wealth of gold may this my song bring unmolested power and might, And, Brahmans, gain the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: ते सयाम देव वरुण ते मित्र सूरिभिः सह | इषं सवश्च धीमहि
transliteration: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha | iṣaṃ svaśca dhīmahi
translation: May we be thine, God Varuna, and with our princes, Mitra, thine. Food and Heaven's light will we obtain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: बहवः सूरचक्षसो.अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्धः | तरीणि ये येमुर्विदथानि धीतिभिर्विश्वानि परिभूतिभिः
transliteration: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso.aghnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ | trīṇi ye yemurigvedadathāni dhītibhirigvedaśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ
translation: Many are they who strengthen Law, Sun-eyed, with Agni for their tongue, They who direct the three great gatherings with their thoughts, yea, all things with surpassing might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: वि ये दधुः शरदं मासमादहर्यज्ञमक्तुं चाद रचम | अनाप्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा कषत्रं राजान आशत
transliteration: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradaṃ māsamādaharyajñamaktuṃ cād ṛcam | anāpyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṃ rājāna āśata
translation: They who have stablished year and month and then the day, night, sacrifice and holy verse, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the Kings, have won dominion which none else may gain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 66
sanskrit: तद वो अद्य मनामहे सूक्तैः सूर उदिते | यदोहते वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा यूयं रतस्य रथ्यः
transliteration: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite | yadohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyaṃ ṛtasya rathyaḥ
translation: So at the rising of the Sun we think of you with hymns to-day, Even as Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman deserve: ye are the charioteers of Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 67
sanskrit: परति वां रथं नर्पती जरध्यै हविष्मता मनसा यज्ञियेन | यो वां दूतो न धिष्ण्यावजीगरछा सूनुर्न पितरा विवक्मि
transliteration: prati vāṃ rathaṃ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena | yo vāṃ dūto na dhiṣṇyāvajīgharachā sūnurna pitarā vivakmi
translation: I WITH a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car, ye Princes, Which, Much-desired! hath wakened as your envoy. I call you hither as a son his parents.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 67
sanskrit: अशोच्यग्निः समिधानो अस्मे उपो अद्र्श्रन तमसश्चिदन्ताः | अचेति केतुरुषसः पुरस्ताच्छ्रिये दिवो दुहितुर्जायमानः
transliteration: aśocyaghniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaścidantāḥ | aceti keturuṣasaḥ purastācchriye divo duhiturjāyamānaḥ
translation: Brightly hath Agni shone by us enkindled: the limits even of darkness were apparent. Eastward is seen the Banner of the Morning, the Banner born to give Heaven's Daughter glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 67
sanskrit: अभि वां नूनमश्विना सुहोता सतोमैः सिषक्ति नासत्या विवक्वान | पूर्वीभिर्यातं पथ्याभिरर्वाक सवर्विदा वसुमता रथेन
transliteration: abhi vāṃ nūnamaśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān | pūrigvedaībhiryātaṃ pathyābhirarigvedaāk svarigvedadā vasumatā rathena
translation: With hymns the deft priest is about you, Asvins, the eloquent priest attends you now, Nasatyas. Come by the paths that ye are wont to travel, on car that finds the light, laden with treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 67
sanskrit: अवोर्वां नूनमश्विना युवाकुर्हुवे यद वां सुते माध्वीवसूयुः | आ वां वहन्तु सथविरासो अश्वाः पिबाथो अस्मेसुषुता मधूनि
transliteration: avorigvedaāṃ nūnamaśvinā yuvākurhuve yad vāṃ sute mādhvīvasūyuḥ |
translation: When, suppliant for your help, Lovers of Sweetness! I seeking wealth call you to our libation, Hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you: drink ye with us the well-pressed Soma juices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 68
sanskrit: आ शुभ्रा यातमश्विना सवश्वा गिरो दस्रा जुजुषाणा युवाकोः | हव्यानि च परतिभ्र्ता वीतं नः
transliteration: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṃ naḥ
translation: COME, radiant Asvins, with your noble horses: accept your servant's hymns, ye Wonder-Workers: Enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 68
sanskrit: पर वामन्धांसि मद्यान्यस्थुररं गन्तं हविषो वीतये मे | तिरो अर्यो हवनानि शरुतं नः
transliteration: pra vāmandhāṃsi madyānyasthuraraṃ ghantaṃ haviṣo vītaye me | tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṃ naḥ
translation: The gladdening juices stand prepared before you: come quickly and partake of mine oblation. Pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 68
sanskrit: पर वां रथो मनोजवा इयर्ति तिरो रजांस्यश्विना शतोतिः | अस्मभ्यं सूर्यावसू इयानः
transliteration: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṃsyaśvinā śatotiḥ | asmabhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ
translation: Your chariot with a hundred aids, O Asvins, beareth you swift as thought across the regions, Speeding to us, O ye whose wealth is Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 68
sanskrit: अयं ह यद वां देवया उ अद्रिरूर्ध्वो विवक्ति सोमसुद युवभ्याम | आ वल्गू विप्रो वव्र्तीत हव्यैः
transliteration: ayaṃ ha yad vāṃ devayā u adrirūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām |
translation: What time this stone of yours, the Gods' adorer, upraised, sounds forth for you as Soma-presser, Let the priest bring you, Fair Ones, through oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: आ वां रथो रोदसी बद्बधानो हिरण्ययो वर्षभिर्यात्वश्वैः | घर्तवर्तनिः पविभी रुचान इषां वोळ्हा नर्पतिर्वाजिनीवान
transliteration: ghṛtavartaniḥ pavibhī rucāna iṣāṃ voḷhā nṛpatirigvedaājinīvān
translation: MAY your gold chariot, drawn by vigorous horses, come to us, blocking up the earth and heaven, Bright with its fellies while its way drops fatness, food-laden, rich in coursers, man's protector.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: स पप्रथानो अभि पञ्च भूमा तरिवन्धुरो मनसा यातु युक्तः | विशो येन गछथो देवयन्तीः कुत्रा चिद याममश्विना दधाना
transliteration: sa paprathāno abhi pañca bhūmā trivandhuro manasā yātu yuktaḥ | viśo yena ghachatho devayantīḥ kutrā cid yāmamaśvinā dadhānā
translation: Let it approach, yoked by the will, three-seated, extending far and wide o'er fivefold beings, Whereon ye visit God-adoring races, bending your course whither ye will, O Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: सवश्वा यशसा यातमर्वाग दस्रा निधिं मधुमन्तं पिबाथः | वि वां रथो वध्वा यादमानो.अन्तान दिवो बाधते वर्तनिभ्याम
transliteration: svaśvā yaśasā yātamarigvedaāgh dasrā nidhiṃ madhumantaṃ pibāthaḥ | vi vāṃ ratho vadhvā yādamāno.antān divo bādhate vartanibhyām
translation: Renowned, with noble horses, come ye hither: drink, Wondrous Pair, the cup that holds sweet juices. Your car whereon your Spouse is wont to travel marks with its track the farthest ends of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: युवोः शरियं परि योषाव्र्णीत सूरो दुहिता परितक्म्यायाम | यद देवयन्तमवथः शचीभिः परि घरंसमोमना वां वयो गात
transliteration: yuvoḥ śriyaṃ pari yoṣāvṛṇīta sūro duhitā paritakmyāyām | yad devayantamavathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsamomanā vāṃ vayo ghāt
translation: When night was turning to the grey of morning the Maiden, Surya's Daughter, chose your splendour. When with your power and might ye aid the pious he comes through heat to life by your assistance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: यो ह सय वां रथिरा वस्त उस्रा रथो युजानः परियातिवर्तिः | तेन नः शं योरुषसो वयुष्टौ नयश्विना वहतं यज्ञे अस्मिन
transliteration: yo ha sya vāṃ rathirā vasta usrā ratho yujānaḥ pariyātivartiḥ | tena naḥ śaṃ yoruṣaso vyuṣṭau nyaśvinā vahataṃ yajñe asmin
translation: O Chariot-borne, this car of yours invested with rays of light comes harnessed to our dwelling. Herewith, O Asvins, while the dawn is breaking, to this our sacrifice bring peace and blessing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: नरा गौरेव विद्युतं तर्षाणास्माकमद्य सवनोप यातम | पुरुत्रा हि वां मतिभिर्हवन्ते मा वामन्ये नि यमन देवयन्तः
transliteration: narā ghaureva vidyutaṃ tṛṣāṇāsmākamadya savanopa yātam | purutrā hi vāṃ matibhirhavante mā vāmanye ni yaman devayantaḥ
translation: Like the wild cattle thirsty for the lightning, Heroes, come nigh this day to our libations. Men call on you with hymns in many places, but let not other worshippers detain you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: युवं भुज्युमवविद्धं समुद्र उदूहथुरर्णसो अस्रिधानैः | पतत्रिभिरश्रमैरव्यथिभिर्दंसनाभिरश्विना पारयन्ता
transliteration: yuvaṃ bhujyumavaviddhaṃ samudra udūhathurarṇaso asridhānaiḥ | patatribhiraśramairavyathibhirdaṃsanābhiraśvinā pārayantā
translation: Bhujyu, abandoned in the midst of ocean, ye raised from out the water with your horses, Uninjured, winged, flagging not, undaunted, with deeds of wonder saving him, O Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 69
sanskrit: नू मे हवमा शर्णुतं युवाना ...
transliteration: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā ...
translation: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Asvins, to the home where food aboundeth. Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 70
sanskrit: आ विश्ववाराश्विना गतं नः पर तत सथानमवाचि वां पर्थिव्याम | अश्वो न वाजी शुनप्र्ष्ठो अस्थादा यत सेदथुर्ध्रुवसे न योनिम
transliteration: aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthādā yat sedathurdhruvase na yonim
translation: RICH in all blessings, Asvins come ye hither: this place on earth is called your own possession, Like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth, whereon, as in a lap, ye seat you firmly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 70
sanskrit: सिषक्ति सा वां सुमतिश्चनिष्ठातापि घर्मो मनुषो दुरोणे | यो वां समुद्रान सरितः पिपर्त्येतग्वा चिन न सुयुजा युजानः
transliteration: siṣakti sā vāṃ sumatiścaniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe | yo vāṃ samudrān saritaḥ pipartyetaghvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ
translation: This most delightful eulogy awaits you in the man's house drink-offering hath been heated, Which bringeth you over the seas and rivers, yoking as'twere two well-matched shining horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 70
sanskrit: यानि सथानान्यश्विना दधाथे दिवो यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु | नि पर्वतस्य मूर्धनि सदन्तेषं जनाय दाशुषेवहन्ता
transliteration: yāni sthānānyaśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu | ni parigvedaatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṃ janāya dāśuṣevahantā
translation: Whatever dwellings ye possess, O Asvins, in fields of men or in the streams of heaven, Resting upon the summit of the mountain, or bringing food to him who gives oblation,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 70
sanskrit: चनिष्टं देवा ओषधीष्वप्सु यद योग्या अश्नवैथे रषीणाम | पुरूणि रत्ना दधतौ नयस्मे अनु पूर्वाणि चख्यथुर्युगानि
transliteration: caniṣṭaṃ devā oṣadhīṣvapsu yad yoghyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām | purūṇi ratnā dadhatau nyasme anu pūrigvedaāṇi cakhyathuryughāni
translation: Delight yourselves, ye Gods, in plants and waters when Rsis give them and ye find they suit You. Enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 71
sanskrit: अप सवसुरुषसो नग जिहीते रिणक्ति कर्ष्णीररुषाय पन्थाम | अश्वामघा गोमघा वां हुवेम दिवा नक्तं शरुमस्मद युयोतम
transliteration: apa svasuruṣaso nagh jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīraruṣāya panthām | aśvāmaghā ghomaghā vāṃ huvema divā naktaṃ śarumasmad yuyotam
translation: THE Night retireth from the Dawn her Sister; the Dark one yieldeth to the Red her pathway. Let us invoke you rich in steeds and cattle - by day and night keep far from us the arrow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उपायातं दाशुषे मर्त्याय रथेन वाममश्विना वहन्ता | युयुतमस्मदनिराममीवां दिवा नक्तं माध्वी तरासिथां नः
transliteration: upāyātaṃ dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmamaśvinā vahantā | yuyutamasmadanirāmamīvāṃ divā naktaṃ mādhvī trāsithāṃ naḥ
translation: Bearing rich treasure in your car, O Asvins, come to the mortal who presents oblation. Keep at a distance penury and sickness; Lovers of Sweetness, day and night preserve us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 72
sanskrit: आ गोमता नासत्या रथेनाश्वावता पुरुश्चन्द्रेण यातम | अभि वां विश्वा नियुतः सचन्ते सपार्हया शरिया तन्वा शुभाना
transliteration: abhi vāṃ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā
translation: COME, O Nasatyas, on your car resplendent, rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses. As harnessed steeds, all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 73
sanskrit: अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्य परति सतोमं देवयन्तो दधानाः | पुरुदंसा पुरुतमा पुराजामर्त्या हवते अश्विना गीः
transliteration: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasya prati stomaṃ devayanto dadhānāḥ | purudaṃsā purutamā purājāmartyā havate aśvinā ghīḥ
translation: WE have o'erpassed the limit of this darkness while, worshipping the Gods, we sang their praises. The song invoketh both Immortal Asvins far-reaching, born of old, great WonderWorkers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 73
sanskrit: नयु परियो मनुषः सादि होता नासत्या यो यजते वन्दते च | अश्नीतं मध्वो अश्विना उपाक आ वां वोचे विदथेषु परयस्वान
transliteration: nyu priyo manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yo yajate vandate ca | aśnītaṃ madhvo aśvinā upāka ā vāṃ voce vidatheṣu prayasvān
translation: And, O Nasatyas, man's dear Priest is seated, who brings to sacrifice and offers worship, Be near and taste the pleasant juice, O Asvins: with food, I call you to the sacrifices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 73
sanskrit: अहेम यज्ञं पथामुराणा इमां सुव्र्क्तिं वर्षणा जुषेथाम | शरुष्टीवेव परेषितो वामबोधि परति सतोमैर्जरमाणो वसिष्ठः
transliteration: ahema yajñaṃ pathāmurāṇā imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām |
translation: We choosing you, have let our worship follow its course: ye Steers, accept this hymn with favour. Obeying you as your appointed servant, Vasistha singing hath with lauds aroused you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 74
sanskrit: इमा उ वां दिविष्टय उस्रा हवन्ते अश्विना | अयं वामह्वे.अवसे शचीवसू विशं-विशं हि गछथः
transliteration: imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā | ayaṃ vāmahve.avase śacīvasū viśaṃ-viśaṃ hi ghachathaḥ
translation: THESE morning sacrifices call you, Asvins, at the break of day. For help have I invoked you rich in power and might: for, house by house ye visit all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 74
sanskrit: युवं चित्रं ददथुर्भोजनं नरा चोदेथां सून्र्तावते | अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु
transliteration: yuvaṃ citraṃ dadathurbhojanaṃ narā codethāṃ sūnṛtāvate | arigvedaāgh rathaṃ samanasā ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu
translation: O Heroes, ye bestow wonderful nourishment. send it to him whose songs are sweet Accordant, both of you, drive your car down to us, and drink the savoury Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 75
sanskrit: वयुषा आवो दिविजा रतेनाविष्क्र्ण्वाना महिमानमागात | अप दरुहस्तम आवरजुष्टमङगिरस्तमा पथ्या अजीगः
transliteration: vyuṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānamāghāt | apa druhastama āvarajuṣṭamaṅghirastamā pathyā ajīghaḥ
translation: BORN in the heavens the Dawn hath flushed, and showing her majesty is come as Law ordaineth. She hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness; best of Angirases, hath waked the pathways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 75
sanskrit: महे नो अद्य सुविताय बोध्युषो महे सौभगाय पर यन्धि | चित्रं रयिं यशसं धेह्यस्मे देवि मर्तेषु मानुषि शरवस्युम
transliteration: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhyuṣo mahe saubhaghāya pra yandhi | citraṃ rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehyasme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum
translation: Rouse us this day to high and happy fortune: to great felicity, O Dawn, promote us. Vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches, famed among mortals, man-befriending Goddess!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 75
sanskrit: एते तये भानवो दर्शतायाश्चित्रा उषसो अम्र्तास आगुः | जनयन्तो दैव्यानि वरतान्याप्र्णन्तो अन्तरिक्षा वयस्थुः
transliteration: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāścitrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āghuḥ | janayanto daivyāni vratānyāpṛṇanto antarikṣā vyasthuḥ
translation: See, lovely Morning's everlasting splendours, bright with their varied colours, have approached us. Filling the region of mid-air, producing the rites of holy worship, they have mounted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 75
sanskrit: एषा सया युजाना पराकात पञ्च कषितीः परि सद्यो जिगाति | अभिपश्यन्ती वयुना जनानां दिवो दुहिता भुवनस्यपत्नी
transliteration: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jighāti | abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṃ divo duhitā bhuvanasyapatnī
translation: She yokes her chariot far away, and swiftly visits the lands where the Five Tribes are settled, Looking upon the works and ways of mortals, Daughter of Heaven, the world's Imperial Lady.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 75
sanskrit: वाजिनीवती सूर्यस्य योषा चित्रामघा राय ईशे वसूनाम | रषिष्टुता जरयन्ती मघोन्युषा उछति वह्निभिर्ग्र्णाना
transliteration: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām |
translation: She who is rich in spoil, the Spouse of Surya, wondrously opulent, rules all wealth and treasures. Consumer of our youth, the seers extol her: lauded by priests rich Dawn shines out refulgent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: उदु जयोतिरम्र्तं विश्वजन्यं विश्वानरः सविता देवो अश्रेत | करत्वा देवानामजनिष्ट चक्षुराविरकर्भुवनंविश्वमुषाः
transliteration: udu jyotiramṛtaṃ viśvajanyaṃ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret | kratvā devānāmajaniṣṭa cakṣurāvirakarbhuvanaṃviśvamuṣāḥ
translation: SAVITAR God of all men hath sent upward his light, designed for all mankind, immortal. Through the Gods' power that Eye was first created. Dawn hath made all the universe apparent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: पर मे पन्था देवयाना अद्र्श्रन्नमर्धन्तो वसुभिरिष्क्र्तासः | अभूदु केतुरुषसः पुरस्तात परतीच्यागादधि हर्म्येभ्यः
transliteration: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrannamardhanto vasubhiriṣkṛtāsaḥ | abhūdu keturuṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcyāghādadhi harmyebhyaḥ
translation: I see the paths which Gods are wont to travel, innocuous paths made ready by the Vasus. Eastward the flag of Dawn hath been uplifted; she hath come hither o'er the tops of houses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: तानीदहानि बहुलान्यासन या पराचीनमुदिता सूर्यस्य | यतः परि जार इवाचरन्त्युषो दद्र्क्षे न पुनर्यतीव
transliteration: tānīdahāni bahulānyāsan yā prācīnamuditā sūryasya | yataḥ pari jāra ivācarantyuṣo dadṛkṣe na punaryatīva
translation: Great is, in truth, the number of the Mornings which were aforetime at the Sun's uprising. Since thou, O Dawn, hast been beheld repairing as to thy love, as one no more to leave him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: त इद देवानां सधमाद आसन्न्र्तावानः कवयः पूर्व्यासः | गूळ्हं जयोतिः पितरो अन्वविन्दन सत्यमन्त्रा अजनयन्नुषासम
transliteration: ta id devānāṃ sadhamāda āsannṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrigvedayāsaḥ | ghūḷhaṃ jyotiḥ pitaro anvavindan satyamantrā ajanayannuṣāsam
translation: They were the Gods' companions at the banquet, the ancient sages true to Law Eternal. The Fathers found the light that lay in darkness, and with effectual words begat the Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: समान ऊर्वे अधि संगतासः सं जानते न यतन्ते मिथस्ते | ते देवानां न मिनन्ति वरतान्यमर्धन्तो वसुभिर्यादमानाः
transliteration: samāna ūrigvedae adhi saṃghatāsaḥ saṃ jānate na yatante mithaste | te devānāṃ na minanti vratānyamardhanto vasubhiryādamānāḥ
translation: Meeting together in the same enclosure, they strive not, of one mind, one with another. They never break the Gods' eternal statutes, and injure none, in rivalry with Vasus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: परति तवा सतोमैरीळते वसिष्ठा उषर्बुधः सुभगे तुष्टुवांसः | गवां नेत्री वाजपत्नी न उछोषः सुजाते परथमा जरस्व
transliteration: prati tvā stomairīḷate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhaghe tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ | ghavāṃ netrī vājapatnī na uchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva
translation: Extolling thee, Blest Goddess, the Vasisthas, awake at early mom, with lauds implore thee. Leader of kine and Queen of all that strengthens, shine, come as first to us, O high-born Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 76
sanskrit: एषा नेत्री राधसः सून्र्तानामुषा उछन्ती रिभ्यते वसिष्ठैः | दीर्घश्रुतं रयिमस्मे दधाना यूयं पात . ..
transliteration: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānāmuṣā uchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ | dīrghaśrutaṃ rayimasme dadhānā yūyaṃ pāta . ..
translation: She bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices. The flushing Dawn is sung by the Vasisthas, Giving us riches famed to distant places. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: उपो रुरुचे युवतिर्न योषा विश्वं जीवं परसुवन्ती चरायै | अभूदग्निः समिधे मानुषाणामकर्ज्योतिर्बाधमाना तमांसि
transliteration: upo ruruce yuvatirna yoṣā viśvaṃ jīvaṃ prasuvantī carāyai | abhūdaghniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇāmakarjyotirbādhamānā tamāṃsi
translation: SHE hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature. Agni hath come to feed on mortal? fuel. She hath made light and chased away the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: विश्वं परतीची सप्रथा उदस्थाद रुशद वासो बिभ्रतीशुक्रमश्वैत | हिरण्यवर्णा सुद्र्शीकसन्द्र्ग गवां मातानेत्र्यह्नामरोचि
transliteration: viśvaṃ pratīcī saprathā udasthād ruśad vāso bibhratīśukramaśvait | hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasandṛgh ghavāṃ mātānetryahnāmaroci
translation: Turned to this All, far-spreading, she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her. She hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours, Mother of kine, Guide of the days she bringeth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: देवानां चक्षुः सुभगा वहन्ती शवेतं नयन्ती सुद्र्शीकमश्वम | उषा अदर्शि रश्मिभिर्व्यक्ता चित्रामघा विश्वमनु परभूता
transliteration: devānāṃ cakṣuḥ subhaghā vahantī śvetaṃ nayantī sudṛśīkamaśvam | uṣā adarśi raśmibhirigvedayaktā citrāmaghā viśvamanu prabhūtā
translation: Bearing the Gods' own Eye, auspicious Lady, leading her Courser white and fair to look on, Distinguished by her bean-is Dawn shines apparent, come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: अन्तिवामा दूरे अमित्रमुछोर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं कर्धी नः | यावय दवेष आ भरा वसूनि चोदय राधो गर्णते मघोनि
transliteration: antivāmā dūre amitramuchorigvedaīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ kṛdhī naḥ | yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho ghṛṇate maghoni
translation: Draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman: prepare for us wide pasture free from danger. Drive away those who hate us, bring us riches: pour bounty, opulent Lady, on the singer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: अस्मे शरेष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्वि भाह्युषो देवि परतिरन्ती न आयुः | इषं च नो दधती विश्ववारे गोमदश्वावद रथवच्च राधः
transliteration: asme śreṣṭhebhirbhānubhirigveda bhāhyuṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ | iṣaṃ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre ghomadaśvāvad rathavacca rādhaḥ
translation: Send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us, giving us lengthened days, O Dawn, O Goddess, Granting us food, thou who hast all things precious, and bounty rich in chariots, kine, and horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 77
sanskrit: यां तवा दिवो दुहितर्वर्धयन्त्युषः सुजाते मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः | सास्मासु धा रयिं रष्वं बर्हन्तं यूयं पात .. .
transliteration: yāṃ tvā divo duhitarigvedaardhayantyuṣaḥ sujāte matibhirigvedaasiṣṭhāḥ | sāsmāsu dhā rayiṃ ṛṣvaṃ bṛhantaṃ yūyaṃ pāta .. .
translation: O Usas, nobly-born, Daughter of Heaven, whom the Vasisthas with their hymns make mighty, Bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 78
sanskrit: परति केतवः परथमा अद्र्श्रन्नूर्ध्वा अस्या अञ्जयो वि शरयन्ते | उषो अर्वाचा बर्हता रथेन जयोतिष्मता वाममस्मभ्यं वक्षि
transliteration: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrannūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante | uṣo arigvedaācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmamasmabhyaṃ vakṣi
translation: WE have beheld her earliest lights approaching: her many glories part, on high, asunder. On car sublime, refulgent, wending hither, O Usas, bring the Wealth that makes us happy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 78
sanskrit: परति षीमग्निर्जरते समिद्धः परति विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्तः | उषा याति जयोतिषा बाधमाना विश्वा तमांसि दुरिताप देवी
transliteration: prati ṣīmaghnirjarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhirghṛṇantaḥ | uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritāpa devī
translation: The fire well-kindIed sings aloud to greet her, and with their hymns the priests are chaming welcome. Usas approaches in her splendour, driving all evil darkness far away, the Goddess.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 78
sanskrit: एता उ तयाः परत्यद्र्श्रन पुरस्ताज्ज्योतिर्यछन्तीरुषसोविभातीः | अजीजनन सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निमपाचीनं तमो अगादजुष्टम
transliteration: etā u tyāḥ pratyadṛśran purastājjyotiryachantīruṣasovibhātīḥ | ajījanan sūryaṃ yajñamaghnimapācīnaṃ tamo aghādajuṣṭam
translation: Apparent eastward are those lights of Morning, sending out lustre, as they rise, around them. She hath brought forth Sun, sacrifice, and Agni, and far away hath fled detested darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अचेति दिवो दुहिता मघोनी विश्वे पश्यन्त्युषसं विभातीम | आस्थाद रथं सवधया युज्यमानमा यमश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्ति
transliteration: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyantyuṣasaṃ vibhātīm |
translation: Rich Daughter of the Sky, we all behold her, yea, all men look on Dawn as she is breaking. Her car that moves self-harnessed hath she mounted, the car drawn onward by her well-yoked horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 79
sanskrit: वयुषा आवः पथ्या जनानां पञ्च कषितीर्मानुषीर्बोधयन्ती | सुसन्द्र्ग्भिरुक्षभिर्भानुमश्रेद वि सूर्यो रोदसी चक्षसावः
transliteration: vyuṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānāṃ pañca kṣitīrmānuṣīrbodhayantī | susandṛghbhirukṣabhirbhānumaśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ
translation: ROUSING the lands where men's Five Tribes are settled, Dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people. She hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen. The Sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 79
sanskrit: वयञ्जते दिवो अन्तेष्वक्तून विशो न युक्ता उषसो यतन्ते | सं ते गावस्तम आ वर्तयन्ति जयोतिर्यछन्ति सवितेव बाहू
transliteration: vyañjate divo anteṣvaktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante | saṃ te ghāvastama ā vartayanti jyotiryachanti saviteva bāhū
translation: They paint their bright rays on the sky's far limits. the Dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle. Thy cattle, closely shutting up the darkness, as Savitar spreads his arms, give forth their lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 79
sanskrit: अभूदुषा इन्द्रतमा मघोन्यजीजनत सुविताय शरवांसि | वि दिवो देवी दुहिता दधात्यङगिरस्तमा सुक्र्ते वसूनि
transliteration: abhūduṣā indratamā maghonyajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi | vi divo devī duhitā dadhātyaṅghirastamā sukṛte vasūni
translation: Wealthy, most like to Indra, Dawn hath risen, and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare. Daughter of Heaven, a Goddess, she distributes, best of Angirases, treasures to the pious.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 79
sanskrit: तावदुषो राधो अस्मभ्यं रास्व यावत सतोत्र्भ्यो अरदो गर्णाना | यां तवा जज्ञुर्व्र्षभस्या रवेण वि दर्ळ्हस्य दुरो अद्रेरौर्णोः
transliteration: tāvaduṣo rādho asmabhyaṃ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado ghṛṇānā | yāṃ tvā jajñurigvedaṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duro adreraurṇoḥ
translation: Bestow on us, O Dawn, that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises; Thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened: thou didst unbar the firm-set mountain's portals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 79
sanskrit: देवं-देवं राधसे चोदयन्त्यस्मद्र्यक सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती | वयुछन्ती नः सनये धियो धा यूयं पात ...
transliteration: devaṃ-devaṃ rādhase codayantyasmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī | vyuchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: Impelling every God to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices, Vouchsafe us thoughts, for profit, as thou breakest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 80
sanskrit: परति सतोमेभिरुषसं वसिष्ठा गीर्भिर्विप्रासः परथमा अबुध्रन | विवर्तयन्तीं रजसी समन्ते आविष्क्र्ण्वतीं भुवनानि विश्वा
transliteration: prati stomebhiruṣasaṃ vasiṣṭhā ghīrbhirigvedaprāsaḥ prathamā abudhran | vivartayantīṃ rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīṃ bhuvanāni viśvā
translation: THE priests, Vasisthas, are the first awakened to welcome Usas with their songs and praises, Who makes surrounding regions part asunder, and shows apparent all existing creatures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 80
sanskrit: एषा सया नव्यमायुर्दधाना गूढ्वी तमो जयोतिषोषाबोधि | अग्र एति युवतिरह्रयाणा पराचिकितत सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निम
transliteration: eṣā syā navyamāyurdadhānā ghūḍhvī tamo jyotiṣoṣāabodhi | aghra eti yuvatirahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryaṃ yajñamaghnim
translation: Giving fresh life when she hath hid the darkness, this Dawn hath wakened there with new-born lustre. Youthful and unrestrained she cometh forward: she hath turned thoughts to Sun and fire and worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो ...
transliteration: aśvāvatīrghomatīrna uṣāso ...
translation: May blessed Mornings shine on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes, Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 81
sanskrit: परत्यु अदर्श्यायत्युछन्ती दुहिता दिवः | अपो महि वययति चक्षसे तमो जयोतिष कर्णोति सूनरी
transliteration: pratyu adarśyāyatyuchantī duhitā divaḥ | apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī
translation: ADVANCING, sending forth her rays, the Daughter of the Sky is seen. Uncovering, that we may see, the mighty gloom, the friendly Lady makes the light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 81
sanskrit: उदुस्रियाः सर्जते सूर्यः सचानुद्यन नक्षत्रमर्चिवत | तवेदुषो वयुषि सूर्यस्य च सं भक्तेन गमेमहि
transliteration: udusriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacānudyan nakṣatramarcivat | taveduṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca saṃ bhaktena ghamemahi
translation: The Sun ascending, the refulgent Star, pours down his beams together with the Dawn. O Dawn, at thine arising, and the Sun's, may we attain the share allotted us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 81
sanskrit: परति तवा दुहितर्दिव उषो जीरा अभुत्स्महि | या वहसि पुरुस्पार्हं वनन्वति रत्नं न दाशुषे मयः
transliteration: prati tvā duhitardiva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi | yā vahasi puruspārhaṃ vananvati ratnaṃ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translation: Promptly we woke to welcome thee, O Usas, Daughter of the Sky, Thee, Bounteous One, who bringest all we long to have, and to the offerer health and wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 81
sanskrit: उछन्ती या कर्णोषि मंहना महि परख्यै देवि सवर्द्र्शे | तस्यास्ते रत्नभाज ईमहे वयं सयाम मातुर्न सूनवः
transliteration: uchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svardṛśe | tasyāste ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṃ syāma māturna sūnavaḥ
translation: Thou, dawning, workest fain to light the great world, yea, heaven, Goddess! that it may be seen. We yearn to be thine own, Dealer of Wealth: may we be to this Mother like her sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 81
sanskrit: तच्चित्रं राध आ भरोषो यद दीर्घश्रुत्तमम | यत तेदिवो दुहितर्मर्तभोजनं तद रास्व भुनजामहै
transliteration: taccitraṃ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam | yat tedivo duhitarmartabhojanaṃ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai
translation: Bring us that wondrous bounty, Dawn, that shall be famed most far away. What, Child of Heaven, thou hast of nourishment for man, bestow thou on us to enjoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 82
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा युवमध्वराय नो विशे जनाय महि शर्म यछतम | दीर्घप्रयज्युमति यो वनुष्यति वयं जयेम पर्तनासु दूढ्यः
transliteration: indrāvaruṇā yuvamadhvarāya no viśe janāya mahi śarma yachatam | dīrghaprayajyumati yo vanuṣyati vayaṃ jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ
translation: GRANT us your strong protection, Indra-Varuna, our people, and our family, for sacrifice. May we subdue in fight our evil-hearted foes, him who attacks the man steadfast in lengthened rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 82
sanskrit: सम्राळ अन्यः सवराळ अन्य उच्यते वां महान्ताविन्द्रावरुणा महावसू | विश्वे देवासः परमे वयोमनि सं वामोजोव्र्षणा सं बलं दधुः
transliteration: samrāḷ anyaḥ svarāḷ anya ucyate vāṃ mahāntāvindrāvaruṇā mahāvasū | viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani saṃ vāmojovṛṣaṇā saṃ balaṃ dadhuḥ
translation: O Indra-Varuna, mighty and very rich One of you is called Monarch and One Autocrat. All Gods in the most lofty region of the air have, O ye Steers, combined all power and might in you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 82
sanskrit: अन्वपां खान्यत्र्न्तमोजसा सूर्यमैरयतं दिवि परभु
transliteration: anvapāṃ khānyatṛntamojasā sūryamairayataṃ divi prabhu
translation: Ye with your strength have pierced the fountains of the floods: the Sun have ye brought forward as the Lord in heaven. Cheered by this magic draught ye, Indra-Varuna, made the dry places stream, made songs of praise flow forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 82
sanskrit: म | इन्द्रावरुणा मदे अस्य मायिनो.अपिन्वतमपितः पिन्वतं धियः
transliteration: m | indrāvaruṇā made asya māyino.apinvatamapitaḥ pinvataṃ dhiyaḥ
translation: In battels and in frays we ministering priests, kneeling upon our knees for furtherance of our weal, Invoke you, only you, the Lords of twofold wealth, you prompt to hear, we bards, O Indra-Varuna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 82
sanskrit: युवामिद युत्सु पर्तनासु वह्नयो युवां कषेमस्य परसवे मितज्ञवः | ईशाना वस्व उभयस्य कारव इन्द्रावरुणा सुहवा हवामहे
transliteration: yuvāmid yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayo yuvāṃ kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ |
translation: O Indra-Varuna, as ye created all these creatures of the world by your surpassing might, In peace and quiet Mitra waits on Varuna, the Other, awful, with the Maruis seeks renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: युवां नरा पश्यमानास आप्यं पराचा गव्यन्तः पर्थुपर्शवो ययुः | दासा च वर्त्रा हतमार्याणि च सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणावसावतम
transliteration: yuvāṃ narā paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ prācā ghavyantaḥ pṛthuparśavo yayuḥ | dāsā ca vṛtrā hatamāryāṇi ca sudāsamindrāvaruṇāvasāvatam
translation: LOOKING to you and your alliance, O ye Men, armed with broad axes they went forward, fain for spoil. Ye smote and slew his Dasa and his Aryan enemies, and helped Sudas with favour, Indra-Varuna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: यत्रा नरः समयन्ते कर्तध्वजो यस्मिन्नाजा भवति किंचन परियम | यत्रा भयन्ते भुवना सवर्द्र्शस्तत्रा न इन्द्रावरुणाधि वोचतम
transliteration: yatrā naraḥ samayante kṛtadhvajo yasminnājā bhavati kiṃcana priyam | yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svardṛśastatrā na indrāvaruṇādhi vocatam
translation: Where heroes come together with their banners raised, in the encounter where is naught for us to love, Where all things that behold the light are terrified, there did ye comfort us, O Indra-Varuna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: सं भूम्या अन्ता धवसिरा अद्र्क्षतेन्द्रावरुणा दिवि घोषारुहत | अस्थुर्जनानामुप मामरातयो.अर्वागवसा हवनश्रुता गतम
transliteration: saṃ bhūmyā antā dhvasirā adṛkṣatendrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣaāruhat | asthurjanānāmupa māmarātayo.arigvedaāghavasā havanaśrutā ghatam
translation: The boundaries of earth were seen all dark with dust: O Indra-Varuna, the shout went up to heaven. The enmities of the people compassed me about. Ye heard my calling and ye came to me with help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणा वधनाभिरप्रति भेदं वन्वन्ता पर सुदासमावतम | बरह्माण्येषां शर्णुतं हवीमनि सत्या तर्त्सूनामभवत पुरोहितिः
transliteration: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhiraprati bhedaṃ vanvantā pra sudāsamāvatam | brahmāṇyeṣāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havīmani satyā tṛtsūnāmabhavat purohitiḥ
translation: With your resistless weapons, Indra-Varuna, ye conquered Bheda and ye gave Sudas your aid. Ye heard the prayers of these amid the cries of war: effectual was the service of the Trtsus' priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: इन्द्रावरुणावभ्या तपन्ति माघान्यर्यो वनुषामरातयः | युवं हि वस्व उभयस्य राजथो.अध समा नो.अवतं पार्ये दिवि
transliteration: indrāvaruṇāvabhyā tapanti māghānyaryo vanuṣāmarātayaḥ | yuvaṃ hi vasva ubhayasya rājatho.adha smā no.avataṃ pārye divi
translation: O Indra-Varuna, the wickedness of foes and mine assailants' hatred sorely trouble me. Ye Twain are Lords of riches both of earth and heaven: so grant to us your aid on the decisive day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: युवां हवन्त उभयास आजिष्विन्द्रं च वस्वो वरुणं चसातये | यत्र राजभिर्दशभिर्निबाधितं पर सुदासमावतं तर्त्सुभिः सह
transliteration: yuvāṃ havanta ubhayāsa ājiṣvindraṃ ca vasvo varuṇaṃ casātaye | yatra rājabhirdaśabhirnibādhitaṃ pra sudāsamāvataṃ tṛtsubhiḥ saha
translation: The men of both the hosts invoked you in the fight, Indra and Varuna, that they might win the wealth, What time ye helped Sudas, with all the Trtsu folk, when the Ten Kings had pressed him down in their attack.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: दश राजानः समिता अयज्यवः सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणा न युयुधुः | सत्या नर्णामद्मसदामुपस्तुतिर्देवा एषामभवन देवहूतिषु
transliteration: daśa rājānaḥ samitā ayajyavaḥ sudāsamindrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ | satyā nṛṇāmadmasadāmupastutirdevā eṣāmabhavan devahūtiṣu
translation: Ten Kings who worshipped not, O Indra-Varuna, confederate, in war prevailed not o'er Sudas. True was the boast of heroes sitting at the feast: so at their invocations Gods were on their side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 83
sanskrit: दाशराज्ञे परियत्ताय विश्वतः सुदास इन्द्रावरुणावशिक्षतम | शवित्यञ्चो यत्र नमसा कपर्दिनो धिया धीवन्तो असपन्त तर्त्सवः
transliteration: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvataḥ sudāsa indrāvaruṇāvaśikṣatam |
translation: O Indra-Varuna, ye gave Sudas your aid when the Ten Kings in battle compassed him about, There where the white-robed Trtsus with their braided hair, skilled in song worshipped you with homage and with hymn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 84
sanskrit: आ वां राजानावध्वरे वव्र्त्यां हव्येभिरिन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः | पर वां घर्ताची बाह्वोर्दधाना परि तमना विषुरूपा जिगाति
transliteration: pra vāṃ ghṛtācī bāhvordadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jighāti
translation: KINGS, Indra-Varuna, I would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage. Held in both arms the ladle, dropping fatness, goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 84
sanskrit: युवो राष्ट्रं बर्हदिन्वति दयौर्यौ सेत्र्भिररज्जुभिः सिनीथः | परि नो हेळो वरुणस्य वर्ज्या उरुं न इन्द्रः कर्णवदु लोकम
transliteration: yuvo rāṣṭraṃ bṛhadinvati dyauryau setṛbhirarajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ | pari no heḷo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṃ na indraḥ kṛṇavadu lokam
translation: Dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage. Far from us still be Varuna's displeasure may Indra give us spacious room to dwell in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 84
sanskrit: कर्तं नो यज्ञं विदथेषु चारुं कर्तं बरह्माणि सूरिषुप्रशस्ता | उपो रयिर्देवजूतो न एतु पर णः सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेतम
transliteration: kṛtaṃ no yajñaṃ vidatheṣu cāruṃ kṛtaṃ brahmāṇi sūriṣupraśastā | upo rayirdevajūto na etu pra ṇaḥ spārhābhirūtibhistiretam
translation: Make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies: make ye our prayers approved among our princes. May God-sent riches come for our possession: further ye us with your delightful succours.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 84
sanskrit: अस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा विश्ववारं रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम | पर य आदित्यो अन्र्ता मिनात्यमिता शूरो दयते वसूनि
transliteration: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṃ rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ purukṣum | pra ya ādityo anṛtā minātyamitā śūro dayate vasūni
translation: O Indra-Varuna, vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure, food, and every blessing; For the Aditya, banisher of falsehood, the Hero, dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 84
sanskrit: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः परावत तोके तनये तूतुजाना | सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात ...
transliteration: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me ghīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā | suratnāso devavītiṃ ghamema yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: May this my song reach Varuna and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring. To the Gods' banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 85
sanskrit: पुनीषे वामरक्षसं मनीषां सोममिन्द्राय वरुणाय जुह्वत | घर्तप्रतीकामुषसं न देवीं ता नो यामन्नुरुष्यतामभीके
transliteration: punīṣe vāmarakṣasaṃ manīṣāṃ somamindrāya varuṇāya juhvat | ghṛtapratīkāmuṣasaṃ na devīṃ tā no yāmannuruṣyatāmabhīke
translation: FOR you I deck a harmless hymn, presenting the Soma juice to Varuna and Indra- A hymn that shines like heavenly Dawn with fatness. May they be near us on the march and guard us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 85
sanskrit: सपर्धन्ते वा उ देवहूये अत्र येषु धवजेषु दिद्यवः पतन्ति | युवं तानिन्द्रावरुणावमित्रान हतं पराचः शर्वा विषूचः
transliteration: spardhante vā u devahūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti | yuvaṃ tānindrāvaruṇāvamitrān hataṃ parācaḥ śarigvedaā viṣūcaḥ
translation: Here where the arrows fall amid the banners both hosts invoke the Gods in emulation. O Indra-Varuna, smite back those-our foemen, yea, smite them with your shaft to every quarter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: धीरा तवस्य महिना जनूंषि वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी चिदुर्वी | पर नाकं रष्वं नुनुदे बर्हन्तं दविता नक्षत्रम्पप्रथच्च भूम
transliteration: dhīrā tvasya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yastastambha rodasī cidurigvedaī | pra nākaṃ ṛṣvaṃ nunude bṛhantaṃ dvitā nakṣatrampaprathacca bhūma
translation: WISE, verily, are creatures through his greatness who stayed ever, spacious heaven and earth asunder; Who urged the high and mighty sky to motion, the Star of old, and spread the earth before him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: उत सवया तन्वा सं वदे तत कदा नवन्तर्वरुणे भुवानि | किं मे हव्यमह्र्णानो जुषेत कदा मर्ळीकं सुमना अभि खयम
transliteration: uta svayā tanvā saṃ vade tat kadā nvantarigvedaaruṇe bhuvāni | kiṃ me havyamahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkaṃ sumanā abhi khyam
translation: With mine own heart I commune on the question how Varuna and I may be united. What gift of mine will he accept unangered? When may I calmly look and find him gracious?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पर्छे तदेनो वरुण दिद्र्क्षूपो एमि चिकितुषो विप्र्छम | समानमिन मे कवयश्चिदाहुरयं ह तुभ्यं वरुणो हर्णीते
transliteration: pṛche tadeno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛcham | samānamin me kavayaścidāhurayaṃ ha tubhyaṃ varuṇo hṛṇīte
translation: Fain to know this in I question others: I seek the wise, O Varuna, and ask them. This one same answer even the sages gave me, "Surely this Varuna is angry with thee."

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: किमाग आस वरुण जयेष्ठं यत सतोतारं जिघांससि सखायम | पर तन मे वोचो दूळभ सवधावो.अव तवानेना नमसा तुर इयाम
transliteration: kimāgha āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṃ yat stotāraṃ jighāṃsasi sakhāyam | pra tan me voco dūḷabha svadhāvo.ava tvānenā namasā tura iyām
translation: What, Varuna, hath been my chief transgression, that thou wouldst slay the friend who sings thy praises? Tell me, Unconquerable Lord, and quickly sinless will I approach thee with mine homage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अव दरुग्धानि पित्र्या सर्जा नो.अव या वयं चक्र्मा तनूभिः | अव राजन पशुत्र्पं न तायुं सर्जा वत्सं न दाम्नो वसिष्ठम
transliteration: ava drughdhāni pitryā sṛjā no.ava yā vayaṃ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ | ava rājan paśutṛpaṃ na tāyuṃ sṛjā vatsaṃ na dāmno vasiṣṭham
translation: Free us from sins committed by our fathers, from those wherein we have ourselves offended. O King, loose, like a thief who feeds the cattle, as from the cord a calf, set free Vasistha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: न स सवो दक्षो वरुण धरुतिः सा सुरा मन्युर्विभीदकोचित्तिः | अस्ति जयायान कनीयस उपारे सवप्नश्चनेदन्र्तस्य परयोता
transliteration: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyurigvedabhīdakoacittiḥ | asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaścanedanṛtasya prayotā
translation: Not our own will betrayed us, but seduction, thoughtlessness, Varuna wine, dice, or anger. The old is near to lead astray the younger: even sleep removeth not all evil-doing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अरं दासो न मीळ्हुषे कराण्यहं देवाय भूर्णये.अनागाः | अचेतयदचितो देवो अर्यो गर्त्सं राये कवितरो जुनाति
transliteration: araṃ dāso na mīḷhuṣe karāṇyahaṃ devāya bhūrṇaye.anāghāḥ | acetayadacito devo aryo ghṛtsaṃ rāye kavitaro junāti
translation: Slave like may I do service to the Bounteous, serve, free from sin, the God inclined to anger. This gentle Lord gives wisdom to the simple: the wiser God leads on the wise to riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अयं सु तुभ्यं वरुण सवधावो हर्दि सतोम उपश्रितश्चिदस्तु | शं नः कषेमे शमु योगे नो अस्तु यूयं पात ...
transliteration: ayaṃ su tubhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaścidastu |
translation: O Lord, O Varuna, may this laudation come close to them and lie within thy spirit. May it be well with us in rest and labour. Preserve us ever-more, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 87
sanskrit: रदत पथो वरुणः सूर्याय परार्णांसि समुद्रिया नदीनाम | सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अर्वतीरतायञ्चकार महीरवनीरहभ्यः
transliteration: radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām | sargho na sṛṣṭo arigvedaatīrtāyañcakāra mahīravanīrahabhyaḥ
translation: VARUNA cut a pathway out for Surya, and led the watery floods of rivers onward. The Mares, as in a race, speed on in order. He made great channels for the days to follow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 88
sanskrit: पर शुन्ध्युवं वरुणाय परेष्ठां मतिं वसिष्ठ मीळ्हुषे भरस्व | य ईमर्वाञ्चं करते यजत्रं सहस्रामघं वर्षणं बर्हन्तम
transliteration: pra śundhyuvaṃ varuṇāya preṣṭhāṃ matiṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhuṣe bharasva | ya īmarigvedaāñcaṃ karate yajatraṃ sahasrāmaghaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bṛhantam
translation: PRESENT to Varuna thine hymn, Vasistha, bright, most delightful to the Bounteous Giver, Who bringeth on to us the Bull, the lofty, the Holy, laden with a thousand treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 88
sanskrit: अधा नवस्य सन्द्र्शं जगन्वानग्नेरनीकं वरुणस्य मंसि | सवर्यदश्मन्नधिपा उ अन्धो.अभि मा वपुर्द्र्शये निनीयात
transliteration: adhā nvasya sandṛśaṃ jaghanvānaghneranīkaṃ varuṇasya maṃsi | svaryadaśmannadhipā u andho.abhi mā vapurdṛśaye ninīyāt
translation: And now, as I am come before his presence, I take the face of Varuna for Agni's. So might he bring-Lord also of the darkness-the light in heaven that I may see its beauty!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 89
sanskrit: मो षु वरुण मर्न्मयं गर्हं राजन्नहं गमम | मर्ळा सुक्षत्र मर्ळय
transliteration: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṃ ghṛhaṃ rājannahaṃ ghamam | mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya
translation: LET me not yet, King Varuna, enter into the house of clay: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 89
sanskrit: यदेमि परस्फुरन्निव दर्तिर्न धमातो अद्रिवः | मर्ळा स. म.
transliteration: yademi prasphuranniva dṛtirna dhmāto adrivaḥ | mṛḷā s. m.
translation: When, Thunderer! I move along tremulous like a wind-blown skin, Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 89
sanskrit: करत्वः समह दीनता परतीपं जगमा शुचे | मर्ळा स. म.
transliteration: kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṃ jaghamā śuce | mṛḷā s. m.
translation: O Bright and Powerful God, through want of strength I erred and went astray Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 89
sanskrit: अपां मध्ये तस्थिवांसं तर्ष्णाविदज्जरितारम | मर्ळा स. म.
transliteration: apāṃ madhye tasthivāṃsaṃ tṛṣṇāvidajjaritāram | mṛḷā s. m.
translation: Thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of water-fjords: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 89
sanskrit: यत किं चेदं वरुण दैव्ये जने.अभिद्रोहं मनुष्याश्चरामसि | अचित्ती यत तव धर्मा युयोपिम मा नस्तस्मादेनसो देव रीरिषः
transliteration: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane.abhidrohaṃ manuṣyāścarāmasi | acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nastasmādenaso deva rīriṣaḥ
translation: O Varuna, whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host, When through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 90
sanskrit: पर वीरया शुचयो दद्रिरे वामध्वर्युभिर्मधुमन्तः सुतासः | वह वायो नियुतो याह्यछा पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो मदाय
transliteration: pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vāmadhvaryubhirmadhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ | vaha vāyo niyuto yāhyachā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya
translation: To you pure juice, rich in meath, are offered by priest: through longing for the Pair of Heroes. Drive, Vayu, bring thine harnessed horses hither: drink the pressed Soma till it make thee joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 91
sanskrit: कुविदङग नमसा ये वर्धासः पुरा देवा अनवद्यास आसन | ते वायवे मनवे बाधितायावासयन्नुषसं सूर्येण
transliteration: kuvidaṅgha namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devā anavadyāsa āsan | te vāyave manave bādhitāyāvāsayannuṣasaṃ sūryeṇa
translation: WERE not in sooth, the Gods aforetime blameless, whose pleasure was increased by adoration? For Vayu and for man in his affliction they caused the Morning to arise with Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 91
sanskrit: उशन्ता दूता न दभाय गोपा मासश्च पाथः शरदश्च पूर्वीः | इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिर्वामियाना मार्डीकमीट्टे सुवितं च नव्यम
transliteration: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya ghopā māsaśca pāthaḥ śaradaśca pūrigvedaīḥ | indravāyū suṣṭutirigvedaāmiyānā mārḍīkamīṭṭe suvitaṃ ca navyam
translation: Guardians infallible, eager as envoys' preserve us safe through many months and autumns. Addressed to you, our fair praise, Indra-Vayu, implores your favour and renewed well-being.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 91
sanskrit: पीवोन्नान रयिव्र्धः सुमेधाः शवेतः सिषक्ति नियुतामभिश्रीः | ते वायवे समनसो वि तस्थुर्विश्वेन नरः सवपत्यानि चक्रुः
transliteration: pīvoannān rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutāmabhiśrīḥ | te vāyave samanaso vi tasthurigvedaśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ
translation: Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he. seeketh men with rich food whose treasures are abundant. They have arranged them of one mind with Vayu: the men have wrought all noble operations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 91
sanskrit: यावत तरस्तन्वो यावदोजो यावन नरश्चक्षसा दीध्यानाः | शुचिं सोमं शुचिपा पातमस्मे इन्द्रवायू सदतम्बर्हिरेदम
transliteration: yāvat tarastanvo yāvadojo yāvan naraścakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ |
translation: So far as native power and strength permit you, so far as men behold whose eyes have vision, O ye pure-drinkers, drink with us pure Soma: sit on this sacred grass, Indra and Vayu.
