title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 92
sanskrit: आ वायो भूष शुचिपा उप नः सहस्रं ते नियुतो विश्ववार | उपो ते अन्धो मद्यमयामि यस्य देव दधिषे पूर्वपेयम
transliteration: upo te andho madyamayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrigvedaapeyam
translation: O VAYU, drinker of the pure, be near us: a thousand teams are thine, Allbounteous Giver. To thee the rapture-bringing juice is offered, whose first draught, God, thou takest as thy portion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 92
sanskrit: पर सोता जीरो अध्वरेष्वस्थात सोममिन्द्राय वायवे पिबध्यै | पर यद वां मध्वो अग्रियं भरन्त्यध्वर्यवो देवयन्तः शचीभिः
transliteration: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣvasthāt somamindrāya vāyave pibadhyai | pra yad vāṃ madhvo aghriyaṃ bharantyadhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ
translation: Prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with Soma-draughts for Indra and for Vayu, When ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you Twain the first taste of the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 92
sanskrit: पर याभिर्यासि दाश्वांसमछा नियुद्भिर्वायविष्टयेदुरोणे | नि नो रयिं सुभोजसं युवस्व नि वीरं गव्यमश्व्यं च राधः
transliteration: pra yābhiryāsi dāśvāṃsamachā niyudbhirigvedaāyaviṣṭayeduroṇe | ni no rayiṃ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ ghavyamaśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ
translation: The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his home, O Vayu, to direct him, Therewith send wealth: to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 92
sanskrit: ये वायव इन्द्रमादनास आदेवासो नितोशनासो अर्यः | घनन्तो वर्त्राणि सूरिभिः षयाम सासह्वांसो युधा नर्भिरमित्रान
transliteration: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ | ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṃso yudhā nṛbhiramitrān
translation: Near to the Gods and making Indra joyful, devout and offering precious gifts to Vayu, Allied with princes, smiting down the hostile, may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: शुचिं नु सतोमं नवजातमद्येन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा जुषेथाम | उभा हि वां सुहवा जोहवीमि ता वाजं सद्य उशतेधेष्ठा
transliteration: ubhā hi vāṃ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṃ sadya uśatedheṣṭhā
translation: SLAYERS of enemies, Indra and Agni, accept this day our new-born pure laudation. Again, again I call you prompt to listen, best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: ता सानसी शवसाना हि भूतं साकंव्र्धा शवसा शूशुवांसा | कषयन्तौ रायो यवसस्य भूरेः पर्ङकतं वाजस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः
transliteration: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṃ sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā | kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṃ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
translation: For ye were strong to gain, exceeding mighty, growing together, waxing in your vigour. Lords of the pasture filled with ample riches, bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: उपो ह यद विदथं वाजिनो गुर्धीभिर्विप्राः परमतिमिछमानाः | अर्वन्तो न काष्ठां नक्षमाणा इन्द्राग्नी जोहुवतो नरस्ते
transliteration: upo ha yad vidathaṃ vājino ghurdhībhirigvedaprāḥ pramatimichamānāḥ | arigvedaanto na kāṣṭhāṃ nakṣamāṇā indrāghnī johuvato naraste
translation: Yea when the strong have entered our assembly, and singers seeking with their hymns your favour, They are like steeds who come into the race-course, those men who call aloud on Indra-Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: गीर्भिर्विप्रः परमतिमिछमान ईट्टे रयिं यशसं पूर्वभाजम | इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा सुवज्रा पर नो नव्येभिस्तिरतं देष्णैः
transliteration: ghīrbhirigvedapraḥ pramatimichamāna īṭṭe rayiṃ yaśasaṃ pūrigvedaabhājam | indrāghnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhistirataṃ deṣṇaiḥ
translation: The singer, seeking with his hymns your favour, begs splendid riches of their first possessor. Further us with new bounties, Indra-Agni, armed with strong thunder, slayers of the foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: सं यन मही मिथती सपर्धमाने तनूरुचा शूरसाता यतैते | अदेवयुं विदथे देवयुभिः सत्रा हतं सोमसुता जनेन
transliteration: saṃ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite | adevayuṃ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṃ somasutā janena
translation: When two great hosts, arrayed against each other, meet clothed with brightness, in the fierce encounter Stand ye beside the godly, smite the godless; and still assist the men who press the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: इमामु षु सोमसुतिमुप न एन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम | नू चिद धि परिमम्नाथे अस्माना वां शश्वद्भिर्वव्र्तीय वाजैः
transliteration: imāmu ṣu somasutimupa na endrāghnī saumanasāya yātam | nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmānā vāṃ śaśvadbhirigvedaavṛtīya vājaiḥ
translation: To this our Soma-pressing, Indra-Agni, come ye prepared to show your loving-kindness, For not at any time have ye despised us. So may I draw you with all strengthenings hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: सो अग्न एना नमसा समिद्धो.अछा मित्रं वरुणमिन्द्रं वोचेः | यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळ तदर्यमादितिःशिश्रथन्तु
transliteration: so aghna enā namasā samiddho.achā mitraṃ varuṇamindraṃ voceḥ | yat sīmāghaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷa tadaryamāditiḥśiśrathantu
translation: So Agni, kindled mid this adoration, invite thou Mitra, Varuna, and Indra. Forgive whatever sin we have committed may Aryaman and Aditi remove it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 93
sanskrit: एता अग्न आशुषाणास इष्टीर्युवोः सचाभ्यश्याम वाजान | मेन्द्रो नो विष्णुर्मरुतः परि खयन यूयं पात ...
transliteration: etā aghna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīryuvoḥ sacābhyaśyāma vājān | mendro no viṣṇurmarutaḥ pari khyan yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: While we accelerate these our sacrifices, may we win strength from both of you, O Agni: Ne'er may the Maruts, Indra, Visnu slight us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 94
sanskrit: इयं वामस्य मन्मन इन्द्राग्नी पूर्व्यस्तुतिः | अभ्राद वर्ष्टिरिवाजनि
transliteration: iyaṃ vāmasya manmana indrāghnī pūrigvedayastutiḥ | abhrād vṛṣṭirivājani
translation: As rain from out the cloud, for you, Indra and Agni, from my soul This noblest praise hath been produced.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: पर कषोदसा धायसा सस्र एषा सरस्वती धरुणमायसी पूः | परबाबधाना रथ्येव याति विश्वा अपो महिना सिन्धुरन्याः
transliteration: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇamāyasī pūḥ | prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhuranyāḥ
translation: THIS stream Sarasvati with fostering current comes forth, our sure defense, our fort of iron. As on a car, the flood flows on, surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: एकाचेतत सरस्वती नदीनां शुचिर्यती गिरिभ्य आ समुद्रात | रायश्चेतन्ती भुवनस्य भूरेर्घ्र्तं पयो दुदुहे नाहुषाय
transliteration: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṃ śuciryatī ghiribhya ā samudrāt | rāyaścetantī bhuvanasya bhūrerghṛtaṃ payo duduhe nāhuṣāya
translation: Pure in her course from mountains to the ocean, alone of streams Sarasvati hath listened. Thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures, she poured for Nahusa her milk and fatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: स वाव्र्धे नर्यो योषणासु वर्षा शिशुर्व्र्षभो यज्ञियासु | स वाजिनं मघवद्भ्यो दधाति वि सातये तन्वं माम्र्जीत
transliteration: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśurigvedaṛṣabho yajñiyāsu | sa vājinaṃ maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvaṃ māmṛjīta
translation: Friendly to man he grew among the women, a strong young Steer amid the Holy Ladies. He gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes, and decks their bodies for success in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: उत सया नः सरस्वती जुषाणोप शरवत सुभगा यज्णे अस्मिन | मितज्ञुभिर्नमस्यैरियाना राया युजा चिदुत्तरा सखिभ्यः
transliteration: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhaghā yajṇe asmin | mitajñubhirnamasyairiyānā rāyā yujā ciduttarā sakhibhyaḥ
translation: May this Sarasvati be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice, auspicious Lady, When we with reverence, on our knees, implore her close-knit to wealth, most kind to those she loveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: इमा जुह्वाना युष्मदा नमोभिः परति सतोमं सरस्वति जुषस्व | तव शर्मन परियतमे दधाना उप सथेयाम शरणं न वर्क्षम
transliteration: imā juhvānā yuṣmadā namobhiḥ prati stomaṃ sarasvati juṣasva | tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṃ na vṛkṣam
translation: These offerings have ye made with adoration: say this, Sarasvati, and accept our praises; And, placing us under thy dear protection, may we approach thee, as a tree, for shelter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 95
sanskrit: अयमु ते सरस्वति वसिष्ठो दवाराव रतस्य सुभगे वयावः | वर्ध शुभ्रे सतुवते रासि वाजान यूयं पात ...
transliteration: ayamu te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhaghe vyāvaḥ | vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyaṃ pāta ...
translation: For thee, O Blest Sarasvati, Vasistha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred Order. Wax, Bright One, and give strength to him who lauds thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: बर्हदु गायिषे वचो.असुर्या नदीनाम | सरस्वतीमिन महयासुव्र्क्तिभिः सतोमैर्वसिष्ठ रोदसी
transliteration: bṛhadu ghāyiṣe vaco.asuryā nadīnām | sarasvatīmin mahayāsuvṛktibhiḥ stomairigvedaasiṣṭha rodasī
translation: I SING a lofty song, for she is mightiest, most divine of Streams. Sarasvati will I exalt with hymns and lauds, and, O Vasistha, Heaven and Earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: उभे यत ते महिना शुभ्रे अन्धसी अधिक्षियन्ति पूरवः | सा नो बोध्यवित्री मरुत्सखा चोद राधो मघोनाम
transliteration: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ | sā no bodhyavitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām
translation: When in the fulness of their strength the Purus dwell, Beauteous One, on thy two grassy banks, Favour us thou who hast the Maruts for thy friends: stir up the bounty of our chiefs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: भद्रमिद भद्रा कर्णवत सरस्वत्यकवारी चेतति वाजिनीवती | गर्णाना जमदग्निवत सतुवाना च वसिष्ठवत
transliteration: bhadramid bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatyakavārī cetati vājinīvatī | ghṛṇānā jamadaghnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat
translation: So may Sarasvati auspicious send good luck; she, rich in spoil, is never niggardly in thought, When praised in Jamadagni's way and lauded as Vasistha lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: जनीयन्तो नवग्रवः पुत्रीयन्तः सुदानवः | सरस्वन्तं हवामहे
transliteration: janīyanto nvaghravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ | sarasvantaṃ havāmahe
translation: We call upon Sarasvan, as unmarried men who long for wives, As liberal men who yearn for sons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: ये ते सरस्व ऊर्मयो मधुमन्तो घर्तश्चुतः | तेभिर्नो.अविता भव
transliteration: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ | tebhirno.avitā bhava
translation: Be thou our kind protector, O Sarasvan, with those waves of thine Laden with sweets and dropping oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 96
sanskrit: पीपिवांसं सरस्वत सतनं यो विश्वदर्षतः | भक्षीमहि परजामिषम
transliteration: pīpivāṃsaṃ sarasvata stanaṃ yo viśvadarṣataḥ | bhakṣīmahi prajāmiṣam
translation: May we enjoy Sarasvan's breast, all-beautiful, that swells with streams, May we gain food and progeny.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 97
sanskrit: यज्ञे दिवो नर्षदने पर्थिव्या नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति | इन्द्राय यत्र सवनानि सुन्वे गमन मदाय परथमं वयश च
transliteration: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti | indrāya yatra savanāni sunve ghaman madāya prathamaṃ vayaś ca
translation: WHERE Heaven and Earth combine in men's assembly, and those who love the Gods delight in worship, Where the libations are effused for Indra, may he come first to drink and make him stronger.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो ऽरुणं दुग्धम अंशुं जुहोतन वर्षभाय कषितीनाम | गौराद वेदीयां अवपानम इन्द्रो विश्वाहेद याति सुतसोमम इछन
transliteration: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dughdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām | ghaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam ichan
translation: PRIESTS, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured. No wild-bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: यद दधिषे परदिवि चार्व अन्नं दिवे-दिवे पीतिम इद अस्य वक्षि | उत हर्दोत मनसा जुषाण उशन्न इन्द्र परस्थितान पाहि सोमान
transliteration: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārigveda annaṃ dive-dive pītim id asya vakṣi | uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān
translation: Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime, O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: जज्ञानः सोमं सहसे पपाथ पर ते माता महिमानम उवाच | एन्द्र पप्राथोर्व अन्तरिक्षं युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश चकर्थ
transliteration: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca | endra paprāthorigveda antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha
translation: Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; the Mother told thee of thy future greatness. O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: यद योधया महतो मन्यमानान साक्षाम तान बाहुभिः शाशदानान | यद वा नर्भिर वर्त इन्द्राभियुध्यास तं तवयाजिं सौश्रवसं जयेम
transliteration: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān | yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema
translation: When thou hast urged the arrogant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them. Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: परेन्द्रस्य वोचम परथमा कर्तानि पर नूतना मघवा या चकार | यदेद अदेवीर असहिष्ट माया अथाभवत केवलः सोमो अस्य
transliteration: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra | yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya
translation: I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished. When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: तवेदं विश्वम अभितः पशव्यं यत पश्यसि चक्षसा सूर्यस्य | गवाम असि गोपतिर एक इन्द्र भक्षीमहि ते परयतस्य वस्वः
transliteration: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya | ghavām asi ghopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
translation: Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Surya thou beholdest. Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle; may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 98
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते युवम इन्द्रश च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य | धत्तं रयिं सतुवते कीरये चिद यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः
transliteration: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya | dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translation: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Brhaspati, and thou, O Indra. Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 99
sanskrit: परो मात्रया तन्व्र वर्धान न ते महित्वम अन्व अश्नुवन्ति | उभे ते विद्म रजसी पर्थिव्या विष्णो देव तवम परमस्य वित्से
transliteration: paro mātrayā tanvṛ vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti | ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse
translation: MEN come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body. Both thy two regions of the earth, O Visnu, we know: thou God, knowest the highest also.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 99
sanskrit: न ते विष्णो जायमानो न जातो देव महिम्नः परम अन्तम आप | उद अस्तभ्ना नाकम रष्वम बर्हन्तं दाधर्थ पराचीं ककुभम पर्थिव्याः
transliteration: na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa | ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ dādhartha prācīṃ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ
translation: None who is born or being born, God Visnu, hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur. The vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported, and fixed earth's eastern pinnacle securely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 99
sanskrit: इरावती धेनुमती हि भूतं सूयवसिनी मनुषे दशस्या | वय अस्तभ्ना रोदसी विष्णव एते दाधर्थ पर्थिवीम अभितो मयूखैः
transliteration: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṃ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā | vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ
translation: Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fain to do men service. Both these worlds, Visnu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 99
sanskrit: उरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुर उलोकं जनयन्ता सूर्यम उषासम अग्निम | दासस्य चिद वर्षशिप्रस्य माया जघ्नथुर नरा पर्तनाज्येषु
transliteration: uruṃ yajñāya cakrathur ulokaṃ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam aghnim | dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu
translation: Ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating Surya, Dawn, and Agni. O Heroes, ye have conquered in your battles even the bull-jawed Dasa's wiles and magic.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 99
sanskrit: इन्द्राविष्णू दरंहिताः शम्बरस्य नव पुरो नवतिं च शनथिष्टम | शतं वर्चिनः सहस्रं च साकं हथो अप्रत्य असुरस्य वीरान
transliteration: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṃ ca śnathiṣṭam |
translation: Ye have destroyed, thou, Indra, and thou Visnu, Sambara's nine-and-ninety fenced castles. Ye Twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal Varcin.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: नू मर्तो दयते सनिष्यन यो विष्णव उरुगायाय दाशत | पर यः सत्राचा मनसा यजात एतावन्तं नर्यम आविवासात
transliteration: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urughāyāya dāśat | pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṃ naryam āvivāsāt
translation: NE'ER doth the man repent, who, seeking profit, bringeth his gift to the far-striding Visnu. He who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: तवं विष्णो सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम अप्रयुताम एवयावो मतिं दाः | पर्चो यथा नः सुवितस्य भूरेर अश्वावतः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः
transliteration: tvaṃ viṣṇo sumatiṃ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṃ dāḥ | parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ
translation: Thou, Visnu, constant in thy courses, gavest good-will to all men, and a hymn that lasteth, That thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: तरिर देवः पर्थिवीम एष एतां वि चक्रमे शतर्चसम महित्वा | पर विष्णुर अस्तु तवसस तवीयान तवेषं हय अस्य सथविरस्य नाम
transliteration: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā | pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṃ hy asya sthavirasya nāma
translation: Three times strode forth this God in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours. Foremost be Visnu, stronger than the strongest: for glorious is his name who lives for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: वि चक्रमे पर्थिवीम एष एतां कषेत्राय विष्णुर मनुषे दशस्यन | धरुवासो अस्य कीरयो जनास उरुक्षितिं सुजनिमा चकार
transliteration: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan | dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṃ sujanimā cakāra
translation: Over this earth with mighty step strode Visnu, ready to give it for a home to Manu. In him the humble people trust for safety: he, nobly born, hath made them spacious dwellings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: पर तत ते अद्य शिपिविष्ट नामार्यः शंसामि वयुनानि विद्वान | तं तवा गर्णामि तवसम अतव्यान कषयन्तम अस्य रजसः पराके
transliteration: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān | taṃ tvā ghṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
translation: To-day I laud this name, O gipivista, I, skilled in rules, the name of thee the Noble. Yea, I the poor and weak praise thee the Mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: किम इत ते विष्णो परिचक्ष्यम भूत पर यद ववक्षे शिपिविष्टो अस्मि | मा वर्पो अस्मद अप गूह एतद यद अन्यरूपः समिथे बभूथ
transliteration: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi | mā varpo asmad apa ghūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha
translation: What was there to be blamed in thee, O Visnu, when thou declaredst, I am Sipivista? Hide not this form from us, nor keep it secret, since thou didst wear another shape in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 100
sanskrit: वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम | वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः
transliteration: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam | vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo ghiro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translation: O Visnu, unto thee my lips cry Vasat! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee. May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: तिस्रो वाचः पर वद जयोतिरग्रा या एतद दुह्रे मधुदोघम ऊधः | स वत्सं कर्ण्वन गर्भम ओषधीनां सद्यो जातो वर्षभो रोरवीति
transliteration: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiraghrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ | sa vatsaṃ kṛṇvan gharbham oṣadhīnāṃ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti
translation: SPEAK forth three words, the words which light precedeth, which milk this udder that produceth nectar. Quickly made manifest, the Bull hath bellowed, engendering the germ of plants, the Infant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यो वर्धन ओषधीनां यो अपां यो विश्वस्य जगतो देव ईशे | स तरिधातु शरणं शर्म यंसत तरिवर्तु जयोतिः सवभिष्ट्य अस्मे
transliteration: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṃ yo apāṃ yo viśvasya jaghato deva īśe | sa tridhātu śaraṇaṃ śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme
translation: Giver of growth to plants, the God who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures, Vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge, and threefold light to succour and befriend us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सतरीर उ तवद भवति सूत उ तवद यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः | पितुः पयः परति गर्भ्णाति माता तेन पिता वर्धते तेन पुत्रः
transliteration: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ | pituḥ payaḥ prati ghṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ
translation: Now he is sterile, now begetteth offspring, even as he willeth doth he change his figure. The Father's genial flow bedews the Mother; therewith the Sire, therewith the son is nourished.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुस तिस्रो दयावस तरेधा सस्रुर आपः | तरयः कोशास उपसेचनासो मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम
transliteration: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ | trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam
translation: In him all living creatures have their being, and the three heavens with triply flowing waters. Three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: इदं वचः पर्जन्याय सवराजे हर्दो अस्त्व अन्तरं तज जुजोषत | मयोभुवो वर्ष्टयः सन्त्व अस्मे सुपिप्पला ओषधीर देवगोपाः
transliteration: idaṃ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṃ taj jujoṣat | mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devaghopāḥ
translation: May this my song to Sovran Lord Parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure. May we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment, and God-protected plants with goodly fruitage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 101
sanskrit: स रेतोधा वर्षभः शश्वतीनां तस्मिन्न आत्मा जगतस तस्थुषश च | तन म रतम पातु शतशारदाय यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः
transliteration: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṃ tasminn ātmā jaghatas tasthuṣaś ca | tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translation: He is the Bull of all, and their impregner lie holds the life of all things fixed and moving. May this rite save me till my hundredth autumn. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 102
sanskrit: पर्जन्याय पर गायत दिवस पुत्राय मीळ्हुषे | स नो यवसमिछतु
transliteration: parjanyāya pra ghāyata divas putrāya mīḷhuṣe | sa no yavasamichatu
translation: SING forth and laud Parjanya, son of Heaven, who sends the gift of rain May he provide our pasturage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 102
sanskrit: यो गर्भमोषधीनां गवां कर्णोत्यर्वताम | पर्जन्यःपुरुषीणाम
transliteration: yo gharbhamoṣadhīnāṃ ghavāṃ kṛṇotyarigvedaatām | parjanyaḥpuruṣīṇām
translation: Parjanya is the God who forms in kine, in mares, in plants of earth, And womankind, the germ of life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 102
sanskrit: तस्मा इदास्ये हविर्जुहोता मधुमत्तमम | इळां नः संयतं करत
transliteration: tasmā idāsye havirjuhotā madhumattamam | iḷāṃ naḥ saṃyataṃ karat
translation: Offer and pour into his mouth oblation rich in savoury juice: May he for ever give us food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: संवत्सरं शशयाना बराह्मणा वरतचारिणः | वाचं पर्जन्यजिन्वितां पर मण्डूका अवादिषुः
transliteration: saṃvatsaraṃ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ | vācaṃ parjanyajinvitāṃ pra maṇḍūkā avādiṣuḥ
translation: THEY who lay quiet for a year, the Brahmans who fulfil their vows, The Frogs have lifted up their voice, the voice Parjanya hath inspired.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: दिव्या आपो अभि यदेनमायन दर्तिं न शुष्कं सरसी शयानम | गवामह न मायुर्वत्सिनीनां मण्दूकानां वग्नुरत्रा समेति
transliteration: divyā āpo abhi yadenamāyan dṛtiṃ na śuṣkaṃ sarasī śayānam | ghavāmaha na māyurigvedaatsinīnāṃ maṇdūkānāṃ vaghnuratrā sameti
translation: What time on these, as on a dry skin lying in the pool's bed, the floods of heaven descended, The music of the Frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: यदीमेनानुशतो अभ्यवर्षीत तर्ष्यावतः पराव्र्ष्यागतायाम | अख्खलीक्र्त्या पितरं न पुत्रो अन्यो अन्यमुप वदन्तमेति
transliteration: yadīmenānuśato abhyavarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣyāghatāyām | akhkhalīkṛtyā pitaraṃ na putro anyo anyamupa vadantameti
translation: When at the coming of the Rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted, One seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: अन्यो अन्यमनु गर्भ्णात्येनोरपां परसर्गे यदमन्दिषाताम | मण्डूको यदभिव्र्ष्टः कनिष्कन पर्ष्निः सम्प्र्ङकते हरितेन वाचम
transliteration: anyo anyamanu ghṛbhṇātyenorapāṃ prasarghe yadamandiṣātām | maṇḍūko yadabhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛṣniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam
translation: Each of these twain receives the other kindly, while they are revelling in the flow of waters, When the Frog moistened by the rain springs forward, and Green and Spotty both combine their voices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: यदेषामन्यो अन्यस्य वाचं शाक्तस्येव वदति शिक्षमाणः | सर्वं तदेषां सम्र्धेव पर्व यत सुवाचो वदथनाध्यप्सु
transliteration: yadeṣāmanyo anyasya vācaṃ śāktasyeva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ | sarigvedaaṃ tadeṣāṃ samṛdheva parigvedaa yat suvāco vadathanādhyapsu
translation: When one of these repeats the other's language, as he who learns the lesson of the teacher, Your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: गोमायुरेको अजमायुरेकः पर्श्निरेको हरित एक एषाम | समानं नाम बिभ्रतो विरूपाः पुरुत्रा वाचं पिपिशुर्वदन्तः
transliteration: ghomāyureko ajamāyurekaḥ pṛśnireko harita eka eṣām | samānaṃ nāma bibhrato virūpāḥ purutrā vācaṃ pipiśurigvedaadantaḥ
translation: Onc is Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat the other, one Frog is Green and one of them is Spotty. They bear one common name, and yet they vary, and, talking, modulate the voice diversely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: बराह्मणासो अतिरात्रे न सोमे सरो न पूर्णमभितो वदन्तः | संवत्सरस्य तदहः परि षठ यन मण्डूकाः पराव्र्षीणं बभूव
transliteration: brāhmaṇāso atirātre na some saro na pūrṇamabhito vadantaḥ | saṃvatsarasya tadahaḥ pari ṣṭha yan maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇaṃ babhūva
translation: As Brahmans, sitting round the brimful vessel, talk at the Soma-rite of Atiratra, So, Frogs, ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year, the first of Rain-time.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: बराह्मणासः सोमिनो वाचमक्रत बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तः परिवत्सरीणम | अध्वर्यवो घर्मिणः सिष्विदाना आविर्भवन्ति गुह्या न के चित
transliteration: brāhmaṇāsaḥ somino vācamakrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam | adhvaryavo gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānā āvirbhavanti ghuhyā na ke cit
translation: These Brahmans with the Soma juice, performing their year-long rite, have lifted up their voices; And these Adhvaryus, sweating with their kettles, come forth and show themselves, and none are hidden.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: देवहितिं जुगुपुर्द्वादशस्य रतुं नरो न पर मिनन्त्येते | संवत्सरे पराव्र्ष्यागतायां तप्ता घर्मा अश्नुवते विसर्गम
transliteration: devahitiṃ jughupurdvādaśasya ṛtuṃ naro na pra minantyete | saṃvatsare prāvṛṣyāghatāyāṃ taptā gharmā aśnuvate visargham
translation: They keep the twelve month's God-appointed order, and never do the men neglect the season. Soon as the Rain-time in the year returneth, these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 103
sanskrit: गोमायुरदादजमायुरदात पर्श्निरदाद धरितो नो वसूनि | गवां मण्डूका ददतः शतानि सहस्रसावे पर तिरन्त आयुः
transliteration: ghomāyuradādajamāyuradāt pṛśniradād dharito no vasūni | ghavāṃ maṇḍūkā dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ
translation: Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat have granted riches, and Green and Spotty have vouchsafed us treasure. The Frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा तपतं रक्ष उब्जतं नयर्पयतं वर्षणा तमोव्र्धः | परा सर्णीतमचितो नयोषतं हतं नुदेथां नि शिशीतमत्रिणः
transliteration: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ nyarpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ | parā sṛṇītamacito nyoṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītamatriṇaḥ
translation: INDRA and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe, send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom. Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा समघशंसमभ्यघं तपुर्ययस्तु चरुरग्निवानिव | बरह्मद्विषे करव्यादे घोरचक्षसे दवेषो धत्तमनवायं किमीदिने
transliteration: indrāsomā samaghaśaṃsamabhyaghaṃ tapuryayastu caruraghnivāniva | brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattamanavāyaṃ kimīdine
translation: Indra and Soma, let sin round the wicked boil like as a caldron set amid the flames of fire. Against the foe of prayer, devourer of raw flesh, the vile fiend fierce of eye, keep ye perpetual hate.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्तो वव्रे अन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि पर विध्यतम | यथा नातः पुनरेकश्चनोदयत तद वामस्तु सहसे मन्युमच्छवः
transliteration: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antaranārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam | yathā nātaḥ punarekaścanodayat tad vāmastu sahase manyumacchavaḥ
translation: Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support, So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवो वधं सं पर्थिव्या अघशंसाय तर्हणम | उत तक्षतं सवर्यं पर्वतेभ्यो येन रक्षो वाव्र्धानं निजूर्वथः
transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ saṃ pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam | ut takṣataṃ svaryaṃ parigvedaatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrigvedaathaḥ
translation: Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth. Yea, forge out of the mountains your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवस पर्यग्नितप्तेभिर्युवमश्महन्मभिः | तपुर्वधेभिरजरेभिरत्रिणो नि पर्शाने विध्यतं यन्तु निस्वरम
transliteration: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas paryaghnitaptebhiryuvamaśmahanmabhiḥ | tapurigvedaadhebhirajarebhiratriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram
translation: Indra and Soma, cast ye downward out of heaven your deadly darts of stone burning with fiery flame, Eternal, scorching darts; plunge the voracious ones within the depth, and let them sink without a sound.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: इन्द्रासोमा परि वां भूतु विश्वत इयं मतिः कक्ष्याश्वेववाजिना | यां वां होत्रां परिहिनोमि मेधयेमा बरह्माणि नर्पतीव जिन्वतम
transliteration: indrāsomā pari vāṃ bhūtu viśvata iyaṃ matiḥ kakṣyāśvevavājinā | yāṃ vāṃ hotrāṃ parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam
translation: Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds- The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you: do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: परति समरेथां तुजयद्भिरेवैर्हतं दरुहो रक्षसो भङगुरावतः | इन्द्रासोमा दुष्क्र्ते मा सुगं भूद यो नः कदाचिदभिदासति दरुहा
transliteration: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhirevairhataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvataḥ | indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sughaṃ bhūd yo naḥ kadācidabhidāsati druhā
translation: In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy these evil beings, slay the treacherous fiends. Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss who evermore assails us with malignity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 7 Hymn 104
sanskrit: यो मा पाकेन मनसा चरन्तमभिचष्टे अन्र्तेभिर्वचोभिः | आप इव काशिना संग्र्भीता असन्नस्त्वासत इन्द्र वक्ता
transliteration: yo mā pākena manasā carantamabhicaṣṭe anṛtebhirigvedaacobhiḥ |
translation: Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit, May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra, like water which the hollowed hand compresses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: मा चिदन्यद वि शंसत सखायो मा रिषण्यत | इन्द्रमित्स्तोता वर्षणं सचा सुते मुहुरुक्था च शंसत
transliteration: mā cidanyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata | indramitstotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhurukthā ca śaṃsata
translation: GLORIFY naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you. Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अवक्रक्षिणं वर्षभं यथाजुरं गां न चर्षणीसहम | विद्वेषणं संवननोभयंकरं मंहिष्ठमुभयाविनम
transliteration: avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuraṃ ghāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham | vidveṣaṇaṃ saṃvananobhayaṃkaraṃ maṃhiṣṭhamubhayāvinam
translation: Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's Conqueror, bounteous like a cow; Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: यच्चिद धि तवा जना इमे नाना हवन्त ऊतये | अस्माकं बरह्मेदमिन्द्र भूतु ते.अह विश्वा च वर्धनम
transliteration: yaccid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye | asmākaṃ brahmedamindra bhūtu te.aha viśvā ca vardhanam
translation: Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid, Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exaltation every day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: वि तर्तूर्यन्ते मघवन विपश्चितो.अर्यो विपो जनानाम | उप करमस्व पुरुरूपमा भर वाजं नेदिष्ठमूतये
transliteration: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito.aryo vipo janānām | upa kramasva pururūpamā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭhamūtaye
translation: Those skilled in song, O Maghavan among these men o'ercome with might the foeman's songs. Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: महे चन तवामद्रिवः परा शुल्काय देयाम | न सहस्रायनायुताय वज्रिवो न शताय शतामघ
transliteration: mahe cana tvāmadrivaḥ parā śulkāya deyām | na sahasrāyanāyutāya vajrivo na śatāya śatāmagha
translation: O Caster of the Stone, I would not sell thee for a mighty price, Not for a thousand, Thunderer! nor ten thousand, nor a hundred, Lord of countless wealth!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: वस्यानिन्द्रासि मे पितुरुत भरातुरभुञ्जतः | माता चमे छदयथः समा वसो वसुत्वनाय राधसे
transliteration: vasyānindrāsi me pituruta bhrāturabhuñjataḥ | mātā came chadayathaḥ samā vaso vasutvanāya rādhase
translation: O Indra, thou art more to me than sire or niggard brother is. Thou and my mother, O Good Lord, appear alike, to give me wealth abundantly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: कवेयथ कवेदसि पुरुत्रा चिद धि ते मनः | अलर्षि युध्म खजक्र्त पुरन्दर पर गायत्रा अगासिषुः
transliteration: kveyatha kvedasi purutrā cid dhi te manaḥ | alarṣi yudhma khajakṛt purandara pra ghāyatrā aghāsiṣuḥ
translation: Where art thou? Whither art thou gone? For many a place attracts thy mind. Haste, Warrior, Fort-destroyer, Lord of battle's din, haste, holy songs have sounded forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: परास्मै गायत्रमर्चत वावातुर्यः पुरन्दरः | याभिःकाण्वस्योप बर्हिरासदं यासद वज्री भिनत पुरः
transliteration: prāsmai ghāyatramarcata vāvāturyaḥ purandaraḥ | yābhiḥkāṇvasyopa barhirāsadaṃ yāsad vajrī bhinat puraḥ
translation: Sing out the psalm to him who breaks down castles for his faithful friend, Verses to bring the Thunderer to destroy the forts and sit on Kanva's sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 1
sanskrit: ये ते सन्ति दशग्विनः शतिनो ये सहस्रिणः | अश्वासो येते वर्षणो रघुद्रुवस्तेभिर्नस्तूयमा गहि
transliteration: ye te santi daśaghvinaḥ śatino ye sahasriṇaḥ | aśvāso yete vṛṣaṇo raghudruvastebhirnastūyamā ghahi
translation: The Horses which are thine in tens, in hundreds, yea, in thousands thine, Even those vigorous Steeds, fleet-footed in the course, with those come quickly near to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: इदं वसो सुतमन्धः पिबा सुपूर्णमुदरम | अनाभयिन ररिमा ते
transliteration: idaṃ vaso sutamandhaḥ pibā supūrṇamudaram | anābhayin rarimā te
translation: HERE is the Soma juice expressed; O Vasu, drink till thou art full: Undaunted God, we give it thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: नर्भिर्धूतः सुतो अश्नैरव्यो वारैः परिपूतः | अश्वोन निक्तो नदीषु
transliteration: nṛbhirdhūtaḥ suto aśnairavyo vāraiḥ paripūtaḥ | aśvona nikto nadīṣu
translation: Washed by the men, pressed out with stones, strained through the filter made of wool, 'Tis like a courser bathed in stream.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तं ते यवं यथा गोभिः सवादुमकर्म शरीणन्तः | इन्द्र तवास्मिन सधमादे
transliteration: taṃ te yavaṃ yathā ghobhiḥ svādumakarma śrīṇantaḥ | indra tvāsmin sadhamāde
translation: This juice have we made sweet for thee like barley, blending it with milk. Indra, I call thee to our feast.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: इन्द्र इत सोमपा एक इन्द्रः सुतपा विश्वायुः | अन्तर्देवान मर्त्यांश्च
transliteration: indra it somapā eka indraḥ sutapā viśvāyuḥ | antardevān martyāṃśca
translation: Beloved of all, Indra alone drinks up the flowing Soma juice Among the Gods and mortal men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: न यं शुक्रो न दुराशीर्न तर्प्रा उरुव्यचसम | अपस्प्र्ण्वते सुहार्दम
transliteration: na yaṃ śukro na durāśīrna tṛprā uruvyacasam | apaspṛṇvate suhārdam
translation: The Friend, whom not the brilliant-hued, the badly-mixt or bitter draught, Repels, the far-extending God;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: गोभिर्यदीमन्ये अस्मन मर्गं न वरा मर्गयन्ते | अभित्सरन्ति धेनुभिः
transliteration: ghobhiryadīmanye asman mṛghaṃ na vrā mṛghayante | abhitsaranti dhenubhiḥ
translation: While other men than we with milk chase him as hunters chase a deer, And with their kine inveigle him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तरय इन्द्रस्य सोमाः सुतासः सन्तु देवस्य | सवे कषये सुतपाव्नः
transliteration: traya indrasya somāḥ sutāsaḥ santu devasya | sve kṣaye sutapāvnaḥ
translation: For him, for Indra, for the God, be pressed three draughts of Soma juice In the juice-drinker's own abode.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 2
sanskrit: तरयः कोशासः शचोतन्ति तिस्रश्चम्वः सुपूर्णाः | समाने अधि भार्मन
transliteration: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ ścotanti tisraścamvaḥ supūrṇāḥ | samāne adhi bhārman
translation: Three reservoirs exude their drops, filled are three beakers to the brim, All for one offering to the God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 3
sanskrit: पिबा सुतस्य रसिनो मत्स्वा न इन्द्र गोमतः | आपिर्नो बोधिसधमाद्यो वर्धे.अस्मानवन्तु ते धियः
transliteration: pibā sutasya rasino matsvā na indra ghomataḥ |
translation: DRINK, Indra, of the savoury juice, and cheer thee with our milky draught. Be, for our weal, our Friend and sharer of the feast, and let thy wisdom guard us well.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र परागपागुदं नयग वा हूयसे नर्भिः | सिमा पुरू नर्षूतो अस्यानवे.असि परशर्ध तुर्वशे
transliteration: yadindra prāghapāghudaṃ nyagh vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ | simā purū nṛṣūto asyānave.asi praśardha turigvedaaśe
translation: THOUGH, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south, Thou chiefly art with Anava and Turvasa, brave Champion I urged by men to Come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यद वा रुमे रुशमे शयावके कर्प इन्द्र मादयसे सचा | कण्वासस्त्वा बरह्मभि सतोमवाहस इन्द्रा यछन्त्या गहि
transliteration: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā | kaṇvāsastvā brahmabhi stomavāhasa indrā yachantyā ghahi
translation: Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Rusama, Syavaka, and Krpa thou rejoicest thee, Still do the Kanvas, bringing praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यथा गौरो अपा कर्तं तर्ष्यन्नेत्यवेरिणम | आपित्वे नः परपित्वे तूयमा गहि कण्वेषु सु सचा पिब
transliteration: yathā ghauro apā kṛtaṃ tṛṣyannetyaveriṇam |
translation: Even as the wild-bull, when he thirsts, goes to the desert's watery pool, Come hither quickly both at morning and at eve, and with the Kanvas drink thy fill.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: दूरादिहेव यत सत्यरुणप्सुरशिश्वितत | वि भानुं विश्वधातनत
transliteration: dūrādiheva yat satyaruṇapsuraśiśvitat | vi bhānuṃ viśvadhātanat
translation: WHEN, even as she were present here, red Dawn hath shone from far away, She spreadeth light on every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: नर्वद दस्रा मनोयुजा रथेन पर्थुपाजसा | सचेथे अश्विनोषसम
transliteration: nṛvad dasrā manoyujā rathena pṛthupājasā | sacethe aśvinoṣasam
translation: Like Heroes on your will-yoked car far shining, Wonder-Workers! ye Attend, O Asvins, on the Dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: युवाभ्यां वाजिनीवसू परति सतोम अद्र्क्षत | वाचं दूतोयथोहिषे
transliteration: yuvābhyāṃ vājinīvasū prati stoma adṛkṣata | vācaṃ dūtoyathohiṣe
translation: By you, O Lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed: As envoy have I brought the prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: पुरुप्रिया ण ऊतये पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू | सतुषे कण्वासोश्विना
transliteration: purupriyā ṇa ūtaye purumandrā purūvasū | stuṣe kaṇvāsoaśvinā
translation: Kanvas must praise the Asvins dear to many, making many glad, Most rich, that they may succour us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: मंहिष्ठा वाजसातमेषयन्ता शुभस पती | गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हम
transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhā vājasātameṣayantā śubhas patī | ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛham
translation: Most liberal, best at winning strength, inciters, Lords of splendour who Visit the worshipper's abode.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 5
sanskrit: ता सुदेवाय दाशुषे सुमेधामवितारिणीम | घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम
transliteration: tā sudevāya dāśuṣe sumedhāmavitāriṇīm | ghṛtairghavyūtimukṣatam
translation: So for devout Sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead, And make it rich for sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: महानिन्द्रो य ओजसा पर्जन्यो वर्ष्टिमानिव | सतोमैर्वत्सस्य वाव्र्धे
transliteration: mahānindro ya ojasā parjanyo vṛṣṭimāniva | stomairigvedaatsasya vāvṛdhe
translation: INDRA, great in his power and might, and like Parjanya rich in rain, Is magnified by Vatsa's lauds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: परजां रतस्य पिप्रतः पर यद भरन्त वह्नयः | विप्रा रतस्य वाहसा
transliteration: prajāṃ ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yad bharanta vahnayaḥ | viprā ṛtasya vāhasā
translation: When the priests, strengthening the Son of Holy Law, present their gifts, Singers with Order's hymn of praiser.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: कण्वा इन्द्रं यदक्रत सतोमैर्यज्ञस्य साधनम | जामिब्रुवत आयुधम
transliteration: kaṇvā indraṃ yadakrata stomairyajñasya sādhanam | jāmibruvata āyudham
translation: Since Kanvas with their lauds have made Indra complete the sacrifice. Words are their own appropriate arms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: समस्य मन्यवे विशो विश्वा नमन्त कर्ष्टयः | समुद्रायेव सिन्धवः
transliteration: samasya manyave viśo viśvā namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ | samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ
translation: Before his hot displeasure all the peoples, all the men, bow down, As rivers bow them to the sea.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: ओजस्तदस्य तित्विष उभे यद समवर्तयत | इन्द्रश्चर्मेवरोदसी
transliteration: ojastadasya titviṣa ubhe yad samavartayat | indraścarmevarodasī
translation: This power of his shone brightly forth when Indra brought together, like A skin, the worlds of heaven and earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 6
sanskrit: वि चिद वर्त्रस्य दोधतो वज्रेण शतपर्वणा | शिरो बिभेदव्र्ष्णिना
transliteration: vi cid vṛtrasya dodhato vajreṇa śataparigvedaaṇā |
translation: The fiercely-moving Vrtra's head he severed with his thunderbolt, His mighty hundred-knotted bolt.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: पर यद वस्त्रिष्टुभमिषं मरुतो विप्रो अक्षरत | वि पर्वतेषु राजथ
transliteration: pra yad vastriṣṭubhamiṣaṃ maruto vipro akṣarat | vi parigvedaateṣu rājatha
translation: O MARUTS, when the sage hath poured the Trstup forth as food for you, Ye shine amid the mountain-clouds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: यदङग तविषीयवो यामं शुभ्रा अचिध्वम | नि पर्वता अहासत
transliteration: yadaṅgha taviṣīyavo yāmaṃ śubhrā acidhvam | ni parigvedaatā ahāsata
translation: When, Bright Ones, fain to show your might ye have determined on your course, The mountain-clouds have bent them down.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: उदीरयन्त वायुभिर्वाश्रासः पर्श्निमातरः | धुक्षन्तपिप्युशीमिषम
transliteration: udīrayanta vāyubhirigvedaāśrāsaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ | dhukṣantapipyuśīmiṣam
translation: Loud roaring with the winds the Sons of Prsni have upraised themselves: They have poured out the streaming food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: वपन्ति मरुतो मिहं पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान | यद यामं यान्ति वायुभिः
transliteration: vapanti maruto mihaṃ pra vepayanti parigvedaatān | yad yāmaṃ yānti vāyubhiḥ
translation: The Maruts spread the mist abroad and make mountains rock and reel, When with the winds they go their way

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: नि यद यामाय वो गिरिर्नि सिन्धवो विधर्मणे | महे शुष्माय येमिरे
transliteration: ni yad yāmāya vo ghirirni sindhavo vidharmaṇe | mahe śuṣmāya yemire
translation: What time the rivers and the hills before your coming bowed them down, So to sustain your mighty force.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: युष्मानु नक्तमूतये युष्मान दिवा हवामहे | युष्मान परयत्यध्वरे
transliteration: yuṣmānu naktamūtaye yuṣmān divā havāmahe | yuṣmān prayatyadhvare
translation: We call on you for aid by night, on you for succour in the day, On you while sacrifice proceeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: उदु तये अरुणप्सवश्चित्रा यामेभिरीरते | वाश्रा अधिष्णुना दिवः
transliteration: udu tye aruṇapsavaścitrā yāmebhirīrate | vāśrā adhiṣṇunā divaḥ
translation: These, verily, wondrous, red of hue, speed on their courses with a roar Over the ridges of the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: सर्जन्ति रश्मिमोजसा पन्थां सूर्याय यातवे | ते भानुभिर्वि तस्थिरे
transliteration: sṛjanti raśmimojasā panthāṃ sūryāya yātave | te bhānubhirigveda tasthire
translation: With might they drop the loosened rein so that the Sun may run his course, And spread themselves with beams of light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: इमां मे मरुतो गिरमिमं सतोमं रभुक्षणः | इमं मे वनता हवम
transliteration: imāṃ me maruto ghiramimaṃ stomaṃ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ | imaṃ me vanatā havam
translation: Accept, ye Maruts, this my song, accept ye this mine hymn of praise, Accept, Rbhuksans, this my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: तरीणि सरांसि पर्श्नयो दुदुह्रे वज्रिणे मधु | उत्सं कवन्धमुद्रिणम
transliteration: trīṇi sarāṃsi pṛśnayo duduhre vajriṇe madhu | utsaṃ kavandhamudriṇam
translation: The dappled Cows have poured three lakes, meath for the Thunder-wielding God, From the great cask, the watery cloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 7
sanskrit: मरुतो यद ध वो दिवः सुम्नायन्तो हवामहे | आ तू न उपगन्तन
transliteration: maruto yad dha vo divaḥ sumnāyanto havāmahe |
translation: O Maruts, quickly come to us when, longing for felicity, We call you hither from the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 8
sanskrit: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिरश्विना गछतं युवम | दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी पिबतं सोम्यं मधु
transliteration: dasrā hiraṇyavartanī pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu
translation: WITH all the succours that are yours, O Asvins, hither come to us: Wonderful, borne on paths of gold, drink ye the meath with Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: आ नूनमश्विना युवं वत्सस्य गन्तमवसे | परास्मै यछतमव्र्कं पर्थु छर्दिर्युयुतं या अरातयः
transliteration: prāsmai yachatamavṛkaṃ pṛthu chardiryuyutaṃ yā arātayaḥ
translation: To help and favour Vatsa now, O Asvins, come ye hitherward. Bestow on him a dwelling spacious and secure, and keep malignities away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: यदन्तरिक्षे यद दिवि यत पञ्च मानुषाननु | नर्म्णन्तद धत्तमश्विना
transliteration: yadantarikṣe yad divi yat pañca mānuṣānanu | nṛmṇantad dhattamaśvinā
translation: All manliness that is in heaven, with the Five Tribes, or in mid-air, Bestow, ye Asvins, upon us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: ये वां दंसांस्यश्विना विप्रासः परिमाम्र्शुः | एवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम
transliteration: ye vāṃ daṃsāṃsyaśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ | evet kāṇvasya bodhatam
translation: Remember Kanva first of all among the singers, Asvins, who Have thought upon your wondrous deeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: अयं वां घर्मो अश्विना सतोमेन परि षिच्यते | अयं सोमो मधुमान वाजिनीवसू येन वर्त्रं चिकेतथः
transliteration: ayaṃ vāṃ gharmo aśvinā stomena pari ṣicyate | ayaṃ somo madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtraṃ ciketathaḥ
translation: Asvins, for you with song of praise this hot oblation is effused, This your sweet Soma juice, ye Lords of ample wealth, through which ye think upon the foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: यदप्सु यद वनस्पतौ यदोषधीषु पुरुदंससा कर्तम | तेन माविष्टमश्विना
transliteration: yadapsu yad vanaspatau yadoṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam | tena māviṣṭamaśvinā
translation: Whatever ye have done in floods, in the tree, Wonder-Workers, and in growing plants, Therewith, O Asvins, succour me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 9
sanskrit: यन नासत्या भुरण्यथो यद वा देव भिषज्यथः | अयं वां वत्सो मतिभिर्न विन्धते हविष्मन्तं हि गछथः
transliteration: yan nāsatyā bhuraṇyatho yad vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ | ayaṃ vāṃ vatso matibhirna vindhate haviṣmantaṃ hi ghachathaḥ
translation: What force, Nasatyas, ye exert, whatever, Gods, ye tend and heal, This your own Vatsa gains not by his hymns alone: ye visit him who offers gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यत सथो दीर्घप्रसद्मनि यद वादो रोचने दिवः | यद वा समुद्रे अध्याक्र्ते गर्हे.अत आ यातमश्विना
transliteration: yat stho dīrghaprasadmani yad vādo rocane divaḥ | yad vā samudre adhyākṛte ghṛhe.ata ā yātamaśvinā
translation: WHETHER ye travel far away or dwell in yonder light of heaven, Or in a mansion that is built above the sea, come thence, ye Asvins, hitherward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यद वा यज्ञं मनवे सम्मिमिक्षथुरेवेत काण्वस्य बोधतम | बर्हस्पतिं विश्वान देवानहं हुव इन्द्राविष्णू अश्विनावाशुहेषसा
transliteration: yad vā yajñaṃ manave sammimikṣathurevet kāṇvasya bodhatam | bṛhaspatiṃ viśvān devānahaṃ huva indrāviṣṇū aśvināvāśuheṣasā
translation: Or if for Manu.ye prepared the sacrifice, remember also Kanva's son. I call Brhaspati, Indra, Visnu, all the gods, the Asvins borne by rapid steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: तया नवश्विना हुवे सुदंससा गर्भे कर्ता | ययोरस्ति परणः सख्यं देवेष्वध्याप्यम
transliteration: tyā nvaśvinā huve sudaṃsasā ghṛbhe kṛtā | yayorasti praṇaḥ sakhyaṃ deveṣvadhyāpyam
translation: Those Asvins I invoke who work marvels, brought hither to receive, With whom our friendship is most famed, and kinship passing that of Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: ययोरधि पर यज्ञा असूरे सन्ति सूरयः | ता यज्ञस्याध्वरस्य परचेतसा सवधाभिर्या पिबतः सोम्यं मधु
transliteration: yayoradhi pra yajñā asūre santi sūrayaḥ | tā yajñasyādhvarasya pracetasā svadhābhiryā pibataḥ somyaṃ madhu
translation: On whom the solemn rites depend, whose worshippers rise without the Sun: These who foreknow the holy work of sacrifice, and by their Godhead drink the sweets of Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यदद्याश्विनावपाग यत पराक सथो वाजिनीवसू | यद दरुह्यव्यनवि तुर्वशे यदौ हुवे वामथ मा गतम
transliteration: yadadyāśvināvapāgh yat prāk stho vājinīvasū | yad druhyavyanavi turigvedaaśe yadau huve vāmatha mā ghatam
translation: Whether ye, Lords of ample wealth, now linger in the cast or west, With Druhyu, or with Anu, Yadu, Turvaga, I call you hither; come to me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यदन्तरिक्षे पतथः पुरुभुजा यद वेमे रोदसी अनु | यद्वा सवधाभिरधितिष्ठथो रथमत आ यातमश्विना
transliteration: yadantarikṣe patathaḥ purubhujā yad veme rodasī anu | yadvā svadhābhiradhitiṣṭhatho rathamata ā yātamaśvinā
translation: Lords of great riches, whether through the firmament ye fly or speed through heaven and earth, Or with your Godlike natures stand upon your cars, come thence, O Asvins, hitherward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवमग्ने वरतपा असि देव आ मर्त्येष्वा | तवं यज्ञेष्वीड्यः
transliteration: tvamaghne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣvā | tvaṃ yajñeṣvīḍyaḥ
translation: THOU Agni, God mid mortal men, art guard of sacred rites, thou art To be adored at sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: तवमसि परशस्यो विदथेषु सहन्त्य | अग्ने रथीरध्वराणाम
transliteration: tvamasi praśasyo vidatheṣu sahantya | aghne rathīradhvarāṇām
translation: O Mighty Agni, thou must be glorified at our festivals, Bearing our offerings to the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: स तवमस्मदप दविषो युयोधि जातवेदः | अदेवीरग्ने अरातीः
transliteration: sa tvamasmadapa dviṣo yuyodhi jātavedaḥ | adevīraghne arātīḥ
translation: O Jatavedas Agni, fight and drive our foes afar from us, Them and their godless enmities.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अन्ति चित सन्तमह यज्ञं मर्तस्य रिपोः | नोप वेषि जातवेदः
transliteration: anti cit santamaha yajñaṃ martasya ripoḥ | nopa veṣi jātavedaḥ
translation: Thou, Jatavedas, seekest not the worship of a hostile man, However nigh itbe to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: मर्ता अमर्त्यस्य ते भूरि नाम मनामहे | विप्रासो जातवेदसः
transliteration: martā amartyasya te bhūri nāma manāmahe | viprāso jātavedasaḥ
translation: We sages, mortals as we are, adore the mighty name of thee, Immortal Jatavedas' name.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 11
sanskrit: विप्रं विप्रासो.अवसे देवं मर्तास ऊतये | अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे
transliteration: vipraṃ viprāso.avase devaṃ martāsa ūtaye | aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe
translation: Sages, we call the Sage to help, mortals, we call the God to aid: We call on Agni with our songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: य इन्द्र सोमपातमो मदः शविष्ठ चेतति | येना हंसि नयत्रिणं तमीमहे
transliteration: ya indra somapātamo madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati | yenā haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ tamīmahe
translation: JOY, Mightiest Indra, known and marked, sprung most from Soma-draughts, wherewith Thou smitest down the greedy fiend, for that we long.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: येना दशग्वमध्रिगुं वेपयन्तं सवर्णरम | येना समुद्रमाविथा तमीमहे
transliteration: yenā daśaghvamadhrighuṃ vepayantaṃ svarṇaram | yenā samudramāvithā tamīmahe
translation: Wherewith thou bolpest Adhrigu, the great Dasagva, and the God Who stirs the sunlight, and the sea, for that we long.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: येन सिन्धुं महीरपो रथानिव परचोदयः | पन्थां रतस्य यातवे तमीमहे
transliteration: yena sindhuṃ mahīrapo rathāniva pracodayaḥ | panthāṃ ṛtasya yātave tamīmahe
translation: Wherewith thou dravest forth like cars Sindhu and all the mighty floods To go the way ordained by Law, for that we long.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इमं सतोममभिष्टये घर्तं न पूतमद्रिवः | येना नुसद्य ओजसा ववक्षिथ
transliteration: imaṃ stomamabhiṣṭaye ghṛtaṃ na pūtamadrivaḥ | yenā nusadya ojasā vavakṣitha
translation: Accept this laud for aid, made pure like oil, thou Caster of the Stone, Whereby even in a moment thou hast waxen great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: इमं जुषस्व गिर्वणः समुद्र इव पिन्वते | इन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्ववक्षिथ
transliteration: imaṃ juṣasva ghirigvedaaṇaḥ samudra iva pinvate | indra viśvābhirūtibhirigvedaavakṣitha
translation: Be pleased, Song-lover, with this song it flows abundant like the sea. Indra, with all thy succours thou hast waxen great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यो नो देवः परावतः सखित्वनाय मामहे | दिवो न वर्ष्टिं परथयन ववक्षिथ
transliteration: yo no devaḥ parāvataḥ sakhitvanāya māmahe | divo na vṛṣṭiṃ prathayan vavakṣitha
translation: The God who from afar hath sent gifts to maintain our friendship's bond, Thou. spreading them like rain from heaven, hast waxen great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: ववक्षुरस्य केतवो उत वज्रो गभस्त्योः | यत सूर्यो न रोदसी अवर्धयत
transliteration: vavakṣurasya ketavo uta vajro ghabhastyoḥ | yat sūryo na rodasī avardhayat
translation: The beams that mark him have grown strong, the thunder rests between his arms, When, like the Sun, he hath increased both Heaven and Earth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यदि परव्र्द्ध सत्पते सहस्रं महिषानघः | आदित त इन्द्रियं महि पर वाव्र्धे
transliteration: yadi pravṛddha satpate sahasraṃ mahiṣānaghaḥ |
translation: When, Mighty Lord of Heroes, thou didst cat a thousand buffaloes, Then grew and waxed exceeding great thine Indra-power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुतेषु सोमेषु करतुं पुनीत उक्थ्यम | विदे वर्धस्यदक्षसो महान हि षः
transliteration: indraḥ suteṣu someṣu kratuṃ punīta ukthyam | vide vṛdhasyadakṣaso mahān hi ṣaḥ
translation: INDRA, when Soma juices flow, makes his mind pure and meet for lauds. He gains the power that brings success, for great is he.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: स परथमे वयोमनि देवानां सदने वर्धः | सुपारः सुश्रवस्तमः समप्सुजित
transliteration: sa prathame vyomani devānāṃ sadane vṛdhaḥ | supāraḥ suśravastamaḥ samapsujit
translation: In heaven's first region, in the seat of Gods, is he who brings success, Most glorious, prompt to save, who wins the water-floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तमह्वे वाजसातय इन्द्रं भराय शुष्मिणम | भवा नःसुम्ने अन्तमः सखा वर्धे
transliteration: tamahve vājasātaya indraṃ bharāya śuṣmiṇam | bhavā naḥsumne antamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe
translation: Him, to win strength, have I invoked, even Indra mighty for the fray. Be thou most near to us for bliss, a Friend to aid.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: इयं त इन्द्र गिर्वणो रातिः कषरति सुन्वतः | मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि
transliteration: iyaṃ ta indra ghirigvedaaṇo rātiḥ kṣarati sunvataḥ | mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi
translation: Indra, Song -lover, here for thee the worshipper's libation flows. Rejoicing in this sacred grass thou shinest forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: नूनं तदिन्द्र दद्धि नो यत तवा सुन्वन्त ईमहे | रयिं नश्चित्रमा भरा सवर्विदम
transliteration: nūnaṃ tadindra daddhi no yat tvā sunvanta īmahe | rayiṃ naścitramā bharā svarigvedadam
translation: Even now, O Indra, give us that which, pressing juice, we crave of thee. Bring us wealth manifold which finds the light of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सतोता यत ते विचर्षणिरतिप्रशर्धयद गिरः | वया इवानु रोहते जुषन्त यत
transliteration: stotā yat te vicarṣaṇiratipraśardhayad ghiraḥ | vayā ivānu rohate juṣanta yat
translation: What time the zealous worshipper hath boldly sung his songs to thee, Like branches of a tree up-grows what they desire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: परत्नवज्जनया गिरः शर्णुधी जरितुर्हवम | मदे-मदे ववक्षिथा सुक्र्त्वने
transliteration: pratnavajjanayā ghiraḥ śṛṇudhī jariturhavam | made-made vavakṣithā sukṛtvane
translation: Generate songs even as of old, give car unto the singer's call. Thou for the pious hast grown great at each carouse.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: करीळन्त्यस्य सून्र्ता आपो न परवता यतीः | अया धिया य उच्यते पतिर्दिवः
transliteration: krīḷantyasya sūnṛtā āpo na pravatā yatīḥ | ayā dhiyā ya ucyate patirdivaḥ
translation: Sweet strains that glorify him play like waters speeding down a slope, Yea, him who in this song is called the Lord of Heaven;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: उतो पतिर्य उच्यते कर्ष्टीनामेक इद वशी | नमोव्र्धैरवस्युभिः सुते रण
transliteration: uto patirya ucyate kṛṣṭīnāmeka id vaśī | namovṛdhairavasyubhiḥ sute raṇa
translation: Yea, who alone is called the Lord, the single Ruler of the folk, By worshippers seeking aid: may he joy in the draught.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: सतुहि शरुतं विपश्चितं हरी यस्य परसक्षिणा | गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हं नमस्विनः
transliteration: stuhi śrutaṃ vipaścitaṃ harī yasya prasakṣiṇā | ghantārā dāśuṣo ghṛhaṃ namasvinaḥ
translation: Praise him, the Glorious, skilled in song, Lord of the two victorious Bays: They seek the worshipper's abode who bows in prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 13
sanskrit: तूतुजानो महेमते.अश्वेभिः परुषितप्सुभिः | आ याहि यज्ञमाशुभिः शमिद धि ते
transliteration: tūtujāno mahemate.aśvebhiḥ pruṣitapsubhiḥ |
translation: Put forth thy strength: with dappled Steeds come, thou of mighty intellect, With swift Steeds to the sacrifice, for 'tis thy joy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 14
sanskrit: यदिन्द्राहं यथा तवमीशीय वस्व एक इत | सतोता मेगोषखा सयात
transliteration: yadindrāhaṃ yathā tvamīśīya vasva eka it | stotā meghoṣakhā syāt
translation: IF I, O Indra, were, like thee, the single Sovran of all wealth, My worshipper should be rich in kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तं वभि पर गायत पुरुहूतं पुरुष्टुतम | इन्द्रं गीर्भिस्तविषमा विवासत
transliteration: taṃ vabhi pra ghāyata puruhūtaṃ puruṣṭutam | indraṃ ghīrbhistaviṣamā vivāsata
translation: SING forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud. Invite the powerful Indra with your songs of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: यस्य दविबर्हसो बर्हत सहो दाधार रोदसी | गिरीन्रज्रानपः सवर्व्र्षत्वना
transliteration: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī | ghirīnrajrānapaḥ svarigvedaṛṣatvanā
translation: Whose lofty might-for doubly strong is he-supports the heavens and earth, And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: स राजसि पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि जिघ्नसे | इन्द्र जैत्रा शरवस्या च यन्तवे
transliteration: sa rājasi puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase | indra jaitrā śravasyā ca yantave
translation: Such, Praised by many! thou art King alone thou smitest Vrtras dead, To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तं ते मदं गर्णीमसि वर्षणं पर्त्सु सासहिम | उ लोकक्र्त्नुमद्रिवो हरिश्रियम
transliteration: taṃ te madaṃ ghṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtsu sāsahim | u lokakṛtnumadrivo hariśriyam
translation: We sing this strong and wild delight of thine which conquers in the fray, Which, Caster of the Stone! gives room and shines like gold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: येन जयोतींष्यायवे मनवे च विवेदिथ | मन्दानो अस्य बर्हिषो वि राजसि
transliteration: yena jyotīṃṣyāyave manave ca viveditha | mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi
translation: Wherewith thou also foundest lights for Ayu and for Manu's sake: Now joying in this sacred grass thou beamest forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तदद्या चित त उक्थिनो.अनु षटुवन्ति पूर्वथा | वर्षपत्नीरपो जया दिवे-दिवे
transliteration: tadadyā cit ta ukthino.anu ṣṭuvanti pūrigvedaathā | vṛṣapatnīrapo jayā dive-dive
translation: This day too singers of the hymn praise, as of old, this might of thine: Win thou the waters day by day, thralls of the strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तव तयदिन्द्रियं बर्हत तव शुष्ममुत करतुम | वज्रं शिशाति धिषणा वरेण्यम
transliteration: tava tyadindriyaṃ bṛhat tava śuṣmamuta kratum | vajraṃ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam
translation: That lofty Indra-power of thine, thy strength and thine intelligence, Thy thunderbolt for which we long, the wish makes keen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तव दयौरिन्द्र पौंस्यं पर्थिवी वर्धति शरवः | तवामापः पर्वतासश्च हिन्विरे
transliteration: tava dyaurindra pauṃsyaṃ pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ | tvāmāpaḥ parigvedaatāsaśca hinvire
translation: O Indra, Heaven and Earth augment thy manly power and thy renown; The waters and thy mountains stir and urge thee on.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवां विष्णुर्ब्र्हन कषयो मित्रो गर्णाति वरुणः | तवांशर्धो मदत्यनु मारुतम
transliteration: tvāṃ viṣṇurbṛhan kṣayo mitro ghṛṇāti varuṇaḥ | tvāṃśardho madatyanu mārutam
translation: Visnu the lofty ruling Power, Varuna, Mitra sing thy praise: In thee the Marut3' company have great delight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: तवं वर्षा जनानां मंहिष्ठ इन्द्र जज्ञिषे | सत्रा विश्वा सवपत्यानि दधिषे
transliteration: tvaṃ vṛṣā janānāṃ maṃhiṣṭha indra jajñiṣe | satrā viśvā svapatyāni dadhiṣe
translation: O Indra, thou wast born the Lord of men, most liberal of thy gifts: Excellent deeds for evermore are all thine own.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: सत्रा तवं पुरुष्टुत एको वर्त्राणि तोशसे | नान्य इन्द्रात्करणं भूय इन्वति
transliteration: satrā tvaṃ puruṣṭuta eko vṛtrāṇi tośase | nānya indrātkaraṇaṃ bhūya invati
translation: Ever, alone, O highly-praised, thou sendest Vrtras to their rest: None else than Indra executes the mighty deed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र मन्मशस्त्वा नाना हवन्त ऊतये | अस्माकेभिर्न्र्भिरत्रा सवर्जय
transliteration: yadindra manmaśastvā nānā havanta ūtaye | asmākebhirnṛbhiratrā svarjaya
translation: Though here and there, in varied hymns, Indra, men call on thee for aid, Still with our heroes fight and win the light of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 15
sanskrit: अरं कषयाय नो महे विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन | इन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षया शचीपतिम
transliteration: araṃ kṣayāya no mahe viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan | indraṃ jaitrāya harṣayā śacīpatim
translation: Already have all forms of him entered our spacious dwelling-place: For victory stir thou Indra, up, the Lord of Might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: पर सम्राजं चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं सतोता नव्यं गीर्भिः | नरं नर्षाहं मंहिष्ठम
transliteration: pra samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāmindraṃ stotā navyaṃ ghīrbhiḥ | naraṃ nṛṣāhaṃ maṃhiṣṭham
translation: PRAISE Indra whom our songs must laud, sole Sovran of mankind, the Chief Most liberal who controlleth men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: यस्मिन्नुक्थानि रण्यन्ति विश्वानि च शरवस्या | अपामवोन समुद्रे
transliteration: yasminnukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasyā | apāmavona samudre
translation: In whom the hymns of praise delight, and all the glory-giving songs. Like the floods' longing for the sea.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तं सुष्टुत्या विवासे जयेष्ठराजं भरे कर्त्नुम | महो वाजिनं सनिभ्यः
transliteration: taṃ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājaṃ bhare kṛtnum | maho vājinaṃ sanibhyaḥ
translation: Him I invite with eulogy, best King, effective in the fight, Strong for the gain of mighty spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: यस्यानूना गभीरा मदा उरवस्तरुत्राः | हर्षुमन्तःशूरसातौ
transliteration: yasyānūnā ghabhīrā madā uravastarutrāḥ | harṣumantaḥśūrasātau
translation: Whose perfect ecstasies are wide, profound, victorious, and give joy in the field where heroes win.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तमिद धनेषु हितेष्वधिवाकाय हवन्ते | येषामिन्द्रस्ते जयन्ति
transliteration: tamid dhaneṣu hiteṣvadhivākāya havante | yeṣāmindraste jayanti
translation: Him, when the spoils of war are staked, men call to be their advocate: They who have Indra win the day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तमिच्च्यौत्नैरार्यन्ति तं कर्तेभिश्चर्षणयः | एषैन्द्रो वरिवस्क्र्त
transliteration: tamiccyautnairāryanti taṃ kṛtebhiścarṣaṇayaḥ | eṣaindro varivaskṛt
translation: Men honour him with stirring songs and magnify with solemn rites: Indra is he who giveth case.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: इन्द्रो बरह्मेन्द्र रषिरिन्द्रः पुरू पुरुहूतः | महान महीभिः शचीभिः
transliteration: indro brahmendra ṛṣirindraḥ purū puruhūtaḥ | mahān mahībhiḥ śacībhiḥ
translation: 1ndra is priest and Rsi, he is much invoked by many men, And mighty by his mighty powers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स सतोम्यः स हव्यः सत्यः सत्वा तुविकूर्मिः | एकश्चित्सन्नभिभूतिः
transliteration: sa stomyaḥ sa havyaḥ satyaḥ satvā tuvikūrmiḥ | ekaścitsannabhibhūtiḥ
translation: Meet to be lauded and invoked, true Hero with his deeds of might, Victorious even when alone.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: तमर्केभिस्तं सामभिस्तं गायत्रैश्चर्षणयः | इन्द्रं वर्धन्ति कषितयः
transliteration: tamarkebhistaṃ sāmabhistaṃ ghāyatraiścarṣaṇayaḥ | indraṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ
translation: The men, the people magnify that Indra with their Slina. songs, With hymns and sacred eulogies

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: परणेतारं वस्यो अछा कर्तारं जयोतिः समत्सु | सासह्वांसं युधामित्रान
transliteration: praṇetāraṃ vasyo achā kartāraṃ jyotiḥ samatsu | sāsahvāṃsaṃ yudhāmitrān
translation: Him who advances them to wealth, sends light to lead them in the war, And quells their foemen in the fray.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स नः पप्रिः पारयाति सवस्ति नावा पुरुहूतः | इन्द्रो विश्वा अति दविषः
transliteration: sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ | indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ
translation: May he, the saviour much-invoked, may Indra bear us in a ship Safely beyond all enemies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 16
sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र वाजेभिर्दशस्या च गातुया च | अछा चनः सुम्नं नेषि
transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra vājebhirdaśasyā ca ghātuyā ca | achā canaḥ sumnaṃ neṣi
translation: As such, O Indra, honour us with gifts of booty, further us, And lead us to felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 17
sanskrit: आ याहि सुषुमा हि त इन्द्र सोमं पिबा इमम | एदं बर्हिः सदो मम
transliteration: edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama
translation: COME, we have pressed the juice for thee; O Indra, drink this Soma here Sit thou on this my sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 18
sanskrit: इदं ह नूनमेषां सुम्नं भिक्षेत मर्त्यः | आदित्यानामपूर्व्यं सवीमनि
transliteration: idaṃ ha nūnameṣāṃ sumnaṃ bhikṣeta martyaḥ |
translation: Now let the mortal offer prayer to win the unexampled grace Of these Adityas and their aid to cherish life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 19
sanskrit: तं गूर्धया सवर्णरं देवासो देवमरतिं दधन्विरे | देवत्रा हव्यमोहिरे
transliteration: taṃ ghūrdhayā svarṇaraṃ devāso devamaratiṃ dadhanvire | devatrā havyamohire
translation: SING praise to him, the Lord of Light. The Gods have made the God to be their messenger, And sent oblation to Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 19
sanskrit: विभूतरातिं विप्र चित्रशोचिषमग्निमीळिष्व यन्तुरम | अस्य मेधस्य सोम्यस्य सोभरे परेमध्वराय पूर्व्यम
transliteration: vibhūtarātiṃ vipra citraśociṣamaghnimīḷiṣva yanturam | asya medhasya somyasya sobhare premadhvarāya pūrigvedayam
translation: Agni, the Bounteous Giver, bright with varied flames, laud thou, O singer Sobhari- Him who controls this sacred food with Soma blent, who hath first claim to sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 19
sanskrit: यजिष्ठं तवा वव्र्महे देवं देवत्रा होतारममर्त्यम | अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम
transliteration: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā vavṛmahe devaṃ devatrā hotāramamartyam | asya yajñasya sukratum
translation: Thee have we chosen skill fullest in sacrifice, Immortal Priest among the Gods, Wise finisher of this holy rite:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: आ गन्ता मा रिषण्यत परस्थावानो माप सथाता समन्यवः | सथिरा चिन नमयिष्णवः
transliteration: sthirā cin namayiṣṇavaḥ
translation: LET none, Swift Travellers! check you: come hither, like-spirited, stay not far away, Ye benders even of what is firm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: वीळुपविभिर्मरुत रभुक्षण आ रुद्रासः सुदीतिभिः | इषा नो अद्या गता पुरुस्प्र्हो यज्ञमा सोभरीयवः
transliteration: vīḷupavibhirmaruta ṛbhukṣaṇa ā rudrāsaḥ sudītibhiḥ | iṣā no adyā ghatā puruspṛho yajñamā sobharīyavaḥ
translation: Maruts, Rbhuksans, Rudras come ye with your cars strong-fellied and exceeding bright. Come, ye for whom we long, with food, to sacrifice, come ye with love to Sobbari.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: विद्मा हि रुद्रियाणां शुष्ममुग्रं मरुतां शिमीवताम | विष्णोरेषस्य मीळ्हुषाम
transliteration: vidmā hi rudriyāṇāṃ śuṣmamughraṃ marutāṃ śimīvatām | viṣṇoreṣasya mīḷhuṣām
translation: For well we know the vigorous might of Rudra's Sons, the Maruts, who are passing strong, Swift Visnu's band, who send the rain.,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: वि दवीपानि पापतन तिष्ठद दुछुनोभे युजन्त रोदसी | पर धन्वान्यैरत शुभ्रखादयो यदेजथ सवभानवः
transliteration: vi dvīpāni pāpatan tiṣṭhad duchunobhe yujanta rodasī | pra dhanvānyairata śubhrakhādayo yadejatha svabhānavaḥ
translation: Islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed: the heaven and earth are joined in one. Decked with bright rings, ye spread the broad expanses out, when ye, Self. luminous, stirred yourselves.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अच्युता चिद वो अज्मन्ना नानदति पर्वतासो वनस्पतिः | भूमिर्यामेषु रेजते
transliteration: acyutā cid vo ajmannā nānadati parigvedaatāso vanaspatiḥ | bhūmiryāmeṣu rejate
translation: Even things immovable shake and reel, the mountains and the forest trees at your approach, And the earth trembles as ye come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अमाय वो मरुतो यातवे दयौर्जिहीत उत्तरा बर्हत | यत्रा नरो देदिशते तनूष्वा तवक्षांसि बाह्वोजसः
transliteration: amāya vo maruto yātave dyaurjihīta uttarā bṛhat | yatrā naro dediśate tanūṣvā tvakṣāṃsi bāhvojasaḥ
translation: To lend free course, O Maruts, to your furious rush, heaven high and higher still gives way, Where they, the Heroes mighty with their arms, display their gleaming ornaments on their forms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: सवधामनु शरियं नरो महि तवेषा अमवन्तो वर्षप्सवः | वहन्ते अह्रुतप्सवः
transliteration: svadhāmanu śriyaṃ naro mahi tveṣā amavanto vṛṣapsavaḥ | vahante ahrutapsavaḥ
translation: After their Godlike nature they, the bull. like Heroes, dazzling and impetuous, wear Great splendour as they show erect.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: गोभिर्वाणो अज्यते सोभरीणां रथे कोशे हिरण्यये | गोबन्धवः सुजातास इषे भुजे महान्तो नः सपरसे नु
transliteration: ghobhirigvedaāṇo ajyate sobharīṇāṃ rathe kośe hiraṇyaye | ghobandhavaḥ sujātāsa iṣe bhuje mahānto naḥ sparase nu
translation: The pivot of the Sobharis' chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk. May they the Well-born, Mighty, kindred of the Cow, aid us to food and to delight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: परति वो वर्षदञ्जयो वर्ष्णे शर्धाय मारुताय भरध्वम | हव्या वर्षप्रयाव्णे
transliteration: prati vo vṛṣadañjayo vṛṣṇe śardhāya mārutāya bharadhvam | havyā vṛṣaprayāvṇe
translation: Bring, ye who sprinkle balmy drops. oblations to your vigorous Marut company, To those whose leader is the Bull.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 20
sanskrit: वर्षणश्वेन मरुतो वर्षप्सुना रथेन वर्षनाभिना | आ शयेनासो न पक्षिणो वर्था नरो हव्या नो वीतये गत
transliteration: vṛṣaṇaśvena maruto vṛṣapsunā rathena vṛṣanābhinā |
translation: Come hither, O ye Mares, on your strong horsed car, solid in look, with solid naves. Lightly like winged falcons, O ye Heroes, come, come to enjoy our offerings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 21
sanskrit: वयमु तवामपूर्व्य सथूरं न कच्चिद भरन्तो.अवस्यवः | वाजे चित्रं हवामहे
transliteration: vayamu tvāmapūrigvedaya sthūraṃ na kaccid bharanto.avasyavaḥ | vāje citraṃ havāmahe
translation: WE call on thee, O Matchless One! We seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves, Call on thee wonderful in fight

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 21
sanskrit: उप तवा कर्मन्नूतये स नो युवोग्रश्चक्राम यो धर्षत | तवामिद धयवितारं वव्र्महे सखाय इन्द्र सानसिम
transliteration: upa tvā karmannūtaye sa no yuvoghraścakrāma yo dhṛṣat | tvāmid dhyavitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim
translation: On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gonse forth. We therefore, we thy friends, Indra, have chosen thee, free-giver, as our Guardian God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: ओ तयमह्व आ रथमद्या दंसिष्ठमूतये | यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी आ सूर्यायै तस्थथुः
transliteration: o tyamahva ā rathamadyā daṃsiṣṭhamūtaye | yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī ā sūryāyai tasthathuḥ
translation: HITHERWARD have I called to-day, for succour, that most wondrous car Which ye ascended, Asvins, ye whose paths are red, swift to give Car, for Surya's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: पूर्वायुषं सुहवं पुरुस्प्र्हं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम | सचनावन्तं सुमतिभिः सोभरे विद्वेषसमनेहसम
transliteration: pūrigvedaāyuṣaṃ suhavaṃ puruspṛhaṃ bhujyuṃ vājeṣu pūrigvedayam | sacanāvantaṃ sumatibhiḥ sobhare vidveṣasamanehasam
translation: Car ever young, much longed-for, easily invoked, soon guided, first in deeds of might, Which waits and serves, O Sobhari, with benevolence, without a rival or a foe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: इह तया पुरुभूतमा देवा नमोभिरश्विना | अर्वाचीना सववसे करामहे गन्तारा दशुषो गर्हम
transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā devā namobhiraśvinā | arigvedaācīnā svavase karāmahe ghantārā daśuṣo ghṛham
translation: These Asvins with our homage, these Two Omnipresent Deities Hitherward will we bring for kind help, these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: युवो रथस्य परि चक्रमीयत ईर्मान्यद वामिषण्यति | अस्मानछा सुमतिर्वां शुभस पती आ धेनुरिव धावतु
transliteration: yuvo rathasya pari cakramīyata īrmānyad vāmiṣaṇyati | asmānachā sumatirigvedaāṃ śubhas patī ā dhenuriva dhāvatu
translation: One of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round, one speeds for you its onward course. Like a milch-cow, O Lords of splendour, and with haste let your benevolence come to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: रथो यो वां तरिवन्धुरो हिरण्यभीशुरश्विना | परि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूषति शरुतस्तेन नासत्या गतम
transliteration: ratho yo vāṃ trivandhuro hiraṇyabhīśuraśvinā | pari dyāvāpṛthivī bhūṣati śrutastena nāsatyā ghatam
translation: That chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold, The famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth, thereon Nasatyas, Asvins, come.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: दशस्यन्ता मनवे पूर्व्यं दिवि यवं वर्केण कर्षथः | ता वामद्य सुमतिभिः शुभस पती अश्विना पर सतुवीमहि
transliteration: daśasyantā manave pūrigvedayaṃ divi yavaṃ vṛkeṇa karṣathaḥ | tā vāmadya sumatibhiḥ śubhas patī aśvinā pra stuvīmahi
translation: Ye with your plough, when favouring Manu with your help, ploughed the first harvest in the sky. As such will we exalt you, Lords of splendour, now, O Asvins, with our prayer and praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: उप नो वजिनीवसू यातं रतस्य पथिभिः | येभिस्त्र्क्षिं वर्षणा तरसदस्यवं महे कषत्राय जिन्वथः
transliteration: upa no vajinīvasū yātaṃ ṛtasya pathibhiḥ | yebhistṛkṣiṃ vṛṣaṇā trasadasyavaṃ mahe kṣatrāya jinvathaḥ
translation: Come to us, Lords of ample wealth, by paths of everlasting Law, Whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised Trksi, Trasadasyu's son.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 22
sanskrit: अयं वामद्रिभिः सुतः सोमो नर वर्षण्वसु | आ यातं सोमपीतये पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे
transliteration: ayaṃ vāmadribhiḥ sutaḥ somo nara vṛṣaṇvasu |
translation: This Soma pressed with stones is yours, ye Heroes, Lords of plenteous wealth. Approach to drink the Soma, come, drink in the worshipper's abode.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 8 Hymn 23
sanskrit: ईळिष्वा हि परतीव्यं यजस्व जातवेदसम | चरिष्णुधूममग्र्भीतशोचिषम
