translation: THOU, Soma, hast a running stream, joyous, most strong at sacrifice: Flow bounteously bestowing wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 67
sanskrit: तवं सुतो नर्मादनो दधन्वान मत्सरिन्तमः | इन्द्राय सूरिरन्धसा
transliteration: tvaṃ suto nṛmādano dadhanvān matsarintamaḥ | indrāya sūrirandhasā
translation: Effused as cheerer of the men, flowing best gladdener, thou art A Prince to Indra with thy juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 67
sanskrit: तवं सुष्वाणो अद्रिभिरभ्यर्ष कनिक्रदत | दयुमन्तं शुष्ममुत्तमम
transliteration: tvaṃ suṣvāṇo adribhirabhyarṣa kanikradat | dyumantaṃ śuṣmamuttamam
translation: Poured forth by pressing-stones, do thou with loud roar send us in a stream Most excellent illustrious might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 67
sanskrit: इन्दुर्हिन्वानो अर्षति तिरो वाराण्यव्यया | हरिर्वाजमचिक्रदत
transliteration: indurhinvāno arṣati tiro vārāṇyavyayā | haririgvedaājamacikradat
translation: Indu, urged forward, floweth through the fleecy cloth: the Tawny One With his loud roar hath brought as strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 67
sanskrit: इन्दो वयव्यमर्षसि वि शरवांसि वि सौभगा | वि वाजांसोम गोमतः
transliteration: indo vyavyamarṣasi vi śravāṃsi vi saubhaghā | vi vājāṃsoma ghomataḥ
translation: Indu, thou flowest through the fleece, bringing felicities and fame, And, Soma, spoil and wealth in kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: पर देवमछा मधुमन्त इन्दवो.असिष्यदन्त गाव आ न धेनवः | बर्हिषदो वचनावन्त ऊधभिः परिस्रुतमुस्रियानिर्णिजं धिरे
transliteration: pra devamachā madhumanta indavo.asiṣyadanta ghāva ā na dhenavaḥ | barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutamusriyānirṇijaṃ dhire
translation: THE drops of Soma juice like cows who yield their milk have flowed forth, rich in meath, unto the Shining One, And, seated on the grass, raising their voice, assumed the milk, the covering robe wherewith the udders stream.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: स रोरुवदभि पूर्वा अचिक्रददुपारुहः शरथयन सवादतेहरिः | तिरः पवित्रमप्रियन्नुरु जरयो नि शर्याणि दधते देव आ वरम
transliteration: sa roruvadabhi pūrigvedaā acikradadupāruhaḥ śrathayan svādatehariḥ | tiraḥ pavitramapriyannuru jrayo ni śaryāṇi dadhate deva ā varam
translation: He bellows with a roar around the highest twigs: the Tawny One is sweetened as he breaks them up. Then passing through the sieve into the ample room, the God throws off the dregs according to his wish.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: वि यो ममे यम्या संयती मदः साकंव्र्धा पयसा पिन्वदक्षिता | मही अपारे रजसी विवेविददभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाज आ ददे
transliteration: vi yo mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvadakṣitā | mahī apāre rajasī vivevidadabhivrajannakṣitaṃ pāja ā dade
translation: The gladdening drink that measured out the meeting Twins fills full with milk the Eternal Ever-waxing Pair. Bringing to light the Two great Regions limitless, moving above them he gained sheen that never fades.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: स मातरा विचरन वाजयन्नपः पर मेधिरः सवधया पिन्वते पदम | अंशुर्यवेन पिपिशे यतो नर्भिः सं जामिभिर्नसते रक्षते शिरः
transliteration: sa mātarā vicaran vājayannapaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam | aṃśuryavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṃ jāmibhirnasate rakṣate śiraḥ
translation: Wandering through, the Parents, strengthening the floods, the Sage makes his place swell with his own native might. The stalk is mixed with grain: he comes led by the men together with the sisters, and preserves the Head.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: सं दक्षेण मनसा जायते कविरतस्य गर्भो निहितो यमा परः | यूना ह सन्ता परथमं वि जज्ञतुर्गुहा हितं जनिम नेममुद्यतम
transliteration: saṃ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavirtasya gharbho nihito yamā paraḥ | yūnā ha santā prathamaṃ vi jajñaturghuhā hitaṃ janima nemamudyatam
translation: With energetic intellect the Sage is born, deposited as germ of Law, far from the Twins. They being young at first showed visibly distinct the Creature that is half-concealed and half-exposed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: मन्द्रस्य रूपं विविदुर्मनीषिणः शयेनो यदन्धो अभरत परावतः | तं मर्जयन्त सुव्र्धं नदीष्वा उशन्तमंशुं परियन्तं रग्मियम
transliteration: mandrasya rūpaṃ vividurmanīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yadandho abharat parāvataḥ | taṃ marjayanta suvṛdhaṃ nadīṣvā uśantamaṃśuṃ pariyantaṃ ṛghmiyam
translation: The sages knew the form of him the Gladdener, what time the Falcon brought the plant from far away. Him who assures success they beautified in streams, the stalk who yearned therefor, mighty and meet for praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: तवां मर्जन्ति दश योषणः सुतं सोम रषिभिर्मतिभिर्धीतिभिर्हितम | अव्यो वारेभिरुत देवहूतिभिर्न्र्भिर्यतोवाजमा दर्षि सातये
transliteration: tvāṃ mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṃ soma ṛṣibhirmatibhirdhītibhirhitam | avyo vārebhiruta devahūtibhirnṛbhiryatovājamā darṣi sātaye
translation: Together with the Rsis, with their prayers and hymns ten women deck thee, Soma, friendly when effused. Led by the men, with invocations of the Gods, through the fleece, thou hast given us strength to win the spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: परिप्रयन्तं वय्यं सुषंसदं सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभः | यो धारया मधुमानूर्मिणा दिव इयर्ति वाचं रयिषाळ अमर्त्यः
transliteration: pariprayantaṃ vayyaṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ | yo dhārayā madhumānūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṃ rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ
translation: Songs resonant with praise have celebrated him. Soma, Friend, springing forth with his fair company. Even him who rich in meath, with undulating stream, Winnner of Wealth, Immortal, sends his voice from heaven,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: अयं दिव इयर्ति विश्वमा रजः सोमः पुनानः कलशेषु सीदति | अद्भिर्गोभिर्म्र्ज्यते अद्रिभिः सुतः पुनान इन्दुर्वरिवो विदत परियम
transliteration: ayaṃ diva iyarti viśvamā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati | adbhirghobhirmṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indurigvedaarivo vidat priyam
translation: He sends it into all the region forth from heaven. Soma, while he is filtered, settles in the jars. With milk and waters is he decked when pressed with stones: Indu, when purified, shall find sweet rest and room.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 68
sanskrit: एवा नः सोम परिषिच्यमानो वयो दधच्चित्रतमं पवस्व | अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम
transliteration: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhaccitratamaṃ pavasva | adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram
translation: Even thus poured forth How on thy way, O Soma, vouchsafing us most manifold lively vigour. We will invoke benevolent Earth and Heaven. Give us, ye Gods, riches with noble heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: इषुर्न धन्वन परति धीयते मतिर्वत्सो न मातुरुप सर्ज्यूधनि | उरुधारेव दुहे अग्र आयत्यस्य वरतेष्वपि सोम इष्यते
transliteration: iṣurna dhanvan prati dhīyate matirigvedaatso na māturupa sarjyūdhani | urudhāreva duhe aghra āyatyasya vrateṣvapi soma iṣyate
translation: LAID like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam. As one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the Soma is impelled to this man's holy rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: उपो मतिः पर्च्यते सिच्यते मधु मन्द्राजनी चोदते अन्तरासनि | पवमानः सन्तनिः परघ्नतामिव मधुमान दरप्सः परि वारमर्षति
transliteration: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani | pavamānaḥ santaniḥ praghnatāmiva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāramarṣati
translation: The thought is deeply fixed; the savoury juice is shed; the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mouth; And Pavamana, like the shout of combatants, the drop rising in sweet juice, is flowing through the fleece.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: अव्ये वधूयुः पवते परि तवचि शरथ्नीते नप्तीरदितेरतं यते | हरिरक्रान यजतः संयतो मदो नर्म्णा शिशानो महिषो न शोभते
transliteration: avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīraditertaṃ yate | harirakrān yajataḥ saṃyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate
translation: He flows about the sheep-skin, longing for a bride: he looses Aditi's Daughters for the worshipper. The sacred drink hath come, gold-tinted, well-restrained: like a strong Bull he shines, whetting his manly might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: उक्षा मिमाति परति यन्ति धेनवो देवस्य देवीरुप यन्ति निष्क्र्तम | अत्यक्रमीदर्जुनं वारमव्ययमत्कं न निक्तम्परि सोमो अव्यत
transliteration: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīrupa yanti niṣkṛtam | atyakramīdarjunaṃ vāramavyayamatkaṃ na niktampari somo avyata
translation: The Bull is bellowing; the Cows are coming nigh: the Goddesses approach the God's own resting-place. Onward hath Soma passed through the sheep's fair bright fleece, and hath, as 'twere, endued a garment newly washed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: अम्र्क्तेन रुशता वाससा हरिरमर्त्यो निर्णिजानः परि वयत | दिवस पर्ष्ठं बर्हणा निर्णिजे कर्तोपस्तरणं चम्वोर्नभस्मयम
transliteration: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariramartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata | divas pṛṣṭhaṃ barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṃ camvornabhasmayam
translation: The golden-hued, Immortal, newly bathed, puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed. He made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe, by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: सूर्यस्येव रश्मयो दरावयित्नवो मत्सरासः परसुपः साकमीरते | तन्तुं ततं परि सर्गास आशवो नेन्द्राद रते पवते धाम किं चन
transliteration: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākamīrate | tantuṃ tataṃ pari sarghāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana
translation: Even as the beams of Surya, urging men to speed, that cheer and send to sleep, together rush they forth, These swift outpourings in long course of holy rites: no form save only Indra shows itself so pure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 69
sanskrit: सिन्धोरिव परवणे निम्न आशवो वर्षच्युता मदासो गातुमाशत | शं नो निवेशे दविपदे चतुष्पदे.अस्मे वाजः सोम तिष्ठन्तु कर्ष्टयः
transliteration: sindhoriva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso ghātumāśata |
translation: As down the steep slope of a river to the vale, drawn from the Steer the swift strong draughts have found a way. Well be it with the men and cattle in our home. May powers, O Soma, may the people stay with us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: तरिरस्मै सप्त धेनवो दुदुह्रे सत्यामाशिरं पूर्व्ये वयोमनि | चत्वार्यन्या भुवनानि निर्णिजे चारूणि चक्रे यद रतैरवर्धत
transliteration: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyāmāśiraṃ pūrigvedaye vyomani | catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtairavardhata
translation: THE three times seven Milch-kine in the eastern heaven have for this Soma poured the genuine milky draught. Four other beauteous Creatures hath he made for his adornment, when he waxed in strength through holy rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: स भिक्षमाणो अम्र्तस्य चारुण उभे दयावा काव्येना वि शश्रथे | तेजिष्ठा अपो मंहना परि वयत यदी देवस्य शरवसा सदो विदुः
transliteration: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe | tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ
translation: Longing for lovely Amrta, by his wisdom he divided, each apart from other, earth and heaven. He gladly wrapped himself in the most lucid floods, when through their glory they found the God's resting-place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: ते अस्य सन्तु केतवो.अम्र्त्यवो.अदाभ्यासो जनुषी उभे अनु | येभिर्न्र्म्णा च देव्या च पुनत आदिद राजानं मनना अग्र्भ्णत
transliteration: te asya santu ketavo.amṛtyavo.adābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu | yebhirnṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ādid rājānaṃ mananā aghṛbhṇata
translation: May those his brilliant rays he ever free from death, inviolate, for both classes of created things,- Rays wherewith powers of men and Gods are purified. Yea, even for this have sages welcomed him as King.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: स मर्ज्यमानो दशभिः सुकर्मभिः पर मध्यमासु मात्र्षुप्रमे सचा | वरतानि पानो अम्र्तस्व चारुण उभे नर्चक्षानु पश्यते विशौ
transliteration: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣuprame sacā | vratāni pāno amṛtasva cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣāanu paśyate viśau
translation: He, while he is adorned by the ten skillful ones, that he too in the Midmost Mothers may create, While he is watching o'er the lovely Amrta's ways, looks on both races as Beholder of mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: स मर्म्र्जान इन्द्रियाय धायस ओभे अन्ता रोदसी हर्षते हितः | वर्षा शुष्मेण बाधते वि दुर्मतीरादेदिशानः शर्यहेव शुरुधः
transliteration: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ | vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīrādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ
translation: He, while he is adorned to stream forth mighty strength, rejoices in his place between the earth and heaven. The Steer dispels the evil-hearted with his might, aiming at offerings as an archer at the game.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: स मातरा न दद्र्शान उस्रियो नानददेति मरुतामिव सवनः | जानन्न्र्तं परथमं यत सवर्णरं परशस्तये कमव्र्णीत सुक्रतुः
transliteration: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadadeti marutāmiva svanaḥ | jānannṛtaṃ prathamaṃ yat svarṇaraṃ praśastaye kamavṛṇīta sukratuḥ
translation: Beholding, as it were, Two Mother Cows, the Steer goes roaring on his way even as the Maruts roar. Knowing Eternal Law, the earliest light of heaven, he, passing wise, was chosen out to tell it forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 70
sanskrit: रुवति भीमो वर्षभस्तविष्यया शर्ङगे शिशानो हरिणीविचक्षणः | आ योनिं सोमः सुक्र्तं नि षीदति गव्ययीत्वग भवति निर्णिगव्ययी
transliteration: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhastaviṣyayā śṛṅghe śiśāno hariṇīvicakṣaṇaḥ |
translation: The fearful Bull is bellowing with violent might, far-sighted, sharpening his yellow coloured horns. Soma assumes his seat in the well-fashioned place: the cowhide and the sheepskin are his ornament.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 71
sanskrit: आ दक्षिणा सर्ज्यते शुष्म्यासदं वेति दरुहो रक्षसः पाति जाग्र्विः | हरिरोपशं कर्णुते नभस पय उपस्तिरे चम्वोर्ब्रह्म निर्णिजे
transliteration: hariropaśaṃ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvorbrahma nirṇije
translation: THE guerdon is bestowed: the Mighty takes his Seat, and, ever-Watchful, guards from fiend and evil sprite. Gold-hued, he makes the cloud his diadem, the milk his carpet in both worlds, and prayer his robe of state.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 71
sanskrit: पर करिष्टिहेव शूष एति रोरुवदसुर्यं वर्णं नि रिणीते अस्य तम | जहाति वव्रिं पितुरेति निष्क्र्तमुपप्रुतं कर्णुते निर्णिजं तना
transliteration: pra kriṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvadasuryaṃ varṇaṃ ni riṇīte asya tam | jahāti vavriṃ pitureti niṣkṛtamupaprutaṃ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ tanā
translation: Strong, bellowing, he goes, like one who slays the folk; he lets this hue of Asuras flow off from him, Throws off his covering, seeks his father's meeting-place, and thus makes for himself the bright robe he assumes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 71
sanskrit: अद्रिभिः सुतः पवते गभस्त्योर्व्र्षायते नभसा वेपते मती | स मोदते नसते साधते गिरा नेनिक्ते अप्सु यजते परीमणि
transliteration: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate ghabhastyorigvedaṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī | sa modate nasate sādhate ghirā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi
translation: Onward he flows, from both the hands, pressed out with stones: excited by the prayer, the water makes him wild. He frolics and draws near, completes his work with song, and bathes in streams to satisfy the worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 71
sanskrit: परि दयुक्षं सहसः पर्वताव्र्धं मध्वः सिञ्चन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिम | आ यस्मिन गावः सुहुताद ऊधनि मूर्धंछ्रीणन्त्यग्रियं वरीमभिः
transliteration: pari dyukṣaṃ sahasaḥ parigvedaatāvṛdhaṃ madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim |
translation: They pour out meath around the Master of the house, Celestial Strengthener of the mountain that gives might; In whom, through his great powers, oblation-eating cows in their uplifted udder mix their choicest milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 72
sanskrit: हरिं मर्जन्त्यरुषो न युज्यते सं धेनुभिः कलशे सोमो अज्यते | उद वाचमीरयति हिन्वते मती पुरुष्टुतस्य कति चित्परिप्रियः
transliteration: hariṃ mṛjantyaruṣo na yujyate saṃ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate | ud vācamīrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati citparipriyaḥ
translation: THEY cleanse the Gold-hued: like a red Steed is he yoked, and Soma in the jar is mingled with the milk. He sendeth out his voice, and many loving friends of him the highly lauded hasten with their songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 72
sanskrit: साकं वदन्ति बहवो मनीषिण इन्द्रस्य सोमं जठरे यदादुहुः | यदी मर्जन्ति सुगभस्तयो नरः सनीळाभिर्दशभिः काम्यं मधु
transliteration: sākaṃ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṃ jaṭhare yadāduhuḥ | yadī mṛjanti sughabhastayo naraḥ sanīḷābhirdaśabhiḥ kāmyaṃ madhu
translation: The many sages utter words in unison, while into Indra's throat they pour the Soma juice, When, with the ten that dwell together closely joined, the men whose hands are skillful cleanse the lovely meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 72
sanskrit: अरममाणो अत्येति गा अभि सूर्यस्य परियं दुहितुस्तिरो रवम | अन्वस्मै जोषमभरद विनंग्र्सः सं दवयीभिः सवस्र्भिः कषेति जामिभिः
transliteration: aramamāṇo atyeti ghā abhi sūryasya priyaṃ duhitustiro ravam | anvasmai joṣamabharad vinaṃghṛsaḥ saṃ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ
translation: He goes upon his way, unresting, to the cows, over the roaring sound which Sarya's Daughter loves. The Falcon brought it to him for his own delight: now with the twofold kindred sisters is his home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 72
sanskrit: नर्धूतो अद्रिषुतो बर्हिषि परियः पतिर्गवां परदिव इन्दुरतवियः | पुरन्धिवान मनुषो यज्ञसाधनः शुचिर्धियापवते सोम इन्द्र ते
transliteration: nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patirghavāṃ pradiva indurtviyaḥ | purandhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucirdhiyāpavate soma indra te
translation: Washed by the men, stone-pressed, dear on the holy grass, faithful to seasons, Lord of cattle from of old, Most liberal, completing sacrifice for men, O Indra, pure bright Soma, Indu, flows for thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 72
sanskrit: नर्बाहुभ्यां चोदितो धारया सुतो.अनुष्वधं पवते सोम इन्द्र ते | आप्राः करतून समजैरध्वरे मतीर्वेर्न दरुषच्चम्वोरासदद धरिः
transliteration: nṛbāhubhyāṃ codito dhārayā suto.anuṣvadhaṃ pavate soma indra te |
translation: O Indra, urged by arms of men and poured in streams, Soma flows on for thee after his Godlike kind. Plans thou fulfillest, gatherest thoughts for sacrifice: in the bowls sits the Gold-hued like a roosting bird.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: सरक्वे दरप्सस्य धमतः समस्वरन्न्र्तस्य योना समरन्तनाभयः | तरीन स मूर्ध्नो असुरश्चक्र आरभे सत्यस्यनावः सुक्र्तमपीपरन
transliteration: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ samasvarannṛtasya yonā samarantanābhayaḥ | trīn sa mūrdhno asuraścakra ārabhe satyasyanāvaḥ sukṛtamapīparan
translation: THEY from the spouting drop have sounded at the rim: naves speed together to the place of sacrifice. That Asura hath formed, to seize, three lofty heights. The ships of truth have borne the pious man across.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: सम्यक सम्यञ्चो महिषा अहेषत सिन्धोरूर्मावधि वेना अवीविपन | मधोर्धाराभिर्जनयन्तो अर्कमित परियामिन्द्रस्य तन्वमवीव्र्धन
transliteration: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhorūrmāvadhi venā avīvipan | madhordhārābhirjanayanto arkamit priyāmindrasya tanvamavīvṛdhan
translation: The strong Steers, gathering, have duly stirred themselves, and over the stream's wave the friends sent forth the song. Engendering the hymn, with flowing streams of meath, Indra's dear body have they caused to wax in strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: पवित्रवन्तः परि वाचमासते पितैषां परत्नो अभि रक्षति वरतम | महः समुद्रं वरुणस्तिरो दधे धीरा इच्छेकुर्धरुणेष्वारभम
transliteration: pavitravantaḥ pari vācamāsate pitaiṣāṃ pratno abhi rakṣati vratam | mahaḥ samudraṃ varuṇastiro dadhe dhīrā icchekurdharuṇeṣvārabham
translation: With sanctifying gear they sit around the song: their ancient Father guards their holy work from harm. Varuna hath o'erspread the mighty sea of air. Sages had power to hold him in sustaining floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: सहस्रधारे.अव ते समस्वरन दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतः | अस्य सपशो न नि मिषन्ति भूर्णयः पदे-पदे पाशिनः सन्ति सेतवः
transliteration: sahasradhāre.ava te samasvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ | asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade-pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ
translation: Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down together, in heaven's vault that pours a thousand streams. His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place are found the bonds that bind man last.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: पितुर्मातुरध्या ये समस्वरन्न्र्चा शोचन्तः सन्दहन्तो अव्रतान | इन्द्रद्विष्टामप धमन्ति मायया तवचमसिक्नीं भूमनो दिवस परि
transliteration: piturmāturadhyā ye samasvarannṛcā śocantaḥ sandahanto avratān | indradviṣṭāmapa dhamanti māyayā tvacamasiknīṃ bhūmano divas pari
translation: O'er Sire and Mother they have roared in unison bright with the verse of praise, burning up riteless men, Blowing away with supernatural might from earth and from the heavens the swarthy skin which Indra hates.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: परत्नान मानादध्या ये समस्वरञ्छ्लोकयन्त्रासो रभसस्य मन्तवः | अपानक्षासो बधिरा अहासत रतस्य पन्थां न तरन्ति दुष्क्र्तः
transliteration: pratnān mānādadhyā ye samasvarañchlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ | apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṃ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ
translation: Those which, as guides of song and counsellors of speed, were manifested from their ancient dwelling place,- From these the eyeless and the deaf have turned aside: the wicked travel not the pathway of the Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 73
sanskrit: सहस्रधारे वितते पवित्र आ वाचं पुनन्ति कवयो मनीषिणः | रुद्रास एषामिषिरासो अद्रुह सपशः सवञ्चः सुद्र्शो नर्चक्षसः
transliteration: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācaṃ punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ | rudrāsa eṣāmiṣirāso adruha spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ
translation: What time the filter with a thousand streams is stretched, the thoughtful sages purify their song therein. Bright-coloured are their spies, vigorous, void of guile, excellent, fair to see, beholders of mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 74
sanskrit: शिशुर्न जातो.अव चक्रदद वने सवर्यद वाज्यरुषः सिषासति | दिवो रेतसा सचते पयोव्र्धा तमीमहे सुमती शर्म सप्रथः
transliteration: divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tamīmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ
translation: BORN like a youngling he hath clamoured in the wood, when he, the Red, the Strong, would win the light of heaven. He comes with heavenly seed that makes the water swell: him for wide-spreading shelter we implore with prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 74
sanskrit: दिवो य सकम्भो धरुणः सवातत आपूर्णो अंशुः पर्येतिविश्वतः | सेमे मही रोदसी यक्षदाव्र्ता समीचीने दाधार समिषः कविः
transliteration: divo ya skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṃśuḥ paryetiviśvataḥ | seme mahī rodasī yakṣadāvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra samiṣaḥ kaviḥ
translation: A far-extended pillar that supports the sky the Soma-stalk, filled full, moves itself every way. He shall bring both these great worlds while the rite proceeds: the Sage holds these who move! together and all food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 74
sanskrit: महि पसरः सुक्र्तं सोम्यं मधूर्वी गव्यूतिरदितेरतं यते | ईशे यो वर्ष्टेरित उस्रियो वर्षापां नेता य इतूतिरगमियः
transliteration: mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṃ somyaṃ madhūrigvedaī ghavyūtiraditertaṃ yate |
translation: Wide space hath he who follows Aditi's right path, and mighty, well-made food, meath blent with Soma juice; He who from hence commands the rain, Steer of the kine, Leader of floods, who helps us hence, who claims our laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 75
sanskrit: अभि परियाणि पवते चनोहितो नामानि यह्वो अधि येषु वर्धते | आ सूर्यस्य बर्हतो बर्हन्नधि रथं विष्वञ्चमरुहद विचक्षणः
transliteration: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate |
translation: GRACIOUSLY-MINDED he is flowing on his way to win dear names o'er which the Youthful One grows great. The Mighty and Far-seeing One hath mounted now the mighty Surya's car which moves to every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 76
sanskrit: धर्ता दिवः पवते कर्त्व्यो रसो दक्षो देवानामनुमाद्यो नर्भिः | हरिः सर्जानो अत्यो न सत्वभिर्व्र्था पाजांसि कर्णुते नदीष्वा
transliteration: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānāmanumādyo nṛbhiḥ | hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhirigvedaṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣvā
translation: ON flows the potent juice, sustainer of the heavens, the strength of Gods, whom men must hail with shouts of joy. The Gold-hued, started like a courser by brave men, impetuously winneth splendour in the streams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 77
sanskrit: एष पर कोशे मधुमानचिक्रददिन्द्रस्य वज्रो वपुषो वपुष्टरः | अभीं रतस्य सुदुघा घर्तश्चुतो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः
transliteration: eṣa pra kośe madhumānacikradadindrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ | abhīṃ ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ
translation: MORE beauteous than the beautiful, as Indra's bolt, this Soma, rich in sweets, hath clamoured in the vat. Dropping with oil, abundant, streams of sacrifice flow unto him like milch-kine, lowing, with their milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 77
sanskrit: स पूर्व्यः पवते यं दिवस परि शयेनो मथायदिषितस्तिरो रजः | स मध्व आ युवते वेविजान इत कर्शानोरस्तुर्मनसाह बिभ्युषा
transliteration: sa pūrigvedayaḥ pavate yaṃ divas pari śyeno mathāyadiṣitastiro rajaḥ | sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānorasturmanasāha bibhyuṣā
translation: On flows that Ancient One whom, hitherward, from heaven, sped through the region of the air, the Falcon snatched. He, quivering with alarm and terrified in heart before bow-armed Krsanu, holdeth fast the sweet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 77
sanskrit: ते नः पूर्वास उपरास इन्दवो महे वाजाय धन्वन्तु गोमते | ईक्षेण्यासो अह्यो न चारवो बरह्म-बरह्म ये जुजुषुर्हविर हविः
transliteration: te naḥ pūrigvedaāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu ghomate |
translation: May those first freshest drops of Soma juice effused flow on, their way to bring us mighty strength in kine. Beauteous as serpents, worthy to be looked upon, they whom each sacred gift and all our prayers have pleased.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 78
sanskrit: पर राजा वाचं जनयन्नसिष्यददपो वसानो अभि गा इयक्षति | गर्भ्णाति रिप्रमविरस्य तान्वा शुद्धो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम
transliteration: pra rājā vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadadapo vasāno abhi ghā iyakṣati | ghṛbhṇāti ripramavirasya tānvā śuddho devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam
translation: RAISING his voice the King hath flowed upon his way: invested with the waters he would win the kine. The fleece retains his solid parts as though impure, and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place of Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 78
sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम परि षिच्यसे नर्भिर्न्र्चक्षा ऊर्मिः कविरज्यसे वने | पूर्वीर्हि ते सरुतयः सन्ति यातवे सहस्रमश्वा हरयश्चमूषदः
transliteration: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhirnṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavirajyase vane | pūrigvedaīrhi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasramaśvā harayaścamūṣadaḥ
translation: Thou, Soma, art effused for Indra by the men, balmed in the wood as wave, Sage, Viewer of mankind. Full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go: a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 78
sanskrit: समुद्रिया अप्सरसो मनीषिणमासीना अन्तरभि सोममक्षरन | ता ईं हिन्वन्ति हर्म्यस्य सक्षणिं याचन्ते सुम्नं पवमानमक्षितम
transliteration: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇamāsīnā antarabhi somamakṣaran | tā īṃ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṃ yācante sumnaṃ pavamānamakṣitam
translation: Apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea, sitting within, have flowed to Soma wise of heart. They urge the Master of the house upon his way, and to the Eternal Pavamana pray for bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 78
sanskrit: गोजिन नः सोमो रथजिद धिरण्यजित सवर्जिदब्जित पवते सहस्रजित | यं देवासश्चक्रिरे पीतये मदं सवादिष्ठं दरप्समरुणं मयोभुवम
transliteration: ghojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjidabjit pavate sahasrajit | yaṃ devāsaścakrire pītaye madaṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ drapsamaruṇaṃ mayobhuvam
translation: Soma flows on for u's as winner of the kine, winner of thousands, cars, water, and light, and gold; He whom the Gods have made a gladdening draught to drink, the drop most sweet to taste, weal-bringing, red of hue.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 78
sanskrit: एतानि सोम पवमानो अस्मयुः सत्यानि कर्ण्वन दरविणान्यर्षसि | जहि शत्रुमन्तिके दूरके च य उर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं च नस कर्धि
transliteration: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇānyarṣasi | jahi śatrumantike dūrake ca ya urigvedaīṃ ghavyūtimabhayaṃ ca nas kṛdhi
translation: Soma, as Pavamana thou, our faithful Friend, making for us these real treasures, flowest on. Slay thou the enemy both near and far away: grant us security and ample pasturage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 79
sanskrit: अचोदसो नो धन्वन्त्विन्दवः पर सुवानासो बर्हद्दिवेषु हरयः | वि च नशन न इषो अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त सनिषन्त नो धियः
transliteration: acodaso no dhanvantvindavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ | vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo.aryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ
translation: SPONTANEOUS let our drops of Soma juice flow on, pressed, golden-hued, among the Gods of lofty heaven. Perish among us they who give no gifts of food! perish the godless! May our prayers obtain success.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 79
sanskrit: पर णो धन्वन्त्विन्दवो मदच्युतो धना वा येभिरर्वतो जुनीमसि | तिरो मर्तस्य कस्य चित परिह्व्र्तिं वयं धनानि विश्वधा भरेमहि
transliteration: pra ṇo dhanvantvindavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhirarigvedaato junīmasi | tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṃ vayaṃ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi
translation: Forward to us the drops, distilling meath, shall flow, like riches for whose sake we urge the horses on. Beyond the crafty hindering of all mortal men may we continually bear precious wealth away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 79
sanskrit: उत सवस्या अरात्या अरिर्हि ष उतान्यस्या अरात्या वर्को हि षः | धन्वन न तर्ष्णा समरीत तानभि सोम जहिपवमान दुराध्यः
transliteration: uta svasyā arātyā arirhi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ | dhanvan na tṛṣṇā samarīta tānabhi soma jahipavamāna durādhyaḥ
translation: Yea, verily, foe of hate shown to himself is he, yea, verity, destroyer too of other hate. As thirst subdueth in the desert, conquer thou, O Soma Pavarnana, men of evil thoughts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 79
sanskrit: दिवि ते नाभा परमो य आददे पर्थिव्यास्ते रुरुहुः सानविक्षिपः | अद्रयस्त्वा बप्सति गोरधि तवच्यप्सु तवा हस्तैर्दुदुहुर्मनीषिणः
transliteration: divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyāste ruruhuḥ sānavikṣipaḥ | adrayastvā bapsati ghoradhi tvacyapsu tvā hastairduduhurmanīṣiṇaḥ
translation: Near kin to thee is he, raised loftiest in the heavens: upon the earth's high ridge thy scions have grown forth. The press-stones chew and crunch thee on the ox's hide: sages have milked thee with their hands into the streams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 79
sanskrit: एवा त इन्दो सुभ्वं सुपेशसं रसं तुञ्जन्ति परथमा अभिश्रियः | निदं-निदं पवमान नि तारिष आविस्ते शुष्मो भवतु परियो मदः
transliteration: evā ta indo subhvaṃ supeśasaṃ rasaṃ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ | nidaṃ-nidaṃ pavamāna ni tāriṣa āviste śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ
translation: So do they hurry on thy strong and beauteous juice, O Indu, as the first ingredient of the draught. Bring low, thou Pavamana, every single foe, and be thy might shown forth as sweet and gladdening drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 80
sanskrit: सोमस्य धारा पवते नर्चक्षस रतेन देवान हवते दिवस परि | बर्हस्पते रवथेना वि दिद्युते समुद्रासो न सवनानि विव्यचुः
transliteration: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari | bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ
translation: ON flows the stream of Soma who beholds mankind: by everlasting Law he calls the Gods from heaven. He lightens with the roaring of Br aspati: h the lakes have not contained the pourings of juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 80
sanskrit: यं तवा वाजिन्नघ्न्या अभ्यनूषतायोहतं योनिमा रोहसि दयुमान | मघोनामायुः परतिरन महि शरव इन्द्राय सोमपवसे वर्षा मदः
transliteration: yaṃ tvā vājinnaghnyā abhyanūṣatāyohataṃ yonimā rohasi dyumān | maghonāmāyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya somapavase vṛṣā madaḥ
translation: Thou, powerful Soma, thou to whom the cows have -lowed, ascendest bright with sheen, thine iron-fashioned home. Thou, lengthening our princes' life and high renown, flowest for Indra as his might to gladdening drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 80
sanskrit: एन्द्रस्य कुक्षा पवते मदिन्तम ऊर्जं वसानः शरवसे सुमङगलः | परत्यं स विश्वा भुवनाभि पप्रथे करीळन हरिरत्यः सयन्दते वर्षा
transliteration: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṃ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅghalaḥ | pratyaṃ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḷan hariratyaḥ syandate vṛṣā
translation: Best giver of delight, he flows to Indra's throat, robing himself in might, Auspicious One, for fame. He spreads himself abroad to meet all things that be: the vigorous Tawny Steed flows sporting on his way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 80
sanskrit: तं तवा देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमं नरः सहस्रधारं दुहते दश कषिपः | नर्भिः सोम परच्युतो गरावभिः सुतो विश्वान्देवाना पवस्वा सहस्रजित
transliteration: taṃ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṃ naraḥ sahasradhāraṃ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ | nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto ghrāvabhiḥ suto viśvāndevānā pavasvā sahasrajit
translation: The men, the ten swift fingers, milk thee out for Gods, even thee most rich in meath, with thousand flowing streams. Soma who winnest thousands, driven by the men, expressed with stones, bring, as thou flowest, all the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 80
sanskrit: तं तवा हस्तिनो मधुमन्तमद्रिभिर्दुहन्त्यप्सु वर्षभन्दश कषिपः | इन्द्रं सोम मादयन दैव्यं जनं सिन्धोरिवोर्मिः पवमानो अर्षसि
transliteration: taṃ tvā hastino madhumantamadribhirduhantyapsu vṛṣabhandaśa kṣipaḥ | indraṃ soma mādayan daivyaṃ janaṃ sindhorivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi
translation: Deft-handed men with stones, the ten swift fingers, drain thee into waters, thee, the Steer enriched with sweets. Thou, Soma, gladdening Indra, and the Heavenly Host, flowest as Pavamana like a river's wave.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 81
sanskrit: पर सोमस्य पवमानस्योर्मय इन्द्रस्य यन्ति जठरं सुपेशसः | दध्ना यदीमुन्नीता यशसा गवां दानाय शूरमुदमन्दिषुः सुताः
transliteration: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṃ supeśasaḥ | dadhnā yadīmunnītā yaśasā ghavāṃ dānāya śūramudamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ
translation: ONWARD to Indra's throat move, beauteously adorned, the waves of Soma as he purifies himself, When they, brought forward with the lovely curd of kine, effused, have cheered the Hero to bestow his gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 81
sanskrit: अछा हि सोमः कलशानसिष्यददत्यो न वोळ्हा रघुवर्तनिर्व्र्षा | अथा देवानामुभयस्य जन्मनो विद्वानश्नोत्यमुत इतश्च यत
transliteration: achā hi somaḥ kalaśānasiṣyadadatyo na voḷhā raghuvartanirigvedaṛṣā | athā devānāmubhayasya janmano vidvānaśnotyamuta itaśca yat
translation: Hither hath Soma flowed unto the beakers, like a chariot-horse, a stallion swift upon his way. Thus, knowing both the generations, he obtains the rights and dues of Gods from yonder and from hence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 82
sanskrit: असावि सोमो अरुषो वर्षा हरी राजेव दस्मो अभि गा अचिक्रदत | पुनानो वारं पर्येत्यव्ययं शयेनो न योनिं घर्तवन्तमासदम
transliteration: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi ghā acikradat | punāno vāraṃ paryetyavyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantamāsadam
translation: EVEN as a King hath Soma, red and tawny Bull, been pressed: the Wondrous One hath bellowed to the kine. While purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawk-like on the place that drops with oil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 82
sanskrit: कविर्वेधस्या पर्येषि माहिनमत्यो न मर्ष्टो अभि वाजमर्षसि | अपसेधन दुरिता सोम मर्ळय घर्तं वसानः परियासि निर्णिजम
transliteration: kavirigvedaedhasyā paryeṣi māhinamatyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājamarṣasi | apasedhan duritā soma mṛḷaya ghṛtaṃ vasānaḥ pariyāsi nirṇijam
translation: To glory goest thou, Sage with disposing skill, like a groomed steed thou rushest forward to the prize. O Soma, be thou gracious, driving off distress: thou goest, clothed in butter, to a robe of state.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 82
sanskrit: पर्जन्यः पिता महिषस्य पर्णिनो नाभा पर्थिव्या गिरिषुक्षयं दधे | सवसार आपो अभि गा उतासरन सं गरावभिर्नसते वीते अध्वरे
transliteration: parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā ghiriṣukṣayaṃ dadhe | svasāra āpo abhi ghā utāsaran saṃ ghrāvabhirnasate vīte adhvare
translation: Parjanya is the Father of the Mighty Bird: on mountains, in earth's centre hath he made his home. The waters too have flowed, the Sisters, to the kine: he meets the pressing-stones at the beloved rite.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 82
sanskrit: जायेव पत्यावधि शेव मंहसे पज्राया गर्भ शर्णुहि बरवीमि ते | अन्तर्वाणीषु पर चरा सु जीवसे.अनिन्द्यो वर्जने सोम जाग्र्हि
transliteration: jāyeva patyāvadhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyā gharbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te | antarigvedaāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase.anindyo vṛjane soma jāghṛhi
translation: Thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord. Listen, O Child of Pajri, for to thee I speak. Amid the holy songs go on that we may live: in time of trouble, Soma, watch thou free from blame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 82
sanskrit: यथा पूर्वेभ्यः शतसा अम्र्ध्रः सहस्रसाः पर्यया वाजमिन्दो | एवा पवस्व सुविताय नव्यसे तव वरतमन्वापः सचन्ते
transliteration: yathā pūrigvedaebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājamindo | evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratamanvāpaḥ sacante
translation: As to the men of old thou camest, Indu unharmed, to strengthen, winning hundreds, thousands, So now for new felicity flow onward: the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 83
sanskrit: पवित्रं ते विततं बरह्मणस पते परभुर्गात्राणि पर्येषिविश्वतः | अतप्ततनूर्न तदामो अश्नुते शर्तास इद वहन्तस्तत समाशत
transliteration: pavitraṃ te vitataṃ brahmaṇas pate prabhurghātrāṇi paryeṣiviśvataḥ | ataptatanūrna tadāmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantastat samāśata
translation: SPREAD is thy cleansing filter, Brahmanaspati: as Prince, thou enterest its limbs from every side. The raw, whose mass hath not been heated gains not this: they only which are dressed, which bear, attain to it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 83
sanskrit: तपोष पवित्रं विततं दिवस पदे शोचन्तो अस्य तन्तवो वयस्थिरन | अवन्त्यस्य पवीतारमाशवो दिवस पर्ष्ठमधितिष्ठन्ति चेतसा
transliteration: tapoṣ pavitraṃ vitataṃ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vyasthiran | avantyasya pavītāramāśavo divas pṛṣṭhamadhitiṣṭhanti cetasā
translation: High in the seat of heaven is spread the Scorcher's sieve: its threads are standing separate, glittering with light. The Swift Ones favour him who purifieth this: with consciousness they stand upon the height of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अरूरुचदुषसः पर्श्निरग्रिय उक्षा बिभर्ति भुवनानि वाजयुः | मायाविनो ममिरे अस्य मायया नर्चक्षसः पितरो गर्भमा दधुः
transliteration: arūrucaduṣasaḥ pṛśniraghriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ | māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro gharbhamā dadhuḥ
translation: The foremost spotted Steer hath made the Mornings shine, and yearning after strength sustains all things that be. By his high wisdom have the mighty Sages wrought: the Fathers who behold mankind laid down the germ,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 83
sanskrit: गन्धर्व इत्था पदमस्य रक्षति पाति देवानां जनिमान्यद्भुतः | गर्भ्णाति रिपुं निधया निधापतिः सुक्र्त्तमा मधुनो भक्षमाशत
transliteration: ghandharigvedaa itthā padamasya rakṣati pāti devānāṃ janimānyadbhutaḥ | ghṛbhṇāti ripuṃ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣamāśata
translation: Gandharva verily protects his dwelling place; Wondrous, he guards the generations of the Gods. Lord of the snare, he takes the foeman with the snare: those who are most devout have gained a share of meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 83
sanskrit: हविर्हविष्मो महि सद्म दैव्यं नभो वसानः परि यास्यध्वरम | राजा पवित्ररथो वाजमारुहः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिर्जयसि शरवो बर्हत
transliteration: havirhaviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṃ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsyadhvaram | rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayasi śravo bṛhat
translation: Rich in oblations! robed in cloud, thou compassest oblation, sacrifice, the mighty seat of Gods. King, on thy chariot-sieve thou goest up to war, and with a thousand weapons winnest lofty fame.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 84
sanskrit: पवस्व देवमादनो विचर्षणिरप्सा इन्द्राय वरुणाय वायवे | कर्धी नो अद्य वरिवः सवस्तिमदुरुक्षितौ गर्णीहि दैव्यं जनम
transliteration: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇirapsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave | kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimadurukṣitau ghṛṇīhi daivyaṃ janam
translation: FLOW, cheering Gods, most active, winner of the flood, for Indra, and for Vayu, and for Varuna. Bestow on us to-day wide room with happiness, and in thine ample dwelling laud the Host of Heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम सुषुतः परि सरवापामीवा भवतु रक्षसा सह | मा ते रसस्य मत्सत दवयाविनो दरविणस्वन्त इह सन्त्विन्दवः
transliteration: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha | mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santvindavaḥ
translation: FLOW on to Indra, Soma, carefully effused: let sickness stay afar together with the fiends. Let not the double-tongued delight them with thy juice. here be thy flowing drops laden with opulence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: अस्मान समर्ये पवमान चोदय दक्षो देवानामसि हि परियो मदः | जहि शत्रून्रभ्या भन्दनायतः पिबेन्द्र सोममव नो मर्धो जहि
transliteration: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānāmasi hi priyo madaḥ | jahi śatrūnrabhyā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somamava no mṛdho jahi
translation: O Pavamana, urge us forward in the fight thou art the vigour of the Gods, the well-loved drink. Smite thou our enemies who raise the shout of joy: Indra, drink Soma juice, and drive away our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: अदब्ध इन्दो पवसे मदिन्तम आत्मेन्द्रस्य भवसि धासिरुत्तमः | अभि सवरन्ति बहवो मनीषिणो राजानमस्य भुवनस्यनिंसते
transliteration: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsiruttamaḥ | abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānamasya bhuvanasyaniṃsate
translation: Unharmed, best Cheerer, thou, O Indu, flowest on: thou, even thou thyself, art Indra's noblest food. Full many a wise man lifts to thee the song of praise, and hails thee with a kiss as Sovran of this world.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: सहस्रणीथः शतधारो अद्भुत इन्द्रायेन्दुः पवते काम्यं मधु | जयन कषेत्रमभ्यर्षा जयन्नप उरुं नो गातुं कर्णु सोम मीढ्वः
transliteration: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyaṃ madhu | jayan kṣetramabhyarṣā jayannapa uruṃ no ghātuṃ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ
translation: Wondrous, with hundred streams, hymned in a thousand songs, Indu pours out for Indra his delightful meath. Winning us land and waters, flow thou hitherward: Rainer of bounties, Soma, make broad way for us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: कनिक्रदत कलशे गोभिरज्यसे वयव्ययं समया वारमर्षसि | मर्म्र्ज्यमानो अत्यो न सानसिरिन्द्रस्य सोम जठरे समक्षरः
transliteration: kanikradat kalaśe ghobhirajyase vyavyayaṃ samayā vāramarṣasi | marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasirindrasya soma jaṭhare samakṣaraḥ
translation: Roaring within the beaker thou art balmed with milk: thou passest through the fleecy filter all at once. Carefully cleansed and decked like a prizewinning steed, O Soma, thou hast flowed down within Indra's throat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: सवादुः पवस्व दिव्याय जन्मने सवादुरिन्द्राय सुहवीतुनाम्ने | सवादुर्मित्राय वरुणाय वायवे बर्हस्पतये मधुमानदाभ्यः
transliteration: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādurindrāya suhavītunāmne | svādurmitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumānadābhyaḥ
translation: Flow onward sweet of flavour for the Heavenly Race, for Indra sweet, whose name is easily invoked: Flow sweet for Mitra, Varuna, and Vayu, rich in meath, inviolable for Brhaspati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: अत्यं मर्जन्ति कलशे दश कषिपः पर विप्राणां मतयो वाच ईरते | पवमाना अभ्यर्षन्ति सुष्टुतिमेन्द्रं विशन्तिमदिरास इन्दवः
transliteration: atyaṃ mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇāṃ matayo vāca īrate | pavamānā abhyarṣanti suṣṭutimendraṃ viśantimadirāsa indavaḥ
translation: Ten rapid fingers deck the Courser in the jar: with hymns the holy singers send their voices forth. The filtering juices hasten to their eulogy, the drops that gladden find their way to Indra's heart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: पवमानो अभ्यर्षा सुवीर्यमुर्वीं गव्यूतिं महि शर्म सप्रथः | माकिर्नो अस्य परिषूतिरीशतेन्दो जयेम तवयाधनं-धनम
transliteration: pavamāno abhyarṣā suvīryamurigvedaīṃ ghavyūtiṃ mahi śarma saprathaḥ | mākirno asya pariṣūtirīśatendo jayema tvayādhanaṃ-dhanam
translation: While thou art purified pour on us hero strength, great, far-extended shelter, spacious pasturage. Let no oppression master this our holy work: may we, O Indu, gain all opulence through thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: अधि दयामस्थाद वर्षभो विचक्षणो.अरूरुचद वि दिवो रोचना कविः | राजा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवद दिवः पीयूषन्दुहते नर्चक्षसः
transliteration: adhi dyāmasthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo.arūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ | rājā pavitramatyeti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣanduhate nṛcakṣasaḥ
translation: The Steer who sees afar hath risen above the sky: the Sage hath caused the lights of heaven to give their shine. The. King is passing through the filter with a roar: they drain the milk of heaven from him who looks on men.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: दिवो नाके मधुजिह्वा असश्चतो वेना दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम | अप्सु दरप्सं वाव्र्धानं समुद्र आ सिन्धोरूर्मामधुमन्तं पवित्र आ
transliteration: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām | apsu drapsaṃ vāvṛdhānaṃ samudra ā sindhorūrmāmadhumantaṃ pavitra ā
translation: High in the vault of heaven, unceasing, honey-tongued, the Loving Ones drain out the mountain-haunting Steer,- The drop that hath grown great in waters, in the lake meath-rich, in the stream's wave and in the cleansing sieve.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 85
sanskrit: नाके सुपर्णमुपपप्तिवांसं गिरो वेनानामक्र्पन्त पूर्वीः | शिशुं रिहन्ति मतयः पनिप्नतं हिरण्ययं शकुनं कषामणि सथाम
transliteration: nāke suparṇamupapaptivāṃsaṃ ghiro venānāmakṛpanta pūrigvedaīḥ |
translation: The Loving Ones besought with many voices the Eagle who had flown away to heaven. Hymns kiss the Youngling worthy of laudation, resting on earth, the Bird of golden colour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पर त आशवः पवमान धीजवो मदा अर्षन्ति रघुजा इव तमना | दिव्याः सुपर्णा मधुमन्त इन्दवो मदिन्तमासः परि कोशमासते
transliteration: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā | divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośamāsate
translation: THY gladdening draughts, O Pavamana, urged by song flow swiftly of themselves like sons of fleet-foot mares. The drops of Soma juice, those eagles of the heavens, most cheering, rich in meath, rest in the reservoir.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पर ते मदासो मदिरास आशवो.अस्र्क्षत रथ्यासो यथा पर्थक | धेनुर्न वत्सं पयसाभि वज्रिणमिन्द्रमिन्दवो मधुमन्त ऊर्मयः
transliteration: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo.asṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak | dhenurna vatsaṃ payasābhi vajriṇamindramindavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ
translation: As rapid chariot-steeds, so turned in several ways have thine exhilarating juices darted forth, Soma-drops rich in meath, waves, to the Thunder-armed, to Indra, like milch-kine who seek their calf with milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अत्यो न हियानो अभि वाजमर्ष सवर्वित कोशं दिवो अद्रिमातरम | वर्षा पवित्रे अधि सानो अव्यये सोमः पुनान इन्द्रियाय धायसे
transliteration: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājamarṣa svarigvedat kośaṃ divo adrimātaram | vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase
translation: Like a steed urged to battle, finder of the light; speed onward to the cloud-born reservoir of heaven, A Steer that o'er the woolly surface seeks the sieve, Soma while purified for Indra's nourishment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पर त आश्विनीः पवमान धीजुवो दिव्या अस्र्ग्रन पयसा धरीमणि | परान्तरषयः सथाविरीरस्र्क्षत ये तवा मर्जन्त्य रषिषाण वेधसः
transliteration: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛghran payasā dharīmaṇi | prāntarṣayaḥ sthāvirīrasṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ
translation: Fleet as swift steeds, thy drops, divine, thought-swift, have been, O Pavamana, poured with milk into the vat. The Rsis have poured in continuous Soma drops, ordainers who adorn thee, Friend whom Rsis love.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: विश्वा धामानि विश्वचक्ष रभ्वसः परभोस्ते सतः परियन्ति केतवः | वयानशिः पवसे सोम धर्मभिः पतिर्विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजसि
transliteration: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoste sataḥ pariyanti ketavaḥ | vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patirigvedaśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
translation: O thou who seest all things, Sovran as thou art and passing strong, thy rays encompass all abodes. Pervading with thy natural powers thou flowest on, and as the whole world's Lord, O Soma, thou art King.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: उभयतः पवमानस्य रश्मयो धरुवस्य सतः परि यन्ति केतवः | यदी पवित्रे अधि मर्ज्यते हरिः सत्ता नि योना कलशेषु सीदति
transliteration: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ | yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati
translation: The beams of Pavamana, sent from earth and heaven, his ensigns who is ever steadfast, travel round. When on the sieve the Golden-hued is cleansed, he rests within the vats as one who seats him in his place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुः पवते सवध्वरः सोमो देवानामुप याति निष्क्र्तम | सहस्रधारः परि कोशमर्षति वर्षा पवित्रमत्येति रोरुवत
transliteration: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam | sahasradhāraḥ pari kośamarṣati vṛṣā pavitramatyeti roruvat
translation: Served with fair rites he flows, ensign of sacrifice: Soma advances to the special place of Gods. He speeds with thousand currents to the reservoir, and passes through the filter bellowing as a bull.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: राजा समुद्रं नद्यो वि गाहते.अपामूर्मिं सचते सिन्धुषु शरितः | अध्यस्थात सानु पवमानो अव्ययं नाभा पर्थिव्या धरुणो महो दिवः
transliteration: rājā samudraṃ nadyo vi ghāhate.apāmūrmiṃ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ | adhyasthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ
translation: The Sovran dips him in the sea in and the streams, and set in rivers with the waters' wave moves on. High heaven's Sustainer at the central point of earth, raised on the fleecy surface Pavamana stands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदद दयौश्च यस्य पर्थिवी च धर्मभिः | इन्द्रस्य सख्यं पवते विवेविदत सोमः पुनानःकलशेषु सीदति
transliteration: divo na sānu stanayannacikradad dyauśca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ | indrasya sakhyaṃ pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥkalaśeṣu sīdati
translation: He on whose high decree the heavens and earth depend hath roared and thundered like the summit of the sky. Soma flows on obtaining Indra's friendly love, and, as they purify him, settles in the jars.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: जयोतिर्यज्ञस्य पवते मधु परियं पिता देवानां जनिता विभूवसुः | दधाति रत्नं सवधयोरपीच्यं मदिन्तमो मत्सर इन्द्रियो रसः
transliteration: jyotiryajñasya pavate madhu priyaṃ pitā devānāṃ janitā vibhūvasuḥ | dadhāti ratnaṃ svadhayorapīcyaṃ madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ
translation: He, light of sacrifice distils delicious meath, most wealthy, Father and begetter of the Gods. He, gladdening, best of Cheerers, juice hat Indra loves, enriches with mysterious treasure earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अभिक्रन्दन कलशं वाज्यर्षति पतिर्दिवः शतधारो विचक्षणः | हरिर्मित्रस्य सदनेषु सीदति मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिःसिन्धुभिर्व्र्षा
transliteration: abhikrandan kalaśaṃ vājyarṣati patirdivaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ | harirmitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno.avibhiḥsindhubhirigvedaṛṣā
translation: The vigorous and far-seeing one, the Lord of heaven, flows, shouting to the beaker, with his thousand streams. Coloured like gold he rests in seats where Mitra dwells, the Steer made beautiful by rivers and by sheep.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अग्रे सिन्धूनां पवमानो अर्षत्यग्रे वाचो अग्रियो गोषु गछति | अग्रे वाजस्य भजते महाधनं सवायुधः सोत्र्भिः पूयते वर्षा
transliteration: aghre sindhūnāṃ pavamāno arṣatyaghre vāco aghriyo ghoṣu ghachati | aghre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṃ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā
translation: In forefront of the rivers Pavamana speeds, in forefront of the hymn, foremost among the kine. He shares the mighty booty in the van of war: the well-armed Steer is purified by worshippers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: अयं मतवाञ्छकुनो यथा हितो.अव्ये ससार पवमान ऊर्मिणा | तव करत्वा रोदसी अन्तरा कवे शुचिर्धिया पवते सोम इन्द्र ते
transliteration: ayaṃ matavāñchakuno yathā hito.avye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā | tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucirdhiyā pavate soma indra te
translation: This heedful Pavamana, like a bird sent forth, hath with his wave flowed onward to the fleecy sieve. O Indra, through thy wisdom, b thy thought, O Sage, Soma flows bright and pure between the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: दरापिं वसानो यजतो दिविस्प्र्शमन्तरिक्षप्रा भुवनेष्वर्पितः | सवर्जज्ञानो नभसाभ्यक्रमीत परत्नमस्य पितरमा विवासति
transliteration: drāpiṃ vasāno yajato divispṛśamantarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ | svarjajñāno nabhasābhyakramīt pratnamasya pitaramā vivāsati
translation: He, clad in mail that reaches heaven, the Holy One, filling the firmament stationed amid the worlds, Knowing. the realm of light, hath come to us in rain: he summons to himself his own primeval Sire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: सो अस्य विशे महि शर्म यछति यो अस्य धाम परथमं वयानशे | पदं यदस्य परमे वयोमन्यतो विश्वा अभि संयाति संयतः
transliteration: so asya viśe mahi śarma yachati yo asya dhāma prathamaṃ vyānaśe | padaṃ yadasya parame vyomanyato viśvā abhi saṃyāti saṃyataḥ
translation: He who was first of all to penetrate his form bestowed upon his race wide shelter and defense. From that high station which he hath in loftiest heaven he comes victorious to all encounters here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: परो अयासीदिन्दुरिन्द्रस्य निष्क्र्तं सखा सख्युर्न पर मिनाति संगिरम | मर्य इव युवतिभिः समर्षति सोमः कलशे शतयाम्ना पथा
transliteration: pro ayāsīdindurindrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyurna pra mināti saṃghiram | marya iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā
translation: Indu hath started for Indra's special place and slights not as a Friend the promise of his Friend. Soma speeds onward like a youth to youthful maids, and gains the beaker by a course of hundred paths.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 86
sanskrit: पर वो धियो मन्द्रयुवो विपन्युवः पनस्युवः संवसनेष्वक्रमुः | सोमं मनीषा अभ्यनूषत सतुभो.अभि धेनवः पयसेमशिश्रयुः
transliteration: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣvakramuḥ | somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubho.abhi dhenavaḥ payasemaśiśrayuḥ
translation: Your songs, exhilarating, tuneful, uttering praise, are come into the plains where the people meet. Worshippers have exalted Soma with their hymns, and milch kine have come near to meet him with their milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 87
sanskrit: पर तु दरव परि कोशं नि षीद नर्भिः पुनानो अभि वाजमर्ष | अश्वं न तवा वाजिनं मर्जयन्तो.अछा बर्ही रशनाभिर्नयन्ति
transliteration: pra tu drava pari kośaṃ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājamarṣa | aśvaṃ na tvā vājinaṃ marjayanto.achā barhī raśanābhirnayanti
translation: RUN onward to the reservoir and seat thee: cleansed by the men speed forward to the battle. Making thee beauteous like an able courser, forth to the sacred grass with reins they lead thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 87
sanskrit: सवायुधः पवते देव इन्दुरशस्तिहा वर्जनं रक्षमाणः | पिता देवानां जनिता सुदक्षो विष्टम्भो दिवो धरुणः पर्थिव्याः
transliteration: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva induraśastihā vṛjanaṃ rakṣamāṇaḥ | pitā devānāṃ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translation: Indu, the well-armed God, is flowing onward, who quells the curse and guards from treacherous onslaught, Father, begetter of the Gods, most skillful, the buttress of the heavens and earth's supporter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 88
sanskrit: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्वे तुभ्यं पवते तवमस्य पाहि | तवं ह यं चक्र्षे तवं वव्र्ष इन्दुं मदाय युज्याय सोमम
transliteration: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunve tubhyaṃ pavate tvamasya pāhi | tvaṃ ha yaṃ cakṛṣe tvaṃ vavṛṣa induṃ madāya yujyāya somam
translation: FOR thee this Soma is effused, O Indra: drink of this juice; for thee the stream is flowing- Soma, which thou thyself hast made and chosen, even Indu, for thy special drink to cheer thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 88
sanskrit: स ईं रथो न भुरिषाळ अयोजि महः पुरूणि सातये वसूनि | आदीं विश्वा नहुष्याणि जाता सवर्षाता वन ऊर्ध्वा नवन्त
transliteration: sa īṃ ratho na bhuriṣāḷ ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni |
translation: Like a capacious car hath it been harnessed, the Mighty; to acquire abundant treasures. Then in the sacrifice they celebrated all triumphs won by Nahusa in the battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 89
sanskrit: परो सय वह्निः पथ्याभिरस्यान दिवो न वर्ष्टिः पवमानोक्षाः | सहस्रधारो असदन नयस्मे मातुरुपस्थे वन आच सोमः
transliteration: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhirasyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamānoakṣāḥ | sahasradhāro asadan nyasme māturupasthe vana āca somaḥ
translation: THIS Chariot-horse hath moved along the pathways, and Pavamana flowed like rain from heaven. With us hath Soma with a thousand currents sunk in the wood, upon his Mother's bosom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 89
sanskrit: राजा सिन्धूनामवसिष्ट वास रतस्य नावमारुहद रजिष्ठाम | अप्सु दरप्सो वाव्र्धे शयेनजूतो दुह ईं पिता दुह ईं पितुर्जाम
transliteration: rājā sindhūnāmavasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvamāruhad rajiṣṭhām | apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īṃ pitā duha īṃ piturjām
translation: King, he hath clothed him in the robe of rivers, mounted the straightest-going ship of Order. Sped by the Hawk the drop hath waxed in waters: the father drains it, drains the Father's offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 89
sanskrit: सिंहं नसन्त मध्वो अयासं हरिमरुषं दिवो अस्य पतिम | शूरो युत्सु परथमः पर्छते गा अस्य चक्षसा परि पात्युक्षा
transliteration: siṃhaṃ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṃ harimaruṣaṃ divo asya patim |
translation: They come to him, red, tawny, Lord of Heaven, the watchful Guardian of the meath, the Lion. First, Hero in the fight, he seeks the cattle, and with his eye the Steer is our protector.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 90
sanskrit: पर हिन्वानो जनिता रोदस्यो रथो न वाजं सनिष्यन्नयासीत | इन्द्रं गछन्नायुधा संशिशानो विश्वा वसु हस्तयोरादधानः
transliteration: pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣyannayāsīt | indraṃ ghachannāyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayorādadhānaḥ
translation: URGED On, the Father of the Earth and Heaven hath gone forth like a car to gather booty, Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, and in his hand containing every treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 90
sanskrit: अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठं वर्षणं वयोधामाङगूषाणामवावशन्त वाणीः | वना वसानो वरुणो न सिन्धून वि रत्नधा दयते वार्याणि
transliteration: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhāmāṅghūṣāṇāmavāvaśanta vāṇīḥ | vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi
translation: To him the tones of sacred song have sounded, Steer of the triple height, the Life-bestower. Dwelling in wood as Varuna in rivers, lavishing treasure he distributes blessings

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: असर्जि वक्वा रथ्ये यथाजौ धिया मनोता परथमो मनीषी | दश सवसारो अधि सानो अव्ये.अजन्ति वह्निं सदनान्यछ
transliteration: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī | daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye.ajanti vahniṃ sadanānyacha
translation: As for a chariot-race, the skillful Speaker, Chief, Sage, Inventor, hath, with song, been started. The sisters ten upon the fleecy summit drive on the Car-horse to the resting places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: वीती जनस्य दिव्यस्य कव्यैरधि सुवानो नहुष्येभिरिन्दुः | पर यो नर्भिरम्र्तो मर्त्येभिर्मर्म्र्जानो.अविभिर्गोभिरद्भिः
transliteration: vītī janasya divyasya kavyairadhi suvāno nahuṣyebhirinduḥ | pra yo nṛbhiramṛto martyebhirmarmṛjāno.avibhirghobhiradbhiḥ
translation: The drop of Soma, pressed by wise Nahusyas, becomes the banquet of the Heavenly People- Indu, by hands of mortal men made beauteous, immortal, with the sheep and cows and waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: वर्षा वर्ष्ने रोरुवदंशुरस्मै पवमानो रुशदीर्ते पयोगोः | सहस्रं रक्वा पथिभिर्वचोविदध्वस्मभिः सूरो अण्वं वि याति
transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣne roruvadaṃśurasmai pavamāno ruśadīrte payoghoḥ | sahasraṃ ṛkvā pathibhirigvedaacovidadhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṃ vi yāti
translation: Steer roaring unto Steer, this Pavamana, this juice runs to the white milk of the milch-cow. Through thousand fine hairs goes the tuneful Singer, like Sura by his fair and open pathways.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: रुजा दर्ळ्हा चिद रक्षसः सदांसि पुनान इन्द ऊर्णुहि विवाजान | वर्श्चोपरिष्टात तुजता वधेन ये अन्ति दूरादुपनायमेषाम
transliteration: rujā dṛḷhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vivājān | vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrādupanāyameṣām
translation: Break down the, strong seats even of the demons: cleansing thee, Indu, robe thyself in vigour. Rend with thy swift bolt, coming from above them, those who are near and those who yet are distant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: स परत्नवन नव्यसे विश्ववार सूक्ताय पथः कर्णुहि पराचः | ये दुःषहासो वनुषा बर्हन्तस्तांस्ते अश्याम पुरुक्र्त पुरुक्षो
transliteration: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ | ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantastāṃste aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo
translation: Prepare the forward paths in ancient manner for the new hymn, thou Giver of all bounties. Those which are high and hard for foes to conquer may we gain from thee, Active! Food-bestower!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 91
sanskrit: एवा पुनानो अपः सवर्गा अस्मभ्यं तोका तनयानि भूरि | शं नः कषेत्रमुरु जयोतींषि सोम जयों नः सूर्यन्द्र्शये रिरीहि
transliteration: evā punāno apaḥ svarghā asmabhyaṃ tokā tanayāni bhūri |
translation: So purifying thee vouchsafe us waters, heaven's light, and cows, offspring and many children. Give us health, ample land, and lights, O Soma, and grant us long to look upon the sunshine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 92
sanskrit: परि सुवानो हरिरंशुः पवित्रे रथो न सर्जि सनये हियानः | आपच्छ्लोकमिन्द्रियं पूयमानः परति देवानजुषत परयोभिः
transliteration: pari suvāno hariraṃśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ |
translation: THE gold-hued juice, poured out upon the filter, is started like a car sent forth to conquer. He hath gained song and vigour while they cleansed him, and hath rejoiced the Gods with entertainments.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 93
sanskrit: साकमुक्षो मर्जयन्त सवसारो दश धीरस्य धीतयो धनुत्रीः | हरिः पर्यद्रवज्जाः सूर्यस्य दरोणं ननक्षे अत्यो न वाजी
transliteration: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ | hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī
translation: TEN sisters, pouring out the rain together, swift-moving thinkers of the sage, adorn him. Hither hath run the gold-hued Child of Surya and reached the vat like a fleet vigorous courser.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 93
sanskrit: सं मात्र्भिर्न शिशुर्वावशानो वर्षा दधन्वे पुरुवारोद्भिः | मर्यो न योषामभि निष्क्र्तं यन सं गछते कलश उस्रियाभिः
transliteration: saṃ mātṛbhirna śiśurigvedaāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāroadbhiḥ | maryo na yoṣāmabhi niṣkṛtaṃ yan saṃ ghachate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ
translation: Even as a youngling crying to his mothers, the bounteous Steer hath flowed along to waters. As youth to damsel, so with milk he hastens on to the. chose meeting-place, the beaker.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 93
sanskrit: उत पर पिप्य ऊधरघ्न्याया इन्दुर्धाराभिः सचते सुमेधाः | मूर्धानं गावः पयसा चमूष्वभि शरीणन्ति वसुभिर्न निक्तैः
transliteration: uta pra pipya ūdharaghnyāyā indurdhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ | mūrdhānaṃ ghāvaḥ payasā camūṣvabhi śrīṇanti vasubhirna niktaiḥ
translation: Yea, swollen is the udder of the milch-cow: thither in streams goes very sapient Indu. The kine make ready, as with new-washed treasures, the Head and Chief with milk within the vessels.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 93
sanskrit: स नो देवेभिः पवमान रदेन्दो रयिमश्विनं वावशानः | रथिरायतामुशती पुरन्धिरस्मद्र्यगा दावने वसूनाम
transliteration: sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayimaśvinaṃ vāvaśānaḥ | rathirāyatāmuśatī purandhirasmadryaghā dāvane vasūnām
translation: With all the Gods, O Indu Pavamana, while thou art roaring send us wealth in horses. Hither upon her car come willing Plenty, inclined to us, to give us of her treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 93
sanskrit: नू नो रयिमुप मास्व नर्वन्तं पुनानो वाताप्यं विश्वश्चन्द्रम | पर वन्दितुरिन्दो तार्यायुः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात
transliteration: nū no rayimupa māsva nṛvantaṃ punāno vātāpyaṃ viśvaścandram | pra vanditurindo tāryāyuḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjaghamyāt
translation: Now unto us mete riches, while they cleanse thee, all-glorious, swelling wealth, with store of heroes. Long be his life who worships, thee, O Indu. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 94
sanskrit: अधि यदस्मिन वाजिनीव शुभ सपर्धन्ते धियः सूर्ये नविशः | अपो वर्णानः पवते कवीयन वरजं न पशुवर्धनाय मन्म
transliteration: adhi yadasmin vājinīva śubha spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye naviśaḥ | apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma
translation: WHEN beauties strive for him as for a charger, then strive the songs like soldiers for the sunlight. Acting the Sage, he flows enrobed in waters and song as 'twere a stall that kine may prosper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 94
sanskrit: दविता वयूर्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य धाम सवर्विदे भुवनानि परथन्त | धियः पिन्वानाः सवसरे न गाव रतायन्तीरभि वावश्र इन्दुम
transliteration: dvitā vyūrṇvannamṛtasya dhāma svarigvedade bhuvanāni prathanta | dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na ghāva ṛtāyantīrabhi vāvaśra indum
translation: The worlds expand to him who from aforetime found light to spread the law of life eternal. The swelling songs, like kine within the stable, in deep devotion call aloud on Indu.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 94
sanskrit: परि यत कविः काव्या भरते शूरो न रथो भुवनानि विश्वा | देवेषु यशो मर्ताय भूषन दक्षाय रायः पुरुभूषु नव्यः
transliteration: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā | deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ
translation: When the sage bears his holy wisdom round him, like a car visiting all worlds, the Hero, Becoming fame, mid Gods, unto the mortal, wealth to the skilled, worth praise mid the Ever-present,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 95
sanskrit: कनिक्रन्ति हरिरा सर्ज्यमानः सीदन वनस्य जठरे पुनानः | नर्भिर्यतः कर्णुते निर्णिजं गा अतो मतीर्जनयतस्वधाभिः
transliteration: kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ | nṛbhiryataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ ghā ato matīrjanayatasvadhābhiḥ
translation: Loud neighs the Tawny Steed when started, settling deep in the wooden vessel while they cleanse him. Led by the men he takes the milk for raiment: then shall he, through his powers, engender praise-songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 95
sanskrit: हरिः सर्जानः पथ्यां रतस्येयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम | देवो देवानां गुह्यानि नामाविष कर्णोति बर्हिषि परवाचे
transliteration: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyāṃ ṛtasyeyarti vācamariteva nāvam | devo devānāṃ ghuhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce
translation: As one who rows drives on his boat, he, Gold-hued, sends forth his voice, loosed on the path of Order. As God, the secret names of Gods he utters, to be declared on sacred grass more widely.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 95
sanskrit: अपामिवेदूर्मयस्तर्तुराणाः पर मनीषा ईरते सोममछ | नमस्यन्तीरुप च यन्ति सं चा च विशन्त्युशतीरुशन्तम
transliteration: apāmivedūrmayastarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somamacha | namasyantīrupa ca yanti saṃ cā ca viśantyuśatīruśantam
translation: Hastening onward like the waves of waters, our holy hymns are pressing nigh to Soma. To him they come with lowly adoration, and, longing, enter him who longs to meet them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 95
sanskrit: तं मर्म्र्जानं महिषं न सानावंशुं दुहन्त्युक्षणं गिरिष्ठाम | तं वावशानं मतयः सचन्ते तरितो बिभर्ति वरुणं समुद्रे
transliteration: taṃ marmṛjānaṃ mahiṣaṃ na sānāvaṃśuṃ duhantyukṣaṇaṃ ghiriṣṭhām | taṃ vāvaśānaṃ matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṃ samudre
translation: They drain the stalk, the Steer who dwells on mountains, even as a Bull who decks him on the upland. Hymns follow and attend him as he bellows: Trita bears Varuna aloft in ocean.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 95
sanskrit: इष्यन वाचमुपवक्तेव होतुः पुनान इन्दो वि षया मनीषाम | इन्द्रश्च यत कषयथः सौभगाय सुवीर्यस्य पतयःस्याम
transliteration: iṣyan vācamupavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām | indraśca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhaghāya suvīryasya patayaḥsyāma
translation: Sending thy voice out as Director, loosen the Invoker's thought, O Indu, as they cleanse thee. While thou and Indra rule for our advantage, may we be masters of heroic vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 96
sanskrit: पर सेनानीः शूरो अग्रे रथानां गव्यन्नेति हर्षते अस्य सेना | भद्रान कर्ण्वन्निन्द्रहवान सखिभ्य आ सोमो वस्त्रा रभसानि दत्ते
transliteration: pra senānīḥ śūro aghre rathānāṃ ghavyanneti harṣate asya senā | bhadrān kṛṇvannindrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte
translation: IN forefront of the cars forth goes the Hero, the Leader, winning spoil: his host rejoices. Soma endues his robes of lasting colours, and blesses, for his friends, their calls on Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 96
sanskrit: समस्य हरिं हरयो मर्जन्त्यश्वहयैरनिशितं नमोभिः | आ तिष्ठति रथमिन्द्रस्य सखा विद्वानेना सुमतिं यात्यछ
transliteration: samasya hariṃ harayo mṛjantyaśvahayairaniśitaṃ namobhiḥ |
translation: Men decked with gold adorn his golden tendril, incessantly with steed-impelling homage. The Friend of Indra mounts his car well-knowing, he comes thereon to meet the prayer we offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 97
sanskrit: अस्य परेषा हेमना पूयमानो देवो देवेभिः समप्र्क्त रसम | सुतः पवित्रं पर्येति रेभन मितेव सद्म पशुमान्ति होता
transliteration: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam | sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā
translation: MADE pure by this man's urgent zeal and impulse the God hath to the Gods his juice imparted. He goes, effused and singing, to the filter, like priest to measured seats supplied with cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 97
sanskrit: भद्रा वस्त्रा समन्या वसानो महान कविर्निवचनानि शंसन | आ वच्यस्व चम्वोः पूयमानो विचक्षणो जाग्र्विर्देववीतौ
transliteration: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavirnivacanāni śaṃsan |
translation: Robed in fair raiment meet to wear in battle, a mighty Sage pronouncing invocations. Roll onward to the beakers as they cleanse thee, far-seeing at the feast of Gods, and watchful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: अभि नो वाजसातमं रयिमर्ष पुरुस्प्र्हम | इन्दो सहस्रभर्णसं तुविद्युम्नं विभ्वासहम
transliteration: abhi no vājasātamaṃ rayimarṣa puruspṛham | indo sahasrabharṇasaṃ tuvidyumnaṃ vibhvāsaham
translation: STREAM on us riches that are sought by many, best at winning strength Riches, O Indu, thousand fold, glorious, conquering the great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: परि षय सुवानो अव्ययं रथे न वर्माव्यत | इन्दुरभिद्रुणा हितो हियानो धाराभिरक्षाः
transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno avyayaṃ rathe na varmāvyata | indurabhidruṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhirakṣāḥ
translation: Effused, he hath, as on a car, invested him in fleecy mail: Onward hath Indu flowed in streams, impelled, surrounded by the wood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: परि षय सुवानो अक्षा इन्दुरव्ये मदच्युतः | धारा य ऊर्ध्वो अध्वरे भराजा नैति गव्ययुः
transliteration: pari ṣya suvāno akṣā induravye madacyutaḥ | dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti ghavyayuḥ
translation: Effused, this Indu hath flowed on, distilling rapture, to the fleece: He goes erect, as seeking kine in stream, with light, to sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: स हि तवं देव शश्वते वसु मर्ताय दाशुषे | इन्दो सहस्रिणं रयिं शतात्मानं विवाससि
transliteration: sa hi tvaṃ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe | indo sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ śatātmānaṃ vivāsasi
translation: For thou thyself, O Indu, God, to every mortal worshipper Attractest riches thousand fold, made manifest in hundred forms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: वयं ते अस्य वर्त्रहन वसो वस्वः पुरुस्प्र्हः | नि नेदिष्ठतमा इषः सयाम सुम्नस्याध्रिगो
transliteration: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ | ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigho
translation: Good Vrtra-slayer, may we be still nearest to this wealth of thine Which many crave, nearest to food and happiness, Resistless One!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: दविर्यं पञ्च सवयशसं सवसारो अद्रिसंहतम | परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यं परस्नापयन्त्यूर्मिणम
transliteration: dviryaṃ pañca svayaśasaṃ svasāro adrisaṃhatam | priyamindrasya kāmyaṃ prasnāpayantyūrmiṇam
translation: Whom, bright with native splendour, crushed between the pair of pressing stones The wavy Friend whom Indra loves-the twice-five sisters dip and bathe,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: परि तयं हर्यतं हरिं बभ्रुं पुनन्ति वारेण | यो देवान विश्वानित परि मदेन सह गछति
transliteration: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa | yo devān viśvānit pari madena saha ghachati
translation: Him with the fleece they purify, brown, golden-hued, beloved of all, Who with exhilarating juice goes forth to all the Deities.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: अस्य वो हयवसा पान्तो दक्षसाधनम | यः सूरिषु शरवोब्र्हद दधे सवर्ण हर्यतः
transliteration: asya vo hyavasā pānto dakṣasādhanam | yaḥ sūriṣu śravobṛhad dadhe svarṇa haryataḥ
translation: Through longing for this sap of yours ye drink what brings ability, Even him who, dear as heaven's own light, gives to our princes high renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: स वां यज्ञेषु मानवी इन्दुर्जनिष्ट रोदसी | देवो देवी गिरिष्ठा अस्रेधन तं तुविष्वणि
transliteration: sa vāṃ yajñeṣu mānavī indurjaniṣṭa rodasī | devo devī ghiriṣṭhā asredhan taṃ tuviṣvaṇi
translation: Indu at holy rites produced you, Heaven and Earth, the Friends of men, Hill-haunting God the Goddesses. They bruised him where the roar was loud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: इन्द्राय सोम पातवे वर्त्रघ्ने परि षिच्यसे | नरे च दक्षिणावते देवाय सदनासदे
transliteration: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase | nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade
translation: For Vrtra-slaying Indra, thou, Soma, art poured that he may drink, Poured for the guerdon-giving man, poured for the God who sitteth there.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: ते परत्नासो वयुष्टिषु सोमाः पवित्रे अक्षरन | अपप्रोथन्तः सनुतर्हुरश्चितः परातस्तानप्रचेतसः
transliteration: te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran | apaprothantaḥ sanutarhuraścitaḥ prātastānapracetasaḥ
translation: These ancient Somas, at the break of day, have flowed into the sieve, Snorting away at early morn these foolish evil-hearted ones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 98
sanskrit: तं सखायः पुरोरुचं यूयं वयं च सूरयः | अश्याम वाजगन्ध्यं सनेम वाजपस्त्यम
transliteration: taṃ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṃ yūyaṃ vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ | aśyāma vājaghandhyaṃ sanema vājapastyam
translation: Friends, may the princes, ye and we, obtain this Most Resplendent One. Gain him who hath the smell of strength, win him whose home is very strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: आ हर्यताय धर्ष्णवे धनुस्तन्वन्ति पौंस्यम | शुक्रांवयन्त्यसुराय निर्णिजं विपामग्रे महीयुवः
transliteration: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājānabhi pra ghāhate | yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṃ hinvanti yātave
translation: THEY for the Bold and Lovely One ply manly vigour like a bow: joyous, in front of songs they weave bright raiment for the Lord Divine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: अध कषपा परिष्क्र्तो वाजानभि पर गाहते | यदी विवस्वतो धियो हरिं हिन्वन्ति यातवे
transliteration: tamasya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ | yaṃ ghāva āsabhirdadhuḥ purā nūnaṃ ca sūrayaḥ
translation: And he, made beautiful by night, dips forward into strengthening food', What time the sacrificer's thoughts speed on his way the Golden-hued.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: तमस्य मर्जयामसि मदो य इन्द्रपातमः | यं गाव आसभिर्दधुः पुरा नूनं च सूरयः
transliteration: taṃ ghāthayā purāṇyā punānamabhyanūṣata | uto kṛpantadhītayo devānāṃ nāma bibhratīḥ
translation: We cleanse this gladdening drink of his the juice which Indra chiefly drinks--- That which kine took into their mouths, of old, and princes take it now.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: तं गाथया पुराण्या पुनानमभ्यनूषत | उतो कर्पन्तधीतयो देवानां नाम बिभ्रतीः
transliteration: tamukṣamāṇamavyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim | dūtaṃ na pūrigvedaacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ
translation: To him, while purifying, they have raised the ancient psalm of praise: And sacred songs which bear the names of Gods have supplicated him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: तमुक्षमाणमव्यये वारे पुनन्ति धर्णसिम | दूतं न पूर्वचित्तय आ शासते मनीषिणः
transliteration: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaścamūṣu sīdati | paśau na reta ādadhat patirigvedaacasyate dhiyaḥ
translation: They purify him as he drops, courageous, in the fleecy sieve. Him they instruct as messenger to bear the sage's morning prayer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स पुनानो मदिन्तमः सोमश्चमूषु सीदति | पशौ न रेत आदधत पतिर्वचस्यते धियः
transliteration: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhirdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ | vide yadāsu sandadirmahīrapo vi ghāhate
translation: Soma, best Cheerer, takes his seat, the while they cleanse him in the bowls. He as it were impregns the cow, and babbles on, the Lord of Song.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स मर्ज्यते सुकर्मभिर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः | विदे यदासु सन्ददिर्महीरपो वि गाहते
transliteration: suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhiryato vi nīyase | indrāya matsarintamaścamūṣvā ni ṣīdasi
translation: He is effused and beautified, a God for Gods, by skillful men. He penetrates the mighty floods collecting all he knows therein.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 99
sanskrit: सुत इन्दो पवित्र आ नर्भिर्यतो वि नीयसे | इन्द्राय मत्सरिन्तमश्चमूष्वा नि षीदसि
transliteration: rigveda09099.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:12:19 GMT
translation: Pressed, Indu, guided by the men, thou art led to the cleaning sieve. Thou, yielding Indra highest joy, takest thy seat within the bowls.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: अभी नवन्ते अद्रुहः परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम | वत्सं न पूर्व आयुनि जातं रिहन्ति मातरः
transliteration: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyamindrasya kāmyam | vatsaṃ na pūrigvedaa āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ
translation: THE Guileless Ones are singing praise to Indra's well beloved Friend, As, in the morning of its life, the mothers lick the new-born calf.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: पुनान इन्दवा भर सोम दविबर्हसं रयिम | तवं वसूनिपुष्यसि विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे
transliteration: punāna indavā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim | tvaṃ vasūnipuṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo ghṛhe
translation: O Indu, while they cleanse thee bring, O Soma, doubly-waxing wealth Thou in the worshipper's abode causest all treasures to increase.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: तवं धियं मनोयुजं सर्जा वर्ष्टिं न तन्यतुः | तवं वसूनि पार्थिवा दिव्या च सोम पुष्यसि
transliteration: tvaṃ dhiyaṃ manoyujaṃ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṃ na tanyatuḥ | tvaṃ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi
translation: Set free the. song which mind hath yoked, even as thunder frees the rain: All treasures of the earth and heaven, O Soma, thou dost multiply.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: परि ते जिग्युषो यथा धारा सुतस्य धावति | रंहमाणाव्यव्ययं वारं वाजीव सानसिः
transliteration: pari te jighyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati | raṃhamāṇāvyavyayaṃ vāraṃ vājīva sānasiḥ
translation: Thy stream when thou art pressed runs on like some victorious warrior's steed Hastening onward through the fleece like a fierce horse who wins the prize.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
