sanskrit: करत्वे दक्षाय नः कवे पवस्व सोम धारया | इन्द्राय पातवे सुतो मित्राय वरुणाय च
transliteration: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā | indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translation: Flow on, Sage Soma, with thy stream to give us mental power and strength, Effused for Indra, for his drink, for Mitra and for Varuna.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: पवस्व वाजसातमः पवित्रे धारया सुतः | इन्द्राय सोमविष्णवे देवेभ्यो मधुमत्तमः
transliteration: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ | indrāya somaviṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ
translation: Flow to the filter with thy stream, effused, best winner, thou, of spoil, O Soma, as most rich in sweets for Indra, Visnu, and the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: तवां रिहन्ति मातरो हरिं पवित्रे अद्रुहः | वत्सं जातंन धेनवः पवमान विधर्मणि
transliteration: tvāṃ rihanti mātaro hariṃ pavitre adruhaḥ | vatsaṃ jātaṃna dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi
translation: The mothers, void of guiles, caress thee Golden-coloured, in the sieve, As cows, O Pavamana, lick the new-born calf, as Law commands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 100
sanskrit: पवमान महि शरवश्चित्रेभिर्यासि रश्मिभिः | शर्धन तमांसि जिघ्नसे विश्वानि दाशुषो गर्हे
transliteration: pavamāna mahi śravaścitrebhiryāsi raśmibhiḥ |
translation: Thou, Pavamana, movest on with wondrous rays to great renown. Striving within the votary's house thou drivest all the glooms away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: पुरोजिती वो अन्धसः सुताय मादयित्नवे | अप शवानं शनथिष्टन सखायो दीर्घजिह्व्यम
transliteration: purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave | apa śvānaṃ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam
translation: FOR first possession of your juice, for the exhilarating drink, Drive ye away the dog, my friends, drive ye the long-tongued dog away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: यो धारया पावकया परिप्रस्यन्दते सुतः | इन्दुरश्वो न कर्त्व्यः
transliteration: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ | induraśvo na kṛtvyaḥ
translation: He who with purifying stream, effused, comes flowing hitherward, Indu, is like an able steed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: तं दुरोषमभी नरः सोमं विश्वाच्या धिया | यज्ञं हिन्वन्त्यद्रिभिः
transliteration: taṃ duroṣamabhī naraḥ somaṃ viśvācyā dhiyā | yajñaṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ
translation: The men with all-pervading song send unassailable Soma forth, By pressing-stones, to sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सुतासो मधुमत्तमाः सोमा इन्द्राय मन्दिनः | पवित्रवन्तोक्षरन देवान गछन्तु वो मदाः
transliteration: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ | pavitravantoakṣaran devān ghachantu vo madāḥ
translation: The Somas, very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow, Effused, the source of Indra's joy: may your strong juices reach the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: इन्दुरिन्द्राय पवत इति देवासो अब्रुवन | वाचस पतिर्मखस्यते विश्वस्येशान ओजसा
transliteration: indurindrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan | vācas patirmakhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā
translation: Indu flows on for Indra's sake: thus have the Deities declared. The Lord of Speech exerts himself, Ruler of all, because of might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सहस्रधारः पवते समुद्रो वाचमीङखयः | सोमः पती रयीणां सखेन्द्रस्य दिवे-दिवे
transliteration: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ | somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya dive-dive
translation: Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows, Even Soma, Lord of opulence, the Friend of Indra, day by day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: अयं पूषा रयिर्भगः सोमः पुनानो अर्षति | पतिर्विश्वस्य भूमनो वयख्यद रोदसी उभे
transliteration: ayaṃ pūṣā rayirbhaghaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati | patirigvedaśvasya bhūmano vyakhyad rodasī ubhe
translation: As Pusan, Fortune, Bhaga, comes this Soma while they make him pure. He, Lord of the multitude, hath looked upon the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: समु परिया अनूषत गावो मदाय घर्ष्वयः | सोमासः कर्ण्वते पथः पवमानास इन्दवः
transliteration: samu priyā anūṣata ghāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ | somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ
translation: The dear cows lowed in joyful mood together to the gladdening drink. The drops as they were purified, the Soma juices, made then paths.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: य ओजिष्ठस्तमा भर पवमन शरवाय्यम | यः पञ्चचर्षणीरभि रयिं येन वनामहै
transliteration: ya ojiṣṭhastamā bhara pavamana śravāyyam | yaḥ pañcacarṣaṇīrabhi rayiṃ yena vanāmahai
translation: O Pavamana, bring the juice, the mightiest, worthy to be famed, Which the Five Tribes have over them, whereby we may win opulence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सोमाः पवन्त इन्दवो.अस्मभ्यं गातुवित्तमः | मित्राः सुवाना अरेपसः सवाध्यः सवर्विदः
transliteration: somāḥ pavanta indavo.asmabhyaṃ ghātuvittamaḥ | mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarigvedadaḥ
translation: For us the Soma juices flow, the drops best furtherers of our weal, Effused as friends without a spot, benevolent, finders of the light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सुष्वाणासो वयद्रिभिश्चिताना गोरधि तवचि | इषमस्मभ्यमभितः समस्वरन वसुविदः
transliteration: suṣvāṇāso vyadribhiścitānā ghoradhi tvaci | iṣamasmabhyamabhitaḥ samasvaran vasuvidaḥ
translation: Effused by means of pressing-stones, upon the ox-hide visible, They, treasure-finders, have announced food unto us from every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: एते पूता विपश्चितः सोमासो दध्याशिरः | सूर्यासो न दर्शतासो जिगत्नवो धरुवा घर्ते
transliteration: ete pūtā vipaścitaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ | sūryāso na darśatāso jighatnavo dhruvā ghṛte
translation: These Soma juices, skilled in song, purified, blent with milk and curd, When moving and when firmly laid in oil, resemble lovely Suns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 101
sanskrit: पर सुन्वानस्यान्धसो मर्तो न वर्त तद वचः | अप शवानमराधसं हता मखं न भर्गवः
transliteration: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ | apa śvānamarādhasaṃ hatā makhaṃ na bhṛghavaḥ
translation: Let not the power of men restrain the voice of the outpouring juice: As Bhrgu's sons chased Makha, so drive ye the greedy hound away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: कराणा शिशुर्महीनां हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिम | विश्वापरि परिया भुवदध दविता
transliteration: krāṇā śiśurmahīnāṃ hinvannṛtasya dīdhitim | viśvāpari priyā bhuvadadha dvitā
translation: THE Child, when blended with the streams, speeding the plan of sacrifice, Surpasses all things that are dear, yea, from of old.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: उप तरितस्य पाष्योरभक्त यद गुहा पदम | यज्ञस्य सप्त धामभिरध परियम
transliteration: upa tritasya pāṣyorabhakta yad ghuhā padam | yajñasya sapta dhāmabhiradha priyam
translation: The place, near the two pressing-stones of Trita, hath he occupied, Secret and dear through seven lights of sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: तरीणि तरितस्य धारया पर्ष्ठेष्वेरया रयिम | मिमीते अस्य योजना वि सुक्रतुः
transliteration: trīṇi tritasya dhārayā pṛṣṭheṣverayā rayim | mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ
translation: Urge to three courses, on the heights of Trita, riches in a stream. He who is passing wise measures his courses out.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: जज्ञानं सप्त मातरो वेधामशासत शरिये | अयं धरुवो रयीणां चिकेत यत
transliteration: jajñānaṃ sapta mātaro vedhāmaśāsata śriye | ayaṃ dhruvo rayīṇāṃ ciketa yat
translation: Even at his birth the Mothers Seven taught him, for glory, like a sage, So that he, firm and sure, hath set his mind on wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: अस्य वरते सजोषसो विश्वे देवासो अद्रुहः | सपार्हा भवन्ति रन्तयो जुषन्त यत
transliteration: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ | spārhā bhavanti rantayo juṣanta yat
translation: Under his sway, of one accord, are all the guileless Deities: Warriors to be envied, they, when they are pleased.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: यमी गर्भं रताव्र्धो दर्शे चारुमजीजनन | कविं मंहिष्ठमध्वरे पुरुस्प्र्हम
transliteration: yamī gharbhaṃ ṛtāvṛdho dṛśe cārumajījanan | kaviṃ maṃhiṣṭhamadhvare puruspṛham
translation: The Babe whom they who strengthen Law have generated fair to see, Much longed for at the sacrifice, most liberal Sage,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: समीचीने अभि तमना यह्वी रतस्य मातरा | तन्वाना यज्ञमानुषग यदञ्जते
transliteration: samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā | tanvānā yajñamānuṣagh yadañjate
translation: To him, united, of themselves, come the young Parents of the rite, When they adorn him, duly weaving sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 102
sanskrit: करत्वा शुक्रेभिरक्षभिरणोरप वरजं दिवः | हिन्वन्न्र्तस्य दीधितिं पराध्वरे
transliteration: kratvā śukrebhirakṣabhirṇorapa vrajaṃ divaḥ | hinvannṛtasya dīdhitiṃ prādhvare
translation: With wisdom and with radiant eyes unbar to us the stall of heaven, Speeding at solemn rite the plan of Holy Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: पर पुनानाय वेधसे सोमाय वच उद्यतम | भर्तिं न भरा मतिभिर्जुजोषते
transliteration: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam | bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhirjujoṣate
translation: To Soma who is purified as ordering Priest the song is raised: Bring meed, as 'twere, to one who makes thee glad with hymns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: परि वाराण्यव्यया गोभिरञ्जानो अर्षति | तरी षधस्था पुनानः कर्णुते हरिः
transliteration: pari vārāṇyavyayā ghobhirañjāno arṣati | trī ṣadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ
translation: Blended with milk and curds he flows on through the long wool of the sheep. The Gold-hued, purified, makes him three seats for rest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: परि कोशं मधुश्चुतमव्यये वारे अर्षति | अभि वाणीरषीणां सप्त नूषत
transliteration: pari kośaṃ madhuścutamavyaye vāre arṣati | abhi vāṇīrṣīṇāṃ sapta nūṣata
translation: On through the long wool of the sheep to the meath-dropping vat he flows: The Rsis' sevenfold quire hath sung aloud to him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: परि णेता मतीनां विश्वदेवो अदाभ्यः | सोमः पुनानश्चम्वोर्विशद धरिः
transliteration: pari ṇetā matīnāṃ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ | somaḥ punānaścamvorigvedaśad dhariḥ
translation: Shared by all Gods, Infallible, the Leader of our holy hymns, Golden-hued Soma, being cleansed, hath reached the bowls.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: परि दैवीरनु सवधा इन्द्रेण याहि सरथम | पुनानो वाघद वाघद्भिरमर्त्यः
transliteration: pari daivīranu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham | punāno vāghad vāghadbhiramartyaḥ
translation: After thy Godlike qualities, associate with Indra, go, As a Priest purified by priests, Immortal One.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 103
sanskrit: परि सप्तिर्न वाजयुर्देवो देवेभ्यः सुतः | वयानशिः पवमानो वि धावति
transliteration: pari saptirna vājayurdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ | vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati
translation: Like a car-horse who shows his strength, a God effused for Deities. The penetrating Pavamana flows along.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 104
sanskrit: सखाय आ नि शीदत पुनानाय पर गायत | शिशुं न यज्ञैः परि भूषत शरिये
transliteration: sakhāya ā ni śīdata punānāya pra ghāyata |
translation: SIT down, O friends, and sing aloud to him who purifies himself: Deck him for glory, like a child, with holy rites.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 105
sanskrit: तं वः सखायो मदाय पुनानमभि गायत | शिशुं न यज्ञैः सवदयन्त गूर्तिभिः
transliteration: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānamabhi ghāyata |
translation: SING; ye aloud, O friends, to him who makes him pure for gladdening drink: They shall make sweet the Child with sacrifice and laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 106
sanskrit: इन्द्रमछ सुता इमे वर्षणं यन्तु हरयः | शरुष्टी जातास इन्दवः सवर्विदः
transliteration: indramacha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ |
translation: To Indra, to the Mighty Steer, may these gold-coloured juices go, Drops rapidly produced, that find the light of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 107
sanskrit: परीतो षिञ्चता सुतं सोमो य उत्तमं हविः | दधन्वान्यो नर्यो अप्स्वन्तरा सुषाव सोममद्रिभिः
transliteration: parīto ṣiñcatā sutaṃ somo ya uttamaṃ haviḥ | dadhanvānyo naryo apsvantarā suṣāva somamadribhiḥ
translation: HENCE sprinkle forth the juice effused, Soma, the best of sacred gifts, Who, friend of man, hath run amid the water-streams. He hath pressed Soma out with stones.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 107
sanskrit: नूनं पुनानो.अविभिः परि सरवादब्धः सुरभिन्तरः | सुते चित तवाप्सु मदामो अन्धसा शरीणन्तो गोभिरुत्तरम
transliteration: nūnaṃ punāno.avibhiḥ pari sravādabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ | sute cit tvāpsu madāmo andhasā śrīṇanto ghobhiruttaram
translation: Now, being purified, flow hither through the fleece inviolate and most odorous. We ladden thee in waters when thou art effused, blending thee still with juice and milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 107
sanskrit: परि सुवानश्चक्षसे देवमादनः करतुरिन्दुर्विचक्षणः
transliteration: pari suvānaścakṣase devamādanaḥ kraturindurigvedacakṣaṇaḥ
translation: Pressed out for all to see, delighting Gods, Indu, Far-sighted One, is mental power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 107
sanskrit: पुनानः सोम धारयापो वसानो अर्षसि | आ रत्नधा योनिम्र्तस्य सीदस्युत्सो देव हिरण्ययः
transliteration: punānaḥ soma dhārayāpo vasāno arṣasi |
translation: Cleansing thee, Soma, in thy stream, thou flowest in a watery robe: Giver of wealth, thou sittest in the place of Law, O God, a fountain made of gold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: पवस्व मधुमत्तम इन्द्राय सोम करतुवित्तमो मदः | महि दयुक्षतमो मदः
transliteration: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ | mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ
translation: FOR Indra, flow thou Soma on, as gladdening juice most sweet, intelligent, Great, cheering, dwelling most in heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: यस्य ते पीत्वा वर्षभो वर्षायते.अस्य पीता सवर्विदः | स सुप्रकेतो अभ्यक्रमीदिशो.अछा वाजं नैतशः
transliteration: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate.asya pītā svarigvedadaḥ | sa supraketo abhyakramīdiśo.achā vājaṃ naitaśaḥ
translation: Thou, of whom having drunk the Steer acts like a steer. drinking of this that finds the light, He, Excellently Wise, is come to strengthening food, to spoil and wealth like Etasa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: तवं हयन्ग दैव्या पवमान जनिमानि दयुमत्तमः | अम्र्तत्वाय घोषयः
transliteration: tvaṃ hyangha daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ | amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ
translation: For, verily, Pavamana, thou bast, splendidest, called all the generations of The Gods to immortality.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: येना नवग्वो दध्यन्नपोर्णुते येन विप्रास आपिरे | देवानां सुम्ने अम्र्तस्य चारुणो येन शरवांस्यानशुः
transliteration: yenā navaghvo dadhyannaporṇute yena viprāsa āpire | devānāṃ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṃsyānaśuḥ
translation: By whom Dadhyac Navagva opens fastened doors, by whom the sages gained their wish, By whom they won the fame of lovely Amrta in the felicity of Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: एष सय धारया सुतो.अव्यो वारेभिः पवते मदिन्तमः | करीळन्नूर्मिरपामिव
transliteration: eṣa sya dhārayā suto.avyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ | krīḷannūrmirapāmiva
translation: Effused, he floweth in a stream, best rapture-giver, in the long wool of the sheep, Sporting, as 'twere the waters' wave.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 108
sanskrit: य उस्रिया अप्या अन्तरश्मनो निर्गा अक्र्न्तदोजसा | अभिव्रजं तत्निषे गव्यमश्व्यं वर्मीव धर्ष्णवा रुज
transliteration: ya usriyā apyā antaraśmano nirghā akṛntadojasā | abhivrajaṃ tatniṣe ghavyamaśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇavā ruja
translation: He who from out the rocky cavern took with might the red refulgent watery Cows, Thou masterest the stable full of kine and steeds: burst it, brave Lord, like one in mail.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 109
sanskrit: परि पर धन्वेन्द्राय सोम सवादुर मित्राय पूष्णे भगाय
transliteration: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhaghāya
translation: PLEASANT to Indra's Mitra's, Pusan's Bhaga's taste, sped onward, Soma, with thy flowing stream.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 109
sanskrit: इन्द्रस ते सोम सुतस्य पेयाः करत्वे दक्षाय विश्वे च देवाः
transliteration: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
translation: Let Indra drink, O Soma, of thy juice for wisdom, and all Deities for strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 109
sanskrit: एवाम्र्ताय महे कषयाय स शुक्रो अर्ष दिव्यः पीयूषः
transliteration: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ
translation: So flow thou on as bright celestial juice, flow to the vast, immortal dwelling-place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 109
sanskrit: पवस्व सोम महान समुद्रः पिता देवानां विश्वाभि धाम
transliteration: pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma
translation: Flow onward, Soma, as a mighty sea, as Father of the Gods to every form.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 110
sanskrit: पर्यू षु पर धन्व वाजसातये परि वर्त्राणि सक्षणिः | दविषस्तरध्या रणया न ईयसे
transliteration: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ | dviṣastaradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase
translation: O'ERPOWERING Vrtras, forward run to win great strength: Thou speedest to subdue like one exacting debts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 110
sanskrit: अनु हि तवा सुतं सोम मदामसि महे समर्यराज्ये | वाजानभि पवमान पर गाहसे
transliteration: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye | vājānabhi pavamāna pra ghāhase
translation: In thee, effused, O Soma, we rejoice ourselves for great supremacy in fight. Thou, Pavamana, enterest into mighty deeds,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 110
sanskrit: अजीजनो हि पवमान सूर्यं विधारे शक्मना पयः | गोजीरया रंहमानः पुरन्ध्या
transliteration: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ | ghojīrayā raṃhamānaḥ purandhyā
translation: O Pavamana, thou didst generate the Sun, and spread the moisture out with power, Hasting to us with plenty vivified with milk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 110
sanskrit: अजीजनो अम्र्त मर्त्येष्वा रतस्य धर्मन्नम्र्तस्य चारुणः | सदासरो वाजमछा सनिष्यदत
transliteration: ajījano amṛta martyeṣvā ṛtasya dharmannamṛtasya cāruṇaḥ | sadāsaro vājamachā saniṣyadat
translation: Thou didst produce him, Deathless God mid mortal men for maintenance of Law and lovely Amrta: Thou evermore hast moved making strength flow to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 110
sanskrit: अभ्य-अभि हि शरवसा ततर्दिथोत्सं न कं चिज्जनपानमक्षितम | शर्याभिर्न भरमाणो गभस्त्योः
transliteration: abhy-abhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṃ na kaṃ cijjanapānamakṣitam |
translation: All round about hast thou with glory pierced for us as 'twere a never-failing well for men to drink, Borne on thy way in fragments from the presser's arms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 111
sanskrit: अया रुचा हरिण्या पुनानो विश्वा दवेषांसि तरति सवयुग्वभिः सूरो न सवयुग्वभिः | धारा सुतस्य रोचते पुनानो अरुषो हरिः | विश्वा यद रूपा परियात्य रक्वभिः सप्तास्येभिरकवभिः
transliteration: ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayughvabhiḥ sūro na svayughvabhiḥ | dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ | viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhirkvabhiḥ
translation: WITH this his golden splendour purifying him, he with his own allies subdues all enemies, as Sara with his own allies. Cleansing himself with stream of juice he shines forth yellow-hued and red, when with the praisers he encompasses all forms, with praisers having seven mouths.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 111
sanskrit: तवं तयत पणीनां विदो वसु सं मात्र्भिर्मर्जयसि सव आ दम रतस्य धीतिभिर्दमे | परावतो न साम तद यत्रारणन्ति धीतयः | तरिधातुभिररुषीभिर्वयो दधे रोचमानो वयो दधे
transliteration: tvaṃ tyat paṇīnāṃ vido vasu saṃ mātṛbhirmarjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhirdame | parāvato na sāma tad yatrāraṇanti dhītayaḥ | tridhātubhiraruṣībhirigvedaayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe
translation: That treasure of the Panis thou discoveredst; thou with thy mothers deckest thee in thine abode, with songs of worship in thine home. As 'twere from far, the hymn is heard, where holy songs resound in joy. He with the ruddy-hued, threefold hath won life-power, he, glittering, hath won life-power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 111
sanskrit: पूर्वामनु परदिशं याति चेकितत सं रश्मिभिर्यतते दर्शतो रथो दैव्यो दर्शतो रथः | अग्मन्नुक्थानि पौंस्येन्द्रं जैत्राय हर्षयन | वज्रश्च यद भवथो अनपच्युतासमत्स्वनपच्युता
transliteration: pūrigvedaāmanu pradiśaṃ yāti cekitat saṃ raśmibhiryatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ | aghmannukthāni pauṃsyendraṃ jaitrāya harṣayan | vajraśca yad bhavatho anapacyutāsamatsvanapacyutā
translation: He moves intelligent, directed to the East. The very beauteous car rivals the beams of light, the beautiful celestial car. Hymns, lauding manly valour, came, inciting Indra to success, that ye may be unconquered, both thy bolt and thou, both be unconquered in the war.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 112
sanskrit: नानानं वा उ नो धियो वि वरतानि जनानाम | तक्षा रिष्टं रुतं भिषग बरह्मा सुन्वन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: nānānaṃ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām | takṣā riṣṭaṃ rutaṃ bhiṣagh brahmā sunvantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava
translation: WE all have various thoughts and plans, and diverse are the ways of men. The Brahman seeks the worshipper, wright seeks the cracked, and leech the maimed. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 112
sanskrit: जरतीभिरोषधीभिः पर्णेभिः शकुनानाम | कार्मारो अश्मभिर्द्युभिर्हिरण्यवन्तमिछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: jaratībhiroṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām | kārmāro aśmabhirdyubhirhiraṇyavantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava
translation: The smith with ripe and seasoned plants, with feathers of the birds of air, With stones, and with enkindled flames, seeks him who hath a store of gold. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 112
sanskrit: कारुरहं ततो भिषगुपलप्रक्षिणी नना | नानाधियोवसूयवो.अनु गा इव तस्थिमेन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: kārurahaṃ tato bhiṣaghupalaprakṣiṇī nanā | nānādhiyovasūyavo.anu ghā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava
translation: A bard am I, my dad's a leech, mammy lays corn upon the stones. Striving for wealth, with varied plans, we follow our desires like kine. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 112
sanskrit: अश्वो वोळ्हा सुखं रथं हसनामुपमन्त्रिणः | शेपो रोमण्वन्तौ भेदौ वारिन मण्डूक इछतीन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: aśvo voḷhā sukhaṃ rathaṃ hasanāmupamantriṇaḥ |
translation: The horse would draw an easy car, gay hosts attract the laugh and jest. The male desires his mate's approach, the frog is eager for the flood, Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 113
sanskrit: शर्यणावति सोममिन्द्रः पिबतु वर्त्रहा | बलं दधान आत्मनि करिष्यन वीर्यं महदिन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: balaṃ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryaṃ mahadindrāyendo pari srava
translation: LET Vrtra-slaying Indra drink Soma by Saryanavan's side, Storing up vigour in his heart, prepared to do heroic deeds. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 9 Hymn 114
sanskrit: य इन्दोः पवमानस्यानु धामान्यक्रमीत | तमाहुः सुप्रजा इति यस्ते सोमाविधन मन इन्द्रायेन्दो परि सरव
transliteration: ya indoḥ pavamānasyānu dhāmānyakramīt | tamāhuḥ suprajā iti yaste somāvidhan mana indrāyendo pari srava
translation: THE man who walketh as the Laws of Indu Pavamana bid, Men call him rich in children, him, O Soma, who hath met thy thought. Flow, Indu, flow for Indra's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 1
sanskrit: अग्रे बर्हन्नुषसामूर्ध्वो अस्थान निर्जगन्वान तमसोज्योतिषागात | अग्निर्भानुना रुशता सवङग आ जातोविश्वा सद्मान्यप्राः
transliteration: aghre bṛhannuṣasāmūrdhvo asthān nirjaghanvān tamasojyotiṣāghāt | aghnirbhānunā ruśatā svaṅgha ā jātoviśvā sadmānyaprāḥ
translation: HIGH hath the Mighty risen before the dawning, and come to us with light from out the darkness. Fair-shapen Agni with white-shining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 1
sanskrit: स जातो गर्भो असि रोदस्योरग्ने चारुर्विभ्र्त ओषधीषु | चित्रः शिशुः परि तमांस्यक्तून पर मात्र्भ्यो अधिकनिक्रदत गाः
transliteration: sa jāto gharbho asi rodasyoraghne cārurigvedabhṛta oṣadhīṣu | citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsyaktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhikanikradat ghāḥ
translation: Thou, being born, art Child of Earth and Heaven, parted among the plants in beauty, Agni! The glooms of night thou, Brilliant Babe, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from thy Mothers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 1
sanskrit: विष्णुरित्था परममस्य विद्वाञ जातो बर्हन्नभि पातित्र्तीयम | आसा यदस्य पयो अक्रत सवं सचेतसो अभ्यर्चन्त्यत्र
transliteration: viṣṇuritthā paramamasya vidvāñ jāto bṛhannabhi pātitṛtīyam |
translation: Here, being manifested, lofty Visnu, full wise, protects his own supremest station. When they have offered in his mouth their sweet milk, to him with one accord they sing forth praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 2
sanskrit: पिप्रीहि देवानुशतो यविष्ठ विद्वान रतून्रतुपतेयजेह | ये दैव्या रत्विजस्तेभिरग्ने तवं होतॄणामस्यायजिष्ठः
transliteration: piprīhi devānuśato yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūnrtupateyajeha | ye daivyā ṛtvijastebhiraghne tvaṃ hotṝṇāmasyāyajiṣṭhaḥ
translation: GLADDEN the yearning Gods, O thou Most Youthful: bring them, O Lord of Seasons, knowing seasons, With all the Priests Celestial, O Agni. Best worshipper art thou of all Invokers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 2
sanskrit: वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं जनानां मन्धातासि दरविणोदार्तावा | सवाहा वयं कर्णवामा हवींषि देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन
transliteration: veṣi hotramuta potraṃ janānāṃ mandhātāsi draviṇodāṛtāvā | svāhā vayaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devo devānyajatvaghnirarhan
translation: Thine is the Herald's, thine the Cleanser's office, thinker art thou, wealth-giver, true to Order. Let us with Svaha offer up oblations, and Agni, worthy God, pay the Gods worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 3
sanskrit: इनो राजन्नरतिः समिद्धो रौद्रो दक्षाय सुषुमानदर्शि | चिकिद वि भाति भासा बर्हतासिक्नीमेति रुशतीमपाजन
transliteration: ino rājannaratiḥ samiddho raudro dakṣāya suṣumānadarśi | cikid vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatāsiknīmeti ruśatīmapājan
translation: O KING, the potent and terrific envoy, kindled for strength, is manifest in beauty. He shines, all-knowing, with his lofty splendour: chasing black Night he comes with white-rayed Morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 3
sanskrit: कर्ष्णां यदेनीमभि वर्पसा भूज्जनयन योषाम्ब्र्हतः पितुर्जाम | ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सूर्यस्य सतभायन्दिवो वसुभिररतिर्वि भाति
transliteration: kṛṣṇāṃ yadenīmabhi varpasā bhūjjanayan yoṣāmbṛhataḥ piturjām |
translation: Having o'ercome the glimmering Black with beauty, and bringing forth the dame the Great Sire's Daughter, Holding aloft the radiant light of Surya, as messenger of heaven he shines with treasures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 4
sanskrit: पर ते यक्षि पर त इयर्मि मन्म भुवो यथा वन्द्यो नोहवेषु | धन्वन्निव परपा असि तवमग्न इयक्षवे पूरवेप्रत्न राजन
transliteration: pra te yakṣi pra ta iyarmi manma bhuvo yathā vandyo nohaveṣu | dhanvanniva prapā asi tvamaghna iyakṣave pūravepratna rājan
translation: To thee will send praise and bring oblation, as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee. A fountain in the desert art thou, Agni, O Ancient King, to man who fain would worship,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 4
sanskrit: यं तवा जनासो अभि संचरन्ति गाव उष्णमिव वरजंयविष्ठ | दूतो देवानामसि मर्त्यानामन्तर्महांश्चरसि रोचनेन
transliteration: yaṃ tvā janāso abhi saṃcaranti ghāva uṣṇamiva vrajaṃyaviṣṭha | dūto devānāmasi martyānāmantarmahāṃścarasi rocanena
translation: Thou unto whom resort the gathered people, as the kine seek the warm stall, O Most Youthful. Thou art the messenger of Gods and mortals, and goest glorious with thy light between them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 5
sanskrit: एकः समुद्रो धरुणो रयीणामस्मद धर्दो भूरिजन्मा विचष्टे | सिषक्त्यूधर्निण्योरुपस्थ उत्सस्य मध्येनिहितं पदं वेः
transliteration: ekaḥ samudro dharuṇo rayīṇāmasmad dhṛdo bhūrijanmā vicaṣṭe | siṣaktyūdharniṇyorupastha utsasya madhyenihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ
translation: HE only is the Sea, holder of treasures: born many a time he views the hearts within us. He hides him in the secret couple's bosom. The Bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 5
sanskrit: समानं नीळं वर्षणो वसानाः सं जग्मिरे महिषार्वतीभिः | रतस्य पदं कवयो नि पान्ति गुहा नामानिदधिरे पराणि
transliteration: samānaṃ nīḷaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasānāḥ saṃ jaghmire mahiṣāarigvedaatībhiḥ |
translation: Inhabiting one dwelling-place in common, strong Stallions and the Mares have come together. The sages guard the seat of Holy Order, and keep the highest names concealed within them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 6
sanskrit: अयं स यस्य शर्मन्नवोभिरग्नेरेधते जरिताभिष्टौ | जयेष्ठेभिर्यो भानुभिरषूणां पर्येति परिवीतोविभावा
transliteration: ayaṃ sa yasya śarmannavobhiraghneredhate jaritābhiṣṭau | jyeṣṭhebhiryo bhānubhirṣūṇāṃ paryeti parivītovibhāvā
translation: THIS is that Agni, he by whose protection, favour, and help. the singer is successful; Who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with far-spreading lustre.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 6
sanskrit: यो भनुभिर्विभावा विभात्यग्निर्देवेभिरतावाजस्रः | आ यो विवाय सख्या सखिभ्यो.अपरिह्व्र्तो अत्यो न सप्तिः
transliteration: yo bhanubhirigvedabhāvā vibhātyaghnirdevebhirtāvājasraḥ |
translation: Agni, the Holy One, the everlasting, who shines far beaming with celestial splendours; He who hath come unto his friends with friendship, like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 7
sanskrit: सवस्ति नो दिवो अग्ने पर्थिव्या विश्वायुर्धेहि यजथाय देव | सचेमहि तव दस्म परकेतैरुरुष्या ण उरुभिर्देवशंसैः
transliteration: svasti no divo aghne pṛthivyā viśvāyurdhehi yajathāya deva | sacemahi tava dasma praketairuruṣyā ṇa urubhirdevaśaṃsaiḥ
translation: O AGNI, shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven. With us be thine intelligence, Wonder Worker! Protect us, God, with thy far-reaching blessings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 7
sanskrit: इमा अग्ने मतयस्तुभ्यं जाता गोभिरश्वैरभि गर्णन्तिरधः | यदा ते मर्तो अनु भोगमानड वसो दधानोमतिभिः सुजात
transliteration: imā aghne matayastubhyaṃ jātā ghobhiraśvairabhi ghṛṇantiradhaḥ | yadā te marto anu bhoghamānaḍ vaso dadhānomatibhiḥ sujāta
translation: These hymns brought forth for thee, O Agni, laud thee for bounteous gifts, with cattle and with horses. Good Lord, when man from thee hath gained enjoyment, by hymns, O nobly born, hath he obtained it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 7
sanskrit: अग्निं मन्ये पितरमग्निमापिमग्निं भरातरं सदमित्सखायम | अग्नेरनीकं बर्हतः सपर्यं दिवि शुक्रंयजतं सूर्यस्य
transliteration: aghniṃ manye pitaramaghnimāpimaghniṃ bhrātaraṃ sadamitsakhāyam | aghneranīkaṃ bṛhataḥ saparyaṃ divi śukraṃyajataṃ sūryasya
translation: Agni I deem my Kinsman and my Father, count him my Brother and my Friend for ever. I honour as the face of lofty Agni in heaven the bright and holy light of Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 7
sanskrit: सिध्रा अग्ने धियो अस्मे सनुत्रीर्यं तरायसे दम आनित्यहोता | रतवा स रोहिदश्वः पुरुक्षुर्द्युभिरस्माहभिर्वाममस्तु
transliteration: sidhrā aghne dhiyo asme sanutrīryaṃ trāyase dama ānityahotā |
translation: Effectual, Agni, are our prayers for profit. He whom, at home thou, Priest for ever, guardest Is rich in food, drawn by red steeds, and holy: by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 8
sanskrit: पर केतुना बर्हता यात्यग्निरा रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति | दिवश्चिदन्तानुपमानुदानळ अपामुपस्थे महिषोववर्ध
transliteration: pra ketunā bṛhatā yātyaghnirā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti | divaścidantānupamānudānaḷ apāmupasthe mahiṣovavardha
translation: AGNI advances with his lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to the earth and heavens. He hath attained the sky's supremest limits. the Steer hath waxen in the lap of waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 8
sanskrit: मुमोद गर्भो वर्षभः ककुद्मानस्रेमा वत्सः शिमीवानरावीत | स देवतात्युद्यतानि कर्ण्वन सवेषु कषयेषुप्रथमो जिगाति
transliteration: mumoda gharbho vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmānasremā vatsaḥ śimīvānarāvīt | sa devatātyudyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣuprathamo jighāti
translation: The Bull, the youngling with the hump, hath frolicked, the strong and never-ceasing Calf hath bellowed. Bringing our offerings to the God's assembly, he moves as Chief in his own dwelling-places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 9
sanskrit: आपो हि षठा मयोभुवस्ता न ऊर्जे दधातन | महेरणाय चक्षसे
transliteration: maheraṇāya cakṣase
translation: YE, Waters, are beneficent: so help ye us to energy That we may look on great delight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 9
sanskrit: यो वः शिवतमो रसस्तस्य भजयतेह नः | उशतीरिवमातरः
transliteration: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasastasya bhajayateha naḥ | uśatīrivamātaraḥ
translation: Give us a portion of the sap, the most auspicious that ye have, Like mothers in their longing love.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 9
sanskrit: तस्मा अरं गमाम वो यस्य कषयाय जिन्वथ | आपोजनयथा च नः
transliteration: tasmā araṃ ghamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha |
translation: To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on; And, Waters, give us procreant strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: ओ चित सखायं सख्या वव्र्त्यां तिरः पुरू चिदर्णवंजगन्वन | पितुर्नपातमा दधीत वेधा अधि कषमिप्रतरं दिध्यानः
transliteration: o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ purū cidarṇavaṃjaghanvan | piturnapātamā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣamiprataraṃ didhyānaḥ
translation: FAIN would I win my friend to kindly friendship. So may the Sage, come through the air's wide ocean, Remembering the earth and days to follow, obtain a son, the issue of his father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: न ते सखा सख्यं वष्ट्येतत सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति | महस पुत्रसो असुरस्य वीरा दिवो धर्तारौर्विया परि खयन
transliteration: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭyetat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti | mahas putraso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāraurigvedayā pari khyan
translation: Thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger. Sons of the mighty Asura, the Heroes, supporters of the heavens, see far around them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: उशन्ति घा ते अम्र्तास एतदेकस्य चित तयजसं मर्त्यस्य | नि ते मनो मनसि धाय्यस्मे जन्युः पतिस्तन्वमाविविश्याः
transliteration: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etadekasya cit tyajasaṃ martyasya | ni te mano manasi dhāyyasme janyuḥ patistanvamāviviśyāḥ
translation: Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, progeny of the sole existing mortal. Then let thy soul and mine be knit together, and as a loving husband take thy consort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: न यत पुरा चक्र्मा कद ध नूनं रता वदन्तो अन्र्तंरपेम | गन्धर्वो अप्स्वप्या च योषा सा नो नाभिःपरमं जामि तन नौ
transliteration: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnaṃ ṛtā vadanto anṛtaṃrapema | ghandharigvedao apsvapyā ca yoṣā sā no nābhiḥparamaṃ jāmi tan nau
translation: Shall we do now what we ne'er did aforetime? we who spake righteously now talk impurely? Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of Waters-such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: गर्भे नु नौ जनिता दम्पती कर्देवास्त्वष्टा सविताविश्वरूपः | नाकिरस्य पर मिनन्ति वरतानि वेद नावस्यप्र्थिवि उत दयौः
transliteration: gharbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kardevāstvaṣṭā savitāviśvarūpaḥ | nākirasya pra minanti vratāni veda nāvasyapṛthivi uta dyauḥ
translation: Even in the womb God Tvastar, Vivifier, shaping all forms, Creator, made us consorts. None violates his holy ordinances: that we are his the heavens and earth acknowledge.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: को अस्य वेद परथमस्याह्नः क ईं ददर्श क इह परवोचत | बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम कदु बरव आहनोवीच्या नॄन
transliteration: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pravocat | bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kadu brava āhanovīcyā nṝn
translation: Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest? Who hath beheld it? Who can here declare it? Great is the Law of Varuna and Mitra. What, wanton! wilt thou say to men to tempt them?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: यमस्य मा यम्यं काम आगन समाने योनौ सहशेय्याय | जायेव पत्ये तन्वं रिरिच्यां वि चिद वर्हेव रथ्येव चक्रा
transliteration: yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āghan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya | jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā
translation: I, Yami, am possessed by love of Yama, that I may rest on the same couch beside him. I as a wife would yield me to my husband. Like car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: न तिष्ठन्ति न नि मिषन्त्येते देवानां सपश इह येचरन्ति | अन्येन मदाहनो याहि तुयं तेन वि वर्ह रथ्येवचक्रा
transliteration: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣantyete devānāṃ spaśa iha yecaranti | anyena madāhano yāhi tuyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyevacakrā
translation: They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those sentinels of Gods who wander round us. Not me-go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 10
sanskrit: रात्रीभिरस्मा अहभिर्दशस्येत सूर्यस्य चक्षुर्मुहुरुन्मिमीयात | दिवा पर्थिव्या मिथुना सबन्धू यमीर्यमस्यबिभ्र्यादजामि
transliteration: rātrībhirasmā ahabhirdaśasyet sūryasya cakṣurmuhurunmimīyāt | divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīryamasyabibhṛyādajāmi
translation: May Surya's eye with days and nights endow him, and ever may his light spread out before him. In heaven and earth the kindred Pair commingle. On Yam! be the unbrotherly act of Yama.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: वर्षा वर्ष्णे दुदुहे दोहसा दिवः पयांसि यह्वो अदितेरदाभ्यः | विश्वं स वेद वरुणो यथा धिया सयज्ञियो यजतु यज्ञियान रतून
transliteration: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditeradābhyaḥ | viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sayajñiyo yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn
translation: THE Bull hath yielded for the Bull the milk of heaven: the Son of Aditi can never be deceived. According to his wisdom Varuna knoweth all: may he, the Holy, hallow times for sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: रपद गन्धर्वीरप्या च योषणा नदस्य नादे परि पातुमे मनः | इष्टस्य मध्ये अदितिर्नि धातु नो भराता नोज्येष्ठः परथमो वि वोचति
transliteration: rapad ghandharigvedaīrapyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātume manaḥ | iṣṭasya madhye aditirni dhātu no bhrātā nojyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati
translation: Gandharvi spake: may she, the Lady of the flood, amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched. May Aditi accomplish all that we desire, and may our eldest Brother tell us this as Chief.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: सो चिन नु भद्रा कषुमती यशस्वत्युषा उवास मनवेस्वर्वती | यदीमुशन्तमुशतामनु करतुमग्निंहोतारं विदथाय जीजनन
transliteration: so cin nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatyuṣā uvāsa manavesvarigvedaatī | yadīmuśantamuśatāmanu kratumaghniṃhotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan
translation: Yea, even this blessed Morning, rich in store of food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for man, Since they, as was the wish of yearning Gods, brought forth that yearning Agni for the assembly as the Priest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: अध तयं दरप्सं विभ्वं विचक्षणं विराभरदिषितः शयेनो अध्वरे | यदी विशो वर्णते दस्ममार्याग्निं होतारमध धीरजायत
transliteration: adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ virābharadiṣitaḥ śyeno adhvare | yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmamāryāaghniṃ hotāramadha dhīrajāyata
translation: And the fleet Falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing Drop most excellent and keen of sight, Then when the Aryan tribes chose as Invoking Priest Agni the Wonder-Worker, and the hymn rose up.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: सदासि रण्वो यवसेव पुष्यते होत्राभिरग्ने मनुषःस्वध्वरः | विप्रस्य वा यच्छशमान उक्थ्यं वाजंससवानुपयासि भूरिभिः
transliteration: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhiraghne manuṣaḥsvadhvaraḥ | viprasya vā yacchaśamāna ukthyaṃ vājaṃsasavānupayāsi bhūribhiḥ
translation: Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass, and, skilled in sacrifice, offers thee holy gifts. When thou, having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds, after long toil, comest with many more.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: उदीरय पितरा जार आ भगमियक्षति हर्यतो हर्त्तैष्यति | विवक्ति वह्निः सवपस्यते मखस्तविष्यते असुरोवेपते मती
transliteration: udīraya pitarā jāra ā bhaghamiyakṣati haryato hṛttaiṣyati | vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhastaviṣyate asurovepate matī
translation: Urge thou thy Parents, as a lover ' to delight: the Lovely One desires and craves it from his heart. The priest calls out, the sacrificer shows his skill, the Asura tries his strength, and with the hymn is stirred.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: यस्ते अग्ने सुमतिं मर्तो अक्षत सहसः सूनो अति स परश्र्ण्वे | इषं दधानो वहमानो अश्वैरा स दयुमानमवान भूषति दयून
transliteration: yaste aghne sumatiṃ marto akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa praśṛṇve | iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvairā sa dyumānamavān bhūṣati dyūn
translation: Far-famed is he, the mortal man, O Agni, thou Son of Strength, who hath obtained thy favour. He, gathering power, borne onward by his horses, makes his days lovely in his might and splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 11
sanskrit: यदग्न एषा समितिर्भवाति देवी देवेषु यजता यजत्र | रत्ना च यद विभजासि सवधावो भागं नो अत्र वसुमन्तंवीतात
transliteration: yadaghna eṣā samitirbhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra | ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāghaṃ no atra vasumantaṃvītāt
translation: When, Holy Agni, the divine assembly, the sacred synod mid the Gods, is gathered, And when thou, Godlike One, dealest forth treasures, vouchsafe us, too, our portion of the riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: दयावा ह कषामा परथमे रतेनाभिश्रावे भवतःसत्यवाचा | देवो यन मर्तान यजथाय कर्ण्वन सीदद्धोता परत्यं सवमसुं यन
transliteration: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtenābhiśrāve bhavataḥsatyavācā | devo yan martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdaddhotā pratyaṃ svamasuṃ yan
translation: HEAVEN and Earth, first by everlasting Order, speakers of truth, are near enough to hear us, When the God, urging men to worship. sitteth as Priest, assuming all his vital vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: देवो देवान परिभूरतेन वहा नो हव्यं परथमश्चिकित्वान | धूमकेतुः समिधा भार्जीको मन्द्रो होता नित्योवाचा यजीयान
transliteration: devo devān paribhūrtena vahā no havyaṃ prathamaścikitvān | dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīko mandro hotā nityovācā yajīyān
translation: As God comprising Gods by Law Eternal, bear, as the Chief who knoweth, our oblation, Smoke-bannered with the fuel, radiant, joyous, better to praise and worship, Priest for ever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: सवाव्र्ग देवस्याम्र्तं यदी गोरतो जातासो धारयन्तौर्वी | विश्वे देवा अनु तत ते यजुर्गुर्दुहे यदेनीदिव्यं घर्तं वाः
transliteration: svāvṛgh devasyāmṛtaṃ yadī ghorato jātāso dhārayantaurigvedaī | viśve devā anu tat te yajurghurduhe yadenīdivyaṃ ghṛtaṃ vāḥ
translation: When the cow's nectar wins the God completely, men here below are heaven's sustainers. All the Gods came to this thy heavenly Yajus which from the motley Pair milked oil and water.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: अर्चामि वां वर्धायापो घर्तस्नू दयावाभूमी शर्णुतंरोदसी मे | अहा यद दयावो.असुनीतिमयन मध्वा नो अत्रपितरा शिशीताम
transliteration: arcāmi vāṃ vardhāyāpo ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutaṃrodasī me | ahā yad dyāvo.asunītimayan madhvā no atrapitarā śiśītām
translation: 1 praise your work that ye may make me prosper: hear, Heaven and Earth, Twain Worlds that drop with fatness. While days and nights go to the world of spirits, here let the Parents with sweet meath refresh us

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: किं सविन नो राजा जग्र्हे कदस्याति वरतं चक्र्मा को विवेद | मित्रश्चिद धि षमा जुहुराणो देवाञ्छ्लोको नयातामपि वाजो अस्ति
transliteration: kiṃ svin no rājā jaghṛhe kadasyāti vrataṃ cakṛmā ko viveda | mitraścid dhi ṣmā juhurāṇo devāñchloko nayātāmapi vājo asti
translation: Hath the King siezed us? How have we offended against his holy ordinance? Who knoweth? For even Mitra mid the Gods is angry there are both song and strength for those who come not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: दुर्मन्त्वत्राम्र्तस्य नाम सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति | यमस्य यो मनवते सुमन्त्वग्ने तं रष्व पाह्यप्रयुछन
transliteration: durmantvatrāmṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti | yamasya yo manavate sumantvaghne taṃ ṛṣva pāhyaprayuchan
translation: 'Tis hard to understand the Immortal's nature, where she who is akin becomes a stranger. Guard ceaselessly, great Agni, him who ponders Yama's name, easy to be comprehended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यस्मिन देवा विदथे मादयन्ते विवस्वतः सदने धारयन्ते | सूर्ये जयोतिरदधुर्मास्यक्तून परि दयोतनिं चरतोजस्रा
transliteration: yasmin devā vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante | sūrye jyotiradadhurmāsyaktūn pari dyotaniṃ caratoajasrā
translation: They in the synod where the Gods rejoice them, where they are seated in Vivasvan's dwelling, Have given the Moon his beams, the Sun his splendour-the Two unweariedly maintain their brightness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 12
sanskrit: यस्मिन देवा मन्मनि संचरन्त्यपीच्ये न वयमस्य विद्म | मित्रो नो अत्रादितिरनागान सविता देवो वरुणाय वोचत
transliteration: yasmin devā manmani saṃcarantyapīcye na vayamasya vidma | mitro no atrāditiranāghān savitā devo varuṇāya vocat
translation: The counsel which the Gods meet to consider, their secret plan,-of that we have no knowledge. There let God Savitar, Aditi, and Mitra proclaim to Varuna that we are sinless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 13
sanskrit: युजे वां बरह्म पूर्व्यं नमोभिर्वि शलोक एतु पथ्येवसूरेः | शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे अम्र्तस्य पुत्रा आ ये धामानिदिव्यानि तस्थुः
transliteration: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrigvedayaṃ namobhirigveda śloka etu pathyevasūreḥ |
translation: I YOKE with prayer your ancient inspiration: may the laud rise as on the prince's pathway. All Sons of Immortality shall hear it, all the possessors of celestial natures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 14
sanskrit: परेयिवांसं परवतो महीरनु बहुभ्यः पन्थामनुपस्पशनम | वैवस्वतं संगमनं जनानां यमंराजानं हविषा दुवस्य
transliteration: pareyivāṃsaṃ pravato mahīranu bahubhyaḥ panthāmanupaspaśanam | vaivasvataṃ saṃghamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃrājānaṃ haviṣā duvasya
translation: HONOUR the King with thine oblations, Yama, Vivasvan's Son, who gathers men together, Who travelled to the lofty heights above us, who searches out and shows the path to many.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 14
sanskrit: यमो नो गातुं परथमो विवेद नैष गव्यूतिरपभर्तवा उ | यत्रा नः पूर्वे पितरः परेयुरेना जज्ञानाःपथ्या अनु सवाः
transliteration: yamo no ghātuṃ prathamo viveda naiṣa ghavyūtirapabhartavā u | yatrā naḥ pūrigvedae pitaraḥ pareyurenā jajñānāḥpathyā anu svāḥ
translation: Yama first found for us a place to dwell in: this pasture never can be taken from Us. Men born on earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient Fathers have departed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 14
sanskrit: मातली कव्यैर्यमो अङगिरोभिर्ब्र्हस्पतिरकवभिर्वाव्र्धानः | यांश्च देवा वाव्र्धुर्ये च देवांस्वाहान्ये सवधयान्ये मदन्ति
transliteration: mātalī kavyairyamo aṅghirobhirbṛhaspatirkvabhirigvedaāvṛdhānaḥ | yāṃśca devā vāvṛdhurye ca devāṃsvāhānye svadhayānye madanti
translation: Mitali prospers there with Kavyas, Yama with Angiras' sons, Brhaspati with Rkvans: Exalters of the Gods, by Gods exalted, some joy in praise and some in our oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 14
sanskrit: इमं यम परस्तरमा हि सीदाङगिरोभिः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः | आ तवा मन्त्राः कविशस्ता वहन्त्वेना राजन्हविषा मादयस्व
transliteration: imaṃ yama prastaramā hi sīdāṅghirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ |
translation: Come, seat thee on this bed of grass, O Yama, in company with Angirases and Fathers. Let texts recited by the sages bring thee O King, let this oblation make thee joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 15
sanskrit: उदीरतामवर उत परास उन मध्यमाः पितरःसोम्यासः | असुं य ईयुरव्र्का रतज्ञास्ते नो.अवन्तुपितरो हवेषु
transliteration: udīratāmavara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥsomyāsaḥ | asuṃ ya īyuravṛkā ṛtajñāste no.avantupitaro haveṣu
translation: MAY they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers who deserve a share of Soma- May they who have attained the life of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we call them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 15
sanskrit: इदं पित्र्भ्यो नमो अस्त्वद्य ये पूर्वासो य उपरास ईयुः | ये पार्थिवे रजस्या निषत्ता ये वा नूनं सुव्र्जनासुविक्षु
transliteration: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astvadya ye pūrigvedaāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ | ye pārthive rajasyā niṣattā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsuvikṣu
translation: Now let us pay this homage to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed, Those who have rested in the earthly region, and those who dwell among the Mighty Races.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 16
sanskrit: मैनमग्ने वि दहो माभि शोचो मास्य तवचं चिक्षिपो माशरीरम | यदा शर्तं कर्णवो जातवेदो.अथेमेनं परहिणुतात पित्र्भ्यः
transliteration: mainamaghne vi daho mābhi śoco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo māśarīram | yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo.athemenaṃ prahiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ
translation: Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, Agni: let not his body or his skin be scattered. O Jatavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the Fathers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 17
sanskrit: तवष्टा दुहित्रे वहतुं कर्णोतीतीदं विश्वं भुवनंसमेति | यमस्य माता पर्युह्यमाना महो जाया विवस्वतोननाश
transliteration: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇotītīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃsameti | yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvatonanāśa
translation: TVASTAR prepares the bridal of his Daughter: all the world hears the tidings and assembles. But Yama's Mother, Spouse of great Vivasvan, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 17
sanskrit: अपागूहन्नम्र्तां मर्त्येभ्यः कर्त्वी सवर्णामददुर्विवस्वते | उताश्विनावभरद यत तदसीदजहादु दवामिथुना सरण्यूः
transliteration: apāghūhannamṛtāṃ martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇāmadadurigvedavasvate | utāśvināvabharad yat tadasīdajahādu dvāmithunā saraṇyūḥ
translation: From mortal men they hid the Immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to Vivasvan. Saranyu brought to him the Asvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 17
sanskrit: पूषा तवेतश्च्यावयतु पर विद्वाननष्टपशुर्भुवनस्य गोपाः | स तवैतेभ्यः परि ददत पित्र्भ्यो.अग्निर्देवेभ्यः सुविदत्रियेभ्यः
transliteration: pūṣā tvetaścyāvayatu pra vidvānanaṣṭapaśurbhuvanasya ghopāḥ | sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo.aghnirdevebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ
translation: Guard of the world, whose cattle ne'er are injured, may Pusan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge. May he consign thee to these Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious Gods let Agni give thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 18
sanskrit: परं मर्त्यो अनु परेहि पन्थां यस्ते सव इतरो देवयानात | चक्षुष्मते शर्ण्वते ते बरवीमि मा नः परजां रीरिषोमोत वीरान
transliteration: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yaste sva itaro devayānāt | cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajāṃ rīriṣomota vīrān
translation: Go hence, O Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel. To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our offspring, injure not our heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 18
sanskrit: मर्त्योः पदं योपयन्तो यदैत दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः | आप्यायमानाः परजया धनेन शुद्धाःपूता भवत यज्ञियासः
transliteration: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanto yadaita drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ |
translation: As ye have come effacing Mrtyu's footstep, to further times prolonging your existence, May ye be rich in children and possessions. cleansed, purified, and meet for sacrificing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 19
sanskrit: नि वर्तध्वं मानु गातास्मान सिषक्त रेवतीः | अग्नीषोमापुनर्वसू अस्मे धारयतं रयिम
transliteration: ni vartadhvaṃ mānu ghātāsmān siṣakta revatīḥ | aghnīṣomāpunarigvedaasū asme dhārayataṃ rayim
translation: TURN, go not farther on your way: visit us, O ye Wealthy Ones. Agni and Soma, ye who bring riches again, secure us wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पुनरेना नि वर्तय पुनरेना नया कुरु | इन्द्र एणा नियछत्वग्निरेना उपाजतु
transliteration: punarenā ni vartaya punarenā nyā kuru | indra eṇā niyachatvaghnirenā upājatu
translation: Make these return to us again, bring them beside us once again. May. Indra give them back to us, and Agni drive them hither-ward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 19
sanskrit: पुनरेता नि वर्तन्तामस्मिन पुष्यन्तु गोपतौ | इहैवाग्नेनि धारयेह तिष्ठतु या रयिः
transliteration: punaretā ni vartantāmasmin puṣyantu ghopatau | ihaivāghneni dhārayeha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ
translation: Let them return to us again: under this herdsman let them feed. Do thou, O Agni, keep them here, and let the wealth we have remain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 19
sanskrit: यन नियानं नययनं संज्ञानं यत परायणम | आवर्तनं निवर्तनं यो गोपा अपि तं हुवे
transliteration: yan niyānaṃ nyayanaṃ saṃjñānaṃ yat parāyaṇam |
translation: 1 call upon their herdsman, him who knoweth well their coming nigh, Their parting and their home-return, and watcheth their approach and rest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनः
transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya manaḥ
translation: SEND unto us a good and happy mind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अग्निमीळे भुजां यविष्ठं शासा मित्रं दुर्धरीतुम | यस्य धर्मन सवरेनीः सपर्यन्ति मातुरूधः
transliteration: aghnimīḷe bhujāṃ yaviṣṭhaṃ śāsā mitraṃ durdharītum | yasya dharman svarenīḥ saparyanti māturūdhaḥ
translation: I worship Agni, Youthfullest of Gods, resistless, Friend of laws; Under whose guard and heavenly light the Spotted seek the Mother's breast:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: यमासा कर्पनीळं भासाकेतुं वर्धयन्ति | भराजतेश्रेणिदन
transliteration: yamāsā kṛpanīḷaṃ bhāsāketuṃ vardhayanti | bhrājateśreṇidan
translation: Whom with their mouth they magnify, bannered with flame and homed in light. He glitters with his row of teeth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: अर्यो विशां गातुरेति पर यदानड दिवो अन्तान | कविरभ्रं दिद्यानः
transliteration: aryo viśāṃ ghātureti pra yadānaḍ divo antān | kavirabhraṃ didyānaḥ
translation: Kind, Furtherer of men, he comes, when he hath reached the ends of heaven, Sage, giving splendour to the clouds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: जुषद धव्या मानुषस्योर्ध्वस्तस्थाव रभ्वा यज्ञे | मिन्वन सद्म पुर एति
transliteration: juṣad dhavyā mānuṣasyordhvastasthāv ṛbhvā yajñe | minvan sadma pura eti
translation: To taste man's offerings, he, the Strong, hath risen erect at sacrifice: Fixing his dwelling he proceeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: स हि कषेमो हविर्यज्ञः शरुष्टीदस्य गातुरेति | अग्निं देवा वाशीमन्तम
transliteration: sa hi kṣemo haviryajñaḥ śruṣṭīdasya ghātureti | aghniṃ devā vāśīmantam
translation: Here are oblation, worship, rest: rapidly comes his furtherance. To sword-armed Agni come the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: यज्ञासाहं दुव इषे.अग्निं पूर्वस्य शेवस्य | अद्रेःसूनुमायुमाहुः
transliteration: yajñāsāhaṃ duva iṣe.aghniṃ pūrigvedaasya śevasya | adreḥsūnumāyumāhuḥ
translation: With service for chief bliss I seek the Lord of Sacrifice, Agni, whom They call the Living, Son of Cloud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: नरो ये के चास्मदा विश्वेत ते वाम आ सयुः | अग्निंहविषा वर्धन्तः
transliteration: naro ye ke cāsmadā viśvet te vāma ā syuḥ | aghniṃhaviṣā vardhantaḥ
translation: Blest evermore be all the men who come from us, who magnify Agni with sacrificial gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: कर्ष्णः शवेतो.अरुषो यामो अस्य बरध्न रज्र उत शोणोयशस्वान | हिरण्यरूपं जनिता जजान
transliteration: kṛṣṇaḥ śveto.aruṣo yāmo asya bradhna ṛjra uta śoṇoyaśasvān | hiraṇyarūpaṃ janitā jajāna
translation: The path he treads is black and white and red, and striped, and brown, crimson, and glorious. His sire begat him bright with hues of gold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 20
sanskrit: एवा ते अग्ने विमदो मनीषामूर्जो नपादम्र्तेभिःसजोषाः | गिर आ वक्षत सुमतीरियान इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः
transliteration: evā te aghne vimado manīṣāmūrjo napādamṛtebhiḥsajoṣāḥ | ghira ā vakṣat sumatīriyāna iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ
translation: Thus with his thoughts, O Son of Strength, O Agni, hath Vimada, accordant with the Immortals, Offered thee hymns, soliciting thy favour. Thou hast brought all food, strength, a prosperous dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: आग्निं न सवव्र्क्तिभिर्होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे | यज्ञायस्तीर्णबर्हिषे वि वो मदे शीरं पावकशोचिषंविवक्षसे
transliteration: yajñāyastīrṇabarhiṣe vi vo made śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣaṃvivakṣase
translation: WITH offerings of our own we choose thee, Agni, as Invoking Priest, For sacrifice with trimmed grass,-at your glad carouse-piercing and brightly shining. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवामु ते सवाभुवः शुम्भन्त्यश्वराधसः | वेति तवामुपसेचनी वि वो मद रजीतिरग्न आहुतिर्विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvāmu te svābhuvaḥ śumbhantyaśvarādhasaḥ | veti tvāmupasecanī vi vo mada ṛjītiraghna āhutirigvedavakṣase
translation: The wealthy ones adorn thee, they who bring us horses as their gift: The sprinkling ladle, Agni,-at your glad carouse -and glowing offering taste thee. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवे धर्माण आसते जुहूभिः सिञ्चतीरिव | कर्ष्णारूपाण्यर्जुना वि वो मदे विश्वा अधि शरियो धिषेविवक्षसे
transliteration: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīriva | kṛṣṇārūpāṇyarjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣevivakṣase
translation: The holy statutes rest by thee, as 'twere with ladles that o'erflow. Black and white-gleaming colours,-at your glad carouse-all glories thou assumest. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: यमग्ने मन्यसे रयिं सहसावन्नमर्त्य | तमा नोवाजसातये वि वो मदे यज्ञेषु चित्रमा भरा विवक्षसे
transliteration: yamaghne manyase rayiṃ sahasāvannamartya | tamā novājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citramā bharā vivakṣase
translation: O Agni, what thou deemest wealth, Victorious and Immortal One! Bring thou to give us vigour,-at your glad carouse -splendid at sacrifices. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अग्निर्जातो अथर्वणा विदद विश्वानि काव्या | भुवद दूतोविवस्वतो वि वो मदे परियो यमस्य काम्यो विवक्षसे
transliteration: aghnirjāto atharigvedaaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā | bhuvad dūtovivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase
translation: Skilled in all lore is Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to life. He was Vivasvan's envoy, at your glad carouse-the well-loved friend of Yama, Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्वीळते.अग्ने परयत्यध्वरे | तवं वसूनिकाम्या वि वो मदे विश्वा दधासि दाशुषे विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣvīḷate.aghne prayatyadhvare | tvaṃ vasūnikāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase
translation: At sacrifices they adore thee, Agni, when the rite proceeds. All fair and lovely treasures-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who offers. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजं चारुमग्ने नि षेदिरे | घर्तप्रतीकं मनुषो वि वो मदे शुक्रं चेतिष्ठमक्षभिर्विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṃ cārumaghne ni ṣedire | ghṛtapratīkaṃ manuṣo vi vo made śukraṃ cetiṣṭhamakṣabhirigvedavakṣase
translation: Men, Agni, have established thee as welcome Priest at holy rites, Thee whose face shines with butter,-at your glad carouse-bright, with eyes most observant. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 21
sanskrit: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषोरु परथयसे बर्हत | अभिक्रन्दन्व्र्षायसे वि वो मदे गर्भं दधासि जामिषु विवक्षसे
transliteration: aghne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat | abhikrandanvṛṣāyase vi vo made gharbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase
translation: Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O Agni, with thy brilliant flame. A Bull art thou when bellowing,-at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn the Sisters. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 22
sanskrit: कुह शरुत इन्द्रः कस्मिन्नद्य जने मित्रो न शरुयते | रषीणां वा यः कषये गुहा व चर्क्र्षे गिर
transliteration: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminnadya jane mitro na śruyate |
translation: WHERE is famed Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as Mitra is,- Who in the home of Rsis and in secret is extolled with song?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 23
sanskrit: यजामह इन्द्रं वज्रदक्षिणं हरीणां रथ्यंविव्रतानाम | पर शमश्रु दोधुवदूर्ध्वथा भूद विसेनाभिर्दयमानो वि राधसा
transliteration: yajāmaha indraṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ harīṇāṃ rathyaṃvivratānām | pra śmaśru dodhuvadūrdhvathā bhūd visenābhirdayamāno vi rādhasā
translation: INDRA, whose right hand wields the bolt, we worship, driver of Bay Steeds seeking sundered courses. Shaking his beard with might he hath arisen, casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 23
sanskrit: हरी नवस्य या वने विदे वस्विन्द्रो मघैर्मघवाव्र्त्रहा भुवत | रभुर्वाज रभुक्षाः पत्यते शवो.अवक्ष्णौमि दासस्य नाम चित
transliteration: harī nvasya yā vane vide vasvindro maghairmaghavāvṛtrahā bhuvat |
translation: The treasure which his Bay Steeds found at sacrifice,-this wealth made opulent Indra slayer of the foe. Rbhu, Rbhuksan, Vaja-he is Lord of Might. The Dasa's very name I utterly destroy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 24
sanskrit: इन्द्र सोममिमं पिब मधुमन्तं चमू सुतम | अस्मे रयिंनि धारय वि वो मदे सहस्रिणं पुरूवसो विवक्षसे
transliteration: indra somamimaṃ piba madhumantaṃ camū sutam | asme rayiṃni dhāraya vi vo made sahasriṇaṃ purūvaso vivakṣase
translation: O INDRA, drink this Soma, pressed out in the mortar, full of sweets. Send down to us great riches,-at your glad carouse-in thousands, O Most healthy. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 24
sanskrit: तवां यज्ञेभिरुक्थैरुप हव्येभिरीमहे | शचीपतेशचीनां वि वो मदे शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यं विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvāṃ yajñebhirukthairupa havyebhirīmahe |
translation: To thee with sacrifices, with oblations, and with lauds we come. Lord of all strength and power, grant-at your glad carouse-the best choice worthy treasure. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनो दक्षमुत करतुम | अधा तेसख्ये अन्धसो वि वो मदे रणन गवो न यवसे विवक्षसे
transliteration: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣamuta kratum | adhā tesakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇan ghavo na yavase vivakṣase
translation: SEND us a good and happy mind, send energy and mental power. Then-at your glad carouse-let men joy in thy love, Sweet juice! as kine in pasture. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: हर्दिस्प्र्शस्त असते विश्वेषु सोम ध मसु | अधा कामा इमेमम वि वो मदे वि तिष्ठन्ते वसूयवो विवक्षसे
transliteration: hṛdispṛśasta asate viśveṣu soma dha masu | adhā kāmā imemama vi vo made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavo vivakṣase
translation: rn all thy forms, O Soma, rest thy powers that influence the heart. So also these my longings-at your glad carouse-spread themselves seeking riches. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: उत वरतनि सोम ते परहं मिनामि पाक्या | अधा पितेवसूनवे वि वो मदे मर्ळ नो अभि चिद वधाद विवक्षसे
transliteration: uta vratani soma te prahaṃ mināmi pākyā | adhā pitevasūnave vi vo made mṛḷa no abhi cid vadhād vivakṣase
translation: Even if, O Soma, I neglect thy laws through my simplicity, Be gracious-at your glad carouse-as sire to son. Preserve us even from slaughter. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: समु पर यन्ति धीतयः सर्गासो.अवतानिव | करतुं नःसोम जिवसे वि वो मदे धरया चमसानिव विवक्षसे
transliteration: samu pra yanti dhītayaḥ sarghāso.avatāniva | kratuṃ naḥsoma jivase vi vo made dharayā camasāniva vivakṣase
translation: Our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells. Soma, that we may live, grant-at your glad carouse-full powers of mind, like beakers. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तव तये सोम शक्तिभिर्निकामासो वय रण्विरे | गर्त्सस्यधिरस्तवसो वि वो मदे वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनं विवक्षसे
transliteration: tava tye soma śaktibhirnikāmāso vy ṛṇvire | ghṛtsasyadhirastavaso vi vo made vrajaṃ ghomantamaśvinaṃ vivakṣase
translation: O Soma, through thy might who art skillful and strong, these longing men, These sages, have thrown open-at your glad carouse-the stall of kine and horses. Thou art waxing great

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: पशुं नः सोम रक्षसि पुरुत्र विष्ठितं जगत | समाक्र्णोषि जीवसे वि वो मदे विश्वा सम्पश्यन भुवनविवक्षसे
transliteration: paśuṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi purutra viṣṭhitaṃ jaghat | samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vo made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanavivakṣase
translation: Our herds thou guardest, Soma, and the moving world spread far and wide. Thou fittest them for living,-at your glad carouse-looking upon all beings. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तवं नः सोम विश्वतो गोप अदभ्यो भव | सेध राजन्नपस्रिधो वि वो मदे म नो दुः शंस ईशता विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato ghopa adabhyo bhava | sedha rājannapasridho vi vo made ma no duḥ śaṃsa īśatā vivakṣase
translation: On all sides, Soma, be to us a Guardian ne'er to be deceived. King, drive away our foemen-at your glad carouse:-let not the wicked rule us. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तवं नः सोम सुक्रतुर्व योधेयाय जाग्र्हि | कषेत्रवित्तरोमनुषो वि वो मदे दरुहो नः पाह्यंहसो विवक्षसे
transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ soma sukraturigvedaa yodheyāya jāghṛhi | kṣetravittaromanuṣo vi vo made druho naḥ pāhyaṃhaso vivakṣase
translation: Be watchful, Soma, passing wise, to give us store of vital strength. More skilled than man to guide us,-at your glad carouse-save us from harm and sorrow. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: तवं नो वर्त्र हन्तमेन्द्रस्येन्दो शिवः सखा | यत सिंहवन्ते समिथे वि वो मदे युध्यमनस्तोकसातौविवक्षसे
transliteration: tvaṃ no vṛtra hantamendrasyendo śivaḥ sakhā | yat siṃhavante samithe vi vo made yudhyamanastokasātauvivakṣase
translation: Chief slayer of our foemen, thou, Indu, art Indra's gracious Friend, When warriors invoke him-at your glad carouse -in fight, to win them offspring. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अयं घ स तुरो मद इन्द्रस्य वर्धत परियः | अयंकक्षीवतो महो वि वो मदे मतिं विप्रस्य वर्धयद्विवक्षसे
transliteration: ayaṃ gha sa turo mada indrasya vardhata priyaḥ | ayaṃkakṣīvato maho vi vo made matiṃ viprasya vardhayadvivakṣase
translation: Victorious is this gladdening drink: to Indra dear it grows in strength. This-at your glad carouse -enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage Kaksivan. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 25
sanskrit: अयं विप्रय दशुषे वजनियर्ति गोमतः | अयंसप्तभ्य आ वरं वि वो मदे परन्धं शरोणं चतरिषद विवक्षसे
transliteration: ayaṃ vipraya daśuṣe vajaniyarti ghomataḥ | ayaṃsaptabhya ā varaṃ vi vo made prandhaṃ śroṇaṃ catariṣad vivakṣase
translation: This to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine. This, better than the seven, hath-at your glad carouse-furthered the blind, the cripple. Thou art waxing great.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 26
sanskrit: पर हयछा मनीषा सपार्ह यन्ति नियुतः | पर दस्रानियुद्रथः पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः
transliteration: pra hyachā manīṣā spārha yanti niyutaḥ | pra dasrāniyudrathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
translation: FORWARD upon their way proceed the ready teams, the lovely songs. Further them glorious Pusan with yoked chariot, and the Mighty Twain!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 26
sanskrit: यस्य तयन महित्वं वताप्यमयं जनः | विप्र आ वंसद्धीतिभिश्चिकेत सुष्टुतीनाम
transliteration: yasya tyan mahitvaṃ vatāpyamayaṃ janaḥ | vipra ā vaṃsaddhītibhiściketa suṣṭutīnām
translation: With sacred hymns let this man here, this singer, win the God to whom Belong this majesty and might. He hath observed our eulogies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 26
sanskrit: स वेद सुष्टुतीनामिन्दुर्न पूष वर्षा | अभि पसुरःप्रुषायति वरजं न आ परुषायति
transliteration: sa veda suṣṭutīnāmindurna pūṣa vṛṣā | abhi psuraḥpruṣāyati vrajaṃ na ā pruṣāyati
translation: Pusan the Strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as Indu hath. He dews our corn with moisture, he bedews the pasture of our kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 26
sanskrit: मंसीमहि तवा वयमस्माकं देव पूषन | मत्मां चसाधनं विप्राणां चाधवम
transliteration: maṃsīmahi tvā vayamasmākaṃ deva pūṣan | matmāṃ casādhanaṃ viprāṇāṃ cādhavam
translation: We will bethink ourselves of thee, O Pusan, O thou God, as One. Who brings fulfilment of our hymns, and stirs the singer and the sage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 26
sanskrit: परत्यर्धिर्यज्ञनामश्वहयो रथानाम | रषिः स योमनुर्हितो विप्रस्य यावयत्सखः
transliteration: pratyardhiryajñanāmaśvahayo rathānām |
translation: joint-sharer of each sacrifice, the driver of the chariot steeds; The Rsi who is good to man, the singer's Friend and faithful Guard.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: असत सु मे जरितः साभिवेगो यत सुन्वते यजमनय शिक्षम | अनाशीर्दामहमस्मि परहन्ता सत्यध्व्र्तं वर्जिनायन्तमाभुम
transliteration: asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivegho yat sunvate yajamanaya śikṣam | anāśīrdāmahamasmi prahantā satyadhvṛtaṃ vṛjināyantamābhum
translation: THIS, singer, is my firm determination, to aid the worshipper who pours the Soma. I slay the man who brings no milk oblation, unrighteous, powerful, the truth's perverter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यदीदहं युधये संनयान्यदेवयून तन्वाशूशुजानान | अमा ते तुम्रं वर्षभं पचानि तीव्रंसुतं पञ्चदशं नि षिञ्चम
transliteration: yadīdahaṃ yudhaye saṃnayānyadevayūn tanvāśūśujānān | amā te tumraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ pacāni tīvraṃsutaṃ pañcadaśaṃ ni ṣiñcam
translation: Then Will I, when I lead my friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless, Prepare for thee at home a vigorous bullock, and pour for thee the fifteen-fold strong juices.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: नाहं तं वेद य इति बरवीत्यदेवयून समरणेजघन्वान | यदावाख्यत समरणं रघावदादिद ध मेव्र्षभा पर बरुवन्ति
transliteration: nāhaṃ taṃ veda ya iti bravītyadevayūn samaraṇejaghanvān | yadāvākhyat samaraṇaṃ ṛghāvadādid dha mevṛṣabhā pra bruvanti
translation: I know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle. Soon as they see the furious combat raging, men speak forth praises of my vigorous horses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यदज्ञातेषु वर्जनेष्वासं विश्वे सतो मघवानो मासन | जिनामि वेत कषेम आ सन्तमाभुं पर तंक्षिणां पर्वते पादग्र्ह्य
transliteration: yadajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣvāsaṃ viśve sato maghavāno maāsan | jināmi vet kṣema ā santamābhuṃ pra taṃkṣiṇāṃ parigvedaate pādaghṛhya
translation: While yet my deeds of might were unrecorded, all passed for Maghavans though I existed. The potent one who dwelt in peace I conquered, grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: न वा उ मां वर्जने वारयन्ते न पर्वतासो यदहम्मनस्ये | मम सवनात कर्धुकर्णो भयात एवेदनु दयून्किरणः समेजात
transliteration: na vā u māṃ vṛjane vārayante na parigvedaatāso yadahammanasye | mama svanāt kṛdhukarṇo bhayāta evedanu dyūnkiraṇaḥ samejāt
translation: None hinder me in mine heroic exploits, no, not the mountains when I will and purpose. Even the deaf will tremble at my roaring, and every day will dust be agitated.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: दर्शन नवत्र शर्तपाननिन्द्रान बाहुक्षदः शरवेपत्यमानान | घर्षुं वा ये निनिदुः सखायमध्यू नवेषु पवयो वव्र्त्युः
transliteration: darśan nvatra śṛtapānanindrān bāhukṣadaḥ śaravepatyamānān | ghṛṣuṃ vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyamadhyū nveṣu pavayo vavṛtyuḥ
translation: To see the Indraless oblation-drinkers, mean offerers, o'ertaken by destruction! Then shall the fellies of my car pass over those who have blamed my joyous Friend and scorned him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: अभूर्वौक्षीर्व्यु आयुरानड दर्षन नु पूर्वो अपरोनु दर्षत | दवे पवस्ते परि तं न भूतो यो अस्य पारेरजसो विवेष
transliteration: abhūrigvedaaukṣīrigvedayu āyurānaḍ darṣan nu pūrigvedao aparonu darṣat | dve pavaste pari taṃ na bhūto yo asya pārerajaso viveṣa
translation: Thou wast, thou grewest to full vital vigour: an earlier saw, a later one shall see thee. Two canopies, as 'twere, are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: गावो यवं परयुता अर्यो अक्षन ता अपश्यं सहगोपाश्चरन्तीः | हवा इदर्यो अभितः समायन कियदासुस्वपतिश्छन्दयाते
transliteration: ghāvo yavaṃ prayutā aryo akṣan tā apaśyaṃ sahaghopāścarantīḥ | havā idaryo abhitaḥ samāyan kiyadāsusvapatiśchandayāte
translation: The freed kine eat the barley of the pious. 1 saw them as they wandered with the herdsman. The calling of the pious rang around them. What portion will these kine afford their owner?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: सं यद वयं यवसादो जनानामहं यवाद उर्वज्रेन्तः | अत्रा युक्तो.अवसातारमिछादथो अयुक्तं युनजद्ववन्वान
transliteration: saṃ yad vayaṃ yavasādo janānāmahaṃ yavāda urigvedaajreantaḥ | atrā yukto.avasātāramichādatho ayuktaṃ yunajadvavanvān
translation: When we who cat the grass of men are gathered I am with barley-eaters in the corn-land. There shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock, and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: अत्रेदु मे मंससे सत्यमुक्तं दविपाच्च यच्चतुष्पात्संस्र्जानि | सत्रीभिर्यो अत्र वर्षणं पर्तन्यादयुद्धोस्य वि भजानि वेदः
transliteration: atredu me maṃsase satyamuktaṃ dvipācca yaccatuṣpātsaṃsṛjāni | strībhiryo atra vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtanyādayuddhoasya vi bhajāni vedaḥ
translation: There wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose, to bring together quadrupeds. and bipeds. I will divide, without a fight, his riches who warreth here, against the Bull, with women.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: यस्यानक्षा दुहिता जात्वास कस्तां विद्वानभिमन्याते अन्धाम | कतरो मेनिं परति तं मुचाते य ईंवहाते य ईं वा वरेयात
transliteration: yasyānakṣā duhitā jātvāsa kastāṃ vidvānabhimanyāte andhām | kataro meniṃ prati taṃ mucāte ya īṃvahāte ya īṃ vā vareyāt
translation: When a man's daughter hath been ever eyeless, who, knowing, will be wroth with her for blindness? Which of the two will loose on him his anger-the man who leads her home or he who woos her?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: कियती योषा मर्यतो वधूयोः परिप्रीता पन्यसावार्येण | भद्रा वधूर्भवति यत सुपेशाः सवयं सामित्रं वनुते जने चित
transliteration: kiyatī yoṣā maryato vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasāvāryeṇa | bhadrā vadhūrbhavati yat supeśāḥ svayaṃ sāmitraṃ vanute jane cit
translation: How many a maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid riches? If the girl be both good and fair of feature, she finds, herself, a friend among the people.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 27
sanskrit: पत्तो जगार परत्यञ्चमत्ति शीर्ष्णा शिरः परति दधौवरूथम | आसीन ऊर्ध्वामुपसि कषिणाति नयंं उत्तानामन्वेति भूमिम
transliteration: patto jaghāra pratyañcamatti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhauvarūtham |
translation: His feet have grasped: he eats the man who meets him. Around his head he sets the head for shelter. Sitting anear and right above he smites us, and follows earth that lies spread out beneath him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: विश्वो हयन्यो अरिराजगाम ममेदह शवशुरो न जगाम | जक्षीयाद धना उत सोमं पपीयात सवाशितः पुनरस्तं जगायात
transliteration: viśvo hyanyo arirājaghāma mamedaha śvaśuro na jaghāma | jakṣīyād dhanā uta somaṃ papīyāt svāśitaḥ punarastaṃ jaghāyāt
translation: Now all my other friends are here assembled: my Sire-in-law alone hath not come hither. So might he eat the grain and drink the Soma, and, satisfied, return unto; his dwelling.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: स रोरुवद वर्षभस्तिग्मश्र्न्गो वर्ष्मन तस्थाु वरिमन्नाप्र्थिव्याः | विश्वेष्वेनं वर्जनेषु पामि यो मे कुक्षिसुतसोमः पर्णाति
transliteration: sa roruvad vṛṣabhastighmaśṛngho varṣman tasthāu varimannāpṛthivyāḥ | viśveṣvenaṃ vṛjaneṣu pāmi yo me kukṣisutasomaḥ pṛṇāti
translation: Loud belloweth the Bull whose horns are sharpened: upon the height above earth's breadth he standeth. That man I guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: अद्रिणा ते मन्दिन इन्द्र तूयान सुन्वन्ति सोमान पिबसि तवमेशाम | पचन्ति ते वर्षभानत्सि तेषां पर्क्षेण यन्मघवन हूयमानः
transliteration: adriṇā te mandina indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvameśām | pacanti te vṛṣabhānatsi teṣāṃ pṛkṣeṇa yanmaghavan hūyamānaḥ
translation: Men with the stone press out for thee, O Indra, strong, gladdening Soma, and thereof thou drinkest. Bulls they dress for thee, and of these thou eatest when, Maghavan, with food thou art invited.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: इदं सु मे जरितरा चिकिद्धि परतीपं शापं नद्योवहन्ति | लोपाशः सिंहं परत्यञ्चमत्साः करोष्टावराहं निरतक्त कक्षात
transliteration: idaṃ su me jaritarā cikiddhi pratīpaṃ śāpaṃ nadyovahanti | lopāśaḥ siṃhaṃ pratyañcamatsāḥ kroṣṭāvarāhaṃ niratakta kakṣāt
translation: Resolve for me, O singer, this my riddle: The rivers send their swelling water backward: The fox steals up to the approaching lion: the jackal drives the wild-boar from the brushwood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: कथ त एतदहमा चिकेतं गर्त्सस्य पाकस्तवसोमनीषाम | तवं नो विद्वान रतुथा वि वोचो यमर्धं तेमघवन कषेम्या धूः
transliteration: katha ta etadahamā ciketaṃ ghṛtsasya pākastavasomanīṣām | tvaṃ no vidvān ṛtuthā vi voco yamardhaṃ temaghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ
translation: How shall I solve this riddle, I, the simple, declare the thought of thee the Wise and Mighty? Tell us, well knowing, as befits the season: Whitherward is thy prosperous car advancing?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: एवा हि मां तवसं वर्धयन्ति दिवश्चिन मे बर्हतौत्तरा धुः | पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि साकमशत्रुंहि म जनिता जजान
transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ vardhayanti divaścin me bṛhatauttarā dhuḥ | purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākamaśatruṃhi ma janitā jajāna
translation: Thus do they magnify me, me the mighty higher than even high heaven is my car-pole. I all at once demolish many thousands: my Sire begot me with no foe to match me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: एवा हि मां तवसं जज्ञुरुग्रं कर्मन-कर्मन वर्षणमिन्द्र देवाः | वधीं वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसनो.अप वरजम्महिना दाशुषे वम
transliteration: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ jajñurughraṃ karman-karman vṛṣaṇamindra devāḥ | vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasano.apa vrajammahinā dāśuṣe vam
translation: Yea, and the Gods have known me also, Indra, as mighty, fierce and strong in every exploit. Exulting with the bolt I slaughtered Vrtra, and for the offerer open with might the cow-stall.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 28
sanskrit: देवास आयन परशून्रबिभ्रन वना वर्श्चन्तो अभि विड्भिरायन | नि सुद्र्वं दधतो वक्षणासु यत्रा कर्पीटमनुतद दहन्ति
transliteration: devāsa āyan paraśūnrabibhran vanā vṛścanto abhi viḍbhirāyan | ni sudrigvedaaṃ dadhato vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭamanutad dahanti
translation: The Deities approached, they carried axes; splitting the wood they came with their attendants. They laid good timber in the fire-receivers, and burnt the grass up where they found it growing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: वने न वा यो नयधायि चाकञ्छुचिर्वां सतोमो भुरणावजीगः | यस्येदिन्द्रः पुरुदिनेषु होता नर्णां नर्योन्र्तमः कषपावान
transliteration: vane na vā yo nyadhāyi cākañchucirigvedaāṃ stomo bhuraṇāvajīghaḥ | yasyedindraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ naryonṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān
translation: As sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift Pair, have been roused by clear laudation, Whose Herald-Priest through many days is Indra, earth's Guardian, Friend of men, the best of Heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: पर ते अस्या उषसः परापरस्या नर्तौ सयाम नर्तमस्यन्र्णाम | अनु तरिशोकः शतमावहन नॄन कुत्सेन रथो योसत ससवान
transliteration: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtamasyanṛṇām | anu triśokaḥ śatamāvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yoasat sasavān
translation: May we, when this Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic Hero! Let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with Kutsa.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: कस्ते मद इन्द्र रन्त्यो भूद दुरो गिरो अभ्युग्रो वि धाव | कद वाहो अर्वागुप मा मनीषा आ तवा शक्यमुपमंराधो अन्नैः
transliteration: kaste mada indra rantyo bhūd duro ghiro abhyughro vi dhāva | kad vāho arigvedaāghupa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyamupamaṃrādho annaiḥ
