translation: What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, Indra? Speed through our doors to songs, for thou art mighty. Why comest thou to me, what gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee food most meet to offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: कदु दयुम्नमिन्द्र तवावतो नॄन कया धिया करसे कन नागन | मित्रो न सत्य उरुगाय भर्त्या अन्ने समस्य यदसन्मनीषाः
transliteration: kadu dyumnamindra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan naāghan | mitro na satya urughāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yadasanmanīṣāḥ
translation: Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us? As a true Friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since food absorbs the thought of each among us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: परेरय सूरो अर्थं न पारं ये अस्य कामं जनिधा इवग्मन | गिरश्च ये ते तुविजात पूर्वीर्नर इन्द्रप्रतिशिक्षन्त्यन्नैः
transliteration: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā ivaghman | ghiraśca ye te tuvijāta pūrigvedaīrnara indrapratiśikṣantyannaiḥ
translation: Speed happily those, as Surya ends his journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses; Men who present, O Indra strong by nature, with food the many songs that tell thy praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 29
sanskrit: मात्रे नु ते सुमिते इन्द्र पूर्वी दयौर्मज्मना पर्थिवीकाव्येन | वराय ते घर्तवन्तः सुतासः सवाद्मन भवन्तुपीतये मधूनि
transliteration: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrigvedaī dyaurmajmanā pṛthivīkāvyena | varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantupītaye madhūni
translation: Thine are two measures, Indra, wide-well meted, heaven for thy majesty, earth for thy wisdom. Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter: may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: पर देवत्रा बराह्मणे गातुरेत्वपो अछा मनसो नप्रयुक्ति | महीं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिं पर्थुज्रयसेरीरधा सुव्र्क्तिम
transliteration: pra devatrā brāhmaṇe ghāturetvapo achā manaso naprayukti | mahīṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsiṃ pṛthujrayaserīradhā suvṛktim
translation: As 'twere with swift exertion of the spirit, let the priest speed to the celestial Waters, The glorious food of Varuna and Mitra. To him who spreadeth far this laud I offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो हविष्मन्तो हि भूताछाप इतोशतीरुशन्तः | अव याश्चष्टे अरुणः सुपर्णस्तमास्यध्वमूर्मिमद्या सुहस्ताः
transliteration: adhvaryavo haviṣmanto hi bhūtāchāpa itośatīruśantaḥ | ava yāścaṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇastamāsyadhvamūrmimadyā suhastāḥ
translation: Adhvaryus, he ye ready with oblations,, and come with longing to the longing Waters, Down on which looks the. purple-tinted Eagle. Pour ye that flowing wave this day, deft-handed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: अध्वर्यवो.अप इता समुद्रमपां नपातं हविषा यजध्वम | स वो दददूर्मिमद्या सुपूतं तस्मै सोमं मधुमन्तंसुनोत
transliteration: adhvaryavo.apa itā samudramapāṃ napātaṃ haviṣā yajadhvam | sa vo dadadūrmimadyā supūtaṃ tasmai somaṃ madhumantaṃsunota
translation: Go to the reservoir, O ye Adhvaryus worship the Waters' Child with your oblations. A consecrated wave he now will give you, so press for him the Soma rich in sweetness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यो अनिध्मो दीदयदप्स्वन्तर्यं विप्रास ईळतेध्वरेषु | अपां नपान मधुमतीरपो दा याभिरिन्द्रोवाव्र्धे वीर्याय
transliteration: yo anidhmo dīdayadapsvantaryaṃ viprāsa īḷateadhvareṣu | apāṃ napān madhumatīrapo dā yābhirindrovāvṛdhe vīryāya
translation: He who shines bright in floods, unfed with fuel, whom sages worship at their sacrifices: Give waters rich in sweets, Child of the Waters, even those which gave heroic might to Indra:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: याभिः सोमो मोदते हर्षते च कल्याणीभिर्युवतिभिर्नमर्यः | ता अध्वर्यो अपो अछा परेहि यदासिञ्चाोषधीभिः पुनीतात
transliteration: yābhiḥ somo modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiryuvatibhirnamaryaḥ | tā adhvaryo apo achā parehi yadāsiñcāoṣadhībhiḥ punītāt
translation: Those in which Soma joys and is delighted, as a young man with fair and pleasant damsels. Go thou unto those Waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify with herbs what thou infusest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: एवेद यूने युवतयो नमन्त यदीमुशन्नुशतीरेत्यछ | सं जानते मनसा सं चिकित्रे.अध्वर्यवो धिषणापश्चदेवीः
transliteration: eved yūne yuvatayo namanta yadīmuśannuśatīretyacha | saṃ jānate manasā saṃ cikitre.adhvaryavo dhiṣaṇāpaścadevīḥ
translation: So maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him. In heart accordant and in wish one-minded are the Adhvaryus and the heavenly Waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: यो वो वर्ताभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकं यो वो मह्या अभिशस्तेरमुञ्चत | तस्मा इन्द्राय मधुमन्तमूर्मिं देवमादनम्प्र हिणोतनापः
transliteration: yo vo vṛtābhyo akṛṇodu lokaṃ yo vo mahyā abhiśasteramuñcat | tasmā indrāya madhumantamūrmiṃ devamādanampra hiṇotanāpaḥ
translation: He who made room for you when fast imprisoned, who freed you from the mighty imprecation,- Even to that Indra send the meath-rich current, the wave that gratifies the Gods, O Waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: परास्मै हिनोत मधुमन्तमूर्मिं गर्भो यो वः सिन्धवोमध्व उत्सः | घर्तप्र्ष्ठमीड्यमध्वरेष्वापो रेवतीःश्र्णुता हवं मे
transliteration: prāsmai hinota madhumantamūrmiṃ gharbho yo vaḥ sindhavomadhva utsaḥ | ghṛtapṛṣṭhamīḍyamadhvareṣvāpo revatīḥśṛṇutā havaṃ me
translation: Send forth to him the meath-rich wave, O Rivers, which is your offspring and a well of sweetness, Oil-balmed, to be implored at sacrifices. Ye wealthy Waters, hear mine invocation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 30
sanskrit: तं सिन्धवो मत्सरमिन्द्रपानमूर्मिं पर हेत य उभेियर्ति | मदच्युतमौशानं नभोजां परि तरितन्तुंविचरन्तमुत्सम
transliteration: taṃ sindhavo matsaramindrapānamūrmiṃ pra heta ya ubheiyarti | madacyutamauśānaṃ nabhojāṃ pari tritantuṃvicarantamutsam
translation: Send forth the rapture-giving wave, O Rivers, which Indra drinks, which sets the Twain in motion; The well that springeth from the clouds, desirous, that wandereth triple-formed, distilling transport.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: आ नो देवानामुप वेतु शंसो विश्वेभिस्तुरैरवसेयजत्रः | तेभिर्वयं सुषखायो भवेम तरन्तो विश्वादुरिता सयाम
transliteration: tebhirigvedaayaṃ suṣakhāyo bhavema taranto viśvāduritā syāma
translation: MAY benediction of the Gods approach us, holy, to aid us with all rapid succours. Therewith may we be happily befriended, and pass triumphant over all our troubles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: परि चिन मर्तो दरविणं ममन्याद रतस्य पथा नमसाविवासेत | अत सवेन करतुना सं वदेत शरेयांसन्दक्षं मनसा जग्र्भ्यात
transliteration: pari cin marto draviṇaṃ mamanyād ṛtasya pathā namasāvivāset | ata svena kratunā saṃ vadeta śreyāṃsandakṣaṃ manasā jaghṛbhyāt
translation: A man should think on wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of Order, Counsel himself with his own mental insight, and grasp still nobler vigour with his spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अधायि धीतिरसस्र्ग्रमंशास्तीर्थे न दस्ममुपयन्त्युमाः | अभ्यानश्म सुवितस्य शूषं नवेदसोम्र्तानामभूम
transliteration: adhāyi dhītirasasṛghramaṃśāstīrthe na dasmamupayantyumāḥ | abhyānaśma suvitasya śūṣaṃ navedasoamṛtānāmabhūma
translation: The hymn is formed, poured are the allotted portions: as to a ford friends come unto the Wondrous. We have obtained the power of case and comfort, we have become acquainted, with Immortals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: नित्यश्चाकन्यात सवपतिर्दामूना यस्मा उ देवः सवितजजान | भगो वा गोभिरर्यमेमनज्यात सो अस्मै चरुश्छदयदुत सयात
transliteration: nityaścākanyāt svapatirdāmūnā yasmā u devaḥ savitajajāna | bhagho vā ghobhiraryamemanajyāt so asmai caruśchadayaduta syāt
translation: Pleased be the Eternal Lord who loves the household with this man whom God Savitar created. May Bhaga Aryaman grace him with cattle: may he appear to him, and be, delightful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: इयं सा भूया उषसामिव कष यद ध कषुमन्तःशवसा समायन | अस्य सतुतिं जरितुर्भिक्षमाणा आनः शग्मास उप यन्तु वाजाः
transliteration: iyaṃ sā bhūyā uṣasāmiva kṣa yad dha kṣumantaḥśavasā samāyan | asya stutiṃ jariturbhikṣamāṇā ānaḥ śaghmāsa upa yantu vājāḥ
translation: Like the Dawns' dwelling-place be this assembly, where in their might men rich in food have gathered. Striving to share the praises of this singer. To us come strengthening and effectual riches!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: अस्येदेषा सुमतिः पप्रथानाभवत पूर्व्या भुमनागौः | अस्य सनीळा असुरस्य योनौ समान आ भरणेबिभ्रमाणाः
transliteration: asyedeṣā sumatiḥ paprathānābhavat pūrigvedayā bhumanāghauḥ | asya sanīḷā asurasya yonau samāna ā bharaṇebibhramāṇāḥ
translation: This Bull's most gracious far-extended favour existed first of all in full abundance. By his support they are maintained in common who in the Asura's mansion dwell together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः | सन्तस्थाने अजरे इतूती अहानि पूर्वीरुषसो जरन्त
transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ | santasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrigvedaīruṣaso jaranta
translation: What was the tree, what wood, in sooth, produced it, from which they fashioned forth the Earth and Heaven? These Twain stand fast and wax not old for ever: these have sung praise to many a day and morning.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: नैतावदेना परो अन्यदस्त्युक्षा स दयावाप्र्थिवीबिभर्ति | तवदं पवित्रं कर्णुत सवधावान यदींसूर्यं न हरितो वहन्ति
transliteration: naitāvadenā paro anyadastyukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivībibharti | tvadaṃ pavitraṃ kṛṇuta svadhāvān yadīṃsūryaṃ na harito vahanti
translation: Not only here is this: more is beyond us. He is the Bull, the Heaven's and Earth's supporter. With power divine he makes his skin a filter, when the Bay Coursers bear him on as Surya.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: सतेगो न कषामत्येति पर्थ्वीं मिहं न वातो वि हवाति भूम | मित्रो यत्र वरुणो अज्यमानो.अग्निर्वने न वयस्र्ष्ट शोकम
transliteration: stegho na kṣāmatyeti pṛthvīṃ mihaṃ na vāto vi havāti bhūma | mitro yatra varuṇo ajyamāno.aghnirigvedaane na vyasṛṣṭa śokam
translation: He passes o'er the broad earth like a Stega: he penetrates the world as Wind the mist-cloud. He, balmed with oil, near Varuna and Mitra, like Agni in the wood, hath shot forth splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: सतरीर्यत सूत सद्यो अज्यमाना वयथिरव्यथिः कर्णुतस्वगोपा | पुत्रो यत पुर्वः पित्रोर्जनिष्ट शम्यां गौर्जगार यद ध पर्छान
transliteration: starīryat sūta sadyo ajyamānā vyathiravyathiḥ kṛṇutasvaghopā | putro yat purigvedaaḥ pitrorjaniṣṭa śamyāṃ ghaurjaghāra yad dha pṛchān
translation: When suddenly called the cow that erst was barren, she, self-protected, ended all her troubles. Earth, when the first son sprang from sire and mother, cast up the game, that which men were seeking.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 31
sanskrit: उत कण्वं नर्षदः पुत्रमाहुरुत शयावो धनमादत्तवाजि | पर कर्ष्णाय रुशदपिन्वतोधरतमत्र नकिरस्मा अपीपेत
transliteration: uta kaṇvaṃ nṛṣadaḥ putramāhuruta śyāvo dhanamādattavāji | pra kṛṣṇāya ruśadapinvatodhartamatra nakirasmā apīpet
translation: To Nrsad's son they gave the name of Kainva, and he the brown-hued courser won the treasure. For him dark-coloured streamed the shining udder: none made it swell for him. Thus Order willed it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: पर सु गमन्ता धियसानस्य सक्षणि वरेभिर्वरानभिषु परसीदतः | अस्माकमिन्द्र उभयं जुजोषति यत्सोम्यस्यान्धसो बुबोधति
transliteration: pra su ghmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhirigvedaarānabhiṣu prasīdataḥ | asmākamindra ubhayaṃ jujoṣati yatsomyasyāndhaso bubodhati
translation: FORTH speed the Pair to bring the meditating God, benevolent with boons sent in return for boons. May Indra graciously accept both gifts from us, when he hath knowledge of the flowing Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: वीन्द्र यासि दिव्यानि रोचना वि पार्थिवानि रजसापुरुष्टुत | ये तवा वहन्ति मुहुरध्वरानुप ते सुवन्वन्तु वग्यनानराधसः
transliteration: vīndra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasāpuruṣṭuta | ye tvā vahanti muhuradhvarānupa te suvanvantu vaghyanānarādhasaḥ
translation: Thou wanderest far, O Indra, through the spheres of light and realms of earth, the region, thou whom many praise! Let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तदिन मे छन्त्सत वपुषो वपुष्टरं पुत्रो यज्जानम्पित्रोरधीयति | जाया पतिं वहति वग्नुना सुमत पुंसैद भद्रो वहतुः परिष्क्र्तः
transliteration: tadin me chantsat vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraṃ putro yajjānampitroradhīyati | jāyā patiṃ vahati vaghnunā sumat puṃsaid bhadro vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translation: More beautiful than beauty must this seem to me, when the son duly careth for his parents' line. The wife attracts the husband: with a shout of joy the man's auspicious marriage is performed aright.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: तदित सधस्थमभि चारु दीधय गावो यच्छासन्वहतुं न धेनवः | माता यन मन्तुर्यूथस्यपूर्व्याभि वाणस्य सप्तधातुरिज्जनः
transliteration: tadit sadhasthamabhi cāru dīdhaya ghāvo yacchāsanvahatuṃ na dhenavaḥ | mātā yan manturyūthasyapūrigvedayābhi vāṇasya saptadhāturijjanaḥ
translation: This beauteous place of meeting have I looked upon, where, like milch-cows, the kine order the marriage train; Where the Herd's Mother counts as first and best of all, and round her are the seven-toned people of the choir.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: पर वो.अछा रिरिचे देवयुष पदमेको रुद्रेभिर्यातितुर्वणिः | जरा वा येष्वम्र्तेषु दावने परि वूमेभ्यः सिञ्चता मधु
transliteration: pra vo.achā ririce devayuṣ padameko rudrebhiryātiturigvedaaṇiḥ | jarā vā yeṣvamṛteṣu dāvane pari vaūmebhyaḥ siñcatā madhu
translation: The Pious One hath reached your place before the rest: One only moves victorious with the Rudras' band. To these your helpers pour our meath, Immortal Gods, with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: निधीयमानमपगूळमप्सु पर मे देवानां वरतपाुवाच | इन्द्रो विद्वाननु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहमग्नेनुशिष्ट आगाम
transliteration: nidhīyamānamapaghūḷamapsu pra me devānāṃ vratapāuvāca | indro vidvānanu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāhamaghneanuśiṣṭa āghām
translation: He who maintains the Laws of God informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters. Indra, who knoweth well, beheld and showed thee. By him instructed am I come, O Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अक्षेत्रवित कषेत्रविदं हयप्राट स परैतिक्षेत्रविदानुशिष्टः | एतद वै भद्रमनुशासनोस्योतस्रुतिं विन्दत्यञ्जसीनाम
transliteration: akṣetravit kṣetravidaṃ hyaprāṭ sa praitikṣetravidānuśiṣṭaḥ | etad vai bhadramanuśāsanosyotasrutiṃ vindatyañjasīnām
translation: The stranger asks the way of him who knows it: taught by the skillful guide he travels onward. This is, in truth, the blessing of instruction: he finds the path that leads directly forward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: अद्येदु पराणीदममन्निमाहापीव्र्तो अधयन मातुरूधः | एमेनमाप जरिमा युवानमहेळन वसुः सुमनाबभूव
transliteration: adyedu prāṇīdamamannimāhāpīvṛto adhayan māturūdhaḥ | emenamāpa jarimā yuvānamaheḷan vasuḥ sumanābabhūva
translation: Even now he breathed: these days hath he remembered. Concealed, he sucked the bosom of his Mother. Yet in his youth old age hath come upon him: he hath grown gracious, good, and free from anger.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 32
sanskrit: एतानि भद्रा कलश करियाम कुरुश्रवण ददतो मघानि | दान इद वो मघवानः सो अस्त्वयं च सोमो हर्दि यम्बिभर्मि
transliteration: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadato maghāni | dāna id vo maghavānaḥ so astvayaṃ ca somo hṛdi yambibharmi
translation: O Kalasa, all these blessings will we bring them, O Kurusravana, who give rich presents. May he, O wealthy princes, and this Soma which I am bearing in my heart, reward you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: पर मा युयुज्रे परयुजो जनानां वहामि सम पुषणमन्तरेण | विश्वे देवासो अध मामरक्षन दुःशासुरागादिति घोष आसीत
transliteration: pra mā yuyujre prayujo janānāṃ vahāmi sma puṣaṇamantareṇa | viśve devāso adha māmarakṣan duḥśāsurāghāditi ghoṣa āsīt
translation: THE urgings of the people have impelled me, and by the nearest way I bring you Pusan. The Universal Gods have brought me safely. The cry was heard, Behold, Dubsasu cometh!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः | नि बाधतेमतिर्नग्नता जसुर्वेर्न वेवीयते मतिः
transliteration: saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ | ni bādhateamatirnaghnatā jasurigvedaerna vevīyate matiḥ
translation: The ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives. Indigence, nakedness, exhaustion press me sore: my mind is fluttering like a bird's.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो | सक्र्त सु नो मघवन्निन्द्र मर्ळयाधा पितेव नो भव
transliteration: mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato | sakṛt su no maghavannindra mṛḷayādhā piteva no bhava
translation: As rats eat weavers' threads, cares are consuming me, thy singer, Gatakratu, me. Have mercy on us once, O Indra, Bounteous Lord: be thou a Father unto us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: कुरुश्रवणमाव्र्णि राजानं तरासदस्यवम | मंहिष्ठंवाघतां रषिः
transliteration: kuruśravaṇamāvṛṇi rājānaṃ trāsadasyavam | maṃhiṣṭhaṃvāghatāṃ ṛṣiḥ
translation: I the priests' Rsi chose as prince most liberal Kurusravana, The son of Trasadasyu's son,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: यस्य मा हरितो रथे तिस्रो वहन्ति साधुया | सतवैसहस्रदक्षिणे
transliteration: yasya mā harito rathe tisro vahanti sādhuyā | stavaisahasradakṣiṇe
translation: Whose three bays harnessed to the car bear me straight onward: I will laud The giver of a thousand meeds,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: यस्य परस्वादसो गिर उपमश्रवसः पितुः | कषेत्रं नरण्वमूचुषे
transliteration: yasya prasvādaso ghira upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ | kṣetraṃ naraṇvamūcuṣe
translation: The sire of Upamasravas, even him whose words were passing sweet, As a fair field is to its lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: अधि पुत्रोपमश्रवो नपान मित्रातिथेरिहि | पितुष टे अस्मिवन्दिता
transliteration: adhi putropamaśravo napān mitrātitherihi | pituṣ ṭe asmivanditā
translation: Mark, Upamasravas, his son, mark, grandson of Mitratithi: I am thy father's eulogist.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: यदीशीयाम्र्तानामुत वा मर्त्यानाम | जीवेदिन्मघवा मम
transliteration: yadīśīyāmṛtānāmuta vā martyānām | jīvedinmaghavā mama
translation: If I controlled Immortal Gods, yea, even were I Lord of men, My liberal prince were living still.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 33
sanskrit: न देवानामति वरतं शतात्मा चन जीवति | तथायुजा वि वाव्र्ते
transliteration: na devānāmati vrataṃ śatātmā cana jīvati | tathāyujā vi vāvṛte
translation: None lives, even had he hundred lives, beyond the statute of the Gods So am I parted from my friend.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: परावेपा मा बर्हतो मादयन्ति परवातेजा इरिणे वर्व्र्तानाः | सोमस्येव मौजवतस्य भक्षो विभीदको जाग्र्विर्मह्यमछान
transliteration: prāvepā mā bṛhato mādayanti pravātejā iriṇe varigvedaṛtānāḥ | somasyeva maujavatasya bhakṣo vibhīdako jāghṛvirmahyamachān
translation: SPRUNG from tall trees on windy heights, these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table. The enlivening Vibhīdaka has pleased me like the draught of Soma from Mūjavant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: न मा मिमेथ न जिहीळ एषा शिवा सखिभ्य उत मह्यमासीत | अक्षस्याहमेकपरस्य हेतोरनुव्रतामप जायामरोधम
transliteration: na mā mimetha na jihīḷa eṣā śivā sakhibhya uta mahyamāsīt | akṣasyāhamekaparasya hetoranuvratāmapa jāyāmarodham
translation: She never vexed me nor was angry with me, but was ever gracious to my friends and me. For a dice which scored one too much, I drive away my own devoted wife.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: दवेष्टि शवश्रूरप जाया रुणद्धि न नाथितो विन्दतेमर्डितारम | अश्वस्येव जरतो वस्न्यस्य नाहं विन्दामिकितवस्य भोगम
transliteration: dveṣṭi śvaśrūrapa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthito vindatemarḍitāram | aśvasyeva jarato vasnyasya nāhaṃ vindāmikitavasya bhogham
translation: My wife drives me away, her mother hates me: the wretched man finds none to give him comfort. [They say:] "I find no more use in a gambler than in an aged horse which is for sale."

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अन्ये जायां परि मर्शन्त्यस्य यस्याग्र्धद वेदने वाज्यक्षः | पिता मता भरातर एनमाहुर्न जानीमो नयताबद्धमेतम
transliteration: anye jāyāṃ pari mṛśantyasya yasyāghṛdhad vedane vājyakṣaḥ | pitā matā bhrātara enamāhurna jānīmo nayatābaddhametam
translation: Others embrace the wife of him whose riches the victorious dice have coveted: Father and mother and brothers say about him [to the landlord's men]: "We know him not: tie him up and take him away."

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: यदादीध्ये न दविषाण्येभिः परायद्भ्यो.अव हीयेसखिभ्यः | नयुप्ताश्च बभ्रवो वाचमक्रतनेमीदेषां निष्क्र्तं जारिणीव
transliteration: yadādīdhye na daviṣāṇyebhiḥ parāyadbhyo.ava hīyesakhibhyaḥ | nyuptāśca babhravo vācamakratanemīdeṣāṃ niṣkṛtaṃ jāriṇīva
translation: When I resolve "I will not play with them, I will remain behind when my friends [= fellow-gamblers] depart [to play]", and the brown dice, thrown on the board, have rattled, like a fond girl I seek the place of meeting.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: सभामेति कितवः पर्छमानो जेष्यामीति तन्वाशूशुजानः | अक्षासो अस्य वि तिरन्ति कामं परतिदीव्नेदधत आ कर्तानि
transliteration: sabhāmeti kitavaḥ pṛchamāno jeṣyāmīti tanvāśūśujānaḥ | akṣāso asya vi tiranti kāmaṃ pratidīvnedadhata ā kṛtāni
translation: The gamester seeks the gambling-house, and wonders, his body all afire, "Will I be lucky?" The dice run against his desire, giving the best throws to his adversary.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: अक्षास इदनकुशिनो नितोदिनो निक्र्त्वानस्तपनास्तापयिष्णवः | कुमारदेष्णा जयतः पुनर्हणो मध्वासम्प्र्क्ताः कितवस्य बर्हणा
transliteration: akṣāsa idankuśino nitodino nikṛtvānastapanāstāpayiṣṇavaḥ | kumāradeṣṇā jayataḥ punarhaṇo madhvāsampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā
translation: Dice, verily, are armed with goads and driving-hooks, deceiving and tormenting, causing grievous woe. They give gifts like boys [do], and then snatch them back from the winner, [they are] sweetened [as] with honey with magic power over the gambler.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: तरिपञ्चाशः करीळति वरात एषां देव इव सवितासत्यधर्मा | उग्रस्य चिन मन्यवे ना नमन्ते राजा चिदेभ्योनम इत कर्णोति
transliteration: tripañcāśaḥ krīḷati vrāta eṣāṃ deva iva savitāsatyadharmā | ughrasya cin manyave nā namante rājā cidebhyonama it kṛṇoti
translation: Their troop of three-times-fifty plays [as undefeatably] as Savitr the god whose ways are faithful. They bend not even to the anger of the mighty: the King himself pays homage and reveres them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: नीचा वर्तन्त उपरि सफुरन्त्यहस्तासो हस्तवन्तं सहन्ते | दिव्या अङगारा इरिणे नयुप्ताः शीताः सन्तो हर्दयंनिर्दहन्ति
transliteration: nīcā vartanta upari sphurantyahastāso hastavantaṃ sahante | divyā aṅghārā iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santo hṛdayaṃnirdahanti
translation: Downward they roll, and then spring quickly upward, and, handless, force the man with hands to serve them. Cast on the board, like lumps of magic charcoal, though cold themselves they burn the heart to ashes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 34
sanskrit: जाया तप्यते कितवस्य हीना माता पुत्रस्य चरतः कवस्वित | रणावा बिभ्यद धनमिछमानो.अन्येषामस्तमुपनक्तमेति
transliteration: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kvasvit |
translation: The gambler's wife is left forlorn and wretched: the mother mourns the son who wanders homeless. In constant fear, in debt, and seeking money, he goes by night to the home of others [probably to steal].

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 35
sanskrit: अबुध्रमु तय इन्द्रवन्तो अग्नयो जयोतिर्भरन्त उषसोव्युष्टिषु | मही दयावाप्र्थिवी चेततामपो.अद्यादेवानामव आ वर्णीमहे
transliteration: abudhramu tya indravanto aghnayo jyotirbharanta uṣasovyuṣṭiṣu | mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatāmapo.adyādevānāmava ā vṛṇīmahe
translation: THESE fires associate with Indra are awake, bringing their light when first the Dawn begins to shine. May Heaven and Earth, great Pair, observe our holy work. We claim for us this day the favour of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 35
sanskrit: दिवस्प्र्थिव्योरव आ वर्णीमहे मातॄन सिन्धून पर्वताञ्छर्यणावतः | अनागास्त्वं सूर्यमुषासमीमहे भद्रंसोमः सुवानो अद्या कर्णोतु नः
transliteration: divaspṛthivyorava ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parigvedaatāñcharyaṇāvataḥ | anāghāstvaṃ sūryamuṣāsamīmahe bhadraṃsomaḥ suvāno adyā kṛṇotu naḥ
translation: Yea, for ourselves we claim the grace of Heaven and Earth, of Saryanavan, of the Hills and Mother Streams. For innocence we pray to Surya and to Dawn. So may the flowing Soma bring us bliss to-day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 35
sanskrit: दयावा नो अद्य पर्थिवी अनागसो मही तरायेतां सुवितायमातरा | उषा उछन्त्यप बाधतामघं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे
transliteration: dyāvā no adya pṛthivī anāghaso mahī trāyetāṃ suvitāyamātarā | uṣā uchantyapa bādhatāmaghaṃ svastyaghniṃsamidhānamīmahe
translation: May the great Twain, the Mothers, Heaven and Earth, this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness. May Morning sending forth her light drive sin afar. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 35
sanskrit: इयं न उस्रा परथमा सुदेव्यं रेवत सनिभ्यो रेवती वयुछतु | आरे मन्युं दुर्विदत्रस्य धीमहि सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे
transliteration: iyaṃ na usrā prathamā sudevyaṃ revat sanibhyo revatī vyuchatu |
translation: May this first Dawn bring us the host of gracious Gods: rich, may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth. The wrath of the malignant may we keep afar. We pray to kindled Agni for felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 36
sanskrit: उषासानक्ता बर्हती सुपेशसा दयावाक्षामा वरुणोमित्रो अर्यमा | इन्द्रं हुवे मरुतः पर्वतानप आदित्यान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः
transliteration: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇomitro aryamā | indraṃ huve marutaḥ parigvedaatānapa ādityāndyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ
translation: THERE are the Dawn and Night, the grand and beauteous Pair, Earth, Heaven, and Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman. Indra I call, the Maruts, Mountains, and the Floods, Adityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 36
sanskrit: दयौश्च नः पर्थिवी च परचेतस रतावरी रक्षतामंहसोरिषः | मा दुर्विदत्रा निरतिर्न ईशत तद देवानामवोद्या वर्णीमहे
transliteration: dyauśca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasa ṛtāvarī rakṣatāmaṃhasoriṣaḥ | mā durigvedadatrā nirtirna īśata tad devānāmavoadyā vṛṇīmahe
translation: May Dyaus and Prthivi, wise, true to Holy Law, keep us in safety from distress and injury. Let not malignant Nirrti rule over us. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 36
sanskrit: विश्वस्मान नो अदितिः पात्वंहसो माता मित्रस्य वरुणस्यरेवतः | सवर्वज्ज्योतिरव्र्कं नशीमहि तद देवानां ...
transliteration: viśvasmān no aditiḥ pātvaṃhaso mātā mitrasya varuṇasyarevataḥ | svarigvedaajjyotiravṛkaṃ naśīmahi tad devānāṃ ...
translation: Mother of Mitra and of opulent Varuna, may Aditi preserve us safe from all distress. May we obtain the light of heaven without a foe. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 36
sanskrit: गरावा वदन्नप रक्षांसि सेधतु दुष्वप्न्यं निरतिंविश्वमत्रिणम | आदित्यं शर्म मरुतामशीमहि तद्देवानां ...
transliteration: ghrāvā vadannapa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣvapnyaṃ nirtiṃviśvamatriṇam |
translation: May ringing press-stones keep the Raksasas afar, ill dream, and Nirrti, and each voracious fiend. May the Adityas and the Maruts shelter us. We crave this gracious favour of the Gods to-day.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: नमो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य चक्षसे महो देवाय तद रतंसपर्यत | दूरेद्र्शे देवजाताय केतवे दिवस पुत्रायसूर्याय शंसत
transliteration: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtaṃsaparyata | dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāyasūryāya śaṃsata
translation: Do homage unto Varuna's and Mitra's Eye: offer this solemn worship to the Mighty God, Who seeth far away, the Ensign, born of Gods. Sing praises unto Surya, to the Son of Dyaus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: सा मा सत्योक्तिः परि पातु विश्वतो दयावा च यत्रततनन्नहानि च | विश्वमन्यन नि विशते यदेजतिविश्वाहापो विश्वाहोदेति सूर्यः
transliteration: sā mā satyoktiḥ pari pātu viśvato dyāvā ca yatratatanannahāni ca | viśvamanyan ni viśate yadejativiśvāhāpo viśvāhodeti sūryaḥ
translation: May this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever heaven and earth and days are spread abroad. All else that is in motion finds a place of rest: the waters ever flow and ever mounts the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: न ते अदेवः परदिवो नि वासते यदेतशेभिः पतरैरथर्यसि | पराचीनमन्यदनु वर्तते रज उदन्येनज्योतिषा यासि सूर्य
transliteration: na te adevaḥ pradivo ni vāsate yadetaśebhiḥ patarairatharyasi | prācīnamanyadanu vartate raja udanyenajyotiṣā yāsi sūrya
translation: No godless man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled Steeds. One lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast, and, Surya, thou arisest with a different light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: येन सूर्य जयोतिषा बाधसे तमो जगच्च विश्वमुदियर्षिभानुना | तेनास्मद विश्वामनिरामनाहुतिमपामीवामप दुष्वप्न्यं सुव
transliteration: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamo jaghacca viśvamudiyarṣibhānunā | tenāsmad viśvāmanirāmanāhutimapāmīvāmapa duṣvapnyaṃ suva
translation: O Surya, with the light whereby thou scatterest gloom, and with thy ray impellest every moving thing, Keep far from us all feeble, worthless sacrifice, and drive away disease and every evil dream.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि परेषितो रक्षसि वरतमहेळयन्नुच्चरसिस्वधा अनु | यदद्य तवा सूर्योपब्रवामहै तं नो देवानु मंसीरत करतुम
transliteration: viśvasya hi preṣito rakṣasi vratamaheḷayannuccarasisvadhā anu | yadadya tvā sūryopabravāmahai taṃ no devāanu maṃsīrata kratum
translation: Sent forth thou guardest well the Universe's law, and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath. When Surya, we address our prayers to thee to-day, may the Gods favour this our purpose and desire.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: तं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी तन न आप इन्द्रः शर्ण्वन्तु मरुतोहवं वचः | मा शूने भूम सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शिभद्रं जीवन्तो जरणामशीमहि
transliteration: taṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī tan na āpa indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutohavaṃ vacaḥ | mā śūne bhūma sūryasya sandṛśibhadraṃ jīvanto jaraṇāmaśīmahi
translation: This invocation, these our words may Heaven and Earth, and Indra and the Waters and the Maruts hear. Ne'er may we suffer want in presence of the Sun, and, living happy lives, may we attain old age.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: विश्वाहा तवा सुमनसः सुचक्षसः परजावन्तो अनमीवानागसः | उद्यन्तं तवा मित्रमहो दिवे-दिवे जयोग जीवाःप्रति पश्येम सूर्य
transliteration: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ sucakṣasaḥ prajāvanto anamīvāanāghasaḥ | udyantaṃ tvā mitramaho dive-dive jyogh jīvāḥprati paśyema sūrya
translation: Cheerful in spirit, evermore, and keen of sight, with store of children, free from sickness and from sin, Long-living, may we look, O Surya, upon thee uprising day by day, thou great as Mitra is!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 37
sanskrit: महि जयोतिर्बिभ्रतं तवा विचक्षण भास्वन्तं चक्षुषे चक्षुषे मयः | आरोहन्तं बर्हतः पाजसस परि वयंजीवाः परति पश्येम सूर्य
transliteration: mahi jyotirbibhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantaṃ cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ |
translation: Surya, may we live long and look upon thee still, thee, O Far-seeing One, bringing the glorious light, The radiant God, the spring of joy to every eye, as thou art mounting up o'er the high shining flood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 38
sanskrit: अस्मिन न इन्द्र पर्त्सुतौ यशस्वति शिमीवति करन्दसि परावसातये | यत्र गोषाता धर्षितेषु खादिषु विष्वक्पतन्ति दिद्यवो नर्षाह्ये
transliteration: asmin na indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāvasātaye | yatra ghoṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvakpatanti didyavo nṛṣāhye
translation: O INDRA, in this battle great and glorious, in this loud din of war help us to victory, Where in the strife for kine among bold ring-decked men arrows fly all around and heroes are subdued.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 38
sanskrit: स नः कषुमन्तं सदने वयूर्णुहि गोर्णसं रयिमिन्द्रश्रवाय्यम | सयाम ते जयतः शक्र मेदिनो यथा वयमुश्मसि तद वसो कर्धि
transliteration: sa naḥ kṣumantaṃ sadane vyūrṇuhi ghoarṇasaṃ rayimindraśravāyyam | syāma te jayataḥ śakra medino yathā vayamuśmasi tad vaso kṛdhi
translation: At home disclose to us opulence rich in food, streaming with milk, O Indra, meet to be renowned. Sakra, may we be thine, the friendly Conqueror's: even as we desire, O Vasu, so do thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 38
sanskrit: यो नो दास आर्यो वा पुरुष्टुतादेव इन्द्र युधये चिकेतति | अस्माभिष टे सुषहाः सन्तु शत्रवस्त्वया वयं तान्वनुयाम संगमे
transliteration: yo no dāsa āryo vā puruṣṭutādeva indra yudhaye ciketati | asmābhiṣ ṭe suṣahāḥ santu śatravastvayā vayaṃ tānvanuyāma saṃghame
translation: The godless man, much-lauded Indra, whether he be Dasa or be Arya, who would war with us,- Easy to conquer he for thee, with us, these foes: with thee may we subdue them in the clash of fight.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 38
sanskrit: यो दभ्रेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भूरिभिर्यो अभीके वरिवोविन्न्र्षाह्ये | तं विखादे सस्निमद्य शरुतं नरमर्वाञ्चमिन्द्रमवसे करामहे
transliteration: yo dabhrebhirhavyo yaśca bhūribhiryo abhīke varivovinnṛṣāhye | taṃ vikhāde sasnimadya śrutaṃ naramarigvedaāñcamindramavase karāmahe
translation: Him who must be invoked by many and by few, who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of men, Indra, famed Hero, winner in the deadly strife, let us bring hitherward to-day to favour us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 38
sanskrit: सवव्र्जं हि तवामहमिन्द्र शुश्रवानानुदं वर्षभरध्रचोदनम | पर मुञ्चस्व परि कुत्सादिहा गहि किमुत्वावान मुष्कयोर्बद्ध आसते
transliteration: svavṛjaṃ hi tvāmahamindra śuśravānānudaṃ vṛṣabharadhracodanam | pra muñcasva pari kutsādihā ghahi kimutvāvān muṣkayorbaddha āsate
translation: For, Indra, I have heard thee called Self. capturer, One, Steer! who never yields, who urges even the churl. Release thyself from Kutsa and come hither. How shall one like thee sit still bound that he may not move?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 39
sanskrit: यो वां परिज्मा सुव्र्दश्विना रथो दोषामुषासो हव्योहविष्मता | शश्वत्तमासस्तमु वामिदं वयं पितुर्ननाम सुहवं हवामहे
transliteration: yo vāṃ parijmā suvṛdaśvinā ratho doṣāmuṣāso havyohaviṣmatā |
translation: As 'twere the name of father, easy to invoke, we all assembled here invoke this Car of yours, Asvins, your swiftly-rolling circumambient Car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: रथं यान्तं कुह को ह वां नरा परति दयुमन्तंसुविताय भूषति | परातर्यावाणं विभ्वं विशे-विशेवस्तोर वस्तोर्वहमानं धिया शमि
transliteration: rathaṃ yāntaṃ kuha ko ha vāṃ narā prati dyumantaṃsuvitāya bhūṣati | prātaryāvāṇaṃ vibhvaṃ viśe-viśevastor vastorigvedaahamānaṃ dhiyā śami
translation: YOUR radiant Chariot-whither goes it on its way?-who decks it for you, Heroes, for its happy course, Starting at daybreak, visiting each morning every house, borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: कुह सविद दोषा कुह वस्तोरश्विना कुहाभिपित्वं करतःकुहोषतुः | को वां शयुत्रा विधवेव देवरं मर्यं नयोषा कर्णुते सधस्थ आ
transliteration: kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoraśvinā kuhābhipitvaṃ karataḥkuhoṣatuḥ | ko vāṃ śayutrā vidhaveva devaraṃ maryaṃ nayoṣā kṛṇute sadhastha ā
translation: Where are ye, Asvins, in the evening, where at morn? Where is your halting place, where rest ye for the night? Who brings you homeward, as the widow bed ward draws her husband's brother, as the bride attracts the groom?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: परातर्जरेथे जरणेव कापया वस्तोर-वस्तोर्यजता गछथोग्र्हम | कस्य धवस्रा भवथः कस्य वा नरा राजपुत्रेवसवनाव गछथः
transliteration: prātarjarethe jaraṇeva kāpayā vastor-vastoryajatā ghachathoghṛham | kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rājaputrevasavanāva ghachathaḥ
translation: Early ye sing forth praise as with a herald's voice, and, meet for worship, go each morning to the house. Whom do ye ever bring to ruin? Unto whose libations come ye, Heroes, like two Sons of Kings?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: युवां मर्गेव वारणा मर्गण्यवो दोषा वस्तोर्हविषा निह्वयामहे | युवं होत्रां रतुथा जुह्वते नरेषं जनायवहथः शुभस पती
transliteration: yuvāṃ mṛgheva vāraṇā mṛghaṇyavo doṣā vastorhaviṣā nihvayāmahe | yuvaṃ hotrāṃ ṛtuthā juhvate nareṣaṃ janāyavahathaḥ śubhas patī
translation: Even as hunters follow two wild elephants, we with oblations call you down at morn and eve. To folk who pay you offierings at appointed times, Chiefs, Lords of splendour, ye bring food to strengthen them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: युवां ह घोषा पर्यश्विना यती राज्ञ ऊचे दुहिताप्र्छे वां नरा | भूतं मे अह्न उत भूतमक्तवेऽशवावते रथिने शक्तमर्वते
transliteration: yuvāṃ ha ghoṣā paryaśvinā yatī rājña ūce duhitāpṛche vāṃ narā | bhūtaṃ me ahna uta bhūtamaktave'śvāvate rathine śaktamarigvedaate
translation: To you, O Asvins, came the daughter of a King, Ghosa, and said, O Heroes, this I beg of you: Be near me in the day, he near me in the night: help me to gain a car-borne chieftain rich in steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: युवं कवी षठः पर्यश्विना रथं विशो न कुत्सोजरितुर्नशायथः | युवोर्ह मक्षा पर्यश्विना मध्वासा भरत निष्क्र्तं न योषणा
transliteration: yuvaṃ kavī ṣṭhaḥ paryaśvinā rathaṃ viśo na kutsojariturnaśāyathaḥ | yuvorha makṣā paryaśvinā madhvāsā bharata niṣkṛtaṃ na yoṣaṇā
translation: O Asvins, ye are wise: as Kutsa comes to men, bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise. The bee, O Asvins, bears your honey in her mouth, as the maid carries it purified in her hand.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: युवं ह भुज्युं युवमश्विना वशं युवं शिञ्जारमुशनामुपारथुः | युवो ररावा परि सख्यमासते युवोरहमवसा सुम्नमा चके
transliteration: yuvaṃ ha bhujyuṃ yuvamaśvinā vaśaṃ yuvaṃ śiñjāramuśanāmupārathuḥ | yuvo rarāvā pari sakhyamāsate yuvorahamavasā sumnamā cake
translation: To Bhujyu and to Vasa ye come near with help, O Asvins, to Sinjara and to Usana. Your worshipper secures your friendship for himself. Through your protection I desire felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: युवं ह कर्शं युवमश्विना शयुं युवं विधन्तंविधवामुरुष्यथः | युवं सनिभ्य सतनयन्तमश्विनापव्रजमूर्णुथः सप्तास्यम
transliteration: yuvaṃ ha kṛśaṃ yuvamaśvinā śayuṃ yuvaṃ vidhantaṃvidhavāmuruṣyathaḥ | yuvaṃ sanibhya stanayantamaśvināpavrajamūrṇuthaḥ saptāsyam
translation: Krsa and Sayu ye protect, ye Asvins Twain: ye Two assist the widow and the worshipper; And ye throw open, Asvins, unto those who win the cattle-stall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 40
sanskrit: जनिष्ट योषा पतयत कनीनको वि चारुहन वीरुधोदंसना अनु | आस्मै रीयन्ते निवनेव सिन्धवो.अस्मा अह्नेभवति तत पतित्वनम
transliteration: janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnako vi cāruhan vīrudhodaṃsanā anu |
translation: The Woman hath brought forth, the Infant hath appeared, the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up. To him the rivers run as down a deep descent, and he this day becomes their master and their lord.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 41
sanskrit: समानमु तयं पुरुहूतमुक्थ्यं रथं तरिचक्रं सवनागनिग्मतम | परिज्मानं विदथ्यं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्वयंव्युष्टा उषसो हवामहे
transliteration: samānamu tyaṃ puruhūtamukthyaṃ rathaṃ tricakraṃ savanāghanighmatam | parijmānaṃ vidathyaṃ suvṛktibhirigvedaayaṃvyuṣṭā uṣaso havāmahe
translation: THAT general Car of yours, invoked by many a man, that comes to our libations, three-wheeled, meet for lauds, That circumambient Car, worthy of sacrifice, we call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 41
sanskrit: परातर्युजं नासत्याधि तिष्ठथः परातर्यावाणम्मधुवाहनं रथम | विशो येन गछथो यज्वरीर्नराकीरेश्चिद यज्ञं होत्र्मन्तमश्विना
transliteration: prātaryujaṃ nāsatyādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātaryāvāṇammadhuvāhanaṃ ratham | viśo yena ghachatho yajvarīrnarākīreścid yajñaṃ hotṛmantamaśvinā
translation: Ye, O Nasatyas, mount that early-harnessed Car, that travels early, laden with its freight of balm, Wherewith ye, Heroes, visit clans who sacrifice, even the poor man's worship where the priest attends.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 41
sanskrit: अध्वर्युं वा मधुपाणिं सुहस्त्यमग्निधं वाध्र्तदक्षं दमूनसम | विप्रस्य वा यत सवननि गछथोऽत आ यातं मधुपेयमश्विना
transliteration: adhvaryuṃ vā madhupāṇiṃ suhastyamaghnidhaṃ vādhṛtadakṣaṃ damūnasam | viprasya vā yat savanani ghachatho'ta ā yātaṃ madhupeyamaśvinā
translation: If to the deft Adhvaryu with the meath in hand, or to the Kindler firm in strength, the household friend, Or to the sage's poured libations ye approach, come thence, O Asvins, now to drink the offered meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: अस्तेव सु परतरं लायमस्यन भूषन्निव पर भरास्तोममस्मै | वाचा विप्रास्तरत वाचमर्यो नि रामयजरितः सोम इन्द्रम
transliteration: asteva su prataraṃ lāyamasyan bhūṣanniva pra bharāstomamasmai | vācā viprāstarata vācamaryo ni rāmayajaritaḥ soma indram
translation: EVEN as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment. Quell with your voice the wicked's voice, O sages. Singer, make Indra rest beside the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: दोहेन गामुप शिक्षा सखायं पर बोधय जरितर्जारमिन्द्रम | कोशं न पूर्णं वसुना नय्र्ष्टमा चयावयमघदेयाय शूरम
transliteration: dohena ghāmupa śikṣā sakhāyaṃ pra bodhaya jaritarjāramindram | kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭamā cyāvayamaghadeyāya śūram
translation: Draw thy Friend to thee like a cow at milking: O Singer, wake up Indra as a lover. Make thou the Hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: किमङग तवा मघवन भोजमाहुः शिशीहि मा शिशयन्त्वा शर्णोमि | अप्नस्वती मम धीरस्तु शक्र वसुविदम्भगमिन्द्रा भरा नः
transliteration: kimaṅgha tvā maghavan bhojamāhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayantvā śṛṇomi | apnasvatī mama dhīrastu śakra vasuvidambhaghamindrā bharā naḥ
translation: Why, Maghavan, do they call thee Bounteous; Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens. Sakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great wealth, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: तवां जना ममसत्येष्विन्द्र सन्तस्थाना वि हवयन्तेसमीके | अत्रा युजं कर्णुते यो हविष्मान नासुन्वतासख्यं वष्टि शूरः
transliteration: tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣvindra santasthānā vi hvayantesamīke | atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatāsakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ
translation: Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the people, Indra, in the fray invoke thee. Him who brings gifts the Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: धनं न सयन्द्रं बहुलं यो अस्मै तीव्रान सोमानासुनोतिप्रयस्वान | तस्मै शत्रून सुतुकान परातरह्नो निस्वष्ट्रान युवति हन्ति वर्त्रम
transliteration: dhanaṃ na syandraṃ bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrān somānāsunotiprayasvān | tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātarahno nisvaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram
translation: Whoso with plenteous food for him expresses strong Somas as much quickly-coming treasure, For him he overthrows in early morning his swift well-weaponed foes, and slays the tyrant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 42
sanskrit: यस्मिन वयं दधिमा शंसमिन्द्रे यः शिश्राय मघवाकाममस्मे | आराच्चित सन भयतामस्य शत्रुर्न्यस्मैद्युम्ना जन्या नमन्ताम
transliteration: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsamindre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavākāmamasme |
translation: He unto whom we offer praises, Indra, Maghavan, who hath joined to ours his wishes,- Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all human glories.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: अछा म इन्द्रं मतयः सवर्विदः सध्रीचीर्विश्वाुशतीरनूषत | परि षवजन्ते जनयो यथा पतिं मर्यंन शुन्ध्युं मघवानमूतये
transliteration: achā ma indraṃ matayaḥ svarigvedadaḥ sadhrīcīrigvedaśvāuśatīranūṣata | pari ṣvajante janayo yathā patiṃ maryaṃna śundhyuṃ maghavānamūtaye
translation: IN perfect unison all yearning hymns of mine that find the light of heaven have sung forth Indra's praise. As wives embrace their lord, the comely bridegroom, so they compass Maghavan about that he may help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: न घा तवद्रिगप वेति मे मनस्त्वे इत कामं पुरुहूतशिश्रय | राजेव दस्म नि षदो.अधि बर्हिष्यस्मिन सु सोमेऽवपानमस्तु ते
transliteration: na ghā tvadrighapa veti me manastve it kāmaṃ puruhūtaśiśraya | rājeva dasma ni ṣado.adhi barhiṣyasmin su some'vapānamastu te
translation: Directed unto thee my spirit never strays, for I have set my hopes on thee, O Much-invoked! Sit, Wonderful! as King upon the sacred grass, and let thy drinking-place be by the Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: विषूव्र्दिन्द्रो अमतेरुत कषुधः स इद रायो मघवावस्व ईशते | तस्येदिमे परवणे सप्त सिन्धवो वयोवर्धन्ति वर्षभस्य शुष्मिणः
transliteration: viṣūvṛdindro amateruta kṣudhaḥ sa id rāyo maghavāvasva īśate | tasyedime pravaṇe sapta sindhavo vayovardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translation: From indigence and hunger Indra turns away: Maghavan hath dominion over precious wealth. These the Seven Rivers flowing on their downward path increase the vital vigour of the potent Steer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: वयो न वर्क्षं सुपलाशमासदन सोमास इन्द्रं मन्दिनश्चमूषदः | परैषामनीकं शवसा दविद्युतद विदत्स्वर्मनवे जयोतिरार्यम
transliteration: vayo na vṛkṣaṃ supalāśamāsadan somāsa indraṃ mandinaścamūṣadaḥ | praiṣāmanīkaṃ śavasā davidyutad vidatsvarmanave jyotirāryam
translation: As on the fair-leafed tree rest birds, to Indra flow the gladdening Soma juices that the bowls contain. Their face that glows with splendour through their mighty power hath found the shine of heaven for man, the Aryas' light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: कर्तं न शवघ्नी वि चिनोति देवने संवर्गं यन मघवासूर्यं जयत | न तत ते अन्यो अनु वीर्यं शकन नपुराणो मघवन नोत नूतनः
transliteration: kṛtaṃ na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvarghaṃ yan maghavāsūryaṃ jayat | na tat te anyo anu vīryaṃ śakan napurāṇo maghavan nota nūtanaḥ
translation: As in the game a gambler piles his winnings, so Maghavan, sweeping all together, gained the Sun This mighty deed of thine none other could achieve, none, Maghavan, before thee, none in recent time.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 43
sanskrit: विशं-विशं मघवा पर्यशायत जनानां धेनावचाकशद वर्षा | यस्याह शक्रः सवनेषु रण्यति सतीव्रैः सोमैः सहते पर्तन्यतः
transliteration: viśaṃ-viśaṃ maghavā paryaśāyata janānāṃ dhenāavacākaśad vṛṣā | yasyāha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati satīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ
translation: Maghavan came by turns to all the tribes of men: the Steer took notice of the people's songs of praise. The man in whose libations Sakra hath delight by means of potent Somas vanquisheth his foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 44
sanskrit: आ यात्विन्द्रः सवपतिर्मदाय यो धर्मणा तूतुजानस्तुविष्मान | परत्वक्षाणो अति विश्वा सहांस्यपारेणमहता वर्ष्ण्येन
transliteration: pratvakṣāṇo ati viśvā sahāṃsyapāreṇamahatā vṛṣṇyena
translation: MAY Sovran Indra come to the carousal, he who by Holy Law is strong and active, The overcomer of all conquering forces with his great steer-like power that hath no limit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 44
sanskrit: सुष्ठामा रथः सुयमा हरी ते मिम्यक्ष वज्रो नर्पतेगभस्तौ | शीभं राजन सुपथा याह्यर्वां वर्धामते पपुषो वर्ष्ण्यानि
transliteration: suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ suyamā harī te mimyakṣa vajro nṛpateghabhastau |
translation: Firm-seated is thy car, thy Steeds are docile; thy hand, O King, holds, firmly grasped, the thunder. On thy fair path, O Lord of men, come quickly: we will increase thy powers when thou hast drunken.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 45
sanskrit: दिवस परि परथमं जज्ञे अग्निरस्मद दवितीयं परिजातवेदाः | तर्तीयमप्सु नर्मणा अजस्रमिन्धान एनंजरते सवाधीः
transliteration: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe aghnirasmad dvitīyaṃ parijātavedāḥ | tṛtīyamapsu nṛmaṇā ajasramindhāna enaṃjarate svādhīḥ
translation: FIRST Agni sprang to life from out of Heaven: the second time from us came Jatavedas. Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the waters. The pious lauds and kindles him the Eternal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 45
sanskrit: विद्मा ते अग्ने तरेधा तरयाणि विद्मा ते धाम विभ्र्तापुरुत्रा | विद्मा ते नाम परमं गुहा यद विद्मा तमुत्सं यत आजगन्थ
transliteration: vidmā te aghne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtāpurutrā | vidmā te nāma paramaṃ ghuhā yad vidmā tamutsaṃ yata ājaghantha
translation: Agni, we know thy three powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided. We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 45
sanskrit: समुद्रे तवा नर्मणा अप्स्वन्तर्न्र्चक्षा ईधे दिवो अग्नूधन | तर्तीये तवा रजसि तस्थिवांसमपामुपस्थेमहिषा अवर्धन
transliteration: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsvantarnṛcakṣā īdhe divo aghnaūdhan | tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsamapāmupasthemahiṣā avardhan
translation: The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and waters, man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven, There as thou stoodest in the third high region the Steers increased thee in the water's bosom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 45
sanskrit: अक्रन्ददग्नि सतनयन्निव दयौः कषामा रेरिहद वीरुधःसमञ्जन | सद्यो जज्ञानो वि हीमिद्धो अख्यदा रोदसीभानुना भात्यन्तः
transliteration: akrandadaghni stanayanniva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥsamañjan | sadyo jajñāno vi hīmiddho akhyadā rodasībhānunā bhātyantaḥ
translation: Agni roared out, like Dyaus what time he thunders: he licked the ground about the plants he flickered. At once, when born, he looked around enkindled, and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: पर होता जातो महान नभोविन नर्षद्वा सीददपामुपस्थे | दधिर्यो धायि स ते वयांसि यन्ता वसूनि विधतेतनूपाः
transliteration: pra hotā jāto mahān nabhovin nṛṣadvā sīdadapāmupasthe | dadhiryo dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhatetanūpāḥ
translation: STABLISHED for thee, to lend thee vital forces, Giver of wealth, Guard of his servant's body. The Great Priest, born, who knows the clouds, Abider with men, is seated in the lap of waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे पशुं न नष्टं पदैरनु गमन | गुहा चतन्तमुशिजो नमोभिरिछन्तो धीराभ्र्गवो.अविन्दन
transliteration: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe paśuṃ na naṣṭaṃ padairanu ghman | ghuhā catantamuśijo namobhirichanto dhīrābhṛghavo.avindan
translation: Worshipping, seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints, Wise Bhrgus, yearning in their hearts, pursued him, and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: इमं तरितो भूर्यविन्ददिछन वैभूवसो मूर्धन्यघ्न्यायाः | स शेव्र्धो जात आ हर्म्येषु नाभिर्युवाभवति रोचनस्य
transliteration: imaṃ trito bhūryavindadichan vaibhūvaso mūrdhanyaghnyāyāḥ | sa śevṛdho jāta ā harmyeṣu nābhiryuvābhavati rocanasya
translation: On the Cow's forehead, with laborious searching, Trita, the offspring of Vibhiavas, found him. Born in our houses, Youthful, joy-bestower, he now becomes the central point of brightness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो नमोभिः पराञ्चं यज्ञं नेतारमध्वराणाम | विशामक्र्ण्वन्नरतिं पावकं हव्यवाहन्दधतो मानुषेषु
transliteration: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo namobhiḥ prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ netāramadhvarāṇām | viśāmakṛṇvannaratiṃ pāvakaṃ havyavāhandadhato mānuṣeṣu
translation: Yearning, with homage, they have set and made him blithe Priest among mankind, oblation-bearer, Leader of rites and Purifier, envoy of men, as sacrifice that still advances.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: पर भूर्जयन्तं महां विपोधां मूरा अमूरं पुरान्दर्माणम | नयन्तो गर्भं वनां धियं धुर्हिरिश्मश्रुं नार्वाणं धनर्चम
transliteration: pra bhūrjayantaṃ mahāṃ vipodhāṃ mūrā amūraṃ purāndarmāṇam | nayanto gharbhaṃ vanāṃ dhiyaṃ dhurhiriśmaśruṃ nārigvedaāṇaṃ dhanarcam
translation: The foolish brought the ne'er-bewildered forward, great, Victor, Song-inspirer, Fort-destroyer. Leading the Youth gold-bearded, like a courser gleaming with wealth, they turned their hymn to profit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: नि पस्त्यासु तरित सतभूयन परिवीतो योनौ सीददन्तः | अतः संग्र्भ्या विशां दमूना विधर्मणायन्त्रैरीयतेनॄन
transliteration: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivīto yonau sīdadantaḥ | ataḥ saṃghṛbhyā viśāṃ damūnā vidharmaṇāyantrairīyatenṝn
translation: Holding his station firmly in the houses, Trita sat down within his home surrounded Thence, as Law bids, departs the Tribes' Companion having collected men with no compulsion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 46
sanskrit: अस्याजरासो दमामरित्रा अर्चद्धूमासो अग्नयः पावकाः | शवितीचयः शवात्रासो भुरण्यवो वनर्षदो वायवो नसोमाः
transliteration: asyājarāso damāmaritrā arcaddhūmāso aghnayaḥ pāvakāḥ |
translation: His are the fires, eternal, purifying, that make the houses move, whose smoke is shining, White, waxing in their strength, for ever stirring, and sitting in the wood; like winds are Somas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 47
sanskrit: जग्र्भ्मा ते दक्षिणमिन्द्र हस्तं वसूयवो वसुपतेवसूनाम | विद्मा हि तवा गोपतिं शूर गोनामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः
transliteration: jaghṛbhmā te dakṣiṇamindra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupatevasūnām | vidmā hi tvā ghopatiṃ śūra ghonāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
translation: THY right hand have we grasped in ours, O Indra, longing for treasure, Treasure-Lord of treasures! Because we know thee, Hero, Lord of cattle: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 47
sanskrit: सवायुधं सववसं सुनीथं चतुःसमुद्रं धरुनंरयीणाम | चर्क्र्त्यं शंस्यं भूरिवारमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः
transliteration: svāyudhaṃ svavasaṃ sunīthaṃ catuḥsamudraṃ dharunaṃrayīṇām | carkṛtyaṃ śaṃsyaṃ bhūrivāramasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
translation: Wealth, fully armed, good guard and kind protector, sprung from four seas, the prop and stay of treasures, Fraught with great bounties, meet for praise and glory; vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 47
sanskrit: सुब्रह्माणं देववन्तं बर्हन्तमुरुं गभीरं पर्थुबुध्नमिन्द्र | शरुतर्षिमुग्रमभिमातिषाहमस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः
transliteration: subrahmāṇaṃ devavantaṃ bṛhantamuruṃ ghabhīraṃ pṛthubudhnamindra |
translation: Wealth, with good Brahmans, Indra! God-attended, high, wide, and deep, arid based on broad foundations, Strong, with famed Rsis, conquering our foemen: vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अहं भुवं वसुनः पूर्व्यस पतिरहं धनानि संजयामि शश्वतः | मां हवन्ते पितरं न जन्तवो.अहन्दाशुषे वि भजामि भोजनम
transliteration: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ vasunaḥ pūrigvedayas patirahaṃ dhanāni saṃjayāmi śaśvataḥ | māṃ havante pitaraṃ na jantavo.ahandāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam
translation: I WAS the first possessor of all precious gear: the wealth of every man I win and gather up. On me as on a Father living creatures call; I deal enjoyment to thou man who offers gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अहमिन्द्रो रोधो वक्षो अथर्वणस्त्रिताय गा अजनयमहेरधि | अहं दस्युभ्यः परि नर्म्णमा ददे गोत्रा शिक्षन्दधीचे मातरिश्वने
transliteration: ahamindro rodho vakṣo atharigvedaaṇastritāya ghā ajanayamaheradhi | ahaṃ dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇamā dade ghotrā śikṣandadhīce mātariśvane
translation: I, Indra, am Atharvan's stay and firm support: I brought forth kine to Trita from the Dragon's grasp. I stripped the Dasyus of their manly might, and gave the cattle-stalls to Matarigvan and Dadhyac.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: मह्यं तवष्टा वज्रमतक्षदायसं मयि देवासो.अव्र्जन्नपि करतुम | ममानीकं सूर्यस्येव दुष्टरं मामार्यन्तिक्र्तेन कर्त्वेन च
transliteration: mahyaṃ tvaṣṭā vajramatakṣadāyasaṃ mayi devāso.avṛjannapi kratum | mamānīkaṃ sūryasyeva duṣṭaraṃ māmāryantikṛtena kartvena ca
translation: For me hath Tvastar forged the iron thunderbolt: in me the Gods have centred intellectual power. My sheen is like the Sun's insufferably bright: men honour me as Lord for past and future deeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अहमेतं गव्ययमश्व्यं पशुं पुरीषिणं सायकेनाहिरण्ययम | पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि दाशुषे यन मासोमास उक्थिनो अमन्दिषुः
transliteration: ahametaṃ ghavyayamaśvyaṃ paśuṃ purīṣiṇaṃ sāyakenāhiraṇyayam | purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yan māsomāsa ukthino amandiṣuḥ
translation: I won myself these herdi of cattle, steeds and kine, and gold in ample store, with my destructive bolt. I give full many a thousand to the worshipper, what time the Somas and the lauds have made me glad.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अहमिन्द्रो न परा जिग्य इद धनं न मर्त्यवे.अव तस्थेकदा चन | सोममिन मा सुन्वन्तो याचता वसु न मेपूरवः सख्ये रिषाथन
transliteration: ahamindro na parā jighya id dhanaṃ na mṛtyave.ava tasthekadā cana | somamin mā sunvanto yācatā vasu na mepūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana
translation: Indra am I none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am I a thrall to death. Pressing the Soma, ask riches from me alone: ye, Purus, in my friendship shall not suffer harm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 48
sanskrit: अहमेताञ्छाश्वसतो दवा-दवेन्द्रं ये वज्रं युधयेऽकर्ण्वत | आह्वयमानानव हन्मनाहनं दर्ळा वदन्ननमस्युर्नमस्विनः
transliteration: ahametāñchāśvasato dvā-dvendraṃ ye vajraṃ yudhaye'kṛṇvata |
translation: These, breathing loud in fury, two and two, who caused Indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray, The challengers, I struck with deadly weapon down: firm stand what words the God speaks to his worshippers. This One by stronger might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me? Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं दां गर्णते पूर्व्यं वस्वहं बरह्म कर्णवं मह्यंवर्धनम | अहं भुवं यजमानस्य चोदितायज्वनः साक्षिविश्वस्मिन भरे
transliteration: ahaṃ dāṃ ghṛṇate pūrigvedayaṃ vasvahaṃ brahma kṛṇavaṃ mahyaṃvardhanam | ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya coditāyajvanaḥ sākṣiviśvasmin bhare
translation: I HAVE enriched the singer with surpassing wealth; I have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me. I, furtherer of him who offers sacrifice, have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: मां धुरिन्द्रं नाम देवता दिवश्च गमश्चापां चजन्तवः | अहं हरी वर्षणा विव्रता रघू अहंवज्रं शवसे धर्ष्ण्वा ददे
transliteration: māṃ dhurindraṃ nāma devatā divaśca ghmaścāpāṃ cajantavaḥ | ahaṃ harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū ahaṃvajraṃ śavase dhṛṣṇvā dade
translation: The People of the heavens, the waters, and the earth have stablished me among the Gods with Indra's name. I took unto myself the two swift vigorous Bays that speed on divers paths, and the fierce bolt for strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहमत्कं कवये शिश्नथं हथैरहं कुत्समावमाभिरूतिभिः | अहं शुष्णस्य शनथिता वधर्यमंन यो रर आर्यं नाम दस्यवे
transliteration: ahamatkaṃ kavaye śiśnathaṃ hathairahaṃ kutsamāvamābhirūtibhiḥ | ahaṃ śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadharyamaṃna yo rara āryaṃ nāma dasyave
translation: With deadly blows I smote Atka for Kavi's sake; I guarded Kutsa well with these saving helps. As Susna's slayer I brandished the dart of death: I gave not up the Aryan name to Dasyu foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं पितेव वेतसून्रभिष्टये तुग्रं कुत्साय समदिभंच रन्धयम | अहं भुवं यजमानस्य राजनि पर यद भरेतुजये न परियाध्र्षे
transliteration: ahaṃ piteva vetasūnrabhiṣṭaye tughraṃ kutsāya smadibhaṃca randhayam | ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya rājani pra yad bharetujaye na priyādhṛṣe
translation: Smadibha, Tugra, and the Vetasus I gave as prey to Kutsa, father-like, to succour him. I was a worthy King to rule the worshipper, when I gave Tuji dear inviolable gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं रन्धयं मर्गयं शरुतर्वणे यन माजिहीत वयुनाचनानुषक | अहं वेशं नम्रमायवे.अकरमहंसव्याय पड्ग्र्भिमरन्धयम
transliteration: ahaṃ randhayaṃ mṛghayaṃ śrutarigvedaaṇe yan mājihīta vayunācanānuṣak | ahaṃ veśaṃ namramāyave.akaramahaṃsavyāya paḍghṛbhimarandhayam
translation: I gave up Mrgaya to Srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws. For Ayu's sake I caused Veta to bend and bow, and into Savya's hand delivered Padgrbhi.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं स यो नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं सं वर्त्रेव दासंव्र्त्रहारुजम | यद वर्धयन्तं परथयन्तमानुषग दूरेपारे रजसो रोचनाकरम
transliteration: ahaṃ sa yo navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ saṃ vṛtreva dāsaṃvṛtrahārujam | yad vardhayantaṃ prathayantamānuṣagh dūrepāre rajaso rocanākaram
translation: 1, I crushed Navavastva of the lofty car, the Dasa, as the Vrtra-slayer kills the fiends; When straightway on the region's farthest edge I brought the God who makes the lights to broaden and increase.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं सूर्यस्य परि याम्याशुभिः परैतशेभिर्वहमानोजसा | यन मा सावो मनुष आह निर्णिज रधक कर्षेदासं कर्त्व्यं हथैः
transliteration: ahaṃ sūryasya pari yāmyāśubhiḥ praitaśebhirigvedaahamānaojasā | yan mā sāvo manuṣa āha nirṇija ṛdhak kṛṣedāsaṃ kṛtvyaṃ hathaiḥ
translation: I travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleet-footed dappled Horses of the Sun. When man's libation calls me to the robe of state I soon repel the powerful Dasyu with my blows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं सप्तहा नहुषो नहुष्टरः पराश्राव यं शवसातुर्वशं यदुम | अहं नयन्यं सहसा सहस करं नवव्राधतो नवतिं च वक्षयम
transliteration: ahaṃ saptahā nahuṣo nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāva yaṃ śavasāturigvedaaśaṃ yadum | ahaṃ nyanyaṃ sahasā sahas karaṃ navavrādhato navatiṃ ca vakṣayam
translation: Stronger am I than Nabus, I who slew the seven: I glorified with might Yadu and Turvaga. I brought another low, with strength I bent his strength: I let the mighty nine-and-ninety wax in power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं सप्त सरवतो धारयं वर्षा दरवित्न्वः पर्थिव्यांसीरा अधि | अहमर्णांसि वि तिरामि सुक्रतुर्युधा विदम्मनवे गातुमिष्टये
transliteration: ahaṃ sapta sravato dhārayaṃ vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyāṃsīrā adhi | ahamarṇāṃsi vi tirāmi sukraturyudhā vidammanave ghātumiṣṭaye
translation: Bull over all the streams that flow along the earth, I took the Seven Rivers as mine own domain. I, gifted with great wisdom, spread the floods abroad: by war I found for man the way to high success.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: अहं तदासु धारयं यदासु न देवश्चनत्वष्टाधारयद रुशत | सपार्हं गवामूधस्सुवक्षणास्वा मधोर्मधु शवात्र्यं सोममाशिरम
transliteration: ahaṃ tadāsu dhārayaṃ yadāsu na devaścanatvaṣṭādhārayad ruśat | spārhaṃ ghavāmūdhassuvakṣaṇāsvā madhormadhu śvātryaṃ somamāśiram
translation: I set within these cows the white milk which no God, not even Tvastar's self, had there deposited,- Much-longed-for, in the breasts, the udders of the kine, the savoury sweets of meath, the milk and Soma juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 49
sanskrit: एवा देवानिन्द्रो विव्ये नॄन पर चयौत्नेन मघवासत्यराधाः | विश्वेत ता ते हरिवः शचीवो.अभितुरासः सवयशो गर्णन्ति
transliteration: evā devānindro vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavāsatyarādhāḥ | viśvet tā te harivaḥ śacīvo.abhiturāsaḥ svayaśo ghṛṇanti
translation: Even thus hath Indra Maghavan, truly bounteous, sped Gods and men with mighty operation. The pious glorify all these thine exploits, Lord of Bay Coursers, Strong, and self resplendent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: पर वो महे मन्दमानायान्धसो.अर्चा विश्वानरायविश्वाभुवे | इन्द्रस्य यस्य सुमखं सहो महि शरवोन्र्म्णं च रोदसी सपर्यतः
transliteration: pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso.arcā viśvānarāyaviśvābhuve | indrasya yasya sumakhaṃ saho mahi śravonṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ
translation: I LAUD your Mighty One who joyeth in the juice, him who is shared by all men, who created all; Indra, whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour Heaven and Earth revere.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: सो चिन नु सख्या नर्य इन सतुतश्चर्क्र्त्य इन्द्रो मावतेनरे | विश्वासु धूर्षु वाजक्र्त्येषु सत्पते वर्त्रे वाप्स्वभि शूर मन्दसे
transliteration: so cin nu sakhyā narya ina stutaścarkṛtya indro māvatenare | viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vāpsvabhi śūra mandase
translation: He with his friend is active, lauded, good to man, Indra who must be glorified by one like me. Hero, Lord of the brave, all cars are thy delight, warring with Vrtra, or for waters, or for spoil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: के ते नर इन्द्र ये त इषे ये ते सुम्नं सधन्यमियक्षान | के ते वाजायासुर्याय हिन्विरे के अप्सु सवासूर्वरासुपौंस्ये
transliteration: ke te nara indra ye ta iṣe ye te sumnaṃ sadhanyamiyakṣān | ke te vājāyāsuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsūrigvedaarāsupauṃsye
translation: Who are the men whom thou wilt further, Indra, who strive to win thy bliss allied with riches? Who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine, to valour, in the war for waters on their fields?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: भुवस्त्वमिन्द्र बरह्मणा महान भुवो विश्वेषु सवनेषुयज्ञियः | भुवो नॄंश्च्यौत्नो विश्वस्मिन भरेज्येष्ठश्च मन्त्रो विश्वचर्षणे
transliteration: bhuvastvamindra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣuyajñiyaḥ | bhuvo nṝṃścyautno viśvasmin bharejyeṣṭhaśca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe
translation: Thou, Indra, through the holy prayer art mighty, worthy of sacrifice at all libations. In every fight thou castest heroes on the ground: thou art the noblest song, O Lord of all the folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: अवा नु कं जयायान यज्ञवनसो महीं त ओमात्रांक्र्ष्टयो विदुः | असो नु कमजरो वर्धाश्च विश्वेदेतासवना तूतुमा कर्षे
transliteration: avā nu kaṃ jyāyān yajñavanaso mahīṃ ta omātrāṃkṛṣṭayo viduḥ | aso nu kamajaro vardhāśca viśvedetāsavanā tūtumā kṛṣe
translation: Help now, as Highest, those who toil at sacrifice: well do the people know thy great protecting might. Thou shalt be everlasting, Giver of success yea, on all these libations thou bestowest strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: एता विश्वा सवना तूतुमाक्र्षे सवयं सूनो सहसो यानिदधिषे | वराय ते पात्रं धर्मणे तना यज्ञो मन्त्रोब्रह्मोद्यतं वचः
transliteration: etā viśvā savanā tūtumākṛṣe svayaṃ sūno sahaso yānidadhiṣe | varāya te pātraṃ dharmaṇe tanā yajño mantrobrahmodyataṃ vacaḥ
translation: All these libations thou makest effectual, of which thou art thyself supporter, Son of Power. Therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best, sacrifice, holy text, prayer, and exalted speech.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 50
sanskrit: ये ते विप्र बरह्मक्र्तः सुते सचा वसूनां च वसुनश्चदावने | पर ते सुम्नस्य मनसा पथा भुवन मदे सुतस्यसोम्यस्यान्धसः
transliteration: ye te vipra brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnāṃ ca vasunaścadāvane | pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasyasomyasyāndhasaḥ
translation: They who with flowing Soma pray to thee, O Sage, to pour on them thy gifts of opulence and wealth, May they come forward, through their spirit, on the path of bliss, in the wild joy of Soma juice effused.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: महत तदुल्बं सथविरं तदासीद येनाविष्टितःप्रविवेशिथापः | विश्वा अपश्यद बहुधा ते अग्ने जातवेदस्तन्वो देव एकः
transliteration: mahat tadulbaṃ sthaviraṃ tadāsīd yenāviṣṭitaḥpraviveśithāpaḥ | viśvā apaśyad bahudhā te aghne jātavedastanvo deva ekaḥ
translation: LARGE was that covering, and firm of texture, folded wherein thou enteredst the waters. One Deity alone, O Jatavedas Agni, saw all thy forms in sundry places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: को मा ददर्श कतमः स देवो यो मे तन्वो बहुधापर्यपश्यत | कवाह मित्रावरुणा कषियन्त्यग्नेर्विस्वाःसमिधो देवयानीः
transliteration: ko mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devo yo me tanvo bahudhāparyapaśyat | kvāha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyantyaghnerigvedasvāḥsamidho devayānīḥ
translation: What God hath seen me? Who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places? Where lie, then, all the sacred logs of Agni that lead him God-ward, Varuna and Mitra?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: ऐछाम तवा बहुधा जातवेदः परविष्टमग्ने अप्स्वोषधीषु | तं तवा यमो अचिकेच्चित्रभानो दशान्तरुष्यादतिरोचमानम
transliteration: aichāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭamaghne apsvoṣadhīṣu | taṃ tvā yamo acikeccitrabhāno daśāntaruṣyādatirocamānam
translation: In many places, Agni Jatavedas, we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters. Then Yama marked thee, God of wondrous splendour! effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: होत्रादहं वरुण बिभ्यदायं नेदेव मा युनजन्नत्रदेवाः | तस्य मे तन्वो बहुधा निविष्टा एतमर्थं नचिकेताहमग्निः
transliteration: hotrādahaṃ varuṇa bibhyadāyaṃ nedeva mā yunajannatradevāḥ | tasya me tanvo bahudhā niviṣṭā etamarthaṃ naciketāhamaghniḥ
translation: I fled in fear from sacrificial worship, Varuna, lest the Gods should thus engage me. Thus were my forms laid down in many places. This, as my goal, I Agni saw before me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: एहि मनुर्देवयुर्यज्ञकामो.अरंक्र्त्या तमसि कषेष्यग्ने | सुगान पथः कर्णुहि देवयानान वह हव्यानिसुमनस्यमानः
transliteration: ehi manurdevayuryajñakāmo.araṃkṛtyā tamasi kṣeṣyaghne | sughān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi devayānān vaha havyānisumanasyamānaḥ
translation: Come; man is pious and would fain do worship, he waits prepared: in gloom thou, Agni, dwellest. Make pathways leading God-ward clear and easy, and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: अग्नेः पूर्वे भरातरो अर्थमेतं रथीवाध्वानमन्वावरीवुः | तस्माद भिया वरुण दूरमायं गौरो नक्षेप्नोरविजे जयायाः
transliteration: aghneḥ pūrigvedae bhrātaro arthametaṃ rathīvādhvānamanvāvarīvuḥ | tasmād bhiyā varuṇa dūramāyaṃ ghauro nakṣepnoravije jyāyāḥ
translation: This goal mine elder brothers erst selected, as he who drives a car the way to travel. So,Varuna, I fled afar through terror, as flies the wild-bull from an archer's bowstring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: कुर्मस्त आयुरजरं यदग्ने यथा युक्तो जातवेदो नरिष्याः | अथा वहासि सुमनस्यमानो भागं देवेभ्योहविषः सुजात
transliteration: kurmasta āyurajaraṃ yadaghne yathā yukto jātavedo nariṣyāḥ | athā vahāsi sumanasyamāno bhāghaṃ devebhyohaviṣaḥ sujāta
translation: We give thee life unwasting, Jatavedas, so that, employed, thou never shalt be injured. So, nobly born! shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the Gods their share of men's oblations.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: परयाजान मे अनुयाजांश्च केवलानूर्जस्वन्तं हविषोदत्त भागम | घर्तं चापां पुरुषं चौषधीनामग्नेश्च दीर्घमायुरस्तु देवाः
transliteration: prayājān me anuyājāṃśca kevalānūrjasvantaṃ haviṣodatta bhāgham | ghṛtaṃ cāpāṃ puruṣaṃ cauṣadhīnāmaghneśca dīrghamāyurastu devāḥ
translation: Grant me the first oblations and the latter, entire, my forceful shares of holy presents, The soul of plants, the fatness of the waters, and let there be long life, ye Gods, to Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 51
sanskrit: तव परयाजा अनुयाजाश्च केवल ऊर्जस्वन्तो हविषः सन्तुभागाः | तवाग्ने यज्ञो.अयमस्तु सर्वस्तुभ्यं नमन्ताम्प्रदिशश्चतस्रः
transliteration: tava prayājā anuyājāśca kevala ūrjasvanto haviṣaḥ santubhāghāḥ | tavāghne yajño.ayamastu sarigvedaastubhyaṃ namantāmpradiśaścatasraḥ
translation: Thine be the first oblations and the latter, entire, thy forceful shares of holy presents. Let all this sacrifice be thine, O Agni, and let the world's four regions how before thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 52
sanskrit: विश्वे देवाः शास्तन मा यथेह होता वर्तो मनवै यन्निषद्य | पर मे बरूत भागधेयं यथा वो येन पथाहव्यमा वो वहानि
transliteration: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yatheha hotā vṛto manavai yanniṣadya | pra me brūta bhāghadheyaṃ yathā vo yena pathāhavyamā vo vahāni
translation: INSTRUCT me, all ye Gods, how I, elected your Priest, must seat me here, and how address you. Instruct me how to deal to each his portion, and by what ' path to bring you man's oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अहं होता नयसीदं यजीयान विश्वे देवा मरुतो माजुनन्ति | अहर-अहरश्विनाध्वर्यवं वां बरह्मा समिद भवतिसाहुतिर्वाम
transliteration: ahaṃ hotā nyasīdaṃ yajīyān viśve devā maruto mājunanti | ahar-aharaśvinādhvaryavaṃ vāṃ brahmā samid bhavatisāhutirigvedaām
translation: I sit as Priest most skilled in sacrificing: the Maruts and all Deities impel me. Asvins, each day yours is the Adhvaryu's duty: Brahman and wood are here: 'tis yours to offer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 52
sanskrit: अयं यो होता किरु स यमस्य कमप्यूहे यत समञ्जन्तिदेवाः | अहर-अहर्जायते मासि-मास्यथा देवा दधिरेहव्यवाहम
transliteration: ayaṃ yo hotā kiru sa yamasya kamapyūhe yat samañjantidevāḥ | ahar-aharjāyate māsi-māsyathā devā dadhirehavyavāham
translation: Who is the Priest? Is he the Priest of Yama? On whom is thrust this God-appointed honour? He springs to life each month, each day that passes; so Gods have made him their oblation-bearer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 52
sanskrit: मां देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहमपम्लुक्तं बहु कर्छ्राचरन्तम | अग्निर्विद्वान यज्ञं नः कल्पयाति पञ्चयामन्त्रिव्र्तं सप्ततन्तुम
transliteration: māṃ devā dadhire havyavāhamapamluktaṃ bahu kṛchrācarantam | aghnirigvedadvān yajñaṃ naḥ kalpayāti pañcayāmantrivṛtaṃ saptatantum
translation: The Gods have made me bearer of oblations, who slipped away and passed through many troubles. Wise Agni shall ordain for us the worship, whether five-wayed, threefold, or seven-threaded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 53
sanskrit: यमैछाम मनसा सो.अयमागाद यज्ञस्य विद्वान्परुषश्चिकित्वान | स नो यक्षद देवताता यजीयान नि हिषत्सदन्तरः पूर्वो अस्मत
transliteration: yamaichāma manasā so.ayamāghād yajñasya vidvānparuṣaścikitvān | sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān ni hiṣatsadantaraḥ pūrigvedao asmat
translation: HE hath arrived, he whom we sought with longing, who skilled in sacrifice well knows its courses. Let him discharge his sacrificial duties: let him sit down as Friend who was before Us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 53
sanskrit: अराधि होता निषदा यजीयनभि परयांसि सुधितानि हिख्यत | यजामहै यज्ञियान हन्त देवानीळामहाीड्यानाज्येन
transliteration: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyanabhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hikhyat | yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devānīḷāmahāīḍyānājyena
translation: Best Priest, he hath been won by being seated, for he hath looked on the well-ordered viands. Come, let us worship Gods who must be worshipped, and pouring oil, laud those who should be lauded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 53
sanskrit: साध्वीमकर्देववीतिं नो अद्य यज्ञस्य जिह्वामविदामगुह्याम | स आयुरागात सुरभिर्वसानो भद्रामकर्देवहूतिं नो अद्य
transliteration: sādhvīmakardevavītiṃ no adya yajñasya jihvāmavidāmaghuhyām | sa āyurāghāt surabhirigvedaasāno bhadrāmakardevahūtiṃ no adya
translation: Now hath he made the feast of Gods effective: now have we found the secret tongue of worship. Now hath he come, sweet, robed in vital vigour, and made our calling on the Gods effective.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 53
sanskrit: तदद्य वाचः परथमं मसीय येनासुरानभि देवासाम | ऊर्जाद उत यज्ञियसः पञ्च जना मम होत्रंजुषध्वम
transliteration: tadadya vācaḥ prathamaṃ masīya yenāsurānabhi devāasāma |
translation: This prelude of my speech I now will utter, whereby we Gods may quell our Asura foemen. Eaters of strengthening food who merit worship, O ye Five Tribes, be pleased with mine oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तां सु ते कीर्तिं मघवन महित्वा यत तवा भीते रोदसीह्वयेताम | परावो देवानातिरो दासमोजः परजायैत्वस्यै यदशिक्ष इन्द्र
transliteration: tāṃ su te kīrtiṃ maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasīahvayetām | prāvo devānātiro dāsamojaḥ prajāyaitvasyai yadaśikṣa indra
translation: I SING thy fame that, Maghavan, through thy Greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror, Thou, aiding Gods, didst quell the power of Dasas, what time thou holpest many a race, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: यदचरस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो बलानीन्द्र परब्रुवाणो जनेषु | मायेत सा ते यानि युद्धान्याहुर्नाद्य शत्रुं ननुपुरा विवित्से
transliteration: yadacarastanvā vāvṛdhāno balānīndra prabruvāṇo janeṣu | māyet sā te yāni yuddhānyāhurnādya śatruṃ nanupurā vivitse
translation: When thou wast roaming, waxen strong in body, telling thy might, Indra, among the people, All that men called thy battles was illusion: no foe hast thou to-day, nor erst hast found one.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: क उ नु ते महिमनः समस्यास्मत पूर्व रषयो.अन्तमापुः | यन मातरं च पितरं च साकमजनयथास्तन्वःस्वायाः
transliteration: ka u nu te mahimanaḥ samasyāsmat pūrigvedaa ṛṣayo.antamāpuḥ | yan mātaraṃ ca pitaraṃ ca sākamajanayathāstanvaḥsvāyāḥ
translation: Who are the Rsis, then, who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness? For from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the Mother and the Father.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: चत्वारि ते असुर्याणि नामादाभ्यानि महिषस्य सन्ति | तवमङग तानि विश्वानि वित्से येभिः कर्माणि मघवञ्चकर्थ
transliteration: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāmādābhyāni mahiṣasya santi | tvamaṅgha tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavañcakartha
translation: Thou, Mighty Steer, hast four supremest natures, Asura natures that may ne'er be injured. All these, O Maghavan, thou surely knowest, wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: तवं विश्वा दधिषे केवलानि यान्याविर्या च गुहावसूनि | काममिन मे मघवन मा वि तारीस्त्वमाज्ञातात्वमिन्द्रासि दाता
transliteration: tvaṃ viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yānyāviryā ca ghuhāvasūni | kāmamin me maghavan mā vi tārīstvamājñātātvamindrāsi dātā
translation: Thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession, treasures made manifest and treasures hidden. Defer not thou, O Maghavan, my longing: thou, art Director, Indra, thou art Giver.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 54
sanskrit: यो अदधाज्ज्योतिषि जयोतिरन्तर्यो अस्र्जन मधुना सम्मधूनि | अध परियं शूषमिन्द्राय मन्म बरह्मक्र्तोब्र्हदुक्थादवाचि
transliteration: yo adadhājjyotiṣi jyotirantaryo asṛjan madhunā sammadhūni | adha priyaṃ śūṣamindrāya manma brahmakṛtobṛhadukthādavāci
translation: To him who set the light in things of splendour, and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness, To Indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary Brhaduktha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 55
sanskrit: दूरे तन नाम गुह्यं पराचैर्यत तवा भीते अह्वयेतांवयोधै | उदस्तभ्नाः पर्थिवीं दयामभीके भरातुःपुत्रान मघवन तित्विषाणः
transliteration: dūre tan nāma ghuhyaṃ parācairyat tvā bhīte ahvayetāṃvayodhai | udastabhnāḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmabhīke bhrātuḥputrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ
translation: FAR is that secret name by which, in terror, the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour The earth and heaven thou settest near each other, and Maghavan, madest bright thy Brother's Children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 55
sanskrit: महत तन नाम गुह्यं पुरुस्प्र्ग येन भूतं जनयो येनभव्यम | परत्नं जातं जयोतिर्यदस्य परियं परियाः समविशन्त पञ्च
transliteration: mahat tan nāma ghuhyaṃ puruspṛgh yena bhūtaṃ janayo yenabhavyam | pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotiryadasya priyaṃ priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca
translation: Great is that secret name and far-extending, whereby thou madest all that is and shall be. The Five Tribes whom he loveth well have entered the light he loveth that was made aforetime.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: इदं त एकं पर ऊ त एकं तर्तीयेन जयोतिषा संविशस्व | संवेशने तन्वश्चारुरेधि परियो देवानाम्परमे जनित्रे
transliteration: idaṃ ta ekaṃ para ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃviśasva | saṃveśane tanvaścāruredhi priyo devānāmparame janitre
translation: HERE is one light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and he therewith united. Uniting with a body be thou welcome, dear to the Gods in their sublimest birthplace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: तनूष टे वाजिन तन्वं नयन्ती वाममस्मभ्यं धातुशर्म तुभ्यम | अह्रुतो महो धरुणाय देवान दिवीवज्योतिः सवमा मिमीयाः
transliteration: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmamasmabhyaṃ dhātuśarma tubhyam | ahruto maho dharuṇāya devān divīvajyotiḥ svamā mimīyāḥ
translation: Bearing thy body, Vajin, may thy body afford us blessing and thyself protection. Unswerving, stablish as it were in heaven thine own light as the mighty God's supporter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
