sanskrit: वाज्यसि वाजिनेना सुवेनीः सुवित सतोमं सुवितो दिवंगाः | सुवितो धर्म परथमानु सत्या सुवितो देवान सुवितोऽनु पत्म
transliteration: vājyasi vājinenā suvenīḥ suvita stomaṃ suvito divaṃghāḥ | suvito dharma prathamānu satyā suvito devān suvito'nu patma
translation: Strong Steed art thou: go to the yearning Maidens with vigour, happily go to heaven and praises: Fly happily to the Gods with easy passage, according to the first and faithful statutes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: महिम्न एषां पितरश्चनेशिरे देवा देवेष्वदधुरपिक्रतुम | समविव्यचुरुत यान्यत्विषुरैषां तनूषु निविविशुः पुनः
transliteration: mahimna eṣāṃ pitaraścaneśire devā deveṣvadadhurapikratum | samavivyacuruta yānyatviṣuraiṣāṃ tanūṣu niviviśuḥ punaḥ
translation: Part of their grandeur have the Fathers also gained: the Gods have seated mental power in them as Gods. They have embraced within themselves all energies, which, issuing forth, again into their bodies pass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: सहोभिर्विश्वं परि चक्रमू रजः पूर्वा धामान्यमितामिमानाः | तनूषु विश्वा भुवना नि येमिरे परासारयन्तपुरुध परजा अनु
transliteration: sahobhirigvedaśvaṃ pari cakramū rajaḥ pūrigvedaā dhāmānyamitāmimānāḥ | tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayantapurudha prajā anu
translation: They strode through all the region with victorious might, establishing the old immeasurable laws. They compassed in their bodies all existing things, and streamed forth offspring in many successive forms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: दविधा सूनवो.असुरं सवर्विदमास्थापयन्त तर्तीयेनकर्मणा | सवां परजां पितरः पित्र्यं सह आवरेष्वदधुस्तन्तुमाततम
transliteration: dvidhā sūnavo.asuraṃ svarigvedadamāsthāpayanta tṛtīyenakarmaṇā | svāṃ prajāṃ pitaraḥ pitryaṃ saha āvareṣvadadhustantumātatam
translation: In two ways have the sons established in his place the Asura who finds the light, by the third act, As fathers, they have set their heritage on earth, their offspring, as a thread continuously spun out.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 56
sanskrit: नावा न कषोदः परदिशः पर्थिव्याः सवस्तिभिरतिदुर्गाणि विश्वा | सवां परजां बर्हदुक्थो महित्वावरेष्वदधादा परेषु
transliteration: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiratidurghāṇi viśvā | svāṃ prajāṃ bṛhaduktho mahitvāvareṣvadadhādā pareṣu
translation: As in a ship through billows, so through regions of air, with blessings, through toils and troubles Hath Brhaduktha brought his seed with glory, and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 57
sanskrit: मा पर गाम पथो वयं मा यज्ञादिन्द्र सोमिनः | मान्त सथुर्नो अरातयः
transliteration: mā pra ghāma patho vayaṃ mā yajñādindra sominaḥ | mānta sthurno arātayaḥ
translation: LET us not, Indra, leave the path, the Soma-presser's sacrifice: Let no malignity dwell with us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 57
sanskrit: यो यज्ञस्य परसाधनस्तन्तुर्देवेष्वाततः | तमाहुतं नशीमहि
transliteration: yo yajñasya prasādhanastanturdeveṣvātataḥ | tamāhutaṃ naśīmahi
translation: May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out to reach the Gods, That perfecteth the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 57
sanskrit: मनो नवा हुवामहे नाराशंसेन सोमेन | पितॄणां चमन्मभिः
transliteration: mano nvā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena | pitṝṇāṃ camanmabhiḥ
translation: We call the spirit hither with the Soma of our parted sires, Yea, with the Fathers' holy hymns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते यमं वैवस्वतं मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त आवर्तयामसीह कषयाय जीवसे
transliteration: yat te yamaṃ vaivasvataṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta āvartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase
translation: THY spirit, that went far away to Yama to Vivasvan's Son, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते दिवं यत पर्थिवीं मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te divaṃ yat pṛthivīṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, that passed away to earth and heaven, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते भूमिं चतुर्भ्र्ष्टिं मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त...
transliteration: yat te bhūmiṃ caturbhṛṣṭiṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to the four-eyed earth, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते चतस्रः परदिशो मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te catasraḥ pradiśo mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away to the four quarters of the world, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते समुद्रमर्णवं मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te samudramarṇavaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, away unto the billowy sea, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते मरीचीः परवतो मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te marīcīḥ pravato mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away to beams of light that flash and flow, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते अपो यदोषधीर्मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te apo yadoṣadhīrmano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, went to the waters and the plants, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते सूर्यं यदुषसं मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te sūryaṃ yaduṣasaṃ mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, that visited the Sun and Dawn. We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते पर्वतान बर्हतो मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te parigvedaatān bṛhato mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away, away to lofty mountain heights, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते विश्वमिदं जगन मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te viśvamidaṃ jaghan mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away into this All, that lives and moves, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते पराः परावतो मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त ...
transliteration: yat te parāḥ parāvato mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta ...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 58
sanskrit: यत ते भूतं च भव्यं च मनो जगाम दूरकम | तत त...
transliteration: yat te bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca mano jaghāma dūrakam | tat ta...
translation: Thy spirit, that went far away to all that is and is to be, We cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: पर तार्यायुः परतरं नवीय सथातारेव करतुमतारथस्य | अध चयवान उत तवीत्यर्थं परातरं सग़्म
transliteration: pra tāryāyuḥ prataraṃ navīya sthātāreva kratumatārathasya | adha cyavāna ut tavītyarthaṃ parātaraṃ sm
translation: His life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men, car-borne, by the skillful driver. One falls, then seeks the goal with quickened vigour. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: सामन नु राये निधिमन नवन्नं करामहे सु पुरुधश्रवांसि | ता नो विश्वानि जरिता ममत्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम
transliteration: sāman nu rāye nidhiman nvannaṃ karāmahe su purudhaśravāṃsi | tā no viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām
translation: Here is the psalm for wealth, and food, in plenty: let us do many deeds to bring us glory. All these our doings shall delight the singer. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: अभी षवर्यः पौंस्यैर्भवेम दयौर्न भूमिं गिरयोनाज्रन | ता नो विश्वानि जरिता चिकेत परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम
transliteration: abhī ṣvaryaḥ pauṃsyairbhavema dyaurna bhūmiṃ ghirayonājran | tā no viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām
translation: May we o'ercome our foes with acts of valour, as heaven is over earth, hills over lowlands. All these our deeds the singer hath considered. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: मो षु णः सोम मर्त्यवे परा दाः पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम | दयुभिर्हितो जरिमा सू नो अस्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम
transliteration: mo ṣu ṇaḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam | dyubhirhito jarimā sū no astu parātaraṃ sunirtirjihītām
translation: Give us not up as prey to death, O Sorna still let us look upon the Sun arising. Let our old age with passing days be kindly. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: असुनीते मनो अस्मासु धारय जीवातवे सु पर तिरा नायुः | रारन्धि नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शि घर्तेन तवन्तन्वं वर्धयस्व
transliteration: asunīte mano asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tirā naāyuḥ | rārandhi naḥ sūryasya sandṛśi ghṛtena tvantanvaṃ vardhayasva
translation: O Asuniti, keep the soul within us, and make the days we have to live yet longer. Grant that we still may look upon the sunlight: strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: असुनीते पुनरस्मासु चक्षुः पुनः पराणमिह नो धेहिभोगम | जयोक पश्येम सूर्यमुच्चरन्तमनुमते मर्ळया नह्स्वस्ति
transliteration: asunīte punarasmāsu cakṣuḥ punaḥ prāṇamiha no dhehibhogham | jyok paśyema sūryamuccarantamanumate mṛḷayā nahsvasti
translation: Give us our sight again, O Asuniti, give us again our breath and our enjoyment. Long may we look upon the Sun uprising; O Anumati, favour thou and bless us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 59
sanskrit: पुनर्नो असुं पर्थिवी ददातु पुनर्द्यौर्देवी पुनरन्तरिक्षम | पुनर्नः सोमस्तन्वं ददातु पुनः पूषापथ्यां या सवस्तिः
transliteration: punarno asuṃ pṛthivī dadātu punardyaurdevī punarantarikṣam | punarnaḥ somastanvaṃ dadātu punaḥ pūṣāpathyāṃ yā svastiḥ
translation: May Earth restore to us our vital spirit, may Heaven the Goddess and mid-air restore it. May Soma give us once again our body, and Pusan show the Path of peace and comfort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: आ जनं तवेषसन्द्र्शं माहीनानामुपस्तुतम | अगन्मबिभ्रतो नमः
transliteration: aghanmabibhrato namaḥ
translation: BRINGING our homage we have come to one magnificent in look. Glorified of the mighty Gods

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: असमातिं नितोशनं तवेषं निययिनं रथम | भजेरथस्य सत्पतिम
transliteration: asamātiṃ nitośanaṃ tveṣaṃ niyayinaṃ ratham | bhajerathasya satpatim
translation: To Asamati, spring of gifts, lord of the brave, a radiant car, The conqueror of Bhajeratha

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यो जनान महिषानिवातितस्थौ पवीरवान | उतापवीरवान्युधा
transliteration: yo janān mahiṣānivātitasthau pavīravān | utāpavīravānyudhā
translation: Who, when the spear hath armed his hand, or even weaponless o'erthrows Men strong as buffaloes in fight;

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यस्येक्ष्वाकुरुप वरते रेवान मराय्येधते | दिवीवपञ्च कर्ष्टयः
transliteration: yasyekṣvākurupa vrate revān marāyyedhate | divīvapañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translation: Him in whose service flourishes Iksvaku, rich and dazzling-bright. As the Five Tribes that are in heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: इन्द्र कषत्रासमातिषु रथप्रोष्ठेषु धारय | दिवीवसूर्यं दर्शे
transliteration: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya | divīvasūryaṃ dṛśe
translation: Indra, support the princely power of Rathaprosthas matched by none, Even as the Sun for all to see.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अगस्त्यस्य नद्भ्यः सप्ती युनक्षि रोहिता | पणीन नयक्रमीरभि विश्वान राजन्नराधसः
transliteration: aghastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā | paṇīn nyakramīrabhi viśvān rājannarādhasaḥ
translation: Thou for Agastya's sister's sons yokest thy pair of ruddy steeds. Thou troddest niggards under foot, all those, O King, who brought no gifts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अयं मातायं पितायं जीवातुरागमत | इदं तवप्रसर्पणं सुबन्धवेहि निरिहि
transliteration: ayaṃ mātāyaṃ pitāyaṃ jīvāturāghamat | idaṃ tavaprasarpaṇaṃ subandhavehi nirihi
translation: This is the mother, this the sire, this one hath come to be thy life. What brings thee forth is even this. Now come, Subandhu, get thee forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यथा युगं वरत्रया नह्यन्ति धरुणाय कम | एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये
transliteration: yathā yughaṃ varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam | evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye
translation: As with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast, So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यथेयं पर्थिवी मही दाधारेमान वनस्पतीन | एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये
transliteration: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn | evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye
translation: Even as this earth, the mighty earth, holds fast the monarchs of the wood. So have I held thy spirit fast, held it for life and not for death, held it for thy security.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: यमादहं वैवस्वतात सुबन्धोर्मन आभरम | जीवातवेन मर्त्यवे.अथो अरिष्टतातये
transliteration: yamādahaṃ vaivasvatāt subandhormana ābharam | jīvātavena mṛtyave.atho ariṣṭatātaye
translation: Subandlin's spirit I have brought from Yarna, from Vivasvan's Son, Brought it for life and not for death, yea, brought it for security.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: नयग वातो.अव वाति नयक तपति सूर्यः | नीचीनमघ्न्यादुहे नयग भवतु ते रपः
transliteration: nyagh vāto.ava vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ | nīcīnamaghnyāduhe nyagh bhavatu te rapaḥ
translation: The wind blows downward from on high, downward the Sun-God sends his heat, Downward the milch-cow pours her milk: so downward go thy pain and grief.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 60
sanskrit: अयं मे हस्तो भगवानयं मे भगवत्तरः | अयं मेविश्वभेषजो.अयं शिवाभिमर्शनः
transliteration: ayaṃ me hasto bhaghavānayaṃ me bhaghavattaraḥ | ayaṃ meviśvabheṣajo.ayaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ
translation: Felicitous is this mine hand, yet more felicitous is this. This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 61
sanskrit: इदमित्था रौद्रं गूर्तवचा बरह्म करत्वा शच्यामन्तराजौ | कराणा यदस्य पितरा मंहनेष्ठाः पर्षत्पक्थे अहन्ना सप्त होतॄन
transliteration: idamitthā raudraṃ ghūrtavacā brahma kratvā śacyāmantarājau | krāṇā yadasya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣatpakthe ahannā sapta hotṝn
translation: THE welcome speaker in the storm of battle uttered with might this prayer to win the Asvins, When the most liberal God, for Paktha, rescued his parents, and assailed the seven Hotras.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 61
sanskrit: स इद दानाय दभ्याय वन्वञ्च्यवानः सूदैरमिमीतवेदिम | तूर्वयाणो गूर्तवचस्तमः कषोदो न रेत इतूतिसिञ्चत
transliteration: sa id dānāya dabhyāya vanvañcyavānaḥ sūdairamimītavedim | tūrigvedaayāṇo ghūrtavacastamaḥ kṣodo na reta itaūtisiñcat
translation: Cyavana, purposing deceptive presents, with all ingredients, made the altar ready. Most sweet-voiced Turvayana poured oblations like floods of widely fertilizing water.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 61
sanskrit: मनो न येषु हवनेषु तिग्मं विपः शच्या वनुथोद्रवन्ता | आ यः शर्यभिस्तुविन्र्म्णोस्याश्रीणीतादिशं गभस्तौ
transliteration: mano na yeṣu havaneṣu tighmaṃ vipaḥ śacyā vanuthodravantā |
translation: To his oblations, swift as thought, ye hurried, and welcomed eagerly the prayers he offered. With arrows in his hand the Very Mighty forced from him all obedience of a servant.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: ये यज्ञेन दक्षिणया समक्ता इन्द्रस्य सख्यमम्र्तत्वमानश | तेभ्यो भद्रमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः
transliteration: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktā indrasya sakhyamamṛtatvamānaśa | tebhyo bhadramaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
translation: YE, who, adorned with guerdon through the sacrifice, have won you Indra's friendship and eternal life, Even to you be happiness, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: य उदाजन पितरो गोमयं वस्व रतेनाभिन्दन परिवत्सरेवलम | दीर्घायुत्वमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः
transliteration: ya udājan pitaro ghomayaṃ vasv ṛtenābhindan parivatsarevalam | dīrghāyutvamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
translation: The Fathers, who drave forth the wealth in cattle, have in the year's courses cleft Vala by Eternal Law: A lengthened life be yours, O ye Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: य रतेन सूर्यमारोहयन दिव्यप्रथयन पर्थिवीं मातरंवि | सुप्रजास्त्वमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीत मानवंसुमेधसः
transliteration: ya ṛtena sūryamārohayan divyaprathayan pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃvi | suprajāstvamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇīta mānavaṃsumedhasaḥ
translation: Ye raised the Sun to heaven by everlasting Law, and spread broad earth, the Mother, out on every side. Fair wealth of progeny be yours, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: अयं नाभा वदति वल्गु वो गर्हे देवपुत्रा रषयस्तच्छ्र्णोतन | सुब्रह्मण्यमङगिरसो वो अस्तु परति गर्भ्णीतमानवं सुमेधसः
transliteration: ayaṃ nābhā vadati valghu vo ghṛhe devaputrā ṛṣayastacchṛṇotana | subrahmaṇyamaṅghiraso vo astu prati ghṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
translation: This kinsman in your dwelling place speaks pleasant words: give car to this, ye Rsis, children of the Gods. High Brahman dignity be yours, Angirases. Welcome the son of Manu, ye who are most wise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: विरूपास इद रषयस्त इद गम्भीरवेपसः | ते अङगिरसःसूनवस्ते अग्नेः परि जज्ञिरे
transliteration: virūpāsa id ṛṣayasta id ghambhīravepasaḥ | te aṅghirasaḥsūnavaste aghneḥ pari jajñire
translation: Distinguished by their varied form, these Rsis have been deeply moved. These are the sons of Angirases: from Agni have they sprung to life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: ये अग्नेः परि जज्ञिरे विरूपासो दिवस परि | नवग्वो नुदशग्वो अङगिरस्तमो सचा देवेषु मंअते
transliteration: ye aghneḥ pari jajñire virūpāso divas pari | navaghvo nudaśaghvo aṅghirastamo sacā deveṣu maṃate
translation: Distinguished by their varied form, they sprang from Agni, from the sky. Navagva and Dasagva, noblest Angiras, he giveth bounty with the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: इन्द्रेण युजा निः सर्जन्त वाघतो वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनम | सहस्रं मे ददतो अष्टकर्ण्यः शरवो देवेष्वक्रत
transliteration: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghato vrajaṃ ghomantamaśvinam | sahasraṃ me dadato aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravo deveṣvakrata
translation: With Indra for associate the priests have cleared the stable full of steeds and kine, Giving to me a thousand with their eight marked cars, they gained renown among the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: पर नूनं जायतामयं मनुस्तोक्मेव रोहतु | यः सहस्रंशताश्वं सद्यो दानाय मंहते
transliteration: pra nūnaṃ jāyatāmayaṃ manustokmeva rohatu | yaḥ sahasraṃśatāśvaṃ sadyo dānāya maṃhate
translation: May this man's sons be multiplied; like springing corn may Manu grow, Who gives at once in bounteous gift a thousand kine, a hundred steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: न तमश्नोति कश्चन दिव इव सान्वारभम | सावर्ण्यस्य दक्षिणा वि सिन्धुरिव पप्रथे
transliteration: na tamaśnoti kaścana diva iva sānvārabham | sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhuriva paprathe
translation: No one attains to him, as though a man would grasp the heights of heaven. Savarnya's sacrificial meed hath broadened like an ample flood.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: उत दासा परिविषे समद्दिष्टी गोपरीणसा | यदुस्तुर्वश्च मामहे
transliteration: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī ghoparīṇasā | yadusturigvedaaśca māmahe
translation: Yadu and Turva, too, have given two Dasas, well-disposed, to serve, Together with great store of kine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 62
sanskrit: सहस्रदा गरामणीर्मा रिषन मनुः सूर्येणास्ययतमानैतु दक्षिणा | सावर्णेर्देवाः पर तिरन्त्वायुर्यस्मिन्नश्रान्ता असनाम वाजम
transliteration: sahasradā ghrāmaṇīrmā riṣan manuḥ sūryeṇāsyayatamānaitu dakṣiṇā | sāvarṇerdevāḥ pra tirantvāyuryasminnaśrāntā asanāma vājam
translation: Blest be the hamlet's chief, most liberal Manu, and may his bounty rival that of Surya. May the God let Ssvarni's life be lengthened, with whom, unwearied, we have lived and prospered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: परावतो ये दिधिषन्त आप्यं मनुप्रीतासो जनिमाविवस्वतः | ययातेर्ये नहुष्यस्य बर्हिषि देवा आसते तेधि बरुवन्तु नः
transliteration: parāvato ye didhiṣanta āpyaṃ manuprītāso janimāvivasvataḥ | yayāterye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devā āsate teadhi bruvantu naḥ
translation: MAY they who would assume kinship from far away, Vivasvan's generations, dearly loved of men, Even the Gods who sit upon the sacred grass of Nahusa's son Yayati, bless and comfort us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: विश्वा हि वो नमस्यानि वन्द्या नामानि देवा उत यज्ञियानिवः | ये सथ जाता अदितेरब्ध्यस परि ये पर्थिव्यास्तेम इह शरुता हवम
transliteration: viśvā hi vo namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devā uta yajñiyānivaḥ | ye stha jātā aditerabdhyas pari ye pṛthivyāstema iha śrutā havam
translation: For worthy of obeisance, Gods, are all your names, worthy of adoration and of sacrifice. Ye who were born from waters, and from Aditi, and from the earth, do ye here listen to my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: येभ्यो माता मधुमत पिन्वते पयः पीयूषं दयौरदितिरद्रिबर्हाः | उक्थशुष्मान वर्षभरान सवप्नसस्तानादित्याननु मदा सवस्तये
transliteration: yebhyo mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣaṃ dyauraditiradribarhāḥ | ukthaśuṣmān vṛṣabharān svapnasastānādityānanu madā svastaye
translation: I will rejoice in these Adityas for my weal, for whom the Mother pours forth water rich in balm, And Dyaus the Infinite, firm as a rock, sweet milk,-Gods active, strong through lauds, whose might the Bull upholds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: नर्चक्षसो अनिमिषन्तो अर्हणा बर्हद देवासो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः | जयोतीरथा अहिमाया अनागसो दिवो वर्ष्माणंवसते सवस्तये
transliteration: nṛcakṣaso animiṣanto arhaṇā bṛhad devāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ | jyotīrathā ahimāyā anāghaso divo varṣmāṇaṃvasate svastaye
translation: Looking on men, ne'er slumbering, they by their deserts attained as Gods to lofty immortality. Borne on refulgent cars, sinless, with serpents' powers, they robe them, for our welfare, in the height of heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: सम्राजो ये सुव्र्धो यज्ञमाययुरपरिह्व्र्ता दधिरे दिविक्षयम | ताना विवास नमसा सुव्र्क्तिभिर्महो आदित्यानदितिं सवस्तये
transliteration: samrājo ye suvṛdho yajñamāyayuraparihvṛtā dadhire divikṣayam | tānā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhirmaho ādityānaditiṃ svastaye
translation: Great Kings who bless us, who have come to sacrifice, who, ne'er assailed, have set their mansion in the sky, These I invite with adoration and with hymns, mighty Adityas, Aditi, for happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: को व सतोमं राधति यं जुजोषथ विश्वे देवासो मनुषोयति षठन | को वो.अध्वरं तुविजाता अरं करद यो नःपर्षदत्यंहः सवस्तये
transliteration: ko va stomaṃ rādhati yaṃ jujoṣatha viśve devāso manuṣoyati ṣṭhana | ko vo.adhvaraṃ tuvijātā araṃ karad yo naḥparṣadatyaṃhaḥ svastaye
translation: Who offereth to you the laud that ye accept, O ye All-Gods of Manu, many as ye are? Who, Mighty Ones, will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: येभ्यो होत्रां परथमामायेजे मनुः समिद्धाग्निर्मनसासप्त होत्र्भिः | त आदित्या अभयं शर्म यछत सुगा नःकर्त सुपथा सवस्तये
transliteration: yebhyo hotrāṃ prathamāmāyeje manuḥ samiddhāghnirmanasāsapta hotṛbhiḥ | ta ādityā abhayaṃ śarma yachata sughā naḥkarta supathā svastaye
translation: Ye to whom Manu, by seven priests, with kindled fire, offered the first oblation with his heart and soul, Vouchsafe us, ye Adityas, sheitcr free from fear, and make us good and easy paths to happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: य ईशिरे भुवनस्य परचेतसो विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्चमन्तवः | ते नः कर्तादक्र्तादेनसस पर्यद्या देवासःपिप्र्ता सवस्तये
transliteration: ya īśire bhuvanasya pracetaso viśvasya sthāturjaghataścamantavaḥ | te naḥ kṛtādakṛtādenasas paryadyā devāsaḥpipṛtā svastaye
translation: Wise Deities, who have dominion o'er the world, ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves, Save us from uncommitted and committed sin, preserve us from all sin to-day for happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: भरेष्विन्द्रं सुहवं हवामहे.अंहोमुचं सुक्र्तन्दैव्यं जनम | अग्निं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगन्द्यावाप्र्थिवी मरुतः सवस्तये
transliteration: bhareṣvindraṃ suhavaṃ havāmahe.aṃhomucaṃ sukṛtandaivyaṃ janam | aghniṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhaghandyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye
translation: In battles we invoke Indra still swift to hear, and all the holy Host of Heaven who banish grief, Agni, Mitra, and Varuna that we may gain, Dyays, Bhaga, Maruts, Prthivi for happiness:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: सुत्रामाणं पर्थिवीं दयामनेहसं सुशर्माणमदितिंसुप्रणीतिम | दैवीं नावं सवरित्रामनागसमस्रवन्तीमा रुहेमा सवस्तये
transliteration: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyāmanehasaṃ suśarmāṇamaditiṃsupraṇītim | daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrāmanāghasamasravantīmā ruhemā svastaye
translation: Mightily-saving Earth, incomparable Heaven the good guide Aditi who gives secure defense The well-oared heavenly Ship that lets no waters in, free from defect, will we ascend for happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: विश्वे यजत्रा अधि वोचतोतये तरायध्वं नो दुरेवायाभिह्रुतः | सत्यया वो देवहूत्या हुवेम शर्ण्वतो देवावसे सवस्तये
transliteration: viśve yajatrā adhi vocatotaye trāyadhvaṃ no durevāyāabhihrutaḥ | satyayā vo devahūtyā huvema śṛṇvato devāavase svastaye
translation: Bless us, all Holy Ones, that we may have your help, guard and protect us from malignant injury. With fruitful invocation may we call on you, Gods, who give ear to us for grace, for happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 63
sanskrit: अपामीवामप विश्वामनाहुतिमपारातिं दुर्विदत्रामघायतः | आरे देवा दवेषो अस्मद युयोतनोरु णः शर्मयछता सवस्तये
transliteration: apāmīvāmapa viśvāmanāhutimapārātiṃ durigvedadatrāmaghāyataḥ |
translation: Keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice, keep off the wicked man's malicious enmity. Keep far away from us all hatred, O ye Gods, and give us ample shelter for our happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: कथा देवानां कतमस्य यामनि सुमन्तु नाम शर्ण्वताम्मनामहे | को मर्ळाति कतमो नो मयस करत कतम ऊती अभ्या ववर्तति
transliteration: kathā devānāṃ katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatāmmanāmahe | ko mṛḷāti katamo no mayas karat katama ūtī abhyā vavartati
translation: WHAT God, of those who hear, is he whose well-praised name we may record in this our sacrifice; and how? Who will be gracious? Who of many give us bliss? Who out of all the Host will come to lend us aid?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: करतूयन्ति करतवो हर्त्सु धीतयो वेनन्ति वेनाः पतयन्त्या दिशः | न मर्डिता विद्यते अन्य एभ्यो देवेषु मे अधिकामा अयंसत
transliteration: kratūyanti kratavo hṛtsu dhītayo venanti venāḥ patayantyā diśaḥ | na marḍitā vidyate anya ebhyo deveṣu me adhikāmā ayaṃsata
translation: The will and thoughts within my breast exert their power: they yearn with love, and fly to all the regions round. None other comforter is found save only these: my longings and my hopes are fixt upon the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: नरा वा शंसं पूषणमगोह्यमग्निं देवेद्धमभ्यर्चसे गिरा | सूर्यामासा चन्द्रमसा यमं दिवि तरितंवातमुषसमक्तुमश्विना
transliteration: narā vā śaṃsaṃ pūṣaṇamaghohyamaghniṃ deveddhamabhyarcase ghirā | sūryāmāsā candramasā yamaṃ divi tritaṃvātamuṣasamaktumaśvinā
translation: To Narasamsa and to Pusan I sing forth, unconcealable Agni kindled by the Gods. To Sun and Moon, two Moons, to Yama in the heaven, to Trita, Vata, Dawn, Night, and the Atvins Twain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: कथा कविस्तुवीरवान कया गिरा बर्हस्पतिर्वाव्र्धतेसुव्र्क्तिभिः | अज एकपात सुहवेभिरकवभिरहिः शर्णोतुबुध्न्यो हवीमनि
transliteration: kathā kavistuvīravān kayā ghirā bṛhaspatirigvedaāvṛdhatesuvṛktibhiḥ | aja ekapāt suhavebhirkvabhirahiḥ śṛṇotubudhnyo havīmani
translation: How is the Sage extolled whom the loud singers praise? What voice, what hymn is used to laud Brhaspati? May Aja-Ekapad with Rkvans swift to hear, and Ahi of the Deep listen unto our call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: दक्षस्य वादिते जन्मनि वरते राजाना मित्रावरुणाविवाससि | अतूर्तपन्थाः पुरुरथो अर्यमा सप्तहोताविषुरूपेषु जन्मसु
transliteration: dakṣasya vādite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇāvivāsasi | atūrtapanthāḥ pururatho aryamā saptahotāviṣurūpeṣu janmasu
translation: Aditi, to the birth of Daksa and the vow thou summonest the Kings Mitra and Varuna. With course unchecked, with many chariots Aryaman comes with the seven priests to tribes of varied sort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: ते नो अर्वन्तो हवनश्रुतो हवं विश्वे शर्ण्वन्तु वाजिनोमितद्रवः | सहस्रसा मेधसाताविव तमना महो येधनं समिथेषु जभ्रिरे
transliteration: te no arigvedaanto havanaśruto havaṃ viśve śṛṇvantu vājinomitadravaḥ | sahasrasā medhasātāviva tmanā maho yedhanaṃ samitheṣu jabhrire
translation: May all those vigorous Coursers listen to our cry, hearers of invocation, speeding on their way; Winners of thousands where the priestly meed is won, who gather of themselves great wealth in every race.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: पर वो वायुं रथयुजं पुरन्धिं सतोमैः कर्णुध्वंसख्याय पूषणम | ते हि देवस्य सवितुः सवीमनिक्रतुं सचन्ते सचितः सचेतसः
transliteration: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ purandhiṃ stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃsakhyāya pūṣaṇam | te hi devasya savituḥ savīmanikratuṃ sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ
translation: Bring ye Purandbi, bring Vayu who yokes his steeds, for friendship bring ye Pusan with your songs of praise: They with one mind, one thought attend the sacrifice, urged by the favouring aid of Savitar the God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: तरिः सप्त सस्रा नद्यो महीरपो वनस्पतीन पर्वतानग्निमूतये | कर्शानुमस्तॄन तिष्यं सधस्थ आ रुद्रंरुद्रेषु रुद्रियं हवामहे
transliteration: triḥ sapta sasrā nadyo mahīrapo vanaspatīn parigvedaatānaghnimūtaye | kṛśānumastṝn tiṣyaṃ sadhastha ā rudraṃrudreṣu rudriyaṃ havāmahe
translation: The thrice-seven wandering Rivers, yea, the mighty floods, the forest trees, the mountains, Agni to our aid, Krsanu, Tisya, archers to our gathering-place, and Rudra strong amid the Rudras we invoke.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: सरस्वती सरयुः सिन्धुरूर्मिभिर्महो महीरवसा यन्तुवक्षणीः | देवीरापो मातरः सूदयित्न्वो घर्तवत पयोमधुमन नो अर्चत
transliteration: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhurūrmibhirmaho mahīravasā yantuvakṣaṇīḥ | devīrāpo mātaraḥ sūdayitnvo ghṛtavat payomadhuman no arcata
translation: Let the great Streams come hither with their mighty help, Sindhu, Sarasvati, and Sarayu with waves. Ye Goddess Floods, ye Mothers, animating all, promise us water rich in fatness and in balm.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 64
sanskrit: उत माता बर्हद्दिवा शर्णोतु नस्त्वष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिःपिता वचः | रभुक्षा वाजो रथस्पतिर्भगो रण्वःशण्सः शशमानस्य पातु नः
transliteration: uta mātā bṛhaddivā śṛṇotu nastvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥpitā vacaḥ |
translation: And let Brhaddiva, the Mother, hear our call, and Tvastar, Father, with the Goddesses and Dames. Rbhuksan, Vaja, Bhaga, and Rathaspati, and the sweet speech of him who labours guard us well!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 65
sanskrit: अग्निरिन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वायुः पूषा सरस्वतीसजोषसः | आदित्या विष्णुर्मरुतः सवर्ब्र्हत सोमो रुद्रोदितिर्ब्रह्मणस पतिः
transliteration: aghnirindro varuṇo mitro aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatīsajoṣasaḥ |
translation: MAY Agni, Indra, Mitra, Varuna consent, Aryaman, Vayu, Pusan, and Sarasvati, Adityas, Maruts, Visnu, Soma, lofty Sky, Rudra and Aditi, and Brahmanaspati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: देवान हुवे बर्हच्छ्रवसः सवस्तये जयोतिष्क्र्तो अध्वरस्यप्रचेतसः | ये वाव्र्धुः परतरं विश्ववेदसैन्द्रज्येष्ठासो अम्र्ता रताव्र्धः
transliteration: devān huve bṛhacchravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛto adhvarasyapracetasaḥ | ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataraṃ viśvavedasaindrajyeṣṭhāso amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translation: I CALL the Gods of lofty glory for our weal, the makers of the light, well-skilled in sacrifice; Those who have waxen mightily, Masters of all wealth, Immortal, strengthening Law, the Gods whom Indra leads.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: इन्द्रप्रसूता वरुणप्रशिष्टा ये सूर्यस्य जयोतिषो भागमानशुः | मरुद्गणे वर्जने मन्म धीमहि माघोने यज्ञंजनयन्त सूरयः
transliteration: indraprasūtā varuṇapraśiṣṭā ye sūryasya jyotiṣo bhāghamānaśuḥ | marudghaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṃjanayanta sūrayaḥ
translation: For the strong band of Maruts will we frame a hymn: the chiefs shall bring forth sacrifice for Indra's troop, Who, sent by Indra and advised by Varuna, have gotten for themselves a share of Surya's light

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: इन्द्रो वसुभिः परि पातु नो गयमादित्यैर्नो अदितः शर्मयछ्तु | रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्देवो मर्ळयाति नस्त्वष्टा नोग्नाभिः सुविताय जिन्वतु
transliteration: indro vasubhiḥ pari pātu no ghayamādityairno aditḥ śarmayachtu | rudro rudrebhirdevo mṛḷayāti nastvaṣṭā noghnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu
translation: May Indra with the Vasus keep our dwelling safe, and Aditi with Adityas lend us sure defence. May the God Rudra with the Rudras favour us, and Tvastar with the Dames further us to success.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: अदितिर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी रतं महदिन्द्राविष्णू मरुतःस्वर्ब्र्हत | देवानादित्यानवसे हवामहे वसून रुद्रांसवितारं सुदंससम
transliteration: aditirdyāvāpṛthivī ṛtaṃ mahadindrāviṣṇū marutaḥsvarbṛhat | devānādityānavase havāmahe vasūn rudrāṃsavitāraṃ sudaṃsasam
translation: Aditi, Heaven and Earth, the great eternal Law, Indra, Visnu, the Maruts, and the lofty Sky. We call upon Adityas, on the Gods, for help, on Vasus, Rudras, Savitar of wondrous deeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: सरस्वान धीभिर्वरुणो धर्तव्रतः पूषा विष्णुर्महिमावायुरश्विना | बरह्मक्र्तो अम्र्ता विश्ववेदसः शर्म नोयंसन तरिवरूथमंहसः
transliteration: sarasvān dhībhirigvedaaruṇo dhṛtavratḥ pūṣā viṣṇurmahimāvāyuraśvinā | brahmakṛto amṛtā viśvavedasaḥ śarma noyaṃsan trivarūthamaṃhasaḥ
translation: With Holy Thoughts Sarasvan, firm-lawed Varuna, great Vayu, Pusan, Visnu, and the Asvins Twain, Lords of all wealth, Immortal, furtherers of prayer, grant us a triply-guarding refuge from distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: वर्षा यज्ञो वर्षणः सन्तु यज्ञिया वर्षणो देवाव्र्षणो हविष्क्र्तः | वर्षणा दयावाप्र्थिवी रतावरीव्र्षा पर्जन्यो वर्षणो वर्षस्तुभः
transliteration: vṛṣā yajño vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyā vṛṣaṇo devāvṛṣaṇo haviṣkṛtaḥ | vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarīvṛṣā parjanyo vṛṣaṇo vṛṣastubhaḥ
translation: Strong be the sacrifice, strong be the Holy Ones, strong the preparers of oblation, strong the Gods. Mighty be Heaven and Earth, true to eternal Law, strong be Parjanya, strong be they who laud the Strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: अग्नीषोमा वर्षणा वाजसातये पुरुप्रशस्ता वर्षणा उपब्रुवे | यावीजिरे वर्षणो देवयज्यया ता नः शर्मत्रिवरूथं वि यंसतः
transliteration: aghnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye purupraśastā vṛṣaṇā upabruve | yāvījire vṛṣaṇo devayajyayā tā naḥ śarmatrivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsataḥ
translation: To win us strength I glorify the Mighty Twain, Agni and Soma, Mighty Ones whom many laud. May these vouchsafe us shelter with a triple guard, these whom the strong have served in worship of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: धर्तव्रताः कषत्रिया यज्ञनिष्क्र्तो बर्हद्दिवा अध्वराणामभिश्रियः | अग्निहोतार रतसापो अद्रुहो.अपो अस्र्जन्ननुव्र्त्रतूर्ये
transliteration: dhṛtavratāḥ kṣatriyā yajñaniṣkṛto bṛhaddivā adhvarāṇāmabhiśriyaḥ | aghnihotāra ṛtasāpo adruho.apo asṛjannanuvṛtratūrye
translation: Potent, with firm-fixt laws, arranging sacrifice, visiting solemn rites in splendour of the day, Obeying Order, these whose priest is Agni, free from falsehood, poured the waters out when Vrtra died.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: दयावाप्र्थिवी जनयन्नभि वरताप ओषधीर्वनिनानियज्ञिया | अन्तरिक्षं सवरा पप्रुरूतये वशं देवासस्तन्वी नि माम्र्जुः
transliteration: dyāvāpṛthivī janayannabhi vratāpa oṣadhīrigvedaanināniyajñiyā | antarikṣaṃ svarā paprurūtaye vaśaṃ devāsastanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
translation: The Holy Ones engendered, for their several laws, the heavens and earth, the waters, and the plants and trees. They filled the firmament with heavenly light for help: the Gods embodied Wish and made it beautiful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 66
sanskrit: धर्तारो दिव रभवः सुहस्ता वातापर्जन्या महिषस्यतन्यतोः | आप ओषधीः पर तिरन्तु नो गिरो भगो रातिर्वाजिनो यन्तु मे हवम
transliteration: dhartāro diva ṛbhavaḥ suhastā vātāparjanyā mahiṣasyatanyatoḥ |
translation: May they who bear up heaven, the Rbhus deft of hand, and Vata and Parjanya of the thundering Bull, The waters and the plants, promote the songs we sing: come Bhaga, Rati, and the Vaijns to my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 67
sanskrit: इमां धियं सप्तशीर्ष्णीं पिता न रतप्रजातां बर्हतीमविन्दत | तुरीयं सविज्जनयद विश्वजन्यो.अयास्य उक्थमिन्द्राय शंसन
transliteration: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīṃ pitā na ṛtaprajātāṃ bṛhatīmavindat | turīyaṃ svijjanayad viśvajanyo.ayāsya ukthamindrāya śaṃsan
translation: THIS holy hymn, sublime and seven headed, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered. Ayasya, friend of all men, hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 68
sanskrit: उदप्रुतो न वयो रक्षमाणा वावदतो अभ्रियस्येव घोषाः | गिरिभ्रजो नोर्मयो मदन्तो बर्हस्पतिमभ्यर्का अनावन
transliteration: udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ | ghiribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatimabhyarkā anāvan
translation: LIKE birds who keep their watch, plashing in water, like the loud voices of the thundering rain-cloud, Like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain, thus to Brhaspati our hymns have sounded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 68
sanskrit: सं गोभिराङगिरसो नक्षमाणो भग इवेदर्यमणंनिनाय | जने मित्रो न दम्पती अनक्ति बर्हस्पतेवाजयाशून्रिवाजौ
transliteration: saṃ ghobhirāṅghiraso nakṣamāṇo bhagha ivedaryamaṇaṃnināya | jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspatevājayāśūnrivājau
translation: The Son of Angirases, meeting the cattle, as Bhaga, brought in Aryaman among us. As Friend of men he decks the wife and husband: as for the race, Brhaspati, nerve our coursers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 68
sanskrit: साध्वर्या अतिथिनीरिषिरा सपार्हाः सुवर्णानवद्यरूपाः | बर्हस्पतिः पर्वते भयो वितूर्या निर्गाूपे यवमिव सथिविभ्यः
transliteration: sādhvaryā atithinīriṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāanavadyarūpāḥ | bṛhaspatiḥ parigvedaate bhyo vitūryā nirghāūpe yavamiva sthivibhyaḥ
translation: Brhaspati, having won them from the mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowing- baskets, The vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless form, well-coloured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 69
sanskrit: भद्रा अग्नेर्वध्र्यश्वस्य सन्द्र्शो वामी परणीतिःसुरणा उपेतयः | यदीं सुमित्रा विशो अग्र इन्धतेघ्र्तेनाहुतो जरते दविद्युतत
transliteration: bhadrā aghnerigvedaadhryaśvasya sandṛśo vāmī praṇītiḥsuraṇā upetayaḥ | yadīṃ sumitrā viśo aghra indhateghṛtenāhuto jarate davidyutat
translation: Auspicious is the aspect of Vadhryasva's fire good is its guidance, pleasant are its visitings. When first the people Of Sumitra kindle it, with butter poured thereon it crackles and shines bright.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 69
sanskrit: घर्तमग्नेर्वध्र्यश्वस्य वर्धनं घर्तमन्नं घर्तं वस्य मेदनम | घर्तेनाहुत उर्विया वि पप्रथे सूर्य इवरोचते सर्पिरासुतिः
transliteration: ghṛtamaghnerigvedaadhryaśvasya vardhanaṃ ghṛtamannaṃ ghṛtaṃ vasya medanam | ghṛtenāhuta urigvedayā vi paprathe sūrya ivarocate sarpirāsutiḥ
translation: Butter is that which makes Vadhryaiva's fire growstrong: the butter is its food, the butter makes it fat. It spreads abroad when butter hath been offered it, and balmed with streams of butter shines forth like the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 69
sanskrit: यत ते मनुर्यदनीकं सुमित्रः समीधे अग्ने तदिदंनवीयः | स रेवच्छोच स गिरो जुषस्व स वाजं दर्षिस इह शरवो धाः
transliteration: yat te manuryadanīkaṃ sumitraḥ samīdhe aghne tadidaṃnavīyaḥ | sa revacchoca sa ghiro juṣasva sa vājaṃ darṣisa iha śravo dhāḥ
translation: Still newest is this face of thine, O Agni, which Manu and Sumitra have enkindled. So richly shine, accept our songs with favour, so give us strengthening food, so send us glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 69
sanskrit: यं तवा पूर्वमीळितो वध्र्यश्वः समीधे अग्ने स इदंजुषस्व | स न सतिपा उत भवा तनूपा दात्रं रक्षस्वयदिदं ते अस्मे
transliteration: yaṃ tvā pūrigvedaamīḷito vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe aghne sa idaṃjuṣasva | sa na stipā uta bhavā tanūpā dātraṃ rakṣasvayadidaṃ te asme
translation: Accept this offering, Agni, whom aforetime Vadhryasva, hath entreated and enkindled. Guard well our homes and ople, guard our bodies, protect thy girt to us which thou hast granted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 69
sanskrit: भवा दयुम्नी वाध्र्यश्वोत गोपा मा तवा तारीदभिमातिर्जनानाम | शूर इव धर्ष्णुश्च्यवनः सुमित्रः पर नुवोचं वाध्र्यश्वस्य नाम
transliteration: bhavā dyumnī vādhryaśvota ghopā mā tvā tārīdabhimātirjanānām |
translation: Be splendid, guard us Kinsman of Vadhryasva: let not the enmity of men o'ercome thee, Like the bold hero Cyavana, I Sumitra tell forth the title of Vadhryaiva's Kinsman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 70
sanskrit: इमां मे अग्ने समिधं जुषस्वेळस पदे परति हर्याघ्र्ताचीम | वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्याः सुदिनत्वे अह्नामूर्ध्वोभव सुक्रतो देवयज्या
transliteration: imāṃ me aghne samidhaṃ juṣasveḷas pade prati haryāghṛtācīm | varṣman pṛthivyāḥ sudinatve ahnāmūrdhvobhava sukrato devayajyā
translation: ENJOY, O Agni, this my Fuel, welcome the oil-filled ladle where we pour libation. Rise up for worship of the Gods, wise Agni, on the earth's height, while days are bright with beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परथमं वाचो अग्रं यत परैरत नामधेयन्दधानाः | यदेषां शरेष्ठं यदरिप्रमासीत्प्रेणा तदेषां निहितं गुहाविः
transliteration: bṛhaspate prathamaṃ vāco aghraṃ yat prairata nāmadheyandadhānāḥ | yadeṣāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ yadaripramāsītpreṇā tadeṣāṃ nihitaṃ ghuhāviḥ
translation: WHEN-men, Brhaspati, giving names to objects, sent out Vak's first and earliest utterances, All that was excellent and spotless, treasured within them, was disclosed through their affection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: सक्तुमिव-तित-उना पुनन्तो यत्र धीरा मनसा वाचमक्रत | अत्रा सखायः सख्यानि जानते भद्रैषांलक्ष्मीर्निहिताधि वाचि
transliteration: saktumiva-tita-unā punanto yatra dhīrā manasā vācamakrata | atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadraiṣāṃlakṣmīrnihitādhi vāci
translation: Where, like men cleansing corn-flour in a cribble, the wise in spirit have created language, Friends see and recognize the marks of friendship: their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: यज्ञेन वाचः पदवीयमायन तामन्वविन्दन्न्र्षिषुप्रविष्टाम | तामाभ्र्त्या वयदधुः पुरुत्रा तां सप्तरेभा अभि सं नवन्ते
transliteration: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyamāyan tāmanvavindannṛṣiṣupraviṣṭām | tāmābhṛtyā vyadadhuḥ purutrā tāṃ saptarebhā abhi saṃ navante
translation: With sacrifice the trace of Vak they followed, and found her harbouring within the Rsis. They brought her, dealt her forth in many places: seven singers make her tones resound in concert.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उत तवः पश्यन न ददर्श वाचमुत तवः शर्ण्वन नश्र्णोत्येनाम | उतो तवस्मै तन्वं वि सस्रे जायेव पत्यौशती सुवासाः
transliteration: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācamuta tvaḥ śṛṇvan naśṛṇotyenām | uto tvasmai tanvaṃ vi sasre jāyeva patyauśatī suvāsāḥ
translation: One man hath ne'er seen Vak, and yet he seeth: one man hath hearing but hath never heard her. But to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond well-dressed woman to her husband.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: उत तवं सख्ये सथिरपीतमाहुर्नैनं हिन्वन्त्यपिवाजिनेषु | अधेन्वा चरति माययैष वाचं शुश्रुवानफलामपुष्पाम
transliteration: uta tvaṃ sakhye sthirapītamāhurnainaṃ hinvantyapivājineṣu | adhenvā carati māyayaiṣa vācaṃ śuśruvānaphalāmapuṣpām
translation: One man they call a laggard, dull in friendship: they never urge him on to deeds of valour. He wanders on in profitless illusion: the Voice he heard yields neither fruit, nor blossom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: यस्तित्याज सचिविदं सखायं न तस्य वाच्यपि भागोस्ति | यदीं शर्णोत्यलकं शर्णोति नहि परवेद सुक्र्तस्यपन्थाम
transliteration: yastityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācyapi bhāghoasti | yadīṃ śṛṇotyalakaṃ śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasyapanthām
translation: No part in Vak hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship. Even if he hears her still in vain he listens: naught knows he of the path of righteous action.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 71
sanskrit: अक्षण्वन्तः कर्णवन्तः सखायो मनोजवेष्वसमाबभूवुः | आदघ्नास उपकक्षास उ तवे हरदा इव सनात्वा उत्वे दद्र्श्रे
transliteration: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyo manojaveṣvasamābabhūvuḥ |
translation: Unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing. Some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder, others like pools of water fit to bathe in.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: देवानां नु वयं जाना पर वोचाम विपन्यया | उक्थेषुशस्यमानेषु यः पश्यादुत्तरे युगे
transliteration: devānāṃ nu vayaṃ jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā | uktheṣuśasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāduttare yughe
translation: LET US with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the Gods, That one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: बरह्मणस पतिरेता सं कर्मार इवाधमत | देवानाम्पूर्व्ये युगे.असतः सदजायत
transliteration: brahmaṇas patiretā saṃ karmāra ivādhamat | devānāmpūrigvedaye yughe.asataḥ sadajāyata
translation: These Brahmanaspati produced with blast and smelting, like a Smith, Existence, in an earlier age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: देवानां युगे परथमे.असतः सदजायत | तदाशा अन्वजायन्त तदुत्तानपदस परि
transliteration: devānāṃ yughe prathame.asataḥ sadajāyata | tadāśā anvajāyanta taduttānapadas pari
translation: Existence, in the earliest age of Gods, from Non-existence sprang. Thereafter were the regions born. This sprang from the Productive Power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: भूर्जज्ञ उत्तानपदो भुव आशा अजायन्त | अदितेर्दक्षोजायत दक्षाद वदितिः परि
transliteration: bhūrjajña uttānapado bhuva āśā ajāyanta | aditerdakṣoajāyata dakṣād vaditiḥ pari
translation: Earth sprang from the Productive Power the regions from the earth were born. Daksa was born of Aditi, and Aditi was Daksa's Child.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: अदितिर्ह्यजनिष्ट दक्ष या दुहिता तव | तां देवान्वजायन्त भद्रा अम्र्तबन्धवः
transliteration: aditirhyajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava | tāṃ devāanvajāyanta bhadrā amṛtabandhavaḥ
translation: For Aditi, O Daksa, she who is thy Daughter, was brought forth. After her were the blessed Gods born sharers of immortal life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: यद देवा अदः सलिले सुसंरब्धा अतिष्ठत | अत्रा वोन्र्त्यतामिव तीव्रो रेणुरपायत
transliteration: yad devā adaḥ salile susaṃrabdhā atiṣṭhata | atrā vonṛtyatāmiva tīvro reṇurapāyata
translation: When ye, O Gods, in yonder deep close clasping one another stood, Thence, as of dancers, from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: यद देवा यतयो यथा भुवनान्यपिन्वत | अत्रा समुद्रा गूळमा सूर्यमजभर्तन
transliteration: yad devā yatayo yathā bhuvanānyapinvata | atrā samudraā ghūḷamā sūryamajabhartana
translation: When, O ye Gods, like Yatis, ye caused all existing things to grow, Then ye brought Surya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: अष्टौ पुत्रासो अदितेर्ये जातास्तन्वस परि | देवानुपप्रैत सप्तभिः परा मार्ताण्डमास्यत
transliteration: aṣṭau putrāso aditerye jātāstanvas pari | devānupaprait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍamāsyat
translation: Eight are the Sons of Aditi who from her body sprang to life. With seven she went to meet the Gods she cast Martanda far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 72
sanskrit: सप्तभिः पुत्रैरदितिरुप परैत पूर्व्यं युगम | परजायै मर्त्यवे तवत पुनर्मार्ताण्डमाभरत
transliteration: saptabhiḥ putrairaditirupa prait pūrigvedayaṃ yugham | prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punarmārtāṇḍamābharat
translation: So with her Seven Sons Aditi went forth to meet the earlier age. She brought Martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 73
sanskrit: जनिष्था उग्रः सहसे तुराय मन्द्र ओजिष्ठोबहुलाभिमानः | अवर्धन्निन्द्रं मरुतश्चिदत्र मातायद वीरं दधनद धनिष्ठा
transliteration: janiṣthā ughraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭhobahulābhimānaḥ | avardhannindraṃ marutaścidatra mātāyad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā
translation: THOU wast born mighty for victorious valour, exulting, strongest, full of pride and courage. There, even there, the Maruts strengthened Indra when. his most rapid Mother stirred the Hero.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 73
sanskrit: दरुहो निषत्ता पर्शनी चिदेवैः पुरू शंसेन वाव्र्धुष्ट इन्द्रम | अभीव्र्तेव ता महापदेन धवान्तात परपित्वादुदरन्त गर्भाः
transliteration: druho niṣattā pṛśanī cidevaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuṣṭa indram | abhīvṛteva tā mahāpadena dhvāntāt prapitvādudaranta gharbhāḥ
translation: There with fiend's ways e'en Prsni was seated: with much laudation they exalted Indra. As if encompassed by the Mighty-footed, from darkness, near at hand, forth came the Children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 74
sanskrit: वसूनां वा चर्क्र्ष इयक्षन धिया वा यज्ञैर्वारोदस्योः | अर्वन्तो वा ये रयिमन्तः सातौ वनुं वा येसुश्रुणं सुश्रुतो धुः
transliteration: vasūnāṃ vā carkṛṣa iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñairigvedaārodasyoḥ | arigvedaanto vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanuṃ vā yesuśruṇaṃ suśruto dhuḥ
translation: I AM prepared to laud with song or worship the Noble Ones who are in earth and heaven, Or Coursers who have triumphed in, the contest, or those who famed, have won the prize with glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 74
sanskrit: हव एषामसुरो नक्षत दयां शरवस्यता मनसा निंसतक्षा | चक्षाणा यत्र सुविताय देवा दयौर्न वारेभिःक्र्णवन्त सवैः
transliteration: hava eṣāmasuro nakṣata dyāṃ śravasyatā manasā niṃsatakṣā | cakṣāṇā yatra suvitāya devā dyaurna vārebhiḥkṛṇavanta svaiḥ
translation: Their call, the call of Gods, went up to heaven: they kissed the ground with glory-seeking spirit, There where the Gods look on for happy fortune, and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 74
sanskrit: इयमेषामम्र्तानां गीः सर्वताता ये कर्पणन्त रत्नम | धियं च यज्ञं च साधन्तस्ते नो धान्तु वसव्यमसामि
transliteration: iyameṣāmamṛtānāṃ ghīḥ sarigvedaatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam | dhiyaṃ ca yajñaṃ ca sādhantaste no dhāntu vasavyamasāmi
translation: This is the song of those Immortal Beings who long for treasures in their full perfection. May these, completing prayers and sacrifices, bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: पर सु व आपो महिमानमुत्तमं कारुर्वोचाति सदनेविवस्वतः | पर सप्त-सप्त तरेधा हि चक्रमुः परस्र्त्वरीणामति सिन्धुरोजसा
transliteration: pra su va āpo mahimānamuttamaṃ kārurigvedaocāti sadanevivasvataḥ | pra sapta-sapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ prasṛtvarīṇāmati sindhurojasā
translation: THE singer, O ye Waters in Vivasvan's place, shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare. The Rivers have come forward triply, seven and seven. Sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: पर ते.अरदद वरुणो यातवे पथः सिन्धो यद वाजानभ्यद्रवस्त्वम | भूम्या अधि परवता यासि सानुना यदेषामग्रं जगतामिरज्यसि
transliteration: pra te.aradad varuṇo yātave pathaḥ sindho yad vājānabhyadravastvam | bhūmyā adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yadeṣāmaghraṃ jaghatāmirajyasi
translation: Varuna cut the channels for thy forward course, O Sindhu, when thou rannest on to win the race. Thou speedest o'er precipitous ridges of the earth, when thou art Lord and Leader of these moving floods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: दिवि सवनो यतते भूम्योपर्यनन्तं शुष्ममुदियर्तिभानुना | अभ्रादिव पर सतनयन्ति वर्ष्टयः सिन्धुर्यदेति वर्षभो न रोरुवत
transliteration: divi svano yatate bhūmyoparyanantaṃ śuṣmamudiyartibhānunā | abhrādiva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuryadeti vṛṣabho na roruvat
translation: His roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth: he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light. Like floods of rain that fall- in thunder from the cloud, so Sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: अभि तवा सिन्धो शिशुमिन न मातरो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः | राजेव युध्वा नयसि तवमित सिचौ यदासामग्रं परवतामिनक्षसि
transliteration: abhi tvā sindho śiśumin na mātaro vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ | rājeva yudhvā nayasi tvamit sicau yadāsāmaghraṃ pravatāminakṣasi
translation: Like mothers to their calves, like milch kine with their milk, so, Sindhu, unto thee the roaring rivers run. Thou leadest as a warrior king thine army's wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: इमं मे गङगे यमुने सरस्वति शुतुद्रि सतेमं सचता परुष्ण्या | असिक्न्या मरुद्व्र्धे वितस्तयार्जीकीये शर्णुह्यासुषोमया
transliteration: imaṃ me ghaṅghe yamune sarasvati śutudri stemaṃ sacatā paruṣṇyā | asiknyā marudvṛdhe vitastayārjīkīye śṛṇuhyāsuṣomayā
translation: Favour ye this my laud, O Ganga, Yamuna, O Sutudri, Parusni and Sarasvati: With Asikni, Vitasta, O Marudvrdha, O Arjikiya with Susoma hear my call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 75
sanskrit: तर्ष्टामया परथमं यातवे सजूः ससर्त्वा रसयाश्वेत्या तया | तवं सिन्धो कुभया गोमतीं करुमुम्मेहत्न्वा सरथं याभिरीयसे
transliteration: tṛṣṭāmayā prathamaṃ yātave sajūḥ sasartvā rasayāśvetyā tyā | tvaṃ sindho kubhayā ghomatīṃ krumummehatnvā sarathaṃ yābhirīyase
translation: First with Trstama thou art eager to flow forth, with Rasa, and Susartu, and with Svetya here, With Kubha; and with these, Sindhu and Mehatnu, thou seekest in thy course Krumu and Gomati.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 76
sanskrit: आ व रञ्जस ऊर्जां वयुष्टिष्विन्द्रं मरुतो रोदसीनक्तन | उभे यथा नो अहनी सचाभुवा सदः-सदोवरिवस्यात उद्भिदा
transliteration: ubhe yathā no ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥ-sadovarivasyāta udbhidā
translation: I GRASP at you when power and strength begin to dawn: bedew ye, Indra and the Maruts, Heaven and Earth, That Day and Night, in every hall of sacrifice, may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 76
sanskrit: तदु शरेष्ठं सवनं सुनोतनातयो न हस्तयतो अद्रिःसोतरि | विदद धयर्यो अभिभूति पौंस्यं महो राये चित्तरुते यदर्वतः
transliteration: tadu śreṣṭhaṃ savanaṃ sunotanātyo na hastayato adriḥsotari | vidad dhyaryo abhibhūti pauṃsyaṃ maho rāye cittarute yadarigvedaataḥ
translation: Press the libation out, most excellent of all: the Pressing-stone is grasped like a hand-guided steed. So let it win the valour that subdues the foe, and the fleet courser's might that speeds to ample wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 76
sanskrit: तदिद धयस्य सवनं विवेरपो यथा पुरा मनवेगातुमश्रेत | गोर्णसि तवाष्ट्रे अश्वनिर्णिजि परेमध्वरेष्वध्वरानशिश्रयुः
transliteration: tadid dhyasya savanaṃ viverapo yathā purā manaveghātumaśret | ghoarṇasi tvāṣṭre aśvanirṇiji premadhvareṣvadhvarānaśiśrayuḥ
translation: Juice that this Stone pours out removes defect of ours, as in old time it brought prosperity to man. At sacrifices they established holy rites on Tvastar's milk-blent juice bright with the hue of steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 76
sanskrit: अप हत रक्षसो भङगुरावत सकभायत निरतिंसेधतामतिम | आ नो रयिं सर्ववीरं सुनोतन देवाव्यम्भरत शलोकमद्रयः
transliteration: apa hata rakṣaso bhaṅghurāvata skabhāyata nirtiṃsedhatāmatim |
translation: Drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us: keep Nirrti afar and banish Penury. Pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons, and bear ye up, O Stones, the song that visits Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 77
sanskrit: अभ्रप्रुषो न वाचा परुषा वसु हविष्मन्तो न यज्ञाविजानुषः | सुमारुतं न बरह्माणमर्हसे गणमस्तोष्येषां न शोभसे
transliteration: abhrapruṣo na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmanto na yajñāvijānuṣaḥ | sumārutaṃ na brahmāṇamarhase ghaṇamastoṣyeṣāṃ na śobhase
translation: As with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise man's liberal sacrifices. I praise their Company that merits worship as the good Maruts' priest to pay them honour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 78
sanskrit: विप्रासो न मन्मभिः सवाध्यो देवाव्यो न यज्ञैःस्वप्नसः | राजानो न चित्राः सुसन्द्र्शः कषितीनां नमर्या अरेपसः
transliteration: viprāso na manmabhiḥ svādhyo devāvyo na yajñaiḥsvapnasaḥ | rājāno na citrāḥ susandṛśaḥ kṣitīnāṃ namaryā arepasaḥ
translation: Ye by your hymns are like high-thoughted singers, skillful, inviting Gods with sacrifices; Fair to behold, like Kings, with bright adornment, like spotless gallants, leaders of the people:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अग्निर्न ये भाजसा रुक्मवक्षसो वातासो न सवयुजःसद्यूतयः | परज्ञातारो न जयेष्ठाः सुनीतयःसुशर्माणो न सोमा रतं यते
transliteration: aghnirna ye bhājasā rukmavakṣaso vātāso na svayujaḥsadyaūtayaḥ | prajñātāro na jyeṣṭhāḥ sunītayaḥsuśarmāṇo na somā ṛtaṃ yate
translation: Like fire with flashing flame, breast-bound with chains of gold, like tempest-blasts, self-moving, swift to lend your aid; As best of all foreknowers, excellent to guide, like Somas, good to guard the man who follows Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 78
sanskrit: वातासो न ये धुनयो जिगत्नवो.अग्नीनां न जिह्वाविरोकिणः | वर्मण्वन्तो न योधाः शिमीवन्तः पितॄणांन शंसाः सुरातयः
transliteration: vātāso na ye dhunayo jighatnavo.aghnīnāṃ na jihvāvirokiṇaḥ | varmaṇvanto na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇāṃna śaṃsāḥ surātayaḥ
translation: Shakers of all, like gales of wind they travel, like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence. Mighty are they as warriors clad in armour, and, like the Fathers' prayers, Most Bounteous Givers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 78
sanskrit: रथानां न ये.अराः सनाभयो जिगीवांसो न शूराभिद्यवः | वरेयवो न मर्या घर्तप्रुषो.अभिस्वर्तारोर्कं न सुष्टुभः
transliteration: rathānāṃ na ye.arāḥ sanābhayo jighīvāṃso na śūrāabhidyavaḥ | vareyavo na maryā ghṛtapruṣo.abhisvartāroarkaṃ na suṣṭubhaḥ
translation: Like spokes of car-wheels in one nave united, ever victorious like heavenly Heroes, Shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors, they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 78
sanskrit: अश्वासो न ये जयेष्ठास आशवो दिधिषवो न रथ्यःसुदानवः | आपो न निम्नैरुदभिर्जिगत्नवो विश्वरूपाङगिरसो न सामभिः
transliteration: aśvāso na ye jyeṣṭhāsa āśavo didhiṣavo na rathyaḥsudānavaḥ |
translation: They who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds, long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers, Like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods, like omniform Angirases with Sama-hymns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: अपश्यमस्य महतो महित्वममर्त्यस्य मर्त्यासु विक्षु | नाना हनू विभ्र्ते सं भरेते असिन्वती बप्सती भूर्यत्तः
transliteration: apaśyamasya mahato mahitvamamartyasya martyāsu vikṣu | nānā hanū vibhṛte saṃ bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūryattaḥ
translation: I HAVE beheld the might of this Great Being. Immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals. His jaws now open and now shut together: much they devour, insatiately chewing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: गुहा शिरो निहितं रधगक्षी असिन्वन्नत्ति जिह्वयावनानि | अत्राण्यस्मै पड्भिः सं भरन्त्युत्तानहस्तानमसाधि विक्षु
transliteration: ghuhā śiro nihitaṃ ṛdhaghakṣī asinvannatti jihvayāvanāni | atrāṇyasmai paḍbhiḥ saṃ bharantyuttānahastānamasādhi vikṣu
translation: His eyes are turned away, his head is hidden: unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel. With hands upraised, with reverence in the houses, for him they quickly bring his food together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: पर मातुः परतरं गुह्यमिछन कुमारो न वीरुधःसर्पदुर्वीः | ससं न पक्वमविदच्छुचन्तंरिरिह्वांसं रिप उपस्थे अन्तः
transliteration: pra mātuḥ prataraṃ ghuhyamichan kumāro na vīrudhaḥsarpadurigvedaīḥ | sasaṃ na pakvamavidacchucantaṃririhvāṃsaṃ ripa upasthe antaḥ
translation: Seeking, as 'twere, his Mother's secret bosom, he, like a child, creeps on through wide-spread bushes. One he finds glowing like hot food made ready, and kissing deep within the earth's realms.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: तद वां रतं रोदसी पर बरवीमि जायमानो मातरा गर्भोत्ति | नाहं देवस्य मर्त्यश्चिकेताग्निरङग विचेताः सप्रचेताः
transliteration: tad vāṃ ṛtaṃ rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamāno mātarā gharbhoatti | nāhaṃ devasya martyaściketāghniraṅgha vicetāḥ sapracetāḥ
translation: This holy Law I tell you, Earth and Heaven: the Infant at his birth devours his Parents. No knowledge of the God have I, a mortal. Yea, Agni knoweth best, for he hath wisdom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: यो अस्मा अन्नं तर्ष्वादधात्याज्यैर्घ्र्तैर्जुहोतिपुष्यति | तस्मै सहस्रमक्षभिर्वि चक्षे.अग्ने विश्वतःप्रत्यंं असि तवम
transliteration: yo asmā annaṃ tṛṣvādadhātyājyairghṛtairjuhotipuṣyati | tasmai sahasramakṣabhirigveda cakṣe.aghne viśvataḥpratyaṃṃ asi tvam
translation: This man who quickly gives him food, who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him, - Him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on: thou showest him thy face from all sides, Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: किं देवेषु तयज एनश्चकर्थाग्ने पर्छामि नु तवामविद्वान | अक्रीळन करीळन हरिरत्तवे.अदन वि पर्वशश्चकर्त गामिवासिः
transliteration: kiṃ deveṣu tyaja enaścakarthāghne pṛchāmi nu tvāmavidvān | akrīḷan krīḷan harirattave.adan vi parigvedaaśaścakarta ghāmivāsiḥ
translation: Agni, hast thou committed sin or treason among the Gods? In ignorance I ask thee. Playing, not playing, he gold-hued and toothless, hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 79
sanskrit: विषूचो अश्वान युयुजे वनेजा रजीतिभी रशनाभिर्ग्र्भीतान | चक्षदे मित्रो वसुभिः सुजातः समान्र्धेपर्वभिर्वाव्र्धानः
transliteration: viṣūco aśvān yuyuje vanejā ṛjītibhī raśanābhirghṛbhītān | cakṣade mitro vasubhiḥ sujātaḥ samānṛdheparigvedaabhirigvedaāvṛdhānaḥ
translation: He born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions, held with reins that glitter. The well-born friend hath carved his food with Vasus: in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्निः सप्तिं वाजम्भरं ददात्यग्निर्वीरं शरुत्यंकर्मनिष्ठाम | अग्नी रोदसी वि चरत समञ्जन्नग्निर्नारीं वीरकुक्षिं पुरन्धिम
transliteration: aghniḥ saptiṃ vājambharaṃ dadātyaghnirigvedaīraṃ śrutyaṃkarmaniṣṭhām | aghnī rodasī vi carat samañjannaghnirnārīṃ vīrakukṣiṃ purandhim
translation: AGNI bestows the fleet prize-winning courser: Agni, the hero famed and firm in duty. Agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven, and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्नेरप्नसः समिदस्तु भद्राग्निर्मही रोदसी आ विवेश | अग्निरेकं चोदयत समत्स्वग्निर्व्र्त्राणि दयते पुरूणि
transliteration: aghnerapnasaḥ samidastu bhadrāghnirmahī rodasī ā viveśa | aghnirekaṃ codayat samatsvaghnirigvedaṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi
translation: Blest be the wood that feeds the active Agni: within the two great worlds hath Agni entered. Agni impels a single man to battle, and with him rends in pieces many a foeman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्निर्ह तयं जरतः कर्णमावाग्निरद्भ्यो निरदहज्जरूथम | अग्निरत्रिं घर्म उरुष्यदन्तरग्निर्न्र्मेधम्प्र जयास्र्जत सम
transliteration: aghnirha tyaṃ jarataḥ karṇamāvāghniradbhyo niradahajjarūtham | aghniratriṃ gharma uruṣyadantaraghnirnṛmedhampra jayāsṛjat sam
translation: Agni rejoiced the car of him who praised him, and from the waters burnt away Jarutha. Agni saved Atri in the fiery cave, and made Nrmedha rich with troops of children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्निर्दाद दरविणं वीरपेशा अग्निरषिं यः सहस्रासनोति | अग्निर्दिवि हव्यमा ततानाग्नेर्धामानिविभ्र्ता पुरुत्रा
transliteration: aghnirdād draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā aghnirṣiṃ yaḥ sahasrāsanoti | aghnirdivi havyamā tatānāghnerdhāmānivibhṛtā purutrā
translation: Agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero, and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle. Agni hath made oblations rise to heaven: to every place are Agni's laws extended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्निमुक्थैरषयो वि हवयन्ते.अग्निं नरो यामनिबाधितासः | अग्निं वयो अन्तरिक्षे पतन्तो.अग्निः सहस्रापरि याति गोनाम
transliteration: aghnimukthairṣayo vi hvayante.aghniṃ naro yāmanibādhitāsaḥ | aghniṃ vayo antarikṣe patanto.aghniḥ sahasrāpari yāti ghonām
translation: With songs of praise the Rsis call on Agni; on Agni, heroes worsted in the foray. Birds flying in the region call on Agni around a thousand cattle Agni wanders.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्निं विश ईळते मानुषीर्या अग्निं मनुषो नहुषो विजाताः | अग्निर्गान्धर्वीं पथ्यां रतस्याग्नेर्गव्यूतिर्घ्र्त आ निषत्ता
transliteration: aghniṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryā aghniṃ manuṣo nahuṣo vijātāḥ | aghnirghāndharigvedaīṃ pathyāṃ ṛtasyāghnerghavyūtirghṛta ā niṣattā
translation: Races of human birth pay Agni worship, men who have sprung from Nahus' line adore him. Stablished in holy oil is Agni's pasture, on the Gandharva path of Law and Order.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 80
sanskrit: अग्नये बरह्म रभवस्ततक्षुरग्निं महामवोचामा सुव्र्क्तिम | अग्ने पराव जरितारं यविष्ठाग्ने महि दरविणमायजस्व
transliteration: aghnaye brahma ṛbhavastatakṣuraghniṃ mahāmavocāmā suvṛktim | aghne prāva jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭhāghne mahi draviṇamāyajasva
translation: The Rbhus fabricated prayer for Agni, and we with mighty hymns have called on Agni. Agni, Most Youthful God, protect the singer: win us by worship, Agni, great possessions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 81
sanskrit: य इमा विश्वा भुवनानि जुह्वद रषिर्होता नयसीदत्पिता नः | स आशिषा दरविणमिछमानः परथमछदवराना विवेश
transliteration: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣirhotā nyasīdatpitā naḥ | sa āśiṣā draviṇamichamānaḥ prathamachadavarānā viveśa
translation: HE who sate down as Hotar-priest, the Rsi, our Father, offering up all things existing,- He, seeking through his wish a great possession, came among men on earth as archetypal.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 81
sanskrit: किं सविदासीदधिष्ठनमारम्भणं कतमत सवित्कथासीत | यतो भूमिं जनयन विश्वकर्म वि दयामौर्णोन महिना विश्वचक्षाः
transliteration: kiṃ svidāsīdadhiṣṭhanamārambhaṇaṃ katamat svitkathāsīt | yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarma vi dyāmaurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ
translation: What was the place whereon he took his station? What was it that supported him? How was it? Whence Visvakarman, seeing all, producing the earth, with mighty power disclosed the heavens.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 81
sanskrit: विश्वतश्चक्षुरुत विश्वतोमुखो विश्वतोबाहुरुतविश्वतस्पात | सं बाहुभ्यां धमति सं पतत्रैर्द्यावाभूमी जनयन देव एकः
transliteration: viśvataścakṣuruta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhurutaviśvataspāt | saṃ bāhubhyāṃ dhamati saṃ patatrairdyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ
translation: He who hath eyes on all sides round about him, a mouth on all sides, arms and feet on all sides, He, the Sole God, producing earth and heaven, weldeth them, with his arms as wings, together.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 81
sanskrit: किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः | मनीषिणो मनसा पर्छतेदु तद यदध्यतिष्ठद भुवनानि धारयन
transliteration: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ | manīṣiṇo manasā pṛchatedu tad yadadhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan
translation: What was the tree, what wood in sooth produced it, from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven? Ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 81
sanskrit: या ते धामानि परमाणि यावमा या मध्यमाविश्वकर्मन्नुतेमा | शिक्षा सखिभ्यो हविषि सवधावःस्वयं यजस्व तन्वं वर्धानः
transliteration: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamāviśvakarmannutemā |
translation: Nine highest, lowest, sacrificial natures, and these thy mid-most here, O Visvakarman, Teach thou thy friends at sacrifice, O Blessed, and come thyself, exalted, to our worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: चक्षुषः पिता मनसा हि धीरो घर्तमेने अजनन्नन्नमाने | यदेदन्ता अदद्र्हन्त पूर्व आदिद्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अप्रथेताम
transliteration: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtamene ajanannannamāne | yadedantā adadṛhanta pūrigvedaa ādiddyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
translation: THE Father of the eye, the Wise in spirit, created both these worlds submerged in fatness. Then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened, the heavens and the earth were far extended.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: विश्वकर्मा विमना आद विहाया धाता विधाता परमोतसन्द्र्क | तेषामिष्टानि समिषा मदन्ति यत्रासप्तर्षीन पर एकमाहुः
transliteration: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramotasandṛk | teṣāmiṣṭāni samiṣā madanti yatrāsaptaṛṣīn para ekamāhuḥ
translation: Mighty in mind and power is Visvakarman, Maker, Disposer, and most lofty Presence. Their offerings joy in rich juice where they value One, only One, beyond the Seven Rsis.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: यो नः पिता जनिता यो विधाता धामानि वेद भुवनानिविश्वा | यो देवानां नामधा एक एव तं सम्प्रश्नम्भुवना यन्त्यन्या
transliteration: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāniviśvā | yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva taṃ sampraśnambhuvanā yantyanyā
translation: Father who made us, he who, as Disposer, knoweth all races and all things existing, Even he alone, the Deities' name-giver, him other beings seek for information.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: त आयजन्त दरविणं समस्मा रषयः पूर्वे जरितारो नभूना | असूर्ते सूर्ते रजसि निषत्ते ये भूतानिसमक्र्ण्वन्निमानि
transliteration: ta āyajanta draviṇaṃ samasmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrigvedae jaritāro nabhūnā | asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtānisamakṛṇvannimāni
translation: To him in sacrifice they offered treasures,-Rsis of old, in numerous troops, as singers, Who, in the distant, near, and lower region, made ready all these things that have existence.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्या परो देवेभिरसुरैर्यदस्ति | कं सविद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमपश्यन्त विश्वे
transliteration: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhirasurairyadasti | kaṃ svid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamapaśyanta viśve
translation: That which is earlier than this earth and heaven, before the Asuras and Gods had being,- What was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the Gods were seen together?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: तमिद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमगछन्त विश्वे | अजस्य नाभावध्येकमर्पितंयस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुः
transliteration: tamid gharbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamaghachanta viśve | ajasya nābhāvadhyekamarpitaṃyasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
translation: The waters, they received that germ primeval wherein the Gods were gathered all together. It rested set upon the Unborn's navel, that One wherein abide all things existing.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 82
sanskrit: न तं विदाथ य इमा जजानायद युष्माकमन्तरम्बभूव | नीहारेण पराव्र्ता जल्प्या चासुत्र्प उक्थशासश्चरन्ति
transliteration: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānāyad yuṣmākamantarambabhūva | nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaścaranti
translation: Ye will not find him who produced these creatures: another thing hath risen up among you. Enwrapt in misty cloud, with lips that stammer, hymn-chanters wander and are discontented.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: यस्ते मन्यो.अविधद वज्र सायक सह ओजः पुष्यति विश्वमानुषक | साह्याम दासमार्यं तवया युजा सहस्क्र्तेनसहसा सहस्वता
transliteration: yaste manyo.avidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvamānuṣak | sāhyāma dāsamāryaṃ tvayā yujā sahaskṛtenasahasā sahasvatā
translation: HE who hath reverenced thee, Manyu, destructive bolt, breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy. Arya and Dasa will we conquer with thine aid, with thee the Conqueror, with conquest conquest-sped.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: मन्युरिन्द्रो मन्युरेवास देवो मन्युर्होता वरुणोजातवेदाः | मन्युं विश ईळते मानुषीर्याः पाहि नोमन्यो तपसा सजोषाः
transliteration: manyurindro manyurevāsa devo manyurhotā varuṇojātavedāḥ | manyuṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryāḥ pāhi nomanyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ
translation: Manyu was Indra, yea, the God, was Manyu, Manyu was Hotar, Varuna, Jatavedas. The tribes of human lineage worship Manyu. Accordant with thy fervour, Manyu, guard us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अभीहि मन्यो तवसस्तवीयान तपसा युजा वि जहि शत्रून | अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहा च विश्वा वसून्या भरात्वं नः
transliteration: abhīhi manyo tavasastavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn | amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūnyā bharātvaṃ naḥ
translation: Come hither, Manyu, mightier than the mighty; chase, with thy fervour for ally, our foemen. Slayer of foes, of Vrtra, and of Dasyu, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: तवं हि मन्यो अभिभूत्योजाः सवयम्भूर्भामोभिमातिषाहः | विश्वचर्षणिः सहुरिः सहावानस्मास्वोजः पर्तनासु धेहि
transliteration: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayambhūrbhāmoabhimātiṣāhaḥ | viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvānasmāsvojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi
translation: For thou art, Manyu, of surpassing vigour, fierce, queller of the foe, and self-existent, Shared by all men, victorious, subduer: vouchsafe to us superior strength in battles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अभागः सन्नप परेतो अस्मि तव करत्वा तविषस्यप्रचेतः | तं तवा मन्यो अक्रतुर्जिहीळाहं सवा तनूर्बलदेयाय मेहि
transliteration: abhāghaḥ sannapa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasyapracetaḥ | taṃ tvā manyo akraturjihīḷāhaṃ svā tanūrbaladeyāya mehi
translation: I have departed, still without a portion, wise God! according to thy will, the Mighty. I, feeble man, was wroth thee, O Manyu I am myself; come thou to give me vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अयं ते अस्म्युप मेह्यर्वां परतीचीनः सहुरे विश्वधायः | मन्यो वज्रिन्नभि मामा वव्र्त्स्व हनाव दस्यून्रुतबोध्यापेः
transliteration: ayaṃ te asmyupa mehyarigvedaāṃ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ | manyo vajrinnabhi māmā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūnrutabodhyāpeḥ
translation: Come hither. I am all thine own; advancing turn thou to me, Victorious, All-supporter! Come to me, Manyu, Wielder of the Thunder: bethink thee of thy friend, and slay the Dasyus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 83
sanskrit: अभि परेहि दक्षिणतो भवा मे.अधा वर्त्राणि जङघनावभूरि | जुहोमि ते धरुणं मध्वो अग्रमुभा उपांशुप्रथमा पिबाव
transliteration: abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā me.adhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāvabhūri | juhomi te dharuṇaṃ madhvo aghramubhā upāṃśuprathamā pibāva
translation: Approach, and on my right hand hold thy station: so shall we slay a multitude of foemen. The best of meath I offer to support thee: may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 84
sanskrit: तवया मन्यो सरथमारुजन्तो हर्षमाणासो धर्षितामरुत्वः | तिग्मेषव आयुधा संशिशाना अभि पर यन्तुनरो अग्निरूपाः
transliteration: tvayā manyo sarathamārujanto harṣamāṇāso dhṛṣitāmarutvaḥ | tighmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā abhi pra yantunaro aghnirūpāḥ
translation: BORNE on with thee, O Manyu girt by Maruts, let our brave men, impetuous, bursting forward, March on, like flames of fire in form, exulting, with pointed arrows, sharpening their weapons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 84
sanskrit: अग्निरिव मन्यो तविषितः सहस्व सेनानीर्नः सहुरे हूतेधि | हत्वाय शत्रून वि भजस्व वेद ओजो मिमानो वि मर्धोनुदस्व
transliteration: aghniriva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīrnaḥ sahure hūtaedhi | hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdhonudasva
translation: Flashing like fire, be thou, O conquering Manyu, invoked, O Victor, as our army's leader. Slay thou our foes, distribute their possessions: show forth thy vigour, scatter those who hate us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 84
sanskrit: सहस्व मन्यो अभिमातिमस्मे रुजन मर्णन परम्र्णन परेहिशत्रून | उग्रं ते पाजो नन्वा रुरुध्रे वशी वशंनयस एकज तवम
transliteration: sahasva manyo abhimātimasme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehiśatrūn | ughraṃ te pājo nanvā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃnayasa ekaja tvam
translation: O Manyu, overcome thou our assailant on! breaking, slaying, crushing down the foemen. They have not hindered thine impetuous vigour: Mighty, Sole born! thou makest them thy subjects.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 84
sanskrit: एको बहूनामसि मन्यवीळितो विशं-विशं युधये संशिशाधि | अक्र्त्तरुक तवया युजा वयं दयुमन्तं घोषंविजयाय कर्ण्महे
transliteration: eko bahūnāmasi manyavīḷito viśaṃ-viśaṃ yudhaye saṃśiśādhi | akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣaṃvijayāya kṛṇmahe
translation: Alone or many thou art worshipped, Manyu: sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle. With thee to aid, O thou of perfect splendour, we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 84
sanskrit: विजेषक्र्दिन्द्र इवानवब्रवो.अस्माकं मन्यो अधिपा भवेह | परियं ते नाम सहुरे गर्णीमसि विद्मा तमुत्सं यताबभूथ
transliteration: vijeṣakṛdindra ivānavabravo.asmākaṃ manyo adhipā bhaveha | priyaṃ te nāma sahure ghṛṇīmasi vidmā tamutsaṃ yataābabhūtha
translation: Unyielding bringing victory like Indra, O Manyu, be thou here our Sovran Ruler. To thy dear name, O Victor, we sing praises: we know the spring from which thou art come hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 85
sanskrit: सत्येनोत्तभिता भूमिः सूर्येणोत्तभिता दयौः | रतेनादित्यास्तिष्ठन्ति दिवि सोमो अधि शरितः
transliteration: satyenottabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇottabhitā dyauḥ |
translation: TRUTH is the base that bears the earth; by Surya are the heavens sustained. By Law the Adityas stand secure, and Soma holds his place in heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 86
sanskrit: वि हि सोतोरस्र्क्षत नेन्द्रं देवममंसत | यत्रामदद्व्र्षाकपिरर्यः पुष्टेषु मत्सखा विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः
transliteration: vi hi sotorasṛkṣata nendraṃ devamamaṃsata | yatrāmadadvṛṣākapiraryaḥ puṣṭeṣu matsakhā viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
translation: MEN have abstained from pouring juice they count not Indra as a God. Where at the votary's store my friend Vrsakapi hath drunk his fill. Supreme is Indra over all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 86
sanskrit: परा हीन्द्र धावसि वर्षाकपेरति वयथिः | नो अह परविन्दस्यन्यत्र सोमपीतये विश्वस्मादिन्द्र उत्तरः
transliteration: parā hīndra dhāvasi vṛṣākaperati vyathiḥ | no aha pravindasyanyatra somapītaye viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
translation: Thou, Indra, heedless passest by the ill Vrsakapi hath wrought; Yet nowhere else thou findest place wherein to drink the Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 86
sanskrit: किमयं तवां वर्षाकपिश्चकार हरितो मर्गः | यस्मािरस्यसीदु नवर्यो वा पुष्टिमद वसु विश्वस्मादिन्द्रौत्तरः
transliteration: kimayaṃ tvāṃ vṛṣākapiścakāra harito mṛghaḥ | yasmāirasyasīdu nvaryo vā puṣṭimad vasu viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
translation: What hath he done to injure thee, this tawny beast Vrsakapi, With whom thou art so angry now? What is the votary's foodful store? Supreme is Indra over all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 86
sanskrit: यमिमं तवं वर्षाकपिं परियमिन्द्राभिरक्षसि | शवा नवस्य जम्भिसअदपि कर्णे वरहयुर्विश्वस्मदिन्द्र उत्तरः
transliteration: yamimaṃ tvaṃ vṛṣākapiṃ priyamindrābhirakṣasi |
translation: Soon may the hound who hunts the boar seize him and bite him in the car, O Indra, that Vrsakapi whom thou protectest as a friend, Supreme is Indra over all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 87
sanskrit: रक्षोहणं वाजिनमा जिघर्मि मित्रं परथिष्ठमुपयामि शर्म | शिशानो अग्निः करतुभिः समिद्धः स नोदिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम
