transliteration: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinamā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭhamupayāmi śarma |
translation: I BALM with oil the mighty Raksas-slayer; to the most famous Friend I come for shelter Enkindled, sharpened by our rites, may Agni protect us in the day and night from evil.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: हविष पान्तमजरं सवर्विदि दिविस्प्र्श्याहुतं जुष्टमग्नौ | तस्य भर्मणे भुवनाय देवा धर्मणे कंस्वधया पप्रथन्त
transliteration: haviṣ pāntamajaraṃ svarigvedadi divispṛśyāhutaṃ juṣṭamaghnau | tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devā dharmaṇe kaṃsvadhayā paprathanta
translation: DEAR, ageless sacrificial drink is offered in light-discovering, heaven-pervading Agni. The Gods spread forth through his Celestial Nature, that he might bear the world up and sustain it.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: गीर्णं भुवनं तमसपगूळमाविः सवरभवज्जातेग्नौ | तस्य देवाः पर्थिवि दयौरुतापो.अरणयन्नोषधीः सख्ये अस्य
transliteration: ghīrṇaṃ bhuvanaṃ tamasapaghūḷamāviḥ svarabhavajjāteaghnau | tasya devāḥ pṛthivi dyaurutāpo.araṇayannoṣadhīḥ sakhye asya
translation: The world was swallowed and concealed in darkness: Agni was born, and light became apparent. The Deities, the broad earth, and the heavens, and plants, and waters gloried in his friendship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: देवेभिर्न्विषितो यज्ञियेभिरग्निं सतोषाण्यजरम्ब्र्हन्तम | यो भानुना पर्थिविं दयामुतेमामाततानरोदसी अन्तरिक्षम
transliteration: devebhirnviṣito yajñiyebhiraghniṃ stoṣāṇyajarambṛhantam | yo bhānunā pṛthiviṃ dyāmutemāmātatānarodasī antarikṣam
translation: Inspired by Gods who claim our adoration, I now will laud Eternal Lofty Agni, Him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre, this heaven, and both the worlds, and air's mid-region.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: यो होतासीत परथमो देवजुष्टो यं समञ्जन्नाज्येनाव्र्णानः | स पतत्रीत्वरं सथ जगद यच्छ्वात्रमग्निरक्र्नोज्जातवेदः
transliteration: yo hotāsīt prathamo devajuṣṭo yaṃ samañjannājyenāvṛṇānaḥ | sa patatrītvaraṃ stha jaghad yacchvātramaghnirakṛnojjātavedaḥ
translation: Earliest Priest whom all the Gods accepted, and chose him, and anointed him with butter, He swiftly made all things that fly, stand, travel, all that hath motion, Agni Jatavedas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: यज्जतवेदो भुवनस्य मूर्धन्नतिष्ठो अग्ने सह रोचनेन | तं तवहेम मतिभिर्गीर्भिरुक्थैः स यज्ञियो अभवोरोदसिप्राः
transliteration: yajjatavedo bhuvanasya mūrdhannatiṣṭho aghne saha rocanena | taṃ tvahema matibhirghīrbhirukthaiḥ sa yajñiyo abhavorodasiprāḥ
translation: Because thou, Agni, Jatavedas, stoodest at the world's head with thy refulgent splendour, We sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises: thou filledst heaven and earth, God meet for worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: मूर्धा भुवो भवति नक्तमग्निस्ततः सुर्यो जायतेप्रातरुद्यन | मयामु तु यज्ञियानामेतमपो यत्तूर्णिश्चरति परजानन
transliteration: mūrdhā bhuvo bhavati naktamaghnistataḥ suryo jāyateprātarudyan | mayāmu tu yajñiyānāmetamapo yattūrṇiścarati prajānan
translation: Head of the world is Agni in the night-time; then, as the Sun, at morn springs up and rises. Then to his task goes the prompt Priest foreknowing the wondrous power of Gods who must be honoured.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: दर्शेन्यो यो महिना समिद्धो.अरोचत दिवियोनिर्विभावा | तस्मिन्नग्नौ सूक्तवाकेन देवा हविर्विश्व अजुहवुस्तनूपाः
transliteration: dṛśenyo yo mahinā samiddho.arocata diviyonirigvedabhāvā | tasminnaghnau sūktavākena devā havirigvedaśva ajuhavustanūpāḥ
translation: Lovely is he who, kindled in his greatness, hath shone forth, seated in the heavens, refulgent. With resonant hymns all Gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: सूक्तवकं परथममादिदग्निमादिद धविरजनयन्तदेवाः | स एषां यज्ञो अभवत तनूपस्तं दयौर्वेदतं परिथिवि तमापः
transliteration: sūktavakaṃ prathamamādidaghnimādid dhavirajanayantadevāḥ | sa eṣāṃ yajño abhavat tanūpastaṃ dyaurigvedaedataṃ prithivi tamāpaḥ
translation: First the Gods brought the hymnal into being; then they engendered Agni, then oblation. He was their sacrifice that guards our bodies: him the heavens know, the earth, the waters know him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: यं देवासो अजनयन्ताग्निं यस्मिन्नाजुहवुर्भुवनानिविश्वा | सो अर्चिषा पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां रजूयमानोतपन महित्वा
transliteration: yaṃ devāso ajanayantāghniṃ yasminnājuhavurbhuvanāniviśvā | so arciṣā pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ ṛjūyamānoatapan mahitvā
translation: He, Agni, whom the Gods have generated, in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures, He with his bright glow heated earth and heaven, urging himself right onward in his grandeur.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: सतोमेन हि दिवि देवासो अग्निमजीजनञ्छक्तिभीरोदसिप्राम | तमू अक्र्ण्वन तरेधा भुवे कं स ओषधीःपचति विश्वरूपाः
transliteration: stomena hi divi devāso aghnimajījanañchaktibhīrodasiprām | tamū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kaṃ sa oṣadhīḥpacati viśvarūpāḥ
translation: Then by the laud the Gods engendered Agni in heaven, who fills both worlds through strength and vigour. They made him to appear in threefold essence: he ripens plants of every form and nature.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: यदेदेनमदधुर्यज्ञियासो दिवि देवाः सूर्यमादितेयम | यदा चरिष्णू मिथुनावभूतामादित परापश्यन्भुवनानि विश्वा
transliteration: yadedenamadadhuryajñiyāso divi devāḥ sūryamāditeyam | yadā cariṣṇū mithunāvabhūtāmādit prāpaśyanbhuvanāni viśvā
translation: What time the Gods, whose due is worship, set him as Surya, Son of Aditi, in heaven, When the Pair, ever wandering, sprang to being, all creatures that existed looked upon them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 88
sanskrit: विश्वस्मा अग्निं भुवनाय देवा वैश्वानरं केतुमह्नामक्र्ण्वन | आ यस्ततानोषसो विभातीरपो ऊर्णोति तमोर्चिषा यन
transliteration: viśvasmā aghniṃ bhuvanāya devā vaiśvānaraṃ ketumahnāmakṛṇvan |
translation: For all the world of life the Gods made Agni Vaisvanara to be the days' bright Banner,- Him who hath spread abroad the radiant Mornings, and, coming with his light, unveils the darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 89
sanskrit: इन्द्रं सतवा नर्तमं यस्य मह्ना विबबाधे रोचना वि जमोन्तान | आ यः पप्रौ चर्षणीध्र्द वरोभिः परसिन्धुभ्यो रिरिचानो महित्वा
transliteration: indraṃ stavā nṛtamaṃ yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmoantān |
translation: I WILL extol the most heroic Indra who with his might forced earth and sky asunder; Who hath filled all with width as man's Upholder, surpassing floods and rivers in his greatness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: सहस्रशीर्षा पुरुषः सहस्राक्षः सहस्रपात | सभूमिं विश्वतो वर्त्वात्यतिष्ठद दशाङगुलम
transliteration: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt | sabhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvātyatiṣṭhad daśāṅghulam
translation: BRISK, at the place of Ila, hymned by men who wake, our own familiar Friend is kindled in the house; Hotar of all oblation, worthy of our choice, Lord, beaming, trusty friend to one who loveth him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: पुरुष एवेदं सर्वं यद भूतं यच्च भव्यम | उताम्र्तत्वस्येशानो यदन्नेनातिरोहति
transliteration: puruṣa evedaṃ sarigvedaaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yacca bhavyam | utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yadannenātirohati
translation: He, excellent in glory, guest in every house, finds like a swift-winged bird a home in every tree. Benevolent to men, he scorns no living man: Friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: एतावानस्य महिमातो जयायांश्च पूरुषः | पादो.अस्यविश्वा भूतानि तरिपादस्याम्र्तं दिवि
transliteration: etāvānasya mahimāto jyāyāṃśca pūruṣaḥ | pādo.asyaviśvā bhūtāni tripādasyāmṛtaṃ divi
translation: Most sage with insight, passing skillful with thy powers art thou, O Agni, wise with wisdom, knowing all. As Vasu, thou alone art Lord of all good things, of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तरिपादूर्ध्व उदैत पुरुषः पादो.अस्येहाभवत पुनः | ततो विष्वं वयक्रामत साशनानशने अभि
transliteration: tripādūrdhva udait puruṣaḥ pādo.asyehābhavat punaḥ | tato viṣvaṃ vyakrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi
translation: Foreknowing well, O Agni, thou in Ila's place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil. Marked are thy comings like the comings of the Dawns, the rays of him who shineth spotless as the Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तस्माद विराळ अजायत विराजो अधि पूरुषः | स जातोत्यरिच्यत पश्चाद भूमिमथो पुरः
transliteration: tasmād virāḷ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ | sa jātoatyaricyata paścād bhūmimatho puraḥ
translation: Thy glories are, as lightnings from the rainy cloud, marked, many-hued, like heralds of the Dawns' approach, When, loosed to wander over plants and forest trees, thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: यत पुरुषेण हविषा देवा यज्ञमतन्वत | वसन्तोस्यासीदाज्यं गरीष्म इध्मः शरद धविः
transliteration: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñamatanvata | vasantoasyāsīdājyaṃ ghrīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ
translation: Him, duly coming as their germ, have plants received: this Agni have maternal Waters brought to life. So in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तं यज्ञं बर्हिषि परौक्षन पुरुषं जातमग्रतः | तेन देवा अयजन्त साध्या रषयश्च ये
transliteration: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātamaghrataḥ | tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaśca ye
translation: When, sped and urged by wind, thou spreadest thee abroad, swift piercing through thy food according to thy will, Thy never-ceasing blazes, longing to consume, like men on chariots, Agni, strive on every side.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुतः सम्भ्र्तं पर्षदाज्यम | पशून्तांश्चक्रे वायव्यानारण्यान गराम्याश्च ये
transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarigvedaahutaḥ sambhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam | paśūntāṃścakre vāyavyānāraṇyān ghrāmyāśca ye
translation: Agni, the Hotar-priest who fills the assembly full, Waker of knowledge, chief Controller of the thought,- Him, yea, none other than thyself, doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुत रचः सामानि जज्ञिरे | छन्दांसिजज्ञिरे तस्माद यजुस्तस्मादजायत
transliteration: tasmād yajñāt sarigvedaahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire | chandāṃsijajñire tasmād yajustasmādajāyata
translation: Here, Api, the arrangers, those attached to thee, elect thee as their Priest in sacred gatherings, When men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment, piously inclined.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: तस्मादश्वा अजायन्त ये के चोभयादतः | गावो हजज्ञिरे तस्मात तस्माज्जाता अजावयः
transliteration: tasmādaśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ | ghāvo hajajñire tasmāt tasmājjātā ajāvayaḥ
translation: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: यत पुरुषं वयदधुः कतिधा वयकल्पयन | मुखं किमस्य कौ बाहू का ऊरू पादा उच्येते
transliteration: yat puruṣaṃ vyadadhuḥ katidhā vyakalpayan | mukhaṃ kimasya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete
translation: When mortal man presents to thee Immortal God, Agni, his fuel or his sacrificial gift, Then thou art his Adhvaryu, Hotar, messenger, callest the Gods and orderest the sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 90
sanskrit: बराह्मणो.अस्य मुखमासीद बाहू राजन्यः कर्तः | ऊरूतदस्य यद वैश्यः पद्भ्यां शूद्रो अजायत
transliteration: brāhmaṇo.asya mukhamāsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ |
translation: From us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him, these. holy words, these Rcas, songs and eulogies, Eager for wealth, to Jatavedas fain for wealth: when they have waxen strong they please their Strengthener.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 91
sanskrit: सं जाग्र्वद्भिर्जरमाण इध्यते दमे दमूना इषयन्निळस पदे | विश्वस्य होता हविषो वरेण्यो विभुर्विभावासुषखा सखीयते
transliteration: saṃ jāghṛvadbhirjaramāṇa idhyate dame damūnā iṣayanniḷas pade | viśvasya hotā haviṣo vareṇyo vibhurigvedabhāvāsuṣakhā sakhīyate
translation: I PRAISE your Charioteer of sacrifice, the Lord of men, Priest of the tribes, refulgent, Guest of night. Blazing amid dry plants, snatching amid the green, the Strong, the Holy Herald hath attained to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 91
sanskrit: स दर्शतश्रीरतिथिर्ग्र्हे-गर्हे वने-वने शिश्रियेतक्ववीरिव | जनं-जनं जन्यो नाति मन्यते विश आक्षेति विश्यो विशं विशम
transliteration: sa darśataśrīratithirghṛhe-ghṛhe vane-vane śiśriyetakvavīriva | janaṃ-janaṃ janyo nāti manyate viśa ākṣeti viśyo viśaṃ viśam
translation: Him, Agni, Gods and men have made their chief support, who drinks the fatness and completes the sacrifice. With kisses they caress the Grandson of the Red, like the swift ray of light, the Household Priest of Dawn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 91
sanskrit: सुदक्षो दक्षैः करतुनासि सुक्रतुरग्ने कविः काव्येनासिविश्ववित | वसुर्वसूनां कषयसि तवमेक इद दयावा चयानि पर्थिवी च पुष्यतः
transliteration: sudakṣo dakṣaiḥ kratunāsi sukraturaghne kaviḥ kāvyenāsiviśvavit | vasurigvedaasūnāṃ kṣayasi tvameka id dyāvā cayāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ
translation: Yea, we discriminate his and the niggard's ways: his branches evermore are sent forth to consume. When his terrific flames have reached the Immortal's world, then men remember and extol the Heavenly Folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 91
sanskrit: परजानन्नग्ने तव योनिं रत्वियमिळायास पदे घर्तवन्तमासदः | आ ते चिकित्र उषसामिवेतयो.अरेपसः सूर्यस्येवरश्मयः
transliteration: prajānannaghne tava yoniṃ ṛtviyamiḷāyās pade ghṛtavantamāsadaḥ |
translation: For then the net of Law, Dyaus, and the wide expanse, Earth, Worship, and Devotion meet for highest praise, Varuna, Indra, Mitra were of one accord, and Savitar and Bhaga, Lords of holy might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 92
sanskrit: यज्ञस्य वो रथ्यं विश्पतिं विशां होतारमक्तोरतिथिं विभावसुम | शोचञ्छुष्कासु हरिणीषु जर्भुरद्व्र्षा केतुर्यजतो दयामशायत
transliteration: yajñasya vo rathyaṃ viśpatiṃ viśāṃ hotāramaktoratithiṃ vibhāvasum |
translation: MIGHTY are ye, and far-extended, Heaven and Earth: both Worlds are evermore to us like two young Dames. Guard us thereby from stronger foe; guard us hereby to give us strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: महि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूतमुर्वी नारी यह्वी न रोदसीसदं नः | तेभिर्नः पातं सह्यस एभिर्नः पातंशूषणि
transliteration: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtamurigvedaī nārī yahvī na rodasīsadaṃ naḥ | tebhirnaḥ pātaṃ sahyasa ebhirnaḥ pātaṃśūṣaṇi
translation: LET these speak loudly forth; let us speak out aloud: to the loud speaking Pressing-stones address the speech; When, rich with Soma juice, Stones of the mountain, ye, united, swift to Indra bring the sound of praise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: यज्ञे-यज्ञे स मर्त्यो देवान सपर्यति | यः सुम्नैर्दीर्घश्रुत्तम आविवासत्येनान
transliteration: yajñe-yajñe sa martyo devān saparyati | yaḥ sumnairdīrghaśruttama āvivāsatyenān
translation: They speak out like a hundred, like a thousand men: they cry aloud to us with their green-tinted mouths, While, pious Stones, they ply their task with piety, and, even before the Hotar, taste the offered food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: विश्वेषामिरज्यवो देवानां वार्महः | विश्वे हिविश्वमहसो विश्वे यज्ञेषु यज्ञियाः
transliteration: viśveṣāmirajyavo devānāṃ vārmahaḥ | viśve hiviśvamahaso viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ
translation: Loudly they speak, for they have found the savoury meath: they make a humming sound over the meat prepared. As they devour the branch of the Red-coloured Tree, these, the well-pastured Bulls, have uttered bellowings.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: ते घा राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्रा अर्यमा मित्रो वरुणःपरिज्मा | कद रुद्रो नर्णां सतुतो मरुतः पूषणो भगः
transliteration: te ghā rājāno amṛtasya mandrā aryamā mitro varuṇaḥparijmā | kad rudro nṛṇāṃ stuto marutaḥ pūṣaṇo bhaghaḥ
translation: They cry aloud, with strong exhilarating drink, calling on Indra now, for they have found the meath. Bold, with the sisters they have danced, embraced by them, making the earth reecho with their ringing sound.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: उत नो नक्तमपां वर्षण्वसू सूर्यामासा सदनायसधन्या | सचा यत साद्येषामहिर्बुध्नेषु बुध्न्यः
transliteration: uta no naktamapāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāyasadhanyā | sacā yat sādyeṣāmahirbudhneṣu budhnyaḥ
translation: The Eagles have sent forth their cry aloft in heaven; in the sky's vault the dark impetuous ones have danced. Then downward to the nether stone's fixt place they sink, and, splendid as the Sun, effuse their copious stream.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: उत नो देवावश्विना शुभस पती धामभिर्मित्रावरुणाुरुष्यताम | महः स राय एषते.अति धन्वेव दुरिता
transliteration: uta no devāvaśvinā śubhas patī dhāmabhirmitrāvaruṇāuruṣyatām | mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate.ati dhanveva duritā
translation: Like strong ones drawing, they have put forth all their strength: the Bulls, harnessed together, bear the chariot-poles. When they have bellowed, panting, swallowing their food, the sound of their loud snorting is like that of steeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 93
sanskrit: उत नो रुद्रा चिन मर्ळतामश्विना विश्वे देवासो रथस्पतिर्भगः | रभुर्वाज रभुक्षणः परिज्मा विश्ववेदसः
transliteration: uta no rudrā cin mṛḷatāmaśvinā viśve devāso rathaspatirbhaghaḥ |
translation: To these who have ten workers and a tenfold girth, to these who have ten yoke-straps and ten binding thongs, To these who bear ten reins, the eternal, sing ye praise, to these who bear ten car-poles, ten when they are yoked.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: परैते वदन्तु पर वयं वदाम गरावभ्यो वाचं वदतावदद्भ्यः | यदद्रयः पर्वताः साकमाशवः शलोकंघोषं भरथेन्द्राय सोमिनः
transliteration: praite vadantu pra vayaṃ vadāma ghrāvabhyo vācaṃ vadatāvadadbhyaḥ | yadadrayaḥ parigvedaatāḥ sākamāśavaḥ ślokaṃghoṣaṃ bharathendrāya sominaḥ
translation: Ho there, my consort! Stay, thou fierce-souled lady, and let us reason for a while together. Such thoughts as these of ours, while yet unspoken in days gone by have never brought us comfort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: एते वदन्ति शतवत सहस्रवदभि करन्दन्ति हरितेभिरासभिः | विष्ट्वी गरावाणः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया होतुश्चित पूर्वे हविरद्यमाशत
transliteration: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravadabhi krandanti haritebhirāsabhiḥ | viṣṭvī ghrāvāṇaḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā hotuścit pūrigvedae haviradyamāśata
translation: What am I now to do with this thy saying? I have gone from thee like the first of Mornings. Pururavas, return thou to thy dwelling: I, like the wind, am difficult to capture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: एते वदन्त्यविदन्नना मधु नयूङखयन्ते अधि पक्वामिषि | वर्क्षस्य शाखामरुणस्य बप्सतस्ते सूभर्वाव्र्षभाः परेमराविषुः
transliteration: ete vadantyavidannanā madhu nyūṅkhayante adhi pakvaāmiṣi | vṛkṣasya śākhāmaruṇasya bapsataste sūbharigvedaāvṛṣabhāḥ premarāviṣuḥ
translation: Like a shaft sent for glory from the quiver, or swift-steed winning cattle winning hundreds. The lightning seemed to flash, as cowards planned it. The minstrels bleated like a lamb in trouble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: बर्हद वदन्ति मदिरेण मन्दिनेन्द्रं करोशन्तो.अविदन्ननामधु | संरभ्या धीराः सवस्र्भिरनर्तिषुराघोषयन्तः पर्थिवीमुपब्दिभिः
transliteration: bṛhad vadanti madireṇa mandinendraṃ krośanto.avidannanāmadhu | saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiranartiṣurāghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīmupabdibhiḥ
translation: Giving her husband's father life and riches, from the near dwelling, when her lover craved her, She sought the home wherein she found her pleasure, accepting day and night her lord's embraces.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: सुपर्णा वाचमक्रतोप दयव्याखरे कर्ष्णा इषिरानर्तिषुः | नयं नि यन्त्युपरस्य निष्क्र्तं पुरू रेतोदधिरे सूर्यश्वितः
transliteration: suparṇā vācamakratopa dyavyākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirāanartiṣuḥ | nyaṃ ni yantyuparasya niṣkṛtaṃ purū retodadhire sūryaśvitaḥ
translation: Thrice in the day didst thou embrace thy consort, though coldly she received thy fond caresses. To thy desires, Pururavas, I yielded: so wast thou king, O hero, of my body.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: उग्रा इव परवहन्तः समायमुः साकं युक्ता वर्षणोबिभ्रतो धुरः | यच्छ्वसन्तो जग्रसाना अराविषुःश्र्ण्व एषां परोथथो अर्वतामिव
transliteration: ughrā iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākaṃ yuktā vṛṣaṇobibhrato dhuraḥ | yacchvasanto jaghrasānā arāviṣuḥśṛṇva eṣāṃ prothatho arigvedaatāmiva
translation: The maids Sujirni, Sreni, Sumne-api, Charanyu, Granthini, and Hradecaksus,- These like red kine have hastened forth, the bright ones, and like milch-cows have lowed in emulation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: दशावनिभ्यो दशकक्ष्येभ्यो दशयोक्त्रेभ्यो दशयोजनेभ्यः | दशाभीशुभ्यो अर्चताजरेभ्यो दश धुरो दश युक्तावहद्भ्यः
transliteration: daśāvanibhyo daśakakṣyebhyo daśayoktrebhyo daśayojanebhyaḥ | daśābhīśubhyo arcatājarebhyo daśa dhuro daśa yuktāvahadbhyaḥ
translation: While he was born the Dames sate down together, the Rivers with free kindness gave him nurture; And then, Pururavas, the Gods increased thee for mighty battle, to destroy the Dasyus.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: ते अद्रयो दशयन्त्रास आशवस्तेषामाधानं पर्येतिहर्यतम | त ऊ सुतस्य सोम्यस्यान्धसो.अंशोः पीयूषम्प्रथमस्य भेजिरे
transliteration: te adrayo daśayantrāsa āśavasteṣāmādhānaṃ paryetiharyatam | ta ū sutasya somyasyāndhaso.aṃśoḥ pīyūṣamprathamasya bhejire
translation: When I, a mortal, wooed to mine embraces these heavenly nymphs who laid aside their raiment, Like a scared snake they fled from me in terror, like chariot horses when the car has touched them.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: ते सोमादो हरी इन्द्रस्य निंसते.अंशुं दुहन्तो अध्यासतेगवि | तेभिर्दुग्धं पपिवान सोम्यं मध्विन्द्रो वर्धतेप्रथते वर्षायते
transliteration: te somādo harī indrasya niṃsate.aṃśuṃ duhanto adhyāsateghavi | tebhirdughdhaṃ papivān somyaṃ madhvindro vardhateprathate vṛṣāyate
translation: When, loving these Immortal Ones, the mortal hath converse with the nymphs as they allow him. Like swans they show the beauty of their bodies, like horses in their play they bite and nibble.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: वर्षा वो अंशुर्न किला रिषाथनेलावन्तः सदमित्स्थनाशिताः | रैवत्येव महसा चारव सथन यस्यग्रावाणो अजुषध्वमध्वरम
transliteration: vṛṣā vo aṃśurna kilā riṣāthanelāvantaḥ sadamitsthanāśitāḥ | raivatyeva mahasā cārava sthana yasyaghrāvāṇo ajuṣadhvamadhvaram
translation: She who flashed brilliant as the falling lightning brought me delicious presents from the waters. Now from the flood be born a strong young hero May Uruvasi prolong her life for ever

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: तर्दिला अत्र्दिलासो अद्रयो.अश्रमणा अश्र्थिता अम्र्त्यवः | अनातुरा अजरा सथामविष्णवः सुपीवसो अत्र्षितात्र्ष्णजः
transliteration: tṛdilā atṛdilāso adrayo.aśramaṇā aśṛthitā amṛtyavaḥ | anāturā ajarā sthāmaviṣṇavaḥ supīvaso atṛṣitāatṛṣṇajaḥ
translation: Thy birth hath made me drink from earthly milch-kine: this power, Pururavas, hast thou vouchsafed me. I knew, and, warned thee, on that day. Thou wouldst not hear me. What sayest thou, when naught avails thee?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: धरुवा एव वः पितरो युगे-युगे कषेमकामासः सदसो नयुञ्जते | अजुर्यासो हरिषाचो हरिद्रव आ दयां रवेणप्र्थिवीमशुश्रवुः
transliteration: dhruvā eva vaḥ pitaro yughe-yughe kṣemakāmāsaḥ sadaso nayuñjate | ajuryāso hariṣāco haridrava ā dyāṃ raveṇapṛthivīmaśuśravuḥ
translation: When will the son be born and seek his father? Mourner-like, will he weep when first he knows him? Who shall divide the accordant wife and husband, while fire is shining with thy consort's parents?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: तदिद वदन्त्यद्रयो विमोचने यामन्नञ्जस्पा इव घेदुपब्दिभिः | वपन्तो बीजमिव धान्याक्र्तः पर्ञ्चन्तिसोमं न मिनन्ति बप्सतः
transliteration: tadid vadantyadrayo vimocane yāmannañjaspā iva ghedupabdibhiḥ | vapanto bījamiva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcantisomaṃ na minanti bapsataḥ
translation: I will console him when his tears are falling: he shall not weep and cry for care that blesses. That which is thine, between us, will I send thee. Go home again, thou fool; thou hast not won me.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 94
sanskrit: सुते अध्वरे अधि वाचमक्रता करीळयो न मातरन्तुदन्तः | वि षू मुञ्चा सुषुवुषो मनीषां वि वर्तन्तामद्रयश्चायमानाः
transliteration: sute adhvare adhi vācamakratā krīḷayo na mātarantudantaḥ | vi ṣū muñcā suṣuvuṣo manīṣāṃ vi vartantāmadrayaścāyamānāḥ
translation: Thy lover shall flee forth this day for ever, to seek, without return, the farthest distance. Then let his bed be in Destruction's bosom, and there let fierce rapacious wolves devour him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: हये जाये मनसा तिष्ठ घोरे वचांसि मिश्राक्र्णवावहै नु | न नौ मन्त्रा अनुदितास एते मयस करन्परतरे चनाहन
transliteration: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrākṛṇavāvahai nu | na nau mantrā anuditāsa ete mayas karanparatare canāhan
translation: In the great synod will I laud thy two Bay Steeds: I prize the sweet strong drink of thee the Warrior-God, His who pours lovely oil as 'twere with yellow drops. Let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: किमेता वाचा कर्णवा तवाहं पराक्रमिषमुषसामग्रियेव | पुरूरवः पुनरस्तं परेहि दुरापना वातैवाहमस्मि
transliteration: kimetā vācā kṛṇavā tavāhaṃ prākramiṣamuṣasāmaghriyeva | purūravaḥ punarastaṃ parehi durāpanā vātaivāhamasmi
translation: Ye who in concert sing unto the gold hued place, like Bay Steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat, For Indra laud ye strength allied with Tawny Steeds, laud him whom cows content as 'twere with yellow drops.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: इषुर्न शरिय इषुधेरसना गोषाः शतसा न रंहिः | अवीरे करतौ वि दविद्युतन नोरा न मायुं चितयन्तधुनयः
transliteration: iṣurna śriya iṣudherasanā ghoṣāḥ śatasā na raṃhiḥ | avīre kratau vi davidyutan norā na māyuṃ citayantadhunayaḥ
translation: His is that thunderbolt, of iron, golden hued, gold-coloured, very dear, and yellow in his arms; Bright with strong teeth, destroying with its tawny rage. In Indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: सा वसु दधती शवशुराय वय उषो यदि वष्ट्यन्तिग्र्हात | अस्तं ननक्षे यस्मिञ्चाकन दिवा नक्तंश्नथिता वैतसेन
transliteration: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vaya uṣo yadi vaṣṭyantighṛhāt | astaṃ nanakṣe yasmiñcākan divā naktaṃśnathitā vaitasena
translation: As if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky, the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race. That iron bolt with yellow jaw smote Ahi down. A thousand flames had he who bore the tawny-hued.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: तरिः सम माह्नः शनथयो वैतसेनोत सम मे.अव्यत्यैप्र्णासि | पुरूरवो.अनु ते केतमायं राजा मे वीर तन्वस्तदासीः
transliteration: triḥ sma māhnaḥ śnathayo vaitasenota sma me.avyatyaipṛṇāsi | purūravo.anu te ketamāyaṃ rājā me vīra tanvastadāsīḥ
translation: Thou, thou, when praised by men who sacrificed of old. hadst pleasure in their lauds, O Indra golden-haired. All that befits thy song of praise thou welcomest, the perfect pleasant gift, O Golden-hued from birth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: या सुजूर्णिः शरेणिः सुम्नापिर्ह्रदेचक्षुर्न गरन्थिनीचरण्युः | ता अञ्जयो.अरुणयो न सस्रुः शरिये गावो नधेनवो.अनवन्त
transliteration: yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpirhradecakṣurna ghranthinīcaraṇyuḥ | tā añjayo.aruṇayo na sasruḥ śriye ghāvo nadhenavo.anavanta
translation: These two dear Bays bring hither Indra on his car, Thunder-armed, joyous, meet for laud, to drink his fill. Many libations flow for him who loveth them: to Indra have the gold-hued Soma juices run.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: समस्मिञ जायमान आसत गना उतेमवर्धन नद्यःस्वगूर्ताः | महे यत तवा पुरूरवो रणायावर्धयन्दस्युहत्याय देवाः
transliteration: samasmiñ jāyamāna āsata ghnā utemavardhan nadyaḥsvaghūrtāḥ | mahe yat tvā purūravo raṇāyāvardhayandasyuhatyāya devāḥ
translation: The gold-hued drops have flowed to gratify his wish: the yellow drops have urged the swift Bays to the Strong. He who speeds on with Bay Steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: सचा यदासु जहतीष्वत्कममानुषीषु मानुषो निषेवे | अप सम मत तरसन्ती न भुज्युस्ता अत्रसन रथस्प्र्शोनाश्वाः
transliteration: sacā yadāsu jahatīṣvatkamamānuṣīṣu mānuṣo niṣeve | apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyustā atrasan rathaspṛśonāśvāḥ
translation: At the swift draught the Soma-drinker waxed in might, the Iron One with yellow beard and yellow hair. He, Lord of Tawny Coursers, Lord of fleet-foot Mares, will bear his Bay Steeds safely over all distress.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: यदासु मर्तो अम्र्तासु निस्प्र्क सं कषोणीभिः करतुभिर्नप्र्ङकते | ता आतयो न तन्वः शुम्भत सवा अश्वासो नक्रीळयो दन्दशानाः
transliteration: yadāsu marto amṛtāsu nispṛk saṃ kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhirnapṛṅkte | tā ātayo na tanvaḥ śumbhata svā aśvāso nakrīḷayo dandaśānāḥ
translation: His yellow-coloured jaws, like ladles move apart, what time, for strength, he makes the yellow-tinted stir, When, while the bowl stands there, he grooms his Tawny Steeds, when he hath drunk strong drink, the sweet juice that he loves.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: विद्युन न या पतन्ती दविद्योद भरन्ती मे अप्या काम्यानि | जनिष्टो अपो नर्यः सुजातः परोर्वशी तिरत दीर्घमायुः
transliteration: vidyun na yā patantī davidyod bharantī me apyā kāmyāni | janiṣṭo apo naryaḥ sujātaḥ prorigvedaaśī tirata dīrghamāyuḥ
translation: Yea, to the Dear One's seat in homes of heaven and earth the Bay Steeds' Lord hath whinnied like a horse for food. Then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily, and the Beloved One hath gained high power of life,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: जज्ञिष इत्था गोपीथ्याय हि दधाथ तत पुरूरवो मोजः | अशासं तवा विदुषी सस्मिन्नहन न म आश्र्णोःकिमभुग वदासि
transliteration: jajñiṣa itthā ghopīthyāya hi dadhātha tat purūravo maojaḥ | aśāsaṃ tvā viduṣī sasminnahan na ma āśṛṇoḥkimabhugh vadāsi
translation: Thou, comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven, acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new. O Asura, disclose thou and make visible the Cow's beloved home to the bright golden Sun.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: कदा सूनुः पितरं जात इछाच्चक्रन नाश्रु वर्तयद्विजानन | को दम्पती समनसा वि यूयोदध यदग्निःश्वशुरेषु दीदयत
transliteration: kadā sūnuḥ pitaraṃ jāta ichāccakran nāśru vartayadvijānan | ko dampatī samanasā vi yūyodadha yadaghniḥśvaśureṣu dīdayat
translation: O Indra, let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee, delightful, golden-visored, on thy car, That, pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil, thou mayest, at the feast, drink of our offered meath.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 95
sanskrit: परति बरवाणि वर्तयते अश्रु चक्रन न करन्ददाध्येशिवायै | पर तत ते हिनवा यत ते अस्मे परेह्यस्तं नहिमूर मापः
transliteration: prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru cakran na krandadādhyeśivāyai | pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehyastaṃ nahimūra māpaḥ
translation: Juices aforetime, Lord of Bays, thou drankest; and thine especially is this libation. Gladden thee, Indra, with the meath-rich Soma: pour it down ever, Mighty One! within thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 96
sanskrit: पर ते महे विदथे शंसिषं हरी पर ते वन्वे वनुषोहर्यतं मदम | घर्तं न यो हरिभिश्चारु सेचत आ तवाविशन्तु हरिवर्पसं गिरः
transliteration: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣoharyataṃ madam | ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiścāru secata ā tvāviśantu harivarpasaṃ ghiraḥ
translation: HERBS that sprang up in time of old, three ages earlier than the Gods,- Of these, whose hue is brown, will I declare the hundred powers and seven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 96
sanskrit: हरिं हि योनिमभि ये समस्वरन हिन्वन्तो हरी दिव्यंयथा सदः | आ यं पर्णन्ति हरिभिर्न धेनव इन्द्रायशूषं हरिवन्तमर्चत
transliteration: hariṃ hi yonimabhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃyathā sadaḥ |
translation: Ye, Mothers, have a hundred homes, yea, and a thousand are your growths. Do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 97
sanskrit: या ओषधीः पूर्वा जाता देवेभ्यस्त्रियुगं पुरा | मनैनु बभ्रूणामहं शतं धामानि सप्त च
transliteration: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrigvedaā jātā devebhyastriyughaṃ purā | manainu babhrūṇāmahaṃ śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca
translation: COME, be thou Mitra, Varuna, or Pusan, come, O Brhaspati, to mine oblation: With Maruts, Vasus, or Adityas, make thou Parjanya pour for Santanu his rain-drops.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 98
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परति मे देवतामिहि मित्रो वा यद वरुणो वासिपूषा | आदित्यैर्वा यद वसुभिर्मरुत्वान स पर्जन्यंशन्तनवे वर्षाय
transliteration: bṛhaspate prati me devatāmihi mitro vā yad varuṇo vāsipūṣā |
translation: WHAT Splendid One, Loud-voiced, Far striding, dost thou, well knowing, urge us to exalt with praises? What give we him? When his might dawned, he fashioned the Vrtra-slaying bolt, and sent us waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: कं नश्चित्रमिषण्यसि चिकित्वान पर्थुग्मानं वाश्रंवाव्र्धध्यै | कत तस्य दातु शवसो वयुष्टौ तक्षद्वज्रं वर्त्रतुरमपिन्वत
transliteration: kaṃ naścitramiṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthughmānaṃ vāśraṃvāvṛdhadhyai | kat tasya dātu śavaso vyuṣṭau takṣadvajraṃ vṛtraturamapinvat
translation: Be, like thyself, O Indra, strong for our delight: here lauded, aid us, Maghavan, drinker of the juice. Savitar with the Gods protect us: hear ye Twain. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स हि दयुता विद्युता वेति साम पर्थुं योनिमसुरत्वाससाद | स सनीळेभिः परसहानो अस्य भरातुर्न रतेसप्तथस्य मायाः
transliteration: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthuṃ yonimasuratvāsasāda | sa sanīḷebhiḥ prasahāno asya bhrāturna ṛtesaptathasya māyāḥ
translation: Bring swift, for offering, the snare that suits the time, to the pure-drinker Vayu, roaring as he goes, To him who hath approached the draught of shining milk. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स वाजं यातापदुष्पदा यन सवर्षाता परि षदत्सनिष्यन | अनर्वा यच्छतदुरस्य वेदो घनञ्छिश्नदेवानभि वर्पसा भूत
transliteration: sa vājaṃ yātāpaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari ṣadatsaniṣyan | anarigvedaā yacchatadurasya vedo ghnañchiśnadevānabhi varpasā bhūt
translation: May Savitar the God send us full life, to each who sacrifices, lives aright and pours the juice That we with simple hearts may wait upon the Gods. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स यह्व्यो.अवनीर्गोष्वर्वा जुहोति परधन्यासु सस्रिः | अपादो यत्र युज्यासो.अरथा दरोण्यश्वास ईरते घर्तंवाः
transliteration: sa yahvyo.avanīrghoṣvarigvedaā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ | apādo yatra yujyāso.arathā droṇyaśvāsa īrate ghṛtaṃvāḥ
translation: May Indra evermore be gracious unto us, and may King Soma meditate our happiness, Even as men secure the comfort of a friend. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स रुद्रेभिरशस्तवार रभ्वा हित्वी गयमारेवद्यागात | वम्रस्य मन्ये मिथुना विवव्री अन्नमभीत्यारोदयन्मुषायन
transliteration: sa rudrebhiraśastavāra ṛbhvā hitvī ghayamāreavadyaāghāt | vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annamabhītyārodayanmuṣāyan
translation: Indra hath given the body with its song and strength: Brhaspati, thou art the lengthener of life. The sacrifice is Manu, Providence, our Sire. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स इद दासं तुवीरवं पतिर्दन षळक्षन्त्रिशीर्षाणं दमन्यत | अस्य तरितो नवोजसा वर्धानो विपावराहमयोग्रया हन
transliteration: sa id dāsaṃ tuvīravaṃ patirdan ṣaḷakṣantriśīrṣāṇaṃ damanyat | asya trito nvojasā vṛdhāno vipāvarāhamayoaghrayā han
translation: Indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed: the singer in the hotise is Agni, prudent Sage. lie is the sacrifice in synod, fair, most near. We ask for freedom and complete felicity,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स दरुह्वणे मनुष ऊर्ध्वसान आ साविषदर्शसानायशरुम | स नर्तमो नहुषो.अस्मत सुजातः पुरो.अभिनदर्हन्दस्युहत्ये
transliteration: sa druhvaṇe manuṣa ūrdhvasāna ā sāviṣadarśasānāyaśarum | sa nṛtamo nahuṣo.asmat sujātaḥ puro.abhinadarhandasyuhatye
translation: Not often have we sinned against you secretly, nor, Vasus, have we openly provoked the Gods. Not one of its, ye Gods, hath worn an alien shape. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: सो अभ्रियो न यवस उदन्यन कषयाय गातुं विदन नो अस्मे | उप यत सीददिन्दुं शरीरैः शयेनो.अयोपाष्टिर्हन्तिदस्यून
transliteration: so abhriyo na yavasa udanyan kṣayāya ghātuṃ vidan no asme | upa yat sīdadinduṃ śarīraiḥ śyeno.ayopāṣṭirhantidasyūn
translation: May Savitar remove from us our malady, and may the Mountains keep it far away from where The press-stone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: स वराधतः शवसानेभिरस्य कुत्साय शुष्णं कर्पणेपरादात | अयं कविमनयच्छस्यमानमत्कं वो अस्यसनितोत नर्णाम
transliteration: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhirasya kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ kṛpaṇeparādāt | ayaṃ kavimanayacchasyamānamatkaṃ vo asyasanitota nṛṇām
translation: Ye Vasus, let the stone, the presser stand erect: avert all enmities and keep them far remote. Our guard to be adored is Savitar this God. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: अयं दशस्यन नर्येभिरस्य दस्मो देवेभिर्वरुणो नमायी | अयं कनीन रतुपा अवेद्यमिमीताररुं यश्चतुष्पात
transliteration: ayaṃ daśasyan naryebhirasya dasmo devebhirigvedaaruṇo namāyī | ayaṃ kanīna ṛtupā avedyamimītāraruṃ yaścatuṣpāt
translation: Eat strength and fatness in the pasture, kine, who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of Law. So let your body be our body's medicine. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: अस्य सतोमेभिरौशिज रजिश्वा वरजं दरयद वर्षभेणपिप्रोः | सुत्वा यद यजतो दीदयद गीः पुर इयानो अभिवर्पसा भूत
transliteration: asya stomebhirauśija ṛjiśvā vrajaṃ darayad vṛṣabheṇapiproḥ | sutvā yad yajato dīdayad ghīḥ pura iyāno abhivarpasā bhūt
translation: The singer fills the spirit: all mens, love hath he. Indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice. For his libation is the heavenly udder full. We ask for freedom and complete felicity.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 99
sanskrit: एवा महो असुर वक्षथाय वम्रकः पड्भिरुप सर्पदिन्द्रम | स इयानः करति सवस्तिमस्मा इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः
transliteration: evā maho asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhirupa sarpadindram | sa iyānaḥ karati svastimasmā iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ
translation: Wondrous thy spirit-filling light, triumphant; thy hosts save from decay and are resistless. The pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 100
sanskrit: इन्द्र दर्ह्य मघवन तवावदिद भुज इह सतुतः सुतपाबोधि नो वर्धे | देवेभिर्नः सविता परावतु शरुतमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे
transliteration: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvadid bhuja iha stutaḥ sutapābodhi no vṛdhe | devebhirnaḥ savitā prāvatu śrutamāsarigvedaatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
translation: WAKE with one mind, my friends, and kindle Agni, ye who are many and who dwell together. Agni and Dadhikras and Dawn the Goddess, you, Gods with Indra, I call down to help us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 100
sanskrit: भराय सु भरत भागं रत्वियं पर वायवे शुचिपेक्रन्ददिष्टये | गौरस्य यः पयसः पीतिमानश आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे
transliteration: bharāya su bharata bhāghaṃ ṛtviyaṃ pra vāyave śucipekrandadiṣṭaye | ghaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītimānaśa āsarigvedaatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
translation: Make pleasant hymns, spin out your songs and praises: build ye a ship equipped with oars for transport. Prepare the implements, make all things ready, and let the sacrifice, my friends, go forward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: उद बुध्यध्वं समनसः सखायः समग्निमिन्ध्वं बहवःसनीळाः | दधिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीमिन्द्रावतोऽवसे नि हवये वः
transliteration: ud budhyadhvaṃ samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ samaghnimindhvaṃ bahavaḥsanīḷāḥ | dadhikrāmaghnimuṣasaṃ ca devīmindrāvato'vase ni hvaye vaḥ
translation: FOR thee may Indra boldly speed the car that works on either side. Favour us, Much-invoked! in this most glorious fight against the raiders of our wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: मन्द्रा कर्णुध्वं धिय आ तनुध्वं नावमरित्रपरणींक्र्णुध्वम | इष्क्र्णुध्वमायुधारं कर्णुध्वं पराञ्चंयज्ञं पर णयता सखायः
transliteration: mandrā kṛṇudhvaṃ dhiya ā tanudhvaṃ nāvamaritraparaṇīṃkṛṇudhvam | iṣkṛṇudhvamāyudhāraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ prāñcaṃyajñaṃ pra ṇayatā sakhāyaḥ
translation: Loose in the wind the woman's robe was streaming what time she won a car-load worth a thousand. The charioteer in fight was Mudgalani: she Indra's dart, heaped up the prize of battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: युनक्त सीरा वि युगा तनुध्वं कर्ते योनौ वपतेह बीजम | गिरा च शरुष्टिः शभरा असन नो नेदीय इत सर्ण्यःपक्वमेयात
transliteration: yunakta sīrā vi yughā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam | ghirā ca śruṣṭiḥ śabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥpakvameyāt
translation: O Indra, cast thy bolt among assailants who would slaughter us: The weapon both of Dasa and of Arya foe keep far away, O Maghavan.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: सीरा युञ्जन्ति कवयो युगा वि तन्वते पर्थक | धीरादेवेषु सुम्नया
transliteration: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yughā vi tanvate pṛthak | dhīrādeveṣu sumnayā
translation: The bull in joy had drunk a lake of water. His shattering horn encountered an opponent. Swiftly, in vigorous strength, eager for glory, he stretched his forefeet, fain to win and triumph.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: निराहावान कर्णोतन सं वरत्रा दधातन | सिञ्चामहावतमुद्रिणं वयं सुषेकमनुपक्षितम
transliteration: nirāhāvān kṛṇotana saṃ varatrā dadhātana | siñcāmahāavatamudriṇaṃ vayaṃ suṣekamanupakṣitam
translation: They came anear the bull; they made him thunder, made him pour rain down ere the fight was ended. And Mudgala thereby won in the contest well-pastured kine in hundreds and in thousands.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: इष्क्र्ताहावमवतं सुवरत्रं सुषेचनम | उद्रिणं सिञ्चेक्षितम
transliteration: iṣkṛtāhāvamavataṃ suvaratraṃ suṣecanam | udriṇaṃ siñceakṣitam
translation: In hope of victory that bull was harnessed: Kesi the driver urged him on with shouting. As he ran swiftly with the car behind him his lifted heels pressed close on Mudgalani.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: परीणीताश्वान हितं जयाथ सवस्तिवाहं रथमित्क्र्णुध्वम | दरोणाहावमवतमश्मचक्रमंसत्रकोशंसिञ्चता नर्पाणम
transliteration: prīṇītāśvān hitaṃ jayātha svastivāhaṃ rathamitkṛṇudhvam | droṇāhāvamavatamaśmacakramaṃsatrakośaṃsiñcatā nṛpāṇam
translation: Deftly for him he stretched the car-pole forward, guided the bull thereto and firmly yoked him. Indra vouchsafed the lord of cows his favour: with mighty steps the buffalo ran onward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 101
sanskrit: वरजं कर्णुध्वं स हि वो नर्पाणो वर्म सीव्यध्वं बहुलाप्र्थूनि | पुरः कर्णुध्वमायसीरध्र्ष्टा मा वः सुस्रोच्चमसो दरंहता तम
transliteration: vrajaṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ sa hi vo nṛpāṇo varma sīvyadhvaṃ bahulāpṛthūni | puraḥ kṛṇudhvamāyasīradhṛṣṭā mā vaḥ susroccamaso dṛṃhatā tam
translation: Touched by the goad the shaggy beast went nobly, bound to the pole by the yoke's thong of leather. Performing deeds of might for many people, he, looking on the cows, gained strength and vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: पर ते रथं मिथूक्र्तमिन्द्रो.अवतु धर्ष्णुया | अस्मिन्नाजौ पुरुहूत शरवाय्ये धनभक्षेषु नो.अव
transliteration: pra te rathaṃ mithūkṛtamindro.avatu dhṛṣṇuyā | asminnājau puruhūta śravāyye dhanabhakṣeṣu no.ava
translation: SWIFT, rapidly striking, like a bull who sharpens his horns, terrific, stirring up the people, With eyes that close not, bellowing, Sole Hero, Indra. subdued at once a hundred armies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: उत सम वातो वहति वासो.अस्या अधिरथं यदजयत सहस्रम | रथीरभून मुद्गलानी गविष्टौ भरे कर्तं वयचेदिन्द्रसेना
transliteration: ut sma vāto vahati vāso.asyā adhirathaṃ yadajayat sahasram | rathīrabhūn mudghalānī ghaviṣṭau bhare kṛtaṃ vyacedindrasenā
translation: With him loud-roaring, ever watchful, Victor, bold, hard to overthrow, Rouser of battle, Indra. the Strong, whose hand bears arrows, conquer, ye warriors, now, now vanquish in the combat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: अन्तर्यछ जिघांसतो वज्रमिन्द्राभिदासतः | दासस्यवा मघवन्नार्यस्य वा सनुतर्यवया वधम
transliteration: antaryacha jighāṃsato vajramindrābhidāsataḥ | dāsasyavā maghavannāryasya vā sanutaryavayā vadham
translation: He rules with those who carry shafts and quivers, Indra who with his band rings hosts together, Foe-conquering, strong of arm, the Soma-drinker, with mighty bow, shooting with well-laid arrows.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: उद्नो हरदमपिबज्जर्ह्र्षाणः कूटं सम तरंहदभिमातिमेति | पर मुष्कभारः शरव इछमानो.अजिरम्बाहू अभरत सिषासन
transliteration: udno hradamapibajjarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭaṃ sma tṛṃhadabhimātimeti | pra muṣkabhāraḥ śrava ichamāno.ajirambāhū abharat siṣāsan
translation: Brhaspati, fly with thy chariot hither, slayer of demons, driving off our foemen. Be thou protector of our cars, destroyer, victor in battle, breaker-up of armies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: नयक्रन्दयन्नुपयन्त एनममेहयन वर्षभं मध्य आजेः | तेन सूभर्वं शतवत सहस्रं गवां मुद्गलः परधनेजिगाय
transliteration: nyakrandayannupayanta enamamehayan vṛṣabhaṃ madhya ājeḥ | tena sūbharigvedaaṃ śatavat sahasraṃ ghavāṃ mudghalaḥ pradhanejighāya
translation: Conspicuous by thy strength, firm, foremost fighter, mighty and fierce, victorious, all-subduing, The Son of Conquest, passing men and heroes, kine-winner, mount thy conquering car, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: ककर्दवे वर्षभो युक्त आसीदवावचीत सारथिरस्य केशी | दुधेर्युक्तस्य दरवतः सहानस रछन्ति षमा निष्पदोमुद्गलानीम
transliteration: kakardave vṛṣabho yukta āsīdavāvacīt sārathirasya keśī | dudheryuktasya dravataḥ sahānasa ṛchanti ṣmā niṣpadomudghalānīm
translation: Cleaver of stalls, kine-winner, armed with thunder, who quells an army and with might destroys it.- Follow him, brothers! quit yourselves like heroes, and like this Indra show your zeal and courage.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 102
sanskrit: उत परधिमुदहन्नस्य विद्वानुपायुनग वंसगमत्रशिक्षन | इन्द्र उदावत पतिमघ्न्यानामरंहतपद्याभिः ककुद्मान
transliteration: uta pradhimudahannasya vidvānupāyunagh vaṃsaghamatraśikṣan | indra udāvat patimaghnyānāmaraṃhatapadyābhiḥ kakudmān
translation: Piercing the cow-stalls with surpassing vigour, Indra, the pitiless Hero, wild with anger, Victor in fight, unshaken and resistless, may he protect our armies in our battles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: आशुः शिशानो वर्षभो न भीमो घनाघनः कषोभणश्चर्षणीनाम | संक्रन्दनो.अनिमिष एकवीरः शतं सेनाजयत साकमिन्द्रः
transliteration: saṃkrandano.animiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senāajayat sākamindraḥ
translation: Soma hath flowed for thee, Invoked of mat Speed to our sacrifice with both thy Coursers. To thee have streamed the songs or mighty singers, imploring, Indra, drink of our libation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: संक्रन्दनेनानिमिषेण जिष्णुना युत्कारेण दुश्च्यवनेनध्र्ष्णुना | तदिन्द्रेण जयत तत सहध्वं युधो नरैषुहस्तेन वर्ष्णा
transliteration: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanenadhṛṣṇunā | tadindreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho naraiṣuhastena vṛṣṇā
translation: Drink of the juice which men have washed in waters, and fill thee full, O Lord of Tawny Horses. O Indra, hearer of the laud, with Soma which stones have mixed for thee enhance thy rapture.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: स इषुहस्तैः स निषङगिभिर्वशी संस्रष्टा स युधैन्द्रो गणेन | संस्र्ष्टजित सोमपा बाहुशर्ध्युग्रधन्वाप्रतिहिताभिरस्ता
transliteration: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅghibhirigvedaaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaindro ghaṇena | saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhyughradhanvāpratihitābhirastā
translation: To make thee start, a strong true draught I offer to thee, the Bull, O thou whom Bay Steeds carry. Here take delight, O Indra, in our voices while thou art hymned with power and all our spirit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: बर्हस्पते परि दीया रथेन रक्षोहामित्रानपबाधमानः | परभञ्जन सेनाः परम्र्णो युधा जयन्नस्माकमेध्यविता रथानाम
transliteration: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrānapabādhamānaḥ | prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayannasmākamedhyavitā rathānām
translation: O Mighty Indra, through thine aid, thy prowess, obtaining life, zealous, and skilled in Order, Men in the house who share the sacred banquet stand singing praise that brings them store of children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: बलविज्ञाय सथविरः परवीरः सहस्वान वाजी सहमानौग्रः | अभिवीरो अभिसत्वा सहोजा जैत्रमिन्द्र रथमातिष्ठ गोवित
transliteration: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaughraḥ | abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitramindra rathamātiṣṭha ghovit
translation: Through thy directions, Lord of Tawny Coursers, thine who art firm, splendid, and blest, the people Obtain most liberal aid for their salvation, and praise thee, Indra, through thine excellencies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: गोत्रभिदं गोविदं वज्रबाहुं जयन्तमज्म परम्र्णन्तमोजसा | इमं सजाता अनु वीरयध्वमिन्द्रं सखायो अनुसं रभध्वम
transliteration: ghotrabhidaṃ ghovidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantamajma pramṛṇantamojasā | imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvamindraṃ sakhāyo anusaṃ rabhadhvam
translation: Lord of the Bays, come with thy two Bay Horses, come to our prayers, to drink the juice of Soma. To thee comes sacrifice which thou acceptest: thou, skilled in holy rites, art he who giveth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: अभि गोत्राणि सहसा गाहमानो.अदयो वीरः शतमन्युरिन्द्रः | दुश्च्यवनः पर्तनाषाळ अयुध्यो.अस्माकं सेनावतु पर युत्सु
transliteration: abhi ghotrāṇi sahasā ghāhamāno.adayo vīraḥ śatamanyurindraḥ | duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ ayudhyo.asmākaṃ senāavatu pra yutsu
translation: Him of a thousand powers, subduing foemen, Maghavan praised with hymns and pleased with Soma,- Even him our songs approach, resistless Indra: the adorations of the singer laud him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: इन्द्र आसां नेता बर्हस्पतिर्दक्षिणा यज्ञः पुर एतुसोमः | देवसेनानामभिभञ्जतीनां जयन्तीनां मरुतोयन्त्वग्रम
transliteration: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatirdakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etusomaḥ | devasenānāmabhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ marutoyantvaghram
translation: The way to bliss for Gods and man thou foundest, Indra, seven lovely floods, divine, untroubled, Wherewith thou, rending forts, didst move the ocean, and nine-and-ninety flowing streams of water.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य वर्ष्णो वरुणस्य राज्ञ आदित्यानां मरुतांशर्ध उग्रम | महामनसां भुवनच्यवानां घोषोदेवानां जयतामुदस्थात
transliteration: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃśardha ughram | mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣodevānāṃ jayatāmudasthāt
translation: Thou from the curse didst free the mighty Waters, and as their only God didst watch and guard them. O Indra, cherish evermore thy body with those which thou hast won in quelling Vrtra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: उद धर्षय मघवन्नायुधान्युत सत्वनां मामकानाम्मनांसि | उद वर्त्रहन वाजिनां वाजिनान्युद रथानांजयतां यन्तु घोषाः
transliteration: ud dharṣaya maghavannāyudhānyut satvanāṃ māmakānāmmanāṃsi | ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājinānyud rathānāṃjayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ
translation: Heroic power and noble praise is Indra yea, the song worships him invoked of many. Vrtra he quelled, and gave men room and freedom: Gakra, victorious, hath conquered armies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 103
sanskrit: अस्माकमिन्द्रः सम्र्तेषु धवजेष्वस्माकं या इषवस्ताजयन्तु | अस्माकं वीरा उत्तरे भवन्त्वस्मानु देवा अवताहवेषु
transliteration: asmākamindraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣvasmākaṃ yā iṣavastājayantu | asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantvasmānu devā avatāhaveṣu
translation: Call we on Maghayan, auspicious Indra. best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 104
sanskrit: असावि सोमः पुरुहूत तुभ्यं हरिभ्यां यज्ञमुप याहितूयम | तुभ्यं गिरो विप्रवीरा इयाना दधन्विर इन्द्रपिबा सुतस्य
transliteration: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyaṃ haribhyāṃ yajñamupa yāhitūyam | tubhyaṃ ghiro vipravīrā iyānā dadhanvira indrapibā sutasya
translation: WHEN, Vasu, wilt thou love the laud? Now let the channel bring the stream. The juice is ready to ferment.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 104
sanskrit: अप्सु धूतस्य हरिवः पिबेह नर्भिः सुतस्य जठरम्प्र्णस्व | मिमिक्षुर्यमद्रय इन्द्र तुभ्यं तेभिर्वर्धस्वमदमुक्थवाहः
transliteration: apsu dhūtasya harivaḥ pibeha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharampṛṇasva | mimikṣuryamadraya indra tubhyaṃ tebhirigvedaardhasvamadamukthavāhaḥ
translation: He whose two Bay Steeds harnessed well, swerving, pursue the Bird's tail-plumes, With Rowing manes, like heaven and earth, he is the Lord with power to give.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 104
sanskrit: परोग्रां पीतिं वर्ष्ण इयर्मि सत्यां परयै सुतस्यहर्यश्व तुभ्यम | इन्द्र धेनाभिरिह मादयस्व धीभिर्विश्वाभिः शच्या गर्णानः
transliteration: proghrāṃ pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyāṃ prayai sutasyaharyaśva tubhyam | indra dhenābhiriha mādayasva dhībhirigvedaśvābhiḥ śacyā ghṛṇānaḥ
translation: Bereft of skill is Indra, if, like some outwearied man he fears The sinner, when the Mighty hath prepared himself for victory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 105
sanskrit: कदा वसो सतोत्रं हर्यत आव शमशा रुधद वाः | दीर्घं सुतं वाताप्याय
transliteration: kadā vaso stotraṃ haryata āva śmaśā rudhad vāḥ | dīrghaṃ sutaṃ vātāpyāya
translation: THIS very thing ye Twain hold as your object: ye weave your songs as skillful men weave garments. That ye may come united have I waked you: ye spread out food like days of lovely weather.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 105
sanskrit: हरी यस्य सुयुजा विव्रता वेरर्वन्तानु शेपा | उभारजी न केशिना पतिर्दन
transliteration: harī yasya suyujā vivratā verarigvedaantānu śepā | ubhārajī na keśinā patirdan
translation: Like two plough-bulls ye move along in traces, and seek like eager guests your bidder's banquet. Ye are like glorious envoys mid the people: like bulls, approach the place where ye are watered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 105
sanskrit: अप योरिन्द्रः पापज आ मर्तो न शश्रमाणो बिभीवान | शुभे यद युयुजे तविषीवान
transliteration: apa yorindraḥ pāpaja ā marto na śaśramāṇo bibhīvān |
translation: Like the two pinions of a bird, connected, like two choice animals, ye have sought our worship. Bright as the fire the votary hath kindled, ye sacrifice in many a spot as roamers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 106
sanskrit: उभा उ नूनं तदिदर्थयेथे वि तन्वाथे धियोवश्त्रापसेव | सध्रीचीना यातवे परेमजीगः सुदिनेवप्र्क्ष आ तंसयेथे
transliteration: ubhā u nūnaṃ tadidarthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyovaśtrāpaseva | sadhrīcīnā yātave premajīghaḥ sudinevapṛkṣa ā taṃsayethe
translation: THESE men's great bounty hath been manifested, and the whole world of life set free from darkness. Great light hath come, vouchsafed us by the Fathers: apparent is the spacious path of Guerdon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 106
sanskrit: उष्टारेव फर्वरेषु शरयेथे परायोगेव शवात्र्या शासुरेथः | दूतेव हि षठो यशसा जनेषु माप सथातम्महिषेवापानात
transliteration: uṣṭāreva pharigvedaareṣu śrayethe prāyogheva śvātryā śāsurethaḥ | dūteva hi ṣṭho yaśasā janeṣu māpa sthātammahiṣevāpānāt
translation: High up in heaven abide the Guerdon-givers: they who give steeds dwell with the Sun for ever. They who give gold are blest with life eternal. they who give robes prolong their lives, O Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 106
sanskrit: साकंयुजा शकुनस्येव पक्षा पश्वेव चित्रा यजुरागमिष्टम | अग्निरिव देवयोर्दीदिवांसा परिज्मानेवयजथः पुरुत्रा
transliteration: sākaṃyujā śakunasyeva pakṣā paśveva citrā yajurāghamiṣṭam | aghniriva devayordīdivāṃsā parijmānevayajathaḥ purutrā
translation: Not from the niggards-for they give not freely-comes Meed at sacrifice, Gods' satisfaction: Yea, many men with hands stretched out with Guerdon present their gifts because they dread dishonour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 107
sanskrit: आविरभून महि माघोनमेषां विश्वं जीवं तमसो निरमोचि | महि जयोतिः पित्र्भिर्दत्तमागादुरुः पन्थादक्षिणाया अदर्शि
transliteration: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhirdattamāghāduruḥ panthādakṣiṇāyā adarśi
translation: WHAT wish of Sarama hath brought her hither? The path leads far away to distant places. What charge hast thou for us? Where turns thy journey? How hast thou made thy way o'er Rasa's waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 107
sanskrit: उच्चा दिवि दक्षिणावन्तो अस्थुर्ये अश्वदाः सह तेसूर्येण | हिरण्यदा अम्र्तत्वं भजन्ते वासोदाः सोम परतिरन्त आयुः
transliteration: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthurye aśvadāḥ saha tesūryeṇa | hiraṇyadā amṛtatvaṃ bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pratiranta āyuḥ
translation: I come appointed messenger of Indra, seeking your ample stores of wealth, O Panis. This hath preserved me from the fear of crossing: thus have I made my way o'er Rasa's waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 107
sanskrit: दैवी पूर्तिर्दक्षिणा देवयज्या न कवारिभ्यो नहि तेप्र्णन्ति | अथा नरः परयतदक्षिणासो.अवद्यभियाबहवः पर्णन्ति
transliteration: daivī pūrtirdakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi tepṛṇanti | athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso.avadyabhiyābahavaḥ pṛṇanti
translation: What is that Indra like, what is his aspect whose envoy, Sarama, from afar thou comest? Let him approach, and we will show him friendship: he shall be made the herdsman of our cattle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 108
sanskrit: किमिछन्ती सरमा परेदमानड दूरे हयध्वा जगुरिःपराचैः | कास्मेहितिः का परितक्म्यासीत कथं रसायातरः पयांसि
transliteration: kimichantī saramā predamānaḍ dūre hyadhvā jaghuriḥparācaiḥ | kāsmehitiḥ kā paritakmyāsīt kathaṃ rasāyāataraḥ payāṃsi
translation: THESE first, the boundless Sea, and Matarisvan, fierce-glowing Fire, the Strong, the Bliss-bestower. And heavenly Floods, first-born by holy Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brahman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 108
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्य दूतीरिषिता चरामि मह इछन्ती पणयो निधीन्वः | अतिष्कदो भियसा तन न आवत तथा रसाया अतरम्पयांसि
transliteration: indrasya dūtīriṣitā carāmi maha ichantī paṇayo nidhīnvaḥ | atiṣkado bhiyasā tan na āvat tathā rasāyā atarampayāṃsi
translation: King Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brahman's consort. Mitra and Varuna were the inviters: Agni as Hota; took her hand and led her.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 108
sanskrit: कीद्रंं इन्द्रः सरमे का दर्शीका यस्येदं दूतीरसरः पराकात | आ च गछान मित्रमेना दधामाथागवां गोपतिर्नो भवाति
transliteration: kīdṛṃṃ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraḥ parākāt |
translation: The man, her pledge, must by her hand be taken when they have cried, She is a Brahman's consort. She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: ते.अवदन परथमा बरह्मकिल्बिषे.अकूपारः सलिलोमातरिश्वा | वीळुहरास्तप उग्रो मयोभूरापो देवीःप्रथमजा रतेन
transliteration: te.avadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe.akūpāraḥ salilomātariśvā | vīḷuharāstapa ughro mayobhūrāpo devīḥprathamajā ṛtena
translation: THOU in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest Gods as God, O Jatavedas. Observant, bright as Mitra, bring them hither: thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: सोमो राजा परथमो बरह्मजायां पुनः परायछदह्र्णीयमानः | अन्वर्तिता वरुणो मित्र आसीदग्निर्होताहस्तग्र्ह्या निनाय
transliteration: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyāṃ punaḥ prāyachadahṛṇīyamānaḥ | anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīdaghnirhotāhastaghṛhyā nināya
translation: Tanunapat, fair-tongued, with sweet meath balming the paths and ways of Order, make them pleasant. Convey our sacrifice to heaven, exalting with holy thoughts our hymns of praise and worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: हस्तेनैव गराह्य आधिरस्या बरह्मजायेयमिति चेदवोचन | न दूताय परह्ये तस्थ एषा तथा राष्ट्रं गुपितंक्षत्रियस्य
transliteration: hastenaiva ghrāhya ādhirasyā brahmajāyeyamiti cedavocan | na dūtāya prahye tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ ghupitaṃkṣatriyasya
translation: Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O Agni, come accordant with the Vasus. Thou art, O Youthful Lord, the Gods' Invoker, so, best of Sacrificers, bring them quickly.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: देवा एतस्यामवदन्त पूर्वे सप्तर्षयस्तपसे ये निषेदुः | भीमा जाया बराह्मणस्योपनीता दुर्धां दधातिपरमे वयोमन
transliteration: devā etasyāmavadanta pūrigvedae saptaṛṣayastapase ye niṣeduḥ | bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyopanītā durdhāṃ dadhātiparame vyoman
translation: By rule the Sacred Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking. Widely it spreads around and far-extended, fair for the Gods and bringing peace and freedom.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: बरह्मचारी चरति वेविषद विषः स देवानां भवत्येकमङगम | तेन जायामन्वविन्दद बर्हस्पतिः सोमेन नीतांजुह्वं न देवाः
transliteration: brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānāṃ bhavatyekamaṅgham | tena jāyāmanvavindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃjuhvaṃ na devāḥ
translation: Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands. Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the Gods and give them easy entrance.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: पुनर्वै देवा अददुः पुनर्मनुष्या उत | राजानःसत्यं कर्ण्वाना बरह्मजायां पुनर्ददुः
transliteration: punarigvedaai devā adaduḥ punarmanuṣyā uta | rājānaḥsatyaṃ kṛṇvānā brahmajāyāṃ punardaduḥ
translation: Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and Morning, each close to each, he seated at their station, Lofty, celestial Dames with gold to deck them. assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 109
sanskrit: पुनर्दाय बरह्मजायां कर्त्वी देवैर्निकिल्बिषम | ऊर्जम्प्र्थिव्या भक्त्वायोरुगायमुपासते
transliteration: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvī devairnikilbiṣam |
translation: Come the two first celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging sacrifice for man to worship As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastward light with their direction.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 110
sanskrit: समिद्धो अद्य मनुषो दुरोणे देवो देवान यजसि जातवेदः | आ च वह मित्रमहश्चिकित्वान तवं दूतः कविरसिप्रचेताः
transliteration: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ |
translation: BRING forth your sacred song ye prudent singers, even as are the thoughts of human beings. Let us draw Indra with true deeds anear us: he loves our songs, the Hero, and is potent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 111
sanskrit: मनीषिणः पर भरध्वं मनीषां यथा-यथा मतयःसन्ति नर्णाम | इन्द्रं सत्यैरेरयामा कर्तेभिः स हिवीरो गिर्वणस्युर्विदानः
transliteration: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvaṃ manīṣāṃ yathā-yathā matayaḥsanti nṛṇām | indraṃ satyairerayāmā kṛtebhiḥ sa hivīro ghirigvedaaṇasyurigvedadānaḥ
translation: DRINK of the juice, O Indra, at thy plea. sure, for thy first draught is early morn's libation. Rejoice, that thou mayst slay our foes, O Hero, and we with lauds will tell thy mighty exploits.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: इन्द्र पिब परतिकामं सुतस्य परातःसावस्तव हिपूर्वपीतिः | हर्षस्व हन्तवे शूर शत्रूनुक्थेभिष टेवीर्या पर बरवाम
transliteration: indra piba pratikāmaṃ sutasya prātaḥsāvastava hipūrigvedaapītiḥ | harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūnukthebhiṣ ṭevīryā pra bravāma
translation: THE Heavens and the Earth accordant with all Gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his. When he came showing forth his majesty and power, he drank of Soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: यस्ते रथो मनसो जवीयानेन्द्र तेन सोमपेयाय याहि | तूयमा ते हरयः पर दरवन्तु येभिर्यासि वर्षभिर्मन्दमानः
transliteration: yaste ratho manaso javīyānendra tena somapeyāya yāhi | tūyamā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiryāsi vṛṣabhirmandamānaḥ
translation: This majesty of his Visnu extols and lauds, making the state that gives the meath flow forth with might. When Indra Maghavan with those who followed him had smitten Vrtra he deserved the choice of Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: हरित्वता वर्चसा सूर्यस्य शरेष्ठै रूपैस्तन्वंस्पर्शयस्व | अस्माभिरिन्द्र सखिभिर्हुवानः सध्रीचीनोमादयस्वा निषद्य
transliteration: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhai rūpaistanvaṃsparśayasva | asmābhirindra sakhibhirhuvānaḥ sadhrīcīnomādayasvā niṣadya
translation: When, bearing warlike weapons, fain to win thee praise, thou meetest Vrtra, yea, the Dragon, for the fight, Then all the Maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled, O Mighty One, thy powerful majesty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: यस्य तयत ते महिमानं मदेष्विमे मही रोदसीनाविविक्ताम | तदोक आ हरिभिरिन्द्र युक्तैः परियेभिर्याहि परियमन्नमछ
transliteration: yasya tyat te mahimānaṃ madeṣvime mahī rodasīnāviviktām | tadoka ā haribhirindra yuktaiḥ priyebhiryāhi priyamannamacha
translation: Soon as he sprang to life he forced asunder hosts: forward the Hero looked to manly deed and war. He cleft the rock, he let concurrent streams flow forth, and with his skillful art stablished the heavens' wide vault.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: यस्य शश्वत पपिवानिन्द्र शत्रूननानुक्र्त्या रण्याचकर्थ | स ते पुरन्धिं तविषीमियर्ति स ते मदायसुत इन्द्र सोमः
transliteration: yasya śaśvat papivānindra śatrūnanānukṛtyā raṇyācakartha | sa te purandhiṃ taviṣīmiyarti sa te madāyasuta indra somaḥ
translation: Indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power: he forced, far from each other, heaven and earth apart. He hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt, a joy to Varuna's and Mitra's worshipper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: इदं ते पात्रं सनवित्तमिन्द्र पिबा सोममेना शतक्रतो | पूर्ण आहावो मदिरस्य मध्वो यं विश्व इदभिहर्यन्तिदेवाः
transliteration: idaṃ te pātraṃ sanavittamindra pibā somamenā śatakrato | pūrṇa āhāvo madirasya madhvo yaṃ viśva idabhiharyantidevāḥ
translation: Then to the mighty powers of Indra, to his wrath, his the fierce Stormer, loud of voice, they came with speed; What time the Potent One rent Vrtra with his strength, who held the waters back, whom darkness compassed round.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: वि हि तवामिन्द्र पुरुधा जनासो हितप्रयसो वर्षभह्वयन्ते | अस्माकं ते मधुमत्तमानीमा भुवन सवना तेषुहर्य
transliteration: vi hi tvāmindra purudhā janāso hitaprayaso vṛṣabhahvayante | asmākaṃ te madhumattamānīmā bhuvan savanā teṣuharya
translation: Even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute, Deep darkness fell upon the slain, and Indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: पर त इन्द्र पूर्व्याणि पर नूनं वीर्या वोचं परथमाक्र्तानि | सतीनमन्युरश्रथायो अद्रिं सुवेदनामक्र्णोर्ब्रह्मणे गाम
transliteration: pra ta indra pūrigvedayāṇi pra nūnaṃ vīryā vocaṃ prathamākṛtāni | satīnamanyuraśrathāyo adriṃ suvedanāmakṛṇorbrahmaṇe ghām
translation: Then all the Gods extolled, with eloquence inspired by draughts of Soma juice, thy deeds of manly might. As Agni eats the dry food with his tongue, he ate Vrtra, the Dragon, maimed by Indra's deadly dart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: नि षु सीद गणपते गणेषु तवामाहुर्विप्रतमंकवीनाम | न रते तवत करियते किं चनारे महामर्कंमघवञ्चित्रमर्च
transliteration: ni ṣu sīda ghaṇapate ghaṇeṣu tvāmāhurigvedapratamaṃkavīnām | na ṛte tvat kriyate kiṃ canāre mahāmarkaṃmaghavañcitramarca
translation: Proclaim his many friendships, met with friendship, made with singers, with the skillful and the eloquent. Indra, when he subdues Dhuni and Cumuri, lists to Dabhiti for his faithful spirit's sake.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 112
sanskrit: अभिख्या नो मघवन नाधमानान सखे बोधि वसुपतेसखीनाम | रणं कर्धि रणक्र्त सत्यशुष्माभक्ते चिदाभजा राये अस्मान
transliteration: abhikhyā no maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupatesakhīnām | raṇaṃ kṛdhi raṇakṛt satyaśuṣmābhakte cidābhajā rāye asmān
translation: Give riches manifold with noble horses, to be remembered while my songs address thee. May we by easy paths pass all our troubles: find us this day a ford wide and extensive.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 113
sanskrit: तमस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी सचेतसा विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुशुष्ममावताम | यदैत कर्ण्वानो महिमानमिन्द्रियम्पीत्वी सोमस्य करतुमानवर्धत
transliteration: tamasya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhirdevairanuśuṣmamāvatām | yadait kṛṇvāno mahimānamindriyampītvī somasya kratumānavardhata
translation: Two perfect springs of heat pervade the Threefold, and come for their delight is Matarisvan. Craving the milk of heaven the Gods are present: well do they know the praisesong and the Saman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 113
sanskrit: तमस्य विष्णुर्महिमानमोजसांशुं दधन्वान मधुनोवि रप्शते | देवेभिरिन्द्रो मघवा सयावभिर्व्र्त्रंजघन्वानभवद वरेण्यः
transliteration: tamasya viṣṇurmahimānamojasāṃśuṃ dadhanvān madhunovi rapśate | devebhirindro maghavā sayāvabhirigvedaṛtraṃjaghanvānabhavad vareṇyaḥ
translation: The priests beard far away, as they are ordered, serve the three Nirrtis, for well they know them. Sages have traced the cause that first produced them, dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 113
sanskrit: वर्त्रेण यदहिना बिभ्रदायुधा समस्थिथा युधयेशंसमाविदे | विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सह तमनावर्धन्नुग्र महिमानमिन्द्रियम
transliteration: vṛtreṇa yadahinā bibhradāyudhā samasthithā yudhayeśaṃsamāvide | viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanāvardhannughra mahimānamindriyam
translation: The Youthful One, well-shaped, with four locks braided, brightened with oil, puts on the ordinances. Two Birds of mighty power are seated near her, there where the Deities receive their portion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 113
sanskrit: जज्ञान एव वयबाधत सप्र्धः परापश्यद वीरो अभिपौंस्यं रणम | अव्र्श्चदद्रिमव सस्यदः सर्जदस्तभ्नान नाकं सवपस्यया पर्थुम
transliteration: jajñāna eva vyabādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyad vīro abhipauṃsyaṃ raṇam | avṛścadadrimava sasyadaḥ sṛjadastabhnān nākaṃ svapasyayā pṛthum
translation: One of these Birds hath passed into the sea of air: thence he looks round and views this universal world. With simple heart I have beheld him from anear: his Mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 114
sanskrit: घर्मा समन्ता तरिव्र्तं वयापतुस्तयोर्जुष्टिम्मातरिश्वा जगाम | दिवस पयो दिधिषाणा अवेषन विदुर्देवाः सहसामानमर्कम
transliteration: gharmā samantā trivṛtaṃ vyāpatustayorjuṣṭimmātariśvā jaghāma | divas payo didhiṣāṇā aveṣan vidurdevāḥ sahasāmānamarkam
translation: VERILY wondrous is the tender Youngling's growth who never draweth nigh to drink his Mothers' milk. As soon as she who hath no udder bore him, he, faring on his great errand, suddenly grew strong.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 114
sanskrit: तिस्रो देष्ट्राय निरतीरुपासते दीर्घश्रुतो वि हिजानन्ति वह्नयः | तासां नि चिक्युः कवयो निदानम्परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु
transliteration: tisro deṣṭrāya nirtīrupāsate dīrghaśruto vi hijānanti vahnayaḥ | tāsāṃ ni cikyuḥ kavayo nidānampareṣu yā ghuhyeṣu vrateṣu
translation: Then Agni was his name, most active to bestow, gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth; Skilled in fair sacrifice, armed with destroying tongue, impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 114
sanskrit: चतुष्कपर्दा युवतिः सुपेशा घर्तप्रतीका वयुनानि वस्ते | तस्यां सुपर्णा वर्षणा नि षेदतुर्यत्र देवा दधिरेभागधेयम
transliteration: catuṣkapardā yuvatiḥ supeśā ghṛtapratīkā vayunāni vaste | tasyāṃ suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni ṣedaturyatra devā dadhirebhāghadheyam
translation: Praise him, your God who, bird-like, rests upon a tree, scattering drops of juice and pouring forth his flood, Speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest, and broadening his paths like one of high command.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 114
sanskrit: एकः सुपर्णः स समुद्रमा विवेष स इदं विश्वम्भुवनं वि चष्टे | तं पाकेन मनसापश्यमन्तितस्तम्माता रेळि स उ रेळि मातरम
transliteration: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudramā viveṣa sa idaṃ viśvambhuvanaṃ vi caṣṭe | taṃ pākena manasāpaśyamantitastammātā reḷi sa u reḷi mātaram
translation: Thou Everlasting, whom, far-striding fain to burn, the winds, uninterrupted, never overcome, They have approached, as warriors eager for the fight, heroic Trita, guiding him to gain his wish.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 114
sanskrit: सुपर्णं विप्राः कवयो वचोभिरेकं सन्तं बहुधाकल्पयन्ति | छन्दांसि च दधतो अध्वरेषु गरहान सोमस्यमिमते दवादश
transliteration: suparṇaṃ viprāḥ kavayo vacobhirekaṃ santaṃ bahudhākalpayanti | chandāṃsi ca dadhato adhvareṣu ghrahān somasyamimate dvādaśa
translation: This Agni is the best of Kanvas, Kanvas' Friend, Conqueror of the foe whether afar or near. May Agni guard the singers, guard the princes well: may Agni grant to us our princes' gracious help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 115
sanskrit: चित्र इच्छिशोस्तरुणस्य वक्षथो न यो मातरावप्येतिधातवे | अनूधा यदि जीजनदधा च नु ववक्ष सद्योमहि दूत्यं चरन
transliteration: citra icchiśostaruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāvapyetidhātave | anūdhā yadi jījanadadhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyomahi dūtyaṃ caran
translation: DRINK Soma juice for mighty power and vigour, drink, Strongest One, that thou mayst smite down Vrtra. Drink thou, invoked, for strength, and riches: drink thou thy fill of meath and pour it down, O Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 115
sanskrit: अग्निर्ह नाम धायि दन्नपस्तमः सं यो वना युवतेभस्मना दता | अभिप्रमुरा जुह्वा सवध्वर इनो नप्रोथमानो यवसे वर्षा
transliteration: aghnirha nāma dhāyi dannapastamaḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvatebhasmanā datā | abhipramurā juhvā svadhvara ino naprothamāno yavase vṛṣā
translation: Drink of the foodful juice stirred into motion, drink what thou choosest of the flowing Soma. Giver of weal, be joyful in thy spirit, and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 115
sanskrit: तं वो विं न दरुषदं देवमन्धस इन्दुं परोथन्तम्प्रवपन्तमर्णवम | आसा वह्निं न शोचिषा विरप्शिनम्महिव्रतं न सरजन्तमध्वनः
transliteration: taṃ vo viṃ na druṣadaṃ devamandhasa induṃ prothantampravapantamarṇavam |
translation: Let heavenly Soma gladden thee, O Indra, let that effused among mankind delight thee. Rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom, and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 116
sanskrit: पिबा सोमं महत इन्द्रियाय पिबा वर्त्राय हन्तवेशविष्ठ | पिब राये शवसे हूयमानः पिब मध्वस्त्र्पदिन्द्रा वर्षस्व
transliteration: pibā somaṃ mahata indriyāya pibā vṛtrāya hantaveśaviṣṭha | piba rāye śavase hūyamānaḥ piba madhvastṛpadindrā vṛṣasva
translation: THE Gods have not ordained hunger to be our death: even to the well-fed man comes death in varied shape. The riches of the liberal never waste away, while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 116
sanskrit: अस्य पिब कषुमतः परस्थितस्येन्द्र सोमस्य वरमासुतश्य | सवस्तिदा मनसा मादयस्वार्वाचीनो रेवतेसौभगाय
transliteration: asya piba kṣumataḥ prasthitasyendra somasya varamāsutaśya | svastidā manasā mādayasvārigvedaācīno revatesaubhaghāya
translation: The man with food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat, Hardens his heart against him-even when of old he did him service-finds not one to comfort him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 116
sanskrit: ममत्तु तवा दिव्यः सोम इन्द्र ममत्तु यः सूयतेपार्थिवेषु | ममत्तु येन वरिवश्चकर्थ ममत्तु येननिरिणासि शत्रून
transliteration: mamattu tvā divyaḥ soma indra mamattu yaḥ sūyatepārthiveṣu | mamattu yena varivaścakartha mamattu yenaniriṇāsi śatrūn
translation: Bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble. Success attends him in the shout of battle. He makes a friend of him in future troubles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: न वा उ देवाः कषुधमिद वधं ददुरुताशितमुपगछन्ति मर्त्यवः | उतो रयिः पर्णतो नोप दस्यत्युताप्र्णन्मर्डितारं न विन्दते
transliteration: na vā u devāḥ kṣudhamid vadhaṃ dadurutāśitamupaghachanti mṛtyavaḥ | uto rayiḥ pṛṇato nopa dasyatyutāpṛṇanmarḍitāraṃ na vindate
translation: AGNI, refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend, Bright Ruler in thine own abode.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: य आध्राय चकमानाय पित्वो.अन्नवान सन्रफितायोपजग्मुषे | सथिरं मनः कर्णुते सेवते पुरोतोचित स मर्डितारं न विन्दते
transliteration: ya ādhrāya cakamānāya pitvo.annavān sanraphitāyopajaghmuṣe | sthiraṃ manaḥ kṛṇute sevate purotocit sa marḍitāraṃ na vindate
translation: Thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy When ladies are brought near to thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: स इद भोजो यो गर्हवे ददात्यन्नकामाय चरते कर्शाय | अरमस्मै भवति यामहूता उतापरीषु कर्णुते सखायम
transliteration: sa id bhojo yo ghṛhave dadātyannakāmāya carate kṛśāya | aramasmai bhavati yāmahūtā utāparīṣu kṛṇute sakhāyam
translation: Honoured with gifts he shines afar, Agni adorable with song: The dripping ladle balms his face.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: न स सखा यो न ददाति सख्ये सचाभुवे सचमानायपित्वः | अपास्मात परेयान न तदोको अस्ति पर्णन्तमन्यमरणं चिदिचःेत
transliteration: na sa sakhā yo na dadāti sakhye sacābhuve sacamānāyapitvaḥ | apāsmāt preyān na tadoko asti pṛṇantamanyamaraṇaṃ cidicḥet
translation: Agni with honey in his mouth, honoured with gifts, is balmed with oil, Refulgent in his wealth of light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: पर्णीयादिन नाधमानाय तव्यान दराघीयांसमनुपश्येत पन्थाम | ओ हि वर्तन्ते रथ्येव चक्रान्यम-अन्यमुप तिष्ठन्त रायः
transliteration: pṛṇīyādin nādhamānāya tavyān drāghīyāṃsamanupaśyeta panthām | o hi vartante rathyeva cakrānyam-anyamupa tiṣṭhanta rāyaḥ
translation: Praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee, Oblation-bearer, for the Gods As such do mortals call on thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: मोघमन्नं विन्दते अप्रचेताः सत्यं बरवीमि वध इत सतस्य | नार्यमणं पुष्यति नो सखायं केवलाघो भवतिकेवलादी
transliteration: moghamannaṃ vindate apracetāḥ satyaṃ bravīmi vadha it satasya | nāryamaṇaṃ puṣyati no sakhāyaṃ kevalāgho bhavatikevalādī
translation: To that Immortal Agni pay worship with oil, ye mortal men,- Lord of the house, whom none deceives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: कर्षन्नित फाल आशितं कर्णोति यन्नध्वानमप वर्ङकतेचरित्रैः | वदन बरह्मावदतो वनीयान पर्णन्नापिरप्र्णन्तमभि षयात
transliteration: kṛṣannit phāla āśitaṃ kṛṇoti yannadhvānamapa vṛṅktecaritraiḥ | vadan brahmāvadato vanīyān pṛṇannāpirapṛṇantamabhi ṣyāt
translation: O Agni, burn the Raksasas with thine unconquerable flame Shine guardian of Eternal Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: एकपाद भूयो दविपदो वि चक्रमे दविपात तरिपादमभ्येतिपश्चात | चतुष्पादेति दविपदामभिस्वरे सम्पश्यन्पङकतीरुपतिष्ठमानः
transliteration: ekapād bhūyo dvipado vi cakrame dvipāt tripādamabhyetipaścāt | catuṣpādeti dvipadāmabhisvare sampaśyanpaṅktīrupatiṣṭhamānaḥ
translation: So, Agni, with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends, Shining among Uruksayas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 117
sanskrit: समौ चिद धस्तौ न समं विविष्टः सम्मातरा चिन नसमं दुहाते | यमयोश्चिन न समा वीर्याणि जञाती चित्सन्तौ न समं पर्णीतः
transliteration: samau cid dhastau na samaṃ viviṣṭaḥ sammātarā cin nasamaṃ duhāte | yamayościn na samā vīryāṇi jñātī citsantau na samaṃ pṛṇītaḥ
translation: Uruksayas have kindled thee, Oblation-bearer, thee, with hymns. Best Worshipper among mankind.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: अग्ने हंसि नयत्रिणं दीद्यन मर्त्येष्वा | सवे कषयेशुचिव्रत
transliteration: aghne haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ dīdyan martyeṣvā | sve kṣayeśucivrata
translation: THIS, even this was my resolve, to win a cow, to win a steed: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: उत तिष्ठसि सवाहुतो घर्तानि परति मोदसे | यत तवा सरुचःसमस्थिरन
transliteration: ut tiṣṭhasi svāhuto ghṛtāni prati modase | yat tvā srucaḥsamasthiran
translation: Like violent gusts of wind the draughts that I have drunk have lifted me Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: स आहुतो वि रोचते.अग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा | सरुचा परतीकमज्यते
transliteration: sa āhuto vi rocate.aghnirīḷenyo ghirā | srucā pratīkamajyate
translation: The draughts I drank have borne me up, as fleet-foot horses draw a car: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?
