title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: घर्तेनाग्निः समज्यते मधुप्रतीक आहुतः | रोचमानोविभावसुः
transliteration: ghṛtenāghniḥ samajyate madhupratīka āhutaḥ | rocamānovibhāvasuḥ
translation: The hymn hath reached me, like a cow who lows to meet her darling calf: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: जरमाणः समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन | तं तवा हवन्तमर्त्याः
transliteration: jaramāṇaḥ samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana | taṃ tvā havantamartyāḥ
translation: As a wright bends a chariot-seat so round my heart I bend the hymn: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: तं मर्ता अमर्त्यं घर्तेनाग्निं सपर्यत | अदाभ्यंग्र्हपतिम
transliteration: taṃ martā amartyaṃ ghṛtenāghniṃ saparyata | adābhyaṃghṛhapatim
translation: Not as a mote within the eye count the Five Tribes of men with me: Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: अदाभ्येन शोचिषाग्ने रक्षस्त्वं दह | गोपा रतस्यदीदिहि
transliteration: adābhyena śociṣāghne rakṣastvaṃ daha | ghopā ṛtasyadīdihi
translation: The heavens and earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: स तवमग्ने परतीकेन परत्योष यातुधान्यः | उरुक्षयेषुदीद्यत
transliteration: sa tvamaghne pratīkena pratyoṣa yātudhānyaḥ | urukṣayeṣudīdyat
translation: I in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious earth Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 118
sanskrit: तं तवा गीर्भिरुरुक्षया हव्यवाहं समीधिरे | यजिष्ठं मानुषे जने
transliteration: taṃ tvā ghīrbhirurukṣayā havyavāhaṃ samīdhire | yajiṣṭhaṃ mānuṣe jane
translation: Aha! this spacious earth will I deposit either here or there Have I not drunk of Soma juice?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: इति वा इति मे मनो गामश्वं सनुयामिति | कुवित्सोमस्यापामिति
transliteration: iti vā iti me mano ghāmaśvaṃ sanuyāmiti | kuvitsomasyāpāmiti
translation: IN all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the Mighty Gods, of splendid valour. As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: पर वाता इव दोधत उन मा पीता अयंसत | कुवित ...
transliteration: pra vātā iva dodhata un mā pītā ayaṃsata | kuvit ...
translation: Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dasa, Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: उन मा पीता अयंसत रथमश्वा इवाशवः | कुवित ...
transliteration: un mā pītā ayaṃsata rathamaśvā ivāśavaḥ | kuvit ...
translation: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants. Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win. quickly with our meath that meath in battle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: उप मा मतिरस्थित वाश्रा पुत्रमिव परियम | कुवित ...
transliteration: upa mā matirasthita vāśrā putramiva priyam | kuvit ...
translation: Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest riches, at every banquet are the sages joyful. With mightier power, Bold God, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yatudhanas harm thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: अहं तष्टेव वन्धुरं पर्यचामि हर्दा मतिम | कुवित ...
transliteration: ahaṃ taṣṭeva vandhuraṃ paryacāmi hṛdā matim | kuvit ...
translation: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat. I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: नहि मे अक्षिपच्चनाछान्त्सुः पञ्च कर्ष्टयः | कुवित ...
transliteration: nahi me akṣipaccanāchāntsuḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ | kuvit ...
translation: Worthy of praises, many-shaped, most skillful, most energetic, Aptya of the Aptyas: He with his might destroys the seven Danus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: नहि मे रोदसी उभे अन्यं पक्षं चन परति | कुवित ...
transliteration: nahi me rodasī ubhe anyaṃ pakṣaṃ cana prati | kuvit ...
translation: Thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth, the higher and the lower. Thou establishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: अभि दयां महिना भुवमभीमां पर्थिवीं महीम | कुवित...
transliteration: abhi dyāṃ mahinā bhuvamabhīmāṃ pṛthivīṃ mahīm | kuvit...
translation: Brhaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, repeats these holy prayers, this strength of Indra. He rules the great self-luminous fold of cattle, and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 119
sanskrit: हन्ताहं पर्थिवीमिमां नि दधानीह वेह वा | कुवित ...
transliteration: hantāhaṃ pṛthivīmimāṃ ni dadhānīha veha vā | kuvit ...
translation: Thus hath Brhaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person. The spotless Sisters, they who are his Mothers, with power exalt him and impel him onward.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: तदिदास भुवनेषु जयेष्ठं यतो जज्ञ उग्रस्त्वेषन्र्म्णः | सद्यो जज्ञानो नि रिणाति शत्रूननु यंविश्वे मदन्त्यूमाः
transliteration: tadidāsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ughrastveṣanṛmṇaḥ | sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūnanu yaṃviśve madantyūmāḥ
translation: IN the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, born Only Lord of all created beings. He fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: वाव्र्धानः शवसा भूर्योजाः शत्रुर्दासाय भियसन्दधाति | अव्यनच्च वयनच्च सस्नि सं ते नवन्त परभ्र्तामदेषु
transliteration: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrurdāsāya bhiyasandadhāti | avyanacca vyanacca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtāmadeṣu
translation: Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose commandments all the Gods acknowledge -. The Lord of death, whose shade is life immortal. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: तवे करतुमपि वर्ञ्जन्ति विश्वे दविर्यदेते तरिर्भवन्त्यूमाः | सवादोः सवादीयः सवादुना सर्जा समदः सुमधु मधुनाभि योधीः
transliteration: tve kratumapi vṛñjanti viśve dviryadete trirbhavantyūmāḥ | svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā samadaḥ sumadhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ
translation: Who by his grandeur hath become Sole Ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers; He who is Lord of men and Lord of cattle. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: इति चिद धि तवा धना जयन्तं मदे-मदे अनुमदन्ति विप्राः | ओजीयो धर्ष्णो सथिरमा तनुष्व मा तवा दभन्यातुधाना दुरेवाः
transliteration: iti cid dhi tvā dhanā jayantaṃ made-made anumadanti viprāḥ | ojīyo dhṛṣṇo sthiramā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhanyātudhānā durevāḥ
translation: His, through his might, are these snow-covered mountains, and men call sea and Rasa his possession: His arms are these, his are these heavenly regions. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: तवया वयं शाशद्महे रणेषु परपश्यन्तो युधेन्यानिभूरि | चोदयामि त आयुधा वचोभिः सं ते शिशामिब्रह्मणा वयांसि
transliteration: tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyānibhūri | codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmibrahmaṇā vayāṃsi
translation: By him the heavens are strong and earth is steadfast, by him light's realm and sky-vault are supported: By him the regions in mid-air were measured. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 120
sanskrit: सतुषेय्यं पुरुवर्पसं रभ्वमिनतममाप्त्यमाप्त्यानाम | आ दर्षते शवसा सप्त दानून पर साक्षते परतिमानानिभूरि
transliteration: stuṣeyyaṃ puruvarpasaṃ ṛbhvaminatamamāptyamāptyānām |
translation: To him, supported by his help, two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit, When over them the risen Sun is shining. What God shall we adore with our oblation?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: हिरण्यगर्भः समवर्तताग्रे भूतस्य जातः पतिरेकासीत | स दाधार पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम
transliteration: hiraṇyagharbhaḥ samavartatāghre bhūtasya jātaḥ patirekaāsīt | sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
translation: I PRAISE the God of wondrous might like Indra, the lovely pleasant Guest whom all must welcome. May Agni, Priest and Master of the household, give hero strength and all-sustaining riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: य आत्मदा बलदा यस्य विश्व उपासते परशिषं यस्यदेवाः | यस्य छायाम्र्तं यस्य मर्त्युः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम
transliteration: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasyadevāḥ | yasya chāyāmṛtaṃ yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
translation: O Agni, graciously accept this song of mine, thou passing-wise who knowest every ordinance. Enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer: the Gods bestow according to thy holy law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: यः पराणतो निमिषतो महित्वैक इद राजा जगतो बभूव | य ईशे अस्य दविपदश्चतुष्पदः कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम
transliteration: yaḥ prāṇato nimiṣato mahitvaika id rājā jaghato babhūva | ya īśe asya dvipadaścatuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema
translation: Immortal, wandering round the seven stations, give, a liberal Giver, to the pious worshipper, Wealth, Agni, with brave sons and ready for his use: welcome the man who comes with fuel unto thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: यस्येमे हिमवन्तो महित्वा यस्य समुद्रं रसया सहाहुः | यस्येमाः परदिशो यस्य बाहू कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम
transliteration: yasyeme himavanto mahitvā yasya samudraṃ rasayā sahāhuḥ | yasyemāḥ pradiśo yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema
translation: The seven who bring oblations worship thee, the Strong, the first, the Great Chief Priest, Ensign of sacrifice, The oil-anointed Bull, Agni who hears, who sends as God full hero strength to him who freely gives.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: येन दयौरुग्रा पर्थिवी च दर्ळ्हा येन सव सतभितं येननाकः | यो अन्तरिक्षे रजसो विमानः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम
transliteration: yena dyaurughrā pṛthivī ca dṛḷhā yena sva stabhitaṃ yenanākaḥ | yo antarikṣe rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
translation: First messenger art thou, meet for election: drink thou thy fill invited to the Anirta, The Maruts in the votary's house adorned thee; with lauds the Bhrgus gave thee light and glory.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 121
sanskrit: यं करन्दसी अवसा तस्तभाने अभ्यैक्षेतां मनसारेजमाने | यत्राधि सूर उदितो विभाति कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम
transliteration: yaṃ krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhyaikṣetāṃ manasārejamāne | yatrādhi sūra udito vibhāti kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
translation: Milking the teeming Cow for all-sustaining food. O Wise One, for the worship-loving worshipper, Thou, Agni, dropping oil, thrice lighting works of Law, showest thy wisdom circling home and sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 122
sanskrit: वसुं न चित्रमहसं गर्णीषे वामं शेवमतिथिमद्विषेण्यम | स रासते शुरुधो विश्वधायसो.अग्निर्होताग्र्हपतिः सुवीर्यम
transliteration: vasuṃ na citramahasaṃ ghṛṇīṣe vāmaṃ śevamatithimadviṣeṇyam | sa rāsate śurudho viśvadhāyaso.aghnirhotāghṛhapatiḥ suvīryam
translation: SEE, Vena, born in light, hath driven hither, on chariot of the air, the Calves of Prsni. Singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the waters and the sunlight mingle.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 122
sanskrit: जुषाणो अग्ने परति हर्य मे वचो विश्वानि विद्वान वयुनानिसुक्रतो | घर्तनिर्णिग बरह्मणे गातुमेरय तव देवाजनयन्ननु वरतम
transliteration: juṣāṇo aghne prati harya me vaco viśvāni vidvān vayunānisukrato | ghṛtanirṇigh brahmaṇe ghātumeraya tava devāajanayannanu vratam
translation: Vena draws up his wave from out the ocean. mist-born, the fair one's back is made apparent, Brightly he shone aloft on Order's summit: the hosts sang glory to their common birthplace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 122
sanskrit: सप्त धामानि परियन्नमर्त्यो दाशद दाशुषे सुक्र्तेमामहस्व | सुवीरेण रयिणाग्ने सवाभुवा यस्त आनट्समिधा तं जुषस्व
transliteration: sapta dhāmāni pariyannamartyo dāśad dāśuṣe sukṛtemāmahasva | suvīreṇa rayiṇāghne svābhuvā yasta ānaṭsamidhā taṃ juṣasva
translation: Full many, lowing to their joint-possession, dwelling together stood the Darling's Mothers. Ascending to the lofty height of Order, the bands of singers 'sip the sweets of Amrta.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 122
sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरोहितं हविष्मन्त ईळते सप्तवाजिनम | शर्ण्वन्तमग्निं घर्तप्र्ष्ठमुक्षणम्प्र्णन्तं देवं पर्णते सुवीर्यम
transliteration: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purohitaṃ haviṣmanta īḷate saptavājinam |
translation: Knowing his form, the sages yearned to meet him: they have come nigh to hear the wild Bull's bellow. Performing sacrifice they reached the river: for the Gandharva found the immortal waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 123
sanskrit: अयं वेनश्चोदयत पर्श्निगर्भा जयोतिर्जरायू रजसोविमाने | इममपां संगमे सूर्यस्य शिशुं न विप्रामतिभी रिहन्ति
transliteration: ayaṃ venaścodayat pṛśnigharbhā jyotirjarāyū rajasovimāne | imamapāṃ saṃghame sūryasya śiśuṃ na viprāmatibhī rihanti
translation: COME to this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, threefold, with seven threads and five divisions. Be our oblation-bearer and preceder: thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 123
sanskrit: समुद्रादूर्मिमुदियर्ति वेनो नभोजाः पर्ष्ठंहर्यतस्य दर्शि | रतस्य सानावधि विष्टपि भराट्समानं योनिमभ्यनूषत वराः
transliteration: samudrādūrmimudiyarti veno nabhojāḥ pṛṣṭhaṃharyatasya darśi |
translation: I come a God foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways, While I, ungracious one, desert the gracious, leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 124
sanskrit: इमं नो अग्न उप यज्ञमेहि पञ्चयामं तरिव्र्तंसप्ततन्तुम | असो हव्यवाळ उत नः पुरोगा जयोगेवदीर्घं तम आशयिष्ठाः
transliteration: imaṃ no aghna upa yajñamehi pañcayāmaṃ trivṛtaṃsaptatantum | aso havyavāḷ uta naḥ puroghā jyoghevadīrghaṃ tama āśayiṣṭhāḥ
translation: I TRAVEL with the Rudras and the Vasus, with the Adityas and All-Gods I wander. I hold aloft both Varuna and Mitra, Indra and Agni, and the Pair of Asvins.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 124
sanskrit: अदेवाद देवः परचता गुहा यन परपश्यमानो अम्र्तत्वमेमि | शिवं यत सन्तमशिवो जहामि सवात सख्यादरणींनाभिमेमि
transliteration: adevād devaḥ pracatā ghuhā yan prapaśyamāno amṛtatvamemi |
translation: I cherish and sustain high-swelling Soma, and Tvastar I support, Pusan, and Bhaga. I load with wealth the zealous sacrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहं रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिश्चराम्यहमादित्यैरुतविश्वदेवैः | अहं मित्रावरुणोभा बिभर्म्यहमिन्द्राग्नीहमश्विनोभा
transliteration: ahaṃ rudrebhirigvedaasubhiścarāmyahamādityairutaviśvadevaiḥ | ahaṃ mitrāvaruṇobhā bibharmyahamindrāghnīahamaśvinobhā
translation: No peril, no severe distress, ye Gods, affects the mortal man, Whom Aryaman and Mitra lead, and Varima, of one accord, beyond his foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहं सोममाहनसं बिभर्म्यहं तवष्टारमुतपूषणं भगम | अहं दधामि दरविणं हविष्मतेसुप्राव्ये यजमानाय सुन्वते
transliteration: ahaṃ somamāhanasaṃ bibharmyahaṃ tvaṣṭāramutapūṣaṇaṃ bhagham | ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇaṃ haviṣmatesuprāvye yajamānāya sunvate
translation: This very thing do we desire, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Whereby ye guard the mortal man from sore distress, and lead him safe beyond his foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहं राष्ट्री संगमनी वसूनां चिकितुषी परथमायज्ञियानाम | तां मा देवा वयदधुः पुरुत्राभूरिस्थात्रां भूर्यावेशयन्तीम
transliteration: ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃghamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamāyajñiyānām | tāṃ mā devā vyadadhuḥ purutrābhūristhātrāṃ bhūryāveśayantīm
translation: These are, each one, our present helps, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman. Best leaders, best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: मया सो अन्नमत्ति यो विपश्यति यः पराणिति य ईंश्र्णोत्युक्तम | अमन्तवो मां त उप कषियन्ति शरुधिश्रुत शरद्धिवं ते वदामि
transliteration: mayā so annamatti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti ya īṃśṛṇotyuktam | amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhiśruta śraddhivaṃ te vadāmi
translation: Ye compass round and guard each man, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman: In your dear keeping may we be, ye who are excellent as guides beyond our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहमेव सवयमिदं वदामि जुष्टं देवेभिरुतमानुषेभिः | यं कामये तं-तमुग्रं कर्णोमि तम्ब्रह्माणं तं रषिं तं सुमेधाम
transliteration: ahameva svayamidaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devebhirutamānuṣebhiḥ | yaṃ kāmaye taṃ-tamughraṃ kṛṇomi tambrahmāṇaṃ taṃ ṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām
translation: Adityas are beyond all foes,-Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman: Strong Rudra with the Marut host, Indra, Agni let us call for weal beyond our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहं रुद्राय धनुरा तनोमि बरह्मद्विषे शरवे हन्तवाु | अहं जनाय समदं कर्णोम्यहं दयावाप्र्थिवी आविवेश
transliteration: ahaṃ rudrāya dhanurā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavāu | ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomyahaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśa
translation: These lead us safely over all, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, These who are Kings of living men, over all troubles far away beyond our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहं सुवे पितरमस्य मूर्धन मम योनिरप्स्वन्तः समुद्रे | ततो वि तिष्ठे भुवनानु विश्वोतामूं दयांवर्ष्मणोप सप्र्शामि
transliteration: ahaṃ suve pitaramasya mūrdhan mama yonirapsvantaḥ samudre | tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanānu viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃvarṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi
translation: May they give bliss to aid us well, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman: May the Adityas, when we pray, grant us wide shelter and defense beyond our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 125
sanskrit: अहमेव वात इव पर वाम्यारभमाणा भुवनानि विश्वा | परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्यैतावती महिना सं बभूव
transliteration: ahameva vāta iva pra vāmyārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā | paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahinā saṃ babhūva
translation: As in this place, O Holy Ones, ye Vasus freed even the Gaud when her feet were fettered. So free us now from trouble and affliction: and let our life be lengthened still, O Api.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 126
sanskrit: न तमंहो न दुरितं देवासो अष्ट मर्त्यम | सजोषसोयमर्यमा मित्रो नयन्ति वरुणो अति दविषः
transliteration: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ devāso aṣṭa martyam | sajoṣasoyamaryamā mitro nayanti varuṇo ati dviṣaḥ
translation: WITH all her eyes the Goddess Night looks forth approaching many a spot: She hath put all her glories on.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 126
sanskrit: तद धि वयं वर्णीमहे वरुण मित्रार्यमन | येना निरंहसो यूयं पाथ नेथा च मर्त्यमति दविषः
transliteration: tad dhi vayaṃ vṛṇīmahe varuṇa mitrāryaman | yenā niraṃhaso yūyaṃ pātha nethā ca martyamati dviṣaḥ
translation: Immortal. she hath filled the waste, the Goddess hath filled height and depth: She conquers darkness with her light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 126
sanskrit: ते नूनं नो.अयमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा | नयिष्था उनो नेषणि पर्षिष्ठा उ नः पर्षण्यति दविषः
transliteration: te nūnaṃ no.ayamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā | nayiṣthā uno neṣaṇi parṣiṣṭhā u naḥ parṣaṇyati dviṣaḥ
translation: The Goddess as she comes hath set the Dawn her Sister in her place: And then the darkness vanishes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 126
sanskrit: यूयं विश्वं परि पाथ वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा | युष्माकंशर्मणि परिये सयाम सुप्रणीतयो.अति दविषः
transliteration: yūyaṃ viśvaṃ pari pātha varuṇo mitro aryamā | yuṣmākaṃśarmaṇi priye syāma supraṇītayo.ati dviṣaḥ
translation: So favour us this night, O thou whose pathways we have visited As birds their nest upon the tree.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: रात्री वयख्यदायती पुरुत्रा देव्यक्षभिः | विश्वाधि शरियो.अधित
transliteration: rātrī vyakhyadāyatī purutrā devyakṣabhiḥ | viśvāadhi śriyo.adhita
translation: LET me win glory, Agni, in our battles: enkindling thee, may we support our bodies. May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardian may we win in combat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: ओर्वप्रा अमर्त्या निवतो देव्युद्वतः | जयोतिषा बाधतेतमः
transliteration: origvedaaprā amartyā nivato devyudvataḥ | jyotiṣā bādhatetamaḥ
translation: May all the Gods be on my side in battle, the Maruts led by Indra, Visnu, Agni. Mine be the middle air's extended region, and may the wind blow favouring these my wishes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: निरु सवसारमस्क्र्तोषसं देव्यायती | अपेदु हासतेतमः
transliteration: niru svasāramaskṛtoṣasaṃ devyāyatī | apedu hāsatetamaḥ
translation: May the Gods grant me riches; may the blessing and invocation of the Gods assist me. Foremost in fight be the divine Invokers: may we, unwounded, have brave heroes round us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: सा नो अद्य यस्या वयं नि ते यामन्न्नविक्ष्महि | वर्क्षेन वसतिं वयः
transliteration: sā no adya yasyā vayaṃ ni te yāmannnavikṣmahi | vṛkṣena vasatiṃ vayaḥ
translation: For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished. May I he guiltless of the least transgression: and, all ye Go-is, do ye combine to bless us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: नि गरामासो अविक्षत नि पद्वन्तो नि पक्षिणः | निश्येनासश्चिदर्थिनः
transliteration: ni ghrāmāso avikṣata ni padvanto ni pakṣiṇaḥ | niśyenāsaścidarthinaḥ
translation: Ye six divine Expanses, grant us freedom: here, all ye Gods, acquit yourselves like heroes. Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, King Soma!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: यावया वर्क्यं वर्कं यवय सतेनमूर्म्ये | अथा नःसुतरा भव
transliteration: yāvayā vṛkyaṃ vṛkaṃ yavaya stenamūrmye | athā naḥsutarā bhava
translation: Baffling the wrath of our opponents, Agni, guard us as our infallible Protector. Let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses, and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: उप मा पेपिशत तमः कर्ष्णं वयक्तमस्थित | उष रणेवयातय
transliteration: upa mā pepiśat tamaḥ kṛṣṇaṃ vyaktamasthita | uṣa ṛṇevayātaya
translation: Lord of the world, Creator of creators the saviour God who overcomes the foeman. May Gods, Brhaspati, both Asvins shelter from ill this sacrifice and sacrificer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 127
sanskrit: उप ते गा इवाकरं वर्णीष्व दुहितर्दिवः | रात्रि सतोमंन जिग्युषे
transliteration: upa te ghā ivākaraṃ vṛṇīṣva duhitardivaḥ | rātri stomaṃna jighyuṣe
translation: Foodful, and much-invoked, at this our calling may the great Bull vouchsafe us wide protection. Lord of Bay Coursers, Indra, blew our children: harm us not, give us riot as prey to others.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: ममाग्ने वर्चो विहवेष्वस्तु वयं तवेन्धानास्तन्वम्पुषेम | मह्यं नमन्तां परदिशश्चतस्रस्त्वयाध्यक्षेणप्र्तना जयेम
transliteration: mamāghne varco vihaveṣvastu vayaṃ tvendhānāstanvampuṣema | mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaścatasrastvayādhyakṣeṇapṛtanā jayema
translation: THEN was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of air, no sky beyond it. What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was water there, unfathomed depth of water?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: मम देवा विहवे सन्तु सर्व इन्द्रवन्तो मरुतो विष्णुरग्निः | ममान्तरिक्षमुरुलोकमस्तु मह्यं वातः पवतांकामे अस्मिन
transliteration: mama devā vihave santu sarigvedaa indravanto maruto viṣṇuraghniḥ | mamāntarikṣamurulokamastu mahyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃkāme asmin
translation: Death was not then, nor was there aught immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider. That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: मयि देवा दरविणमा यजन्तां मय्याशीरस्तु मयिदेवहूतिः | दैव्या होतारो वनुषन्त पूर्वे.अरिष्टाःस्याम तन्वा सुवीराः
transliteration: mayi devā draviṇamā yajantāṃ mayyāśīrastu mayidevahūtiḥ | daivyā hotāro vanuṣanta pūrigvedae.ariṣṭāḥsyāma tanvā suvīrāḥ
translation: Darkness there was: at first concealed in darkness this All was indiscriminate chaos. All that existed then was void and formless: by the great power of Warmth was born that Unit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: मह्यं यजन्तु मम यानि हव्याकूतिः सत्या मनसो मे अस्तु | एनो मा नि गां कतमच्चनाहं विश्वे देवासो अधिवोचता नः
transliteration: mahyaṃ yajantu mama yāni havyākūtiḥ satyā manaso me astu | eno mā ni ghāṃ katamaccanāhaṃ viśve devāso adhivocatā naḥ
translation: Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire, the primal seed and germ of Spirit. Sages who searched with their heart's thought discovered the existent's kinship in the non-existent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: देवीः षळ उर्वीरुरु नः कर्णोत विश्वे देवास इहवीरयध्वम | मा हास्महि परजया मा तनूभिर्मा रधामद्विषते सोम राजन
transliteration: devīḥ ṣaḷ urigvedaīruru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsa ihavīrayadhvam | mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhirmā radhāmadviṣate soma rājan
translation: Transversely was their severing line extended: what was above it then, and what below it? There were begetters, there were mighty forces, free action here and energy up yonder

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: अग्ने मन्युं परतिनुदन परेषामदब्धो गोपाः परि पाहि नस्त्वम | परत्यञ्चो यन्तु निगुतः पुनस्ते.अमैषां चित्तम्प्रबुधां वि नेशत
transliteration: aghne manyuṃ pratinudan pareṣāmadabdho ghopāḥ pari pāhi nastvam | pratyañco yantu nighutaḥ punaste.amaiṣāṃ cittamprabudhāṃ vi neśat
translation: Who verily knows and who can here declare it, whence it was born and whence comes this creation? The Gods are later than this world's production. Who knows then whence it first came into being?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 128
sanskrit: धाता धातॄणां भुवनस्य यस पतिर्देवं तरातारमभिमातिषाहम | इमं यज्ञमश्विनोभा बर्हस्पतिर्देवाः पान्तु यजमानं नयर्थात
transliteration: dhātā dhātṝṇāṃ bhuvanasya yas patirdevaṃ trātāramabhimātiṣāham | imaṃ yajñamaśvinobhā bṛhaspatirdevāḥ pāntu yajamānaṃ nyarthāt
translation: He, the first origin of this creation, whether he formed it all or did not form it, Whose eye controls this world in highest heaven, he verily knows it, or perhaps he knows not.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 129
sanskrit: नासदासीन नो सदासीत तदानीं नासीद रजो नो वयोमापरो यत | किमावरीवः कुह कस्य शर्मन्नम्भः किमासीद गहनं गभीरम
transliteration: nāsadāsīn no sadāsīt tadānīṃ nāsīd rajo no vyomāparo yat | kimāvarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarmannambhaḥ kimāsīd ghahanaṃ ghabhīram
translation: THE sacrifice drawn out with threads on every side, stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one,- This do these Fathers weave who hitherward are come: they sit beside the warp and cry, Weave forth, weave back.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 129
sanskrit: न मर्त्युरासीदम्र्तं न तर्हि न रात्र्या अह्न आसीत्प्रकेतः | आनीदवातं सवधया तदेकं तस्माद्धान्यन न परः किं चनास
transliteration: na mṛtyurāsīdamṛtaṃ na tarhi na rātryā ahna āsītpraketaḥ |
translation: The Man extends it and the Man unbinds it: even to this vault of heaven hath he outspun, it. These pegs are fastened to the seat of worship: they made the Sama-hymns their weaving shuttles.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: यो यज्ञो विश्वतस्तन्तुभिस्तत एकशतं देवकर्मेभिरायतः | इमे वयन्ति पितरो य आययुः पर वयाप वयेत्यासते तते
transliteration: yo yajño viśvatastantubhistata ekaśataṃ devakarmebhirāyataḥ | ime vayanti pitaro ya āyayuḥ pra vayāpa vayetyāsate tate
translation: DRIVE all our enemies away, O Indra, the western, mighty Conqueror, and the eastern. Hero, drive off our northern foes and southern, that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: पुमानेनं तनुत उत कर्णत्ति पुमान वि तत्ने अधि नाकेस्मिन | इमे मयूखा उप सेदुरू सदः सामानि चक्रुस्तसराण्योतवे
transliteration: pumānenaṃ tanuta ut kṛṇatti pumān vi tatne adhi nākeasmin | ime mayūkhā upa sedurū sadaḥ sāmāni cakrustasarāṇyotave
translation: What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order, So bring the food of those men, bring it hither, who went not to prepare the grass for worship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: कासीत परमा परतिमा किं निदानमाज्यं किमासीत्परिधिः क आसीत | छन्दः किमासीत परौगं किमुक्थंयद देवा देवमयजन्त विश्वे
transliteration: kāsīt pramā pratimā kiṃ nidānamājyaṃ kimāsītparidhiḥ ka āsīt | chandaḥ kimāsīt praughaṃ kimukthaṃyad devā devamayajanta viśve
translation: Men come not with one horse at sacred seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies. Sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty Indra for his friendship.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: अग्नेर्गायत्र्यभवत सयुग्वोष्णिहया सविता सं बभूव | अनुष्टुभा सोम उक्थैर्महस्वान बर्हस्पतेर्ब्र्हती वाचमावत
transliteration: aghnerghāyatryabhavat sayughvoṣṇihayā savitā saṃ babhūva | anuṣṭubhā soma ukthairmahasvān bṛhaspaterbṛhatī vācamāvat
translation: Ye, Asvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice, And aided Indra in his work with Namuci of Asura birth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: विराण मित्रावरुणयोरभिश्रीरिन्द्रस्य तरिष्टुब इहभागो अह्नः | विश्वान देवाञ जगत्या विवेश तेनचाक्ळिप्र रषयो मनुष्याः
transliteration: virāṇ mitrāvaruṇayorabhiśrīrindrasya triṣṭub ihabhāgho ahnaḥ | viśvān devāñ jaghatyā viveśa tenacākḷipra ṛṣayo manuṣyāḥ
translation: As parents aid a son, both Asvins, Indra, aided thee with their wondrous Powers and wisdom. When thou, with might. hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, Sarasvati, O Maghavan, refreshed thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: चाक्ळिप्रे तेन रषयो मनुष्या यज्ञे जाते पितरो नःपुराणे | पश्यन मन्ये मनसा चक्षसा तान य इमंयज्ञमयजन्त पूर्वे
transliteration: cākḷipre tena ṛṣayo manuṣyā yajñe jāte pitaro naḥpurāṇe | paśyan manye manasā cakṣasā tān ya imaṃyajñamayajanta pūrigvedae
translation: Indra is strong to save, rich in assistance may he, possessing all, be kind and gracious. May he disperse our foes and give us safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 130
sanskrit: सहस्तोमाः सहछन्दस आव्र्तः सहप्रमा रषयः सप्तदैव्याः | पूर्वेषां पन्थामनुद्र्श्य धीरा अन्वालेभिरेरथ्यो न रश्मीन
transliteration: sahastomāḥ sahachandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ saptadaivyāḥ | pūrigvedaeṣāṃ panthāmanudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhirerathyo na raśmīn
translation: May we enjoy his favour, his the Holy may we enjoy his blessed loving kindness. May this rich Indra, as our good Protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: अप पराच इन्द्र विश्वानमित्रानपापाचो अभिभूते नुदस्व | अपोदीचो अप शूराधराच उरौ यथा तव शर्मन्मदेम
transliteration: apa prāca indra viśvānamitrānapāpāco abhibhūte nudasva | apodīco apa śūrādharāca urau yathā tava śarmanmadema
translation: MAY Dyaus the Lord of lauded wealth, and Earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice, And may the Asvins, both the Gods, strengthen the worshipper with bliss.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: कुविदङग यवमन्तो यवं चिद यथा दान्त्यनुपूर्वंवियूय | इहेहैषां कर्णुहि भोजनानि ये बर्हिषोनमोव्र्क्तिं न जग्मुः
transliteration: kuvidaṅgha yavamanto yavaṃ cid yathā dāntyanupūrigvedaaṃviyūya | ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣonamovṛktiṃ na jaghmuḥ
translation: As such we honour you, Mitra and Varuna, with hasty zeal, most blest, you who sustain the folk. So may we, through your friendship for the worshipper, subdue the fiends.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: नहि सथूर्य रतुथा यातमस्ति नोत शरवो विविदेसंगमेषु | गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तोव्र्षणं वाजयन्तः
transliteration: nahi sthūry ṛtuthā yātamasti nota śravo vividesaṃghameṣu | ghavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyantovṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ
translation: And when we seek to win your love and friendship, we who have precious wealth in our possession, Or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: युवं सुराममश्विना नमुचावासुरे सचा | विपिपानाशुभस पती इन्द्रं कर्मस्वावतम
transliteration: yuvaṃ surāmamaśvinā namucāvāsure sacā | vipipānāśubhas patī indraṃ karmasvāvatam
translation: That other, Asura! too was born of Heaven. thou art, O Varuna, the King of all men. The chariot's Lord was well content, forbearing to anger Death by sin so great. This sin hath Sakaputa here committed. Heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth, When the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: पुत्रमिव पितरावश्विनोभेन्द्रावथुः काव्यैर्दंसनाभिः | यत सुरामं वयपिबः शचीभिः सरस्वतीत्वा मघवन्नभिष्णक
transliteration: putramiva pitarāvaśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyairdaṃsanābhiḥ | yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatītvā maghavannabhiṣṇak
translation: Your Mother Aditi, ye wise, was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven. Show love and kindness here below: wash her in rays of heavenly light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 131
sanskrit: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतुविश्ववेदाः | बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्यपतयः सयाम
transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatuviśvavedāḥ | bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasyapatayaḥ syāma
translation: Ye Twain have seated you as Lords of Wealth, as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole, upon the wood. These our disheartened tribes Nrmedhas saved from woe, Sumedhas saved from Woe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: ईजानमिद दयौर्गूर्तावसुरीजानं भूमिरभिप्रभूषणि | ईजानं देवावश्विनावभि सुम्नैरवर्धताम
transliteration: tā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dhārayatkṣitī suṣumneṣitatvatāyajāmasi | yuvoḥ krāṇāya sakhyairabhi ṣyāma rakṣasaḥ
translation: SING strength to Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place. Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: ता वां मित्रावरुणा धारयत्क्षिती सुषुम्नेषितत्वतायजामसि | युवोः कराणाय सख्यैरभि षयाम रक्षसः
transliteration: adhā cin nu yad didhiṣāmahe vāmabhi priyaṃ rekṇaḥpatyamānāḥ | dadvān vā yat puṣyati rekṇaḥ saṃ vārannakirasya maghāni
translation: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth. Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: अधा चिन नु यद दिधिषामहे वामभि परियं रेक्णःपत्यमानाः | दद्वान वा यत पुष्यति रेक्णः सं वारन्नकिरस्य मघानि
transliteration: asāvanyo asura sūyata dyaustvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsirājā | mūrdhā rathasya cākan naitāvatainasāntakadhruk
translation: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs. Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O Indra, who would smite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: असावन्यो असुर सूयत दयौस्त्वं विश्वेषां वरुणासिराजा | मूर्धा रथस्य चाकन नैतावतैनसान्तकध्रुक
transliteration: asmin svetacchakapūta eno hite mitre nighatān hanti vīrān | avorigvedaā yad dhāt tanūṣvavaḥ priyāsu yajñiyāsvarigvedaā
translation: The robber people round about, Indra, who watch and aim at us,- Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: अस्मिन सवेतच्छकपूत एनो हिते मित्रे निगतान हन्ति वीरान | अवोर्वा यद धात तनूष्ववः परियासु यज्ञियास्वर्वा
transliteration: yuvorhi mātāditirigvedacetasā dyaurna bhūmiḥ payasāpupūtani | ava priyā didiṣṭana sūro ninikta raśmibhiḥ
translation: Whoso assails us, Indra, be the man a stranger or akin, Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: युवोर्हि मातादितिर्विचेतसा दयौर्न भूमिः पयसापुपूतनि | अव परिया दिदिष्टन सूरो निनिक्त रश्मिभिः
transliteration: yuvaṃ hyapnarājāvasīdataṃ tiṣṭhad rathaṃ nadhūrṣadaṃ vanarṣadam | tā naḥ kaṇūkayantīrnṛmedhastatre aṃhasaḥ sumedhastatre aṃhasaḥ
translation: Close to thy friendship do we cling, O Indra, and depend, or, thee. Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 132
sanskrit: युवं हयप्नराजावसीदतं तिष्ठद रथं नधूर्षदं वनर्षदम | ता नः कणूकयन्तीर्न्र्मेधस्तत्रे अंहसः सुमेधस्तत्रे अंहसः
transliteration: rigveda10132.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:12:36 GMT
translation: Do thou bestow upon us her, O Indra, who yields according to the singer's longing, That the great Cow may, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand streams, give milk to feed us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: परो षवस्मै पुरोरथमिन्द्राय शूषमर्चत | अभीके चिदुलोकक्र्त संगे समत्सु वर्त्रहास्माकं बोधि चोदितानभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु
transliteration: pro ṣvasmai purorathamindrāya śūṣamarcata | abhīke cidulokakṛt saṃghe samatsu vṛtrahāsmākaṃ bodhi coditānabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
translation: As, like the Morning, thou hast filled, O Indra, both the earth and heaven. So as the Mighty One, great King of all the mighty world of men, the Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: तवं सिन्धून्रवास्र्जो.अधराचो अहन्नहिम | अशत्रुरिन्द्रजज्ञिषे विश्वं पुष्यसि वार्यं तं तवा परि षवजामहेनभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु
transliteration: tvaṃ sindhūnravāsṛjo.adharāco ahannahim | aśatrurindrajajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryaṃ taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahenabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
translation: Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness. Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Goddess Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed Mother gave thee life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: वि षु विश्वा अरातयो.अर्यो नशन्त नो धियः | अस्तासिशत्रवे वधं यो न इन्द्र जिघांसति या ते रातिर्ददिर्वसु नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु
transliteration: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo.aryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ | astāsiśatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati yā te rātirdadirigvedaasu nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
translation: Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies. With all thy powers, O Sakra, all thine helps, O Indra, shake them down:

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: यो न इन्द्राभितो जनो वर्कायुरादिदेशति | अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि विबाधो असि सासहिर्नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाकाधि धन्वसु
transliteration: yo na indrābhito jano vṛkāyurādideśati | adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi vibādho asi sāsahirnabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākāadhi dhanvasu
translation: As thou, O Satakratu, thou, O Indrv, shakest all things down As wealth for him who sheds the juice, with thine assistance thousandfold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: यो न इन्द्राभिदासति सनाभिर्यश्च निष्ट्यः | अव तस्यबलं तिर महीव दयौरध तमना नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु
transliteration: yo na indrābhidāsati sanābhiryaśca niṣṭyaḥ | ava tasyabalaṃ tira mahīva dyauradha tmanā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu
translation: Around, on every side like drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall. Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 133
sanskrit: वयमिन्द्र तवायवः सखित्वमा रभामहे | रतस्य नःपथा नयाति विश्वानि दुरिता नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु
transliteration: vayamindra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvamā rabhāmahe |
translation: Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor! As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O Maghavan.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 134
sanskrit: उभे यदिन्द्र रोदसी आपप्राथोषा इव | महान्तं तवामहीनां सम्राजं चर्षणीनां देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत
transliteration: ubhe yadindra rodasī āpaprāthoṣā iva | mahāntaṃ tvāmahīnāṃ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ devī janitryajījanadbhadrā janitryajījanat
translation: IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where Yama drinketh with the Gods, The Father, Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 134
sanskrit: अव सम दुर्हणायतो मर्तस्य तनुहि सथिरम | अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि यो अस्मानादिदेशति देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद भद्राजनित्र्यजीजनत
transliteration: ava sma durhaṇāyato martasya tanuhi sthiram | adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi yo asmānādideśati devī janitryajījanad bhadrājanitryajījanat
translation: I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old, On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 134
sanskrit: अव तया बर्हतीरिषो विश्वश्चन्द्रा अमित्रहन | शचीभिःशक्र धूनुहीन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य ...
transliteration: ava tyā bṛhatīriṣo viśvaścandrā amitrahan |
translation: Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O Child, the new and wheel-less car Which thou hast fashioned mentally, one poled but turning every way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: यस्मिन वर्क्षे सुपलाशे देवैः सम्पिबते यमः | अत्रा नोविश्पतिः पिता पुराणाननु वेनति
transliteration: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ | atrā noviśpatiḥ pitā purāṇānanu venati
translation: HE with the long loose locks supports Agni, and moisture, heaven, and earth: He is all sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: पुराणाननुवेनन्तं चरन्तं पापयामुया | असूयन्नभ्यचाक्षं तस्मा अस्प्र्हयं पुनः
transliteration: purāṇānanuvenantaṃ carantaṃ pāpayāmuyā | asūyannabhyacākṣaṃ tasmā aspṛhayaṃ punaḥ
translation: The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue. They, following the wind's swift course go where the Gods have gone before.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: यं कुमार नवं रथमचक्रं मनसाक्र्णोः | एकेषंविश्वतः पराञ्चमपश्यन्नधि तिष्ठसि
transliteration: yaṃ kumāra navaṃ rathamacakraṃ manasākṛṇoḥ | ekeṣaṃviśvataḥ prāñcamapaśyannadhi tiṣṭhasi
translation: Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds: You therefore, mortal men. behold our natural bodies and no more.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: यं कुमार परावर्तयो रथं विप्रेभ्यस परि | तंसामानु परावर्तत समितो नाव्याहितम
transliteration: yaṃ kumāra prāvartayo rathaṃ viprebhyas pari | taṃsāmānu prāvartata samito nāvyāhitam
translation: The Muni, made associate in the holy work of every God, Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: कः कुमारमजनयद रथं को निरवर्तयत | कः सवित तदद्य नो बरूयादनुदेयी यथाभवत
transliteration: kaḥ kumāramajanayad rathaṃ ko niravartayat | kaḥ svit tadadya no brūyādanudeyī yathābhavat
translation: The Steed of Vata, Vayu's friend, the Muni, by the Gods impelled, In both the oceans hath his home, in eastern and in western sea.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: यथाभवदनुदेयी ततो अग्रमजायत | पुरस्ताद बुध्नाततः पश्चान निरयणं कर्तम
transliteration: yathābhavadanudeyī tato aghramajāyata | purastād budhnaātataḥ paścān nirayaṇaṃ kṛtam
translation: Treading the path of sylvan beasts, Gandharvas, and Apsarases, He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful friend

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 135
sanskrit: इदं यमस्य सादनं देवमानं यदुच्यते | इयमस्यधम्यते नाळीरयं गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः
transliteration: idaṃ yamasya sādanaṃ devamānaṃ yaducyate | iyamasyadhamyate nāḷīrayaṃ ghīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translation: Vayu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend, When he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, water from the cup.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 136
sanskrit: केश्यग्निं केशी विषं केशी बिभर्ति रोदसी | केशीविश्वं सवर्द्र्शे केशीदं जयोतिरुच्यते
transliteration: keśyaghniṃ keśī viṣaṃ keśī bibharti rodasī | keśīviśvaṃ svardṛśe keśīdaṃ jyotirucyate
translation: YE Gods, raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low. O Gods, restore to life again the man who hath committed sin.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 136
sanskrit: मुनयो वातरशनाः पिशङगा वसते मला | वातस्यानुध्राजिं यन्ति यद देवासो अविक्षत
transliteration: munayo vātaraśanāḥ piśaṅghā vasate malā | vātasyānudhrājiṃ yanti yad devāso avikṣata
translation: Two several winds are blowing here, from Sindhu, from a distant land. May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 136
sanskrit: उन्मदिता मौनेयन वाताना तस्थिमा वयम | शरीरेदस्माकं यूयं मर्तासो अभि पश्यथ
transliteration: unmaditā mauneyana vātānā tasthimā vayam |
translation: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind; For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 137
sanskrit: उत देवा अवहितं देवा उन नयथा पुनः | उतागश्चक्रुषं देवा देवा जीवयथा पुनः
transliteration: uta devā avahitaṃ devā un nayathā punaḥ | utāghaścakruṣaṃ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ
translation: ALLIED with thee in friendship, Indra, these, thy priests, remembering Holy Law, rent Vrtra limb from limb, When they bestowed the Dawns and let the waters flow, and when thou didst chastise dragons at Kutsa's call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 137
sanskrit: दवाविमौ वातौ वात आ सिन्धोरा परावतः | दक्षन्ते अन्य आ वातु परान्यो वातु यद रपः
transliteration: dvāvimau vātau vāta ā sindhorā parāvataḥ | dakṣante anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ
translation: Thou sentest forth productive powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest forth the kine, thou drankest pleasant meath. Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing might. The Sun shone by the hymn that sprang from Holy Law.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: तव तय इन्द्र सख्येषु वह्नय रतं मन्वाना वयदर्दिरुर्वलम | यत्रा दशस्यन्नुषसो रिणन्नपः कुत्सायमन्मन्नह्यश्च दंसयः
transliteration: tava tya indra sakhyeṣu vahnaya ṛtaṃ manvānā vyadardirurigvedaalam | yatrā daśasyannuṣaso riṇannapaḥ kutsāyamanmannahyaśca daṃsayaḥ
translation: SAVITAR, golden-haired, hath lifted eastward, bright With the sunbeams, his eternal lustre; He in whose energy wise Pusan marches, surveying all existence like a herdsman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: अवास्र्जः परस्वः शवञ्चयो गिरिनुदाज उस्रा अपिबोमधु परियम | अवर्धयो वनिनो अस्य दंससा शुशोचसूर्य रतजातया गिरा
transliteration: avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayo ghirinudāja usrā apibomadhu priyam | avardhayo vanino asya daṃsasā śuśocasūrya ṛtajātayā ghirā
translation: Beholding men he sits amid the heaven filling the two world-halves and air's wide region. He looks upon the rich far-spreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: वि सूर्यो मध्ये अमुचद रथं दिवो विदद दासय परतिमानमार्यः | दर्ळानि पिप्रोरसुरस्य मायिन इन्द्रो वयास्यच्चक्र्वान रजिश्वना
transliteration: vi sūryo madhye amucad rathaṃ divo vidad dāsaya pratimānamāryaḥ | dṛḷāni piprorasurasya māyina indro vyāsyaccakṛvān ṛjiśvanā
translation: He, root of wealth, the gatherer-up of treasures, looks with his might on every form and figure. Savitar, like a God whose Law is constant, stands in the battle for the spoil like Indra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: अनाध्र्ष्टानि धर्षितो वयास्यन निधीन्रदेवानम्र्णदयास्यः | मासेव सूर्यो वसु पुर्यमा ददे गर्णानःशत्रून्रश्र्णाद विरुक्मता
transliteration: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣito vyāsyan nidhīnradevānamṛṇadayāsyaḥ | māseva sūryo vasu puryamā dade ghṛṇānaḥśatrūnraśṛṇād virukmatā
translation: Waters from sacrifice came to the Gandharva Visvavasu, O Soma, when they saw him. Indra, approaching quickly, marked their going, and looked around upon the Sun's enclosures.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: अयुद्धसेनो विभ्वा विभिन्दता दाशद वर्त्रहा तुज्यानि तेजते | इन्द्रस्य वज्रादबिभेदभिश्नथः पराक्रामच्छुन्ध्युरजहदुष अनः
transliteration: ayuddhaseno vibhvā vibhindatā dāśad vṛtrahā tujyāni tejate | indrasya vajrādabibhedabhiśnathaḥ prākrāmacchundhyurajahaduṣa anaḥ
translation: This song Visvavasu shall sing us, meter of air's mid-realm celestial Gandharva, That we may know aright both truth and falsehood: may he inspire our thoughts and help our praises.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 138
sanskrit: एता तया ते शरुत्यानि केवला यदेक एकमक्र्णोरयज्ञम | मासां विधानमदधा अधि दयवि तवया विभिन्नम्भरति परधिं पिता
transliteration: etā tyā te śrutyāni kevalā yadeka ekamakṛṇorayajñam | māsāṃ vidhānamadadhā adhi dyavi tvayā vibhinnambharati pradhiṃ pitā
translation: In the floods' track he found the booty seeker: the rocky cow-pen's doors he threw wide open. These, the Gandharva told him, Rowed with Amrta. Indra knew well the puissance of the dragons.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: सूर्यरश्मिर्हरिकेशः पुरस्तात सविता जयोतिरुदयानजस्रम | तस्य पूषा परसवे याति विद्वान सम्पश्यन्विश्वा भुवनानि गोपाः
transliteration: sūryaraśmirharikeśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotirudayānajasram | tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyanviśvā bhuvanāni ghopāḥ
translation: AGNI, life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in wealth of beams! Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the worshipper, with strength, the food that merits laud.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: नर्चक्षा एष दिवो मध्य आस्त आपप्रिवान रोदसीन्तरिक्षम | स विश्वाचीरभि चष्टे घर्ताचीरन्तरापूर्वमपरं च केतुम
transliteration: nṛcakṣā eṣa divo madhya āsta āpaprivān rodasīantarikṣam | sa viśvācīrabhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīrantarāpūrigvedaamaparaṃ ca ketum
translation: With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light. Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as Son: thou joinest close the earth and heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां विश्वा रूपाभि चष्टेशचीभिः | देव इव सविता सत्यधर्मेन्द्रो न तस्थौसमरे धनानाम
transliteration: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃghamano vasūnāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭeśacībhiḥ | deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthausamare dhanānām
translation: O Jatavedas, Son of Strength, rejoice thyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and songs. In thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food, born nobly and of wondrous help.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: विश्वावसुं सोम गन्धर्वमापो दद्र्शुषीस्तद रतेना वयायन | तदन्ववैदिन्द्रो रारहाण आसां परि सुर्यस्यपरिधिन्रपश्यत
transliteration: viśvāvasuṃ soma ghandharigvedaamāpo dadṛśuṣīstad ṛtenā vyāyan | tadanvavaidindro rārahāṇa āsāṃ pari suryasyaparidhinrapaśyat
translation: Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give wealth to us, Immortal God. Thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: विश्वावसुरभि तन नो गर्णातु दिव्यो गन्धर्वो रजसोविमानः | यद वा घा सत्यमुत यन न विद्म धियोहिन्वानो धिय इन नो अव्याः
transliteration: viśvāvasurabhi tan no ghṛṇātu divyo ghandharigvedao rajasovimānaḥ | yad vā ghā satyamuta yan na vidma dhiyohinvāno dhiya in no avyāḥ
translation: To him, the wise, who orders sacrifice, who hath great riches un der his control, Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous food, givest him wealth that conquers all.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 139
sanskrit: सस्निमविन्दच्चरणे नदीनामपाव्र्णोद दुरो अश्मव्रजानाम | परासां गन्धर्वो अम्र्तानि वोचदिन्द्रो दक्षं परि जानादहीनाम
transliteration: sasnimavindaccaraṇe nadīnāmapāvṛṇod duro aśmavrajānām | prāsāṃ ghandharigvedao amṛtāni vocadindro dakṣaṃ pari jānādahīnām
translation: The men have set before them them for their welfare Agni, strong, visible to all, the Holy. Thee, Godlike One, with ears to hear, most famous, men's generations magnify with praise-songs.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 140
sanskrit: अग्ने तव शरवो वयो महि भराजन्ते अर्चयो विभावसो | बर्हद्भानो शवसा वाजमुक्थ्यं दधासि दाशुषे कवे
transliteration: aghne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso | bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājamukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave
translation: TURN hither, Agni, speak to us: come to us with a gracious mind. Enrich us, Master of the house: thou art the Giver of our wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 140
sanskrit: पावकवर्चाः शुक्रवर्चा अनूनवर्चा उदियर्षि भानुना | पुत्रो मातरा विचरन्नुपावसि पर्णक्षि रोदसी उभे
transliteration: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā udiyarṣi bhānunā | putro mātarā vicarannupāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe
translation: Let Aryaman vouchsafe us wealth, and Bhaga, and Brhaspati. Let the Gods give their gifts, and let Sunrta, Goddess, grant us wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 141
sanskrit: अग्ने अछा वदेह नः परत्यं नः सुमना भव | पर नोयछ विशस पते धनदा असि नस्त्वम
transliteration: aghne achā vadeha naḥ pratyaṃ naḥ sumanā bhava | pra noyacha viśas pate dhanadā asi nastvam
translation: WITH thee, O Agni, was this singer of the laud: he hath no other kinship, O thou Son of Strength. Thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard. Keep the destructive lightning far away from us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 141
sanskrit: पर नो यछत्वर्यमा पर भगः पर बर्हस्पतिः | परदेवाः परोत सून्र्ता रायो देवी ददातु नः
transliteration: pra no yachatvaryamā pra bhaghaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ | pradevāḥ prota sūnṛtā rāyo devī dadātu naḥ
translation: Thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood, Agni: as Comrade thou winnest all living things. Our coursers and our songs shall be victorious: they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 141
sanskrit: सोमं राजानमवसे.अग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे | आदित्यान्विष्णुं सूर्यं बरह्माणं च बर्हस्पतिम
transliteration: somaṃ rājānamavase.aghniṃ ghīrbhirhavāmahe |
translation: And thou, O Agni, thou of Godlike nature, sparest the stones, while caring up the brushwood. Then are thy tracks like deserts in the corn-lands. Let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: अयमग्ने जरिता तवे अभूदपि सहसः सूनो नह्यन्यदस्त्याप्यम | भद्रं हि शर्म तरिवरूथमस्ति त आरेहिंसानामप दिद्युमा कर्धि
transliteration: ayamaghne jaritā tve abhūdapi sahasaḥ sūno nahyanyadastyāpyam | bhadraṃ hi śarma trivarūthamasti ta ārehiṃsānāmapa didyumā kṛdhi
translation: YE made that Atri, worn with eld, free as a horse to win the goal. When ye restored to youth and strength Kaksivan like a car renewed,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: परवत ते अग्ने जनिमा पितूयतः साचीव विश्वा भुवना नय्र्ञ्जसे | पर सप्तयः पर सनिषन्त नो धियः पुरश्चरन्तिपशुपा इव तमना
transliteration: pravat te aghne janimā pitūyataḥ sācīva viśvā bhuvanā nyṛñjase | pra saptayaḥ pra saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ puraścarantipaśupā iva tmanā
translation: Ye freed that Atri like a horse, and brought him newly-born to earth. Ye loosed him like a firm-tied knot which Gods unsoiled by dust had bound.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: उत वा उ परि वर्णक्षि बप्सद बहोरग्न उलपस्य सवधावः | उत खिल्या उर्वराणां भवन्ति मा ते हेतिं तविषींचुक्रुधाम
transliteration: uta vā u pari vṛṇakṣi bapsad bahoraghna ulapasya svadhāvaḥ | uta khilyā urigvedaarāṇāṃ bhavanti mā te hetiṃ taviṣīṃcukrudhāma
translation: Heroes who showed most wondrous power to Atri, strive to win fair songs; For then, O Heroes of the sky, your hymn of praise shall cease no more.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: यदुद्वतो निवतो यासि बप्सत पर्थगेषि परगर्धिनीवसेना | यदा ते वातो अनुवाति शोचिर्वप्तेव शमश्रु वपसिप्र भूम
transliteration: yadudvato nivato yāsi bapsat pṛthagheṣi praghardhinīvasenā | yadā te vāto anuvāti śocirigvedaapteva śmaśru vapasipra bhūma
translation: This claims your notice, Bounteous Gods! - oblation, Asvins! and our love, That ye, O Heroes, in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: परत्यस्य शरेणयो दद्र्श्र एकं नियानं बहवो रथासः | बाहू यदग्ने अनुमर्म्र्जानो नयंं उत्तानामन्वेषिभूमिम
transliteration: pratyasya śreṇayo dadṛśra ekaṃ niyānaṃ bahavo rathāsaḥ | bāhū yadaghne anumarmṛjāno nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveṣibhūmim
translation: Ye Twain to Bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the region's end, Nasatyas, with your winged steeds came nigh, and gave him strength to win.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 142
sanskrit: उत ते शुष्मा जिहतामुत ते अर्चिरुत ते अग्ने शशमानस्यवाजाः | उच्छ्वञ्चस्व नि नम वर्धमान आ तवाद्य विश्वेवसवः सदन्तु
transliteration: ut te śuṣmā jihatāmut te arcirut te aghne śaśamānasyavājāḥ | ucchvañcasva ni nama vardhamāna ā tvādya viśvevasavaḥ sadantu
translation: Come with your joys, most liberal Gods, Lords of all treasures, bringing weal. Like fresh full waters to a well, so, Heroes come and be with us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 143
sanskrit: तयं चिदत्रिं रतजुरमर्थमश्वं न यातवे | कक्षिवन्तं यदी पुना रथं न कर्णुथो नवम
transliteration: tyaṃ cidatriṃ ṛtajuramarthamaśvaṃ na yātave | kakṣivantaṃ yadī punā rathaṃ na kṛṇutho navam
translation: THIS deathless Indu, like a steed, strong and of full vitality, Belongs to thee, the Orderer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 143
sanskrit: तयं चिदश्वं न वाजिनमरेणवो यमत्नत | दर्ळंग्रन्थिं न वि षयतमत्रिं यविष्ठमा रजः
transliteration: tyaṃ cidaśvaṃ na vājinamareṇavo yamatnata | dṛḷaṃghranthiṃ na vi ṣyatamatriṃ yaviṣṭhamā rajaḥ
translation: Here, by us, for the worshipper, is the wise bolt that works with skill. It brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous man brings the effectual strong drink.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 143
sanskrit: नरा दंसिष्ठवत्रये शुभ्रा सिषासतं धियः | अथा हि वां दिवो नरा पुन सतोमो न विशसे
transliteration: narā daṃsiṣṭhavatraye śubhrā siṣāsataṃ dhiyaḥ | athā hi vāṃ divo narā puna stomo na viśase
translation: Impetuous Ahisuva, a bull among cows of his, looked down upon the restless Hawk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 143
sanskrit: चिते तद वां सुराधसा रातिः सुमतिरश्विना | आ यन्नः सदने पर्थौ समने पर्षथो नरा
transliteration: cite tad vāṃ surādhasā rātiḥ sumatiraśvinā |
translation: That the strong-pinioned Bird hath brought, Child of the Falcon, from afar, What moves upon a hundred wheels along the female Dragon's path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 144
sanskrit: अयं हि ते अमर्त्य इन्दुरत्यो न पत्यते | दक्षो विश्वायुर्वेधसे
transliteration: ayaṃ hi te amartya induratyo na patyate | dakṣo viśvāyurigvedaedhase
translation: FROM out the earth I dig this plant, a herb of most effectual power, Wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for oneself.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 144
sanskrit: अयमस्मासु काव्य रभुर्वज्रो दास्वते | अयं बिभर्त्यूर्ध्वक्र्शनं मदं रभुर्न कर्त्व्यं मदम
transliteration: ayamasmāsu kāvya ṛbhurigvedaajro dāsvate | ayaṃ bibhartyūrdhvakṛśanaṃ madaṃ ṛbhurna kṛtvyaṃ madam
translation: Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the Gods, victorious plant, Blow thou the rival wife away, and make my husband only mine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 144
sanskrit: घर्षुः शयेनाय कर्त्वन आसु सवासु वंसगः | अव दीधेदहीशुवः
transliteration: ghṛṣuḥ śyenāya kṛtvana āsu svāsu vaṃsaghaḥ | ava dīdhedahīśuvaḥ
translation: Stronger am 1, O Stronger One, yea, mightier than the mightier; And she who is my rival wife is lower than the lowest dames.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 144
sanskrit: यं सुपर्णः परावतः शयेनस्य पुत्र आभरत | शतचक्रं यो.अह्यो वर्तनिः
transliteration: yaṃ suparṇaḥ parāvataḥ śyenasya putra ābharat |
translation: Her very name I utter not: she takes no pleasure in this man. Far into distance most remote drive we the rival wife away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: इमां खनाम्योषधिं वीरुधं बलवत्तमाम | ययासपत्नीं बाधते यया संविन्दते पतिम
transliteration: imāṃ khanāmyoṣadhiṃ vīrudhaṃ balavattamām | yayāsapatnīṃ bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim
translation: GODDESS of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight. How is it that thou seekest not the village? Art thou not afraid?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: उत्तानपर्णे सुभगे देवजूते सहस्वति | सपत्नीं मे पराधम पतिं मे केवलं कुरु
transliteration: uttānaparṇe subhaghe devajūte sahasvati | sapatnīṃ me parādhama patiṃ me kevalaṃ kuru
translation: What time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicada's voice, Seeming to sound with tinkling bells, the Lady of the Wood exults.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: उत्तराहमुत्तर उत्तरेदुत्तराभ्यः | अथा सपत्नी याममाधरा साधराभ्यः
transliteration: uttarāhamuttara uttareduttarābhyaḥ | athā sapatnī yāmamādharā sādharābhyaḥ
translation: And, yonder, cattle seem to graze, what seems a dwelling-place appears: Or else at eve the Lady of the Forest seems to free the wains.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: नह्यस्या नाम गर्भ्णामि नो अस्मिन रमते जने | परामेवपरावतं सपत्नीं गमयामसि
transliteration: nahyasyā nāma ghṛbhṇāmi no asmin ramate jane | parāmevaparāvataṃ sapatnīṃ ghamayāmasi
translation: Here one is calling to his cow, another there hath felled a tree: At eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: अहमस्मि सहमानाथ तवमसि सासहिः | उभे सहस्वतीभूत्वी सपत्नीं मे सहावहै
transliteration: ahamasmi sahamānātha tvamasi sāsahiḥ | ubhe sahasvatībhūtvī sapatnīṃ me sahāvahai
translation: The Goddess never slays, unless some murderous enemy approach. Man eats of savoury fruit and then takes, even as he wills, his rest.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 145
sanskrit: उप ते.अधां सहमानामभि तवाधां सहीयसा | मामनुप्र ते मनो वत्सं गौरिव धावतु पथा वारिव धावतु
transliteration: upa te.adhāṃ sahamānāmabhi tvādhāṃ sahīyasā | māmanupra te mano vatsaṃ ghauriva dhāvatu pathā vāriva dhāvatu
translation: Now have I praised the Forest Queen, sweet-scented, redolent of balm, The Mother of all sylvan things, who tills not but hath stores of food.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 146
sanskrit: अरण्यान्यरण्यान्यसौ या परेव नश्यसि | कथाग्रामं न पर्छसि न तवा भीरिव विन्दती.अ.अ.अन
transliteration: araṇyānyaraṇyānyasau yā preva naśyasi | kathāghrāmaṃ na pṛchasi na tvā bhīriva vindatī.a.a.an
translation: I TRUST in thy first wrathful deed, O Indra, when thou slewest Vrtra and didst work to profit man; What time the two world-halves fell short of thee in might, and the earth trembled at thy force, O Thunder-anned.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 146
sanskrit: वर्षारवाय वदते यदुपावति चिच्चिकः | आघाटिभिरिवधावयन्नरण्यानिर्महीयते
transliteration: vṛṣāravāya vadate yadupāvati ciccikaḥ |
translation: Thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer Vrtra, O Blameless One, with heart that longed for fame. Heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey, thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 147
sanskrit: शरत ते दधामि परथमाय मन्यवे.अहन यद वर्त्रं नर्यंविवेरपः | उभे यत तवा भवतो रोदसी अनु रेजतेशुष्मात पर्थिवी चिदद्रिवः
transliteration: ubhe yat tvā bhavato rodasī anu rejateśuṣmāt pṛthivī cidadrivaḥ
translation: WHEN we have pressed the juice we laud thee, Indra, and when, Most Valorous we have won the booty. Bring us prosperity, as each desires it under thine own protection may we conquer.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 147
sanskrit: तवं मायाभिरनवद्य मायिनं शरवस्यता मनसा वर्त्रमर्दयः | तवमिन नरो वर्णते गविष्टिषु तवां विश्वासुहव्यास्विष्टिषु
transliteration: tvaṃ māyābhiranavadya māyinaṃ śravasyatā manasā vṛtramardayaḥ | tvamin naro vṛṇate ghaviṣṭiṣu tvāṃ viśvāsuhavyāsviṣṭiṣu
translation: Sublime from birth, mayst thou O Indra, Hero, with Surya overcome the Dasa races. As by a fountain's side, we bring the Soma that lay concealed, close-hidden in the waters.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 147
sanskrit: ऐषु चाकन्धि पुरुहूत सूरिषु वर्धासो ये मघवन्नानशुर्मघम | अर्चन्ति तोके तनये परिष्टिषु मेधसाता वाजिनमह्रये धने
transliteration: aiṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūriṣu vṛdhāso ye maghavannānaśurmagham | arcanti toke tanaye pariṣṭiṣu medhasātā vājinamahraye dhane
translation: Answer the votary's hymns, for these thou knowest, craving the Rsis' prayer, thyself a Singer May we be they who take delight in Somas: these with sweet food for thee, O Chariot-rider.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 147
sanskrit: स इन नु रायः सुभ्र्तस्य चाकनन मदं यो अस्य रंह्यंचिकेतति | तवाव्र्धो मघवन दाश्वध्वरो मक्षू स वाजम्भरते धना नर्भिः
transliteration: sa in nu rāyaḥ subhṛtasya cākanan madaṃ yo asya raṃhyaṃciketati | tvāvṛdho maghavan dāśvadhvaro makṣū sa vājambharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ
translation: These holy prayers, O Indra, have I sung thee: grant to the men the strength of men, thou Hero. Be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest: keep thou the singers safe and their companions.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 147
sanskrit: तवं शर्धाय महिना गर्णान उरु कर्धि मघवञ्छग्धिरायः | तवं नो मित्रो वरुणो न मायी पित्वो न दस्मदयसे विभक्ता
transliteration: tvaṃ śardhāya mahinā ghṛṇāna uru kṛdhi maghavañchaghdhirāyaḥ | tvaṃ no mitro varuṇo na māyī pitvo na dasmadayase vibhaktā
translation: Listen to Prthi's call, heroic Indra, and be thou lauded by the hymns of Venya, Him who hath sung thee to thine oil-rich dwelling, whose rolling songs have sped thee like a torrent.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 148
sanskrit: सुष्वाणास इन्द्र सतुमसि तवा ससवांसश्च तुविन्र्म्णवाजम | आ नो भर सुवितं यस्य चाकन तमना तनासनुयाम तवोताः
transliteration: suṣvāṇāsa indra stumasi tvā sasavāṃsaśca tuvinṛmṇavājam |
translation: SAVITAR fixed the earth with bands to bind it, and made heaven steadfast where no prop supported. Savitar milked, as 'twere a restless courser, air, sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 149
sanskrit: सविता यन्त्रैः पर्थिवीमरम्णादस्कम्भने सविता दयामद्रंहत | अश्वमिवाधुक्षद धुनिमन्तरिक्षमतूर्तेबद्धं सविता समुद्रम
transliteration: savitā yantraiḥ pṛthivīmaramṇādaskambhane savitā dyāmadṛṃhat | aśvamivādhukṣad dhunimantarikṣamatūrtebaddhaṃ savitā samudram
translation: THOU, bearer of oblations, though kindled, art kindled for the Gods. With the Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, come to us: to show us favour come to us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 149
sanskrit: यत्रा समुद्र सकभितो वयौनदपां नपात सविता तस्यवेद | अतो भूरत आ उत्थितं रजो.अतो दयावाप्र्थिवीप्रथेताम
transliteration: yatrā samudra skabhito vyaunadapāṃ napāt savitā tasyaveda | ato bhūrata ā utthitaṃ rajo.ato dyāvāpṛthivīaprathetām
translation: Come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours. O kindled God, we mortals are invoking thee, calling on thee to show us grace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 149
sanskrit: पश्चेदमन्यदभवद यजत्रममर्त्यस्य भुवनस्य भूना | सुपर्णो अङग सवितुर्गरुत्मान पूर्वो जातः स उ अस्यानुधर्म
transliteration: paścedamanyadabhavad yajatramamartyasya bhuvanasya bhūnā | suparṇo aṅgha saviturgharutmān pūrigvedao jātaḥ sa u asyānudharma
translation: I laud thee Jatavedas, thee Lord of all blessings, with my song. Agni, bring hitherward the Gods whose Laws we love, whose laws we love, to show us grace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 149
sanskrit: गाव इव गरामं यूयुधिरिवाश्वान वाश्रेव वत्संसुमना दुहाना | पतिरिव जायामभि नो नयेतु धर्तादिवः सविता विश्ववारः
transliteration: ghāva iva ghrāmaṃ yūyudhirivāśvān vāśreva vatsaṃsumanā duhānā | patiriva jāyāmabhi no nyetu dhartādivaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ
translation: Agni the God was made the great High-Priest of Gods, Rsis have kindled Agni, men of mortal mould. Agni I invocate for winning ample wealth. kindly disposed for winning wealth.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 149
sanskrit: हिरण्यस्तूपः सवितर्यथा तवाङगिरसो जुह्वे वाजे अस्मिन | एवा तवार्चन्नवसे वन्दमानः सोमस्येवाण्शुं परतिजागराहम
transliteration: hiraṇyastūpaḥ savitaryathā tvāṅghiraso juhve vāje asmin | evā tvārcannavase vandamānaḥ somasyevāṇśuṃ pratijāgharāham
translation: Atri and Bharadvaja and Gavisthira, Kanva and Trasadasyu, in our fight he helped. On Agni calls Vasistha, even the household priest, the household priest to win his grace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 150
sanskrit: समिद्धश्चित समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन | आदित्यैरुद्रैर्वसुभिर्न आ गहि मर्ळीकाय न आ गहि
transliteration: samiddhaścit samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana |
translation: By Faith is Agni kindled, through Faith is oblation offered up. We celebrate with praises Faith upon the height of happiness.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 151
sanskrit: शरद्धयाग्निः समिध्यते शरद्धय हुयते हविः | शरद्धां भगस्य मूर्धनि वचसा वेदयमसि
transliteration: priyaṃ śraddhe dadataḥ priyaṃ śraddte didāsataḥ | priyambhojeṣu yajvasvidaṃ ma uditaṃ kṛdhi
translation: A MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe, Whose friend is never done to death, and never, never overcome.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 151
sanskrit: परियं शरद्धे ददतः परियं शरद्द्ते दिदासतः | परियम्भोजेषु यज्वस्विदं म उदितं कर्धि
transliteration: yathā deva asureṣu śraddhāmughreṣu cakrire | evambhojeṣu yajvasvasmākamuditaṃ kṛdhi
translation: Lord of the clan, who brings us bliss, Strong, Warrior, Slayer of the fiend, May India, Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 152
sanskrit: शास इत्था महानस्यमित्रखादो अद्भुतः | न यस्यहन्यते सखा न जीयते कदा चन
transliteration: na yasyahanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
translation: SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth, And shared his great heroic might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 152
sanskrit: सवस्तिद विशस पतिर्व्र्त्रहा विम्र्धो वशी | वर्षेन्द्रःपुर एतु नः सोमप अभयंकरः
transliteration: svastida viśas patirigvedaṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī | vṛṣendraḥpura etu naḥ somapa abhayaṃkaraḥ
translation: Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth: Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 152
sanskrit: वि रक्षो वि मर्धो जहि वि वर्त्रस्य हनू रुज | वि मन्युमिन्द्र वर्त्रहन्नमित्रस्याभिदसतः
transliteration: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja | vi manyumindra vṛtrahannamitrasyābhidasataḥ
translation: Thou art the Vrtra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament: Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 152
sanskrit: वि न इन्द्र मर्धो जहि नीचा यछ पर्तन्यतः | यो अस्मानभिदासत्यधरं गमया तमः
transliteration: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yacha pṛtanyataḥ | yo asmānabhidāsatyadharaṃ ghamayā tamaḥ
translation: Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee, Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 152
sanskrit: अपेन्द्र दविषतो मनो.अप जिज्यासतो वधम | वि मन्योःशर्म यछ वरीयो यवया वधम
transliteration: apendra dviṣato mano.apa jijyāsato vadham | vi manyoḥśarma yacha varīyo yavayā vadham
translation: Thou, Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy might: Thou hast pervaded every place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 153
sanskrit: ईङखयन्तीरपस्युव इन्द्रं जातमुपासते | भेजानसःसुवीर्यम
transliteration: bhejānasaḥsuvīryam
translation: FOR some is Soma purified, some sit by sacrificial oil: To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 153
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र बलादधि सहसो जात ओजसः | तवं वर्षन्व्र्षेदसि
transliteration: tvamindra balādadhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ | tvaṃ vṛṣanvṛṣedasi
translation: Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to heaven, Who showed great Fervour in their lives, even to those let him depart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 153
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्रासि वर्त्रहा वयन्तरिक्षमतिरः | उद दयामस्तभ्ना ओजसा
transliteration: tvamindrāsi vṛtrahā vyantarikṣamatiraḥ | ud dyāmastabhnā ojasā
translation: The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away, Or who give guerdon thousandfold, even to those let him depart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 153
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्र सजोषसमर्कं बिभर्षि बाह्वोः | वज्रंशिशान ओजसा
transliteration: tvamindra sajoṣasamarkaṃ bibharṣi bāhvoḥ | vajraṃśiśāna ojasā
translation: Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners, The Fathers, Yama! Fervour-moved, even to those let him depart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 153
sanskrit: तवमिन्द्राभिभूरसि विश्वा जातान्योजसा | स विश्वाभुव आभवः
transliteration: tvamindrābhibhūrasi viśvā jātānyojasā | sa viśvābhuva ābhavaḥ
translation: Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun, The Rsis, Yama! Fervour-moved, even to those let him depart.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 154
sanskrit: सोम एकेभ्यः पवते घर्तमेक उपासते | येभ्यो मधुप्रधावति तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात
transliteration: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtameka upāsate | yebhyo madhupradhāvati tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt
translation: ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill. We frighten thee away with these, the heroes of Sirimbitha.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 154
sanskrit: तपसा ये अनाध्र्ष्यास्तपसा ये सवर्ययुः | तपो येचक्रिरे महस्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात
transliteration: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāstapasā ye svaryayuḥ | tapo yecakrire mahastāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt
translation: Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn. Go, sharp-horned Brahmanaspti and drive Arayi far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 154
sanskrit: ये युध्यन्ते परधनेषु शूरासो ये तनूत्यजः | ये वासहस्रदक्षिणास्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात
transliteration: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye tanūtyajaḥ | ye vāsahasradakṣiṇāstāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt
translation: Yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the river's edge,- Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 154
sanskrit: ये चित पूर्व रतसाप रतावान रताव्र्धः | पितॄन तपस्वतोयम तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात
transliteration: ye cit pūrigvedaa ṛtasāpa ṛtāvāna ṛtāvṛdhaḥ | pitṝn tapasvatoyama tāṃścidevāpi ghachatāt
translation: When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast, All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 154
sanskrit: सहस्रणीथाः कवयो ये गोपायन्ति सूर्यम | रषीन्तपस्वतो यम तपोजानपि गछतात
transliteration: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye ghopāyanti sūryam |
translation: These men have led about the cow, have duly carried Agni round, And raised their glory to the Gods. Who will attack them with success?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 155
sanskrit: अरायि काणे विकटे गिरिं गछ सदान्वे | शिरिम्बिठस्यसत्वभिस्तेभिष टवा चातयामसि
transliteration: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe ghiriṃ ghacha sadānve |
translation: LET songs of ours speed Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race, And we will win each prize through him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 156
sanskrit: अग्निं हिन्वन्तु नो धियः सप्तिमाशुमिवाजिषु | तेन जेष्मधनं-धनम
transliteration: aghniṃ hinvantu no dhiyaḥ saptimāśumivājiṣu | tena jeṣmadhanaṃ-dhanam
translation: WE will, with Indra and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing worlds into subjection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 156
sanskrit: यया गा आकरामहे सेनयाग्ने तवोत्या | तां नो हिन्वमघत्तये
transliteration: yayā ghā ākarāmahe senayāghne tavotyā | tāṃ no hinvamaghattaye
translation: Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring, let Indra form together with Adityas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 157
sanskrit: इमा नु कं भुवना सीषधामेन्द्रश्च विश्वे च देवाः
transliteration: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraśca viśve ca devāḥ
translation: MAY Surya guard us out of heaven, and Vata from the firmament, And Agni from terrestrial spots.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 157
sanskrit: यज्ञं च नस्तन्वं च परजां चादित्यैरिन्द्रः सहचीक्ळिपाति
transliteration: yajñaṃ ca nastanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityairindraḥ sahacīkḷipāti
translation: Thou Savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations, be thou pleased: From failing lightning keep us safe.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 158
sanskrit: सूर्यो नो दिवस पातु वातो अन्तरिक्षात | अग्निर्नःपार्थिवेभ्यः
transliteration: sūryo no divas pātu vāto antarikṣāt | aghnirnaḥpārthivebhyaḥ
translation: YON Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high. I knowing this, as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 158
sanskrit: जोषा सवितर्यस्य ते हरः शतं सवानर्हति | पाहिनो दिद्युतः पतन्त्याः
transliteration: joṣā savitaryasya te haraḥ śataṃ savānarhati | pāhino didyutaḥ patantyāḥ
translation: I am the banner and the head, a mighty arbitress am I: I am victorious, and my Lord shall be submissive to my will.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 158
sanskrit: चक्षुर्नो देवः सविता चक्षुर्न उत पर्वतः | चक्षुर्धाता दधातु नः
transliteration: cakṣurno devaḥ savitā cakṣurna uta parigvedaataḥ | cakṣurdhātā dadhātu naḥ
translation: My Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen: I am victorious: o'er my Lord my song of triumph is supreme.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 158
sanskrit: चक्षुर्नो धेहि चक्षुषे चक्षुर्विख्यै तनूभ्यः | संचेदं वि च पश्येम
transliteration: cakṣurno dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣurigvedakhyai tanūbhyaḥ | saṃcedaṃ vi ca paśyema
translation: Oblation, that which Indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high,- This have I offered, O ye Gods, and rid me of each rival wife.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 158
sanskrit: सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं परति पश्येम सूर्य | वि पश्येमन्र्चक्षसः
transliteration: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ prati paśyema sūrya | vi paśyemanṛcakṣasaḥ
translation: Destroyer of the rival wife, Sole Spouse, victorious, conqueror, The others' glory have I seized as 'twere the wealth of weaker Dames.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 159
sanskrit: उदसौ सूर्यो अगादुदयं मामको भगः | अहं तद्विद्वला पतिमभ्यसाक्षि विषासहिः
transliteration: udasau sūryo aghādudayaṃ māmako bhaghaḥ | ahaṃ tadvidvalā patimabhyasākṣi viṣāsahiḥ
translation: TASTE this strong draught enriched with offered viands: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy Coursers. Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for thee are ready.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 159
sanskrit: अहं केतुरहं मूर्धाहमुग्रा विवाचनी | ममेदनुक्रतुं पतिः सेहानाया उपाचरेत
transliteration: ahaṃ keturahaṃ mūrdhāhamughrā vivācanī | mamedanukratuṃ patiḥ sehānāyā upācaret
translation: Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant songs invite thee. O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all and drink the Soma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 159
sanskrit: मम पुत्राः शत्रुहणो.अथो मे दुहिता विराट | उताहमस्मि संजया पत्यौ मे शलोक उत्तमः
transliteration: mama putrāḥ śatruhaṇo.atho me duhitā virāṭ | utāhamasmi saṃjayā patyau me śloka uttamaḥ
translation: Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and spirit,- Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma famous.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 159
sanskrit: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः | इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्ना किलाभुवम
transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ | idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnā kilābhuvam
translation: He looks with loving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for him the Soma. Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who hate devotion.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 159
sanskrit: असपत्ना सपत्नघ्नी जयन्त्यभिभूवरी | आव्र्क्षमन्यासां वर्चो राधो अस्थेयसामिव
transliteration: asapatnā sapatnaghnī jayantyabhibhūvarī |
translation: We call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and spoil, of cattle, and of horses. For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, as our welfare.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 160
sanskrit: तीव्रस्याभिवयसो अस्य पाहि सर्वरथा वि हरी इह मुञ्च | इन्द्र मा तवा यजमानासो अन्ये नि रीरमन तुभ्यमिमेसुतासः
transliteration: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarigvedaarathā vi harī iha muñca | indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyamimesutāsaḥ
translation: FOR life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from Consumption; Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra, thou and Agni.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 160
sanskrit: तुभ्यं सुतास्तुभ्यमु सोत्वासस्त्वां गिरः शवात्र्याा हवयन्ति | इन्द्रेदमद्य सवनं जुषाणो विश्वस्यविद्वानिह पाहि सोमम
transliteration: tubhyaṃ sutāstubhyamu sotvāsastvāṃ ghiraḥ śvātryāā hvayanti | indredamadya savanaṃ juṣāṇo viśvasyavidvāniha pāhi somam
translation: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death already, Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 160
sanskrit: य उशता मनसा सोममस्मै सर्वह्र्दा देवकामः सुनोति | न गा इन्द्रस्तस्य परा ददाति परशस्तमिच्चारुमस्मैक्र्णोति
transliteration: ya uśatā manasā somamasmai sarigvedaahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti | na ghā indrastasya parā dadāti praśastamiccārumasmaikṛṇoti
translation: With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him, That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 160
sanskrit: अनुस्पष्टो भवत्येषो अस्य यो अस्मै रेवान न सुनोति सोमम | निररत्नौ मघवा तं दधाति बरह्मद्विषो हन्त्यनानुदिष्टः
