transliteration: anuspaṣṭo bhavatyeṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam | niraratnau maghavā taṃ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hantyanānudiṣṭaḥ
translation: Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters. Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Brhaspati, Savitar yield him for a hundred!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 160
sanskrit: अश्वायन्तो गव्यन्तो वाजयन्तो हवामहे तवोपगन्तवा उ | आभूषन्तस्ते सुमतौ नवायां वयमिन्द्र तवा शुनंहुवेम
transliteration: aśvāyanto ghavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopaghantavā u |
translation: So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed. Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 161
sanskrit: मुञ्चामि तवा हविषा जीवनाय कमज्ञातयक्ष्मादुतराजयक्ष्मात | गराहिर्जग्राह यदि वैतदेनं तस्यािन्द्राग्नी पर मुमुक्तमेनम
transliteration: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kamajñātayakṣmādutarājayakṣmāt | ghrāhirjaghrāha yadi vaitadenaṃ tasyāindrāghnī pra mumuktamenam
translation: MAY Agni, yielding to our prayer, the Raksas-slayer, drive away The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 161
sanskrit: यदि कषितायुर्यदि वा परेतो यदि मर्त्योरन्तिकं नीतेव | तमा हरामि निरतेरुपस्थादस्पार्षमेनंशतशारदाय
transliteration: yadi kṣitāyuryadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyorantikaṃ nītaeva | tamā harāmi nirterupasthādaspārṣamenaṃśataśāradāya
translation: Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh, The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 161
sanskrit: सहस्राक्षेण शतशारदेन शतायुषा हविषाहार्षमेनम | शतं यथेमं शरदो नयातीन्द्रो विश्वस्यदुरितस्य पारम
transliteration: sahasrākṣeṇa śataśāradena śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣamenam |
translation: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo, That which will kill the babe at birth, even this will we drive far away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: बरह्मणाग्निः संविदानो रक्षोहा बाधतामितः | अमीवायस्ते गर्भं दुर्णामा योनिमाशये
transliteration: brahmaṇāghniḥ saṃvidāno rakṣohā bādhatāmitaḥ | amīvāyaste gharbhaṃ durṇāmā yonimāśaye
translation: FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin, Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यस्ते गर्भममीवा दुर्णामा योनिमाशये | अग्निष टम्ब्रह्मणा सह निष करव्यादमनीनशत
transliteration: yaste gharbhamamīvā durṇāmā yonimāśaye | aghniṣ ṭambrahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādamanīnaśat
translation: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine, From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यस्ते हन्ति पतयन्तं निषत्स्नुं यः सरीस्र्पम | जातंयस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
transliteration: yaste hanti patayantaṃ niṣatsnuṃ yaḥ sarīsṛpam | jātaṃyaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
translation: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart, From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यस्त ऊरू विहरत्यन्तरा दम्पती शये | योनिं योन्तरारेळि तमितो नाशयामसि
transliteration: yasta ūrū viharatyantarā dampatī śaye | yoniṃ yoantarāreḷi tamito nāśayāmasi
translation: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet, From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यस्त्वा भराता पतिर्भूत्वा जारो भूत्वा निपद्यते | परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
transliteration: yastvā bhrātā patirbhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate | prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
translation: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails, From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 162
sanskrit: यस्त्वा सवप्नेन तमसा मोहयित्वा निपद्यते | परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
transliteration: yastvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate | prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
translation: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint, From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 163
sanskrit: अक्षीभ्यां ते नासिकाभ्यां कर्णाभ्यां छुबुकादधि | यक्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं मस्तिष्काज्जिह्वाया वि वर्हामि ते
transliteration: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukādadhi | yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkājjihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te
translation: AVAUNT, thou Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away. Look on Destruction far from hence. The live man's mind is manifold.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 163
sanskrit: गरीवाभ्यस्त उष्णिहाभ्यः कीकसाभ्यो अनूक्यात | यक्ष्मं दोषण्यमंसाभ्यां बाहुभ्यां वि वर्हामि ते
transliteration: ghrīvābhyasta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt | yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyamaṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te
translation: A happy boon do men elect, a mighty blessing they obtain. Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live man's mind seeks many a place.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 164
sanskrit: अपेहि मनसस पते.अप कराम परश्चर | परो निरतया आचक्ष्व बहुधा जीवतो मनः
transliteration: apehi manasas pate.apa krāma paraścara | paro nirtyā ācakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ
translation: GODS, whatsoe'er the Dove came hither seeking, sent to us as the envoy of Destruction, For that let us sing hymns and make atonement. Well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 164
sanskrit: भद्रं वै वरं वर्णते भद्रं युञ्जन्ति दक्षिणम | भद्रं वैवस्वते चक्षुर्बहुत्रा जीवतो मनः
transliteration: bhadraṃ vai varaṃ vṛṇate bhadraṃ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam | bhadraṃ vaivasvate cakṣurbahutrā jīvato manaḥ
translation: Auspicious be the Dove that hath been sent us, a harmless bird, ye Gods, within our dwelling. May Agni, Sage, be pleased with our oblation, and may the Missile borne on wings avoid us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 164
sanskrit: यदाशसा निःशसाभिशसोपारिम जाग्रतो यत सवपन्तः | अग्निर्विश्वान्यप दुष्क्र्तान्यजुष्टान्यारे अस्मद्दधातु
transliteration: yadāśasā niḥśasābhiśasopārima jāghrato yat svapantaḥ | aghnirigvedaśvānyapa duṣkṛtānyajuṣṭānyāre asmaddadhātu
translation: Let not the Arrow that hath wings distract us: beside the fire-place, on the hearth it settles. May, it bring welfare to our men and cattle: here let the Dove, ye Gods, forbear to harm us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 164
sanskrit: यदिन्द्र बरह्मणस पते.अभिद्रोहं चरामसि | परचेता नाङगिरसो दविषतां पात्यंहसः
transliteration: yadindra brahmaṇas pate.abhidrohaṃ carāmasi | pracetā naāṅghiraso dviṣatāṃ pātyaṃhasaḥ
translation: The screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the Dove hath settled, To him who sent it hither as an envoy, to him be reverence paid, to Death, to Yama.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 164
sanskrit: अजैष्माद्यासनाम चाभूमानागसो वयम | जाग्रत्स्वप्नःसंकल्पः पापो यं दविष्मस्तं स रछतु यो नो दवेष्टितं रछतु
transliteration: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāghaso vayam | jāghratsvapnaḥsaṃkalpaḥ pāpo yaṃ dviṣmastaṃ sa ṛchatu yo no dveṣṭitaṃ ṛchatu
translation: Drive forth the Dove, chase it with holy verses: rejoicing, bring ye hither food and cattle, Barring the way against all grief and trouble. Let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 165
sanskrit: देवाः कपोत इषितो यदिछन दूतो निरतया इदमाजगाम | तस्मा अर्चाम कर्णवाम निष्क्र्तिं शं नो अस्तु दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे
transliteration: devāḥ kapota iṣito yadichan dūto nirtyā idamājaghāma | tasmā arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtiṃ śaṃ no astu dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade
translation: MAKE me a bull among my peers, make me my rivals, conqueror: Make me the slayer of my foes, a sovran ruler, lord of kine

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 166
sanskrit: रषभं मा समानानां सपत्नानां विषासहिम | हन्तारंशत्रूणां कर्धि विराजं गोपतिं गवाम
transliteration: hantāraṃśatrūṇāṃ kṛdhi virājaṃ ghopatiṃ ghavām
translation: THIS pleasant meath, O Indra, is effused for thee: thou art the ruling Lord of beaker and of juice. Bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons: thou, having glowed with Fervour, worthest heavenly light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 166
sanskrit: अहमस्मि सपत्नहेन्द्र इवारिष्टो अक्षतः | अधः सपत्नामे पदोरिमे सर्वे अभिष्ठिताः
transliteration: ahamasmi sapatnahendra ivāriṣṭo akṣataḥ | adhaḥ sapatnāme padorime sarigvedae abhiṣṭhitāḥ
translation: Let us call Sakra to libations here effused, winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice. Mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us: we pray to Maghavan the Vanquisher of hosts.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 166
sanskrit: अत्रैव वो.अपि नह्याम्युभे आर्त्नी इव जयया | वाचस पतेनि षेधेमान यथा मदधरं वदान
transliteration: atraiva vo.api nahyāmyubhe ārtnī iva jyayā | vācas pateni ṣedhemān yathā madadharaṃ vadān
translation: By royal Soma's and by Varuna's decree, under Brhaspati's and Anumati's guard, This day by thine authority, O Maghavan, Maker, Disposer thou! have I enjoyed the jars.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 166
sanskrit: अभिभूरहमागमं विश्वकर्मेण धाम्ना | आ वश्चित्तमा वो वरतमा वो.अहं समितिं ददे
transliteration: abhibhūrahamāghamaṃ viśvakarmeṇa dhāmnā |
translation: 1, too, urged on, have had my portion, in the bowl, and as first Prince I drew forth this my hymn of praise, When with the prize I came unto the flowing juice, O Visvamitra, Jamadagni, to your home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 167
sanskrit: तुभ्येदमिन्द्र परि षिच्यते मधु तवं सुतस्य कलशस्यराजसि | तवं रयिं पुरुवीरामु नस कर्धि तवं तपःपरितप्याजयः सवः
transliteration: tubhyedamindra pari ṣicyate madhu tvaṃ sutasya kalaśasyarājasi | tvaṃ rayiṃ puruvīrāmu nas kṛdhi tvaṃ tapaḥparitapyājayaḥ svaḥ
translation: O THE Wind's chariot, O its power and glory! Crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder. It makes the regions red and touches heaven, and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 167
sanskrit: सवर्जितं महि मन्दानमन्धसो हवामहे परि शक्रंसुतानुप | इमं नो यज्ञमिह बोध्या गहि सप्र्धोजयन्तं मघवानमीमहे
transliteration: svarjitaṃ mahi mandānamandhaso havāmahe pari śakraṃsutānupa | imaṃ no yajñamiha bodhyā ghahi spṛdhojayantaṃ maghavānamīmahe
translation: Along the traces of the Wind they hurry, they come to him as dames to an assembly. Borne on his car with these for his attendants, the God speeds forth, the universe's Monarch.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 167
sanskrit: सोमस्य राज्ञो वरुणस्य धर्मणि बर्हस्पतेरनुमत्या उशर्मणि | तवाहमद्य मघवन्नुपस्तुतौ धातर्विधातः कलशानभक्षयम
transliteration: somasya rājño varuṇasya dharmaṇi bṛhaspateranumatyā uśarmaṇi | tavāhamadya maghavannupastutau dhātarigvedadhātaḥ kalaśānabhakṣayam
translation: Travelling on the paths of air's mid region, no single day doth he take rest or slumber. Holy and earliest-born, Friend of the waters, where did he spring and from what region came he?

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 167
sanskrit: परसूतो भक्षमकरं चरावपि सतोमं चेमं परथमःसूरिरुन मर्जे | सुते सातेन यद्यागमं वां परतिविश्वामित्रजमदग्नी दमे
transliteration: prasūto bhakṣamakaraṃ carāvapi stomaṃ cemaṃ prathamaḥsūrirun mṛje | sute sātena yadyāghamaṃ vāṃ prativiśvāmitrajamadaghnī dame
translation: Germ of the world, the Deities' vital spirit, this God moves ever as his will inclines him. His voice is heard, his shape is ever viewless. Let us adore this Wind with our oblation.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 168
sanskrit: वातस्य नु महिमानं रथस्य रुजन्नेति सतनयन्नस्यघोषः | दिविस्प्र्ग यात्यरुणानि कर्ण्वन्नुतो एति पर्थिव्यारेणुमस्यन
transliteration: vātasya nu mahimānaṃ rathasya rujanneti stanayannasyaghoṣaḥ | divispṛgh yātyaruṇāni kṛṇvannuto eti pṛthivyāreṇumasyan
translation: MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing: may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices. May they drink waters rich in life and fatness: to food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 168
sanskrit: सं परेरते अनु वातस्य विष्ठा ऐनं गछन्ति समनं नयोषाः | ताभिः सयुक सरथं देव ईयते.अस्य विश्वस्यभुवनस्य राजा
transliteration: saṃ prerate anu vātasy viṣṭhā ainaṃ ghachanti samanaṃ nayoṣāḥ | tābhiḥ sayuk sarathaṃ deva īyate.asya viśvasyabhuvanasya rājā
translation: Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through sacrifice are known to Agni, Whom the Angirases produced by Fervour, vouchsafe to these, Parjanya, great protection.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 168
sanskrit: अन्तरिक्षे पथिभिरीयमानो न नि विशते कतमच्चनाहः | अपां सखा परथमजा रतावा कव सविज्जातः कुत आबभूव
transliteration: antarikṣe pathibhirīyamāno na ni viśate katamaccanāhaḥ | apāṃ sakhā prathamajā ṛtāvā kva svijjātaḥ kuta ābabhūva
translation: Those who have offered to the Gods their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to Soma,- Those grant us in our cattle-pen, O Indra, with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 169
sanskrit: मयोभूर्वातो अभि वातूस्रा ऊर्जस्वतीरोषधीरारिशन्ताम | पीवस्वतीर्जीवधन्याः पिबन्त्ववसाय पद्वतेरुद्र मर्ळ
transliteration: mayobhūrigvedaāto abhi vātūsrā ūrjasvatīroṣadhīrāriśantām | pīvasvatīrjīvadhanyāḥ pibantvavasāya padvaterudra mṛḷa
translation: MAY the Bright God drink glorious Soma-mingled meath, giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life; He who, wind-urged, in person guards our offspring well, hath nourished them with food and shines o'er many a land.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 169
sanskrit: याः सरूपा विरूपा एकरूपा यासामग्निरिष्ट्यानामानि वेद | या अङगिरसस्तपसेह चक्रुस्ताभ्यःपर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ
transliteration: yāḥ sarūpā virūpā ekarūpā yāsāmaghniriṣṭyānāmāni veda | yā aṅghirasastapaseha cakrustābhyaḥparjanya mahi śarma yacha
translation: Radiant, as high Truth, cherished, best at winning strength, Truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens, He rose, a light, that kills Vrtras and enemies, best slayer of the Dasyus, Asuras, and foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 169
sanskrit: या देवेषु तन्वमैरयन्त यासां सोमो विश्वा रूपाणिवेद | ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः परजावतीरिन्द्रगोष्ठे रिरीहि
transliteration: yā deveṣu tanvamairayanta yāsāṃ somo viśvā rūpāṇiveda | tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ prajāvatīrindraghoṣṭhe rirīhi
translation: This light, the best of lights, supreme, all-conquering, winner of riches, is exalted with high laud. All-lighting, radiant, mighty as the Sun to see, he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 169
sanskrit: परजापतिर्मह्यमेता रराणो विश्वैर्देवैः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः | शिवाः सतीरुप नो गोष्ठमाकस्तासांवयं परजया सं सदेम
transliteration: prajāpatirmahyametā rarāṇo viśvairdevaiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ |
translation: Beaming forth splendour with thy light, thou hast attained heaven's lustrous realm. By thee were brought together all existing things, possessor of all Godhead, All-effecting God.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 170
sanskrit: विभ्राड बर्हत पिबतु सोम्यं मध्वायुर्दधद यज्ञपतावविह्रुतम | वातजूतो यो अभिरक्षति तमना परजाः पुपोषपुरुधा वि राजति
transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat pibatu somyaṃ madhvāyurdadhad yajñapatāvavihrutam | vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣapurudhā vi rājati
translation: FOR Ita's sake who pressed the juice, thou, Indra, didst protect his car, And hear the Soma-giver's call.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 170
sanskrit: विभ्राड बर्हत सुभ्र्तं वाजसातमं धर्मन दिवो धरुणेसत्यमर्पितम | अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहन्तमं जयोतिर्जज्ञेसुरहा सपत्नहा
transliteration: vibhrāḍ bṛhat subhṛtaṃ vājasātamaṃ dharman divo dharuṇesatyamarpitam | amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhantamaṃ jyotirjajñeasurahā sapatnahā
translation: Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant, And sought the Soma-pourer's home.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 170
sanskrit: इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरुत्तमं विश्वजिद्धनजिदुच्यते बर्हत | विश्वभ्राड भराजो महि सूर्यो दर्शौरु पप्रथे सह ओजो अच्युतम
transliteration: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotiruttamaṃ viśvajiddhanajiducyate bṛhat | viśvabhrāḍ bhrājo mahi sūryo dṛśauru paprathe saha ojo acyutam
translation: Venya, that mortal man, hast thou, for Astrabudhna the devout, O Indra, many a time set free.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 170
sanskrit: विभ्राजञ जयोतिषा सवरगछो रोचनं दिवः | येनेमाविश्वा भुवनान्याभ्र्ता विश्वकर्मणा विश्वदेव्यावता
transliteration: vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svaraghacho rocanaṃ divaḥ | yenemāviśvā bhuvanānyābhṛtā viśvakarmaṇā viśvadevyāvatā
translation: Bring, Indra, to the east again that Sun who now is in the west, Even against the will of Gods.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 171
sanskrit: तवं तयमिटतो रथमिन्द्र परावः सुतावतः | अश्र्णोः सोमिनो हवम
transliteration: tvaṃ tyamiṭato rathamindra prāvaḥ sutāvataḥ | aśṛṇoḥ somino havam
translation: WITH all thy beauty come: the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 171
sanskrit: तवं मखस्य दोधतः शिरो.अव तवचो भरः | अगछःसोमिनो गर्हम
transliteration: tvaṃ makhasya dodhataḥ śiro.ava tvaco bharaḥ | aghachaḥsomino ghṛham
translation: Come with kind thoughts, most liberal, rousing the warrior's hymn of praise, with bounteous ones,

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 171
sanskrit: तवं तयमिन्द्र मर्त्यमास्त्रबुध्नाय वेन्यम | मुहुःश्रथ्ना मनस्यवे
transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra martyamāstrabudhnāya venyam | muhuḥśrathnā manasyave
translation: As nourishers we tie the thread, and, liberal with our bounty, offer sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 171
sanskrit: तवं तयमिन्द्र सूर्यं पश्चा सन्तं पुरस कर्धि | देवानां चित तिरो वशम
transliteration: tvaṃ tyamindra sūryaṃ paścā santaṃ puras kṛdhi | devānāṃ cit tiro vaśam
translation: Dawn drives away her Sister's gloom, and, through her excellence, makes her retrace her path.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 172
sanskrit: आ याहि वनसा सह गावः सचन्त वर्तनिं यदूधभिः
transliteration: pitubhṛto na tantumit sudānavaḥ prati dadhmo yajāmasi
translation: BE with us; I have chosen thee: stand steadfast and immovable. Let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 172
sanskrit: आ याहि वस्व्या धिया मंहिष्ठो जारयन्मखःसुदानुभिः
transliteration: uṣā apa svasustamaḥ saṃ vartayati vartaniṃ sujātatā
translation: Be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved. Stand steadfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 172
sanskrit: पितुभ्र्तो न तन्तुमित सुदानवः परति दध्मो यजामसि
transliteration: rigveda10172.shtml by HTTrack Website Copier/3.x [XR&CO'2008], Sat, 22 Nov 2008 14:12:40 GMT
translation: This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by strong oblation's power. May Soma speak a benison, and Brahmanaspati, on him.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 173
sanskrit: आ तवाहार्षमन्तरेधि धरुवस्तिष्ठाविचाचलिः | विशस्त्वा सर्वा वाञ्छन्तु मा तवद राष्ट्रमधि भरशत
transliteration: viśastvā sarigvedaā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭramadhi bhraśat
translation: WITH offering for success in fight whence Indra was victorious. With this, O Brahmanaspati, let us attain to royal sway.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 173
sanskrit: इहैवैधि माप चयोष्ठाः पर्वत इवाविचाचलिः | इन्द्रैवेह धरुवस्तिष्ठेह राष्ट्रमु धारय
transliteration: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parigvedaata ivāvicācaliḥ | indraiveha dhruvastiṣṭheha rāṣṭramu dhāraya
translation: Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities, Withstand the man who menaces, withstand the man who angers us.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 173
sanskrit: इममिन्द्रो अदीधरद धरुवं धरुवेण हविषा | तस्मै सोमोधि बरवत तस्मा उ बरह्मणस पतिः
transliteration: imamindro adīdharad dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā | tasmai somoadhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ
translation: Soma and Savitar the God have made thee a victorious King All elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 173
sanskrit: धरुवा दयौर्ध्रुवा पर्थिवी धरुवासः पर्वता इमे | धरुवं विश्वमिदं जगद धरुवो राजा विशामयम
transliteration: dhruvā dyaurdhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parigvedaatā ime | dhruvaṃ viśvamidaṃ jaghad dhruvo rājā viśāmayam
translation: Oblation, that which Indra. gave and thus grew glorious and most high,- This have I offered, Gods! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 173
sanskrit: धरुवं ते राजा वरुणो धरुवं देवो बर्हस्पतिः | धरुवं त इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च राष्ट्रं धारयतां धरुवम
transliteration: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ | dhruvaṃ ta indraścāghniśca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam
translation: Slayer of rivals, rivalless, victorious, with royal sway, Over these beings may I rule, may I be Sovran of the folk.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 174
sanskrit: अभीवर्तेन हविषा येनेन्द्रो अभिवाव्र्ते | तेनास्मान्ब्रह्मणस पते.अभि राष्ट्राय वर्तय
transliteration: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte | tenāsmānbrahmaṇas pate.abhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya
translation: MAY Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you according to the Law: Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 174
sanskrit: अभिव्र्त्य सपत्नानभि या नो अरातयः | अभि पर्तन्यन्तन्तिष्ठाभि यो न इरस्यति
transliteration: abhivṛtya sapatnānabhi yā no arātayaḥ | abhi pṛtanyantantiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati
translation: Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence: Make ye the Cows our medicine.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 174
sanskrit: अभि तवा देवः सविताभि सोमो अवीव्र्तत | अभि तवा विश्वाभूतान्यभीवर्तो यथाससि
transliteration: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat | abhi tvā viśvābhūtānyabhīvarto yathāsasi
translation: Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength, Look down with pride on those below.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 174
sanskrit: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः | इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्नः किलाभुवम
transliteration: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ | idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam
translation: May Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him Who sacrifices, pouring juice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 175
sanskrit: पर वो गरावाणः सविता देवः सुवतु धर्मणा | धूर्षुयुज्यध्वं सुनुत
transliteration: pra vo ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā | dhūrṣuyujyadhvaṃ sunuta
translation: WITH hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the Rbhus' mighty deeds. Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the earth as, twere a mother cow.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 175
sanskrit: गरावाणो अप दुछुनामप सेधत दुर्मतिम | उस्राः कर्तनभेषजम
transliteration: ghrāvāṇo apa duchunāmapa sedhata durmatim | usrāḥ kartanabheṣajam
translation: Bring forth the God with song divine, being Jatavedas hitherward, To bear our gifts at once to heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 175
sanskrit: गरावाण उपरेष्वा महीयन्ते सजोषसः | वर्ष्णेदधतो वर्ष्ण्यम
transliteration: ghrāvāṇa upareṣvā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ | vṛṣṇedadhato vṛṣṇyam
translation: He here, a God-devoted Priest, led forward comes to sacrifice. Like a car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 175
sanskrit: गरावाणः सविता नु वो देवः सुवतु धर्मणा | यजमानाय सुन्वते
transliteration: ghrāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā | yajamānāya sunvate
translation: This Agni rescues from distress, as 'twere from the Immortal Race, A God yet mightier than strength, a God who hath been made for life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 176
sanskrit: पर सूनव रभूणां बर्हन नवन्त वर्जना | कषामा येविश्वधायसो.अश्नन धेनुं न मातरम
transliteration: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇāṃ bṛhan navanta vṛjanā | kṣāmā yeviśvadhāyaso.aśnan dhenuṃ na mātaram
translation: THE sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the Bird adorned with all an Asura's magic might. Sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth: the wise disposers seek the station of his rays.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 176
sanskrit: पर देवं देव्या धिया भरता जातवेदसम | हव्या नोवक्षदानुषक
transliteration: pra devaṃ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam | havyā novakṣadānuṣak
translation: The flying Bird bears Speech within his spirit: erst the Gandharva in the womb pronounced it: And at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-bright invention.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 176
sanskrit: अयमु षय पर देवयुर्होता यज्ञाय नीयते | रथो नयोरभीव्र्तो घर्णीवाञ्चेतति तमना
transliteration: ayamu ṣya pra devayurhotā yajñāya nīyate | ratho nayorabhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñcetati tmanā
translation: I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on his pathways. He, clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 177
sanskrit: पतंगमक्तमसुरस्य मायया हर्दा पश्यन्ति मनसाविपश्चितः | समुद्रे अन्तः कवयो वि चक्षते मरीचीनाम्पदमिछन्ति वेधसः
transliteration: pataṃghamaktamasurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasāvipaścitaḥ | samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnāmpadamichanti vedhasaḥ
translation: THIS very mighty one whom Gods commission, the Conqueror of cars, ever triumphant, Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Tarksya for our weal will we call hither.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 177
sanskrit: पतंगो वाचं मनसा बिभर्ति तां गन्धर्वो.अवदद गर्भेन्तः | तां दयोतमानां सवर्यं मनीषां रतस्य पदेकवयो नि पान्ति
transliteration: pataṃgho vācaṃ manasā bibharti tāṃ ghandharigvedao.avadad gharbheantaḥ | tāṃ dyotamānāṃ svaryaṃ manīṣāṃ ṛtasya padekavayo ni pānti
translation: As though we offered up our gifts to Indra, may we ascend. him as a ship. for safety. Like the two wide worlds, broad, deep far-extended, may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 177
sanskrit: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम | स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्तिभुवनेष्वन्तः
transliteration: apaśyaṃ ghopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam | sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīrigvedaasāna ā varīvartibhuvaneṣvantaḥ
translation: He who with might the Five Lands hath pervaded, like Surya with his lustre, and the waters- His strength wins hundreds, thousands none avert it, as the young maid repelleth not her lover.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 178
sanskrit: तयमू षु वाजिनं देवजूतं सहावानं तरुतारंरथानाम | अरिष्टनेमिं पर्तनाजमाशुं सवस्तयेतार्क्ष्यमिहा हुवेम
transliteration: tyamū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahāvānaṃ tarutāraṃrathānām | ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājamāśuṃ svastayetārkṣyamihā huvema
translation: Now lift ye up yourselves and look on Indra's seasonable share. If it be ready, offer it; unready, ye have been remise.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 178
sanskrit: इन्द्रस्येव रातिमाजोहुवानाः सवस्तये नावमिवा रुहेम | उर्वी न पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे मा वामेतौ मा परेतौरिषाम
transliteration: indrasyeva rātimājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvamivā ruhema | urigvedaī na pṛthvī bahule ghabhīre mā vāmetau mā paretauriṣāma
translation: Oblation is prepared: come to us, Indra; the Sun hath travelled over half his journey. Friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 178
sanskrit: सद्यश्चिद यः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इवज्योतिषापस्ततान | सहस्रसाः शतसा अस्य रंहिर्नस्मा वरन्ते युवतिं न शर्याम
transliteration: sadyaścid yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya ivajyotiṣāpastatāna | sahasrasāḥ śatasā asya raṃhirnasmā varante yuvatiṃ na śaryām
translation: Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well-dressed, I fancy, is this recent present. Drink, Indra, of the curd of noon's libation with favour, Thunderer, thou whose deeds are mighty.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 179
sanskrit: उत तिष्ठताव पश्यतेन्द्रस्य भागं रत्वियम | यदि शरातोजुहोतन यद्यश्रातो ममत्तन
transliteration: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāghaṃ ṛtviyam | yadi śrātojuhotana yadyaśrāto mamattana
translation: O MUCH-INVOKED, thou hast subdued thy foemen: thy might is loftiest; here display thy bounty. In thy right hand, O Indra, bring us treasures: thou art the Lord of rivers filled with riches.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 180
sanskrit: पर ससाहिषे पुरुहूत शत्रूञ जयेष्ठस्ते शुष्म इहरातिरस्तु | इन्द्रा भर दक्षिणेना वसूनि पतिःसिन्धूनामसि रेवतीनाम
transliteration: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhaste śuṣma iharātirastu | indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patiḥsindhūnāmasi revatīnām
translation: VASISTHA mastered the Rathantara, took it from radiant Dhatar, Savitar, and Visnu, Oblation, portion of fourfold oblation, known by the names of Saprathas and Prathas.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 180
sanskrit: मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः परावत आ जगन्थापरस्याः | सर्कं संशाय पविमिन्द्र तिग्मं वि शत्रून्ताळि वि मर्धो नुदस्व
transliteration: mṛgho na bhīmaḥ kucaro ghiriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaghanthāparasyāḥ | sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavimindra tighmaṃ vi śatrūntāḷi vi mṛdho nudasva
translation: These sages found what lay remote and hidden, the sacrifice's loftiest secret essence. From radiant Dhatar, Savitar, and Visnu, from Agni, Bharadvaja brought the Brhat.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 180
sanskrit: इन्द्र कषत्रमभि वाममोजो.अजायथा वर्षभचर्षणीनाम | अपानुदो जनममित्रयन्तमुरुं देवेभ्योक्र्णोरु लोकम
transliteration: indra kṣatramabhi vāmamojo.ajāyathā vṛṣabhacarṣaṇīnām | apānudo janamamitrayantamuruṃ devebhyoakṛṇoru lokam
translation: They found with mental eyes the earliest Yajus, a pathway to the Gods, that had descended. From radiant Dhitar, Savitar, and Visnu, from Surya did these sages bring the Gharma.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 181
sanskrit: परथश्च यस्य सप्रथश्च नमानुष्टुभस्य हविषोहविर्यत | धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णो रथन्तरमा जभारा वसिष्ठः
transliteration: prathaśca yasya saprathaśca namānuṣṭubhasya haviṣohaviryat | dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇo rathantaramā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ
translation: BRHASPATI lead us safely over troubless and turn his evil thought against the sinner; Repel the curse, and drive away ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort!

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 181
sanskrit: अविन्दन ते अतिहितं यदासीद यज्ञस्य धाम परमंगुहा यत | धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोर्भरद्वाजो बर्हदा चक्रे अग्नेः
transliteration: avindan te atihitaṃ yadāsīd yajñasya dhāma paramaṃghuhā yat | dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorbharadvājo bṛhadā cakre aghneḥ
translation: May Naratarhsa aid us at Prayaja: blest be our Anuyaja at invokings. May he repel the curse, and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 181
sanskrit: ते.अविन्दन मनसा दीध्याना यजु षकन्नं परथमन्देवयानम | धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोरासूर्यादभरन घर्ममेते
transliteration: te.avindan manasā dīdhyānā yaju ṣkannaṃ prathamandevayānam | dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorāsūryādabharan gharmamete
translation: May he whose head is flaming burn the demons, haters of prayer, so that the arrow slay them. May he repel the curse and chase ill-feeling, and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 182
sanskrit: बर्हस्पतिर्नयतु दुर्गहा तिरः पुनर्नेषदघशंसायमन्म | कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः
transliteration: bṛhaspatirnayatu durghahā tiraḥ punarneṣadaghaśaṃsāyamanma | kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ
translation: I SAW thee meditating in thy spirit what sprang from Fervour and hath thence developed. Bestowing offspring here, bestowing riches, spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 182
sanskrit: नराशंसो नो.अवतु परयाजे शं नो अस्त्वनुयाजो हवेषु | कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद यजमानायशं योः
transliteration: narāśaṃso no.avatu prayāje śaṃ no astvanuyājo haveṣu | kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karad yajamānāyaśaṃ yoḥ
translation: I saw thee pondering in thine heart, and praying that in due time thy body might be fruitful. Come as a youthful woman, rise to meet me: spread in thine offspring, thou who cravest children.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 182
sanskrit: तपुर्मूर्धा तपतु रक्षसो ये बरह्मद्विषः शरवेहन्तवा उ | कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः
transliteration: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣaso ye brahmadviṣaḥ śaravehantavā u | kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ
translation: In plants and herbs, in all existent beings I have deposited the germ of increase. All progeny on earth have I engendered, and sons in women who will be hereafter.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 183
sanskrit: अपश्यं तवा मनसा चेकितानं तपसो जातं तपसोविभूतम | इह परजामिह रयिं रराणः पर जायस्वप्रजया पुत्रकाम
transliteration: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā cekitānaṃ tapaso jātaṃ tapasovibhūtam | iha prajāmiha rayiṃ rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāma
translation: MAY Visnu form and mould the womb, may Tvastar duly shape the forms, Prajapati infuse the stream, and Dhatar lay the germ for thee.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 183
sanskrit: अपश्यं तवा मनसा दीध्यानां सवायां तनू रत्व्येनाधमानाम | उप मामुच्चा युवतिर्बभूयाः पर जायस्वप्रजया पुत्रकामे
transliteration: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā dīdhyānāṃ svāyāṃ tanū ṛtvyenādhamānām | upa māmuccā yuvatirbabhūyāḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāme
translation: O Sinivali, set the germ, set thou the germ, Sarasvati: May the Twain Gods bestow the germ, the Asvins crowned with lotuses.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 183
sanskrit: अहं गर्भमदधामोषधीष्वहं विश्वेषु भुवनेष्वन्तः अहं परजा अजनयं पर्थिव्यामहं जनिभ्यो अपरीषुपुत्रान
transliteration: ahaṃ gharbhamadadhāmoṣadhīṣvahaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣvantaḥ ahaṃ prajā ajanayaṃ pṛthivyāmahaṃ janibhyo aparīṣuputrān
translation: That which the Asvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of gold,- That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 184
sanskrit: विष्णुर्योनिं कल्पयतु तवष्टा रूपाणि पिंशतु | आसिञ्चतु परजापतिर्धाता गर्भं दधातु ते
transliteration: viṣṇuryoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu |
translation: GREAT, unassailable must he the heavenly favour of' Three Gods, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 185
sanskrit: महि तरीणामवो.अस्तु दयुक्षं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः | दुराधर्षं वरुणस्य
transliteration: mahi trīṇāmavo.astu dyukṣaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ | durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya
translation: FILLING our hearts with health and joy, may Vata breathe his balm on us May he prolong our days of life.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 185
sanskrit: नहि तेषाममा चन नाध्वसु वारणेषु | ईशे रिपुरघशंसः
transliteration: nahi teṣāmamā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu |
translation: Thou art our Father, Vata, yea, thou art a Brother and a friend, So give us strength that we may live.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 186
sanskrit: वात आ वातु भेषजं शम्भु मयोभु नो हर्दे | पर णायूंषि तारिषत
transliteration: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde | pra ṇaāyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translation: To Agni send I forth my song, to him the Bull of all the folk: So may he bear us past our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 186
sanskrit: उत वात पितासि न उत भरातोत नः सखा | स नोजीवातवे कर्धि
transliteration: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā | sa nojīvātave kṛdhi
translation: Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes: So may he bear us past our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 186
sanskrit: यददो वात ते गर्हे.अम्र्तस्य निधिर्हितः | ततो नो देहिजीवसे
transliteration: yadado vāta te ghṛhe.amṛtasya nidhirhitaḥ | tato no dehijīvase
translation: The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends So may he bear us past our foes.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 187
sanskrit: पराग्नये वाचमीरय वर्षभाय कषितीनाम | स नःपर्षदति दविषः
transliteration: prāghnaye vācamīraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām | sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translation: Now send ye Jatavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed To seat him on our sacred grass.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 187
sanskrit: यः परस्याः परावतस्तिरो धन्वातिरोचते | स नःपर्षदति दविषः
transliteration: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatastiro dhanvātirocate | sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translation: I raise the lofty eulogy of Jatavedas, raining boons, With sages for his hero band.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 187
sanskrit: यो रक्षांसि निजूर्वति वर्षा शुक्रेण शोचिषा | स नःपर्षदति दविषः
transliteration: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrigvedaati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā | sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translation: With flames of Jatavedas which carry oblation to the Gods, May he promote our sacrifice.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 188
sanskrit: पर नूनं जातवेदसमश्वं हिनोत वाजिनम | इदं नोबर्हिरासदे
transliteration: pra nūnaṃ jātavedasamaśvaṃ hinota vājinam | idaṃ nobarhirāsade
translation: THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the Mother in the east, Advancing to his Father heaven.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 188
sanskrit: अस्य पर जातवेदसो विप्रवीरस्य मीळुषः | महीमियर्मिसुष्टुतिम
transliteration: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḷuṣaḥ | mahīmiyarmisuṣṭutim
translation: Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres: The Bull shines out through all the sky.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 188
sanskrit: या रुचो जातवेदसो देवत्रा हव्यवाहनीः | ताभिर्नोयज्ञमिन्वतु
transliteration: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ | tābhirnoyajñaminvatu
translation: Song is bestowed upon the Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms Throughout the days at break of morn.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 189
sanskrit: आयं गौः पर्श्निरक्रमीदसदन मातरं पुरः | पितरं च परयन सवः
transliteration: pitaraṃ ca prayan svaḥ
translation: FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were born: Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 189
sanskrit: अन्तश्चरति रोचनास्य पराणादपानती | वयख्यन्महिषो दिवम
transliteration: antaścarati rocanāsya prāṇādapānatī | vyakhyanmahiṣo divam
translation: From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced, Ordainer of the days nights, Lord over all who close the eye.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 189
sanskrit: तरिंशद धाम वि राजति वाक पतंगाय धीयते | परतिवस्तोरह दयुभिः
transliteration: triṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṃghāya dhīyate | prativastoraha dyubhiḥ
translation: Dhatar, the great Creator, then formed in due order Sun and Moon. He formed in order Heaven and Earth, the regions of the air, and light.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 190
sanskrit: रतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात तपसो.अध्यजायत | ततोरात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः
transliteration: tatorātryajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ
translation: THOU, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend. Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 190
sanskrit: समुद्रादर्णवादधि संवत्सरो अजायत | अहोरात्राणिविदधद विश्वस्य मिषतो वशी
transliteration: samudrādarṇavādadhi saṃvatsaro ajāyata | ahorātrāṇividadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī
translation: Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord, As ancient Gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.

title: Rig Veda Mandala 10 Hymn 190
sanskrit: सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धाता यथापूर्वमकल्पयत | दिवं चप्र्थिवीं चान्तरिक्षमथो सवः
transliteration: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrigvedaamakalpayat | divaṃ capṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣamatho svaḥ
translation: The place is common, common the assembly, common the mind, so be their thought united. A common purpose do I lay before you, and worship with your general oblation.
